column13:
and again the guys at dianas red hots through down with the beat breakfast ever. 
these guys dont even sell breakfast but went out of there way to make what i wanted.
would recommend to every one in the carolstream, glendale hts area

Date of my visit: 31-August-2016
Time of my visit: Lunch

Let me start by saying, this was not my first time here...  I remembered why it took me this long to come back...  It might be awhile before I come back again...

I always liked little moms & pops type places.  My first test is always to try the gyro.  I ordered gyro, fries and a drink.  Total came under $8 with tax, I thought that was reasonable.  My first reaction was to reach for my AMEX, oops they didn't take it.  That was a strike one!  Look, I get it, it's expensive to take that card, but either take them all or be a cash only.  They were busy, so it took them a few minutes to get to me.  I asked my order to be for here and instead I get it to go, at least they apologized.  Normally, it would not be a big deal, but I have yet to get my order correctly at this place (usually I get no onions on my gyro, since I have to go back to work, so either screw no onions up or something like for here or to go).

On to the food, the fries were average and nothing special.  Gyro meat was a bit dry and average.  I have had better gyros.

Honestly, I am not sure when I'll come back again, but I will try something else and some point, I just need to remember not to reach for my AMEX.  Overall C-.

If you're looking for a hot dog joint in the burbs, give this place a shot. It's better than all the others in the Carol Stream area. 

It's a little hole in the wall, with a small dining area. I've been going here for about 10 years. It's family owned, and the staff is very friendly. 

They offer just about everything you would expect from a good hot dog joint, and I've never had anything bad off their menu. 

Their steak sandwich is killer, the burgers are good, they also have really, really good gyros. They also offer tacos, burritos, and that have menudo on the weekends. 

The prices are great too. Another reason I keep going back. Not like Scooby's down the road, who have a two hot dog special for $9.99.....

The burger was alright. I would say they meal was really cheap though. I think the place could use some fixing up. It looked run down and old. They had great combo deals though, which is great for someone on a budget.

Was in the mood for a chili cheese dog and figured with the high marks, this place would shine. Not sure why he wrapped up everything in a bag to-go, I was dining in. Tried to unfold the mess that was the dog. Onion rings are generic and he tried to charge me a $1 for a cup of water. I paid $7.81 for a very disappointing meal. I think they may appeal to a different style customer. At least I can remove them from my bookmarks. No warm fuzzy feeling from the staff.

Decent food for super, super cheap.

I got a cheeseburger and fries with a horchata. Because I could. It set me back $6.72, which is nothing short of amazing if you keep track of beef prices like I do.

The burger was pretty good. It's hard for me to describe a run-of-the-mill, hole-in-the-wall burger without using more hyphens, so I'll just say that it was a good burger. Fresh lettuce and nice, melty cheese.

The fries tasted slightly off. I can't tell you how, because my wife didn't think they tasted off, but to me I thought maybe some of the flavors from other fried foods leaked into the oil.

The horchata was very, very good, cold, cinnamon-y and exactly what I was looking for.

Overall though, it's pretty difficult to beat Diana's - which, by the way, appears to be run by a Hispanic dude, and I wasn't sure if red hots were actually on the menu - at this price point. I'd come back.

I have been here so many times they actually recognize me when I come in.

This place has a really weird menu but I am seeing more of this. They have Mexican, American and a little Greek selection. I have tried a few and am a fan.

The service is super friendly. The food is always perfect. Everything is cooked to order so there is no cold food or old food!

The hot dogs are their specialty. Typical Vienna dog but they do it all so well. It comes with fries at no extra charge. I have had their gyros, tamales and as I mentioned hot dogs. All were good and I trust that everything else in there menu, which is huge by the way, is going to be just as good.

Looking forward to my next visit.

Best fast food restaurant around the area recommend it... I love the hamburgers they got 
Also good deals good price

From the outside this place looks a bit sketchy but their food is really good! Our group had tacos, gyros, and an italian beef & we were all pretty happy with what was ordered. The gyro I had was awesome, I'd definitely come here again next time I want some tasty "cheat" food!

This place has it all.  Anything from Gyros and Hotdogs to Mexican food and steak sandwiches.  Ive tried tons of stuff on the menu and everything is always great.  Try the tacos, believe it or not they are awesome.  The prices are super cheap and the portions are huge.  The owner is very friendly as well.

Good food decent price.
Easy parking 
Easy to get to.
I live this place. Very reasonable prices and in my opinion they might have the best gyro in the west suburbs.
Best gyros on the planet. This place is great and the people who work there are awesome!
I haven't been here in awhile and really wanted a gyro. I'm glad that it's still the same great place, with great people, and great food. I love this place. You will leave full and satisfied.

Diana's Red Hots is a small fast food joint located on the Southeast corner of North Avenue and Schmale Road in Carol Stream. 

When you walk in you'll notice that it's very hot inside as the cooking equipment is very closely packed into the front. When I went to Diana's I ordered the hot dog.

The hot dog comes with fries and is a skinless vienna beef dog. The bun was a regular non-poppy seed bun. The pickle was cut thinly but was not quite long enough to get pickle in every bite. It was light on mustard and relish but had a decent amount of onions. The relish included was not the neon green style found at most Chicago style hot dog joints, but wasn't too sour either. The peppers included weren't too hot and complimented the dog nicely. The bun wasn't particularly soft, but it wasn't hard either.

The fries included were thick, they were fairly cripsy on the outside and had a decent potato filling. They weren't too salty, but were a bit on the greasy side. 

Overall this was an average at best Chicago style hot dog. The light condiments, regular bun and so so fries included keep it from reaching the three star plateau. Not awful, but I've definitely had better.
This place is off the hook with great tasting food and outstanding customer service.l always feel welcome when i stop in. The rib tips and gyros are the bomb.

This place is old school simple. Minimalist decor, food is outstanding, ingredients tasted fresh and everything was delicious and made to order. Grill is in sight if the tables, you watch your meal get prepared. People are super friendly and nice, I'll definitely go back to this diamond in the rough.

First of all this 5 stars for personality and of quality in simplicity. This place is a dive in and out joint, its small not too cozy but packs a punch in food and flavor. Their gyros are awesome, it is a very generous portion of meat, tomato, onion and "gyro sauce" as they like to refer to it, and if you order the plate (comes with fries and a drink) you'll definitely be walking away full (make sure to grab some Louisiana hot sauce for them fries mm mm). 

Their hot dogs and cheese steak sandwiches I would recommend next, the hot dogs are classic nothing extraordinary but their sandwiches are, I definitely recommend a try. Finally, their menudo on Saturday and Sunday is extremely tasty. Although sometimes they sell out quickly due to phone in orders, I got their today at 10:09 am (they open at 10 am) and they were already sold out, yeah its that good. 

Anyways, the location and setting can be a little off putting but the food and service is excellent I highly recommend this place if you like good food at a decent price. 

Oh yeah and they also serve good burritos and tacos. Check em out.

Wonderful hidden gem! Staff is wonderful and everyone is always smiling, even when they are packed, which is nearly every time I walk in. The food is good and fast, and my husband swears it is the best gryo around!

So darn good! A buddy at work recommended this place to me and then I was reading some of the other positive reviews.  The staff was very friendly and the gyro that I ordered was so on point.  I doused my fries in Louisiana Hot Sauce which was a nice touch.  I'll definitely be coming back to this place.

Great (authentic) Chicago dogs, beefs, gyros and authentic Mexican street/fast food. I regularly bring my work associates who visit from Mexico and they love it, they just tell them what they want, forget about the menu. The eating area is kept clean, behind the counter is clean considering the volume going through there. I have always felt welcome and cared for. Space can get tight in the winter, during the summer there are seats outside, in the sun so high heat days are pretty rough
Came arcoss this place looking for a place to eat for my lunch break and instantly got hooked. Great freindly service, had their steak sandwich it was awesome, simple but with lots of flavor.
Been going here for years! Their Gyros keep bringing me back! I haven't found anything else as good as Diana's. Very friendly staff and very good food!

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone... They food is great, especially their gyros, and their service is awesome... I got there five minutes before they were supposed to close .... They had cleaned everything out because they close at ten.... But he just got everything back out because I came in and ordered gyros... I even told him I could order something else if it would help him... And he said that as long as I walk in the door before they close the door... I get anything I want from their menu.... The owner is always so polite and happy... I love this place
super awesome food.  great food.  all of the food here is delish!  fries, beef, and burritos are great, do not forget extra salsa!  pizza puff FTW!

Sushi City is a nice little place.
Went recently with love of my life and his aunt. 

They have a nice little $20 all-you-can-eat sushi and appetizers. Only catch is you gotta finish what you order or they charge you for it.  The sushi was quite good, and the appetizers were to die for! 

I thought the service could have been better, seemed like they were rushing us the whole time which bugged me, a lot. I also wish they would have brought each persons order on a single plate instead of bringing individual plates for rolls, since we each would forget what we ordered and what was what.

I love this AYCE sushi place!!

Such good, fast service

Sushi is fresh, flavorful and has a good fish to rice ratio

ALSO they have Saki flights! How fun.

Came here with some childhood friends to relish in summer one last time before college started again. This is my local haunt for a reason: they have the best all-you-can-eat sushi around. Just the best. My favorite rolls are Jo-Jo, Torch Dragon, and Sapporo. Be aware that they do  charge you for uneaten rolls, which is logical bc wasting food is bad, so just don't be a turd and it won't be too expensive. The Shumai and Gyoza usually come fried, but you can ask for them to be steamed instead. I prefer this for taste reasons but also because it makes me feel like I'm being healthy while stuffing my face. Efficiency! Irony! Success! If you are getting the takoyaki(sp?) or the fried scallop, just know that they are hotter than the fiery depths of hell and will hurt you if given the opportunity. As far as the individual pieces of sushi go, I'm a fan of the salmon, tuna, and eel.

They usually have pretty good service. I've been there tens of times and they've never made any mistakes with orders or anything. That being said, it takes time for them to make sushi so gauge your hunger earlier on and order based on that.

If you're able to walk comfortably after you're done eating here, do better next time :D

AYCE = wearing clothing that ends in -egging. While most AYCE seem like they throw you either day old fish or a version of the California roll with 10 different toppings, Sushi City does not play you like that. 

You pay about $20 and everything is up for grabs. Drinks are extra but even the apps are included in the price. If you're all about the grub, you'd keep your liquid consumption to a minimum and save that precious stomach space on bomb sushi rolls instead. 

Between 6 people, we probably ordered every damn specialty roll on the menu, at least 3xs. Being fat is fun. 

Keep in mind everyone is ordering a ton of food like you, so when you place your order, it's gonna take a while. The quality of sushi is actually bomb as are the freshness of the fish so it's all worth it. 

When you decide you want a second or third order, just try to combine them all and stuff yourself because you can't leave food unless you wanna pay extra. You won't leave anything because it's all so damn good.

Prepare yourself with some leggings/jeggings and enjoy. 

Must order: touched dragon, Jojo, turtle and blue sky.

The food was good, however they mixed our order with another groups order. Also, I found a hair in the sushi which is kinda disgusting. The food was cooked to order and everything else was fine. The service was okay...they don't really understand English, but they got the job done.

hoooooo my gaaaawwwt i ruvvvv dis prace rika soooo much!!! I make da 20 ordaas of torch draaagon erry time. SO DERICIOUS!!! I reccomend tooo errybodiiii todaiiiiii! Dey neeed to fic one probraaam. Dey no giv me daa alumyay muuuyaaaa sauce wit erry roorrr. Hooo my gawwwt, why u hate me sumtime :'(. Lika someboooodiiii arr you can eat fo 25 dorrars iz a rearrry good dearr!!!!

-BUKRAU

A very good AYCE sushi restaurant in Downers Grove.  Excellent service from promp and friendly staff in a very relaxing dining room. Fish was fresh. Excellent selection special rolls on the dinner menu plus a very large appetizer menu included.  I highly recommend it if you like variety as much as I do. We will become regulars.

Omg this place is amazing.  Get the torched dragon is delicious. The staff were very attentive and friendly. Came several times to our table to see how every was. Definitely coming back. Good job guys

ACYE Sushi Dinner for $20.  We came here for dinner with a big group (17 people) and they did pretty well.  The food came out on the slow side, but I got my food and had a happy belly by the end of the night.  There was no issue paying separately, either.  We just one by one paid at the cashier up front before we left.

I was looking for the Torched Dragon maki on the AYCE menu but didn't see it.  Just now realized it's not on that particular menu, but you can still order it as part of AYCE because it's on the house special menu.  

My one qualm about the rolls, especially the Godzilla roll, is that it's way too big!  What if I'm eating with a smaller group of people, how will I get a variety of rolls if the Godzilla roll is so enormous that I can't even eat 1/3 of it by myself.

Location: Next to Toys 'R Us

I was reading the reviews about this place when I told the fam if they're up for Sushi. The kids instantly agreed, but the wife was hesitant when I mentioned it's an "all you can eat" place, since she's on a diet. But I talked her in and everybody was super hungry so might as well go on a pig-out.

The place is situated in a strip mall where toys r us, shikara, and Royal Buffet in 75th is located. Don't let the facade fool you since it's a little small from the outside but there's ample seating and a bar area where the Itamae (Sushi chef) does all the magic. I'm more of a nigiri and sashimi guy so this place was perfect for me, but there's plenty to choose from including specialty rolls and makis. Me and my wife went for the eat all you can 20$ each and kids shared the teriyaki plate for 11$.

So our journey started with miso soup, takoyaki (one of my fave Japanese street foods), chicken yaki (bbq on stick), ika salad (squid w/pickles), few standard rolls, and a specialty roll. What stood out was the Torched Dragon which is now my favorite like everybody elses. The other dishes came out as expected and fresh, not the ones you eat at buffets where the sushi rice was stale and ingredients have dried out.

2nd round we asked for a mango roll with potato crunch on top, salmon roll, various nigiri (eel, tuna, salmon, mackarel). The problem with this batch is that there's a strand of hair stuck on one of the rolls. So we told the guy. He was very apologetic and hurried up took the plate, told the Itamae about it and they gave us a new batch. The server handled the situation very well IMHO, but at the back of my head, I wanted to check every piece of sushi. My other problem is the mackarel nigiri is not prepared consistently. I got one piece with just chewy fish skin, then another thick piece too big for one bite, and few others were the fish is not glued together with the wasabi.  But if you ask me if I will go back here again, I'd definitely will, just because of great service and now that I know what to order or what to stay away from the menu. Overall it's a really good experience and for the price point. Btw, they charge 1$+ for left over sushi so you would want to order only what you can finish, another rookie mistake I made.
Great place!  I love their sushi but can get crazy busy, and obviously the busier the slower the service, but worth the wait.

Tremendous sushi excellent service and delicious sushi top of the line sushi for the price in Illinois. Quality sushi. 5 stars and 2 thumbs up. I loved all the varieties they have and place is nice and clean. Everthing was beautiful and amazing. Perfectly made with excellent service. Hands down best place in town.

I like Sushi City. They have great tasting rolls and a great all-you-can-eat sushi and appetizer spread. The only reason that they don't have 5 stars is that it's sloooooooooow. The price of 20.99 is more than reasonable for the sushi buffet. You get to choose from a slew of appetizers as well. 

What sets this sushi buffet apart from others is the sheer amount of specialty rolls included. I have never been to a sushi buffet with a list of 10+ specialty rolls you can order from. I think this is what truly slows them down. There is no limit to how much you can order per sheet-most places limit you to two specialty rolls at a time. 

This place wants you to go all out at all times. And people do. This means the kitchen is inundated with 50 blue sheets at a time with a bagillion rolls listed on each sheet. The sushi chefs work their butts off, and the rolls always come to you prepared nicely, but it's gonna take quite a while for those rolls to get to you. As far as specialty rolls go, I recommend the Torched Dragon. 

Definitely check out Sushi City, but only if you're prepared to be there for a good chunk of time. The food is quite tasty, though.

Love the food here but the service is horrible. 

We did the all you can eat sushi for lunch. They make you wait forever even just for the appetizers.

Very poor service, but food is good.

4 stars for the food
1 star for the service.

Very good place for people who haven't tried sushi before. The torched dragon is probably the best, along with the turtle. The service is always top notch and it's always cold in there so wear a jacket!

I've been to Shiro's, Nobu, and Mirai. Those are no doubt some of the best places for sushi in the country, but sometimes I just like pounding back mystery nigiri until I pass out into a food coma.
I would be the first to admit that I come here way too often. The sushi is probably only 7/10, but the value for the all-you-can-eat is incredible. The only better deal in the area is Lawrence Fish Market in Albany Park, and they are takeout only. It's just a place to have fun and fill up after a day of go-karting and paintball. 
Like I said, nothing is mind-blowing, but I would definitely recommend Sushi City for carb-loading, preparty dinners, post shopping relaxing, and just meeting up with friends.

My boyfriend and I tried this sushi spot when we heard from one of my friends who have been here before. She told me this place was 'alright' so we gave it a shot. 

1) service is decent 
2) sushi- not the worst but I could have something better. (We were disappointed & we love sushi) 
3) the seating was not great. On a winter day, how could you seat someone by the window..? Cold air. But they were kind enough to change our table to an inner table when we asked. 
4) finished eating, paid. While driving home we both didn't feel so well. Our stomach started to hurt. 

We don't think the fish was fresh. This problem never happened when we go out for sushi. 

We will never be returning back.

My buddy and I had their AYCE buffet this past Friday evening. We usually go on Sunday afternoons when it seems less busy. I was thoroughly impressed that despite the crowds, service was great (even though we were missing soy sauce and soy sauce dishes, we got those after we asked) our orders came correctly, AND we each received our respective orders at once on our own plates. (They've been coming out as made/piecemeal lately otherwise.) 

They're good on refills, everything is clean, and service in general is usually good. The rice can be rather plain IMO (vs. true sushi rice). A few girls recognize our mugs by now.

The only problem we seem to consistently have is that they don't include wasabi + pickled ginger, so we always have to ask for some. They give us a generous amount though. I ordered 4 rolls and a few pieces of nigiri and it was the perfect amount - I was pretty full but it was manageable. 

                                  - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Fast forward to last night (Sunday, 2 days later): my boyfriend and had the AYCE. The server said, "Besides water, do you want anything else to drink?" I asked for a hot tea. She brought 1 water and my tea, so we had to ask for my water (..which I thought was coming anyway based on her wording, but whatevs; we got it).

We had to ask for wasabi and ginger. Again.

We each ordered 4 rolls and a few pieces of nigiri, which we agreed was the perfect amount. However, it seemed we got way more - so either we over ordered or somehow ended up with someone else's. Anyway, we were STUFFED and raised the white flag. 

The server came over and asked how we were doing. We said fine, but couldn't eat any more. I asked her to tell us what we'd owe for the rest. She then began to question us about why we ordered so much.

Wait...what? I thought I heard her wrong at first.

"Why did you order so much?"

"..Uh.. we were hungry and thought we ordered enough.."

...I was thinking, Are you scolding us? Orrrrr do you think we planned to have excess? Because that's what it felt like. Very uncomfortable.

She just kind of looked at us, then counted up the pieces and gave us a price  ($15), told us "I'm supposed to charge you 50 cents per piece." That was fine, but it was just all kinds of awkward. I mean, I understand they charge you for what isn't eaten. But that's MY problem, right? $55 of sushi pre-tax ($61 post-) and second-day sushi that never ever tastes half as good.

So, yeah, total 3 star experience last night.  Still, I hope it was just a fluke with this one girl.

I don't know..maybe Friday night is the best time to go. I'll be sure to stick to 3 rolls in the future (and order more if needed/wanted) to avoid being scolded otherwise.
Read the fine print before you eat here. Sub optimal at the best. 18% gratutity while all the waiter are watching like a hawk communicating in japanese....

Okay...

This place is alright for AYCE (not amazing but worth it for the price they charge). Sushi City used to turned me off because of the noticeable amount of rice they put on the sushi -- seriously, they put A LOT of rice (even for what you would expect from AYCE). I used to dismiss this place as among the worst AYCE sushi restaurants in Illinois, but I gave it another shot yesterday on my 18th birthday and was pleasantly surprised.

The nigiri here are PACKED with rice, BUT the fish is surprisingly not bad. I'm very impressed that this place actually has white tuna (yes, by white tuna I mean albacore tuna, NOT escolar) and sea bass. I'm also gonna say that the fish quality here is MUCH better than the quality from Para Sushi & Ramen that is located slightly east of here on 75th. Most of the rolls here are what you would expect from an AYCE place, but some of them here are red flags in terms of the amount of fillers they purposely use to fill you up.

So let me caution every sushi lover here. Acknowledge that everything is packed with a little extra rice compared to what you would normally expect from other places, but some items aren't as bad as others in terms of filler (some of the sushi here is actually tasty despite the generous rice portions). To any serious sushi lover, I would recommend to stay away from the Godzilla roll and any roll that seems to have too much filler or is deep fried; stick with some nigiri (if you can stand the amount of rice they put) and some of the house special rolls.

And this gets me to what I really wanted to say: the house special rolls IMO are the only reason for me to come here, specifically the Torched Dragon Roll. Not all the house special rolls are great (some of them are just bad in terms of sushi fillers), but the Torched Dragon Roll is really something special here. It's a roll with shrimp tempura and imitation crab inside with fresh fish on the outside drizzled with spicy mayo, eel sauce, and lemon wasabi sauce and torched under a flame to give it a nice grilled taste. No wonder it's the most popular roll here; I would come here just to get the opportunity eat the Torched Dragon! The Jo-Jo and Turtle Roll here are alright as well IMO; I'd advise serious sushi goers to avoid the Downers Grove Toll (too much filler).

All in all, you gotta be careful eating her to get your money's worth of sushi.
Terrible service....waited 45 minutes after placing an order only to be told sorry waitress is new and forgot to place your order. I instantly walked out and will never come back to this dump.

Hands down the worst quality sushi around. I get the bargain idea of 20$ all you can eat but the quality is so bad it's hard to put down a single roll. The sashimi is oddly colored as well as tasting very bad I'm sure they source their fish from the cheapest place around. I'll give them one star for the service which is decent.

Sushi City...we're over. I liked the idea of low-priced AYCE sushi, but I've come to the conclusion that: 1. There are better AYCE sushi places and 2. I'd rather pay fancy-North-Side prices if it means I don't get the stink eye all night from your creepy waiter. 

The rice to fish ratio is way off here. Obviously they want to control their overhead...I get it, but I'm not liking it. The portion of food is dramatically different from roll to roll. One kind may be huge, the next roll is a baby-sized portion. If you have leftovers, you get charged extra. I came in more than 30 minutes before closing and was told I had to order all my rolls in one go. Well, how am I supposed to gauge how much I'm going to eat considering the wildly different sized rolls?! And that's not All You Can Eat, either. It's crappy customer service.

20.99$ for all you can eat sushi - can't beat that!
For all of those who are complaining - do you really expect top of the line sushi for 20$?
Price is good, sushi is decent, fresh. Make sure you pick from the "special menu" - torched dragon, jo-jo, city.
Crab ragoons - the best!

Came here for the first time and food was ok. Service not so great. The server we had was slow, absent, and unconcerned with waiting on us. It was busy but even before that, she never brought soup, failed to refill drinks. The kicker is they charged us for not finishing our order which I get is the policy but after waiting 50 minutes for the last of our all you can eat order, we weren't hungry any more. We had to pay for it anyway. Probably won't be back.
At sushi city. Thought we'd give it a second chance. The food we have gotten so far is soggy and my son has been waiting an hour for is plate. Awful

Good af, but god damnnn did that food take 6 years to come to our table. I dont know if we are just teenagers or what? But it seemed to me like they literally forgot about us other then our water which came every half a second. Very looooong wait time.

I avoided this place for a while because of poor reviews here but saw several favorable ones in the past few months so decided to go in for lunch today.  I've been to several places in the area with comparable prices and they always take FOREVER to bring the food out and usually miss an item or two.  We had our food within 10 minutes here and the server was very attentive.  I don't think my water glass ever got less than half full.  The amount of fish in each roll was great compared to other places where they overstuff all the rolls with rice to fill you up.  Next time I'm definitely paying more for the dinner options because all of the basic options on the lunch pricing were outstanding.  If you are looking for AYCE sushi this is the place to go.

I will never come in for takeout ever again.

They had open tables and weren't all that busy when I went in, after the promised half hour when I placed the order for an appetizer plate, sashimi dinner, and some sides. They promptly took my payment of almost $50, then made me wait another half hour while they then scrambled to start and put my order together.

I waited in the waiting area, mouth watering as I watched other platters make their way to the few occupied tables during the half hour I was forced to wait. Some of those tables that got served were people who arrived and were seated after I had gotten there and paid.

I'm sure this establishment is alright if you eat in. But I would make sure that you don't wait until you are famished to place a takeout order, because it will take an hour even before you get your food.

Great deal if you like sushi! They have all you can eat lunch for $15.99 & a lil more options for dinner for $19.99. Check with your server on sizes of rolls before ordering as some are gigantic. Been here three times now & always left satisfied. Must consume all orders or you will be charged extra!

This has been the best AYCE sushi place.
Their special rolls are memorable and tasty! For $20!!!
My recommendations are: blue sky, jo jo, snow mountain :) 
日本人です、とっても美味しかったですよ！
(オーナーは日系ではないとおもいますが)

I have been to a handful of different sushi places in my rather short lifetime, but Sushi City has been my go to AYCE sushi place in the suburbs for the last 3 years. 

What separates them from the other ACYE sushi places in the suburbs are their ACYE special sushi rolls, like the Torched Dragon - flamethrower-ed to perfection - and the Turtle Maki. I also really like their Godzilla roll, Spider roll, and Nigiri pieces. While my check-ins don't show it, I have probably been here about 10 to 15 times in my life. Sometimes the service can be slow, and on Fridays and Saturdays, it can get pretty packed. But time and time again, we come back hungry and leave stuffed. As you can see form other reviews, price is like $20 for AYCE dinner. The wasabi is good, ginger is plentiful, and sushi taste great. But yes, service can be slow sometimes, but I think it's worth the wait. And if you come in knowing it could take around 20 minutes to make your rolls (Depending on order size), then what is there to complain about?!?! ARE YOU NOT ENTERTAINED?

Pretty darn good sushi. Did take out order and they were quick on the order. Great presentation and taste.
Only tried 3 rolls so looking forward to going back to try more options.
I'm here now service is so slow!!!!!Good sushi but you will wait forever and ever.Cmon its fcking fish and rice wtf is taking soooooo longgggg!!!

I personally don't eat alot of sushi, but when I have a craving for it I drive here from the Southside of Chicago.  You cannot beat their price for the all you can eat special. The Torched Dragon, Blue Sky,  Mango Tokyo, and Godzilla were great.

Hard to believe  this is an AYCE place!  I RARELY 5 star any place. So, here we go,
 The quality of the rolls this place is putting out is fabulous. 
  First time here & I must say its spot on with what the other reviewers are saying. The service is very good. Go early as the later it gets,  the busier it gets. Have the buffet as its well worth the 19.99 price.  Don't make the mistake of over ordering as you will pay for uneaten food. 
 My favorite rolls were Torched Dragon, & the Godzilla. Had the sweet potato it was interesting! Ask 4 wasabi & ginger between samples. I had plenty of green tea to wash  down between rolls. I have had better sushi before but not very often. Its a tremendous bargain @ this price & ill definitely be returning.

We have eaten here many times and loved it UNTIL we got spoiled fish and my daughter threw up immediately in there bathroom I brought the spoiled salmon to there attention and they made every excuse possible and the fact nobody spoke any English made it very hard to resolve they didn't charge for my daughter but made a point to charge every one else even though they ate the same spoiled fish bad customer service

The best rolls in Chicago and the suburbs, me and my friends we drove 45 min. to get here, the best roll Torched Dragon, if come here you have to try this roll. #2 Jojo, #3 Mexican. I didn't give 5 because there is too much rice in nigiri.

I was looking forward to a great night out with my friends. I came to city sushi, I heard they were known in the area for great food. I do have to say, the sushi was excellent. Very tasty, well prepared, and visually appealing. The service however was terrible. When we arrived, we were only given 3 menus to order from when we had a party of 5. Our waiter was extremely rude. He always seemed to be giving us dirty looks. Never came by and asked how things were. He didn't really do anything for us at all. The one thing that bothered me the most... It took extremely long for our food to arrive at our table. One roll of sushi would take around 30 min or possibly more. I think that I will be visiting sushi city again only because the sushi was great. I just hope that the service gets better. Otherwise I may not be back for a third visit.


UPDATE: since the last review I made, I have been to sushi city twice more. I have to say, I got a terrible first impression. Their all you can eat menu for $20.99 is quite amazing... An array of appetizers, a plentiful amount of different rolls. And not to mention the house specials are included in the AYCE menu also. I suggest coming here on a weekday when its not too busy. Food is great and service is getting better. Highly suggest this place

Sushi city offers unlimited sushi deals, which is great because sushi gets expensive! $20.99 for unlimited sushi which includes appetizers as well! 

Beware before ordering, you have to pay for each piece you don't eat! 

I recommend the torched dragon & turtle. If you like sweet rolls, try the snow mountain. If you like would like a spicy, fresh, & tangy roll, try the Mexican roll. It is my favorite!  The eel is also very good. Along with the coconut shrimp, potstickers, and shumai for appetizers. 

I have been coming often with some friends and we love the setting and the customer service. Evenings on weekends do tend to get busier and rolls take a bit longer to come out! 

The guava candy they give after you pay is so good! They sell the bags as well for $5.

Wow! My son's birthday was today amd he wanted to do a train type restaurant so we decided to go to All Aboard in Downers Grove. Luckily for us they were closed for Father's Day so my son wanted to go to Sushi City next door. I'm glad we came. My wife had the torched dragon sushi roll which she loved and my 8 yr old son had the turtle which he absolutely loved! My daughter and I both enjoyed the teriyaki chicken dinner that was out of this world. We also started things off with the shrimp and vegetable tempura. We enjoyed this place for a birthday dinner and fathers day treat. The boy even got mochi ice cream which is flavored ice cream rolled in a rice paste. I knocked one star for our server. He seemed really pissed that we all didn't order the all you can eat sushi. I don't eat it nor will my daughter. We never saw him after we got our drinks and such. He was present for the other tables around us bringing dish after dish but our waiter turned into a several women including the hostess. Maybe my money wasn't good enough or I looked poor. My wife and boy waited forever for their sushi only to find out the order had never been placed or simply overlooked but my daughter and I received our dinner in a timely fashion. Because of his lack of attention they took care of us. Nothing was free but they discounted the bill. Nice of them to do.  Really good! Try it of you are in the neighborhood!

Came back for another go at the restaurant. Still as tasty as ever, my only complaint is the service. I will say that the food keeps me coming back but the service takes away from it. In particular whenever you do need something like napkins or more water or just need to ask about anything, it's almost a strain to get the waitress's attention.
If you like good sushi I still recommend this place for the food.

It was weird. There was this survey they had us take in the beginning. We were supposed to rate the rolls interest to us on a scale of 1 to 5. It was kinda strange.  We never even placed an order but they started bringing us out plates of sushi every 3 minutes or so after we turned in the survey. At one point we had over 20 rolls in in front of us.  We weren't sure if we were supposed to be sampling them.  We were sitting at the bar,  they put so many out it looked like they were setting up a buffet. Upon asking the manager he informed us that they were indeed for us.  We weren't too familiar with Japanese culture and were concerned they would be offended that we didn't eat all the sushi they gave us to sample.  We gave it all we got.  At one point there was a lot of chatter and attention from other patrons directed at us.  We felt a bit uneasy,  thinking this might be some kind of prank on a Japanese game show.  After three hours the check came.  There was a base charge of 20.99 for each of us and additional charge of $272 for all the uneaten sushi. We were quite taken aback that they were charging us for uneaten sushi we didn't even order.  We felt like arguing our case but thought better of it since some samurai swords were on display right near the bar.  Interesting experience to say the least.  Would we come back?  No its too expensive. And they don't even have cinnamon rolls.

As far as AYCE sushi places in the burbs, this place is pretty good. Good quality sushi and, a rarity, lots of house special rolls on the AYCE menu. For $20, you really can't for anything more....except BYOB.

Something weird we noticed- 4 different servers came up to take our drink order once we sat down, as if they weren't assigned to sections. Nice that there was constantly someone at our table, but annoying that there was zero communication between the servers as to who was taking the lead. However, once we told them we were trying to catch a movie, they hustled our food out and we made it in plenty of time.

Try: Downers Grove (our favorite), Torched Dragon, Sweet potato, any of the individual sushi pieces

Don't waste room in your belly with: Philly roll, Rainbow (bland and lacked the proper layering of fish over the roll), any of the appetizers (especially the fried "scallops," which we dissected and discovered to be flavored, compressed white fish. Gross).

IMPORTANT NOTE, the servers all emphasized that while its policy to charge for leftover sushi, if you leave only 3-4 pieces, they won't charge and will actually give you a to-go box for them. I appreciate that, as that last forced bite of sushi can have tragic consequences afterward

So glad I found this phenomenal slice of sushi heaven on yelp! 
Went here for the first time with my bff on a Wednesday night around 4pm. Place was about 1/3 full, which I Love. (Can't wait til I'm over 60 and can actually capitalize on that early bird dinner mess) 

First off, the service was beyond impressive. The servers at most to all AYCE sushi restaurants I've been to have been unfriendly and seem to always rush you out in order to fill your seats. Not Sushi City. Our waitress was very patient, our waters were always full, and she even asked us if we were hungry for more on multiple occasions. Whaaa?! It was hard to understand her through her accent and mumbling, but who cares when she's not sweeping under our feet and rushing us out?! 

Second, the speed. Our apps, nigiri and rolls seemed to come out in perfect timing. Everything was temperature appropriate and spaced out just right. Glad we came before the dinner rush! 

And lastly, the SUSHI. I swear they had a barge come in with our names on it just before we arrived. Fish was fresh, generously cut, and the sauces were impeccable. For $19.99 a person, you can not only order off the AYCE dinner menu, but the huge list of specialty rolls were also included in the price! At an average of $12 per roll, you CANT beat this awesome deal! Highlights were the Torched Dragon roll, New York roll, and the Mexican roll. Portions were MASSIVE. I almost wish I had other friends so we could've tried more. Truth be told, I'm a bit selfish when it comes to my sushi so larger portions actually work out perfect. #gluttonousamerican

I WILL be back. Even if I have to go alone. Free parking, great service, excellent sushi, crazy good prices, I think I've found my new fish feeding frenzy!! 
Ps, can I just comment on the clean, multi stalled restrooms...? Now there's something you rarely see in an authentic sushi restaurant!!

Get the ayce buffet option for Dinner. Well worth it! Especially for the Torched Dragon roll! But make sure to order wisely, since you have to pay extra if you have leftovers when you do the buffet option.

For an AYCE sushi joint, its not too bad. I like a majority of these sushi choices (torched dragon, Mexican maki, jo-jo) I particularly like that they don't put too, too much rice on their sushi rolls. However, on occasions they did stack it up though. Their service is decent, and I only say that because depending on when you go, it gets super busy! And you wait forever to get your food and you're just sitting there, letting your food digest instead of consuming.

$20.99 for all you can eat sushi! Can't beat that!!  Torched dragon and turtle are my absolute favorite rolls. The coconut scrimp and fried scallops are delicious. Definitely recommend this place for sushi lovers!

It's alright, I mean it's an AYCE sushi place so don't expect greatness but there are other places that are 10x better that are AYCE.

As others have mentioned, service is a bit weird. They seem to have plenty of staff but they are a bit slow, and seem not organized. They have a lot of offerings on the menu, but the torched dragon seemed to be the best. Other rolls I ordered, such as the Godzilla roll, had way too much cucumber and rice(to get you full I assume). And comes in huge portions.

I would prefer to give zero stars...horrible horrible service and it took over an hour and a half to get 6 rolls. The waiters and waitresses are not there to serve you...they don't explain their menu or ordering processes. The rolls are stuffed with rice and vegetables it made us want to cry...most expensive rice we've ever paid for. We checked out this place because of the reviews but I don't know what people are eating when they come here...definitely not sushi.

All you can eat sushi? And it doesn't make you sick? SOLD! 

Great place with a variety of sushi! I really don't eat sushi, as I'm not the biggest fan of the stuff, but this place was delicious. All of the rolls are made to order, the fish is fresh, and you can eat as much as you want of it! My favorite roll was the Turtle Roll and crab Rangoon. I will not disclose how many orders I had, but lets just say I could clear house. 
The place was dead, but we did go on a Wednesday evening for my sisters birthday. I hope that it gets packed on the weekends because I would hate to see this place drown. The staff is super nice and informative on the menu and what exactly it is. 
There is a catch though, you do have to eat everything you order. Anything left over they will charge you per piece (it's not too much though) so make sure your eyes aren't bigger than your stomach.

All you can eat sushi. I mean it isn't LA or Las Vegas or New York. But for an all you can eat sushi place in the Chicago area it isn't bad. The service is what really shines here. My glass was always filled with water and whenever our table needed anything they seemed to be able to read out minds and know when to service the table. I do have some complaints which is why they don't get 5 stars. The eel tasted fine But was 'stale'. That's all I will say about that. Each piece of sushi had a little more rice than I would have liked. Really packed in with an average size of fish on top. The fish didn't taste super fresh. Fresh enough but I'm being picky here and comparing the fish to upscale sushi joints. The fried scallops use fake scallops just be advised. But I could have sworn the first one I ate was a real scallop. Who knows maybe they mix and match.

In the end the food was ok. Nothing spectacular, but not bad. The service was amazing and the people there very kind. Nice place for lunch!

I've done a ton of all-u-can-eat sushi in my days.  This is by far the worst.  We tried it because it was close to us and the reviews were good.  We went on a weekend lunch and it wasn't too busy.  Perhaps we had come before the rush?  The rolls have too much rice, which I understand, this is a business and they are trying to fill you up but the amount of cucumber that was in each roll was ridiculous.  I usually prefer a different all you can eat restaurant and will be driving at least 40 minutes next time for better food.  None of the rolls really stood out or were that great.  Basics again were just overstuffed with cucumber and rice in comparison to the amount of actual fish.  The decor is very nice and the place is bigger than it looks from the outside.  Location has ample parking in a large shopping plaza.  Service was good, and the ingredients were fresh and well-prepared.  I have no qualms about quality but overall, I was turned off by the fact that I accidentally ordered a roll with nothing but rice and fruit... no meat and had it be half of my meal because it filled me up too much.  Hehe my fault for not looking at the ingredients closer but so sad I couldn't try something more yummy.  In all we ate about a good 6 rolls or so.  Some were more yummy than others which I forget the names.  

Price was similar but very disappointing.  I had high high hopes for this place.  Will most likely not be going back.

What can I say?  This establishment offers quality all you can eat sushi that doesn't make you sick for $19.99. What else is there to say other than this place is awesome and on my regular rotation of places to take my wife for date night or meet friends for an evening out.

My most recent visit had me stretch my sushi eating abilities and venture into uncharted waters by trying a Turtle Maki, New York Maki, Highway Maki and a Blue Sky Maki rolls and then following up with a Dragon and Torched Dragon rolls. All of these rolls were delicious and prepared perfectly.

My only criticism is that the customer service lacks on occasion by the wait staff and orders seem to occasionally get lost and disappear in thin air. This makes it difficult especially when you are with a large group and those around you have been served and are eating while you are waiting....and waiting...and waiting.

I used to love this place, but recently it has gone down hill. The service has always been bad (sometimes I waited hours for sushi), but I kept coming back for the sushi. The last couple of times I went the rice was old and the fish was not fresh. You can always expect to be there for at least two hours because the service is so slow. Go to sushi para right down the road, the fish is so fresh and the food is amazing there. Sushi para is the same buffet style, and a dollar cheaper
Came for AYCE sushi and the kitchen is slow as hell.  Can't complain about quality but damn, get a move-on....
Everything including the nigiri was salty. The rolls were mostly rice and the nigiri was thinly sliced over a big hunk of rice. Not coming back.
The food is excellent, and well priced.  And I live close so it's a win-win!

food poisoning!! stay away!!! my daughter ate there and has been vomiting violent for two days. Doctor said food poisoning and has heard this from others about this place. I'm calling the health inspector. STAY AWAY!!!!

Slow ass service. The place is not even busy. There are five people making the sushi and it's taking them forever. I didn't think it was that difficult to roll up raw food. Waiters keep bringing the food to the wrong table.

All you can eat rice! Super slow service. Most of the rolls are super loaded with rice. Instead of paying 20$ for rice it is better to go other sushi places to get couple of good rolls and done with it. Not coming back.

20 min wait time in between orders (three orders) and an additional 15 minute wait for our check? During normal dinner hour and it not being busy? Subpar prepared sushi/sashimi on top of that? No thanks. Updated my review to one star after having this happening several times already as is. Been coming here for years but enough is enough. Clean your game up - until then, not coming back.

Proves the adage that you can pick two out of three of Price, Service, Quality.

Sushi is decent, great price point, terrible service.  Over an hour for 12 pieces of sushi and two rolls, and nothing but excuses when I asked about the status of our order.

I'll pay more for better sushi and far better service next time...

Love this place, I have been going there for a couple years now. It's super affordable, $20 all you can eat sushi made to order. I always go with a group of friends and we always order way too much. I didn't know for the longest time that you can order the house special sushi, so get the Torched Dragon- it's amazingggg. The mexican & turtle rolls are good too. The goyza is a must. Some people are turned off by hearing that it's a "sushi buffet," but they are just annoying sushi snobs anyway. The servers are nice and attentive. Don't over order like we do, because then you have to pay extra and leftover sushi doesn't taste good the next day. Everyone I bring here likes this place, and we end up going back. Check it out !

All you eat sushi....need I say more!  Its not fine dining sushi, but it will satisfy the cravings. Some of my favorite rolls are the shirmp tempura, downers grove, and the Mexican.  Crab ragoon is on point!

I went to Sushi City with a group of 9 and we all wanted some mad sushi. We all got the unlimited sushi. With their dinner price, you get the speciality rolls along with any appetizers or causal rolls. It was a long wait for our first set of rolls, but considering it was a Friday night, they came out pretty quick! 

I was not displeased with any of the food brought to the table. We as a table tried almost every speciality roll and loved everything. 

They had the absolute BEST crab rangoon!! My favorite roll was the Snow Mountain which was a coconut flavored sushi roll. It was so full of flavor that I just had to get two of the rolls! The other table favorite was the Scorched Dragon! This was a shrimp tempura with a spicy mayo. 

The presentation of the food was also beyond impressive. They were flawless with it and I almost didn't wanted to eat the rolls. The service was great. They constantly were filling out water and making sure we had everything we needed. 

Easily, Sushi City is my new favorite.

I've been looking for a place similar to Sushi
Para (Palatine) in the Downer's Grove area for a while now and I've finally found it!

Similar to other all you can eat sushi places, the service isn't great. The servers are nice enough but the interaction mainly consists of just setting down your food and walking away rather than engaging. They are really good about checking in with you to make sure you have enough to drink.

We ordered Crab Rangoon to start (1 order includes 2 pieces) which are included in the all you can eat deal ($19.99!) They were delicious!

The sushi was amazing - it was all very fresh and I liked that their portions were very reasonable. 

With the all you can eat deal you can choose up to 10 specialty rolls. We decided on the Turtle Maki and a Dragon Roll. Both were very good but I would recommend the Turtle!

Overall I feel like Sushi City met my expectations. Considering the service 4 stars may be a little bit generous, but the sushi was THAT good! We will definitely be coming back!

I came in for lunch since a few friends still continue to rave about Sushi City. Hubby and I had gone a year or two ago, and it was ok. I was taking a class in the area, so I figgured sushi would be good for lunch, especially since they do an all-you-can-eat during lunch and dinner. Boy....what a disapointment! The service and the cleanliness was good. The waitstaff was very attentive, and kept the refills on my water coming. The sushi, however was another story. I now see why they serve an all-you-here...becasue 90% of the sushi is rice! I even took a picture of their Boston roll. It was suppose to have salmon, avocado, cucumber, and letture (not sure why on the lettuce!). I seriously had to HUNT for the salmon! Although the food was generally tasty and well made, I can't justify purchasing sushi when I get rice :(

This is a great place! The food was awesome and the price was great for all you can eat. The service was slow only because everything is made fresh to order. The service was very courteous otherwise. You need to leave about 2 hours to enjoy your time here. And that is the only only reason for 4 stars.

I'm only giving one star because I have to. The service here was horrible. We came in and it wasn't busy, yet they told us we couldn't have a booth. (There were 3 available in the back) we asked about those and they said they weren't seating anyone there. So they seated us at the table right at the front by the cash register and sushi bar. Throughout our time there they sat people in all 3 booths. One opened up and we asked if we could move there. She said no because we already ordered and we have to before we order. We said there isn't many people here, can't you just bring our food there or can we move once our food comes to the table? She wouldn't let us. 

When ordering, she kept reminding me that I couldn't eat off their buffet because I chose not to do the buffet because I wasn't that hungry....which is annoying to assume that I would. This also made me think this is why they wouldn't let us sit in the booths in the back. 

The food was just okay. They messed up our order a few times and she would bring and say "___ doesn't have this or that, can you guys just share it?" instead of taking it back and fixing it, she would try to have the other girl doing the buffet eat it. They definitely did not have any care for customer wants. I will never go back here.

Good God I ate it all. Success!!

I was warned about being able to finish what you order else you pay for what you can't finish!!!

So I paced myself and only small sips of water and I did it!

Everything we ordered was a hit except for the Sapporo roll. Too much ginger.

This includes appetizers and soup too!!!!

The reviews are right though- it's a LONG wait. We waited half hour to be seated and about another hour until our orders came out.  So don't fill up on water waiting!!

I ordered the following rolls shown below- torch roll, mango Tokyo roll, crazy maki, yellowtail sashimi and sea bass...honestly I can't even name them all.  Def worth the money and we easily at $100 worth of sushi for $20 each!

Not bad. Too much rice, not enough fish. Not great service; food came relatively quickly but long time before anyone checked back to see if I needed anything (I did), was missing anything (I was), or if I wanted anything else (I did.) Eel was delish. Hostess was exceptionally nice and friendly.
Service was ok, sushi was great!

I originally was not a huge fan of sushi. But, in coming here for a few date nights/grabbing a bite to eat before a movie, I got hooked. The service was quick, the food was good(I'm a fan of anything spicy so - a lot of the spicy rolls are my go to), and it was fairly priced. The one downside, which, I can see with it being as busy as it was...I was out with a guest, she ordered edamame and, after we got all our rolls, the edamame still never showed up.

"I'm going to eat all the things." 

On my dude-date with Andres D, last week, we did just that thanks to Sushi City's all you can eat for $20 policy. Was it the best or freshest sushi? No. Not even close, but it was decent and a few rolls were downright outstanding and and totally made it worth the trip and set me up for what I know will be repeat visits... hopefully also with Andres D, because as far as appetite goes, we're a good ass match.

Also worth noting is that the $20 AYCE sushi doesn't just go for the sushi, it's the whole menu. Any roll, maki, nigiri, sashimi, etc +  edamame and rangoon and all apps count towards A total steal, but that's not even the best part- you can get all the miso soup your little heart desires... and my little heart desires a sh*t ton. 

When doing Sushi City, you MUST get the Torch Dragon Roll. It's hands down, world's above the rest. One of the better sushi rolls I've had in my nominal time as a sushi connoisseur. The char flavor had me going back or bite until my gut just about burst.

Another notable, the Blue Sky made with blueberry mayo. Flavor was good, not great, but the presentation was what killed it... in a good way (like phat, not fat). Defo check out those pics. 

I feel like seeing is believing, so just check out the snaps of The Great Andres & Candice Eat-a-thon of 2012 and let your gubber guide you to greatness... and by greatness I do mean quantity, which sometimes, the stomach prefers over quality. And anyone else who's ever gone to a fancy seafood restaurant and paid several hundred dollars for food that was exquisite, but left you hankering for a cheesy beef from Portillo's after knows what I'm talking about.   

And I just want to say it one more time, to show my appreciation- AMEN FOR ENDLESS MISO!
This place is amazing! All You Can Eat for $20 - heck ya! Not only is the price amazing, but the service is great, the sushi tastes awesome, and their bathrooms are always clean.

This is my all time favorite sushi buffet. It is located in a big shopping plaza, so there are tons of parking. You usually don't have to make reservations or wait when coming here, which is a plus. However, the last time I came, which was this past Saturday around 7pm, the place was packed, but we were seated right away. I don't know if it is just this time, but we usually come during weekday and weekend at this time and it has never been this packed. Maybe everyone is beginning to find this place good!

The sushi selection on their buffet is decent size. The selection isn't as big as House of Sushi, but the quality is a little better. The appetizers here are really really good. We normally get tons of sui mai, gyoza, ika salad, seaweed salad, and sesame balls. For the rolls, the Torched Dragon is by far my favorite roll here. This is under the special menu which is written on the board there, or you can simply ask them about their special menu. Other rolls that are good are Hi Way, Spicy Shrimp, Godzilla, Spider, Unagi, and Jojo (another special menu item). They also have nigiri which is really good and fresh as well.

I love coming to this place because I never have to worry about parking and I never have to wait at any time that I have came here so far. Although I live in the city, which is a 30 minute drive, I still find myself coming here vs. other sushi buffets in the city that is around me.

Agree with what everyone said about little fish and a lot of rice.  These guys are stingy won't be back.  Felt like I went to an all you can eat rice restaurant for 20$ including tax and tip.  This place sucks.  You've been warned!  

For all those ppl giving this place 5 stars, you need to get out more and try real sushi in Chicago.  There isn't much competition for sushi in the area so they can get by with subpar fish and sushi.  

Try ko sushi on weber and boughton road for all you can eat at 19.99.  Rolls are good and they don't try to pack rice and skim you on the fish.  There are other options you just need to find them out.
While the sushi is pretty dependable, the service is not. Expect to have the wait staff ignore your needs as they flagrantly walk past you oblivious to their tables.

TL;DR- If you're in a large group and want to try out many different things, this is a place to go, for the price.  But if you're looking for a date night spot, might want to try someplace else.  (For that, I recommend Hokkai [AYCE] in Glen Ellyn)

We went based on a recommendation and having wanted to try a new AYCE sushi place.  When we arrived, we were seated quite quickly.  The interior was nicer than I anticipated.  They have boxed lamps on the ceiling, which looks really nice.  There was very little people there, maybe 10 other people in total.  We went to order and after placing our first order the waiter made sure that I had chosen the right roll from House Specials, because one side is included in it, the others are not.  I changed it and our apps and our sushi came out pretty quickly.  

The croquettes were fantastic, as was the coconut shrimp and the sauce that it came with.  The rolls however, were a different story. We ordered the Downer's Grove and the Godzilla Roll and the Crazy Maki.  While they lived up to their giant name, they came apart far too easily when picked up.  I feel like they weren't rolled well enough or the rice just wasn't sticky enough.  The quality was alright, about what you'd expect from most AYCE.  We barely finished all three rolls before we were full. 

The one downside is the service after serving us.  I say that because no one came to refill our water, we had to explicitly ask someone to come and refill our water.  Then they messed up someone's order and delivered another coconut shrimp to our table.  When we informed them we didn't order it, they looked at us puzzled.  They didn't even ask if we wanted to go for a second round.  (WE didn't, but that's not the point).

  The service was less than ideal, but the food was alright.

First of all, I would like to point out how ridiculous the name is. It's so easy to mess up the pronunciation whether you say it with a slow or quick pace. Sushi City.....Sushi City.....Sushi S*itty..... Excuse me for such vulgar language but the sushi quality was in fact along those lines. 

It was a dinner for four on a Sunday evening at 7:00pm. There were a total of three tables including ours. With all the hype from my fellow FB friends, this definitely didn't feel right. But enough with the hesitation, we proceeded to ordering: miso soup, edamame, shumai, goyza, seaweed salad, tako su, sake sushi, tobiko sushi, ika sushi, tako sushi, unagi sushi, hokigai sushi, and dragon makimono. We ordered at least three rounds of food and it was enough to feed a village. 

The appetizers were much more appealing. I could've spent my whole dinner chowing on the tako su and seaweed salad. The texture and quality were on par as was the portions. I particularly liked how the tako su had a hint of vinegar. The sushi was mediocre at best. They were more than generous with the rice. I imagined they took one huge chunk and squeezed it tight enough that you couldn't even find a piece of rice in full form. The sashimi slices atop the rice weren't any flattering. They were sliced to paper-thin. 

The generosity of the rice balls will most likely stay as is. I just hope they'd lessen the amount of salt and rice wine vinegar with the sushi. On our way home, I was on the verge of passing out from thirst. I literally chugged one whole bottle of water the moment I arrived home. 

For $20/person, I think I can get the same "punishment" from the city from our fellow Para joints. In the meanwhile, any sushi buffet will be staying off my radar!

OMG! First of all the name should be changed to a Rice City. Nigiri and rolls alike are 25% fish and 75% rice.  The fish is just so so.  Nothing special.  And when I had 1 or 2 pieces of rice left on my plate, I was scolded like a child told I could not order additional sushi until I finished my rice.  I would give this place zero stars for the rude service
Unlimited sushi for $20 bucks, do I have to say anything else? Yeah the service is garbage and you dont know what theyre saying sometimes but $20.....

Came back here and was really disappointed. The food was still good but at the end, the rude waiter informed us that he was going to charge us extra because we had leftovers.  Between two of us, we literally had 2 small piece left from the 4 rolls we ordered.  The fact is that we didn't want to overstuff ourselves and this jerk wanted to charge us because of it!  We didn't over order or take advantage of the all you can eat...   What a pathetic joke!  My husband and I could have become extremely loyal and ongoing customers since we live so close but we won't be.  The waiter was so pushy and insistent!!!   My husband eventually said "fine charge the $2" but truthfully, is your business so sad that you need to charge $2 extra?   Moreover, is that lousy $2 worth losing our business?  I'd say that was a bad move.

This is my sushi Sunday place. Great selection of rolls and appetizers on the AYCE menu. Tasty. Tried some of the specialty rolls. I don't like the butane-ish taste on the Torched Dragon, but liked the insides. I'm going to see if we can get the roll without the torchiness. The service is good, and now that my friend and I have been back so often, they are beginning to recognize us and give us "our table." Going back really soon!

A great choice for affordable, quality sushi. :) Sushi City is best known for their all-you-can-eat lunch and dinner buffet options. Everything is fresh made-to-order and included is a wonderful, plentiful and great quality selection of food. By far the best all-you-can-eat sushi place in the Western suburbs of Chicago. Great service and ambiance as well.

*A note about the service: With word of mouth spreading about this place, it has gotten considerably busier. The service does their very best to handle it and doesn't deserve all the flack they get.

*A note about food quality: It's great quality food, very delicious! However, some people like to complain about the amount of rice and fish... the food is absolutely wonderful and overly-picky people with unrealistically high expectations have certainly tarnished its reputation. Each roll is hand-crafted with freshly-cooked premium white jasmine rice and the freshest fish in the suburbs.

Great options for non-sushi eaters, such as tasty dinner entrees and noodles. Vegetarian and vegan friendly as well! Definitely worth a visit!

OH HEY UNLIMITED SUSHI FOR $20, YOU'VE GOT YOURSELF A FAN!

And to my surprise, this amazing deal doesn't just apply to sushi but with appetizers and such.  But for real, why go with filler when you can get all killer, right?!?! haha. That being said, the Torched Dragon and Blue Sky signature rolls are what you need.  These sealed the deal for me. 

The only complaint I have about Sushi City is that the service is sooooo sloooow.... Don't come here if you're in a rush or get impatient easily.  I typically would write off a place that had "eh" service, such as this, but seriously, I cannot find a better deal with some fairly creative and delicious sushi!  :D

Okay, went back here on a week day for lunch and it was not nearly as packed as the first time I came on a weekend for dinner.  So, lunch AYCE was something like $15, I can't remember.  Even if you come in time for the lunch hours you can still upgrade to the dinner menu for $20.  So if that's your thing, go for it.  The dinner menu definitely has much more options and you can choose from the signature roll menu too, but we opted for the lunch menu.

I think I can speak more for the sushi than I was able to in my first review because I was more or less calm when I went there the 2nd time.  The sushi was good, not the freshest, but really, we're in the burbs so I'll let it pass.  Service was more attentive this time around, probably since it was less chaotic.

Ugh... Was such a good vegan until my fiancees birthday dinner. I guess I can write more reviews as I have more dining options until I buckle down again.

Sushi City. Unlike my yelp bud, Derrick T. I enjoyed this place. I know he compared this place to Sushi Para and his review was a few years back so maybe at that point in time the 2 stars was warranted. For myself, I would say Sushi City is a good 4 stars. Sushi Para has gone down in quality and I thought the rolls at Sushi City to be good for AYCE sushi.

Although we came during lunch we did the dinner AYCE option to order some of the specialty rolls. Not going to name all the sushi we ordered, but we only had one miss and that was the blueberry mayo one. Avoid that and all should be well. 

Oh and avoid the fried stuff like the tempura as those were really greasy when we went. For the price though, still quite happy with the meal here!
My gf and I eat here all the time  Good sushi, price, and service. We love the all you can eat price and it's close to home. Yet to have a bad experience here. Highly recommended

Has someone made the "Sushi Shitty" South Park joke yet? :P  

For about $20, you can get all-you-can-eat sushi that includes many special-made rolls.  I stuffed myself with what I considered to be good, not amazing, sushi, but it was certainly not as horrible as recent reviews of this place have been.

I've only been to this place once because my family took me here while I was visiting.  It was right after the lunch rush, so I didn't experience any long waits, and the food seemed acceptably fresh.

Food: 4
Service: 5
Ambiance: 4 
Value: 5
TL;DR: Great all-you-can-eat deal!

Honestly, the best all you can eat sushi place I have ever been to. The fish was fresh, the rolls were not stuffed with rice, and you get the entire sushi (and appetizer) menu!

Just beware, the rolls are HUGE!

I went for a Sunday lunch hoping for the $15.99 deal...but was told you pay the dinner price ($19.99) all day on Saturday and Sunday. 

I definitely plan on coming back, just maybe for a weekday lunch!

Sushi city strikes again , I seriously love this place . As soon as I walk in with my fiancé we got greeted as if we were family.  The waitress didn't even bother asking what we want becuz she memorized what we order:-) I love coming here for many reasons , clean , not pricey , great customer service and awesome sushi . The Mexican roll is one of the best rolls here . Also the downers grove roll these are the 2 rolls I strongly recommend .

All you can eat sushi is great! The service is not good! I only go there for the food. If your in a hurry, do not come here. It will take a while for service! The assortment of appetizers are great as shown in my pictures below. The main sushi menu has a lot of sushi rolls with cream cheese I noticed. The menu picture below lists the different type of rolls. It takes time for service with the waiter and getting your food on time. They lag in that area! The rolls tastes great! Make sure you finish your sushi or they will charge you for left overs!

I have eaten at sushi city about a dozen times with three other larger appetite folks (just like meh), always the AYCE with just water. I have never gotten more than half way down my glass of water before having it quickly shoshed full of filtered ice water. I have had many of ever single selections on the ayce menu and several from the regular menu. They are one of the only sushi places to serve my fav. super white tuna...remember to be careful with this "colon blow fish" and if you don't know, gurgle it. This has a wonderful oily taste, but have more than a few cuts of this fish actually called "escolar" and you will feel like John Candy on Xenical. 

Anyhoo, yes, it can take a while to make the food. There are two little sushi chefs behind the counter. So yes, order lots of stuff. BTW if you watch them, they are actually quite quick with those pointy razor sharp knives. I would imagine you would not want to piss them off and damper that quiet Asian smile they always seem to have. I could just imagine someone trying to rob the place and get made into a bunch of sushi. Heh. "Twy our new, fresh convict sashimi, so very sowwy, no burglar maki roll left" Uh so yeah, don't order a single stinking roll, eat it and then another. Just order a bunch of stuff. I have pulled rolls apart and left a cup of rice and seaweed on my plate and the wait staff just cleared the plates and brought clean ones without a word. 

That being said, yes of course thy want you to eat all the rice...which is good, well cooked ahort grain rice btw....but if you have a few bites that you don't want, just put it in your napkin or something. Jeez. I didn't find this out of proportion. You know,  eating sushi actually means eating rice, yeah?

So the Miso is salty,... it is cooked down for hours. Nobody wants it. That is just stuff that comes for free when you go eat expensive sushi by the roll. The best is the fresh shrimp dumplings and pot stickers....whatever they are called. Order three orders for each dude...trust me they are small. All the other fish was pretty top shelf. Of course I am spoiled because I eat sushi in New England where the fish is still wriggling around a little when you eat it because you just chose it while it was still swimming around and watched a sushi master slaughter it before your eyes.

It was kind of fun being the largest four people In the place. The people of Wal-mart does not hold a candle to me and my boys. The 90 lb Asian waitress looked at us like we were going to dip her in wasabi and eat her. But despite our ordering literally about what would have been $150 in sushi for our first order, the staff didn't bat an eye. They didn't lecture us about leaving left overs or some stupid rules. Yes, we ate a lot. No, it was not the top flight sushi you could pay $7.50 for two little cuts for. But it was flavorful and plentiful and it is sashimi grade fish. The place was decorated with simple minimalist design. There was plenty of sake choices if that is your thing....hot alcohol, not my thing. The subsequent orders did not really take that long at all. 

It was really fun to re- order and eat the same $150 quantity of the same thing three more times and eat every bit of it. Again, no one bitched or recited stupid rules to us. The 90lb Asian waitress actually seemed either impressed, or disgusted. Either way, we were pretty happy and tipped her a twenty.

FINALLY made it in and I am so glad I did!! My friend has been raving to me about this place so when my daughter and I were in the area we stopped in for lunch! 

It was quickly approaching nap time so I decided to get out order to go. I ordered the turkey spin-art with chips and a pickle for myself. My daughter got the kids menu grilled cheese which comes with apples sauce and chocolate milk. I also grabbed a turtle jar and a chocolate chip jar. Everyone in the store is so friendly. I really enjoyed that! 

When we got home I expected the sandwiches to be soggy as someone stated in another review. No way! They held up perfectly. The turkey spin-art was so good. I will definitely be back for that. My three year old is the pickiest eater and she ate 3/4 of that grilled cheese. There is something to be said about that for sure. 

But the jar was really where I was impressed. The cheesecake was the perfect consistency. I didn't think the crust was crumbly at all. It was perfect. As I lay on the couch right now with the cheesecake-sweats all I can think about is how my husbands chocolate chip jar is in the fridge... 

If you are local get yourself over there. It's a much better alternative to the fast food that's all over the area. I love supporting small business and this one rocks!

Small town deliciousness. Tried their panini sandwich and it was good. Finished off with a cheesecake jar which was awesome. Support the small businesses in Plainfield. 

I also enjoyed the customer service I this place. Nice people and a clean restaurant is always a welcome sight.

What a place!
My wife has been here many times before during weekday hours for lunch, and absolutely raves about it.  We went here for lunch on a Saturday. 
I was expecting it to be like a bakery, but I was pleasantly surprised.  It is set up like a deli, but with a more upscale feel. Plenty of seating inside and out. Order at the counter and they bring the food to you. You can help yourself to a can of soda or other drinks, and they have a case for their cheesecake jars.
The menu is pretty descent. Mostly panini and other sandwiches. All of them sounded great, but I tried Kelli's Grilled Cheese. It was a panini with two cheeses and sliced tomato. Excellent!  Choice of sides, but I was simple with chips and a pickle. There is a good kids menu here. My son had a grilled cheese also. I tried it, and it was pretty good. His side was homemade apple sauce. I could probably eat it with every one of my meals.  
My wife got a cherry cheesecake jar for after our meal. I tried a bit of it, and wow!  I'm not a cheesecake fan, but this was one of the best I've ever had. My toddler son tried it as well, and he actually wouldn't let us have any more. 
The food was great, and inexpensive. There are plenty of choices here, so probably anyone can go here and find something to eat, including picky toddlers.  The staff was very good as well. Everyone smiles and they are very social.  It is a very comfortable atmosphere as soon as you walk in the door. 
I will definitely be returning.

I really like that the cheesecake store is a family run place. It just feels cozy. The food itself is simple, wholesome and tastes delicious. I like the small details around the place that reminds me that this is a small business. I see changes almost every time I go, some big, some small but a good business owner never stops trying to improve their customer's experience. Now on to the cheesecake. Damn it, I love it! It's so rich and creamy and perfect.
