My hubby wishes that there was more crust possibly in a cheesecake, crust, cheesecake crust layers but I cannot at all discriminate because I love the creaminess the most. Their service has always been really good. Their staff is friendly, attentive and the restaurant is clean and uncluttered. Overall, my experiences are always positive, give them a try!

Had coffee and cheesecake here with a friend the other night and really enjoyed the cheesecake.  I had the salted caramel one and thought that the caramel was the best I've ever had.  if that thing was sold by the jar, I would definitely be buying lots of it.  The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was the taste and amount of the graham cracker crust.  I found it to be a bit too dry and too much for my liking.  Also, there wasn't much selection left by 6pm on a weeknight...guess that is a sign of how popular the place is.  All the employees were very friendly and the place was super clean.  Would love to try some of the other flavors next time.

Where to start? Well they are always smiling and very welcoming upon entering. The menu is not huge but has interesting selections that are considered uncommon. Gr8! I love unusual & different. Ive now tried several wraps & several panini's and have concluded that Mr Buresh KNOWS how to assemble a menu. All of these items are 5 star quality.  
 The service is always top shelf & reliable. My new fav is the Kung fu tuna wrap. Spinach wrap with a delightful serving of tuna w/ a kick, cucumbers, fresh ruffage! Amazing taste! And that leads us to the star of the store, the cheesecake in a mason jar. I finally got to try some today. Boy was it amazing! I usually show up late like 7 pm and all the cheesecake jars are sold out. Had the cherry amaretto. today. Luscious! Many ideas for new flavors.
Cheesecake prices are high, but well worth it!!!  Sandwiches are actually a bargain considering what you get and the quality of food being put out.  Do stop!
5 stars & I dont give them out often.

I stopped in yesterday for the 1st time.  I got 2 cheesecake jars, strawberry & chocolate chip!  They were delicious!  I love cheesecake that is creamy with a tang!  I let them sit out for about 45 min so they were not so cold.  I also ordered the goat cheese salad minus the goat cheese but they did substitute it for sliced mozzarella.  Their citrus vinaigrette was the bomb!  I only wish the salad was bigger lol!!  I will be visiting again soon!!
I hate cheesecake, but my GF loves it so we went there and it was actually really good. It's a small town place, but definitely worth it. Check it out!

Had the maple bacon cheesecake in a jar.

Great flavor, texture, and concept. 

And for the Yelpers complaining about high prices....imagine trying to make a living AND paying a store-lease from selling small jars of cheesecake. Their pricing seems fair and obvious to me. 

Definitely will be back.

Came here from a word of mouth recommendation since I work near the area and I'm tired of going to Jewel for cheap chicken. This place is my new go to for a fresh light lunch that's near guiltless if you have the will to refrain from the cheesecake. Which I'm not sure I can comment on yet because I have left and I'm staring right at the cooler full of their jars full of cheesecake, yes the slices are in mason jars.

What a unique business! I'd had my eye on SB's Cheesecake Store for quite some time, and when I finally visited, I was pretty pumped. Mini mason jars? Filled with cheesecake?! Totes adorbs! I've been several times, and here are my pointers:

Cheesecake: Reader beware - not all cheesecake is created equal. I've had very flavorful cheesecake here, and I've had very bland. This is much of the reason I've only marked three stars - no consistency. Some of the flavors I've picked have been wildly disappointing. However, this won't stop me from continuing to try out new flavors. 

Food: Pass. This is the other main reason that I docked stars. We were here to pick up a bunch of cheesecake jars around lunchtime on a Saturday. We always try to support local businesses, so thought we'd give the food a try. We ordered carry-out, because the restaurant only has a few tables and they were all taken. We're also only two minutes away. By the time we arrived at home, my panini (which the person behind the counter recommended) couldn't be lifted up, as it was completely soggy and falling apart. The lobster bisque (which other reviewers raved about) was lacking the lobster and was heavy on the cream. As my husband put it, "this isn't anything I couldn't make at home". Another wild disappointment.

Deals: If you return your mason jars, you get $.50 off your next purchase - and you can combine them! Since I've purchased for two small family parties, I have enough to redeem for several free items. I'll do my best to pick out some great items, but if flavor is lacking again, this may be the last time we visit.
One of our favorite places in Plainfield for a quick lunch or dinner. Their food is reasonably priced and yummy. The bonus is the cheesecake lives up to the hype.

I was SUPER excited to try this place after following their Facebook page and reading the reviews here.

The cheesecake in the jars is a great idea! I have zero complaints about portable cheesecake! I tried the key lime and the cherry cheesecake.  The cheesecakes were OK, they could have been more flavorful and the texture is not what I expected.  It was more like a very thick custard, than a cheesecake-like texture.  Which is fine, just not what I expected.

I tried the lobster bisque which was also OK. Again, not much flavor and very little lobster. To me it tasted very similar to the lobster bisque they sell at Mariano's.

Then, I tried the Reuben panini. This was pretty tasty! The slaw instead of sauerkraut was a really nice touch! Also really liked the hummus as a side.

The restaurant itself is clean and very nicely decorated. The staff was so friendly!!! I'd really like to try the cheesecake ice cream, so I'll probably be back.

Steve recently started offering some of his graham cracker crust in a cup and I was finally able to get into the shop to grab some. GAME CHANGER!! We throughly enjoyed our large jars last night (that were supposed to be dessert for Valentine's Day, oops) with our extra "crust". Keep up the great work Steve!!
Their caramel sauce has crack in it. It's phenomenal. It goes without saying that the cheesecake is amazing. Go get a jar or 12.

So first time here came with my family. The employees are so nice! This is what every business should be like! Family atmosphere great food employees take pride in! You can feel the pride resonating in all they do here! All the food that we had was delicious! Cheese cakes are awesome! So good! You need to try it!

Love, love, love this place!  Just wish it were located in Edison Park instead of Plainfield :)  Luckily my friend lives in Plainfield and brings the cheesecakes in a jar to me almost everytime I see her (she really is a great friend!!).  My favorites have been cake batter, turtle, and chocolate chip.  This weekend I was finally able to visit the cafe with her and I tried the Steve's Red Light panini, which was sooo good!!!  I can't wait to make it out there again, so I can try one of the salads or wraps next.

This is definitely a good place for lunch. I'm lactose intolerant and have dairy from time to time and the cheesecake in a jars here are great! I'm glad that this restaurant is in the suburbs and the cheesecakes are made daily. The staff is very friendly and kind too.

This place is excellent. I highly recommend stopping by for a try. I had half of a turkey bacon panini which was solid, and the kung fu tuna wrap, which was excellent. The tuna was one of the best tuna items Ive ever had. Great blend of flavor n texture. It is very crisp n fresh tasting. The hummus side was very good. They provide free flavored water infused with fresh fruit. I am going to order some cheesecake in jars to go, so I will have to update my review. The owners are extremely nice and welcoming. It is very clean inside. I need to find my way over here again.

First timer here, after following them on Facebook for months! A friend of mine is obsessed, and I had been meaning to try it, but whenever I had been out that way, the store would be closed. Finally made it out there on New Year's Eve, and danggggg did it smell heavenly in there! Next time, I plan to bring my husband back to try their sandwiches and salads. I got 4 jars of cheesecake for us to split and try- all of them delicious! We got Turtle, Cookies and Cream, Vanilla Bean, and Gingerbread(my least fav out of the 4- it was too "spicy" of a ginger flavor).

I do have a suggestion though! They should offer cheesecake parfaits- layers of cheesecake filling w/ the crust in between. The crust was the best part, and just not enough IMO!!

There was a young girl(maybe 10?) running the cash register. I'm assuming she's the owner's daughter. But she was pleasant and did a great job too.

Will definitely be back.

Came from Texas to visit relatives and stopped in. Sandwiches were fresh and delishious. The salads were also amazing and fresh. But the highlight is the cheesecake in a jar, you won't find a better and more delishious. The ice cream pushpops are great for the kids. Overall a great place for lunch, dinner or desert!
I like this little place... Their turkey panini sandwich was delicious and their cheese cake in a jar is so good!

Use a looonnggggg tea spoon to truly enjoy it. My absolute favorite is turtle cheesecake. Ivwas blown away when he made girl scout cookie cheesecake. I didnt fall in love with it but i was so supper impressed that he supported a local troop!! The pace has a warm mom and pop feel. With a hint of hippy/tree hugger/ burkenstock its just awesome!!!

Went here recently for lunch.
GREAT food! Really good cheesecake! (Love that they come in a jar)
Charming atmosphere.
Friendly staff!
I would love to see more flavors offered in the small size cheese cake.
Will definitely be visiting again!!!

It always makes me happy to see something different open in the suburbs, especially in Plainfield, where the main drags are filled with chain restaurants.

The Cheesecake Store is in a new, mostly desolate, strip mall on Route 30 in Plainfield.  The area is mostly dotted with newer subdivisions.  Since it is so close to home, I couldn't resist checking this place out.

I was surprised that the Cheesecake Store has more than just cheesecake.  I was expecting a small bakery, but there's a full cafe inside with limited seating.  The menu consisted mostly of panini and salads, with some options for kids.  And this place really packs in the business - there wasn't a single open seat on Saturday afternoon.

The cheesecake is stored in the refrigerator case by the register.  Even though it was busy, there was still a nice variety of flavors available in both jar sizes.  Small jars are $3, and large jars are $5.  If you bring back a clean jar, you get 50 cents off of your next purchase.  

Small jars are perfect portions for one person, and I wanted to try two flavors, so I chose the Salted Caramel and the Key Lime - both in small jars.

I really liked the salted caramel, but the key lime wasn't very tangy or limey.  I do love cheesecake, but I didn't particularly like their graham cracker crust.  It was soggy and crumbly, probably from being under the moisture of the cheesecake and then sealed in a jar.

I would come back here for cheesecake cravings, especially since there isn't a Cheesecake Factory in the area, but I'm not quite at the point where I'm telling all of my friends in distant lands all about it.
Delicious!  I love the unique, fresh food and the cheesecake is to die for.  A bit pricey, but definitely worth it.

Amazing food, and CHEESECAKE...in a jar.
Fresh produce and Bread. This place is a must for a yummy lunch.

Will be back with hubby soon... His thing is cheese cake.

Awesome cheesecake.
Awesome food.
Awesome owner.

Fact: The cheesecake is so good that my two year old decided that Steve is Santa Claus. Steve looks nothing like Santa Claus.

Also, get the pb cheesecake jar.  Another nice thing is that you can get a smaller jar so that you're not tempted to eat toooo much. 

If you haven't tried this place yet, please do so immediately!

This little hidden gem offers the most delicious cheesecake. I stopped by the other day to pick up some tasty cheesecakes in a jar and opted to by a full salted carmel cheesecake instead. Steve, the "cheesecake expert" personally added the salted carmel to the cheesecake while I waited. 
Thanks Steve for allowing me to look like a rockstar with my guests. 
I suggest you give this cheesecake a try - I must warn you - it is deliciously addicting.

This place is amazing!!!! 

Cheesecake comes in a wide variety of flavors all are delicious. 

Clean facility, service is spot one! 

Food (other than the Cheesecake) sandwiches,paninis are fantastic. 


A must if in the area!!!!!

I tried The Cheesecake Store for the first time today- what a great experience!  I enjoyed the delicious cheesecake in a jar, but almost guilt-free as the hummus wrap I ordered was so healthy and full of quality ingredients. I will definitely go back- can't wait to try breakfast!!
Fantastic cheesecake and really good food. Nieghbor told me about this place and now I am hooked.

When I saw the reviews (and the name), I knew I wanted to try this place. Luckily enough, we found ourselves in the area and seized the opportunity. 

I was disappointed to see at noon they only had 3-4 varieties available. It seems to get the flavors you want, you better be here early. We picked the Salted Caramel and Turtle and set out. While checking out, I was surprised to find out they had only been open for 3 weeks. Those are amazing reviews to have after only three weeks! 

The salted caramel was great. The topping was delicious and the cheesecake is incredibly smooth. My only qualm is the amount of graham cracker crumb at the bottom. It's a thick layer and hard to get to in the first few bites. The turtle was OK, but not as good as the salted caramel. I wish we were able to get/try more but there wasn't much available. I feel that the prices are on point, and I want to make sure to recycle those jars.

We learned about this shop through word of mouth.  My co-workers and I tried it today for lunch.  Although this shop is smaller, I love the cozy ambiance.  The colors are darker greys and browns, the table tops for the holidays are decorated with simple holiday snow globes.  I ordered the Kung Fu Tuna Wrap which came with my choice of side(hummus and veggies.) The food is served on what we thought to be old china.  All of is compared it to items we remembered from our grandparents. This only adds to the charm.   

My food was fresh, so tasty(I ate it all), and perfectly portioned for the price.  I added to my mean a small cheesecake in a jar(cherry cheesecake).   I love my sweets.  I have a sweet tooth that never stops and I have now found my new love.   As it states in the history of the store on the shops wall, these are literally portable slices of cheesecake and taste like a thick perfectly sweet, not overpowering, New York cheesecake.   I think it is a great idea and I also like that if you return your mason jar(clean), you will receive a $.50 off when you next visit.   

I have found my new go to restaurant that provides everything I am looking for in comfort, taste and value, while being close to home.   I would highly recommend you give this place a try!!!

It's a great sign for a business when you arrive a few minutes before they open and find the parking lot full of other people doing the same thing. There were about five cars waiting for delicious cheesecake the day we went. 

My wife and I bought four jars of cheesecake and two orders of the lobster bisque to go. 

The owner, Steve, was very kind, welcoming and friendly. But the entire store smelled like burnt oil (or burnt something?). Not sure if that's normal, but even tho we were only there a few minutes we left with our clothes smelling of it. 

To be quite honest, our lobster bisque wasn't impressive. That burnt smell had permeated into the soup and it was rather unpleasant. There were only two tiny pieces of lobster in my whole bowl, and most of the contents were shallots (or onions? I can never tell the difference). 

The cheesecake jars were very nice. Creamy. Sweet. Smooth. I enjoyed them a great deal. The first one I ate wrong, and as I reached the bottom I was left with a 2-inch pile of graham cracker dust. The second one I had I tried to mix the crust in with my bites of cheesecake, but eating it from a jar is not really conducive to such a method and I was still left with a hard graham cracker dust crust when I was done. To be honest, I'd prefer either less crust or no crust at all. 

I understand the business started as a mobile cheesecake truck, so the jarred cheesecake concept makes sense. But now that there's a store I would have preferred slices. The jars are difficult to eat out of and I hate wasting them. Steve offers a $.50 discount on your next purchase for returning clean jars, but honestly it's kind of far and I probably won't be back so I had to toss them in the recycle bin. Sad. 

Overall, great cheesecake. Excellent service and friendliness. Not fond of the crust or jars. Didn't like the soup. It was fun to try but I probably wouldn't make the journey back.
Love their cheesecake jars! I wish they the "regular/common" cheesecake flavors daily. But regardless its all delicious.

These little jars of awesomeness can't be beat. The added bonus of getting a great sandwich or salad is the icing on the cheesecake. Every sandwich and salad I've had was amazingly good. The cheesecakes in a jar ...well what a great idea!
Cheesecake is so good it's sinful!

Like others before, I had a different expectation for the texture and taste of the cheesecake.  I had turtle, choc. chip, salted caramel, and peanut butter choc. chip.  The texture was creamy.  I was expecting a little more density.  The flavor of the cheesecake itself was mild and on the unsweetened side.  I prefer more sweetness and flavor in the cake.  Most of the flavor came from the mix-ins:  caramel, nuts, chocolate, etc. 

I would not go out of my way to get cheesecake from here, but I wouldn't say no to a small bite if someone else had some.

The only thing I have tried here so far is the cheesecake jars. While they were pretty good, it's a little bit impractical to serve them in mason jars. For one thing, there really is no crust, just a crust like crumble at the bottom of the jar. The problem with the jar concept is that you can't really get any bites of cheesecake with the crumble until you get almost to the bottom of the jar and that's all that's left. I didn't even bother eating it once I got to the bottom because I had already ate all the cheesecake, and who just wants plain crumble? I get that the mason jar thing is their gimmick in hopes of making their cheesecake stand out from the rest, but it would seem more economical for them to just sell slices of cheesecake instead of having to buy mason jars to put the cheesecake in. They do have an offer where they give you a percentage off your next purchase if you bring back the cleaned jars, so I guess that helps defer some of the cost of the jars. I do plan to go back to try the sandwiches as those looked really good, but I'd probably take them to go. The reason: the place has a strong odor of what smells like garlic when you walk in. It's so strong that I was still smelling it in my nose when I got home. It was very overwhelming. But besides all that I will try the sandwiches one day.

I came super excited to try the cheesecake when Steve first opened the place. He's a super funny guy and is very endearing on facebook. lol. So I was happy for him and wanted to show support. We got the turtle, salted caramel, key lime and chocolate chip cheesecakes in the jars. I was a little disappointed. Turtle is my most favorite flavor ever and it really didn't taste like much other than cheesecake, which I was surprised cause it had a lot of stuff on it. The key lime barely had any lime taste. I don't remember the chocolate chip, but the salted caramel was really good. The best out of all we tried. My husband agreed.
I had the hammy cheesy panini and it was by far the best panini I've ever eaten. I will definitely be going back.
Who doesn't love cheese cake in a jar, awesome food. And an amazing staff!  Steve had done a wonderful job building his legacy from the ground up. You will go down in history.
Wonderful food, hidden gem!  Cheesecake is wow!  Orange is surprisingly amazing!  People are helpful and so sweet!  The salads and pain is are magnificent!

Love to see someone build an empire where no one else has gone around here. The cheesecake is amazing and I am glad the portions in jars aren't too large because you would non stop eat it. Pricey at $6 for a large and $3 for a small so I would only treat myself here and there.

The paninis and salad items I would skip. Expensive and nothing you couldn't duplicate at home. The name doesn't make you think they have anything outside of cheesecake anyways so I only took off stars for the non cheesecake items.


A must visit for the cheesecakes. You will be hooked.

It is ok cheesecake  and I think over priced.
If you want a delicious cheese cake go to cheesecake by James in downtown  Joliet..... Yummy worth the trip and the money!!!!

The server was young and new, but came through with flying colors. Order arrived as specified,  quickly. This place was packed at lunch. Great food by great people at good prices. Great lunch stop.  Breakfast menu looks intriguing.

If you love trying something local this is the place. Providing an amazing atmosphere and hospitality.
The cheesecake is outstanding and there sandwhiches make me come back every other day.

The staff is wonderful. The cheesecake, we'll let me tell you this. I was brought up to share and be a gentleman. You touch my cheesecake jar, I will cut ya. Mine, mine, mine, all MINE!!!!!!!  Get your own. That being said I can't wait to try the soup and sandwich's.
Hooked! Delicious paninis and absolutely amazing cheesecakes! Doesn't get any better than Steve's. Support local!

It is about time I update my review for Steve, it has been a long time coming. My hubby, daughter, and I (or some combination of us) make a stop here nearly once a week. That is unusually for us as I like to change things up. 

That being said we have tried nearly everything on the menu and haven't been disappointed. We have 2 favorite cheesecake flavors, PB cup and Cake Batter. Yum!

I had finally had the chance to eat lunch here!  Steve's cheesecakes have graced my fridge and my company's luncheon more than a few times so I know I'm getting a great dessert.  But now it was time to try the food!  
Grown Up Panini with Jicama slaw-  Perfectly toasted panini with pesto, fresh tomato and a yummy piece of mozzarella . The cheese was not oily like other places sell, or dry and crackling.  It melted perfectly and was so smooth!  The slaw was cold, crunchy and lightly flavored with cider vinegar and cilantro among other flavors. So good! Like so good I had to pace myself!
Son had---Kung Fu Tuna Wrap with chips and a pickle
Great all white tuna flavored with a little kick!  The wrap was lightly toasted too! Very good!
Also for my son---Grilled cheese panini with side salad.  Cheese again was not oily like other well known places serve.  It melted so perfect I was tempted to snatch a bite! Side salad was a great mix of leafy goodness!
Ice cold lemon infused water free of charge was waiting and the staff was very friendly!
I will be back!!!
Topped it off with Cherry Amaretto and my son had the the same!

When you visit Steve will most likely be around.  Ask him anything!  He takes great pride in not only serving you great food but providing great service and food that is good for you!  Chef Logan is the bomb-diggity!!!  The staff is always friendly!  Service goes a long way but great food stays with you!  Definitely have to come back!

I would like to start by stating that I have watched Steve Buresh build his dream from nothing, to a cheesecake mobile and now to a brick and mortar store. It has been a wonderful thing to watch him grow and I admire him for enduring and overcoming all the obstacles it has taken him to succeed. 

My family and I had lunch on day at his store and thoroughly enjoyed the Lobster Bisque soup. It was homemade and divine! 

We also had his cheesecakes which as phenomenal.  

If you are looking for a cute cafe for lunch with the best cheesecake around, look no further.

Yummy...

Decided to check this out, my son and i really enjoyed the novelty of the cheesecake.

They have about 12 or so flavors written on their menu, food items like sandwiches and some soups.

The cheesecake come in a little mason jar type of thing, a big and small portion. It is reasonably priced and tasty.

The staff is nice and friendly. I look forward to coming in again!


#Cheers

2-6 oz cheesecakes  squished into a jar $11. Ouch! What does a whole cake cost? Wow I hope it's good. Ok so now that I've tried it I have to say it tasted old, my wife said maybe spoiled. To me it tasted like something I could have bought in the frozen section at Walmart. I won't be back.

Fresh sandwiches made with healthy items. The hummus is one of my favorites. The cheesecake jars are so FABULOUS!! My favorites are turtle, anything with PB, and salted caramel. The decor is great, filled with family history. Love the staff. They always have a smile on and willing to help make a new choice for lunch or dinner. Plus, they just started serving breakfast. So much better than those unhealthy fast food places. Please, stop by and give the Cheesecake store a try!!

this was our third time ordering and third time was diffinantely not the charm. we ordered the sampler and the mini cheese cakes were flavorless.  the caramel was watery and the fruit tasted old. we were all very disappointed. it's too bad because the other two times the cheesecakes were great.i do not believe I will go back.

I've been a fan of Steve's cheesecake ever since a friend brought me a turtle jar on a gloomy day. I was immediately hooked. 

And now he has a restaurant! My friend and I ventured out today for the first time, and it was everything I had hoped it would be. 

His new place is so cute and the staff is very welcoming. I had a delicious caprese panini with a salad and the salted caramel cheesecake. It was heaven in a jar!

The only downside is that my clothes smell kind of funky? Not sure what that's about, but for the amazing cheesecake, I'm willing to change my clothes! 

I bough two more jars to go, and can't wait to dig into them in the days to come!

SOOO good!!! My family and I came in for the first time today and were not disappointed!...I had the Mixed Berry cheesecake and it was delicious!!!...Dangerously so!!!...The only negative thing I would have to say would be that it is a bit pricey...for 3 large jars and 1 small jar it was over $20.....but for a once-in-awhile treat it goes without saying that we will be back!! :)
Wonderful food and cheesecake. Friendly staff. There is nothing negative to say about this place. This is my fifth time coming here and they get better every time.

A coworker arranged for a take-out lunch for us. SO good. The ingredients were super fresh (my salad tasted like summer...and it's January). The Panini was delicious too. The cheesecake jar? OMG. Heaven in a jar.

Must. Try.

My family and I took a trip here for a casual mid-week dinner and were pleasantly surprised. My husband had previously ordered a cheesecake for my birthday back in January and not only was it was delicious but was personalized for me on request.

When we came for dinner I had the All-Grown Up panini and it was very tasty! We left with a few jars of cheesecake and a personal check-in with Steve himself. He was super polite to my kids and wanted to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.

Very friendly staff, clean tables and tasty sandwiches. For the proximity alone and unique cheesecake presentation, I'd go back soon!

I stopped in for lunch today and it was great. I had the all grown up panini and my 4yr old had the grilled cheese. For desert we grabbed the egg Nog cheesecake jar. My panini was made way beyond my expectations and the flavors and ingredients were so fresh and good. The side salad with home made balsamic was a good size portion and the dressing was homemade. The daughter raved about the grilled cheese, I stole a bite and it defiantly deserved all the praise she was giving it! And we can't forgot about the cheesecake, my favorite is still salted Carmel but the eggnog was a nice Christmasy feeling treat for the day. 
The service was really friendly and so was the apmosphere. 
I'll defiantly be back!!

LOVE it! The staff is so friendly. Greeted by everyone when you walk in. Had the grown up panini, which was amazing. The hummus is to die for. It needs to be sold in a jar like the cheesecake! My daughter had the kids grilled cheese. She actually ate her whole sandwich before diving into anything else. Prices are reasonable. Try the cheesecake ice cream too! Steve's is the only cheesecake we will eat!

Saw reviews and had to give it a try. 
Bought four different kinds
-Oreo cookie
-Banana Pudding
-Salted caramel 
-Girl scout samoas 


By far the best was the Salted Caramel. The others were okay. 

Will take the empty jars back and get credit for a different flavor.

I went with a friend for lunch and found this restaurant to be charming and homey. The staff was friendly and helpful when I had a question. I ordered the Heavenly Hummus Wrap. It was full of fresh veggies and delicious  hummus and tasted...heavenly!  Even though the place was full, it didn't feel crowded and we didn't feel rushed. We resisted the cheesecake. but from the other reviews, I can't wait to go back and try a panini and a jar 'o chesse cake!
This place is great! I absolutely love it! The cheesecake is super good. It's a lunch must when I have friends in town!
If I could give more stars I would. This cafe is the absolute best. I have never been disappointed with any of the sandwiches I have tried and the cheesecake is amazing!!!!!!

I just tried this place for the first time, and now I'm hooked.  Made to order sandwiches, homemade soup, fresh salads with homemade dressings, and To-Die-For cheesecakes in mason jars!  The price is much less than you would pay at a chain restaurant like Panera Bread, and the quality and amount of food is so much better.  Great for lunch, and there is a kid's menu also. 5 Stars!
The food was pretty good but Steve is hilarious on Plainfield area sale making fun of all the crazy people!!! That in it self will make me keep buying his cheesecake!!

Love this place! I kept hearing about how amazing the cheesecake was, so when I actually got some I was amazed! Very good cheesecake and the women working were wonderful and cheerful! I had an amazing experience and will be returning!
Its so good! The white chocolate raspberry cheesecake is amazing. Their hummus is homemade they said and also so good! Definitely going back.

Amazing cheesecake! My favorite is the turtle, but every one I've tried has been delicious! The food is great too. Good, healthy, natural food at a fair price. I love that it's a small shop, ran by Steve (the owner), his friendly staff and his family! Highly recommend!
Stopped by there today and met some cool people. The customer service was awesome and the salted caramel cheesecake was amazing.

After some co-workers were treated to some cheesecake jars the day before, I had to stop in and check it out for myself!  I stopped just before closing and picked up a variety of flavors that were left from the day. We've only split one so far, but my man-friend kept trying to stab me with the spoon to keep me away from the chocolate chip cheesecake. Tasted great!  We will be back!

I have ordered here for Thanksgiving and Christmas. Both times the cheesecake was awesome! Everyone who tried it was impressed! Much cheaper then some other places. $30 for a 9 inch super thick cheesecake is a steal.  All his flavors are $30, I know at other places like Eli's your paying $35- $60 for the same size cheesecake.  Great job Steve.

I found out about this place through a coworker who was hesitant to even give me the name because he was so worried about too many people discovering it and eating up all of the cheesecake! So far I have only had the jars of cheesecake, only because I haven't found an excuse yet to buy an entire cheesecake. I have tried the white chocolate raspberry, strawberry chocolate, turtle, and vanilla bean - all were delicious! I look forward to trying the rest of the flavors!

I've always been a HUGE cheesecake person BUT.....I have never known real cheesecake until I tried Steves!! Life changing little jars! And his food is fantastic! My favorite jar flavor (currently) is the tres leches!  & I highly recommend the all grown up panini or the Kung fu tuna wrap (amazing!) the staff is just awesome! I love that I can always stop in and be welcomed by great people!

Love this cheesecake. Have tried a few flavors of the jars (turtle, pb cup, white choc raspberry, vanilla bean, and cherry amaretto) and all were amazing. I also brought a fresh strawberry large cheesecake for my MIL for her birthday and it was a huge hit. Food is good as well. Some may say it's a little "pricey" but for quality ingredients and knowing you aren't eating artifical stuff, it's priced good !!

I went to check this place out today, and I'm so glad I did! Steve was very nice and helpful with explaining the jars and everything. All of the employees were very friendly as well. I am a total cheesecake snob, and this cheesecake was some of the best I have ever tried. I got the salted caramel one, and there was a delicious layer of salted caramel on top. My mother had the strawberry one, and also had great things to say. I cannot wait to go back!

Steve's got a great business model: put cheesecake in your store name and they will come....and they definitely do come!! Steve's cheesecake has garnered a cult-like following so expect to wait in line which is usually a good sign and is because the cheesecake and food is fantastic!
Good food and cheesecake :) a little on expensive side but all in all ok if your trying to grab something quick.

Yummy! Love the fresh sandwiches! Love the fresh salad! Love the fresh soup! Love the fresh prices! Love the fresh rubber infused chickens! How about some fresh cheesecake! So far my favorite is the salted caramel. Going there today to try some more. Steve has a heart and care about what his customers think? Plus it's served with a side of humor :)

Really delicious.  We have eaten here a few times now and every time we go we find something else that's just delicious!   Not only are the cheesecake jars really yummy (technical term), but they are fun!  I truly feel that this is a family establishment and each time we go I see not only smiling adults, but also cheerful kids really enjoying their grub.  Here we are in the middle of Girl Scout Cookie sales and the owner not only invites those little sellers into his store, but also incorporates those loved flavors into some fantastic cheesecake.  Truly giving back to the community.  The Lobster Bisque is wonderful and the paninis are unique and tasty.  Everyone we have spoken to at the shop has been a pleasure.  We are looking forward to many more meals and dessert stops in our future.  Thanks for sharing your gift with us!
The cheese cake is the best I ever had. Eli's has some competition. Food is good. Soup is amazing. Service is good

The Cheesecake Store is delicious, welcoming and full of greatness!  The staff gets to know people by name and takes time with each customer.  The food is unique, made from scratch and very tasty!  Love the new ice cream they have!

I finally went here just for the cheese cake. I picked a turtle, chocolate chip, girl scout thin mint and vanilla bean. The turtle was good, the vanilla bean was good, so was the chocolate chip, and the girl scout thin mint. Everything was tasteful. Not overpowering by any means. I was expecting a little more mint in the thin mint but it was still good. I believe the small jars are only 3 oz. which was satisfying enough for me and I'm a fat dude! My wife who is always tracking calories gave in based on caloric measurements. She didn't feel guilty in the least and really enjoyed the turtle. I wish Steve, his family and staff all the best and hope he becomes as  successful as Buresh's lobster house was! I will be back!
I ordered 4 cheesecake jars to go today. OMG simply amazing!!!!! I had the Egg Nog cheesecake. I can't wait fort family to try the others!!! (If I can stay away until then!)

After rave reviews from several people, we went in for lunch today. The food was good. The service was fantastic. The place was super clean. The price point was perfect (2 kid meals and 1 adult meal w/drink was less than $13). I liked using real plates. I will definitely go back!

I have been here a few times. The cheesecake is good! Great idea and love the story behind the owner. Lately I have ordered Panini's and they have been very greasy and I am sad to see the prices going up. I feel you should get more in your salad for the prices. I do not feel that it is comparable to Panera.

Love the salted Carmel cheesecake and the tomato and mozzarella salad! I've also tried several different soups and have not been disappointed with any of them! I'm excited to see the summer menu items!
The cheesecake is amazing as well as the caprese salad.  We go to Steve's at least once a week.  Our goal is to try everything on the menu.  So far, everything we've tried has been awesome!
I'm so glad that I found out about this wonderful place! The cheesecake is amazing!! I bought a variety and EVERYONE was pleased! Can't wait to come back. :)
Great lunchtime place. Panini's are very good.  The lobster bisque is excellent here!

So, first of all this location is both a KFC and a Taco Bell.  I was starving, saw Taco Bell and my  'cheapness' kicked in.  I'd seen the 5 dollar box deal posted somewhere and I figured:

A.) I'm hungry and running errands 
B.) I needed something cheap 

Well I must say, I'm glad I went there, the 5 dollar box was more than I could eat at one time and it came with a drink.  They were pretty swift getting my order out and they even offered me sauces. 

My only compliment was the lack of a Thank You and the funky way you have to get into the drive thru.

The kfc side does not have a menu with pricing other than for meals. When I asked how much two different items were I caught an attitude. Very slow service as well. Too bad, used to love going to kfc.
This location is always slow!!! They are never friendly and the food was cold! I hate this place and will never go back again. Save your money

I have never been disrespected at a restaurant like I was this very evening at 7:45 pm at KFC.

I arrived to KFC at around 7:00 pm. I asked for two meals, before I was told that they are out of grilled chicken. When I asked how long it will take for them to grill a new batch, that same employee, who initially told me they do not have any available, changed her mind and said that they do have a few pieces left. I said fine. My wife was told to wait 2 minutes, yes 2 minutes for her order (regular fried chicken). The employee looked and sounded completely wasted and her eyes were extremely red, as if she were high on drugs (my assmuption, given the way she was talking and behaving). Still, I minded my own business and I said thank you and stepped aside.

My order arrived missing the side and my wife's order took over 25 minutes, not 2 minutes as we were initially told. During that time, I made more than 3 visits to the counter to ask about the status and that same employee constantly ignored me and forgot about the order. Finally, I went to her and expressed my concern and asked her to bring my food asap, because it was getting really frustrating to just sit and wait and be ignored. Her rude response to me was, "yeah, well I have been working since 5 am", even though that KFC opens at 10:00 AM. (As I was told later by the district manager)

So, I decided to speak to the manager, but there was non on duty. Then, I asked one of the other employees (a gentleman who was very nice and professional) to give me a phone number that I can call. He gave me the number of the district manager. I did call her on her number (779) 435-3442. I explained what happened and she was very surprised that there was no manager on duty, even though I never complained about that matter.

She was nice at first and while I was explaining to her about the issue, that same employee heard me as she was exiting the restaurant. I left the restaurant and did not accept getting a refund for the meals and started driving. Few minutes later, my phone rang and that same district manager started telling me that 3 "different" customers called her to say that I was screaming and swearing at the poor "high" employee and that it was all my fault.

She did not even allow me to speak and she hung up at me after telling me that I am not welcome at KFC and that she will give my number to the police.

My wife called her to explain to her that non of what she was told is true. I believe that the employee made her friends call and pretend to be customers after she heard me complain over the phone. However, instead of allowing my soft spoken wife to speak, again she shamelessly hung up in my wife's face and told her not to ever call again.

Now, I am a 44 year old professor at a very respectable school. The last thing I would do is swear and yell at a 16 year old girl who works at a KFC. The store had cameras all over it and one would expect that a district manager who manages 9 locations as she claimed, to at least investigate things before jumping into conclusions of that magnitude. 

I have kids with the same age group as this employee. It is outrageous for a manager to believe that "3 different" customers would call an unpublished number, that is only available upon special request and lie about what happened; (mind you that the store did not even have 3 customers at the time). The district manager insulted me, nsulted my wife and did not even give us the chance to speak. I was begging her to just let me talk and she would just not stop talking and hang up.  

I have travalled accross continents and have been always loyal to this chain and never in my life witnessed such attitude and behavior. It really is not about the food that was late and it is not about the teen ager cashier. It is about the principle and the customer's right and minimal respect. This behavior from a district manager is completely unacceptable.

I will never eat at any KFC again. I will make it my very mission to let as many people that I know, know about what happened, unless if that disrespectful district manager calls back (she knows my number) and listens to me and to my respectful wife and  appologize for her actions. Those many cameras at the store are not for decoration and should be used in such situations. It would have taken her 5 minutes to validate who is at fault instead of acting the way she did.

What a shame that a big brand like KFC would step down to this level and acuse customers of illogical lies. Absolutely disgraceful and insulting to even think about what happened.

Note: I did file a complaint through the KFC website and I did call the customer service center and spoke to someone about the matter. I am supposed to recieve a call very soon from the HQ and I will update this story based on how things progress.

Thank you.

District manager:

Shame on you and shame on who gave you that job.
Service is fast and the staff is friendly. Food is always fresh and delicious. I have no complaints on this location.

Very dissatisfied! My fiancee and I were super hungry craving some chicken came through the drive thru! Customer service! Awful! Person says give me a few minutes leaves us waiting to order in our car, then we get to the Window after finally ordering for the employee to say "We put everything away! And only have half your order" 
This place is ridiculous!  Hours state open till 11pm yet   they were shutting down at 9:40!
Food was awful! Ordered chicken strips what I got looked and tasted more like chicken jerky it was terrible. Never will I return here.

If you want Taco Bell this is not the spot to get it from. The taco bell menu is not made correctly. Our food looked thrown on a slab. Extremely messy entrees.
      The KFC is ok ic you have taste for chicken. There are some Taco Bells who take pride in providing quality menu item's. 

     This location has never made an order right. I will not order from their Taco Bell menu at all.
My kids do and they complain every time.

One of my favorite Mexican Restaurants ever. Food made fresh, even Margaritas use fresh squeezed juice. Pork dishes are excellent, Tacos great  (tried ground beef, shredded beef and chicken - difficult to decide which best). I usually prefer hot sauce, but their warm mild is great, especially with the home made chips.

Way pricey for what it is. The atmosphere is meh.  Very slow service and it's really not designed well for large crowd or a rush of people. Also the house margs were awful ...had way too much sour mix and were over priced. My tacos were ok. 
No kids menu either so with most entrees $12 and up a family of 5 will drop 100 for sure. First time in my life I tipped under 10% and thought that was generous.

Not bad food just VERY overly priced. I got the enchilada mexicanas meal and there was hardly any meat and way too much mole sauce. Heads up if you want guacamole on the side it's an extra 2.25 for a tiny cup. The waitress was really nice on the plus side. 
My husband had the longly tacos which were good but they are not longly they're shorty. And the beans are soupy.

Just finished lunch here with a party of 6.  Just before our food comes out, the owner wanders out and goes table to table to see how things are.  He arrives at our table and sees one member of our party has a "Love Trumps Hate" button on her purse.  He proceeds to tell us that he is voting for Trump because Hillary is "a liar and a crook."  I was dumbfounded.  He goes on and on spewing the hate normally found on far right wing blogs.  I have never seen a restaurant employee, much less THE OWNER, delve into an unsolicited political discussion with the patrons.  It left me with a serious case of indigestion.  So if you are on the far right politically, this is the place for you.  If you are not, be prepared for a political tirade with your Mexican food.
And very pricey for Mexican food lunch... two plates of tacos and two drinks came to $55 with tip.

This was the worst food, drink and service we've ever experienced. The sangria was awful. The food was not edible. We had to repeat our order many times. They never came back to check on the food until they were dropping the check and when we said the Burrito was a sloppy mess and we didn't like it, they didn't take it off the check. Yuk! Skip this place.

The food at this place is pretty good but be prepared for higher than normal prices for a small Mexican restaurant. The location is great, right across from the train station, but this part of downtown parking can be a hardship if you're coming by car. Why only 2 stars? its the lack of friendliness of the staff. Not only is it hard to catch their attention, but they get annoyed when you order more chips, always stressing that more chips are not free... even if you already know this fact because you can read.

we live in blue island il. and today we went to eat there. not the worst but not the best. the prices are very very overpriced.  the serviced could do better. if i am speaking spanish speak spanish back. The food was ok not the best the rice a little to dry and hard. and the beans not to authentic.  if we are ever around will definitely try something other the el zarape again

My brother and I went here in remembrance of our father passing away.  Our father loved tequila, and we wanted to do a shot in his honor with an extra shot on the table that was for him.  The manager let us do a shot at the bar in honor of our dad, gave us top shelf tequila, and comped it.  The meal was great, and the kindness was appreciated more than this yelp review can express.  

My brother and I are customers for life now.
Thank you.

So two starts is Meh, I've experienced better.  I would like to say that I have experienced better here before.  My most recent experience was not that good.  The food was really salty and covered in cheese, not in a good way.  The service wasn't very attentive and our server seemed not to understand what we actually ordered.

We walked out the last time we were there (like seven years ago) and never went back. Our 1 yr old grandson was crying and even though my daughter took him in the bathroom the owner came over and said the kid was disturbing others. He was a jerk. We walked out half way through the meal and left our food on the table and didn't pay. I thought my husband was going to punch his face in. My daughter was crying. It was awful. The diners around us were upset that he said that. We did give the server a cash tip on our way out though.

New to the area and trying out different restaurants in Wheaton. Food was delicious and the wait staff was top notch and very attentive. Nice touch that the owner, Ed, comes around for a brief chat with everyone. We were all really happy with our meal and will definitely return. Thanks for taking extra special care of our little blonde Colombian toddler with his own personal bowl of salsa. He LOVED it.

Kind of suprised after being here many times over the years , always good food, but walking in and waiting to be seated (Basically being ignored) was a little annoying.  Hostess was two feet away and never said a word, too busy to say "I will be with you in a moment"........I guess.    Can find pretty good Mexican food in many other places.    Like I said food was good, no doubt, waitress was great.

Better than front street.  Do yourself a
Favor and order the longy tacos. You will be happy all over

We love this place!  We have been going here for years!  Great food!  Fantastic service and cozy atmosphere!  We spent last Sunday watching Sunday football!  The owner is very friendly and we enjoyed spending the day, making new friends!  Their salsa (hot) is fantastic and I loved my Steak Chimichanga!!  Thank you for making our day special!!

Food was very bland, I had ground beef tacos. The small cheese quesadilla was good...I believe chihuahua cheese, but I can make that myself. 

They brought out the wrong enchiladas to one of the people in my party.

The margaritas was really tasty...but way too expensive for what they deliver. I used to come here when I was little and this was just a disappointment. 

Too costly for everything and no where near the quality I would expect for the price.
My wife and I love this place.  Quick service and quaint atmosphere.   Has a very authentic feel.

Amazing margaritas, authentic Mexican foods, and attentive service. Food is delicious and great value; not much variety but has all the classics you would expect. Atmosphere is very crowded on busy nights. The menu lists extra charges: a split-plate fee, refill limit on sodas (some sodas have one refill, others, such as Cherry Coke, have zero refills) and refill fees on chips.

I've had a lot of authentic Mexican food in my life. I must say the food is very good, and quite unique in comparison to other Mexican restaurants. It actually tastes closer to homemade food than anything else. I like the chile relleno and the cheese enchiladas. The refried beans are delicious, but as a warning to anyone who eats halal or kosher, I used to taste pork in it, though now I don't taste it anymore. It may be wise to ask if the refried beans have pork in them. The chips and salsa they give you are very good, though the "mild" salsa isn't spicy at all (possibly to suit the tastes of the inhabitants of central Wheaton). The only complaint I have is that I received my food a little cold once, but this is one out of at least 20 times that I've been here.

The service has always been very good and the manager has always been very polite and friendly. There's no time any waitress has been rude.

I'm not a huge fan of the price range, but what can you expect from a place in downtown Wheaton? Luckily, they do give you a lot of food. Unfortunately, this isn't your local taqueria, a lot of the dishes are set up to fit the tastes of central Wheaton (which has to be among the least culturally diverse Chicago suburbs).

The general ambiance is pretty nice. It's definitely a step-up from the other non-American restaurants in downtown Wheaton. It's also more pleasant than your typical taqueria, while still maintaining that Mexican feel, but it's not like being in one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. The one thing is that there is somewhat loud music at times, but this is no surprise to anyone who goes to Mexican restaurants frequently.

Overall, I've had great experiences and the food is definitely good. I definitely recommend this place.

Killer top shelf Margaritas. Chips are incredible and selection of 2(3 are available) salsas included. Food is good and plentiful . You won't be disappointed with portion or taste but they aren't reinventing the menu either. Good value!!

Get your credit card ready! Very nice
staff, good food, (wait on it) good salsa, chips, drinks....but wait till the bill comes!  We live and eat in Wheaton so its not cheap in general but this place is robbery. Sorry.

Last night my boyfriend and I tried for the very first time, El Zarape in downtown Wheaton. I have passed this place many times and really only thought it was a take out place but I was pleasantly surprised. There are several tables, about 15 so and it is so cozy! They serve complimentary chips and 2 types of salsa. I had the steak quesadilla dinner that came with rice and beans. My boyfriend had the enchiladas with mole sauce. Both were delicious! The service was wonderful and the food came out right away, served hot! The manager came around several times to check and see if everything was ok and it was a very nice touch. If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, give El Zarape a try. You will not be disappointed.

Quaint space downtown Wheaton adorned with colorful Mexican decorations. Received the usual chips and salsa when we sat down....came with a red salsa and another salsa (brownish-red) that was delicious!!! Ordered the combo (pick 2) and got a taco and enchilada. Came with beans and rice in the side for $11. It was a good portion and there was a lot to choose from the list. Also the service was FAST! Got our food 5 mins later. One downside,  the beer (tecate) was $5 for a can and the price wad not posted on the menu..so be careful!

My gal and I enjoyed dinner together here. I had a very tasty steak taco (reasonably priced and a excellent little serving of fresh salsa with it), as I was not very hungry. 

She had shrimp quesadilla and raved about it. And her rice and beans were tasty as well. 

They seem to make a lot of dough on th margarita, however. Mine was $10 and hers, with the special tequila , was $14. To high. Won't do that again !

Service was good and place was busy. I rate it as average to above average.

I'll start by saying that we eat Mexican food weekly in Glen Ellyn, at Santa Fe, we love Mexican food. Went here tonight for an early easy dinner. My steak milanesa was greasy and flavorless. No pico, no sauce, not even salt. Very underwhelming. My wife ordered a chimichanga, it was soft and greasy. Clearly the oil was not hot enough, yet they served it anyway?

Decor is whatever free handout the beer distributor gives them, and our table was so wobbly dinner was a complete mess. Then a bill for nearly $40.00, and no alcohol.

I wanted to like it, I really did, but it was not only not good, it was flat out bad.

Short version: bartender/ manager doesn't like customers ordering, thinks it's a hassle.

Long version: Super disappointed in the customer service.  Showed up at 5:45 on cinco de mayo, just wife and I.  Was told 15 min wait, ok cool. We figured we could grab a margarita at the tiny bar and wait it out.  It's May 5th after all, we expected some slower then prime service.  After being ignored for 5 mins I had to ask the bartender if we could get a couple drinks and he replied. "no I'm too busy". Btw, the bar only holds three people.  He didn't say sure but I'm backed up gimmie just a sec, he actually said, no. Thinking maybe he's just frazzled I gave him a second try a couple mins later after he ran some drinks out.  But same response again while he paced the bar line without purpose.  That was enough, we're understanding people, but when I'm told , no, i won't serve you I leave and give my money to another business.

Probably won't be back.

Waited awhile to write this because I hate being negative, but this remains the worst restaurant we have been to in two years. The margarita pitchers were more expensive than in Chicago and seemed to contain scarcely any alcohol. The nachos looked like they were microwaved. We ordered them with extra meat and literally got a plate with ten chips, each with a spoonful of beans and a single piece of meat on them -- it was so strange! The main course was adequate and tasted microwaved. Everything was bland and very, very overpriced.

Nice on the inside and was greeted within a few minutes. The mild salsa as they call it tastes like the mole sauce. Ordered the steak fajitas and the steak a la Mexicana. A plate of mush. All the pieces of beef we're mostly fat. Greasy and way to spicy. Most of the food on the plate looked like it came out of a can. Very disappointing, since I love downtown Wheaton. For the prices they charge, I won't be going back.
Meh. Nothing to really write home about. The food was delicious but lacked a wow factor. I really liked the mural...but that's about it.

Great food! Only somewhat neg. comment would be being charged for addl. chips and salsa. Only Mexican place I've ever encountered this concept. Otherwise, it's one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in town!

kicked me out because i didn't tip.
been there couple of times.
food wasn't good, maybe poor at the most.
no wonder why i didn't tip??

Super unimpressed my first time eating here. My husband and I ordered food for pick up and brought it home to eat. When my husband arrived home with my nachos I was absolutely dumb founded by what I saw. Let me back up: the nachos are $10, which is pretty expensive for nachos but I was thinking Mexican restaurants are usually very generous with portions so it would be worth it. False. I opened up my to-go container if nachos to find 8 chips with barely anything on them. A little sprinkle of cheese, a little beef. Eight chips... That is not an exaggeration. Needless so say I was pretty upset that I paid so much for eight chips. I will say though, on a positive note, the guacamole was delicious. Definitely didn't make up for me getting ripped off but whatever. I tried them once and for now on I'll be eating at Mi Casa. Much better nachos. Much more for the money too.

If you want Americanized Mexican food go somewhere else, this is true Mexican food, the best. I've eaten every kind of Mexican food from all the different regions as each place cooks differently. The El Pastor is the best!  One of my fav places to eat. And for the decor, truly a down home Mexican restaurant and changed out with every holiday. Sweetest girl wait staff ever.
Chicken enchiladas, fresh guacamole, fresh salsa, excellent service! Muchas Gracias! We love your food!

Tried the Carne asada, spinach quesadillas, Mexican fried potatoes, cheese enchiladas, with a large side of mole. The prices our well out of step with quality of food. Service was excellent but could not make up for the prices. The $17 dollar Carne asada was no better than some $9 Carne asadas I've had. The Mexican potatoes were flacid and a little oily. Decor is festive and colorful. Seating is limited but tables clear fast. Right next door to Gino's East.

El Zarape is a cute little place that the owners obviously put a lot of effort into. I can't say I was thrilled about the "cock fighting" implied in one of the murals, but otherwise the overall theme and ambience is pleasant.

I had a decent margarita and the food was ok. The chips and salsa were not particularly exciting. I surely would not pay $2 for a basket of chips. Christopher had steak fajitas. The meat tasted good, but it did not come out sizzling, but on a regular plate and buried under a huge pile of grilled veggies. The ratio of veggies to meat was way over the top. The rice and beans were decent, though typical. Nothing was a stand out.

I had the Chilaquiles with steak. The steak was pleintiful and very tasty. The chilaquiles were very soggy, and although the flavor was not bad, it kind of turned me off because it was like mush. I would not order it again.

They seemed to do some things well (like steak), but other elements of our meals ranged from ok to fair. The guacamole side I ordered was average. I am glad I did not get a full order. Christoper opted for fried ice cream for dessert. He said he it was mediocre and that he had much better at other places.

As we do not live in Wheaton, we will not be back to this place. If you are a local however, and sort out the food items they do best, you can probably put together a decent meal.

I have been here twice with my 3 kids. I think the food is good, however, I did feel nickel and dimed. I ordered a combination with two items for myself, and a combination with 3 items to split amongst my 3 young children. I was surprised to see a $1 per extra plate charge for splitting the combo amongst the kids. I didnt even ask to have them split in the kitchen. It would have been a waste to order them individual meals. Not to mention the $2 charge per additional chip basket. I mean, chips? Isn't that a staple complimentary item in Mexican restaurants? Although the food was ok, I wouldn't recommend this place. You can literally walk around the corner to the cantina and get a much better deal. $54 for two meals and a drink a piece. Pffft. No thanks.

Esta bien. Translate yourself if you don't know.

Anyway, walked in about 7 PM (MAD DINNER RUSH) and we got a table right away. This place is on a street corner; small, unassuming, and very good. We didn't get our water right away, which wasn't a big deal at all, because I wasn't sure if the staff knew who had the honor of having me as a patron.

Of course, par for the course, they bring chips and two types of salsa. Chips are double bogey for nutrition. Don't waste your stomach on that! My mom got a combo with three things (tamale, burrito, y enchilada). I went with the Huevos a la Mexicana and double black beans. It was a great choice for both of us. My mom had been here before, but I never have (you would think, 22 plus years of being a Wheaton resident and actually working for the city, I would have hit all the spots, BUT I DIGRESS). Salsa that came with the chips was good. I hit the spicy salsa hard, as my mom described the mild as tomato soup like.

Those murals on the wall, the decor, and the ambiance of the place make it feel more, authentic, if you will. I certainly can't be objective about it, since I haven't been south of the border, but I was in San Diego and Tucson, which are pretty much the same, right?

As I took in the atmosphere, it was some guys birthday, and the waitress put on the "El Zarape" sombrero, which was displayed for all to see. It was also hilarious that said guy enjoys a breese, as his behind was hanging out of his pants as he ate. 


All in all, if you're looking for a solid meal, come here. For the reviewers who posted about cock fighting, it's the culture. I just wish Enrique was there singing or something. Small, unassumming, and SOLID!

It's probably the best of what's around, but I still wouldn't recommend it. 

Food was bland, prices were pretty steep for what you get and they charge for extra anything - including to split a meal. 

Like I said in my tip, skip it and make the trek to Pilsen or Little Village...

My boyfriend and I have been dining here regularly for years.  We normally come on a Saturday night which is probably their busiest night of the week and we have always have had a good experience.  I do not believe that they take reservations but normally we never wait more than 10 minutes for a table for two. The staff has always been friendly and efficient.  The dinner always begins with complimentary chips and two types of salsa; hot and mild.  This works out great for us because my boyfriend prefers hot and spicy while I prefer mild.  The serving of chips is always plenty for two people.  The servers have always been friendly, prompt and efficient.  The manager/owner is always there and often stops by the table to check in and ask if we need anything.  The margaritas are good but often we opt for beer.  I normally order the same thing - bean burrito with rice and beans but my boyfriend usually orders something different each time.  The food is always fresh and portions are ample. The restaurant is small but quaint and festively decorated.

Stunned by how poor the service was here! I stopped in for a margarita while I waited for my train. The waitress said she had to check with her manager about my government issued Texas ID. He came over to question me about it, though it clearly stated that I was over 21, the picture matched me, and watermarks confirmed the ID valid. He asked for a second ID, which I assured him he didn't need with a valid 21+ ID in front of him. I ended up having to show him a credit card with my name on it to prove my identity I suppose? How unbelievably insulting and rude. And he made a scene in front of the whole restaurant. 

They then proceeded to charge me for the chips and salsa, which I didn't order. My margarita was over $10, more than the usual price of a meal, but they charged me for chips! I have never been to a place that charged for chips. Truly rude. They said that I should have "not eaten them" after she placed them in front of me in order to indicate that I wasn't ordering food. What, would they have served them to the next guest? I let them know that I thought it was both rude and wrong to charge for those. He argued you with me, holding up multiple customers waiting to pay, making a scene, and almost causing me to miss my train. I told him I'd be the gracious one and pay, but I wanted him to know that I thought it was terrible hospitality.

It's really too bad, because it was a pretty good margarita. Unfortunately, I can't patronize a place that treats their customers this poorly.

This is one of my favorite restaurants; I have been coming here for 20 years with my family and friends. It has the best authentic Mexican food in the area. The owner, Ed, is very nice and friendly. The cosy atmosphere adds to the authenticity of the restaurant. I have had most of the things on the menu and everything tastes amazing. I go there at least once a month! Definitely worth trying out.

We used to love going here for the food.  I have young kids and they especially like the chips and salsa.  It used to be unlimited, but now they charge you if you want more chips.  That was a major downer.  The service is just ok.  The food is good, but its gotten a lot more expensive.  We have decided to try other options.

Would love to give 0 stars but cant, I don't even know where to begin, first of all the waitress had an attitude problem, the steak tacos were TERRIBLE I meen TERRIBLE huge chunks of CHEWY steak then when I asked to get something else the manager got so mad at me cuz I didn't like his tacos he was telling me how he has the best tacos in town and this and fought with me on taking off the tacos from my bill when I only took 1 bite!!! omg save urself from dealing with this a hole guy and his crappy food, o and how can I forget the prices are so high for the garbage u get!!!!

This is a tasty Wheaton eatery! Very cozy and warm. 

They give you two different sauces upon arrival (with chips), which I love because I like some heat, but not everyone does, so that caters to different palates.

I had the mole enchiladas, they were good. The portion was plentiful!

I enjoyed the maragrita(s) the most!

An interesting note, there is a mural on the dining room wall that appears to be the start of a cock fight, at least that is what our table decided. Going in to make your own interpretation of this art is worth the trip!

This dude has forgotten his Mexican heritage!

-charging for extra plates
-charging for another basket of chips
-charging 'market price' for guac (c'mon, it's not nearly that volatile)
-must buy food with drinks (even at the bar)
-terrible al pastor
-horchata is almost entirely made out of sugar

C'mon man!

Almost passed it by on the way to another restaurant and decided to stop in. We are glad we did. Excellent chips, the salsas were good (the warm mild sauce was almost creamy -yum!). Basic margarita was OK, I had the Patron Margarita rocks+salt, much better. Daily special pork carnitas were like pork fajitas, but slow-cooked, not grilled - wonderful, juicy, meaty with excellent sides. Fish tacos also on special were great. Excellent FRESH coffee, and good friendly service.

My only beef is with drink prices. I thought the entrees were fairly priced, but the menu did not show drink prices. The Patron Margarita was $12, a regular $8. Seems more of a downtown Chicago price. A bottle of Bohemia was a much more reasonable $5. Booze seems a little pricey. Our food was $28, drinks were $40. But was good. I would definitely go back and drink beer. Negra Modelo!

The food is good. In fact, I liked it so much that I went there 3 times in 2 months, but I immediately stopped eating there because my mom and I BOTH got food poisoning here. The thought of eating here again makes me feel ill. :(

Even though I prefer El Puente (same family) in St. Charles and grew up on their food in the 80's and early 90's at the Main in West Chicago, El Zarape is a gem.  It's more Americanized than local taquerias, but has a solid menu with lots to choose from.  Perhaps it's just a fuzzy, warm memory but I love the orangeish warm sauce which comes with the chips and is on the enchiladas.  Simple, yes, but real good.  The longy tacos are killer - you have to check them out.  Good queso fundido as well.

Wonderful food. I used them for catering for my son's high school graduation party. Everyone loved the food! They were very professional, provided ample food and charged a very reasonable price. A great restaurant!

We found this place by accident and have gone back twice.  Service was a little slow.  Food was great though.  I was disappointed that you had to pay for an extra basket of chips.  Which we did, because we wanted them, but that should be a gimme....  Or put in a bigger basket.

Love this place!  El Zarape has delicious mexican food.  My favorites on the menu are the chile rellenos and the chicken fajitas.  They have a warm (temperature) salsa and a spicy salsa.  One downside- if you want more than one basket of chips you have to pay (sometimes they make us pay and other times it's not on our bill... not sure why).  
Try this place and you won't be disappointed!
Food is okay but atmosphere leaves a whole lot to be desired. Drinks are very Mediocre for the price.

This is a super cute Mexican restaurant with good food, decent service, and so-so prices. 

We were promptly seated, just missing the dinner rush. We were served a basket of chips with two types of salsa, which we scarfed. My traditional margarita was good. I wanted a chorizo quesadilla but chorizo wasn't listed as an option on the menu - thankfully the waitress asked and the kitchen had no problem making one for me. It was delicious. The husband's combo platter was great too. They have a small parking lot, which is nice. The service was prompt and attentive without being intrusive. 

My only complaint was the table of unruly kids playing electronic games with annoying music at loud volumes two tables away - but really I blame the parents and not the restaurant.

I thought the staff was very friendly and helpful.  Food was great and served fast.  Parking can be a challenge and the place is kind of small.  But, $12 small margaritas!!!  Would've been nice if that info was on the menu.  Defiantly not worth the $55 dinner bill for two of us.  Stick with cerveza.  Great salsa and chips, but like like everyone says, be prepared to pay for refills.  I'll definitely go back, now that I know the routine.

El Zarape is a great little find, that is, if you enjoy authentic Mexican food and ambience.  My boyfriend and I found this restaurant driving through downtown Wheaton looking for something that looked appetizing.  

As we walked in, I smiled because this was exactly what I had in mind.  The painted mural, various Mexican decor, as well as the sound of today's pop hits (en espanol, of course).

We were promptly served by a friendly waitress who took our drink order and brought chips and salsa.  Chips seemed to be homemade, but the two salsas definitely were.  The mild salsa was warm (in temperature) and had a tomato base.  The spicy salsa was chunky

For my meal, I ordered the two chicken enchilada combo plate.  It came with rice & beans (I chose black beans).  The enchiladas were excellent!  Homemade tortilla wrapped around shredded chicken topped with a flavorful red sauce.  My boyfriend opted for the two (beef) taco lunch special.  Looked pretty basic, but he seemed to enjoy them.

Overall, our meal was very enjoyable.  I mentioned that I would like to come back again to enjoy a margarita or two.  The only thing I would like to see in this restaurant is a salsa bar, (similar to Salseria in Elmhurst).  That would be enough to bump my rating up to 5 stars.

Ok so you plan on coming here for food ??? You might want to also bring your piggy bank, pirates gold, amex card and lot's of smiles.  My girl and I split a nacho plate entree which cost 14.00 with surcharge of 2.00 since we split the plate and they had to bring us an extra fork (note: fine print on bottom of menu oh and bring glasses even if you have 20/20 vision.) The owner was nice too he couldn't take his eyes off the t.v and didn't say one word to us even when we payed the bill. I wish there was zero stars I would have given that instead. God bless america and wheaton!!!

This is the good Mexican restaurant in downtown Wheaton.  I grew up around here, and this is a reliable place to get very good Mexican food at a reasonable price.

In addition to the regular menu items, I highly recommend taking a look at the daily specials.  There are often some very, very good things on here as well.

Thought I'd give this place another try....holy crap-$10.00 for 2 BEEF TACOS with rice and a pinch of beans?!? 

The service here stinks.....you wait ten minutes to be noticed. Then they can't even crack a smile or be friendly as you order.....then you want a drink refill? Good luck on that one! 

BEWARE----Coffee refills ARE NOT FREE-and of course, we didn't know that until we got the bill, and when we questioned why the bill was so high the owner/manager was VERY RUDE. We feel we should've been told if the coffee wasn't free refills, not shcoked by an extra $2.50 each time!

I can go to Qdoba, get more for my money, better tasting, and WAY BETTER SERVICE. And that's where I'll be going from now on. I'd give this place no stars if I could!

Never again, sorry.

column2: Lover Of Food And Culture Z.
column13:
I came here last week with my family and it was very disappointing! The waitress was not very smart she messed up the Taquila drink order twice! and the food order too. This place has the best Mole for sure! Home made and really flavorful. I noticed that everything was very different this time around. I think I won't go back, I have a feeling they are hurting and they are also under staff..Kinda sad but they do have really great Don Julio Margaritas and the best Enchilada with mole sauce.

The service is bad, very slow and the food is still good but who know what's going to happen.

My 31-year-old brother in law went into El Zarape recently and was completely berated by the unprofessional owner. The owner refused to serve him and actually engaged him in not one, but two yelling matches that arose over my BIL attempting to use the facilities.  During one of the heated arguments, the owner referred to my BIL as an f****** Wheaton college kid with small "anatomy" (obviously not in those words).

This behavior is completely unacceptable and should not be rewarded with your business. If you dare enter this establishment, please have your phone ready to record any inappropriate behavior that is bound to occur if you encounter this man. 

Decent food, yes...but is it worth it to be berated and cussed out just to get a somewhat decent meal?

I agree with all the other reviewers that commend the owners with the great service, nice decor and cleanliness.
But really what brings people in is the food.
The chips were oily and the salsa was either bland or too hot.  After we finished the basket, being charged $2 for more chips was not reasonable and very off putting.
We ordered a tostada, enchiladas, tacos and a burrito.  So we had quite a variety.  None of the food was good.  It was very bland.  The beans and rice were tasteless.  If a Mexican restaurant cannot make tasty beans and rice, then it can't make anything more complicated is my opinion. 
For what we paid, the quantity was good, but the quality of the food and the taste was missing.

Great atmosphere in a tiny little restaurant in downtown Wheaton.  It's a tiny little place located on a street corner, with a tiny little parking lot.

While the food is nothing extremely out of the ordinary, it's tasty, and the chips and salsa are great.  The salsa itself is rather spicy, and the enchilada sauce given for dipping as well is perfect if spicy is not your thing.  The entrees come with beans and rice, so you leave feeling full.  The price is just right for me, and I'm not rich, so not sure where the gripes with the prices came from.

I love the fact that the owners are very nice and that they decorate the heck out of the place.  Every month has a theme and the curtains and tablecloths are changed to fit the theme.  Halloween has little pumpkin curtains and July has patriotic themes.   I think they make them themselves and it adds to the place.

The restaurant itself is quite small (one little room), and rather dark inside, but, again, the owners make up for this by adding a lot of charm to the decoration.

For dessert, make sure to get the hot sopapillas (fried dough) with the chocolate dipping sauce and whipped cream.  Those are at least 75% of the reason I go there!  SO tasty.
