Overall, a nice dining experience that is not super high-class (though it's clearly not meant to be), with tasty food and a nice dining environment.  A+!
We used to order out from here often until they raised all of their prices. Their food is good, but definitely not worth what they charge.

Was not impressed with food at all.  Service was good.  Just not what we expected from reviews.  Just a side note, they have no kids meals.

Food was very mediocre

Yum! Had an impromptu lunch here recently and enjoyed it very much. I initially thought the taco lunch special was really small and meager, but the portion actually turned out to be just right. I was full by the end of the lunch.

This is what I call a good "utility" Mexican joint -- good tacos, good nachos, my favorite Jarrito (tamarind!) Nothing too fancy, nothing too horrible. A great place to stop if you're just coming off the highway and don't want fast food. If I found myself in Wheaton again anytime soon, I'd definitely eat there.

Well, I was pretty sure nothing could replace my love for Front Street Cantina or Las Palmas for good Mexican food in the 'burbs...until I tried El Zarape. My first attempts at writing this review were after eating an obscene amount of chips and salsa, so my first draft consisted of mostly the words "om nom nom". Anyway, this is a really cute, tiny place with really good, authentic Mexican food. I especially loved one of the salsas, which was creamy, tomato-y, just a tiny it spicy and unlike anything I'd had recently. Service was very friendly and the prices were quite reasonable. I'd highly recommend this place for a quick lunch or dinner.

Used to be a great place to go.  Foods just ok.  Owner will nickel and dime you...$2 for more chips, $1 to share/ split a meal...no longer have kids menus.  We had our last visit there.  I would rather go to front street or cozumels.  Need I say more?

Pitchers and 1/2 pitchers of margaritas!  When you find a spot that  serves good alcohol in Wheaton you have to spread the word!

This place is cozy with about 15 tables.  Service is very attentive, yet the atmosphere is very casual.  They have a parking lot that fits about 8 cars.  Usually there isn't a spot to park here, but there's plenty of street parking.

The margaritas are GOOD.  We got 1/2 pitcher of the grande and I could taste the alcohol and not that sweet stuff that is usually poured on.  You get the salty tortilla chips and 2 containers of salsa, one is mild and one is spicy, when you sit down.

For dinner I got the chicken fajitas with black beans and rice.  Normally you get refried beans, but they let me substitute with no problem.  Hubby had the Carne Asada ala Tampiquena and his skirt steak was perfectly cooked.  They had tons of authentic Mexican stuff on the menu and it was hard to choose.  They also have authentic Mexican sodas.  It wasn't the same as being in Cancun, but it was MUCH better than some of the other "authentic" places.

We split a fried ice cream for dessert and lingered for a long time without being hassled.  We drive by this place all the time and had never checked it out.  It was a nice surprise!

Longy tacos are my absolute favorite here! They're this creamy ground beef taco that takes almost deep fried its so decadent. I get them again and again, always with a side quesadilla. Love that the chips and salsa comes with 2 different types of salsa! Intimate atmosphere is perfect, yet it's usually easy enough to get a table! They are always decorated so cute for every upcoming holiday. I don't live in Wheaton anymore, but I make the drive for El Zarape!

I have been to El Zarape several times. Usually i order something different each time. Have never been a fan of their rice due to some wierd after taste and after effects, but there were other items to order. Tried their tacos one evening, not so bad. So, it was a rainy afternoon and we stopped by for lunch. Only one other table being served at the time, although they didn't appear to be happy with the food. Left most of it on the plate, then left. I ordered tacos with black beans and rice. My partner ordered enchiladas. When the orders came out, you couldn't tell which was which. It was just a runny mess. The black beans that I ordered came directly from a can. They were not rinsed or cooked, but cold and swimming in that liquid that canned beans have.  We sampled each others entrees. They tasted exactly the same!  Like frozen microwaved Mexican? Food.  Eww!  Maybe this place changed owners or suffers from lack of customers, the recession, i dont know.  Make something up!  But it's not fresh or good.

Real authentic mexican food!!!  Cute little restaurant.  I had the carnitas special, yummy.  My hubby had a huge burrito!   We have been looking for a really good mexican restaurant for a while.  Busy little restaurant.  The do charge for a 2nd basket- $2, but no biggie.  We just can't get over how good it was-  it was not that chainy-american mexican restaurant like uncle julios-  if that's the type of food you like - don't. Come here.  This is real mexican food.

I went to this restaurant just last week and ordered a steak quesadilla. It was hard to decide what to get with all the delicious options on the menu. The food came ridiculously fast. It probably took 10 minutes, tops. The chips and guacamole were excellent and really added to the meal. The manager went above and beyond the call of duty. He was incredibly friendly and really made our meal enjoyable. Also, my water glass was always full. I always appreciate when the waiters keep refilling your water glass. Overall, excellent service and excellent food!

El Zarape is a standard little sit-down Mexican spot right across from the Wheaton metra station. The food is fine, the prices are a little high for standard Mexican, the salsa is hot, and the service is good. Three stars because it isn't really AMAZING food, it isn't overly fancy, and it isn't a dive with great deals. It's just a middle-of-the-road spot that I'd go to often if I lived nearby or was looking for a meal downtown.

We like this place as "comfort food" .  We know exactly what to expect and get it every time.  Home cooked food, good flavors, friendly family run store and margaritas we crave (gold..  kinda brown actually and that makes them GREAT)

Skirt steaks, Mole, Ceviche, Salsa Fresca... mmmmmm  Treat them like you are visiting family and you will have friends for years!

The good, the bad and the ugly:  The good was that their chips and salsa are very tasty.  The warm sauce reminded us of Hernandez in Delavan, WI.  The bad, they do charge you for more chips ($2.00), which we can live with that because they were tasty and addicting.  The service is not very good and not one person that works there had a smile on their face (that generally flows down from the owner/management).  The lack of friendliness tends to bring down the entire tone of the restaurant.   The unfriendly service is odd as the restaurant is decorated very cute and cozy.   We had the pork (carnitas) special, which was very tender and was seasoned very flavorfully (this came with a couple of flour tortillas).  The other entree was a beef enchilada special, which was kind of heavy and somewhat over flavored by all the shredded cabbage on top and heavy on the potatoes.   They do not appear to change their specials, as they were the same ones when we were in a couple of weeks earlier on a Saturday for lunch.  The ugly comes in when we asked for two more tortillas for the pork dish we ended up being charged an extra $1.25 for them!  I would have to say that we have been to over 60 Mexican restaurants and have NEVER been charged for little flour tortillas!  When the owner was asked why would they charge a customer that just purchased $29.00 for two entrees and $22.00 for 4 tap beers to pay an extra $1.25 for a couple of flour tortillas, he was actually aggressive and stated other high end restaurants charge for extra tortillas.  Well sorry to inform you Sir Owner, this is certainly not a high-end restaurant.  The prices were on the high end, but realistically, that was it!  We would have liked to come back to this restaurant as we did feel the food was overall very good, but with no one smiling and friendly, and the owner's non-concern for the customer; it leaves us no choice but to go spend our hard-earned-money elsewhere.   Sorry....
By far, the best Mexican food in Wheaton. Get the Carne Asada and you won't be disappointed. I've been a regular for years and the food has never disappointed.

Several reviewers have commented on the burritos and tacos, but I must recommend the dinners here-  the carne asada and especially the roast pork in green sauce are worth a trip.  

For tacos, try "el pastor" - the green sauce and onions are wonderfully tangy and not too heavy. 

For starters, the two salsa selections are both good, but I agree with other raters that it is an annoyance to pay for seconds of chips & salsa when you are ordering dinner and drinks.  I wonder how much business they've lost since implementing this policy.

If you are looking for a burrito (or chimichanga) you might like Front Street better, but for a subtly spicy main dish and a family-run restaurant vibe, I choose EZ.

Great. Classic.  Simple.  Friendly.  The beers are cold, the chips and salsa tasty and the food quite nice.  It's a family owned place and that's reason enough for us to keep going back.  In this day of fancy, fake and chain, I'll take the owner smiling at us we walk through the door any day.

I've been going to El Zarape since I was in elementary school and I'd walk dowtown to meet my dad getting off the train for dinner. About 99% of the time I get a half order of guac and some chicken tacos. Some times I'll get crazy and add an enchilada. The chips always taste fresh and I usually end up going through two baskets. The salsa has a little heat but I love love love the warm red sauce they give you for the chips. I wish they bottled and sold it. Lately I've been getting my orders to go during my lunch break at work and the owner is almost always there to chat with while you're waiting. Service is attentive and it's just a cute small Mexican place with amazing food! Whenever I'm out of town for a while this is always the place I have to go to right when I get home!

This is a fantastic authentic restaurant in the heart of downtown Wheaton.  The owner sees you to your table and manages the entire dining experience to ensure you have a wonderful setting and meal unlike any other.  I highly recommend the pick three soft beef tacos with a burrito and an ice cold Tecate.  Excellent service and dinner for two for only $30 With tip.,

Not impressed at all! First of all my husband and i got steak tacos which were not even cut into small pieces and the steak was tough and for the prices... need i say more. Ans im mexican  so i always eat  mexican food and i make WAY better tacos at my house  I would NEVER come back to this place again. And the service sucked too. Like the owner was walking around like his s*** dont stink lol sorry but in my opinion if your gonna act like that u better damn well have some good tacos. If you want some really good tacos and awesome service go to la taqueria in hp or la campana in bloomingdale!!!!

My gf and I went here last night because we were craving some good Mexican food and wanted to try something new.  When we arrived it was not busy and we sat right down.  It was a cute place and the decor was very cute.  The service was pretty good also.  We ordered a combination platter to split and a couple of non-alcoholic drinks.  We also ordered some of their queso dip.  The queso dip was very gritty and we were not big fans.  The food was so so. We got a burrito and flauta.  The fact that we spent over $20 yet they still insist on charging us for extra chips is absolutely ridiculous to me!  I have NEVER been to a Mexican restaurant where they charge for extra chips, especially when the basket they come in is so dinky and small!  Overall we were just not impressed with this place at all.  We ordered a appetizer and split an entree and our bill was $25 which is crazy to me at a small little Mexican restaurant.  We definitely will not be back because there are way better choices in the area.

Just came back from my last visit to El Z. I have loved Longy tacos since forever but have found the flavorless beans and rice at this place hardly worth eating. Now I find the tacos are no longer available a la carte, which means an $11 dinner is the only option for two tacos. French fries and a lifeless-looking plate of iceberg are offered as replacement for the beans and rice but who eats French fries with tacos? Add $2.50 for a soda, $2 for a little basket of chips and suddenly we are asked to pay $35 for a dinner that's not worth half that. Sorry, Longy - hasta la vista.

Weak, suburban Mexican. Overpriced food that tastes like microwave Stouffers. Guess its okay in a place like DuPage County, but c'mon, 2.50 for a small "burrito" that is nothing but a tablespoon of beans and a tortilla? Plus, they gave me no napkins or fork for a to go order. Boy, did I have fun eating their slop with my hands in the back of Wheaton City Hall. I guess it's popular with the Wheaton folks, as their mommies...I mean, village elders....don't allow you to drink without a piece of food by your side  (a rule attested to by a big sign on the El Zarape "bar")

My favorite place for Mexican food. The food is great. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is that the place is small the service is not great and the margaritas are not great either but the food is fantastic.

El Zarape is an authentic Mexican restaurant off the beaten path in downtown Wheaton. I enjoyed a delicious, generous steak quesedilla for lunch. The service was attentive and friendly and my food arrived in 10-15 minutes. If you are looking for tasty Mexican in the western burbs, be sure to check our El Zarape!

We've been going to El Zarape for 15 years.  We love the food and ambiance, and we often recommended the place to friends.  I particularly like the tacos al pastor.  But on our last visit we were dismayed to find that the prices had been raised about 20% on all the dinners.  To make matters worse, a la carte ordering is no longer permitted at dinner - each person now must order a complete dinner w/ rice & beans.  That was never a problem for me, but my wife has a small appetite and always ordered a couple of tacos a la carte.  The a la carte policy along with the 20% price hike has made El Zarape too pricey for us.  I'm sad to say that we will probably not be returning.

I haven't been here for several years but was planning to go soon so I took a look to see if it's changed.  Sounds about the same.  It 's popular, especially on weekend nights, and you may have to wait a while for a table.  But everybody is friendly so time passes quickly.  Lots of good items on the menu in large portions.  The waitresses always used to be friendly and efficient, refilling the chips and salsa quickly.  Enchiladas are a good choice and the drinks and beer are good!

Just a cute little Mexican restaurant in downtown Wheaton the owners are nice always seems to be around talking with the customers and with every season they decorate the place with the holiday theme.  I have been to a couple closed parties here that have worked out pretty good too.  No big fancy room just the entire restaurant rented out to you and your friends to celebrate your special occasion.
Nice "local" place. Good food and good service.  No real bar to sit at; this is definitely a place to eat at and not sit and drink.

Always great food! Best Chipotles ever and I even drive out of my way to go to this location! They are always friendly, professional, and the food is always fresh! The only thing is some of the employees get upset if you ask for more stuff. So, like extra cheese or sour cream, etc. Sorry, I like more than half a dollop, just saying.
I once ate at this location for 7 days in a row. Every bowl was perfect and the service was always friendly. No complaints here

This place gives their customers so much food! Get the burrito bowl and order a side tortilla or mini soft/hard shell Tacos. This will guarantee your stomach to feel satisfied and give you a pat on the back
I swear what is wrong with people today!! What a bunch a idiots! I can't even start to get into it because this will be a mile long! But if I get sick someone will hear about it!
This is one of my best fast food spots! They are super fast and put in more toppings then other Chipotle locations. Always fresh!

Before I start, let me just say I am a chipotle lover!  I am giving two stars because this location has the slowest service I have really ever experienced. I have given them at least 10 chances and every time I am amazed at how slow they r.  Other reviewers touch on this as well. Note to owner: please talk to your staff.

Love this place. Great location. Great service. Awesome food. I love carnitas. Guacamole is fiyaaaa. Chips are good. I like all the salsas.. Definitely try this fast food chain. Excellent option over McDz or whatever else.

My go-to luncheon for work. Quick, cheap, and easy! Never had any problems and I don't expect to have any problems. Always busy, some what loud but I usually have my ear plugs in anyways, and there is always one or two people on the floor taking empty tray off the table and cleaning the seats and mopping the floor.

Slow service. Ordered the steak bowl. The steak was cold and chewy. 
Don't get me wrong, their customer service is great. They're very attentive, but they need to be a tad faster. I think they take care of online orders first. In that case, they need to hire more staff during their busy hours.
Get some HVAC. Not heat in winter, no air in summer. Always way understaffed, yummy food.

I really do love the concept of Chipotle. This is definitely not authentic Mexican food, but what Chipotle does it does pretty well. The food is fresh, you can customize your order, and the price is decent. 
     For this particular location, there are few things that are bothersome. First of all, it gets very cold in this Chipotle location. In the winter it is almost unbearable to eat inside. Second of all, the employees are pretty restrained with the toppings. If I'm paying over seven dollars for a burrito bowl I would like to at least see the meat that I'm paying for. I do understand that as a business maybe you need to be frugal with the meat, but it wouldn't kill to put more veggies on top (and I'm not talking about the lettuce). 
     A problem with Chipotle is that your food ends up being cold because all of the toppings are straight out of the refrigerator. There's been plenty of times I've had to take my food home and warm it up in the microwave. Despite all of this, I still like going to chipotle when I need something fast and fresh to eat.
Love this chipotle. Everyone is very welcoming and friendly. Even when there is a long line these hard workers get through the it quickly and efficient.

Chipotle is my absolute favorite and this location is the reason. I've been to many other locations and the quality just doesn't compare. The food here is just delicious and they're very generous with their portions. Keep it up!

First let me say that I LOVE Chipotle.  
Now for the rational of 1-star.  My husband and I visited this location many times and each time we have the same experience.  NO FOOD.  

Last friday which was April 17th we arrived at 7:10 and didnt leave the line until 7:30.  
They had run out of white rice (a Chipotle staple) and they had also run out of steak and chicken.  We decided to wait rather than go across the street to Buona Beef.  HUGE MISTAKE!  We waiting for 15 minutes along with 6-7 other people.  When the food became available they didnt notify any of hte people they knew were waiting.  After seeing other leave with chicken we went up and asked how come no one notified us this was ready.  The said they forgot.  You forgot? About 7 people staring you down from the side of the line?  Strange. 

Regardless we finally had our food.  My husband got the steak and I the chicken.
The chicken was very good but my husband steak bowl consisted of 1/2 fat and 1/2 steak.  Not sure what is going on at this location but no manager was to be found anywhere.

Super great service, and really good food! So happy they built one so close to home! This is a great lunch place. Only thing is, its a little small inside, but the people are nice and the food has always been very fresh!

Ordering online has made this experience way better! I cannot stand waiting in line, so I order online ahead of time. The Carnitas Burrito bowel is my fav. Always fresh. Always tasty. Fast and friendly service.

My food was not ready when I arrived. I was late for my pickup time and when I walked to the line, they hadn't even started it yet. So much for ordering ahead. This is the 3rd time this has happened to us.

I've been going to this chipotle location (among other close by locations) for awhile now. I am totally addicted to their food. You'll end up spending about $10 a person which can be a bit pricey but OMG the food.

Let's start out with the burrito bowl. I had one for the first time thanks to a recommendation from a friend. You get meat, rice, beans, veggies, among other choices in a GIANT bowl for about $8. It's my new favorite item on the menu. Their tacos are amazing as well but for the price you don't get as much food.

The Chips are warm and taste amazing with the homemade guac they sell.  There is also food for vegetarians as well.
The food is so delicious here. I really like everything about this restaurant the chicken bowl is great.

I've been to a lot of Chipotle's in the last 9 years and this was my first time to this one. Has a great patio area but doesn't seem to handle crowds well. I got the my usual steakburrito and it was poorly wrapped, fell apart half way through and someone had brought back their burrito because it fell apart and they remade it.

We ate outside but by the time we starting eating the burrito (and my wife had tacos), were getting cold, yet it was 80 degrees out, so that means the meat and all as barely hot.

I consider El Famous to be the "gold standard" in tacos and burritos (yet my wife isn't crazy about them), but after this trip Chipotle still has a ways to go.

Great restaurant, very clean, efficient and great staff. I don't have a single complaint! The food is well made and if you ask for extra rice ingredients they will often add it for free. Also if you get a girl making your food, if you compliment them they will often throw in a free drink! Just a tip! :)
Who needs meat?!! Vegetarian Burrito is the best here!!!

2 days worth of sodium in 1 burrito. Sad to say not going to be in my top 10. I like the food but during busy times they get skimpy. If you need anything that's not on front of the team.... They aren't sure what to do. The  chicken has gotten dark with  fat globs.  Love the freshness. I think it's a bit pricey and needs attention to dining room during busy hours. This is NOT wheelchair friendly . the way you have to order is difficult to maneuver and the dining room can not be rolled through when busy.

Very good location. Had a vegetarian burrito with everything on it . They kind of overfilled it and the employee had a hard time folding my burrito. Other than that excellent service and food. Quacomole was awesome and went good with the hot salsas.

OMFG the lime rice is amazing. The buritos aren't quite as large as I remember them being, but they are still so delicious. A little spicy (even for the mild), but so good. I could eat just the lime rice and the chips and dip and be set for dinner. Their guacamole is to die for. Big, giant chunks of avocado.... mmmmmmmm.
They get irritated extremely easily. I wonder if they get in trouble for giving too much rice or salsa. The food is great though!

This Chipotle is closest to my house. I recently come here a lot with my boys. Eventhough we've been ordering online and taking out since it opened. I always like to get a burrito bowl with steak and my wife gets always the chicken. For me it's the rice with a dash of lime taste to it plus the grilled veggies is the main thing here...Then I usually try different kind of meat, depending on my mood. My kids like the chips and guac and the cheese quesadilla. The freshly brewed ice tea washes the spiciness of the salsa in a good way. The line is always long specially during meal time but the service is quick so it's worth of a little wait. Try the frozen margarita, it's good although it's served on a plastic cup of course... Enough seating area and the patio seating is the best option here. Very cheap Tex-mex grill with healthy food. I'm a FAN...

Yay! I just used this Chipotle's online ordering feature and it was awesome! I've enjoyed the Burrito Bowl on several occasions but to be able to order it on my smart phone at my leisure, state what time I would like it to be ready and then walk in past the lines to the secret half door (just for us online customers) to pick up your labeled, ready to enjoy, customized food...well, you'll just have to try it yourself! Awesome! I actually wanted and did give a tip...out of joy!

Management needs replacing, workers are nice, but complain about the managers. Mexican food done the McDonalds way. Same as all Chipolte's. Not a bad place to go to once in a while. I call it Yuppie Mex.

I heart Chipotle.

For a long time, I was like "oh yeah chipotle's ok" but then i realized my issue was just that those burritos are so stinkin big it was just overwhelming. That's when I discovered the BurritoBol. Hooray, all the insides of a burrito but in an easy to use bowl. I had always been going with chicken on mine. Then one day I tried the steak. Sweet! Whatever magic they use to season their steak...I must confess my love to those spices. The chips rule, Salty goodness. The guacamole is delightful. I don't exactly understand why they charge you $1.25 to put guacamole on your burrito but whatever. 

When we go with the kids we drop a tip in the jar because we feel bad that there is going to be a rice explosion under our chairs when we leave. So hopefully that makes up for it.....

I love Chipotle.  I especially love the Bolingbrook Chipotle.  I have been to 4 different Chipotles but this one is by far my favorite.  Their steak is always very tender and juicy.  The location in Oswego (where I live) the steak is dry and tough.  I don't know what they do different but there is something different about the way they cook the steak.  I will drive all the way to the Bolingbrook location for my buritto.  The staff is very friendly and I go there often enough that they know what I want before I order it.  They use the best products from the best farms.  All pesticide and hormone free!!!  Yummy.

What can I say I love Chipotle! I mean I'm real easy when it comes to this place. Give me a chicken buritto with extra rice, and extra cheese THATS IT. the chips and HOT salsa are good too. All I can say is there needs to be one closer to my house!

I don't know.  There's something about a fast-food like restaurant that serves Coronas and Margaritas that I just have to love.  I have only been to one other Chipolte location, and this one is just better.  Of course, it is a very new location, so it's very clean, well lit and maintained.  I like the fact that every time you order something, there is a mild taste variation, so you pretty much know that it is made fresh daily.  The hot salsa and barbacoa is just a little tangier from one visit to the next.  The service here is always quick and friendly.  And fresh brewed iced tea is always a good thing.  A pretty good place for a change from other fast food options.

My husband and I ordered our dinner online this evening and it was set to be ready at 7pm.  I came in at 7pm to pick it up our food. I was told it was not ready yet.  The nice man at the register gave me a free pop when I waited and apologized that it wasn't ready.  I sat down for a couple minutes.  The manager Brandon came over to me with my food.  He apologized for the inconvenience and that my food wasn't ready on time. He gave me 2 buy one get one free coupons for our next visit.  This Chipotle is always friendly.  The manager Brandon showed exemplary customer service.  Thank you Brandon!
I'm so glad I went home after my meal . My restroom visit was so intense I regretted that my toilet isn't equity with a seatbelt ...

What's not to like about Chiplotle? Well ehhh, except for the whole e. coli rap, I can't think of many folks who don't like this place.

The Naperville location is cool. It's right across from a Barnes and Noble, in downtown Naperville. The space is big and the layout is not weird. I've always got fresh, hot food from here, and efficient service. 

I like the bowls because you get more and you dont have that flour torilla (not very healthy for you). 

Also, I know a lot of people will be like "EWW TOFU!!"  but actually, their marinated tofu is the bomb. It's salty and super flavorful with a delicious marinade. Be brave! Try it!!
When in such a rush to wrap a burrito to go maybe make sure the tortilla is actually covered. Quality ingredients smeared with chemical ink, thank you so much.

My bad on that previous review.  I was mad about the steak and still think it sucks, but since then have been eating the chicken and it's pretty awesome.  Lesson learned, I will no longer post a review at the peak of my anger after trying and failing to chew on gristly steak.  Other lesson learned, that chicken must have crack in it because now I'm an addict.  Other other lesson learned, I learned I'm a double-meat bowl guy.

Super disappointed in the steak quality at this chipotle. I have attached a picture below to help yelpers see. Steak tasted like a gummy bear with a steak appearance. It was so chewy it reminded me of eating a marshmallow. Aside from that it looked undercooked. I told the cashier about my concerns and she said and I quote " I will tell the kitchen to cook it longer" so basically she knows that they are not cooking that steak for long enough. Felt sick the next day. Terrible service and quality. Cannot recommend this based on my experience.

I love Chipotle but at this location, I usually get skimpier portions. My requests are often disregarded (like extra lettuce please).. But above all, today my burrito contained SOOTY unidentifiable things. Did they forget to clean the sooty grill before stir-frying the vegetables ...? It Is not very pleasant to chew on completely blackened unidentifiable sooty remnants.

When it comes to Chipotle, I'm here for fast service and food to fill me up and this is the place for me to go! Big fan of the veggie burrito bowl where you can get guac for free. I do wish they kept their items more frequently stocked... I feel like whenever I go they are just running out of sauté veggies, or steak, or lettuce, or something... just my luck to get the scraps :( I hate scraps.

To me it's actually comical how much you can tell that the people working there do not want to be there at all. Between how they throw your meal together or lack of smiling, it's hilarious. Out of all of the times I've been there, only a handful of times was someone there taking my order with a smile on their face. The Chipotle on my college campus was always terribly busy with lines out the door but the workers there had a huge smile on their face... maybe because they were petrified of losing their jobs and then losing their booze money.

This place just opened and they seem to be doing pretty well because when i stopped in today around dinner time, they had already ran out of white rice! 

They're so new that I can still smell the paint drying and the staff is a little slow but I was very satisfied with my order. It might turn into a regular haunt, since it's so close to my work.

Stopped in here today during the dinner rush for some quick Chipotle to go. The line was long, which only seemed to be amplified by how (obviously) new most of the people working there seemed to be. The stress levels were palpable, as the line waited for chicken and fajita vegetables while the dude manning the grill tried his best so speed the laws of thermodynamics.

This Chipotle is stupidly convenient for me to go to, so I'm sure they'll be seeing lots of me. I'll re-review this place once the employees get a little more comfortable with pumping out the perfect Chipotle burrito. I can't bust their chops too hard, not yet, anyway.
This one is a bit small inside, but heck its Chipotle.  I have never had a bat experience at any Chipotle and this one is no exception.
My go to place when I am lazy to cook. Tasty, healthy food. The food is 100% organic. Don't forget to add Guacamole, they charge around $1.5 extra for it, but worth it.

I've been here a few times and every time is the same.  I always have to ask for more everything!!  And they always give that nasty stank eye followed by "oh extra".  I simply say no and I just want more.  I don't want extra I want normal, adequate amounts of meat, hot sauce, lettuce, etc.  you get my point.  Never returning to this location!

I've been to only this Chipotle location several times, mainly in the evening.  I have never eaten inside the restaurant, because there's too much loud music and way too many hard surfaces.  I find this a major downside.  However, the restaurant is clean, attractive and bright.

I have found the service to be fast, friendly and reliable, although my tendency is to watch the preparers closely.  Everything looks fresh. My consistent bottom line for Chipotle is that everything is fresh.  However, the net effect, when all those food components are all glopped together in that bowl is that the sum is MUCH less than the parts.  That's why I might only allow it into my diet once every month or two.  I don't think that they should charge extra for guacamole.  Suck it up, Chipotle!

I know people that eat their Chipotle favorites several times a week and mainly out of convenience.  I couldn't do that, but it's probably a step above the other fast food options.

I could take or leave Chipotle, but for others, it must be heaven.

I hate this place! Every time I ask the person serving my food to put the meat first they either roll their eyes or give me attitude and I have to repeat it more than once. The food is always cold and their guacamole is always nasty, on multiple occasions that I've gone in the guacamole is a shade of brown, if it were fresh it'd look a nice shade of lime not brown almost! I've asked if they have a different batch and they've told me they look the same way. The staff is rude and they always seem more interesting in socializing with each other rather than taking care of the customers waiting in line. The only reason I've kept going to this location is because I was not aware of other locations near my job until today.
Compared to other Chipotles, they do "skimp" on ingredients...so the burrito is huge instead of massive. darn.

Great location and the staff seem like they genuinely interested in providing the best service. Dang those burritos are huge! Lol. I went in during the "lunch rush" and the line was pretty long, but it moves surprisingly fast. I was expecting them to just make my food as fast as possible and scoot me down the line. They did a great job of actually having a small conversation while still making everything very fast. Other places should take notes on how they do service!!! 

I wish there was a larger seating area though!

Had a very nice experience at this Chipotle today.  The one downtown Naperville is closer but the parking is a pain so tried out the new one today in the old TGIF location.  Everything was as expected - no huge lines, no skimping on the meat, loaded up with hot sauce...and plenty of parking.  Nice addition to the food options in the area.

Unfortunately this Chipotle isn't as good as the one on Diehl. The workers are mostly new so they understuff and still somehow rip the burrito. It still has the great Chipotle taste and the employees are still very kind and helpful however they just aren't as good at wrapping burritos. I still come every now and then, I just don't think it meets the standards that Chipotle has.

I'm not a chipotle lover but family wanted to go there.
Tried the spicy beef bowl and it was amazing! 
I would definatly order this again!

Another DISAPPOINTING experience at this Chipotle location. Arrived at 9:30pm, and I completel understand that end of the night means things may not be fully stocked. However in this instance, there were 3 customers waiting for steak to be grilled (20 pieces of steak on the grill), a small amount of black beans that they were clearly trying to skimp on to customers so they didn't have to make more, and THE BIGGEST TRAVESTY OF ALL: No Guacamole!! They were completely out, and when I asked if they were making more they said they don't make more past a certain hour and it was late. Since we always get guac on our bowls and also chips and guac, they definitely lost $$ on us.

And again, unhappy customers left the building . If it wasn't so close to home,  I would NEVER SET FOOT IN THIS LOCATION!!!!
Sooooooo slowwwwww! I've been here for 25 minutes. There are still 5 people ahead of me.

The food was great, but the service was poor. I had to wait five minutes for the cashier to finish his conversation in the back. The food guy yelled for him four times and ent in the back t
Wife for him. When the guy finally came out to ring up my order he asked what else he could do for me.  I told him I wanted a discount for waiting five minutes. He didn't get the manager, but he did laugh at me. No discount and no proper customer service.

This is the slowest most inefficient Chipotle I've ever visited. You can't keep the line moving on a normal evening. How could you possibly think you can handle the crowd on the opening night of the world series while offering a BOGO discount? The line is in the parking lot and barely moving. Inept at best.

I've been coming to this location for years. 
It's the best in the area! Trust me I've been to every one.
I actually live closer to the Oswego one but I love south Naperville so I always go there instead!
Friendly and courteous staff always!
Solid for what it is--sometimes disappointed with portions here when compared to other chipotle's, but It's still good.

What can i say, it's good quality fast Mexican food.  The one thing that impresses me with this corporation, is no matter which city I'm in, the food consistency is always the same - consistently good.

Consistency.... 5th time I've came here and got rice that is not cooked. I expect crunch from the veggies but not rice. Seriously, I understand this place gets busy, but TASTE TEST YOUR FOOD before serving! 

Aside from that, the service is quick and the severs are nice.

Chipotle is usually a win for me no matter which restaurant I'm at, but my experience at this location was less than stellar. What a chaotic mess!

I stopped in with my mom and grandma to pick up some lunch to go. There was about four people in line ahead of us, but we actually showed up just in time because about a minute later the line was flowing out the door.

The employees working the assembly line were frantic and sloppy. Sure, it was busy, but the way they were flinging food was ridiculous. I felt bad for the woman in front of me who had questions about the kids meal options. They were not explaining things well at all and kept rushing her along. Customer service really went out the window.

Needless to say it was uncomfortable for everyone. The food was good and what I would expect from Chipotle, however my chicken burrito bowl wasn't made exactly how I like. I usually ask for just a little hot sauce and a tad sour cream, but because I was rushed and food was flying, they globbed 'em both on pretty heavy.

Disappointing. I think I'll stick to the Chipotle on Route 59.

My family and I went here for dinner on Tuesday.  The restaurant was reasonably busy but the staff was welcoming and friendly.  I asked for white rice without cilantro and they happily went in back to get me some.  I appreciate that.  The order was assembled quickly and was rung up correctly.  The seating area was clean and there were plenty of napkins, straws, utensils and a small assortment of hot sauce.  The food orders were warm and tasted great!  My family enjoyed a good meal and we will definitely be back again.

Came here for lunch today! As a chiptole lover, I've never really had a bad experience. But what stuck out for me today was the fact we were approached by the new general manager (Juan) of this location. He approached while we enjoyed our lunch outside. He simply asked "What can we do better?" I thought it was really neat how genuine he wanted to know.  
Thanks for wanting to get feedback from your customers!! And congrats in your new job :)

We have been to many Chipotle restaurants across the Midwest and this location is on par with the best in terms of food quality and portions, hence the 5 stars. We have chipotle a few times a week and love the quality that they deliver. The only negative would be two of the cashiers that are not the most friendly ladies out there. When Chipotle sent out the free coupons one of the ladies rolled her eyes and said "another free one", although I purchase food there all the time. But alas, it is about the food for me since it is a fast food restaurant.

Closest location to my home. Have given them endless chances and rec'd numerous free meals, but enough is enough. Recd raw chicken AGAIN. The very night they closed all US locations for 4 hours to re-train them on the dangers of ecoli. Place is empty and they still hand out raw chicken.
Never again.

I enjoy eating at this Chipotle location, but my most recent experience this past week was AWFUL.  The person (white young guy, a bit overweight) that placed the last ingredients into my burrito, surprisingly used a counter top rag to wipe the INSIDE PART OF THE FOIL WRAPPER before wrapping my burrito. I saw it and repeatedly asked him why he did that.  He denied it and said he used a napkin. My friend next to me ALSO saw it and confirmed it too!! After leaving Chipotle I called them asking for the manager.  They gave me a person named Kirin. Kirin said I misinterpreted what I saw, but I know I saw a rag, NOT a paper napkin being used.  So, she continued to deny it.  I knew this was going nowhere. So, later in the week I spoke to the store manager, Juan.  He thanked me for the feedback and said he would look into it. I don't know if something was really done about it.  Anyway, if there is anything that you want to take away from this review, it should be that you carefully watch the people that are assembling your food.  THEY SHOULDN'T BE PUTTING YOU AT RISK FOR AN ILLNESS FROM IMPROPER FOOD HANDLING, LIKE USING A RAG TO WIPE THE INSIDE FOIL WRAPPER OF YOUR BURRITO.

Major fail tonight. Ordered ahead, wasn't ready when I arrived. When I got there, they started making right away.  I noticed they were doing it incorrectly so I pointed it out. They fixed it. Once the food was assembled (4 meals in total), they bagged it up and handed it to me. My my order incomplete. It was missing FOUR items. When I told the employee, she proceeded to make another guests order. I stood and waited and basically had to beg to be helped. After that, they still questioned my order and finally another employee said "just give it to her," which made me feel like they thought I was lying???  I had ordered two kid meals...they only gave me one drink and one side.  Should have been two. Also, I ordered a salad and wasn't given dressing. So when I noticed, I went back and asked for it and they told me they were out of dressing. It would have been nice to know before they made the SALAD. The best part of that salad is the dressing, imo.  Finally I left without the dressing or any sort of apology.  Coming off the bad rap recently from all of the food born illnesses (chipotle in general), you'd think they would make an effort to step up their customer service game.  Worst part, food was basically cold by the time I got home after all the nonsense back and forth.

I like many things about Chipotle.  The variety of food and the build your own are appealing. The lines though are ridiculous and there always  chaos at the counter especially when ordering multiple meals.  Solution to all of the- the Chipotle app! No line no waiting and no chaos at the counter!

I come to this chipotle all the time, I came in last time before they opened, and when I say before they opened I mean literally 3 minutes before, the staff was just sitting around staring at me while I tried to open both doors to get in. You would think that they would open the door for someone waiting outside trying to get in. Ill never go to this chipotle again. "Trying to lose customers" must be chiptoles new slogan. Its working for them.

I've been going here a few times a year since it opened, and each time I leave with regret. Trust me when I say the drive to the one more north on 59 by Meijer or the one in Bolingbrook is worth it!

Food: The same as every chipotle you've been to, but for some odd reason they always manage to screw something up... Rice isn't cooked well enough, chicken is not seasoned well and tastes horrible, guacamole tastes like nothing. One time I got a burrito and couldn't finish it because it was bad.

Service: Others have already mentioned this before, but the service is laughably slow. The lines aren't even THAT long maybe 10-15 people. Every other Chipotle I've been to could easily handle twice the crowd in the same amount of time. Severe lack of communication between employees on the line leads to a lot of wasted time. The employees look confused and just as annoyed as the customers are. I think the root of this is that they keep hiring braindead high school/college students leading to high turnover. Every time I go in there is an entirely new fleet of staff. Portion controls are abysmal (I have to ask for DOUBLE everything to get a semblance of a burrito I could get at any other Chipotle.)

Store: Minimal seating, but I guess that's the bullshit feng shui ambiance Chipotle goes for... I would not plan to dine in here during lunch or dinner as I doubt there'd be seating.

I am convinced the only thing keeping this abomination open is the fact that it has a location convenient enough that southside Naperville families are willing to give up a good Chipotle experience for convenience. Do yourself a favor and drive to a different Chipotle.

I love this place. I usually am working down the street so the iPhone app comes in handy and they are generally pretty good about getting it right.

If your iPhone order is messed up they will go out of their way to correct it.

I don't know what it is about this location, but 99% of the time it's too crowded to get into the door. Your wait time is generally 5+ minutes before you get to the front of the line, and one door to the outside is almost always broken (weird). I can only guess it's due to the popular location, or perhaps it's the slow service? Either way, I'm sure it's a profitable spot. The first few times I came here, hubby's burrito fell apart or ripped and grease went everywhere. It's getting better, and the people are very friendly, but until there's a consistent speedy turnaround, I won't be updating this review.

Quick sidenote: the sofritas are amazing! I used to be a loyal Barbacoa fan, but I've converted.

I need consistency from this place! I think I have eaten here a hundred times for the most part everything is good but once in a while things just are not right. Today I think whoever made the quac doubled the salt it was unbearable to the point I had to toss the rest. I like the concept the food is fresh not using any gmos and antibiotics is important. There are not many chains that do due to cost etc. I will continue to eat hear but need them to be more consistent when preparing the food!

Great food, attentive service, sometimes to expensive for a Fast Food Mexican restaurant; but if you want alright food really cheap you'd go to Taco Bell not Chipotle! My family and I love LOVE the shredded pork on or in ANYTHING, always piping hot, fresh, and juicy! Only bad thing I can say is that it's very 'cold' by that I mean uninviting. However, that's how the 'Industrial Design/Decor  typically makes a person feel. Which this is why we always get our food to go. Normally I am forced to make my kids to put the food in the front of the car (NO EATING IN THE CAR!!!) so they don't devour it all - before we can make it a little less than 2 miles to get home. Yummy so so good!!
The three stars are not for the food but for the sloooooooooowwwww service. Other than that the food is great. Stay away from the steak though, fatty and dry. Chicken is yummy

Chipotle is pretty much the same everywhere. They are consistent in their food, it's always very fresh, and I've never had poor, unfriendly service at any Chipotle location. This one in particular is very clean and the staff are outstanding. Regardless of how long the line is, you're guaranteed to get your food relatively quickly because of their burrito/bowl assembly line. It works very well! The only complaint I have about this location is the music. For some reason, it's like a club in here and you have to literally yell over the music. It's a real problem.
I've always had a good experience here! Clean and delicious food even during busy lunch rush!

Treated poorly by a young, in her late teens or early 20's, order taker-taco warmer girl. She assumed i want same meat on 3 tacos and blamed it on me when i told her otherwise. Nagged me like i was a child, the nerve!! Definitely no customer service training, no no with that kind of attitude, it's one thing to tell your customer to "next time say it really fast so i don't mess up your order" but it's pushing it and being just plain rude when you start banging the taco warmer!! Cashier rectified the situation and our disappointment by not making us pay for our orders-4 tacos total. Nice gesture by her, terrible experience nonetheless, never going back.

We went on opening day which also happened to be BOGO burritos for teachers.  The line was wrapped around the interior of the building, but it moved fast.  Two of the girls behind the counter looked frazzled while trying to keep up the pace, but they still kept their cool.  

All of the staff was upbeat and friendly, despite some customer complaints in line that they "weren't ready for this."  I don't agree with this at all, because the line moved quickly and efficiently, even when parents let their children, who can't see above the counter, order for themselves.

Perfect portions on the burrito bowls, and when I asked for "extra cheese," let me tell you - I got EXTRA cheese!

This location is super busy at lunch and dinner times but one thing I have to give props for is the fact that I went at dinner time and the line was coming outside the door and when it was my time to order the employee apologized for the wait and on top of that all the other employees still had smiles on their faces.  One of the employees mentioned that they were short handed as 3 employees had called off.  They had one employee in training and 2 others running the front end. I was extemely happy with the fact that they were super friendly despite being so busy.  Great customer service and of course  great tasting food.

Love this place. The barbacoa burrito bowl is my favorite. The staff is always friendly and the food is really good. The corn and the hot salsa are a must on the burritos or the bowl. Overall, a great lunch or dinner spot.
This is the most hectic chipotle I've ever been too, so unorganized all the workers r high, ripped two burritos well rolling it, terrible service
Steak is very tough to chew. Plus they are stingy with meat and TOO generous with sour cream. I mean who eats that much sour cream?!
Almost guaranteed to find a foreign object in your food. Last time I got a piece of steel.

I eat at this chipolte a few times a month, I'm always satisfied with the service I receive (usually from the same smiling faces) 
the one thing they can improve on is watching how the cut the steak, a handful of time I have had big chunks of fat (yuck). 
Other than that they give give portions and listen when you ask for extra anything. Service is always fast and efficient.

As far as Chipotle's go, everything was standard here. No problems with the order, got through the line quickly, food was great Chipotle quality. I'm giving the 5 star rating for the customer service! What a fun group of workers there! My friend requested the veggies for her meal, and they had swapped out a new tray for her, the server said "wow, just smell that!! doesn't that smell awesome?", with the way the windows were angled, this is not a possibility, but he was so nice and excited about it. The cashier was also friendly and joked around with us. It was nice to see.

It was okay, I asked for extra black beans, all I got was a watered down beans for my rice.. as a frequent on the road person, let me go and get a quick bite, how bad can it be.. It was noisy, 6 people behind the counter just standing there.. the manager was cleaning the tables.. pathetic, those employees need to be fired and get a new team.. it was cold in the establishment.. where is the heat?  I had a better experience at other Chipotle.. this Naperville location is to be missed.. I'd rather go to McDonald's..

I place online orders regularly and with many different Chipotles across the area. This location is by far the most attentive and most consistent in their quality.  When you are ordering for clients that can sometimes be picky with their food, this is very important. I find myself even going out of my way to use this location when I'm placing larger orders.  Also, their guacamole is always the best compared to other locations. They all might use the same recipe, but not all guacamole is created equally.

First time at this location, I stopped in for a burrito bowl and as always the food quality was very good. My favorite is the carnitas with cilantro lime white rice and black beans. No burrito bowl is complete without chips and guacamole. The guacamole is always fresh and the chips are perfectly salted. The "assembly line" process they use is fast and effective. I usually get mine "to go" so I can enjoy cervesa with my meal at home without worrying about the drive. I've always had good customer service at other locations, but here I was treated to exceptional customer service. The staff was friendly and helpful, but  I was struck by the girl who was serving the salsa/guacamole/cheese etc. She had the most infectious smile and seemed to really enjoy her job. I was so impressed, I complimented her directly, I wish I had got her name because she deserves mention here. It was a great overall experience and I will be back.
Can never go wrong with this location!! Food is always at its freshest & the crew is amazing and accommodating!! Love love love it!!!!!
Every time I visit, no matter what day or time of day, the service is so slow. Doesn't have to be. I've been to other locations and they MOVE!

This location is a hot mess.  The employees have terrible communication issues and they are always yelling at one another to do thibtgs. I always have to wait for them to cook and/or refill ingredients I want and no one is ever happy.  I'll go out of my way from now on to another location after 5 consecutive bad experiences. Also pretty dirty/messy.

I really enjoy eating at Chipotle and the one here in Plainfield is a very good one to eat at. The food has always been fresh, the restaurant is clean and I have always had good service. My favorite is the barbacoa bowl, brown rice, black beans and all the extras.
I can't think of a better meal for under $10.  Well run and a good crowd.  Occasionally the line runs out of this or that but not too often.
The skimpiest portions of meat of any Chipotle I've been to. The location works for me, so I go hete. I might need to make some longer trips.
Not a fan of this location. Love Chipotle in general, but this one even feels different from the others and seems to be poorly managed. Sorry

For being so new I was surprised it was so bad.  My burrito had a tiny bit of cheese in the corner fold and a 2 inch long piece of plastic.  They also didn't have any ice.  I had this order pre made so I didn't see them make it but I would have said something.   Email the corporate office quite some time ago and have heard nothing.

Our family loves Chipotle, but we will drive several miles out of our way to find a different Chipotle location. The service here is poor...the employees are very rude and have bad attitudes....poor portion size....and the restaurant portion is always rather dirty.

I have actually been eating here when other customers have complained to management about the attitude of the employees, etc. and he did not react as you would expect management to react.
One of the slowest chipotles I've ever been to, over many different trips.always a long line(10mins etc) and a lot of employees standing around while 1-2 make the whole order for everyone in line.

I live close to this location and it would be great if I could go here. However, I will no longer waste my time going to this location. I would rather drive an extra 10 minutes. The wait time is higher than any chipotle I've experienced. Beyond that, I once placed a phone order and upon picking it up, the manager told me not to place phone orders anymore because it slows them down. I explained that there is no quesadilla option on the online order website which is why I called it in. He made me feel stupid. When your website provides a phone number to order, you take the order. There may be people who don't have access to the Internet and would like to order by phone. In another incident, the line was so long when I got to the checkout that the woman charged my credit card before my order was done being prepared. The man preparing my burrito bowl put guacamole on it after she charged the card. At this time, in a rude tone, the woman says "well I didn't charge you for that" as she sticks her hand out for my card. I would have no problem paying for the guac as I intended to, but this is the cashier's error. She wanted to charge the card before my order was ready because the line was very long. Customer service and work ethic at this location are horrendous. I recommend you drive the extra 10 minutes to get a good chipotle experience.

I travel constantly for work, and I've had a lot of pho at a lot of vietnamese restaurants all over the US - the pho I had here was quite surprisingly some of the best I've ever had!!

The broth was aromatic and flavorful, the noodles had the right consistency, and the combination of tendon, tripe, beef balls and flank was pretty amazing. I will say the flank was a bit overdone and could've been thinner/rarer, but it was still delicious.

I can't comment on the service - I came in at 5pm on a Tuesday and I'm the only customer here (I'm literally still here, because I ordered a banh mi sandwich to go). I am DEFINITELY coming back here again though, and as much as I love pho, I might need to try some of the other dishes here as I'm sure they're just as amazing.

I rarely give less than 3 stars unless something was really poor. I think my review which was a 1st visit may have come on a night (5pm) the kitchen was having an off-day. I think we should have ordered some kind of Pho. Because the other entrees weren't very good. Mom had shrimp skewer over sliced pork over vermicelli.  Noodles were dry and hard to cut, shrimp tough,  pork very tough even tho I soaked it in my broth for her. Dad had overcooked eggplant. I had chicken, pineapple and veggie fried rice that was just OK. 

Service seemed disinterested and overly busy. When we arrived we were one of 2 families there. Quiet and pleasant. But the noise level went through the roof as the place filled up. The wooden chairs on a wooden floor didnt help. My parents have hearing aides and werent able to hear well though the din. The decor was interesting though! Which my parents liked but they won't be back. Maybe I will and order Pho which looked tasty and give another review later.

The food is extremely fresh and consistently delicious, service is good and the décor has been upgraded.  I recommend:

Salt & pepper calamari
Fried tofu and broccoli in oyster sauce
And item 402

A very solid pho restaurant. Glad it's close to home so that we don't have a long drive to Chicago or other suburbs for some good pho. 

With that said, we did eat here on a Friday night and noticed that they were understaffed. The service was a long wait even though there were only 3 other tables when we arrived. Also, the prices seemed a bit high compared to other pho restaurants, then once again we are paying for the convenience of having one in our own neighborhood.

Pho. It has been years since I've had it. I tried it again yesterday and I have learned to appreciate it a lot more. Green Basil, a hidden gem looks like a house turned into a restaurant, is in downtown Naperville surrounded by so many restaurants. It's easy to miss but I'm glad I stumbled upon it! Our server was cute and friendly, helped us through the menu and made good recommendations. The restaurant was busy but we got seated right away. We ordered Muc rang muoi (calamari was okay) and cha gio (spring rolls were yummy) for appetizer. Pho tai nam gau, green basil com chien (w/o pork) and tom ram man as the main course. I would definitely recommend checking it out for Vietnamese food and Pho cravings.

I've been here twice and the service is a hit or miss. The first time, we came when it was less busy and with a smaller party, and the service was spectacular. However, the second time I went, the restaurant was more crowded and I had a party of about twelve people, and the service was very spotty. We kept having to request for more of this or that, food came out slow, water was not filled, and even the waitress was a bit rude/standoffish towards us.

Service aside, this place has really yummy Vietnamese curry and coffee (Cafe Su Da). Their pho is okay, I thought the broth could have been a bit hotter (in temperature). 

The decor is very Vietnamese oriented with little trinkets and sculptures relating to Vietnamese cultures. The place is a bit hard to find because it looks like a house and the entrance towards it was a one way street so you have to go further down and enter through the bank parking lot and loop around...

This is a good option if you live in the west burbs and are craving Viet food and too lazy to drive to Argyle.

3.5 stars

Came here the day after Halloween for a hangover cure since our go to closed down. We ordered the pho, Vietnamese ice coffee with condensed milk, and calamari.

Calamari 4/5 stars. The calamari was a nice texture and lightly fried. The flavor was nice and not too greasy. For $12 it was a very skimpy portion which would prevent me from ordering this again.

Pho: 3/5 the beef was tender and flavorful but the broth lacked the depth of flavor I'm looking for in a nice bowl of steaming pho. It was sweeter than normal and tasted as if it could stand to simmer another 5 hours. The flavor was lighter and left me wanting for more. The portion was okay but not worth $10.

Iced Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk: 3/5 it lacked the complexity of flavor I look for in Vietnamese coffee but it was strong and sweet. It does the job but I wouldn't order it again.

Ambiance: 2.5/5 stars. The decor is nice but I watched the hostess seat a family at a table that had an extremely dirty floor. The chairs are hard and uncomfortable and the layout is a little strange. 

Service 2/5 stars. Typical non attentive Vietnamese service but it came from nonvietnamese servers. The dirty dishes stayed on our table the entire duration of the meal. They forgot our ice coffee and didn't check up on us at all. We had to flag then down for the check a box. For these prices, a little more attentiveness would be nice.

Overall, I don't think the ambiance justifies the exorbitant price since the service was extremely lacking. I'd only go here this place for when I'm desperate and not willing to drive to Argyle.

I've been biting my tongue about this place for the longest time. I created my Yelp to SPECIFICALLY leave a comment about this restaurant (And I leave really good reviews for plenty of places). Every time I try to give this place a second chance, it's ruined by the service. Here is what I want to say:

IT SEEMS as if (does not mean it is one hundred percent true, just in my experiences) you are young, and do not look rich, the servers will make you less of a priority than those who do. The service is straight up bad. 

I used to be a LOYAL customer to this place. And by loyal, I mean I went here every single week, and I tipped over 20% every single time. The servers recognized me and my friend. Both of us attended North Central College. We are college students, we are young. I used to serve and I know how difficult it can be. It's hard. I get it. A lot of people don't tip good. So I would always tip over 20%.

Let me start off by saying the food here is TO DIE FOR. It's by far the best Vietnamese food I've had period. This is why we went here all the time. 

This is where things get bad. I started to notice the service getting worse. For some ungodly reason, this place closes for like, 3 hours in the middle of the day. If you come an hour before they close, they are SUPER rude. I get that it is frustrating, but 1. You shouldn't close your restaurant in the middle of the day, and 2. You don't show your customers you are irritated. I worked at a TGI Fridays and people would come in  MINUTES before closing and it is STILL your obligation to serve them. This business does not uphold that standard.

But alas, it gets worse. One day, my boyfriend and I ordered for pickup about an hour before they closed in the middle of the day. We noticed that the charge was 10$ for something that is normally 8$. That was really sketchy and we didn't realize it until later. Even then, we tipped and went on our way. Be careful when ordering for pickup.

We still continued to go here until we gave them their last chance. They take FOREVER to get you water at this place if you run out. This is a consistent thing, not a one time thing. So my boyfriend and I were asking our server to get us water, and in the middle of asking her, an older, richer looking woman asked for something at a table by us. Our server DROPPED WHAT SHE WAS TALKING ABOUT to rush to the other guest. Little things like this happened CONSTANTLY, and it just became too much to continue going there. Also, in the same visit, the girl fought with her coworker on their ear pieces IN FRONT OF US and during our conversation. I mean like, yelling through the earpiece. It was a mess.

It really sucks because the food is good. It costs more than normal Vietnamese places, but the quality is better. Too bad the service is the worst I have ever had anywhere, because I would continue to go here.

I get that young people don't always tip. However, assuming this is discrimination based on age. I always tip 20% or more when my service is okay.  Sometimes I tip 20% even when the service is kind of bad just to disprove this stereotype. When you are a regular who consistently does this, it is IRRITATING when the employees blatantly lack on your service, while working hard for other customers. I will never eat here again.

A better option is Noodles Pho U, which is also in Naperville. 100% better service and more options on the menu. The food isn't as quality, but it is still really good.

Spring rolls were very good. Calamari appetizer perfect size for two to share. 

I was not hungry so this was a perfect stop. Spring rolls and calamari. 

The calamari was unusual as it was served with diced onions which added a great taste b

Can't wait to come back for the soup.

My food came out quickly, however I asked for no tripe.  There was a ton of tripe in my dish.  Not cool.  We were the only table there, so it's not like they were rushing things in the kitchen. I also wished the dish had more flavor.  I'm not into bland mediocre food.  I won't be going back.

As I personally predicted, I received no response from the owner of this restaurant after my last review.
The owner is obviously apathetic to the majority of the reviews that highlight the absolute poor service of this restaurant. Their lack of action and minus zero star service implicitly and explicitly communicates a manipulative assumption of support from a small core group of people who come back for a type of cuisine they can't get locally anywhere else--irrespective of how they're treated.

This is an awful restaurant.

Green Basil is a clean restaurant because the floor is not sticky. Decorations were spot on. There were paintings of ancient Vietnam and many Asian sculptures and fake plants which set the mood for fine dining. 

The waitress was very kind. When I said "thank you", she said "You're very welcome" in the most soothing voice ever. 

Ordered Com Suon Nuong which is a rice dish with grilled pork chops, lettuce, cucumbers, and tomatoes on the side with a price tag of $10.50. While it is not the most authentic I've tasted in Vietnamese restaurants in the Chicago suburbs, it was still enjoyable to eat. The portion was just enough for me. Unfortunately, there were no doggy bags to take home. 

When the check came, I was sad that there were no fortune cookies or guava candy offered. Only toothpicks at the front.

Everything was so good! Specially their soup!  
I just wish their servers will be more attentive. They "maybe" forget to refill our glass with water, but overall every food that we ordered was spot on!

I like the food but the wait staff seems like they're all stressed out and don't know what to do when they get busy. They also try to rush you into ordering. Yeah you have like 20 things on the menu but I still need some time to think and settle in before I decide. There's one lady there who's older with glasses and she really pissed me off because she gave me attitude and just rushed me when I didn't even know what to order. She just stood there while I was trying to decide what to eat. Vermicelli was pretty good but the pork is really dry. Pho is pretty good too best Asian food I had while here in Chicago. (Not really sayin much) but I went here a few times during my stay and it was good.

Wow what a surprise! Great food! Even my teenagers loved it. Super fresh, clean, good service. Been back several times can't believe I did not review before now! Had the Pho soup amazing. Fried rice rocked. Spring rolls addicting.
The pho is okay. Pretty average. I'm very impressed with their willingness to accommodate my vegetarian friend though.

First I will say the chicken wings appetizers were amazing. I have never had them so big and so crispy and so flavorful. Saying that, that was the highlight of our lunch. We went with the Chicken wings and Spring rolls but apps, and Bahn-Mi and Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio for entree. 
Don't get me wrong the food was good but it didn't stand out. It tasted like other vietnamese food I had. If you live in the area then defintely check this place out. If you live far away, I don't think it is worth the drive. Living in the Joliet/Shorwood area. I am fortuate enough to havre two restaurants in the area.

I had high hopes, but it was just...bad. He ordered 302 - Pho Tai Nam Gau Gan Sach and said he wanted it without the tripe (beef intestines) twice. It was brought with the tripe, and no biggie, except there was a TON of it. And it was a throw-away, tenuous tissue filler similar to eating cartilage. Not good. I ordered the 402 - Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio. Things were going good...until I turned over a side of the rice noodles in the dish and a dark hair was tangled up within the noodles. I wanted to take the blame, but my hair was pulled back into a ponytail. And it didn't look like mine. It was too dark. The server apologized & said if we came back, we could order the 302 without the tripe. We both said at the same time, "We did." The girl who took our order got it wrong. The guy who settled up our bill was very apologetic. I really wanted to like this place, but I'm not hungry for hair anytime soon.

Everyone I work with R E A L L Y loves this place but I find it to just be OK. Historically speaking, I loooove rice bowl/boxes and was totally spoiled in NY when I had a hard time deciding which vietnamese / banh mi place I liked best.

So I 'spose my expectations are high. I've tried the rice bowl here a few times, hoping that maybe it was just an off day in the kitchen. Sadly, the predominant memories of my meals here are of very dry/overcooked pork, too-heavy-on-the-fish sauce vietnamese vinaigrette, and a shocking amount of bean sprouts. It's also kind of pricey for what you get.

However, their Vietnamese Iced Coffee is VERY delicious, and they have great service. Maybe I'll try the sandwiches or pho and report back.

The pho here definitely doesn't compare with the ones you'll get in Little Saigon In California, but it does the trick. 

The soup here is light yet flavorful and the meat tender. The bowl is quite large, but for the price I still think it's a little over priced. The portion of meat to noodle is definitely not right. There needs to be more meat for a $10 of noodle. 

The piece here is actually a little overpriced. If you get an appetizer and a bowl of pho; it will run you about $20. 

One of the main reason I come here is the Ban Xia. It's a batter crepe with bean sprouts, shrimp and pork fried in a pan until they're super crispy. You eat it in a lettuce wrap and dip it in fish sauce. So fatty yet so good. 

I definitely would come here again to satisfy my craving since there's no other choices in the burb to her pho's like the one in California. 


Tip: close between 3 and 5.

What a great little restaurant nestled in downtown Naperville!!! Easy parking which is the least important part of this review haha. We started with tofu spring rolls which were good but the tofu was a little greasy; it was almost as if they dusted it in flour and then deep fried it? But they well put together; they came with a great peanut sauce that had a slight undertone of chili. I ordered the Phó which was light, aromatic and delicious (most of the reason for the 4 stars) my friend is a vegan and ordered a fried rice with tofu; I thought the dish was bland and heavy a tad too greasy for me. She liked it though. Another highlight of the meal was the Vietnamese coffee!!!! Omgness it was so strong and rich, not at all bitter. They steep it on the table for you. The thing with ALL Vietnamese restaurants is that the meal is an experience; the food comes out slow. Enjoy your time at this adorable little restaurant with your company and savor every bite!
In from California and needed to get some pho and was not disappointed. Do try this place great service and delicious food. Try their avocado smoothie and mix it with their Vietnamese iced coffee!
I adore Green Basil!  The pho is fresh, flavorful, hot and delicious!  Service is very quick, friendly, and efficient.  Love the casual atmosphere.  A secret gem of Naperville!

We found out about this place by accident.  A tantalizing aroma was wafting towards Jefferson Avenue and we saw a lady with a carry-out bag.  Always on the look out for new great food, we asked her where she (and the smell of spring rolls mixed with mint leaves) was coming from.  She was kind enough to stop and tell us about Green Basil, and also informed us about the noodle dish she preferred. 
My first visit was with my husband and niece about a week later.  They tried a beef noodle soup.  My husband likes a little heat, and tried mixing some spicy sauce from the table with it, while my little niece was in noodle heaven.  I had fried calamari which was outstanding.
The second time I took my friend and we tried a bunch of appetizers.  I loved the chicken wings, but was disappointed with the spring rolls.  They were just average.  
I wish the waitress would explain how to use certain condiments because we didn't know what went with what. 
Overall, great food and a quaint atmosphere make me give Green Basil four stars.

Hands down the best Vietnamese restaurant I have evee been in the States. ×) I loved it! 

sticky chicken wings were awesome (kindda reminded me of Korean fried chicken (kyochon)) crispy and sweet. Vietnamese sandwich was also on point, fresh and crispy! yumm. 

I had house specialty pho dac biet, and I especially loved the fact all meat parts seemed clean and did not smell bad- which is common issue with other restaurants' pho with tendon and tripes. 

The smoothies with boba were great as well. I had strawberry smoothie and splited with my bf and they even splited into two separate cups. that was nice :)

I was so happy after the meal. I am going to be back!

I'm half Vietnamese and this was super authentic, delicious, and great value!  Im definitely recommend dining at this hidden gem. It's a bit tucked away but so worth it.

I got bun thit nuong cha goa. (vermacelli bowl) and the chicken wings for an appetizer. So good!!

Portions are good sized and good value. 

Service is good but a bit slow. They are nice though.

We go here quite often. The food is delicious, healthy and fresh. We always enjoy everything we get here. Service can be a little slow when they are packed but it is not worth taking any stars away when the food is that good. Great place for a family meal!

The pho is really good. The banh mi were alright, but nothing special. One time when I went I was the only customer and there were three or four waitresses standing idly while another took care of me, but the other time I went the place was pretty full and there was only a single waitress for the whole restaurant. The staffing could use some work, but I've had slower service before. Overall, I'd go there again. It's too bad it's so hidden, I've lived in Naperville for 18 years before discovering it!

I think this was my first time trying Vietnamese food. I really liked it. Usually my wife and I go out for Thai food and this compares very well. We tried 3 appetizers; shrimp eggrolls, crispy calamari and sticky chicken wings. All three were excellent. The main entree Tom Ram Man (Jumbo shrimp in garlic and Chilli sauce) was also very good. Overall a good experience.

Really great food for an extremely reasonable price. I was able to get Vietnamese iced coffee, a favorite of mine, which is hard to find. The menu has plenty of options, but not so many that it's overwhelming to read. 

The restaurant has very quaint decor which makes for a pleasant dining atmosphere.  The staff is polite and attentive. 

I plan to make a point of coming here more often, as I feel that it may be overlooked since it's not in central downtown Naperville.

We ordered Cha Gio (crispy egg roll) $5.50 and Bo Nuong Sot Dat Biet (grilled cubed filet mignon) $8.50. The filet bites were incredible with lots of unique flavor.
