Our server offered to bring five rather than the listed four of each item to accommodate our family. Friendly service in a casual setting just a block east of Washington.

Went on a Wednesday night around 6.30.  Not busy at the time but by the time we left they were very busy.  The food was really good and tasty!  Two us shared 101 - goi cuon, shrimp rolls, 308- pho ga chicken based soup with noodles, bean sprouts, lime, 507- ca ri ga - curry chicken.  My favorite was the curry chicken.  It had so much flavor.  When you eat the pho ga, you need to add sauce for additional flavor/spice.  Service was slow when we were done and we didn't get a refill on our water.  I think they got busy and didn't have enough help to cover everyone.  The server was very nice and helped us navigate the menu to decide what to order.  It was plenty of food for two and we had leftovers.

I do not usually order pho at a restaurant, I prefer homemade pho. However, I was still hangover from the night before and my friends kept telling me "pho is the best cure for hangover". One of the cleanest pho restaurant I have seen so far in Chicago. I got pho dac biet and the broth was really flavorful. For the smoothies, they actually use real fruits instead of powders. The spring rolls were ok, nothing too special.

What a pleasant surprise! 

I typically frequent Argyle so I arrived without expectations. Four of us came dined in on a Sunday afternoon and we shared an order of cha gio, bun thit nuong, banh xeo, and bun bo hue. 

In English terms, the cha gio is a plate with four pieces of egg rolls with shrimp, water chestnut, carrot, and glass noodle. There is a side of fish sauce for dipping. Each bite was welcomed with a crisp and the ingredients were very refreshing. The bun thit nuong is rice vermicelli with pork tenderloin, lettuce, bean sprout, mint, roasted peanuts and fish sauce. Whenever I order vermicelli at other places, they are usually too dry. Green Basil does it just right with very juicy and well-grilled tenderloin. It is served cold so I would highly suggest having this on a summer day. The bun bo hue is much more winter-friendly because it is a bowl of traditional spicy beef noodles soup with pork shank and pork pate. It is mildly spicy without killing too many of your tastes buds. I could easily have this whole bowl to myself without sharing. But the star of the afternoon would definitely go to the banh xeo which is Vietnamese crepes with crispy rice, shrimp, pork, bean sprouts, mint leaves, basil, and lime fish sauce. It takes a bit longer to prepare but your time will be well-spent. The portion is huge and the batter is perfect. Just listen to the slight cracking sound as you cut into the crepe. You won't find that elsewhere! 

This is a rarity that I will make an effort to revisit!

I want to give this place a higher rating but I just can't.  I come to Naperville on business often and always looking for an ethnic flare instead of the chain restaurants near my hotel. 

This place is cute.  Located downtown, the area is nice with many stores in walking distance.   The service was good and the decor was above average for a Viet place.  

I ordered the spring rolls which at 4.50 were very very tasty.  The wrappers were tight and cheery and full of shrimp and meat. The peanut sauce was a little bland but I enjoyed the fact that it is served warm.  You can add aittle of the the hoisin sauce for more flavor.  

Instead of getting pho, which I heard was bland, I got the bun bo hue. Spicy beef noodle soup.  This is a delicacy in many parts of this country as a good bowl is hard to come by.  The bowl was big but mostly full of broth.  The noodles to broth ratio was odds   Very little noodle and meat to lots of broth.  That won't be such a bad thing except the broth was bland.  It lacks the essence of bun Bo hue, the lemongrass and shrimp paste flavor.   The meat was tensor but small bits and hey we're missing the quintessential herb, rau ram, which is required for this dish.  

Overall the the western palate, this place will suffice.  For the Asian and ethnically inclined, I say get the rice dishes because the soups are lacking in my book.

Really loved this charming restaurant, only, being a vegetarian, am a bit disappointed they don't have much on their menu for us veggies. Also, service staff a bit inattentive, but very nice. Whatever I did have though was extremely good and fresh.
The pho here is great for cold days and hangovers.

I've been to pho restaurants across the country. I ALWAYS get pho Dac Biet. I can without a doubt say this is my favorite. The broth seems is extremely flavorful, filled with the spices you'd find in a homemade pho.

As far as the portions go, this place is the most generous of any bowl I've had in regards to tripe, tendon, and beef. Wow, my search is complete for a great local Vietnamese place.

definitely one of the better pho places around the neighborhood. Service is very fast and courteous. The interior of the place seems a little lacking but to be honest Im not there to enjoy the view. Definitely would go again for a local pho fix.

The Vietnamese food here rivals and in some cases surpasses Argyle. There I've said it. 

Coming from the busy, bustling, city, hectic, fend-for-yourself lifestyle of Viet-town Chicago, it was strange to see calm, open seating in a small clean Vietnamese restaurant in downtown Naperville. While the change of pace is nice, the main reason I constantly return is because of the fantastic food. 

I usually start off with a Vietnamese Coffee, which is both strong in coffee and strong in condense milk, providing a huge kick start to the meal. It's delicious, but sometimes a little too sweet for me (but the ice and addition of a bit of water helps). 

I have tried to sample a bit of everything on the menu, here's my favorites. 

Appetizers - 
While traditionally people usually go to the Goi Cuan (rice paper spring rolls), I usually go with the Cha Gio (fried variety). While the Goi Cuan is not bad, it really doesn't stand out from the other Vietnamese experiences I've had. However, the Cha Gio really seems to outshine the Goi Cuan. The crispy of the skin combined with savory shrimp inside all wrapped in a lettuce/pickled veggies dipped in a fantastically tangy fish sauce  really makes me savor at the thought of it. The fried spring rolls come pipping hot, and  really get the meal started off right. 

Noodles -
I love pho, but I'm not a huge fan of pho here. Once again, not because the pho is bad, it's more because the pho is slightly average comparably to Viet-town. However, the Bun Bo Hue (spicy beef soup) is really special. The many different varieties of meat soak in the spicy broth as they bring out a plate of special veggies that really provide it a nice crunch. The broth is different and delicious, while the noodles also have a different texture from pho. The noodles in this dish are slightly thicker and a bit chewier. The beef shank usually is really flavorful and slightly fatty (almost melts in your mouth). After having this once, I never went back to the pho. 

Rice Vermicelli - 
I haven't tried too many of the rice vermicelli dishes, but I did try the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio (pork chop vermicelli). The pork chop was tender and flavorful, seasoned nicely to compliment the star of the dish, fish sauce. The fish sauce carries the rest of the dish to glory as it ties in the vermicelli, the pork, the pickled veggies, and peanuts. While I don't order it often, it's definitely a treat when I do. 

Star of the show - Bahn Xeo 
So the main reason I come to Green Basil is the fantastic Bahn Xeo (Vietnamese pancake). It is seriously the best I've had anywhere. The batter is cooked to a beautiful crisp to perfectly compliment lettuce and pickled veggies. There is a generous in the pork and shrimp pieces inside the pancake, and the house fish sauce really gives it that great tangy balance. This is by far my favorite dish. 

Overall, the experience isn't flawless, but it has quickly become a regular weekend lunch spot for me. The service can be hit or miss, the classic food selections (pho, Goi Cuan) can turn out average. But if you explore a bit into the menu, you can really stumble upon a memorable experience that you will want to revisit time and time again.

Voting Green Basil as Number #1 Vietnamese place in Chicago area! The pho soup has the distinctive scent of freshness and you can feel that it has been on the stove for long hours. I have tried the soup at several other places and I can easily tell if the soup is truly from bones or simply from bone powder. This place is truly from bones and the soup was on the stove for HOURS! The spring roll was fantastic and I loved it! I am a strong advocate of this place.

I have been to this place several times but have never thought about leaving a review. After comparing the beef pho with another Viet Pho place I went to recently, I decided that Green Basil should receive credit for the flavorful beef pho they have. The beef broth here is very good, full of flavor and aroma. And by the time you finish your rice noodle, the broth is still very tasty instead of tasting like water in some other places. The reason I gave it 4 stars is that they forgot the sandwich I ordered and I ended up cancelling it.
Vietnamese food in downtown Naperville. Pho is the main reason to be there but don't forget about the rest of the menu

It's about time Naperville got itself a Vietnamese pho restaurant! 

The pho tai ($9 beef noodles w/ sliced beef) was to die for. The broth was what did it for me, super rich & flavorful. The portion size was generous and the plating presentation was delicate. We also ordered the spring rolls but those were pretty average. 

The weather happened to be perfect so we were lucky to be able to snag some outdoor seating on the patio. Only wish I had known it's byob, though be advised there is a corkage fee.

Amazing food we are regulars here now and come once a week sometimes even twice a week.
The service is great and the staff are very nice.
We love this place!

this is for carryout.  We had a couple of the pho...the spicy red one and the chicken noodle....both were very good...the spicy red did have kind of lesser quality beef cuts...a little fatty, gristle.  Next time I would prbably get spicy red with chicken.

the sticky wings are also really good.  really fresh stuff no doubt...best pho we have had in this area for sure.

cold vietnamese coffee also makes for a great dessert drink.

Came here a few days ago since the last visit for about 3 years. Thought service would be better but it hasn't changed or improved. It's such a shame because the food here is actually good. Years ago, the food ordered was out...this time the tapioca was out for smoothies. Took almost 20 minutes for the food to come out- had to ask the waiter. Okay, food came but waiter forgot the eating utensils so I had to ask for spoons. While I was eating, I could see, near the entrance/counter, a huge family waiting to be seated and it took the workers also 20 minutes to seat them. Ended up giving no tip. Probably not going to eat here for a long time...

The pork chop on rice is really delicious!  The price is high for Vietnamese food but at least I don't need to drive to the city.   I also ordered the spring rolls and it was good too.  The peanut sauce was flavorful and the texture is just right.   The only bad thing was they had only two people working there.   It was busy so the service was terrible.   Great food but bad service.

This place was relatively good. My husband and I went for lunch and we both ordered the pork with vermacelli noodles which was delicious, and we shared sticky chicken wings, which tasted a little old. Overall nice environment, and the service was efficient.

I have to say it that I have never been treated as rude as I was today.  We had a good lunch but when it came time to pay they didn't have change. Our bill was $30.00 and u have them $100. She said she had no change... What. You've been open with full house for 2 hours.. No change? Then she threw the bill at us

Lesson here is that if you are a small business owner you never know who the customer is. So this nationally food critic now has something to write about

Horrid service if you go order the egg rolls
And bring small change as they seem to be struggling to make enough money to make change

"Welcome to Green Basil. We close in 20 minutes." That was our greeting at 8:40pm on a Saturday night in downtown Naperville, where we had many other choices. Surprisingly, though, there are very few Vietnamese choices in Naperville. We usually drive to Luong Loi in Wheaton but they were closed, so we were kind of stuck. We ended up waiting quite a while for someone to take our order. We soon figured out why...the staff were busy eating their dinner! Other tables were finishing up and a lot of tables hadn't been bussed yet. After everyone else left they decided to noisily bus the tables while we were eating. After a disappointing fried tofu appetizer and so-so bowls of pho, we were out the door at 9:10...they thanked us with a smile and said "come back soon." No thanks!

One of the best Vietnamese restaurant in the Chicago area. The foods are delicious. We had Pho, Bun Bo Hue, Bun thit nuong cha gio, Com xuon nuong, Bo la lot. They are are very tasty and authentic. The restaurant is nice and clean. The staffs are friendly. I am glad to have it in Naperville so we do not have to go Chicago for Vietnamese food. Highly recommended Vietnamese restaurant.

I came in from out of town and had to try this place from a friend's recommendation. I have to say, I'm glad I did! The decor was nice and homey and the food was great, but probably even better was that it was actual authentic Vietnamese cuisine, something that's hard to find in most places. Definitely recommend the Roasted Pork Belly and their avocado smoothies. The chef, Nick was also incredibly nice and showed great hospitality. I would definitely be here again on my next trip to Chi town!

I love the food here specially the fried rice, rice wrap with shrimp, soup and more the smoothies!. My favorite Avocado smoothie. The price is decent.
The only thing that I always complain is the service: very impersonal. The lady, who always serves me or my family to go or eat at the restaurant is polite, but never makes any effort to recognize me as a frequent client (since 2013) or at least smile.

Finally a worthy Pho place tucked behind us bank on the other side of the Irish pub. The filet mignonette appetizer was very good with watercress garnish. The Pho tastes very original and not a lot of msg. This will definitely be our weekly stop for our lunch

Green beef curry is delish! So is the fried rice. So flavorful. 

Best thing they have - everything!
Good Vietnamese food but I concur with other reviewers that service can be spotty.  And for the most part friendliness is not part of the bargain.  But the food makes it worthwhile.

We heard about this place on Chicago's Best, and want to give a try. 

Pho: very very good. good broth, tender meat, very good spice and flavor. 

Com Suon Nuong:   It is very good.  It was also recommended on the Chicago Best. 

Coffee: the only thing I was disappointed about this place was the coffee.  I have been to Vietnam, the way they serve it was with a dripping system and the coffee slowly dripping to the condensed milk.  The way they serve it is just a cup of coffee.. Although the taste was ok, it was not authentic Vietnam coffee. 

That's why I gave it four star.  But I will definitely come back.

Good food and pretty authentic from what I'm told. Enjoyed dinner here with a friend and his son - my godson, who about a year and a half ago returned from several months of teaching English in Vietnam. He said everything we ordered was right on course.

OK - bear with me as I can't recall the actual Vietnamese names of what I enjoyed, but I'll tell you I ordered a 101 and a 403. The 101 is essentially your standard spring roll thing with a pretty decent peanut sauce. The 403 was Vietnamese Fried Rice and was also pretty good - a bountiful order as well. In addition to that I also enjoyed their chicken wings (a "1 - oh - something") that were really more like drumettes. Believe me, no chicken could have ever flown with what was served to us. Those too, hit the spot.

I did observe some service issues at other tables while I was waiting for my friends to come, but our service was spot on. It's a BYOB place - we enjoyed dinner with some Eugene Porter from Revolution Brewery - a good pick. Overall a good choice - as some have noted, it's a little hard to find and parking is best done at the CBD lot across the street.

our Sunday brunch ritual. constant crave. favorites are spring rolls, tangy/crispy chicken wings appetizer, pho, and bahn mi. but everything else is delicious too. wish they cut down on msg though -- I get really thirsty afterwards. but we love this place. and it's okay that it's no longer byob -- less crowded so we can be sure to have a table.

The guy and I had a delightful meal the other night. Appetizers of tofu spring rolls and papaya salad with fresh mint, shrimp and pork.  The papaya dish alone would have been a fine entrée, and was super.  The rolls came with peanut and chili sauce.  The guy ordered a cornish hen that was delicious well beyond our expectations.

All in all, the flavor combination possibilities were bountiful.

The service is polite.  It's not a fancy place.  The servers are dressed casually - it's all about the food.

BYOB!

Good / fast / cheap, it gets a perfect rating.

It's a rarity to find good suburban Vietnamese, but Green Basil nails it.  The boyfriend and I visit often (though admittedly we get take out) and our food is always fresh and delicious.  The restaurant itself is adorable, and set back slightly from the main bustle of Naperthrill.  While the interior would seem small, each table offers up enough privacy so that you aren't sitting on your neighbors laps. 

While I'm not normally a proponent of tofu, I have nothing but rave reviews about the tau hu xao.  It isn't soggy (which is my chief complaint about tofu dishes) and the way the flavors meld together is divine.  The bahn mi's are nothing short of fantastic (especially the pork belly, can't get enough of it) and have just enough spice and sweet to please the palate. My only slight bit of disappointment was that the sticky wings were on the dry side, but the sauce itself was great.  As far as pho goes, we have tried almost all of them and you really can't go wrong.  They also do not skimp on all the fixings that come with (bean sprouts, basil, etc) even when pho is ordered for takeout.  

Will definitely be here again. ...And again.

The food is great, the service can be better, my water glass was empty for most of my meal. Bathrooms were clean. They are also no longer BYOB. All in all, I'd likely come here again but probably order carry out instead.

I'm here every month and every month they prove to me that they are the best Vietnamese restaurant in Naperville. The pho is hot and good, the spring rolls and egg rolls are made in house and awesome.  The prices are a little high , but that's what you get in Naperville.   The service is not great but to me it's typical Vietnamese restaurant service. People who come here expecting great service will be disappointed.  What they do have here is great food.  If you want great service and to be bowed down to like a king go else where is you want good pho and banh mi this is your place.  I recommend this place to everybody.

Slightly hidden...find Quigley's Irish Pub, enter Green Basil on the east side of the building. Wife & I loved the Spring Rolls and Sticky Wings. Great staff, attentive and very knowledgable. BYOB with only a $5 corkage fee. Great restaurant to kill an hour while we picked up family at the Naperville Train Station inbound on Amtrak. They do a brisk carry out business...

Yesterday night i had dinner there because a friend recommended it. 

The food was yummy and The Service was good as well.

Definitevily will go back :)

It is such a nice restaurant for pho noodle soup and other Vietnamese food. I am always craving for a nice pho soup during the winter time. So glad I found this place in downtown Naperville.

It is a very homey and relaxing setting of this place. It has plenty bright natural light during the lunch time. The entire wooden floor and all bamboo-ish tables and chair give the lobby a settled feeling. I feel like I could sit by the window for the whole afternoon.

The pho noodle soup was very decent with the fresh ingredients and just perfectly seasoned.  The fried rice was well welcomed by kids. I also loved the Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk. 

The waitress was very professional and super quick. 

The only thing I didn't like was the parking. The restaurant was not easily found as the restaurant is not facing the street but on the east side of the building. The building is on the north side of Jefferson but I could NOT turn into the park lot from Jefferson. It is one way out. I have not figured out how to park in front of the restaurant yet. You could either need to park on the side of the street or park at the park garage across the street.

Excellent food and service was attentive but not pushy.  We lingered for an hour after lunch. No liquor service which was the only down side to the afternoon. Com Suon Nuong (grilled pork chop) was my favorite.

I ordered vegetarian fried rice as I don't eat meat at all, and 15 minutes later the order arrived,  I was half way into my fried rice and I find a piece of meat in it, I have never had meat in my life and was disgusted to see the meat, I called upon the manager (some Asian old guy) to complain this and this is what he said " this is just ONE PIECE OF MEAT" seriously? ?? I told him how disgusted I was feeling and to which he responded "mistakes happen".  The worst part is he was NOT AT ALL apologetic and didn't even try to understand my sentiment. And shockingly he asked me to review what ever i wanted to on yelp. I came out furiously off the restaurant and couldn't wait to let people know what happened. If you are a muslim or vegetarian,  this place is not for you. I am pretty sure they do not have any cooking standards as well. I a pretty sure this is not going to affect them as they don't care but I am going to post it on various platforms until you guys learn some standards and customer service.

This place is truly amazing. I'm from San Jose, California. I know my Vietnamese food and I can tell you that this place is the best you can find in the area. I don't know if this can beat the ones in the city, but it's definitely the best of the burbs. The sticky wings are to die for and one of the best wings I've ever had. The fried egg rolls are always hot, fresh, crispy and delicious. The pho broth is rich and the noodles are never over-cooked and the meats are always tender and amazing. In my experience, Vietnamese places aren't very strong in the decoration sector but Green Basil is an exception. The place looks like a home from the inside out and is so warming, which is a bonus. Overall, if you want a nice place in Downtown Naperville to have some great Vietnamese food, this place should be, without a doubt, your go-to (and mine).

In my continuing quest to find awesome pho, I went to Green Basil with the fam on a blustery February evening.

And....it was good pho!I would even go as far to say that it's the best that I've had in the area, except for Hue Palace in Joliet. Yeah, Joliet.

The broth was pretty decent, and the meat was the best quality of any suburban pho I've had so far. Yes, I said "suburban pho". I can't say I've had "city pho", so that means nothing. 

But yes, if I had three thumbs, I'd give it three thumbs up. We also got a chicken wings appetizer, which was pretty good! They were deep fried and came with a dipping sauce full of bits and goodies. We also got this awesome pork chop topped with a fried egg. It tasted delicious like a unicorn and I would eat it again and again. 

In terms of ambience, this place was ok. It's located in the Jefferson Hill Shops, which kind of gives it a haunted house vibe. Spookies! Not that it's old and crusty, it's actually very clean and updated. 

Also, the waiters wear like these little bluetooth ear things. Awesome! I felt like I was talking to a stock broker on the go: buy, sell, buy, sell, you're fired!

Two stars for level of customer service here and it seems I'm not the only one to have experience the long wait for food and service here. I actually came here several months ago but haven't gotten a chance to write up my review. I came here on a busy day, granted that, but when you're most busy and when it's most chaotic is when service is most important! 

While their food is A-Okay, it is nothing to leave you dreaming for. I'm Vietnamese and personally, the food here is not as authentic as some of the places in Argyle. Although, they have fresh ingredients, I'm not so sure that a 40 minute wait for appetizer and over 1 hour wait for entree "pho soups" are worth it. On top of that, the beef salad I had ordered, (I swear) came out raw! I had to dip my raw beef into my HOT boiling soup entree to try to cook it myself! 

I would have told someone but being that it already took me an hour to get my food, I didn't want to bother with another complaint to see if they will even address it. Overall my impression of this place? I just remember coming here, sitting for a really long time to wait for my food, and whenever we wanted to check in to see how much longer it will take, our waitress acted like she could careless. In fact, her tone was condescending a bit with a reply with something that was along the lines of "we're very busy as you can see" (yes I can see) and "I don't know when your food will come out but it will be out (really, that's the best thing you can tell me?!).  She didn't apologize for the wait, and she did not try to tell me if it would be another 5 minute or 45 minutes! If I wasn't with a group of people that day, I would have walked myself out of there. 

Honestly, a customer's experience in a food place can be of two things: 1) they remember how great the food was or 2) they remember how bad the service was. Sometimes if you're lucky, they'll remember 3) that both food AND service was phenomenal. 

This place falls in category #2: unsympathetic service. On top of that, their food is nothing to rave about. In my opinion, the price here is high, the food is overrated because it's by downtown Naperville. It needs a lot more of a personal touch and better prices to push this place back up on my list!

Yes, this place is the cleanest pho I've ever been to. This restaurant takes the place of a home because there's a fireplace where everyone dines.

First impression, fresh abundance of vegetables and a good wholesome bowl.  Nice hot broth that isn't overwhelmed with MSG. Nice! I like this place already.

Second impression, where's my che ba mau? I'm done with my pho before it is brought out after I had asked about it halfway through my bowl.

Third impression, THIS is a che ba mau?? This cocktail cup with what looks like the right ingredients for che ba mau but has a funny/weird aftertaste? I don't really treat che ma bau as a dessert, it's more of a drink to me so if it came in a tall glass beer mug, I'm cool with it. I almost expect for it. The cup is frivolous with a long spoon out of it.  It looks like the $3-4 che ba mau is more for looks and not for the actual che ma bau content.

Fourth impression, why is it taking so long to get the check?

I don't know. It has the ingredients of a pho restaurant but it's not an authentic Vietnamese pho restaurant. I feel like it's a diluted or twilight zone version of a Vietnamese pho restaurant that is trying to reach to the level of an American-style restaurant with pretty decor, fancy drink cocktail glasses, and folded paper napkins. There's just a lot of things here and there that are just off and doesn't sell it to me.  

The bowl of pho was pretty ok though, but nothing to rave everything about.

Went today for lunch and had none of the service problems some others are noting - we had lovely service from a nice college-aged guy and a fantastic and reasonably priced meal of spring rolls and pho. The broth in the pho was perfection and the meat (in 304, beef and brisket ) tasty. 
The pho menu is small, I wish they had duck and a seafood option, but we were very happy overall.

Maybe it's because I'm vietnamese and I'm spoiled with how something should taste, but Green Basils food wasn't what it all seemed to be. I come back only because it's the only place that has what I want, but if I'm honest I just settle. 
The service is poor, and rude too. And how do you expect someone to understand you repeating your order if you say just the numbers ? I ordered by name, I want to hear it back by its name. And the food tastes different each time. 
I only go back because I settled. 
Expensive, rude service, long wait, & did I say rude?

Stopped in for small bites as part of our family's own 'taste of Naperville' tour. Had the egg rolls (cha gio) and cubed filet mignon (bo nuong sit dat biet). Very polite wait staff and great food. Would definitely come back.

A friend and I set out Saturday night for some good Vietnamese food...and decided, upon her previous experiences here, to come to Green Basil. It was my first time. I'm always on the look out for new restaurants so when this place sneaked onto the Naperville scene, I was surprised. It has gained word of mouth for one reason alone...the food. 

Nothing about the rest of our experience here was worth returning for. Upon entering the lobby area, you're staring at a disorganized service station that could easily (and should) be disguised or be made less unsightly. The rest of the place is small and plain. A little paint for color would liven it up a lot.

We didn't have to wait very long for a table, although the small restaurant was full when we arrived. The waitress was maybe 19 or 20 and absolutely clueless. I asked her about two things on the menu to which the response was "um, they're different". Yeah, okay, that's helpful sweetie. 

I had brought two beers with me (BYOB, score! 50 cents to open each, $5 cork fee for wine) and after ordering she brought both to the table and acted confused to why I didn't want them at the same time. Strike two. There is an obvious lack of experience or training of the wait staff here. 

The whole front of the house staff was under 21 (best guess) and every single one of them, including the eldest male who seemed semi-in-charge moved like molasses and had blank looks on their faces. I'm not kidding, we sat for about thirty minutes with FIVE empty tables around us covered in dirty dishes. Every one of these kids wandered by them numerous times without clearing a plate. We noticed what seemed to be a busser appear toward the end of our meal who began to clear tables. So annoying. If I were the owner I would be irate -- I mean, new diners had to walk in and by all those dirty tables!

Okay, on to the positives...the eggroll appetizer was good. Fresh and crispy with a more interesting sauce than the typical sweet and sour. 

I had the beef pho, very good once doctored with some basil, soy and lime juice. Huge portion! I took half of it home -- oh while I'm on that subject, they bring you a container for it. I'm not exactly sure how one manages to transfer the pho to this provided container, but luckily my friend held it over her empty bowl and didn't spill much. It would be nice if they offered to do such a task in the kitchen where spillage would be more avoidable.

My friend let me try her chicken curry which was awesome. The meat was incredibly tender. 

One other thing I'll mention is that the food does take a little longer than one might expect, we decided that it must be because the chef does most of what happens in the kitchen (which is great!)

It would be in their best interest to train their servers to set that expectation to guests: "Our chef personally handles each dish in the kitchen so your food may take slightly longer than you might expect in other establishments...blah blah"

I really hope the owners read these because they need to see a pattern in the reviews....

YOUR FOOD IS GOOD, PEOPLE LIKE IT.

YOUR SERVICE SUCKS, TRAIN YOUR STAFF.

Think of Naperville as the Black Widow of restaurants...if everything isn't on par, you'll be eaten alive. Food, Service, Ambiance, Cost. Strike the balance quickly or poor word of mouth or the next food establishment will knock you off the playing field before you've served your last pho.

I really wanted to like this place. A lot. It's a cute, off the beaten path Thai restaurant that has more charm than pretty much everything else in downtown Naperville. It's basically in a living room and offers up something different in terms of ambiance and food. How could you go wrong?

I can't really put my finger on it. The service was ok. The food was ok. The wait was ok. Everything was just...ok. The Goi Cuon was a good start (spring roll with shrimp and pork), followed by Green Basil Com Chien (their fried rice with shrimp, chicken, pork, pineapple, lot of veggies) and Ca Ri Ga (yellow curry chicken). I liked it all. Maybe I just needed to order something new and different. These are standard things that we tend to order when we go out for asian food. So I don't know. The service was definitely on the slow side, even though everyone was nice. I just don't think I'll be back. I can order these similar items at a Chinese take out and get the same effect.
The pho was absolutely delicious and served perfectly! Everything on the menu was priced reasonably and was authentic. The take out is very convenient as well, and tastes just as good as eating in!
First time. Impressed by service, presentation of food, and taste... yummy.  The smoothies are deelish.  Parking can be an issue but we were lucky.

Food: excellent. Quality of ingredients and skill of execution was more than abundant with all the dishes my group ordered. My bo la lot was made with actual la lot leaves (not grape leaves, like some places substitute -- which is fine, but just to state). BYOB corkage fee is currently $5, which is totally reasonable -- and nice since Tasting deVine is right up the street *nudge, nudge*. 

Service: good, but a little flustered. Example: one person at our table ordered a big bowl of soup, but the server had to be flagged down a little later in order to get a spoon. We also had to ask a couple of times for them to cork our bottle and bring us some wine glasses. We went early on a Saturday night, before the place got really busy. 

Location: If you can get someone else to drive or you're within walking distance, this is a fantastic place to have some legit Vietnamese food. Prices are completely reasonable for the quality, quantity, and execution of the food that you get. If you tend to get nervous about driving/parking in congested areas, keep that in mind if you go -- this place IS located in downtown Naperville.

This is a great place to get authentic Vietnamese food.  The food is right up there with other great Vietnamese restaurants in Chicago's Uptown and Rogers Park.  Chef / Owner Nick Nguyen, former head chef at Sawtooth in Chicago (Michelin Guide recommended), has finally brought a worthy taste of Vietnam to the Southwest suburbs of Chicago, where authentic Vietnamese can be hard to find.  Of the 13 or so restaurants serving Vietnamese dishes in the Naperville area, only 2 are completely Vietnamese; the rest are fusion.  This is by far the best choice of them all.

I like the fact that it's tucked away from the noisy and often congested part of Downtown Naperville because it adds to its quaint and cozy vibe.  Even though it's a little bit pricier than Chicago prices and is BYOB, I still give it a 5 stars because it saves me a trip to Chicago to get great Vietnamese food.  

If you end up appreciating the food here, please try learning the names of your favorite dishes and stop calling them by the numbers .  Even the most feeble attempt to pronounce the Vietnamese name of a dish shows your appreciation for the food and the culture it represents.  

If you're wondering what Vietnamese food is, check out Taste of Vietnam article: http://www.examiner.com/article/taste-of-vietnam

I am really disappointed with the dinner experience at Green Basil and for the following reasons:

The dinner services was super slow and it took a while before a server came over to take my spouse and mine order. 

Not to mention, I feel like the pricing for the dishes that were listed on the menu were over priced.

The flavor of the dishes are pretty basic. Nothing special other than that they try to make the dish look contemporary.

It was nice to try this place once but I am not sold on coming back for a second dining experience.

Given how Green Basil is kind of tucked away and can be hard to find, the fact that I run into someone I know every time I come here is definitely a sign that they're doing something right.

I walked in with my family around 7:50pm on a Sunday, completely unaware that they close at 8pm. Thankfully, the servers--two adorably dopey teenage boys--didn't kick us out and said we just have to order quickly and try not to loiter too long. But then one of them went and complained about us coming in late to another table. Teenagers...

We got our order in right away and the food came out fairly quickly. The aroma of delicious pho immediately enters your nostrils but you will probably have to flag down the same dopey server to get some spoons before you can devour it and lick the bowl clean. I also tried the pork belly bahn mi sandwich. Fatty cuts of meat on perfectly baked bread? Gluttonous YUM. and BYOB! Prices are very reasonable also-- about $9 for a sizable bowl of pho and $5 for bahn mi.

Especially now that the weather is getting nicer, come for a comforting meal and then you get the option of walking it off in Downtown Naperville or collapsing at home in a food coma. It's a win/win/win situation.

I have to preface this review by stating that the service almost ruined our experience at this restaurant. 

First the bad. The service there is highly questionable. It was obvious that the girl did not want to be there. Although we arrived before two other tables, they were served before us (drinks and orders). The waitress (possibly a bus girl) was very very rude. She rolled her eyes when we asked for clean silverware.  We tried to get her attention multiple times, but she was insistent on ignoring us. We asked for fish sauce for our pho, and she brought the wrong one (rolled her eyes once again as if it was our fault). Luckily the nice Asian girl upfront took over to save our experience. Such horrible service for such a nice town.

Now the good. Pho tai (beef noodle soup) was rich in flavor. The goi gun (summer rolls) were tasty. The crispy egg rolls are highly recommended. Get take out if you're going to eat at this place.

Went in just based on Yelp reviews, and ended up really enjoying our experience. Authentic pho, though the add-on offerings were a bit limited. Wait staff was very nice and helpful, but could have been more attentive (We often found ourselves waiting for water.). It's a bit hard to find as it is set back off the road; but walkable from either campus or downtown.  Perfect for lunch or a nice night out, although the dining room can get a bit cramped when crowded. Go and try something new, as the menu is smaller but very well done.

Horrible first time experience. We just had our fourth baby 1 week ago. Heard great things about this place. We walk in. Two yr old fell asleep and newborn sleeping in car seat. My husband carrying sleeping 2 yr old and newborn. Carrying two kids. We walk in and many empty tables. I try to just allow him to walk in so he can put at least one child down. He's carrying two. The waitress doesn't smile and greet us. Our first time here. She gives me attitude and shoo's us back and says we don't have a table ready for you. She then makes us wait. There's no waiting area to sit so he can put down the two kids. He's still holding them. She finally walks to us and I tell her we just had a baby 1 week ago. This is our first time here. And he's still holding two children waiting. She could at least say oh here's a chair.  Why don't you sit. Awful first impression to make. Food can be 5 stars but if you're rude waitress with glasses greets you with attitude it just isn't worth it. We are back to noodles pho u.

This was really upsetting to learn but this restaurant uses MSG. I found out by accident after I brought a friend here who is very sensitive to additives and she immediately got a migraine. We called them after and it was admitted they do use it, although they tried to lie about it at first.

Quaint little spot hidden just outside the heart of downtown Naperville. This place is really easy to miss, but you should not. 

The customer service here is great. They are friendly, give recommendations and are not overbearing. 

I always order the pho with every imaginable cut of meat in it, and spring rolls. Both did a great job. I love the aroma of hot pho, it may just be the best hangover food. The noodles are not overly starchy and the broth warms you up almost instantaneously. 

The environment is very relaxed, it feels like you are visiting a friend's grandma and she wants to feed you everything she can make. It is also very clean and well-lit. 

The only drawback I have of this place is the music. There are times they play heart-wrenching love ballads, and there are times you hear bass-pumping Vietnamese techno, which I am not too entirely big on. Is this place supposed to be a night club as well?!
I got the 301 today. I thought the pho was just ok... it was nothing special and the soup base did not have much taste to it. I've definitely had more flavorful soup before. Not much else to say...
Best Pho in Naperville. A little hard to find(kitty-cornered on a side street by community college) but food is so worth it!

Never have I had Vietnamese food before - but let me tell you - it's good. Really good. 

Tucked away in downtown Naperville, I came to Green Basil with a friend and a bottle of wine (BYOB). Our server was super nice, but a little awkward, in terms of explaining the menu and coming up to ask if we needed anything... But that's totally cool. Made for plenty of conversation starters :)

We got the Bo Luc Lac and Tom Ram Man - amazing dishes with steak and shrimp, respectively. Incredible value and amount of food for the price ($8-13/dish).

Everything that they brought out of the kitchen looked AMAZE so I will definitely be back to try 10 more menu items. Highly recommend!!

I came in during my lunch hour to get some pho because everyone was raving about this place.   It's an adorable, simple place with wooden floors and white walls.  It seemed like a cozy place to get pho. The waitress/hostess at the front seated me in the back near the window.  It't not a huge establishment, but I was excited to come by.  

Here's where trouble began. I was never approached by anyone at my table.  The person who I assumed was my waitress, lifted one finger, while standing by another table, me to signal "one minute" without even looking at me. No smile, just one finger from a distance to signal a minute. Eight more minutes passed and she was serving everyone else around me but no further eye contact.   No one came by to give me water, and I sat there for about 10 minutes without any sort of acknowledgement.  It was clear to me that I was a bother for coming. I got up and left and never got to try the food.  It was really disappointing.  

I will give kudos to the girl who sat me down. She saw me heading towards the door and asked why I was leaving.  I explained  and  she apologized.  But yes, I never got to try their food.  I'm sure it was amazing but I will not be ignored or rudely signaled "one minute."

I understand restaurants and lunch hours can be busy - my family owned a restaurant in the past so I can relate.  But some friendly customer service feedback, you are never too busy to take 10 seconds, walk over and  say "Hi, it will be another minute or two.  We're a little busy." versus just giving someone a "one minute signal across the room."  Customers will understand.  Ignoring them or just giving less than friendly contact isn't inviting and can be offensive.  I do not believe I will return.

I'd go with about 3.5 stars here.  It's a nice downtown Naperville location for pho.  It's also BYOB with a nominal corkage fee for beer or wine.  I didn't try them but Vietnamese sandwiches can be had for $4.95.  I had the #304 pho bowl for $7.50.  The bowl was quite large, so you get a lot of broth, but the noodles and meat serving size was pretty typical, so it was overall a typical value.  Service was a little slow on a busy weekday lunch hour.  You do get comfortable, cozy dining in a historic building, and a convenient location right across the street from the two story parking garage on east Jefferson.

Our most recent visit here was a real dud. The service was VERY slow, even though there were almost as many staff as customers!  It took over 25 minutes for a simple appetizer to arrive and our waitress never once came to check on us to see if we needed water or anything else.    One of our dishes was overcooked (shrimp) and stone cold, as if it was done long before the other dish, so they just let it sit there until the second dish was ready.  The table next to us sat piled with dirty dishes for 45 minutes before someone came to clean it up.  This was mid-afternoon on a Saturday, so maybe the REAL staff was not there? 

The restaurant still has the problem of having a messy entryway, as if you're entering through a sloppy office and pantry area.

This sushi place came highly recommended from a regular and I had a craving for sushi so I decided to stop in. I love the fact that they have happy hour from 3-7 and then again from 10-close during the week. 

Decided to sit outside on the patio with 25 minutes of happy hour goodness left. Well it took someone to take our order over 10 minutes. Which, the place wasn't crazy busy but still. Not even a hi I'll be right with you.... When she came to take our order she was nice, we were able to squeeze in our happy hour order before the end. The sushi rolls came out pretty quickly, however, the lady who brought out our rolls told us that one was a spicy tuna when it was a spicy yellowtail, so as I am getting my viva las vegas roll and my pineapple cream cheese wontons I kept wondering where my yellowtail roll was. Finally our waitress was like oh that was the first one she put on the table. I said no, she put a spicy tuna first on the table. Our waitress proceeded to have what I took as a mini argument. Either way, we ended up getting the actual spicy tuna, and the yellowtail roll so I could actually eat it (and not my guest across the table.)

The viva las vegas roll was so good I could have ordered another. It is bursting with flavor, sometimes so good you aren't even aware of what you are eating! A must try. The yellowtail roll was decent, although for the first time I ever had a yellowtail roll without a jalapeno in it was a bit strange, it did have a slice of cucumber which totally detracted from the roll itself. The pineapple cream cheese wonton was quite a delight. I wasn't sure if the pineapple would be a welcome addition or detract from it, but it was actually a welcome addition to the creamy goodness of the wonton. I also sampled the spicy shrimp roll which was relatively standard. 

Looking forward to trying more of their unique roll creations!

I used to come here at least twice a week for reverse happy hour but long gone are the days where you can count on such services like waitresses remembering your drinks or the hostess knowing when happy hour is. The last time we ate here we waited 25 minutes for a beer (in a can at that, zero effort was needed) and then 40 minutes for the check to be processed. The time before that I ordered to go and the order didn't even resemble what I ordered. And when I called they said the kitchen was closed (ten minutes after I left, at 9pm on a Saturday). And just tonight when asked when happy hour was going on, the hostess said "I have no idea". (Because it's not like it's her job to know details of the restaurant she works at). 

Every other Ra location I've been to in the last few years has been good experiences, but somehow this one survives despite the staff being the least adequate group of people I've ever encountered. 

The sushis good though if you decide to test your fate.

First and last time here.  We elected to sit in the bar area on a Friday afternoon at around 4:30.  There were a few folks at the bar and four tables including us.  From what we could tell, two servers were taking care of everyone there.  Our server was less than on top of it so our experience suffered.  It took her a while to come to the table but when she finally did, we ordered our drinks and edamame.  We didn't get any water for at least 15 minutes and the only reason we finally did was because we repeatedly asked for them.  We were given some excuse about doing things in order but being a former server myself, water is the first thing you deliver when you greet the table, SERVING 101.  

Rather than incessantly going on about how she'd disappear for long periods of time, the food was decent but next time I'm going to make my own sushi at home - the service will be better.

Don't recommend this place very much.  Maybe sit in the dining room.
Love this place, excellent service and food! Server continually checked up on the table and gave good suggestions. Need better lighting in the place though

Hoo"RA"y for RA! An affordable and fun atmosphere to get your sake and sushi on! Especially for the great prices during weekday happy hours 3-7pm.

Star #1: This location has an outdoor patio for those sunny days and moon tanning nights. The interior has a trendy sushi bar on the right and spacious seated tables within.

Star #2: As an added tip, make reservations using your Open Table app to get dining points and make sure upon approaching the host desk to let them know you made reservation through OT.

Star #3: Their menu has a vast selection of mixed Asian cuisine from sushi to Chinese fare. There are options for raw and cooked alike. 

Star #4: The bar has an eclectic array from sake to mixed drinks. I recommend a cold unfiltered sake to share or the amazing fish bowl for fun.

Star#5: Service is good. Servers and bartenders alike are timely and friendly.

The food is mediocre at best. However, service is almost nonexistent. We came on a Wednesday for lunch, and the place was pretty quiet with only three tables in the lounge area. We opted for the dining area instead of the lounge. We ordered the rockin shrimp, and it came out looking way over fried. My mom refused to eat it. So, I wanted to send it back for a redo. I must have waited for at least 10 minutes with no one passing by. I ended up waving someone down across the restaurant just to ask for my server. My server still took a while to come over. 

She took the shrimp back with no problems. And it's not that she wasn't friendly, she just wasn't around. We ran out of tea, but no one came around to check if we wanted more, and which my mom did. We finished eating, and just sat there for like 15 minutes trying to someone's attention to get our bill. Again, no one came, so this time I had to call out to the bus boy by the water stand to get my server. When she finally came, the bill was wrong. They charged me twice for the freaking shrimps. Of course our server corrected this, but I hope you can feel my sense of annoyance and frustration with this establishment. My server came back with a coupon for $10 off a $30 purchase on my next visit. I left it there. Unless someone else is paying, it's very unlikely they will see another penny of mine.

Stopped in for lunch today.  My first time at this restaurant.  We were seated immediately and our server stopped by within a couple of minutes.

Our server, Kaleigh, was excellent.  She was very attentive and refilled the water glasses without being asked.

The food was okay but not as good as some of the restaurants in the immediate vicinity (Brio Tucsan Grille and Capital Grille to name a couple).

I would consider eating here again.

Was craving sushi .. Decided to try this place based on Yelp reviews... Overall just OK. Perhaps we didn't order correctly ... Rolls were good but everything else was just blah. Chili ponzu wings had a good taste but too BIG (Not my taste) ... Happy hour prices were good based on what they serve... 

Kina the waitress was knowledge and on point!

So, I tried my first Japanese mule. Too much ice through, I had the shrimp calamari tempura it was above average and Iiked the ginger sauce. Rack and roll was the best thing on the menu. As for the stand alone shrimp tempura. I have had better.

Great service like always...,specially from my waiter Jodie!! She is new at this place and is amazing how fast she feet in to the Ra family.
Very friendly atmosphere.

I must say, in the last 2 years, RA has really stepped its game up in the sushi department. 

I've visited about 3 times since my first review. Their newish Happy Hour menu makes my wallet and my stomach happy. They have about 20 roles on that menu to choose from for a much better price than the original price. They also have some drinks on there as well. They do make a mean cosmopolitan for 5 dollars on the HH menu. They also have their famous Viva Las Vegas role for 7 dollars, and their Rainbow Role for 8. When you're talking those roles are usually 13, 14 or 15 dollars, I'd say it's worth the effort to go during Happy Hour. 

My favorite part though...Their RA club! On my half birthday, they sent me a $20 dollar certificate. No real strings attached. No minimum purchase. It was honestly, one of the best birthday related deals I've ever gotten. 

So give these guys a try. Yes, they have a young wait staff...So the service isn't always the best. But I've never had too many issues. The drinks are good, the sushi is good, and I always leave satisfied. 

Enjoy!

Food was actually pretty good, but the service was abysmal. After waiting an extended period of time before anyone ever stopped by our table, we were finally able to order a drink. Little did we know this would be our last of the evening because nobody ever came by to ask if we wanted another. We ordered 1 special appetizer, another from the menu, and a selection of maki. Expecting a decent pacing from the kitchen, we were shocked at how the items arrived from the kitchen. Our appetizers as well as the 4 rolls we ordered all came out at the exact same time. We were trying to solve a puzzle getting everything to stay on top of the cramped 2-top without something falling over. The general lack of awareness, attentiveness and hospitality will ensure we won't be back anytime soon.

RA has good happy hour deals (which has been the main and sometimes ONLY reason why I come to RA.)
If you're looking for good sushi and you know what it should taste like, I recommend going elsewhere. 
However, if you're new to sushi and aren't excited about the idea of consuming raw fish, this isn't a bad place to start since they have a lot of "easy" rolls filled with cheese and all kinds of things you wouldn't find in a real sushi restaurant. They also have a lot of other non-sushi entrees. 

If you're a sushi enthusiast, stay away. Their rolls are poorly constructed and their sashimi can be hit or miss in terms of the cut and freshness. Also, their mixologist or whoever is making drinks needs to step up their game/recipes because their drinks are terrible.

RA RA Shish Boom ---- Baaaah. As in bah, this place is just kinda baah. Not terrible, not great just kinda in the middle. Happy hour specials are pretty good, about $6 for a Martini and/or roll. Each night they also have additional weekday specials that range from 2 for 1 rolls or specific rolls that can be even cheaper than the happy hour stuff. 

Sushi - All I can say is that this place is not very original. They seem to have an excess of Krab "salad" stuff that is normally present only in California rolls. It showed up in all of the rolls and was just not that impressive. left me with the impression of just being a filler to avoid any other ingredients. Bland and not exciting at all. 

On the contrary though, the dessert here was amazing. Very tasty and original, the fried exterior was a crispy delight mixed with the chocolate. 

Service was pretty good, the staff were all very attentive and were very helpful. Since we caught all the specials the prices were great.

Give it a try if you are feeling a bit adventurous but I would not come back on my own but if others wanted to, I would not refute.

I love the location dt. The service here is so bad. I sat at the bar at lunch time. There was one other table. The server/bartender went on gossiping with her table for 5 minutes without acknowledging me but she knew I was there bc she was facing me. I had no menu as well. Since I knew what I wanted I went to the desk and told the host/manager I need a server and know what I want. Finically the bimbo gossiping came over and took my order. What crap service! They need to stay on top of their servers. Total bs to sit while she literally was chatting with her friends for 5 minutes letting customers sit around.

The food here is decent, but there are definitely better places out there.  It's pretty expensive for what you get.  The service is average to above average.  
I usually get the chirashi or the spicy tuna lunch bowl.  I think the atmosphere and ambiance is very nice, and has a nice somewhat upscale feel to it.  And I'm sure they get a good crowd based on the location but there are just better places for sushi.
To top it off, they don't accept coupons off your phone.  Who makes you print shit these days?  It's a waste of paper and they are unique codes anyway.

I've been coming to Ra for years, they are open late and the ambiance is not bad. 
All last week I seemed to be eating out and eating late. My boyfriend and I had a taste for sushi but most places were closed, but Yelp saved the day by suggesting Ra. 
We drove over to Yorktown mall to dine at Ra.
We got there around 10 and the bar/lounge area was pretty busy. We stood at the door waiting for someone to greet us for way too long. Finally someone seats us and she brings us waters. 
They have happy hour that late at night and some of their rolls are on special. That was very nice, so we ordered a few rolls from that menu and we also ordered their specialty rolls. 
The sushi isn't bad but it isn't the best I've had, this is a chain after all. 
The Ra-llipop stole the show. Cool presentation and it was delicious. It had 3 different kinds of fish if I remember correctly. 
We enjoyed our meal very much. Everything was good but the service was lacking. The girl who sat us was also our server and bar tender. I think they were too busy for the amount of staff they had working. 
Ra is a great place to have drinks at, they are open late and it's a fun scene.

Honestly I didn't choose this place. My bestie didn't want to drive too close to the city. If it were up to me, I would only eat sushi at sen in oak park. But we came here so let's move on. 

It's in the heart of the suburbs at Yorktown mall so you will always find parking. Let me just get to the point:

Is it clean: very
Is parking free: yes
Is it good for groups: yes 
Is there outdoor seating: yes, plenty
Was it nice inside: very much so 
Is there variety in the drink menu: yes
Was the service good: I would say average
Was the sushi good : one of the three I tried were good. I didn't like the other ones. They tasted like they came out of a box at store or something 

Did you get an appetizer: yes, the lobster roll. The sauce was good but the rolls had too much cream filling. It was not as described. 

The store is very nice and clean and well decorated. This is a chain of restaurants so keep that in mind. It's a suburb and at the mall so remember that too. It's not very fresh. The vegetable roll was delicious which was surprising. 

I don't plan on returning to be honest but it's nothing against the store. I just don't like their sushi. Plus I don't live here anymore. The smaller sushi independently owned and run stores are where it's at. I think this place fulfills its duty to the area. I'm sure the kiddos love this place. 

I would say 1-2 stars. They deserve at least two because of how clean and well decorated this store is. Maybe even three stars if you pick the right rolls. I just wasn't lucky with the rolls today.

I have visited both the Chicago location and the Lombard location and I have never had issues. I have ate here during happy hour and regular hours as well. The fish is always fresh. Definitely try the seared tuna during happy hour. They have plenty of good rolls on that happy hour menu. Try the calamari roll, crazy monkey roll, viva las vegas roll, pork gyoza and the strawberry saketini. All were delicious!  If you sign up on their website for emails you get a $20 certificate for your half birthday (not to be used with happy hour specials). We have always had wonderful servers that work around that and let us order regular food with that certificate and then happy hour and make it two separate bills. The bar/lounge area has TV's the dining room does not. We have had great service at both. Thanks RA!

Ugh so disappointed with RA. I'm a busy mom of two. This was one of my favorite restaurants. My husband and I planned on getting a to-go order to celebrate our Valentine's Day instead of dragging our kids with us and ruining other people's evenings. 

I called to place the order, pressed the correct to-go extension and was transferred to what seemed to be the hostess. The hostess seemed incredibly annoyed when I asked for a to-go order. Maybe it's because lots of people were waiting to be seated? I can only speculate. While she took my order she kept asking "THE WHAT?" When I listed item names (which I read right off the menu pdf file). Multiple times. Horrible phone and people skills. No manners. She ended up taking my order and said "k. It'll be ready in 30 mins" and barely gave me enough time to say goodbye. 

Realizing she didn't repeat my order -- I texted my husband who was already there to double check the order. Unfortunately he didn't see my message (husbands ;) am  I right?) and when he got home -- we checked the food. Surprise surprise! She forgot an entree. By then it was too late to drive all the way back there and look for parking on Valentine's Day weekend. We just decided to forget it. Our kids ended up splitting our entree. Date night was cancelled.

This used to be my favorite place. I wish managers would realize if they choose people who completely lack any personal skills as the first impression their clients get, they won't have returning customers. This experience was enough to make me not even bother going back. I probably won't be returning.

I can here with my girlfriend for lunch after hours of shopping and my experience exceeded my expectations.  The service was impeccable and the atmosphere is cute.  Try the scallop dynamite roll it's amazing! A true party in your mouth! My amazing server recommended it.  She also told me about the strawberry coconut sakatini.  Ask for Yara she was an excellent server.  I will def return and tell all my friends!

It was reasonably priced with great ambiance and very attentive wait staff. We tried the signature rolls and the calamari appetizer and everything was exquisitely prepared with generous servings. Had 3 signature rolls, the appetizer and a couple of iced teas... Bill came to about $50.
I've been coming here for years! They always have the freshest sashimi and amazing happy hour specials! Win win!

I love Ra Sushi! I've been to the Lombard location many times, and visited the San Diego location once. Everything is so delicious here, from the appetizers to dessert. I have tried many rolls here and have never been disappointed. A few things you must try from the menu:

1. Crunchy Shrimp Tempura Roll
2. Viva Las Vegas Roll
3. "Ra"ckin' Roll
4. Gojira Roll
5. Garlic Edamame
6. Moshi Mojito and/or Ginger Blossom
7. Coconut Creme Brulee

Those are my go-to's every time I visit Ra. Other items on the menu including apps, rolls, cocktails, and desserts are just as good, but the above are hands down their specialty items. I love that service at Ra is always fast and good, and the ambiance is very inviting. Definitely a go-to for sushi in the western suburbs!

I actually have been taking advantage of happy hour.

First time I went, really bad

Second time...AWESOME. I had sushi and I loved it!

Last few times: SERVER SUCKS. Ask for Alyssa.

My favorites are spicy shrimp and shrimp nigiri. I don't get the "Franken" rolls due to not wanting to be 600 lbs.

I would highly recommend the strawberry lemonade and the Vegas roll. This was my second time coming to this restaurant and similar to the first time, almost every table order a Vegas roll. "Order it for the Instagram." The Vegas roll looks really pretty and it worth the order just for a quick snapchat. The restaurant also has happy hours so the rolls are a little bit cheaper. Aside from the Vegas roll, the other rolls were ok. Nothing too special.

One of my friends ordered the chicken Katsu, but the order did not come with rice. Most places that I have been to usually include rice in the order, but I guess this place does not. Free refill for the strawberry lemonade, totally worth it. This restaurant also have outside seatings which is really nice on sunny days.
We split  the Spicy Salmon bowl and california roll. I enjoyed the spring onions in the miso soup. Our server Sam was very attentive and sweet!!
My favorite sushi place I love coming here when I'm visiting Chicago. Living in Las Vegas there are not that many great sushi place is surprisingly even though there are Asian people everywhere.

RA is a petty solid sushi place in the burbs. Their rolls are definitely generous with size of their rolls, and they're priced accordingly. The biggest issue I have with most sushi places is I leave hungry cause I don't want to spend a small fortune for a satisfying meal. At RA, my gf and I split 4 rolls and we left satisfied!! 

They have great presentation, and their rolls and sauces were delicious!!

Our server, Alyssa, was amazing!! She was constantly checking up on us, making sure our drinks were full. When she dropped off the check, she said "there is absolutely no rush, take your time and enjoy." We were there on a very busy Friday night. For her to reassure use that we could just stay an chill, instead of trying to turn the table, was very nice to hear!! We will definitely be back and we'll definitely be requesting her section next time!!!

Let me start by saying 3 stars is generous for the last trip I had in RA Sushi. The only reason it was less is because I have had great service here in the past. Most days I would give RA. 5 stars for food and staff even on the busiest of days. I've worked in the service industry before so I get it. 

It started with getting us a table. My fiancé and I met with another couple for dinner and drinks one night. We got there early so we could put our name in. We put our name in and waited 45 while other people walked in and for sure did not have reservations. Once everybody was seated and we continued to sit in the waiting area, the hostess asked us our name again and mumbled under her breath, "oh shit" and said right this way. 

Once we were seated we were seated at a table for 2 with 4 people. Even though we're close friends we don't like to eat that close to each other. 

We ordered drinks and an app before placing our main order. We got our sushi first and our friends 20 minutes later followed by our app for dessert. 

Drinks ran dry and my patience ran thin. We left our server a 20% tip because I know our experience was not 100% her fault. I also know people have off days and they survive on tips. She was a nice girl and it wasn't her fault we were stuck at a 2 person table. 

I really hope front of the house management reads this and works on how they seat people a little bit better.

I come here strictly for the chirashi bowl and the happy hour when I'm desperate for sushi and don't want to kill myself by eating all you can eat sushi. 

Chirashi bowl: 3.5/5 It's sushi rice topped with chopped up sashimi, cucumber, and seafood topped with a sweet sauce. It does the job for when I can't get the real thing.

Happy hour: 3/5 the sushi is very mediocre and has been really skimpy lately. The only dish I think is okay is the seared tuna. The portions seemed to have shrank over the past three years and there seems to be excessive rice.

I'll probably be back but it's no where near my favorite.

I love this place and I come here all the time, but the servers have no concept of how soon to greet a table. I worked at a sports bar across the street and was taught to do so in 90 seconds to less. This place takes 5-8 minutes usually. And it's not even busy. Food is great and love the atmosphere!

Can your say happy hour food specials!!! I stopped by on a Tuesday night with my niece. We were seated outside at a lovely high top and had Amanda as our waitress. 

RA has a fancy pants vibe with cool cocktails and fun sushi. With the exception of the giant ginger salad we ate completely from the special menu. Our order was placed in a staggered manner and the waitress and food runners checked on us and cleared the table quickly. The fried shrimp appetizer was surprisingly good (I don't usually order fried but I didn't read). The spring rolls were yummy, they could have skipped the mustard/ketchup dip because it didn't seem to compliment the rolls. 

Prices were average for sushi so I was impressed, even the regular menu items were reasonably priced. On a side note their regular iced tea was delicious, nothing special that I could pick out but super yummy.

I will return to check out their other special nights.

I have been back many times since my first review and always have a great time. Sometimes the service is bad, but this week I went in with a group of 5 and our waitress was great. I had my half-birthday coupon to use ($20 off any purchase, Monday-Thursday) so it was a great steal too. I started with the lobster spring rolls, which I probably wouldn't get again. $11.50 for 4 small spring rolls that were mostly filling and not lobster. However, the Viva Las Vegas Roll was amazing as usual. I crave that roll! So good. If you can come during Happy Hour (3-7pm), a lot of their food is discounted but you can't use any coupons with that.

The rolls here all taste the same...No matter which one you order its just the same flavor over and over again. I dont know why this is known as a sushi bar but the quality of the sushi is below average. 

Also, the service is horrible at this location. Our server she seemed sooo uninterested in being there.  Looking back this place was really good about 3 years ago...now its as if the employees don't care and cant wait to clock out. 

I would skip it.

My classmates and I had a busy week at school so for a Friday evening, we took a break and enjoyed HH at RA in Oak Brook. We got there around 530 and HH was from 3 - 7 PM Mon-Fri. The waiters were very polite, understanding, and helpful as we kept having to add on tables since more and more classmates were coming. 

I shared the spicy salmon, spicy tuna, and Las Vegas roll w/ a friend and that was more than enough for us. I also got to try the lobster ceviche that another classmate ordered and that was actually pretty good! The lobster tasted fresh and they added avocado so there was a twist to it. They order a good amount of mixed drinks for the HH menus if you want to drink while you enjoy sushi.

Total for 3 HH rolls was around $25 after tax and tip, very good deal for sushi. As my party was leaving around 7ish, there were a lot of people waiting to be seated so I suggest to beat the crowd and come a bit earlier on Friday nights.

I love coming to this place. They have the best sushi it's so fresh. You have to get the tunacado. In addition it's a great place for music and people watching on a Friday and a Saturday night. The decore is fun too.

My one and only place to go eat Sushi!!! I love love their Viva Las Vegas Roll, it's my favorite!!! Also the Rock and shrimp Roll is great!  They have a happy hour and they service is great! Nothing but good review for this restaurant! Love it!

Good quality sushi with a very nice atmosphere and service.  I've been to RA several times over the past couple of years and can't believe I'm only now writing a review. 

Plenty of seating at the bar, sushi bar, high tops or dining room.  So whatever you are in the mood for-RA has it. 

Food is good and and the menu is very large which is great if you are with someone that might night dive into the sashimi on the first date. 

The portions are also very good and the various platters won't break your bank.  Service has always been very good which is t something you always get a the larger sushi places. 

Overall a very nice experience so dive in!

Cheers!

John

First time here and it was the best sushi I had ever had great service and Food; someone had told me about it and if they wouldn't have told me about it I would of probably wouldn't have even came, but it turned out great and now I'm going to tell others about.

If I could give this place negative stars I would give it a NEGATIVE 5 STARS. I used to love this place. Ive gone here for 8 years. I've been to over 20+ sushi restaurants in the Chicagoland area. Today, you couldn't pay me to go here. Let's start off with---7 out of the 9 times I've come here last were atrocious. I've only come here based on RA's Hookup or if friends invite me here. Let's go over each experience in a much shorter version.

Food/Drinks = 4 out of 5
Service = -5

Experience 1 (2011): Five people including myself. We sat down and got our waters. There were two other tables being waited at approximately 8pm. After sitting around for 15 minutes and no one has approached us to take our order, we got up to look for assistance. No waiters/waitresses in sight, no one at the front podium, and no one at the bar. As we searched, the busboys proceeded to take our silverware and waters away and cleared the tables as we told them to stop because we haven't been served yet, they proceeded to ignore us and it was that time to just walk out and go elsewhere.
Experience 2 (2013): Six people with a semi busy Sunday happy hour. Waitress was quick to introduce herself. After she took our drink orders, she brought our drinks back and said "one moment". 20 minutes later she came back and took our order. It took 45 minutes for us to get our food. At this point, most of us just wanted to eat, pay, and leave ASAP. It took 38 minutes to get our check. Once she collected our cards (3 separate bills with a total of 8 rolls) it took 20 minutes to come back. In short, it took over 2 hours to eat a 15 minute meal. Amen.
Experience 3 (2013): This was actually an OK experience except we never got any refills on water and there were no plates, napkins, or soy sauce ever given to us even when we asked for them. Semi busy.
Experience 4 (2014): 5 people. Only some of our food was brought out. Our check was brought out also a few minutes afterwards....we didn't ask for it and we haven't even finished ordering. Come on man!
Experience 5 (2015): Not bad. Finally.
Experience 6 (2015): Not bad. A two trip streak!
Experience 7 (2015): Streak ended. Forgot our order completely. LMAO.
Experience 8 (2015): Found snot/spit in our food. Goodbye.
Experience 9 (Today): The only reason I came back today was due to my RA Hookup $20 Half Birthday with my girlfriend. Our waitress to awhile to get to our table, but she seemed rushed. We asked for waters and some soy sauce because ours was empty. She grabbed it and put it on another table and gave us that one. (Which by the way, another couple sat there moments later asking the same question) she took our sushi order as soon as she brought our waters. Our food came out and she forgot one of my rolls because she gave it to another customer. I eventually got it back. After we finished eating food, we were waiting for refills for our water since no one else came by. We sat there for a total of 31 minutes with empty plates and glasses and our waitress was talking to other tables and periodically disappeared. I was able to stand up and do a 360 view of the dining room and counted 1 RA employee behind the sushi bar. No waitresses. No one at the podium. No one tending the bar. De ja vu? Wednesday night we 3 empty tables. I thought it was just me, but there were two other tables with couples sitting there that haven't had a chance to order yet (31 minutes).

Needless to say. I am no longer eating here in my lifetime. Eat at this location at your own risk. Maybe during happy hour or if you get coupons. If you don't mind crappy service, you might not be bothered by this place. I enjoy good times with friends and an attentive waiting staff, not perfect, but attentive enough to get a water refill or at least stop by and ask if we are ok. RA has not cared for the past 5 years. Good luck with this location and happy yelping!
Always great food & happy hour specials. My boyfriend had sushi here for the first time a year ago here. It's our special spot and never disappointed!

I'm typically not good at trendy, guys. I'm basically the oldest 30 year old I know. I spend my weekends volunteering and baking things my husband would enjoy. I find myself playing music in the car at reasonable volumes. I am relied upon at work (and not in that "yeah it's reliable that she'll be 20 mins late!" kinda way). 

ANYWAY, I digress. THE POINT is that Ra is trendy, and it's weird to me that I enjoy it so much. And for sure, there's parts I don't enjoy. The decor is way too much, for instance. I can understand trendy, but this almost feels like trying-too-hard. The staff is obnoxious, particularly the hostessing staff. They're cold and unwelcoming. Our server on this particular visit was very helpful, so maybe the tide is turning there, but my experience has been that service is meh. 

But the 3 stars (wish I could do 3.5, but alas) are all for the fun, innovative, and delicious sushi. Hubs friend who was in town this weekend ADORES sushi, and when I noted they don't have any Ra locations in Michigan (from whence he came) I knew it'd be a good choice (plus I didn't have to hike all the way out to the city on a Friday night when I was already exhausted - old lady, remember?)

We ordered a boatload of food and somehow managed to eat it all. My husband did the best of all of us when ordering - he got the seared salmon which was to DIE for, and an avocado and salmon sashimi looking bit that was presented beautifully and tasted delicious.
