As for me, I'm always content with a spicy tuna roll (classic, but done well) and the ever popular Viva Las Vegas roll, a roll so bastardized that it could only be named after Sin City, but so delicious that I cannot resist it, creamy crab mix rolled into a giant roll with a tempura batter and a lotus root "chip" adorning the top of each piece. It is decadent, filling, and wonderful. I don't care about authenticity when the sushi tastes this good.

We find ourselves returning to Ra to gorge on sushi and feel cooler than we are maybe once or twice a year, and will likely continue to do so. Maybe visiting such a cool, trendy place will help keep me young.

I love coming to RA for their happy hour specials. Although the prices have gone up over the years, everything is still a great deal. Their happy hour drinks even run all day.

The atmosphere is very hip and modern. The only thing that ruined it on my most recent trip was the sun blaring through the shades. It took some strategic planning to not be directly in the light.

My recommendations off the happy hour menu is definitely the viva Las Vegas roll. There is nothing like it. I don't love raw fish so there are certain things I steer clear of but this roll is just perfect. Plus it's huge! The tootski maki is also good, with similar flavors. 

The service is prompt, it's a great price and really good sushi. Although the drink specials run all day, they aren't much to brag about.

Happy Hour is the only reason I come here. You do get a great deal on certain sushi and cocktails. Half of the staff isn't very friendly, but I try to look past that so I can enjoy the good food and good atmosphere. The food is always amazing and I love the urban setting.  The Pacific roll is my favorite and Las Vegas Roll.
Nice place. Decent set up and the sushi was fine, didn't blow me away. Service was good. Pricing in line.

Service was bad. And the food was mediocre. It wasn't that busy so no excuses for the lackluster service. Had to ask for everything-  3x for chopsticks and napkins while our food sat in front of us, 2x for wasabi and ginger. Shouldn't these items be automatic at a sushi spot?? The rainbow roll tasted very fishy,  not fresh at all. The rest of the rolls we ordered were just uninspired and bland. The one star is because I had to. Would not recommend at all.
First time here .. My son  recommended  me .. Ordered viva Vegas my DIL choice and spicy shrimp tempura ! But the fried calamari was amazing .. Service was prompt and server was very helpful

For sentimental reasons I'm giving Ra 4 stars instead of 3. 

Good menu with lots of options although I wish they had more basic sushi rolls like Alaska and Boston.

Dessert here is lame... I never get it.

Amazing happy hour deals!! They usually have 2 happy hours too - one early and one late offering both drinks and food. The happy hour options are great too -they have rolls on there that I absolutely love (like the spicy salmon, pacific and cali.)

The fancy rolls are usually fried and pretty tasty. My family doesn't like sushi so Ra is a great compromise between cooked and raw. They actually enjoy coming here for their sushi rolls!

The service is consistently good both in the bar area and the dinning area. They also have outdoor seating during the warmer weather which is always nice.

The vibe is trendy (for the burbs.) It doesn't feel intimidating in the way that most trendy places make you feel. The decor is nice but not fancy, warm but not too romantic... classy but still casual. 

Overall, this is a solid place to grab a decent dinner even if you are not interested in eating raw fish. It strikes a true balance that I think will please most people.

Let's start with the one and only positive, atmosphere was decent. 

My server was utterly clueless. I wanted warm sake and she didn't even know what kind of sake would be warm. The sushi was extremely bland, tasteless and it honestly felt like it came out of a carton as oppose to being freshly rolled by a chef.

Very tough to tell the difference between types of fish because they all tasted really stale and non flavorful. Personally, this places gets business cause of the location. Food is awful. Do not come here if you want tasty sushi.

Literally best sushi place I've ever been to (and I've been to many)! Their special rolls are delicious and their sushi is consistently perfectly executed!! Not only is the sushi amazing but so are their other entrees! This place is a favorite and has never disappointed !

nice food n good service... cool place to hang out especially during happy hours...
we had "ra"ckin' shrimp taco... "ra"ckin shrimp n viva Las Vegas roll... very tasty n special...shrimps were crispy n love the dipping sauce a LOT!!!!!!

The miso soup was way too salty. I had add hot water to water it down. The rolls were mediocre as I had better rolls at places. The servers were way too proactive with their attire with low low cut shirts and mini mini skirts. Not very kid friendly or family environment. I was expecting much better food from this chain. Bit disappointed.
Great tastes. Tempura calamari! Try it if you haven't! Beautiful outdoor seating. Great "sweeten yourself" iced tea. Thanks!

Update: Sorry for the late update, but moving this up to 2 stars (from 1) temporarily bc I had a good immediate response from 2 different managers. Both called, offered to take care of me if I came back in, and would honor my now expired certificate. One spoke with the Customer Service department to reissue the certificate. (Side note: it didn't happen, but as previously noted, the Customer Service doesn't seem to respond, so not surprised.) However, he also directly sent me a gift certificate to have a new meal. 

I haven't gone yet to use it (a little hesitant to return after the last experience - need to make sure I've cooled down appropriately to give then a fair shot at getting my business back), but will update again after my experience.
I love this place for sushi in Chicago. Food is always consistent I've gone here for many years.  Also a great place to drink. Happy hour is something to definitely look into!

This is by far, my favorite sushi restaurant. I love the happy hour specials, and the "Ra"ckin Roll is one of my favorite things to eat on the planet!!

I highly recommend giving them a try.
I love coming here for sushi it's always consistent the services Good! I recommend the tunacando,and shitto peppers. The hours are good considering it's still in the suburbs.

Sooo good! My friend and I were looking around for some good sushi and decided to check it out. We sat in the dining area vs the bar area.. Both are really nice.. The decor is inviting and theres a nice ambience. We ordered the lobster spring rolls as an appetizer. They were really good! We got three sushi rolls.  One , I cant recall the name but it was a shrimp and scallop roll.. Its served in a little skillet with spoons.. You kind of have to spoon the roll out because of the sauce. It had a spicy kick and I loved it. The service was exceptional. When we looked confused at the appearance of the roll that I described, the server offered to take it off of the bill if we didnt like it. The drinks were good too..I will surely be a repeat diner.

Sushi was fresh and tasty. However, deficiency is in the service. Waitress (I withheld her name ) forgot that we ordered an appetizer that she herself described to us in detail. Filled water glass once and never asked us about how our meal was or if anything else was needed. Dirty plates sat on table for the entire meal. Manager walked around delivering meals also never stopped by or picked up dishes that were empty.

We went on a Monday night around 5:30. Surprisingly, it was super packed for a Monday night! We sat at a cocktail table. It took a pretty long time for the server to take our order, but once she did, the sushi came out fast.

Rackin roll- this is a warm temperature specialty roll. It has lots of avocado and cream cheese and thus was deeelicious!!! Definitely my favorite. It came in a roll of 6.

Crazy monkey- this was def my least favorite. It was a specialty roll but looked like one of the simple rolls. It had lots of yummy avocado but it was completely drenched in mango sauce which completely ruined the whole roll. Even my hubby didn't want to finish the roll! He told me to leave the last few to let the restaurant know it was so bad, we didn't even want to finish it, lol. This came In a roll of 8.

Spicy salmon- this was a simple roll. It tasted okay. I felt there was too much cucumber which neutralized the flavor of the salmon. The salmon was a tad spicy. This came in a roll of 8.

Viva Las Vegas- this is a warm temperature specialty roll. It is drenched with toppings and doesn't even look like sushi anymore. It's pretty good. This comes in a roll of 5.

Pineapple cheese wontons- these were 4 tiny crab rangoons on top of coleslaw. They were very yummy but too small! Wasn't a fan of the coleslaw either but the insides of the rangoons were so good!

My hubby got hot saki. He said it was terrible and that it was the worst he's ever had. This was the first time in my life I've ever heard him say he didn't like an alcoholic beverage!

Overall their sushi is pretty good!

Comparatively, Ra didn't serve up the best sushi I've ever had, then again- it wasn't the worst either and there were a few really amazing items. I came here with my team for Customer Service appreciation week and I left feeling full and super appreciated (at least for a few hours.)

There was 6 of us at the table and we each received a regular menu, but we were only given 1 sushi menu. We had to ask for more so we didn't have to fight over it and so we were able to make a quick decision. It was a little annoying to me that the server didn't make herself readily available to answer questions about the different things they offered or make suggestions. She pretty much just came back to collect the sushi menu that we filled in with our order.

I can't really remember everything that was ordered but we ended up ordering 2 items each and just sharing everything as a table. I was surprised but we ended up eating almost everything, with only about 1 roll left. 

Food highlights-

-Lobster spring rolls. These were fantastic and something I would absolutely order again. There were only 4 of them, which was a disappointment because I wanted all of them to myself. It had a sweet sauce with it, which ended up making it a fantastic combination of sweet and salty.

-Scallop dynamite roll. I can only say this was DY-NO-MITE (said in my best J.J voice) It was my first experience with warm sushi, but I gotta admit that I didn't hate it. It was a sushi roll topped with warm scallops and some heavenly sauce. When the rest of my table was done with it, I found myself scooping all of the leftover sauce on my plate just so I could have every last drop of it. I will come back and just order this and be one happy woman.

-Dragon roll. Two of the people at my table said dragon rolls were their fave, so we ordered two of them. I'd never had these before but I thought they were really flavorful, especially the sauce that was on top of it.

The rest of the sushi was just okay for me--not splendid, but not bad either.

Our total bill was $155 pre-tip for 11 rolls, 1 appetizer, 3 sodas and a side order of white rice, so about $25 per person. It was a little high to me, but then again, my husband and I usually try to go for our sushi fix during Happy Hour to save some money.

I think it's pretty sweet that they have Happy Hour on Saturdays too (3-7) The only crying shame is that the scallop dynamite roll isn't on the HH menu.

Overly priced pretty good sushi. I asked for a sweet potato roll instead of the tempura. Roll was $8.50, the waitresses and hostesses were nice when I asked to see if the amount could go down due to it just being sweet potato. Manager was nice but justified it by saying they put in more sweet potato to offset the other veggies being absent and he won't lower the price. I said sure fine, but thought in my head that a lb is sweet potato is 75 cents. Asparagus and eggplant is what makes the cost higher. I'm just going to keep to KYOTO where I can get the same quality at half the price. My sweet potato roll and avocado roll at RA was over $15. At KYOTO, it's $8... My mistake.

RA is one my favorite sushi spots in the area. The happy hour deals are great. The Las Vegas role, calamari roll and spicy crab roll were ncredible. The waitress was very nice and the service was pretty fast compared to most restaurants. Had a great time here and will be coming back very soon.

I've been to plenty of RAs, but this one is the closest to me, so I go to it the most. 
Food: Awesome. Great for the newbies. 
Drinks: Awesome. Come in with some friends. 
Meeting the people? Priceless. 

But you know what's the worst about this place? The clientele. I come into RA on my work breaks, and like to do a thing called "people watching" (my nieces/nephews told me about this) which is observing people's behaviors in whatever setting they are placed in. I will notice people happy with their server (so a happy server), and the server will go to her next table, who appears to be upset/frustrated and will demand/expect something in return (A very upset/anxious server). What's wrong with you people? Don't you know "life's what you make it"? If you come in with a bad attitude/mood, your server can sense it, and will try her best; its hard to give a person a positive experience when they're a grouch, am I right? Have you ever spoken to the RA servers? They are all great girls! Reason why they were hired! So personable. I wouldn't want to be around a person/group of people who were rude to me by demanding orders at me. How would you feel if that was done to you? Put yourself in these girls' shoes! These girls are human beings, and have a life just like yourself. The servers I have had a couple times have made mistakes, but apologized, fixed it, and learned from their mistakes. I understand if its truly horrible, then yeah complain, but if its a honest mistake, you need to relax. 

My niece is a server, and I highly respect servers more than ever because of her. The horror stories she tells me about what people say/do and she's the one that has to take the blame, and the tips she receives that are sometimes nonexistent even if she gave the world to her table (she's not a server at RA, she works at a diner fyi). And the biggest issue of all, please tip 20% or more! I have always done it, but my niece has made me more aware of this issue. That tip is their income people! You're SUPPOSE to tip 20% or more to complete their income. If you cant afford to pay for your meal, AND YOUR SERVER IN FULL. DON'T GO OUT TO EAT. End of story. (Unless is truly horrible service)

RA Sushi, I love your place, but the people that come in...thats what kills my mood, but I do my best to deal with it.
Good clean place, must try monkey roll and the other classics. Good place for a late dinner with drinks.

Eh... so not good.  We had a clueless waitress that was sweet as pie but knew absolutely nothing about the menu.  The food was not good at all. .. tasteless and unappealing. The ambiance was great but would never come back again.

RA...I like you, but only as an acquaintance. I've been here multiple times and usually I end up here because one of my other top choices has somehow fallen through. I mean, the food is decent, but to me it's nothing special. 
 I've pretty much tried all the big sushi rolls, and most of the appetizers. The food is okay. Service can be hit or miss. It's a cool atmosphere, but sometimes the music is completely obnoxious. There is a small patio you can sit on as well. 
Some things that are worth noting is that this place serves food late when most-to-all other restaurants in the area have shut down. Also, the Umami punch (formerly, the tsunami punch) is always worth getting. The large 6 million-ounce one is always fun to drink...until it's not. Make sure you have enough people to share with you, or you'll end up looking like that taxidermied fox meme. I don't love you, but I don't hate you either. I'm sure I'll be back on another late night when I have nowhere else to go.
3 to 7pm happy hour is great. Hot Sake and some great sushimi! Staff was very friendly. Going back soon!

I have been going to Ra for over 6 years now and I dont know why I haven't written a review. Well here it is. Ra its not the same as it was when I first started coming to the place. The service is not what it used to  be either. The place is full of distracted servers with bad attitudes. No bueno.
Many of the rolls are smaller of what they were back in the day and the presentation is not as creative as it used to be. I know that sounds like a silly reason but I know how fun the plates used to be and when they are not anymore, it makes u wonder what happened? Did the chef not take my sushi seriously? Maybe i am being a bit pretentious but why expect less then perfect? Especially since once this place  was my favorite sushi spot in town.
Fridays they had a live band that were really good. Played all sorts of music that would liven the place up. What happened to them? 

 I have tried pretty much everything on their menu. From miso hot soup to their sashimi, to the rolls, the salads and the drinks. 

They have some decent rolls such as crazy monkey roll, pacific roll, crunchy calamari roll, scallop dynamite roll and they have some that are pretty much plain old boring. My favorite thing in their menu by far is rheir miso hot soup (not to be mistaken with their regular miso soup). It has chives, bok choy, shrimp tofu and mushrooms. It can be spicy upon request and has the most amazing vinegar like taste to it. I LOVE it. 

Over all is not a bad place to go. Fun patios and cool atmosphere. Just dissapointing at the level of service and the quality of the sushi.

Overall is a fun place to go just not the good old Ra it used to be.

I've been to this resturant multiple times but tonight by far was the best. Alyssa was our server and she was so attentive and nice! Any question we had she was more than willing to answer. I will defintely be back! If you want good service ask for Alyssa and you won't be disappointed!

Awesome place for fabulous sushi! Service was very good and drinks were mixed well.  They accommodated my vegan diet without a hitch.  Party of three and we all ordered something different and we all tried each other's and we all enjoyed everything which suggests that they are pretty spot on with most of the menu.  Love the atmosphere here although it was a tad bit louder than I would have liked but u eventually got used to it.  Casual atmosphere great parking.

My usual go to spot for sushi when I'm in the area,  however today I walked in asked to sit at the bar and sat there for about 5 mins there were two bartenders in the bar who saw me come in and neither one greeted me the place was completely empty. The standard in the hospitality industry is that the tables are greeted within 60 seconds. I never got a drink.  They just continued to clean and stock the bar. Managers were present on the floor no one bothered to say or asked me anything.  After sitting there for so long.  I got up and walked out without anyone saying a word to me or attempting to help. This is unacceptable! I am in the hospitality industry myself and would never treat a guest this way especially considering that my income is based off of tips and service! Will never return to this place and will make sure that I stop recommending this place to family and friends!

I have been coming to ra with my family for over 4 years but the last few times I've visited I've had the worst experience. Today my girlfriend asked for a margarita and it came back too salty so she asked for a sugar rim.The waitress had the nerve to just pour the margarita in a new sugar cup so when it came back it STILL tasted like salt! When we told her it still tastes like salt she said she would have to charge for a new one then and when we asked to speak to a manage the blonde haired manager responded "well she brought back another one, so everything's fine"... Then walked away. There's no reason why the bar didn't make a fresh margarita since it was sitting for 20 minutes waiting for the waitress to get back to the table. Officially never coming back. So unprofessional

It's great that they have the happy hour specials. The sushi here is hit or miss, much like the service. This time around the service was good. I wish I could recall our waitress's name because if not for her, our dining experience would have been intolerable. We had the tuna tataki, pineapple cheese wontons, ultimate shrimp tempura roll, zone roll, and seared tuna. The filling in the the wontons were skimpy and the seared tuna was drowned in so much sauce you could barely tell it was seared. They do have great deals - half birthday discounts and a decent amount on the happy hour menu. If not for that and a few of the tolerable dishes on the menu, there'd be no reason to return

Went with a large party on NY Eve. They accommodated us very well and the server Alyssa (who was 7 months pregnant! ) was absolutely fabulous.  The food came out quickly and was tasty.  We ordered several appetizers, rolls and a couple entrees for the non-sushi eaters.  The best of the main courses was Scallop Dynamite.  

I'm withholding one star because the food was a little "chainish" and not as authentically Japanese as other sushi restaurants.  My husband and I have been spoiled by Swordfish in Batavia which cannot be surpassed in freshness,  taste and preparation.  

Ra is a solid choice and has much to offer for the less adventurous.

Ehhh I'd give it 2 and a half stars. We ate today around 4pm for happy hour. I think they prep the shrimp tempura for some of the rolls for some of the happy hour rolls because I got the crispy calamari roll and the tempura was hard as a rock. It was pretty bad. The shrimp tempura was dry- it would have been good with some spicy mayo or something drizzled on top. And then the calamari was decent when it 1st came out and was fresh- but about 10 minutes after it hit the table the squid was already gummy and gross and un edible. They also had all the windows open and it was literally 90 degrees out today with no wind. The entire restaurant was warm and we were not sitting by the Windows.. We were in the dining area. I think there's better places in the area for happy hour... But we wanted to give RA a try... Maybe the food is better on the weekends when the place is consistently busy throughout the day and the food is always being prepared fresh

I will most likely be back to this place! It's a great place for everyone! I personally went here for a blind date and a meet up with a friend. Whether you are meeting a hot date, riding solo, or have a family there is space for everyone. I wish this place had all-you-can-eat-sushi but the single rolls are just as good. I usually order the mango sushi roll-forgot what it was called but it had a blend of sweet and spicy! I also noticed that most of the people that come to this location are in the range of 18-40 so there's always beautiful people to watch in case you're lonesome :)

I've been going to this RA location for many years-with big groups for girls' night out and also with my husband. Tonight, after taking a seat in the bar area, my husband and I waited about 10 minutes at least before our waitress came over to take our drink order. We asked if we could just order as well. I got a few items off the Happy Hour sushi menu, and my husband (who doesn't like sushi) ordered a noodle dish. 

My sushi came out fairly quickly. When our waitress brought it, she asked, "Is there anything else I can get you?" I laughed and said 'just his food' thinking she knew that. Well, after about 15 minutes passed without his food arriving, I had the hostess ask our waitress to come over. I asked if she remembered his food, and she said it should be up soon. After another few minutes, someone tried to deliver a chicken dish without noodles to him. We told her it was the incorrect dish. Our waitress came back to say they brought that dish to us by mistake, and the correct noodle dish should be up shortly. At this point, I am almost done eating, and I am literally the slowest eater on the planet. We asked for a manager, and she came over and apologized but nothing more.  Well, she did refill my drink for me.

Finally, my husband's food arrived, and our waitress said that sometimes that dish takes longer than the sushi. Really? 1/2 hour longer?? We have ordered sushi and that noodle dish before on several occasions, and sometimes the noodles even come out 1st!  He wound up taking 1/2 of it to go.  We think our waitress may have forgotten to enter my husband's noodle dish from the get go and the rest was them trying to act like that didn't happen. Maybe just admit you forgot it?? We would have been more understanding that way. And maybe a free dessert for me to eat while my husband starts his dinner? Or, maybe not. Disappointing  to say the least, from a very, very long time customer. I am giving 2 Stars only because the food was good and consistent.  The service could use a little work.
Rolls and drinks were perfect!

I've been to this place a few times. I love the attitude of the waitress but when we arrived, the table wasn't clean and there were no utensils at our table nor were they given to us when our food came out. Moreover, the quality of the food was subpar at best. For starters, I ordered octopus sashimi and salmon sashimi. The sashimi was warm and had a salty taste which I've never encountered before (and I've had a lot of sashimi). The second biggest concern that I specifically informed the waitress was the discoloration of the octopus sashimi. One side of the octopus sashimi was brown while the other side was pink. I was expecting some response or acknowledgement from the staff about the situation however there was none. I will have to reconsider coming back here again.

I love coming here during their Happy Hour. They have really great deals on food and drinks.  The Viva Las Vegas roll is mainly the whole reason why I go to RA. It is to dieee for! The servers are always really nice and attentive.
Last night here in Chicago. Took my lovely fiancé and we absolutely loved the Las Vegas roll. Plus the cosmopolitan martini was great!! Service was wonderful!

While the food is good, everything else is disgusting and dirty. They need to clean their menus, plates, saucers and glasses. Dried up food everywhere. So nasty. Don't order hot tea either unless you want a potion created by a five year old with chunks of green herbs floating on top. Get a maid and a better dishwasher please!!!

It had been a few years since I last came to RA Sushi, and my most recent trip reminded me why:  lackluster sushi.

I should first mention that as a vegetarian, of course my experience is limited to those items - so obviously I can't speak on the nigiri/sashimi/non-veggie rolls, etc.

The two items I had enjoyed were the Agedashi Tofu and the Mochi dessert.  I felt the mochi was a bit overpriced (as it tends to be in sushi places, in my opinion), but still delicious.  The agedashi tofu was really great!  I hadn't tried it there before, but was really glad I did - it was by far the best thing I'd had.

The maki I ordered were a special vegetarian roll (it's not listed on their current online menu, but is similar to their vegetable tempura roll) and the vegetable roll (in soy paper).  The vegetable roll was incredibly bland; and while I liked the specialty roll better (mostly due to the crunch topping and eel sauce, which gave it some flavor), it wasn't a ton better.  I quickly realized why it'd been so long since I'd been there.  

I have no desire to come back, unless in a group setting - they do have a good drink menu and they have the ambiance going for them.
I've been coming here for years the foods really good the bartender makes great drinks but make sure your server is good
The food is really good but what everyone goes there for the viva las vagas but is really expensive but the viva las vagas is amazing must try

Super cute place! Sat at the bar and bartender was very attentive. 

I ordered the Las Vegas roll and it was a piece of artwork so much that it was too hard to eat because it was so large. I definitely would not recommend getting this roll if you are on a first date or business meeting. 

I also ordered the spicy shrimp roll and it wasn't spicy at all and not very good. However, my friend ordered the fried calamari and it was delicious!!!

The only reason I gave them 3 stars is because they had great happy hour specials AND beautiful atmosphere.
Ra is a little pricey but I found that you get what you pay for when it comes to sushi and these guys don't disappoint. I will definitely be coming back for drinks and sushi rolls
Food is good, place is clean, service is good. No complaints. Went with a group of friends. We loved the calamari tempura app.

We sat in the bar area for a quick bite to eat before we headed out to catch a flick. It's been awhile that we went to sushi ra. The bar area was a nice size not overly crowded with tables and chairs. They had a happy hour special menu until 7pm heck yeah!  The salmon nigiri was fresh not so much sushi rice and the salmon pcs sizes we're good. The spicy tuna maki roll was really spicy I likey! The shrimp maki was pretty good too. The chicken teriyaki dinner was a pretty good size with fresh vegetables not overly sweet. Keep in mind this is an Asian fusion place so the main dishes are not authentic Japanese.  The server Theresa was amazing!  very attentive always had our drinks filled without us asking for more. And I liked that the staff was cleaning off our table as we finish one dish after another. I'd come back when I'm in the area especially during happy hour!

Went here last night with friends for my fiancés birthday. The sushi was great. Flavorful and well put together. We had drinks as well that were good. My friend and I had the Momo Bellini. It was great. The boys had saki bombs, I didn't try it but it looked good. 

My fiancé didn't really enjoy sushi so he got the steak. I was a little disappointed that the steak was so tiny. It was pretty fatty as well. For the four of us we spent $160 which was a little expensive. I think the food and drinks were a little overpriced. The atmosphere was great. I would probably go bCk because the sushi was great.

Overrated, overpriced. Will not return. 

First off, this is not traditional or authentic sushi for those under a rock. They were blasting Latino music when we walked in and the staff are high school/college kids with way-too-fake tans and hair highlights circa 2000.

We always start with gyoza when we have sushi (tradition for us) and they were bland and the sauce tasted like pure vinegar. I've had better gyoza from the frozen food section of the grocery store. 

The sushi was overly salty and doused in thick sauces. This is always a warning side to me. What are they trying to cover up? Maybe poor-quality fish? After 4 rolls, we were craving just a regular, traditional roll which we ordered. $60 later, we left unsatisfied and still hungry. 

Ambiance (we ate outside) was nice and service was decent.

I came in here near the tail end of happy hour (and with a new date) so there was a lot riding on the food and drinks being good.  I was really happy with the cocktails, the server was awesome, and the sushi was both creative and delicious.

The Happy Hour prices were pretty good compared to the menu prices.  We tried the salmon/asparagus rolls, the Viva Las Vegas, and some nigiri pieces.  The fish was all fresh and well-prepared.  I thought the rolls were creative, and definitely different than other places I've been.  They also have a menu with non-sushi items, so this is a definite go-to if people in your group aren't sushi fans.

Overall I thought this place was really good.  It has a cool atmosphere, the drinks are good, and the service is great.  I'll be back.

Friendly professional staff.  "Beau" was terrific! 
Food is above average.  
Restuarant & bathrooms were clean.  
I will definitely be back.

A CIVIL UNION

Normally I wouldn't be wandering around Wheaton on a weeknight, but when you get a chance to dine with three lovely ladies, what's a guy to do?  (say yes, obviously)

Jacqueline B, Olivia B, Kate S and I met here as part of a standing monthly dinner outing for the Yelp Chicago 'burbs team.  We chose Union House because of its centralized location, consistently high marks, and the fact that they were showing the NLCS.

I arrived fashionably late (as always!) and saw that we were the only customers in the restaurant at 7pm.  Hmmmm.  It was a little odd, especially considering that both the Bears AND Cubs were playing but I paid little mind to it.  They had a nice draft beer selection and promising menu.

Wasting little time, we placed orders for the homemade bbq chips, fried pickles and buffalo shrimp.  The chips came out first and couldn't have been better.  Perfect thickness and dusted with a sweet yet tangy barbecue seasoning.  The pickles followed and came served with an avocado ranch, an ideal dipping sauce for those delicious deep-fried morsels.

Next up were the shrimp, which were coated with buffalo sauce and accompanied by a blue cheese dip over a bed of mixed greens.  Electing not to stop there, we kept things moving along with lobster mac n' cheese and prosciutto-wrapped asparagus.....minus the prosciutto (which they were out of).  The creamy lobster mac was a great big portion size and had wonderfully rich texture, not to mention ample amount of lobster meat and andouille sausage.

For dessert somebody chose the hot fudge brownie sundae, and it was definitely a hot fudge brownie sundae.  The bites I took seemed to be mostly chocolate chips for some reason, but it was decadent and nearly put me over the edge into a food coma.

Bread = 4.5
Circuses = 3

Our server was fine, although she told us about the daily specials as we were finishing our third dish.  Oopsssss.  Too bad so sad, a few of the ones she mentioned sounded tasty.  What's more, she started off by telling us that Union House has "had 20 or 30 menus in the past 4 years."  Are you trying to tell us that the kitchen likes to mix it up.......or that new menus means new management because your business experiences high turnover?

Part of this place's charm is the eclectic assortment of cutlery and wall decorations, no two of which are the same.  Ultimately, those quirks drove the OCD part of my brain absolutely nuts.  There were clocks on the wall set at totally different times, every table had unique styles of plates, and Olivia B randomly got a jank-ass bent spoon.  All in all, there were more continuity problems than an Ed Wood movie.

My lasting impression is that the food was awesome, which is enough to spur me to return should I ever find myself in the area again.

Union House is a cute little gem tucked away in Winfield. The food here is unique and made from scratch. Their menu changes often based on the season and available local items. They don't have any microwaves or hot plates, so everything is served up fresh and when it's ready! The menu is meant for sharing, although certain items will definitely feed more than others so I suggest asking your server for recommendations!

They have a great beer list and wines that I have never heard of. Union House has a full bar as well and a small list of cocktails on the menu. At 6:30 pm on a Thursday night the restaurant was completely empty. I had to laugh since I had made a reservation for our group of four. It was a Cubs playoff game night though and the Bears were playing, so I can understand. They do have two TVs up at the bar though, so we were able to keep an eye on the games while we dined!

Our waitress was sweet and helpful, although she did forget to mention the specials until we had already finished eating which was a bummer. Everything we had ordered though was really good. We started out with the house made BBQ chips (knowing they would come out fast) and these were the perfect pre-dinner snack. We then proceeded to order the fried pickles and BBQ shrimp. Both were really good! The sauces were perfect for each. The fried pickles came with an avocado sauce and the BBQ shrimp a blue cheese which was a nice touch. 

For our second round, we ordered the asparagus and lobster mac n cheese. The asparagus was seasoned really well and had the perfect amount of crunch. The lobster mac n cheese was huge and flavorful. This dish could have been split between like 5 people, but three of us finished it off no problem. For dessert I ordered the chocolate cake sundae for us to share. It was really yummy of course because it's cake, ice cream, and whipped cream, but nothing overwhelmingly special.

Definitely a charming and quirky little spot. They have a nice outdoor patio, so I would definitely like to come back when it's warmer out!

Small town hidden gem. I didn't expect to find quite a near by restaurant like this. The food here is inventive and good all made from scratch. The owners are a husband and wife team which is cool! They only problem I noticed is that our food wasn't as warm as it should be and it took longer to get each dish. Huge beer selection and daily specials. Don't bother on checking the time here as they have clocks all over the walls that I think don't all work. Lol.

We had the lobster andouille Mac and cheese delicious little spicy, shrimp and grits yum, and mini pork sliders tasty.

I tend to write quite a few 4 star reviews and Union House is a 3.5+, but I rounded up here due to originality of the menu and the effort they put into what they do.

My wife and I went on a recent Friday evening for dinner and we enjoyed most of what he ate.

The o.k. to decent:
-The crab hush puppies were dry and overcooked, but the sauce was tangy and sweet.

The very good and beyond:
-Shrimp and grits were good and get the cheese for the grits ($0.50 extra, but they use a good flavorful cheese that made the dish).
-The bacon-super thick and cooked well done, it topped off the shrimp and grits nicely and absolutely made the bacon blue salad.  Speaking of that salad, a good portion with crisp, cool lettuce and tomatoes and the house made blue cheese dressing was the perfect combination of crumbly, creamy awesome.
-Fried brussels sprouts were cooked well and the sauce was a buerre blanc with sea salt.  My wife loves these and I like them, just a small portion.   
-Crab cakes were tasty-flaky-and the creamy remoulade was good.

Decent drink selection and solid service.   The quality of the meat/seafood is good as is the produce, while the sauces are not overwhelming, but compliment things nicely.  I've just solidified the 4 star rating in my mind and will be back in the not too distant future, maybe for lunch...

The food was good, but not great. How to make it better? Add salt. Just a little bit of salt on each dish would have brought out the flavors of the food and made the dishes more delicious.

We tried the fried Brussels sprouts, lobster Mac n cheese, pulled pork sandwiches, crab cakes, and the shrimp and grits.

Brussel sprouts: 3/5. Flavor was almost there. A little charred for my liking but it was probably the best thing we had that night. 

Lobster Mac: 3/5. The actual Mac n cheese part was boring, not amazing. It comes with lobster and pieces of sausage in them and those are the best part.

Pulled pork: 4/5. Come on pretzel buns and the pulled pork speaks for itself. 

Crab cakes: 4/5. This dish was simple and executed well. Good flavor and good sauce.

Shrimp and grits: 2/5. I have yet to find a restaurant that does a good shrimp and grits in this area. The grits were flavorless and the bacon overpowered the dish. 

They do have outdoor seating and a good wine/beer list. This is not a cheap destination for dinner so be prepared to have your wallet hurting afterwards. 

Overall I'm not sure if I would go back. The owner of the restaurant was personable and around making sure we were enjoying the meal and got everything we needed. The server was nice too, but the food was lacking.
I recently hosted a couple's baby shower at Union House. It was excellent. The staff is friendly, professional and courteous. This is a great space and location, highly recommend!
Bast crab cakes ever. Craft beers and GOOD wine selections. This clearly takes Winfield dining to another level. Open late if busy- what I posted is the late menu. I will be a regular.

Came here with my wife and was very happy with our choice, we got the shrimp and grits, fried pickles and pulled pork sliders it was amazing the best I've had in a long time. You can taste that the food is fresh and not cooked in a microwave. They also had a very good beer selection. After our meal we tried the cheesecake for dessert which was to die for my wife loved it. Highly recommend this place.

This place looked quite interesting and they have a high rating on Yelp. We thought we would treat ourselves to a nice dinner before our movie on date night!

We were nicely greeted initially by the server who began to seat us then asked us to move to the next table because she had a large group coming in, sure whateves. She asked if we'd been there before and when we said no she started to explain the restaurants history. It was ok at first, but ended on sorta a pretentious note. We finally got the specials and put in our drink order for a couple of Not Your Father's Root Beer - the 10% stuff! 

The set up of the space is kinda off... There is more room for the patrons at the bar (behind the bar stools) taking away space for the tables and moving around the dining area. I'm glad we weren't there when it was busy! I could see how this would become an issue with a full dining area!

We ordered the Chicken Fried Chicken on top of mashed potatoes covered in country gravy & fried egg to share. The chicken breast was pounded thin, but not overcooked. The country gravy was nicely seasoned! The egg was just a little runny giving it that additional gravy. It was a good dish.

I ordered the Crab Cakes. There were three cakes served with a remoulade sauce. Ok, these cakes were mostly crabby! That made me happy! They were a couple inches in diameter and quite filling. The crab flavor was very prominent since they weren't overloaded with a ton of other stuff!

The boy got the Lobster Mac which has homemade cheddar mornay sauce, Andouille sausage, & grated parmesan. It had pretty good size pieces of lobster in it! The cheese sauce was well seasoned! This was a really good dish!

There were only 2 other tables while we were there. No big group showed up. It was 5pm on a Friday when we went. The server asked if we had a reservation when we arrived - there was nobody there... Maybe they get really busy and you should consider calling ahead. Our server was the only one in the dining room. She did tell us that the plates come out as they are completed in the kitchen, so don't expect them all to come out at once.

It's an interesting concept and it was nice to check it out. The food was really good. We may or may not go again.

A deal from Groupon brought me here... Otherwise, I would have never known about this place since I'm not from the area.  In short, it will not get a star for location. It is a block away from CEntral DuPage Hospital, across from a Chase bank, and other small neighborhood stores. 

The place is cozy and small. There is a bar that offer tons of craft beers and wine. Service is great, attentive, and informative. Their concept is farm to table and all of the plates are SMALL. It's like tapas but American food. My issue: small plates and small portions are charged at a full price. Another star deducted for value. 

The bbq pulled pork was their award winning entree which I thought was just ok, it can have a more zesty flavor, kick, or perhaps more bbq sauce. Sad to say that I had too much expectations for this little piggy, it was totally underwhelming. It came with 2 pretzel bun sliders and chips, $13! For 2 sliders!!! 

I also had chicken fried chicken ( fried chicken on top of mashed potatoes topped with fried egg), this plate is delish! Their chunky mashed potatoes was fresh and light. But again, pricey!

The fried pickles and onion rings were ok. They were both very greasy. And I honestly would use a different sauce for these 2!  

Overall, I enjoyed the passionate workers at this place.  Although they take pride in having high quality ingredients, I just can't justify such high priced food for this location.  Maybe in downtown Chicago, definitely not across the hospital in Wheaton!

Well, my second visit went much better than the first. I tried a Revolution fistmas beer and out server let us try some samples before ordering it. this is the second time I've been here and each time I've discovered a new beer that I enjoy. 

For food, the pulled pork sliders were quite good, the crunch of the pickle helped add some texture to the pork, slaw, and pretzel roll. The BBQ sauce was darker than most and seemed to have a vinegary taste to it. The grilled shrimp skewers had some good cayenne and pepper on them, very well done. The roasted asparagus spears were just ok, but nothing memorable. 

Then, came out second round of food. We had the bourbon pork skewers. You must try these. Brown sugar, bourbon, and garlic flavors on top of a creamy Sriracha based sauce. Sweet and heat, it was like Louisiana meets Asian cuisine. The crab cakes were a huge disappointment. The remoulade was mediocre and there was zero crispiness on the outside. They were listed as Baltimore-style crabcakes. Well, I've been to Baltimore and their crabcakes are crispy on the outside!

Shea, our server, was very friendly. Plus I like her name anyway, for obvious baseball reasons. Good meal, good times.

I finally made my way in, now that they've open for lunch and I'm already looking forward to exploring more of their menu.

I enjoyed the "12 Buck BLT" and love the house chips. I hope to get back soon for some Shrimp and Grits. They can accommodate a group lunch or special event too. Owner is super sweet and they were even working on adding some new menu items. 

Chef Vito is in da house on Fridays, so look for something special.

My partner and I had a terrific time here on a Saturday night. We live in Wheaton so nice to be so close to this restaurant! 

A few things to mention...the food we had was very good (pork sliders, buffalo shrimp, crab hush puppies, and brussel sprouts). Beers on tap were unique and delicious, and our server was wonderful. Food was well presented albeit proportions were slightly off on the shrimp (just five shrimp - not all that big) and the bowl of brussel sprouts was massive in proportion ( but we ate them all! :) 

Food items came out hot and fresh, and it was all really terrific food. We eyed what other tables ordered to make notes for next time. We will definitely be back!

We came in on a Saturday night for drinks and much needed  noshing! As we recently moved to the area this was on our list of bookmarked places. There are pros and cons to this place but I feel this place has the makings of being a local gem!! 
Menu is nicely balanced with options of small plates. Beer menu was acceptable, would recommend adding some local IPA like Pipeworks Lizard King. I had the sangria which was excellent, full bodied and not too sweet. 
Noshing included the shrimp skewer, chicken sliders-A+++, Brussels sprouts-delicious, and brownie sundae. The sundae was a disappointment-not warm as described in menu and no WOW factor. Not enough hot fudge and needs maybe a little pop to make it a Union special! I'm thinking warm churro sundae!! 
Overall the place feels family owned with a few kinks being worked out . We weren't given specials until we heard regulars ask about them and then we asked about them as well. Maybe a collaboration with the bakery next store would be cool?! We enjoyed it and will definitely stop back. Looking forward to more seasonal options sourced locally.

My wife and I are always looking for great places to hang out on the western burbs. We saw an ad in the Glancer and decided to check out the Union House. I'm writing this on our second visit. Reasonably priced drinks and food. Love the brussel sprouts and other small plates we tried. Great service and cool atmosphere will keep us coming back.

We went with the kids. We had a recommendation from friends...wow! We had the fried Brussels sprouts...even the 12 and 14 year old ate them and they don't like them usually! We had the bourbon pork skewers, DELISH! Pork sliders were a hit with the slaw and pickles. The brownie sundae my son ordered. I had a VERY hard time not stealing warm chewy gooey bites! Such a cozy atmosphere. We will be back for lunch and dinner. Ask for Evie the waitress, she knows the menu and rocks the service

Party of six with a variety of tastes. Made an online (Yelp) reservation which was honored without issue. Great place for small plates to let everyone try something different.

Treat the menu as if you were at a tapas place. They do have a few entrees that are sufficient for a one person meal, but the fun is sharing plates. The food comes out as it is prepared, so pace yourself. We did two and a half rounds, probably four or five plates per round.

We had a little of everything. 

Good to great: The asparagus (plain and with prosciutto) was outstanding. Mac and cheese, very good (even without bacon, per request).  Firecracker shrimp skewer -- very good. Nice heat. The Brussels sprouts were remarkably good. Crab cakes were quite nice, with a good Remoulade. The chicken skewers were quite good and not at all sweet.

Pretty good: The chicken fried chicken needed a thicker chicken breast, but was quite tasty. The BLT was good, but needed way more bacon. The Texas toast is a bit much. 

Meh: We got the slaw with the pulled pork sliders on the side and were glad to do that as the slaw had an off taste and smell. One of party said that it smelled like hand cream. The sliders were quite good, however. The crab hush puppies, as noted elsewhere, need work. They come out too well done and lack flavor.

They had a wonderful cheesecake and a really good carrot cake (and I normally don't like carrot cake).

The venue is smallish, so there could be a wait if they get busy, but I think it is about the right size for the menu.

We visited with a group of six and had a great experience. Our server was friendly and helpful, the place was packed yet she remained attentive and accessible. The food was excellent, small portions meant to be shared.  We were told that the menu has changed 30 times in the last 2 years. This is a testament to the restaurant using seasonal locally sourced ingredients. We will definitely return.

Union Kitchen remains a solid choice if you are looking for comfort food, craft cocktails, or beer. Having eaten here several times now, we have been very happy with the food, drink, and service on all visits. The food is definitely not health food, and many items are easily shared. The onion rings are among the best we've ever had: very light breading, not too greasy, hot and tender. The mac and cheese is a little bit plain but very good, and we should have ordered it with the lobster. The chicken fried chicken is wonderful and the pork sliders are out of this world. The poem sliders came with house made barbecue potato chips that were really yummy. Did you like Brussel sprouts as a kid? Neither did I but I bet your mom or dad didn't dry them in butter and wine. They are hot, crispy, and delicious. The chicken skewers are tender and tasty. The craft cocktails are excellent and deceivingly potent. There is also full complement of craft beers and wine selection. All in all, Union kitchen is a wonderful place to come for your comfort food fix. We will definitely be back.

We are new to town and decided to check this place out. We were definitely NOT disappointed. The ribeye special topped in blue cheese and bacon was cooked to perfection. The Brussel sprouts were crispy and delicious. The beer was cold and the atmosphere was casual and inviting. We will definitely be back!!

We got there early and it started to get more crowded as the evening went on.

Really enjoyed this place. Food is served as small plates and come out as they are done. We ordered fried Brussels sprouts that were served with a mustard beurre blanc and sprinkling of sea salt. I didn't get much of the mustard but overall it was a great dish. Then we had fried pickles and BBQ pulled pork sliders topped with slaw on a pretzel bun. The pickles with the house made avocado ranch dressing are addictive. I think I ate the entire plate. Hashtag sorry not sorry. The sliders were tasty. The owner smokes the pork herself and between the smoke flavor and sauce, it's a hit. Not sure how I feel about the house made potato chips. Lastly, we had the shrimp and grits. The shrimp were plump, perfectly cooked and seasoned little morsels. They rest upon grits topped with chunky bacon (the bacon is the bomb!) and a sunny side up egg. This plate would be perfect if the grits were seasoned a bit and not as runny. It was hard to eat with a fork which was the only utensil besides a knife that we had. The grits fell through the tines on its journey to our faces. 
Ample beer and wine selection with local brewers represented. 
Lindsay, our server, was great. 
This is a nice addition to the neighborhood and would be a good place for a GNO.

I didn't think this was a five star, but it is better than four.  Everything was on point. Freshly prepared with good ingredients.  We had the blt, crab hush puppies, crab cakes, bourbon chicken skewers, asparagus, meatball sliders and my son demolished the kid's burger which looked really good.  I will definitely return if I'm in the area. 

Service was great and fast.  

And the cheesecake for dessert was fantastic. Very light and fluffy which is how i like it with an Oreo crust.

Only downside was the price was a little high.  But at least it was worth it.  It was $100 with tip and no alcohol.

A disappointing meal for a restaurant hat was rated 4.5 stars. Most dishes (shrimp & grits, lobster Mac & cheese, and Brussels) were under-seasoned. The crab cakes were great. A little salt really helps to being out flavors and would have made all the difference. Because we were sitting outside, there wasn't any on the tables. Unfortunately my husband left furious at the amount of the bill for a mediocre meal. We probably won't be back. The silent ride back home was not how I wanted to end the evening. I have to add, the woman who took care of us was delightful.
Love the small plates. Great to try some new and original things. The fried  brussel sprouts are to die for.

Recently remodeled little gam. Had a few craft beers on Mario's recommendations. The dry rub wings that you can only get on Wednesday night were excellent! 

Bring an appetite you'll need it for this portion size.

How good was it? This is the first time I've ever cleaned my plate or finished my whole meal at any restaurant. But let me start at the beginning.

What brought me here was a search for shrimp and grits in the suburbs. Per James H.'s review the ones here were great. So tonight me and my husband went, snagged a seat on the patio, and dug in. 

The menu is small but the beer list is nice and long. I got to try the Bell's Amber Ale(reminded me of Hacker Schoer) and the Not Your Fathers Root Beer(tastes JUST like root beer but has alcohol). Both were great, but the NYFRB was more my speed and it's a new favorite.  

Most of the menu is small plates. We ordered a lot of different things because everything looked so good. For appetizers we did fried pickles, grilled oysters grilled shrimp. All of these rocked the house. The grilled shrimp was huge, tender, seasoned and sauced just right.  We'd never had grilled clams, and these were fantastic. 

The shrimp. The grits. Wow. This was a larger plate, definitely an entree. The dish also nice sized bacon pieces and a perfect egg over easy.  My husband was was lucky to get a few bites, because I finished the whole thing. I almost ordered some to go. This dish is the perfect combo of all the delicious things I love. 

The pulled pork sliders were tasty. Nice pretzel buns and not over sauced. The onion rings were crispy, battered thick the way they should be.

To top it off, bread pudding. Bread pudding made with...wait for it...DONUTS! And it must've had magical powers because I looked away for a second and it disappeared. Or my husband inhaled it. 

Each item, besides the ones we asked to be brought as entrees, was brought separately. I really feel like that gave us a chance to enjoy the flavors properly. Our server was attentive, fun, and informative. Each dish was prepared fresh and presented cleanly.  Despite their extensive beer list, don't make the mistake of dropping by Union House just for a beer.

It could be a really nice place.  Service was really nice.  But their small plates, they charge the price of entrees.  It really adds up.  We work in the city and would pay the same price as what our bill totaled up to.

Modern Southern cuisine comes to the Western Suburbs. Amazing food that is farm to table fresh. The menu is always evolving but some staples always remain. We had Whiteford's Buffalo Shrimp, Pulled Pirk Sliders, & Mac & Cheese can't wait to come back as the food more than pleased this foodie.

This is my new favorite place in the western suburbs! It's so rare when every single item on the menu is absolutely delicious. The shrimp and grits are a killer dish, the sliders so savory, and even side dishes like fried pickles will bring a tear to your eye. 
It is a small plate restaurant, so bring a friend and your appetite. If you are a beer drinker, you will be very happy with the beer selection there. Mario behind the beer will satisfy you with a delicious selection and some great conversation about beers and life. 
This is the type of place you need in your neighborhood. This is not some subpar corporate restaurant, the owners are there all the time. Why are you still reading? Go right now! You can thank me later.

Very enjoyable American "Tapas". Beware, when they say small plates plus, they mean plus. For three of us, we ordered five dishes. 

The hostess was very unwelcoming, even though we had a reservation. The large party took over the restaurant and was loud and out of control. After this experience, I would go elsewhere before returning. 

Management needs to care about all their customers.
This is a great place with yummy food and a great beer selection. The fried Brussels sprouts and steak special are outstanding.  Great service!

Great food complimented with great service makes for a great evening! I was recently at Union House for a company event and the staff did an excellent job hosting the party. The food was flavorful and, in addition, there was a fun, creative drink menu. I would highly recommend this place for an enjoyable evening out!

Best meal I've had in a while! Farm to table is so hard to find in the suburbs I appreciate this place so much! Had the pork sliders with house made chips , lobster mac and cheese, and chicken fried chicken,, all were excellent ! I will definitely be back !

We have been to Union House several times and have always enjoyed it.  It offers a different fare than other restaurants in the area.  It is a small space, and is never overly crowded, although we tend to go in the early evening.  We have stuck to our favorites on the menu -- shrimp and grits, crab hush puppies, and pulled chicken sliders.  They are consistently good.  The service is good; the owner seems to be there a lot and is friendly.  We will be back to try more of the menu.

Union House has a hip city feel but also retains a cozy Winfield charm. Great food and great beer list to go along with a friendly and attentive staff. Not too loud either, so perfect for a date or taking the family out. Mostly meat on the menu but I do appreciate the addition of a veggie burger. And the salads are tasty too. Give this place a try!

Pork sliders, BLT, Bourbon/Ginger cocktail and Oreo crusted cheesecake with Door County bluberries were absolutely delicious! The owner and ambiance are incredible.  Staff is very knowledgeable about menu, drinks and recommendations. Parking is plentiful, outdoor seating in warm weather.  Really enjoyed all and can highly rate this gem of a restaurant and recommend you go there for drinks, snack after work, lunch or dinner for casual or special night out.

Table for 5 last night. Despite it being our servers first day, the service was exceptional. The food was even better and you could tell it was made with the freshest ingredients. The atmosphere and food all together had a real homey feel, which was great. The pork is absolutely amazing! We had the bourbon pork skewers and the pork sliders. Also the fried brussels sprouts are a must for brussels sprout fans. The owner came out and talked to us and also told us they host bottle shares, you just have to call to give a heads up. Overall a great place with great tasting food/beer and run by equally great people. Will be coming back!

This is such a refreshing new addition to restaurants in this area.  I highly recommend going with a group if you can so you can share all of the small plates.  Each dish was really good but it was especially fun to try about 7 different plates and have some craft beer with friends.  The atmosphere is really cool and suits the concept very well.  The sliders were all great!

Without a doubt its my go-to place in Winfield for dinner, particularly when I have guests come from out of town to visit. Everything I had here - the pulled pork sliders, shrimp and grits, mac and cheese, pork skewers. Everything is great and high quality. Service is always great. 5 stars!

Union House catered a recent party at our house and the food and service could not have been better! They helped us to pick the menu and provided servers to help during the event which made the planning easy and stress-free. We eat at Union House often and highly recommend them for catering as well!
The food is ok, but we didn't love the small plates sharing concept.  It was kind of pricey for the food.
Been there a few times. Will be there more if it weren't far from the place I live. Not Your Father Root Beer is great, the food is generally delicious.

The local sourced food and unique recipes make union house a beacon amongst restaurants in the area. Union house has a homey yet hip vibe. The modern decor mixed with classic comfort food creates an experience I would love to have again. Definitely five stars.

We had reservations but not sure we needed them. We were sat right away.  Service was so slow at first.  But the waitress informed us that she was new.  The owner came over several times to apologize.  We came to find out this was her first night.  Albeit slow it turned out okay.  The food was excellent.  We had the crab hush puppies, bourbon pork skewers, Mac n cheese, and pulled pork sliders.  All of the food was so good!  My hubby ordered beer.  He ordered a non-draft beer but it was on the warm side  and no glass offered.   It took us awhile to get a glass.  I ordered wine.  The wine selection wasn't all that impressive.  Only four different wines to choose.  All in all, it was a good experience.  Come to find out just bought out my new owners two weeks ago.  Hope it stays positive!  Would go there again and recommend!  Food was excellent!
Great food! We had several of the item and loved them all.  They are a farm to table restaurant and are Gluten free friendly.
Love this place! Great time tonight with awesome food and Penrose Beer. Really enjoyed the Pulled Pork and Pulled Chicken Sliders. The Brussels Sprouts and  Hush Puppies were excellent also!
Locally owned, excellent food, and great service. We've had two great experiences here. Plates are plenty big to share, so don't over order. We love it here.

Some how this place was not even on my radar.  My boyfriend surprised me by taking me here for dinner because he knows I love southern food and tapas.  Put them together and you have my new favorite dining experience!  Union House is smaller, but they were very smart in how they arranged everything so that you can still have a personal conversation with ease.  The bar has all of their drink options up on large chalkboards, some drinks are served in mason jars, and none of the plates match.  Great way to put out that country vibe.  They even have my favorite "Not Your Father's Rootbeer" on tap!

The food.  I have a serious dining problem where I like to taste as many things on the menu has possible.  Urban House clearly understands me with the way their menu is created.  You should know that everything below was shared between two people that love to eat and we left very full.  During our visit we had the following: 

Fried Pickles: YES! They do the batter just right here so that it's the perfect fried pickle bite.  Their dipping sauce was clearly homemade and tasted great.
Macaroni and Cheese: Nothing extraordinary, but it was very good.
Beef Sliders: Boyfriend and I both found these to be a little bit more cooked than we typically like to eat our beef.  They had great flavor, but for a place that says they have a private butcher I was surprised to receieve a well done burger.
Pulled Pork: The pork itself was very good, but it needs a little something.  Some more acid in the cole slaw would help contrast the flavors.  The onion rings that came with it were awesome! They should let you order a whole side of those! So good!
Mahi Mahi - Incredibly fresh fish!  The fish was so moist, tender, and flaky we couldn't believe that this came out of a midwest restaurant.

Service: Incredible.  Our server was so polite and check on us after literally every plate came out.  Towards the end of the night she actually comped our mahi mahi because she said that they were taking too long to bring it out and it was not fair to our dining experience.  YES! Some one that understands!  As if the food wasn't good on it's own, I will most definitely be back for the excellent service.

Awesome. Great little gem right in the western suburbs. Very family-friendly. Food was fantastic. We will be back for sure. No heat lamps so the food comes out piping hot as soon as it's ready. Western suburbs based family is running it and are here tonight working hard to make sure this place is top notch. Bill for 2 adults + 2 teenage kid totally fair for the quality. My kind of place!

We have dine here now several time & every time everything is great. Service is always great! We have tried pretty much everything & have not been disappointed. Last night we had their steak & was great. Husband & I love the tapas style dishes. Unfortunately they are in downtown Winfield which does not have much but I love that they are so close. Don't judge a place because of the location.

Awesome little restaurant! My brother and I came in on a Friday night and sat at the bar for dinner. Very knowledgable and friendly bartender. The beer selection was great, and I also tried one of their mixed drinks..cucumber. DELICIOUS! I had the meatloaf sliders and fried Brussels sprouts. Fried did not mean breaded and fried...just fried...which was WONDERFUL and hit the spot! The meatloaf was melt in your mouth good. I will definitely be back!!

I really wanted to like this place. My wife and I were looking for a farm to table place to have a date night. I stumbled upon Union House via a friends Instagram. 

We walk in at 7:30 on a Friday and the place is about 1/2 full. Which was a bit alarming. I made a reservation thinking if I didn't there would be a long wait. This was not the case. 

We got sat right away and promptly waited 10 minutes before any server approached us for an order or explanation of the menu. 

When our server finally arrived she gave us the "farm to table" spiel and also said the food comes out when it comes out. Which I found kind of odd but hey ok. Then she leaves. Like leaves. Doesn't take a drink order or ask is if we have any questions. Just leaves. Almost mid sentence and it was bizarre. 

Now to the food. The menu is a sort of southern "soul food" tapas. Yea know fried okra and pulled pork. The wife and I ordered their Mac & cheese, pulled pork sliders, and BBQ chicken sliders. 

All I can say about the food is meh. It was VERY underwhelming. The mac & cheese couldn't have been anything more but some Velveeta and bacon bits, and the chicken sliders had pickle on them which was not listed on the menu. If it was I would have asked them to skip the pickle like I did with the pulled pork. 

The pulled pork was good. No complaints. Apparently it has won them some awards at local cook offs. 

Overall the experience was really a let down. The wife and I won't be returning to Union House any time soon. I guess that's what I get for trusting an Instagram filter.

This is a cozy place with small plates.  The menu is pretty limited and I don't know how frequent it changes.  We ate 6 things on it, so it was a good sample.  They were out of 2 things we wanted to eat, so perhaps they should just print out paper menus that can be updated.  We were strategically planning our food after all!

The first thing hubby noticed was how bright the lights were.  The first thing I noticed was that we were the youngest patrons in the place (I'm 50) and lots of them were eating with their coats on.  They need something to block the cold air from the front door.  After we got past that, we settled in and checked out the menu.

First we had fried pickles and the grilled romaine salad.  Both were yummy especially the fried pickles.  Then we had shrimp hush puppies and the scallops.  Two thumbs up on that.  Finally we had the chicken wings and some duck dish.  The chicken wings had bbq sauce on them, but were crisp, like they had been under the broiler.  The original duck dish was not available, the flat iron steak was not available and the wings weren't available and then were.

All the food was good, but we ate about half the menu.  Our server was friendly and answered all our questions.  The owner was walking around and visiting with customers, but we didn't get a visit.  I'm not sure why since there were only about 6 tables.

I would give 5 stars for the food, but I have to take one away for the lack of the updated menu as well as the environment.  That stuff can be fixed, so get on it!
Shrimp po'boy sandwich is delicious!!!!!! My friend had the BLT and loved it. Oh and those chips don't even get me started! Definitely coming back :)

Wow, incredible!  My 11 and 9 year old boys and I loved the fried brussel sprouts, crab hush puppies and fried pickles... they finished it off w/ kids grilled cheese on pretzel bun and I with pulled pork sliders.  Everything was extremely fresh and tasty... great micro brews... I sometimes find "small plate" places can be short on quantity and flavor and high on price - this place was reasonably priced, small plates aren't too small and incredible flavors.  Nice work!  We'll be back...

I typically like to visit a  place twice before rating it but the Union House is an exception.  I can't imagine them falling falling that far from my initial visit.  The service was very good and each of the six entrees we orldered were all done well. Pork sliders won awards and I can see why.  They had just the right amount of sweet/heat. The size of each  plate wasn't that exciting for the cost but I guess that's why there called small plates. plus most farm to table establisments have that added premium.
I would definitely visit again.

Groupon brought us here, sometimes you win, sometimes you lose.
We had the grilled shrimp skewers- over cooked with a tiny bit of sauce artfully displayed on the plate, nothing like another reviewers picture!  We also had the pork skewers, wonderful flavor but really tough, not sure what cut of meat they used but I suggest they start using pork tenderloin.  Lastly, we had the meatloaf sliders which was burnt slices of meatloaf on pretzel buns with cheddar cheese (not melted) tomato and lettuce, no sauce of any kind, they were very dry.  Could have benefitted with some barbecue sauce, maybe grilled onion too!
Our loss this time, theirs too since we won't be back.....

Good lookin' menu. Great beer list along with some wines & cocktails. Neighborhood gem.

Some people say the prices are a bit high for some of the shared plates in proportion to what you get, but I say they aren't at all if you are comparing them to other small plates/tapas restaurants.  Yes, if you are comparing them to your typical bar appetizer fare.  But typical bar appetizers these are not!  They pride themselves in using as many local foods & booze as possible and change the menu often to make the most of the seasonal fresh produce available.  Our server told us they opening in January of this year and have changed the menu 10 times.  Not to mention their weekly/daily specials they throw in.

We started with a couple of draft beers and shared the Crab Hushpuppies (4 hushpuppies, perfect for just the 2 of us), Pan-Fried Brussel Sprouts (I'm a brussel sprout fiend!), and the Pulled Pork Sliders.  Everything was delicious with one tiny exception.  The 2 onion rings that came with the 2 Pulled Pork Sliders were incredibly greasy - we only took one bite each and passed on those.  But everything else was so very good.  The BBQ sauce on the sliders is a 3-time award winner and I can see why - just the right amount of smoky, sweet, tangy & spicy goodness to really make those sliders POP!  The meat was plentiful & smoky-seasoned and came topped with a hefty dollop of coleslaw.  All this was served on those amazing Gnarly Knot's pretzel buns.  And they say "sliders" but honestly this was a regular sized sandwich to us, definitely not the White Castle slider bun size you might expect.  It was $11 for these 2 big "sliders" so I would say that was definitely a damn good price.

Before tip is was $49 & some change and we actually took a cup of the brussel sprouts home (hey, like I said, I'm a brussel sprout FIEND & those weren't going to waste!).  Not bad at all for some really great food in a cool pub atmosphere.  Our server was very nice & helpful in choosing items on the menu.  In fact, everyone there was very friendly and we overheard another server dealing with some difficult customers (they were right behind us & that couple was definitely being quite difficult) and their server stayed perfectly cool, patient & upbeat the entire time.

This may be the first time I am going to write a review like this. Union House American Kitchen has a lot of promise, but those promises are not delivered on.

I'll try to keep it short. Great location, great staff, lots of options for drinks and beer. And thus 2 stars to cover those areas.

As for the food, the menu holds a lot of promise, but the taste of almost everything was so bland I had to get the menu again to check on what I had ordered. I think the chefs ideas are in the right place, but the lack of flavor made me wonder what went wrong. One the extreme other side was the doughnut bread pudding. Made with a glazed doughnut is was beyond being way too sweet. Teeth hurtingly sweet. I would recommend a regular doughnut instead. Back to the food I would recommend a touch of salt in some areas. I believe the shrimp in the shrimp and grits was was cooked perfectly, but the grits were bland. Just add a pinch of salt to wake them up. Now someone tell me that I missed on the menu that this was a salt free restaurant and the rating jumps to 4 stars.

I would get a drink here any time and it would be a nice place to take a date for drinks. For food I'll have to pass. For that food it like to sit down with the chef and go through each recipe and see what we could do to make them sing and put a line outside the door.

This place is so close to being great. Flavor people, flavor!

I came in the restaurant this evening and was treated like I didn't matter!  I mentioned I was there to see Vito who is the cook and she totally ignored me and just started taking care of the next person in line!  Very rude!  Wondering how an owner of a company can treat their NEW customers that way???
Love this place!  The small plates are all amazing. Love the Brussel sprouts!  Great wine selection and craft beers. The atmosphere is great too.  Highly recommend.

I am giving 2 stars because past positive experiences kept me from giving 1. My girlfriend and I have been here 4 times now since Union House opened. We were excited that there was a tapas restaurant in Winfield near us. Good food, a little overpriced for the quantity IMO, but we still paid happily the first two visits. In our first two visits the food was great, and the servers were friendly, knowledgeable, and provided great service. 

The reason for the poor rating is the next two times we have gone back the service was mediocre and nonexistent,  respectively. We went to UH about a month ago and it took a good 5 minutes before our waitress greeted us (she had walked through the section multiple times, but did not say anything to us), and our service continued to be slow the entire night. I think the waitress may have been new, so I could look past it. However I couldn't help but notice that several other tables had people sit down after us, receive drinks before us, and receive food before we had even had been asked for our order.

This past time though, last night around 7 o'clock,  was by far the worst.  My girlfriend and I came in and were greeted and seated by the host, the one positive experience in the visit even though he only had one menu for us. In the next 10 minutes that we sat there we watched each waiter/waitress, the same host that sat us, and whichever manager/owner that was working the floor walk past us multiple times, about 2-3 times on average without offering us water, taking a drink order, or saying a word to us. One waitress walked by us (I started counting after the first two times) 4 times, checking on each table adjacent to us while seemingly ignoring us.

The manager/owner apologized to a table right behind us for slow service and then walked away without saying a word to us when seeing we had nothing on our table (we had been sitting there about 8 minutes at that point without a server greeting us or being given water). The restaurant is not very big (about 15 tables), the place wasn't full, and there were 5 employees working the floor. I'm 6'6" and we were seated at a table right in the middle of the restaurant where each employee walked past frequently, yet it felt like we were invisible to the staff. In the restaurants that I have worked at, regardless of whether you are a host, a server, or the owner if there is a guest sitting for more than 60 seconds without getting their drink order taken there is a problem.

After sitting there for 10 minutes, seeing two other parties sat, given 2 menus for each table, and served drinks while being walked past 10+ times by servers/management without a word to us we left.
