No one said anything to us on our way out, and I wonder if anyone besides the host even realized we were there. We ended up going to caliendos next door instead. We live close, but I'm not sure if we will be returning to Union House after this latest experience.


***UPDATE***
-Here is the correspondence with this owner after he decided to comment on this review-

Vito M.'s comment on your review:

Grab a manager...or open an account on yelp and rant...... hmmmmm
 
Derek B.
One week ago
Too funny... Improve your lousy service, or post a snarky comment on a customer's feedback... hmmmm...  Definitely won't be returning after this, thanks for the closure!
 
Derek B.
One week ago
You have a nice restaurant, and we enjoyed going our first couple times when your restaurant first opened.

These past two visits have not been good experiences due to the poor service we received, and I felt compelled to write a review.  In that review I complemented you guys for those first couple visits, but also gave my honest feedback on our last two visits.

It is disappointing to see that instead of using your time to utilize feedback to improve your business, you choose make sarcastic comments back to a repeat customer.  And to think, I almost felt bad about leaving this review being a waiter for years.

It is not surprising in the least that your restaurant isn't full on Friday nights, and I will be sure to share my experience with friends and family after your unprofessional response.  Have a good one and good luck!

Vito M.

snarky does not mean false
 
Derek B.

Vito M.

One week ago
Grab a manager before posting. Pretty simple... cant fix things for you ex post facto. In your line of work what if  this happened to your business?

Terrible, simply terrible.  This would easily be a negative rating if allowed by Yelp.

My wife and I, ex New Yorkers who have frequented top restaurants in NYC and Europe, have been around the block.  We've eaten at establishments where the food preparation was pure perfection, quality was at its peak, impeccable service.  Union House is none of those, but with the prices charged come off as one that wants to be.

We went out on a Saturday night around 6:30 pm, most of the customers were at the bar and not eating (warning sign).  Our server, who was a bit green, came out and blundered through the specials, and wasn't completely helpful.  No water was offered, none brought out, however he did bring the table next to us water as soon as they were seated.

Beer list wasn't bad, mostly locals and nothing too challenging. Prices were a bit high for drafts, 1-2 dollars more than what the pour ended up being.

We started with the fried Brussel Sprouts (special) and the Crab Hush Puppies.  Both were overcooked, clearly the fryer oil temp was well beyond 375.  If the restaurant was packed I could understand bumping up the fryer oil temp to balance out the orders, however with maybe 3 tables that wouldn't constitute a rush.  The burned sprouts were flavorless, oily - literally oozing oil, which is a fete when you consider that would happen when the oil wasn't hot enough.  The hush puppies were also under seasoned, the sweet sauce completely un-necessary and an odd pairing with the fried dough.  These were burned on the outside, under cooked inside.  Where the 'crab' was in the mix I couldn't tell, so my guess is lower-end crab or more likely canned.

We were both surprised while asking the server about the meal options - the Mac and Cheese, even without adding the bacon, had bacon fat incorporated into it, so that was out.  The Shrimp and Grits, for some bewildering reason, had the grits cooked in chicken stock.  Why ruin the flavor of the grits with stock?  Nobody cooks grits with stock, you do it with water, then add in your flavor profile depending on the overall dish.  IF anything do it with a mild seafood stock.  Only other option was to take the Sea Scallops for her, I went with the burger.  Another strike against the restaurant, this burger only came well done due to there being bacon ground in with the meat.

My wife's scallops came out first - which shouldn't have happened.  In a good restaurant (or in any) the burger would have been fired first and while the burger rested you fire the scallops.  I sat there waiting for my burger for another 5-7 minutes.  

The scallops were insulting.  The owners have some gall pricing out THREE scallops for $18.  A pound of 10-12 count scallops would run around $18 for people not in the food industry.  These were probably pre-frozen so you know the mark-up is insane.  No vegetables, no starches, just 1/4 of a shaved apple.  The scallops were clearly under-cooked.  Do the 'chefs' even know how to pressure test scallops?  My wife got through 2 before giving up.  My burger finally came out...on burned toast!  The potato chips were also overcooked, under seasoned.

The burger...where to even begin with this.  The bacon was a terrible choice for a protein combo.  Serve the bacon on top or do something like a bacon-infused cheese, hell put it into the bread dough!  There's a freebie for the chef.  The meat was only 'juicy' thanks to the fat in the bacon, otherwise this was beyond what anyone should eat meat at.  The giant smear of pimento cheese was disgusting, tasting of canned cheese.  No vegetables, no condiments on the burger so that went down dry and hard.  Couldn't even make it through the 15 chips on the plate due to the overwhelming burned flavor.  Burger was also overpriced at $11 for maybe 4-6 oz of meat, more toast than burger.

We were not offered dessert, table behind us were offered.  The check came out and we were shocked to see a total of $80, considering the service and low quality of the food.  Dropping four bills or more at David Burke or Le Cirque wasn't a problem but this...we were flabbergasted.  Left there with a lowered bank account total AND still hungry!  

We promptly went out and got more food someplace else.  Avoid this place like the plague.  If you want to drop that kind of money go to an actual restaurant not a place that's striving to be a 'new American gastropub' that totally misses the mark.

The chicken fried chicken is damn near the perfect comfort food.  The 12 buck B.l.t. was smokey goodness. The bacon mac is also. Pulled pork sliders were savory. ..crab jalapeño hush puppies yummy..The beer list is always interesting. The service has been spotty...The brownie sundae wasn't to bad either. . My only complaint if I had to have one was the one time I order the scallops they were not very good and to expensive to try again.  The outdoor seating is nice on a nice day. I think I've ordered just about everything on their menu. Overall good food and vibes.  FARM TO TABLE WHEN POSSIBLE.

Go to this place!! Food is great; beer selection is great, and the place is SPOTLESS.  I am so sick [pun intended] of getting mild food poisoning from incorrectly washed glasses, dirty beer lines, food prep issues.  This place really has it all, plus we met the owners & they are so dedicated and hard-working.  This is what America should be about- don't go to a chain; go somewhere where individuals care about what they're doing and are proud of their work.

The portions were small, but I thought that was commensurate with the idea that this is supposed to be a beer bar of sorts. Concept: fancy bar food. There is one thing on the menu that is flat AWFUL: this "salad" made of tasteless, cold, wet zucchini and goat cheese. Yuck. I had the server take it back. The food is ok. This is not really an ideal place for kids, though they are welcome. I say this because of the menu and the fact that it is a bar. If the owner wasn't such a nice lady I would have given this place three stars. I am sure she is hard pressed to find people who know how to cook. The menu needs to be re-worked and new kitchen staff need to be hired. Menu is trying too hard. Suggestion: do simple standards well, then branch out. We go to DuPage Hospital across the street about 2-3 times a year. I doubt we will try this place again, though.

I'm not sure how I have not written a review for this place yet... They are awesome!

My best friend & I frequent here because they have very friendly staff & they have an atmosphere that makes you want to sit with your friends & drink all night. I got their crab hush puppies the last time I was there & they were great. 
Also, If I don't know what I want to drink, the staff is always really good at giving me a great drink if I tell them what I am looking for. :)

What a pleasant surprise.  Farm to table in Winfield, who knew?  We went on a quiet week night.  I hear weekends there can be quite a wait as there are only 12 tables.  Great service and food.  Really enjoyed the scallops as well as the shrimp and grits.   Will most definitely be back especially for the lobster mac and cheese.  

Note to the New Yorkers who slammed the place....please go back to New York.
This place is the best! Down the street from my house it is definitely the best local pub. Alex was personable and all the staff was great. Try the fried pickles.

Well its been awhile since my first couple reviews of Union House. They have stepped up their game big time! Improving more each time I've visited. These guys are tuned in and producing great food! The beer selection remains smaller but well thought out. Rotating menus and specials seem to be the normal plus some great staple dishes. If you haven't yet give Union House a try!

A friend and I had dinner here last night.  Service was excellent (thanks Rachel!) and food was better than expected.  We started with the fried pickles.  I'm not usually a huge fan, but my friend loves pickles, so I figured I would give it a whirl.  They really were excellently executed and the breading was light but had so much flavor (hint of cayenne?).  We also had the hummus, which was quite a large portion with plenty of pita triangles...I thought the introduction of peanuts into the hummus would be weird, but turned out to be a nice, unique touch!  

We next had the chicken fried chicken.  WOW.  Two large cutlets pounded thin, beautiful crispy breading...again, not too heavy.  The light country gravy and fried egg a beautiful touch.  Mashed potatoes good, but could use a bit more seasoning.  A steal at $11!!

We split a piece of the chocolate pecan pie.  Was good, but I think would be better warmed up and maybe with a little ice cream instead of whipped cream.  Just a personal choice.

One other small suggestion is for the martini glasses.  While the glasses on the bias are cute, it was kinda annoying when I spilled some of my $11 worth of Grey Goose over the lip of the lower end.  Again, nothing that I would take a star away for.  The restaurant and the bathrooms were spotlessly clean.  A+!

I went to this restaurant for lunch. Amazing experience. Food was great. I had chili and shrimp po boy sandwich. Both items were to delicious . I can have them 3 times a day!! Service was outstanding . I would highly recommend this place for lunch. I am going to try to have dinner there pretty soon . Can't wait to go back -:)

Great, quick food and tons of drink options! Can't beat having Not your father's on tap. Food was awesome, I highly recommend the pulled pork sandwiches! Outdoor seating was perfect, Definitely will be back!

As a repeat visitor I will happily attest to the fact that a small town like Winfield can play host to a unique gourmet establishment like Union House.  I had expected a southern (Charleston region) influenced menu based on what I had heard of this place, but I had not counted on the small-plate concept.  The downside to this is that dining here can be a bit pricey if you arrive with a good appetite; but the plus side is that you get to enjoy a lot of different flavors and experiences.  We enjoyed the fried pickles, crab hush puppies, hummus, mac & cheese, pork sliders, shrimp and grits, firecracker shrimp, and more.  I also really enjoyed their "Grown Up Root Beer Float" as well as a good craft beer.

Expect southern-influenced fare, unique local and organic ingredients, and speedy attentive service.  With options galore, kids will enjoy Union House too.  Now I need to try their brunch!

I can't believe this gem is right in our backyard.  So we checked yelp tonight and there it was.  4 stars, "southern food".. ok, how bad could it be right?  We were expecting nothing more than 3 stars.  We were tired, and didn't want to cook.

So we get there, parking is pathetic because it's on a corner adjoined to an L shaped parking lot and it's right next to the tracks in downtown Winfield.    We got a seat no problem.  It's a tapas place, with xl size plates.  Tonights special was pork belly. I have never had anything so delectable, crispy, savory and sweet at the same time.

The gulf shrimp was grilled on a skewer simply served with lemon.  Delicious.  The desert was a carrot bunt cake with just the right amount of cream cheese frosting, and was as moist as can can get.

What an amazing meal.  Just to sum it up for you guys, $67 for TWO!! 4 tapas, 2 deserts, and 2 drinks.  

BRAVO Vito [the chef].  Thanks for a great Friday night meal!!!
Delicious small plate restaurant.  Everything is local and cooked to order. Delightful staff. Very fine beer selection. Pulled pork sliders are to die for!

Well I must say I was pleasantly surprised. My husband wanted to head to DT Winfield for a couple drinks on Saturday night and honestly I hate most places in Winfield so I wasn't looking forward to it.

Hey this place isn't bad at all! They have good beer (we are beer people). We liked the staff a lot. We will stop back and eat there and I will update my review accordingly but it seems like a great place.

The only thing is they seem to have no lunch hours.
Everything was delicious.  Lobster Mac and cheese, shrimp and grits and smoked Cornish hen were all great.
Great food and drinks! Many craft brews and cocktails. The food is fabulous! Loved the shrimp po' boys!  The chicken fried chicken was delicious.

I usually hate posting bad reviews, but this one still bugs me over a week later after visiting. 
We were looking for a place to go on father's day and I wanted good ribs. I read the reviews and thought it would be worth a try. This was our first visit to Union House. I called as soon as they opened and was told they had a limited menu but ribs were one of the entrees. They were not taking reservations that day but would get our group in when we arrived.
When we arrived the place was nearly empty and found a table big enough for our group of 5. The beer and drink menu was awesome...some drinks were a bit pricey but they were out of a lot of ingredients so we couldn't order some of them anyway. Not a great start.
My wife and I ordered the ribs, I a full slab and she a half slab. The kids stuck with the hamburgers and we ordered a grilled romaine salad and pita chips and hummus as an appetizer.  Both starters we good, the hummus was fresh tasting and perfectly seasoned. The salad was good, but not great. It had a weak smokey/char flavor and could have used more grilling. The kids enjoyed the hamburgers and the homemade chips.
Now the bad. The ribs. They were served pretty quickly, which should have been the first warning flag. The server put my plate on the table in front of me, and it was completely charred black with no signs of sauce or meat. Just charred black. At this point I should have sent it back and ordered something else, but I soldiered on. My wife's wasn't as charred but still very black. I started to cut into the first rib bone and the meat was so tough and dried it took a few tries to get through. The meat was like beef jerky and at this point I should have send it back. But I soldiered on still. I figured that it would get better as I got toward the middle. It didn't. It got worse. When you think of good ribs, you think of meat falling off the bone. This meat stuck to the bone for dear life and i had to chew if off.
So disappointed. The bill was $138.00 and it put me in a bad mood the rest of the day. I felt like we wasted good money and could have gone to Portillo's (I am not a fan of mentioning another restaurant in a yelp review, but this one deserved it) and spent half that amount and gotten decent ribs. Not sure what happened that day or why they would send out two ribs that were obviously over-cooked and were possibly left over from the night before and reheated.I should have taken pictures of the ribs (I will in the future) so you could see I wasn't making this up.
The good part. I am willing to forgive (but not forget!) and give them another try so I could see the full menu. (They did have a shrimp and grits I would love to try).  It's so hard to find a great rib place now a days in our area. I was hoping for this place to be one of them. I will suggest to them that they need better quality control, because there are a lot of great reviews for them, so that must mean they can turn out decent food. Customers are hard to come by, so they need to make sure each one that comes through the door is taken care of. Just as a suggestion, do with it what you will.
Just had a celebratory meal here with family and friends and they did a superb job! Fantastic food, unique flavors and great service. I cannot wait to go back!!

My family and I went here on Friday evening for the first time, a party of 7.  Given that this is a small plates concept, we tried nearly everything on the menu, and everything was delicious.  Everything is also farm-to-table and as local as they can get it according to the staff.

Fried Pickles, Crab Hush Puppies, Hummus, Mac and Cheese, Pork Sliders and BBQ Chips, Shrimp and Grits, Steak, Firecracker Shrimp...and a few more dishes that I can't remember (we ate a lot).  The Pork Sliders, Shrimp and Grits, and Crab Hush Puppies are still on the menu today, all three were delicious and worth going back for. 

The other thing worth mentioning about Union House is while the draft beer menu was small, it had good craft selections.  

The food was great but the service was even better, so we'll definitely be returning.

Oh. My. Lord. I sincerely can't believe we have this in Winfield.  We are city transplants and regularly drive back in to the city on date night to visit our old favorites and to try new places with friends.  In all sincerity, Union House rivals any high end popular eating establishment in any large city. Between the 4 of us we sampled over half the menu and everything that came to the table was better than the next.

Yes, it is "small plate" but it is substantial.  If you are not familiar with small plate eating just go in with an open mind, the expectation of ordering 2-3 items per person depending upon your appetite, and sharing.  Its fun and you get to taste many delectable flavors. 

The beer list is impeccable as is the service.  The root beer is out of this world (its beer - that tastes just like root beer). The owner is delightful and checks in a few times to make sure you are well taken care of.  We brought our little one along and she made sure she was well fed, despite there not being a "kids" menu - and well fed she was!

The prices are in line with the quality and flavor of the food and was worth EVERY penny.  We had the best dinner we've had in a VERY long time and are seriously quite simply amazed.  Out of this world!  Bravo, chef!  Thank you!\

I was afraid I would come to yelp and find more reviews from folks like Mary and Jonathon ... happily not!  Folks that frequent places like Ruby Tuesdays and Applebee's will feel a bit lost in a place like this. 

I live close so I am happy to have Union house as a dining option! I hope that the locals get it,  and that there is a draw for those looking for a dining experience rather than pulling your chair up to a trough.

Despite others assertions,  I actually was surprised to see rather large portions* coming or way.  Each plate had an ample amount for two to share and savor.  Great timming between each plate,  and my fiancee and I were borderline full after only 4 plates ... and some great beer.  *When I say large,  I mean large for small plates/tapas.

The food was great.  Highlights were the beur blanc drizzled over the brussell sprouts, scallops cooked to perfection and the shrimp on my shrimp and grits was the most succulent and silky I've ever had. Ever.  Not kidding. I am sure they were butter poached or something naughty like that then perfectly seasoned.

The chef has great energy. And I hope he keeps it up.

Went here again! Awesome service. Very attentive. Even when our first round salads took over 10 minutes, our server apologized a couple times and ensured they would be out shortly, which they were. 
I always have the mindset that tapas won't fill me up-I'm wrong every time. I was full and also had the satisfaction of numerous different plates. Pulled pork =yum. The crab cake hush puppies are amazing! Server was very attentive with drinks. I noticed it started to rain outside and they had no problem getting outside seaters indoors. The table next to us was very loud but once they left we had a very enjoyable time. It's crowded-but its a small place. Whatcha going to do? Will come back again and again! Nice job on the server training! They know how to make guests feel special!
new owners for 8 months. what a profound difference! great service, wonderful food, and they're open for lunch! the owner, stephany is welcoming and personable. love the place!

Y'all, Union House isn't messing around. I met a few friends for a round of drinks and some apps. We decided to try the whole menu. Okay, maybe I'm exaggerating a bit, but the 3 of us tore through a good chunk of the menu. The stars of the show? Fried brussels spouts and the shrimp and grits. Outstanding. The fried pickles were tasty, if not a little too oily. Overall, I think Union House is a fantastic addition to the western suburbs dining scene. While UH serves 'small plates', it is a fun place to share tastes of different dishes. Unlike a few previous reviews, I found the portions to be sufficient.

Lest I forget, the beer list: phenomenal. That is all.

My wife and I stopped by there tonight after hearing some great things about the food from a few friends.  First, let me start with the food.  We ordered the fried pickles, the bourbon pork skewers and the pork sliders with a couple beers.  The pork skewers were extremely tender and flavorful.  I have to wonder what Robert S. was referring to in a previous post, because in out case, the flavor of the pork and the homemade sauces on both items were excellent and memorable.  The sauce that created the flavor in the sliders won a 3rd place award out of 600 participants in The Glen Ellyn Smoke Off last year.  It was obvious to me living down south for while that Mario and his mother have created a good thing to build on here.  The sandwiches were so good that my wife and I will definitely be going back for a full dinner next week.  We try to go out to dinner once a week and while we like to try various restaurants, we are very picky about where we repeat our visits to.  This one goes on our repeat list!!  We absolutely loved it!!  Note, I should mention that the pork in the sandwich was smoked right outside the previous day and the pork on the skewers was marinated for 48 hours.  In addition to the sandwiches, they come with homemade chips that are simply outstanding!!  I wish I had a bag of those chips with me tomorrow to watch The Super Bowl!  (I'm not joking). 

The other thing about this place is the atmosphere.  While the setting is small overall, they do a nice job at creating a southern restaurant like environment that allows you to feel relaxed and in the moment to enjoy a special occasion.  In addition, they have a wall in their hallway that is a tribute to local military personnel that have served our beloved USA.  

Great job guys, and thank you for making our date night nice.  

Tom and Sandra

We were apprehensive about coming here because the reviews were so mediocre.  Needless to say, I'm glad we tried it for ourselves.  

As a tapas restaurant the portions were larger than most other tapas places and very reasonably priced.  And the taste is just incredible.  We tried the mac and cheese, the scallops, pork belly, and the pulled pork sliders.  Everything we had was fresh, full of flavor, and filling.  

 Everyone should check this place out and support farm to table service and an adventurous local chef!!!

FUUUCCCKKKKYESSSSS!! 
Do as I say:
Go to Union House. Order a beer. Order the buffalo shrimp. Order a different beer. Now try the chicken fried chicken. Order the root beer beer for dessert. Hibernate. 

You're welcome.
Delicious food & beer! Great service. Friendly owners. So glad this place is walking distance from my house!

The food was really good and our server Evie was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  The restaurant focuses on a farm-to-table model (as noted by our server) by sourcing many foods and beers locally.   The small plate format allowed us to try a full sampling of the menu.  The award-winning sliders (server recommended), mac 'n' cheese, brussel sprouts, fried pickles, house-made chips and mash & white gravy were all very tasty.  The Union House also has an extensive craft beer list, including an alcoholic root beer.  This is definitely a new favorite for us.

You can have a good time at this restaurant! Fun atmosphere. You will enjoy being there. Small plate concept and everything is shared. All the different foods were excellent. Our waitress Evie made it especially enjoyable telling us how to enjoy the experience.

I was very excited to hear that a new restaurant was opening up in my local neighborhood, I was even more excited when I heard it was going to be something new!  A restaurant that only serves local healthy food prepared by a real chef!

Experience: I went with a group of friends on Saturday, we made reservations and were promptly seated as soon as we got in.  All employees were super nice, and seemed to care/enjoy their job.  That's always a huge plus in my book.  The restaurant itself can still use some sprucing up, but I can let that slide since it just opened.

Service:  Service was OK.  Drinks and food all came out at different times, a couple orders were forgotten.  Once again, not a big deal to me as I know this is a new place and I've worked retail all my life.  A for effort, C for results.

Food: The food tasted great.  I could definitely taste the difference in the food served here compared to a regular restaurant.  I had an appetizer and the flat iron steak.  The presentation of the steak was good, and it tasted fantastic but came later than the rest of the groups food (ordered medium rare).

Value:  This is my largest problem with Union House.  Maybe I came in with the wrong expectations, but I LOVE to eat.  I understand that this is a small plate restaurant, in which you are supposed to share, but how can a friend of mine share his chicken plate when there are only two drum sticks?  It just doesn't make sense to me that this type of food be served on small plates.  I would personally enjoy spending much more per plate, and getting much more food.  If I could have gotten a larger serving of the flat iron steak, with an appropriate side, I would have been in heaven.  I hope in the future that something like this may be offered here at a higher price point, I'd have no problem paying.

Conclusion: I like the idea behind the real chef and the local farm raised food.  My biggest gripe is the portion size.  Maybe this is just my personal preference, but I like to receive a large plate filled with food, and I expect it at certain price points.  If you enjoy smaller plates with great tasting food, then this place is for you, if you like to leave a restaurant feeling full/sated than I'd recommend a different location.  I don't see myself revisiting this location in the future unless larger portion sizes are offered in the future (I don't mind paying more).

The Chicarron is legit, like one of the tastiest sandwiches (definitely top 3) I've had, awesome.  The fried rice was very good as well.  Kids had the "hot dog" and fries (and they give an insane amount of fries).  The Loma Saltado is merely good.  

Because of the Chicarron and value, five stars.  Will definitely be back to try other stuff.

Ok, I don't usually get impressed with food these days a specially with a sandwich. But BOOM! There it is a hole in the wall that has amazing sandwich. 
I ordered chicharron, which is pork butt with sweet potatoes, salsa criolla relish and fresh parsley mayo. Seems simple until you take a bite and the flavors of braised pork butt and sweet potato just start dancing on your tongue like two flamenco dancers. 

Will be coming back to try other sandwiches including quinoa burger

I love this Peruvian sandwich spot.  I think that I have slowly worked my way through the menu here.  I have had Chicharrón, Butifarra, and Lomo Saltado.  Those sandwiches are fresh, tasty, and delicious.  I did not think that I would like sweet potato or fries on my sandwich, but Peru loves potatoes.  I guess that I do too now.

The chicken fried rice is amazing.  I always try to stay on my diet and not get the fried rice or maybe eat a little of it.  That just never works.  It is too good.  I put a little extra hot sauce in it and my mouth starts to water.

I have had the fried plantains there too.  In the past, I have never liked fried plantains because they are usually soggy or greasy.  The owner/chef makes them crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.  It shows just how great this place is - something as simple as a plantain done so well.

The owner/chef and his mother seem to do everything here.  They are very friendly and attentive.  You pay at the counter and there is seating.  It may be more of a lunch spot, but I go for dinner and it is not crowded.  I pray that he remains healthy and gets some kitchen help so he can keep making these great sandwiches, fried rice, and sauces. Yum. Yum. Yum.

It's been a while since I've been to SanguChe, but I still remember the overflowing amount of food that was served! 

For a very fair price, SanguChe serves up loads of fresh Peruvian eats and stuffed sandwiches that are sure to please the masses. While the place itself is straightforward - expect no frills here, clean tables, clean bathrooms, a soda machine, and a handful of tables - the food is complex and full of flavor. I went with the Aji de Gallina: shredded chicken in a creamy yellow aji pepper, peanut and basil sauce, served on a French Roll with slices of sweet potato and hard-boiled egg. Per SanguChe, it's mix of Spanish and Peruvian flavor. For me, I saw peanut sauce and sweet potato and said, sure, that sounds great. 

And it was. It wasn't a flavor combo I was used to, but it was a nice mix of salty sweet and tender chicken. My dining mate, Jacqueline B, ordered a size of fried rice (arroz chaufa) and it.was.enormous. For $3.50 a normal sized human could easily fill up on this generous portion. 

SanguChe has something special here and I hope they keep it going!
Great authentic food with friendly owners!  This place is a must for anyone who likes something unique. The hot sauce is banging

As a newbie to Peruvian food, I was super intrigued by SanguChe and am now officially a fan!

I've had SanguChe bookmarked since the day they opened and finally just came here for lunch with Nicole W last week. They're located in my no-so-favorite Naperville area due to the construction and traffic that is always happening at North Aurora & Route 59. With that being said, I have no problem heading this way for fantastic food from places like SanguChe and their nearby neighbors Fire It Up.

SanguChe is a small, casual little shop with probably like 5 or 6 tables. At 11:30 am on a Friday they were mildly busy. I think there was one other group dining in, but plenty of folks popped in to grab lunch to go.

As I perused their menu which is written up on a chalkboard, the Chicharrón sandwich caught my eye. This beauty on a bun is made up of their traditional Chicharron (which is pork butt that is braised then fired in its own juices) served on ciabatta roll with slices of sweet potato, salsa criolla relish & drizzled with fresh parsley mayo. 

I think those toppings pretty much speak for themselves, but in case you need more direction, it's basically AMAZING. Such a unique flavor and a way more exciting lunch option then the usual boring old sammie. Their menu describes the Chicharron sandwich as their influence of African culture from the South of Lima.

To accompany my sandwich I ordered a "side" of fried rice (arroz chaufa). It's appropriate that I put the word side in quotes because IMO this is nowhere near a side - and I'm not complaining! Their order of fried rice is huge! It honestly could be a meal in itself (and for only $3.50!). This rice is just as delicious as it is plentiful, let me tell you.

Definitely plan to eat my way through the rest of their menu. Great lunch spot.

Before I start, I must admit that I am a newbie to Peruvian food and my wife made me come here because she stated that I should try something new! I am so glad that I did! When you walk in, there are 5-6 tables, there is Peruvian music playing, and the environment is cozy. We asked the chef (who turned out to be the owner, more on him later) what he would recommend and he said "try the chicharron." We ordered that and the adobo de cerda. In addition, we ordered a side of empanadas and fried yucca. An older lady (the chefs mom) brought our food to us. She started with the empanadas. The empanadas was filled with meat, raisins, and a relish. Weird combo, but it worked and tasted amazing. Then they brought out our sandwiches. These were the best sandwiches we have had in long time. The bread was perfectly toasted and the flavor of the sandwiches were nothing I have experienced before. Finally, the fried yucca was the weirdest choice on the menu. Turns out, yucca is a thicker version of a potato (a potato on steroids). It came with a mustard sauce on the side and this out any French fry to shame. Towards the end of our meal, the chef/owner came out and ask us how our meal was. He was extremely friendly and you can tell he enjoys what he does! We plan on eating our way through the menu!

Based on all the reviews here & having an interest in trying different foods (never had Peruvian before) i was in the area & decided to give it a try.

I had the chincarron which is a pork shoulder sandwich & it was excellent, freshly cooked, it's not a fast food place so give them a few minutes. 

The people were very nice, they gave me a free appetizer, fries yucca with mozzarella melted inside yum. 
The place is very clean & bright, & they have the Wall Street journal on the tables for your reading pleasure.

Overall it was a very nice experience. 

The only criticism I have is its a little on the pricey side. The sandwich & an order of fries, no drink & not including tip was a little more than $11, more than I like to spend. 

However if I'm in the area at lunch time again I'd go back.

I've never been mistaken for Guy Fieri and it's likely I never will be either. He's got about 100 tattoos. I have zero. He has a ton of TV shows. I have zero. He's got a red classic car and other ones, too. I have zero.  

But in addition to having better hair than Guy, I have access to SanuChe. He does not. At least not yet. But he may. If I were him, I stop in as part of Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and give this place a test drive. 

SanguChe is family run and very welcoming. Peruvian artwork adorns the walls along with photographs of people enjoying Peru. There is also some Peruvian jewelry for sale. It all works very well to take what would be an ordinary, strip mall vibe and add some life and energy to it.

The menu is clear in its explanations of the dishes. I went, however, with something off of the menu after conversing with the owner. He recommended a filling of meat, olives, onions and other seasonings and things wrapped in a potato and then deep fried. It was served with pickled onions and a hot sauce and it was awesome. The olives complemented the meat filling and the pickled onions and hot sauce made the dish a smash. Even without the hot sauce, the dish was terrific. I don't know the name of it, but if you ask him for it, he will definitely know what you want. 

I also went with some fried Yucca. The Yucca was stuffed with some mozzarella and served with another sauce, also delish. For me, the appetizer was waaaayyyy too much food for lunch but it was mighty tasty. 

My only complaint is that they don't serve unsweetened iced tea. I don't really go for pop or lemonade so that was a bit of a bummer. But they do offer water and that works just fine.

This little place is in the same strip mall is Fire It Up, another place I've grown to really like. Support this business. These people are cooking with their heart and soul. And if Guy Fieri stopped in, I'm pretty sure he'd say the same thing.

Nice place for lunch.  This is not your typical sandwich shop.  This beats subway all the way!! It was my first time here and not my last. It's a taste of Peruvian cuisine. I had the Milanesa and my friend had the Adobo de Cerdo.  My Milanesa was tasty although it needed more sauce and heat because I love spicy food! All the sides are al carte and drinks too. Close to the Naperville 59 train station. Staff was friendly and considerate of alternatives.

Lomo Saltado, where have you been all of my life?!

I've never experienced Peruvian food, but I'm willing to try anything at least once. So I looked over their menu and was immediately drawn to the Lomo Saltado. Containing strips of sirloin that have been sauteed in vinegar, garlic, and soy sauce, this sandwich is constructed beautifully with flavorful meat nestled on a soft french roll and garnished with red pepper, onion, and tomatoes. Topping it off are french fries and a delectable spicy aji panca. I was sold.

The decor at SanguChe is simple yet clean and inviting. There is a fountain drink machine but you can also order  Peruvian colas. There are five tables adorned with small, minimalistic centerpieces. It's a very casual, low-key establishment, but don't let that deter you from experiencing the fabulous food. The menu is small (seven types of sandwiches, including a quinoa burger option) but in a world where menus are diverse and overwhelming, I appreciate the simplistic approach at SanguChe. Still not convinced? You can build your own sandwich as well.

The gentleman who took my order (I believe it was Cesar) was extremely nice. He offered me a taste of the hot sauce that came with my sandwich and wow! That sauce is a creeper! At first you taste flavors and no heat but then spiciness kicks in. That's my kind of sauce, bring on the heat!

So the sandwich itself is nothing short of uh-may-zing!  The meat, the soft bread, the spicy sauce, the red peppers, everything was so fresh tasting! I was sad when my food was over. 
I opted for no side with my sandwich,but I certainly would like to try the rice. I also plan to try the Adobo de Cerdo sandwich on a future visit. The food and great service exceeded my expectations. I look forward to returning soon!

Holy hell this place is awesome! Came here for lunch, split the lomo saltado sandwich and a pot roast type sandwich special they had. Both were unexpectedly bursting with complimentary flavors. Definitely will come back to try all of their sandwiches.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!

Being a foodie, the concept of a Peruvian Sandwich Shop is something so unique that I had to try it out for myself.  The place is small and comfortable and tucked away in a strip mall.  You wouldn't even know it was there if you didn't hear about it from somewhere else.  That being said I've tried three of the sandwiches here and each one I had was amazing in it's own right. 

The other thing is who can argue with the price point? They also have something for everyone here as they have a pretty good vegetarian quinoa burger to offer.

Of the sandwhiches I've tried the Steak is my favorite but the Chicken and chicharron aren't far behind.  I'm not a big fan of the fried rigce but I love the fried yucca.  Also the Inca Cola is a must.  If you're a fan of going off the beaten path, this place is a must.

ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. This was my first time trying SanguChe and I was blown away. I couldn't take a picture of my sandwich because I devoured it. The sandwiches may not look like much but the flavors are out of this world. I got the Chicharron and I have to mirror what another review said. It was definitely one of the tastiest sandwiches I've had in my lifetime. The sweet potatoes and the pork was so delicious. The salsa criolla relish that comes with it was also amazing. I poured it onto my sandwich. So excited to come back and try other things!

Some friends and I did a cary out order and were very happy with the quality of the food!! We had one of each of the sandwiches, fried yucca, and the fried rice. All were very good!! The photos show the Steak & Chicken on Ciabatta but the normally come on a french roll, both are good.

The fried yucca is like a big potato in terms of what it eats like. They give you a great dipping sauce to go with it. The fries are "FreshCut" or handcut as they say. One thing I'd love to see is a selection of hot sauces to put on the sandwiches when you dine in. At home we did Sriracha & Tapatio which were both great to spice it up a bit!!

We will be back!!

My toddler always amuses me when she's too full to finish her burger and insists on bringing her "single bite" leftovers home. --She won't waste any amount. After eating SanguChe's Chicharrón, (with their hot sauce!) I fully understand her. I would wrap up a single bite and bring it home too. That sandwich should never be wasted!

So good in fact, I feel like I should go to every sandwich shop I've ever reviewed and deduct a star from those reviews because after eating here, no other sandwich I've ever eaten could deserve a 5 star. 

My husband clearly felt the same way as I. He had barely finished his Lomo Saltado and was already intensely studying the menu to see what sandwich he was ordering for the next time we come here! 

People, the hype is real!

Thank you, Yelp, for directing us to this gem of a place when we had a hankering for sandwiches because we wouldn't have stumbled across them otherwise!  The sandwiches here are delicious!  I wish we lived closer to enjoy them more often.  The owner/chef is incredibly nice and very helpful if you have questions about the menu. You can tell the meats for their sandwiches are slow roasted or braised for a long period of time as they are all very tender & oh-so-flavorful with just the right amount spices/seasoning.  The last time we visited the Hubs & I split a sandwich and an order of the Peru Poutine - more than enough food for the two of us.  

I recommend getting the hot sauce for the sandwiches on the side if you haven't had it before and they typically will ask you this just to be sure.  It's a unique hot sauce and I have no idea what is in it but it's very flavorful & packs quite a punch - a little goes a long way.

In my opinion the only thing holding this place back is their location but I'm sure it's because they are a new place & need to keep their rent low.  I'm certain if they were on the main stretch of 59 or in downtown Naperville then they would be packed.

I tried the Chicharone and the Adobo sandwiches  (I'm also pretty positive that I spelled at least one of those wrong) as well as the fried yucca. 

I was definitely impressed and will definitely be back.

The meat in both sandwiches was hot and had good texture, not dried out or greasy. The vegetables were all fresh and the bread was good. 
I  have absolutely no idea what the saices were but they were both delicious and mild.... nothing spicy but very flavorful.  
 
The fried yucca was like the best, super crispy steak fries you've ever seen,  but they are more dense than potatoes. ... do yourself a favor and enjoy them BEFORE you google nutrition information on yucca. 

The proprietors seemed really nice and the place was clean. I'd definitely recommend it.   The only reason I can't go with 5 stars on the review is that A- I've only been there once, and B- it was a little expensive.  Not too bad considering the quality of the food but it should either be a buck or two less per sandwich or the sandwiches should be a little bigger. Fairly priced though...... I'll raise the rating after going a few more times if I keep having good experiences.

Love this Peruvian joint in Naperville. The team of mother and son makes the most amazing food, particularly the empanadas and fried rice. The best thing I have ever tasted are the fries yucca. It's a must!

This place needs to be packed every day!! Except 
Monday,   they are closed. I had a pork sandwich that was sublime.  Boyfriend had the shredded  chicken with boiled egg. We also had frys and fried yucca. We had the mild and the hot sauces with it and they were both fabulous!  Son and mother cook. Son would not handle our cash because he was handling food so Mom had to come up front to give us change. That really impressed me. They also have poutine! Peru meets Canada! I'm getting that next time. Small menu but very good. Give it a chance, you won't be disappointed.  They also have a quinoa burger for my veg. friends!
The adobo de cerrado sandwich was flavorful and tender.  The ceviche was fresh and done right.

This place is awesome! I had the Pollo Ambulante with a side of Yucca and I have to say that it exceeded my expectations. All of the ingredients were incredibly well balanced and no one aspect of the sandwich overpowered the other. The manager/chef is also a really awesome guy and was a lot of help when it came to choosing what to order. Highly recommend it!

I made my first visit to SanguChe yesterday after seeing all of the great reviews and it didn't disappoint.  For a location and set up that is so simple, the tastes and flavor of the food sure isn't simple.   

I had the Adobo de Cerdo, a pork shoulder sandwich.   Great ciabatta roll, cool and crisp shredded lettuce and tomato slices and the spread was creamy with a great amount of spice and eventual heat.   The fried rice on the side was tasty as well-very simple with just eggs and green onion and not oily or greasy.   They brought me a side of salsa, which was great when mixed with the rice-a smooth medium-hot sauce that kicked it up well.

Perfect for lunch in that the portions are good but not too much and the food is fresh and ample but not heavy at all.  Their upcoming 4 course dinner looked good from the menu-check the website for details.   I'll likely update my review in the future as I know I'll be back!

Truly epic sandwiches. It serves the best butifarra I have ever had (I previously favored those served by the Panaderia San Antonio in Lima, Peru). The chicharrón was superb, the lomo salatado divine and the ceviche absolutely delicious. In addition, we were made to feel more than at home. 

I can't recommend this gem of a family run establishment enough. If you are in Naperville, you must visit and if you are not in Naperville you should make your way there.

My most heartfelt congratulations to the SanguChe team.
Really good interesting food. Possibly the best fries around. A lot of different pork. My son is begging us to go back. We will definitely be back soon. A little pricey

This tiny Peruvian sandwich place, hidden behind a much larger draft beer house, provides great comfort food. It's quick and delicious. The fried yuca is a great take on the traditional fries and is a must try. The Quinoa Burger is a perfect refuge for vegetarians. All in all, a place worth finding and stopping by.
They could increase the drink selection, though.

Hands down best ethnic food in Naperville. I have gone through all the sandwiches and they are all great. I am in love with his poutine!! The ability to add whatever meat you prefer changes it up for me every time. The cheese sauce is to die for. Highly recommend to anyone wanting to try something new. Simple yet special and unique.

Had two sandwiches here and they were as amazing as other reviewers have said. But the stars of the show had to be their fried rice and homemade spicy sauce. It's the best fried rice I've had since I was in ny Chinatown from my aunts restaurant. Phenomenal spicy sauce as well. Can't say exactly what's in it but I can tell there were fresh herbs in there. Try it out!

I love and very much appreciate this place and hope that it stays around for a while.  I say this with caution because this type of venture seemed risky (in this casual reviewer's opinion).  First off, there are no Peruvian restaurants west of the city.  The location is in an obscure strip mall off of Route 59 and away from the bustling Fox Valley area.  And, if someone is looking for a more traditional Peruvian experience, this is not the place to go because its a sandwich shop.  That being said, I certainly did not leave disappointed.  I've tried several Peruvian eateries (from high end restaurants to casual bistros) and have been to Peru, so I'm familiar with the cuisine and culture.  While not "traditional", the brightness of the food, the Peruvian-themed photos of the walls, and the pop/rock music in Spanish made me reminisce about my short time in Lima.

But enough of the nostalgia, let me talk about the food:  SO GOOD!  I got the quinoa burger and fried yucca.  Friend got the chicharron (braised pork) sandwich and Peru poutine with aji de gallina (shredded chicken in cream sauce).  I didn't know what to expect with the quinoa burger, and was surprised to find that the patty had more of a seitan-like texture.  The sandwich also had a slightly sweet taste to it which gave it a fresh and bright taste.  The chicharron sandwich was also really good.  The chef (who btw was wearing this festive Pisco Sour apron) offered a sample of the chicharron before ordering.  This chicharron is not fried pork skin (which is what I thought chicharron was) but thick slices of deliciously braised pork.  Both sandwiches were very flavorful and also very filling.  Both my friend and I are healthy eaters, and we were both stuffed and satisfied.  

Their regular fries are good (they are the type that have peel on them like Hot Doug's), but to really kick the meal up I recommend the fried yucca.  Usually I find fried yucca to be bland, but these were nicely fried and seasoned.  It was served with a creamy sauce that tastes similar to the aji de gallina sauce.  Peruvian food, in general, is not as spicy or tangy las other Latin American foods.  The Peru Poutine is a fun take on "fries topped with stuff".  We got ours with aji de gallina, and it was topped with sliced hard boiled eggs and green onions.  This was a meal in itself, and we had to take half of it home.  

The price is a bit on the pricey end ($7-9 per sandwich, $11 for poutine) but honestly these prices are on par with the frou frou, hipster-friendly places in the city.  And I think the price warrants the uniqueness and quality of the food.  Also, South American enthusiasts may be a bit disappointed to find that the Inka Kola they carry is the American version, and not the bottled cane sugar version we've all come to know and love.  But listen--Peruvians are notorious for bragging that they have the best food in the world.  The chef, as evidenced in the restaurant and on their website, is proud of the food he has created for this shop.  And in this casual blogger's opinion, they have every right to be.  Its simple but flavorful, modern but authentic, unique but familiar.  Sanguche is a great addition to the culturally-limited options of the western suburbs.

I had the Milanesa sandwich. Perfect amount of mayonnaise, perfectly toasted bread, perfectly breaded chicken! The shoestring potatoes were perfectly crunchy. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had! I also ordered the yucca fries with this light cheese sauce that made me believe in the possibility world peace! So good. I told all my coworkers.

Awesome place that wife and I tried on a whim based upon the Yelp reviews. Needless to say everyone was right! Food was delicious, and the chef super friendly! He guided us through the menu and made suggestions, I had the Peru Poutine with a fried egg and my wife had the Lomo Saltado. Everything tasted amazing, and the hot sauce they gave us had great flavor and kick! Definitely will be back, can't wait to try everything else on the menu!

Mouth watering Peruvian Lomo Saltado (steak sandwich) the friend rice phenomenal. Go here  for a nice relaxing lunch that hits all the flavors you'd expect in Peru- but your in Naperville IL. Don't forget the Yucca

We weren't impressed, but it was good enough that we would be willing to try again if we are in the area.

I didn't know what to get, so I asked for suggestions. The man suggested ceviche. My husband said he wanted it, and I said I didn't like seafood and asked again. He recommended something... I don't remember the name, but it was a fried potato ball stuffed with hard boiled egg and ground beef.

We weren't impressed. My husband didn't like the ceviche. It was serve with beans and a boiled sweet potato, and my husband said it needed something to mellow it out. And said it wasn't fresh. He didn't finish it, which is shocking for him. I got the potato ball, and it was cold in the center, which was really disappointing. It was tiny. I would have needed three to make a meal. I ended up giving it to my toddler, and it was perfect for him! Great size and perfectly cold. 

I went back up and ordered the Peru Poutine with Cicharron. The fries were amazing!!! The sauce basically tasted like cheese sauce. The meat wasn't very flavorful or tender. It would have been better with a shredded meat, and I wish they would have recommended that. It was a good portion, too. My husband and I enjoyed it, but it wasn't really special.

Our first experience with Peruvian food. I had the Adobo de Cerdo (Pork) sandwich. It was awesome! The pork was tender, cooked perfectly, and the sauce on it was amazing. Make sure to ask for some of their hot sauce. It was amazing! We had the regular fried, but a friend told us we should have had the fried Yucca. Next time.
Great great taste exactly what I was looking for great service fast service clean east to get to great parking and the food was bomb af

SanguChe is a little hard to find - it's situated in a strip mall that you can see on North Aurora and you access from Fairway. Takes a second to figure it out.

Besides that, I don't have any criticism. This is one of the absolute best restaurants I've been to in Aurora/Naperville. I've never had Peruvian (or Peruvian-inspired) food before, and after trying the wonderful food at SanguChe, I really regret that decision. While many of the dishes here do contain meat, they are wonderful about dietary restrictions which makes this place a great vegetarian/vegan spot.

I got the Quinoa Burger and the fried rice. Both were absolutely delicious and well portioned. I typically hate veggie burgers that go the "sweet" route rather than the "savory" or "spicy" routes, but I was really loving the sweetness of whatever topped the burger. I think the only thing that could have made the burger better was if the party itself was a bit spicier to give a bit of contrast to the sweeter topping. But really, I can't complain. The fried rice was totally solid - a delicious accompaniment to an already delicious meal. Typically, they make it with chicken, but they were very happy to accommodate a meatless request.

The service is wonderful, the restaurant is clean and spacious, and the food is divine. Chef César Chang hit the ball out of the park. I can't think of a better possible addition to the restaurant scene around here. I'll definitely be back.

I would definitely recommend eating at SanguChe!  The Yuca fries were amazing! (The hot sauce is a must to dip them in!)  I had the Seca sandwich mainly because it was the special and sounded delicious... and it did not let me down, it was delicious!  My one and only suggestion is that a small side of something delicious should be served with the sandwich.

I wish there were more places like this and not a bunch of tasteless chain restaurants everywhere that worried more about their pieces of flair rather than the quality and taste of the food they offer.  I support good food and I will be going back!
I'm so happy to have discovered this gem! Great service, and so delicious flavours! It was about time to have an authentic Peruvian restaurant around this part of town!

Small little place with some really delicious food. I ordered the lomo saltado. Every bite of it was heavenly even though I tend to not like sandwiches. Yummm....

P.s. I also ordered a pork tamale but will be saving that for my pre-flight meal tomorrow so I can't comment on that yet.

Went in blind and there are not pictures of the menu items. Have faith and give it a shot. So glad I took a random shot at it. The Lomo Saltado was awesome. Prices are fair,  made to order,  great quality.  Fries delicious. What a hidden gem.

This place is fantastic. My wife got the aji de gallina shredded chicken which was creamy and enormous and delicious. I got the chicharron pork sandwich, which I think was the best sandwich of any kind I've had in my life. There's tons of other great looking options on the menu, but it will be hard for me not to just get that every time.

On top of the great food, the chef and his family that run the place were very friendly, helpful, and attentive to all their customers. This is a unique, gutsy restaurant to start way out in the burbs, and it deserves to enjoy fabulous success. If you live around here, your job is to patron them regularly until they can afford to do a location in downtown Naperville or somewhere with more foot traffic. I think you'll find the work very enjoyable.

Food is perfection.  We had a beef empanada, the lomo saltado with a side of rice - everything was flavorful and just divine.  Soooo tasty!  

Oh and take my word for it, eat an Alfajore for dessert.   They melt in your mouth and you will be a very happy person after your meal.  We ate one and went back and bought 1 DOZEN.  Yes, they were that good!

Great place. Great food.  
Clean, good customer service and the food!!! Pollo Ambulante sandwich was on point.
YUM. Lomo Saltado! Best sandwich I've ever had, would love to try everything on the menu! 5 star for the nice and fast service also their cleanness. Highly recommend it. You won't be disappointed!

Tried this place today to broaden the lunch horizons & because some co-worker friends had it, loved it & told me we're going here for lunch.  

It's a small-ish place in a strip mall.  Decor is very basic with 5 tables, various Peruvian pictures on the walls along with what appears to be somebody's old wooden fence along the one wall.  The menu is on a big chalkboard above the counter/window where you order.  They have about 8 sandwiches to choose from (or make your own) along with a few sides.  
The place is very clean & service was very nice/friendly, albeit  a little hard to understand at times. 

After perusing the brief menu & wanting to not risk getting anything spicy out of concern for my co-workers & the ozone, I ordered the chicken milanese samich and split the Peruvian Poutine with pork with my friends.  The sandwich, share of the poutine & pop came to about $16.  Li'l  sticker shock at that initial cost in my opinion.   They have Pepsi fountain pops & only 1 size, 12 ounce cup.  We were told to take a seat & they'd bring the food out. 

All the food was brought out separately as it was done, which was a bit unusual but I get they want you to have it as fresh as possible.  The Peruvian pork poutine came out in about 5 minutes & was fantastic.  The pork was thinly sliced, flavored wonderfully with a lighter cheese  sauce & nice, fresh, hot, soft fries.  The ONLY ding I have on the fries was that they needed a little salt to me.  

The milanese samich came out a few minutes after the poutine.  The bun was extremely fresh, soft and big.  The chicken was hammered very thin & fried and came with small, thin fried taters and basil-y mayo and some other seasonings.  I thought the samich was very good but not blow me away good.   I'd have preferred the chicken to be a little thicker and juicier.  I didn't think the samich alone would be filling but it was!  I did eat all of it but my pants and diet  are wishing I hadn't.  

All in all, this place is very unique and a bit pricey, but also very good and extremely filling.  There are a few minor things I'd like to change but  I definitely look forward to coming back &  trying their other tantalizing samiches in the future.

This place is great - I will definitely be back!

I had the quinoa "burger" with fried yucca (note: the sandwiches don't automatically come with fries/yucca/etc. - it's a separate charge), along with two different yellow sauces. I believe these may be huancaina, but I'm not 100% sure - one was very mild with no kick, and the other was very spicy with ají (chile). I used both on both the sandwich and to dip my yucca fries in - delicious!

I loved the way the quinoa burger tasted with the purple cabbage. I'm not a big fan of super thick bread (mine was on ciabatta), but with the sauce, I didn't mind it. The yucca fries were SO GOOD - I went in thinking I was going to get "regular" (potato) fries, but I'm so glad I went for the yucca. I found myself eating those up before I even got to my sandwich, and ended up taking the second half of my sandwich home as a result (even though the fried yucca portion was reasonable/not big).

They also had little alfajores (a little shortbread cookie "sandwich" filled with dulce de leche/caramel and topped with powdered sugar) for sale the day I went in, so I tried one - I didn't really care for it, but to be fair, I only really like the dulce de leche part (just thought I'd try it again).

They also have a few free-trade items for sale in the corner of the restaurant, as well as various pictures of people in Peru and especially Machu Picchu. The people working that day were super friendly and nice, which definitely encourages me to come back!

SanguChe is the bomb. If you're in the area, you have to go and try this place out. They have a variety of delectable Peruvian sandwich selections. My friend and I split the Chicharron, Lomo Saltado, and an order of the Peru Poutine with Adobo de Cerdo on top.

All the meats are super delicious. Both sandwiches were great. However, we preferred the flavors of the Chicharron sandwich. The meat was tender and the sauce in the Chicharron brightened up the entire sandwich.

The poutine was also really delicious with the meat definitely being the highlight of the dish. My one big complaint would be that the Huancaina sauce drizzled on top was a tad bit salty.

Also, be sure to try out an Inca Cola. Apparently, it's a Peruvian type creme soda and it's sweetness goes well with the salty, savory sandwiches. 

The space was a little bit sparse feeling. A few table scattered in a dining area that probably could've been packed with a few more tables and chairs actually. The order-at-the-counter format is quick and easy. The menu is simple. And the restaurant definitely has a down home feel with down home food that the owners are passionate and proud of.

I will be back to try the other menu items and would recommend this place to anyone in the area.

Ok ...finally something DIFFERENT. This place is totally awesome. This food is unique and really delicious. I never expected Peruvian food to be this good. It tastes really unique and really homemade. The combination of ingredients is super unique. Garlicky, full of herbs. And finally...the alfajores...were ridiculous. Homemade! Not to mention the price is super right.

I thought I wrote a review for here but apparently not lol. This place is delicious and an unexpected treasure. Family owned, clean, and a little taste of Peru. I have had multiple sandwiches there but my favorite has to be the chicharron. And no this is not Mexican food...so what they call chicharron is totally different. The pork is so tender, and the flavors...just amazing. Fried yucca is fried to perfection and the little sauce it comes with is delightful. If you like things spicy, ask for their hot sauce. Not only is it spicy, but full of flavor. On Sunday's they have tamales...which are different from the traditional Mexican or Puerto Rican kind. Highly suggest you try them. Don't forget to get the little cookie sandwiches. So light and flaky with sweet in the middle-the mothers recipe :-)

We just ate here for the first time, I'm only sorry I waited so long.   I eat out a lot and sometimes it's hard to get excited about the usual dinner fare.  What a wonderful surprise to find that there is a whole new (to me, anyway) cuisine - Peruvian!  

Since Peruvian food is so new to me I really don't have any idea what we ate - I had a delicious steak sandwich.  My wife had a pork shoulder with pickled red onion and sweet potato sandwich.  The fried yucca was an interesting new flavor; but probably the biggest surprise was the chicken fried rice.  Simple, Subtle and incredibly delicious. 

The chef was friendly, helpful and overall made us feel welcome - even if we were a bit clueless.

Couldn't resist any more.  I pass by this place almost every day after coming from the train station and I've had it on my list of restaurants to visit but after over 100 Yelp reviews at 4.5 stars, I could no longer hold off.  Very nice couple as owners.  Got to talk to them a little while I was there.  Asked them what the most ordered item was and they mentioned the Chicharon.  I come from the Philippines and this is a specialty there as well so I asked what the next most ordered item was.  Got the Lomo Saltado to go.  They have a small seating area but it wasn't packed when I got there around 6 pm.  I think most people order to go?  Anyways the sandwich tasted like Filipino steak my dad makes but instead of eating with rice...it was on a bun with some French fries stuck in-between.  I love my dad's cooking so this hit the mark.  Very tasty.  The meat was a little thicker and very tender.  My maybe only complaint is it could have had more meat for a $9 sandwich but you certainly can't beat the taste..  I will definitely go back and try the rest of the menu.  I also saw an Adobo item which is also a Filipino food so can't wait to try that.  Benefit is it's so close and on the way home from work so I'll hit it a lot sooner next time.  It's a unique flavor so you gotta go!

Came to Naperville to pick up a friend from the train station and heard about this place a few times so I went to check it out. 

When I pulled up, the open sign was flashing, so I proceeded to walk up to the door noticing that I arrived close to an hour before they opened. The two workers in the back let me inside anyway and even offered that I eat inside after I insisted multiple times I could just take it to go since they weren't officially open yet. At this point I was already very pleased by the welcoming and homey vibe from SanguChe. 

I decided on the Lomo Saltado sandwich(Sirloin sautéed in garlic vinegar and soy sauce) and was not disappointed. It came on a French roll that was toasted to perfection and topped with tender sirloin topped with fries. The flavor is amazing and not something you can really explain to those who have not tried Peruvian food. 

I definitely got the fee of one of those small fusion restaurants in the city and almost forgot I was in Naperville. It's nice and cozy and everything about this place is great, along with the service and attitude of the employees. Hoping this place stays around for a while and I will definitely be back!

I'd never had Peruvian food before coming here, so I really didn't know what to expect. I got the Lomo Saltado, and it was okay. It didn't jump out at me as being delicious, but it wasn't offensive. Maybe I got the wrong thing, but I wasn't as impressed as the other reviewers.

My husband and I have been here twice and everything has been delicious! Right now my favorites are the Quinoa Burger and Fried Yuca. The Peru Poutine is out of this world crazy good HUGE portions  that can easily be shared with 3 or even 4 . This will definitely be our new go to spot.

This was our first time here! And with 3 kids under the age of 11 we didn't know what to expect... Great food! The owners are great! Very kind and friendly! The food was tasty, not spicy but very flavorful. The lomo saltado was great and definitely the group favorite! The chicharrón sandwich was great very unique with sweet potato on it. The sweet potato fries were great as well!
The owner makes everything himself which is great too!

Unique twist on Peruvian cuisine. I and a coworker split the Lomo Saltado and Aji De Galina sandwiches. Also tried the yucca fries. Everything was delicious. The yucca fries tasted just like the ones I had in Peru. Cooked perfectly, which isn't easy to do. Would defiantly go back. Nice lunch spot.

We were looking for a change of pace and found this great little Peruvian sandwich shop. My husband had the Chicharron. The pork was very lean and flavorful and the toppings really added to the flavor.  I had the Aji De Gallina with shredded chicken in a delicious pepper, peanut and basil sauce. And the prices can't be beat! We both will definitely be back!

UPDATE: We still haven't eaten in the restaurant, but takeout sandwiches from SangueChe have become a regular habit. I've also tried the Lomo Saltado (stir-fryed beef) and loved it too. Sometimes you can get deliciously fattening homemade cookies...
-------
We found SangueCHE from a friend's Facebook post and decided to do takeout for lunch today. So this review is based on that. I will update once we eat in the restaurant. We were especially curious about SangueCHE as we will be visiting Peru next month.

We both selected the Chicharrón (PORK) from their menu on the web. It tasted every bit as good as it looked. The salsa Criollo could have been a bit more present, but otherwise the rest of the sandwich pleased, especially the pork with crispy edges and the parsley mayo. We will be back!

The food is amazing. The Peru poutine is unbelievable and the prices are really good. You get a lot of food for your buck and the people who work here where super helpful. Definitely going to become a regular here

I actually went to SanguChe for the first time a few weeks ago. It's practically across the street from my apartment and I'd had a full day of doing nothing. It was close and Yelp said it was a good idea. It was so damn yummy that I woke up this morning wondering if fried yucca was a breakfast food.

I have absolutely no experience with Peruvian cuisine, and I won't pretend that I do. My first SanguChe meal was the Aji De Gallina sandwich ($8) (thanks to the suggestions of other yelpers). A french roll piled with shredded chicken, yellow aji pepper, sweet potato, hard boiled egg and sauced up with a peanut and basil sauce. In a word, fabulous. I'd never imagine such a sandwich combo, but now I can't imagine a world without it.

I also grabbed a side of fried yucca ($3). It came with a yellow sauce that reminded me of the aji sandwich, but I'm not entirely sure what it was. I mean, it was frickin good so I didn't really question it.

I'll be going back for lunch today, but I'm trying the Peru poutine next!

Finding this place was one of my most positive experiences with Yelp. The food is delicious and though the dishes such as a quinoa burger and milanesa are seen at many restaurants , the Peruvian flavored really shine for a completely unique meal. Both the quinoa burger and the fried yucca were the best I've had. My friend ordered the milanesa and loved. However , he did say that it's a bit heavy with the sauce if that's something you're concerned with , but it's easily adapted as the food is all made in front of you ( not in a Chipotle or Subway fashion, rather it's just possible to see into the kitchen). Also , the prices are cheap! The perfect lunch spot with enough options that you might be coming back for do

The food was tasty. I have no complaints. But there wasn't really anything that seemed distinctly peruvian. The beef was seasoned well and it was good food but it really wasn't much different than just a good steak sandwich. And the fries with beef was simply the same beef on top of nacho cheese sauce. Calling nacho cheese by a peruvian name is still just nacho cheese. Good flavors. Tasty. But was not the peruvian experience I was hoping for. I have no additional knowledge of peruvian culture or food as I did before I walked in.

Located in a strip mall on the Naperville side of the Route 59 train station, this place is definitely unique in that it is the only Peruvian restaurant in the area. The menu is small and features sandwiches along with various sides.

We stopped in on our way back to Iowa, and we were walked through the menu, getting a feel for the different cultures that are mixed in with the Peruvian cuisine.  It was interesting to learn about the influences and see that portrayed into the menu.  My husband is always skeptical when trying new foods/cuisines, but we ordered 3 sandwiches to share and they were all different, but equally amazing.  We ordered the Milanese, Lomo Saltado, and the Chicharrón.  We also tried the fried Yucca, which was like big potato wedges, but were crisp on the outside and soft in the middle.  They came with a delicious yellow sauce.  

Every order is made fresh to order.  The service is excellent and you can see the passion for the restaurant from the owner, Cesar.  

The feel of the restaurant is family-friendly.  There are some photos of people in Peru, along with some jewelry and decorations from Peru (and maybe other countries) that are for sale in the corner.  

I cannot recommend SanguChe enough and I also can't wait to go back.

Wow. These sandwiches are so flavorful. We got four different sandwiches at our table and just traded back and forth. Every single one was phenomenal. The meats are all cooked to perfection. I like foods spicy though, so more heat would have been nice, but I enjoyed the food exactly as it was served. The staff is incredibly friendly and more than willing to explain things to you or even just chat.
So good!! Definitely come super hungry because it's very filling, and you'll cry watching the yuca or bites of sandwich that you can't finish.

DELICIOSO! César, the owner & chef, is formally trained and certified in culinary arts and holy smokes, what a difference in the quality! I ordered the Chicharrón sandwich and Yuca fries -amazing! It was cooked right in front of me, everything was fresh and light, not too heavy. We also ordered a new sandwich, the Seca. The beef was perfectly cooked. I'm in love with this place because it's not Panera churned out by teenagers, loaded with preservatives. It's better tasting and BETTER for you. This authentic Peruvian food puts all the surrounding chain restaurants & burger joints to shame. A MUST GO!
The chicharron sandwich is amazing!! After I eat two sandwiches I take a chicharron to go because I love it so much!!
The restaurant is small, it has about six tables, People are friendly.  The sandwiches are amazing, the depth of flavor is unbelievable.  Highly recommend the chicharron!
My favorite take-out spot in Naperville/Aurora. Delicious sandwiches with flavor combinations that are to die for. Personal favorites: the lomo saltado and the butifarra.

Fantastic hand made to order deliciousness.

I had the steak sandwhich, wife had the breaded chicken.  Great flavor combinations, excellent sauces.

We ordered both the chauma (fried rice) and yuca fries to try both and were very happy we did.  Fantastic simple rice.  Would come for lunch just for the rice.

Well executed, we will definitely be back to try more!

Excellent place, clean and makes you feel welcome. Food was great, we totally recommend the lomo saltado sandwich but we also tried the Aji de gallina one and it was very tasty. We would come back next time we are around.

Food was fresh, interesting different flavor combinations. Price was a little higher than I would have liked, but very unique and a nice change of pace. Fried rice was a good size portion. Fried Yuca was good but I think I prefer regular fries ( just my preference) pork sandwich was my favorite thing I tried. Staff was very friendly.

We had several different dishes here, including the Peruvian Poutine (which was delicious!)
The staff was courteous and friendly, and the restaurant was BUSY (which is usually a good sign)!

This place is amazing! My husband and I stopped in after seeing it on Yelp, and not only was the customer service amazing, and the people were so nice you genuinely want them to succeed, but the food was AMAZING! We shared the lomo saltado, and the chicharron and yuca fries! Soooooooooooo amazing! Ask for the sauce that comes on the poutine to dip them in! Outstanding! We will definitely be back!!!
Good food......the beef sandwich and the fried rice was good...had a fried chicken sandwich (since that was the only one available) which was kinda ok....

Amazing! My husband is Peruvian so we tried this place with a knowledge of what to expect. I am vegetarian and knew I would be limited but the Quinoa burger was the bomb. What flavor! Also love Yucca and was not disappointed.  My husband had the Lomo Saltado and said it was delicious. 
The Alfajors were gone for the day so we'll need to come back for those and compare them to what we are use too!
Love Alfajors so I was sad I did not get any but my waistline thanked me for it. A sweet treat.

The reviews are correct, this is a great find.

While the decor is virtually non-existent and the location is only good for people living nearby or riding the Metra (station very close), this little joint is worth a visit.

The owners are very friendly and make delicious food to order.  I hope business continues to pick up with more Yelpers visiting as it would be a shame to lose this gem.

The Lomo Saltado will blow your mind. This place is seriously legit. Such great service and deduction to quality. The bread is amazing!

We also ordered the fried yucca and it was excellent!

Just wanted to add that I've been here several times since my initial review and I have never been disappointed. My husband is from Perú and he absolutely loves this place as well. My favorite is the lomo saltado. The beef is very tender and juicy. I've had lomo saltado in quite a few Peruvian places in the city, and this is by far the best. Many times I've had it in other places it's been dry and tough. The fried yuca with salsa a la huancaína is amazing as well. My husband's favorite is the chicharrón, but between the two of us we've tried all of the sandwiches aside from the quinoa burger. The arroz chaufa is delicious and the alfajores (dulce de leche shortbread cookies) are to die for. Everyone that works here is very friendly. I'm hoping someday to try the tamales. We will definitely be back many, many times in the future.
