Great creations of food. Looking for a place that takes a sandwich up a notch this is it. Fresh ingredients and hand made to order.

Peru was our international country this month and we chose to dine out vs cooking at home. This is a wonderful find that we will visit again. We shared 3 different sandwiches each of a different meat and a side of fried yucca. All fantastic. Service very friendly helpful and prompt. Very reasonably priced. Its a small menu done right. Every sandwich unique and very flavorful.

We had an appointment in Naperville, and are always on the lookout for new local restaurants to try.  I found this on Yelp, and we were really glad we did.  My husband who is Mexican loved his Adobo de Cerdo sandwich, and only wished it had been larger due to how good it was!   I had the milanesa, and it was good, though I would have enjoyed it a bit more with a bit more seasoning.  In fairness, my mother-in-law makes the world's best milanesa, so I am judging it against really high marks.  The fries were good and a large portion; next time I'd like to order the yucca just so I can try it :)  We enjoyed talking with the owner and discussing the differences between Mexican and Peruvian food.  We would definitely visit this again to try other menu items!

I can't believe how close this place is to my house, and I am so excited about that.  I did have a little bit of trouble finding it - It's got a sign on the street, but I couldn't find the right strip mall building at first, so if you have to drive around a parking lot twice like I did, don't give up!  It's worth it!  I got takeout on a weeknight for my husband and I and didn't call ahead, but it was very fast service.  The restaurant is pretty bare bones and on the empty side, so my guess is they do a lot of takeout business.  If this place was on grubhub, I would probably get delivery constantly.  We had the chicharron and the aji de gallina sandwiches with the fried yucca and the rice.  Everything was pretty good, but I would probably skip the fried yucca next time.  They were prepared really well - crispy outside, nicely salted, with a good, creamy/garlicky dipping sauce, but they just weren't really my thing.  The chicharron sandwich was the star of the show.  The pork is crispy and salty, with nice bite from the pickled onions (I don't even like onions) and sweetness from the sweet potato.  We also got the cookies at the register (on another yelper's recommendation) and it was like shortbread clouds.  So good!

Please, please, please go to this place.  It was very empty when I was there (weeknight takeout) and it would be a crying shame if a place this unique, delicious, and fast went under.  You won't regret it. Next time you're thinking that you want something fast, skip Chipotle and try local instead!!
Incredible food. Freshly made. Came with a group of 6 and each of us had something different.. Each of us looved it!!!

Give this place a try...or five.  What a nice change from one of those big chain burritos or a common torta. But this was not Mexican.  After my first experience with Sangu Che Peruvian Flavors, it"ll be hard to go back to those other places.  Why would I?  The lomo saltado was incredible, and the chef took the time to acquaint me with his work; the sauces, the secrets of great French, or should i say Peruvian, fries, the drinks, and how Peruvian food is head and shoulders above Chilean food.  He was so excited to talk about his food you know he puts the same enthusiasm and care in his cooking.  It showed.  I'll be going back soon, next time with lots of friends.

Can I just begin with how much I adore this place- you'll want to check this review out! 

Let me give you my experience here :

It's a rainy afternoon and I just got out of yoga... As I walk through the door I'm greeted by smiles, hellos and a board of pictures of people at Machu Picchu! I start to gander the menu and see aji de gallina, lomo saltado and chicharrón - all famous Peruvian dishes I'm well aware of :) (I'm thinking at this point this is too good to be true) and of course it is for me since I'm a newly vegetarian. Wahhhhhhhh... so I figure I can start with the fried yucca and maybe a salad. Oh no, no, no ... Cesar, the nicest chef around, catches wind of the fact I don't eat meat and offers to whip me up a sandwich of veggies! :) :) :) 

Now I'm thinking this could go wrong. This could go terribly wrong since I'm already well aware of how rich these food combos can be- tomatoes marinated with cilantro, onions and lime, olive sauce, eggs, aji sauce .... But fear not because Cesar really knows what the heck he's doing in that kitchen- the first bite and taste buds exploded- ( it took me back to Lima, Peru- literally). You wonder why there's no picture with this review? Because I devoured my sandwich and sweet/spicy/peanut coleslaw (seriously an awesome spin on Asian Peruvian fusion and American slaw)... I also washed that down with fried yucca and huancaina sauce(best dipping sauce ever), part of a tamale and an alfajore(the first think I ate)... Let's just say my belly and heart were extremely satisfied. 

Now I can't sit here and give all the credit to the food because anyone can cook - I mean, I cook Peruvian food, and yes it's hard, but it can be done! But there is some serious talent here. Cesar is not only from Peru but has moved around the U.S. cooking at various places. His concept of sandwiches on these famous dishes is genius and you won't be left wanting more. All the food and ingredients are fresh and prepped each week, which is not easy, if you've ever cooked these dishes. Cesar also does a great job explaining this food to newcomers as I asked how overwhelming it must be for people who have never seen this stuff before. Hearing his story made the experience just that much more awesome and his and his mothers hospitality and friendliness made me feel like I was in their home (how it normally is in Peru too!) Thank you again for that :) 

All and all, this little slice of paradise has something for everyone. I recommend the lomo saltado (steak lovers) or chicharrón, Salchipapa for the kids, Plato del mes for the drunkies and tamales for the brunch goers. Again, you really can't go wrong and if you're still lost don't be afraid to ask Cesar- he won't steer you the wrong way! Keep up the good work Sanguche - my new favorite place! 

-ChiGirl Fit

What a great restaurant. No frills, cooked with love and taste profiles that are complex and reflect truly authentic Peruvian food. Chef Cesar, who is Peruvian, and his mother have brought a new, vibrant taste to the suburbs. 
The sandwiches are out of this world. The meats- chicken, pork or beef are all tender, flavorful and well portioned. The Aji de Gallina a shredded chicken dish as a sandwich is awesome. My other favorite is Chicharron, a pork butt sandwich with meat that melts in your mouth. The same is true of the sirloin. 
Another authentic dish is Peru Poutine which is your choice of meat over hand cut fries smothered in Huancaina sauce. It is absolutely incredible. 
This place is low key, with great food!!!!!

We are lovers of Peruvian food of all types. This was our first time here. Both ordered the Lomo saltado sandwich...extremely tender and flavorful pieces of steak, onions, peppers and grilled tomatoes on the yummiest roll. It was incredible. Like lick the paper in the basket for every last bit delicious! The owner and who I assume was his mama were there. They were both incredibly helpful. They recommended Yuka fries and they were incredible. The dipping sauce with it was almost too good to be true. I needed more fries. Honestly I would have dipped a stick in it. So tasty. Don't pass this place by, it's super yummy and super affordable! We'll likely see you there bc we've got lots more menu items to try.
Awesome sandwiches! The Milanesa is soooo goooood. And the empanada is great! A welcome to the neighborhood of naperville

The Owner/Chef is so personable and makes you feel special. He remembers what you like to order and even intricacies like your favorite sauces and to add extra onions.  This place is gem in Naperville you have to try it.
Great food, but they completely forgot part of our order and took another 20 mins to make it.

I visited this place a week after opening. The outside isn't very inviting but in the end, that really doesn't matter. I looked at their menu and was surprised to see how small it was. They only had three sandwiches and everything was an add-on. I ordered the Aji de Gallina (two of them) and when they were given to me, they were too salty and the meat seemed like it had been out too long. We ordered separate fries and drink and the total was nearing 30 dollars. In my opinion, for that kind of money, I'd rather go to Red Robin (only two miles away) and eat a great sandwich or burger with bottomless fries. Don't waste your money here.

Outstanding!!!! Had fried rice and yucca! Also tried the chicharron and hubby had lomo saltado 
Although it did take a while to get our food, it was worth every minute!! Definitely on my list of favs in Naperville

AMAZING!! Saw this place by accident driving by, and boy, am I happy I did! Nice little family owned and operated restaurant. The food is full of flavor combinations that I have not had before. A must try is the Lomo Saltado and fried rice, my favorites. Our new spot for neighborhood quick eats.

Muy bien...."Cocktail only" review follows
Hinsdale is not my normal path in life, I found myself with an hour to kill and in downtown Hindsale, so I walked past CiNe and was pulled in by the wall of tequila and other indulgences behind the bar.  
I had a patron margarita. They were both top notch. Made with care and presented with class, these drinks did not have any pre made electric green mix - just fresh good lime and tequila.

Great little spot for authentic Mexican with a great wine list, cocktails, and authentic Mexican beers. 

Right away I was greeted with a smile and the service followed suit. They were catering to allergies and asked all the right questions to make my experience more enjoyable. 

Solid date spot, and family friendly. Also great space for private events or parties.

I will be back again, can't wait to try more of their extensive menu.

Wow!!! What a change. After having several bad experiences more than a year ago we have had 4 occasions to return in the last couple of months. Much, much better. Some of the best service we have ever had. Attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. Food was out of this world and even cocktails were way better. Two thumbs way up..,, we will be back.

7/21/16- Cine had become one of our standard " go to" places over the last year but again the service is starting to suffer. The place was empty last night and yet we had to repeatedly search out our waitress & finally went and asked the hostess for our check. Not that our waitress wasn't pleasant just not trained or up to the task. 

The food is again slipping. Some days quite good and others a " C" at best. Inconsistent . But it's the service that is going to be the death of Cine if they don't get solid management & a well trained staff in place.

Five stars to a place with excellent service and hella hot homemade hot sauce!

Their cocktails and margaritas are fabulous. If you're on the spicy rage, get the jalapeño cucumber margarita. It will burn your throat but ahhh so good!! 

I like how they have all kinds of homemade sauces and they put their own spin on Mexican. I like to call it New Mexican. The enchilada had a brown sauce that was rich but also slightly sweet with a hint of cinnamon. The marinade on my steak taco was also well done with a tangy and flavorful pop.

All this would give them 4 stars but what pushes it to 5 stars is the AMAZING service. They made fresh chips for my friend with a gluten allergy and he didn't even ask for it! They were attentive, and our waitress was super friendly. She was also very knowledgable and catering about the drinks.

If you're in the west suburbs looking for spicy or just an awesome New Mexican place, try here!

Cine is located in downtown Hinsdale, right next to Fuller House. It looks like a smaller version of Carnival with its colourful decor and fun atmosphere. I went on a week night when it wasn't very busy but the service was still slow. Cine hit the spot for my mexican food craving. Got free chips and salsa and a free churro when I checked into yelp. Ordered the mahi mahi, chicken quesadillas and the steak and chicken fajitas. For dessert we got the tres leeches cake, I liked it. The mahi mahi had a great presentation but failed to deliver in taste. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't as fresh and light as I prefer it to be. Their virgin mojitos were a little too sour. The chicken quesadillas and fajitas were pretty good. Overall it's a solid place around the burbs.

Done done done. Totally done with this place. The first time I had the chicken tinga tacos I was amazed. I couldn't wait to order again, so I did. Twice. Each time was a joke. The first time I ordered pick up and they messed up my order, I had to wait like 20 extra minutes to get it fixed. The girls at the front were so annoying. Jumping at the bit to seat people and completely ignoring me and my requests for them to check the kitchen. Ridiculous. Then I get the correct order and the food was bad. Not worth a cent. 

Today I had to order again because the kids wanted tacos. Worst mistake. First off I asked for no beans just rice with the tacos. The girl said "ok so you want double rice instead of the beans it comes with" yes, I want that. Great, food comes she sends me two sides of rice for $3 each, $6 worth of rice for the garbage. Such a joke. 

So they tell me the driver will come back and give me a refund. Waited two hours, finally got my refund . The delivery driver was super sweet and awesome though, so props to him. 

It's nothing but a hassle dealing with these people. Save your self time and money.


I will vow never to come back to this place and anyone who asks me about good Mexican food will be quickly steered in the other direction. BYEEEEEE CINE!!!!!!!!!!

Another great indie restaurant in Hinsdale.  Love what they did with this old building.  Good, strong margs,  Ceviche appears to be a favorite but it's not my thing so we didn't order it.  Tacos I had were excellent.  Fresh and full of flavor, I had the fish and the carne.   Do make sure to get an order of the trio of salsas and avocado fries.  Both were excellent.  Husband and couple we dined with had combo plates.  Did my proper girlfriend with pearls on lick her plate?  Why yes I think she did!

I love this place.  The chips/salsa are addictive and the margaritas are great - the skinny margarita is my favorite.  My favorite entree is the chicken tinga crepes - to die for.  They come with a rissoto side that's also wonderful.  I've been several times a the service has mostly been really good and the location is great.  The ambiance is nice too, especially in the front and in the bar.
Hasn't been good lately. What happened? Seems like they had it all together when it first opened, but quality is lacking. They got our order wrong but gave us a full refund, which was nice.

Been here multiple times and never had a bad experience!!! Can't think of one bad thing about the place. I try something different each time I go but so far my favorite dish is the chicken alambre. It's delicious!! Pair that with a fresh margarita and u have the perfect combination. Can't wait to go again and try something new

I love this place! Chef Luis makes the best dishes
Drinks are great, overall very satisfied!

We have come here a few times and it seems like every time we go something goes wrong.  They truly lack customer service.  Yesterday we went in for dinner and my daughters were given a children's menu (piece of paper) which said "Kids Eat Free Every Sunday" and below it is a drawing that says "HAPPY FATHERS DAY" for the kids to color.  At first I wondered if the Kids Eat Free would be on Father's day however given the kids menu was made for Father's day and Kids Eat Free was included I assumed it was.  I should have asked as when we received the bill and questioned they stated "oh not on Father's day" with no hesitation and no apology, etc.  If this was the first situation I'd let it go but it always seems to be something.  

Cine please focus on your customer service - you now have competition on the next street.

I very well might be upgrading this to 5 stars if they stay along the current path.  Location is great being right across from the Metra.  The service is top notch.  Javier took care of me the first time and the chef's son the second (I didn't know he was chef's son but was complementing how great the food was the last time and he confessed that is his dad) and both were outstanding.  The decor is really interesting.  The bar area is fairly standard but a good sized bar.  Then there are two separate dining rooms with difference types of decor.  The one to the right has very bright colors and I really think that is cool.  The other is a bit more neutral.  I've never sat in either since I opt for the bar area.  I wanted a spicy margarita and they don't have one on the menu but they made me one with muddled jalepeno that was really solid.  The chips are very warm when they come out, which I quite like.  The salsa is decent although not the star.

I got the three ceviches and wow.  I really enjoy ceviche and to many spots get it wrong.  I don't want something swimming in citrus and don't want cooked seafood thrown into lime juice.  All three were truly outstanding.  The portion sizes were appropriate for ceviche as well.  The camaron was nice and spicy and the mahi mahi, which I thought I would like least, was my favorite.  The scallop one has baby scallops that were really tasty.  My husband got the tacos and that is his go-to at Mexican places so he is a good judge and said these are really great.  I didn't think I'd like the quesadillas because I prefer some good chunks of veggie in mine like onions and peppers and these were more high quality meat and cheese but they were very good.  The tortillas were light and crispy and just really well executed.  This is definitely my favorite Mexican restaurant in the suburbs and rivals the best in the city.  Flavors are very well balanced and very much pop.  The food speaks for itself but the service is stellar as well.

Tonight, my husband brought me here for my birthday/our first dinner date alone (with no squirmy toddler) in almost two years.  We arrived at 4pm, and it was pretty empty (just the way we like it.)  it was the perfect place (and time- early evening) to come for a romantic, quiet meal. 

We sat at a booth, were served margaritas right away (not the best I've ever had, and a little small for my liking, but very tasty nonetheless.) 

The chips and salsa were fresh and flavorful.

For an appetizer we had the shrimp ceviche, which I was glad we tried, but I'd opt for something else the next time around.  

We also ordered (and split) the gigantic arugula salad which had sweet potatoes, golden raisins, tomatoes, strawberries and Mamey dressing. Sounds like a weird combo but it was AMAZING & I want more now.  I love that they didn't skimp on the salad dressing. 

Our server timed the food perfectly and we were able to eat everything calmly. She also checked on us just the right amount of times, which we liked.  

For dinner we had a stuffed pork dish (stuffed with apples and sweet potatoes, I believe) 
The dish came with rice, mole sauce and plantains. I was excited when I read on the menu that the dish had plantains but disappointed when I only saw like three small cubes of plantains on the rice.  I got over it quickly, though because the flavors in this dish were fantastic.

I can't wait to come back and try different dishes!

Steak tapiqueño was outstanding.  
Wifey had shrimp fajitas, also super delicious. 
The house margaritas are just right.  
Overall a must do when I'm Hinsdale.  
I'll be back for sure.
Very nice atmosphere and music selection. The regular margaritas were awesome and the food was delicious.

This is the second if not third time the girl on the phone taking our carryout order has blatantly ignored how we order our food. I specifically told her 3x I cannot have the guacamole in the same container as my food but it needs to be in a separate container because I am highly allergic to avocado!  The food arrives I check the meals and of course my meal has the guacamole sitting next to my entree in the same container not in the separate container as I ordered!  I can't eat it. I call Cine and instead of the girl who took my original order a guy answers the phone and he states they will send out a new meal right away. No compensation nothing. So I wait...my family eats their meal and 55 minutes later I'm still waiting for my dinner! I call again and this time the girl who took our order answers the phone...she admits she did not convey on the order the guacamole instructions. I asked where is my meal? I asked for the manager who comes on the phone and tells me it was out for delivery awhile ago. An hour and 15 minutes it took for me to get my carryout meal with no compensation. The girl taking the order has no respect for people ordering with food allergies. I'm done getting anything from this restaurant again. No respect for the customer and no idea how to do customer service!

Came on a date night with my husband. Decor was fun, decent atmosphere. Service was acceptable, not amazing.  Chips were flimsy and store-bought. Salsa was good.  We had the CiNe ceviche on the server's recommendation as an appetizer. We love ceviche. It was like a sweet milky shrimp and scallop soup. Tacos were terrible. Won't go back.

Sad to give them a bad review.  This place has good food.  But the service is so terrible, it ruins the experience.  They should consider training their staff on attentiveness, as well as timely service of food.  It doesn't matter what day or time of day we go, the service is consistently poor.  I don't have high standards in this area, so the fact that I would give a poor review on this front really says something.

Bad customer service. We called in an order for pick up at 6:15. The hostess took the order but forgot to notify the kitchen. When we arrived to pick up the food at 6:15, they realized that they didn't have anything and started cooking everything. I think it was the blonde hostess's fault because she had a lot of trouble taking the simple order on the phone and only solved the problem by eventually getting a manager. Will not be paying for Mexican food this expensive when it doesn't even come with good service and there are plenty of other options available. This would have been a one star review anyway, but they also forgot to put lettuce on all the tacos which we specifically asked for...
Although the food was delicious, it was very expensive. The quality of service was poor. We did not receive silverware or napkins until halfway through our meal.

The food and service here has gotten progressively better and better. The Ceviche trio is amazing and the vegetarian options are really really good from the burritos to the tacos. All the ingredients are fresh. Don't miss the table side home made guacamole and margarita.

Where to begin.......

Food was terrible. Service was even worse. I'm not even sure I can call it service when almost no one came by the entire 2 hours we were there. We hardly ever saw a single waiter even though I noticed maybe 10-15 of them existed while walking back to the restroom. Not quite sure what they're up to, but it's certainly not waiting on tables. Also the food somehow took about 20-30 minutes even though no one else was ordering and it should be fast to cook up tacos and a burrito bowl. My burrito bowl fell short of even chipotle, and at twice the price. How they feel they can charge a premium for the worst Mexican food ever I'll never know ($12 for a burrito bowl). They serve it up with a weird hostile attitude, to boot. 

You know that "the emperor's new clothes" story? I feel like the emperor right after he figures out he's naked. Got swindled fa sho. I WANT MY TIME AND MONEY BACK!!

Best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to. We went on a Saturday night and didn't have to wait, but it's best to make reservations if you want a nice booth. They have valet service as well. Free wifi if you ask server for password. Staff is very friendly and helpful to provide suggestions. 

Large menu- I ordered sangria to start which was very refreshing. We also got the spicy pomegranate margarita on the rocks which was delicious but definitely spicy. Would have been nice with mango or something to balance it. Table comes with homemade crispy chips and mild salsa. They can make guacamole at your table for $12. We ordered large side for $9 and it was fine but I like it mild. 
We got chicken fajitas and cine steak- both amazing. Flank steak had poblano crema and it had a warm pepper flavor but not to spicy. Both come with rice and beans. Fajitas came with lettuce, sour cream, and tomatoes but very small portion. 
For dessert you can get free churros for checking in! We also got the tres leches cake which is the best! Too small portion in my opinion but it was so soft and full of flavor.
Classy and modern ambience. Definite perfect date night if you're craving Mexican food.

CiNe! You've done it! We've been back several times in the past few months and received nothing less than great service, tasty cuisine, and bottomless chips and salsa. CiNe for the win - thanks for bringing out our daughter's meal/drink immediately, and for your friendly and fast responses to our dining needs. I recommend the three cheese enchiladas and chicken fajitas, mmmm. We'll return again soon, with friends!

A pretty good high end Mexican restaurant and I didn't really eat just had chips and drank. There is a nice side bar and the place looks great and food is great from what I hear. I still preferred this place though when it was a movie theatre and basically there are hundreds of these high end restaurants out there . The place seemed crowded on a cold Sunday so they must be doing something right in this competitive area.

Keeping this short:
Good food, haven't been disappointed yet 
Well-sized menu with plenty of variety.
Nicely decorated and clean restaurant, which is always appreciated.
Lastly, service is on the slow side, and has been on all occasions that I've been there, regardless of how busy they are.
Is it worth returning to? For me, yes.

Beautiful atmosphere but below average food. It might as well be Chipotle food served in a nicer setting. I've eaten here 3 or 4 times and twice they messed up my order. I am lactose intolerant and asked for no cheese or sour cream and they put it on... I won't go back because of this, it has happened more than once so I think the staff is just negligent.

FOOD POISONING
We are at CiNe on 2/6/16, a party of 4. 
3 out of 4 people started violently vomiting several hours after leaving the restaurant. They were sick for about 24 hours. 3 out of 4 people ate the ceviche trio. I called the restaurant & left a voicemail. No one returned my call. I called again on Tuesday. Spoke with the manager, Luis. Luis said he spoke to the chef who told him we couldn't have got sick from the ceviche because it's fresh & the seafood cooks in the citrus juice. Well then someone must not be washing their hands at CiNe. It doesn't take a genius to figure out if 3 out of 4 people get sick who dined at the same place & consumed the same food that might be the culprit. No apology, no accountability. We won't dine there again. We also won't dine at Il Polliggio or Nobuki since they are owned by the same people.
What is there not to like? Service is great. Food is wonderful. And the desserts were excellent. George was our server and he was very nice and helpful. My favorite restaurant in the area.

Our server Maria was amazing. She was extremely helpful and kind. Everything you'd want a server to be. The decor and ambience was perfect. It was a beautiful establishment.

Unfortunately, the food was not good at all. The group I was with had a carne asada, enchiladas de mole, crepas de tinga and combo #1 which included a tamal, taco, and enchilada.

The presentation of the food was nothing impressive and the flavor of all of these dishes was bland. The rice was tasteless, the flour tortillas used were not authentic to the Mexican dishes. Sadly, we didn't enjoy the food. So much so, that I didn't want to take any of my leftovers. 

Being Mexican and loving Mexican food, I guess I expected an authentic Mexican meal. Although this was not to my standards in sure others based on the reviews loved it. Just wanted to share an honest review from a person that enjoys Authentic Mexican food.
Great food and wonderful atmosphere.  Staff could be a little more attentive.  Will definitely keep coming back.

Although the restaurant decor was nice, the service and food could have been better. The service was pretty slow because they had an all-in-one person (waiter, host and bartender) serving five separate tables at the same time. To make up for the slowness, we did get complimentary chips and guac/salsa. That was a plus.

I ordered three steak tacos off the lunch menu for $10. Now, I understand lunch portions are small, but I didn't realize that lunch portion sizes applied to tacos too. I'm not kidding, but the tacos were the most expensive I've encountered and the smallest sizes I've ever seen. The tortilla was the size of a person's palm. Not only that, the steak was dry too.

I would pass on this one.
Excellent Mexican food.  We got the tacos: steak, chicken and shrimp.  They were to die for!!!  Loved their margaritas too!!

Food is fresh and the atmosphere is casual and enjoyable. I have a very restrictive diet so I had the salmon salad sans the dressing..it was very good. My family enjoys the chips, churros, and tacos as well.

I love this place!  The fire-roasted salsa is AMAZING!!  I just can't get enough of it!  We started with the seafood ceviche...great!  Moved on to the Skirt Steak tacos...so yummy!!  Love the chunks of cheese, the cilantro, the steak...it's all so delicious. 

Here's my recommendation to them...stop watering down the sangria. Your sangria is great...leave it alone. The last 2 times I've been in there, the sangria as been weak. 

Definitely would go back. Atmosphere is unique & inspiring.

Not horrible buuuut...

Cine is simply a forgettable experience. I first tried cine out after they had just opened. I have been a half dozen times since and used to be that they had really creative food and most importantly innovative cocktails. Now the food has become pretty typical tex mex fair with your typical -insert any fruit flavor- margarita menu. There's just nothing special. Combo plates? Is this cine or Panda Express?

Looking for a unique dining opportunity for my birthday, my companion and I chose CiNe (the name means what...?) as something new. Overall, it was worth the try.

We started with a trio of empanadas (pork, veggie and beef), which gladly the waiter identified because they looked identical. They were all tasty, if not terribly self-identifying. The pastry was flaky but not greasy. Ultimately I preferred the beef filling.The sprinkle of cheese offset it nicely.

We went on to the tacos; an order is four, and you can split it 2 and 2 if you want flavor-wise. I went for the pastor and carnitas, and he chose the pastor and veggie. 

I definitely preferred the pastor, with its pineapple tang and spicy hit from the jalapeno. The carnitas was a little too one-note, and made me wish that I hadn't chosen two pork options (not that it was bad). 

I had a bite of his veggie but wasn't thrilled with the potato croquette that forms the substantial base of the taco.

For dessert he had the special: a guava tamale, which he really liked; I had a bite, but since I do not care for tamales it just was not the dessert for me -- even with the guava it was too bland, and the grit of the cornmeal put me off. 
I enjoyed the tres leches cake I ordered, though it was not the best execution I had ever had. 

I had also chosen a margarita, which was very good -- light but with an enjoyable twang of citrus; oddly, it was only salted on one side? 

Service was swift and smooth -- so swift that we weren't done with our appetizers when the food arrived and they were trying to take the dish, which also happened at the end of the meal...the place wasn't full; what's the hurry?

At any rate, this was an enjoyable example of nouveau Mexican. It's a ways from me and I'm not sure I'd make the trek specially to visit, but if I was in the area I might go again.

I usually write longer more in-depth reviews but seriously, Cine is worth much of my time.

Cine took over the space that used to be the Hinsdale movie theater.  It would have been amazing clever had they made seating in what used to be the beautiful interior of the actual 1925 movie house.  Instead they only utilized the front/lobby portion of the building.  Decently decorated.

That said, beware of any restaurant that refuses to list their price online when you click on the menu tab.  Invariably that means $$$$.  Yes, they use elite tequilas, squeeze their own juices and make their own sour mix.  Good - fine.  It still doesn't justify $13-$18 for a four ounce drink.

Suffice it say that the food is - sincerely - just Mexican fare.  NOT expensive to make nor innovative in any way.  I've had much better - much cheaper.

Our bill for four people, two of whom had 2 margaritas each and we had one drink a piece was $225 before tip - and believe me, we really didn't eat a lot. Nothing extraordinary.

I was born in Hinsdale. We were a working class family surrounded by wealthy neighbors.  I really like my home town but just because there is preponderance of multi-million dollar homes doesn't mean the residents are stupid enough to pay for this mediocre fare.

They didn't get rich by wasting their money. Don't waste yours.

Try the chips and salsa.  

Personally I found the service below average, however it appears they need more staff and the waiter was doing his best with 10 tables.

I had the chicken fajitas ($16) and they were what you'd expect.  Next time I plan to try one of the specials, which looked good.

Overall we had a great time... The decor is unique and interesting.

This was second visit to CiNe. Server brought our drink order after we had finished our appetizers. 15-20 minute wait for a pitcher of Margaritas, two glasses of wine and a soda?!?!   Previous visit we ordered table side guacamole this time we ordered two orders of pre made stuff. Pre made was much less flavorful and half the portion size   Of the table side version. The queso fundido was good. The entrees were ok....we had a party of eight I ordered a combo with stuffed chicken breast and a chile relleno. Chile was barely warm , chicken was in small over cooked pieces. Meh.  Bleh. My wife's steak tampaquena was a better choice steak was pretty good but the chile was not made fresh either. The cheese was not even warm.   Bummer. My Mom had red snapper and was also disappointed. Server brought coffee after we were halfway through dessert. Helllloooo.....let's have the coffee before the dessert is delivered. Service was slow even with a lot of servers and not a full restaurant tonight either. 
Kinda of bummed I picked this restaurant for my Birthday dinner. My first visit was much better than this one.

I ordered the combo platter that included a taco, enchillada and tamale.  The chips, salsa and guac were all great.  The tamale and enchillada were just ok.  I enjoyed my strawberry margarita but not my $40 bill for one dinner and one drink!

I was between 3 and 4 stars...but went with 3 because they really should have their act together by now.  Let me start by saying the food is good, BUT for the prices they charge, it should be great. They have the look, feel, and location for an upscale restaurant, but the food is lacking.  Service is always slow here...and last night was no different.  I find myself choosing Cafe Salsa more and more when I want restaurant quality Mexican food. Also, it's really loud inside, the sound tends to bounce off the walls. The outside "alley" seating is charming and if the  weather cooperates is a better choice if you want to have a conversation with the people you are with.

This place certainly has potential: atmosphere fun and decorated so well; food was delicious (chips and salsa yummy, Cine salad light and flavorful, steak fajitas tender and satisfying, AND strawberry mocktail... I'm 9 months preggo... AWESOME). We had reservations and were seated around 15 mins late... ok, fine, it happens. But, on top of it, took at least 20 mins to get water and 25 or so to receive drinks. Things improved from there, and our waitress was clearly working to redeem the situation, so not sure if it's management or short staff that caused some initial issues. Overall, I'd say worth going to and if they can get things flowing better it would be 5 stars.

Having lived in Hinsdale for years, I have a good idea of what the downtown Hinsdale dinner spots typically have to offer. Most of the restaurants are simply overpriced with uninspired, poor quality food. They exist to be trendy, and have no substance beyond that.

CiNe is a welcome change. The food is absolutely delicious, the service warm and attentive, and the menu full of interesting dishes to explore. I try something new each visit, and I'm never disappointed. Jorge is super energetic and friendly. The desserts are great. Try any of the tacos, the mole chicken, or the CiNe margarita.

If you're in the southwest suburbs and looking for slightly upscale, satisfying Mexican food, check it out.

Terrible place. We left after waiting 45 minutes to get the wrong drinks. We asked if we could get a server and when they came, they brought us chips and salsa and never came back. Our appetizers never came. On our way out we saw the manager who was dodging other unhappy customers and he was brushing them off saying it was Valentine's Day and offered no apologies. Thank u but no thank you. Plenty of other places to go to Valentine's Day or not.

Our favorite was the trio of ceviche & virgin mojito.   I loved the salmon ceviche.  The fish tacos had delicious batter & Combo #2 was generously portioned and yummy.

I look forward to eating there again.  I had a realy hard time choosing what to order.  All prices seemed right on to me. 

Our service was perfect & the atmosphere is the icing on the cake.  We loved the outdoor seating.

Great spot for a Saturday lunch.  Sat outside and enjoyed the all you can eat taco special.  Our favorites were the chicken, pastor, vegetarian, and fish.  Margaritas were good... Spicy pomegranate had a nice kick to it.

I just had dinner at Cine tonight with two friends.  I would have rated it higher if it had not been for the unprofessional things they did at the end of our meal.
The food was good.  Guac was great, prickly pear margarita was amazing and the entrees were good.  We also thought our waitress did a good job.
They only problem was that a little before 9:00pm they turned off the music and started their obvious routine of closing up.  The website states that they are open until 10:00.  Not sure why they were in such a hurry to get rid of us but they got rid of alright...maybe for good.

My husband and I dine here often and the food is always fresh and the flavors are amazing!  I typically order the salmon in a mole sauce and my husband usually has a steak.  Both are always bursting with outstanding flavors!  The margarita selection always makes it fun try something new. The mango margarita is a nice tasty treat but only offered in the warmer months.  Great creative chef and always one of our favorite places to dine.

Went to CiNe a couple days ago with my girlfriends,  and must say we came out satisfied.  Loved the outside architecture of the place.

We were greeted by the hostess and promptly taken to our seats. The waiter was super friendly and even gave us suggestions on what was his favorite dish on the menu. 

We ate guac chips and salsa and the guacamole was great. Perfect amount of flavor. We also ordered the Aguachile ceviche along with the Tinga Tostaditas.  The only complaint I have with those is, "I want more!" :) 

For entrees we just shared the tacos. They were good I just wish they would be a bit warmer when brought out. 

For dessert we had the vanilla flan,  chocolate taco, and tres leches cake. The first two were magnificent, the Tres leches cake was too dry so we had to send it back :/

All in all, it's an adorable place to catch dinner with the girls or come on a date with. Can't wait to go back!

Nice decor, beautiful dishes, and tasty food. I'm a bit of a Mexican food snob and it didn't quite fulfill my needs, but it was a lovely lunch with good staff and an attentive waitress. I would go again.

Dreadful place.  Lukewarm, so-so food, served in mouse's portions for $$$$$.  Four people, eating minuscule food, soft drinks only, and the bill was over $200.00 - ?!  Left the place starving - went to Burger King on the way home.
Blown away by our chile rellenos and tacos!! Yum yum yum. Will be back! I wish I could rate it more stars.
Delicious food, sangria was the best I have ever tried!  Beautiful decor and friendly staff! Will return.

I'm giving Cine a .5 for service and a 4 for food. Overall experience evens out to a 2 somehow...

Pros: I really enjoyed the pineapple margarita which was sweet yet smokey from the mezcal in it. The chicken enchiladas with salsa verde were also very good. 

Cons: We sat at the bar and service was insanely slow despite the fact that the restaurant was only about 15% full. We had to ask for our chips and guac (count 'em) 5 TIMES. When they still didn't arrive before our entree we had to go back to the hostess stand and ask her to get them for us. We were also not given utensils and had to find the server stand and get them ourselves. Did I mention I got the wrong order? They were able to correct it in about 5 minutes but still worth noting. 

If I lived closer I might go back and give table service a try, but wouldn't recommend it to friends.

CiNe.  Wondering about that name?  Well just take a look around if your Spanish is not up to snuff.  CiNe is for cinema- perfectly apropos given the location of the newest addition to the Hinsdale eating scene is located in the old historic theater.

Enter on 1st street (plenty of street parking or there is a lot across the street or in behind) under the old marquee area.  Inside- you may be surprised, as I was, as to how large the space is.  A bar runs the length of the front room on the right hand side with plenty of high tops on the left.  And as you proceed toward the back the eating areas get more intimate and there is even a "party room" in the back that will seat 50 of your closest friends for dinner or 70 standing for a cocktail party.

But back to the real star- the food!  We ordered a wide range of the menu as is normally the case when I check out a new place.  Our server, Diana, was just a delight!  It was kind of like being waited on by a new friend as she was quick with suggestions of her favorites, showed us proudly around the space and even shared some personal stories that had us laughing at the table!  Nicely done!

We started with the salsa and guacamole.  The quac was delicious with big chunks of avocado and a creamy texture that had us both reaching for more chips.

As for entrees- we tried three of them- the enchiladas, which were lighter than expected as they were done with a crepe base, the steak, plated with avocado creme, onions and some tortilla chips and the chille rellano- which was stuffed with cheese and served in a wonderful sauce.  Both were served with a small side of rice, peas and carrots which had the creamy consistency of a risotto.

And for dessert- the churros were a great sweet choice- with the chocolate dipping sauce the perfect complement.

And before I end- just a minute on the drinks.  They have a cocktail list so I ordered one of their signature margaritas.  This was a great choice as it was light (almost fizzy)- I kept looking at the list to see if they put carbonated something in it but that was not the case.  Just a premium tequila that I really liked!

CiNe is owned by the same people who brought Nabuki and Il Poggiolo to Hinsdale which is great.  Hinsdale has been devoid of decent restaurants for many years but now there are reasons to "eat local".

Dinner for two with drinks ran about $100 which is probably more than you might expect to pay for Mexican but you can't go into CiNe thinking cheap tacos and burritos.  Rather- think of it as a nice evening out with upscale Mexican food served by some of the nicest servers around!

I have been to Cine twice now and both times the food was pretty good but the service was extremely slow.  Last night we were there and the restaurant was half empty.  It took quite a long time to get our drinks and we had to flag down our waiter a couple of times. The food is good,but not good enough to make up for the service.  Maybe I will be back in the summer to sit on the patio

On a brutally cold Friday, the three of us decided to stick close to home to grab dinner in town.  Shockingly, the other restaurants - Nabuki and Il Poggiolo - were full to the rafters but this place was only 30% full.

Hostess seated us, and waitress arrived quickly for drinks.  All looking good.

We ordered nothing special - two orders of Habenaro Soup and one order of Trio of Empanadas, which were very nice.  Guacamole as an extra to our chips was about a half cup, but really overpriced at $8.

I ordered the Alambre or Hanger Steak - it was tough, over cooked, and really nothing special at all.  It came with a side of cold onions, peppers, and a few bits of bacon.  This long boat-like stick of burned cheese held a table spoon each of pico de gallo, pureed avacodo, and barely warm black beans.

One of our party ordered the Enchiladas, shredded chicken a pair of interesting sauces and a side of creamy rice.

Unfortunately, our third party has a fish special over spinach what a sauce that fortunately was not my choice -- a taste of her dinner almost ruined mine.

No dessert, and two drinks each, and we ended up spending over $70 per person.  Now I know why the other customers are voting with their feet -- this is WAY over priced -- and no where near good enough to meet the price.

If cost is no object: it's not crowded, very pretty abiance, very loud, and acceptable wait staff.  However, I will not be returning anytime soon.  Aguamiel in Clarendon Hills will be getting my business.

It's great to have a Mexican option back in Hinsdale and I dined here with the family to celebrate my birthday.  This is upscale Mexican so don't come in thinking its Uncle Julio's. CiNe's interior is beautiful. And the bar is expansive. Several televisions also make it an ideal spot to watch a game.  We started with the house margaritas. Excellent, except too much ice. Chips and salsa came with the drinks.  The salsa is made daily and was spicy!  Loved it. Can't say the same for the guacamole.  At $8, the portion was small and tasted like something you could buy at Jewel--a disappointment. I had the chicken enchiladas which came in a cream like sauce. They were good, but again the portion was small for $18.  Dessert was very tasty. Children's menu available, but it would have been nice if it included tacos. Service (Lauren) was excellent, especially since we were there the first week.  

Overall, better than good. Just wish the portions were a bit bigger for the Hinsdale prices.  I shouldn't have to fill up on chips to feel satisfied. I will be back.

Great Service! Stephanie was attentive and friendly, I came with 3 kids and she did everything needed to make the trip great for all! Food was fresh and fabulous and the Margarita could not have been fresher! I will be back soon, especially for their $5 CiNe Margaritas on Weds!

I have been to Cine multiple times, and it never fails to impress!  the guac--wow. It has an a delectable traditional "guac" taste; however, it incorporates an original myriad of flavors with the tomatoes and spices that are integrated. Additionally, the main course (fish tacos) raise the bar for the other fish tacos of hinsdale. This is the place to be, you won't regret it!

We like the food and atmosphere here very much.  But on our latest visit two items, the tostadas and the side of beans had one price on the menu, but then rung up for a higher price when we received our bill.  At worst that means every guest who does not notice is being over charged.  The manager corrected our bill but only after a lengthy wait.  My advice: check your bill carefully.

Our server was the best and the food was delicious.  Fresh guacamole made table side, delicious ceviche and steak and shrimp fajitas.  They have tv's upfront so you can watch the game, too.  We'll definitely be back soon!

Great tacos with a good variety and a solid Margarita (all natural none of that syrup).  I think of this place as a little bit "modern Mexican-American".  Don't come in looking for a huge plate of cheesy nachos or a honking burrito.  The portions are good and the food has fresh, poppin flavors.  Overall, a solid place for dinner or lunch.

Wow!  I love all sorts of Mexican and Latin food and this place is one of my new favorite restaurants. Can't wait to return with our kids - kids menu looked great. We went with another couple and had some apps and then some tacos. Guac was great. Tempura fried goat cheese was very tasty - but should come with a couple more pieces of bread for dipping. Ceviche was just so-so, mostly veg, not much fish, and the little jar it came in kept tipping over. Tacos were excellent. Al pastor was our fave but chicken and carnitas were also great. The whole menu looked amazing, can't wait to go back and try more. Drinks were very tasty too!  Oh and our server was awesome, recommended her favorites and the most popular items. Downtown quality fancy Mexican food, in the 'burbs!  I am in love!

CiNe is fun and and has a fresh twist on Mexican dishes. The shrimp ceviche was delicious. The chicken  tostadas were a little spicing but very good. I enjoyed the fried guacamole and the dipping sauce. Service was good and the bartenders were very attentive. I would definitely go back.  I liked seeing the outdoor cafe on the side.  Wish it was warmer out to sit outside. Well worth trying out. White sangria was very good, lots of fruit.

I'm in LOVE with CiNe restaurant.  CiNe has the perfect food & the flavor is AMAZING. Let me talk about the drinks they are on point my #1 favorite drink is Avion & Patron Roca Margarita. I been to many other restaurants and there is no mexican restaurant just like CiNe. The servers are great and very knowledgeable & also the hostess .  THANKS SO MUCH CiNe for the great experience in your restaurant you guys are the BEST!

I am really happy that I chose to eat here before reading the yelp reviews!  I met a friend (both of us just relocated here from San Diego, so we've eaten a lot of tacos!) in the area and we decided to eat here after walking past a few times.  It was absolutely delicious!  I had the fried fish taco, a carnitas taco, and a steak taco.  Each one was better than the one before.  I will be back!

Spur of the moment, we decided to go to Cine' on Valentine's Day. It was a terrific choice! We started with margaritas, my wife getting a classic one and mine was spicy tamarind . It was delicious! We followed with ceviche and then for dinner she had a scrimp dish and I had carne assada. Both were very good. I especially liked the mole sauce served as part of the carne assada. Also, our waiter did an excellent job explaining the contents of the each dinner and was very attentive throughout our meal.

My wife and I just had their fixed price meal for two - margaritas, appetizer, entree, and desert - and every course was fantastic. Margaritas were smooth and actually unique for a house drink. The quesadillas, steak, red snapper, tres leche cake and apple pastry for dessert were all deliciously fresh, unique in ingredients and sauces, and were some of the best Mexican food we've ever had. They have a huge menu of food and drinks. The service from Jennifer our server was very attentive and she was very helpful making recommendations. Restaurant is in the heart of downtown Hinsdale with plenty of parking. It looks on the outside like an old movie theater that has been beautifully decorated inside - booths and tables, unusual photographs on the painted brick walls - just an overall soothing atmosphere.
We plan on definitely going back.

Coming from Oklahoma its always good to find a restaurant that makes good tex-mex and authentic Mexican food. The ambiance is casual, and they have a great outdoor area. Compared to some of the other Mexican restaurants in the area they are pricier, but with that price comes better food.

What a disappointment, $14 for 3 tacos that were small, not how I ordered and the meat was dry and flavorless.  We also ordered quesadilla's and we each had one bite and quit.  Too many great Mexican restaurant's in the area for this place to last.  I very rarely give 1 star but that's all I could give to Cine.

Not a great experience. Went at 430pm when it was empty on a Saturday. Took 15 minutes to get drinks. When asked if we wanted guac and said no thank you the waiter still brought it out told him we didn't order it so he took it back. Asked for no beans extra rice couldn't get that one right. Used a coupon for free churro and asked for check, got charged for churro had to get taken off. Overpriced and below average food.

CiNe has excellent service, well-trained servers who understand the Mexican cuisine. The food is good and the variety of tequillas cannot be matched. We did not have a reservation but we were seated promptly without waiting. I love the fresh made-to-order guacamole. Overall, a very good place.

Went here with my daughter (8)... Had nachos and she had a Mac and Cheese... she loved it... Nachos were good...

I ordered a burrito (no meat). They left out the beans too, so it was tomato, green peppers, loads of jalapenos, lettuce and goat cheese... it was really hot and quite honestly rather awful... They brought me a side of black beans to ease the pain... goat cheese in a burrito is not a good idea either... got the distinct impression that they try to be cool/inventive but the result is another suburban culinary disappointment... the margarita was tiny and mostly ice...  the city spoils us...

However, the place was nice inside, good atmosphere, great service... and my daughter liked it...

I made my choice of this place to celebrate "Dia de los Muertos", (Halloween), my first time here, was a little skeptic when I started reading the menu, but when me and my wife started eating ; WOW, everything was delicious, the waitress was so very friendly taking her time to explain the way it was cooked and the ingredients used, after ward we moved to the bar where we met the bartender, let me explain, this young man was not the typical College part timer, this was a real bartender, more of a Mixologist than a bartender,so very knowledgeable of his profession and all the time enjoying a delicious "Pumpkin Margarita" , a creation of his very own.
It is worth to mention the decoration of this place, very nice and not the typical loud colors associated with Mexican Restaurants, this place is very elegant , yet discreet.

              Highly recommend it.

                              Oscar 
                               From Palos Hills.

This is by far one of the best Mexican restaurants I've ever been to, very different from any other one. All of the details in the elegant and cozy decor, ambience, and service are incredible. Cine has a very good feel about it and very fun. It is a good blend of old world Mexico and new world restaurant service. The flavors and combinations are unlike any other using regional ingredients paired with French techniques offering a fantastic array of tastes...

CiNe is a mecca for foodies and lovers of Mexican cuisine.  does not disappoint! 

Bravo !!!

My husband and I live in the neighborhood and we finally stopped by Cine yesterday to have a drink and some apps before dinner. We had a really lovely experience and would come back...especially with friends/family who need convincing that there are worthwhile restaurants in the suburbs. 

The outdoor patio is very quaint.  The empanadas were really skillfully put together with lots of delicate flavors and textures. And my margarita was likely one of the best I've ever had...fragrant, perfectly chilled, with a really delicious orange flavor. It probably could have used a bit more tequila but it did not get in the way of how much I enjoyed it.

I was excited to try Yanni's food, after dining at Sabor Saveur.  I have some problems with it....The watermelon cocktail brought me back to my days spent in Mexico. so bravo.  
The menu was so tempting, I ordered the Chili Relleno and have to say, the filling has to much of a gritting mouth feel to go with the el dante poblano pepper, and no flavor so just texture...which was awful, a disappointment. The sauce exceptional. would not order again this recipe needs to be reworked.  I also was disappointed with the rice served with the dish, not sure which ingredient in the rice was in the refrigerator too long, but it had a strong taste of "refrigerator bite"
My fiance ordered the pork enchiladas, the flavors were exceptional in this dish, but the shredded pork was extremely dry. 
Hope the chef takes this to heart...because the space is delightful and will not take much to reach perfection!

I dined here with my husband and in-law's.  All four of us enjoyed our experience.  We are all fans of Il Poggiolo, so we were eager to try CiNe. 

I tried the CiNe margarita, which was wonderful, and my husband had the Prickly Pink, which was different, but very good as well.  We started with the guacamole and empanada trio--both good.  I ordered the chile relleno for my entree, and I have no complaints.  However, I will say that the best description that I can come up with for everything is that it was "good"...not much else to say.  My husband and father-in-law both ordered desserts, and both were decidedly unimpressed by them.  No complaints on the service nor atmosphere, but it was incredibly dark where we were sitting.  My husband had to whip out his phone to light our menus. 

I am glad that we gave it a try, but I would not go out of my way to dine here again.

First of all, there are a bunch of bad reviews for Cine by people who have only reviewed 1 thing on Yelp ever. That is a sure sign that someone is posting bogus reviews. Maybe they don't like the owner, maybe they own a competing restaurant, but these are not real reviews. I find that very annoying because it is a great addition to downtown Hinsdale and I would like to see them do well.

I thought Cine's food was excellent and the atmosphere/ decor is really cool. I had the steak tacos which were perfect. The guac was decent and the margaritas were excellent. I do agree that the portions were a little light (especially the drink size which was like 3 sips) but that was the only negative. I'll definitely come back to Cine.

It's a great place for a night out in the suburbs. The food, the drinks, the atmosphere, and the staff are great!
A couple of things to remember about Ciné:
1. Try one of their margaritas. Pineapple or spicy pomegranate are unique and taste great. 
2. The ceviches... Yum! Probably one of the best apps there. And with the latest menu updates, you have a possibility of trying all the different varieties the restaurant offers. 
3. The enchiladas or filet mignon (even though the restaurant offers Latino cuisine) are just fabulous.. I remember the first impression about the enchiladas (wrapped in crapes instead of tortillas).. You just have to try it. 
4. Keep some room for dessert. 
5. The staff there knows a lot about their menu. Ask them questions. And don't forget to learn some more about tequila and actually fall in love with the liquor. Ciné has one of the biggest selections of tequilas I've ever seen.

Outstanding Mexican with French inspiration!

While the ambiance was warm and inviting, the service was how this place first won us over.  Our waiter, Steve, introduced himself with warm enthusiasm (but not over-the-top or overbearing)!  After explaining that the chef of Cine is "Mexican but went to school in France", we received several excellent French-inspired Mexican recommendations, of which we enjoyed:

Nachos: Truffle oil turns some people off (not us!) but this was a *huge hit* with a black bean puree, mild crumbled cheese, and an avocado mousse.  The best and like nothing else we've had!  Plus we wouldn't have tried it without a recommendation, and I highly recommend it myself!

Enchiladas: Instead of traditional tortillas, the enchiladas come wrapped in crepes and topped with bit of sauce over the top (not drowning like the usual sort).  They had a bit of sweetness, but the savory filling and sauce brought them right back into a perfect balance.  Even better, they come with a  "side of creamy Mexican rice", but it's more of a rich risotto lightly but warmly spiced.

Margarita Parfait: This we were told was a "special" dessert that was the first of its kind at the restaurant, with layers of a creamy margarita-flavored puree, lime gelatin, mint, and a light ponzu sauce at the bottom.  This is one of the few desserts that is without chocolate that I find acceptable, which is saying something!

Overall, a visit to this unique restaurant is an excellent experience you won't want to pass up!

We chose to dine in the lounge area that seemed to be a little more upbeat to celebrate my birthday. The place was packed which is always a good sign to me. Our server, Mariam, was fabulous. 

The thing I love about Cine is the all over the board types of food you can get from traditional to modern, but very unique at least in the ones we tried.  Our table of four all tried different things and everyone were big fans. We all shared a bit, but my personal favorites were the veggie tacos, the guacamole, and the churros y chocolate. The chocolate used for the churros is outstanding.

.

The food here isn't good. I wish it was but it is just so bland. We went last night and nothing I ate had any flavor.  I had the Combo #1 (very bland) and the Lobster Croquettes (couldn't find or taste any lobster). My wife had three tacos and only ate one. I tried her other two and they were very blah. This was our second time here. I will give it one more chance.

I'll keep this review short and sweet. I went to CiNe with a small group from work for our Christmas party.  Everyone raved about the hand shaken margaritas, though I went with the CiNe cider.  Multiple appetizers were ordered so we could try a little bit of everything and when our dinner orders came out we all tried a little bit of everyone's food. Not one person had a complaint about the apps or entrees! Everything was delicious.  The desserts were good as well, though not the stars. A few people mentioned that they thought the tres leches was a bit dry, though another said theirs was not.   Our server, Jennifer (I believe), was very helpful and knowledgeable about the food being offered and very attentive when needed. The decor and atmosphere was great as well. If I lived closer I would definitely be back.

I came to CiNe today for lunch with a friend. We had the quesadilla appetizer which was great. Then we had steak tacos which were wonderful! the margaritas are GREAT! we waited about 10 minutes for service when we were seated, otherwise CiNe would get 5 stars.

My husband and I went to CiNe for the first time on Valentine's Day. We walked in and was pleasantly surprised by the friendly atmosphere and colorful decor. It's a place you can go with girlfriends, your spouse or with the family, young kids included. 
The food was beautifully presented. I had the chicken fajitas and my husband had the hanger steak. Both were delicious. We enjoyed the house margaritas and a chocolate martini for dessert. Both very fresh.
The service was outstanding.
We plan on going back again soon.

Great atmosphere, but little else for the price.  Went early on a Saturday night and it wasn't crowded.  Service was slow and you had to flag down the waiter for any service after the order was initially taken.  As to the drinks, the margaritas were good but of little volume due to the large amount of ice in the glass.

The guacamole was bland and the portion delivered tiny (about the size of golf ball) for the price.  My enchilada dinner at almost $18 was shockingly small, each of the 3 about the size of a small cigar.  Here too not even a hint of spice (Stouffer's frozen enchiladas are better).  

One of my table mates ordered fish tacos without cheese only to have the tacos delivered covered in cheese.

My companions shared the same complaints of size, flavor and price.  1 star
The atmosphere and food were great! Our service was amazing! Would definitely return.

Went to Cine for lunch on saturday for the very first time. I was very impressed with the house margaritas. Me and a friend ordered the pescado and pastor tacos which were amazing. For dessert we had churros "cine style" and they were so sweet and delicious. The service was great, 5 stars.  Thank you cine, we will be back!

One of the best experiences my father had here, when we brought him to the restaurant for dinner during his visit to Chicago in September.

Their salsa is to die for. Presentation gets 6 stars and the ambiance gets 7! I would recommend dining in their patio if the weather is nice. We were lucky to get cosy weather the night we dined.

I ordered their Cine salad. It was fresh, tasty and presented very well. Nice kids menu too. Our daughter did the chicken nuggets and fries. The manager personally came to greet us and make sure if everything was good. 

Awesome hospitality!

Not sure what is with all the bad reviews.  This is a good place to go to in the suburbs (where there is a lack of Mexican restaurants) with family (even kids) and friends. Sure this restaurant is not Frontera Grill, but it's still serves up some good quality and creative Mexican food.  Surprisingly, it is not an uptight place considering it's in the heart of the uptight town of Hinsdale.  The atmosphere is fun, colorful, and casual.  Great Mexican music playing.

The food was fresh.  Tacos--can't really go wrong with those--were flavorful.  I got the fish tacos and a friend got the skirt steak.  The skirt steak was tender, and not leathery as it usually is.  It had a good flavor and was marinaded well.  I actually enjoyed the guacamole and thought it was very fresh and simple.

Service was friendly and excellent.  Would definitely go back and glad to see a non-uptight place in this neighborhood.

Dinner tonight at Cine was exceptional once again. Try it--you won't be disappointed. Great food and service and upscale ambiance.  5 stars for every dish we had tonight --Chicken tortilla soup, Carne Asada w/ creamy cilantro rice and asparagus w/ fabulous Colorado mole sauce, and delicious taco combo-- chicken tinga, pescada/ fish and carnitas!!  ( other choices as well)
Beautiful atmosphere, great service, delicious food! All you need.

It took a long time to get our food and it was cold.  The waitress was unfriendly and could not be found. That is u til another waitress who brought us water and we gave her the tip!  and then she miraculously showed up

Ordered a rare filet got it Med returned it got it cold all the way through but a good piece of meat so I had a good blue steak.
Waitress was nice manager was fairly rude when I told him the steak was over cooked so I guess he was the one who told them to serve it cold.

Had this for lunch today. Food was great and the service was great even though they were short staffed. Hubby ordered a prime rib by mistake instead of a rib eye and our server Katrina was so kind to swap it out for him. 

The glazed carrots are good with a hint of cinnamon, but they didn't seem glazed. Still tasty but would have loved to seen more glazing.

The grilled chicken with artichoke, mushroom and tomatoes was a tad salty but still delicious in the herb wine sauce ad the mash potatoes never dissapoint.

Things started out bad when they were out of bread at 4 pm on a Sunday afternoon. This whole experience could of been avoided if they would have told us this before we ordered and received our drinks. I ordered an appetizer to make up for the lack of bread and the chilly cheese fries came out with very little chili or cheese and the fries on one side were burnt black. I then made the mistake of ordering prime rib and whatever I received was definitely not prime rib. It was a well done cut of mystery steak served with the normal prime rib sides. When I pointed this out the waitress immediately grabbed my plate and said she would return with another one in a manner that made me suspect she anticipated my reaction. What was then brought to me was something resembling rib but in looks only. It was a tough and tasteless excuse that even a chain restaurant should be ashamed of. I've had much better luck at the location in orland park the several times I've been there and was deeply disappointed with the whole experience.

Time is not on their side!
Food was good but SLOW!!!!!
Forgot their slowness and ventured on in when too hungry!!! It took about an hour to get fed.
Anna's Grilled Salmon Salad had an over-grilled crust on it and the management and waitstaff though asking if everything was ok, managed to ask when our mouths were full and left before we could gather an honest complaint!
My aunt Betty rest her soul liked this place, but I still can't understand why!
We'll probably be back, but I won't know why then either! Only if someone wants us to go here.

Saturday night and the place is packed.  Food was good, but the Rita was watered down.  It was supposed to have Patron Silver, and I can usually tell unless there's too little Patron.  Service was excellent.

All I can say is do not order the filet. That cut must be on the chefs "how do I cook this piece of meat" chart. I don't like to insult chefs but if you don't know how to cook a steak, why are you working at a steakhouse? I learned my lesson. If you want good steak, just do it yourself. Noted.
The drinks were very good. Perfect amount of alcohol. 
The service was good and our server was very attentive to our needs. 
Might be a while before I go back here.

We love coming to Longhorn the food is normally really good and service has its ups n downs. 

Tonight it was especially ruff!

We arrived at 8:40pm, after the dinner rush. We were told 10-15 minutes unless we wanted to eat at the bar, I prefer a table so we waited. There were 3 couples ahead of us and in the dining room there was around 10 tables open and I counted at least 8 servers on the floor. No biggie we'll wait... they start seating 1 couple at a time about every 5 min or so. A couple walks in and said they called ahead and 1 of the hostesses says it'll be 15- 20 min he gets upset and she says we don't do reservations but you are on a wait list and then proceeds to tell him he's late anyway for the time he called in for... uhm.. customer service much? 

We finally get seated in the bar at a table. Server comes and asks for our drink order, water with lemon for him and a unsweetened tea with lemon for me. She brings me idk what flavor tea it was I could see syrup swirling in my glass, look around she's no where to be found, 2nd hostess sees me looking and gladly takes it to switch it for me meanwhile server is back with bread, no small plates doesn't notice my drink is gone. 

We place our order... stuffed mushrooms. French onion soup for him wedge salad for me and ask her if prime rib is still available, she says yes so we both go for prime rib with baked potatoes. 

We get our mushrooms and they're awesome as usual, then our soup and salad comes... French onion soup tasted like it was loaded with sugar and the wedge salad was literally 5 leafs of romaine lettuce with the regular toppings, put it to you this way... there was more toppings than lettuce! 
As we are almost done with these the server shows up with a menu and says the manager just gave out the last piece of prime rib and we need to choose something else (at this point she is standing in front of my ice tea that has 1 sip left)...  did we not ask if it was available and she said yes... she didn't check just assumed... so now as our food should be coming out we have to choose something else. Fine, 2 rib eyes instead. My husband looks at me in complete disgust and says he's ready to walk out and go eat Taco Bell! 

So those come out and the plates looked so sad a hunk of meat and a potato. Where's the fresh veggies? I didn't bother asking. At this point my ice tea has been empty for 10 minutes and she finally comes and refills it. 

My husband took at few bites and asked for a box just from the disgust of the whole situation he's lost his appetite.  So I take a few more bites ask for a box and the check. Meanwhile I look and see a bunch of people waiting to be seated and I look thru the restaurant and it's over half empty tables. 

Get the check and see she put the soup and salad as our 2nd sides, we didn't ask for that to be done, we like our veggies! 

My husband said no tip and I being a former server and bartender can't do that, I know people live on their tips. So she got a tip but not a normal tip that we would leave. 

Side note: my husband had gone outside for a cigarette before the meal arrived and a employee just got off work and sat down on the bench next to the door took his shoes, socks and shirt off and was sitting there. 

So disappointed I don't believe we will be back at all. The 2 stars are for the mushrooms and the 2nd hostess noticing my issue with my tea.

Okay, so, confession time...  I'm really not a steak guy.  Yeah yeah, rain down the boos.  Steak just isn't my thing.  Despite that, there's always something good for me to order at LongHorn steakhouses, so I don't mind going with when any of my pals are in the mood for a big ol' hunk of beef.  The Bolingbrook location is no different - good service, clean restaurant, and really good grilled chicken.  It's probably never gonna be my first choice, when picking out a restaurant (though, honestly, I'm never the one picking out where a group of us eat, since I'll eat anything)...  But I also never walk away hungry or disappointed when I hit LongHorn.
The steaks are consistently good and at a reasonable price. The service is good . I think that it is one of the better chains along with The Texas Roadhouse.

Wow it had been a while but things have changed so much!! Got the dinner for 2 and while they at one point used to make the steak sauce table side we had to ask for it and it was served in a bowl hazardly nothing impressive the state used to come out on a beautiful plate with roasted garlic and it was just put on a regular steak with a couple sides of garlic cloves kind of disappointing makes me rethink my hundred dollar meal

This was my second time at this steakhouse and this time maybe because of being a holiday was not the best. I say if we are spending over $100 for a meal and $20 tip I expect to not be in a chili's atmosphere. It was so loud fired up my sound meter app and it went to 60-65 db. For $100 we were shuffled into the bar section sitting on 4 foot high bar type stools.  All I can say is NOT going back.

Culver's - Better Burgers!!!

Wow on the low end their Burgers started at  $ 11 and high end I think $ 15.   I got the basic burger since I though that was expensive enough for a burger.      I've never seen a sadder & more boring looking burger brought to my table in a real restaurant.     Not quite that busy at lunch when we stopped Sunday at noon.   However the cook or someone managed to make the burger selection even worse by forgetting to add my Cheddar I'd requested.    Bun looks like something you could get from Aldi's.       No condiments (ketchup, mustard) were brought to the table, had to wait & request both with different individuals (neither of which were our waitress think her name was Tiffany.     The boyfriend had the Parmesan topped chicken and I had a bite of that and that was decent, and it should be for $ 16.    DO NOT ORDER THEIR BURGER IT'S A WASTE OF CALORIES & MONEY!!!1
A f*** Manager Stef insisted on this is medium. Go back to school and learn what is prime rib is. I'm gonna send these pictures to their company.

A very confused, yet very busy Longhorn.

We love Longhorn, but this one certainly disappoints. Very limited bar with no bar tender in sight. I still don't know who mixed our drinks, but they were poorly done.

The wait staff really needs training.

My Strip Sirloin was thin, grey, and past medium rare by quite a bit. The bill for three was very confusing in the way the waiter allocated the ordered items. I'm still not sure what we were billed for, but I do believe that it's correct.
Staff was super nice; food was good. I only sampled small items so I have to go back but I plan on doing so.

I have eaten at Longhorn Steakhouse quite a few times and have never had a bad experience.  Last night was not a bad experience, just have a couple comments.  I ordered the 7 Pepper Steak salad, without bleu cheese.  Got the salad with bleu cheese, and no dressing.  Even though I did not say I no dressing.  I figured I could scrape off the bleu cheese, which I did.   I mentioned this to the waiter, who didn't offer much of a comment.   I then ordered a second beer, Blue Moon.  The waiter brought me the beer, which did not taste (to me) like Blue Moon.  So he took it back, and tried again.  The second one also tasted weird, so I said forget it.  No offer of free dessert or something else to make up for these small issues.  Last comment, I ordered the side of grilled corn.  For $4.79, I got ONE piece of grilled corn that was not all that great-kind of soggy.
Just a decent place to eat; good service, good food and good atmosphere.

Decent chain steak joint. 
I eat here often when I want a good basic steak (think Outback or Roadhouse). It's close to home and I have not been disappointed. 

During my recent visit, the service was pleasant and well timed. The server recommended the Primetime burger to my son. It's a shaved prime rib, with mushroom and swiss. He absolutely loved it! I had a taste of the garlic parmesan fries served with it and they were also delicious.

My goto is the 20oz Porterhouse with a baked potato. Standard char fired faire. The salad and sides were pretty basic. Not bad, just nothing to write home about. The steak here is always cooked as ordered. I have never had it overlooked and that's a big plus+. 

Good food, good price. I'll eat here again.

I really enjoyed taste and the quality of the food! (Plus a star) The servers were very nice, and there wasn't a single issue.
