(Plus a star) The environment was very clean and classy for a steakhouse. (Plus a star) The food came to our table in a decent amount of time and our server checked on us every 5-10 minutes. (Plus a star) The sad thing is the amount of food you get it a little less than Texas Road house and the prices to me seemed a little higher, to me. (Minus half a star) For a "classier" place than Outback and Texas Roadhouse I was a little disappointed  in the amount of food for the price they charged but I guess it makes a little sense. 

Overall: 4.5 stars/5 stars
Quality of food: Excellent 
Customer Service: Excellent
Environment: Excellent
Wait Time: Excellent
Price over Quality: Okay/Alright

We had dinner here tonight and everything was great. Yolanda was our server and she couldn't have been more friendly and accomodating. Our food was delivered fast and was really good! We will most definitely be back.

Good place, decent prices and over all good food. The outlaw Ribeye is my favorite there along with the wedge salad. The break they bring out is always frozen in the middle and so is the butter. Staff is good and friendly.

After I attended the Elite event, my parents wanted to try Longhorn. We decided to dine early Sunday afternoon and use my $5.00 gift card. 

Overall, I think we had a solid 3.5 star experience. When we walked up to the hostess stand, there was no one there and we waited a while. A girl finally came to seat us and had to grab silverware and napkins for our table. The staff seemed unprepared. 

However, our waitress was friendly. She was prompt with the orders too. I decided to order a Blue Moon, and it came with a lime. I like Blue Moon for its refreshing citrus taste. Hot, crusty bread was also served, and my guests raved about it. 

Since I tried a steak at my previous visit, I ordered the chicken fingers. The breaded chicken pieces were generously seasoned. The chicken itself was tender. On the side, I had honey mustard dipping sauce. I could taste both the honey and mustard. I can't really gush about the chicken fingers, though. It was a pretty standard dish. My guests thoroughly enjoyed their meals. Everyone said the food was seasoned and flavorful. 

We had a pleasant experience at Longhorn Steakhouse and will probably return.

Picked up a $45 to go order here today.  I ordered the 12 oz prime rib medium rare and the hubs got a sirloin w shrimp medium. I thouggt my prime rub looked overcooked and mentioned it to the bartender and he said that it looked fine, it would be more red when I cut into it. I was trying to get home to the Cubs game so I came home and started eating it. It was way overcooked. Medium rare should be red in the center. Mine was brown all around and pink in the center. For that much $ I expected more. We've been here about 5 times since they opened and its hit or miss everytime.

Let's just go in order:
1. soup- we asked if it was spicy, going to share with baby girl, they say a little. Um, chicken tortilla was throat burning spicy.
2. salad- not fresh, wilted, brown
3. steak- parmesan crusted- suuuuuuper salty. meat itself, ok.
4. sides- broccoli is cooked well as requestd but the weirdest texture, like inflated rubber. mashed potatoes- the only great thing there.
5. price- overpriced for what we got.

I like Longhorn and will return but I have 1 complaint and I say this about any place where this holds true.

Longhorn does not have 1 decent Pilsner Style Lager on draft and since most people drink Pilsner Style Lagers, I cannot understand any establishment that doesn't offer 1 over all this crap IPA/Craft garbage.

Add a Stella or a Dos Equis or something. Sam Adams does not count.

My family and I got here at around 6pm, I checked in with the person taking reservations and she said it would be about 30 minutes, it's about 7:30 pm now when I ask how long they tell me there's 3 people ahead of me. It's to late to go anywhere else so here we sit still waiting , this place sucks on being on time with a seating time. If you come here and they tell you 30 minutes , turn around and leave.

I had the prime rib what the mashed potatoes and it was very exquisite. my wife had the bone in ribeye and that cooked medium was excellent and the daughter had salmon with broccoli and she loved it. overall great atmosphere to be at and also with the food you cannot beat the quality Love it and will return for sure.

The boy received a phat gift card for the holidays from his work, so of course we choose the meatiest choice of the places to spend it!  Of all the chain steak places I can't say that I've ever been to LongHorn. I was indeed looking forward to getting a phat steak and celebrating!

We both went for the 22 oz Prime Rib with 2 sides and bread for $24.49 (hey, if it's someone else's money why not go all out?!).  We knew we wouldn't be able to eat it all, but we didn't know it would be due to the challenging experience with the meat!  There was a ton of silver skin that needed to be cut off.  I'm used to Prime Rib having a bit of fat; however, the silver skin just isn't edible or enjoyable to have to cut through.  Our knives were dull as well, so this didn't really help our dining experience!

I will say that the boy's Steakhouse Mac & Cheese (corkscrew pasta, four cheeses & bacon) as well as my baked sweet potato with cinnamon & butter were both amazing!  We sat at the bar since the wait for the dining area was over 45 minutes.  The bartender on Friday night was great, though she was a little forgetful.  

I'm sure there are some other good steaks at LongHorn, I just wasn't overly impressed with what we received.  It was an ok steak.
Great service when we first got there our waiter greeted us happily even with a packed house. The steak (rib eye) was amazing not to tough and just the right amount of lean.

Never disappointed !   We love the warm bread and whipped butter they serve while you're waiting for your meal to arrive. My mom enjoys a  tender steak  and this is the only place that she will eat steaķ. The filet they make here is perfectly cooked every time, tender and juicy. The ribs melt-in-your-mouth and the chicken avocado sandwich on flatbread was delicious. I haven't tasted chicken so tender, juicy and flavorful such as this in a very long time. We are never disappointed when we come here and we will be back!

I went here today with my family for a family member's birthday dinner.  It was, frankly, a hideous disappointment.  First, the food was a mixed bag.  Those who ordered steak were satisfied but those of us who don't eat red meat and tried something else, yuck!  I got the tilapia with mango salsa and it was inedible.  Gross.

Another big problem was the service.  Our waitress was the slowest!  She messed up our order more than once.  She forgot my vegetables and then when I was trying to find out what happened, she disappeared for at least 20 minutes.  I asked another waiter who passed by about my vegetables and he said he would take care of it...   Of course he didn't.  The waiters and waitresses are really bad here.  Many times, a bunch of them stood around chatting and not working.  The last thing that was horrible was that there was this huge amount of people standing in the lobby and bar waiting for their seat.  Meanwhile, there were several (like 8-10) empty tables!  Bad management.  

Bad bad bad!!!!

So I gave this place another try because after I wrote the review originally the relations manager contacted me for more information and offered me a gift card to come back and give them another try. I was more pleased with the second experience however I still can not give it 5 starts. I ordered a steak and my bf ordered a chicken dish. My steak was delicious! It was melting in my mouth. Nothing I would change about it. However my boyfriends dish was at best mediocre. It was bland and very very very greasy which is off putting. I tried a little bit of his food and was not impressed at all. I would come back here but the only thing I would order is a steak! I would not recommend any other dish here but I guess if you are going to steakhouse you should be enjoying a steak anyway. Also I would like to mention the staff was great this time. Our waiter was informative and was very nice. He was the one to recommend the steak for me, which again was delicious.

Had my first visit to Longhorn's recently because I received a gift card.  All I can say is I am glad I did not pay for the meal out of my own pocket.  As for the finer points, the service was good.  The salad was excellent which got my hopes up for the main entree being as good.  It wasn't.  Both mine and my wife's main course was salty.  I don't think it is because the cook over-salted.  I think it was because of the marinade that was used.  A couple hours after the dinner I felt like I had eaten a salt block for dinner.  The baked potato and sweet potatoes were both very good.  After the meal, our check was brought quickly and the server collected our payment quickly as well.  (I hate having to wait forever for the check and to pay once I have finished my meal.)  As for the restaurant itself, it was clean and very nice.   I just wish the food had been better as I still have about $50 left on the gift card.  I guess I will try Olive Garden as I understand they take the same gift cards.

Went there for the first time to meet friends for dinner. We ordered the fried green tomatoes and parmesan asparagus appetizer. The asparagus was OK, but the only thing parmesan about it was a couple shavings of cheese. The tomatoes were bad. They had some type of thick batter which was a bit crispy on the outside but cakey and underdone inside. We had just started on the appetizer when the waiter decided we needed our soup and salads. (Although a Saturday night, it wasn't really busy and there was no crowd waiting). We had just started our salads when they brought the food! We told them there was no way we wanted our main course since we hadn't even begun to have the salads. The runner took the entrees back. A couple minutes later the waiter came by and apologized saying he'd put a 10 minute hold on the entrees but the kitchen was slow and they just pushed out the food. (Huh??) He assured they would prepare fresh entrees for us. When the food came the manager came out and apologized again. The prime rib was OK (we all ordered it) but I've definitely had better for less. There was some stringy tendons in the meat making it very difficult to cut. I had the creamed spinach which was good, although the bread crumb topping could have had some flavor instead of being just bread crumbs. It would be an OK place if I was in the area, but there are much better options very close. Just so so.

This place is good for a group of people and want something a little better with a slightly lower price point.

I had the longhorn salmon. It came with a starting salad (options are Caesar or house).  The salmon is a little over cooked but the bourbon glaze was delicious. It sat on seasoned rice, and you have your choice of a side. I wanted to see how the Brussels sprouts were. It was too cheesy and too creamy for my liking. 

Dessert was the cinnamon sugar pillow donuts. Really good but it's a lot to eat on your own. Great sharing dessert.

Overall, food is ok and service is nice.

This was my first time here and I can't believe I haven't been here before.  My friend and I both had the mac n cheese/salad combo.  The mac n cheese was one of the best I've ever had.  It also came with this little cup of potato chips with some cheese and bacon on them, truly enjoyed!  Then we had no choice but to split the pumpkin lava cake dessert......OH MY GOD, wish we didn't split it as it was that delicious.  I have told everyone I know about it already and can't wait to be back.  I also liked the restaurant itself, besides the yummy food, it was very clean (including the bathrooms) and the staff was very friendly as well!  The manager did a quick is everything o.k. which is also nice.  Hidden little gem across from Bass Pro!

Seriously becoming my favorite steakhouse and I only been here twice. First time with a group of friends for dinner and drinks. But this last visit for my mother's 62nd birthday was absolute dynamite.

Our server Joanna S rocked! She took our party of 5 order like a champ. I even mentioned to her my mother's steak had to be served with no pink on it since my mom is a well done kinda gal. Joanna made sure that fire grilled t-bone was to my mama's liking and still burst with flavor.

The crispy calamari appetizer with sweet tangy bbq dipping sauce was spot on good! The caesar salads were a great intro to our ultimate steak showdown.

I ordered the Ranchers Sirloin 12 oz with a fried egg on top and bacon. Its wingman on the plate was a loaded baked potato. Geez I swear God cooked my steak cause it tasted like heaven! Perhaps Moses poured my seasonal Sam Adams tall boy cause even that was going down like water.

Service was great and the prices are actually very reasonable. I love the fact that the ambience could entertain anyone from a birthday celebration or a lovely affair (not the cheat on your spouse one).

I really have enjoyed every Longhorn Steakhouse, except the one in Bolingbrook.  Stopped on our way home on our wedding anniversary.  I was expecting the same excellent service and food I get in Des Plaines but this was poor.  My wife ordered a ribeye which was not cooked as requested and the staff response was you ordered it that way.  It didn't even look like a ribeye steak.  Her mashed potatoes didn't taste or look very good, she asked the waitress if the potatoes were real or made from flakes - the response was "not sure they come out of a bag".  The usual hot loaf of bread to start the meal was cold. Very disappointing. I would not recommend this location.

I do usually love this restaurant, and when asked for a recommendation for a special occasion I will readily suggest Longhorn. But we went here for Father's Day this year and we were pretty disappointed.

The one good thing was that we were told it would be a 2 hour wait, but it ended up only being about 30 minutes. Not sure if they tell people long times like that to scare them away or if they really thought it would be 2 hours.

They seated us 2 inches away from the next tables though, making it uncomfortable for all of the diners. I kept having to apologize to the diner right behind me for being so close. I could barely move, so I was not comfortable enough to really enjoy my dinner. Unfortunately this has happened to me at other restaurants as well and I am not sure why this happens. I would rather have waited a little longer for a table I would be comfortable at.

Food was great, as always. It kills me to drop my 5 star rating to 4 but it's just not perfect anymore.

This restaurant is not even close to being near the top of my list for steak in the SW burbs or anywhere for that matter.

Our server took care of us OK but he was very cold almost to the pint that we were just waiting for him to come back to are table and butcher us with an ax.

If you like your food salted so much that it is all you can taste or so much salt that it immediately sends your blood pressure into the danger zone, then you would have loved our meal. My steak was pretty lousy.

I don't know what my steak house mac-n-cheese even tasted like as my mouth was filled with salt and that is all I could taste.

Hey Longhorn FYI salt is supposed to accent/enhance flavor and not be a flavor
If you never been in Fogo de Chao at downtown Chicago, you definitely love this piece of crap. Low prices for low quality food.

Skip it!!
The steaks are certainly tasty, but they don't know how to cook them- I ordered a $25 medium T-Bone and got rare, as did my wife. The worst thing are the watered down drinks- ordered a "Perfect" Margarita, shown on the menu for $8.99.  Not priced right to start with- and after a few sips it became obvious that it was almost entirely lime juice and ice. $9 for a sweet, high-calorie mixture of junk. Told the waiter that we were disappointed with them- he couldn't find the manager so never did anything to fix them. When we got the bill, he had the nerve to charge us for a Patron Perfect Margarita instead- $11 each- half-apologizing that he'd pushed the wrong button. Then there is Bolingbrook- the highest tax suburb in Chicagoland- adding its 15% liquor tax on top of its 8.5% sales tax, adding a whopping 23.5% tax to anything liquor, even though it appeared to have less than 1/2 oz. of liquor in it. 
No way I go back to this place- a Darden concept (run by the same struggling company as Red Lobster and Olive Garden), or for that matter, we're done visiting any restaurant, liquor store (or buying wine from the Costco) in Bolingbrook.

Great food, service, environment, and priced right! I have been to this place several times and every time no matter what time of day it's been great! The steaks are awesome, potato soup excellent, and burgers are delicious. Also love the kettle chips with sauce. Overall excellent place for any occasion if looking for a great cut of steak at an excellent price!

Stopped by the day before Mothers day and even though it was only 5 the place was packed. The restaurant isn't a large place and when we were leaving the wait was an hour plus.
With 5 of us, the food ranged from average to good.

Service was okay for as crowded as it was.
This is my favorite place for a steak for a good price.  I've been coming here since they opened.  The staff is really friendly.
It was alright service was a tad bit slow and a little over priced but food was fine, still if i had to choose i would go to famous daves next door, mmmmmm yummy ribs

Im definitely a fan. Great service. Food is tasty. Steaks cooked the way you want it . Great appetizers. I order everything when I come here. Ceasar salad is just ride and complimentary bread is actually fresh. Good for a date night or a family seating. Thanks Long Horn!

Ok I really like this place! First off I love that they play country music! I love the decor in there as well. Always good service when I go. Great service at the one in Orland Park as well so good job guys! 

I have had the steak and shrimp combo here in the past. YUMMO. My new love here is the BLT steak salad. I went for lunch and had it. Steak was cooked perfectly and it was almost hard to finish. Great size for the price. Great Peppercorn Ranch dressing and plenty of bacon. MMM BACON!! :) I will be ordering that again. 

If I remember right from another trip they have some yummy drinks. They had a few new Sangria's on the menu which I need to try. 

I will have to remember to go back and just sit at the bar and have some drinks. I like the set up there. If only they were open later for drinks after work. 

CHEERS!!

Yum! Yum! Yum!!
Can seriously become addicted to this place!

Took my son and husband here last week after experiencing a rocking time with the Yelp crew at an event. Was craving the steak and sauce ever since!!

Everything was once again spot on!
Wild west shrimp - amazing!! 
My son's bacon wrapped white cheddar filet - So damn good!!

And our split porterhouse for two?
Cooked to perfection!!

Service is wonderful and attentive! Not only is the food spot on, but super fast service too! Pricing is reasonable! and it's a much much better option then chains like outback! 

My only regret?
Not knowing that the cobb salad was available as an optional side! Note for next time!

You need to eat here!!
Great steak, great food. Always seems busy when we go so I would recommend making reservations. Service is always pleasant. Bring a sweater too because the last time we were freezing in there.

My boyfriend and I went for a late lunch and we really enjoyed ourselves.  We started with the happy hour wild west shrimp tacos and they were so good I could eat them all day long. Then for dinner we split the salmon salad as well as a calamari. Ive had the salmon salad before and it was very juicy and tender perfectly cooked. The calamari was okay It wasn't as spicy as I hoped but well cooked. I would have traded it for those tacos for sure! The server, Christy was very sweet and attentive and the manager Sarah was also very delightful.  It was a very enjoyable dining experience.

Just had lunch here for my brothers birthday and the manager gave us 2 free desserts because we couldn't decide! If that's not great customer service I don't know what is! As for the food, it was, as always, absolutely delicious!!
Mini tacos and a split caesar perfect for my girlfriend and I. Manager was friendly will most certainly be back

Enjoyed a Black & Bleu burger at the bar with sweet potato bites.  They have a couple of Sam Adams and Sierra Nevada Pale Ale on tap, so you have a few good beer choices.  Thanks to the cowboy inspired decor, I didn't even mind the goat-roping music.  I was hoping that Cowboy Curtis would sidle up.  A tip of the Stetson to Longhorn!

I've probably tried to come here at least 2 times and today was the first time that the wait period was do-able (20 minutes) and now I finally know why they have such good traffic. 

First of all, great food at great prices.  For a steakhouse, I was expecting to have put a dent in my wallet but surprisingly, the price range (which is top 2 on my list, #1 being food quality) was quite decent.  For the most part, most of the food seems to be around $12-$24 range.

For around $12 you can get a chicken entre and or 6 oz. steak and have the option to add more sides for extra cost or choose their existing combos.  I chose a $15 combo of 6 oz. steak with grilled shrimp smoked on a plank (like 5 or so).  Every entre comes with the choice of 2 sides or a side and a salad.  I chose a rice pilaf (which was amazing!!! the best I've tasted: full of flavor and juice) and a salad mix.  If you get the salad, it would be brought out first as an appetizer and the portion is quite large (a good plate full).  They also give out unlimited freshly baked bread that was really good.  In the end, I didn't even have room for desert.  

I went with a friend and we each received a salad, ate the whole basket of bread.  He had the Flo's Filet (which as super tender and moist-- I definitely recommend) and a good slab of salmon for only $23.  Altogether, our bill of 2 came out to be $38 before tax, a really good value considering this is a steakhouse.  

I would definitely visit again!

We stopped in here for dinner yesterday while we were out for a walk while staying at the local hotel.  My 2 1/2 yr old niece is handicapped with a terminally illness called SMA.  The staff really did a good job to accommodate her 6 foot store wheelchair and our waitress included her in her visits to the table. So, many tend to overlook her and act like she is not there.  It made our meal so much better.  

We also enjoyed the food choices we had and a couple of upcoming items they had as specials.  We will be back.

Great experience! The staff was extremely friendly! I came in with a group of girls so we had a while to wait awhile which was fine. They brought us out free appetizers which was awesome! The food and drinks were wonderful! We will all be back for sure!

I love this place! My husband and I go here for a "nice" dinner but don't want to spend the money that Five-star places charge. You can dress up if you want (we always do) but definitely don't have to. The customer service is always great. I had to ask for the manager a couple times and got what I wanted. I had been a waitress for ten years and know what they can and can't do.

I always get the filet mignon. He changes it up between steak and salmon. We love them both! I always get mashed potatoes and veggies, love. He always gets mashed potatoes and extra mashed potatoes! haha
I haven't had dessert there yet, but i bet its fabulous!
T
HIS is going to be my christmas present to everyone this year!
The only bad thing is taht there isn't one closer to me, I'm in Glen Ellyn :(

I'm kind of reluctant to give 5 stars for only eating here one time, but it was that good! We ordered the porterhouse for 2 and my mouth is still watering just thinking about it. The steak comes with a steak sauce made table-side. steak sauce, really? as a steak connoisseur, why would anyone use steak sauce? well, i wouldnt recommend that you eat this steak without it! it is that good. I even tried to match this sauce (with a little less luck) at home. the sides were ok too, but you dont come here for the sides, you come here for this steak! i'm not sure i'll ever be able to order anything else from the menu!

Good food, especially for the price. The pretzel stick appetizer was excellent and for $40.00 we had the appetizer, steak, potatoes, dessert, tea, and a beer. The staff was friendly and very attentive. I will be back!

Just got home from an absolutely delicious dinner at LongHorn! I had the small fillet and my husband had the prime rib - both cooked to our specifications. Our baked potatoes were huge and nice and 'fluffy' inside. And, I don't want to forget to mention that we started with the spinach dip which was so creamy and rich! Special kudos to our waiter, Justin, who was knowledgeable about the menu and who kept a close eye on our table without hovering - he was awesome!

We stopped in for a little lunch right when they opened and were pleasantly surprised with the quality of everything. The place was almost empty when we walked in so I wasn't expecting the best service, but everyone was nice and the timing was perfect. We were pleased

The pricing of the lunch menu was very reasonable, with items averaging around 10$ or so. I had the grilled trout, and it was delicious. The kid's burger was a real sized burger with fries and an adorable kids cup full of whatever you want. Our server was very nice and the manager came to check on us as well.

The best part of our whole experience however was the dessert. The chocolate stampede is hands down one of the best cakes I have ever had in my life. It was fluffy cake with chocolate mousse and layers of chocolate on top of that. It was so big that I had to bring some home.  Even if I don't eat here, I will probably come back just for the cake. Awesome.

My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary. Sarah, one of the managing partners, came to our table to speak to us personally. She is wonderful. Ray was our waiter and he was very attentive. Jana, the other manager, was able to get us anniversary treats. We had a full dessert plate with anniversary decorations. As always Flo's Filet was delicious! Go here for special locations.
Havent been to a LH in years but 11 bucks for a small burger and a handful of soggy fries?  Burger was good but over (injected flavoring?) seasoned for me.

I really enjoy long horn for a comfortable, relaxing dinner place. Nice side caesar salad and the bread thats served to everyone is good when hot. The Sirloin steak is my go to and they cook it exactly the way you ask them too. Clean place and a hundred times better than apple bees. No comparison

Went for dinner with my son last night, and we were in the mood for steak, so we went to Longhorn. 

This place was kind of fancy, they tried to be upscale like the more prominent places, Fancy, expensive, fair service, mediocre food, 

The steak was way to fatty, the asparagus was stringy, potato was fine and the ice tea was very good.

The fire alarm went off while we were sitting there, all the staff left but they forgot to tell the customers what was going on, too bad we had already paid, but we decided to leave when the fire dept pulled up, I did not want to be cooked well done. 

Next time it's Ponderosa for me.
yes they get a 5 star from me which is hard to do, but not only is their food but they have great customer service which goes a long with me .

Wow.  Me and my wife were looking for some place to get a steak for dinner that we have not tried.  We came across this place and it had got reviews so we thought we would give it a shot.  We where amazed.  The staff was very nice and welcoming.  The waiter was very attentive.  Most of all the food was great.  We will return again soon.

The Father's Day mission was to eat good-quality yet affordable steak and stay away from downtown Chicago. 

Mission accomplished. 

Six adult dinner meals including two large appetizers, a few alcoholic drinks, tax and 20% tip cost about $160. (NOTE: After signing up for Longhorn's online mailing list, we had received a coupon to get 1 appetizer for free, so that shaved $8 from the total.)

As expected, it was crowded. LongHorn didn't accept reservations, but they had an electronic system that accepted "call aheads" (i.e. meaning you call ahead 30-45 minutes before you arrive to cut down on your wait time) and special requests. We wanted a table for 6 by a window for 4 p.m., along with cutting down our wait. So, while another party who did not call ahead had to wait an hour (or more) to be seated, we waited about 40 minutes even with our special request. Over the phone and in person, the staff were very professional and courteous.

Almost everyone enjoyed the food, even with slight mix-ups on orders (i.e. sides). The star of the day thoroughly enjoyed his OUTLAW RIBEYE and BAKED POTATO, while others enjoyed the FLAT IRON STEAKS (particularly the one with portabella mushrooms). They were glad that A1 Steak Sauce was not needed. One person felt the RENEGADE TOP SIRLOIN was not juicy enough though. Also, they enjoyed the warm, UNLIMITED HONEY-WHEAT BREAD and CAESAR SALADS that came with the steaks. The FRESH GREEN BEANS were loved as well. As for what I thoroughly enjoyed:

WILD WEST SHRIMP ($8.99): Spicy, tasty, and an ample amount for the table.

WESTERN CHEESE FRIES ($7.99): I got caught up and accidentally tasted this starter. I did my best to avoid the bacon and chili. It was pretty good. The cheese was real, not liquid goop.

GRILLED SALMON SALAD ($13.99): The hefty salmon was perfectly-grilled, medium-well, bourbon-marinated goodness on top of huge salad. The portion size was out of control, but I'm not really complaining. A whole head of lettuce had to have been used, along with chopped tomatoes, shredded cheddar, cucumbers, croutons, and red-onion slivers. The chipotle ranch sauce that I ordered on the side was a perfect compliment.

WHITE PEACH MARGARITA (frozen, $?): It was a delicious cocktail and likely the white peach puree helped. The size was appropriate. On a side note, someone ordered a watermelon martini that was shaken & served tableside. The shaker was left, so actually the amount was of two large martinis. She loved the watermelon-flavored candy/sugared rim as well. I didn't care for the medicinal taste of that drink, but it's hard to avoid that in melon cocktails that rely only on melon-flavored liquor.

The decor and music were country, and the restaurant was clean. There was a long bar, along with seating in the front which helped distract from the wait time (which again, could have been spent in traffic toward downtown otherwise). The outdoor benches could have used some shaded cover. I was surprised that the women's bathroom didn't have more stalls than 2 or 3. Also, after the first rush of people, I did notice that tables were not cleared right away (although, our great waitress Beth started clearing ours). A manager asked about our meal at the end and offered our party a few more coupons for a free appetizer. We wanted desserts at first, but our stomachs weren't up to the task.

We had a great casual dining experience at LongHorn. It may become our go-to Father's Day destination!

Surprisingly we got sat right away on a Friday evening. It's a nice clean place with a cowboy feel. Ordered a sangria and sipped on that while I chewed on some warm bread they bring to the table. We all ordered steaks and they were very flavorful. They came with two sides. Good food, great price!
Best steak you can get for the price.

Yum - I was so happy to finally try this place and was overall pretty happy with the experience.  I loved the menu - they had things that you don't see at every other steakhouse that you go to.  They had a great variety of steaks as well as other things like chicken and fish.  They offered a great variety of everything really - beverages, desserts, salads, appetizers - a lot of choices in all of the menu categories.  An entree comes with a choice of side and a salad, so you get plenty of food.  I liked that they offered several different sides to choose from including unique things such as a sweet potato with butter and cinnamon and roasted asparagus.  They also have a pretty good kid's menu that offer several non-expensive entrees that come with a side and drink.  The prices were about average - but more importantly I felt like I got portion sizes that were appropriate for what I was paying for.  My only complaint here was that our service was a little slow and our waitress was a little off.  She never brought us bread until we realized that everyone else in the restaurant had bread and we asked for it, when I ordered a T-bone steak she came back and said they were out, then came back and said they had some afterall - but in the end I got a different cut and when she brought a refill for my drink she brought the wrong drink.  None of these things made the experience bad - but I could have lived without.  

What we specifically got and LOVED:
I had the cherry limeade to drink, they offer this and a few other concoctions that are both made to order and are refillable!  They also had a pretty extensive alcoholic menu as well (including yummy margaritas) but it wasn't that kind of night.  We started with a seafood cheese dip which was pretty good - but I would probably try something else next time, they had a lot of appetizers.  I tried to order the T-bone, but ended up getting a NY strip steak.  There is a note on the menu that they don't freeze any of their meat, which is why the occasionally run out of stuff.  For that reason, I am okay with the substitution.  My husband had the Porterhouse - both steaks tasted excellent.  Mine was a little overdone, but not enough that I would complain about it as it was still very flavorful and juicy.  I got the loaded baked potato which was average - my husband got the sweet potato which was really good.  Overall a really good experience - we will be back again and hopefully will save enough room for dessert next time.

My boyfriend ordered a medium-rare New York strip steak... And it came out medium-well. He wasn't pleased. The waitress was incredibly accommodating and she put in an order for a new steak. The second came out a little less done but not much and it was far too seasoned with pepper to be enjoyable. They had two chances and failed both times. We won't be returning and I advise all of you to be weary of trying this place out for the first time for a steak.
Very good experience here, food was delightful, service was fast and the waitress kept our drinks filled!
Sometimes inconsistent but the ribeye, when cooked properly is delicious, and the prices is more than right.

I usually never review chains but this place is not a huge chain in Chicagoland, plus it is so good I think it's worthy of my review.  The staff is super friendly and effecient and if they mess up, which has happened to me before, they make it right with instant discounts off the bill.  The steaks are to die for, juicy and made right!  This is one of the best steak places in Chicagoland.  Now before you snip at me and say Chicago has plenty of good steak and is known for it, I must remind you that this is not before 1971, when the Union Stock Yards used to plate Chicagoland with the finest cuts of meat.  Since that meat packer closed down Chicago has not been the same for steaks, so that is why this chain runs away with one of the best in my opinion at an affordable price too.  May I recommend the Mac N Cheese!?  Excellent, but not healthy LOL.  They have excellent appetizers I can't remember which one I had last time but it was excellent it was some kind of dip.  Lastly, keep in mind this place is slammed on weekends with long waits (not the restaurant's fault), so if you want to eat at 6 for example, show up at 5!

I can't remember the last time I saw a washroom this clean. Actually when I was waiting for my friend I noticed that the whole place looked like my mother did a number on it. Nice atmosphere and very inviting. Wednsday at noon and the place was empty for the whole time we were there. I mean 6 customers total. I guess that's how they keep this place spotless. Our server was on top of us like nobody's business. We both had the salmon salad. Mine was with the caesar. It was very tasty but both of our filets were black on the top and very dry? There are tumble weeds going by this place. Does the cook have anything better to do? Everything was great and I would have given it another star. But I didn't order blackened anything.

I was looking forward to a great steak. The atmosphere was there, the staff was pretty good, but the food was nothing to write home about. The best part of the meal was the fresh baked Honey-Wheat bread. My wife and I both ordered steaks cooked Medium-Well. Mine came out Medium-Rare, and my wife's was Well Done. The manager took mine back to cook it a little more. I thought it would be okay, because I had ordered a side of ribs, but the ribs were very disappointing. Way over cooked. I've had some good "fall of the bone" ribs, but the meat was mushy and tasteless. The BBQ sauce didn't help, either. All-in-all the meal was a disappointment.

We were here on Friday night and a couple weeks ago as well. 

A few weeks ago my boyfriend and I came on a Sunday around 3:00pm and were surprised at how busy it was. We were seated right away, but it filled up quickly. Anyways, we ordered the Firecracker Chicken Wraps as an appetizer - Good, but not as spicy as I guess we would like, or expected. I ordered the Grilled Chicken & Stuffed Portabella - which would never order again. I just didn't like the mushroom sauce and the stuffed portabella mushroom that was on top was the size of a dime. My boyfriend ordered the Bacon Wrapped Filet - and it was very good.

Our Friday night experience was much better (in my eyes). We ordered the Wild West Shrimp (enough to feed 4) - AWESOME! I ordered the Sierra Chicken, it was cooked perfectly! My boyfriend ordered the Loaded Sirloin and said he would order that again if we ever go back. 

We don't live close to a Longhorn - so for us to go back, we will have to make a trip! And with so many other places like Longhorn around us with the same quality (if not better), I don't think we will be back any time soon. Good food, good prices - and worth a try if you are in the area.

We searched and searched for a reasonable price steak house to take our mothers to for Mothers Day. I came to yelp to read reviews and at first was a little skeptical of coming to this place . The comments on their western Decor and county music kind of made me question the integrity of the atmosphere. 
When we got there we were seated almost instantly. We had to wait for them to join tables to meet the size of our group . I noticed the decor instantly and thought that it was nothing like I had imagined it would be . Nothing gaudy at all and the music was at a nice level where you didn't feel you needed to shout over it to talk to someone at the other end of the table . 
We were given lunch menus (because of the time we went) but requested the dinner menus. The dinner menus offer a way bigger selection then the lunch menus . So I recommend the dinner menus. I do wish they were given automatically cause I would have never known things were missing off the lunch menu if i wasn't at there website the day before. 
The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable . They aren't coming to your table every 5 minutes after you have just taken a bite off your fork to ask if everything is okay. They come around at appropriate times and refill your beverage without being asked. Was very accommodating. 
And on to the main reason we go to a steak house ... The food ! 
We had the shrimp and lobster dip in addition to the stuffed mushroom caps.. They were both delicious and the never ending bread was a nice bonus. The steak was melt in your mouth amazing. My father in-law ordered the lobster tail addition to his steak and was very pleased . The steamed vegetables are crisp and compliment your meal. 
Overall ... We were very pleased and every one of us in our party of 6 
left with good memories and happy tummies. I would definitely recommend Longhorn to a friend. 

-Bon Appétit

I've never tried a Longhorn Steakhouse but this recently moved out to Bolingbrook so I figured, why not! It was goooood!! We went for lunch so not a huge appetite went with! I had the Parmesan Crusted Chicken Sandwich which was a grilled, fresh chicken breast topped with melted provolone and a parmesan & garlic crust, served on a grilled sesame seed bun with parmesan spread. It was yummy! I was pleasantly surprised! I don't know what I expected but this place lived up to expectations! It is a fairly small restaurant so your better off going at a weird time. Thumbs up!

My first time at a LongHorn Steak house.  My husband, 18 yr. old son and I went at 2pm on a Sunday.  We had a very good experience. The waitress and other wait staff could not have been any nicer. The food took a little long to get out to us but that is ok. The waitress recommended their new appetizer of fresh potato chips and dip for $3.99. It was ok. I think I have had better at other restaurants. Husband and son's chopped steak was cooked perfectly to their order.  Good mash potatoes, good fries. I ordered the Southern Fried Chicken salad and it was terrific.

I have eaten here 5 times. Each time the service and food were great. Not disappointed. The steaks were seasoned and prepared perfectly. On several occasions the manager stopped by to check on us. My wife and I are pleased with the consistency of the food and service.

Sirloin Steak sandwich - very tasty and reasonably priced, a good sampler to gage their steak products. Have it with the stuffed baked potato.
Chicken and Portabella Mushrooms - Very good, but a little salty. (the wife)
Strawberry Limeades - great, and bottomless!
Firecracker Chicken Wraps - also very tasty appetizer - share it if you don't want to spoil your supper!
Molten Lava Cake - awesome, but larger than the picture.  Make sure you have belly-room before ordering.
Atmosphere - clean and classy.  Country music was on too loud for the mellow lunch crowd, but we understand.  Maybe some alt-bluegrass next time, mr. dj? We are Northerners, after all. ;-)
Waiter: Adrian.  Good job, sir.

This place was great!
A gift card brought us out and we were glad it did. We came in for a late lunch on a Saturday. Lots of cars in the parking lot, but to our surprise, no wait. 
Since it was lunch, we decided to split the steak and salmon entree. We upgraded to a Ribeye and also asparagus. We also got the chicken roller appetizer. They were delicious and came plated among lettuce, tomatoes and sauce, my only regret was getting the salad with our meal because of this. Drinks and bread were kept replenished. 
When our meal came out, we were surprised at the huge portions of both. And we were even given an extra plate for sharing at no charge. The salmon was great and full of flavor but the ribeye stole the show. So juicy I cut mine with my butter knife and needed no sauce. It was perfectly cooked - well done just the way we like. 
This place was kid friendly too. Menu, crayons and even Teddy Grahams to tide our little guy over while we waited for our food, which came up surprisingly fast.
We were too full for dessert and a little sad that our only left overs was salad.
We will definitely come back for shopping in the area as well as a fabulous steak.

My husband had seen this restaurant last week and decided we should try it out.  We made the 30 mile trip.  Beautiful decor.  Not too much of a menu but we did come for steak.  I tried the lobster, shrimp bisque soup.  Not too good.  Just didn't taste right.  I picked up a pepper mill and noticed the bottom of it was filthy, absolutely gross.  Our steaks were okay, all three of us had overcooked steaks.  The service was lacking, better at McDonald's.  There were only 3 tables there and we were looking for the server.  At one point I went up to the host and had him find the waiter.  Very disappointing.     
I think we will stick to the Outback. Service is great and you can count on your steak being cooked properly.

Delicious, went in a week ago with a friend and got the outlaw ribeye and the parmesan crusted chicken and split both, we left stuffed! Definitely recommend both. The server Ray was very quick to refill drinks and greeted us promptly despite the fact the restaurant was slammed. Great experience, only complaint was there was no small plates on the table so when we got bread we had nothing to eat it on but oh well not the end of the world, otherwise everything was fantastic.

Server was great. This is the second time I had Flo's Filet and it has been terrible. Strawberry Salad was great though. I am not sure I will go back. In the past the steaks were great, not sure why the quality has gone way down.

Visited 7/19/12. Sat at the bar and Tina was very nice. She was little preoccupied with the Famous Dave's employees that were therE, but that was fine.
I have Flo's Filet 7oz. and my Husband had the 9oz. The filets were cooked as we like them because we asked for medium and they come out medium rare which is what always happens nowadays. I had the mashed potato side and Sweet potato side for my Husband. All in all the food was good. Salad was big and fresh. 4 stars on food as was cooked well and tasty while not being over seasoned. No steak sauce required.
The cocktails were so-so and were always made out of sight which led us to believe they did not want to show being poured. We thought they were week considering price. Corona was $4.49 in bottle, 7&7 was $5.69 and 1800 Margarita was $7.99. The margarita being the best value. On top of the price of drinks is a 14% tax that is special to the Town of Bolingbrook. That in itself brings it down one star. Presentation so-so. So good food, avoid the high priced and weak drinks and have a good time.

Gross disgusting sticky dirty menus and salt/pepper shakers. Slow and uncaring service. Long wait for initial contact, drinks, and food. We were never offered a refill on our sodas. Food was passable, but they forgot one add-on item my husband was really looking forward to. Never again!!

Pretty good - wait wasn't too bad on a Friday night.  Ordered a parmesan crusted steak, which was really really good, but they forgot the shrimp that I ordered with it.  Since they weren't very busy, I was a little disappointed.  But overall, the service was fine and we had a nice time.  I think if I had a choice though... I'd choose Lone Star over Longhorn.
One of my favorite places. I have never had bad wait service and my bf and I will drive from Streamwood to go. I love their parmesean chicken.

I went here the other night with my boyfriend. He had no complaints about the meal. The atmosphere was nice, and our waiter was down to earth and very friendly. However, I came here for a good steak. I ordered the Porterhouse, Lobster Tail, Mashed Potatoes, and Mixed Veggies. The steak was of low quality. I swear I've had better steak at IHOP. It was VERY over-seasoned, and WAY too tough. The Lobster Tail was over cooked, hard and rubbery, and smelled WAY too fishy. I made it through one bite, and couldn't bare to eat anymore. The Mashed Potatoes and Veggies were great!! Drinks were GREAT too. But very disappointed in paying $26 for a nasty steak, and $10 for a nasty Lobster Tail. Ewww.
My family eats her almost every weekend. Very friendly staff and great food,

The food is good and there are a lot of wonderful options on the menu, but the customer service is horrible. I brought my mother for her birthday and had a terrible experience. 

Not only did the server mess up our order and forget to bring silverware, but he couldn't even tell whose omelette was whose when he was asked. I have a zucchini allergy and I was given the wrong plate. We waited about 50 minutes for our meal to arrive.

After we received the bill, we noticed we were charged for several items without notice. He failed to explain the hidden up-charges in the menu. He charged us for pancakes that were not labeled in the menu as specialty pancakes. He never explained that the substituted turkey sausages were more expensive.  And the food mix up and pricing issue wasn't the primary problem.

When we calmly and respectfully inquired about the pricing discrepancy, I was told that it was common sense and I should have known. 

Then, when I asked to speak to the manager, he told me that his server had been with him for a year and a half, that he knows the server would have explained it, and that he trusts his guy. Not only did the server and the manager fail to validate my legitimate complaint, but the manager chose to support his employee and minimize his customers concerns. 

I've been here once before and had a positive experience previously. After today, I cannot recommend this place and will not be returning. Visit at your own risk.

Every restaurant has their off days but this place is disgusting. Seriously, you are better off going to McDonalds or Wendy's. 

Our server was really good and no issues -it's the only reason this place is getting a 1 star, because of the server. 

The food was terrible and instantly made me sick.... I specifically asked for no butter to be cooked in with my skillet (I watched the server write this) but obviously the careless "chefs" in the back decided otherwise. I'm not much of complainer but when I ask for something to not be put into my food I kind of expect it since this restaurant is claiming to not be like a fast food joint.... Clearly dropped the ball on that one considering they were too lazy to whip up some extra hash browns and veggies without it. I also asked for avocado and got guac..... Again, laziness.....  Bathrooms were horrendous- it was like stepping into a port-a-John :/ ugh, so gross.... Made me want to take my chances on squatting in 
a bush outside. 

Also, $40 for two skillets, cup of coffee and small glass of oj? You are out of your mind ... We are not in Chicago ( where I would actually get quality service and way more bang for my buck @ that price).

It's a bit unfortunate to actually see this place starting to suck since my husbands family is pretty close to the owners.... Oh well, good luck on running the place- I will most def not be back or recommend anyone here.
This restaurant is like a smaller version of Wild Berries. Food quality is great and excellent customer service.
Pancakes are awesome! Food came out quick! Apple pancake was AWESOME! Will be back! Jelly is free, fantastic!

This breakfast/lunch place is crowed and a popular. Even though there were many people waiting for a seat on a Sunday morning, the wait went quickly.  That's a positive.  Our server Nicole was friendly and checked on us frequently. Another positive.  My complaint and low rating is because it took over 30 minutes to get my egg white omelette and side of bacon, as well as my husband's breakfast.  It wasn't our server's fault. She said the kitchen mixed up the tix. I could have made that same breakfast quicker at home. The low rating was for the long wait for our food and the lack of a manager presence when I wanted to bring this to his attention. He was there when we arrived and disappeared, no checking on tables and customers. I don't think I'll be back with other more efficient breakfast places near my home.

Food is just meh to be this pricey.  Been here 3x since it has opened, staff is more interested in socializing.  Manager walks around and talks to customers but never our table/booth.
Pass on this place and drive further to Tasty Waffle.

Solid breakfast place.  Ordered the eggs with a side of gyro ($5 for a not so plentiful portion of gyro) and was not disappointed.  The soup (beef barley) was quite good.  The others in my party chose various omelettes that they seemed to enjoy. The portions were quite generous with the hashbrowns and the pancake side was also nice.  It was not too busy the day I went, so we were there like 40 minutes total which is how I like it.

Place could use a bit more in terms of customer service skills for the employees. Food was ok but nothing to go wild about- basic breakfast, not that hard to do, harder to make it a wow factor. Check came and when trying to pay advised the credit card machine was down. Surprised, not knowing if my 90 year old mother or I had money, our server said we should have read the sign in the door. I advised I didn't see the sign and the hostess who came to work when we entered said it wasn't there when we arrived. Needless arguing  over their lack of a credit card machine that worked is pointless and just poor service. We found some money but sadly not enough to cover any kind of tip for the waitress who could have card less. Not sure why servers who depend on tips are so rude and non-caring for items out of their customers control. Having been a server, I saw every customer as a potential 20% tip of the total bill and made every effort to earn it. We visited, we ate, we found cash, and there isn't really a need to go back.
Service was fast and courteous. Food was ok, I saw this place on Chicago's Best, they pumped it up good but nothing special.

We have been coming here for breakfast and lunch for close to 2 years. It has always been fantastic food and mostly service except for today. I substituted cheese on my skillet for feta cheese and when we got the bill my skillet was $4 more! It would be great if our server told us about this up-charge before we placed our orders, knowing it, I would have made another choice. She took the bill and talked to the owner and he didn't do anything! All she said is 'my fault, sorry about that'. We're very disappointed on how we were treated and I'm not sure if we'll be back.

The pumpkin pancakes are the best run don't walk 

We got there 30 min before close they never made us feel rushed    The staff was friendly.  Eggs were good but the pancakes are the best much better than pancake cafe
Best. Pancakes. Ever. Food is always awesome. Staff is always friendly. Portions are almost too much, and that's not a bad thing.
Failed to turn in my take out order. Sat here for 20 minutes while they made it. Then they lied and said they didnt. Then once i got my food it was all wrong. Place is tanking.
Staff is disorganized to get people a table. Young waiters who doesn't pay attention to the empty tables. Poor management and poor customer service. Don't eat here...you'll be dissappointed.
Been here a few times. Food is always good and plentiful.  Wait staff is friendly and attentive. Better than most breakfast and lunch places in the area

Been there a bunch of times, the food is good and service is friendly.. I recommend as always very early when they just open or late when the big crowds are gone otherwise you'll stand there for a while.. The torpedo burger one of my favorites.. Sometimes the fries that come with it are a bit cold apart from that no complaints at all.

I will say that on my first trip here, I just ordered the wrong thing.   I put this place to the "Great Steak and Egg Challenge" and let me say, it is the best to be found in the area!
     My strip steak came lightly seasoned, and a perfect rare.  Over easy eggs done just right, and a pile of thinly shredded hash browns rounded out the meal.  Not a complaint to be had.  I am very happy to put this place on my rotation of breakfast favorites.

This is a great breakfast place with great service.  I had the Mediterranean omelette and it was perfect.  Hash browns were really good as well.  I didn't care too much for the chunky monkey pancakes, but the chocolate chip pancakes were pretty good.  Coffee is great and fresh here as well!  Will be trying the Naperville location next to see if its as good as this location.

Where do I begin with this one? I am not a frequent Yelp reviewer, but my first and last visit to this breakfast spot forced me to write. If you read the reviews, which I did prior to visiting, you see mostly poor reviews or great ones, which seemed odd. My daughter wanted to try this restaurant, though I mentioned reading reviews that were less than favorable. We had a coupon, though when I showed it to the hostess; she said we could not use it on the weekend, though there is no mention of it on the coupon. When asked why, she just said "that's what the manager tells us to say". 

We waited more than 10 minutes for coffee. I finally got up and asked group of women at hostess station if someone could get me a cup. They were busy applying lotion, so I figured they had more time than our waitress (who was friendly). 

Once we ordered, it seemed to take longer than most breakfast places for our food to arrive. My top pancake was crispy. Eggs (spinach/feta omelette) fine. Though we didn't have enough silverware. We had no ketchup, syrup or hot sauce. Food continued to cool until we had these "extras".  We noticed a few fruit flies, odd because it was freezing cold and snowing outside.

I think what bothered me most is that while we waited for everything, we noticed so many people standing around doing nothing except talking, or watching ,TV. 

 I thought for a moment that maybe the restaurant was closing soon. I had the feeling that people were waiting for the few diners there to leave so they could swing into action. But no, they were going to be open a few more hours. 

I know this is a harsh review, but I've been a server. I've been a manager. The crew here needs training in efficiency and customer service. Anyone of the many staff members standing around could have walked through the room offering coffee. The manager could have checked in on guests to see if anything was needed. Instead, I saw a lot of people wasting time while we sat and waited...the one thing I did like, the forks. Once we all had one, I notice the heft and design of the silverware, which I did enjoy. 

I mentioned to my daughter that businesses need to care more about first impressions. Ours was poor and we won't be back.

This is my favorite breakfast place in the Romeoville/Bolingbrook area.  The portions are huge and the food is delicious.  Coffee is good and plentiful.  They really know how to cook eggs and they always come out the way you order them.  Pancakes and skillets are both excellent as well.  Delicious.
Their service is good, but they're kind of pricey for a breakfast restaurant. I will be back though, because i love good service.

The worst meal I have ever had... the El Gordo dish. I couldn't stomach the meal,let and had to return it after two bites. The manager did not even bother to come find out why the meal was returned. Did not take it off our bill either. I understand that every now and then things go wrong in the kitchen. But why this place lost my business has to do with the poor customer service and lack of concern.

So my friends have been telling me to go to this place for some time now. When I finally made the decision to give this place a shot, I was shocked with the wave of flavors that overcame my taste buds.
There is a special menu at eggs. When you talk to the owner, ask for "The Gregorian". It is a skillet with a layer of hash browns made with fresh picked yukon golden potatoes and a hint of onion, a layer of the juiciest, most succulent fried chicken in Illinois (dare I say in the United States), followed by the creamiest sausage gravy known to man with 2 eggs of choice.
You don't understand how this dish changed my life...heck...it saved my life. I am now a regular customer who starts his weekend with the late, the great, the legendary...Gregorian.

P.S: Order their coffee as a side. It's organic java breeze.

I've been here on three different occasions for morning breakfast due to being in the immediate area. Each time the scrambled eggs were good. Once I had the buckwheat pancakes and the flavor was way sour. When I brought it to their attention, they claimed it had something to do with the recipe. However, the next time I had them, the sour flavor wasn't there. 

Prices mostly seem fair and the parking is decent. Two things bug me though.  Two bucks for marginal coffee is a rip and check out my photo of the glass with the residue. That's unacceptable.

It's not bad but I wouldn't venture off the expressway for it.
fresh, delicious food in a clean,modern restaurant with courteous staff! Our  favorite breakfast spot in the area! We've been going for a few years and have never been disappointed!

The healthy start dish was average. The taste was bland and the mood was that of an old Chicago diner. 

My meal included a grilled chicken breast, egg whites and Multi-grain pancakes. The grilled chicken breast was acceptable, although, it lacked taste. The egg whites topped with mozzarella were juicy and full or taste. The pancakes had too much cinnamon.

Worst service ever.  I'm actually rating this as I sit here. Sat within 10 mins of arriving.  And waited over 10 mins for a cup of coffee. Had to ask the hostess to find me a server...5 minutes later had to ask the manager....finally got coffee and the order I but waited Another 10 mins for my son to get his little cup of Orange juice.  Then 30 minutes to get a second cup of coffee.  Won't be back

This morning we decided to go out for breakfast and Eggs Inc was close by.  We have been to the one on Washington St in naperville.  But I must tell you ..I ..we did not like this location. Service was pathetic and our server instead of bring us garden fresh skillet..got us garden fresh omelet. when told her she tell us but I repeated it back to u..yes u did and u said skillet not omelet.  Called a manager and he shows up after we are almost done and tell us may be she misunderstood! !! But do u like it?? I mean yeah skillet to an omelet sure!!! And walks away. No apologies no replacement and no compensation! !! Terrible service and terrible management.  The manager himself had no regrets!  
I would recommend Juicy o or eggsperience! !

Great food and a great atmosphere. Been there three times in the last two weeks for breakfast and each time it was spot on. The food is fantastic, fresh, and the portion sizes will never leave you wanting for more. The service is friendly and fast. 2/3 times the manager stopped by to check on us and even provided a military discount as an added bonus. Highly recommended if you want fresh breakfast with a smile. Best item: baked pancakes or the frittatas!

This is the best breakfast place I have ever eaten at.  The omelets are great, incredible hash browns and the best fresh squeezed orange juice.  My adult sons also love it but they order different items.

I had to get in today to try the Pineapple Upside Down Pancakes, not what I was expecting, too sweet. 

There usually seems to be an issue with their WiFi but Penn Station's is available. All too often you have to ask for a coffee refill, even when it's slow. Too much standing around and socializing by the servers.
Only reason didn't get 5 stars was because didn't get any refills on drinks.. Food was great .. The cost was decent

Never, ever, disappoints me here.  Great food, and quick service.  Friendly servers too! Prices are decent. I never have had a bad experience here. I recommend this place for breakfast anytime. I like their skillets. 
If I have more time, I recommend the torpedo burger! 
There are lots if people that have negative reviews, I have always had a positive experience here. It's worth trying. You won't be disappointed.

I really want to love this place. I really do but I can't seem to find anything on the menu that blows me away. I tried the kefi torpedo ( the sandwich in Chicago's best) and was not thrilled. I've had bacon waffles and I've had the beef dip. All have just been satisfactory. 

While the place is very close to my house the best part about that is only that it IS close to my house. The food is just good enough to enjoy. I like the atmosphere, the staff are great and they have some cool ideas like their stuffed pancakes. 

Overall it's a nice little restaurant with a decent menu and a nice staff/interior. Eating here shouldn't become a regular thing unless it's easy for you to get to. Don't go out of your way for this place.

My server was Steve and he was awesome! Extremely friendly and attentive to our needs. He went above and beyond for our picky tastes. They brought us flavored coffee creamer and even labeled it for us. The food is amazing, too!

The food, service and atmosphere is fabulous. My husband is picky on restaurants and we fell in love. We will definitely be making this our new favorite place for breakfast and lunch. Our server was great and very attentive.

Last weekend we were headed west for shopping so you might as well have breakfast, hey, why not?

We yelped breakfast places in Bolingbrook and found this pleasant cafe.  What I loved the most was coming in and seeing piles of fresh oranges in a juicer.  I have only seen one of those once before, in a cafe in Madrid so I already felt like I was on a vacay, olé!

It is a very clean, fast moving restaurant with friendly servers and host.  There are lots of tables and booths so we did not have to wait.  I had a large glass of the delicious orange juice and as previously mentioned, I was on a pretend hispanic holiday.  so the obvious choice was the MARGARITA SEÑORITA frittata which is as much fun to eat as it is to order.  Full disclosure:  I ordered it without the jalapeño and my server stuck around and was very solicitous about checking that they had made it that way, which they did.

Add to it a crispy English muffin, served dry just the way I like them and you have a solid breakfast.  We also had coffee and some hilarious children at the table next to us to round out a nice Sunday morning.  

Sigh of contentment.  I love going out to breakfast!

Waitress was nice but had blue stained hands, which made me wonder about the restaurants cleanliness. Ordered traditional  Eggs Benedict with fruit and I was not impressed. I've had better at Dennys. The fruit cup had unripe melon and the English muffin was of a poor quality and the hollindase sauce was separated. Cheap eats but not a destination place.

This restaurant has been a family favorite since they opened. We come here almost every Sunday for brunch. It's the first place we think of when we want to go out for breakfast.  Pete and team are the best!
Never had a bad meal here. Service is great. Staff is friendly and always smiling . Even during busy hours.

Always impressed with the menu choices and some really delicious skillet/omelets. I keep thinking this place will be like the other breakfast joints in the area, but I  leave feeling it was unexpectedly better than I planned for.  Cannot think of a better place in the Bbrook area.

Some of the dishes here are great.  Definitely overpriced, including $4 OJ.  My issue here was the Huevos skillet.  It was green! And despite that the eggs were glowing green, I tried to eat it anyway and it was so gross that I had to complain to the sweet server (something I really don't like doing).  This dish was that unpleasant that I took pics of it at the table and texted them to people.  Anyways, their biscuits and gravy IS worth recommending. 
I would say Eggs Inc serves up a nice egg. But an egg is an egg, and they're $1 a carton so I'd rather go to a goooood place (think Butterfields, Egg Harbor, Honey Jam) then pay $9 for a .50 cent egg at Eggs Inc.

Egg's Inc is good and they have some different things to try. I like their sausage as it is unique

I usually order scrambled eggs and their sausage links plus some strawberries. I love their sausage links because they are different than most but not overly spicy. 

The coffee has a distinct taste and I always enjoy at least a cup or two. Service is great, seating is comfortable with plenty of booths and also tables. Servers are prompt and attentive. 
I have dietary restrictions so I can not eat the potatoes and bread that come with the meal and they do not charge me extra to sub out the strawberries. 

My husband usually orders a regular breakfast which comes with an ample helping of hash browns and choice of bread. Our bill usually comes to around $23. 

We will definitely continue to enjoy our breakfasts at Eggs Inc in Bolingbrook eggsincorporated.com
Love, love, love!!! Best in town and around, you can tell they all take pride in the food and the cleanliness of the place is amazing!!

Eggs, Inc. gets it right!

Excellent food!
Excellent service!
Friendly atmosphere!
Reasonably priced!

I'm quite upset.

I live 6+ hours away and would love to sample the menu beyond what I was able to do.  

Had a great omelette with avocado, jalapeno and other goodness.  Good pancakes and hashbrowns.  Significant portion size for the cost.  Lots of other unique breakfast items on the menu that interested me which is hard to do, I love breakfast but usually stick to the basics.  

Service was great, food was great.  Pleasant atmosphere.  Would definitely go again.
Great service but the food was just okay. The waitress was really sweet and attentive, the place overall is nice but maybe too cramped up on weekend mornings.

Been here 2 times.  Each time I was ignored or looked at like I was breaking up a social club. 2nd time, I waited for someone to acknowledge and seat me (wasn't busy and again,  felt like I was a nuisance). I waited 5 or so minutes as workers stood to the side of me talking and just ended up walking out.  Food is good, so 3 stars for food but nothing else spectacular.

This place has been in the back of my mind for quite some time, but decided to go this morning after seeing their segment last night on "Chicago's Best". While I did not get the Torpedo burger, I had a very tasty skillet. The omelet the girl had was also really good. 

Oddly enough, the silverware left a solid impression with me. It was big and with some weight to it. For some reason I loved that. 

Also, I don't understand how people are complaining about price. Two people/2 breakfasts/2 cups of coffee ~ $20. That's pretty standard at any similar sit-down breakfast. 

At the end of the day, it's worth a trip. I can see my future and that future includes the Torpedo Burger

I was ready for this to be my new diner/breakfast option when visiting the family, I really was, but I think we all know that its not. The space was cute and the staff was extremely friendly, but the most important thing, the food, was pretty mediocre. The omelets looked like an egg hash that were force pressed into a football shape, and that's about how they tasted. The build your own omelets were a little outrageously priced, so I tried one of the existing ones (the Hollywood I think?) and tried to just remove some items to make it to my liking. The omelet I got is essentially just an avocado and mushroom omelet, something i get all the time, but for reasons I can't quite understand the one at Eggs Inc comes with three different cheeses, tons of garlic, and sour cream. In fact, lots of their omelets come with sour cream and most of those are not remotely of the "southwestern" varietal. 

No one else at our table had anything that looked terribly appetizing either. I might return, but would probably play it extra safe with a basic eggs/toast/meat arrangement. Better yet, I'll cast my vote for a trip to Colonial instead, where the omelets have actual avocado slices in them (not mushed up stuff that might be pre-bought paste) and taste a whole lot better for about $2 less.

I admit, I've only been here for breakfast, but lunch is a definite on my  "to do"  list.

The menu is EXTENSIVE and there are daily specials.  It takes a while just to go through the menu.

They will happily make substitutions upon request.

Food came out quickly and hot, just the way food should be served.  Portions are overly generous AND if you are not satisfied they will happily exchange it for something else.

Our waiter was very attentive and his suggestions only made the final decision MORE difficult.

Just a tip, if you are driving southbound on Weber, turn left at Lily Cache and then you can turn in at the next drive, which is the back side of the building.

I'm not impressed.

My friend and I were planning to go to Chipolte next door, but at the last minute decided to try Eggs, Inc. instead.

We should have gone with the burritos.

It wasn't crowded at all when we were there, but service was so slow. We were seated immediately, and then promptly ignored. We waited forever to place our orders. The food was just so-so.

And then we were ignored again. We needed refills on our coffee, and our server was busy chatting with other staff. She seemed annoyed that I finally asked a busboy for coffee.

I was planning to order dessert, but by the time the server came back, we were out of time. 

We won't be back.

Best coffee I have ever had in the states.

Food was good, service was great, will definitely be back again.

Eggs inc is awesome. We stop here almost every sunday with our kids. They are fast and food is great. It's close too. Overall you can't go wrong. 

Try little Billy combo. Crepes, eggs, sausage and bacon. Mmmmm

I really liked it. My omelet was huge and the service is great. My only recommendation would be that they came over to our table 5 or 6 times, which is definitely better than poor service. However, I kind of got sick of getting interrupted.

Other than that, I really like it. They have a huge selection, the atmosphere is nice, and the food was great.

Bolingbrook has been patient long enough...finally a breakfast and brunch cafe has emerged on Weber Rd. Of course this entire block is filled with a variety of eating choices, however Eggs, Inc has just taken the trophy with their new presence. 

My buddy and I were immediately greeted by a young staff full of smiles eagerly awaiting to serve us. Although this restaurant is new the friendly "hello" goes along way in my book. Lets talk decor...comfortable earth tone colors and spacious booths that do not have you hugging the table. I immediately noticed the fresh squeezed orange juice machine at the hostess station. That's a great seller so I will take one of those and a cup of coffee. Cream and sugar is on the table however would love to have had the option for the flavored coffee creamer, I didn't see it so I didn't ask for it. 

Let me dive in and order a skillet. I chose the "Yo Adrian" since its not everyday I can say that to a random stranger taking my food order. Plus the fact its loaded with Italian sausage, spinach, tomato and cheese sounded macho and tasted fabulous! My buddy ordered the "El Gordo" skillet with chorizo sausage, jalapenos, avocados, onions and both monterey & cheddar cheese. The presentation was clever with a wood like bottom plate that would house my skillet in place. Silverware was above average and comfortable to hold, although may be a tad heavy for the young kids. 

Great experience, fresh food and thank you for the prompt coffee refills. I did catch the name Gus on the way out. Friendly manager keeping a watchful eye on his staff. Keep up the good work Eggs, Inc Cafe, I would love for you all to stay a long while.
The omelets were nice, fluffy, moist and delicious. The cantaloupe was not quite ripe enough but it is nice they have fruit as an option for a side instead of hash browns.
Didn't get coffee refills, oj fresh squeezed, food average for breakfast, bacon was thin

Yummmm!! I really enjoyed the food here, service was helpful and really quick. Everytime I went to Chipotle, I would pass it, but it'd always was closed! So when I saw this joint on ABC7, I knew I had to get on down. My mom & I didn't have much time so we put in the orders quickly and shockingly, it came quickly.
we go there at 11:35, 
ordered at 11:40, 
11:54 we ate. [we also told them we were in a rush]
I got a simple platter of pancakes [new place, played it safe.] and my mom got a chicken panini and lentil soup. She enjoyed the soup very much. Pancakes were soft and sweet. Wish I had more syrup. :\ 
I suggest this place most def. They do close early, so hurry, hurry. The bill came and we were astounded it only cost $18.00! At honey jam, we paid 30.00 for just us 2!

Very impressed with this new Bolingbrook breakfast/lunch spot. Easy to find at the corner of Weber Road and Lilly Cache and plenty of parking.  All new insides, converted from the old Zale's Jewelry Outlet store, with wood floors and river stone trim walls, the place looks very clean--no smudged hand/head prints on the windows, no crumbs on the seats.  The owner made a point to check with every table and even took up my credit card payment for the busy waiter.  Wait staff very friendly and checked back to the table often.  

Breakfast food was outstanding. Food was hot and served quickly--they know what they are doing in the kitchen.  Wife had fresh blueberry crepes that were great and I had the bananas Foster special: banana bread French Toast with caramelized cinnamon  bananas Foster and a vanilla creme drizzle.  Outstanding.  

Only weak spot was the coffee.  Seemed to be a little "off" maybe too long on the burner?   

Highly recommended.

Found this hidden gem while moving into the area. A great down home diner with a large menu to choose from. I wish they were open for dinner too. I had an excellent tuna melt and my friend an omelette. Food and service were both excellent, will be going back when in need of lunch or brunch.
I love this place, it is now my favorite breakfast place. Great coffee, super nice and fast service, and the food is delicious. Try the Frittatas and the oatmeal with fruit..yummy!

Don't be fooled by the very basic-looking sign. Beyond the doorway, you'll find a cozy breakfast place and excellent food! Coffee was great and service was spot on. I had the Margarita Senorita frittata which was amazing - eggs, avocado, jalapenos, bacon, onions, potatoes... yum! They had a broad menu, and other great sounding specials - the banana bread french toast was another one that jumped out at me.

I'll definitely be back!

I went to Eggs Inc. with a friend during the weekday when it wasn't very busy. The waitress was friendly, and food was o.k., but overpriced. The second time I went was on a Sunday morning. They were very busy. The people weren't friendly at all. A guy grabbed menus and walked away. We weren't certain if we were supposed to follow or not. We did, and when we got to the table, he was in the process of tossing our utensils and menu onto the table. Our waiter wasn't friendly at all; very abrupt, and spoke as though he had had enough for the day. Our food was mediocre; toast was barely warm, pancakes not fluffy but dry and hard on the outside. I prefer the old IHOP that closed...McDonalds probably also better. Like I said before, the food is overpriced. I should have stopped going after the first time. I'll try Taco Bell breakfast before I go again.
