I've taken the family here on several occasions for breakfast.  The food and service is always good and they seem to appreciatte the business.  Can't go wrong with eggs, bacon and crispy hash browns followed by pancakes.

While there was no wait, there was also no greeting at the door. After standing there in front of 3 staff members for a moment- I said "table for two please" they looked at me like I was annoying them. 
The menu is very extensive, and I order an omelet and the other person I was with order a fruit salad flatbread with chips. The omelet came out hot, but it was as if they had cooked the eggs and then added the other parts as a topping, lumping each part together... The flatbread was pretty thick and the fruit salad poorly rolled into it. Upon eating the flatbread my companion noted it to be stale and very difficult to eat. The chips that came with it were soggy. The waiter was very gracious when we told him that it was not great- but kept insisting on bring out more food- which we said no to. Surprisingly they did not make is pay- but we will not be returning. :-(

My in-laws had breakfast every Sunday at the same place for nearly 20 years.  They had a falling out with the establishment, and searched all over area for their new Sunday morning coffee and eggs benedict delivery mechanism.  And now their new Sunday morning routine involves a stop here at Eggs, Inc.  

Having tagged along with them several times in the last few months I can see why.  The breakfast skillets are mind-blowing.  My wife is a huge fan of the apple crepes, my daughter owns the Mickey Mouse pancakes, and my father-in-law recommends pretty much anything on the menu that involves a combination of meat and eggs.

The staff is great, and can have a breakfast for a table of 5 in under 10 minutes.  

This is a fantastic place and I highly recommend it as a regular breakfast stop.

Fast and friendly restaurant waits for you in this gem off Weber Road in Bolingbrook.  I had such a great experience when I went earlier today.  I was in a lunch rush in between appointments, advised them that I needed to get in and out of there with some urgency, and got treated like a king.  I was greeted by my server, Demetri, who I totally recommend.  He knows his menu and paid close attention to my needs.  Kept my coffee topped, and brought out my complimentary soup which was delish! 

The restaurant itself is great.  Nice and cozy, warm colors and great decor.  I was greeted by two of the owners who took the time to chat with me and encouraged me to come back.  

Today I had the California Dream which was out of this world.  Grilled chicken, topped with bacon and avocado, and I had mine served on Panini.  It was paired with kettle style pepper chips which made for a great lunch.  When in town, I will most definitely come back.
Go in and ask for Demetri.
Food was delish and service was great!!!

Our family has frequented Eggs Inc several times for breakfast - we've never been disappointed. Favorites include the Traditional Eggs Benedict, Asparagus Omelette, Italian Omelette and Biscuits and Gravy.   Meal portions lean towards being generous. Service has been prompt and friendly.   Eggs Inc.gets a solid recommendation!

My husband and I go out for a weekend breakfast a couple times a month and choose Eggs, Inc. about half the time.  The  food is delicious and you get alot of it for the cost.  Definitely a good bang for the buck! 

Can be a longish wait on the weekend and there is very little space inside to wait so I always feel bad for the people sitting in the front who have the waiting people hovering around them.  

Once you've been seated, the service is fast and your food comes out quickly.  Will keep going back!

I had 2 eggs over easy with hash browns and cheese blintzes. Yummy! The crepes were a little thicker than your typical crepe but it didnt detract from the taste. The eggs weren't runny like they sometimes can be when ordering over easy. I paid a little extra for the blintzes, but I had to try them... I can't ever find them any more! The service was outstanding!! I had Dave as my server and he was super friendly, the whole staff was!! It's a much more pleasant dining experience when the service is so good.

I tried Eggs, Inc. for the first time today. Since Ilove breakfast, but not morning, it's nice that they're open until 3pm. We were there around 1pm and it was only about half full.

I decided to treat myself this morning and tried the Chunky Monkey pancakes - made from chocolate batter, drizzled with chocolate sauce, peanut butter and chocolate chips and topped with b-a-n-a-n-a-s. A great sweet treat for the morning. The side of turkey sausage links was very standard, but a necessary salty to go with all of that sweet. 

My friend had a skillet with avocados, jalapeños, chorizo, onions, eggs, hash browns and Monterey jack cheese. He also really enjoyed his meal.

The service was excellent; the waiter was attentive without being annoying. Our water and coffee were never allowed to get empty before someone offered to top them off. I gathered that the man who sat us, Gus, was the owner. It's nice to see restaurant owners participating in the service at their establishment.

Another great perk about Eggs, Inc is for XSport gym members. I had seen an ad at the gym and found out that members receive 10% off Mon-Fri with their membership card. Vinnie came and introduced himself to us and explained the benefit. I really felt welcome at the restaurant and enjoy supporting local business, as we are Bolingbrook residents.

I would like to try more of the menu, as sweet pancakes are not the norm for me, however the meal we had was delicious and I would definitely go back. We already talked about becoming regulars after our first visit!

Great job, Gus! We look forward to visiting again!

I was visiting my sister in her neck of the woods and we decided to go get some brunch on Sunday morning. So there was a bit of a wait. No big deal. Once we were seated at our table their service was great. 

I ordered egg whites, hash browns, and turkey sausage. My sister ordered a omelet and my mom ordered a skillet which was super big. Over all food was good and if I'm in the area I'll be sure to stop by.

Not impressed. Went in today around noon and was met by a crowd (to be expected on a Sunday so no big deal to me). We made our way to the register and were ignored by 2 employees. More diners came in after us and were promptly greeted and added to the waiting list for a table. I politely ask for a table for 2 and bite my tongue about being there first and being ignored. Fast forward 15 minutes and we are seated (or shall I say waved to "that booth over there") by one of the employees. I felt completely unwelcome at that point and should've just left but decided that we waited and finally made it to a table so we might as well stay to try out the food. 

As soon as we are seated our waiter came to take our drink orders and returns a few minutes later. Without saying a word, he put the drinks down and walked away. We wait a few more minutes more and he comes back to take our orders. Another server brings us our food (I ordered a cheese omelet with pancakes and hash browns) and forgets to bring syrup for my pancakes. We asked 2 other employees for syrup and by the time it was brought to the table my pancakes were cold.  

I understand that we were there at a busy time on a busy day but I felt ignored, rushed, and insulted. The menu is quite expansive and while perusing the menu I found myself picking meals I would like to try in the future but my omelet was nothing to write home about, my pancakes were cold by the time syrup arrived, and the prices were a little too high for the bad service and mediocre food. I will gladly take my business elsewhere.

The food is yummy and service is good. My hubby gets the skirt steak and eggs and I get the crepes. We both enjoy our food. We get our son the Mickey Mouse pancake, which is cute. On our last visit, there was a very long hair on our sons sausage. The server apologized and brought us a new one. However, we would have handled it a little better, being that we were both servers in the past. All in all, we like it there, so we'll go back.

My first time eating here was a fabulous experience.  My daughter was given a coloring pad with crayon and a cup with straw.  Not only were the hostesses and our waitress friendly and knowlegeable, but the food was good too.  We had the Hercules Omelet and Nutella Crepes.

The Hercules had gyros and yummy cheese.  It was super creamy.  I have never had an omelet this tasty before.  The Nutella Crepes had, in addition, fresh strawberries and bananas with cinnamon.  It was really tasty and had just the right amount of sweetness.

Oh, and many of their breakfast and lunch items are under $10, if not all.  Thanks, Gus, for coming into town.  I believe my family and I will be frequenting often.

Meh. I've eggsperienced less eggspensive pancake houses. Last weekend we decided to go out to breakfast for Easter Sunday. Went over to Honey Jam Cafe over on Boughton. The wait was at 1 hour, 15 minutes. People climbing over each other and babies being born. I'm not kidding you. Boy-Oh-Boy do we wish we waited it out. Headed over to Eggs Inc (aka Eggspensive, Inc.) instead of waiting.

Wow! No wait at all. We were so excited. Nice decor, ice cold pancakes? Mom ordered 2 over easy eggs with bacon, how do you really mess that up?  Bacon tasted off. I won't even begin to describe what happened to the bathroom afterwards. Glad I wasn't home. 

Fake, curly hair waitress complemented my grandmother on her hidious hat. You're kidding? Then along came another waitress who said the same thing. Are they schooled to do this? Overkill sucks. Calm down on the useless butt kissing, you'll get a tip. Better luck next time, if there is one. I reccomend going to the airport across the street for breakfast. Good Price, consistantly good food. And no BS'ing for tips.

Fantastic selection, great food, consistently great food and service. Priced right too. Definitely one of my favorite places to dine.  The only con is that once you've gone there a few times you may have a hard time deciding what to get. I'm getting hungry thinking about it.

This place was very expensive.  The food was just ok, nothing to write home about.  The staff was kind of slow but very friendly.  They did have a lot of options to choose from.

There's not a lot of choices like this one in Bolingbrook.  We will go again and try something different.

You could never go wrong with anything that you order off of this menu.  Every dish is is made with fresh, quality ingredients.  The hard work that the owner puts into Eggs Inc shows.  I have only been twice so far - once for breakfast and once for lunch.  

This afternoon, my boyfriend and I went for lunch.  He ordered the stuffed pineapple, a chicken salad dish with fruit, cottage cheese, and egg on the side.  I got the Inc Cobb - chocked full of avocado, bacon, blue cheese, and delicious salad fixings.  

This place has gotten so much press lately and they truely deserve it!  Please don't pass on the amazing breakfast/lunch experience.

A new place, but really good. The only thing that disappointed was the service. I had asked for no cheese in my omelet because I am lactose intolerant and behold, my omelet had cheese. Then I had to wait another 20 minutes for another one.

Also, they did not have any kind of non-dairy creamer or soy milk for my coffee, so I had to run over to Caribou (right next door) to get some soy for my coffee. 

I would definitely go again though, because the food is great!!

Great solid breakfast/brunch.  Its close, its dependable, it has a huge menu, I always get a table right away and the servers are great. Ive come many times with just my husband and with a crowd and never have a problem getting a table right away, which is rare on Saturday/Sunday morning brunch time in the burbs.   What more could you ask for?  Never tried their lunch so I cant speak to that, however, I really like all the options they have for breakfast.  I usually end up with the "fussy gus", a make your own omelet type deal with plenty of options.  Portions are huge and fresh.  Come hungry!  Leave happy!  And with leftovers for the next day's breakfast.
Love love love !!!!!!! As simple as that! Everyone go here!!!!!

I'm so pleased that Bolingbrook has finally got a Breakfast place, I hope to see more!

The food was great, I felt that the hash browns could have been a little more cooked, but they were very good either way. Our server was nice and attentive, at the end was a little slow at getting our checks together and what not, but as someone who once use to be a server I understand that things happen so not really a big deal. 

I plan to come back here again, although being that it's new I worry that I may run into issues when it's busy judging by others comments.

Service always on. They are always packed and even with that said.. The food still seams to come in a decent amount of time. Huge selection to choose from. I haven't ever had any thing bad there. Prices are nice and affordable. Nice amount of food. Filling.. The place is well located but parking can be challenging. The  Interior is plain.. But who cares. It's breakfast/lunch.

A very spacious restaurant. I went on a friday morning (10:30-11ish) for breakfast and it wasn't too crowded. Service was friendly and they gave off a very homely, casual vibe. very laid back and nice. I got the stuffed french toast and my only complaint is that you have to order sides (hash browns, bacon, etc) with pancake and french toasts separately because they are not included with the meal.

Very disappointed. Went for the torpedo burger after seeing it on tv the night before. Show up at 2:30, are ready to order by 2:35 husbands going to have the Elvis waffles and I'm having the torpedo burger, waitress takes off when I give my order comes back to let me know the can not make my burger due to it taking a half and hour and they close at 3... We drove an hour to get this lunch. Orange juice was good as was the coffee but seriously? We then asked for our checks and left. May I just add it does not state in the menu that this burger takes this long :( a wasted LONG trip.
Strange to see so many negative reviews. The service and food have always been great. I absolutely love the hash and eggs
I don;'t know what they hype is? it was good but not worth the hour wait on saturday.
Freshest orange juice I've ever had. Any pancake item is a win.

I am excited we finally have a breakfast place on the west end of Bolingbrook.  That's a plus!  Haven't tried the airport, but it's on my list.  Food at Eggs, Inc. is okay - very average, but okay.  Coffee is okay.  I had a Pancho Villa Omelet - there were so many peppers in it the egg turned green and it was too spicy to eat.  I also prefer an omelet where the ingredients are wrapped in the egg, as opposed to cooked into it. I've been back a few times - nice to have a local option.  Eggs benedict is okay - order the sauce on the side.
Food was okay, just plain ole. The Bacon on the other hand was plain terrible! Tastes like it was cooked last week. Service was so-so.  Would not try again.
A+ all the way around! Great pizza,communication and customer service! If a mistake happens the owners will call u with no excuses just apologizes to make it better!!
Quality has gone down, used to be my go to pizza place.

Order the buffalo wing pizza with blue sauce / ranch sauce. It's their undeclared signature dish. 
Fresh quality ingredients. Yummm...

Very friendly manager.

Secret! They are willing to do off menu items - like an Italian beef pizza. I wish I knew it before I bought my Italian beef sandwich.

They lost me on the deep-dish, but totally won me back over with the chicken alfredo pizza. Having delivery choices is a new concept to me. I used to live in Willow Springs in a weird area where delivery options were a choice between two places. Now that I'm in DG I'm overwhelmed by the plethora of dining options. 

John and Eddie's sent me a coupon as part of a new mover packet, so we gave them a try. And their deep dish pizza was just terrible. The sauce tasted like unseasoned stewed tomatoes. The crust was rubbery and gross, and the outside was just flavorless. Not to mention the fact that my delivery dude must've carried it sideways because almost half the sauce slid off onto a corner of the box. 

But then we took a bite of the chicken alfredo pizza and something magical happened. My taste buds danced around my mouth and I regretted ordering that shitty deep dish disaster, because this? This is where it's at. Forget the red sauce, John and Eddie. You do alfredo. You do you. You do delicious. 

All is forgiven for effing up the dd and sliding sauce all over my clean counters. Bring me another alfredo and we'll be friends forever. BFFs even.

So I've been here quite a few times. We always get a barbeque chicken pan pizza and also a size of garlic breadsticks because USUALLY they're amazing. I haven't been here in a while so I don't know if they just got new staff that aren't all there or if these high school kids are super lazy. So I call at about 830 pm on a weeknight to pickup and order of breadsticks. They tell me 15 minutes. 

I get there a little early because I only live down the street. I sat in my car waiting, which wasn't a problem at all. But all of the kids working just stared at me as if they didn't want me there right before closing. (Specifically a tall young girl with brown curly hair)  so as I'm still waiting in my car they just keep staring. 

THEN they just are all standing behind the counter texting on their phones as if a customer isn't right there. So finally I walk in to go pick up my food. I get all the way home to open up my box and see that  MY BREADSTICKS ARE FULL OF HOT SQUISHY RAW dough.  

I used to like this place but after this I'm definetly not coming back. Clearly John has a bunch of staff that could care less about the place or what their customers eat. Either that or they're just a bunch of lazy teenagers. Pick up the slack John get some new people who know how to actually work. And to the staff Thanks for ruining a good place for me. I will not be coming back. 

BEWARE. EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK. And before driving half way home make sure you check your food to see if it's thoroughly cooked. Wouldn't doubt if someone caught food poisoning. They don't care.

My family loves the pan pizza here!  They definitely use great ingredients, but they use an excess amount of sauce.  The thin crust is just as good, but I think the amount of sauce on the thin crust has the perfect amount of sauce.

Terrible service!
Ordered at 5:34, called at 7:03 looking for my order? It will be going out shortly I was told. Pathetic service! Should have told 1:30 -2:00 hour wait.  Couldn't understand why I was upset.  Too many great choice's for Pizza in this neighborhood; Dan's, Mrs T's, Uncle Petes, Angelo's, etc who offer good service.

This will probably be my new go to pizza place, they sell fries!

I tried their pan pizza and was fan of their crust. Only draw back was cheese didn't stay on the pizza when you lifted it out of the box. 

Wings were ok, wasn't a huge fan but ok.

On our way to the Arboretum this past Wednesday we decided to yelp nearby pizza joints and came across this place.

Delicious mozzarella sticks and Hawaiian pizza.

BOTH pizza - by - the - slice options in pepperoni and cheese were ok. The dough was thick and maybe it's made thicker to hold better in the warming tray? The made to order pizza dough tasted better to us. 

Really nice counter girl.  But the tables weren't wiped down and no one was there at 130pm.

Went to the DQ spot next for for dessert. 

If I'm in the area we'll stop by again.

This pizza is not worth the $$$.. Same pizza as Pizza Hut. I grew up in Berwyn where ordering pizza was hard because so many places where great!!! Moved out west and it's the opposite. I've been out here for over 10 years and still haven't found a place that's great and consistent. Even places like Falco's and Al's from Cicero are great all the time are so hit or miss out here and the prices turn you away cause your worried it's gonna suck.. This is one of those situations. Don't gamble on this one.. You'll loose.. Their thin crust is thick and soft even the edge of the crust. Sauce it decent and ingredients. But  a thin crust pizza is suppose to have a thin crust with a nice thin crispy edge. That my opinion.. Don't waste your time or money!!!!

Stopped in here for a quick lunch and knew that I was in trouble as I was the only one here during what should have been a busy time of day. Ordered two slices of pizza which were terrible. I ate less than one piece and tossed it and the other slice out. The crust was very soggy and the toppings were not good. Maybe just a bad day but I won't be back.

We have been going here since it first opened a few years back. At first they were all over the place with delivery times. They would quote and hour and it would take 2, or they would quote an hour and a half and it would be here in 45 minutes. We kept going back though because the pizza was so good. I absolutely love their cheese stuffed breadsticks and their mac and cheese bites!! I'm so glad they figured out their delivery times because the last handful of times we have ordered they have been right on target!!
Great thin crust pizza! We tried it for the first time tonight and really enjoyed it. Will be our go to pizza place from now on!

Picking a new pizza place to try is always a daring event considering most areas are saturated with "We're the best pizza in town!" places. But for a random pick, I was pretty pleased with this place. Crust was great, tasty sauce and I loved the amount of toppings. Nice pizza, and reasonably priced. Oh and you gotta order the garlic sauce!

So I don't love the Chicago pizza scene as much as the natives. Usually it comes down to the crust and the grease. In all the places I've tried so far, it's been weak on the former, too much on the latter. My one friend loved Jets, but honestly if I wanted to eat cardboard, I could do it cheaper than that. And Girodano's was pretty eh outside of their decent deep dish, which has not broken the internet, as promised.

But J&E's puts together a really solid pizza. The crust is crisp, and the ingredients are well balanced, overall, it's well above average and I'd recommend it to anyone.

I wish I could give it 4.5 because I feel like 4 is under selling it, but it's not a 5. It just isn't all there to make it perfect.

I called yesterday for the first time. The pizza was ok, didn't wow me. I'm rating them 0 star for the employee who were taking orders! I called to place my order and started with the toppings when he yelled at me and said "SiZE!". Omg I said calm the down!!! Wow the attitude! Why can't you say it nicely that you need to know the size first before the toppings?! My gosh it was just  pizza LMAO! That would be my first and last order, that's for sure!!!
Good stuff at this place. Had the chicken wrap and fries. It was a great lunch. Was temped to try the pizza but my stomach was already on full. Next time...
I didn't try the pizza at this place but judging by the quality of the sandwiches I don't know what the pizza would taste like.

The lunch deal of two pieces of pizza and a pop for six bucks is great. The taste is mediocre at best,  similar to a jets pizza or a sarpinos,  but it's close and clean.  Beware of the order taker,  she sports hickies which is repulsive to me. The people could use more smiles as well. It's as if there's a dark cloud of nothingness looming over the employees.

Disclaimer - this review will likely be thrown out as hearsay as I disdain the good name of Chicago legacy pizza . . . but . . . Literally still chewing and wiping off my fingertips in order to not dirty the keyboard but attempting to give a semi-coherant review. Executive Summary - Non conformist pizza makes me happy! Granted, I am not a Chicago native (midwest but not chicago) nor am I a hipster, but I have never really been convinced that i have found the mecca of all things pizza dwelling in chi-town and the surrounding burbs. Cracker crust? Why didnt i I just melt some cheese over some saltines? Butter crust combined with unholy gobs of cheese n meat, of course tasty but not balanced by any means, literally an assault to my arteries. Anywho, while eating this pizza tonight I am impressed as it does not try to stake its value prop based off of the tired cliche. The crust is just, what do you call it . . . fresh? Not thin, not thick, just legitimate. The sauce? Gratuitous but complimentary. My mushrooms were cut fresh and the cheese was soft, melty and not ridiculously salty. It's pizza, my friends. Substantial, original, and just damn tasty. A 'za I would be happy to try again or at least con my in-law into liking  :)

Spontaneously stopped in to bring dinner home. We ordered BBQ chicken pizza and bread sticks. The BBQ sauce on the pizza was delicious. We had breadsticks with and without cheese. They were very soft and garlicky. We will definitely order here again.

Recently ordered from them . Carry out both times. Pizza both times . Service was above average, as was the food. Better than conventional fast food piZza suppliers and competitively priced . Will be doing business with them again.

Stopped here on a whim having driven by it a few times. Recently moved to the area and we have been trying different pizza places/restaurants. They had a pretty large menu with both Pizza's and sandwiches. We opted for a sandwich. I had a roast beef and my wife had a buffalo chicken. The place is very clean and the guys behind the counter very nice. But took two bites out of each sandwich and ended up throwing the rest away. We might try pizza next time.

I grew up on Southside Chicago pizza- the corner shop that made a fresh and hot and consistently great pizza.  I FINALLY found consistently great thin crust pizza outside of the city!
We've ordered from here pick up and delivery about 5 times now and we are hooked. Also a plus are the wings- we love the mild buffalo and tonight I discovered the terriyaki!  WOO HOO- those are my new favorite.  They are sweet and savory and I might just tell my husband he won't like them so I can have them to myself :)

Frankly I feel like arguing about "who has the best pizza" in the Chicagoland area is like arguing about who has the best hotdog.  Or for that matter, how many licks does it take to get to the center of a Tootsie Pop?  That being said, I enjoyed their pizza and it wasn't that overpriced.  Very courteous staff - that is a big thumbs up in my book.  The staff just "got it."  They helped clip the coupon from their flier and asked if I needed any napkins or parmesan.  My wife and family enjoyed the pizza even though my kids like Little Caesars too..... all jokes aside, pizza was good.  Well done.

I'm hesitant to even give this place one star. We decided to try john and eddies because the pizza place their building used to house was pretty good. Wrong decision. We got a thin crust sausage pizza and I'm not joking when I say it made Dominos look good (and I hate dominos). The crust, instead of being thin and crunchy, was more doughy and about a 1/4 inch thick--it just tasted bad...and it's hard to screw up pizza. The sausage looked like the kind you'd find freeze dried on a frozen pizza. I don't like giving bad reviews, especially for new businesses, but hopefully this will help the pizza improve! I will say, we ordered hot wings as well and they were decent...but the pizza was atrocious!

Pretty decent pizza.  If you like really thin crust, go with the ultra thin because the thin crust isn't what I would normally expect for thin.  I also recommend staying away from the Italian Sausage.  Out of the 2 pizzas we got the only thing we didn't like was the Italian sausage.  We would go back.

Stopped here after a hectic day. We were hungry and just had a taste for pizza.  Saw this place from one destination to another and stopped.  We didn't get anything fancy, just a couple simple pizzas, one reg crust and one thin crust.  Both arrived looking and smelling fantastic.  My son is picky about his pizza and he loved it.  Mine was good, but could have used just a little bit more cheese, the thin crust was just crispy enough without tasting like a cracker.  Definitely will go back and try some of their other offerings.

Kinda tired of my usual pizza place on maple ave, drove a few blocks further last night and ordered from here. I think it was a different pizza place before. Anywho the pizza was awesome, and will order again. Pineapple and bacon was wicked good. Menu is good has a lot of options, and the salad was really good too. They have pizzas, sandwiches and also buffalo wings and boneless wings. The owner took my order and seemed like a nice guy. I hope this place sticks around.

Love this place. 

Service is excellent, wine list is exceptional, ambiance is very comfortable, and food is very good. 

When we arrived we ordered a bottle of wine and some appetizers - the lobster avocado salad and lava roll. The server explained that the sushi chef was not in until 5 (it was an early dinner), and that it would take a little longer. It was not a long wait at all. 

Lobster salad was simple and delicious with very fresh ingredients. Sushi roll was excellent and the rice on the roll was still warm!

I got the pork chop duo and my wife got the surf and turf. The pork was cooked perfectly but the beans and kale were the real star of the dish. Absolutely delicious. 

Surf and turf was super cute. 3 little filet medallions with a shrimp on top of each, and a tarragon butter sauce over it. 

Prices are extremely reasonable for what you get. Definitely check out this place.

Parsino is a clean large Organic restaurant in an adorable little quant area In downtown Lagrange.
There are 4 of us. I ordered a Bloody Mary with Grey Goose and it had all the trimmings celery, olives, cucumber, lemon & lime.. Then we got 2 black bean burgers, Mediterranean chicken salad.
The Food is Incredible!!!
The staff are wonderful!!!
Loved our time here and we will be back..
Our hostess Gabrielle was so sweet.
I loved our round booth we had too.

We came here to celebrate my mother's birthday on a Sunday afternoon (4pm). It being the La Grange area, we decided to call ahead and make reservations since our grandma and sick uncle would be joining us (they have trouble moving around). We got there and they hadn't set up the table--I'm assuming because they weren't very busy, but it would've been nice if they had since my grandma can't stand for very long.
Also, they had water dripping from the ceiling and buckets to gather it? It didn't look like the roof was leaking, but maybe it was their AC unit. Kind of dangerous despite the "caution-wet " signs since we had elderly relatives and I'm 9-months pregnant.
Our server was very friendly and patient with our group. We consisted of older Spanish speakers who didn't really understand the menu (first time here) and he took the time to answer any and all (redundant) questions. 
Their lunch menu had many options for my husband and I (we were the younger of the group) but it was difficult for our older relatives to decide since they mainly had salads, sandwiches, and a couple of entrées to offer (not their fault, just making an observation). They had one soup available--it was a creamy chicken & rice soup, delicious. I ordered the tilapia which came on a bed of orzo---very good & fresh. I also ordered the crab cakes, which were just ok in my opinion. They could have had a little more flavor. Just an FYI, they don't have any fountain drinks such as Coke or Pepsi...everything they have is organic and my group did not enjoy the less carbonated "Mexican" version they had available. The lemonade was very delicious and highly recommended. 
I wish I could say I loved the place. Maybe we can try it out at dinner time and see if it's better, but I'm not jumping to the chance to go back.

My family has dined at Prasino twice now. We travel to Illinois at least once a year, and Prasino will definitely be a staple in our rotation of restaurants to visit when we are in town. The restaurant is clean, service excellent, food delicious. However, most important for us is that they went out of their way to meet the needs of family's food allergies.

I have such a love/hate relationship with Prasino. I LOVE the food and I LOVE the concept although I'm a hot dog and fries kind of gal most of the time, I like to shake things up every so often and eat locally grown food sometimes too!

Their appetizers are pretty small so do not expect much, but I recommend the mussels and the lobster avocado. Both are absolutely amazing and light so you can still eat your full entree.

They recently switched up their menu, I think, and I love the new items. All of their fish is always so fresh and delicious. Of course the same goes for any veggie you pick out as a side. I recently tried their sushi for the first time and was incredibly impressed. Of course Nabuki will always be my favorite local sushi spot, but Prasino can satiate my cravings too! 

The only suggestion, it might be a good idea to offer more drinks. I love the green teas and the bloodies during brunch, but sometimes I really want a coke with my healthy fish! I know that sounds weird, but even offering Jones soda would make a world of a difference.

Also, so many time there's a million open tables and the host will tell you it's a 30 minutes wait. Of course, those might be reserved tables but it would be nice if the host said that so you aren't annoyed that you're waiting for 30 minutes while a ghost takes up space on empty tables.

Saturday was the perfect day.  I've lived in Naperville and now I think La Grange was some how hidden from us, so we wouldn't know how good some of its locations are.
Couldn't of asked for a better breakfast and mimosa alternative. You will not be disappointed with starting your day with some bourbon when you order the Kentucky Blue.  It's refreshing, fun, and delicious. The meal will still overshadow your drinks, deservingly so, but they work well together. I had the Corned Beef skillet, which filled me up without being overly full. Next time I'm getting it with sweet potatoes, yes they offer it , or going for the French Toast which I'm being told numerous times to try.

Haven't had Prasino since the Wicker Park location closed; it was always one of my go-tos for brunch. We were meeting my in-laws halfway and I'm happy to report that Prasino in La Grange was it. 

We had reservations at 11:30 on a Saturday morning. The place wasn't packed, but lively and busy enough. Our table was ready right away and our server very friendly and helpful. 

I strayed from my former regular order of the Paris benedict and instead got the tacos rancheros. I think they have tortilla options depending on your preference. I went with my usual corn ones (and, really, nobody should ever be eating flour tortillas...). They were delicious. The portion was quite large and I wasn't able to finish it all. Luckily, my husband did get the Paris benedict for himself so I stole a bite or two. Happy to report that it was just as good as I remembered. My in-laws and SIL were all very happy with their orders too. 

I also had an iced chai which was great (and happy to report that they have almond milk as an option). My husband had a strawberry-pineapple-something juice and it was quite good! You could definitely make it a brunch drink with some schnapps or bubbles.

Have you ever driven by a place seventy bazillion times and been like "nah" and then read reviews of a place on Yelp and been like "hell YEAH!" and then you drive there and you're like "OH WAIT, that's THIS place?" Totally happened to me with Prasino.

So I was so taken with the reviews of this place that my mom, hubs and I came here for brunch today. I'm so glad I did! I kind of can't believe I'd discounted this place for so long. First of all, it's enormous, which I love because huge space = potentially less wait (though there was no wait on a Friday at 10am). The decor is not really my taste but fits right into their ecologically-minded theme. The chairs are comfortable. There's fun booths seemingly encased in brick, and I wish we could have sat there, but alas.

Their menus are exceptional. The drink menu alone left us wanting two-three drinks. I decided on a mocha that was served at the approximate temperature of the sun, but was rich, delicious, and well-made. My husband got a macchiato which came in the neatest double-walled glass. My mom got a chai latte and loved it. Hubs later also got a "honeymoon" quencher, and loved that too.

I decided to get Angela P.'s exact order, because it sounded SOOO right in her review! The pretzel croissant French toast with a side of chicken apple sausage.  The sausage was AMAZING and rivaled the chicken Apple sausage at the bongo room. The croissant French toast was delicious, but definitely better on paper than in reality. Neither pretzels nor croissants are very sweet, and it didn't seem like it sat in the batter long enough to become that creamy dreamy French toast texture. The caramel sauce was maybe cooked a minute too long and had moved from amber golden sweetness to a teensy bit burnt tasting. The white chocolate sauce was good, but there wasn't enough of either sauce, especially because they were served without syrup. I dunno, maybe I'm a sugar fanatic. But "pretzel croissant French toast" promises so much! I wanted more! 

My mom got the chicken chilequiles which was INCREDIBLE. Packed with the most tender, pull-apart chicken on the planet atop a mountain of tortilla chips and nestled in with guacamole, two eggs, and other delightfulness. My husband got the crab cake Benedict which my mother and I adored, but weirdly he got a bite that was ALL black pepper and kind of ruined the whole dish for him. He didn't finish it, but liked the breakfast potatoes that accompanied it. 

All in all, I enjoyed Prasino but for the prices, I expected just a smidge more to make it a 5-star experience. I definitely will come back if I'm in La Grange or to try their dinner menu.

I've been here a handful of times and I've been pleased with my food every time. I LOVE the atmosphere here; you feel like you're in a spa with the bamboo shoots and calming beige coloring. It's very relaxing and fairly posh for a place in La Grange. 

I've tried plenty of the menu, including delicious pancakes, crab cakes, and eggs benedict. There's something for everyone here whether you're vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, or a plain ole omnivore. I really appreciate that the menu specifies which items are vegetarian/vegan since I don't eat red meat. The food is SO good and you can eat feeling completely okay with finishing an entire entree because everything is pretty healthy (nothing has been bathed in oil like so many other restaurants). The atmosphere also makes me feel relaxed, and in a good mood as I enjoy my meal.

My only complaints: It's a little pricier than it should be. Again, this is a suburb, not Chicago, and menu items should be priced accordingly. If I wanted to order an app, drink, and dessert, then I would end up paying probably $80 for two people. We were conscious of this when choosing items to order. Additionally, the service was a little off. All three of the times I've been here, I have made a reservation first and the hostess did not seat us right away. Why even bother making the reservation? I've also barely received any kind of apology for it. I make reservations because my time is valuable, and I fully expect restaurants to honor those reservations. If super busy, popular places in the city can properly honor reservations, then I really expect a place like Prasino would be able to do so (and, if not, offer a complementary drink). 

In any case, I do enjoy and recommend Prasino. I will definitely return in the future because it's one of the nicest place to get brunch in the nearby Western suburbs.

Finally made it to Prasino for breakfast, and was not disappointed.  Came on a Sunday, and surprisingly did not have to wait.  The interior is beautiful and comfortable.

I try to eat organic at home, so when I saw Prasino tries to use organic ingredients whenever possible, I was super happy.  I have no problem paying extra for organic, sustainable food.

I went with the Irish skillet, and was pleased to see it was served with actual large chunks of corned beef.  No canned corned beef crap here.  The eggs were cooked over-easy to perfection and the skillet  was chock full of tasty peppers, onions and potatoes as well.  My only complaint was that the skillet seemed to only have a slight dash of cheese on top.  It definitely needed more cheese.

The service was friendly and attentive.

One of my absolute favorite places to eat in the Western Suburbs! Organic, unique, tasty food! Trendy atmosphere. A green/eco-conscious/sustainable business model. I love introducing people to this restaurant!  My favorite dishes are the turkey burger, banana bread french toast and the fish tacos!

Busy location so reservations are recommended. Nice options on the menu. Juices are fresh and interesting. Full bar available. Espresso drinks are good! Coffee is strong. 

Tried the Paris eggs Benedict - very good flavor. Would recommend it get again. Huge portion size!

The decor is strange. It feels like a spa or yoga studio. I'm glad we got to try this place. Lots of kids and families. 

Decent prices for the size and quality. 

Service is very good. 

Would go again.

Prasino, where have you gone???!  My drinky was the size of my pinky, and my taco of fish had no zip.  For $10, may we have more thank 6ounces in our glasses?  And how about some herbs or spices infused with the cauliflower gratin?  So sad.  
Prices are more like $$$.

Quality and excellence in food and service. Seriously, this place is really good. Great drinks and appetizers. The lobster avocado was fantastic! Great bloody marys too. They really built a nice downtown district there in Lagrange. This is one of them. A modern restaurant that you wouldn't expect in a south-western suburb. Worth the trip! Plenty of other great things to see and do there too.
Very delicious food always. We tend to just eat breakfast here and we looooove it ! Everything is always fresh. Their bloody Mary's are the bomb!!! Service is pretty awesome and friendly.
We had the beets, flat bread and veggie burger. All of the food choices was amazing. We would defiantly eat here again.

Very leery when we were first seated because the whole restaurant had a bad fishy smell. "oh, that's the salmon," said the hostess.  Really? Ok, we knew what NOT to order!

Our food was very nicely presented and very tasty. We had the lobster avocado appetizer. One person in our group had the surf and turf and said it was great. Two of us had the braised short ribs. They were very tender and the sauce was well done. 

I would be tempted to try the sushi on a future visit. I just couldn't force myself to try it after the bad fishy smell we started with.

We had a late brunch here today.  I ordered my usual, chipotle tofu scramble and cauliflower gratin.  While the meal was decent, it did not seem very fresh.  Most of the potatoes were hard and lukewarm, the veggie sausage was overcooked, and the cauliflower gratin seemed like it was cooked as an afterthought.  They have also decreased their tofu portion.  I like Prasino, I truly do.  However, if I am paying $15 for my meal it should be fresh.

I came here on a Saturday night and based on the reviews I was very surprised to find this place empty. The decor was nice but it was poorly lit which made reading the menu difficult.

After reviewing the menu my friend and I quickly realized that this was a vegetarian restaurant with a limited menu and limited options . The menu also did include vegan and gluten-free options. We both decided to get the Thai Yellow Curry as it seemed the most appealing and filling option as we were both very hungry. In my opinion it was good but could have been better; I was not really amazed by it and I felt it was a bit sweet for a curry. 

Overall, I was not too impressed with this restaurant and i am not enticed to come back again to try another entree from their menu. However, it is a good place if you are a vegan or require a gluten-free diet. There were a lot of pictures of their breakfast and brunch dishes so they may specialize more in that area.
Service is excellent and food is delicious. You gotta try the healthy juice options. Yum

No one is debating how good the food is here, that is obvious. And no one is perfect, so a 5-star rating is out of the question. I see many open tables, meaning the restaurant is not at full capacity. I expect a certain wait for food, but unfortunately today the wait is 30% longer for no significant reason. Food exceptional. Maybe they are understaffed today, but this eval will reflect.

I met my friend from out of town here Sunday morning. We chose it since it had vegan options for me. I wasn't impressed. The vegan pancakes were the worst - the worst pancakes I have every tried. I took one bite and didn't want anything else from there. The waiter was respectable but seemed annoyed. The best part about this place was the kid's menu. There was so much to choose from for my 2 year old son. If you are vegan - or like taste do not order the vegan pancakes.

I took my daughter for her graduation from college.  I was excited because she said they had many vegan options.  I am pretty forgiving when it comes to food.  With that being said, if you are a vegan don't waste your money here!  I had the black bean burger which was tasteless and basically a glob of smashed black beans shaped into a mushy patty.  It was disgusting I couldn't even eat it.  My daughter was a vegan for a long time and tried it and confirmed my thoughts.  I cannot judge the regular fare but my daughter had sushi and was not impressed.  We also had drinks and appetizers but overall the experience was a fail.
Prasino has great mussels and a southwest chicken salad. My grandson took me here and we ate outside on the patio. I would recommend this restaurant for downtown Lagrange.
Great food, service, staff, Management and circuses, as usual! My favorite place in the West suburbs!!

We visited Prasino for brunch.  I checked OpenTable and they had a few reservations open so I figured we would not have a wait but we did.  I knew I should have made a reservation but I figured we were only half an hour away so what could change?  So expect a wait if you go after 10 on a weekend.  The wait was about 20-25 minutes, as quoted.  It's fairly average looking but I found the bar to be strange.  They had TVs behind the bar but no stools.  Like no one could sit there but there were TVs that seemed to invite people to that space.  Our server promptly came over and took our drink order and brought a mimosa and a bloody.  Both were just okay.  She had some food recommendations as well, which we took.  However, one low spot was that our server disappeared for quite some time after we ordered food.  It was evident that my drink was empty for a while and even when she reappeared, she went to a few tables before coming back to us.  She was very nice but it didn't seem that she had so many tables that she should have taken such a long time.  You would think she'd be anxious to refill me hoping to add to the tip.  When she did return I got a strawberry mimosa, which I preferred to the regular mimosa.  The bloody was okay but it really lacked spice.

I tried the chilaquiles.  I've had chilaquiles at many spots and these just really fell short for me.  They had chicken as opposed to pork or duck and the chicken had a decent flavor but it seemed a bit fatty although I will say it was tender.  The chip ratio was off as in there were close to a bag of chips on there but not the other things to go along with it.  More sauce and cheese would be preferred.  Chilaquiles should have a layered sort with a few chips in between for texture and to absorb the fatty goodness but this was more like a plate of nachos without a ton of fixins.  So a few components were okay but nothing was great.  My husband got the pretzel croissant french toast.  It sounded cool but we were really unsure where the pretzel was.  It was basically croissant french toast and cause the croissant is so light, it got soggy.  Also the sauce that accompanied was just clawingly sweet.  The dish was not very balanced, which is what I can say for my dish as well.  Overall some average or below average food and not great service either.  I wanted to like this place more and I'll give another try but so far underwhelmed.

My husband and I love Prasino.  We've dined for lunch, brunch and dinner and have never had a bad experience.  The food is unique and flavorful.  Love the fact that they locally source what they can.  Dining area is always clean and the service is always great.  I highly recommend!

Prassino Is One of my favorite restaurants! I love sitting outside in the summer w my husband, a bottle of good wine and a few appetizers to snack on! So good I never even feel the need to get an entrée

I came here for dinner with a couple of friends on a Saturday night and was quite surprised to find that the place was dead. I will say that the menu was very interesting. It definitely caters to allot of different diets for example you'll find a lot of gluten-free items and dishes that are vegan. 

I have a flat bread as an appetizer, sushi for my main entrée and chocolate mousse for dessert.  I was not impressed, this would not motivate me to try something different from their menu. The rest of the table opted for salads and they seemed very content with them. 

I did enjoy the decor of the restaurant the dim lights and the overall atmosphere.

Haven't been here in some time, but plan on it very soon. Crab cake eggs Benedict... YUM!!! We usually share our food as a family, like a bite to try it, but I eat ALL of mine. It's TOO GOOD to share. Can't wait to come back!
Prasino is a favorite restaurant of ours. The staff is friendly and food is consistently delicious.

I'm all over the place with Prasino.   It's a one-of-a-kind restaurant, with it's wholesome and original menu, cheerful decor, and numerous options for special diets.    The drinks here are good, and there's often (but not always) attention to detail in the food items.   But unfortunately Prasino suffers from a number of systemic weaknesses that nearly ruin what could otherwise be the perfect dining experience.

PROS:   

 - Great drinks.   One of the best bloody marys in the area.   Good quality cocktails all around.   And to my knowledge it's the only restaurant in the west suburbs to make and serve their own kombucha.

 - Accommodating menu.   If your dining companions are vegetarians, they wont feel left out at Prasino.   And bonus points for tremendous gluten-free menu integration.   My wife loves coming here for brunch because she gets nearly a full menu to choose from, even though she is restricted to a gluten-free diet.    They  will even substitute gluten-free bread for toast for only a small upcharge.

 - Cheerful decor.    Eating here makes one feel like they are on vacation.   

 - Complete acceptance of Open Table, even on the weekends, makes this one of the only restaurants where you can make a reservation for Sunday brunch!    This is really great if you want to take your family out for pancakes but don't want to wait in line.


CONS:

 - Your reservation doesn't mean they will seat you if you show up on time.    For reasons I will never understand, Prasino gives some priority to walk-in customers when they are busy.   It's not unusual to make a reservation for 1pm and not get seated until 1:30, while watching walk-in parties get seated ahead of you.    This happens even when there are empty tables.

 - Service is available and friendly... but only at first.   Your waitress may abandon you after your order is taken, and you wont likely see her again until you are about done with your meal.   Do you need silverware?   (More than once we were seated at a table without place settings.)  More coffee?   Hot sauce?    Too bad.   You will have to get up and find it yourself.

-  The food is sometimes good, but also sometimes really bland.   Very uneven.    I sometimes suspect that the cooks don't use any seasoning whatsoever.    If the item you order derives most of its flavor from cheese or meat fat, you will need to add salt, or hot sauce.

-  It's just too expensive to eat here for what it is.    Breakfast for two with only one side between you should not cost $45.    I get the feeling that Prasino can't decide if it's a diner or a hip restaurant or both.   So they charge as if only the latter.


I will likely keep coming here because of the limited number of dining options available for my gluten-free pescatarian wife, and by virtue of how often we are in the area.   But I can't say I will seek this place out.   Not until the service and food quality even out.

Management need a tune up .One of our ol fav`s needs some attention .May 25 the we decide to go  we arrive at the front door at 8:05- 8:10 pm to find the doors locked with staff and patrons inside. Web site states restaurant hours are til 9 pm  Called next day to talk to management concerning the doors being locked and the manager on duty was not available but someone will call back after investigating the situation  NO CALL BACK .One staff member just looks and gives a shoulder shrug and walks outta site Meanwhile its starting to pour  .Ok move on to next wednesday doors open yea!! Get t seated enjoy our meal and have a expired Planit Save voucher that is, as per Planet Save and Groupon supposed to be valid for up to 5 years after expiration date for the paid amount  .Wait staff informs us that the Manager refuses to honor the coupon ! Quickly getting removed from our fav`s list

This was a nice change from the usual lineup of breakfast places. We're not often in the area, but decided to make a stop on our way to Brookfield Zoo. 

Service was nice, pretty professional and prompt. The host could have been friendlier and certainly more helpful when I asked to be directed to the restroom, but I'll let it slide.

The coffee, I didn't love, but my husband enjoyed, so I guess it's a wash there. Seems like they make their own brand of coffee somehow, although I didn't see a place for a roaster on site. Cream and sugar were served in cute, reusable containers (not that I use either, but still appreciated the nice touch).

I enjoyed my Jump start tacos. Egg whites, avocado, and cheese, with an interesting salsa served on the side. My husband and kids had the Hippie omelette that is made with tomato jam, which I've never had before but is so uniquely delicious. The potatoes served with our meals were top notch. And their GF pancakes are nothing to sneeze at, either.

We weren't given kids menus despite having two little ones, and there was no changing table in the restroom. Pretty family-friendly otherwise, despite coming off a little cool and upscale. I'm interested in coming back for lunch.

Simply deliscous - from the teas to the fresh dinners to their amazing breakfasts. You'd think that a pancake is a pancake, but you'd be wrong. Good service, nice decor, unique utensils and table items.  Love this place.

Always great service and fresh quality food. They have a great range of options including vegetarian, gluten-free, and 
organic.

Vegan. Pancakes. VEGAN PANCAKES. My two favorite words put together on a lovely breakfast menu. I've been to Prasino's before I was vegan and I was a fan but it wasn't someplace I would visit frequently. I don't know if they had vegan options prior to my transition but it was definitely a pleasant surprise!

They offer a good amount of vegan options for breakfast which is awesome since I'd always feel vegan options to be so limited. Lunch...not so much, but they offer fresh juices! 8 vegan breakfast items, 2 vegan lunch items, and 2 vegan dessert options. 

For breakfast I ordered the vegan pancakes, and the cocoa chia seed pudding with a side of fresh fruit. The pancakes were awesome! They had this glaze on top which gave it more texture and flavor. The cocoa chia seed pudding was OK. I'm not a big fan of it by itself (very chia-y), but when you eat it with the fresh bananas on top...REALLY good, especially pairing it with the vegan pancakes. 

For lunch I ordered the ginger maryann juice (apple, carrot, ginger), a side of mini greens, the black bean burger, vegan mint chocolate mousse, and trio of sorbets (yes, I can eat a lot). The juice was good, packed a punch to my face with how much ginger they threw in there but I love ginger so it woke me up. The mini greens was a side salad with a balsamic dressing with very little tang (YES, thank god) so it didn't leave a weird impression on your throat (and it was good). The black bean burger I really enjoyed after tweaking a minor issue that dates back to one bad salad experience that forever scars my soul. Arugula just tastes awful to me so of course that was the greens of choice. With how flavorless a black bean patty can be, I feel that the arugula overpowered it to much extent sooo I scraped that sucker off and was left with bun, pico de gayo and guac...PERFECT.  The patty was a little mushy in some areas and in other areas it was crispy. Like I said, black bean patties tend to be very bland so its how you cook it and what you throw on top of it that makes it bad ass.

As for dessert...yes, you should order the vegan mint chocolate mousse and the trio of sorbets. The vegan mint chocolate mousse was so good, even my dad (who is a non-vegan) loved it! The sauce wasn't great. Not great at all, in fact, just avoid it and eat the chocolaty goodness. The sorbet was good too, except for the apple cider flavor. Just...wasn't good. But the black cherry and raspberry sorbet were great!

Overall...YES, go here for breakfast and lunch! Awesome vegan options.

We were in Chicago apartment hunting and we're looking for a great place for brunch. Read the reviews on Yelp and decided to check this place out in LaGrange and so glad we did. 3 of us started with bloody Mary's and 1 had a Mimosa. We had their Basic Bloody which was nicely spiced and garnishing plus rhe glass was rimmed with spices. The mimosa was nice but served in champagne glass, nothing special. For brunch we had their homemade corn beef hash, short rib hash and the frittata with spinach, feta and avocado. Sides were toast or pancakes. The fried potatoes were fantastic, nicely spiced and crisp. Highly recommend Prasino! We sat outside on a beautiful Sunday. They also put us on the wait list for first available when we called in versus waiting until we arrived at the restaurant. So we were seated right when we arrived. Very nice waiter, Chris, excellent service

Food was boring and breakfast menu was scarce. The root beer tasted like medicine. Nice location but it seemed like they were trying too hard to be hip that they lacked on substance with their food. I had some type of salmon and then random green "leaves" on my plate. I felt like I was on a cartoon where you order something expensive and they only place a pea on a plate and hand you a knife and fork.
Amazing food, fresh ingredients perfect presentation, the ambiance was great the service was spectacular.

Walking through the door I was welcomed with the smell of rosemary and a friendly hostess. After brought to my seat I was brought my organic chai tea latte immediately after ordering it and it was absolutely delicious. I ordered the sweet potato soup which was brought out within a couple minutes too. My main entree, the butternut squash ravioli was my last dish. It was all so great, including my waiter too. If I had anymore room left I would have tried dessert. I'll definitely be back to try it though!

Restaurant is big, good for groups. We went for lunch, I tried the strawberry blonde juice, it wasn't the best like everyone says, it's good but you can pass that up. I had the soup of the day which was so good and lobster avocado, so yummy! My husband had the turkey burger which was good. Would go back and try more!

Above average food and atmosphere, excellent outside seating area.  We had sushi and loved it. The flatbreads we also great. Everything was ver fresh and the service was good+.  Perfect for nice warm evenings outside.

Absolutely love Prasino! Definitely a gem of downtown LaGrange. Both lunch and breakfast are amazing, and their Caprese sandwich is to die for. Everything is so so fresh and clean. Ingredients are natural and they strive for organic, clean healthy food. Only downside is if you come with a soda lover, Diet Coke or Pepsi isn't an option. However, the fresh squeezed orange juice is an incredible replacement! Love this place!

The best restaurant around.  The service is fantastic, the food is consistently excellent, they provide organic based healthy food, and it is so clean.  It has something for everyone.  It is an easy place to bring clients and family.  People that I have introduced Prasino to always go back again.

I love when you approach a restaurant and you are greeted with amazing food smells.   That's how this place was.  It was packed but we were seated quickly.  I had their orange juice which was fresh squeezed and perfect and a tea which was so good.  It was raspberry something.  It was delicious!  I ordered an omelette with turkey sausage, spinach and goat cheese and potatoes and side of pancakes.  The omelette was so good.  If I went there again, I might order it again!   The pancakes were just okay.  Looking around to see what other people ordered, I also thought the salads looked good.  They were huge.  The restaurant is located downtown on a cute little block.  They had plenty of outdoor seating but you can never tell the weather in Chicagoland Fall.  Parking can be tricky.

I've walked past this place so many times and it always looked great so on a whim the hubs and I decided to go here for brunch on a Sunday. Overall the place is clean and modern. I thought the menu options were great - husband went with the short rib skillet and I had the quinoa with almond milk, we split one of the juices as well which was super refreshing. The prices I felt were way too high, but I do get it that it's all organic, blah blah blah. The food saved this place from a two star review because the service was TERRIBLE. our server only came to our table twice - to take our order and to bring our check. someone else brought us our food. We were seated outside around 10am and by the time we were finally served and finished it was after 12pm and completely scorching outside so we were desperate to get going. I literally had to walk up to the outdoor station and help myself to a to-go container and we had to go inside to ask for our check. Finally when she took our bill, she disappeared with our credit card for about 15 minutes and had a different person return it to us. For the prices you pay, I would expect MUCH better service. Also, neither the mens or womens restrooms had any soap.

I had been wanting to try Prasino for awhile. There had been a lot of good reviews and one creepy one that kept popping up on my home page that was almost my Prasino kryptonite. I'm so glad it wasn't!

After a long, cold winter and two months without seeing my mom, the possibility of a decent Sunday was approaching.

 "Mom what are you doing this weekend?" "Ugh, my taxes"
"It is supposed to be nice on Sunday. Want to at least try for brunch?"
"Of course!"

And so I made an 11 am reservation on Open Table for Prasino knowing we could then try breakfast or lunch dependent on our moods.

It was pretty crowded when we got there and we ended up having to wait about 2 minutes for our table but I was relieved for having thought ahead and made that res. The first gorgeous Sunday in forever and a breakfast spot near the zoo? Of course this place is going to be hopping and hopping with kids!

I opted for a non-alcoholic juice choice to start - a strawberry blonde. This juice was fresh squeezed orange, pineapple, and strawberry juice. It both looked and tasted amazing.

I opted for the Prasino Cakes with fresh berries. The menu does not give much description on the prasino cakes. It actually gives none. They were blueberry pancakes. They were fantastic. The berries on top were ridiculously fresh and moist. I absolutely loved them. 

Mom opted for some breakfast tacos. She had never considered tacos as a breakfast option before. She loved them. I didn't try them;however, I did eat some of the red skinned potatoes that came as a side for her. OH MY GOD!!! I could eat those potatoes all day long. They were fantastic. 

We got out of there for about $33 before tip that is including the $7 fancy juice I drank. It's a reasonable price for breakfast considering I could go to the pancake house down the street and spend about the same per person before beverages.

Def. must go place.  I ordered healthy wrap and my bf ordered ham and cheese.  High quality service and food was so tasty.  Server came by our table in a timely manner, checking on us.  Interior is very nice and interesting.  We were here for brunch.  Wish I can come here again during dinner time.
OMG... The avocado with lobster!!! So delicious -- and the fish tacos were good, too. I love the ambience of this place.

Since it is right across the street from the La Grange Theater--we eat dinner here every few months.  Each time the service has been excellent, the good delicious and the bill.....well it is a bit pricey! But we figure the movie is cheap so it evens out!

I recommend staying with the avocado stuffed with lobster & mango salsa.  It is soooo yummy!  The salads are also good & so is the soup of the day.   

One issue: skip dessert. It isn't their forte!

This place is really nice! They have a lot of vegan and vegetarian options, and everything is so fresh and such good quality. I really like their black bean burger with avocado, and I love their mezze appetizer plate which includes hummus and falafel. This is something you should definitely try if you're looking for fresh, organic, healthy food.

I've had Prasino bookmarked foreverrr (real time: maybe a year?), and I had the hardest time deciding whether to try them out for breakfast or dinner.  Well, once I noticed that Prasino was one of my oldest bookmarks (on a Thursday evening), the next meal occurring would be breakfast on Friday morning.  Lucky me, we were both off of work for the holiday.

I love eating breakfast out.  It makes me feel like I'm on vacation, because that's the only time we really eat a hearty breakfast.  The decor at Prasino adds to that vacation feeling that gave me a west coast vibe:  light wood used in tables and flooring, white walls, and lots of wide windows that allow in tons of light. Their menu, a "farm to bar" concept, contains no Coke or Pepsi products and focuses on local, sustainable food.

The beverage menu is enticing.  Lots of cocktails with unique ingredients like blueberry jam, smoothies, and house-made sodas.  I eyeballed some cocktails but chose an elderflower soda instead.  I was a little misinformed - the waitress said something about house-made sodas, including a ginger ale, but I was served elderflower soda from a bottle.  Dominic P. had a cocktail which tasted like a healthy, freshly squeezed juice, with vodka added.  I wouldn't mind coming back here just for the cocktails!

Who knew that somehow, some way, a menu item like PRETZEL CROISSANT FRENCH TOAST could fall into the "local, sustainable" category?  I see items like this and I don't ask any questions.  It was amazing, with the perfect amount of caramel and white chocolate drizzled on the plate.  I also had a side order of the chicken sausage, which balanced the sweetness of the French toast.  The sweetness didn't get to me at all, the way a sticky sweet apple pancake at your typical diner would.

Dominic P. had the short rib skillet, served with a side of pancakes.  The skillet looked delicious, and the pancakes were nice and fluffy.

I really enjoyed my breakfast at Prasino, and I would most certainly be interested in trying their dinner menu as well.  Prices are reasonable; however, once you start ordering fancy sodas and cocktails, you may find yourself paying more than $40 for two just for breakfast - yikes!  Prasino's still worth it for that once in awhile treat.
Great Black Bean Burger for vegetarians.

The tall grasses bend in the breeze that kisses your warm skin. The melodious babble of innocence flies in the feathers of birds and on the whiskers of squirrels. Happiness is a tangible hug that embraces the experience at Prasino - the verdant, clean restaurant that delivers the taste of effervescence in every bite and sip.

Moments swirled around our table in an endless passage of a story that we wanted to last forever. Kathleen M, Clifford S, M and I were eased into conversation with Prasino's libations and appetizers. The refreshing Cilantron cocktail was my favorite - topping even the velvety White Mayan. Other drinks that played on our tongues were the Kir Royale, Strawberry Mosa, at least two different red wines, and a concoction created extemporaneously by the mixologist.

Although our hearts were brimming with pleasure, Prasino filled our stomachs with edible delights. We started with mussels and crab cakes. I only had a nibble of crab cake because I wanted to save myself for more. M is a mussel aficionado and said that Prasino's rendition was good. Later Kathleen M enjoyed a generous portion of lamb, Clifford S and M were both served pork chops where the corn somehow took center stage, and I had the lobster avocado and dragon roll. My lobster avocado tasted like butter.

The owner Peggy stopped by our table a few times and treated us to dessert. Kathleen M devoured hers before I had a chance to see what it was! I'm also unsure what Clifford S ordered because M's vegan chocolate mousse dominated the conversation. We unanimously decided that animal fat is a blessing in mousse and that the vegans are martyrs to their diet.

The visionaries of Prasino know how to carry a theme. Their food is clean and simple as is the decor and service. Unstained wood tables and chairs and prairie style lines throughout bragged of unadulterated lucidity. At first the service was slow, but then picked up. He did not interrupt us with verbose explanations of specials or menu items. He was the breeze bringing us delights but gave us space for the ebb and flow of our banter.

I feel confident speaking for my group when I say that we all had a delightful four hours at Prasino in LaGrange. Although it's always the case that the restaurant only provides the backdrop for our visits, Prasino rose to the occasion. They did not dominate our interactions  with grandiose ornamentation that distracted our conversation. Prasino provides a lovely restaurant dimension when it comes to a meeting place for friends.
I am a healthy eater and I live in the area so this is a perfect spot for me. I love the muscles and the southwest chicken salad. For breakfast I love the gluten-free pancakes.

For breakfast/brunch Prasino is a 5. Dinner service is hit or miss, but go for breakfast, its a great experience. Reminds me of breakfast at an upscale hotel. High quality tea and coffee. Fresh honey and homemade jams. Very dedicated to organic foods and Earth friendly operation, even have reclaimed wood fixtures throughout. Unique breakfast items; the breakfast tacos, carrot pancakes, salmon/bagel, and eggs benedict items are all REALLY good. Oh, lets not forget the juice bar! AMAZING juice selections made fresh. We usually get more than one beverage per person to enjoy the coffees, teas, juices. It's a very relaxing, spa like breakfast experience. Beautiful nature photos displayed on the front screens.
Really enjoyed Prasino!  Service was just right - helpful but not too overbearing, and the decor was modern and looked clean.  The menu had a lot of interesting options and is vegetarian friendly.

This was my second time at Prasino and now I know why I came back, great place all the way around. The restaurant is big, decorated nicely and its open and airy feel is great. I have only been here for breakfast. First time I had the chilaquiles and this recent time I got the short rib skillet. Both items were absolutely delicious. The ingredients are fresh, flavorful and just yummy. My short rib skillet had onions, peppers, potatoes and cheese topped with 2 eggs. The meat was perfectly cooked and the potatoes were fantastic. It was also very filling. I ordered pancakes instead of toast and those were amazing too.  To wash down my meal I ordered a bloody mary that was very good, had the just right amount of kick to it. Our server was very attentive and very nice. I must go back to try them out for lunch and dinner. Next time hopefully sit outside on their patio.

I have been here a couple times and have enjoyed it both times. I love that they have an extensive tea menu, as well as tea you can purchase to take home. The food is always delicious regardless of the meal eaten. I love the ambiance and decor. Would go back regularly. Service has been good each time as well, with minimal wait times.

Awesome place to come and get food!!! I eat here occasionally after training and always leave full and happy. Service is solid- very respectful and accommodating. Also they make they're good with healthy ingredients. I definitely recommend this place

Get the short rib skillet!  It's amazing, and the portion is huge!  I ended up boxing half of it.  The short rib is tender and plentiful, and the vegetables were amazing.  I had the Under The Palm fresh squeezed juice, but in my opinion, it wasn't worth the price.  For dessert, we had the pretzel croissant french toast- it was unlike anything I've ever had.  I loved the sweetness of the batter and white chocolate sauce, mixed with the saltiness of the pretzel.  I also ordered a coffee to-go, and it was top notch!
we love going there for breakfast and then walking around downtown LaGrange. I like that they have healthy options such as organic, gluten free, etc.

Living in the area for the past few  years, I can officially say this is my new favorite restaurant! My sister showed me this restaurant and I have gone for all different meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner) and I have ye to try something on all their menu's that I do not like!

They offer so many different options (gluten free, vegetarian, vegan, etc.) and you can truly feel guilt-free about ordering anything here as it is all amazingly fresh, healthy and delicious! I just have to make sure I don't order too much!

Absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a more contemporary american restaurant, looking for a lighter/healthier option without giving up great taste!

I feel a sense of serenity and peacfulness when I dine at this restaurant.   It is open and airy and comfortable.  Service is wonderful and the menu is refreshing.

I stopped here today while walking around the outdoor arts & craft fair in LaGrange, for a late breakfast and to get out of the heat.   It was 10:30ish and I opted for the breakfast menu, though I think you could have ordered lunch.   My server was amazing, friendly, and offered up her favorite dish - which is what I got.     It was the Santa Monica frittata.  

I was sitting at the window, people watching and my food came out in about 10 minutes.  It was a plate size frittata, which came with a side of house potatoes and a choice of toast or pancakes.  Since I'm kicking it low-carb, I skipped all the sides.   The frittata was topped with the most creamy goat cheese and fresh avacado.   This dish was heaven on a plate!

There are so many good restaurants to eat in in the downtown LaGrange area, that sometimes it is hard to choose - but Prasino is my go-to for good food and atmosphere!

I honestly believe Prasino is under new management. The menu has changed and has less of a variety. I have been to this hot spot in the past and I would have given my past experience a 4.5. However, this weekend was horrible, the customer service and the food was not up to par.  The server's focused their attention on a large part they had in the front of the restaurant. They sat us in the sun, when they had plenty of other available tables.  Our food was not cooked,  the only item we ordered that was delicious  was the flat bread.  This is not a kid friendly restaurant.

I absolutely LOVE this place. The food is healthy and clean. The staff is always very friendly, so that's a plus. The pei Wei mussels in red sauce are my go-to appetizers. I always order the southwest Chicken salad. Though the menu says it's only available during lunch time, sometimes they are able to make it for you at any time if you ask them. Other great options: lobster avocado, fish taco, lava sushi, spicy lobster sushi to name a few

Pricey, but one of the best brunches I've had in awhile. My friend and I tried their fresh squeezed juices. They had about 8-10 different choices, which were as good as tropical cocktails, but without the booze :) We ate the Paris eggs benedict (to die for!!) and the tacos rancheros (so rich and flavorful). The service was excellent and the ambiance modern yet comfortable. Will definitely be back!
The food is great. Very fresh. Nice atmosphere. I highly recommend the shirt steak with your salad choice.

The food here is amazing and the atmosphere is really nice! The beef short rib skillet was awesome. Tender meat and delicious vegetables. Two over easy eggs on top made it even more awesome. We also tried the pretzel croissant french toast. I didnt even think those 4 words could go together but im glad that we ordered it. It was not overly sweet but very delicious. We also tried the Under the Palm fresh squeezed juice. The juice was alright but I wish it was colder. For the price of the juice I wasnt the biggest fan, but everything else was amazing!

Loved this restaurant! Came to eat here with a friend and decided on the breakfast menu instead of the the lunch menu. Had the pretzel croissant French toast and loved it! Shared the pasino pancakes and they were so good.. We'll be coming back very soon.. FYI look for debt parking

My girlfriend and I both ordered vegan pancakes and split the vegan Benedicts. Then the waiter brought us syrup and BUTTER! I was clearly trying to avoid cruelty. But the waiter was a nice guy. The pancakes were decent. I did not like the Benedicts. The sweet potato hash was okay. Good juices and smoothies. Very expensive.

Love, love, love. Came for a Sunday brunch and was super excited about all the veg breakfast options, so I'll have to come back and try some more of them.

I immediately felt good about it when I walked in. The decor is trendy and modern, open and bright on a sunny day. Beautiful art on the walls. You can sit outside too, if you'd like.

Then I ordered some iced coffee. Happiness in a glass, and there are a couple of fancier kinds you can get.
