Now when we were sat, we waited. A lot. Like 15 minutes before we were even greeted. And then she had to get us menus. After she dropped those off, it was another 15 minutes before she came back to us. It was a bit frustrating waiting 30 minutes just to place our orders. 

We finally got to order and the food was eventually brought out to us - again this took quite awhile. And she set it down and walked away before we had a chance to remind her we had no silverware. So we sat for another 5 minutes with our food in front of us but no way to eat. When she came back around, she was of course apologetic that she didn't realize we had silverware. She snagged it off another table and all was well in the world. I understand it was busy and it's a diner but there were some serious service flaws.

For brunch I had a delicious ham & cheese omelette. The cheese oozed out of it when I cut into the perfectly cooked egg. Everything tasted very fresh to me, perfectly sized pieces of ham, very enjoyable. The hashbrowns that came with it were different than any I've previously had. The shreds of potato were more thick but still soft & crispy in all the right spots. 

Overall, our meals were good, service wasn't but it could have just been an off day. I wouldn't hesitate to go back but would prefer trying somewhere else before returning.

Liked the food, our server was very nice and attentive. All was well until a busboy ACCIDENTALLY cleared a table when a mother and daughter went to the restroom.  When they came back to the  table and mentioned it to the waitress , the waitress actually brought the busboy to the table and YELLED at him embarrassingly, the whole restaurant was looking. Very unprofessional.  We will never be going back. The food was mucho delicioso.

I love this place. I come here often and the food is always fast, FRESH, and service is great. I always leave full and have loads to take home in doggie bags if I need. (I just personally never take home breakfast)

I come here whenever we go to breakfast

I'm just not that convinced. 

Maybe I went on an off day, or maybe this is how it always is, but the service was really bad. What should have been maybe 40 minutes top for a meal turned into an hour and a half just because the waitress couldn't get our food to us in a timely fashion and made us wait 30 minutes to get our check. Believe me, if it was busy, I wouldn't have minded so much. But, it was just a basic crowd. Nothing special about it.  

The food? Meh, pretty good. It wasn't anything to brag about. Basically all the same options that any other breakfast place has. I did have breakfast though. Their lunch menu looked decent too. Maybe their lunch is better?

Maybe next time will be better? I'll update if it is.

My husband and I love this restaurant. We can always find something on the menu to please both of us. We never have to wait for a table very long. Always great soups to choose from. Very accommodating waitress, Robin. Very kind, strange to say that about a waitress, but true. Understood my diet struggle. 
The remodel after taking over from the Sandpiper is pleasant.
You will not regret coming here!

My favorite place for breakfast! The staff is always friendly and attentive. I love that ma and pa feeling I get every time I go. The Denver omelette is my absolute favorite! Plus every dish comes with a piece of fruit. Great food and great service!! Keep it up!
Great coffee and the best breakfasts around! I can never finish the whole thing, which makes it the most amazing deal ever.

Just like everyone else said, it's as good as good can get.  From the moment you walk in the door the service is exceptional...attentive, friendly and thorough, and the food arrives well-prepared, fresh, hot and fast. You can't ask for more.

The food is pretty average for a breakfast place, hence the 3 stars. I usually get the omelet with ham (since I don't like their sausage). Today I had a side of corn beef hash and they added a very bruised strawberry on the side. Made the dish look sad. Hubs always gets the neltnor skillet, with my bonus hashbrowns cuz I keep forgetting to ask for something else. The pancakes I get chocolate chips but they just add a sprinkle on top, not melted in the actual pancake, for a $1 extra. Not worth it. One time I inquired why they're not inside, she had an attitude and told me that most places don't and I should have asked prior to ordering. Well ok then! So, hungry and in the area? Sure. But not worth a special trip.

The food was adequate. Brought out lukewarm for the omelette and unable to melt the butter pancakes.
The silverware was worn out ( my knife appeared to be spot rusting), the appearance is dated.
It is a great spot for locals and everyone appeared to know each other.
So three stars because I did not get sick and the people are very nice.
Perhaps Easter Day was a bad day to try a new place.
Very good food. Large size meals, and price doesn't hurt your wallet. Food was all fresh and prepared to order. Would definately recommend this place!!

Never order the side of fruit. It's $3.79 and you get one small slice of watermelon, a slice of cantaloupe, a slice of honeydew, and one strawberry. For almost $4?! That's a rip off. The food was good but I won't go back with prices like that.

This restaurant delivers grade A breakfast, without the insistence upon itself that is reflected in the prices of other breakfast restaurants. You want a good breakfast that won't leave your wallet, empty?  Go here.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would! LOVE LOVE LOVE the customer service & food here! The owner puts a lot of time & hard work into making sure everyone is satisfied/ had a wonderful experience! He also walks by tables & starts conversations with his customers! That's how it should be in every restaurant. The staff is super friendly, with great manners. Food is also very delicious & filling! You almost feel like everyone who works at egg yolk is your family. I love it. Will forever be a loyal customer here! Recommend this place to everyone! :)

I personally have not been here since it changed from the Sandpiper a couple years back (despite living but a couple blocks away...)  Anyway, family has, and said it was good.  Nothing more or less than what it was before they changed.

I'm not from around here and needed a good place to get breakfast. I drove past this place and thought I'd give it a try. They have all the traditional food you might be hoping for, plus a few custom extras that other places don't have! The atmosphere was vibrant and happy, and the staff were fast and very friendly. 
The most important part, the food was fantastic! I got the Wisconsin omelette, which has 3 types of cheese in it, and the hash browns, which were amazing. I normally soak my potatoes in ketchup, but these tasted so good that I almost left it off completely! They had the perfect amount of crunch to them. Hoping to come back some day to try the lunch food!

Been here a couple of times and I love the way they  have renovated this restaurant. The chorizo skillet here is my usual.  We are still getting to know the servers but they are usually more than capable.  There are one or two servers that are a bit stingy with the coffee but other than that the food and service has been good.

Well the food and service are Definitely 5 star . I see they treat Customers and really like how people are treated like family . Somewhat busy and it seems like they call most people by first name !
( Dale Carnegie's book . How to win friends and influence people) 
Ordered 2 eggs over easy ( perfect )
And I got 4 easy . Same price. 
Not to many places do that any more
Yes I'll be back and yes I recommend it here.
Ok, nothing special, the staff is nice the food was ok. Expect to wait a while if you plan to visit on a Sunday morning.
My omelet was delicious but the toast and the hash browns were both burnt.   Great service

I've been to Egg Yolk Cafe for breakfast 4 times now.  On Saturday or Sunday, this place always has a line, which to me is a good sign.  The staff is always energetic and engaging.  The food is very good.  For as busy as it is, it's always clean.  It's now our go-to place for breakfast.

Egg Yolk Cafe is one of the closer breakfast places to my brothers so we end up there fairly often.  Also, they were open on both Thanksgiving and Christmas which worked out nicely for us as we're too pathetic to make ourselves breakfast.  

The food is always really good.  Greg almost always gets the corned beef hash and eggs, Sue has the pancakes that come with it, and I get confused because the menu is too big.  They have a hawaiin omellete (I believe they call it the Hawaii Five-O, which is silly, so I'm refusing to call it that), that is really good.  It's canadian bacon, pineapple, and cheese.  I've also had the biscuits and gravy, they were really good.  They have tuna salad stuffed pineapple and I appreciate the attempt at stuffing something but let's be serious, just put the tuna salad on a plate with chunks of pineapple.  I won't mind if it's not in an uncut half of a pineapple that I now have to awkwardly cut up with a butter knife.  

The service is usually pretty good, not great, but *pretty* good.  The dining room is actually a little nicer and newer than most of the diner-y places in the area.

I was decently surprised by this place. I think that the new owners are doing a stellar job and have really turned this place around.

I think we made poor choices on what to eat, but we will for sure return.

Egg Yolk Cafe's food quality and menu selection is a very nice improvement over the old Sandpiper Restaurant at this location.  We had stopped going to Sandpiper years ago because  we were never happy with our meals.  About a year or two ago, we started hearing very positive things about the new restaurant, and decided to try out Egg Yolk.  We have been pleasantly surprised with the friendliness of the new owners, the improvement in the menu and food quality, and the good service we have received from the waitresses at Egg Yolk.  So nice that West Chicago now has a good breakfast place in town!

Went here for the first time for a Saturday after Thanksgiving brunch.  It wasn't too busy but the placement of our table was kind of awkward.  One side was flush against another table, and the other side was into a walking area.  Fortunately nothing happened, but it was kinda awkward.
The food was pretty good.  I got some crepes and they were good.  Coffee refills were quick.  The orange juice tasted fresh squeezed, and was tasty.
The only thing I dislike about these places is the price of their a la carte eggs.  I mean 5.49 for 2 eggs.. C'mon man.
But that is typical of most breakfast joints.

The food in general wasn't too salty and came out pretty hot.  There are quite a few options which is always nice.  The eggs benedict were good and their hash browns also had a nice brownness to them.

They have turkey patties as a replacmeent for pork.
Good food. Kinda pricey. Cute place. Very clean. Nice waitress. Overheard a fight in the kitchen. Swearing, yelling, dropping F bombs. Scary thing in this day and age.

Every time I come here it's always been good so I try to venture out and try new things so I had the festive pumpkin spice swirl pancakes. These are so good! Nice frosting glaze added- Perfect, hit the spot! Would have taken pic before I devoured half of it but it was calling my name!

They have hands down the most amazing fresh sqeezed orange juice EVER.  I've ordered it to go.  The omelet are awesome.  Service at peak times can be real real slow.  Once I did order to go and service at the front was awesome.  They did forget the orange juice to go once, and I had to drive back for it.  YES it's worth it!  Another time I ordered to go... and I called it in ahead of time cuz I was in a hurry.  I walk in and nothing was done... all I had ordered was like pancakes, orange juice and toast or something.. LIKE SERIOUSLY?????  I was NOT HAPPY.  But since the food is good... they get good ratings.  I've also tried a custom veggie skillet there, was DELISH!  

I'm a huge fan of brunch... and this place is great if you're near the area.

Wonderful improvements to the old Sandpiper- the owners of Egg Yolk Cafe have made (and continue to make) great updates to this restaurant.

They have an excellent new menu. The food quality seems improved too. The prices are reasonable and affordable. They now have freshly squeezed orange juice and the serving size is generous. Their strawberry crepes are AMAZING and come with a bowl of fresh whipped cream- you get three big crepes- wow. I had a breakfast combo with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and french toast and ate every bite.  

The service is very good too, with some familiar faces from the Sandpiper. I appreciated that our server checked on us a lot but just walked by intentionally, without interrupting our conversation- it was a perfect balance and we always had just what we needed. I also liked that they leave a carafe of water with lemon on your table so you can refill your own water as needed instead of it happening throughout the meal and you feeling like you have to stop your conversation each time.  

This is a comfortable restaurant and a great place to have a good conversation over great food and great service. I look forward to trying their lunch items eventually too. 

Please note- the restaurant now closes at 4 pm so is no longer open for dinner.

If you're looking for a good mom and pop breakfast location, Egg Yolk Cafe is an awesome stop! Growing up in the area, this use to be the old Sandpiper Cafe, which looked old and dingy. Now that it's turned into Egg Yolk, the atmosphere is very homey with your standard breakfast fare. There are some unique  bites (lox Benedict), and their servings are huge! If you're looking for a good, standard breakfast place, Egg Yolk is awesome!

I didn't set out to go to Egg Yolk Cafe, in fact I didn't even know it existed. When driving on a Sunday morning to visit a different breakfast place, I missed a turn and the yolk was one me as I wound up stopping here instead. Having spotted it from the nearby intersection I decided I was hungry enough to just give it a try, and boy was I in for a treat.

Egg Yolk Cafe is a very typical breakfast/diner restaurant. The decor inside is pleasant, the place itself is very clean. There's high ceilings and even a skylight. The inside is surprisingly spacious and well decorated for a family diner. After being seated I looked over the menu and quickly identified a Mexican skillet as the menu item of my desires. Shortly thereafter a waiter came to the table, took my drink and food order, and within about 10 minutes my food had arrived at my table. 

While the place is clean, spacious and aesthetically pleasing, it would all be in vein it if the food weren't up to snuff. The Mexican skillet I ordered came with lots of cheese, eggs and clearly lots of spicy chorizo sausage ground up on it. There were a few jalapeno peppers in the skillet as well to give it that extra bit of spice. I was also given two bottles of different hot sauces.  The dish was garnished with a strawberry in the corner to give it an extra appetizing look. The first thing that's notable about this particular skillet is that the potatoes covering the bottom of the skillet were very well seasoned and well cooked and were quite flavorful. Often times when ordering skillets I find places serving bland, flavorless, unseasoned potatoes as filler. The potatoes here had some hot and some caramelized onion mixed in. This along with other seasoning added some extra flavor and were easily the best hash potatoes I've found at the bottom of a skillet. I seriously wish other diners would try these skillet potatoes out and take notes on how it was done. The eggs were made well, and there was a generous amount of cheese and meat on the skillet. It was spicy, but not too spicy, and the extra hot sauce bottles allowed me to add a little extra kick if I wanted it.

I also opted for pancakes instead of toast. These were fairly average pancakes with nice thick syrup that had a good amount of flavor. While there wasn't anything particularly unique about these flapjacks, but they were a nice compliment to the skillet.

Overall I was extremely pleased with everything about my experience at Egg Yolk Cafe. This is an egg-cellent place to grab breakfast and I will definitely be coming back in the future, just writing this review makes me hungry for their food. I HIGHLY recommend the Mexican skillet here, and I'm going to give this place a well deserved and somewhat difficult to obtain from my grading standards five star review.

When we arrived at the new Egg Yolk Cafe (formerly The Sandpiper) they were mildly busy for a Sunday morning, but there were still over a dozen tables open.  We were immediately run down by 4 bus boys that seemed to be in a rush.  Not one of them excused themselves or apologized for their rudeness.  After about 5 minutes an "owner" looking man asked that we wait a moment, so we did still wanting to check out the newly renovated space.  A family of 6 came in 5 minutes later and told the owner that they were just going to sit over "there" and took their seats.  I gave the owner a sour look as we had already been waiting and there were only 2 of us.  He grabbed a couple of menus and sat us at the nearest table.

The waitress had informed me that the Corned Beef Hash was "homemade" when I asked, so I was pretty excited to order that with a couple of scrambled eggs, hash browns, and pancakes.  My boyfriend ordered the Potato Pancakes along with some bacon and scrambled eggs as well.  I also asked that they bring out a new pitcher of water as the ones they leave at the table have lemon in them and I cannot have lemon at all.  The guy acknowledged that he understood, yet all he did was dump out the water in the pitcher and refill it.  My boyfriend did a quick taste test of it and confirmed that I couldn't drink it.  I nicely asked the waitress for just a straight up class of plain water.  She was nice enough to oblige.  

When we received our food I was dismayed to find out that the Corned Beef Hash was not "homemade" as I was told previously, but just the canned stuff browned up a little.  Complete disappointment.  My boyfriend's Potato Pancakes were a little floury and contained corn as well as carrots.  They were quite bland and could use some seasoning since all I really tasted were the corn and four.  Overall everything was pretty greasy and nothing really had any seasoning!  I was pretty disappointed as I've wanted to try this place out ever since it changed over!  I drive past it every day on the way to work and the positive reviews only heightened my interest even more... Needless to say we won't be coming back!
Much better than the previous establishment. Awesome that they are super local and not expensive. On par with Egglectic and Egg Harbor and can handle their crowds a little better.

This our go to place for breakfast and lunch in the winter for their soups.  Everybody is friendly and we have our favorite servers but all good.  On the weekends the place is super busy, but we can always catch the busboy or our waitress if we need something. If your check comes out to slow, it is because food comes out of the kitchen like crazy on the weekends. Remember this is a larger restaurant so lots of tables. If you don't get your check the Hostess stand has it in the computer already. I would rather have no check then cold food.

Formerly the Sandpiper Restaurant, the Egg Yolk Cafe is under new ownership and management.

I dined here for lunch during their early transition period. The menu is a standard breakfast & lunch only menu focusing primarily on breakfast entrees...  pancakes, crepes, waffles, omelettes, other egg dishes. Their lunch items include soups & salads, paninis & wraps, various sandwiches and burgers.

Although I stopped in during lunchtime, I chose to try a bacon and avocado omelette with hash browns and wheat toast. The omelette was nicely shaped and folded, covering almost half of the plate. It was slightly overcooked for an omelette, but I was okay with that since I don't like runny eggs. Hash browns covered the other half of the plate. The bacon was fine, but the avocado was not very appealing. 

At first I thought they made a mistake and added mushrooms to my omelette. I don't like mushrooms, so I began picking them out of the eggs. But upon further inspection, I realized the brown pieces were indeed avocado pieces. Now, I'm no chef and I don't know if the cooking process affected the color of the avocados, but I know I've had green avocados in an omelette at other restaurants... which causes me to think that these ones were old and brown when they were were added to this omelette.

Anyway, the service was good and friendly (their saving grace). And I am pleased to see that this restaurant space did not ultimately shut down, but rather is being redefined. So for now, I am stretching to give it a 3-star rating, and I'm hoping the kinks in their food prep or freshness will be worked out soon.

I work in West Chicago, and I will be back once they are in full swing to reevaluate their quality, for better or worse. So, give them some time to make their transition. But for now, don't order an omelette with avocados.

Oh, and new for this restaurant: Free WIFI... yeah!

Stopped here on a whim while looking for some breakfast. Hits all the rights spots....good egg options, pancakes, waffles, etc. Not all breakfast spots offer up pepper jack cheese so that was a welcome surprise and made my omelet even better. Overall...good breakfast spot.

Food is good, service okay, but when you order breakfast, every single little thing results in an extra charge making a $6 meal and $12 meal which is my only beef really. 
Waited forever to get my check and never did so I had to go up front to ask and then pay. Which is one of my pet peeves.

For days I drove past this place, wondering what it was like. Finally I was able to try. I do not regret it, my meal was delicious, service was prompt, and the atmosphere was interesting. 

Only downside to me is that I don't think they stay open very late, more of a breakfast-brunch type of place. I wish they were open more hours, but maybe that has since changed.

What a great place for breakfast. Tried it for the 1st time on a whim. The staff always greets you with smiles. The food is great, always hot and full of flavor. I tell everyone I know about this SPECIAL place!! I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!
i like egg yolk very much! the food is great and the amount is even greater! but i love the way the host treat us! they even speak spanish! good place great people!
The wait is bit longer than usual; Bigger portions so order less if you visiting with family. Very fresh food

This diner has great comfy atmosphere, feels a little like a mom and pop Perkins, it's big and can seat many patrons. We were excited to have brunch here and were not disappointed. The menu had all the favorites one wants, eggs Benedict, omelettes, skillets, waffles, pancakes and then all the standard lunch fare.  They were very accommodating to my request of extra veggies in my breakfast skillet and it comes with 4 eggs!!!  The pancakes were amazing!  I only had one complaint, we waited a good 25 minutes for our food, but it was very busy, full at the time we were there. Once our food came, it was all together and all hot, and our waitress was attentive and came around with coffee refills regularly. If I lived in West Chicago, I would definitely come back.
Excellent food, large portions. Great prices and very friendly staff. I would definitely come back to this place. Came in with my band and the customer service was outstanding.

I generally don't go to places that do not have a website just because I like to check out the menu before I go. 
We just needed to get out of the house and this was the closest thing so we stopped in. The staff was super friendly, and the portions were a decent size for their price bracket. Unfortunately their food was not really anything spectacular....but it's definitely not bad either. But seeing that they had what seemed like an endless menu, I didn't really expect it to be kick ass either.

What a nice restaurant! First time here, and was impressed the second I walked thru the door. I was greeted with 2 beautiful smiles (and may I add, by 2 beautiful ladies :).! The decor and atmosphere was also welcoming and modern. The waitress was at my table the second she saw I was seated comfortably. Very polite, had a smile on her face, and all around did a great job. The omelette was perfect. Food came out very quickly. All good. This establishment has it right. Full 5 stars in my book. So if you're cruzin down 59 in West Chicago, and looking for a great breakfast, stop on by. You'll be glad you did!

I am giving this a 4 because is  very good and very fresh. However the wait is much too long.  Do not mind waiting when the restaurant is full but when I see that there are a dozen open tables I get annoyed. Last Sunday we waited 30 minutes only to see many empty tables and many people behind us still waiting.  Will probably only go there on weekdays. Too bad this is a great place

I had a nice lunch here the other day. It was my second time trying to eat here, and the first time I actually did it. Last time, I saw a line of high school kids hanging out in front and decided to take a pass, since it was cold out and I didn't feel like waiting. This time, the high school kids were all leaving when I got there. This slowed things down a bit, but I did get to wait inside, so no big deal. My advice to you is to keep an eye out between 11:00 and 11:45 during the week when school is in session if you need to get in and out of here quickly.

I ordered the crepes with strawberries, bananas, and walnuts. I was immediately impressed with the quality of the fruit. Sometimes, a menu will read "fresh strawberries," but they really mean "fresh from the can." Other times, the berries are fresh but come doused in syrup, like the canned ones. Here, there were just sliced berries on top of my crepes, which were cool and naturally sweet. The bananas were not brown or mushy. The walnuts were added with a good nut to fruit ratio in mind. These would have been the best crepes I've had in a long time, except the actual crepes were slightly undercooked and mushy. Still, they were not undercooked to an unsafe or disgusting level, and the large portions meant I could set aside the few mushy pieces and still fill up on the rest.

I also liked that they give you a full carafe of water here. The service isn't bad, but it isn't fast enough to fill up the glass of a pregnant woman who goes through water like Shamu at Sea World. My glass was never empty, but I didn't have to flag somebody down for more water every five minutes, either. Very nice!

I might bump them up to a fourth star on a later visit if I don't have to stand around waiting for the football team to clear out because there is slightly more staff to accommodate the lunch rush.

Great food and a great place !
We have went several times now.
Breakfast and lunch were both very good.

Will be back

People who don't give this atleast 4 stars don't know what they are talking about. Seriously. This place is off the hook. I love this place and the food is extremely delicious and they get you your food on time. Trust me and atleast try it
They have very good breakfast . There omelets are outstanding . Two thumbs up excellent.
Nice surprise!  We were looking for a place for breakfast and stumbled on Egg Yolk Cafe. Typical diner menu options, quantity and quality were great!  Service was quick & friendly.
Neltnor Skillet! Very friendly staff, good food & clean atmosphere.

Really friendly staff and good breakfast. My husband raves about their skillets (and cleans his plate every time). They give you a big portion and there are lots of choices on the menu. I usually have to ask for my hash browns to be well done, otherwise they're a bit under done and not crispy. They have a really nicely updated and comfortable space, with lots of light from large skylights (they could use a bathroom remodel though--they're pretty nasty). But we overall love this place and the food, and are here about every other week for breakfast.

We arrived at 10:00 Saturday morning for and were told it would be a 20 minute wait "while the kitchen catches up". The dining room was about 3/4 full at the time. We were seated in about 20 minutes, but waited another 15 before a wait person came to our table. We placed our order and waited another 30 to 40 minutes for our breakfast. Food was not good, over easy eggs were cooked hard, pancakes were tough and the toast was only toasted on one side. Home fries were tasteless and cold.
Greenville needs a good breakfast place, I hope they get their act together.
I give between 2 and 4.  Four because the Food and selection is excellent, as is environment and friendleness and two for service as the waitress was more than extremely slow ....terrible.

This used to be the Sandpiper restaurant for a long time and stopped going because was not impressed so when this new place opened I was anxious to try it and wow what a nice looking place which was needed and the food was good. I thought the overall experience was good and I had breakfast at lunch time and the rest of the family had lunch. I thought the blueberry pancakes were good but lunch looked good to and was from what I heard from the rest of the family and when i go back I will have to try it. The parking lot needs a lot of work but they just opened and maybe have not got to it yet since it was crumbling and hard to walk on for some one who has a problem walking on loose gravel. I will be back.
From the genuine greeting to the tasty food and friendly servers, this place quickly became a favorite for Sunday morning breakfast. I look forward to every visit!

Excellent local restaurant with friendly service and great food.
Large portions at reasonable prices.

This place is quickly becoming our go to for breakfast on Sunday mornings. My boyfriend and I like coming here because it's close to home (great if we've been drinking the night before), the service is always prompt and friendly and the busboys are great at refilling water (again, clutch if we were drinking.) Coffee is hot and plentiful and the food is delicious! Not sure what everyone is complaining about. I really like the lox benedict (their hollandaise sauce is a little lemony but still hits the spot) and my boyfriend swears by their skillets. And most of the time we can get out of there for around $20! Can't beat that! :)
We go to the Egg Yolk quite often.  It is a favorite!  Great food, excellent service with WiFi.  Portions are a good size and we always have some left overs.

Wow is all we can say.  This place is so great it ruins all our visits to other breakfast places.  We always find ourselves comparing any place we go to Egg Yolk Cafe.  The owners are great, everyone is so friendly, the wait staff is attentive and polite....just an over all awesome experience.  My wife would just say two words...APPLE PANCAKE!  We are always glad to tell our friends about this place...we love supporting local businesses and wish there were more of them like this place.

Regular weekend customers for breakfast.  Always greeted quickly and with a positive attitude.  Food is better than most.  Pancakes are very good.  Coffee is average.  Pricing is in line with everything.  The service is excellent, and where Egg Yolk really does a good job in differentiation from other breakfast joints.  
Never had a poor dining experience.  Happy for the new owners.  West Chicago needs a place like this.

Good breakfast place. Walked in about 8am on a Staurday and it was already crowded. Excellent french toast, good coffee, prompt service. Portions are good sized and maybe a tad more expensive than other breakfast places. Seems to be family run and they know all the "regulars". Nicely remodeled.

Took a chance while driving by after seeing positive reviews. Very nice inside. The food was great, very generous portions (the sausage links are huge!) and the service was really good. We don't liveclose by, but would be willing to make the trip to come back.

I use to come to the Sandpiper when it was open, and after a few bad experiences had given up on the place.  I was happy to see that new owners were taking over and that the Egg Yolk was born. I came in and was greeted by some very friendly employees and taken to my table within 5 minutes. My waitress was a cute and bubbly brunette by the name of Jen that made the experience quite enjoyable. Upon her suggestion I ordered the STEAK SKILLET which was AMAZING!!!! And the fresh orange juice was fantastic!!! Everyone was helpful, the decor appealing, and the prices more than fair. I look forward to going back and visiting this new and improved restaurant. Do yourself a favor go see for yourself.

Really liked my visit a week ago.  Everyone is friendly.  Wait was less than 5 minutes and for mid-morning on Saturday, that is impressive.  Food was very good and you get a lot of bang for your buck with the 7.99 options.  I look forward to coming again when I'm in the area.

I'd love to have been a spy on the conversation when the owners decided to open this place: "Let's serve the same food that everybody else does, about the same quality as everybody else and charge about the same, too." I would think that new owners would want to be inventive, unusual, find something that makes Egg Yolk distinctive from every other restaurant. The food wasn't bad, just ordinary. Not worth the drive for me.

Love this new restaurant!!!! Have been for breakfast quite a few times since the old Sandpiper was bought and reinvented. Everything I've ordered both breakfast and lunch has been fresh and delicious. I love how you can order breakfast or lunch items all day. The service is great and everyone there is extremely friendly and accommodating. Really feels like a family environm ent with good home cooked food. This is a great addition to West Chicago and I wish the owners a lot of success.

We were "now and then" patrons of the Sandpiper, but we have become "regulars" at The Egg Yolk Cafe. The service is excellent, the prices are very reasonable and the food is wonderful.
My favorite is the steak and eggs. The skirt steak is always tasty and perfectly cooked. The menu says it comes with two eggs, but I always get 4. (by which I mean they routinely serve the 4 eggs, I have not requested extra eggs) The hash browns are crispy and done all the way through and the toast is fresh from the toaster hot and buttery.  My husband loves the Julienne salad...plentiful, fresh and crispy.
We were not the least bit disappointed to hear they had torn out the bar and are replacing it with a "Party Room" for private events. I think it will be a perfect place for baby and wedding showers or perhaps a dining room for a larger family or group from an office or business.. We wish them much luck !!!!
On Sunday mornings they are packed, but after about 1:00, things slow down a bit and you should have no trouble getting a table.

Loved the food !!!
Must go there
Best food especially for vegetarian 
I am new in USA and its very difficult get pure vegetarian resturant  but yes shree has pure veg and delicious food

I went considering the innumerous reviews they had on yelp. As per Yelp this is supposedly the best south Indian restaurant in Naperville. 

Both my Dosa and Samosas were average. The Sambhar especially was disappointing. 

Update. There is no doubt the service of this place is awesome. The people here are great and know their service perfectly. I feel somewhere in between the Indian western styles of food the flavor has been lost. The food is too westernized for my taste buds.

Glad we noticed this place driving by. It's a little far from home to visit often, but I think we'll make the trip again.

The atmosphere is really warm and comfortable, and we received a friendly welcome. All of these things are somewhat unusual in my experience at Indian restaurants. All of our food was delicious...they were generous with the paneer, which is often not the case at other restaurants. The breads we tried, batura and butter naan were both very satisfying.

The bathroom was clean. What a bonus!

My only semi-complaint is that there was very strong incense burning when we arrived, but they toned it down when I mentioned that it was bothering me.

We'll definitely be back to try the lunch buffet.

I still didn't got it what wAs the $16 service charge on my bill last week  , the gravy of my sabji was only suger water with turmeric powder , don't go there if u wanna pay for food+labor
Thanks

First time here.. Really liked the aloo kachori. The bhaturas were dry good and it too oily. However the chole was different that what we were expecting. It was the dark brown chole and we have had better. But overall it was a rich dish. 

The shahi paneer came in a yellow gravy and was rich too. I personally would like to try a red paneer curry next time. The dosa was crunchy and tasty. The chutney and sambar were fresh and tasty as well. I really liked the dosa. 

The service was personal and attentive. I liked the manager of the place as he was very helpful with the dish selection. 

Will be back!

Good food but bad service. If you go there for dinner expect a wait time of at least 30 minutes. We saw folks who came after us served food before us. Only when we raised this issue with the owner they told us that they've messed up our order and would have to wait for some more time. All of us (including kids) lost our appetite by the time the food arrived. We ended up paying a lot of money for a very disappointing experience. This was our first ...and last visit to this restaurant.

The attitude of the serving staff was ridiculously rude and unacceptable.
The server rudely came and gave us the menus and was very bluntly asking us to order just once. "I can take your order only once"
What is wrong with you? Really?

The food is good no doubt, but with that attitude you're going no where but downhill.

Can I get a 4.5 choice Yelp?

The food is great! The ambiance is lovely: decor and background music. The kind of place to take a date. The server was nice and helpful, but a little too cheeky for me (you may want to keep an eye on that date). 

The food was very, very good.

Wish I could give less than 1 star. I usually do not write reviews but the lack of taste in the dishes we ordered has compelled me to write this review. Indian fast food joints are better than this restaurant and cheaper. Save your money and run far away from this place.

I visited second day.great food great price great service .
Great presentation . Happy to see SHREE in naperville
Had an unimpressive Mysore masala Dosa and samosa were right from Costco frozen section.
It's good to see shree in Naperville ; I love it's pure veg and food is excellent and service is. Perfect  thanks
Naperville has a new treat - what great ambience, awesome service and food - it's all delicious. We will be back!

The food was average. We ordered Aloo Kachori, Idli, Mango lassi, salted lassi, Chana bhatura, and paneer handi. The aloo kachori and idli were ok. Nothing special about it. Lassi was little watery. I would rather call it Mango shake than Lassi. Chana bhatura were exceptional. They make the butter tandoori roti differently so make sure you ask for tandoori roti with butter on top if you are used to having regular butter roti at other north indian restaurants.

I would defintaley go back for their Chana bhatura.
First time the food was exceptional about a month back ...today the food was stale. If you want not to be sick do not go there.This restaurant may close down soon...which I may never want

I am so glad Shree took over this Restaurent. 

Great Food ! Excellent service - will come here a lot more.

I cannot speak for their sushi as I've usually gone to Oishi Sushi in Willowbrook but their dim sum here is pretty good. The owners are pretty nice and the atmosphere here has always been very well served. By that I mean is the ambiance is not too loud not quiet, everything is laid out pretty well. There is seating in the back for larger parties and overall you don't feel too claustrophobic considering this establishment isn't very large. 

Their food comes out decently quick and they are made to order, NOT frozen. In terms of taste, I've never left feeling in satisfied or hungry. Chefs and preps all are from Chinatown so rest assured so do their ingredients. Service for myself and others has always been pleasant and accurate. I would rate this place two stars higher than the newer Minghin Cuisine restaurant down the street in Naperville. 

If it's not broken, don't fix it. Will be back again as always.

I had a taste for udon soup again after having it last week at Sushi House, but traffic was fouled up downtown last night by the Christmas parade so we went north to Raku Sushi because it's on their menu too. 

The broth was soy-heavy, with lots of kamaboko fish cake and the tempura perhaps slightly overfried, but the noodles were still good, hefty and slippery. 

My dad, who doesn't even like Japanese food and was just along for the ride, was pleased with the appetizer plate of beef teriyaki skewers he ordered on a whim. 

Our waitress was friendly and checked on us a lot (the place was also pretty empty later on a Sunday evening). 

The restaurant has a somewhat dated look and could use some more light in the parking lot (it butts up against the Stardust Motel). 

I would probably try other places before returning, but good service here was a plus.

REALLY SHOCKED at the high reviews for this place.  Extremely dirty and NOT FRESH!

My time was limited, as I had an appointment scheduled across the street, yet needed to squeeze in dinner, so I stopped in here.  I remembered I had eaten here before, but could not recall why I hadn't frequented this establishment more often, until now...

I ordered (rainbow roll & shrimp tempura roll) and headed towards the bathrooms to wash my hands.  You literally have to walk through a fabric curtain (yuck) to gain access to bathrooms.  

BUGS!!!   Did I say bugs?  

The ceiling panel had so many dead bugs in it, I stopped looking.  I should have taken a picture.   COLD water in bathroom sink, NO SOAP.  I headed out and was actually going to grab some soap in the men's bathroom when I discovered a 3rd bathroom for handicap.  I headed in there for soap.  Great some soap. But same infestation of bugs in ceiling panel.

Now how could  all these bugs appear overnight or even in 1 week?  Not.  This is laziness. Months???

I would have left right then, but I am diabetic and my sugar was dropping.

I returned to table.  The waitress knew I was on a timelimit, and informed me she was giving me an order for takeout since I was in a hurry.  I was thrilled and grateful and thanked her!  only to receive a dish of the smelliest sushi I have ever encountered

 I lifted a piece to smell, just to make sure...I went to sample a small corner and really?  A little slimy.  I waited for 2nd dish, thinking shrimp tempura would be cooked, should be okay.  I told the waitress that the rainbow roll was not fresh.  She literally was arguing with me.  I was being as polite as possible.  I had to say please take this away.

I ate the shrimp tempura.  It was okay.  I was praying I would not get sick ...

Omg...would never go back!  Want top notch?  Checkout Chef Soon on Route 53.  Maybe you need to  enjoy excellence for comparison :-)  ...said the nicest possible way

If the parking lot is empty, it is NOT because of construction

Sometimes I low brow it with grocery store sushi and some Netflix in bed, but my teenage son has no interest in any part of that scenario. :P I knew that many of my local friends speak well of Raku. So off we went one afternoon. He was skipping school and I his accomplice. 

It's very easy to miss with Ogden under construction. The parking lot entrance narrow with construction signs planking each side, I held my breath as I entered, afraid my car would get scratched. My car didn't scream at me, but there's definitely only room for a single vehicle at a time to enter or exit. 

It's not fancy but that's by no means an issue with me. But I was immediately concerned when the menu listed the bento boxes as "benton" boxes. Benton Box? 

My son had no intentions of eating sushi in my bed, so we stuck it out and took our chances. He ordered a ramen and a Phoenix roll and I ordered a chicken "benton". His sushi roll was not very fresh tasting. Perhaps construction is driving down business? I'd take sushi from my local upscale grocer any day over what he was served. 

Sadly, the chicken in my "benton" was overcooked and tough. *sad face*. No one should have really high hopes for shrimp around here since shrimp isn't harvested out of Lake Michigan and the ocean far away..but the shrimp tempura was extra unexciting. Definitely pre-frozen. 

They were very nice and the service was pretty quick. My waiter called me "too skinny" which was the best part of my visit. But I wouldn't likely return. Face it, you aren't going to find good Japanese in Naperville. It's just a fact.

So I came here to pick up dim sum for lunch (take-out) after having returned from the OC where I unfortunately did NOT have dim sum.

I got three things for myself: pan fried turnip cake, shui mai (pork and shrimp dumplings), and xiao long bao (soup dumplings). For all three it was $15.

My thoughts:
Pan fried turnip cake - pretty good flavor, but it was over-fried/oily and mushy. 
Shui may - things was probably the best item out of the three.
Xiao long bao - i've had frozen ones better than this...the flavor was off and (similarly to frozen ones) there was little to no "soup" 

Overall the place was a miss for me. I was aware beforehand that it might be a mistake ordering dim sum from a suburb of Chicago when I'm used to dim sum in NY or SoCal.
Very good quality sushi with an exceptionally  friendly staff.   They make you feel like family!

This place is much nicer on the inside than it looks from the outside. The sushi was pretty good albeit pricey. The fish in the rolls was better quality than the nigiri. The nigiri fish had that frozen-then-thawed taste to them. It wasn't terrible but definitely not the freshest or best sushi I've had. They also charged $1 for extra ginger.

Not my favorite sushi place, especially for the steep prices, but it's decent.

This is my favorite sushi spot. They have great lunch specials during the week and overall their prices are reasonable. At the same time, the sushi is great quality. The staff is very friendly and service is fast. Fire Dragon and Lion Dance are my favorite rolls.

Recently moved to the sub, wanted to try out some asian place but.....

We only had sushi, let's just say we are not coming back!  The sushi isnt as fresh, probably due to not having enough customers getting sushi

This is the ONLY place I willingly tried sushi, I order noodles but our lovely server convinced me to make the jump and I'm soooo happy I did. 
Everything was amazing, this will be the one and only place I eat sushi at. I don't think the prices are unfair at all, they import their eel sauce straight from Japan and their sushi tastes extremely fresh. We live in Chicago and I have never tired sushi this good, and we've tried many, many places.

The service was great our server was so friendly and suggested great options, 

Go with the fire dragon to start, the presentation won't disappoint

As a HongKonger, I love dim sum a lot 
This one has a professional Hong Kong dim sum chief in kitchen

I have been going to Raku Sushi since they opened. The maki and sushi rolls are amazing. You have to try unagi and the tropical roll! The staff is super friendly and they even know me by name. I have even gotten a few of my friends (who never liked sushi before) to try it and they fell in love! Raku Sushi is a great place to go on a date or a night out with friends -- from the relaxing atmosphere and price's, you can't go wrong!

Been here twice and it's still just as good as the first one for dimsum! 

The menu is similar to that of Chinatown, you order what you'd like and each plate ranges in price from small to extra large.  

The soup dumplings were good too!

I'd have to say its the best dimsum that's in the area.  Will keep coming back here if we're not in Chinatown :) 

*haven't tried the sushi here, just the dimsum

Went here for dinner tonight and I cannot get over the great experience my boyfriend and I had. The service was amazing and I honestly felt welcomed and right at home. My boyfriend is very indecisive sometimes and didn't really know what to get. Luckily, our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and had him feeling confident about his decision. When our food came out I was stunned. The presentation was beautiful and needless to say it tasted amazing! This place is great and I will definitely be back! Thank you guys for the great dinner!

We didn't find out this awesome place till my friends said this place started to sell the dim sum all day long about a month ago. It turned out they not only have decent dim sum but also delicious Sushi. To top that off, I really enjoyed the services too. We visited this place twice in a week. 

My kids finished edamame, Xiao long Bao, and pan fried pork buns in no time before I could take a decent picture of those. Chicken congee, steamed chicken feet, and Cantonese shrimp crepe were all delicious with the right flavor. Among the dim sum dishes, my personal favorite is the sesame balls which didn't have the typical filling of red bean paste but with egg yolk. Very rich but super tasty with the crunchy sweet rice shell. 

I tried the spicy tuna, unagi, and salmon sashimi. All are fresh and flavorful. I liked the spicy tuna the best. Kids loved the unagi - grilled eel.  We also tried the grilled fish jaw based on the photo from a fellow yelper. It had a Very clean taste as it did not have any seasoning on the fish just the nice grill flavor.  An unique dish to eat. 

The owner was there waiting the tables along with another nice lady. Both of them were great with my kids and accommodate us as much as they could. Really enjoyed the chat with them.

First time here for a sushi dinner. Upon entering the overwhelming smell of the fish in their aquariums was a total turnoff. We almost left because of it, but peeked into the dining room and decided to give it a try as the tables were far enough away to avoid the smell.  Also disconcerting was one poor large lion fish in a space of approximately 18" wide by 30" high in an aquarium. He could hardly move. So cruel!  The dining room itself was not pretty nondescript, not very clean either. The sushi however was very good. Unfortunately, because of the condition of the restaurant as well as the smell when you first walk in, I will not be back for dinner. There are better places to enjoy a good sushi in the area. This restaurant could definitely use a remodel and cleaning of their fish tanks.

Ughhhh.

I was pretty impressed by the google reviews (4.7/5)  and had not yet tried them out yet so I was definitely anticipating much MUCH better.

I decided to try an order of California Rolls for lunch.

They were very small, but an order is 8 pieces for around 5 bucks cannot be beat, right?

Well, the cucumber isnt skinned, the avacodo is browning and the crab and rice/seaweed are dried out and tastes like these were rolls from last night left over in the fridge/or just left out and not freshly rolled to order or even made freshly at all today.

It leaves such a disgusting, invaded feeling in your mouth because you know it isn't fresh and that makes you start thinking how old it could be and then what conditions it's stored and prepared in and that quickly made me only more sour in the gut.

Im disappointed as Tairyo also has been slacking on its freshness latley too. There goes two sushi restaurants fairly close to home. 

I will be going in later to get my $5 dollars back because they were that dreadful.

Pretty good. This place was delicious. Took my brother in law and sister in law and really enjoyed it. Will have to come back here with my husband on date nights. The dim sum hargow was so good. The shrimp were huge! So glad we only live 5 minutes away. (:

The best dim sum in Chicago is in the burbs. You heard right. We've had dim sum on the north side and in Chinatown and this folks beats them all. They serve it every day all day long. The dishes are all prepared when you order which is why it takes a little longer to get served. But well worth the wait. Nothing is made ahead of time and the dim sum is very very fresh.

Also, the owner and his wife were super friendly and told us all about how they make their dim sum right in their kitchen. Them, their chef and their staff drive in from Chicago each day. 

And the price is really reasonable. My wife and I had 9 dishes and tea - totally stuffed. Bill came out to $38. Sorry downtown Chicago but we're staying in the burbs for dim sum from now on.

Walking into this place brought back memories of late nights at Baker's Square... 

Came here for dim sum and wasn't disappointed. I like that they cook things to order rather than pushing a cart around. Everything we ordered came out just right, hot, and/or crispy. Definitely beats driving into Chicago for dimsum, especially with 2 littles. The staff were very helpful.

Lovely! Went here with my sister and 18th month old. One of those days where the little one is a little fussy. Servers were super nice and chatty with little one and very attentive to our table. Ordered the salted chicken congee.. perfect for a sore throat and little one kept muttering yumm nguymmm yumm.. Nuff said. Also ordered fire dragon roll, a spicy tuna roll, shrimp crepes and choy sum vege dish. Simply delish. 

So very glad I found this place.. amazing dim sum without going to chinatown, comfort congee (nguymm yumm yumm) and spicy tuna rolls. Will be back, will recommend to people I know.
Great, fresh sushi, friendly service. Fire dragon roll is served literally with dressing on side on fire (yay for preps like me). Super white tuna and yellowtail sashimi was delicious

I have been here twice now with my boyfriend. First time great food and good service second time even better also bonus points for taking car of your exotic fish and their tank. Delicious smoothies as well. Unlike most of Naperville I didn't get a "snob" vibe.

Five years ago I would give this place a five star rating. But not now. 

I used to go here when I went to college nearby and the sushi was excellent. The lunch specials were affordable for students and the sushi tasted great. Fast forward three years and I went to Raku and the sushi wasn't as great, nor did the Salmon steak taste fresh. I Cringed. The fire dragon tasted stale. The only thing I enjoyed was the calamari tempura and miso soup. 

Thinking this was perhaps a bad day I went another time with couple friends and every person was kind of disappointed about their orders but wouldn't say anything. We talked trash after leaving the restaurant. 

I mustered the courage to go a third time couple years later,as I was in the area, and couldn't get the memorable college times outta mind. I am sad to say that Raku has gone downhill and I unfortunately won't ever go back. 

The people are super friendly and the same waiters and waitress since my college days but the quality of the food has gone down. I wish they'd go back to being the way they did when they were new.

The Food.. excellent. The people..excellent. The smell when you come and go.. Horrid. It's unfortunate because the Mexican roll and the Fire Dragon roll were...excellent. But because of the nasty smell of those dirty koi fish, I will have to rate it a 3. I'm sorry it's the truth.
Best dim sum this side of China Town. And if you're not familiar with dim sum, you're in for a treat. Great service and friendly staff. I plan on being a regular.

Finally dim sum that's really good, reasonable priced and close to home! Plus sushi too! The Customer service is by far the best!! A friend of mine found this place a few months ago and my family and I tried it for the first time  on Valentine's Day and we loved it! Our waitress was so patient and sweet w our youngest son. It was clean, freshly prepared food, fast and friendly service. We will definitely be back again!

I went here last night with my boyfriend for the first time. We really enjoy sushi and were looking to try a new place around town as we had yet to find one we liked (we had gone to four or five different places trying to find "the one"). I would definitely say this place will be our go to from now on as the sushi was great and so was the service! The sushi came out quick even though the place was getting very busy, it was still very well made, and the fish was so fresh! Service was never lacking either even as they accommodated large groups. Sushi selection was fantastic and I have to agree that the Fire Dragon roll is amazing! Would highly recommend this place.

I have eaten at Raku more times than I can count. Not only do they know my order when I call, but they ask how my extended family is doing when my husband and I dine in. The owners and staff are so hard working and you can tell they truly love and care about what they do as well as for their customers. 

Coming from the east coast and always having access to fresh fish, I was a little worried about moving to the Midwest and getting decent sushi. Well, I got better than I was hoping for. I found a place that sells phenomenal sushi. You can tell from the moment you walk in that the fish is fresh because there is no fishy smell when you enter.

I typically order 3 tuna cucumber rolls (the tuna is fantastic). My husband goes between the Lion Dance, Mexican and also enjoys the sweet potato (he's a beginner). Their sashimi is also wonderful. Try the super white tuna -- it melts in your mouth!

Came here for dinner at about 9. Place was pretty filled, lots of people. I ordered the tempura udon and some other small eats like the fried tofu. Also had some maki rolls, which were delicious. However, the udon was quite salty. It had me drinking the tea after every spoonful of soup. The tempura was very good. My only complaint is how salty the udon was.

We have taken the family there several times and we have always been impressed by the quality and presentation of the sushi. The owners drive out to Naperville from Chicago daily. They are always friendly and accommodating.  We love the Lion Dance, the Eel rolls, Spider roll -- it is ALL good, but those are our favorites. If we can ever get past the sushi, we hope to try the Dim Sum - I hear it is wonderful.
Highly Recommended!

Came here with the intention of getting sushi, but noticed the dim sum menu and everything else went out the window. While it certainly can't compare to Chinatown, it was good enough. We were one of the last tables to be seated, didn't know what time they closed, and were essentially rushed out the door so they could all go home. While I understand how annoying it must be to seat people so close to closing, if they would have told us that BEFORE seating us, that would have helped.

In my opinion, it is the best sushi place in chicagoland - definitely naperville. $8.95 for a big chicken teriyaki box lunch w chicken, sushi, vegetable tempura and rice? How can u beat that?  The service is outstanding.

I love the food but I hate the service. We waited for like 20mins for the server to take our order. Then our sushi was served right away but we had to wait more than 30mins for our dim sum. Then a male server was server rude when we asked for our check and a box then we waited again to get the check & they forgot our box so we waited again. 

All in all we pretty much wasted an hour for waiting.

We just went there for valentine's dinner. The sushi is as fresh as it gets. The fish is fresh and the crunchy tempura was flavorful and fluffy. The lychee martini was delicious and sweet.The fire dragon roll is unbelievable. Our favorite sushi place in the city is Butterfly and nothing has compared to that place until now. Raku was delicious!

We tried dim sum during weekend at this place.  Authentic Dim Sum.   

The only thing was my husband had a bad stomach after last visit...We probably will not go back because of that.

The atmosphere, staff, and food were excellent! We had several of our favorite sushi rolls including the California, and the crunchy shrimp. The hostess was attentive, not overbearing. Everyone in the place seemed to be having a great time! I would definitely recommend this place!

Very good and very reasonably priced! We love Chef Soon too but this is a great option too. Not as hip and upscale but great service and food. My 17 son can eat a ton of sushi and it adds up fast. Chef Soon for date nite and Raku for family nite. No wait on a Saturday nite!

Driving by I decided to stop when I saw a full parking lot which is always a good sign. Awesome dim sum. Place was packed for lunch. Pan fried pot stickers, chicken buns & har gow jumbo shrimp were my choices. All were really good, freshly prepared dishes. Will be back when I'm in the area next time!!

I wasn't blown away by Raku.  There are about a billion (rough estimate) other sushi places in the area, and every other one is better than Raku.  The menu selection is average:  we ordered the Spicy Tuna, Mexican, Rainbow, and Shrimp Crunch.  

Everything was okay, but I mean "okay" as in, it was edible, fairly priced, but really not much better than grocery store sushi.  Some of the rolls fell apart easily, and they charge extra for additional wasabi or ginger, which is kind of lame.  I wouldn't come here again because I can better quality and variety elsewhere.

The ambience is casual, and the restaurant is dimly lit.  Loud talkers should avoid the place, because I could clearly hear just about every conversation around me.  It isn't cozy or romantic, and the Christmas lights that are on the windows belong either A) decorating a dorm room or B) on a Christmas tree.

The service was pretty slow too.

Nothing made the experience horrible, but nothing made it great either.  Sushi fail.
Beyond delish!! Highly recommend.

It was yet another solo sushi date for this lone wolf. Looking to escape the monsoon happening outside, I sought refuge (and piping hot green tea) inside an empty Raku.

I was greeted promptly and with big smiles from the staff of Raku and quickly sat at small booth in the front dining area. The decor is fun with paper umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, a salt water fish tank and geisha statue with stacked sake barrels near the entrance. And my server had a contagious smile and everyone working was friendly and welcoming. 

I started with a standard bowl of miso soup. It wasn't the best miso I'd ever had and I was a bit disappointed that the bowl was really only barely half full, but it was only $2 and helped warm me up none the less, also helped along by the whole pot of hot tea they left for me on the table. I drank so much, it felt like I could've floated out of there. 

My next course involved my go-to spicy tuna roll and a light avocado roll. I felt like the spicy tuna was okay. Not better, pretty good, but not a star and not at all spicy. Then again, it looked like some of their more signature rolls were where the big show was, but I avoided as I'm not huge on tempura but for my next visit, I think I'll definitely break down and give it a try. They look really well done and other reviewers seem to have enjoyed them. The avocado roll was simple but great. Creamy with plenty of avocado and not the kind of veggie roll where you really only taste the rice.  

I left stuffed for only $14 and some change and happy with my decision to break from my rainy day activities and errands to be greeted with smiles that would stay fresh in memory for the rest of the otherwise grey and dreary day.

Not sure why this place is 4/5 stars. Me and my family came here for my mom's birthday and the owner seated us to the corner on a shaky table. We asked to change tables and he kept arguing with us saying "your not here to rock the table", which was a complete insult and disrespectful especially on my mom's birthday. The owner ruined the mood for my mom's birthday. Will not be returning. Go to szechuan house by the mall for authentic, better service, cheaper, and tasty food!

My husband and I were excited about the reviews Raku Sushi received for the dim sum menu.  The idea of not having to drive from the western suburbs and fight traffic on the way home from Chinatown was definitely appealing.  We tried it out and ordered shrimp dumplings, steamed spare ribs, egg rolls with chicken and taro, BBQ pork steamed buns, and sticky dumpling ( hom siu gok).  Everything is made to order and the wait was very short.  When we went there were only 2 tables ordering.  The other 4 already had their food.  The food was nice and hot and the service was very good. Contrary to what some other reviewers mentioned.  Our one complaint - the food was quite bland which was a big disappointment!  We used lots of low sodium soy ( nice of them to provide this alternative), hot oil and plum sauce to try and boost the flavor.
Our search for good dim sum in the western suburbs continues.
First time trying sushi. The server was very nice and introduced me to saki bombs. The food was excellent as well. Mexican roll and Phoenix roll were delicious.

My fiance and I came here for the first time. It was around 1pm on a Saturday and we were the only customers in there.

We got one of the Makimono rolls- 4 california, 4 crunchy shrimp, 4 salmon, and 4 philadelphia. It was pretty good! We also got a phoenix roll which was pretty good as well.

The waitress/owner was super nice and talked to us for 5 minutes. We would definitely come back!

I love everything about Raku. The food is awesome, the service is amazing, the decor is beautiful. Came here for a friends birthday, they ordered many rolls of sushi. 
Being a vegetarian at sushi place Raku has a varitey of options. 
I ordered the tofu udon noodles which were delicious.  
My friends ordered a variety of rolls, the owners also gave us free saki shots for my friends birthday!! 
Next time my friend goes she said she will order one of the extravagant sushi boats, 

Will be back for sure. Great food, amazing hospitable service, beautiful decor.

We didn't come for the sushi, but for the Dim sum which we had heard was alright.

Food: Good tasting traditional dim sum but some of the dishes came out cold and not very fresh. Price was a little bit unfair due to the quality but I suspect they are only doing well because they are one of the only dim sum places in the area. 

Atmosphere: Decent for a sushi restaurant but unusual for a dim sum place. The servers were also all very nice but a little slow and unprofessional. We were also wrongly charged for 6 person tea when we only had 4 people so go over your check before you pay!

SIDENOTE: All dishes were very oily. Most of the dishes were sitting in pools of oil.
Very fresh sushi. Great service. They understand gluten free dietary needs.  Highly recommend.

We were looking for a quality sushi restaurant and believe we found it here. Very friendly server who helped guide us in a few menu choices. We had a good varriety of sushi with hot miso soup, veggie egg rolls, and tea. It was all so delicious and very resonable priced.

Went here on a sushi craving on the recommendation of a friend..wow..delish! Great sushi. Not a very fancy place, but the sushi is fantastic. I had the fire roll, the lion roll, and a few pieces. All very good...I will go back! A hidden gem for sure.

Ahhhh Im so behind on my review!  I was here Oct 25, 2013... so yeah soooo behind!

Driving around Naperville, for dinner and we couldnt fine anything so I went to my Handy Dandy... CELLPHONE! and yelp =D

First of, yelp sent me to some country club... umm negative! so I drove around Ogden finding this place smh, omg it was right by H MART!! ahah!

Anywho, yelp gave this place 4 stars... and I was hoping it would be because I was getting hangry!! (hungry angry).... and it was better than 4 stars! 

I'm giving this place 5 stars because the sushi taste and smelt fresh. It was smooth, and sweet, the sushi rice was okay, but the quality of fish was just right. OH! I can't forget about the Sweet Shrimp... om nom nom nom... The shrimp head was fried just right, and the sweetness of the ama ebi with a little bit of masago on it was excellent! 

My gf for the tonkatsu, her go to dish, and it was nice is crispy as it should be. once again the rice was okay. 

Serve was great, maybe because we were 1 of the 2 groups of people there and they were about to close at 10.

Pricing there was fair and great for what you get. 

Def, going back there when I'm in town again... which most likely will happen since I always stay at the Hyatt in Lisle

Went for the lunch special which is a good deal. For 12 bucks I got soup, salad, and two rolls. I received quick service and my food about 5 mins after I sat down. The rolls were decent and the soup was ok. The salad dressing was a litter too bitter for me but I still ate it. Overall not too bad but I've had a lot better. I'd come back again for the lunch deals.
I love this place! My friends and I always go for the lunch specials on week days! They're around $10 and it comes with a miso soup & a small salad. It's a great deal!

We got here at around 8:10PM, ordered an edamame to start with. Then the server did not show up until 8:50ish. And then she was rushing us by saying it would probably be the last call. (By the way the site says it is open until 10 PM, and they had guests coming in after 9:30PM)

The salad was really good. So we had some hope. The Miso soup not worth remembering, the chicken curry and veggie fried rice were both mediocre. We ordered Rainbow Sushi, California Roll and Spicy Tuna. The spicy tuna was the only good sushi. (How can you mess up California Roll?) We also ordered the Calamari Tempura and it was not good either. 

Maybe we caught these guys on a bad day, but the 4.0 average rating was nowhere to be seen. What I find intolerable is the server LYING about the hours and the last call. 

Oh and they charged a dollar for extra ginger. 

I do not say this often, but I will not be eating here anymore.

We came for a Sunday Dim Sum brunch. Loved the food, all the dishes that we ordered were fantastic except xiao long bro, which were dry, while soup shall be wrapped inside the xiao long bao. However I should still consider five stars for the food. Service was not that great I am afraid and that's why I can only give four star overall.

Maybe I've been spoiled with good sushi & dim sum my whole life but I wouldn't say this place was "good". 

I'll start with dim sum,  as I grew up eating it in Chinatown. I came here with my parents because they wanted to check out a dim sum place closer than the city. I eat the same dishes every time I eat dim sum and the food was not good..... At all. Had to send back 4 dishes because it was still raw in the center. Like cold and pink... And my fried sweet ball with meat had all this white residue on the inside. $50 later we didn't even eat half the dishes. Would rather drive the extra distance to Chinatown. 

I also ordered the lunch box lunches they offered and I had the fried pork cutlet. It was so thin and hard I couldn't even bite through it. It was drenched in sauce.

The ambience was cute. Small Japanese place. Servers were really nice and apologetic. I won't be back. You can get way way way better food for cheaper elsewhere.

"Hello, may I please leave a review for the worst night of service of my life?"
"Oh yes, I'll get it ready for you right away"
.....

{20 minutes later)

"Okay you may write your review now"

---

*That is the preview for this upcoming review. Warning, if you experience anxiety, nausea, fainting spells, bursts of rage, depression, hallucinations or extreme headaches please be advised that this review may not be for you.

---

I would like to first of all point out how rare it is that I submit a one star review. As of today I have 84 five star reviews, 27 four star reviews, 6 three stars, 4 two stars and this will make my 5th one star. Obviously, I am not hard to please. It takes a lot to piss me off.

Enjoy.

---

7:30pm on a Friday evening | Group of 10 trickle in and are seated immediately. 

We casually order various appetizers and drinks. Everything seems like it will be fine. Just like the start to a horror movie... We should have realized that something was amiss when my younger brother's appetizer was mysteriously forgotten. Later, we looked back on this seemingly trite occurrence and wished so dearly that we would've taken it to mind, instead of brushing it off so flippantly.

8:00 | We've all been ready to order for a while and we are trying to make it to Saddle Up for some line dancing before they end it at 10. So, I call the waitress over and ask if we can place our orders. She says yes, and that she will be right back.

She mysteriously disappears for a time - just like my little brother's appetizer order... Is there something in the restaurant that we don't know about? Perhaps a wormhole into a different world? Maybe there is a giant monster living underneath that needs constant food and attention. I don't know. But one thing I do know, there is something fishy about this place - and not just because it's a sushi restaurant ; )

8:20 | Our waitress comes back to take our order. Now, I'm not the best at math, but I do know that from 8:00 to 8:20 = 20 minutes. What!? 20 minutes!? What was she doing!? Where did she disappear to for 20 minutes!? {Let me take a moment to remind you that we were a TABLE OF 10 PEOPLE}

Also, this is a sushi restaurant, right? So. Like most sushi restaurants - all we had to do was.... hand. her. our. sheets. of. paper. with. our. sushi. orders. marked... she didn't even have to write anything down. She could have picked up our silly little papers 20 minutes ago and we could have maybe had our food by now...

---

I would like to reiterate my warning from the beginning. If you've made it this far and you think you're doing okay - I'm sorry my friend, but it gets much. much worse.

---

Time passes. Some of us start to believe we are in purgatory. Others begin to eat invisible food off their plates. Everyone uses the bathroom at least once and there are multiple smoke breaks. 

We have drank all of the soy sauce and eaten all of the garnishes from our appetizers.

....Let me remind you that we had wanted to leave by 8:30/8:45 so we could make it to saddle up for some line dancing. Also - this is a group of people that for the most part don't live near the naperville/aurora area - so we don't get to go every day. We picked this place specifically because it was close to Saddle Up - and they were able to take a last minute large table reservation. Also I trusted the yelp reviews. I still trust yelp. I won't take this experience out on yelp. I only wish that my review could count for negative stars so as to help people steer clear of an awful experience like mine. I digress...

9:10 | At this point - we all probably look like that skeleton in Snow White that is reaching through the bars for a jar containing a single drop of water. I actually saw the eyes of a cannibal in my best friend's expression for a moment and I feared for me life. 

The waitress finally appears from whatever mysterious thing is happening in this restaurant that we can't see. She comes over to me and I am so excited, my heart almost leaps out of my throat {It's a good thing it didn't, because I probably would've eaten it - and then I would be dead right now}

She tells me that....
Oh, it's too difficult to relive. I feel like I may be experiencing minor ptsd from the experience - but I must. push. through. it.

She says.... not apologetically, but in a practical, this is the way life is sort of way: "they are starting your food now"

whuuu? uh. bbbuut. whu. uh. uh. uh!? WHART!? um. EXCUSE ME!?!

I get angry. My boyfriend gets angry. He goes over and at least gets a nice amount off each of our tabs - but nothing could make up for our experience so far. And it's. not. over.

9:35 | Our food all comes at different times. We all eat it like monsters. One couple gets their food after everyone is done and has to eat by themselves. At this point, I go to the waitress to ask for the bills. 

9:55 | Our bills finally come.

10:00 | We all go home. I guess no Saddle Up tonight.

This is my 5001 character mark.

While Raku is easy to overlook when driving past, (It's next to the Wendy's) it is a great spot for a quick Sushi lunch! 

The food is always fresh, quick, and filling. The sushi was nice restaurant quality. The flavors are what you would expect from a sushi joint - nothing too surprising.  The prices are great, especially for the $10 lunch specials -- They fill you up!

This is my all time favorite sushi place! I love their volcano roll and phoenix roll the best. Also, I always have a Sapporo beer which is awesome. The service is always phenomenal and the atmosphere is excellent. Don't miss out on this restaurant! :)

We have tried so many sushi places in the area and this one is our favorite. Great portions and prices. Staff is always kind and on top of things. Never had a problem and we have been here at least a dozen times. Not the fanciest sushi place, but the food is great!

I went to Raku for a friend's birthday. The exterior of the building looks pretty shady. At first my husband and I were like, "Why did she pick this place of all the Sushi places in Naperville?" She later informed us that she was also skeptical after driving by it, but it got really good reviews! Please do not be fooled by the outside. This place is awesome!

As soon as we walked in, it was like a completely different restaurant. I love the decor, very chic. The ceiling especially. You will see what I'm talking about when you visit. There are cute colored lights everywhere. We were greeted and sat almost immediately which was nice considering it was evening time on a weekend (although she might have made a reservation). Either way, it wasn't packed. Our waitress was really great. She explained the menu and the specials to us and took our drink orders. They have thai tea, which is a favorite of mine. Theirs is really good!

I can't speak on the sushi because I didn't try any but my friends ordered a variety of it and they really liked it. It was also a great price for how much you get considering sushi is normally pretty pricey. I ordered the hibachi and I love it! They brought it out in this pretty little box and it came with sooo much food! I'm talking chicken, steak, shrimp, fried vegetables, salad AND soup, and dessert! All for a seriously great price. My husband ordered the steak curry and it was spicy and delicious.
