I will definitely be back here. The service was great and so were the prices. Although the building isn't much on the outside, the inside is clean and beautifully decorated. I would highly recommend this place.

I've eaten here on multiple occasions with friends and family and everyone seems to enjoy it! Their shrimp crunch roll is the best along with their miso soup! The only problem I have is that I always get really bad stomach aches after eating here which I never do at other sushi places :/ Wish this wasn't a problem because the food & service is great here

The boyfriend and I have been craving sushi for the past two weeks, we tried this place by my school and it was ON POINT. 
We were really hungry so we ordered steamed shrimp shumai, gone in like two minutes.
We ordered makimono rolls which are 4 pieces of 4 different rolls which worked perfectly because we got to try more rolls without ordering too much. In that order, it included a california, spicy tuna, eel and crunchy shrimp roll.
On top of those we ordered spicy salmon and raku raku

THEY WERE ALL SO GOOD. except for the california roll, just because it's so plain compared to all the other rolls we tried. 
The raku raku was good but that might be because it's fried...after a few pieces it got a little heavy for me..
I think my favorite was the crunchy shrimp roll...

i cant wait to come back.
NOT a fan of the sushi, but the DIM SUM is GOOD!! An ex-chef from Chinatown makes all of their dim sum in-house. SO HAPPY to have a good local dim sum place at all hours too!!

Personal favorite maki place! They greet you instantly and the woman remembers us each time, asks about school, etc. 

The servers sometimes forget if you ask for something extra (straw, etc) but aside from that, absolutely love going here.

After many of the reviews here I went expecting a fun dining experience, however we were disappointed. We were seated quickly but then "quickly" went bye bye. The service was very slow. It appeared that our server had too many tables to herself although there would be s younger guy who would pop out once in awhile. She took forever to take our drink order. And then for the drinks took forever to come out too. She wasn't all that friendly either, probably due to being overly busy. As far as the décor..yes they had there paper umbrellas hanging from the ceiling but the place looked tired rather than fun. We had several different rolls and they were fine. The prices are reasonable but given everything else I prefer Yamado across the street, much nicer and quicker service, food is equal and prices are the same.

My husband had tried sushi on a business trip and was hooked. We decided to try some sushi in our area. We tried out another restaurant on a recommendation and it was just okay. The next day, the husband decided we should have sushi again, and try a different restaurant, so we did. Funny thing is, I am a vegan, and he is not. At the first sushi restaurant, the waitress looked at me funny and said she could get them not to put crab in the California rolls. I was kinda surprised, as I thought sushi was made fresh. Anyway, at Raku, the waitress wasn't even phased. She recommended several items, one being the sweet potato rolls. OMG they were delicious. I ordered four rolls and my husband two. I took most of mine home with a unique sweet and sour sauce that had a kick. The staff was very accommodating and welcoming. We will be back, many times.

As the popular phrase goes "don't judge a book (restaurant) by it's cover (outside)." This goes for Raku Sushi because when you pass it along Ogden Avenue in Naperville, you don't think it would be very gourmet. Step inside and you are shown how great of a place it is and how tasty their cuisine is too, especially the sushi.

When going in for dinner one night with my mother, we were surprised at how great their service and food was. We ordered an appetizer which came out right away, and then we ordered a variety of sushi and maki to share, which was nicely presented and as tasty as it looked. They also kept coming back to refill our drinks as needed too, which is always a plus when eating out.

So step outside your comfort zone, try new places, and don't always judge a place by how it looks from the road. Give Raku Sushi Gourmet a try if you are a sushi fan.

I LOVE Raku! I've been coming here for years since they first opened. The staff is always friendly and goes above and beyond (aways asks how my university education is going...they remember their regulars for sure!) and it doesn't hurt that the food is awesome. Very reasonable price considering that they will only serve sushi made of fresh ingredients, and if that particular ingredient is unavailable super fresh that day, they will inform you that, unfortunately, that roll is not available. I love the honesty, especially with raw seafood! Recently they started offering dim-sum which is so yummy. If you go I recommend the dragon roll (my favorite) from the sushi menu and the dumplings from the dim-sum menu. In short, I absolutely recommend this place to anybody in the Naperville area.

In browsing through some yelp reviews I noticed a couple of customers point out that at busy times they seemed to wait for their food. I just want to throw out there, that, yes, on a Friday night at 8:00pm with a party of 10 people, your food is not going to be ready by 8:15pm. To be honest, I'd rather figure an extra ten minute wait for my dinner and know my money is going toward a hard-working family business, rather than some McDonald's-esque business who could have my food out in 5 minutes, is worth it to me.

P.S.: They do takeout too!!! Box everything very conveniently and have it ready for you ASAP

I'd give this place 4 stars but their service sucks. Food takes forever to come out. And don't bother asking for anything else once you've ordered your food. They won't remember what you asked for or bring it to you when you don't need it anymore. Now to the food. Tried the chicken udon soup. I loved it. It's very similar to "kow piek sin" aka Laotian chicken noodle soup. Also tried their fried rice and yakisoba. Both good but wish the portions were bigger. Overall I'd continue to go here because it's not too far and prices are decent.

This a good choice for a mixed group of people who do and do not like sushi. The varied menu includes grilled skewer appetizers, miso, tempura, curry over rice, fried rice with a choice of meats, and noodle soups. The shrimp shumai appetizer was very good. There is an extensive list of maki rolls. Everything we ordered was good, but lacked a bit in visual presentation. The Hamachi Guacamole roll had a nice zing of lime to balance the mild fish. The Fire Dragon with scallop, tuna, cucumber and avocado was also very good. The Lion Dance was ok but had too many tempura crumbs dumped on top. Prices are reasonable.

Do you know one of those restaurants that you always say "Oh yeah, that was fantastic! The food was great and it was cheap!" and yet, you have never returned? This is that place for us. We have very positive feelings towards it, but have yet to go back. It's still in business, so it must be doing well, because businesses that do just ok in Naperville don't stay open very long!

We got a huge boat of sushi with 5 rolls and several pieces of nigiri. Plus a couple bowls of miso. It was all about $50. The place was empty, and out of every corner of the place there appeared to be employees smiling at us. At one point we looked towards the kitchen and three people (from the back) were looking at us, smiling. It was a bit goofy. Maybe because we were the only people there and they wanted to ensure our satisfaction was through the roof. Either way, I can't say anything bad about this place. Maybe I'll head there sometime soon.
Dim sum is on point here. Sushi is eh. I got a couple rolls and it could maybe have been fresher. The tempura flakes tasted stale. I'll be back for sure but more so for the dim sum.
The nicest people, the best sushi, and the prices are great.  I love this place.  Thank you for being in the area.

Wow.  What a great place.  The sushi was amazing,  the service was fantastic.  I had ordered the Eel, California, Philadelphia and Salmon with Scallop rolls for pick up.  I went there and I had picked up and the gentlemen that was working there so wonderful.  I picked up my order and left him a 15.00 tip.  I will be going back there very soon.

I had visited Raku last week (after reading all of the amazing reviews).
I was so disappointed. Rolls were not good at all (tuna did not look fresh, rice was not the best I ever tried either). I, personally, never would go back. My companion was disappointed as well.

Average sushi spot. It's affordable but very basic. Nothing special. The sushi was great. However, the preparation was VERY slow compared to what I've experienced in the past. I visited with a group of 7. It took over an hour for 7-10 rolls to be prepared. The bathroom was dim and NOT clean.

Went here based on the reviews on Yelp and as usual mg fellow yelpers did kit disappoint.  We had the fire dragon roll the Mexican roll and a spicy tuna roll. They were all really good. The prices were very reasonable and the waitress was attentive and very helpful. Give it a try if you are in the neighborhood.  you won't be disappointed

sushi with dim sum doesn't equal to great sushi or sashimi. We ordered Tonka sure which way too thick with no flavor and sushi dish which the fish was dry and limp. The raw fish looked like it was in the fridge way too long. The price wasn't cheap either. With a bill of 50 plus for two dish and a appetizer I say go some where else for this price. Highly disappointed.

Great sushi spot in Naperville!  After a long morning of shopping at the outlets in Aurora, we searched Yelp for a nearby sushi restaurant and we were led to Raku!  Our server was super friendly and recommended one of their special rolls and it was amazing-the plate came out with flames!  The Spicy Tuna and Mexican rolls were also very good and the house salad with ginger dressing comes in a very generous portion size!  If we're in the area again, we'll definitely return to Raku!

Nice spot and probably more ideal for dinner than lunch since it's just a wee bit pricier than one might normally spend on lunch.  But the food is excellent.  I brought my laptop in with me to work a bit during lunch and they were nice and seated me in a spot near an outlet.  Waitress was friendly and checked in several times to make sure I liked what I ordered (she suggested some of the items).  Really, can't say anything bad about the spot and it's for sure worth checking out.  Will be back again as well!

The slowest service of all sushi places I have been to. Food just OK, like generic nothing special sushi stuff, special rolls are overpriced. When I ordered 10 pcs sashimi assortment they included 2 crab imitation sticks and one shrimp in total count. Although the restaurant is spaceous and conveniently located I will not return since it doesn't appear to be managed well. And to further add to my dissatisfaction they don't accept American Express.

We came here on a yelp whim when my girl friend suggested it.  It was either Red Lobster or this late night around 9 or 9:30 on a weekend.  We were greeted and seated.  They have DIM SUM late night too!  We had to try it!  My friends ordered sushi, I ordered some handrolls, and sashimi pieces.  For dim sum we ordered the dumpling I think it was #1.  We also ordered the large congee to share, and the shrimp stuffed eggplant.  It was the most amazing stuffed eggplant I've tried in my life.  The textures were perfect and carmelized.  The owners were very friendly and we got our fill.  Sushi or Dim Sum, you can't go wrong.  I haven't tried other dishes but I'm sure it'll be good.  Can't wait to go here again!
Usually go their for lunch. Never busy, which surprises me because the food is great! Highly recommend)! Staff is friendly, price average!

I promised my wife sushi for her birthday.  Instead, I surprised her with a houseful of family members, great Filipino and Chinese food, and some excellent ice cream cake.  The next morning, she flips over to tell me:  "You still owe me sushi!".  What an addict.

That's the start of why we made our way to Raku Sushi.

1st off, pricing on their sushi/sashimi is quite reasonable.  All orders are for TWO pieces of sushi, so perfect for a date, and far better priced than most sushi joints.  On my personal experience of quality scale, it is squarely a medium, to mid-high level quality of fish.  Ordered up our standards:

Tamago - Slightly sweet egg, super tender.  Good start.
Sake - Nice fat lines, breaks with each bite perfectly without stringiness, no fishiness, and light flavor.
Unagi - Meaty with just a little bit of crisp on the side.  Just how we like it.
Ama Ebi - The meat wasn't as sweet as I hoped, and the deep fried head wasn't as seasoned as I would like... but it was tasty nonetheless, and a very reasonable price at $8 for two pieces.

We didn't try any special rolls, so I can't comment to those.  Looked interesting, so we may be back to try again.  Did the standard spicy tuna roll and shrimp tempura roll, both were good, but pretty standard priced.

Note:  It was very slow, but the sushi chefs placed our order on a beautiful boat to be eaten from!  Don't know if this is common for them, but excellent presentation!

Figured we wanted a big more food to balance out the menu, so we noticed that a few customers had received a separate Chinese food menu.  I requested that menu and ordered up some string beans with pork and fried anchovies.  (That's one dish).  String beans were perfectly crisp and cooked, and the dish was an excellent way to round out the meal.

Verdict:  Very friendly service, sushi/sashimi is super affordable, the rolls are standard priced, and a regular priced Chinese menu to round out the meal.  A good standard place to get a bite of sushi.  We're fans, and we'll be back.

Recent reviews about service being so slow and sushi quality being poor surprised me.  My family and I have been going to this restaurant since 2011 and have had no experience about slow service or poor-quality sushi.  We've become restaurant regulars and friends with the owners and they already know what we want to order as soon as we walk in.

So, here's my side of the story:

+ Friendly & efficient service
+ Chinese & Japanese cuisine available
+ Fresh & delicious sushi.  Our family favorites are: shrimp crunch roll, lion dance roll, volcano roll, and fire dragon roll.
+ Lunch Specials and Bento Boxes are available (Prices range from $9.95 to $12.95. Big bang for your buck!) 
+ Their fruit shakes, made up of REAL FRUIT, are delicious!  You may add tapioca for extra charge.  Our family favorites are the avocado and mango shakes.
+ They recently introduced DIM SUM SPECIALS (small/bite size plates; the Chinese version of tapas plates for those not familiar).  Prices range from $3.95 to $6.95.  We are looking forward to trying that. 
+ They also cater.
+ Very clean bathrooms.
+ Very clean dining area
+ Nice ambiance.  Some Yelpers are correct.  This is a more quiet restaurant (which I prefer) so loud talkers may want to use their indoor voice while dining here.  Who wants to listen to other people's conversations when having lunch/dinner anyway?  Chinese or Japanese instrumental songs play in the background.  No annoying K-pop, J-pop, or American Top 40 Hits here.  It is nice to have a calm, relaxed, and quiet environment while eating.  The world is too full of noise and distractions already.  It's nice to escape it and have a nice conversation with friends/family at Raku Sushi once in a while.  In addition, I am not bothered by the Christmas lights inside at all.  I think it adds to the ambiance.
+ Ample parking

Nothing negative to say.

So, come try Raku Sushi!  For the negative reviewers: I hope you give it one more try.  Your negative experience may have been a fluke.  If it sucks the second time around, then, fine: everyone is entitled to his/her own opinion.  I will always be a big fan of Raku Sushi.

This place sucks. I was here on Christmas Day, there restaurant had only four tables occupied which has been already served. First of all, it took them over 10 mins to come get our appetizer order. We had to wave several times to get someone's attention. They finally got the order. The appetizer wasn't even there 20 mins after that and when we called the waitress she didn't even listen to us and simply said with an attitude, I know your food isn't here. And quickly went away saying it'll be here soon. It still took them another 7mins to bring it out.. Oh well! We ordered steamed gyoza and they brought out fried. When we mentioned that the lady said, well the guy the took the order left. (Umm.. Is that my fuckin problem?) I said, well sorry but we can't have it. She instead of just saying sorry, which she didn't, said again with an attitude do you want to order another one. At that point we were beyond hungry so I said, no we will just have our entre order. And shamelessly she says,"oh, that isn't in yet. It'll take another 15mins for that". Duck that shit! At that point, I had it. We said, politely, we get to leave as it's been way over half an hour for our food to arrive and we get to be somewhere. To which, there is no apology at all from her at any time, and she argued how it had only 15mins since we had come. Wow! I couldn't believe it! She didn't apologize for their improper service at all and argued with us for leaving when half of our food wasn't right and the other half order wasn't even placed! I had it. I simply had to leave and say," well, you have other customers here why don't you take care of them at least they will have their service on time." It's hard for me to accept a service this lousy. I have worked in the food industry too but this is something I have never experienced. People in Naperville are doomed. Thankfully I'm from Los Angeles and would not have to go here again.

Disclaimer: 3 stars is good for me...

I always get the sashimi lunch special... trying the different rolls each time, veggie and hamachi guacamole were good. 

First time I tried the ramen - not so much... and that salad at lunch is kinda silly

Smoothie is good - I think Joy Yee's is better

Sushi was good... Service was very sloooooooowwwwww.  We went on a Sat night, only 2 servers on the floor.  It was a good hour before we got our food :/ Prices were very reasonably priced.  Would go back hoping for faster service :)
I was very impressed with this restaurant. They give very generous portions at reasonable prices, and were relatively fast considering I was in a group of 8. I will definitely be going back!

Our inlaws told us about Raku having fresh dim sum every day. We were skeptical but they said it was all made fresh and really good. We went there today for lunch. It was a bit odd -- a dual personality restaurant with both the sushi menu and the dim sum menu with even a choice of chinese tea or japanese tea. But it was really really great dim sum. It was so fresh. We have eaten dim sum in every one of the good dim sum restaurants in Chicago's chinatown and we used to live in San Jose, CA and ate dim sum at some huge famous dim sum resturants there. Trust me, this is BETTER than any of those. If you like dim sum please try it out. You will be so happy you did. 

The service was great too. However, remember that your dim sum order is being freshly made, it isn't all frozen things being steamed like I suspect a lot of the dim sum in chinatown is done. So be prepared to wait a few minutes after your order. It is worth the wait.

My fiancé is Cantonese so we decided to try the dim sum instead of driving to the city. We tend to go to Chinatown and will continue to do so.  The fried Taro tasted more like a bean burrito...blah! The beef crepes.. meh. Needless to say, she was not impressed. We switched gears and tried the sushi. Nothing seemed really fresh. Whole Foods sushi sitting in the case tastes better and seems more fresh. Besides the the food being below average, the service was slow and the place was dirty. To toe things off, when I payed they charged my card for another table and it took quite some time to get it corrected. I don't see what all the hype is for this place and why it's rated on par with establishments that are far superior. Could it be that it was somewhat cheap which some people correspond with good? We will stick with Chinatown for dim sum and Chef Soon for sushi while in the western burbs.

This place is amazing.  They have an awesome 250gal salt water tank place in the dining room.  But, aside from that, I am a pretty big sushi fan and I'd have to say that this is one of the best sushi joints I've been to in the area.  Took the g/f and a friend of mine here today and we all really enjoyed the food.  Atmosphere is very pleasant and the staff is friendly.  One of the owners, even took the time to talk about the salt water fish with us as well.

Bottom line is that this is a great place to enjoy sushi and the price isn't too bad at all.  I highly recommend this place.
This was my first time here and it was excellent. Definitely try the spider and volcano roll. Service was awesome!
Go every year after scarecrow fest and we love it! Good food, beer, awesome service and a wonderful patio all at a great price!

I have lived in Saint Charles for 10 years and I have tried to to McNally's twice. The first time it was closed for new ownership taking over the spot I was disappointed that I did not try it prior to that night. Well we returned on Saturday August 20 about 5 pm. We entered through the rear since that is where the parking is located. The hostess asked us twice what we needed due to a loud obnoxious group of guys. We had to work our way through a number of rude individuals to get to a nice table in the front of the restaurant by the windows.

As we were seated the hostess apologized a number of times for the noise and said they should be leaving soon. The server arrived a couple of minutes later and my daughter and I ordered our soft drinks and I could not tell you what she ordered nor could she tell you what I ordered because of the noise. The server returned with a regular soda when I asked for an Ice tea, she apologized as well for her mistake due to the loud crowd. When my daughter was unable to her me respond to her question I decided enough is enough. I paid for the drink I did not order and left, you would of thought the server would have said no worries its on the house due to the noise and it was not what I ordered. We ended up at Wok N Fire much better and peaceful place. 

My first visit was a sign not to return to this site when it was closed, I will never return and I encourage you to call first and see if 25 obnoxious guys are there first. 

I would have given a zero but I had no choice.

The hubster and I recently spent a thoroughly enjoyable time at McNally's. Since we were staying just across the street, McNally's looked like the ideal spot to knock back a few beers and enjoy a low-key dinner. We took a seat near the window, which allowed us to people-watch while enjoying the atmosphere and each other. The beer, of course, was absolutely perfect. The very friendly owner came be a couple of times during the course of our visit to ask about the beer and our food. It may sound strange, but the bread with fantastic Irish butter was our favorite thing about the meal. We both also loved the soup of the day, a potato-leek creation with caramelized leeks on top. For entrées, the hubby got fish and chips, and I had the Reuben sandwich. I was kind of full already from the soup and the bread, but I did my best on the sandwich, leaving most of my fries uneaten--a fact that did not escape the notice of the concerned owner. I assured him that the fries were yummy, but that my eyes were bigger than my stomach. The sandwich itself was quite good, although the coleslaw in place of the sauerkraut was a bit unexpected (and honestly, I prefer the kraut).  I didn't try the fish and chips, but the hubby seemed to like the dish. But really, the take-away for me was the wonderful, friendly atmosphere and the perfect beer. I'd love to come back and fill up on more suds and a few appetizers.

This is your typical Irish pub but more upscale. 4 of us came here on a Friday night. We wanted to sit downstairs or outside but because we had a reservation we were seated upstairs because they had a table saved for us. We are in our mid- late 20s and everyone upstairs was old or it was families so that was interesting. Drinks were good. Server was attentive. Food was good. Really no complaints but really nothing to completely rave about. I will say there was a jazz band downstairs which was great but if you are sitting downstairs you won't be able to hear anyone because it's so freaking loud.
Delicious food and wonderful staff. We sat on the second floor patio and enjoyed the authentic food and atmosphere.

It's a Friday night. I am with my father and a few of his close friends way back from Highschool. Let me tell you this is a eccentric spot to hang out, especially if you are looking for quality night life. Food was impeccable (we love traditional Irish food) I had the full Monty, it's breakfast-y, with sausage, eggs, and Canadian bacon, and my father has a peculiar dish with Salmon and potato pancakes which was packed with flavor! Service was fast and pleasant. Shortly after dinner, a two man band started to play which was entertaining and thrilling. Their sound was loud and filled the place with laughter and guitar chords which is everything you want on a Friday night out. I asked to play "Here Comes the Sun", and to my amusement they obliged.
McNally's was alive and tasteful!

I have been here a couple times now and I am always impressed. Great food, good beer selection, and great service. Their Reuben was awesome and the thick cut fries were delicious. Pulled pork was average, but the expectations for it weren't high since this is an Irish Pub. Highly recommend McNally's over some of the other pubs in the area.

I'm glad Mom and I tried this but it was just average. My Mom said the fish batter was heavy. She prefers a lighter batter. The fries were nicely seasoned, but I prefer thinner and/or crisper fries. At lease they weren't wedges. The coleslaw was satisfactory.  I had the fried egg sandwich. The bread was good and nicely toasted but it didn't have much bacon and cheese on it. I prefer the woody sandwich across the street at The Filling Station. It doesn't have egg on it but it features more bacon, more cheese, and it is available with whole wheat bread. As I said this is fine but the Filling Station across the street is better.

My wife and I just enjoyed the most delicious  Reuben  boxty ever. The corned beef was lean, tender, and superbly seasoned! Just fabulous. The slaw was piled high and, again, just the right balance of tang and creaminess. It was such a good portion, we easily shared it.

We had plans to meet some of our family at a restaurant  up in Crystal  Lake in few weeks. We're now thinking McNally's is the place to go instead.

McNally's has been one of our favorite places for years. We were so glad to see the McNally name back! Wishing them great success! Thanks for a great meal...every time!

The best Fish and Chips in the area. Flakey light fish with a golden crispy batter. The crust was flavorful and crunched oh so well. It came on a hot bed of fresh cut fries and I didn't stop eating until it was gone. Only down side was the ketchup wasn't on the table and was a side cup. It was one of those meal that I needed a nap afterwards. Too bad I had to go back to work.

Amazing fish and chips,house salad, amazing,atmosphere pretty cool.
Definetly would go there again.

Returned again  on Friday the 13th because of such a great experience last time and again
Wasn't disappointed .
Couldn't get away from ordering the fish and chips again and it was delish.  Everyone very friendly and was checked in on not only by the waiter but 3 other people making sure everything was fine, and it was.
Salads great again, love that house dressing. Was down with a couple of pints of Guiness.
I'll be back.

I am so glad that McNally's is back. I am especially glad because it appears that not only did they come back with what was once a really good pub, but they actually improved on what they were originally known for. Great food, tremendously friendly service and a good vibe. Their fish and chips are unbelievably delicious, the Full Monty is the perfect anytime breakfast, the Shepard's Pie brings comfort food to a new level. I could go on and on. All I have left to day is do yourself a favor and check them out. Perfect for a date, business meeting, or by yourself.

We were McNally lovers before they closed, but, I have to say it's better than before. Food was absolutely amazing. I had the fish fry and my husband had the salmon. Both were very delicious. Welcome back and don't ever go away again!

Excellent time and service and food tonight. We were immediately greeted by the manager (I think), who recommended the Lurgan Lager. It was delicious! Britten was a very friendly and knowledgeable server. We asked her to recommend 2 small plates. We had Paddy's Poutine which was to die for...loved the curry gravy. Also had Sligo Sprouts which were the best Brussels sprouts I have ever had. Very generous portions. Cannot wait to go back! Such a great place in a beautiful setting. Thank you!

The new McNally's is nothing like the old one.  The menu is different and the food not nearly as good.  We had a boxy (ok), fish and chips (way too much bread), and a chicken sandwich (which was decent).  All three of us had stomach aches after we left.  I also had a gin drink that had tea in it which was very good! I wanted to like the place because the people working there are SUPER friendly but the food just doesn't measure up.  I hope they can turn things around...or go back to the old menu.

Welcome back, McNally's! Our whole family came here every year for the St. Patty's day parade for the last 4 years and were heartbroken when we found out that last year would be the last year. Fast forward to the end of January when we were leaving our food tasting at Hotel Baker and seen that it was reopening! Once our family found out they were over the moon!

Our  most recent visit, 2/27 was as amazing as the rest have been. Our server Keegan (I hope that was his name) was awesome and very attentive. The food was AMAZING! I'll even go as far to say its even better. Our entire table had the Ruben sandwich and the corned beef was so juicy and tender, it was perfect.

We will definitely be back to eat & are really excited about coming back for the parade this year!
Service was very poor, Food was average at best. Please focus on services it makes average food taste better .

First time here yesterday and I was really pleased.  The owner (or maybe manager) was exceptionally friendly and accommodating.  He made us feel very welcome and personally thanked us for coming as we left.  The service was great, as well as the food.  I was with a friend who is a bit of a finicky eater and she said her burger was fantastic.  I had the fish and chips and it was definitely some of the best I have ever had.
Very nice CHINESE Chinese restaurant. Much better then chose so called Chinese chains.

Oh no! Yu's sold to another owner!  The service was a disaster. A take out order that normally takes 15 minutes took 45.  The new owner speaks no English and will only converse with people who speak her native language. It took ten minutes for someone to take my order.

The order came late and was wrong and missing an item.  30 minutes later the missing item added. The wrong dish wasn't replaced but a promise of "we'll try again" wasn't worth the wait. I could hear people eating at the tables complaining that their orders weren't complete.  Another person who had take out and came in just after I did still hadn't received his order.

Finally, the food was ok. Normally it is exceptional. The Dry Chili Shrimp is now breaded (lightly) instead of just crispy.

We won't be back.
The number 630-355-5883 has been disconnected, it seems they are out-of-business.
Love love love!  Good food & they deliver!!

Loved Pockets! I got the southwest pocket and the fresh flavor was fantastic. Serving size was generous and we got our food quickly. The pocket was good but I would get a salad next time as it was hard to pick up and I just ended up eating it with a fork!

So excited when I saw this place, there's a tin of these in the city and I absolutely love them! So fresh taste great nothing's bland! Pita is fresh and is so yummy! I always get the chicken southwest with avocado and half pocket is Perfect and that size is even hard to Finnish! Always smells wonderful inside and very clean and cozy! Friendly staff and food comes out fast, I'll be a regular! Best heathy place around!

Oh my word, what an awesome place! I wish there was one a little bit closer to home, but I don't mind the drive to get here. I only wish I had come here sooner!

I came on my lunch break today, and ordered a Full Southwest pocket with chicken. It comes with lettuce, spinach, tomatoes, green peppers, a black beans and corn mix, red onions, and cheddar cheese. I added some jalapenos, southwest mix, and cilantro to mine as well. You get chipotle ranch dressing on the side. 

As I waited rather impatiently, I glanced around at the lunch rush crowd and was worried whether I'd make it back to Naperville in time. There were quite a few orders ahead of me. The employees craft every order with precision and care, but the downside is that it leaves a large wait time. I finally received my order about ten minutes later ("Hidi?") and was on my way. I was going to dock a star for the "slow service" until I realized A) This is not McNasty Food that's been sitting under a heat lamp, and B) "Good things come to those who wait" is certainly applicable at this establishment.

The "Full" portion is huge, to say the least. There was more food than I expected, but I'm not one to shun leftovers. To say the pocket was filled was an understatement; it was filled and so was half of the box it came in. Squeeeeee! I'm sorry, but it's hard not to get excited about huge portions in this sad little world of overcharging the customer for child size meal portions. Oh, speaking of which- my large pocket cost a little under $9. For the amount of food, and the quality of the ingredients used, I'd say the price is more than fair. 

The first bite was absolute heaven. Fresh, fresh, fresh. The lettuce was crisp and cold. The chicken was tender, juicy, and cut into bite sized cubes. Every other ingredient met or exceeded my expectations. When I brought it back to the cube farm, many coworkers came up and inquired what on earth smelled so good and "holy crap, where did you get that thing?" Nice. 

The restaurant itself is clean, with plenty of seating. The only gripe would be that there's only one door, so if people are waiting in line and it's quite long, it extends out the door and the people leaving have to squeeze past them. Not a big deal to some, but just an observation. The employees were all friendly and helpful. Despite the line growing longer, orders taking longer to prepare, and the phone ringing off the hook, the smiles remained on their faces and their attitudes positive. It was impressive. 

Their menu is diverse; specialty pizzas, calzones, potatoes, salads, kids meals, and soups and chili. You can pick from pre-selected options as I did, or you may create your pocket, salad, or pizza. With the pre-selected options, feel free to substitute the meat to one of your choice. If you decide to go the vegetarian route, a buck and some change is deducted from the cost of the pocket. How cool is that?

Pockets boasts using fresh ingredients that contain natural colors and flavors. Hallelujah! Is anyone else tired of eating food made with stuff they can't pronounce and  chicken that doesn't look like chicken? I am. Thank you Pockets for doing something different, and doing it well. I am definitely a fan and will be back very soon!

Love this place!  It's becoming quite the popular place these days which is good for business but not my lunch time! The line was out the door! 

I always make my own pocket,  but I see some items I would like to try like the original calzone and they have an awesome looking baked potato. All ingredients are super fresh and service is quick which is the mantra of the business.  The pocket is freshly baked so you get a warm pocket in minutes stuffed with whatever you'd like. Oh yea, and they don't skip on the ingredients - they pack it in. They gave me a ton of sliced avocado which most businesses like to skimp on! They also have a good selection of sauces to choose from. 

The owner is super nice and service is always good. This place is a winner! One of very few good places to eat around this area.

I love Pockets!!  I used to eat at these all the time when I lived in downtown Chicago.  Staff is always friendly and the food is extremely fresh.

My only gripe is that they don't have more locations throughout the suburbs.

Alright, as far as the actual food is concerned, the sandwiches (or pitas, or whatever they're more appropriately called) are fantastic. They make their bread fresh, so it's warm when you eat it, and I like that they give you your sauce on the side so you can control how much (or little) you want. We saw some people getting salads while we were there, which is essentially just the Pockets sandwich in a bowl instead, and those looked great too.

My criticisms on this place basically come down to price and presentation. The good was good, but $20 for lunch for two with no drinks seems expensive. At that price point, Pockets falls in that weird uncomfortable middle ground between saving money just grabbing Subway or similar fast food-level sandwiches and actually just going out to a restaurant for a couple bucks more.

I guess you could make an argument towards "premium" ingredients or whatever, but watching them put your pita together is a bit of a turn off. Instead of something like Chipotle where they're heaping your stuff into a tortilla then rolling it up, if you order a sandwich here all the fixin's go on one of those supremely cheap white paper plates. From there, they jumble it all up with their hands on the plate and ram it into a pita.

I understand the point of doing this is to toss the ingredients around more or less, but it just seems uncomfortably janky for them to be using paper plates and their hands to do it instead of making a dramatic presentation with stainless steel bowls and flipping the stuff around kind of like how they handle salads at Portillo's. I could see it if this was just some one-off hole in the wall sandwich place in a college town, but this is a franchise, right? Is this Pockets standard operating procedure? If so... It seems really weird.

The source of our second sandwich was a bowl they pulled out of the fridge (presumably someone ordered the same thing as a salad and didn't show up or wanted something different or something). From there, they flopped the whole contents of the salad on a paper plate and did the same thing. It felt really weird, like "Hey you just ordered a sandwich here's someone else's leftovers." From a practical standpoint I realize it's all the same food, but, it'd be like going to Subway, ordering your sandwich, and them being like "Oh someone just ordered that let me put it on the bread you want."

But, hey, whatever, the food was good which is what matters at the end of the day. I'm not usually very squeamish about the things I eat but there's just something unappetizing about a dude squishing all your food in between his fingers on a paper plate particularly when you just paid $10 for the privilege.  If you're going to make your food like that, make it in the back so I don't have to stand there and watch you.
Love this place, it never disappoints and the quality is always grade A, been eating here since 3 years and not once did the quality disappoint
Delicious, nutritious, and filling! The full size was more than enough for lunch. All the view goes were chopped perfectly and were fresh. I got the Greek pita with turkey and it was awesome.

Pockets is one of my favorite places in the neighborhood.  I love the healthy and the not so healthy options.

The staff is always very friendly.  Including the manager.  He has helped me a lot.  They're not perfect, they do mess up but they don't blame you for their mess ups and they are quick to resolve offering a discount the next time you order.

The delivery is pretty pricey, so I only use it when I need some extra special care... Like being sick.

I love the build your own salads, they are amazing.  They keep expanding their toppings too, which is great cause in the beginning they were pretty limited.

I love Pockets and I love that I have one close to home.  Even though I usually pick it up, myself, I love that they deliver.  

I pretty much get the same thing here, every time.  I love the build your own salads.  So many fresh toppings to chose from!  I love that they have avocado now, even though it stuck to the top of the container.  Doesn't have to look pretty to taste good. :)  The, homemade, ranch dressing is crack and I will lick the container as to not waste a bit of it.  

Other favorites are the create your own baked potato and their frozen yogurt.

The staff is always very friendly and helpful.  The manger is super nice.  Any time there has been an issue, like an item we didn't get, he always corrects the issue.  He takes great pride in the quality, accuracy and keeping his patrons happy.

The restaurant and wash rooms have always been clean and nice looking.

This is one of my favorite places to grab a healthy meal.  My favorite is the spinach berry and chicken pocket with the balsamic dressing.  There is a wide variety on the menu for every taste.
The owner is almost always there and is obviously invested in making the business successful.  Every employee I have dealt with has been pleasant and obliging.
They have a great punch reward system and yesterday I got my meal completely free!  I love this restaurant and recommend it without reservations.

I LOVE this location of Pockets! The first time I visited, I had to wait a bit for my order, and decided to check-in on Facebook and plug the store a bit. As it turns out, the owner was there at the time, and saw the post immediately, thanked me, and we had a good conversation! Though it's a (small) chain, it was nice to get a personal thank you while I was there!

I've only tried a few things at Pockets, namely because I love the flavors too much to differ. My favorite salad is the Asian (the dressing is out of this world) and I love to make my own calzone - the ranch dressing is equally as good! I have to believe they make their own dressings, because they're delicious!

My only quip, coming from someone in Marketing, is that the advertising in-store is outdated. When I visited and had to wait, I noticed that the stands on the tables were months past the advertised expiration date.

PHENOMENAL! I absolutely love this place! The employees are all so very nice. The ingredients are all fresh. And they are not stingy on the quantity of food they give! I love that in some of the salads they actually shred the lettuce so it's not like trying to shove whole leaves in your mouth like all other restaurants. I've tried the chicken chili, the gobbler, the white pizza and almost all the salads with the half pocket. I have yet to be disappointed in their food or the quality of their ingredients. And they deliver! Two thumbs up!

I have been to Pockets a couple times now and have not been disappointed. GET THE CHICKEN CHILI. The chicken chili is awesome, not gonna lie, when I think chili never have I thought chicken until Pockets. Great flavor and the chicken is a nice touch. 

The sandwiches are also good, I feel like they have added more to the sandwich when you order it now because from the first time I had it when I thought, meh, could have a little more to now, big improvement. I had the Southwest and it's extremely good. Imagine taking good bread and shoving a good salad inside of it. That's what you get basically. And it's a combinations that works for sure!

We like us some Pockets!  There isn't much I can say about it beside it's fresh, clean and efficient.  

However this location hasn't seemed to catch on yet.  It seems slow every other time we go in but when there is a line they seem to slow down operation.  That would be my only purpose for one less star.  You have your choices of pockets or you may try the calzones.  I'm not much of a cheese eater these days since I'm very intolerant so I always opt for the pockets.  I'll be damned if the calzones don't look good though.

Be a pocket believer, especially for you veggiesaurs!

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE this location of pockets! I will go out of my way to go to this location and I'll tell you why......
1. SUPER CLEAN all the time!!!
2. SUPER FRIENDLY STAFF everyone here is so nice and the guy that sits at the front which I'm sure is the owner/operator is the nicest and sweetest guy ever!! He always makes sure we are well taken care of and that we get what we want and that we love what we got.
3. BRIGHT AND SPACIOUS seating areas with lots of room. I've never waited for a table here and the tables are always clean and well kept.

So easy and quick. I usually order online and pick it up because this place gets SLAMMED during lunch.!! I've never had anything I didn't like.  The canzone s are probably my favorite.  The staff is friendly and always thanks me for waiting... which I find funny since they make everything fresh after I order it!  Great find!

Love the pockets...perfect favor combos and the chicken chili was awesome..I made my own half pocket with chicken, red onion, cranberries, romaine lettuce, and cilantro. All the ingredients were very fresh. The sesame ginger dressing is outstanding. I think I've found a new favorite place for quick and tasty meals. I will be back to try a calzone.

This place is SO tasty and cheap and great when your looking for a fresh meal fast. Definitely recommend and wish I lived closer to Pockets.
The homemade Ranch dressing is outstanding!

Oh my how I loved that we stumbled upon this place. They will make everything to your liking, everything is so fresh and makes you feel good about eating out! Great prices as well I just wish it was alot closer! Maybe not I'd probably be here everyday!

Great, fresh ingredients!! We tried this place for the first time and really enjoyed it!  I love that the sides on the kids meals are fruit.  I had the buffalo chicken calzone and we ordered the southwest chicken sandwich.  Both items were very flavorful!  We will definitely be back!

NEW LOCATION!!!  Fuel up on delicious Pockets before a day of shopping at the Premium Outlets (which is a couple driving blocks away).  The site is new and fresh and the service is friendly.

Environment:
This store went through months of remodeling construction before finally opening this summer.  The interior is new, clean, and seats a couple dozen customers.  Bathrooms are also new and clean.

Service:
The service has been prompt and pleasant.  The dishes are prepared on the spot and are pretty quick (10 minutes depending on your order, calzones take longer).  If you are on-the-go, it's best to pre-order online or by calling in ahead of time.

Food:
My all time favorite salad is the Berry Bleu with House Dressing.  Berry Bleu is salad topped with tons of edamame, cucumber, bleu cheese, and almonds.  (The edamame makes it especially filling and the cucumbers creates a fresh and light crunch.  If you are not a bleu cheese fan, substitute with a milder feta.)  The House dressing is French-based, mild tasting with a slight tang.

Parking:
Parking is right outside the small strip of stores and easily available

Unique:
One unique features I noticed at this location is a soft serve ice cream station with an array of toppings.  Sweet!
All good here....very fresh.....I like everything I have had....healthy!  Not typical....like that too
Love it.  Custom calzones are amazing

I love the food here. Great alternative to other fast food places. Service was poor. Not able to use points or a coupon I had accumulated. I was over charged and not given a refund when it was their mistake admittedly. A new girl made a mistake and I had to pay for it. Good food but the service needs help.

We have been going to Pockets in the city since 1987. We were so loyal that we would venture from the suburbs to the city just to get their calzones and veggie lo-cal pockets. It was AWESOME!

Unfortunately, they changed their dough recipe a few years ago. Despite this, we thought we would try again. Oops! What a mistake. We ordered the same items and were disappointed with both. The calzone was significantly smaller than before. The dough on both reminded us of sawdust. 

That's it.Another Chicago institution (like Red Tomato) is gone.

My husband picked up our food and brought it home, so I can't comment on the abiance or customer service. The food was delicious and the portions were quite generous. I wish the menu online matched the menu at the store, but that's my only complaint. I had the Southwest pocket and my husband had the Italian, we both liked our own and each other's. Next time I'll ask for extra dressing. The amount povided with my southwest pocket was not nearly enough.

Went here for the first time today, hubs told me about $1 pockets so we figured it'd be a good day for me to try it out. (He works down the street & has eaten here a few times) So we make the trek out there, arrive at 3:57, they were serving $1 pockets until 4. As we walk in, we notice the sign advertising the special deal is still out so we figure we are okay. Walk in, 2 people in line ahead of us. Guy in front of us says "are you still offering the  dollar pockets?" "yes." He orders, walks away, the cashier says "it's after 4, we are no longer offering the dollar pockets." "seriously? we were in line at 4" "yes, we told him when he walked in he was the last one."(which was a lie, because I heard him ask) Mind you, there is no one behind us in line. I understand having a cut off time for a deal-especially if you have a bunch of people in line, but we were in line at 4, & they still had the sign up outside. So we decided to leave & not get anything. I was really turned off by the customer service. It would have been nice for her to tell us as soon as we walked in that they weren't offering the dollar pockets anymore, that could have changed the whole interaction. Originally, we were going to eat there regardless of the deal. So we go to leave, the manager is outside taking down the signs as we are walking out. Get in the car, I say "let's go talk to the manager because that's ridiculous how they handled that." Long story short(ish), we don't even get a chance to discuss the real issue at hand(customer service), he simply said, "give them the deal" & walked away. We made sure to thank him for giving us the deal, because he certainly didn't have to. We got two pockets, Southwest & Greek. Southwest has beans, roasted peppers, corn, cheddar, tomatoes, spinach & lettuce with a chipotle ranch dressing. Greek has black olives(canned), tomatoes, spinach & lettuce, & feta with a greek dressing. Both were tasty & nicely seasoned. I liked the Southwest better overall. Would I come here again? Maybe, maybe not, poor customer service is a big turn off for me. I know we got the deal, but that wasn't the point, the whole thing was handled wrong.

Excellent service and food. The calamari was exceptional. The beer selection too. Wait staff helped us move tables for our growing party. 

Scallop dinner was awesome. Salad was crisp and fresh. Prices were reasonable. We will be back.

We had been here before when it was The Bank and it was fantastic! Now that we live in the area, we thought we would check it out as Emmett's.

We were told it would be a 10 minute wait to be seated. Not bad for a Friday night, so we waited... and waited... and waited... and waited.... For an hour! Each time we asked about our ten minute wait for our table we were told it should be any minute now... Once we were seated it was 15 minutes before a waitress came to take our drink orders. Several people came by our table to leave things or take things away, but they didn't say a word to us! I had a question about one of the drinks and the waitress said she would go ask about it... I asked her if she would come back and she looked at me like I was crazy... After 7 minutes we left...

So last night we were walking through downtown Wheaton and decided to give Emmett's Brewing Company another try. Although our last experience wasn't very good, our intention was to enjoy the moment and have a good experience. Unfortunately, it turned out to be quite the opposite. Once we arrived, the two of us were immediately seated in the main dining area because all of the tables close to the sidewalk were occupied. We started off ordering a medium rare Prime Rib and medium Filet Mignon. When the food arrived the steaks were tough and improperly cooked, and the vegetables were dry. However, my baked potato was good... Although we did not get bread included with our salads or meal, we elected to order some. The bread was served about 15 minutes later and arrived burnt. The two of us just looked at each other as if it were some sort of joke. Both the food and the service have a lot to be desired.

Im really not sure what type of place Emmett's is wanting to be. Those that were sitting along the sidewalk were sipping wine and enjoying conversation. Although the curbside appeal imply an upscale venue, the tables in the main dining section were open and were fitted with Ketchup and mustard bottles. I read other reviews about the burgers so we elected to stay clear of them and the beer... If this place wasn't in such a fantastic location or have such an appealing look from the sidewalk, it wouldn't have lasted as long as it has! Wheaton is filled with good restaurants, Emmett's simply isn't one of them. I do believe that we might enjoy sipping wine at the tables near the sidewalk on a warm summer night.

We met up with a few friends for dinner here on a Saturday night. The place was popping and we waited about an hour for a table. We had a lot to chat about so the hour went quick, but if I came back, I'd try to come earlier to avoid the rush. 

Everyone we spoke with (hostesses, bartenders, servers) were all accommodating and nice, although conversations were understandably rushed. 

I decided to try the fish tacos because I can rarely pass them up, no matter the location. They were a solid option and I wouldn't hesitate to order them twice. I also got the truffle fries and cheddar ale soup. The fries were pretty good but the soup was incredible. I honestly wish I ordered a bigger portion or at least ordered an extra. It also comes with a pretzel twist so don't skip it-- even if you're avoiding carbs. (It's worth the cheat. Trust me) We sampled a few of the beers and I really liked all of the ones I tried. 

I think this is a great location for dinner because the menu is vast and they even accommodate gluten free.

We finally decided to give Emmett's a try after walking past it numerous times and seeing that it was seemingly a very popular place. We stopped in on a Thursday evening around 6pm. It wasn't very busy, there were a couple people sitting at the bar and high tops in the bar section open, so we just grabbed one of those. It didn't look like the main dining room was very full, however I didn't get a good look at it.

It took some time for our waiter to greet us, which was strange, because it seemed like they were way over staffed for the night. He also seemed new, so we didn't let it bother us at all. My fiancé ordered a drink, which took about 15min for her to get. Apparently the drink takes a minute to make and the bartender wasn't looking forward to making this particular drink, even though it's a "specialty" on their menu, so she focused on socializing. 

Once she got her drink, we put in our food orders. I went with the chicken sandwich and she got the lettuce wraps. The food definitely took longer than that type of order took, but again, we tried to not let it bother us. Once it came, it wasn't hot and came with a sauce that I specifically said I didn't want. If it would have came hot, I think it definitely would have made my sandwich better, but a cold chicken sandwich isn't exactly desirable. She said her lettuce wraps weren't great, but they weren't awful either. The only thing that I'd say was really good were the truffle fries. They were thicker than the usual truffle fries, however they were really good.

Overall, I'd say it was a C- experience. Considering the restaurant wasn't even close to full, the service was really slow and they really didn't seem interested in providing us a great experience. The food was average, at best, and the truffle fries were good.

Not sure if we'll be back, but there are certainly better choices in the area.

I was in downtown Wheaton and thought I would stop in here for a beer. I had been here when it was The Bank and I thought there food and drinks were pretty good. 

I was not impressed with this new restaurant at all. We walked in and there was no host at the front door so we decided to sit at the bar. There were only a few people sitting at the bar and the rest of the counter was dirty. We sat there for quite some time before the bartender offered beer a sample. I found one beer that I liked an ordered one. I was surprised by the dirty glasses that sat behind the bar almost the entire time I was there. 

I was caught off guard by how dirty the restaurant seemed. My feet stuck to the floor and the overall appearance was not impressive. I glanced at the food menu but nothing jumped out at me. I did not order food so I can not review that. 

The bartender mentioned the brewery that would be opening in the basement. She said we could go down and take a look. I looked around and tried to get an idea of what would be offered. A manager walked down and tried to explain things but he was not sure about certain processes. 

Overall- The beer was ok, service could be improved, and the cleanliness could use a lot of work. I might stop in again for a beer but I don't think I would ever eat here.

The best thing about "The Bank" when it was here was the room.

The best thing about "Emmett's" (since they took over) is about the same. This is a real disappointment since we've been to some of their other locations and had a better (not great) experience.

The hostess was completely uninterested in us, wanting to seat us right in the path of the kitchen door (despite the fact that there were better seats available) We finally told her that we would just sit in the bar. 

They were short on wait staff.. the waits were excruciating.

They were out of diet sodas.

I started with the steak and black bean chili, it wasn't chilly.. but it wasn't hot either. It was tasty but I wouldn't seek it out.

I ordered the Chicken Saltimbocca, it was OK with a potential towards very good. Ok, because it wasn't very hot (Potatoes were actually cool) and the artichokes were kind of dry. I've had a more successful version of this at another one of their locations.

Lisa started with the beer cheese (Cheddar Ale) soup, it was good and came with a good pretzel roll, the portion seemed a bit light for a "bowl" My "cup" of chili seemed to offer as much.

Then she had a small plate fish taco with fries, it was good but pricey for what you got. The fries were lukewarm (I'm being generous)

Overall a disappointing experience and we will be very reluctant to try it again.

We've been fans of the Bank for some time and have enjoyed the atmosphere, the food, and the service. Not much of that has changed - except for the obvious home brew beer element that is defining Emmet's.

Service continues to be very good and the atmosphere is far from pretentious. It's good for families and for couples. 

Our most recent trip to Emmet's involved a simple lunch of burgers and wine. The burgers were so overcooked, it was sad. Kobe burger ordered medium and delivered medium well/well done. So dry and disappointing. 

The red ale, which the bartender allowed us to sample (we sat at the bar) was not very good. The bartender agreed that most people didn't care for it. We then tried the ESP, more of a brown ale, and it was pretty good, but not enough to make me bite. I chose wine instead.

Emmet's is a pretty good restaurant. The service is consistently very good. So, they have that going for them. I think the kitchen needs some work.

It's not often that I crave a salad, but I seriously have been thinking about Emmet's raspberry walnut salad since I enjoyed it earlier this week.

From what I've gathered, this Wheaton location is newer. Others have complained about the service, but I have to say we loved our waitress! She chit-chatted with us, shared the specials, and helped us make menu choices. On top of her game for sure.

They have an outdoor patio which I highly suggest taking advantage of! It was lovely enjoying the beautiful weather while sipping on a glass of wine. I had their California Pinot Grigio which was $7.

Now the salad... Perfect and refreshing for a warm day! This green goddess includes a large bed of mixed greens, grilled chicken (or salmon for an up charge), walnuts, blue cheese crumbles, craisons, and pear slices topped with a raspberry vinegarette. Pretty sure this combo will be my go to salad choice of the season. I highly suggest!

I'll have to come back to check out the beers since well, ya know, they are a brewing company!

Pro tip: Emmet's is located right off the metra!

just for a beer. I haven't  been to this place for a few months but it's surprising how a bar never carries a full selection of beverages. they're always out of bourbon, whiskey and now vodka. if it's on the list of beverages that you serve you should carry it in stock.

Upscale American pub atmosphere and fare. Cute building (cannot remember what this place used to be! Not 'The Bank' ... before that. Back when Wheaton was dry and there were no restaurants or nightlife of any kind downtown. Back in the 'all the traffic lights go to flashing red because its a ghost town' days. When the religious shop was Reuss's and the corner was Gaede's. This was a print shop of some kind, I want to say?)

Mini plate + paddle was a fun and affordable combo. Sweet potato fries were perfect. 

I'll second the slow service comments I'm seeing. It was indeed slow. We were there for a leisurely pint and conversation, so not a bother for our party, but could have been if we were in a less lackadaisical mood. Also: I genuinely thought the place might have closed at 8pm. We were practically the only ones there at that hour, and staff appeared to be cleaning up. Guess things haven't moved *that* far from ghost town-after-7pm days.

We came here for an early dinner. Our server was good, checked on us enough but not too much where it's annoying. Hubby liked the beer and their cocktail selection was good. The food was a little lacking but can only go up.

The place was packed being a summer Fri night in downtown Wheaton. We waited 45 minutes for a table for 2 which was fine since we could check out the antique car show outside. 

The hostesses were pleasant and phoned us when our table was ready. Once seated, our server was engaging and seemed well informed about the food and beverages. 

Unfortunately, the kitchen has some issues. We ordered pretzels for an appetizer. 20 minutes later we were served ice cold on the inside and somewhat warm on the outside pretzels sticks. Our server took care of the problem promptly by taking the plate and offering us our next course. Great... Cuz we are pretty hungry now. Our soups and salads took an additional 20 minutes to arrive. (I assume our server was in the weeds here) Another 30 minutes or so later our entrees arrived. The prime rib was decent but it was served with an uncooked "baked" potato. The fried cod was really tasty but again, the fries were par-cooked. 

Overall, our server tried to accommodate us but he seemed to be playing catch up most of the time from what I saw at other tables. The cooked food was decent. The beer was decent. The 2.5 hours of time spent on a Friday night to simply eat a partially cooked meal at Emmet's... Not cool. Hoping they work out the kinks soon because the location is awesome.

Seafood Trilogy
Walleye Bites
Mozarerella vegetarian flatbread
I would give the Walleye bite a 3 star due to the fact that they were heavy.

Nice lunch on the balcony today. Turkey Reuben and a club sandwich. The Reuben was great, lots of turkey, really thinly sliced. Light and not too much dressing and not greasy. My husband really enjoyed the club. Again, not too heavy, but full of flavor. He had the freshly made chips and they were awesome. Really crispy. (I had to steal a couple!) Our server was veer nice,  attentive but not over the top. We'll definitely be back.

This is an improvement on The Bank, in my opinion, but that's not necessarily saying much. While their food is still not great and service is spotty, they make excellent concessions for entertaining kids, which is a pretty smart business move in family-oriented Wheaton. I sure wouldn't want to come here for date night, but if we needed a place to have some standard American food with our young kids, we'd come here again.

This is our 4th time going here and each time was horrible!!! We kept going back because of the location, the view/area is very nice. Three out of four times we got stuck with the same waiter, I think he's name is Billy (older gentleman w gray hair). He was extremely unfriendly, slow, and forgetful. Our food took way to long. The table next to us came in after us and had a different waitress and they received their food way before us. The food was okay, not worth the price. Overall, the service was horrible but the food was okay. They need to hire new friendly people!

The staff was friendly and there were over a dozen regular and seasonal beer selections. They are kid friendly and have a standard kid menu and give out crayons. 

The pretzel twists appetizer was delicious. The pretzels were soft and the honey mustard dipping sauce paired well. The brewer's chicken sandwich was really good. The soft pretzel bun was a great fit for this sandwich. My hubby had the fire starter burger and said it had a very balanced flavor and wasn't too spicy. The sweet potato fries and the chips were very good. 

Hoptweet was exactly as billed. A pale ale, with vibrant fruit notes. Patriot's Pride had a very noticeable roasted malt character, in the style of a scotch ale. The hubby is looking forward to trying more. 

We definitely feel like we need to try more of this menu since everything was really good.

A group of us stopped here for a couple cocktails and snacks between a wedding and reception. The atmosphere was great, we took a tour of the place and were shown around the old vault and safety deposit area. There is some great history here. We just had a few appetizers and drinks and all were great. 

In a place like this I like to ask the bartender how he feels about making an Old Fashioned and he was actually excited to show his skills. Not many people do it right but if you like them and Andrey is at the bar, let him make you one his way. You can trust me on this, it's the right way.

This place is a little far from home but next time I'm in the area, I will definitely make another visit.

My husband and I have been here twice. We ate at the bar thus avoiding other yelper's service issues. 

We had great service and delicious food. The salads are fresh, different and delicious. The hot pretzel appetizer are a tasty indulgence. Crisp on the outside, tender on the inside with horseradish or mustard dipping sauces.  

Burgers tasty too!

My husband and I went there around 2:30pm today for lunch. They weren't busy, however, our server was bad. It took a long time for our food and we waited 20 minutes for the beer list. All the other tables were being tended too much faster. And they were larger parties. I felt bad because the lunch cost us $50 and the service lacked. We don't do this much so having a bad experience really ruined it. The food was fine and lukewarm. I don't think we'll be going back anytime soon. My husband left a so so tip.

Good riddance to the Bank! We have been a dozen or so times now and the food is great, service is solid but we have only eaten at the bar and gone for lunch.

It's nice to finally have a good 'regular' place to grab lunch.

I frequented Emmett's in Palatine so when we moved down to Wheaton I was excited to see that Emmett's was following us here. We went for dinner and sat outside out front. 

The staff seemed pretty indifferent about their jobs and the service they were providing. 

The food was just as good as it is in Palatine though I'm really disappointed they dont have the Pita and Hummus because it is the best I've had. Their beers are just ok. If you like darker beers you'd probably enjoy some of theirs. 

Overall a mediocre experience. Wish I could pick up the Palatine location and plop it in Wheaton!

I have been here a handful of times, because it's just so convenient for me... every time we end up downtown Wheaton, we end up here. The atmosphere is pretty nice, and I've had very good service every time I've been here. Last time I ended up here it was just for some cocktails with my friends after a mediocre dinner elsewhere. We had tried to stop in to the Irish place next door, but it was too crowded and we were being stared at by the patrons in a weird manner... and then no one would help us...so we left and came here. The bartender was awesome, super helpful. I don't drink beer, so I can't really speak to the beer selection at all. My friends seemed happy with what they ordered...so there's that. My drinks were good, though I order really basic drinks...so ... it really doesn't show anything great about anyone. But the service was really excellent, and the prices aren't terrible. That said... this last time we went...it really did smell awful in there.  I hope they get whatever is causing that terrible smell under control. 
The other times I've been here was for lunch. The food was always good, and the prices are pretty decent. The service has been good each time I've been here. I will be back again, I've had good experiences here, so I will likely be back.

We decided to try Emmett's for a late lunch.  Walking it was a little dark and it was musty smelling.  We were the only one's in the place at 2:30.  That could be normal for them.  We ordered a beer and a glass of wine to start.  They no longer had the wine even though it was still on the wine list.  We left and went to Warren's Ale House.

We were very excited when Emmett's opened a couple blocks away from our place and even got an Emmett's card. We've given them 4 or 5 second chances and every trip has been disappointing: mostly with regard to the food quality and order errors. We won't be back.
Low grade dog food and a clueless wait staff. They may make it through the summer but that will be it.

Great food, great beer, great people!  Weekly food specials - Taco Tuesday is a favorite.  Great atmosphere.  Nice street side seating, bright veranda seating, long bar, separate dining from bar, downstairs bar as well.  Knowledgeable and friendly staff.

Went here tonight with my wife and haven't been in this place since it was The Bank. We were seated promptly. I read a lot of complaints about the service and had a really terrific service the whole time.

My wife ordered the French onion soup and I had chicken tortilla soup. Both of them came out hot and were very tasty. My wife is a bit of a French onion soup foodie and this passed the test!

My bride had the three sliders and enjoyed all of them. It was a good variety choice and probably a safe bet for a pub food sort of place like this.

I went out on a limb and ordered the whitefish and was impressed. The fillet they offered was generous, (no joke!) over 12 inches long, and perfectly cooked and deboned. The horseradish potatoes were nicely piped out around the plate rim and had horseradish flavor was there without being overbearing. The garlic spinach was well cooked and enjoyable.

Overall, for the genre and price point, a very solid choice. We will be back.

I would give it 2.5 stars if possible.

Waitstaff pleasant although they pushed more food.
Place was NOISY.  Difficulty hearing others speak.
How could a place be out of Pepsi and Baked Potatoes on a Saturday night?
Plus Saturday is Prime Rib special.  Baked potatoes needed for that!

Disappointed with Turkey burger.  It seemed to me that it had been a frozen patty.  
Perhaps I would have fared better with a regular burger.

Best way I can describe this place...
If you asked me to go with you I would, 
  however I would not suggest coming here.

Did I mention it was NOISY!!!!!!!

Good beers and decent tacos, with especially great prices on Tuesdays ($3 pints, $2 tacos). 

However, the bartender we had really ruined the experience. The place was certainly not slammed, but he made it quite clear he was too busy for us, only barely greeting us after sitting at the bars for 15 minutes. It was hard to get more than a one word answer out him, not to mention every interaction we had with him consisted of him flying by, trailing off as he talked to us, making it even harder to ask him about anything on the menu, or feel that he was actually aware that we were there, ya know, as customers and all.

Stopped in for a beer.  I didn't even look at the food menu but I would assume it is similar to the other Emmetts locations.  What this Emmetts location has that others do not is its location.  Taking over the old Bank Restaurant gives it prime real estate in downtown Wheaton.  Small patio facing the street and decent drink specials make it a good place for a drink after work.  I don't think there is really anything to stand it apart from any other of the restaurant/brewery combos in the area.

Unfortunately this was our second bad experience here. We thought the first time might have been a fluke so we tried it again tonight.  Never again!  The service was terrible and actually worse than last time.  
We were lucky enough to get a table outside on a beautiful summer night but that was the only good thing about our experience.  We were greeted soon after we sat down and ordered a beer and two waters. The beer came and then we didn't see a server for a long time. Finally, he came by and we ordered the artichoke dip and reminded him about our waters. The dip was awful.  It tasted like mayo and it was served with very greasy pita triangles. We were so hungry, we had to eat some of it.  By the way we had no plates or napkins. Finally we ordered our food and it was mediocre.  Once we got our food, it must have been a half hour before anyone checked on us.  We had no drinks.  What can I say......done with that place for good.

well, after reading the negative reviews for emmett's i was a little reluctant to try it. the one in dundee is wonderful, the one in downers grove is a downer.
first of all, the space is absolutely beautiful. what a lovely place for a cozy meal. we were seated immediately, and the service from start to finish, was perfect. i decided to try something i hadn't had at the other locations- walleye bites and the mini caprese salad. i had a nice chardonnay for eight dollars. i have to say that everything was excellent, and i'll be back as soon as i can drag someone out for lunch or dinner. a very nice addition to the local dining scene.

Mediocre food, extremely slow wait staff.  We had to get our orders in by a certain time because of some kitchen issue (this was in the first 2 weeks of the place opening, their equipment should have been brand spankin' new!). Then, they were out of what I wanted (a steak sandwich) so I asked for the same thing, but with chicken. Our waiter charged us the same amount for it, but last time I checked beef is a lot more expensive than chicken!

Overall, just a "meh" experience, definitely will not go back. It was a very small feeling restaurant and had absolutely no brewery feel.

Good whitefish
Dried out bad chicken sandwich
Very nice waitress
Liked eating outside

Upon arriving at Emmett's we were told the kitchen was backed up and could not be seated for 15 minutes. There were a few empty tables. So we waited in the empty bar. My husband had a beer and I had a glass of wine. 

After 15 minutes we were seated on the patio. The waitress told us the kitchen was backed up (yeah we got it). We enjoyed the patio and had another drink and ordered our dinner. Obviously we were not in a hurry and enjoyed the outdoor seating. My husband ordered the kobe burger and I ordered the steak wedge salad. Thirty minutes later we were served. My husband said his burger was fair and my steak wedge salad was warm from sitting under the warming lights. I guess to keep the three dried up steak pieces warm. 

The table of four behind us complained about their meal and they were re-served two of their meals. The man said to the manager it was their third time there and would not be returning. I could not complain because I felt bad for the waitstaff and manager. 

I waited a week before writing this review hoping to reconsider my opinion. I wanted to like Emmett's because I loved The Bank (the former restaurant). We will not be back for a while. Hopefully they get their act together.

This place is consistently disappointing. 
The food can be ok but the drinks are pretty bad. My beer is usually warm and their mixed drinks are pretty awful. The worst part though is the service. I can get over so-so food and crappy drinks (booze is booze, right?) but the couple of times I've dined in the bar area, it takes way too long to get a second drink, if it all. This last time we just gave up and got the check because the waitress/bartender didn't seem interested in bartending/waitressing. 
There are better places to spend your money in the area which is a shame because the terrace is very nice when the weather allows.
I left a good tip but I won't be coming back.

Great food, however it was really bad service.
We waited a very long time for drinks and food.
 It was not super busy at this time.
The server was not easy to contact throughout our 
entire visit, and had to be reminded of the drinks we ordered.

We arrived at Emmetts around 1:45.  We chose to sit in the bar.  When we were finally greeted, it took an additional 15 minutes to receive a bloody mary - because the bartender was talking to other servers and to another guest from across the bar.  She also had to go in back to retrieve the mary mix. 
My friend asked to try a beer that had more malty flavors vs hoppy.  The bartender brought out 3 samples of their "lightest" beers. None of which were malty. Perhaps it was a misunderstanding...of beer. At a pub.
