The food saved the day. The portobella fries, french onion soup and slider trio were very tasty.  It would have helped if the bartender knew the menu.  We were lucky we had an hour and a half for lunch.  With so many dining  choices available, i will not return.

Had a great experience here,  I don't know why everyone is so critical.  The beer was great,  tried the Maibock and a pils...loved them both. The staff was friendly and the place is clean. Our food was delish. I'll definitely be back.

Been here several times since they opened. Service is great! Kinda hit or miss when they fist got started, but things are much better now. Love the selection of beers, lunch specials, and atmosphere. I usually get the Brie Burger with a beer or two, yum...

Our party attended Emmett's Brewing Company in Wheaton on a "Taco Tuesday" night. There was no host to seat us; the bar was virtually empty and only about three tables had customers. We seated ourselves in what we thought was the busiest section of the restuarant. 

Service:
The wait-staff obviously had some European training. They would tilt their heads away like the Russian soldiers marching in the Mayday parade at The Kremlin if you attempted to get their attention. After about fifteen minutes of being actively ignored we were asked for our order. We had not even been given menus. There were no written descriptions of the twelve or so beers available. 

Food:
My tacos were served in limp, soggy and cold shells. The lettuce and tomato filling was at room temperature and mushy. The seared Ahi tuna was barely warm and appeared to have an odd color. 

No reason to return.

Nothing good to say about this visit. We were told that there was a 15 minute wait,ended up waiting 45 minutes. Service at the bar was slow,dirty glasses and dishes were visible everywhere.  When we were finally seated,our table service wasnt much better. One of our orders was screwed up by the kitchen when we got our food, one entrée was hot,one was lukewarm at best,we sent that back,and refused to wait for the replacement. We asked for the manager,who was apologetic and offered to pick up the check.  Won't be back.

We've been here two times within the last 3 months and the service is hit or miss. The 1st time we had an excellent waitress that was not only beautiful but super attentive to our every need.....despite being busy. We sat on the patio, our food was great and we enjoyed our lunch.

I was there earlier today and I enjoyed my firestarter burger but our waiter was very rude and dismissive. He had earrings which didn't fit the area much but also seemed bothered by how busy it was. He rushed through our area and seemed annoyed that we were in his section. The food was great and the chili was excellent. I would have given them a 3.5 but the food is good so they won the 4 stars. We'll go back and see if they get it right next time.

Their Food may be good and their atmosphere may be good as well. HOWEVER DO NOT trust that when they say something is Gluten free that it is. We ate there Sunday evening and today we both are suffering. I can say with almost complete certainty that our exposure was from eating here. this is the only place we have eaten at outside our home in the last week because of this issue. NOT HAPPY!!!

The greet by the host was friendly. Our server was very nice. We did order appetizers which were served without any utensils nor plates. I ordered the filet mignon and the best part of the dish was the Gorgonzola cheese on it. I couldn't chew the meat. I asked for it medium and it was tough beyond belief. Where are you buying your meat?...  The mashed potatoes were like paste. My friend's pasta was cold too. What else can I say?.......oh, my mojitos tasted like soda water and rum. The margaritas are from a margarita mix too. Yucky. We spent over 100 bucks on a meal we just could not enjoy. The manager did stop by to ask how everything was but where can you begin by telling the guy that he doesn't have a clue on how to run a business. Have you ever even tried a drink your bartenders make? I give two stars because the waitress was friendly and the young man bussing tables was too. I gave her the appropriate 20% gratuity her service deserved. It's no their fault. They don't cook the food and they didn't make our shitty drinks. My advice would be to work elsewhere! Your personalities should match the food and drinks. You could do so much better than this place. Good luck :)..........oh yes, they have a gluten free menu but take your chance of getting a bad reaction and dine anywhere else,seriously

This is my second time trying Emmet's.  First time service was ridiculously sloooow.  Beer was good.  Food was forgettable.
Today, I went with my kids for lunch.  My kids ordered kids cheese pizza.  (My boys love cheese pizza). I ordered the Brewer's chicken sandwich.  
My mom stopped in to say hi to us since she was in the area.  The waiter came to the table to rudely tell my 70 year old mother that she cannot have outside drinks in the restaurant.  (She just came from a doctors appointment with what was left of her McDonalds coffee). He was a total jerk and basically set the mood for never wanting to step foot into this place again.
It's a good thing they have a nice manager ... She was the only thing that was decent about the place.  Although, my son said that the pizza was "gross" and refused to eat it.  She knew that.... She offered to get him something else to eat and he said no thank you.  But still didn't eat the gross pizza.  It was $6 for dough. 
My chicken sandwich was quite boring and was missing flavor.  I think they should offer some kind of chipotle mayo or something with a kick.... It was blah.  
We eat out in downtown Wheaton often... This might be one of my worst dining experiences to date.  
FYI- I have never left a tip less than 15% (usually 20%+) before today.  My mother thought 1 cent was appropriate for the service.  
I left slightly more and that was only for the second waitress that took over at the end.  
It's really too bad.  The location and building is awesome... Too bad the food and service isn't.  NEXT

I came here for the first time today and was far from impressed. The service was BEYOND terrible. It somewhat seemed like they were understaffed in one part of the restaurant but not the entire place. Our waiter almost never came over to our table. We waited quite some time to even be served drinks or have anyone notice our table at all. I tried the Munich Light beer which was actually pretty good. I ordered a couple things off the small plates menu which included the mini brie burger. The brie was so mini it almost didn't exist and I ended up asking for more. One of my friends didn't even get to eat because they messed up her meal. She ordered a medium filet and it came out well done. She sent it back and never received anything in return because it was taking so long. I know that it doesn't take very long to cook a medium steak and it was taking so long that she canceled it. Everyone else seemed to have decent food but nothing that was mind blowing. We were all finished with our food, barely had any drinks left and no one bothered to see if we wanted more. We probably waited 30 minutes AFTER telling the waiter AND manager to cancel the steak to even get our bill. I felt like most of our time was spent waiting than eating and drinking. I may give this place a second chance but it's hard to get me back to a place that has such terrible service and doesn't even apologize for making a mistake. Also, 4 out of 6 people in my group worked in the hospitality business and usually we're pretty easy on people but we were blown away with how poorly we were treated.

Please Wheaton phase Emmetts out and put something better! Maybe they don't want to raise the bar to provide good service like the Bank did but trying out this place on a Thursday night made me walk out and I will never return until it's revived / revibed to a customer friendly establishment. I love Wheaton. I grew up in Wheaton. Visiting is special to me. When I sit at a bar as a new face, I expect good service. Being treated as second class or that my order is not important is not only rude and disrespectful but also inexcusable. Take some advice and employ your staff with some training for customer service because no one in HOSPITALITY should offend their customer -- this world is just too competitive to be slow, rude and off putting!

Emmett's nails these three concepts: on-site rotating craft brewery, small gastro-pub bites, and bar-craftenders; plus the ambiance of yesteryear in this former Wheaton Bank space.  

1) BREW
Emmett's has 7-12 locally brewed taps with a spectrum from lighter lagers or pilsners, to mid-range to bitter IPAs, a FANTASTIC local red ale, and all the way to chocolate roast stout or sweet stout.  The winners so far have been the red ale which boast the bit and range of a true american red-head; mid-range citra IPA for its floral hoppiness; and the roasted stout with distince bittersweet coffee notes.  Are all the beers 5 stars? No.  But try a flight, make up your own, enjoy the sweat and tears of the local brewmaster.

2) GASTRO-PUB
Emmett's has a range of pub-far to full ribeye entree.  The pub fare is available as a full meal, or if you want to go tapas style you can get a limited range for $4 such a a brie burger or tavern taco which INCLUDES one side.  It's an amazing beer and snack, or date night sharing place because of this flexibility.  

The small bites menu includes awesome tavern tacos including vegetarian roasted vegetables which taste great with a swizzle of southwestern sauce on top of a corn taco.  You can upgrade to a premium side for $1.50 more.  So for $6.50 you are eating in style if you want to go full boat on flavor and experience without busting a gut.

Another small bite is caprese salad with just right mix of oil, vinegar, and basil topping drizzled across the fresh cheese and red tomatoes.

The entrees include rib-eye, and there is a special one night a week on the steaks.

For soups: Chili is beyond solid.
The winner though is French Onion.  I've had a lot of bad french onion.  You know what I'm talking about.  Salt bomb, cheap bread, hard cheese, small or no onions.  Not here.  It's full flavor, soft cheese, french bread, with full slivers of onions.

The only item that is missing is the awesome veggie ratatouille available from it's former tenant THE BANK.


3) Craft-tenders.
Do you want a bartender that can shake up a tropical cocktail?  Show off spinning bottles?
Don't go here.

Do you want a bartender that knows what is in the beer, how it was brewed, matches the brew to the meal, cares about your beer experience?  Go here.  Well at least go to Andre.  He cares.

Today, on this Sunday afternoon I came into to watch a Bears/Packers game, have a good red ale beer, enjoy some food as I work on my laptop.  WiFi is available.  Power outlets here and there.  TVs on with the game.  As I make my way through the red ale, and make my way into the small bites, I choose the roasted veggie tavern taco.  Andre pairs the taco with the CitraIPA, and suggest the French Onion to complete the a flavor profile.  When it arrives, as I dig into the cheese crust, the broth is hot, flavor is savory, and bread has substance.  The four flavors work together: roast veggies on corn, savory french onion, and the floral IPA.

And to top it off: TOUCH DOWN BEARS!
Give it a try.  Hopefully they will have a good drive / run themselves.

The service was horrible and slow. Nobody even in the place. We ordered wine because the waitress wasn't knowledgeable about the beers on tap. She neglected to tell us there was a homemade sangria on special for $5.50 when our wine was $8.50. We ordered portabella fries, they were drenched in grease. We got our check and left. The ONLY good things about this place is that Graham's ice cram shop next door!

We didn't even have a chance to review the food. After we waited over 10 minutes for the wait staff to acknowledge us (which never happened) we just got up and left. After reading some of the other reviews, I wouldn't recommend this place.
Had the Cuban sandwich, wife had the turkey burger. Both were not good. Daughter had pizza- doughy and ick. Service was very good though.

Attended the Brewmaster's Dinner this week, and while I expected a nice dinner and good beer, I was really impressed by how far my expectations were exceeded.

The Brewmasters developed the beer list - in this case, it was an all-IPA evening. The chefs tailored the menu to complement the beer.  As an IPA fan, this was a treat! While I liked some beers more than others, there wasn't a single disappointment on the list. 

The food... Oh, the food! My husband and I are still talking about it several days after the event. Everything was made in-house and it was clear that a lot of thought and care was put into everything. I can't decide whether my favorite part was the appetizer - a red snapper ceviche with pickled green tomatoes (which I would never have chosen, but might just have stolen the show) - or the dessert, a rich summer berry strudel with brown sugar frozen custard. In any case, I enjoyed every single part of the experience and can't wait to go back!

All in all, our experience felt disorganized and the food lacking. 

Our server was sweet, but I don't think she knows much about beer. I asked for a smooth, not-too-hoppy or bitter beer, and she referred me to the IPA and the Hoptweet. I am no beer genius but I'm pretty sure those do not fall into the category of what I'd requested.
 
The beer menu needs tweaking: the seasonals are listed out of order, making it a challenge to understand how they fall on the spectrum. Also, our server served our tastes out of order. You can't serve an IPA, then a Dubbel...

We, like others mentioned, waited more than a half hour for...a pretzel. A $4 Small Plate "Pretzel" should be larger than a fat permanent marker. Their proportions are off: one tiny little pretzel came with two ramekins full of sauces. I get the "one pretzel" cuteness, but come on...it's $4. That's a gip and a tease - especially considering how long we waited for it. 

We waited an additional 15 minutes for our other food to be served. Walleye bites were fine (deep fried fish is hard to screw up) and the sriacha aioli was a nice compliment. Chicken slider was much better sized for a $4 small plate, but nothing unique. Prepared okay, but nothing special. 

After all our food was served we were told, without prompt, the ordering system was spitting out items one at a time and hence the delay. I could not have cared less at that point, considering how long we'd already waited. They should have remedied the situation earlier and not given guests an excuse so late in the game. 

Sorry, Emmett's, but you've got some work to do.

I've read the reviews commenting on slow service and I have to add my voice to them.  We waited so long for a waiter that we finally had to ask the hostess to find him for us.  Drinks came out in a somewhat timely manner as did our soup and salad.  The clam chowder, which was the daily special, was watery, thin and flavorless.  We then waited about 25 more minutes for our entrees, a Cuban sandwich for me and three sliders for my husband. The Cuban had very little meat and was dry.  The sliders were as hard as hockey pucks.  
There are better restaurants in Wheaton within 2 blocks of this place. We will not be back.

Not the best, not the worst.  The service was good although when I asked our waiter what kind of soups they had he replied with "I was told our soup of the day is clam chowder but it doesn't look like clam chowder," which I found to be odd.  I did not try any beers but for dinner I would say it's about average.

Waited a hour for a hamburger and it still wasn't there when we packed up and left.  I really wanted this place to be  - a good place.  Server all but forgot us.  I let hostess know as we headed out the door. Hopefully they will get their act together.  I won't be going back anytime soon.  Muldoons has nothing to worry about.

______________________________

Updated: I went back late June 2015 and gave the place another try.  The server was fantastic.  Unfortunately, I forgot her name otherwise I would post it.  The food was good and promptly served. This was a much better experience than my first one a couple weeks earlier.  Perhaps they are still working out the kinks.  I also want to note that the management reached out to me after my not so great first visit.  I appreciate that they are trying to make the place better.  It's a cool spot, nice bar and will soon be brewing beer on site.  What's not to like if they get it right? 

I am upping the review to three stars from my previous one star.  I am going to try the place once again and will report back. I wish them luck in getting the place right.  More restaurants are opening in downtown Wheaton and Emmett's is going to need to be at their consistent best.

We went to Emmett's today with our three kids while we were in town house hunting.  Liked the food.  They had excellent kids goodie bags and offered fruit instead of fries as the side with the kids meals, which is great.  My husband loved the beer.  We all really liked the beer cheese soup and since it was served with a pretzel stick, it also acted as an appetizer for the kids.  If we decide to move to Wheaton, we'll definitely be back.

It was good, but $17 for 2 fillets on the fish and chip dinner? Beers are $5.75. A little on the spendy side for your average brew pub. Wheaton is not that special. Why are all the downtown bars above average cost. A good pint should never be over $5 in the suburbs. Parking around here is as hard to find as downtown too. Hmmmmm.....

Amazing food, excellent service, and quality brews. Well worth the trip. We have gotten the nachos a couple times and several of their desserts. My husband enjoyed the Belgian golden, and their seasonal cocktails were tasty! The atmosphere is laid back and friendly. Staff have always been super helpful with suggestions and attentive without hovering.

What a great brewery! I had their award winning Pale Ale and Imperial Ale and both were fantastic. Our server (Kai?) recommended entrees that paired with our drinks. I had the Steak and Black Bean Chili which is better quality than nearby restaurants (Muldoon's, Shannon's, etc.) and the New York Strip Steak. Seared to perfection! Didn't have room for dessert but I'm sure that it is just as wonderful as the rest of the meal was!

My fiancé and I stopped in last night for a few beers.  Our bartender, Sheena, was awesome!  She was very knowledgeable about the beers and offered suggestions based on our likes.  She really made us feel welcome and also shared some fun facts about Emmett's and about the brewing process.  She is truly an asset to Emmett's Brewing Co.  We look forward to seeing her on our next visit.  

The beers that we sampled were all good.  If you are looking for something light and crisp, the Munich Light is a great choice.  I also had a pint of the 1am Ale, which was a nice twist on an English Ale.  My fiancé leans toward the more hoppy beers and enjoyed both the Hoptweet and Patriot's Pride.  Ask the bartender or server for the list of beer descriptions, so you have an idea of what to sample.  We look forward to trying some of their other brews.  

While we did not eat, we were told by another patron that the walleye bites are amazing.  We will definitely be back to try them.

We stopped by on a Saturday afternoon, and they were not buys at all. We were promptly greeted and seating. Our server saw us and stopped by shortly thereafter telling us he would be right with us.... About 10 minutes later he did stop by. We ordered everything, food and drinks (mind you two iced teas and a Pepsi). Another 8 minutes goes by. My husband gets his soup, still no tea, Pepsi or even water. We have to flag down another waiter. It still takes another 5 minutes to get our drinks. So over 20 minutes from the time we sat down just to get some water. Our appetizer comes out and less than five minutes later our food is there. My food almost got cold waiting yet again on the waiter so I could ask for condiments. The waiter never stopped by again to ask how everything was. I had to ask again for more iced tea, which he gave me tea, no ice. By that time I just wanted to leave. The food was good, but the service was horrible.

The food was great and the drinks were mixed to perfection! We got the calamari for starters. My wife had a bowl of their baked French onion soup and I had the BBQ Chicken Salad with a gin and tonic to drink. Our server, Philip, was very personal and made great recommendations, as it has been a while since either my wife or I have visited an Emmett's. It's nothing like the previous restaurant in that location, The Bank, and that's what's great about it!!!   I highly recommend it...

Three Fridays in a row I have been compelled to go to Emmett's in wheaton bcz the food is so amazing.  I told my waiter complements to the chef.  We were greeted with a visit from the chef himself.  The head chef Edward rocked out the menu all those weekends !!

Went there for lunch and really loved the atmosphere and the food was great. However, we were very very disappointed with how slow the service was. The place was pretty empty when we arrived, but filled up a bit more after we were there around 20 minutes. I had mentioned when making the reservations that we were just on lunch break from work, so I was especially annoyed that it took almost two hours out of our work day. This is the holiday season, and Emmett's is in downtown Wheaton, so you would think there would've been enough staff to handle the lunch crowd. The wait staff was very nice and professional, but extremely lax in attending to our table between courses. It took way too long! So, if you're in the mood to just sit there, then it's great, but if you need to be somewhere in a decent amount of time, I would say skip it.

We were headed for a nice family girl's night out, 6 of us.  Had a reservation for 6:30 , lost one in our party to the weather and when we checked in, there was a lot of whispering at the host desk and we were moved to a booth in the back......okay, because one person made that much difference - or because it was all women....placed drink order, then later appetizer, appetizer came and had to ask about drinks, they finally came. Calamari was tough, not worth ordering.  Entrees were good, food not too warm though, wait staff not attentive. Won't rush back to this one, too bad had high hopes!
Always fun to have a new place open in town!  Great beer selection, friendly and helpful service though the kitchen is slow at times.  Good people, good food, great evening

Great atmosphere, with a welcoming group of people. Good prices for great food. Decent selection of beer. The manager Josh is a very warm, welcoming, and funny guy. Great with people and knows how to make the guests Happy. Beth at the bar was Also really great. Would come back here for any occasion and I know I would have an amazing time. Love this place.

Dined here Friday night on the patio. Our server, Candice, was very helpful as to suggesting some great beers and even better dinner options. Its awesome to see someone really take pride in what they are selling! Though it was a little loud for our liking, we know emmetts cannot control the train volume in wheaton. All in all we had a wonderful experience and will be back to join Emmetts special "beer club" soon! Try the Whitefish!!

Food was boring and bland. Brewer's chicken sandwich - Swiss and bacon on a grilled piece of chicken surrounded by a pretzel roll/bun. Sounds good, right? Wrong. No sauce, the sandwich was kind of cold, (which is odd considering how long it took to come out) and the pretzel bun tasted stale. Absolutely no flavor to this sandwich. The fries were ok - nothing to write home about. Outdoor patio is small and crowded, and flower pots attract bees! Portion is small when you compare it to other restaurants - good if you're not starving, but leaves a lot to be desired if you are. 2 stars because the venue itself is kind of cool.

My husband and I ate there last night and i can not say enough about how amazing the food was, our server was very busy non the less our. service didn't lack at all food was timely and  my husband had the fire starter with homemade chips and I had caprese salad with Salmon both were outstanding, we will definitely be back!!

Staff was friendly. I only had drinks and appetizers.  Had a really good sampler platter sort of thing with cheese and dips.  The calamari was spicy and delicious. Their fried mushroom platter was not really what I expected with these huge fried mushrooms sticks.  Over all was good and will be back.

My husband and I have been here twice since it became Emmett's Brewing.  The Bank was a lot more pretentious feeling, but now as Emmett's it's a much more comfortable atmosphere.  The first time our server was pretty much non-existent.  She brought our drink order and then it took a long time for her to come back and take our food order.  Then when we got our food, they didn't bring us silverware, so we had to swipe it off an unoccupied table.  However, our food and the beer was really good.  So...we gave it another try last night.  This time our server was GREAT and the service was fast.  Kyrie was her name, I think.  The food was hot and fresh.  My husband loves their Crabcake sandwich.  I had the Cuban sandwich the first time and Fish & Chips last night which was good. Their Cheddar Ale Soup and Steak & Black Bean Chili are really good.  I recommend the Red Ale and can't wait to try the Kolsch.

Have been to the Wheaton location twice. Had a wonderful experience both times. Service was great and the food was amazing.  Fantastic burgers and the truffle fries with roasted garlic aioli were out of this world. Will look forward to returning.

This is the fifth time I've been here and the first time I've written a review.   Everything I've  had here has been extraordinary.   Tonight it was the portobello fries and smokehouse burger.   Both were exceptional and would definitely order again.   As for beers... Yum! They offer true cask beers here and the beer on cask today was their Belgian IPA and it was one of the best beers I've ever had! I would definitely recommend this establishment to anyone who ask me for a good place to go for delicious craft beers and excellent food!   I'll be back!

Emmet's is so much better than the bank! Better service and better food, much more consistency. We have only ever been here for lunch and sat outside every time. Mostly we have had sandwiches and burgers, all good, large portions, and the side fruit option is quite fresh. Most recently though I ordered the baby spinach salad NO onions. Well my salad showed up looking huge and delicious but topped with onion. I informed the server and he immediately took it away to fix. I figured they would pick the onions off and bring the same salad back, but anyone who doesn't like onions knows the whole salad will still taste of a giant onion. This was not the case. When my salad was brought back sans onion I could not taste a single bit of onion. Plus it was brought back by whom I'm assuming was a manager. She apologized for the mistake profusely. The salad was very tasty and I was happy with the service. I'm so glad emmet's is here! Oh and my husband loves the baked macaroni and cheese!

Solid 4 star hibachi. We also shared a smoked salmon roll as an appetizer and would give that the same 4 star rating. 
I had the chicken and filet. The filet definitely stole the show. It was cooked perfectly (medium rare), tender, juicy, and bursting with flavor. The chicken was pretty mediocre, but in no way bad. The meal came with a soup, which was a bit on the bland side when compared to other Japanese soups Ive had, a salad that was fresh and light, fried rice that was pretty standard fare, and shrimp that took a close second to the filet in the taste category. My wife had the scallops, which sampled as well, and found them to be tender and delicious. 
All in all, a good experience, nice staff, and good service. I'll certainly put this on my list for the next time I have the rumblies that only hibachi can satisfy. I may even go back for a "sushi only" meal

Went for the first time last night for a friend's birthday. We had a 7:30 reservation and they said when everyone arrived we would be seated. Even after everyone arrived, we still probably had to wait another 10 minutes. The interior is very nice and upscale and the service was great. Much better than other hibachi places I've been to. Sushi was passable, we got a California Roll and I didn't think it was anything special. The chicken hibachi was awesome! It came with shrimp, fried rice and the veggies. Our chef let the birthday girl flip and egg and cook at the grill a bit which Was awesome. They also sang to my friend and she got a free dessert. I thought overall the experience was really nice and worth the money, as it is a bit pricier than similar restaurants. 

For what it's worth, I got a free soda for checking in on Yelp. They also say you get a gift card if you write a review so let's see what happens with that!

2.5 stars
Came here to celebrate a birthday of sorts with friends. The location is super random, essentially sandwiched between a Menards and Michaels. But yeah, this is a hibachi and sushi place. Decently expensive, decent food. 

For those not familiar with Hibachi-style cooking, you sit at a table that surrounds a grill as the chef cooks for you and puts on a show. Lots of flashy knifework, lots of fire, lots of fun. 

The hibachi meal is about $25 and comes with a mushroom-miso soup, a little salad, and your choice of protein over fried rice. This is the same price as roughly 15 pieces of sushi here.

Our hibachi chef was not really all that spectacular. His performance was unimpressive and it felt pretty forced. It was also unnecessarily loud - I was having trouble hearing my friends speak over all the steel-on-steel clanging, which was cute and fun at first but went on a bit too long. Still, making a volcano out of onions is a neat little trick, and we had a good time. 

The food was really good. The miso mushroom soup was beautifully rich and savory without being too heavy and the salad, while forgetabble on its own, was a nice clean flavor between the soup and the main dish. The fried rice and calamari were lovely, definitely a lot better than I expected it to be after a man had tossed it around like a ball for several minutes. 

Lastly, the servers brought out a "surprise" birthday dessert (the surprise sort of died when the server asked 'Oh is it someone's birthday?' after we ordered the dessert discreetly) which was served with a smile and a rather brusque rendition of what was presumably a Japanese birthday song. No explanation was provided. 

Overall good food, pretty disappointing service, rather expensive. If you want a proper Hibachi experience, I'd hit up a Benihana.
Best Hibachi in the suburbs! Although the location looks a little random, the food, service, and presentation is fantastic.

By far the best sushi in the West Suburbs.  My wife and I love coming to Kiku whenever we get the chance.  From the atmosphere, to the service, and most importantly the food!  This is a great place to come for date nights and also for quick lunchtime sushi cravings!  The teppanyaki is also amazing.  I normally get the steak and my wife gets the chicken.  For sushi rolls I recommend the Kiku Rainbow and the Lobster Dynamite, but you really can't go wrong with anything you order.  We absolutely love Kiku! Keep up the great work guys!

My mother took me here once for my birthday celebration. To this day, I still have fond memory of this place. The chefs all can perform amazing tricks with their cooking utensils, ingredients, oil, and fire. So you are never bored while waiting for your food. In addition, I highly recommend getting the fried rice over the normal white rice. Like most Japanese steakhouse, it is teppanyaki style. The portions are quite generous, so I would recommend people share multiple combo sets like Surf & Turf, scallop, shrimp, etc. Reservation is recommended during busy hours. In addition, if you are celebrating your birthday, you should definitely share with the waiter as they give you free small ice cream or cake. Enjoy!

Best hibachi you'll find in the suburbs hands down!!! I took my bf here for his birthday, I also got sushi there sushi was quite good! And for the hibachi I also got the scallops which were prepared to perfection with a good amount! The place is super cute, great for a nice date night. But please, don't bring your kids, bring them during lunch, give us our dinners! Lol now that that's out of the way, they are not shy about drinks either, every drink we ordered was quite strong, but not to the point where it wasn't drinkable, just to the point where u felt comfortable paying what you're paying for them! Very pleased with this place and I'm looking forward to stoping in again! :-)

Mickey Mouse ears, I love you messages, and shrimp tossing....what do they have in common? You can find them all at this restaurant. I have been here twice. Once for a birthday party and once for a get together.  The second time was my favorite. Here is why this is a fun time:

1. It paces how fast you stuff your face with food. They want to make sure you don't inhale your food like most American restaurants. They bring out your soup, then your salad, and one by one your main hibachi course is made. And if you don't eat them as they come out, you risk each part getting cold till the next part comes. 


2.  It keeps you distracts from stuffing your face with food. You have live entertainment by your chef. You also can join in. Whether it's the chef allowing you to bounce an egg on a metal spatula or the chef tossing a shrimp in your mouth, you are entertained. 


The food is average in my opinion. The sushi was probably the best part and I didn't order the rolls so I don't really know what they were except delicious. The hibachi chef was very good. The service was good too. They give you a hot moist towel at the beginning of your experience. They do take reservations. There is plenty of free parking. 

The bathrooms don't have a coat hanger inside each stall. That's annoying for your purse. 

Food:
1. Soup was decent. I liked the green onions
2. Salad was not that good but a very small part of your meal
3. Appetizer shrimp was average
4. Ginger, wasabi and other sauce were good to try but gross on the seafood (I had scallops and shrimp)
5. Avoid the egg butter sauce on your shrimp. It's neither buttery nor savory. It's just yellow goop. 
6. The veggie fried rice is just ok. Needs more salt. 
7. Scallops were decent

That is all.

There were several things that were off-putting about this place. First, as you walk in, the vestibule looked like it happened been swept in a long time...and this is how you enter the establishment. I was surprised to see how big this place was and wondered if it ever gets filled. Besides us, there was only one party around the hibachi table. When we looked at the menu, it seemed scarce. There were dishes that seemed to be main dishes aa appetizers. Also, the sushi menu seemed limited. We ordered our food and then were told the Tonkantsu was out??? So not many options and some aren't available?? Portions were small and I honestly got sick from the sushi I ate later in the afternoon. Needless to say this place left a bad taste in my mouth and I will not be returning. I agree...I am not sure who is giving this place high ratings???

I don't normally leave reviews, but I was so disappointed with my experience that I felt the need to share.

Mis en scene: my wife is in the hospital having just given birth to our second son.

For the duration of the pregnancy, she craved Kiku, as we enjoy their restaurant fairly regularly. When she had my first son, I left the hospital to get her an assortment of rolls to enjoy from Kiku. Wanting to make it a tradition, I went as soon as she was moved to her room and cleared to eat.

I made it to Kiku at 9:35 (25 mins before their posted 10PM closing time), only to be met by a man rushing across the restaurant yelling that they are closed. When I stated that I didn't want to sit, only to get a platter to take to the hospital, he forcefully repeated that they are closed and that I had to leave. No apologies...
Talk about a disappointing experience, and one that put a damper on an exhilarating day.

I got to the car, and checked if there was any other sushi restaurant open nearby, and decided to try my luck at Shinto up the street. I walked in 5 mins before they closed (10PM) explained the situation, and they readily agreed to reopen their kitchen to make our rolls. 

Kiku, you may not care, but you have lost this customer, and any of my friends that go there.  Shame on you!

We came here to celebrated my sons birthday. The service was phenomenal. Our chef was funny and entertaining. They were very accommodating when we told them there was a food allergy in the group. Our server and the rest of the staff made sure all our needs were met and our drinks were full. The food was very tasty and cooked exactly as we ordered. We all commented how it had been awhile since we had been to a hibachi/sushi restaurant. We have found a keeper!!

This is my favorite hibachi grill place hands down! I have never been disappointed by the food or service for the years I've been coming. Located in a strip mall gives it a local hideaway feel but, you will walk away feeling like you found Naperville's best kept secret (or not since I always try to convince people to come here)

Forget about it being my favorite hibachi... Its in my list of favorites overall!

We had a reservation for 5 people for 7:30. We were not seated until 8:15. I felt awful for the staff, because other people with earlier reservations were experiencing similar issues, and they unfortunately had to deal with the anger of the customers. I wasn't really upset, but it sort of is unacceptable to make a reservation, and to be seated 45 minutes after said reservation. What is the point?

Anyways, after finally being seated, we ordered drinks and sushi. My mom ordered some wine. The rest of us ordered waters. Unfortunately, my mom's glass was extremely dirty. Another demerit for Kiku. I will say that things got better from here.

I'll strictly stick to my orders; For Sushi, I ordered two a la carte tamago rolls. I'd never had egg sushi, but I was pleasantly surprised. The egg was cooked (sorry, no pictures), and basically was a wall around some white rice. The egg was slightly sweet, which I enjoyed. 

For my Hibachi meal, I ordered the steak/shrimp combo. I requested the steak be cooked medium, and I was given the choice to have my shrimp cooked teriyaki, hibachi, or with egg yolk. I chose the latter. Each hibachi meal is given the option of a chicken broth soup or miso soup. I went with the miso. You are also given a 4 piece shrimp appetizer (that came with the meal) and the option of veggie or chicken fried rice. The chicken is an upcharge, so I decided on the veggie.

The miso soup was very good. Strong flavors which included green onion, tofu, and seaweed. A bit small, but nothing too much to complain about. 

The fried rice came next. Excellent as well. It's hard to mess up eggs, vegetables, and rice, but our Chef had a nice presentation, too.

The main course was stellar. My shrimp appetizer was small, but my portions of vegetables, steak, and shrimp were acceptable. The steak was cooked to my request. Same goes for the vegetables, which featured zucchini, onions, and carrots.

The highlight of my meal was my egg yolk prepared shrimp. First off, the shrimp were much larger than the appetizer portion. Secondly, not being a huge seafood guy, I wasn't sure how good it would be. Well, the results were awesome. Simply put, my favorite part of the meal. The chef placed egg yolk on top of the cooked shrimp, and steamed it on the hibachi grill. The result was an extremely decadent dish! Very rich, but so good!!!

Overall, the food was fantastic. Our hibachi chef was playful and entertaining. I will note that I caught one of the shrimp tosses from our chef; I was the only one at our table!!! Our waitress was a bit airhead-y (I made a joke about the 'guacamole' on the sushi plate... she thought I was serious) but she was nice. She mostly kept my water full as well.

I would like to give Kiku another chance, but compared to other similar restaurants in the area, I'm not sure why I would return. Prices are comparable, but there was nothing that screams COME BACK. Especially with the reservation snafu.
Excellent pace for sushi, one of the best in Naperville. My favorite rolls are Crispy Volcano and the Hawaiian with a side of fried rice with egg sauce.

My family and I have been coming to Kiku since they opened. Every time we have gone we have had an excellent experience! We have tried all the hibachi restaurants in the area and Kiku is by far the best! Their food is high quality and I love all of their sushi rolls.

This is the best Teppenyaki  place, service is terrific--baristas greet you as you walk in the door and deliver your drink to you--no waiting in a queue by the counter. 
Fresh Meats and Seafood. Thanks
Everything was even better than usual. Cannot beat overall quality, ambience and service.

Entertaining and good food
They will customize your dinner if you have food allergies or special requests.
Sushi as an appetizer before your meal- yum!

Walked in and immediately greeted. Sat down to beautiful cocktails. Specials were told to us in which we ordered and were fantastic!!!! As were the rest of our dishes, sashimi of salmon, uni and beautiful egg yolk shrimp. Will come back again and again!!! Thank you Kiku!!!

This is our go-to place for special occasions, birthdays, baptism party, or just because we are craving for sushi moment. I've been to several hibachi places and this is my favorite. When I had a party here 2 years ago they were very helpful in creating the menu and even printing it out so the guests will know what was in the menu. We have friends who are vegetarian and their request was easily accommodated. 

The drinks (alcohol in particular) and sushi are on the expensive side but I would say they are really good!

My husband and I love going to Kiku, not only because they are local, but because of the delicious food, great atmosphere and the owners are amazing.

Sushi is always tasteful, hibachi chefs are some of the most entertaining, and the staff is on point. What's even greater is the atmosphere is for everyone: families, date night, groups / celebrations.

Be sure to check out all the yummy food this gem has to offer.

Kiku is, hands down, one of the best restaurants in Naperville!

Holy cow, Naperville white people unite! It seemed like all the good looking women with husbands obviously outkicking their coverage were out tonight! It also seemed the ideal Naperville family (4.6 people) Dad working a business job, mom staying at home (drinking a lot of wine as she probably would while at Shinto), the oldest child: young "bro" with his flat brim hat and Abercrombie pants, the middle child in middle school who is athletic and "has a chance to be an awesome high school basketball player), wearing her Uggz,  and the little brother who just wants to play on his PS4 and drink Coca Cola all night! PROPERS TO YOU, NAPERVILLE!

Went here on a Saturday night with a 7:30 reservation! My cousin (who is more than 30 years old) called this place AMAZEBALLS. I looked forward to it...kept on looking forward to it...Yes, I understand it was a busy Saturday night but being seated at 8:15 for a 7:30 reservation...Come on Kiku!

We were seated and to the shock of our server, she noticed that my brother and I were related. This tends to happen when you have a twin. We were hungry (HANGRY girls in the group...uh oh). We ordered the sushi and drinks as soon as possible (which was 15 minutes after we sat down). Water and other drinks came about 10 minutes after the order. My mom's wine glass wasn't cleaned very well and we ALWAYS discuss being "THOSE PEOPLE" who complain about everything, but all five of us could see lip marks. PROPZ to the waitress for taking it right away. Salads and miso soup came out, then finally our sushi (almost a half hour later SAD FACE HERE). Our orders were in! Since we all know how hibachi works, I ordered the steak (RARE) and scallops. I was excited because it also came with shrimp...but more on that later. I ordered the scallop a la carte and spicy tuna sushi which were pricey, but delicious! 

Our cook was awesome. I am sure he deals with hangry people all the time. He got our food out, did some volcanoes, made some butterfly, and did the beating heart. That's what this is: EXPERIENCE! He also went around the table and did the obligatory shrimp toss to which only my brother caught! I HAD IT and it rimmed out. The lovely British people at our table also tried (and failed). The youngest looking lad, who no doubt reads (IE worships) Harry Potter, plays football (soccer, but not very well) and loves fish and chips, said "I always catch a shrimp when I go to places like these!". Well, let me be the first to tell you: HE FAILED...thrice! My aformentioned twin brother was the only one who caught the shrimp on a fly! Another example of America kicking Britain's' booty. SINCE 1776 THESE COLORS don't run. 

I want to go back, I really do. The food and cook were AWESOME! The server was good, but it seemed like it was understaffed or overbooked. I want to go back and see if they can take and KEEP a reservation.

Kiku, I want to choose you (again), like Pikachu, but it'd be hard with Shinto right down the road.

Have been here several times and have never had a bad experience or meal. Good has always been good even when not having the "show" put on for you. I've also eaten here for sushi only and I would put this place up for best sushi in Naperville. Always fresh!  We will be back again!

***Check out my wife's (Allyson) review of Hokkaido and my review of Shinto for reference.

Kiku, you amaze me. A server showed up! She took our order! She brought us drinks and food! Your hibachi chef prepared food and served it to us! We ate it and it was delicious! We were super happy! We loved the decor and everyone was wonderful!

See Shinto and Hokkaido? We're not hard to please... :)

If you want hibachi, go to Kiku every time!

First time at a japanese steakhouse. I was worried about finding something that i would like but they helped me out! Food was awesome, very friendly and talented cook! And the place was so clean!! Would definitely go back with a group! Remember your paying for dinner and a show!!

Some people get all worked up over the ratings.... I said good food, but no reason to turn it into personality attack.  Stay objective, my friend.

Good food, Not the best for the price, however.  I like that there are some alternatives to Shinto in the area.

Love love love love this place!  I have been a customer here for a very very long time, gosh, probably ten years now!  Over the years we have been to several other hibachi restaurants but we always seem to keep coming back here.  Why?  Because the quality of the food and service are hands down consistently better than other places.  

The hibachi chicken, steak, lobster, and scallops are always cooked just right.  Not too salty.  The sauces that go with them are delicious.  The salad that accompanies the meal is fresh and tasty.  And when it comes to the "show" with knife tricks etc, they seem to have the best overall presentation, relying on good clean wholesome fun---like flipping food into your mouth and making fiery volcanoes.  I also notice that although the prices are a bit higher than some other hibachi grills, I always seem to have enough to take home for a light meal the next day which makes up for it.  

Finally, Kiku's is a great supporter of our school fundraisers.  I have come here several times to ask for gift certificates and they have been extremely generous.  While many restaurants and businesses no longer participate in fundraisers with donations, Kiku's has always come through with something big to help us out with raising money.  

I hope that Kiku's stays around for a very long time.  And I just ask that those of us who benefit from the donations from Kiku's that we return the favor.  When choosing a restaurant for lunches, dinners, celebrations, etc etc...please do remember Kiku's!  The food is delicious, service is great, this is a fun & entertaining place to bring both kids and adults, plus the most important thing to remember is that they are generous supporters of our schools and our community!  Thank you Kiku's for all you do!!!!  Many happy returns!

This is my TOP sushi restaurant in the Naperville area! 

My go-to items are the Gyoza and the Godzilla Maki. The food is consistent and always FRESH. Service is always great and fast!

The ambiance is awesome..it's really chic and clean! Love, LOVE Kiku!

Awesome experience! Perfect for any occasion.

Quality and taste of food is simply awesome ! Ambience/Decor of rest. is superb ! Perfect place for a partyy..

Best Japanese Steakhouse outside of Chicago 
Quality food, quality service.
I have been coming hear for over 10 years, never disappointed

Pricey but very good. The hostess and management is not very helpful and are now t very friendly, but when you get to your table it's pretty cool. Food is very good. The chefs are very friendly and put on a good show. They rice is the bomb! Awesome hibachi and highly recommended

Kiku is our favorite sushi/hibachi restaurant in Naperville. My first experience was for my bf's birthday two years ago, and from that moment on, we were hooked. On that visit, we had the hibachi, which of course is fun to experience at least once. Now we just go for the sushi, and last night was probably our third trip to Kiku. Over the years, we have received about $200 in gift cards for here, so that helps bring us out, too. Kiku isn't always a cheap date.

We were seated promptly in the sushi bar, right next to the main bar, which we found convenient. Our server, Coco, was extremely friendly. We both ordered Sapporo's,  to which she asked "the large one, right?" Nice upsell, Coco. We both told her that'd be fine (I usually just get the smaller one). We received our drinks immediately; Coco even poured them in our glasses, which most of the time at other places, the server just sets the bottles and glasses down at the table.

We both ordered Miso soup, as we always do. Kiku's miso soup is excellent.  The tofu is soft and silky, it literally melts in your mouth. Between spoonfuls the bf and I made our first round sushi selections.

For the maki selection, I ordered spicy tuna rolls, and the bf picked spicy salmon rolls. We also ordered sushi consisting of Hamachi (yellowtail) and smoked salmon for the bf. Finally we each chose a specialty roll; the Ecuador for him and Crispy Volcano for me. The Crispy Volcano is chopped tuna, buttered crispy rice with thin slices of jalapeno, cilantro, and a specialty sauce on top.

For a Wednesday,  I was surprised how busy they were. Every table and hibachi station was full. Normally when we come here, we are the only ones in the sushi bar and there's one group having hibachi. I'm not sure if it was from the full moon or there was a special going on that we were unaware of.

Our food arrived in under ten minutes, which was great. All of our selections were fabulous; fresh and flavorful. We tried to eat slowly to save our food and hopefully make some room for round two, but we were quite piggish and finished rather quickly. Nonetheless, we ordered a second round.

The second time around, we did order a few more of the Hamachi and smoked salmon, and I decided to get the Kappa Maki (cucumber strips) to help quash the burn from the fresh sliced jalapenos from my Crispy Volcano. After that, we were clearly done.

I couldn't be more pleased with our server Coco. The food was fabulous, and even though it was quite crowded, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The only irritating moment was when a mother, her tween daughter, and three little ones under the age of 6 were seated near us. The young ones were obnoxiously loud. One of them wouldn't sit down and kept flailing about in between tables, making it difficult for the servers to bring out orders. The second kept trying to climb out of his high chair, thus knocking over dishes, silverware, and other various objects on the table. The third kept calling for her mother's attention in the loudest voice I've ever heard from a little girl. Thank god they arrived near the end of our experience, but the twenty minutes we had to endure their antics was pure torture. We left Coco an extremely generous tip and got the hell outta there.

I definitely recommend Kiku's for anyone who likes sushi or hibachi. The food is really good and is consistent. The interior is beautiful and intimate with dimmed lights.  It can be quite an enjoyable experience.

Opened the door and entered the restaurant. Could not breathe. The place smells. I have been to many hibachi restaurants, but this one has really bad ventilation. To make things worse, had a reservation for six, but they made us wait for more than 10 minutes with no updates. We left. Could not stand waiting in the smell. 

No idea about the food or the service, but I am not likely to be back.
Excellent drinks, fresh sushi, relaxed atmosphere. Pear martini and the shrimp appetizer were delicious. If pass on the bacon sushi roll (I forgot the name)
Love the Service, Tasty Hibachi entrees and sushi!
Always delicious and fresh food.  Service and chefs are outstanding.  Pricey but great for special occasions (sons birthday celebration! ) :)
This restaurant is our "go to" for family special occasions. It's consistently good with good service. Everyone always has a great time. Never a bad experience and I've been going here for years.
It was delicious but expensive. I would return just because of the edamame. The staff was very nice.

This place is excellent! The best gyoza in the area. The hibachi is excellent. I typically get the veggie delight and they have a great assortment of veggies! My kids love the teriyaki chicken. My husband always enjoys the golden shrimp. Excellent hibachi in the area!!!
GREAT ATMOSPHERE! The food is amazing ! Great flavors ! All hibachi cooks are friendly and playful they honestly take the dinner to the next level . Awesome place recommend to friend and family .

Overall a decent dining experience but not one I will be rushing back for any time soon. For the price you might as well go to the sushi house , which has both better food as well as an infinitely better atmosphere. If you're looking for hibachi grills at your table however , this would be the second choice to Beni Hana. Cheap decor and touches throughout however , including splintered chopsticks and hand towels that are basically just wet wipes. Be careful for the added mayonnaise prominent on the sushi , which can be a bit heavy handed.

Had a wonderful time at this authentic, classy, and professional restaurant! Delicious food, friendly staff, and great atmosphere. The cooks are so interactive, and the wait staff is always attentive. It's nice to see the management walking around, making sure things are going well for everyone. If you are in Naperville, and never tried Kikus, YOUR MISSING OUT!
Delicious sushi! Fresh seafood. Beautiful decor. If you're gonna go anywhere for Japanese, go here.
Great restaurant! One of my favorites in Naperville. Great service and awesome food! Would totally recommend to someone looking for sushi and good quality food!

Kiku is a fabulous spot for sushi & hibachi! It's a bit pricey for my taste, but the food is definitely worth it. Plus, it's not just the meal you're paying for, it's the experience...

Over the years Kiku has become a staple spot in my family for special occasions (typically birthdays). It truly is a fantastic place for groups! My family usually starts off with sushi, pot stickers and edamame for appetizers then pair off and split hibachi bowls which also comes with miso soup and salad (this is more than enough!). It's the perfect mix of my favorite foods and live entertainment behind the grill! 

Service has always been great. The tricks on the grill get me every time and kids love it! I appreciate all the interaction that happens while prepping the food - makes for a fun and delicious evening :)

I've thoroughly enjoyed everything I've tried here, but here's a few shout-out to my fave dishes...

-Edamame
-Gyoza
-Hibachi Steak/Shrimp
-Sea Scallop
-Godzilla Maki
-911 Dragon Roll
-Spicy Tuna Roll
-Caterpillar Maki
-Crunchy Maki

.... to name a few!

Tid bit: I often enjoy a vodka soda with my meal and those bartenders aren't shy... drinks are typically pretty strong!

This place is where I tried my very first sushi roll, so it will always have a special place in my heart. I really enjoy their miso soup and Kiku roll, their hibachi tables are also usually a pretty good time. My only criticism would be that the service isn't always on point. I usually get pretty good service at the hibachi table but not at the single tables for sushi. Regardless, I highly recommend this place to any sushi-lover!

This is one of my favorite places to go to dinner because the food is amazing. The sushi is really delicious, and the miso soup is to die for! The hibachi is good, too. Even if you don't sit at the hibachi table, it's incredibly fun to watch the chefs entertain the guests that do sit around them. 

So why three stars? The service is atrocious. We had the same server the last two times we went and it was just a horrible mess. The first time, she brought us our bill before verifying we were done with dinner, when we hadn't even requested the check yet. The place wasn't busy, so it wasn't like they were trying to hurry us along (which wouldn't make it right anyway.) We ordered some light sushi, and were going to order another round, plus some drinks and dessert, but we never got the chance. The waitress just dropped off the check and left. We tried waiting around for a bit to tell her to add some more stuff to it, but it took her forever to come back. By that time, we were over it. 

Then another time we went, same server, same horrible communication. My husband ordered a Tanqueray martini. Five minutes later, the waitress comes back asking him to verify what he wanted. Ten minutes after that, she comes and says "I'm sorry, the bartender doesn't know how to make that." Exasperated, I said "your bartender doesn't know how to make a martini?!" Then she said that the bartender doesn't have what we requested, and I had to politely point out that I saw the Tanqueray sitting right there on the shelf. We had our food before my husband had his drink, but I did have a nice view of the waitress standing around the bar with a very confused look on her face for about twenty minutes, so that was fun. 

I would visit Kiku a lot more often if I knew I could get reliable service. The food really is incredible, but being frustrated definitely is not.
Great food, great chefs, great service. Definitely the best Japanese steakhouse in town.
Great place been going here for years. Great sushi and hibachi the chefs are fun make the dining experience fun. Took the kids last time they had a blast.

Food was pretty good. Mai tai was excellent. The vegetarian option was nice. Great atmosphere inside. Was very entertaining. I didn't notice any ventilation issues like the other reviewers mentioned. Overall I would go back.

This place used to be our favorite place for sushi. Today we came for dinner and they're short waiters. Our reservation was no good because they forgot about it, and the portions are a fraction of what they were.  The waiter they gave use had no idea of the menu and too young to know about wine.  Piece of advice to the owners, if you are trying to cut costs to stay in business, you are in trouble, I come for the service and the food. Tonight you failed on both counts. As for your desserts please rethink your business strategy, if you are trying to loos regular customers you are on the right track. Now you are becoming like all the other fly by night one time wonder restaurants. Your regulars are used to a higher level of expertise.  YOU FAILED

My first visit was this past Friday with my boyfriend and it was so great. The appearance of the restaurant is so different and perfect for a date. We came in for the sushi after finding out about Kiku on Yelp and were not disappointed. The first visit we had: Kiku Soup (I think ; it has mushrooms) the California Roll, Spider Roll, and the Lobster Dynamite. It was delicious and prepared quickly considering how packed it was. Our second visit was yesterday evening and it wasn't opened on both sides of the restaurant, just one but still had a decent amount of people. This time I had the soup, him a salad. We also are another Spider Roll, filet mignon and shrimp with hibachi rice and vegetables. Once again great food and served in a short amount of time. It's on the pricey side if you're used to cheap sushi from around the corner but if you're looking for something better then Kiku's got it. One of my new favs.

Honest review: really over exaggerated do not believe the other reviews there all from people who never had sushi or eaten hibachi before ok for starters the  hibachi isnt that good its like meh ok like nothing magical if u want the best hibachi go to domo 77 theres one in napperville its so much better then the sushi part they only have like the most simple cream cheeze fake crap rolls like stuff that u can buy at the grocery store but more expensive the spicy Mayo is good though but that doesnt make everything else good if u want the best sushi in chicago go to kaizan so after everything jus really over exaggerated dont listen to people that think this is the best sushi n hibachi place in chicago its not

This was my first time trying anything like this. Me and my father sat at the grill with other guests ( who where vary friendly) our order was taken then we where served soup witch was great fallowed by a salad. Then the chef came out and cooked our food. The Ingredients where vary fresh. The chef put on a show and got the guests my self included. The food was amazing it tasted great. I will come back here. It is pricy though 80 for two people.
Thank you Kiku for some great Sushi, wine, Mochi ice cream, and some birthday lava cake!!!!
Amazing hibachi & sushi with a great atmosphere for date night or cozy night out with friends!

Been here about a dozen times, never had a bad meal and only 1 near death experience.  Yes, near death, the hibachi chef was a little of this day and flung his knife right at my self and my friend and hit him in the shoulder.  No blood, hit off point but holly fook, this was nuts.

Always order the garlic shrimp with steak or chicken.  

Pricing is a bit steep for the location, probably why the rating is just short of 5 stars.
We always come here. The food and service is always amazing. Coco was so nice, she was so sweet.

Food was solid, place is clean but could use some additional ventilation.  Hibachi show was also good, kids really enjoyed watching the cooks.  It would be cool if they had actual Asian cooks handling the grill, that would take the experience up a level.  

Sushi was good but pricey.

Kiki is by far the best place for sushi in the far west suburbs. Fish is fresh and well prepared. While the rolls have gotten a bit pricey for the area, the quality is consistently good. Highly recommended.

Kiku is a nice restaurant with a nice atmosphere.  The management seems nice, the employees are nice and the service is good.

It's certainly NOT a place I will frequent or even consider dining at again.

My problem is the price.  I called an order in for two philly rolls, a spicy tuna roll, a cali roll, a salmon skin roll, three ikura, two tako and a salad and the total came to nearly $70.00.  I believe that is a lot to pay for only three people when none of us were sated.  For the price, I feel the rolls should have been more substantial.

I've had better sushi at places that cost less (ie. cali rolls are $4-$5 instead of Kiku's $7).  I will not return to Kiku unless they're having a special.  I know that sounds frugal but they really weren't worth the money.  In this case, you don't get what you pay for.
Good sushi (but expensive for what you get ... I prefer Wild Tuna).  Food is OK, but go for the show.

Kiku has to be one of my favorite hibachi style restaurants around the Chicago-land area. About three years ago, my boyfriend's family and I went for dinner there and I absolutely remember how delicious the food was. Anyway, my boyfriend's sister wanted the family to go out for his birthday, so when she asked me where we should go, I suggested to come back here. 

My second experience was just as good as the first, if not yummier :) We had a party of 7, where they seated us near the windows, however, it was so cold that we requested to be moved, and within 15 minutes or so, we got prime seating in the main dining room. Starting with service, our waitress was just OK - she kept forgetting things that I would ask of her and never brought out something that I asked for, which wasn't a big deal or anything, but unpleasant enough to rate this only 4 stars. Our hibachi chef (wish I knew his name) was incredibly social and fun, with a great smile the entire time. We asked him to do something different and he made us an angel of fire out of onions/eggs - really cool! 

Now onto the food.. the miso soup that was given with the dinner entree was absolutely delicious and different from any I have tried. To be honest, I am so sick of miso soup, but this one had mushrooms in it and was not as salty as they usually are. For an appetizer, I ordered myself one sushi roll - Spicy Tuna Carpaccio - Salmon, spicy tuna, tomato, seaweed salad, red tobiko, avocado, cucumber. It was one of those crazy special rolls, where one piece is hard to fully fit in your mouth, but it was one of the best I've had. We've had other sushi there before and I remember it all being good. 

All but one of us had the hibachi style dinner - I picked the combo entree of Filet mignon/shrimp. Since the meats/fish are all made at different times, I had most of my rice by the time I got my meat, but it was all incredible, especially because they provide a tray with three sauces that you can pick and choose from. Everyone ordered different entrees, but it was all very much enjoyed. 

For my boyfriend's birthday, they brought out a delicious chocolate lava type of cake with a candle and they sang him a song - very cute! The atmosphere is pleasant, giving off an authentic Japanese vibe. There is the main dining room, private seating, sushi dining room, and even a mini-lounge area - all with a red theme and Asian lamps. 

I definitely recommend Kiku for a special occasion - Delicious, fairly priced, and a fine environment!

i have been a loyal domo follower since 1984, this place kicks it butt on all levels.  we will be back.  we have found a new sushi home.. from the food to the entertainment to the actual look of the place was amazing..

I just don't think this place is as good as everyone makes it out to be. It's a place for people who think they're into sushi, and think if they pay a lot for it then it must be good. A typical suburban hotspot...almost good.  I think there are way better sushi places in the area for the price... The lines here are always killer long too which would lead one to believe its super delicious. I'm not saying this place is bad... But if you're a foodie and you really dig sushi...this place probably won't tickle your fancy as much as the typical person.

*update*
Man, I went here again recently and this place is just as lackluster as I remember. The sushi is so mediocre it's painful. Every roll tastes exactly the same. We got spicy rolls with jalapeño and you could've fooled me... Tasted about the equivalent of spicy if you had put green pepper on it. It annoys me that people(/ I just did) pay so much for such bland quality.

Kiku has become a family-birthday tradition for years now and has never been a disappointment! I have dined in for their sushi and countless times for hibachi and have always enjoyed both of them equally. It may seem pricey but for the amount of food you get & "show", its worth it. I would recommend their filet & shrimp hibachi & make sure to eat the yum-yum sauce with it! (Mmm) My family always looks forward to returning to Kiku and sharing a delicious meal together.

I will never go back.  these people treat their female employees terribly- harassment is ignored again and again by management, and this is a fact.  I now go to standard market and sit in the cube and have fabulous sushi for much less money, and am thrilled to not be supporting these chauvinistic owners.

One of my favorite places to go to for great sushi. I must admit, we tend to skip the hibachi. I will say the hibachi tables are usually full when we go there. They have expanded their restaurant and with good reason. It's a popular restaurant and they needed to accommodate for their growing clientele. They are constantly improving and adding to their menu. One of their newer rolls is the bacon bomber. It's got bacon in it, enough said! They have a points card, it's free to obtain one. If the food isn't enough of a draw, the service staff should be. Whether busy or not, their good service doesn't lag. Also a great place to celebrate special occasions. They have tatami rooms that can accommodate your party, you can reserve one of the hibachi tables, or just group a few tables in their regular dining area. One last note, they have a pretty good drinks menu as well

We had the pleasure of going to Kiku on Saturday.   This was my first visit here  but others in our party had been here before.  As far as Hibachi goes this place rates very high.  Compared to Benihana I would choose Kiku now any day.   Don't let the location in a strip mall fool you.   This place is top notch.  I had the steak for dinner which was a New York strip.   My wife had the filet which I tried and was excellent also.   We had a party of 13 and others had lobster, chicken, and scallops too which everybody said their meal was outstanding.  The kids menu is limited on the hibachi but we knew our 5 year old would not want that.  We ordered a chicken appetizer which was the closest thing to chicken tenders.  There were great too for those picky eaters.   I'm not a sushi person but others seemed to really enjoy theirs.  The Hibachi chefs did the typical table tricks and even let our 10 year try to flip the eggs while making the fried rice.   

My only complaint was we had a 6:30 reservation and we didn't get seated until about 7:15.  Yes it was Saturday night and yes we had a party of 13 and it was busy but 45 mins past your reservation time is a little bit much especially when you're told at 6:30 it would be just a few minutes.  We were told after a few inquiries as to what the wait was we were told they were waiting on a specific set of tables for our large party to be seated the people were just sitting after paying and chit chatting.  But after seeing several parties of 6 or 8 being seated together we thought we could have been seated at those before them.  After finally being seated it did take quite a long time to get drinks ordered and then even longer to finally make our food order.   By this time I was short on patience and thought I'd never ever come back here but once the food came that changed my tune pretty quickly.  I'm looking forward to going back and hoping not for a repeat of the reservation fiasco.

I've actually been here several times (I actually don't like writing a review unless I've been there at least a couple of times), and I will no longer be going there.  The service isn't bad, and neither is the food, but they aren't great either.  I realize that for a lot of people the 'atmosphere' is very important, but to me it isn't--I would prefer clean and simple--and that's what you're paying for when you go to Kiku: the atmosphere.  I don't mind spending a hundred dollars on my dinner, but I would prefer to be paying for my food, not the things that hang on the walls.  The food itself isn't bad or anything, it's just that I didn't find it to be any different or any better than the generic offerings you find these days at hibachi/sushi places.  The food is two stars and service is maybe three stars, but the prices (or more like what I'm paying for) brings it all down to two.

I'll keep this review rather short as we only had an assortment on an appetizer platter.  We wanted a full dinner but I think the server misunderstood, brought us our appetizers and another drink and then left us.  Next time we saw her, she brought over our bill.  Uh..hello?  We came for dinner, but didn't even get a chance to order it for some reason.  I'm sure there was a misunderstanding on both sides as I should have made it very clear that we didn't just want appetizers, but c'mon... you may want to ask if we want to order a meal when you bring them to us. (sigh)

The place was beautiful and we were able to be seated away from the grills so we could actually talk and hear each other - which was easily accomplished. 

As for the food we did get, it was delicious.  The rolls were well made and tasted very fresh and clean.  Well made and very tasty! Yum.

Only drawback was the pricing is pretty high for what you get.  Yes, the place looks fantastic as does the food, but if you go there be prepared to pay way more than you would think compared to other upscale sushi restaurants. 

I'd definitely go back to try a full meal, but it is dang pricy for the experience.  Great service, friendly staff, and great food.

The food here is amazing, bartender was super nice and made perfect drinks. One of the owners never smiles when he greats you, he is polite yes but he looks like he wants to be home so that kills the mood automatically.  It's nicely decorated, good environment.  Service is pretty good most of the time. Sushi is great.. Why not 5 stars? Owners mood and take out prices without the show are the same which makes no sense. If there was takeout prices little cheaper like 5 bucks for the food then I would order a lot more.

Have been coming here consistently for years since it first opened. The sushi is fantastic, and I compare every other sushi place to Kiku. The hibachi is delicious and you get so much food! Definitely a great dinner date spot.

Just visiting Naperville. My cousin took me to this place. Living in Chicago you know many good sushi places. This place was pretty impressive. The maki rolls were good and fish was pretty fresh. We had Kobe wait our table and we give him a 5 star as well. Next time definitely trying the hibachi.

Compared to Domo 77 (another hibachi joint in the area) this place is 5 star but all in all I'd give it 3 1/2.  The service was friendly but slow, they seemed understaffed.  I liked that there was the option to get hibachi style food without sitting at a hot hibachi table full of strangers.  We were seated next to the servers station so I was right next to stacks of glasses and a fountain soda machine, so much for ambiance.  I will say that the food was very good, adequate portions for the price. And my Asian pear Martini was to die for!

Much better than Domo. Comparable to Shinto. We somehow go here more often. The Hibachi chefs and rest of staff is very good. We've been going here for years and they definitely know what they're doing. The food is enough that you definitely get full. The miso soup and ginger salad are tasty. I've had just about every combination of hibachi.  The taste is always similar no matter what you order but it's always tasty. This is no different than any other hibachi having similar tasting food. I've also ordered off their regular menu but usually get the hibachi. The price isn't bad and the decor is nice. Definitely keep coming back.

I'll make this short and sweet... 
Kiku is SO good that my husband rewards me with dinner at Kiku for every 100  miles I run. Let me tell you... I try to run as MUCH as possible.

The contemporary decor adds a very unique touch. The bar has every drink you need. The food is absolutely to DIE for. I have never ordered anything other than the "Egg Yolk Shrimp combination with Chicken or Beef" and I don't ever plan to order anything different. The chefs are interactive and it is evident that they enjoy their job. For the experience, the environment, the food, the bar, everything is well worth spending approximately $25 per plate!!!

My mouth is watering just thinking about it!

The food is amazing, the staff was even more amazing and I had a fantastic time.  I was initially shocked at the price of my Jack & Coke, but soon got over that after a few of them - LOL

I've been to Kiku a few times and always look forward to going back.  The great staff makes the visit even better than the food does.  

Always one of my favorites.

My sister, my dad and myself came here for a daddy daughter dinner night. Very nice restaurant, friendly staff, my filet was cooked perfectly, my drink was nice and strong. I love the egg yolk topping that you can order on top of the lobster and they have a shrimp appetizer served like that as well. We had excellent food, service and company, who could ask for anything more??
Always good.

Seriously my favorite place to eat sushi around naperville. Quality is so good, except the scallop sushi. Ikura and uni is the best here. Great service and atmosphere!! Love it!! Went to Shinto and will never go back again. Kiku is by far better sushi!! Try it, you won't regret it!!

This is my favorite sushi spot in these here Western Suburbs.  Every time I've come here I'm graced with the same experience sushi wise.  However, I've never done the hibachi.  Not my thing really.

My husband was a sushi skeptic until one of his buddies brought him here.  Guess what?  I'm up one sushi buddy!

Every thing is clean and the ambiance is very welcoming.  The wait staff is very attentive.  Although the hibachi folk do get annoying but I can't hold it against them since I'm a non-believer.  I might also suggest the Kiku Soup if you choose to visit.  My personal favorite is the Spicy Tuna Capacio.  Super fresh and slightly spicy.
Best sushi in the western burbs.  The bacon bomber is good, not great, but a heck of an experience.
Another fave that I have to goto when in town-great service, fresh sushi and overall good time.  I love hibachi and think kiku is at the top-also clean and inviting atmosphere. Now I'm hungry

My daughter picked this place for her birthday dinner.  I'm not a huge fan of hibachi, but agreed to go as it was her pick.  I don't care for hiachi as it seems you eat in shifts.  First was the fried rice.  Then came a 4 piece shrimp "appetizer"  Not sure why they called it an appetizer as is was served after the fried rice.
