Then the seafood dishes were made and served, and then the beef dishes.  I'm also not a fan of the ginger salad dressing that every hibachi seems to have.  I asked if they had alternative dressings and the waitress said "no".  So I ordered my salad plain without dressing.

So then the chef comes and proceeds to serve 3 sauces to each diner.  One was a horseradish/ranch type sauce.  I dipped a fork full of my salad in and it was very good so i poured that over my salad.

Service was good.  Ordered 3 different rolls to share off the sushi menu and those were all good.  Drinks were pricey as was the dinners.  For the 6 of us with drinks and tip, the bill was $325.

So why only 3 stars?  I'm not fond of the chef flipping pieces of shrimp at people and expecting them to catch it in their mouths.  Most people miss, so the floor has these pieces of shrimp scattered about...which may or may not explain why the floors were so sticky.

I'm not really impressed after hearing so many people rave about this establishment.  We waited nearly an hour after being seated at our table for the chef to begin preparation of the meal, only because the people who were seated just after us requested him.  The rice is marginal at best, with a hint of sweetness that should not be in rice.  Some of the vegetables were obviously frozen, which does not appeal to me and then lacked sufficient amount of sauce.  The filet was delicious, as it was properly prepared, however, the mushrooms prepared with them were barely cooked, nearly raw.   The most pathetic part of the meal was the scallops, which were rather thin, then nearly burned on the grill top.  My wife was without a beverage for nearly 30 minutes during our wait for the sub-par chef.

The food it's good but we literally waited at the table while staring at 3 empty tables next to us for 35 minutes. This was after waiting 40 minutes to sit.  Empty tables does not mean busy.  Suggestion to the owner... hire more cooks.

My favorite place to go for hibachi and sushi in Naperville! I always have special occasions here because I know I'll never be disappointed. The food is always fresh and flavorful and I always leave full and happy!
Very good sushi and service.  Was very impressed. A little pricey but quality is superb.

My husband and I have been to over 10 Japanese Steakhouses and Kiku is by far the best one we've ever had! The appetizers and Sushi are AMAZING, but we come for the Hibachi. We request Chuma as our chef, his food is always consistent and he puts on a great show (We usually tip him an extra $10 or $20 after the meal is over, but that is not expected here) We also ask to sit on the "new" side if we're dining alone or with friends and the "old" side if we bring our son. The wait staff is more attentive here than other places of it's kind.  The owners remember their loyal customers and always make us feel very welcome.

Must Try Menu Items: Chicken Fried Rice (with the Garlic used on the seafood on top), Lobster Sushi Roll, Kiki Maki, Asian Scallops, Hibachi Shrimp and Lobster with Garlic, Tempura Icecream

I had heard tremendous reviews on Kiku, so we finally made it there for my birthday.  Overall, I thought it was pretty good, but not any better than Shinto or Domo 77.  Soup was good, but why use metal spoons that absorb heat?  Ordered the steak and garlic shrimp. It was... good, but I felt the steak wasn't all that flavorful.  It was on the same level as Domo 77.  I think Shinto is an overall more impressive experience.  No complaints, just expected it to be a cut above the rest.  Never tried Shinto, Kiku or Domo 77?  They all are good, but for my money... I would recommend Shinto 1st... and Kiku / Domo 77 a step below.
...went again and loved all of it...got a bit upset right now when I realized my review was on not recommended..what's up yelp ???

Picked the place, because of the good yelp ratings..

HOWEVER

If I could rate it lower, I certainly would. Made a reservation for friday night, earlier in the  day. I greeted the hostess and she responded rather currently, " stand over there and I'll seat you in a bit".  Given that I was trying to be well behaved with the date I was with I let it slide......This time....

Place was packed with a number of walk ins , who were waiting to be seated. (easily greater than 6 different parties of three or more)  Again we are only two & with a reservation.  She then started to seat a number of walk ins first!

I grabbed who I thought was the manager as he was passing by, (turns out it was the owner!) who states well you're just going to have to wait. A reservation gets you a table after a 10 minute wait. ( it was actually approaching 20 minutes )

I gave him a few choice words and told him.....I hope with poor operations management like this and insensitivity to focus on throughput times....I hope his restaurant flounders and flops like a dead fish on a boat and burns to the  ground in front of his eyes.  I have lived in Chicago proper, New york and Boston. I have worked in a restaurant when I was younger and to not have the courtesy and decorum of how to treat customers is the ultimate sin in my opinion. 

Make your choices wisely of where to spend your money!

The sushi is fantastic!  They have a great variety and all the maki rolls I've tried have been delicious.  There are negatives, it's very pretentious, pricey, and the service is not the best.  However, the ambience is great and style is very trendy Japanese.

This is your typical hibachi place - large grills that can seat up to 9 comfortably, and plenty of food.  This was a business trip, and it was quiet enough for us to talk at a comfortable level.  We had several appetizers, including gyoza, edmame, calamari, which were all good. 

The main course came with the show (of course - sorry, couldn't resist the pun).  The artistry is scripted (we saw the same show going on at other tables), which is fine.  The chef's patter was pleasant, and he even invited one of our party to try to flip catch one of the eggs.  (He wasn't successful - I think more got on the floor than the grill).

Anyway, if you like this type of food, it is a pretty good show and the prices aren't bad.

We came to celebrate our 11th wedding anniversary and everything was perfect. Since we were celebrating, we took advantage of the valet parking for $7. There is however a garage right across the street that would have worked. Our reservations were for 5:30pm and we had no problems being seated. Our waitress was very friendly and a food server immediately brought us some tasty warm bread. We ordered our drinks and a calamari appetizer. Before I could decide on my entree the calamari was at our table. With a new baby at home I was happy the night was moving fast. My husband had the lobster & risotto special. I ordered the linguini with mussels in white wine. All the seafood was cooked perfectly! From the calamari to our entrees, everything was GREAT!! We will definitely be back, Rosebud gave us the perfect hour and a half dinner. We even had enough leftovers to have lunch the next day.

I've lived in the area for a while and never came to Rosebud. I recently moved to Austin, TX and came back for a visit. My mom suggested we dine here, to celebrate my landing a new job in Austin. I never really knew what this place was...Italian, steak, pizza....but once I walked inside, I knew it was loud. Really loud and much smaller than I'd imagined. We had a reservation to eat chewy calamari, heavy gnocchi and obscenely large pork chops...and had to stand by the front door. I was thinking they'd have an area to sit and wait, but it didn't. 

Our waitress was a bit overbearing and stood in front of us as my mom was eating her pork chops, waiting for her to finish so she could put the rest in a box. I had to ask her to wrap up mine, twice, to get her to walk away. Took us a while to get water refills and the desert menu was a bit...boring. Every Italian place has tiramisu. I was hoping for more originality. 

In hindsight, I'd have pressed to go to Hugo's. But even if I lived here, I wouldn't come back.

This place always seems to be busy, maybe it's just the location of where it's at in Downtown Naperville, but I figured I couldn't go wrong with a visit to this place since there's another location in the City on Taylor Street where the best Italian eats are at!

Late Saturday afternoon I decided to make a reservation, just in case... and I'm glad I did.  Our reservation was at 8pm.  We arrived at about 7:50-ish and requested to be seated outside.  They said it was fine, but it would be about a 10 minute wait still... 8:15, we're hanging at the bar and I decide to go up and ask what's up, especially after a couple who came in AFTER us were seated.  Aren't reservations taken first come, first serve?  I did mention what I just saw and I was told "they had an advance reservation" A what??? - Yeah, so did we...we got seated promptly after that.

After that scenario everything was great...our server was great, he gave some great wine recommendations, and just like every restaurant, the up-price on the wine is ridiculous!  A $19.99 bottle of wine at Binnys is $65 here!!! Buyer beware... we opted for the $40 bottle, which is probably $12.99 at the store. *eye roll*  it was good, I wanted a nice meal out so this place served it's purpose.  It was very hard to choose from the pasta dishes, but my +1 and I were very satisfied with our meal here!

This place was passable but I'm not sure I would go back.  I've been to Rosebud in Chicago and it was like night and day.  First of all we arrived Saturday night with an 8:30 reservation, we were seated at 8:30 on the dot in a booth but the noise level in this place is deafening, and a bit off putting.  Our server was pleasant if less than attentive or observant.  We ordered fried calamari which was chewy, way too chewy.  My dinner companion had gnocchi with bolognese sauce, and the gnocchi were a tad heavy.  My order of Pork chops Calabrese was good, chops cooked quite well but the sauce was crude, gluey and other than the peppers had no flavor.  The portion was lumberjack size though I wish more attention had been paid to the sauce than the size!  I was neither impressed with service nor food and find it difficult to make a return visit, I've had better.

This is exactly what I want when I go out for Italian food. 
I hate the congestion of downtown Naperville but it's worth threading my truck through the swarm of Prius just to get here.  Either way, the food...... 
The entrées here are hearty, high quality, made with fresh ingredients, and done correctly.  The veal parmigiano was enormous, the cheese was very good - not some slice of prepackaged junk. The tomato sauce was outstanding.  The Alfredo sauce was creamy but not too heavy and the pasta had a perfect texture.
All of the desserts we tried were fantastic. 
I like places like this because they don't have to play up their ethnicity to appear authentic. It's honest good food the way it was intended.

The place was packed when we got there but service was pretty good. Our glasses were never empty and the waiter was attentive.  No complaints there at all.

In all, it's not much more expensive than the Olive Garden (which is the worst thing to ever victimize Italian food) the portions are good, the ingredients are fresh, and the ambiance is very nice - even if dining outside in Naperville is like living in a Gap advertisement from 1999.

Judging by the threats of prison shanking from Wifey-poo if I ate her leftovers it's safe to say that she liked it too.

My boyfriend surprised me with dinner here for my birthday. I had never been to Rosebud's before, but had driven past the restaurant multiple times. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo with chicken, which was pretty good! The noodles were cooked to perfection and I'm pretty sure they make the pasta fresh in the restaurant. The food was really good but a little pricey for my taste. I'd probably come back here for a special occasion.
Slow service. Food was inadequate. Overpriced for mediocracy. Probably won't come back.

Had a dinner there, decent service, polite and very attentive but overloaded waitress, had calamari as an appetizer, nothing different than your grocery store package, spouse had spicy pasta and she liked it, apparently it was made with panceta but we didn't see any, I've had pork chops, yeah portion was big but the meal was mediocre, nothing besides tiramisu stands out from the dinner experience. Food is just tasteless, it isn't cheap either, IMHO they have lost touch to their roots and dumb down everything on the menu to feed the masses, I won't confuse their name with real Italian food in the future and won't be coming back....

Sadly disappointed.  We went in for an anniversary dinner and wound up disappointed.  We had a reservation (Open Table) and still waited almost 20 minutes.  We were lucky enough to grab a couple of seats at the bar while we waited, then we waited, and waited for over 10 minutes to be asked if we wanted a drink.  The drinks were a nice pour. 

Once we were squished, I mean seated, in the back room of the restaurant we were served by two alternating wait staff.  They tried but it was too loud and too crowded.  Don't worry I fixed the wobbly table with an extra napkin.

Food was excellent...however...I ordered asparagus go on top of my steak salad and it came on a second plate.  While I was cutting it the waitress came over and asked how everything was tasting (which is a term I despise) and I said well the asparagus came on a second plate.  her answer "well the kitchen is busy as you know".  I do know but a good kitchen and wait staff would have coordinated and gotten my order correct.

Overall I rate it a MEH.

Second Try!

Its a four stars this time, last time was a one so it really should be 2.5 stars lol

The waiter this around is much better, came back to check on us several times!

Food were much better, we ordered another salmon, its pretty big but tasted OK :)

*******************************************

Services were OK but food cant say the same!

However they do have a large wine and cocktail list :)  To start out my meal, ordered a super refreshing cocktail call cucumber martini!  

We ordered salmon, it looked pretty fresh, topped w/ spinach.  We did ask them to cook it medium but it was over cooked....!

I had a steak, asked for medium rare......but guess what is was probably 90% 95 cooked :)

Taking your spouse and parents here for an upscale Italian dinner, you can easily spend a couple hundred bucks.  Manager and hostess staff very nicely dressed.  Good food, but I think a few tacky details stuck out during my visit: Black pepper in a shaker, not a peppermill/grinder.  Powdered Parmesan cheese, not freshly shredded. A college football game/ESPN playing on the TV at the pizza oven counter, for the entire restaurant to watch.  These kinds of things just cheapen the atmosphere, making you quietly mumble to yourself, "Hmmph" and slightly raise an eyebrow at the end when you open the folio to reveal the total bill.  And oh yeah, as every other review mentions, the wood/tiled floors make it fairly loud in here even off hours when the restaurant is 1/3 full.

Cleanliness is the most important part of a restaurant. This is the dirtiest retaurant i have been to. They brought out bread wrapped un a red stained napkin. Then we have very dirty silverware.  Plates were dirty. We sent everything back and went somewhere else.

I had a pretty good experience here on a Saturday at lunch, bordering on great. It was a beautiful day so we sat outside on the patio to watch the people of Naperville as we enjoyed some delicious food. The waiter we had was very friendly and helpful in recommending drinks and dishes and even provided us with some great inside information. I know know where 8 finger cavatelli got its name... I felt like the service may have been a tad slow, but I didn't overly mind and everything I asked for I did receive. 

I started out my meal with a super refreshing cocktail called the cucumber martini. I don't remember what in it gave it this pink color - but it was super refreshing. For lunch, I had the 8 finger cavatelli. It was a great sized portion and left me with a late night snack later that night (as I was too stuffed for a proper dinner). And if all that wasn't enough, we topped it off with a desert that I can't remember the name of - but essentially it was fried pieces of dough rolled in cinnamon and sugar and topped with ice cream and chocolate sauce. 

Everything was great. I guess a little pricey, but for a special lunch or dinner this is a great option downtown.

Awesome experience. My server was friendly and helped me pick out a dish I had never had before and I was glad she did! It was delicious! Manager came by and welcomed us and food time was perfect everything here was great! Thank you for the hospitality !

The service and food has been consistently good each time I come here. They have a large wine and cocktail list. I recommend trying the lobster stuffed salmon on the chef's specials menu. It had a delicious lemon butter sauce and the salmon was on top of cooked spinach. This dish with shareable between two people.
Food quality has declined over our past few years. Furthermore, they have never recorded our reservations made on Open Table.  It is too bad.  It use to be a good restaurant.

I wish I could tell you about the food, but we never got to eat or be seated. This review is solely for how they handled a REQUEST for a table of two in the middle of the afternoon - past what one would assume is a rush time. 

I so appreciated not one but two people greeting our approach to the host area with disdain and anger. Slamming menus down on the counter was a real bonus, as was the loud and looooong sigh. 

Also enjoyed being told that it would be "at least 30 minutes, maybe more" to be seated, though we could clearly count a dozen open tables.

Those frowns turned upside down when we told them not to worry, we weren't staying. A nice touch to feign concern and eke out an "I'm sowwwy" look. Meanwhile, the only way it could have been ANY clearer you didn't want us there would have been if you held up a giant "GT FO" sign and pointed to it. We did GT FO, never to return.

Being a restaurant owner, our dinner at Rosebuds was awesome and the portions are huge. We got the Veal Parm and the Veal Milanese. Totally on point !

The service was great along with the desserts!

See you all again soon!!!

I'm almost as confused about Rosebud as they seem to be.

I miss the old location, it was charming, quaint, romantic... dangerous* 

..but I don't think their business was good enough because they made that strange switch to being a burger place that served Italian...

*and the ever present floods and fire..

So they moved over to the old Martini's (steak and cocktail place) which itself took over the spot from the Cuban joint. 

Now they are back to being an Italian place, and that's what we had. I was jonesing for some pasta.. carbs and sauce and protein. It was Labor Day and a lot of places weren't open. Rosebud was, and they were open for a late lunch. Easy decision for us. 

We sat in a booth, the booths are nice big curved affairs that strangely back to the windows.. making the restaurant the focal point. So we looked around (took the waiter a while to get to us) and were kind of confused.. the nice booths had the paper placemats and the tables were all white tablecloth.. kind of a mix of two styles.

Our neighbor (facing out we just watched him eat) was having some Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken.. that's what I wanted, the look of the ribbons of pasta bathed in sauce was too much to bear. I wanted it, but Lisa ordered it..(curses! foiled again!) I had to get something else.

Gnocchi Bolognese, it was calling my name (not as loudly as the FA was.. but well.. you know what happened there)

The gave us some bread, with the plate of olive oil and parmesan. We ran out, waited and had  to ask for more. 

I started with a Caesar Salad that was both lovely and tasty, the parmesan crisps were all angular and made the plate interesting.

Lisa's Fettuccine came and was very appealing looking, my Gnocchi wasn't quite so pretty, but it's tough to be pretty when you are a lump of dough in a meat sauce. 

Lisa wasn't so excited about her pasta, she thought that it was good, but a bit bland.. I tried it and agreed, I think that it could have used more cheese in the sauce.. or on top.. some Pecorino Romano.. or Reggiano shavings.. maybe?

My food was very flavorful, and the Gnocchi was very good. The pasta was light, the sauce meaty.. somehow, I lucked out and got the right thing...

Even better was when we started sharing a bit. The Fettuccine was a really good compliment to the Gnocchi. So that's what we did.. they should sell 1/2 and 1/2 servings.. because that worked out really well.

It's best not to plan on using their parking lot.. it's always crowded and can be difficult to maneuver.. it's a popular mall. There is a small parking lot in the back of the mall and Naperville's funky three level garage (each level has a separate entrance) across the street. Sometimes, if you look up you'll spot one of Naperville's Finest checking you out .. watching to see if you've been over-served and are driving. 

I'm knocking Rosebud a bit on service. The room is nice, the food pretty good. We probably won't go back unless we have friends that want to go there. It's not a "goto" place for us, although it's a fine place to go to. It's pretty much what they were before (that's before their weird hamburger phase) but in a more upscale atmosphere. 

Probably deserving of a half star more... if I had a half to give.

Large portions for the price of quality you are getting! Also great, timely service with little waiting time for a Friday night with no reservations! Also, good selections of wine and entrees!

Waiters are very professional and the hostess was friendly.

No cons :)

We had my brother's 18th birthday lunch party here and overall it was a positive experience.

We had reservations for around 15 people at 2:30. They had a nicely-located table set up for us ready for our large group. 

We began with some shared appetizers that included bruschetta, a mixed green & fruit salad that was on special, as well as the usual bread and oil. We thought the appetizers were all on point, the salad was delicious, some of our group thought it needed more dressing but I disagree. The bruschetta was above average, without a doubt.

Everyone ordered their own entrees. I personally got the Grandma's Gravy, which was like braised beef over rigatoni with sauce and cheese. I was pleasantly surprised how flavorful and tasty this dish was; the pasta was exactly al dente and the meat cooked to the right temperature. I am always torn whether to order a pasta or a meat dish at Italian restaurants and this was certainly the best of both worlds. I heard good feedback from the fettuccini alfredo, linguine & clams, as well as the skirt steak, and the chicken vesuvio.

The service was good, we had two servers who kept up with my family's rigorous and incessant demands quite well. Our only gripe would be that they didn't want to give us more cheese for some reason, the server just kept going around with the jar and spoon asking people individually. No big deal.

The prices seem a little bit higher than similar Italian restaurants. I personally think many of those other places can easily stack up with this Rosebud location. I haven't been to the other Rosebud restaurants downtown, though.

Not bad! 4/5

We went in for a late lunch on a Saturday afternoon. The service at first was terrible. We got bread and water and then waited and waited. Finally the waitress came over and apologized for the confusion (although I saw this happen with at least 2 other tables so they really need to figure this out). The food was mediocre. Definitely MUCH better Italian options in the area. I had the vodka pasta which had a weird taste to the sauce. My husband ordered a sandwich which came with cold French fries. The kids meals were good, but VERY pricey for the portions. In fact everything was overpriced. They charge $15 for a glass of wine when the bottle can be bought at the grocery store for $15. I would also think an Italian restaurant would have more interesting wine choices to entice customers to have a glass or two. The portions were small for the price and the service was less then expected (even after they figured out who our server was). Good location, but there are so many better options around. We won't be back.

It had been a really long time since I had been to Rosebud (several years), but I visited again a few nights ago and was glad I did!

The pastas and appetizers are all quite good from what I was able to sample in our large party of guests. I liked my Rigatoni alla Vodka best of all! The desserts were just OK. They weren't really worth ordering and I probably would pass on them next time, but everything else was excellent (even the bread)!

The prices are a bit higher than comparable restaurants, but nothing was totally unreasonable. The service we had was quite good. The server kept up with me on refills, and I'll admit I'm not an easy one to keep up with. Overall, it was a pleasant experience that I shared with my family. I'm sorry it took me so long to return, but I'll be back sooner this time around.
This Rosebud offers classic Italian food in a casual atmosphere. Parking is in the lot. Very popular locale so it gets pretty packed. Outdooe seating is also available

I've always passed by this place and was given a gift card so my husband and I gave it a try.  Every time we went, we were happy with the overall service and food.

If you plan on visiting, might I suggest you make reservations ahead of time.  The weekend especially gets super crowded and the wait can get ridiculously long especially around dinner time.

My favorite dish is the mussels mediteranio.  It's an appetizer on their menu and the broth to this dish is heavenly.  It's soooo good.  Their calamari is good too.

My only complaint would be how crowded it gets during dinner.  The tables are too close together and it doesn't seem as private when you're with someone because other diners are less than 2 feet seated away from you.

We were seated outside, nice night but not super busy, no wait at 6pm on a Wednesday.  Waiter really slow, lazzie faire, to wife's order and left the table, forgot to take my order??  Went inside, tracked down waiter and explained that both of us would like to eat.  Response; oh I thought you were planning to share.again??

Gets better,  it's now 7pm and just got orders, 1 hour for a couple salads with empty drinks.  They forgot the chicken on salad.  Not good Rosebud..

Pricing seems like it's gone up and quality gone done.  Will not be back.

3 stars for great food.  HOWEVER, wait staff is all about up charging.  They try and sell you on most expensive items, wine, and food. They are rude all about running up your bill.  We had a work party here and several items had to come off the bill because staff just brought it after we told them not to. (extra bottles of wine, additional appetizers) Because the party was large they didn't think we would notice. 
Also, they tried to charge us twice for tip.  They include the tip in the bill and then leave a space for you to do it again. Very sneaky and although the food was good, staff was not trained properly.

As always the food at Rosebud's is consistent and delicious. We have always enjoyed dining at Rosebud's for both lunch and dinner but we have noticed a big difference in the service since it seems there has been a total turn around in the wait staff.  All of the familiar faces are gone and along with that is that "personal touch" you received. The last three times we have dined we have had less then stellar service.  Today we had lunch and our server visited our table to take our order, clean up our dishes and ask us if we were done. Not once did he ask if we wanted our drinks to be refilled, ask if we wanted more bread, or ask if we wanted dessert or coffee. In fact, we were in and out in less than a half hour, and the sad part was he was taking care of our table and one other.  It was always the food and service together that keeps us coming back but it is becoming less favorable for us to return because of the lack of personal attention and service we are consistently receiving. With all of the choices downtown Naperville has to offer Rosebud will most likely fall on our list of choices.

Service, ambiance, quality & selection were exceptional. Hot spot for a Friday night! We performed a secret shop for this location and while the secret shop was never submitted for review, I absolutely planned to include the details here for my fellow Yelpers and restaurant guroos and foodies to indulge in. Having lived and breathed the restaurant business for over 7 years of my life, dining at upscale establishments like the ones I used to work at is still exciting because I know all the back-end work that gets the place moving and ready for happy diners.

We have been to this location a number of times and other Rosebud locations around Chicago. Above them all, I do find this location to be a favorite. The menus all vary just a little, but this location can be both on the fancier spectrum with their food offerings, or more casual for some nitty gritty, down and home cooked Italian faves. It's located in a bustling downtown area, parking is more than ample, free, or valet service is available. 

Service: Overall, it was excellent. There were two managers in sight during our visit and both that "touched" us during our dining experience. Our server, Matt, was spot-on with his recommendation of one of the best Chilean Seabass preparations I've had in ages and was not kidding about having plenty of delicious leftovers for the next day. He made us feel welcome and was both conversational and professional, despite it being a packed house and his station being packed the entire time of our dining. There's definite value in serving large portions, so that should be noted and he did just that! The host staff seemed nice enough, but wasn't overly friendly or smiley. We were seated near the window with full view of the host stand, so at one point I even called the front desk to grab the name of the hostess for my formal review I've now submitted to the restaurant directly.

Ambiance: This restaurant is large and loud, in a robust, fun kind of way. If you like small, quaint joints, this one will provide that near the windows and perimeter or in their back room, group dining area. The dim lighting is both romantic and relaxing. You can't beat the smells coming from that fairly open kitchen! If you don't have a reservation and there might be a wait, there's a covered patio portion that is heated, so have no fear. Definitely don't let that be a deterrent from dining at this fantastic joint during the sub zero evenings.

Food: You're not going to be cutting many calories when dining here, but you definitely will be leaving with a full belly and happy taste buds. In addition to the Chilean Seabass Velasco (made with white wine, garlic, jalapeno peppers and olive oil + roasted potatoes), we ordered the Stuffed Pork Chops with Provolone, sundried tomatoes, spinach, broccoli, crispy potatoes and a Marsala wine sauce, the Della Casa salad to share (great recommendation from our server, as it's large!), a few glasses of delicious wine and a sampling of four of their gelato offerings. How about that salted caramel one... amazing! Let's just say we enjoyed every course! 

Overall: We were stuffed like turkeys when we left, but enjoyed bite after bite of wonderful food and the entire experience. The bathrooms could've used a little attention with toilet paper refilling, but really... that's not bad for a busy Friday night and a restaurant full of indulging patrons. 

Other fun tips:
They have Open Table reservations as an option.
Free parking in Downtown Naperville.
Gift cards available!
Big room for larger group dining is also an option... which is so nice and intimate.

**Edit: apparently not all of you Yelpers get the "ample parking" bit. Honestly, it matters when you get there and to me, 44 spots in the lower parking lot and no fewer than 3 spots in the main parking in front of the restaurant is "ample" to me. I guess I just get lucky because I always seem to snag a spot. And really... how can we complain when we're not digging for quarters?

We went to this place twice. The first time we were impressed by the seafood pasta which was served in a "gigantic" plate. It was amazingly tasty. They also got very tasty fried calamari   so we were very pleased the first time. However, the second time our experience was OK. The pizza is a bit soft, without the whole crunchiness. Plus the topping is easily fell off the dough. Therefore, we have not been back ever since... maybe we should give it another try at some point?

Pretty lackluster Italian. Noodles were overcooked. Sauce had no flavor. It was bland and boring. I think the best part was the salad. And even then the dressing tasted like shelf bought. Service was mediocre.

I had a terribly stressful day and called the wrong Rosebuds and ordered food for my very ill mother. When I arrived , they did not have the order. Totally my fault but I did not realize it. The General Manager went so above and beyond. I will never forget his kindness on this otherwise horrible day. What a way to turn a bad situation around and have a loyal customer for life!
We loved it ... Excellent food AND service!!! The pork chops are pretty amazing. It's been awhile since we were here, but definitely looking forward to it again soon!

I came here with my son Luigi to celebrate Mother's Day.  I did not have a reservation and they sat me no wait.  I like coming here for Americanized Italian food.  My son Had skirt stake I was surprised they garnished it with jalapeño peppers.  We had desert. Too bad they did not have that coconut cake.  We had food left over to take home.

I recommend coming here if you enjoy overpriced Chef Boyardee. 

My table ordered two pizzas and one pasta dish. Not only did it take ages to come out, but it was also bland, boring and expensive to boot. 

Our waitress lacked in the "good service" department, and we found ourselves asking other servers for help since she was never around or checked back on us. We waited 25 minutes for our check, and another 15 minutes for her to run our card and return it to us. 

We left the restaurant annoyed, disappointed, and hungry. Never coming back.
Too $$$. $280 for 4 adults 3 kids (16 and under) with 3 modest drinks total. 42 for Grouper.  They are full of themselves. There are better alternatives nearby.

I visited Rosebud Saturday night for a birthday celebration. From beginning to end, I was impressed with the service at this location. First, they were very accommodating when it came to fitting in a party of 15 on the same night as a local high school dance. We were seated right away, our drinks, salads and entrees were quick, and all the food was delicious. 

Our service was exactly what we needed considering we were there for an event. If it had been more of an intimate evening, we might have expected more attentive service, but considering the place was packed and we were loud and rowdy, it was perfect. 

Speaking of loud... There are so many people packed into this place on Saturday night that I felt like I had to shout to be heard. It was crazy busy, and getting to the bathroom without weaving your way through the tables was a challenge. 

All in all, I think this place does a nice job. The food was so tasty that I might even consider just ordering carry out next time.

I'm actually quite shocked at all of these bad reviews. Some  of these need to be flagged- people aren't reviewing the restaurant but what happened internally with an employee issue- yelps not for that people! I wanna know what the foods about! Get it together!
      Anyway I came to Rosebuds for the first time for my friends 30th Bday. The place was packed. I hate the parking. The lot is way too small to accommodate all of the business, and the parking garage across the street was completely full. rosebuds does offer $7 valet, but I don't usually like valet. When my dinner is over I want to go, and not have to wait for my car to be brought to me.
         My bday group had ten people and we were seated in the back area away from the main dining room. The server was pretty cool. He handled us well. I had no idea what I wanted so I let him surprise me with soup- he picked Pasta fagioli which was pretty damn good I have to say! The soup had beans and pasta in it and other stuff I can't remember.  Just know it was good people! 
           I noticed  the menu had a  fish salad which has shrimp, calamari, squid, and white fish. I wanted that mix of seafood, but not in a salad which led me to my dinner choice, Zuppa di Pesce. I'm not a salad as an entree kinda dude. The Zuppa di Pesce  is  an enormous dish. It was $32, and  well worth it. My pasta was EVERYTHING. When my fat ass is enjoying food I get all into it. In the zone. I was in my lane. On roadblock status tuning every b*tch out in the room that  said something to me lol! I was focused on my food! My pasta also had clams & mussels unlike the salad. 
          I enjoyed my meal and will definitely be back. It's unfortunate  that Rosebuds has so many bad reviews  written by people that never even ate here!? #Fail  #GetItTogether  When I'm dining out I want to know how my dining experience will be, not what went on with an employee that I have no knowledge of and don't know the whole story. #BusyBodies #FindSomethingBetterToDo
Rosebuds I'll be back!!

That's all folks!!

From all the pizzas in Naperville's neighborhood, I think that Rosebud has the best, specially the one with Prosciutto, that I couldn't find in the online menu. I usually don't like so much pasta with red sauce, but Rigattoni a la vodka, was amazing. I like to ask for fried calamari and grill calamari both are fine and Portions in general are ok.
The only issue is that the service is quite slow so I prefer to call and take to go.

We were in tonight and had some very slow service. We had a new waiter who did nothing wrong and was trying hard but we had a sitter at home and were trying to get home. Drinks took a very long time (and one was wrong) and entree didn't arrive for 1hr and 15 min. Talked with the general manager who went beyond good customer service. He boxed up our meals and even added a dessert and comped the whole thing. We will be back rosebud. Maybe when we have more time.  Thank you!!

Rosebud in Naperville used to be a romantic hot spot of great Italian cuisine... 
I've had better service and food at the Olive Garden.

While the food was fair and our waitress was average, (even though she didn't mention the specials, we found the list under the center piece) the brunette hostess had no personality and dropped our menus on our table before mumbling something and walked away. I asked her if we could get a booth ( yes we had reservations) and she looked me blankly, shrugged her shoulders and said they were all 'reserved' then promptly turn away.
Additionally, it was way loud and crowded and I don't loud with energy, I mean loud with small children running around and people standing around in the entrance and tables way too close... 
If it wasn't for the apathetic hostess, it would have been okay but she really soured our impression before we were even seated; can't take that back.
Not going back here anytime soon.

Paying $16 for spaghetti and meatballs isn't usually something I'm a fan of doing at any time. When I saw the prices here for pasta I considered leaving and heading over to one of the cheaper Italian restaurants or pizza places in the area but decided that we'd give Rosebuds a try.

I'm glad we did.

Now look, I'm not saying that I'm going to go here every week and it's my new favorite place ever. No. The prices are a bit too rich for my blood for pasta, one of the cheapest things on the planet. But. The food was delicious. The meatballs were large, moist, and seasoned perfectly. The sauce tasted fresh, with small chunks of tomatoes that burst with flavor when I bit into them. The pasta was obviously high quality.

My wife ordered a pizza and while it wasn't a Chicago-style deep dish delight, it was still seasoned well and obviously used high quality ingredients.

Our server was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. We couldn't have asked for anything more from him.

If you're looking for a treat night out, a nice date, or cost simply isn't an issue for you (you lucky dog), then I highly recommend going here. You won't regret it.

Snotty attitudes ruin my appetite!  The somewhat condescending attitude of the valet and our waiter today were so off putting that I changed my mind from Mahi Mahi to a Salad.  The food is a 4.5 but the attitude knocks my score down to a 3...

I went to Rosebud for my work Holiday Party this past Sunday. It actually wasn't our first choice, but it turned out to a fantastic one anyways!

We had a table of 13, so we were placed in a private back room with another big group. The restaurant itself is very loud, but where we were seated, the volume level was very manageable.

I forgot to mention that the restaurant offers valet parking. I did not choose this because there's also a parking garage right across the street. The restaurant is located in the heart of downtown Naperville.

Our server, whose name is slipping me, was attentive and helpful. One of my coworkers said that the staff is usually really good, but I wasn't wowed by our service. Not that it was bad, but nothing great. My water was kept filled by various members of the staff, so I apprecited that.

The table ordered a few appetizers with our entrees. The eggplant rotolo and stuffed mushrooms were ordered on my half on the table, and my fellow diners were very satisfied with their choices. I decided to save room for my  main course by opting not to get an appetizer.

For my entree, I went with the Chicken Caccitore, which was a half broasted chicken in a tomato white wine sauce garnished with peppers, mushrooms, and olives. It was the first time I had ever had the dish, and I can't imagine any other place doing it better. The chicken was succulent, and the vegetables were sauteed to my liking (not too watery or firm). I'm not a fan of olives, but I ate a few of them anyways. One of my codiners suggesteed that I dip some of the bread brought to the table in my leftover sauce... what a great idea! The sauce was more liquidy compared to your basic marinara. For 20 dollars, the amount of food given was pretty fair!

I also sampled a bite of the chicken parmesan, and that was good. I can't be that objective about the whole dish, but it was solid. As for the rest of the party, various dishes were ordered, and everyone had leftovers, except for me (sort of a badge of honor). Dishes that were ordered included Eggplant Parmesan, Chicken Vesuvio, Veal Marsala, and the baked Ziti. Everyone was very satisfed with their decisions.

We all skipped out on dessert, even though I wasn't full but that's the problem with always being hungry.

Overall, I was very satisfied with my experience. The restaurant was very accommodating and felt very warm. A bit pricey for my liking (I paid 28 dollars for my dish after tax and tip; 18 percent added for parties of 6 or more FYI), but I would definitely return.
What can I say, Any place where my 10 year old will eat broccoli is ok In my book.  The food was good but parking was a bit of a challenge.

Bad service. Not sure if it's the kitchen or a bad waitress but our non-specialty order took way too long. I had to ask for another glass of wine and a plate to eat my pizza on, which was served on a metal tray. (So, an extra plate should have been a given.) The table across from us (an aunt and 9-year-old nephew) waited patiently for their pizza twice. When the restaurant messed up their order again for the second time, the patron nicely offered to pay for her drink and go because her nephew was just plain hungry by that point. The waitress actually took her card rather than apologizing and comping her the one measly drink. Really unreal. I guess the kitchen screws up repeatedly and the wait staff has to make do, but this waitress didn't do that well. Food was decent. Ambiance good sitting outside in downtown Naperville.

Our meal was okay.  Waiter was excellent.  Problem was when we went to pay the bill, our party of 6 with 3 checks found an 18% "service" charge on each check.  One couple had already had their card run and left after unknowingly adding 20% on top of that.  I questioned the manager about a service charge for a table of 6.  He, very dispassionately, told me that this was very typical and he did not understand why I was questioning it.  What if we recieved very poor service?  Scratched out the 20% I was going to leave the waiter from the check and left. So he was out 2%.

Not going back, or if forced, I would have to leave 2 friends at home.  Two thumbs down for you Rosebud.

we've eaten in their restaurant many times and loved it but.............their carry out service is just very very mediocre. Twice out of four times one item was missing  and we only ordered a total of 3 dishes each time.

Tonight we ordered a Caesar Salad, mushroom appetizer and mussel appetizer for a total of $40.00 - not really inexpensive. The mushrooms and mussels were totally cold, mind you we only live about 5 minutes away and the Caesar Salad had not been included. We had paid by cash and when I called they gave me two options, come back and get it or get a credit for the next order. Barely an apology - it sounded like a routine happening that occurred all the time.

Well, we will still go to the restaurant to eat there - especially in the summer on their very pretty outdoor patio but NEVER EVER WILL WE ORDER CARRY OUT!!

P.S. I wished they would teach the hosts and hostesses to answer the phone so you can understand them - the "greeting" is not a greeting but rather a nightmare!

I recently went here for the first time since they moved to the new location-I'd been to the former one down the street several times years ago.   Very good Americanized Italian food that to me, is on par with or maybe a little better than Maggiano's.

Calamari and Caesar salad were both good-salad in particular was the right mix of dressing (not too creamy), shredded parmesan, and the few anchovies on top were just right.

My one son ordered spaghetti with a meatball, and this meatball had to be what the kid's song is about-enormous-probably a pound.   Other dishes ordered were Chicken Parmesan-my older son's favorite-which was good, and Fettuccine Alfredo.   My meal was their baked ziti, which is the best of its kind around.

Attentive service, good food, and in terms of value-4 dinners the night of and 3 substantial lunches two days later-a good deal as well.

First time
Diner and it was really good

Had the chicken parm for dinner and couldn't finish it

Do yourself a favor ask for Ashley she is great waitress

We had a fabulous lunch today our server was Morgan.
The manager Joe was walking around greeting tables and wishing everyone a happy sweetest day!
Morgan gave us some suggestions because we were just looking for a light lunch- she was dead on  with what she suggested, what  we ordered was perfect and delicious!

Great lunch... Eggplant salad, rigatoni alla Vodka.. And salted caramel gelato!! We can't wait to go back

Meatballs are one of life's perfect foods - they are round, moist, meaty and full of taste and you generally get them with red sauce.  

And I love them at a ridiculous level.  It is one of those special foods that I am always on the lookout for.  (Meatballs, ginger, potato pancakes, donuts, champagne cocktails, lamb and molasses cookies are on my YES list.)

Obviously there are going to be meatballs in an Italian restaurant but here's the thing, I am not that nuts about having spaghetti with them.  I just want to focus on the meatballs and they had such a great answer here - meatball salad!  Can you believe it because I could not.  It was salad on one side that was pretty ordinary, nothing at all special and on the other side two spectacular meatballs in red sauce.  I gobbled up those meatballs and left most of the salad.

Paired with a sparkling fresh iced tea it made for a darn good lunch.

Meatball salad, don't knock it until you've tried it.

We were here for a late lunch on a Friday.  There seemed to be more staff than customers when we were there.  There were pluses and minuses during our visit.  As before,  The tables are close so as the dining room filled up with the early dinner crowd the room gets very noisy.  

The high point of our visit was our server, Laura K.  She was very personable and she was efficient without being intrusive.  The bussing was also very good.

The sauces on our entrees were on the watery side but the dishes still had good flavor, except for the side of pasta.  The marinara sauce was straight out of a can, i.e. not very good at all.  The coffee was borderline terrible.

This place is expensive especially the wine by the glass.  But then they have a prime location in downtown Naperville.  I can't imagine what their rent must be.

Had an amazing birthday dinner here with friends. Reservation upheld and our table for 6 ready on time, during busy Saturday night. Our server, Matt, was impeccable. Friendly and amazingly efficient. 

The food was great from start to finish- eggplant rolls were best I've ever had. Sausage and peppers in a sauce where you want to lick the plate afterward. 

True test? The gravy! Their red sauce is perfect. Not too salty, just thick enough. Lots of flavor. 

The cavatelli w/ sausage and broccolini is delicious. I stepped it up w/ arrabiatta sauce. 

And a special chocolate mousse cake completed the birthday. 

Why 4 stars? The noise level is near deafening. Not easy to hold a conversation.  

Otherwise perfect. 

Actually liked this location's food more than the downtown Rosebud!

After my previous review, someone from Rosebud contacted me and sent us a gift card to try them out one more time. My husband and I went over the weekend, and it was definitely our best visit. Our server, Laura, was very friendly and attentive. Since we had previously been disappointed with the pasta, we went with salads and pizza. Both were quite delicious. I wish all of our visits had been as nice as this one, but I definitely respect them trying to make it up to us. I'm giving them another star.
Amazing!  My first trip to downtown Naperville and I was referred to Rosebud by an acquaintance. Very clean. Excellent service. Broad menu with good wines. Loved it!

When planning to be in Naperville this weekend, I made a reservation at Rosebud because Italian food sounded good.  It was very busy and we were told we would have to wait, but when we spotted two open seats at the pizza bar, they were able to seat us there right away.  The pizza looked and smelled delicious so I had high hopes for our dinner.  

Normally this is the part where I get on my high horse about service but I'll begin instead with my complete disappointment with the food.  I ordered spaghetti and meatballs - if someone asked me "what is your favorite food of all time?" I would answer with Spaghetti and Meatballs each time.  The dish looked impressive but how could half a pound of pasta and nearly a pound of meatballs not look amazing?  The meatballs were tender but flavorless.  I probably could have gotten past that (and did eat the meatball because I was starving, having not eaten much all day in anticipation of a big Italian dinner) but the spaghetti sauce was just not good.  Spaghetti sauce should be deep red, rich, robust with herbs and garlic, thick enough to coat the pasta but not so thick that it weighs everything down.  The Rosebud spaghetti sauce was bland, weak, and loaded with cheese.  Even a generous sprinkling of salt was not able to save this dish.  My boyfriend - who rarely complains about food - had the cheese ravioli and the ravioli itself was good, but he said the same thing about the tomato sauce on his dish.

The service was not what I would expect in a place that charges $17 for spaghetti and meatballs.  As mentioned, it was busy in there but our waitress seemed exceptionally busy.  When she asked if I wanted a box (for a large portion of remaining spaghetti) and I said no, she should have asked if everything was okay, but she didn't.  

I like the chaotic ambiance of the restaurant, and loved sitting at the pizza bar because I got to watch them make pizzas and desserts, but otherwise the experience isn't one that bears repeating.

In one word, 'NO'!  Don't go to this restaurant.  I was visiting Naperville and went to Rosebud with a friend's family on a Saturday evening.  We originally wanted to go to the nearby Mangolian grill, but the wait there was 40 minutes.  We just walked in the downtown and came to Rosebud.  There was no wait for a table and we decided to have dinner there.  It was a wrong decision, should have waited for our first choice.

I asked our server if he recommended any appetizer and he suggested Scampi Limone - it was way too salty.  The dish should come with a disclaimer that anyone with blood pressure should not order it!!

We also ordered Stuffed mushrooms, which were ok.  They were edible and I've had much better in other places.

Eggplant parmesan was better than the other two dishes, but not the best.

Considering the price we paid for our food, the place was a let down.

We went here for my nephew's college graduation dinner (19 of us). Parking is difficult on a Saturday night (7 pm). It is in a small strip mall with a Five Guys and Jamba juice, I think. Bottom-line, the lot was hilarious - trying to maneuver an extra long Ford Expedition in it. There is a lot across the street but also very busy in downtown Naperville on a Saturday evening.

They sat us at a large (makeshift) table next to the window at the front of the restaurant, which by the way is on the small side, and it worked but it was tight. The noise level in this restaurant was the challenge and not appreciated. It was just super busy with lots of large parties. A few got a headache during the long meal (server and busboys great--it was just really busy, so with appys, meals, and dessert, it was 2.5 hrs). A couple of us had a noise hangover the next morning.

The above issues dropped the rating to a 3. With a good server, and busboys, the food was excellent (5 rating). The calamari (fried not the grilled one-we had that too, just wasn't as good) and the seafood salad (lots of seafood, well prepared, light dressing on greens) were the absolute rage during the appetizer round.

The mains were awesome too. The kids loved their various pastas and pizzas. The adults enjoyed the homemade gnocchi, eggplant salad, and chicken vesuvio.

The tiramisus were shared and coffee was enjoyed by all even though were stuffed.

This is one of those places I never go to, because it's always going to be there, so I'm always trying new places instead. But whenever I come back here, I am completely satisfied every time.

Really comfy, cozy place for a wintertime meal. The last time we went, we were celebrating a friend's promotion over a quiet dinner. Our table for four wasn't cramped at all, despite it being a Friday night and the place being totally busy. They had candles lit everywhere, perfect for a romantic evening or a nice dinner. I know the place isn't glam or anything, but I wouldn't recommend bringing a hoard of kids here, it really seems upscale without shoving it in your face (if that makes sense). Basically, I can show up here in jeans without feeling stupid, but still feel like I'm at a really nice restaurant. 

Cavatappi ala Rosebud all the way. I basically never get anything else. I wish I could talk about other items, to a full extent...I love the green beans in the dish, it mixes the plate up a bit. The cavatappi is soft and and sauce is creamy, so the crunchy green beans are a welcome diversion. The gnocchi our friends shared was really good too, I definitely told myself I would order that next time.

They have your standard lasagna, pizza, chicken parm, veal...but I like that they have things on the menu that are a little bit different too. The menu is generally the same every time too, unlike La Sorella di Francesca around the corner (menu constantly changing). I like to try new, seasonal items, but its nice to know that your favorites will still be there when you go to visit (I'm still grieving the loss of a ravioli dish from La Sorella that never returned, why can't it just be a regular menu item?). 

Basically, if you like Italian food, this place will meet/exceed your expectations. My only recommendation is that you don't bring a ton of kids...there isn't a bunch of space and it just isn't that kind of atmosphere.

So was asked to try this place again. I was under the impression that if you are asked to try a restaurant again, they will do something a little over the top. The manager greeted me on his way out and told me our waiter would take care of our table. The waiter was a nice guy but the food was still just ok. 305 dollars later, of which about 50 dollars was an 18 percent tip that was added for me, I will never again fall for the come back and try us line.
Really expensive for so-so Iltalian food... Eggplant Parm is $20, and was better at my local pizza delivery place...

Rosebud is a consistently great restaurant. Service is professional and food is exceptional. My faves are Radiatore Arrabiati, Lasagne, Pork Chops, and pizza. Salads are good too. Parking is tricky at this location but Rosebud is worth a walk or a valet.
Good service but not so good food. Sort of disappointing

So disappointed , went in for a late lunch it was not busy at all we had to wait for them to clean off a booth which took forever .  Finally got seated and our server was 
MIA ... Once she made it over we ordered food was okay at best , spaghetti was more like spaghetti soup , meatball sandwich was cold waitress never came back to check on us .Finally manager came over we complained . He took the food and rolled his eyes ... Bad experience all the way !!
Thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience! Best eggplant and veal Parmesan we've had in years! Excellent service as well! Looking forward to going back soon!

It says a lot for me to give a restaurant five stars. When Rosebud in Naperville was located further down Chicago Avenue on the corner of Main Street, I did not think much of it. Since they've been in this new location I bring my family there or get a carry out at least once a week.they've always been very accommodating and eager to please. Even when we had our three-year-old son with us,they would always get us a nice table.everything on the menu is delicious, but I highly recommend two items: Grandmas Gravy- tender beef tipsin the tastiest red sauce you've ever had.  The only thing on the menu that's part of the net is the chicken piccata - chicken breasts lightly sautéed in an egg batter with lemon butter sauce and capers... Mouth watering good. The atmosphere is fun and inviting. You won't be disappointed.

After reading some of the reviews, my boyfriend and I were afraid this would turn out to be a typical Italian chain restaurant with much to be desired. However, we were relatively pleased.

It's darker inside, presenting a nice romantic ambiance. The noise level is high, but I prefer this over a whispering setting where everyone can hear you talking. Not a fan of the red and white checkered table cloths, but who cares.

Arrived slightly early for our reservations but were promptly seated. We skipped appetizers as we had a full night of food restaurants lined up. The bread they serve you was warm and soft - I wish there was more olive oil and parmesan for dipping though, not a big deal though. I ordered the 8-finger cavatelli pasta and my boyfriend ordered the fusilli carbonara. Mine was FULL of flavor - garlic, parmesan, crumbled italian sausage, brocollini - yummy. The sauce was olive oil based which I misread on the menu - it was little thin for my usual liking but it was still delicious. His pasta lacked flavor to the sauce - typical alfredo sauce that was missing that extra punch of flavor. Maybe some garlic or onion to kick it up a notch? The prosciutto and mushrooms were paired very well, and overall a good dish.

Next time we come back we are trying out the stuffed mushrooms that we were eyeing at the next table over.

****This review is a non-food review****

We were in a car accident today at the intersection where Rosebuds is located. Two staff members came out to check on us, and the children who were in our car. They offered lemonade, water, crayons, coloring paper, and were more than willing to assist in any way. We were able to use their outdoor seating as we waited for police to arrive on scene.

This act of kindness, alone, warrants 5 stars. And, we will absolutely be heading over to Rosebud's soon to check out what they have....we already know the people are GREAT!!!

We've never been to a Rose Bud Cafe before, and we had a gift card, so we decided to use it our Anniversary. 

Our server was Lorenzo.  He was very nice,  and professional. 
We started with soup.  My husband had the minestrone,  and I had the pasta fagioli.   We both enjoyed our soups.

I ordered the veal franceses, and my husband had the chicken marsala.  Wonderful!!

Oh, but we have to have dessert! !
I had the Cannoli cake...
The biggest wedge I've ever seen! 

My husband had the Tiramisu. ..
Both were fabulous. 

We loved our celebration dinner. And then I found out about the young delivery driver with cancer, that lost his job, because he had to undergo treatment. .

BBBBBOOOOO
For that, you lose 3 out of 4 stars...

Our waitress was, at best, inept.  She started out by spilling water when she filled our glasses on not only the table, but my hat.  And she completely was unaware of it, and never even bothered to wipe the table.  After we ordered she picked up the menus which apparently had some kind of debris on them which promptly fell into the olive oil/parmesan cheese they serve with the bread.  So I was ready to hate this place.  But the food saved us.  It was really quite good.  The price was inexpensive and in the end the waitress was so nice it was hard to hate on her.  She was so bad it was funny. I am not in downtown Naperville very often, but I would go back again if the opportunity presented itself.

The food is delicious and the decor is very inviting, but the main reason for this fantastic review is to rave about our server Chris G. He really went above and beyond not only providing great service to our table, but more so when he came out to help my disabled mom out of the car and into the restaurant. He continued to impress me when he, without hesitation, noticed my mom having trouble cutting her food and jumped right in and cut it for her! I have never had such a great and kind and compassionate server! Thank you Chris for making our day yesterday!

This place is NOT CELIAC FRIENDLY.  I asked for the gluten free menu and they said they didn't have it despite the website saying they do at all locations. They have gluten free pasta but it was overcooked and mushy.  I had a reaction from gluten contamination.  This place is probably fine for gluten intolerant people for not for those with Celiac.

This was my first visit to the new location (which really isn't so new anymore).

Much smaller, tables much closer together, and the noise level has greatly increased.  The good news, the configuration is no longer a maze.

The bread was served hot for the first portion.  The second portion, or refill, was not served hot.  No butter on the table only things for dipping and it's a community plate.

Our salads came out quickly, but our entrees took an unusually long time.  Several tables that arrived after us got their food before we did.  I had the chicken picatta, which was good, but not the best I ever had.  However, the assortment of gelato and sorbet, which was not what we expected when we ordered vanilla gelato, was very good as were the coffee and espresso.

We were there early on a Sunday evening and it filled up while we were there.

Chris was our server and he did a great job.  I never had to ask for a refill of my ice water and he came back to check on us frequently.

Awful service compounded with overpriced food, equals a terrible experience.   We went with a large group to celebrate the holiday's, as we have for the past five years.   Not any more.  Apparently they have new management, along with a new event coordinator.  Traditionally we have the back room to ourselves to avoid any congestion.  This year, they had two other tables in the back room with our party of 20.  Needless to say, it was very crowded and busy.  Meanwhile, the food was served family style and the quality and quantity of the portions have gone downhill drastically.  WAY OVERPRICED for the quality and quantity.  To top it off, for no particular reason, the manager decided to call the police on our group over something that never occurred, because a waitress heard something that was completely false.  Unless you enjoy poor service, overpriced food and drinks, poor food quality and terrible ambiance, this is your place

Went here last night with my wife and our friends. The ambience was good but the service was terrible. Our waitress did not once smile from the moment we walked in. One of the couples got some entree and requested it to be made without sausage. But they got a piece of sausage in their food. When we let our waitress know about it she said "oh" and picked up the plate and took it to the back. No apology or anything. Not once was our water refilled until we had to ask the manager.

The rest of the food was bland. "Ok" at best. 

The manager, Rich, did a great job of making us feel more welcome after the sausage mishap. He apologized for the way the waitress was treating us and took care of our appetizers as well. 

Giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because of Rich.

Hands down the worst place I have ever been to.  Loud.... terrible service, terrible food..... by far the worst pizza I have ever had..... dont let the "pizzeria" sign fool you... and on top of everything its expensive.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY !

It's Rosebud.  You know what to expect.  You will get it.  Great open plan dining space.  Solid food. Great place for lunch.  Funny, helpful service.  Huge portions that scared me.  Baked cavatelli and linguini marinaio.  Good choices.  Parking in the small lot if you can find it, or in the lot across the street.

Food was superb!  Salad was delicious along with mussels in red sauce with linguini.  Wait staff was fast and professional...couldn't ask for a better dining experience.  Every time I eat at Rosebud I leave with a belly full of delicious food!

Been there just before Christmas '13. 
Had Stuffed Mushrooms for Appetizers. Tasted great, needed a little more seasoning.
Tried out their Specialty Pasta 'Cavatelli Alla Rosebud'. Deeeelicious. 
Not so happy with the deserts. I tried their house special 'Rosebud Lime Donuts'. They were huge but the taste didn't have that lemony Zest I was expecting. 

The Ambiance was very nice. They have a section to the corner/back for couples,It was intimate, quite without any TV playing sports.

The service was Awesome. We were helped by two servers and they were very friendly to go through the menu and suggest options. Tag Team. :)

Overall it was a very nice experience with good food and drinks.

I am a fan of this Rosebuds. Just wish their prices were a little bit lower. I'm elderly and on a fixed income. But I do enjoy an amazing Italian dish every once in awhile that I don't have to cook myself. I will be back.

Caveat zone: This review is based solely on Monday nights, in the past, we've made a tradition of gorging ourselves on all you can eat spaghetti and meatballs. It's basically the best $10 you can spend on a Monday, as the amount of food you get is simply ridiculous. If you manage to power through your first massive bowl of spaghetti (and two giant meatballs) they'll just keep it coming. Also, unlike a lot of all you can eat deals, they're totally down with you finishing your first bowl, getting a refill, and just taking that all home. It's GOOD spaghetti too, with sauce that you can tell they make from scratch as each week there's mild flavor variations and the same can be said for the meatballs.

Seriously, check it out if you're looking for a place to eat in downtown Naperville on a Monday night. It's the best deal in town.

What's with all these bad reviews. I LOVE THIs PLACE. I try to go here once a month and ALWAYS ask for a booth. It's cozy and cute. My favorite is:

Chicken Parm
Broccoli and Shells
Pepperoni Pizza


yUMMMmmM!
Xoxo
Great food! Awesome desserts! went with my office colleagues and we all enjoyed the experience.

I've been going to Rosebud on Taylor St  and Naperville for a lot of years.If I'm being honest is has done nothing but get progressively worse.They raise prices & cut portions.They used to have great people know they hire terrible wait staff.Never again will it be like when  Benny Mario Alberto were on Taylor St. The day you went corporate was the beginning  of your legacy turning to shit. You might have become rich Alex but you ruined the original. Your business is now a  hole.

There were a number of problems with my dinner at Rosebud. I am new to Lisle, but I hope I can find better Italian elsewhere. First, it took several minutes after sitting down for someone to bring us water. It came with the bread. The bread was great, but I was thirsty. Second, the food was good but not great. It was pretty bland. For the price, I expect much better and can get it other places. Third, there were pieces of plastic in my food. I didn't say anything at the time because I seriously thought maybe my fillings were coming out or something, but I haven't had any problems since, so it seems likely that it was Rosebud. Fourth, we are vegetarian, and we always ask our waiter what they recommend. Our waiter seemed surprised and had no idea what to recommend.

The food is outstanding and they have a great variety from traditional Italian to steaks and fish.  They always have decent specials and the salted caramel gelato is awesome.  The only thing that holds this back from being 5 stars is the wait staff doesn't always speak and/or understand English.  It's a pain in the ass trying to order a drink and getting them to understand which brand of liquor you're asking for.

This is the newer Rosebud in Naperville, the old one burned, it appears to have a slightly different and more modern concept than the old Rosebud. They still have many of the old "traditional" italian dishes but they also have some new more contemporary menu items as well. We had reservations the place was packed and we could not even get close to the bar for a drink, to add insult to injury our table was not ready for over 30 minutes after our reservation time and we even arrived to check in early so we were just standing there for about 40 minutes. As for the meal, it was excelent Our waitress was great, friendly and on the ball even though she was swamped with tables. 

Summary, great food, good service, comfortable dining room but the reservation delay and not having access to the bar while we waited was a bit of a let down. They need to address this problem or have a cocktail waitress running drinks to waiting guests that can not get up to the tiny bar, they would see an instant spike in weekend revenue if they took this approach, not sure why management has not thought of this???

I will go back because the food is excellent.

Best chicken parm I have ever eaten in my entire life. You will pay a lot per dish but the portion sizes are far too big! You will go home with leftovers I promise. Their red sauce is amazing. You can taste the basil and garlic in it. Not too crazy about its atmosphere and location. Used to be located on the riverwalk and they had balconey seating over the water. It was quiet and romantic...then it burned down after an oven fire. Now it is noisy and not so intimate. Would have given it five stars otherwise because the food is great!

Never had a bad meal here, the selection is a bit limited, otherwise i'd give it 5 stars.  Eggplant salad and the brick chicken are awesome, nice local beer selection and friendly staff.  parking is a pain unless you're ok with valet

We went to the grand reopening on 22 East Chicago Avenue.  

They were playing Top 40's pop music the entire time we were there. Not that I don't love Lady Gaga, but I found the music constantly distracting considering that we were eating pricey Italian food at a romantic-looking restaurant with valet parking.  Maybe that was just an opening night thing, but still!

The eggplant parmesan ($15) lacked texture--not even a hint of crispiness.  Worse, it tasted overwhelmingly like egg. I mean, if I were blindfolded I would've thought I'd just bitten into a plain omelet. The stuffed mushrooms ($12) were tasty though.

The service was good most of the night, although our waitress made a huge display of surprise (and disgust?) when we mentioned maybe ordering dessert after our meal (two appetizers, two entrees and a side, some of which we were were bringing home--nothing outrageous). It struck me as somewhat insulting.

When I got home and opened up my carry-out container of broccolini ($6), I found a genital hair nestled into one of the broccolini heads. WTF.


P.S. If you're looking for a classy Italian chain, I suggest Maggiano's, which serves similar food at high quality while charging less. ($9 for stuffed mushrooms, $13 for eggplant parmesan and $4 for a side of broccolini.)
The food was very good! My square noodles were delicious, Grammy's Gravy also very great! The service was good! She could have been more attentive. The atmosphere was nice! We enjoyed the evening!

First time at the new location and pleasantly surprised! 

Best Calamari I have ever had!

The service was very good as well.

I called ahead to make reservation and let them know that we were coming for our wedding anniversary and we wanted a more private table.  They really went ABOVE AND BEYOND to make it special.  They placed us is a large booth and immediately brought us champagne and congratulated is. They also brought a wonderful chocolate moose cake at the end of our meal. All those things aside, the food is fantastic!!  Best meatballs ever!!!

Also, if you live near a train station, it is an easy walk from the Naperville stop.

This place is amazing! I had their Chicken Parmesan Sandwich, to die for! I had fries so ordered Honey Mustard to go with it, wow! Best honey mustard ever! You can tell everything is homemade and made to order. We waited a while for the food, but it was well worth it! The meatball was so moist and tender. We also got their Bombalonis (or whatever they are called), those we delicious. They had a different flavor to it, we are thinking it was lemon or something, but it was good. Wish I lived closer!

nouva italia 
i have been in the restaurant business for over 45 years i know some about food when it comes to italian food nuova italia its the best of course they will never please everyone there are some idiots out there that no matter what you do you will never be happy to them i said ho well 
i recommend this place to the best food connoisseur to the rest there is always pizza hut or burger king 

love nuova italia 

sincerely 
ramon j chamorro any questions or comments here my # 6302549672

Food, service, decor, ambiance was all top-notch. 

They really made every extra effort to please us and it worked. I was really impressed with how good the food was. The drinks were refilled and we never had to ask for anything extra because it was all taken care of. 

This is a great place for dinner or just for drinks. You'll like it!

This is a regular spot for a group of business owners that I am involved with. The owner and his wife are top notch hosts and the food is five star!! My wife and I even got engaged there. As a regular client I must say they do not disappoint!!! 
This is a gem of fine dining in Addison!!

Took our family of 6 on a week night. Service was odd, our waiters switched on us and waited some time for service.
Not many other customers at the time. Food was decent, flavors average and kids liked the ravioli.  Would probably not return as I could cook the same foods at home.
The food here is average and the service was poor.  We also don't think much of the ambiance.

DO NOT EAT HERE.  They gave me food poisoning and when I called to discuss it, I was yelled at like I was lying about it.  Why would I lie about food poisoning?  To get a free pizza?  I have $4 pizzas down the street from me.  Ermil is a real jerk and is making a point about not calling soon enough.  If throwing up on my birthday, missing work, and having diharrea for two days straight isn't food poisoning, then I'm not sure what is.  Calling right after, or a few days after has no impact on the claim that his food made me sick.  Do not spend your money here, they don't care about their customers health or their repeat business.

This is one of my favorite spots to frequent for lunch or dinner. The fish and other seafood specials are by far my favorite, but you can't go wrong with a steak or pork chop, too. For appetizers, I love the Grilled Calamari & Oysters Rockefeller. If you have a taste for something, the owner will go out of his way to find the right meal to hit the spot. It is nice to see that he cares so much about his customers. It is the BEST Italian restaurant in the area. Looking forward to my next visit!
Very good food and friendly service. Brick oven pizza. Great wine list. Will come back when we are in the area again.

I made reservations here on February 13th...
Needless to say it was very busy. We were greeted by the hostess and waited about 15 min at the bar. The bartender was busy with a teen birthday party in their party room. So he never asked us if we wanted a drink. This was the reason i didn't give 5 stars.
We ordered drinks from their extensive wine list. 
And an appetizer. 
Dinner here was amazing. The food was delicious. She ordered the chicken vesuvio and i had the veal cutlet in butter sauce. 
The dessert menu offered many delicious choices. I opted for spumoni in a chocolate cup. She had the flour-less chocolate cake. 
At almost two and a half hours for dinner was a tad long. It was well worth it. I will definitely be returning here soon.
Very good food. Deceiving spot in location in a strip mall. Strongly recommend. The owners were very nice and couldn't do enough for the entire party. I'll be back!

Most Italian places, while delicious, are nothing special. Chicken Parmesan, lemon chicken, four types of pasta, and so much bread. So when our friends invited us to a tiny little Italian place in Addison a couple of weeks ago, I wasn't expecting much.
