Kinda cute I guess, if you're in to that mushy nonsense.  I'll come back here if I'm in the area and there's a sushi emergency.  This place is still way better than that disastrous establishment across the street known as Tokyo Bay.
This place has the best sushi, great drinks and friendly staff! Very reasonably  priced. Try thier spicy seafood miso, amazing!

It is about time I wrote a review about Wild Tuna. This is my all-time favorite place, and serves as the benchmark that I judge other (comtemporary) sushi joints. I have had rolls that equal or exceed that of Wild Tuna, but their entire specialty menu is items I regularly enjoy, especially the Naperville, Mango Tango, Snow Mountain and Lobster.  

Their Sushi fish and Sashimi is also excellent, and Gene's guys always have artful and careful presentation, no matter what the dish. I'd say my dad and I are regulars and they always treat us well, when we ask for something special, he puts something together, and (occasionally) something gets put on the house. He's a very good man.

Other things I enjoy
Diamond shrimp appetizer, The house hot green tea, The miso soup, salad, the Ice Cream (try the Green Tea and Red Bean if you're adventurous). Overall, I think it is the only sushi restaurant in Naperville worth going to more than once.

Lou Malnati's encourages you to call ahead.  They take your food order and time of anticipated arrival and are very careful to tell you they will do their best to seat you if there is available seating, or seat you in the waiting area.  

Everything was perfect.  They had a table with the requested high chair.  No sooner was our drink order completed and delivered when here comes our pies.  Attentive, but not overly so wait staff brought patience to their task.  I thank them for that.  To have a table for seven with high chair, drinks and food at 5:30 PM on a Friday night requires preparation and execution. Our deep dish pies were hot and delicious.  My fav is the deep dish  "Lou", a veggie mix...it was awesome.  

Great job, Lou Malnati's.  Virginia and I thank you.

The old firehouse location is quite charming, but unfortunately I find it more often than not overcrowded, loud and uncomfortable. 
The pizza is good, but overrated. Some people go crazy for the buttery crust, but that's not what I want in a pizza crust.   It seems  inauthentic to this Italian lady.
I have to say, I seem to be in the minority with my lack of adoration, so in most cases, people seem satisfied and it seems to be a safe bet for a large group.   
They offer an acceptable gluten free crust.  You will be hard pressed to find anything else other than salad that is gluten free. 
It ls location in the heart of downtown Naperville is fun for oy of town guests, but parking can be a real nightmare.

Lou Malnati's is my favorite Chicago style deep dish pizza that I can get in the burbs.

This place gets pretty packed since it's in downtown Naperville, and that can lead to long wait times.

But in general, they get the job done, and the pizza is worth the wait.

I have been to this location before but hadn't reviewed it, so here's my take. Lou's is one of those Chicago joints that claims to be the inventors of the Chicago style pie. Not sure if they are, don't care, they ROCK!! This was the first place I ever had deep dish and have tried others but I like Lou' a lot. The pie is great and I swear there sauce is made it just the right way for the Windy City trademark. There is something about the sausage I really dig to, perfect balance somewhere between sweet and hot. I had garlic bread that was worth mentioning, it was just perfecting toasted and I guess that was enough.

When it comes to favorite Chicago style deep dish, Lou Malnati's is at the top!  I have been to the Naperville location a few times and each time it has been fast and great service.  Plus it is in the hub of downtown Naperville to check out the shops and Riverwalk after having great pizza!  

When it comes to sizes, the small was great for two people! The three-cheese bread is also recommended to try!

It's just my opinion but Lou Malnattis is by far my favorite pizza in Chicagoland.  This location in particular is always pretty busy but there's enough seating that we never have to wait to get seated.  Order pizzas right away because it takes a long time to get them.  Although the wait is worth it.  The staff is always friendly and attentive. If it's warm enough you can sit outside and people watch...one thing I love to do.  Prices aren't bad and the pizza slices are filling.  A great place for pizza if your in the area.

In the battle for Chicago deep dish supremacy, everyone has their opinion. This review is not to take on that epic battle but to share some ways to make your experience at Lou's in Downtown Naperville as memorable as possible. And while this review is for Naperville, I've found these apply to all the sit down ones!

The Naperville Experience is one of my favorites. It situated in a great location with nice outdoor seating that let's you take in the views. The ambiance is an old firehouse mixed with a small town 16 inch softball feel. The staff is amazing and will get to know you by name after just your third visit. My kids call the manager Aunt Chrissy and she is flat out amazing! They do a great job with parties and other events - you are treated like gold. 

First Timer Experience/What to Expect
1. Expect to wait if you go during the evening. Lines can get hectic and it gets quite cramped in there. If you want to avoid lines, go on the weekends for lunch or before 4:30pm any day.
2. Don't pre-order. Yes. It speeds things up but I always felt the pizza quality is less
3. Block Out the Menu! There is a lot going on with a Lou's menu and many good things, but first timers need to stick with the classic deep dish and a pizza cookie at the end.
4. This is a ripe tomato sauce is on sweet and tangy side. If you are expecting savory, the sauce won't be the spot for it but you get a killer combination of sweet and savory with butter crust as well as sausage and pepperoni.

What to Order: Pizza Recommendation
1. The Foundational Experience: Deep Dish Cheese with Butter Crust | the Malnati Classic (sometimes we add light pepperoni)
2. The Adventure Experience: Deep Dish Extra Cheese, Sausage (full patty), Pepperoni, Garlic, and Hot Giardiniera. Packs a wic
3. The Unexpected: The Crustless Pizza
4. The Kids/Picky Ones: The thin pizza is pretty darn good and kids that are less inclined to enjoy the heavy sauce and toppings of a deep dish really take to this pizza. 

What to Order: Other Items to Try
1. French Fries: It sounds odd. I absolutely adore their curly fries. I find with the sweet sauce that is Lou's, the salty/savory concept of fries is great.
2. Salad: We like the Family House with House Red Wine Vinaigrette or the Sweet Vinaigrette
* again, plenty you can get and we've tried most. I just don't see much of a point if coming to Lou's for the other aspects.

Tips
1. BIG THING: This is huge. Only order Medium Pizzas. The distribution of a Lou's medium is perfect. Anything larger and the center is soggy and anything smaller hinders the crust. We get two mediums for our family and it is perfect!
2. Crust: Do make it Butter crust
3. Sausage: the traditional sausage at Lou's is a sheet (we call it a hockey puck). I love sausage but it is too much for me so I ask for sausage crumbles. 
4. Save Room for Dessert: The Chocolate Chip Pizza is to die for especially post pizza. However, do the big one. The little ones get too soupy. I do wish they brought back on the Peanut Butter Pizza (no one seems to believe me about this one)
5. Well done is something that I personally like but only when I do extra cheese, sausage, and pepperoni. It doesn't work well with just cheese and I'm 50/50 with those that have tried well done.
6. Great New Year's Eve party for families!

Dined in with my family tonight for my birthday.  My wife ordered the buffalo wings appetizer and they were severely overlooked.  Took a while for the waitress to return but she was quick about getting a new batch for my wife.  The manager never came over to check on us even after food was sent back and no discount was offered as a result of the bad food.  This is pretty common thing to do in this situation.  Wasn't very crowded not sure what happened.  Bad experience, the downtown Chicago location wouldn't have done this.

This is my fave deep dish pizza spot out of all of them. Sorry, Giordano. Sorry, Connie. Sorry, other guy. Lou is boss.

This specific location is fun because it's an old firehouse. Before that it was a police station with a little jail (source: my eight year old). We like to speculate that it was a haunted jail and that the creepy boy doll/mannequin that they have suspended from the ceiling in the back dining room might just come awake when the restaurant is closed. He's also probably watching us eat, looking to see if we are his long lost family so that he can follow us home and.............

Too scary!

Also, the pizza is great. We usually stick with the deep dish sausage or the Lou, which is a veggie pizza. The thin crust is really good too, so give it a shot. Salads are good and there's beer. All boxes checked - Lou gets five stars.

I went here for dinner and it was so good!

There were 5 of us, so we ordered a large deep dish pepperoni pizza (pictured) and a thin crust medium. This was the perfect amount of food for us as there was only 1 deep dish piece left at the end!

I had two pieces of the deep dish pizza and it was amazing! You certainly have to eat it with a knife and fork, and it's worth good to the last bite!

I finally moved to the Chicago suburbs and wanted to try some deep dish pizza for the first time...well Chicago style deep deep dish for the first time.

And the fact there is some deep dish pizza in downtown Naperville where all the cool restaurants, shops and bars are located was a plus.

And this is a sit down place too, they have other locations where it's just pick-up only. Very big with outdoor seating, bar seating and more seating in the back. And you can taste all the flavors oozing out of the deep dish pizza especially Lou's specialty.

Definitely fills you up after a couple of slices. Just enough of toppings where it doesn't saturate your palette and you can taste all the goodness.

Desserts are designed for 2 or more, but they have individual size ones too and I had the warm cookie with ice cream. Nice way to finish my meal.
Had my first experience here and it was great! The environment was very friendly and pizza was delicious!

This place reminds me of bucca di beppo which is an Italian chain. I came to Chicago to visit and one of the top things on my to try list was obviously deep dish pizza. After much research and consulting my fellow yelpers, I decided to go for Lou malnatis. I went in with high expectations but was slightly disappointed.

We called ahead of time to order our pizza and after we arrived still had to wait a long time before it was ready. The first bite did taste heavenly but after that it got just a bit much. The crust seemed like a pie crust so it was a bit weird. There was just also too much cheese and not enough flavor. I am not sure if I'm just not a huge fan of deep dish or this place just didn't deliver. I'll definitely try another place if I visit Chicago again. Their individual sized salads can feed a whole family lol.

I came here with my son on a Saturday night for some pizza. When we checked in they said it would be an hour and 15 minute wait, but that did not discourage me. When I've got my mind set on having some deep dish pizza nothing else will do. They got us seated in about 45 minutes, much quicker than the originally estimated, and we pre-ordered our pizza so there was only a short wait for our meal to arrive. Man, these guys make a good pizza! We ordered a half cheese half spinach Chicago style with buttercrust. Delicious! The staff was very friendly and this is  a clean restaurant. I'd definitely recommend it.

You can really never go wrong with Lou's. We got here at about 7:30pm on a Saturday night and there was an hour wait and it was a full hour. We pre-ordered our deep dish while we were waiting but it still took over a half hour to come after we were seated.

Always get their deep dish and prepare to wait!

It's Lou Malnatis. Do I really need to write a review? Of course I do!

Best. Pizza. Ever. 

I grew up in Naperville so I may be a bit biased, but Lou's is my favorite pizza in the world. This location tends to usually get pretty busy and parking can be a nightmare, but if you park across from the library or go up a street you'll usually find spots!

I live in California now but my husband and I order Lou's shipped and it's usually just as good as ordering in the restaurant. 

This will forever be one of my favorites!

Came her with my wife and daughter after the daughter ran the half marathon. While watching  the race at the 8 mile mark was offered coffee from the manager who had the place open to allow us to use the bathroom. Very nice!  
So after the race we came back for bloody Mary's and pizza. The drinks we OK, but the pizza, Lou's special was just outstanding. 
We love this place and the great service provided by the entire staff. 
We will be back. 
The butter crust is the best!!!

The Malnati Chicago Classic -- made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust -- is the paragon of deep dish as far as I'm concerned. Skip breakfast and loosen your belt. 'Nuff said.

For a city known for pizza, I was incredibly unimpressed with the quality of food. We got thin crust and the famous deep dish crust. Neither of which tasted good. To match that, the service was terrible. Our waiter either ignored or forgot all of our requests. She was also hardly seen until the end of the meal when we were rushed out. 

All in all, If you're here on vacation and want a classic Chicago pizza, I'd try somewhere else.
Fantastic service by Fernando. He made our meal so much more enjoyable.  Thank you for being so friendly and fun!!
Excellent deep dish! Not too salty which is underrated sometimes. Had spinach onion and tomato deep dish.

I love Lou's! Not just because they have amazing deep dish pizza (Lou's special!) and not because it used to be the firehouse, but the atmosphere is perfect for families! There are a few TVs, but they're not loud or overwhelming. There's a lot to look at, which makes it fun for kids (I spy...) but it's not too kitschy; rather, the walls are filled with artefacts and Chicago history.

The service is usually pretty great. The pizzas take a while but so an appetiser is in order to share with the table.

In the warmer weather, they have the outdoor seating avail me. My favourite place to sit is at a high table, right under the large garage doors (I trust they won't fall). Perfect for watching what's going on downtown Napes!

I'll start this review by declaring that I'm not a deep dish pizza fan, but...I've been to Lou's many times over the years and just order other things and enjoy it each time.

The best thing on their menu is the Malnati's salad-lettuce mix with crunchy bacon, gorgonzola chunks, diced tomatoes, olives and a sweet dressing.

Their thin crust pizza is good-crust on that as well as the deep dish is excellent.   Sauce is decent-a little too chunky tomato-ey for me-but ingredients (meats as well as vegetables) are fresh and they're not skimpy on the cheese!  The deep dish cookie sundae is...awesome!

Lively atmosphere inside the restaurant-the old Naperville fire house-with a back room for larger parties.   Take out works as well-enter on the side door on the east side of the building and they do quite a business on their own.

Definitely worth stopping here to fill up on pizza.  Good service and a great pizza.  We ordered the recommended pizza from the waitress and we were not disappointed.  

Two slices is more than enough for a grown man.  Get ready to be happy and full.

A friendly staff makes for a great experience. And Lou Malnati's delivers on that front!

Didn't catch the name of my server, but he was efficient and knew his stuff. I ordered a family sized house salad and he advised that it would be too big for a party of 3. And he was right. Downsell!

The house salad was to die for. Perfectly tossed, it was bursting with flavor and the bacon bits gave it just enough crunch. I ate a LOT of salad.

Got some other apps too which were good, but nothing to write home about.

The pizza, however, different story. We got the Chicago classic, a deep dish butter crust large with a sheet of sausage!  Let me say - fantastic! From the bottom up, it's layered as - crust, cheese, sausage sheet, sauce. And the sauce really made the pizza - you can really taste the fresh tomato dices in it.

Sadly, I was so stuffed I only ate one slice in the restaurant (I went overboard with the salad). But I packed the rest and can't wait to be hungry again!!

Definitely would return and recommend anyone try this Chicago staple!

Listen carefully. Trust me when I say that this is going to be very helpful information for you, so listen up. When coming here, you should only get the Lou. Seriously trust me on this. I am a meat lover and this pizza has none. Although the Lou might not have any meat, this is the only exception I make. If you don't like the Lou you are better off going to Giordano's. I came here with a group of 10 and we had to wait almost 2 hours without reservation on a Saturday night around 6:00PM (got seating at 8:00PM). Overall, the pizza at Lou Malnati's is slightly underwhelming in size compared to Giordano's and the only pizza worth getting is the Lou.

SPECIAL TIP: For folks over 21, if you ever get the Lou for take-out or eat here, make sure you get some wine. Wine+The Lou is a dream duo. Trust me on this one.

Love the pizza at Lou Malnatis!! I usually have it delivered but I dined in over the weekend. Felipe was our server and he did a great job!! Our beers were brought right away and he made sure to keep them filled. We loved the taste of the deep dish Chicago classic and the Malnatis salad. Our server boxed everything up for us when we finished the meal. Great experience! I will be back soon!  

My review for their delivered pizza.- We love their pizza but it's better in the restaurant then delivered. They make ordering easy with their online ordering. I would suggest not getting it cut before delivering. The taste of the pizza was great but we had to warm it in the oven when the delivery driver dropped it off. The deep dish pizza stays hot and we can eat it when it arrives. The delivery drivers always seem polite and happy to be delivery the pizza...but we would order more often of the pizza stayed hot when it's delivered. I think Lou Malnatis is better in the restaurant.

Place is awesome....period! If you are a giordanos fan you'll change teams very quickly! 

The one thing you must know you gotta block off a couple hours if you decide to eat here. Yes the pizza takes awhile but to grab a seat is the real killer on time. The wings are great too, eve though they're kinda small the flavor on the buffalou is delicious. Oh and their homemade ranch is outstanding! If they took reservations, we would be there every Saturday night and also become very fat!

I just wanted to take this opportunity to thank Noah, for his outstanding demeanor and true concern for my friend and my satisfaction during our dining experience this evening.  Noah went over-and-above-board in ensuring that our meal was enjoyable. ..Noah is a true asset to the management team of Lou Malnati's!!!  Thank you once again Noah!!!

I visited this place this week with some family members that were looking for some good pizza. We settled on this place and were seated promptly. After this however our experience went a bit down hill. 

We were hungry and ordered bruschetta, pizza, and meatballs from our waiter. The bruschetta came fairly fast but we never saw our waiter again after that. After waiting for about 45 minutes after the bruschetta another waitress delivered our pizza. We were excited to eat it but we were disappointed that the pizza was cold. The cheese wasn't warm and the plate it was cooked on was room temp. It even had the look of a pizza that had been sitting out for a while. Needless to say we were disappointed (the meatballs also never came nor were they rung up in the computer). 

Since we were disappointed the waitress brought over the manager. He was awkward and not really sure how to handle the situation but ended up offering the pie for free. That was an Ok response but you could tell he was just trying to stop talking to us.

TLDR; I ended up eating a cold slice of pizza that was OK and the service was subpar from the wait staff to the management.
Without a doubt The best Chicago Pizza.  Everybody else is wrong.

So me and my father wanted two hours to get seated... We got salad they where ok. The waiter was kinda snippy while taking our order, and the desk messed up our pre order of pizza. When we finally got the pizza it was really good. But not good enough for me to wait two hours.  And oh my god service was slow Jesus 15 min to make a salad ? 
I will be back but I won't wait that long again.

My boyfriend and I dined here for lunch on a Saturday. Nicely located at the end of the of the downtown Naperville complex, we were able to find convenient parking just across the street--a short walk from the restaurant. The restaurant itself is larger than it appears. We chose to dine outside on their covered patio, but I noticed there's plenty of seating inside the restaurant as well. Luckily, they were not busy so we were able to be seated without a wait.

We shared the Malnati Chicago Classic: Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. To balance out the heavy pizza, we decided to also share an order of the Chicken BBQ Club Salad: chopped romaine lettuce, grilled chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, shredded mozzarella, cheddar and Volpi salami served with Club dressing and tortilla chips. I thoroughly enjoyed both the salad and the pizza! I think ordering an appetizer here is a must while you wait for your pizza, otherwise you will probably find the wait to be excruciating, especially if you come hungry! The pizza is definitely worth the wait though. Our pizza was loaded with a  ton of hot, delicious cheese and tomato. As a Southerner, I have to be honest and say I can only ever finish one slice of Chicago Deep Dish, but I love it every time. The crust is crispy and  I really enjoyed tasting the fresh ingredients in both the salad and the pizza, and this meal was one of my favorites on my visit. We had a bit of salad and pizza leftover and we ended up taking both home because frankly, you don't waste goodness. 

Service is excellent, looking forward to coming back!

Looking for top notch Chicago deep dish? You found it! One pie will probably be enough for 3 or 4, but side salads here are also delicious with good portions.

Come early, you'll be waiting for a table.

This was my first time having real Chicago deep-dish pizza, I'm Chicago. The place was packed but since I was on my own, I secured a place at the bar without a wait.  The bartender was very nice and a hard-worker. They had some good beers on draft and she was efficient. The pizza arrived about 40 minutes later (I was told it would) and I was served a slice. It was very good but as I explained to my girlfriend, I was expecting to be thinking, "I can't wait to have this again".  After eating a small, I am not left craving it.

Dining in the old fire station is kinda cool.  But we usually get delivery of deep dish pizzas.  Uncut, the come delicious but if you get it precut be prepared for a soggy mess.  Expensive but worth it for such delicious sauce and meat.

LOU'S NEVER DISAPPOINTS!  

Had a great dinner last night!  Called ahead to have order started as soon as we arrived.  Great way to cut wait time.  

Was immediately greeted at our table by Brian, with a friendly smile and a offer for something drink.   Pizza came out quite quickly and tasted as amazing as ever... Crisp crust, perfectly seasoned sausage, and just the right amount of cheese and tomatoes.  

Whether with a bunch of kids after a game or just for a quick date night, Lou's downtown Naperville is a great stop.

First of all, I love Lou's pizza. It's not my favorite Chicago style but it's always good. However, this visit was a bit disappointing. 

We got there and they told us it'd be a 45 minute wait but we ended up waiting for over an hour. Once we sat down, it took 15 mins to get drinks. We finally ordered and it took a while to get the pizza out, which is expected. (Tip: You must have lots of patience for Chicago style pizza) But then what really annoyed me is the waiter brought out our pizza and say it down next to us. Then he disappeared for about 5 minutes with us just sitting there, salivating for a taste of the pizza.

Overall, the pizza is great. You can't go wrong with Chicago style pizza. The atmosphere is casual and fun. However, this location seemed very slow-moving. I would suggest going to another Lou's or another pizza place, unless you have the time and patience for slow service.

Best Chicago style pizza. Service is ok, honestly they just need a bigger place or a bigger pizza oven because they are loved so much the place gets packed and you have to wait for room in the oven for your pizza to be made. That is how good this place is.  If you want a true Chicago experience you gotta have the Chicago classic with an inch thick layer of sausage. Yum!

Some of the best deep dish pizza you'll get in Chicago! Prices are reasonable: $6.75 for personal deep dish pizza to $18.25 for large deep dish, and $2.25 for each topping. They have a variety of toppings, and they have gluten free crust too! My coworkers from Edward Hospital love ordering delivery from here because they're quick! I highly recommend their salads as well!

Such amazing Chicago style pizza. This place was suggested to me by someone who lives here, as I am just visiting, and have to say this was a great suggestion. They have some amazing deep dish pizza and awesome salad. I would definitely come back for my next visit to Chicago and would suggest this place to anyone else that is visiting Chicago.
This is our favorite Chicago style pizza and we've tried them all.  Ono's is a close second but not as consistent at Lou Malnati's.

Trips to Chicago always involve a gorge-fest,  and this was no exception. The place was hopping on a Thursday evening, and our beleaguered server explained that the wait for the pizza would be 35 or more minutes. Not a problem: my hubby and I sipped suds and people-watched. When the pizza arrived at the table, I immediately gained weight. I mean, hello? butter crust! Say it with me: BUUUUUTTTTEEEERRRR CRUUUUUSSSST. Just unbelievable. The sausage is one continuous, pressed layer hiding out beneath the chunky tomato sauce. And despite all the delicious stuff going on in that pizza, the (butter!) crust stayed light and crispy. 

Fabulous.

This review is for for the new online ordering for delivery. Which is a GREAT feature. I was happy to see you could finally order online. But maaaan, is it janky. Even if you have an account you still have to start from square one, fill in a lot of redundant information they already have just to find out if they deliver in your area. They do. That's why I made the account. I won't get into all the details but it's buggy af. Please look into it.

And sadly, pizza delivery has shown up straight-up burnt the last couple of orders. Cheese is terrible tasting because of it. 

The delivery drivers have always been super nice, though. A+ for those dudes. You should give them your dumb delivery charge, they deserve it.

You can be assured Lou's will make good on a mistake. I decided to go with a deep dish tonight and I wasn't too disappointed. I'll leave thin crust for dine in or pick up. Pizza arrived in under an hour, as I called right when they opened. Butter crust uncut is the way to go, I didn't need to put it in my oven, like I did with their thin crust in the past. It was a tad well done and trying to reheat it the next day made for a super crunchy crust. I guess I'll stop using this location.
First time here and it was great! Went with the thin crust with pepperoni and mushroom. We loved it ! The service was smooth and very reliable. Will revisit in the near future !
This is a great pizza but I waited for 1/2 hour for a small pizza. I ordered a pepperoni but I got a sausage. No compensation just a sorry.

The Lou Malnati's Pizzeria in Naperville has great pizza and excellent salad.  The wait staff has offered to package the leftovers and in the case of the salad has added extra cups of dressing and cups of gorgonzola pieces.  When relatives come from out of town, I always take them here for the experience.
It is nice to have a good pizza place in the area without the hassle of Chicago traffic.  I happen to prefer the Naperville location to the Bolingbrook option.
Still my favorite Gluten-Free Pizza place those looking. My friends from out of town ordered the deep-dish and said it was the best pizza they ever tasted.

Great place if you love deep dish pizza. 
Their chopped salad is fantastic. I order some each visit, and take some home. Each meal has always been fresh tasting.

First I have to state my bias; having spent my formative teenage years eating this pizza, I consider this the standard for Deep Dish Pizza.  So, whenever my husband and I are visiting family, we make sure to make a stop here.  

Parking:  Have always been able to find street parking out front.
We've always been able to get a table without a wait.

What do we order? 
The Malnati Chicago Classic:  Lou's lean sausage, extra cheese, on Buttercrust.  SO GOOD.
Also, like the Malnati Salad & Calamari, but our priority is always the DEEP DISH.

My husband will usually order a beer, but I don't because that would take up too much room!  Haha

Plus, always have had great service.

Lou Malnati's has delicious, authentic deep dish pizza! The mozzarella sticks are amazing and everything is really affordable considering the quality. The restaurant was packed even on a week night, but that's typical of restaurants in downtown Naperville. We were fortunate to be seated right away and the service was surprisingly fast given how busy it was. The only downside to this location is the parking. Because it's downtown Naperville, you may have to park in a lot or garage a few blocks away. Definitely worth the walk!
Deep dish pizza was on my Chicago area bucket list. They made my deep dish pizza dreams come true

Almost ten years have passed since I first reviewed the dt Naperville Lou's. I watch the carbs much more now than before, so this is a treat. It's sad to eat spinach salad while everyone else eats pasta and pizza, but when enough time has passed, the spinach pizza with extra garlic is like Christmas in July.

I really enjoy this spot. The outdoor seating and the inside tables both provide great atmosphere. The service is always GREAT.
Amazing pizza, great service, awesome bruschetta and choc chip pizza cookies! Loved the casual ambience and would definitely recommend trying the deep dish here!

Lou Malnati's has the BEST tasting pizza among the Chicago deep dish restaurants. It is my favorite pizza place. I would give five stars for their taste. However, this Naperville downtown branch needs to improve few things... Most importantly, the kitchen does not read the specific order instructions most of the times. 

1/10 times the order comes right, but the other 9 times they do not come as I indicated. Adding 5 more minutes to cook it well-done seemed to be really hard thing for them... It comes with very soggy under the pizza and the undercooked butter crust ruins the whole taste. Also, some servers and hosts here are very unprofessional and disrespectful. The manager here needs to check on their employees for the quality issues.

The one in Arlington Heights is perfect. It seemed like a whole family runs it. Their food taste very consistent. I highly recommend going there instead.

Came here for dinner with four of my friends and the wait was about thirty minutes. Free parking was around the corner in a big parking lot on Webster. While we waited, they allowed us to pre order a pizza so that it will be ready sooner when we get a table. My party also got a pitcher of Goose Island and calamari. 

Calamari (~$8) was yums and the pitcher of Goose Island ($16) went well with our deep dish pizza. This was my second time eating Lou Malnati's and for some reason, I like it more than the first time. The style grew on me but the crust is still too much for me too finish. 

We got a large for 5 people and it was perfect portion for everyone to be satisfied. Total came out to about $63 after tax and tip. Great place to take your family/friends visiting from out of town to try the Chicago style deep dished pizza and perfect for large group

I ordered a thin crust half cheese half peperoni pizza for delivery at 9 pm. It came at 11:20 when they said it would take 1 hour it took 2 hours and 20 minutes and and arrived cold. Not worth it

They made it right and sent 2 vouchers.

Today we have a disgusting and horrible experience at Lou Manati's pizzeria in Naperville. The pizza was completely uncooked and it had raw pieces of garlic. We asked the waitress to put it back in the oven and the manager came. We told him that we didn't like the pizza but we will pay it anyways. He offered us apologies and a free dessert that never came to the table. 
We went there because of the advertising of "The best pizza of Chicago" but to be honest it is the most distasteful pizza we have tried. Also, the experience with the manager shows that he didn't really care about the customers opinion.

Pizza was supposed to be ready for pick up at 9:05... Waited 25 min without any update from anyone and the manager hands me the pizza without even saying I apologize for it being a bit late. Disappointed.
Okay we just did a taste comparison of Lou Malnati's vs Giordano's deep dish pizzas and Two thumbs up for Lou Malnati's butter crust deep dish and our waiter Fernando!

Having spent several college years working in restaurants, I feel compelled to write a review on poor dining experiences.  We do love Malnatti's Pizza, but when I brought the fam in to this location the other day, the service almost couldn't have been worse.  After being seated, no one came to our table.  At all.  It was like Twilight Zone.  I had to get up 3 different times to eventually get someone to come take our order.  Completely unacceptable.  We came very close to walking out.  No bueno.
Amazing crispy yet buttery crust!  The best deep dish pizza!!!  Most of all, the delivery guy was super accommodating and friendly!  Two thumbs up!!

Why is it that every time someone from out-of-town visits me, they insist upon ordering a deep dish?  --It's kind of like a big tomato casserole served on a pizza crust. I much prefer regular crust or thin crust pizza, but, if someone is visiting and they refuse to leave the Chicago area without a deep dish pizza, Lou's is where I take them. While DD is not my favorite version of a pizza, I can appreciate it once in a while and I love Lou's buttery crust. 

While my guests eat their "tomato casserole" pizza, I order a personal sized "Lou" for myself. --Spinach, mushrooms, sliced roma tomatoes covered with mozzarella, romano and cheddar cheese and made with their garlic Buttercrust.

And for the Gluten-Free people, my brother is a very sensitive celiac and Lou's makes a legit GF pizza! Only pizza he's been able to eat for years! He loves it and loves that he can momentarily forget that he has to eat differently than everyone else. No issues at all! Made in its own pan. No cross-contamination. --Winner winner pizza dinner!
 
Salads are HUGE and always fresh (all can be made GF by omitting possible croutons).The "Malnati" is my go-to salad. --The sweetened vinaigrette is paired perfectly with the gorgonzola cheese and the salty olives. Even my kids love it.  Note: a regular size will feed a family so forget the family size if you're also ordering pizza and apps! Especially because leftover salad is a waste; it never keeps overnight.

Although, I've never eaten it, my teens go to Lou's with their friends *just* to eat their "Chocolate Chip Pizza" --a cookie made in a personal sized pizza pan, served with ice cream and whipped cream. It's supposed to serve 2-3 people but I swear they order one for each of them. Oh, to have the metabolism of a teenager.... ;)
Love the dough at Lou's! The downtown Naperville location is perfect for big parties and anyone visiting from out of town. The old firehouse location is pretty cool.

Good experience! The deep dish pizza was good, I was expecting a little better but still a good deep dish. 

Overall fun time, nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

Throughout the dinnertime hours of Saturday, May 28, this location had a problem with central air in the restaurant (81 degrees Fahrenheit, according to their thermostat). Also, one of their ovens stopped working, which resulted in much longer wait times for every customer that evening. Although my group of six people waited nearly two full hours for our two deep dish pizzas, management didn't charge us at all for our entire order. More importantly, both pizzas tasted great!

It took a tremendous amount of courage and integrity for their staff to accept everything which happened in their restaurant that night and make it right for the customers. While losing our money on a busy Saturday night is the last thing they would want, this kind of care for great customer service speaks loudly for how well this location is managed. I will most definitely continue to do business with this Malnati's location. Kudos to the Downtown Naperville staff!
Fantastic Chicago deep dish pizza! Good service from Chris. Very clean bathrooms.  Parking was tricky - tough finding a spot in a city lot. Highly recommend!

I would love to leave a more positive review, but given that this location (downtown Naperville) refused to take my order, 1 star is the best I can do. 

I recently called to place a very large delivery order for a family get-together. Not only was I placed on hold for a long period, but the person answering the phone wasn't all that pleasant to begin with. Not going to fault them for that; we all have bad days. After the long wait, I was told that I wasn't in their "delivery zone." That's pretty odd considering that I had another large order delivered a few months back. I was told that the manager said I was out of the location's delivery zone and that we couldn't proceed with the order. Still not sure how I managed to mysteriously fall out of their delivery zone, but there wasn't much I could do at this point. I then asked if there was a location near me (Lisle) that delivers. Didn't really get much help and eventually I (not the staff) suggested the Downers Grove location. They said to call that location as that would be my "best bet." Great.

I ended up calling the Downers Grove location (it's actually further away from my house than the downtown Naperville location) even though they don't carry all of the same items. The manager (Matthew, I believe) said that even though I was outside of his delivery area, he would take the order. I really appreciated that and plan on leaving a positive review for his location.

I would suggest the downtown Naperville location keep its "delivery zone" consistent so that people don't have to scramble at the last minute to find a replacement. Extremely disappointed and definitely not ordering from Lou's again. Good thing we're in Chicago - there's a lot of other options. Do yourself a favor and explore them.

My first review! Hands down, my favorite place for pizza. Love this pizza. Love the downtown location. My daughters absolutely love it here, too. It can get a bit crowded at times and wait times can be lengthy, but it's worth it. Always have to hit the gym after eating a few slices.

The atmosphere is pretty cool in an old firehouse in the heart of downtown naperville, but pe prepared to wait 30-45 on a Friday or Saturday night. The deep dish is very good and very filling as even on my most hungry days i cant have more than two pieces. This is my go to pizza place for entertaining friends or family. Will say that the pizza isnt for everybody. The sauce is different and may not sit well on everybody's pallet, but overall i have a very good experience with the wait staff and the food. Just need to work on the wait times and have room for people to sit while they are waiting.

I visited Vape58 on 10:21 2015 turns out they got approved for final inspection, they're opening up this weekend, I was kicking back with Rudy the manager, I ordered a large deep dish pizza, you gotta let it cool down a little bit because of cheese is way too hot, but after it cools down a little bit that's the best deep dish pizza I've ever had, me and Rudy knocked off the whole large, love it whatever you guys are doing, keep it up.

One of the best Chicago-area pizza places! I recommend ordering your food before being seated to cut down time at the table. 

The deep dish pizza is delicious! Thin crust pizza has a nice crispy crust. They also have a great local craft beer selection, some even on tap. Great place, will come again!

Coming from NY area, chain pizza is a sin but I guess in Chicagoland that's fine if not expected.  I'm not a big deep dish fan, but this place makes a pretty good one, and this may be sacrilege to say but I think there thin crust was even better.

I made a fatal error however, I came here 2 days after a pizza party back home so was looking for non-pizza food - do not attempt.  I ordered the grilled chicken (disgusting) with spinach and mushrooms....my body rejected this dish VIOLENTLY after a few hours rumbling in my stomach.

So we love LM's for deep-dish, our fave, we go here often. Couple weeks ago we went with son and coupla buddies in tow. Sat nite and busy...we pre-ordered our pizza like we always do and walked over to Andersons and Apple Store to hang and wait for our buzzers to go off. They did in about 45, all good, we sat down. Nice waiter produced our pre-order info and took care of the kid orders. So we watched and waited while the kids food arrived as well as everyone's around us, folks who had arrived long after us. So...we, concerned and purty damn hungry, got our very apologetic (and working his ass off, BTW) waiter to fetch a manager, which he did. Our order got lost...by this time kids were done and roaming...so...management brought a large pizza in a box, comped our entire meal, and gave us free pizza voucher. This is how u treat folks, people! Customer service at its finest...Bravo, Lou Malnati's, we remain loyal customers!

First 80 degree spring day so my girlfriend and I decided to head to Lou's. It was packed, but the wait staff did a perfect job with getting names down and taking orders efficiently. We ordered a large thin with green peppers and spinach. However, when we got our pizza it also had pepperoni. I mentioned it to the waitress and the manager Doug was so nice about it and offered a free share size pizza cookie. The service overall was amazing and even with the mistake on the pizza I enjoyed my night.

Very crowded on our saturday night visit, but very tasty.

There was a large party taking up about 1/3 of the seating, so it was good that we called our order in ahead.  This should be standard for any deep dish place unless you plan to order and wait at the bar.... if there isn't a seat open you'll be doing it anyway.

Speaking of, the bar isn't huge, but has an OK selection of local favorites (two brothers, etc)... however I could always use more.  Its nice to be able to grab a drink while you wait though.

I don't know why its not on the menu (or so hard to find), but they have a deep dish with italian beef and hot giardiniera, so don't skimp and get the good stuff!  Nobody wants to be left asking "Where's the beef?"

We had that (and the waiter complimented the order) as well as a spinach pepperoni thin crust and I thought both were very tasty.  Pizza is left tableside and your first slice (or more) is served by the waiter.

Be prepared to eat well, and enjoy every bite.  Lou's is a Chicago great!

We came here on a late afternoon to celebrate Father's Day. Men + pizza = happiness (just go with it) :). We decided to sit outside with our two kids on the patio. We were seated right away and had a good view of people walking around the downtown area (mostly swarming around the Apple Store). 
     Our server was friendly, but service itself was a bit slow and spotty. I think our waiter must have been newer or way too overstretched. At the end of the meal I waited a good 10 minutes to finish paying for everything. But onto the food: we split a Caesar salad with chicken. The adults got the Lou and the girls split a thin crust cheese pizza. It is standard to wait for a deep dish pizza, so don't be surprised at how long it takes to come or. Luckily my kids chose to not act like they do at home and were quite patient and civilized. The salad was huge and held everyone over until the pizza came. It was a great tasting, fresh salad and the amount of dressing was just right. 
    The pizzas of course are great-in terms of Chicago pizza (I've lived here forever sonJve had my fair share), I would say this ranks in the top 3 for deep dish definitely! You are totally full after less than 2 slices-plenty of leftovers. The kids enjoyed their crispy thin crust too. Pizza from here has never disappointed us-when we want a pie, this is the first place we think of.

The Lou with pepperoni added is still the king of the pies for me. 

Crispy crust chock full o' toppings perfectly balanced. Yum.

Had a very good dining experience. After a rough 90 minutes at the Apple Store across the street my out of town coworker wanted to have a great dinner and beer. Lou Malnatis fit the bill. Our server was great and had fun personality.   Ordered the speciality pizza Malanati and it was great. Of course we couldn't eat it all so that made for great leftovers. 

Thx!

Overall, your best bet is to eat at the restaurant.  I have had Lou Malnati's delivered many times.  When being delivered it is recommended that you get the pizza uncut,  It only stays warm if you order the deep dish, not thin crust.  For some reason they do not bring the pizza to the door in a bag warmer.  With that said, the restaurant service is good.  The most recent visit had good hospitality service from our server Felipe.  He was very attentive and made sure our drinks weren't empty.  He was sure not to come too much, but also made sure not to ignore and forget about us.  My wife and I shared the small Malnati salad as we planned on ordering a deep dish pizza which takes around 30 minutes.  The small salad was a large generous portion which we took over half of it home.  The pizza we ordered was the Chicago Classic which actually came out in less time than advertised.  We ordered a larger pizza to take leftovers home as the leftovers heat up very well.  The price point for Lou Malnati's is competitive, especially to another local competitor.  Whether you are looking for a thin crust or deep dish pizza, Malnati's is the place to go.

After passing and occasionally stopping by and leaving  because of the extremely long wait, we've finally dined at Lou Malnati's! So we both got bowls of the minestrone soup (pretty average, but I'm no soup pro) as well as a large stuffed pepperoni and sausage pizza. The bottom is crisp and the toppings are plentiful; this is the only pizza I know if that I can have the sausage (most places have the caraway seeds which, to me, give it a bad bite)! It was a tad dry, but that won't stop me from coming back. Our server, Max, was on his game, keeping our drinks full as well as being friendly. He is fast; I see him chatting with every table he serves, yet zooms by for the next person. A definite asset! Next time we shall try the thin crust :-)

Located in downtown Naperville, this is a pretty good pick for pizza. Perhaps I'm a bit biased, because I prefer Gioradano's located just a couple blocks away, but the pizza was good.

Pros:
 - Excellent service. Our waiter was always checking on our party of 8. When we ordered appetizers expecting the rest of our party to arrive shortly, and they didn't, our waiter told us to go ahead and eat the apps - he'd bring us more (on the house) when our party arrived, so the apps didn't get cold. Very nice.
 - Good pizza. Adequate cheese and toppings and tasty butter crust. Call be crazy, but I prefer the thin crust. Most others in my party preferred the thick.
 - Those little fried cheese ball appetizers are AMAZING.

Cons:
 - Parking is not fun. Sure, it's free, but it took a while for us to find a spot at 11:30am on a Saturday. We finally found one a couple blocks away in a big parking lot. We nabbed the spot as someone was leaving. 2 seconds after we pulled out of the spot to leave, it was taken.
 - It can be a little cramped trying to navigate around tables. This is because the pizzas are brought and served from a tray that sits next to the table. Dodge the trays.

We were there for a good 2+ hours and we were never made to feel rushed. I'd go back.

Delicious and friendly!! 

Staff is fantastic, Lauren our server, was super patient and friendly.  She helped us make a great choice. I had no idea what to order but that wasn't a problem.  I would overlook the food for a great experience, but not the case here.  The food is excellent... Highly recommend we can't wait to come back.

Alright, bring out the pitchforks: I don't like Chicago-style pizza. 
Too heavy, too saucy, too doughy, too much! 
Anytime someone from IL suggests going out for pizza I cringe. 

But at least if we go to Lou's I know I have a good thin-crust option (though frankly it's a little too thin in my mind; kind of "appetizery," not enough substance. I guess it's one extreme or the other here!)

Their pizza is really flavorful, though: the sauce or herbs or whatever really have a pleasant pungency, and you and your entire party had better be eating the pizza or you will annoy one another with your gahhhlic breath on the ride home!!

This location is convenient to downtown Naperville (read: parking sucks; just go for the parking deck rather than circling like a schmuck). You will also encounter a zillion families with kids. Do your shopping and then settle in for your deep dish depth charge! I'll be over here with my thin-crust, thanks ;)

For a place we really love, this was a horrible experience. I am a server and my husband is a restaurant manager, we have both been in this business for a long time. I only mention that to show that we can be understanding of a rough night on the job....but this was ridiculous!!! I called when we were on our way, to order the Chicago Classic (my favorite), cuz I know it takes awhile. When we arrived, we were told it would be a 35-40 minute wait for 6 of us....we were sat in about 15 minutes. They way over shot the wait time, which was good for us, but others might get discouraged, and go somewhere else. We were also told that my call ahead order is timed to arrive at our table within 15-20 minutes after we are seated...which was fine with me, cuz we were ordering more food. When we were seated, the server came promptly and took our drink order, which we also received quickly, but after that, all was a complete fail! The pizza I ordered ahead came immediately, and we hadnt even ordered our apps or anything else. Our server never returned. I sat right by the host stand, watching the manager laughing and joking with 3 young looking hosts, one of which was playing with her hair and picking at her face (yuk)! I went up to the host stand and asked if we were gonna see our server again, which the inexperiened manager replied that he would go find her. When she finally came over, she apologized and said she didnt think we were ordering anything else, because I called ahead an order. Its pretty obvious that 1 medium pizza is not gonna feed 6 people. Besides the point that she should be checking on her guests anyway. At no point yet, had a manger come over. During all this we watched different people wandering around attempting to drop off food and drinks to wrong tables. We were approached with the wrong food, and had someone try to drop off a beer at our table, that we didnt order. He then went to the couple next to us, who also expressed it wasnt theirs, but they joked they would take it anyways, and he gave it to them! Mind you, they were young looking, so there goes your liquor cost and a possible underage situation....no ID was asked for or shown. We finally received our other pizza and food 1 hour into our visit....unacceptable. During the rest of our time there the server did redeem herself and stay polite and attentive, in the end we felt for her and blamed terrible and lazy management. Oh, at the end, the manager did finally come over and apologize for the server...he offered us a free dessert for the whole table of 6, how insulting. This used to be my husbands favorite spot...NEVER AGAIN!
Really good deep dish. I was full after one slice. Good for a family night out. Service was great and right on point. Will be returning.

I'm still feeling guilty a few days later after indulging in this pizza...but YOLO!!!! 

Anyway - It's been YEARS since I've stepped foot into a Lou Malnati's and I knew there was one in Naperville, I just wanted the perfect time to visit.  Every time I've passed this place at night around dinner time it's beyond packed.  This past weekend was the perfect time to grab a late lunch and wait out the storm hitting the area so we got in around 2:15.  

I liked that this place used to be a firehouse? I think? So the decor is firehouse inside...pretty neat.

I was very surprised to see how many staff were working and standing around just watching tv - around TEN!!! This is besides the point because it wasn't very busy, and our service was just fine.  If we didn't get good service, I'd complain about the many employees hanging out doing nothing.  The way the shifts are scheduled has nothing to do with me but just a little put off by actually seeing the staff just hanging out.

Deep dish is the way to go here... there is thin crust but that is just out of the picture.  The pizza isn't your typical thick doughy deep dish either - it's just right.  There really isn't another option here!

Service was good, pizza was good... hit up this place during non-peak times and you can get in and out...though I'd say it's definitely worth the wait as well!
Deep dish pizza with a beautiful caramelized crust and cheese. The sauce is incredibly flavorful.

This is seriously the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. 

I went here with a group of friends and was starrrrrving. This was my first "true Chicago deep dish pizza" experience and I will always remember it. Yeah, I've tried some pretty damn good Chicago-style pizza in STL but nothing compares to this. 

The ingredients are a notch above. The sauce, cheese, and meat is all amazing. And the crust...don't get me started on the crust. So buttery and delicious. It has an amazing flavor! I get so excited whenever I get to eat Lou Malnati's. I'm coming around in August and I can't wait!

The hostesses were very rude/snotty  when we came in with a large group. Some of us came early to try and put in our name and they would not let us put in our name to wait. When we came back 20 minutes later they acted like they had never met us and said the wait was 1 hour. We went to Giordanos instead and had great service and food. Second time I have had a bad experience at a Lous so I won't be back.
Family visiting from St Louis. Had to take them to Lou's. Breanna was a fantastic waitress!  Food was delicious as always!

I have been ordering from here for over 16 years. They have always delivered. I was informed when placing a order we should have  not  been delivery. Ask to talk to manager put on hold waiting no response. Two days later my neighbor got pizza delivery.  Sorry  for u i will  no longer order from u nor will my neighbor 
Being a loyal customer  means  nothing  to  u

Wonderful food, fresh delicious,  great staff
And reasonable prices 
Love this place!!

While visiting family we decided to stop for lunch at Bernard's. What a treasure! My wife had the sausage pizza which was amazing and a huge portion! I had the Bernard sandwich with imported prosciutto from Italy! OMG! It was the most incredible sandwich I have ever eaten. This place was very clean, service was friendly and attentive! It's no wonder it has been around for 28 plus years! Do yourself a favor and eat lunch or dinner at Bernards. You will not regret it!

We had a luncheon catered by Rita/Bernard's today for 85 women.  It was a smashing success.  The food was way above what you would expect at such an event.  The stars on the menu were the chicken breast pinwheels stuffed with spinach and topped with a madeira wine sauce, the rice pilaf with mushrooms, and grilled veggies.  We often have events catered by Rita, and are always pleased with the quality of the food as well as the service.

Carol W
Oak Brook IL

In the voice of Randy "macho man" Savage...Oooooh yeeeahhh! Why haven't I found this deli in a yelp network of recommendations. Absolutely a must go! They have their arms wrapped around the restaurant experience like a bear hug from the burly uncle who is truly happy to see you. They hit it out of the ballpark in every aspect of a perfect restaurant experience. If you even come near 83 and where they are at, you must tap the brakes and hang a turn into their parking lot. Not a better lunch experience out there. Pastrami? Yes! Soup? Yes! Service? Absolutely! Go. Go. And go again!

I love Love LOVE this place!!! I have been coming here for years. YEARS!!! Even when I lived in the city...I made the hike to meet friends because it was worth every penny!! Super fresh and rediculously delicious. Unfortunately it lacks that "something special" when it comes to customer service. Five stars for food...zero for "Behind The Counter Service". Such a shame....There should be a line around the block every day....This is why there isn't. It doesnt take 20+ years experience in the business to tell you that!!!! Get it together Bernards!! There are a million different restraunts out there!! You are special and so are your customers. Start treating them that way.

Been coming here my whole life pretty much, and have never had anything bad here. My menu choices include (capellini and meatballs, sausage focaccia, turkey burger, chicken sandwich) just to name a few favorites. Probably one of my favorites, if not my favorite place to order pasta at. The pasta and sauce is homemade and delicious. Always have a lot of specials, and pretty good sized menu. The prices aren't exactly low, but definitely worth it to pay the few extra bucks. Good place for lunch and dinner.

The decor is typical mom and pop shop, clean. Salad bar is very impressive. All of the food is delicious and quite fresh. The only reason I give this review a 3 star is due to customer service. I dealt with one employee on the phone who was incredibly rude and ignorant. So much that I was tempted to call back and cancel my order. When I picked up my food, I told the manager about my experience. Her response was "Oh really? I will have a talk with him." No compensation, which was fine. But not even an apology. I could not believe the lack of empathy and how it really didn't seem to faze her. Unfortunately, I don't think I will be back.

I'm a picky Italian eater & this one of the best places I 've been too. There are no waiters so what you would pay in tip , you get in quality. If the owners Joel & Rita are there get one of their specials they are usually game changers . one of the best Italian / American hidden gems around
Bernard's has great pork chops.  The bread is exceptional and is worth a trip.

I was at a party last weekend and this place come up in a conversation.  I have been there a couple of times and it was good, but it is off the beaten path and is a subtle choice that we seldom think about as an option.  They guy I was talking with was an older and old school Italian guy who said it is the closest thing to the way he remembers the kind of food his mother made when he was a kid.  I thought that was interesting enough to put it on the list.  We will be stopping in again in the next week or so.

-One of the best meatball sandwiches in the western 'burbs
-One of the best ravioilis in the Chicago Metropolitan area
-Great fresh pastas
-Excellent special salads (changes daily)
-Very casual

This is that one place that I have put off reviewing because I am afraid that this place with explode with popularity someday and I won't be able to get a table. But, since I've been trying to give good reviews where they are deserved I have to.  I believe in Yelp, and what it has done for business.


Let me say I LOVE, this place!!!!

I wish I lived closer, but am glad I get to go here from time to time.

The great thing about this place is that's it's cafeteria style, so you don't really have to tip... although, there is one person that if he's there I always do, cause he really takes care of you.

They have spoiled me on bruschetta.  They have the best, and I rate everybody else's on theirs.  

I also think they have the best Fettuccine Alfredo too, which is something I don't order in many other places because it never satisfies me the way Bernard's does.

There daily specials are always amazing and on display when you walk in.

My only negative is the last time I went here they don't accept credit cards.  So I always use either their ATM or the one in the bank next store and end up with paying the $3 charge for taking out money from someplace that isn't my bank.

But even with the additional $3, it's still a great meal.

We're here at least once a week- and never get tired of it. The food is always fresh, daily specials, excellent salad bar, and yummy desserts. Oh, and alcohol!  What more could you want? Fresh bread in a variety of flavors always in the oven and delivered to your table. Nice staff and clean environment. A little pricey (don't be fooled by "deli" in the name) but worth it.

I love this place. The grilled fish of the day with grilled vegetables is always awesome... a little pricey... but super good... my go to place around here for fish.

And... a little outdoor patio during the summer.

My family and I have been going to Bernard's since they opened. Rita and Joe always offered great food and service. Jose added a personal touch. I had a taste for pasta last night, my wife is out of town, I ordered angel hair and marinara . It was awful, more like Ragu on spaghetti. What happened this is not the Bernard's I remember?

I had the signature sandwich (capicola w/pickled egglplant on peasant bread) for lunch over the weekend. The quality of the charcuterie was good, and the eggplant gave a nice acidity to the sandwich. The sandwich was served with some robust rippled potato chips. I don't know if they were cooked on site, but they were certainly of a thicker cut than the mass market varieties I've tried. Very tasty. 

I was pleased with the quality of my sandwich at Bernard's, though I believe that the sandwiches and burgers are a little overpriced (by about a buck) compared to the area competition. If you don't mind paying a slight premium for a quality product, then Bernard's is your place. I'm glad they are here to provide a high-quality option for lunch and a good casual spot for dinner.
Great food, great staff, and great prices. Quality ingredients every time. We love this place!
Amazing Italian food every single time. Never disappoints. Great for a quick dine-in experience or grab n go to take home.

Stopped for a quick lunch.  Had never been here before.   Great pizza!  Crispy crust.  Flavorful sauce.  Delicious!!!  My wife had the spinach ravioli that the girl at the order counter had recommended, and found it to be excellent.  

Great find!  We will be back.

Stopped for coffee a few days ago when I saw Bernard's served Illy.  Stayed for lunch, the dining room and menu looked so inviting.  Met the owner who told me about her homemade pasta so I brought my elderly mom a few days later and we both enjoyed a tasty supper. I had broccoli and artichoke heart lasagna.  Mom had a turkey spinach panini.  Both delicious.  Generous portions so we brought a lot home. The Italian bread is some of the best I've ever tasted.
I've been going here for years. Never had a bad meal. Pasta sauce is great! Go, you'll love it.

Not a bad place for lunch -- I used to live right around the corner from Bernard's and would go there to grab a sandwich when I was working from home.

A full range of deli sandwiches is available along with some panini selections. They also have pizza and some Italian dishes and desserts but I never got to sample those. Sandwiches came with chips and they were always great.

Bernard's doesn't accept credit cards but there's an ATM right inside the front door.

Nice option for a quiet lunch.

We ordered from here for our anniversary dinner.  The food was absolutely delicious.  I had the veggie lasagna with Alfredo sauce and my husband had the spaghetti and a meatball.  Beyond delicious.  The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because after leaving, we drove 15 minutes to our hotel and there were no forks in the bag. GRRRRRR.  We had to put our food away, put our coats on and head to a gas station to find forks.  It added an adventure to our anniversary evening but could've done without it.  Despite that inconvenience, we enjoyed the food all the same.  If we are ever in this area again, we will definitely return and if we're taking our food to go, we will be sure to double check the server that gives us our food to make sure their are forks in there.

I have been eating here for over 20 years.  Some people consider comfort food as burgers, fried chicken, etc.  My comfort food is Bernard's.  Nothing makes me feel better than the Capellini with half marinara and half alfredo sauces.  The salad bar is amazing!  My favorite is the pesto noodles with artichoke hearts and the green bean salad.  The homemade everything is just delicious and hits the spot each and every time!  They finally started accepting credit cards over a $10 purchase which is no problem since the average meal will run you about that.  The staff is always friendly and makes you feel right at home.  Definitely go check this place out when you're in the area.

My team came to Bernard's for lunch last month and they all raved about it! I went today for lunch to see what they hype was about. I had a turkey burger with cheddar cheese and grilled onions with fries..under $10! The burger was delicious..nicely melted cheese and very seasoned! My coworker had the meatball and it looked very good! The food is fresh and cooked to order! My office isn't far from here so I will defintely go back!

It almost made me angry to find out that this place was here! I am in this area quite often and I have only stopped in just recently!.The following is what I ordered on the inaugural visit!

Bernard's - Proscuitto, roasted red peppers, lettuce, cracked pepper and herb dressing, and provolone cheese on peasant bread 
$7.50.

i decided to also order a bowl of chicken soup to go along with my sandwich! They hit the nail on the head this day! Everything was delicious and a GREAT value. The staff was really friendly and our food was up quickly! There is nothing more that I could have asked for here! I am going to be back on numerous occasions!

This is a restaurant that can't decide if it is a deli, pizzeria, or a sit-down restaurant.  The result was crappy service, good pizza and bread, but the worst sandwiches we've ever had at a deli.  The meat was poor and the bread was stale.  Dang shame.  If they ever put up a sign that says 'Under New Management', I'll try it again.
Great food.  Pastas and salads are notable.  Dinner is great.  Ambiance is more casual.

Ok.. What happened?? As I mentioned previoulsy prices were reasonable but last time I went there I paid $10.25 for a turkey burger! Yes $10.25! It used to be $8.75 and all of a sudden prices went up and they did by a lot.   WOW! Since when does turkey cost as much as beef?? YI am quite disappointed to be honest.  I mean the food is exactly the same, it's not like they are adding anything special or changing their ingredients yet prices are very high.  Don't get me wrong I enjoy their food but I don't think I can afford it anymore, I can definitely find a cheaper meal.

Just went here with a group of coworker pals, and will certainly be back. The food here is really good and tastes really fresh. I had the turkey burger with grilled onions,and it was amazing. I didn't feel like I was eating a light alternative to a regular hamburger. The fries are delicious and have kind of a crispy batter thing happening with them. My friends got a corned beef, reuben and turkey panini and they were all thrilled with their food. The only two small things preventing me from giving this place a full five star rating are: they don't take credit cards (and I never have cash on me) and the music was kind of all over the place (weird old timey one minute, bad 80s the next) and loud enough to be noticeable.

It's good. Not great. Not bad.

It's a decent place to go to when you can't decide. 

They only accept cash and aren't cheap ($15 entres).

Yeah, it's pretty tasty. I'm an outsider, not a loyal fan coming to this place. The salad bar is one of the best I've seen, but everything is covered in oil. So, although a delicious salad but, a deceptively unhealthy one at that too. 

The pickled beets are delicious, as are the cold pasta dishes. And the prices are pretty good too.

I've been going here for close to 20 years now.  I usually come here for the pasta, most of which is good, but I have consistently been disappointed by their Ravioli.  While it isn't bad, it does tend to be a bit bland (I can tell no difference between the spinach and cheese varieties other than their appearance).  Their lasagna is also good, but be forewarned, the cheese they use is very VERY rich and probably won't sit well with everyone.  Their marinara sauce is amazing and their meat balls are the best I have ever tasted!

Their special pizzas usually are worth a go. I suggest ordering just a slice before ordering more as they sometimes can be too salty.  Their personal-pan pizzas are alright but my personal favorite is the Boboli, try it if you like a simple cheese, tomato and pesto pizza.

Their salad bar is quite good, just be careful how much you grab, it's $7 and change per pound.

Their busboy Jose has been here since the beginning, and while some may interpret his mannerisms as being pushy I always found him to have the best intentions.

For some reason this place is vehemently anti-credit card, so be sure to bring your cash or an ATM card as they now have an ATM right next to the till.
Awesome Italian homemade food, casual service and simple

The fresh pastas are wonderful (and you can purchase by the pound to go).  I am always seeking out good cheese ravioli, and this place has it!  You get your choice of sauce on whatever pasta you choose, which I think is cool.  They had a special tomato sauce with leeks and it was amazing!  Also, the bread was tasty.  I don't usually eat bread with my pasta, but i could not resist this after watching someone take it out of the oven and cut through its crunchy crust with a giant knife.  The salad bar was good- no iceberg in sight.  They have beer and wine, so that's another point in my book.  
The only thing I don't like about this place is that you have to order up at the counter. There are 2 different places where you have to pay if someone in your party gets the salad bar.  kinda disjointed.  The atmosphere is quiet and good for talking, but I wish they had wait service, especially for the price of their entrees.

I work in Willowbrook and am still discovering little places like this to have lunch.

I had the special panini, which was ham, provolone, and tomatoes.  Damn, this sandwich was good.  I forgot how much I love ham in a deli sandwich, I try to order leaner meats, but I could not resist this time.

My only complaint was that there was a kind of puddle under my sandwich, like when you have a pickle spear on the side.  Except there was no pickle..where was this moisture coming from?  I can only guess that it was from the tomatoes being pressed in the panini??  I dont know, but I dont like a soggy sandwich.  Even still, it was pretty damn good.

I almost had the tuna salad because that is my go-to deli staple, but Im glad I didnt.  I'll try it next time.

Great atmosphere, good food, nice staff.

Have always liked their food, but their customer service is behind the times. Stopped in to grab carry out for the family. Placed a $46 order, only to be reminded they STILL don't take credit cards. Apparently, they don't want to pay credit card fees to offer this convenience to their customers. But YOU can pay the bank fees to use their conveniently installed ATM. How thoughtful. No wonder the place was empty on a Saturday evening.

Probably the best option in the area if you're looking for a hot meal at a non-corporate chain restaurant.  

The busboy Jose has been there forever, and used to be pushy and super rude about where he wanted you to sit... I wonder if the years have chilled him out.  I haven't seen him lately but I haven't been in there very frequently, either.

Ate there today and noticed that they had freshly-made pasta in their front fridge - had always known their pasta was tasty!  

They have a popular salad bar that I haven't tried, but looks like it has some good options.  Tasty homemade soups and good bread make this a good lunch spot to try.

Eating at Benard's always puts a smile on my face.  They have great specials, but my favorite thing to eat is their Sausage Loaf which is similar to a calzone.  That is my kind of comfort food.  Be advised - they do no take credit cards, they only accept cash and checks.

Whenever I am back home in the burbs, I make a point to visit this Deli.

The salad bar is amazing with plenty of options all fresh and delicious. I usually fill a plate and make a meal from the salad bar alone. The also serve excellent pasta dishes - made from scratch daily. The chicken and other meat dishes are all delicious as well.
Definitely a family favorite.

So, I just went here yesterday after not being there for like a million years!!  And it is exactly the same as I remembered it!  YUMMY!!  There is even this busboy guy that has been working there since before we started going and he remembered us after all these years!  Either me or my sister always get their egg salad sandwich...it is seriously the best I have ever had besides my own! =]]  I have also had their pastas and specials that have ranged from meatloaf to chicken vesuvio...all of which were delicious and tasted like grandma used to make!!  They also have a small salad bar that has homemade salads, my favorite being the creamy pasta salad with veggies...YUM!!  There is also a small assortment of cheeses and meats, dressed tomatoes, lemony-herb pasta (cold), garlic bread strips and yesterday there was also some roasted veggies at the end and I tried some...there were DELICIOUS!!  The only down side about this place is that they don't take credit/debit cards!  That annoys me...but it would never stop me from going!

Great place. 
The guacamole comes with bison on top. It is hot, fresh and covered with cheese.
The bison rib eye is fantastic. It is quite different from regular beef. It is more gentle and sweet.
My friend had the crab cake with kale salad. It is the crab cake I have ever had. It is made with more the 95% crab meat and you can see the meat.

Ted's is very different, not your typical place, so I recommend trying it at least once.  Here's what you might want to know before going.

Most of their menu consists of burgers and steaks.  They have both beef and bison, which is why I like going....we get enough beef so I like to have bison when I go.

When you walk in you really feel like you could be in Montana.  Feels very country, without being country.  That may not make sense.  It's not like southwest or southern country, its northern country.  

The walls have a nice wood panel to them.  There's a big buffalo head hanging on the wall.  Ted likes to use sustainable, recycled products:  the straws for your drink are made from recycled paper.  At first you won't really notice, but after 10 minutes your straw starts to soften up.  Everything on the table is recycled...napkins, etc.  may not seem like much, but it adds to the ambiance.

At most restaurants they bring out bread while you wait.  Ted brings out these natural made pickles that are probably the best I've ever had.

So, burgers.  They aren't the best or the biggest, but they are good quality.  You can tell that Ted puts a lot of effect I to making everything there high quality.

You don't see this at too many places, but the bathrooms use a powdered hand soap called boraxo, and the men's stalls are waterless.

I recommend trying it at least once for the overall experience

As soon as you walk through the revolving door at Ted's you feel a comfort of upscale classic western dining. Ted's takes me back to a family road trip out west and brings back memories that was decades ago. Ted's staple and feature food is of course Bison. Finding Bison as fine dining in Illinois is a challenge. There Bison is tasty, well seasoned and didn't disappoint. 

I had the glorious bacon cheeseburger topped with a little American flag. I paired my juicy burger with the 50/50 which consists of half fries and half ginormous onion rings. My bison burger paired perfectly with a glass or two of red Cabernet. 

For all the meat lovers and bison extraordinaire  out there Ted's will not disappoint you. The only thing I would change about the experience is Ted didn't ask if I wanted dessert and I'm always for something sweet.

Place seems a bit upscale, but people come here eating casual. Bar area with a couple of tv's and a separate dining area with mostly booths.

I've been wanting to try out their bison, so I opted for the bacon cheeseburger version, medium rare. Couldn't tell the difference between this and a regular burger, but anyways, didn't like it.

Skip this place on your next visit to downtown Naperville.

My family and I went here for my parent's 25th anniversary, everything was fantastic. Our server Judy was delightful. Every bite of food was cooked to perfection and came out quickly. We will definitely be back. Thanks again Judy!

We eat at Ted's all the time, in fact it's our go-to place for meat when dining out. Nice selection, and because it's an actual steakhouse you can expect that they are going to know how to cook it.
