So I thought. The other night I was feeling weak (after having had the flu the week before) and decided to boost my iron with a little red meat, so I went to Ted's alone for a steak. I ordered the beef Delmonico ribeye, medium. 

When I got it, the outside was fine but the inside was quite literally raw. I cut through it in a couple of places to make sure it wasn't just one spot, but it had been seared on the outside and was totally underdone throughout. Urgh. I flagged my waitress; she looked at it and agreed and said she'd have them "put it back on," which didn't sound promising (because since the outside was perfect, it would be toast by the time the inside caught up). 

Sure enough, when she brought it back and urged me to cut into it, it was so scorched I could barely saw into it, literally. She said they would make another. Meanwhile I kept my garlic mashed potatoes and gravy (excellent side dish!) because I was really hungry!!

Meanwhile the manager came over, and this was honestly the weakest point in the transaction. The restaurant was fairly loud and the woman was mumbling; I had to say, "I can't hear you" twice. Also, she said, "You had a problem with your Del?" "We're making you a new Del." I didn't know what she was talking about but eventually realized she meant the DELmonico steak. Using jargon with patrons isn't helpful: just say "steak"! 

Anyway, they did make a new one, which was better, and since I was alone and wasn't in a hurry it wasn't a big deal, and they comped the meal (as they should). My waitress tried to say I didn't need to tip her, but it certainly wasn't her fault! Service is never a problem here, and the ambiance is nice, which is why we come back so often (try to get one of the enclosed booths if you can; deadens some of the sound). 

So even though this wasn't the finest experience, I know they are capable of great things, and I will be back,

I absolutely love bison (apologies, vegetarians ) and this location is sentimental to me; I used to spend a lot of time at Oswald's when I was younger.

Last Wednesday was a protein day for me. I had an hour to spend downtown while my phone was being repaired and walked into Ted's around 11:30. I sat at the bar. The staff seemed hasty. I asked for a bison burger, no bun, no sides and was told it would be about 15 minutes. No problem. About 5 minutes after I ordered, I had to ask for water. About 10 minutes after I ordered, I was brought the check. I was a little taken aback but paid and waited.

Since I didn't have my phone and I was alone, my entertainment was looking around. The decor was cozy, a bit like a lodge but much nicer. The retro cash register was a nice touch. Sports were playing on two TVs, not to my interest but I didn't bother to ask anyone to change the channel either.

My food was brought out in a container. I asked for a fork and knife and was given plastic. As I was about to wonder what the heck was going on, I realised they thought it was a to-go order. They gave me some silverware and I ate at the bar.

Simple mistake. I get it. But what frustrated me was that it was $12 for a burger with water. A burger with nothing on it, no sides, nothing. Just meat. I'm not really sure what to think or say beyond that. I know special requests can be frustrating but it was simple and I was as polite thankful as can be. Still I felt like a nuisance.

Rough morning/afternoon at Ted's? Maybe.
It was a pricey ... experience.

I've eaten at this Ted's several times and it's always been great.

The prices are a bit steep for a burger (my go to) but the bison is quality and tastes much leaner than your typical ground beef. They will add toppings without any additional cost (avocado!).

The mashed potatoes are delicious. And those pickles they serve as an app are amazing.

This place is known for their bison burgers (something that I didn't try, but my boyfriend did) - we ordered the Avalon beef burger and George's Cadillac bison burger. The bison meat weirded me out at first, but it tastes just like beef and is healthier for you! The burgers are the perfect portion size and come with fries as a side (which are AMAZING by the way). Overall good food and wide variety of burgers

Very comfortable environment, perfectly dim lighting, retro map-designed table mats, cozy hard-wood floors.
Bathrooms are awesome, eco-friendly everything

Most importantly, BEST BISON BURGER EVER, try the Avalon medium rare. Delicious soups and salads.
Not the greatest variety of IPA's, but the Snaggle-tooth bandana and Laguinitas hit the spot!

Ask for Joel- Awesome guy, very knowledgeable, welcoming, and has a great sense of humor.
We'll definitely be back! Thanks guys!

My first time here is on a Sunday night around 6, they're not terribly busy. The host takes a while (5 minutes or so) to seat us, but sure why because there are so many tables. Then we wait about 10 minutes before the server finally comes by. After that, things got better. Our food was out within 10 minutes. I had the Avalon burger and it was by far the BEST burger I've had in ages. Asked for it medium and it was cooked perfectly. The service could use some work but overall our waiter was friendly and I highly recommend the burgers.

Lunch today at Teds. Nothing to complain about. We had our dog with us, so we sat on the patio out back. Before we even placed a drink order, they came with a bowl of water for Charlie. 

We had big salads with burger patties on them. Bison for babes and Beef for me. Awesome big burger salads. Side of 50/50 fries and rings. 

Top this off with a cap'n and diet and a Bloody Mary and damn that was a fine Saturday brunch. We are going to give our Ted's at Glenview Glen another try. 
They were taking donations for No Kid Hungry. Do gooders too.

Used to love coming to Ted's, but after being diagnosed with Celiac Disease and milk allergy. I have been very skeptical about eating out.  Luckily I found online that they have a gluten free menu, my dad and I went in and had lunch a few weeks ago and I told our waiter that I had Celiac and cross-contamination was a big issue and I ordered off the Gluten Free menu only to get glutened.  I called later that night and explained what happened and the host or whoever picked up the phone explained that the gluten free menu was for people who were choosing to be gluten free, not for allergies/celiac disease, they recommended that I come in when it wasn't busy to eat, at odd times so that they could more carefully watch the production of my food.  Already with my condition I have enough worries and issues, now I'm expected to eat dinner at 2:00pm if I want to eat out so that they can take their time?! Ridiculous.  Do not recommend as customer service is not a priority.  Zero stars would be a more appropriate rating in my opinion.

In an nutshell... meat was good, restaurant is cozy and attractive, but the appetizer was skimpy (don't order the nachos), there was no bread, there was no service, there were no refills, and don't order the mashed potatoes unless you smoke a pack a day, or have a death wish. 

The explanation
I've been to this place three times, and last night was my third, and probably the last .. At least at this location. We came in last night around 8pm. The occasion was a small celebration and I was treating my family to dinner. Overall, I have a few complaints that mar anything else that might be this restaurant's saving grace. I'll get to those things in a second, but first, the good stuff. 

The meat is incredible, it really is. Even if they don't cook it RIGHT, it's still good -- which says a lot about their cuts. The atmosphere is great and the place is very cozy with lots of wood, lamps, and creaky floors. 
My smallest complaint -- like many others, is that they give you salty pickles instead of bread. It's probably to get you used to the onslaught of salt they're about to serve you, which makes you continuously order more 6 dollar beers. 

Both my father and my husband avoid salt like the plague. Excessive amounts really make them sick, so they just avoid it altogether. So when we asked if we could get things without being salted it didn't seem to be a problem -- until the food arrived. Neither of the guys could touch their mashed potatoes, and even after I regretfully took a few bites, I have to say that my tongue still burns this morning after last nights salt lick. It ruined the meal. Add that to the lack of service we received and it's difficult to enjoy your food when all you taste is salt AND you have no water, much less ice tea, or beer refills.

The layout of the restaurant isn't particularly conducive to good service. There's a very large partition in the middle that divides the restaurant length and although I think it handicaps the servers, they probably aren't trying very hard anyway. We were literally the ONLY people in the restaurant last night, and service was very poor. Understandable for an overworked service, but unacceptable when she's just sitting at the bar flirting with the chef and chatting with the other server. I had to stand up and wave through the glass twice at the other server who got her attention for us. 

In conclusion, meat was good, restaurant is cozy and attractive, but the nacho appetizer and bison meatloaf were skimpy for the price, there was no bread, there was no service, there were no refills, and don't order the mashed potatoes unless you smoke a pack a day, or have a death wish.

Step into Big Sky Country on the Corner of Jefferson and Main
If you are unaware this is a Restaurant chain that was started by Ted Turner of Turner Broadcasting the Media Empire.  His philanthropy extends to trying to keep the history of the American West alive including it's Native peoples.  If you are looking for a great burger joint that serves chicken patties and buffalo as an option to any craft burger they offer this is it.  Different Soup Everyday-Chili is always on.  Smoked (in house) Trout Appetizer served with home made tortilla chips. Buffalo 41 cocktail-Bourbon, Grand Marnier, Freshly squeezed lemonade with 2 plump (drunkin') blackberries that were a great finish.  Mountain Breeze is also exactly as described-Finlandia vodka infused in house with fresh squeezed Grapefruit, lime, orange juice, splash of cranberry.  Staff know the menu and make themselves discreet when necessary.

Amazing service. Somehow they have mastered an upscale feel with burgers and beer. The music is classic country or bluesy. The FOOD!! Wow! They have over ten different burgers with either chicken, bison or beef. Great selection of cocktails and wine. Only a few beers on tap. The decor is perfect! Lots of wood and leather with inset booths. Really impressed and will be back.

Well here we go again. Love the food but the service is still spotty. The hipster host marched my wife and I past many unoccupied booths and parked us in the booth right across from the very busy entrance to the kitchen. Excellent choice! Asked to be relocated. The hipster looked surprised that we didn't want to be entertained by an endless procession of wait staff  but showed us to one of those unoccupied booths nonetheless. Where we sat and sat and sat until I went up to the front of the house and asked the other hipster host if we could have a waiter pretty please. Ted needs to kick some ass.
My wedge salad just arrived. It's pretty small - more like a weh than a complete wedge.

The Good: Quality food, good service. Had the Bison filet with sweet potato fries, everything was cooked perfectly and promptly. 

The Bad: Only complaint would be that I ordered a side salad with no onions and of course it came with onions, not a make or break though. 

If you've never had Bison meat then you're missing out, def give this place a visit, you won't regret it.

I really want to like this place. My bison ribeye was great. But I would have loved to have my salad first but it never came. My guest cut his lip on a broken glass. My coworker ordered a coffee at the end of the meal but it took so long. An hour espresso machine wouldn't go astray. Ketchup has to be asked for twice. Took ages to it the bill. Good food. Reasonable price. Just slow and forgetful. Not a place to take guests.

I'm on a strict diet and because of that, Ted's is a favorite. The "Big Sky" with Bison is something I salivate just thinking about. I eat my salads dry without dressing (and without cheese or croutons) because of my dietary needs. Vegetables are very fresh and they don't skimp. So fresh and good that I don't even miss eating dressing. -thé tomatoes, avocado, bacon and bison patty provide all the flavor I need!

The fresh pickles... I fight everyone at our table for them! Which is silly of me because they'll bring more. ;) So fresh though. You can still taste the cucumber. 

I give it a 4 star because some of the kids' meals are lacking. One of my kids ordered a kids' steak and it had the weirdest flavor. I couldn't even get it down. They replaced it for free and were very kind about it, bringing out Mac n Cheese to replace it. --I could barely taste any cheese on it. It was better than the funky steak so I wasn't about to complain to the staff though. 

A few days ago, my 3 yr old ordered the beef sliders and fries and she nearly ate all of them, which is a definite testament of what she thought of them. :) She even asked the very next day if we could go back again.

On a business trip, came in for dinner.  Great place, love the atmosphere.  Wait staff was exceptional.  My first time dining here.  Waiter (Eugene) explained the history of the reastaurant,  focus on food quality, freshness etc.  Not too wordy..raised my bar on what to expect.  I dined by myself, ate at my own pace, never felt rushed.  App & entree came out in perfect timing.  Food was exceptional.  I didn't save room for dessert, but I ordered it anyways.  Wild berry cheesecake...rich & fluffy, sweet yet tart.  
I'll be back!
Jade K.

We really likethe food, bison is great and the place is very kid friendly. The energy is a bit low, but that makes it easier to get in compared to other Naperville restaurants. Bison party on chopped salad is my go to order.

One of my favorite American style food places to eat.  Stick to your ribs type of food.  Can be heavy meals so be prepared because you will not leave hungry.  Great bar, refinished, clean, and king size cocktails.  Fridays & Saturdays for the prime rib is my absolute favorite.

Bison! Yum!

Yes, I'm a fan... At this price point they give you something a little different.. a bit healthier. Sure they have beef and other things, but I'm grooving on the bison when I'm at Ted's. 

Stopped in with my son yesterday and had the Bison Pot Roast, it's tender and not too fatty.. comes with a tasty gravy, GREAT mashed potatoes and somewhat crisp green beans.. a winner of a dinner... BUT! because this is not my first Ted's rodeo... I started off with the excellent Bison Chili... I love the Bison Chili! They throw some fresh sliced Jalapenos on top (which is good for those of us that like some spice and crunch) and that is something that I can appreciate. A cup wouldn't be enough, so I got a whole bowl.

My son, Ian, got the Avalon (Bison) burger and loved it... I was going to ask how he was enjoying it... but when I looked up from my own plate..it was gone! He also had a bowl of the Chicken and Sausage Gumbo (if I didn't want the Chili so bad... that's what I would have gotten too.. I love me some Gumbo) and said it was great (better than Heaven on Seven's?)

There are other reason's to like this place, they are nicely located in Downtown Naperville (Street and Garage Parking is free everywhere) and close to the Riverwalk (A big bowl of Chili AND a whole meal needs some after dinner activity!). They took over the old space long inhabited by Oswalds Pharmacy, it's a long narrow restaurant with entrances on both sides; north side at parking lot (always full, but big, free garage across the street) and south side on Jefferson.

Ted's also makes an effort at being environmentally friendly which somehow makes me feel better about making a pig out of myself when I'm there.

Teds is where its at!

We had four out of towners staying with us for New Years Eve so we decided to take them out to dinner on Tuesday December 30th. They are from down state so things like deep dish pizza, Portillos and Bison is something they do not get everyday. We tried to go to Lou's but there was a 90 minute wait so we came over to Ted's. Our wait was about 30 minutes for a party of 6 so we stood by the bar for a quick drink and were sat within about 25 minutes. 

We were promptly greeted by Matt, who was such a delight. He brought over the pickled cucumbers which are amazing. I had only been to Ted's once before and had 5 newbies so we were a bit lost with the menu. We all wanted to try bison but were unsure of the taste but Matt was so great to explain the similarities and differences of bison to ground beef.

All six of us ordered a different variety of bison burger, two bacon cheese, two cheese, one George's Cadillac and one green and hot. Everyone raved about what they had ordered. My cheese bison burger was phenomenal and may have been the best burger I have ever had. Our normally loud and chatty group was silent with the exceptions of yums and hmms.

The only downside we had with our night was the quite drafty door we were sitting near. The restaurant has two rotating doors on each end of it. We didn't want to complain because the restaurant doesn't have many 6 top tables and they were completely full. We did mention being chilly to Matt who then told the manager. Two minutes later, we heard the heat kick on. He also went to the rotating door we were near and pulled it so there were no gaps. 

Well done, Matt. We will definitely be returning and hope to see in your section again!

Bison Burgers? Sure, I'm in.

In fact I am looking to just keep trying new restaurants in downtown Naperville because I love that they have so many charging station parking spaces for electric cars! 

I come to this area once a month for my quilt guild and meet a long time teacher pal. We used to always go to the same place and now we've decided to try a different restaurant each month. When we get tired of that, we'll have a new strategy.

This restaurant was pretty empty around 4:15 when we entered. There were a few booths with patrons at the front. They sat us in the very first booth which is probably the least private booth in the whole restaurant where there were easily 30 empty tables available. Whatever.

Our server was very friendly, didn't hurry us but kept a nice pace. I adored the straws, they are paper. I wish all straws were paper!

I also really liked my bison burger, not dry at all. I had a sweet potato as my side and it was really delicious with yummy things to put in it.

My friend and I wanted to get two cookies and split an order of ice cream. Around 5:25 or so there was only one chocolate chip cookie left. Really? It's not like you're making them from scratch and Grandma has already gone to bed. These are frozen dollops you're baking. 

At any rate we split the cookie which was just an average chocolate chip cookie. I would go here for the burgers and sweet potatoes but skip dessert.

And we never got our coffee. Oh well, I stopped at Starbucks on the way home from Guild. 

Next month we'll try a new place. This one is 4 because the burger and the straws were outstanding.

They're complimentary pickles are to die for! Get the Bison Burger! They're salads and house made dressings are AMAZING! Great place to eat around the corner from shopping literally. I always enjoying sitting on the patio after shopping.
Loved the food. Judy was the best server I have ever had. She was so sweet!!!  She knew her stuff

Pretty pricey and just meh. Nothing fantastic at all.

Pickles or pickled cucumbers to start .... odd choice. I'm used to being given some bread. But, whatevs.

There was nothing that impressed me so much that I feel the need to ever go back. The food was just okay, the atmosphere just okay, the service just okay.

Honestly left a bit disappointed in spending the money.
Prices are a bit higher than I would like but the food is definitely worth your money. The bison burger was cooked to perfection and the sangria was wonderful!

Great customer service. Awesome big burger. I had the Avalon burger. Although i will say its overwhelming how theres soo muh meat($14 and bison meat $17). Couldnt finish in 1 seating. Overall a good experience.

My date and I came here to celebrate Valentine's Day last night. We absolutely LOVED our food. And our waiter was the best we've had in a really long time. Attentive, funny, and knowledgable. My only complaint is that our drinks seemed a little weak and were more mixer than alcohol. I also didn't like that I saw other waiters with their jeans sagging and boxers showing. It's a nice, pricier restaurant and if I'm paying for an expensive dinner I don't want to have to stare at a 16 year old's boxers. Other than that, I'd come back. And eat here everyday if I could.

I've been here twice, the first time just with my boyfriend and the second time it was the two of us and our moms. Let's start with similarities: the food was excellent, we received our drinks quickly and they were well made, the restaurant was packed, the  service was decent, and they gave us weird cucumbers we never ate. 

Their wine selection is okay, but I always balk a bit at spending what I'd pay for a bottle at Binny's on a just a glass. But I digress. Both times we visited (because I know what I like and I'm super adventurous) I got the green and hot bison burger with the Bogle Petite Syrah. The burger was perfectly cooked, the wine brought out the heat without being murderous or bitter. My boyfriend got the Kansas City strip (bison) the second time we went paired with an old fashioned. His steak was amazing, cooked to a perfect medium rare, and the drink was beautifully presented. My mother got the salmon, which she loved, and his mother ordered the avalon burger, which she also loved. Like I said, the food is great. 

The first time we went we arrived around 7pm on a Friday night with no reservation. We were seated (slightly begrudgingly) within about 10 minutes, and by the front door. Which was freezing. This is my only complaint about our first visit, our service was good and you really can't expect much at that time with no reservation, we were lucky to be seated at all. 

The second time however, we received a much less warm reception. Since there were more of us, my boyfriend called ahead and made a reservation several hours in advance. One would think this adequate, no? Well we got to the restaurant, he left me and the moms off at the back entrance and went to park. My boyfriend's mother, I should note, has a very difficult time getting around and was visibly relying on me and a cane to make it in to the restaurant. We walked in and were told (as I already knew) that the hostess stand is up front, and we would have to go all of the way to the front of the restaurant to be seated or checked in with our reservation. Really? That seems a bit blind to tell a person with a visible handicap that they'll have to walk all of the way to the front. We ended up asking another waiter and he assured us this wasn't necessary. We told him we had a reservation, gave the name and he returned just as my boyfriend got in from parking to tell us there was no reservation under this name. Boyfriend assures him that yes, indeed, he made a reservation. Two men I assume are managers come back with the book and tell us very rudely that there is no reservation under his name. Boyfriend shows them that he had a several minute long phone call several hours previous to the restaurant's number. One manager assures the other that that isn't true (right in front of the customer no less) the other looks closely at the phone, then walks a few feet away to confer with other manager. After almost a minute he walks back and gestures roughly to a booth and says "Just sit there," and walks off. We waited about another fifteen minutes for a waitress. I understand mix ups happen, but this just isn't how you deal with them.
Great bison burgers! Love the cherry ice tea and the fries are excellent. If you get alcohol it can be a bit pricey. Stay with water, ice tea, or soft drinks. Your wallet will thank you!

This was the first time I visited this restaurant.  I found it odd that it was on a forced wait but, this would be the beginning of a disappointing  experience.  I believe the hosts (a two person team) actually forgot about us. After 20 mins, an employee the manager I believe came and inquired what we are waiting for moments later we were sat.  The waitress took about ten minutes to greet us, we placed our order.  Our food came shortly afterwards, while eating no one came to check on us.  There were errors in our order, which we just had to deal with, I attempted to wave my server down but she continued to walk by with her head down.  We finished our food which was pretty tasty, despite the server issues.    I requested a dessert menu from my server. After receiving it, She disappeared for 30 minutes.  At this point, I just wanted to leave. After about 15 minutes I was able to pay and go. The staff on all levels really failed with exception to the cook.  For a dinner date, save yourself some irritation and try another place out in the area.

Went here for our anniversary and we were extremely disappointed.

The hostess was great. There was a 45 minute wait, no room at the bar, so he took down our number to call us as we walked around downtown.

I loved the atmosphere. Very private booths (although we did not get to sit at one), and dimly lit, so it's quite romantic for an anniversary date.

After being seated, they brought us out pickled cucumbers. I thought that was kind of odd as a starter. No bread? But nevertheless they were pretty good.

Our waitress had no personality and talked as quiet as a mouse. She approached our table and I could hardly make out what she was saying. All I know is she said "Hello, how are you tonight?" to which we responded "Good, thanks"....and then she just stared at us. Uhhh are you going to ask us what we want to order?? There was a very long, awkward pause of us just staring at her until my husband finally said, "Well I'll have the bison steak." and I ordered the mini bison burgers with fries. She didn't even ask us what we wanted to drink.

Some service for such a nice, expensive restaurant....

After waiting 30 minutes (which I think is a pretty long wait for two mini burgers and a steak), my food came out cold. Completely cold. I grabbed the waitress and asked her to have them make me a new one. She did, but again she mumbled so quietly, I don't even know if she had apologized for the mistake.

Then I waited...and I waited. My husband started to eat his because it was getting cold. He liked the bison steak a lot. Not chewy like regular steak and absolutely no fat. But for $32 dollars....he expected a little more. This thing was sooo small. It also came with asparagus and a baked potato. Both were nothing special. 

...And here I am still waiting on my food. It's been at least another 25 minutes. My husband is now done with his food, so I grabbed whatever waitress I could since ours hadn't been around and told them to cancel my order. I was beyond done waiting on this place and was absolutely starving aside from the three pickled cucumbers that sat in my stomach.

When the waitress came by she asked if I wanted the manager. Really? Why wouldn't you just send him/her over to begin with? Why are you asking me? You already know what the problem is. "No I don't need to speak to a manager, just bring me the check."

When she brought out the check, she also brought me the bison burgers to go and removed it from our check. That was nice, but I'm not gonna write a review on Ted's Montana Grill day old leftovers. 

Very disappointed, won't be back.
Yummmo....bison short ribs are great! Crab cakes are amazing...full of thick crab chunks, one can be filling. :)  they also have a house red wine that was smooth and flavorful.

We arrived at 6:30, and were seated promptly.  Our server was Judy; we gave her our drink order, which we received at 6:44. I was a bit aggrivated until she said all the computers suddenly went down. Understandable, it explained why all the servers were running around frantically from table to table. 

She took our appetizer order (St. Phillip's Island Crab Cake) and our entrees (a Blue Creek bison burger with an added fried egg for the birthday boy, and a Red Rock bison burger for myself).

First of all, the crab cake is probably the best I've had in a long time, if ever! The handmade guacamole and coleslaw served along side of it is to die for. I wanted to slow down and savor it, but I found my plate cleared before the bf was halfway done with his.

The burgers arrived, and I was unsure how on earth I was going to eat this thing- it was huge!  I managed to "smush" it down a big, which definitely helped me dig in. Holy cow! (Err, holy bison???)  This was DEFINITELY the best burger I've ever had. I've experienced bison before, but not like this. I was in heaven. 

The fries that come with the burgers were exceptional, and the portion is large. I barely dug through half of them.

By the end of our meal, we were both so full. The bf didn't save room for his double chocolate cookie with vanilla ice cream, but Judy, being the awesome server that she was, boxed it up for him to take home. 

I can't wait to go back here. I'm so sad I haven't tried it sooner. I would definitely recommend Judy as a server, too.

Friday's clam chowder is a reason to go.  A bit loud at time....  Hostess desk can be a bit off-putting with a singular goal of gatekeeper but wait staff is always spot on.

Oh yea, the bison is an unusual treat as is the prime rib.  MAke sure to get the grilled asparagus side dish.

I stopped in yesterday around 5pm for a bite with 2 friends. Only one of us had been there before and she liked it so we went in. We were seated right away in the mostly empty restaurant. They brought out a bowl of pickles, which were basically just really salty cucumbers and they were delicious! We started with the chips appetizer and it was really good, nothing special but still tasted good! I got the Avalon burger (beef) which was Gruyère, blue cheese, bacon caramelized onions, roasted garlic aioli, and baby arugula. I ordered it well done and it tasted amazing! So good. I also got the broccoli as a side instead of the fries and it was very good but it's just 2 pieces. We were stuffed by the time we left so no dessert, but I will be back for sure!

I guess I'm a stickler for good service.... I would not expect to walk into any restaurant in downtown Naperville on any night of the week and stand at the host/hostess station for a whole 2 minutes and have to wait for the host/hostess to notice I was standing there. So, I mark them down a star because of this. 

However.... everything else about Ted's Montana Grill is amazing. I had a bison burger with bacon and blue cheese and it was absolutely out of this world. The meat was so juicy and tender. Our server (once we had been seated) was great and very attentive to our needs. The decor and ambiance inside the restaurant is great. Not too loud, not too bright or too dark. Booths are nice and private.

So... they get a 4/5 from me! I'm sure I will be back here, I just hope that the next time I return I'm greeted right away!

First off,  great service.  We had a large group for lunch and they took great care of us.  Food all came out at the same time which was great. 
Food is overpriced.  I had a bison Burger that I asked for med-rare and it came out well done.  Very bland.  Almost no flavor.  Very disappointing considering it was $19 for this weak burger and an iced tea. 
I'd be willing to give them another chance.  I may have hit them on a bad day.
Love this place!! Visiting from Arizona, my friends took me here and told me they love it. They will be back and when I come for a visit I will too. I had the Bison burger! Awesome!!

My sister & I dined in and had a wonderful experience. We both tried the bison burgers, both were very tasty. The pickle platter when we first sat down was really good too. The service was prompt and the waitress kept checking in on us. The restaurant was very clean. I'll come back for sure.

We went for dinner on a Monday evening because I had a craving for steak. The seating allows for privacy and was great for kids. The service was good. The food was amazing. Aside from the servers in jeans, which was ironic for the formal avian and the price of the food, it was perfect. I had the rib-eye which was cooked to perfection at medium rare. It was very flavorful. My husband has a burger that was melt in your mouth tasty. My kids shared the kids salmon and they devoured it. Can't wait to return!

I must have forgotten to write about my first experience here like 6 months ago... but from my memory, we liked the complementary cucumbers and then I think I got the Knife and Fork Chili Bison Burger and my husband got the Avalon Burger. We both enjoyed our meal. It was super busy, so service was slow.

We went again tonight. We enjoyed the cucumbers, they're surprisingly good! This time, I got the Avalon Burger and my hubby got the Green and Hot. He liked his burger. I thought the sauce was pretty good but the burger was messy and fell apart easily. I also thought the bison meat was crumbly and dryer than beef. I did not think there was enough sauce on the burger to compensate for the crumbly and dryness. I did like the fries though. They are medium sized- in between skinny and steak fries. Also, the waitress kept rushing us out. IE- we were only a few bites into our burgers and she asked if we were thinking about dessert. We said no, so she came back with the check immediately while we were halfway through our burgers. Also, she never asked if we wanted refills or new drinks. We had all finished our one cup before we finished our burgers. It was dinner time on a Friday so we understand it's busy, but she made it obvious she wanted to flip the table immediately. Dislike.

Ted's wasn't horrible experience, but it wasn't a fantabulous, either

My husband ordered the Big Sky Grilled Salad with Salmon.  He wanted to add some more protein so he asked how much it would be to put a grilled chicken breast on it. The waiter said it would add another $10 to the salad. For one chicken breast?!  Oy vey.

The look on my husband's face was hilarious. His mouth was open, so I tossed a few pickles in there (hoping it would keep his hunger at bay.)---In case you're wondering,  It didn't work.

I ordered the Ted's Chopped and even with omitting a few items, the salad came out fresh and large.  

The bathroom was spotless, the decor was classic with a retro touch.  It was a nice quiet spot.  I would go back, but convincing my husband...now that's a different story.

What keeps this rating at 4 and not 5 is the cost of eating there - it's soooo expensive for what it is. Two cocktails, two burgers and a kids meal is $70 with tip. That's a little high for a lunch. But that said, I love the food - I am responsible or eating all of those pickles on the table and generally asking for more. The bison is great - the portions are good and the restaurant is very pretty. The waitstaff is almost Stepford like. They check in frequently and sometimes they are slow to leave. It's not a complaint, more an observation. Certainly its better to find your waiter than not. Overall, I enjoy it I just wish it was a little more reasonable on the wallet. It's Naperville, not London.

With all the hustle and bustle in d'town naperville this spot is a nice change in pace. If you want to eat on a weekend you'd better make a reservation. Food is solid, service is usually good ... overall a great place to take the family.

On the one hand, I absolutely love bison, it's delicious, much healthier than beef, and i think has a much better texture. On the other hand, Ted's is a chain, admittedly not a huge one and it's a higher end chain, but I rarely eat at them and they always disappoint....except Ted's.

I was instantly impressed by the menu, their bison burger options were incredible. Normally I sit down and there's a couple burger options and only one stands out as unique or remotely interesting. But Ted's has easily over a dozen truly unique and interesting burgers. These are high end top notch burgers they've designed with everything from avocado to horseradish cheddar or melted gruyere. 

I had the Avalon, though I wanted to try a good four or five others. The Avalon comes with gruyere, blue cheese, crumbled bacon, caramelized onion, and roasted garlic aioli. Wow. Every bite was sheer heaven. Asked for medium, was cooked to perfection. The gruyere was the absolute perfect complement to the bison meat. And I loved the roasted garlic aioli (and that coming from one who's not a big fan of garlic). There was so much flavor, I don't even remember the crumbled bacon. My mouth is watering again just thinking of it.

One great tip, the burgers come with fries, but you can substitute the fries for onion rings. The fries are pretty good but nothing truly special. The onion rings on the other hand, superb, some of the best I've had in a LONG time. 

The prices are a bit high in my opinion, but the food is so great and so delicious that it's worth paying a bit extra.
Will be back soon for sure.

Had been talking with a friend about how great the food is at Ted's so we went for dinner.  3 of us and we had to wait quite some time for our food to be served.  It was a Tuesday night and the restaurant was full.  I guess they took the extra time to overcook our burgers.  Every single one was order medium rare and they all came out well done.  No pink at all.  Very disappointed.

Food was pretty good. Unfortunately they lied on their menu when they say their steaks are aged. I asked about how long on they age them for and the process and they said they weren't aged. Still fairly good food just false advertising.
Buffalo is one of it's claim to fame. We buffalo nachos they were good   My wife's idea of adventure was the fish sandwich .

I never ventured out of my way to go here because it's a chain, and a chain goer I am not.  Not that chains are bad (they have their time & place), but I usually find the same or better at independent establishments.  But, friends & I were having lunch, and this is what they chose.  

And yum.  I know that burgers are versatile, but every place that says, "we have burger variety!!" is usually lying or considers leaving tomatoes off as a "variety".  At this place, it was true, and the options were elevated.  I had the Avalon in bison, and while I planned to save half (watchin' ye old waistline, hear hear!), I DID NOT.  I ate it, and I did so fast and hard.  Oh yes. 

I had broccoli for a side - no problems, no glitter.  Just broc with parm.  A standby.  

Service was fine, attentive & complete.  

Ok, off to eat 8000 more burgers from here.  Seeya.
Loved the booth's quaint atmosphere, had great service, and bison burgers with fries and homemade ranch dressing were outstanding!

Ted's Ted's!
When my family reunites Ted's is our go to (a yummy burger can be a nice change from holiday turkeys.) If you are an environment junkie like myself Ted's takes extra precautions like environment friendly soap and napkins. 

The bison burgers are luscious while the toppings are fresh. The Green and Hot is my go to especially if you like something with a little kick. Gluten free options are available also.

The atmosphere is hospitable and friendly with the staff doing their best to make everyone happy!

I have eaten at Ted's a few times now It is always good. I have tried their bison burger which is good but my new favorite is the bison pot roast., it literally melts in your mouth. Ted's is not quite as trendy or fancy as a couple of the other high end steakhouses in downtown Naperville but I would still consider it an upscale establishment and it is a little easier to get into on a busy weekend night. We arrived around 7:30 without reservations on a Saturday evening and only had to wait about 20 minutes which is not bad by downtown Naperville standards. They have a pretty big bar area where you can wait and have a cocktail.  Service has always been spot on. I am not usually a dessert person but I did get hooked on the hot apple cobler, it's simply amazing.
Definitely not worth the prices. If you want a bland burger, there are plenty of places to go.

I was excited to come here based on the good reviews and the fact that they served bison meat. Overall I was disappointed with my experience at Ted's. First the host was unattentive when I was the only person in line and seemed to have an attitude when I requested a booth seat. I was seated at the very back of the restaurant near the door which had a constant cold draft due to the winter weather. The waitress was nice and attentive. I was presented with a small dish of pickles which I have to say were delicious and my girlfriend and I ate right up. We ordered the soup of the day which was chicken tortilla. The soup was very flavorful and had a nice kick to it. I ordered the $17 Red Rock bison burger (medium) with 50/50 onion rings and fries. The burger took almost 30 minutes to arrive. To sum it up, the burger was dry, overcooked, had no flavor, and was nothing special by any means. The fries were somewhat warm and not very fresh. The onion rings were bland and I couldn't eat them. Upon leaving I had buyer's remorse and started to think how I could have better spent $60 on a dinner. I would not recommend this mediocre restaurant to anyone.

Just had a fabulous meal here. I started with a perfectly prepared Tanqueray martini, shaken, not stirred, it was gin perfection! I followed with bison pot roast served with garlic mashed potatoes, gravy, and green beans. The bison pot roast was delicious, a little stronger beef flavor than regular beef.  The potatoes, with a perfect level of garlic and butter. The green beans were prepared perfectly, with a little sauteed onion & garlic. What can I say, it was comfort food perfection. My husband's salmon was perfect, served with a piquant horseradish sauce.  We split a chocolate brownie, served warm with caramel and Kahlua chocolate sauce for dessert. OMG, I can't remember when I've had a more perfect dessert!  We will definitely be back.  Btw, the bison comes from Ted Turner's Montana  ranch.

Amazing bison! If you're hesitant to try bison ask for a sample. The crab Rangoon is just three measly pieces and overall isn't worth it. The air conditioning in the summer and large comfy booths contributed to an overall very esthetically pleasing environment. Staff was friendly and funny- overall great experience!

Had the cedar wood salmon. It was dry, nothing special for the price. The asparagus wasn't cooked all the way through and was poorly seasoned. The mashed potatoes looked and tasted like they were under a heat lap. Also, I paid about $6 for a small beer. On top of the less than spectacular tasting food, the music was awful and comical, it was an ignorant representation of the music culture of that area, I grew up in South Dakota. Suffice it to say, I won't return.

Went here for lunch with my friends, i ended up getting the delicious duo, which had two sliders; one with beef, one with bison. Both were really good! The fries were very delicious, really fresh!

I dont know if i'll be back, this place is kind of expensive for me.

On my most recent trip to Ted's, I opted for soup and salad for something different. The potato soup was decent, very thick and flavorful. I had the lemon vinaigrette on my salad, that's what gives this a 4-star review. It was excellent, I have not had a lemon dressing before. On past trips I have had the bison burger, make sure to order it medium, bison is not supposed to be cooked well done because it drys out.

It's just okay..

The wait time is normally very little if any at all.  The food is obviously pre made and just reheated to be served.

The plating is very basic and semi- careless, over salted side vegetables and dried out squash casserole.   

Bottom line:  if you are in a rush or really hungry right now and food quality can be sacrificed,  it's an option.

Excellent quality bison and beef.  Excellent service. This is one of the most consistent restaurant downtown Naperville. One of the few places where you can substitute fries for a great range of side options such as sweet potato, broccoli, onion rings, asparagus, etc. Excellent place for burger if you want something other than fries to go with your burger. Dinner gets pretty busy and hectic, I like this place for lunch much better.  5 star for me. Never had a bad meal here.

Well, this blindsided me.  I expected an overpriced, under tasty, and badly served meal.  I was wrong and I might as well spit that out.  I am easily prepared to dislike, complain about and argue against most things in Naperville & Ted's surprised me.  Granted, I prefer the city but when in the burbs, this place will do!

 A couple of friends and I stopped in on an early Saturday evening. We waited around 30 minutes and were seated at booth.  Not too shabby with no reservations. Our server was friendly, quick, and helpful.  When it came time to order-one of us had the short ribs, two of us had burgers of the bison variety.  The sweet potato fries were A-ok and the burgers were right on.  The short ribs looked pretty awesome but I did not partake.  For dessert two split the cookies.  Reports were pretty outstanding.  The bill was reasonable. 

All around, little pretension (unheard of in these quarters), reasonable service and decent food.  I would happily return.

The salmon was yummy and the potatoes were great, but the green beans were so salty they were inedible. Service was good, and I do like the pickles that they serve with every meal. It's a nice atmosphere and an enjoyable lunch spot.

Maybe they had an off night.  Food was cold, almost pre-made. (Bison nachos came out in like 2 min). Too fast.  Service was good though.  I had the bison burger with a fried egg on top, the egg was cold!  Ruined my experience.  I think if they upped their game and the temperature of the food this place would be ok, But We won't be back, too many other great spots in the area.

First, one of my favorite jokes:

What did the mother buffalo say to her child as he left for school?
...
BISON! 
....

Perfect for Ted's Montana, right?!?!


Ok. For realz now.  Here's my review: 2.5

Came in to grab a small bite with my friend K.O.  I don't remember why but we just decided to dine at the bar.  We were greeted by the barkeep and got some menus.  We needed a couple minutes to review them so we did just that... but then for an additional 15 minutes! Why? Because there was no waiter or bartender in sight!  I was like whaaaa???  It was like 3:30PM on a Thursday and it barely any patrons. Come on!  Anyway, we eventually  got our order in.

Sooo, once we got our food, we couldn't help notice that the kitchen and wait staff were just standing around the border of the kitchen and bar.  Some were even eating right there, clearly visible, which I don't think you're suppose to do.  Oh, there were also a lot of people, who assumed were management walking in and out of the back room nearby the bar.  Just kinda distracting and kinda odd....

Anyway, we both got appetizers; the bison sliders and the bison nachos.  The bison sliders with the corn biscuit were pretty great but the nachos were so-so.  

Food was aiight and the service was kinda eh.  Maybe they were having an off day, who knows.  I won't them write them off just yet but my first impression... not so good.

Five stars, not because I think it's the best restaurant ever, but because they frequently serve something that I happen to be in the mood for, American classics like pot roast, meatloaf, etc. I also like that they have Goose Island Green Line on tap.

I always have high ambitions towards straying off the reservation of just ordering a bison burger every time I come here, but it doesn't help that Ted's is one of the only places I've been to in town that'll actually serve a burger rare when you order it that way. Typically it seems in suburban restaurants "rare" is "medium," "medium" is "well," and "well" is... Well, I don't even know how you classify a burger that burnt. You people who like their meat cooked how they order it know what I'm talking about!

I'm sort of confused by the reviews here that mention small portions, as a trip to Ted's almost always induces the food sweats for me. A couple tips- Don't skimp on the salad. The wedge with blue cheese (and crumbles) is heavenly. Also, swap out your fries for garlic mashed potatoes, you'll thank me later. ...Not that the fries are bad, but, man, those mashed potatoes. If I could fit it in the trunk of my car, I'd just bring a 55 gallon drum for them to fill up.

Docked a star because it seems like there's almost always a considerable wait whenever we come here. I guess it's good that a restaurant is that busy, but, the typical (at least in my experience) 20ish minute wait isn't that fun. If they did reservations via OpenTable or a similar online system, I'd be all over that.

Good bison burger and HUGE portions.  I really like how you can choose any side item in place of the standard fries with the sandwiches & burgers.  I also like how you can have any "burger" made with bison, beef, chicken or veggie patty.  They have SO MANY types of toppings, some interesting combinations - all sounding delicious it was hard to choose.

Our server, Kelsey, was fantastic!  As it was our first time she explained the menu and just had such a nice, pleasant attitude.

I have eaten here many times, however this last visit I decided to try something different. Usually I stick to ordering one of the many buffalo burgers they offer, none of which will disappoint you in the slightest! 

This time I ordered the ribeye as I was craving a steak. I should have ordered the filet as the ribeye was underwhelming to say the least. It really had no flavor at all and very little if any seasoning. This was the first time I have been disappointed in a meal at Teds! 

Stick to the buffalo burgers, I would recommend the kitchen sink burger with the fried egg! They also have the best fresh lemonade!

If you want a great burger and a fun place to eat check out Teds, just don't get the ribeye!

My issue seemed to be the same as many others. I came in on a Thursday around 730 and had to wait about 5 minutes to speak to a hostess, another 5 to get a table, when there were plenty availabe. I wouldve liked a bit more attention from the waitress so I didn't have to wait without a drink for a while... the serve wasn't that bad however, I wouldve just liked more replenishment on drinks and finger foods. As for the actual eats, they're delicous. I had a bison burger with cheddar and bacon and it went excellent with their fries. Everything is made from scratch, and they advertise the benefits of eating buffalo meat. I've had buffalo meat out in the state of montana, and this stacks up with it easily. Great food, iffy  service, expensive menu.... the quality of this food weighs my review to four stars still so that truly exemplifies how tasty this food is. I recommend a try.

A friend and I came here for lunch on a Saturday. We were seated right away and greeted by our waiter. I ordered a bowl of the Bison chili and a side Caesar salad.  Although they provide pickle chips at the table, we wanted something a little more substantial; we did the unthinkable and asked if they had any bread.  They did!  Yay! The waiter brought out a delicious plate of biscuit-like bread.  It was really good, flakey yet thick.

My chili had the perfect amount of heat to it.  There was a generous amount of meat and the flavors of the sauces, peppers, beans, and cheeses really mixed well together. The Caesar salad was nothing really special; in fact, a few pieces of the Romaine were a little wilted. I just picked around it and enjoyed the ones that were crispy (it was only a side salad).
I thought my burger was very good and the service was fantastic! I had a Jalapeno Burger and instead of fries I got a baked sweet potato in stead. Very good!

Best veggie burger in the suburbs. The best we've had in a long time. They start you off with yummy pickles, service is friendly and the food comes out fast. I love the Eco details too, such as paper straws, power soap in the restrooms, etc.

I am heartbroken to give Ted's two stars.  My hubby and I LOVED the Ted's in Schaumburg and were super stoked to come to this location with another couple after paddle boating!  Im not a big meat eater and the Schaumburg locaiton used to have the Beef, Bison and Chiken option for the burgers...not anymore apparently! :( 

I had two options for my chicken sandwhich...not very pleased about that!  The service was HORRIBLE!!! Our waitress took almost 15 minutes to first come to our table, then took forever to get our drinks and didn't even bring out our food!  Another waiter (who we were jealous of his tables because he was a rockstar!) brought out our food!  Really?  Another waiter with tables as well can bring out our food but our waitress cant? 

My husbands meal was incorrect, my chicken was kind of gross, which is SO disappointing because we would go to the Schaumburg location on a regular basis and loved it!

I do love the eco-friendliness of Ted's!  That is probably my favorite aspect of the restaurant!

We will not be coming back to this location unfortienetly...
Alway a delight when in the mood for Bison. Fun stop in downtown Naperville. Large servings and polite staff. The food is fresh and fairly quick. Reservations are the beat option.

I went here for a 30th birthday treat on a Saturday night with my wife and parents. A big bison fan I said: "finally! a restaurant around Bison!!!"

It has a great location within walking distance of a number of other destinations in cute downtown Naperville. There is a free parking lot immediately behind the restaurant.

The ambiance is masculine. Impressive brass spinning doors with what seems like bison hair seals greet you, and when you arrive inside the imposing bison bust on the wall above the bathrooms immediately catches your eye and has everyone remark at how massive and majestic of an animal it is. Everything has an old-time American feel, lots of dark wood inside with naturalist paintings of western bison herds on the wall and antique mirrors. Lighting is brighter than dim below medium lit. You can see the kitchen on the walk to your seat, everything is very clean. There are many private high-walled booths for four, creating a cozy and private feeling. They have two coat hooks at the end of each one making it super comfortable on a cool or cold day to hang your hat jacket or winter coat. Coat hooks in Chicago always make me happy I don't know why everyone doesn't extend that comfort to their guests anymore.

As soon as we arrived they provided a surprisingly refreshing bowl of sliced, lightly pickled cucumbers. Everyone enjoyed them.

The Menu: as you can see it's impressive with both innovative and classically satisfying uses for bison. The bison Nachos were clean and tasty. My wife had a salad that they put a bison burger on top of, my mother a "duo" mini bison burger plate with fries, and my dad and I each had the ribeye bison steak. All were great. 

Because Bison is dry, not tasty, and unpleasant when overcooked, and plus since bison roam free without any of the e.coli (from feeding cows corn) or mad cow disease problems of beef, they have slid their cooking scale down a bit in regards to rare, med rare etc. I agree because otherwise too many people wouldn't like bison if it was always cooked like beef. The waiter has an illustrated card of what their 'rare, medium rare, medium' etc mean to them. *** Look at it! *** I usually get rare and ordered my steak medium rare, and I got rare. My father ordered medium and it was what we would call medium rare. 

Both were excellent and full of flavor, and I loved the little American flags stick into the food. We had the asparagus and yellow squash casserole sides. The asparagus were good, not excellent, but with the steak's lemon butter on them they were absolutely excellent. The squash casserole had someone's aunt's name on it, so it should have been much tastier than it was. I was totally underwhelmed by it and that's a shame because I was so excited to try what sounded so good. The roll was delicious and flaky.

My wife ordered her burger medium though and got medium well, so it was dry and not so good at all. My mother ordered medium and received medium as we understand it, not as their picture showed which was slightly red then pink in the middle. So overall they need to get a little more consistent with their cooking.

The waiter (I forgot his name) was a middle-aged man and truly excellent. He was very clear and courteous, and patient, while being attentively "Johnny on the spot." When my beer was almost gone he soon asked if I wanted another. He brought everything in perfect time- not too fast where you feel rushed out and not too slow where you have to wonder where it was. He never interrupted our conversations once (a pet peeve of mine) in all his visits, and the one time he had to ask us something when he approached while we were talking, he waited until the end of the sentence, for us to turn to him, said "excuse me" before immediately asking his question. The check wasn't too rushed either. We were all impressed with his service and left a big tip. 

They gave me a cookie ice cream dessert for my birthday which was tasty.

This may be one of my favorite restaurants now.

I removed one star because:
-I love making bison and make it better myself at home with my secret recipe. I was hoping they would cook it with an herb or something for some pleasant taste and aroma highlights, and I expected it to be more seared on the outside by default.
-The side dishes could have been more succulent: better asparagus exists as do tastier squash casseroles
-My wife's burger was overcooked by our standards, and way overcooked by theirs.
-I didn't see any corn bread on the menu, which would have been a nice, preferable option for the roll.

Very disappointed.  The grilled chicken sandwich came with a gooey mix of melted cheese and onion straws but had zero flavor except for the extra bbq sauce I added. Hamburger had zero flavor.  Fries were cold.  Server had an attitude that he just didn't want to be working.  Not a lot to choose from on the menu and a bit pricey.  Would not go back.

First time at Ted's.  I had the Bison meatloaf sandwich,  my gf had the Amazing fish sandwich. Both were very tasty, filling for what we wanted to eat, both came with fries. All plus a beer for $26.00 before tip. Will definitely come back again.
Everything's great at Ted's, especially the Bison burgers, but sure do miss the Schaumburg location...nonetheless, it's worth the drive from wherever you live.

Teds Montana Grill, in my opinion, is so far the best place to grab a burger in Naperville. The burgers are rich and delicious with tons of flavor and meat and the menu offers tons of variety to accomadate for all the customer's preferences. I was surprised to find that the restaurant recieved 3.5 stars so i wrote this review to give this restaurant more justice. If you're looking for a burger beyond fast-food quality, then Teds is the place to go.

Expect a hefty wait for a table anywhere in downtown Naperville.  Ted's was no exception on Saturday night, with a 45 minute wait.  And don't you just hate when they guesstimate totally wrong, and you have to wait 30% longer than what they told you?

DInner rolls were requested promptly upon being seated.  (Ask, or they won't bring it to you.  Dinner rolls are much superior to pre-dinner pickles.)   A side of onion rings was ordered as an appetizer.  It comes with horsey sauce - delicious!

For the first time ever, I didn't order a burger here.  Instead, I opted for the crabcake entree.  It was justly $24 because of the abundance of crab, and they had a nice, smoked flavor.  The side of asparagus was bland though, as was the butternut squash casserole, and my mom's beer can chicken.  Don't be afraid of salt and pepper, people!  Or flavor for that matter!  Put an end to blandness!

Ted's isn't always a place I think of when deciding where to go to eat, but I always seem to enjoy it. 

Went on a Friday a little after 6 p.m. and while it was 80%+ full, the service was fast and attentive. Pros include the wedge salad-freshly cooked and crumbled bacon is always good! The meatloaf sandwich was decent, but the green beans (perfect amount of seasoning and well-cooked) were a highlight. 

My son ordered the kids steak and it was undercooked quite a bit. We had cut it into pieces and they took it back and came out with a new steak, which was cooked perfectly as ordered and the manager took it off the bill. An unexpected positive-wasn't that big of a deal, but it was the sort of attention and gesture that won't soon be forgotten. 

The service and speed was the factor that brought it up to 4 stars-a good place to eat and a good variety on the menu beyond beef or bison. Their lemonade is a must order-fresh and over crushed ice. 

The main hallway has tables on one side, booths on the other and the middle is a little narrow-part of being in an old town building setting, so if you can it in the very front or bar area, I'd recommend that.

Ate here for the second time. I was pretty happy with everything the first time I was here, however today was not as great of an experience. The service tonight was terribly slow. Our waitress forgot to fill our drinks a few times and we didn't get our food until about 35 min after ordering it. We all just had burgers and there were only 3 of us. We were all very pleased with our burgers though! Over all we got here at about 7 and didn't get our food until about 8:30.

We have seen Ted's restaurant across the country and never stopped in one until this week. Huge waiting lists at the area restaurants so we decided to checkout Ted's Montana Grill. GREAT service! GREAT food! What a delightful surprise for this chain! We'll definitely go back!
First place I have ever been that had steak on the kids menu! My 8 year old  ate it up! My bison burger was delicious. Server was great, service was fast. When in the area we will eat here again.

Recently our extended family was in Naperville for a wedding. We choose Teds based on solid reviews on Yelp and were not disappointed. Overall  the food was great. Generous portions, timely service and cooked as ordered. It was good enough we came back a second time during the week.  The plank salmon was a little over smoked.  Lots of choice on the menu to satisfy the whole family.

Teds is known for their bison burger and they did not disappoint in that category. If you don't want bison you can get any burger option in beef or chicken instead. They are decent size burgers but not enough to make you feel sick. Our waitress was very friendly, and the kitchen is fast. They have a nice variety of food options on their menu, but my boyfriend and I recommend the bison! We will be back!

Service was perfect. Our server was Ken and he was very informative and attentive. We both had the Bison burger which was flavorful but not heavy. Very juicy and the fries was fresh cut and perfectly seasoned. Our bill was $40 with tip and we only had waters. A bit expensive, but the service was great. Recommend coming for lunch cause the lunch menu is less expensive. Will visit again.
The bison has a weird taste, I prefer good old beef burgers. Otherwise, the food is good and so is the service.

Walked in while shopping in Napperville intent on having a steak. After being greeted by a lovely staff member I was seated and saw crab cakes on the menu, Being a fish lover and growing up on the Jersey shore I was hesitant to order this in the Midwest, I asked the waitress if she recommended it and was informed people rave about the, Well, I was very impressed. These are some of the best crab cakes full of crab that I have ever had! It came with a cole slaw that was amazing and fresh asparagus. Alos guacamole whihc was different wit crab but delicious! I cannot wait to go eat them again! Found out this is a franchise and being from Indiana I only hope they have the same crab cakes there. If you like crab cakes you will not be disappointed!!

Wow went  for dinner just now with two of our friends and we are all in awe of this amazing place there is a 20 ft tall chocolate rig absolutely breath taking chocolate paintings on the walls and you really feel like you are in New York or  Los Angeles 
The music is also a big part of the ambiance 
As for the food it is out of this world simple but great flavors well presented with an impeccable service 
The lamb was falling of the bone and so tender 
My wife had the salmon in a brioche tower with a surprise inside a poach egg and glazed with an aoilly  cream sauce fantastic 
Bread was serve warm 
selection of wine is not the biggest but the selection is solid 
We ended up with the drunken gelato in a handblown glass coupe gelato drowned in chocolate vodka  that said it all wow 
A fantastic experience for sure and a place to enjoy with all senses

Me and my friend stopped by there last nite at about 915pm. We asked to be seated in the corner sofa area. Were told by the host that someone would come bring us the menus in a bit. A woman came over...handed us the food menu...at that time we were also notified that the kitchen was closing in 5 minutes so we had to give our order quickly....at which time we notified her that we were here for wine n desserts only. She continued to stare....so then i asked what wines do you have? She went to get the wine menu. I thought maybe i should know what wine we wanted...lol.
After looking it over...i decided to get a cappacino...n my friend got the cheesecake n some wine...i cant remember. While bringing the wine to us...the host seated 5 more people....2 seperate groups...me n my friend just looked at eachother coz we saw our server roll her eyes and literally clang down the wine glass...oh boy. Very unprofessional. At this time it was about 930??
After that...we didnt really see her much except to give us the bill (at that time she mumbled bout being sorry to rush us b4 coz apparantly they dont have a closing time....etc etc...)....a guy came over to us to ask if we wanted refills on our waters, wine or coffee...we said just water please. And then we left... that was the service....now for the food...
OMG!! sooo rich...soo good...soo worth the attitude...lol....already luv their coffee...and desserts from the other side...so no suprise we luved the cheesecake! Only thing i would change was...i was not able order desserts from other side to enjoy there with my friend's wine and my cappicino. I wouldve luved to enjoy the creme brulee but they didnt have it on the menu...
:-(

The food is probably excellent, however I am beyond frustrated with the "service." We called for a reservation (the number for reservations is nothing more than a voice mailbox where you have to leave a message and they claim they will call you back) however nobody bothered to call us back. At all. Had this been a one time thing, I probably wouldn't be writing this review because I've been a long time customer of All Chocolate Kitchen and absolutely love it. That said, we also were interested in ordering a cake from ACK for a birthday celebration last fall and were given the name and number of someone we were supposed to contact regarding this. After several calls and never reaching this person, we ultimately took that business elsewhere. I get it, you're a popular business and maybe you don't have the manpower or hours in a day to accommodate everyone, but it's still extremely rude to not even bother getting back to people to say something along the lines of "we're completely booked but we have other dates/times available." 

That all said, I'd love to be able to give your business a try and be able to say something positive. Maybe tell your reservations person that in the professional world, you're actually expected to return calls by the end of the business day?

I had been anxiously waiting to try Primo since it's opening in February, but had to wait until my 21st birthday since it's a 21+ restaurant. Upon arrival, the hostess was so excited for my boyfriend and me to experience the restaurant for the first time and gave us an explanation of the artwork in the restaurant (all made of candy and/or chocolate!!) We started with a cheese plate that did not disappoint. It was the perfect size for its price and included some amazing jams, mustards, and breads. We were also given a bread basket that was constantly being refilled with warm bread and crackers. The two of us ordered and split the short rib and risotto for our main course. They were perfect sizes to share and we couldn't decide which one we liked better. Of course, we were so excited to try the desserts and ended up ordering two because we just couldn't decide. We ordered the flourless chocolate cake and the devil's food cake...both came with homemade whipped cream and strawberries, which were to die for! 

I am so glad I got the chance to experience dinner at Primo and look forward to eating here again in the near future!

I recently hosted a private event at Primo for work. We had the room reserved for the event and welcomed about 20 guests. 

THIS VENUE IS AMAZING! Attention to detail and service were superior. I host events often and was absolutely blown away. The atmosphere was colorful and featured striking pieces of art (made by Chef of course)!

The food was beautiful in presentation and each course was delicious. They also catered to our guests with food allergies wonderfully with attractive dishes that were equally as tasty. 

The wines were thoughtfully paired with the foods we were enjoying!

The service was out of this world. I am blown away at the level of care this team took. There was never a missing fork or a dirty napkin. They anticipated our needs and made the experience an uninterrupted one, allowing conversation to flow seamlessly among the guests. 

If you are hosting a private event, I highly recommend this venue.

Primo has a wonderful atmosphere, the service was terrific, and the food was four stars. I expected more from dessert than the creations from the chocolate store. I assumed for dessert we'd get something unique and magical, so I was a little disappointed, but it was still delicious.    

Unfortunately, we had to jump through hoops to make a reservation. We called, emailed, and even walked into the restaurant, and couldn't get anybody to take our reservation. With this type of impossible reservation system, I don't see how they can stay in business. The night we went to Primo, there were only two other tables with diners.

The last time we were at All chocolate kitchen we noticed they had opened a restaurant and we finally had a chance to try it . Absolutely amazing food, a real foodie experience. The Poblano soup is a must have . Top notch service, very personable when made the reservation, which is highly recommended as they fill up quickly. Incredible sugar and chocolate art...you have to see for yourself!
Words can't even describe the dinning experience. Overall meal was extremely delicious and meets all expectations of the European setup. Will be returning soon!
I loved everything about Primo. Decor,, cheese selection, entree & dessert. You got to check this place out.

Like being issued into Willy Wonkers inner sanctuary, double doors slide open and from the husstle and bustle of the ACK, you are taken into a fairy tale land for grown ups (21 and above a nice change for atmosphere, and guarantees no trouble  with the licence) . One cannot fail but to be impressed by the giant Catherine wheel/windmill dripping chocolate, the giant sugar art. Music maybe a tad too loud for this crowd, I overheard other tables saying the same.
Menus magically light up when opened, another great idea.
Hostess explained the art and the concept , which was appreciated.
Charcuterie boards are all the rage currently and here the focus is on creating your own from the large selection of cheeses and meat. We ordered 6 cheeses from the 10 and we found the cheeses slightly wanting in flavour, The Red Dragon (welsh chddear with wine) didn't live up to the hype, I would have preferred a great Montgomery or Cornish Cruncher cheddar for flavour. Being a french  influenced menu it was nice to see so many french regional cheese, but I would have added an Epoisses de Bourgoune, (strong) for breadth and Tomme Savoie likewise. The cheese was well presented with mustard, oil, balsamic and delicious bread and flat cracker.
We had a bottle of champagne that was both reasonably priced and well chosen before the cheese.My small ding was that our waitress was happily opening the bottle with showing us beforehand, a basic faux pas.
Lamb entree was classic southern Lamb shank over beans , simply delicious. Crfemini Risotto perfectly cooked. Both absolute winners. A bottle of Cahors was perfect choice for us. One of our party enjoyed the Reisling by the glass.
Dessert , as you would expect, matched the entrees. How could it not. 
3 Observations
1.Successfully creating a completely different atmosphere once through the sliding doors, this is spoiled by having to use the ACK bathroom, waiting in line behind 3 kids and 2 adults for 15 minutes detracted from the experience
2. There was a young man in a suit walking around the relatively small restaurant; i assumed sommelier or such. Never found out. Seemed incongrous.
3. With Chef Roby's talent, make some desserts just for Primo if you want to maintain the atmosphere of both exclusivity and magic

A welcome addition to Geneva for sure and please place a cassoulet on menu in winter.

I don't often give a restaurant 5 stars, but our first experience at Vincitori's a few nights ago warrants the highest rating. Everything ordered in our party was delicious. The service was very good. And while some reviewers have suggested that the prices are a bit high, the quality of the food was worth it. For starters we ordered the bruschetta with prosciutto--incredible. We also ordered the sausage, peppers and onions -- again, incredible. For entrees, the group selected braciola with grilled polenta, shrimp Vincitori, butternut squash ravioli, and the breaded steak sandwich. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their entrees and shared the goods. To cap it all off, we split pieces of the homemade cheesecake with strawberry sauce on one and caramel on the other. I highly recommend Vincitori's.

I came downtown late afternoon to get a haircut, then the family and a neighbor met me for dinner. I was hanging at the bar at Vincitori getting a martini while waiting for them, and we decided to just stay there to eat. They moved my tab to the table. Our very excellent your waiter Anthony took good care of us, and made some good recommendations on food and wine. Everybody had something that turned out to be great. Overall an outstanding evening.

I attended a private bridal shower here a few weeks back. There were 3 servers taking care of the whole party (two female one male). The first impression I got from the two female servers was not a good one. They stood by the server station staring at the entire party and when I got up to go to the bathroom I overheard them gossiping about a few of my family members. The male server definitely made up for it he was great and even cracked a few jokes with us! 

When the food came out I was not impressed. Everything looked and tasted as though it were a day old. Presentation was less than mediocre.  

We had a reservation until 4. Once the clock hit 3 we were told we needed to hurry up and leave at least 6 times. Not ok. 

We had a few issues when the bill came too. They charged us for people who didn't show up, charged full adult price for a 5 year old child, and charged $5 for virgin mock tails that were pretty much just pineapple juice. We asked to speak to the owner who was a complete ass to my confused mother who was just trying to pay for what she got (which was nothing special whatsoever). 

I've worked in many restaurants over the years and have never been so appalled by the attitude of a staff. Needless to say I'll never be going back and I'm spreading the word!

Attended an adorable baby shower here on a Saturday afternoon.  A male server took my drink order and made me a custom virgin cocktail; he was friendly and did a good job. However, the food was just mediocre and small-portioned (4 strips of baked chicken with a small scoop of mashed potatoes and 2 stalks of asparagus).  The gelato was served 100% rock-solid frozen, so I had to wait for it to thaw.  The worst part was the rest of the serving staff; they rushed the party out of the dining area 30 min before the party was set to end so they could set up for public dining. All but the male server seemed to have an attitude toward the guests. I don't see any reason to try this restaurant again. Not a good 1st impression!

Meh.  Been here several times and chose this as a birthday dinner- along with a birthday coupon  for $20.  My beef tenderloin was rolled with cheese and served with sauce and polenta.  Polenta was the tastiest part of the dish.. big price of chocolate cake could have used some sauce or ice cream- it was very dry.  My husband raved about his pasta dish. Service was good

I had a gift certificate for Vincitori and since we were down the street for a wake tonight, my husband and I decided to dine here. We didn't have reservations, but had no problem getting a booth in the bar area. We chose the bar because there were two crooners entertaining. The restaurant is dimly lit and intimate. It isn't a very large restaurant. The hostess was friendly and once we were seated, we were brought water and a bread basket right away. The bread was warm crusty bread served with olive oil and Parmesan cheese. Paco was our server and was friendly and attentive. He was a very nice guy and I would request him again.  My husband and I had a glass of Chianti with dinner. Since it was late we did not order appetizers or soup or salad. I think the soup and salad are al la carte since I didn't see anything on the menu that it was included with the entrees. My husband ordered the Vincitori rigatoni.  The pasta had Italian sausage, ground beef, crispy pancetta, fennel and onions in a creamy light sauce with romano cheese. I snuck a taste and it was full of flavor and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente. I had the gnocchi lamb bolognese.  The gnocchi were light pillows served with a wonderful red sauce with ground lamb dolloped with ricotta cheese on top. I thought it would be heavy but it surprisingly was not. The portions were not huge like most places so there were no doggie bags...of course, we enjoyed our meal so much, I think we would've still cleaned our plates even with a larger portion.
