During dinner the crooners sang a few Elvis tunes when I said I liked their Elvis songs. Very nice of them.  The owner came by for a chat and told us we needed to try one of their house-made desserts so we ordered the cannoli to split. It was fabulous with a crispy shell filled with a not-too-sweet creamy ricotta cheese filing and dipped in pistachios and decadent chocolate on one end. So good!  I definitely liked this small restaurant and would go back. I understand there are Groupons, as well as Restaurant.com coupons. You can also find coupons on their website.  Good deal!

We went for our first visit using a Groupon.   We were seated right away and a busboy brought water and bread.   The about five minutes later a table was seated next to us.   Right away they had a server taking their drink order.   We alerted the hostess who indicated he would be our server as well.  He then came and took our order, noticed the busboy did not leave cheese for the bread and brought some.

The food was mediocre which is not good since it is very expensive,   One of our orders was brought out not prepared correctly and the server stated he remembered.   Not sure why he didn't notice as he brought it to the table.   The food was not very flavorful and not well prepared.   Also took a long time to come out.

Service was indifferent and somewhat cold.   We drank the carafe a water and they took the empty away.   Later we had to ask to get another carafe.  One in our party was only drinking water.

Overall mediocre food and poor service with a high price tag.  We will not be going back.

Lots of atmosphere here!  Sinatra style singer belts it out from the bar. Nothing fancy on the menu. Just plain old fashioned Italian with large potions at somewhat reasonable prices. Service was excellent. Wine list is minimal but what you'd expect.  I had the Eggplant Parmigiana which was quite good. Check for a Groupon before you come in. And make a reservation as it was crowded on a Friday evening-- we were seated right away!

Came here with the Groupon, though we have been here before! My boyfriend and I had somewhere to be later that night, so we got there at 4pm - right as they opened. Now I understand that workers are still arriving and what not, but the manager's attitude kind of rubbed me the wrong way. To explain, the manager continued to talk to different people on the wait staff to tell them to pick things up or ask them about their lives. I get doing that as a manager, but when you're talking across a dining room, regardless if only one table is taken, it kills the ambience for the guests! Not to mention, he didn't ask once how we were doing or if we liked the food. Instead, he sat at the bar and watched the BYU game while talking to everyone else!

Okay, now that that's covered, the food is delicious! We ordered the grilled calamari and an appetizer pizza for our appetizers, we split the frutti de mare (seafood pasta) for our main course, and had the tiramisu for dessert. The food was fantastic - it's something different but in a good way. On top of the food being great, our waiter, Will, was also awesome. Easy to talk to, had great recommendations, and very attentive. 

I most likely would have given Vincitori a 4-5 star rating if the manager didn't kill the mood. I felt like I was at a docking station right from the start instead of an intimate Italian restaurant. I feel like professionalism has been a killer for this place.

Soooo I wanted to give this restaurant another try right? And yeah.... Good thing I had a $40 Groupon.... 

Made a 5pm reservation using Open Table. 

Got there maybe 4:50pm.... This snotty young Caucasian receptionist was like.... "Your reservation is 5pm but uhm ok... Let me get you a table"

Hmmm.... Can you be a little more boring and un- inviting?!!!? Grrrrr

Then gave us a tiny table .... I was like looking around.... Maybe 3 tables had patrons but pretty much an empty restaurant at that time. 

I asked her to give us a bigger table... she said.... "Let me see what I can do"

I was like.... You're kidding right? This joint is empty!!!! Gosh.. 

Soooo that was not a good start.... One star gone for sure....

Now our waiter, Antonio... was friendly.... We like him


We ordered the following:

Estancia Cabernet Sauvignon bottle $32 

Stuffed Banana Peppers $9.95 - a tad bit spicy but very tasty

Roasted red pepper clam soup $3.95 (got two) -- good but has more potato than clam 

Grilled chicken w/ mushroom risotto $20 -- good

Duck w/ butternut squash ravioli $30 -- very good

At first... They brought a very well done duck... My BF who never complains was like.... Antonio, you don't serve Duck well done do you? Can you ask the chef to give me a medium rare duck? 

After 10 mins.... Antonio brought the perfect duck.,, with a little pink in the middle ...

Good thing my BF saw that right away... Otherwise, they would serve a yucky tough duck to us for $30... 

Nooooo way!!!!

Banana beignets -- very good

Cappuccino -- very good

Bill was &127 minus $40 groupon = $87 plus 20% tip

Verdict: ok with Groupon.... Otherwise, will go somewhere else

Haven't been here in quite a while and we were disappointed. Seems like the prices have gone up and the quality has gone down. The restaurant had become a cliche, with a very loud Frank Sinatra type singer, who quite honestly disrupted our ability to have a conversation. Add to that walls and walls of Rat Pack artwork. The risotto was not true risotto with arborio rice and that just doesn't seem right for a high end Italian restaurant. The Caesar salad was amazing tho. But not enough to make us come back again.

If I could give zero stars I would. Horrible service. Was yelled at by the man at the bar. 

Dishonest business practices - will not accept Groupons for carry out despite not stating that they do not accept them for that. This was our first time trying them, now not only did we leave without picking them up but they lost a customer for good and luckily Groupon refunded my money. Can't say if their food is good, but this is Chicago so good pizza isn't hard to find. Good customer service is!

Food quality overall was pretty good but the portions were on the smaller side. The dueling pianos wasn't worth it. The back room was jampacked and too loud to actually hear what songs were being played.

If it was possible to give zero stars out of five, I would. My party of three walked in and there was no greeter at the entrance to seat us. Instead, we got stared at by the waiters that were serving other customers. We then waited for about fifteen minutes without service before leaving. We will not be coming back.

Haven't returned since my last review.  However returned last night. Restaurant was fairly empty so we were easily seated without a reservation.  Service was very good.  My husband had a shrimp and pasta dish was very good he enjoyed it.  I ordered the Carmelized  salmon salad.  It usually is an excellent dish.  The salmon was very good however the salad underneath the salmon was supposed to have asparagus, there was no asparagus,  it was supposed to have avacado, there was one small thin slice.   There was a good amount of artichoke.  It was quite a let down the three stars is just for the excellent tasting salmon on top of the salad.

Vincitori hosted my bridal shower and let me tell you it was perfect!  The atmosphere is so nice and the entire staff was very accommodating to our large group!  The food they made us for our lunch was delicious and the service was outstanding!  They put a champagne bar together for us and were very generous with the drinks.  The owner Bob is such a nice guy!   He felt bad about sending his chef home early, so he ran out and bought all the guys (hanging out at the bar during the bridal shower) burgers and fries because he wanted to make sure they had food to eat as well.  I would recommend Vincitori to anyone looking to host an event!

Holy Molly, did you see the huge plate or the basin in which they serve Fruitti Di Mare? You could easily bathe the baby in that. No kidding. The best part is that we ordered this to share by two of us and we didn't order anything else for the third person who came about 20 minutes late. After we saw this dish, we knew this could easily feed three of us. And to make it better it was Delicious.

Please don't judge me. I might have an addition with seafood and Marinara sauce. And they cooked the pasta just right so the noodles absorbed enough flavor from the sauce but still chewy. I loved it. 

The kid's pizza was huge as 10 inch and very thin crust. My daughter tried very hard to finish 1/3 of it. 

The lobby was nice and dark themed with huge drawings on the wall. Our waiter was very nice and attentive. He was one to recommend the Fruitti Di Mare and said it is more than enough for you two. Thanks!

My husband and I used a Groupon for dinner.  The atmosphere is romantic and cozy.  We had great service and our waiter was knowledgeable with the menu items.  The food was delicious and prepared well.  Prices here are a little steep but you truly get what you pay for- a nice evening out.

I've eaten here twice every time it has been a four star gourmet meal. Every dish tastes like it has been hand crafted by the chef. Staff very knowledgeable about the menu and what goes well with it. I especially love the piano bar and the valet service

I would highly recommend this restaurant for dinner, they do have Groupon's fairly regularly, so you might want to buy before going. The food is made fresh, so you can expect to be dining for longer then usual but the wait is worth the time.
 I did make a mistake in not ordering the French Onion soup, two other people in my party did and I was jealous! I did have the minestrone soup and it was very tasty. For a main course I enjoyed the lasagna, it was done to perfection, noodles were cooked just right and the cheese and sauce were perfectly proportioned. It was delightful eating every bite! I was not happy with the bread, maybe just a little too dry for me, even with the oil.
 The service was awesome, we did have reservations, so we were seated promptly. Our waiter was awesome and he created a delightful dinning experience!
 We will return to Vincitori!

Went here on a groupon, though I've been before.  Nice, classy place in the heart of downtown Westmont.  

As a non-Italian, I thought the food was really good.  We ordered fried calamari and I got the chicken limone over linguini.   There could have been a little more calamari in the dish, but it was good.  Served with a shrimp sauce, and a wanna be tarter sauce....meh.  The chicken limone was great, super moist (and I hate that word) and great flavor.  The sauce over it was great too over the linguini....yum. I wouldn't mind some more, right now...please?

The Italian bf had the cavatelli and vodka.... Looked good and smelled great.  He said the vodka sauce was too tomato-y.  I tried a bite, and would agree.  But overall "it was just okay". 

I wouldn't hesitate to go here again.  Reasonable prices, nice atmosphere, good food.  Over all, a pretty good place.  

And I hope the self proclaimed Irish man on date numbered 2-4 next to us made it to second base tonight.  He was sure trying!

The first time was for my birthday this month and I had a great time. Will was pleasant, funny, and very helpful. The atmosphere was very cozy, clean, and inviting. My food was great and they made my birthday dinner very special. I came again for my 2nd time last night and Will was there and provided great service once again. I recommend this place for anyone who likes Italian food and great night out.
Slow, nearly rude service. Food was mediocre. Expensive,fortunately we had a groupon. Won't be going back.

Meh. 

We started with the sausage and peppers. This is definitely a good meal starter. Spicy and flavorful, a tad greasy though. 

I had the acorn squash ravioli. It was pretty good, nice and tasty. Unfortunately it was warm and not hot.

I also tried the half chicken. I'll pass on that dish. It wasn't the most desirable. The flavor was only on the skin. Not a good dish.

As far as service, Frank was ok. I felt he should've been a little more attentive given the fact that we were the only table there. The water carafe was often empty for too long.

Excellent place to eat!  Lilah is a fantastic waitress and the food is wonderful.  Portion sizes are big, so if you don't take something home, you have a good appetite!  If you want a good seat near the window, make a reservation.  Place gets packed at 7pm on a Friday.  Variety is sufficient with meat, chicken and seafood - the calamari was very tasty.  Appetizers are wonderful - get the sausage and cheese in a pepper!  Finally the burnt caramel ice cream was fantastic.  Enjoy!

Adorable, hole-in-the-wall Italian restaurant. Good service. Good food. It's a reliable standby for when you want a filling, tasty meal. I especially like the Gorgonzola tortellini, and my husband raves about the Frutti de Mare (quite possibly the biggest dish I have ever seen). If you go on a weekend, make a reservation. Otherwise, just pull up a seat at the bar. The bartenders are friendly and the drinks are flowing!

Absolutely the BEST Lamb in the world! Ok, I haven't had lamb all over the world but I can't imagine how lamb could possibly taste better! Chef Bob marinates the lamb in a Garlic & Chianti reduction sauce that is Amazing!!! If you like lamb you will LOVE the Signature Lamb Chops or the Lamb Chop Salad - the salad is a great dish with a twist!
We were there tonight,I didn't know they had BBQ ribs, out server Lila told me they were great, she was right, I also love their pasta fagioli soup is excellent, Ask for Lila, she is a great server
Atmosphere was ok. Food is Olive Garden only priced higher. Bartenders, bit of an attitude. Owner was a rude, cubs loser. Wait staff outstanding.

Reservations were set for 8pm...a table of 10.  We arrive on time and are immediately seated.  Our waiter approaches and kinda gives is a run down...but starts by saying that "all items are made from scratch and there is a longer than usual wait time" when ordering.   He takes drink orders and skips both of my children and myself.  When he returns 10 minutes later I let him know he missed us (how he didn't realize it is beyond me).  He is rushed and very rude.

We order appetizers for the table.  Calamari, Burrata and Baked Clams.  With a table of 10, you would expect for this to be sufficient.  Nope.  The calamari was skimpy and not at all tasty.  The naked clams were "ok" and the Burrata was moderately good. They were gone in minutes and 3 people didn't eat any.  The bread was hard and the plate of parmesan and oil was a joke.

Our table ordered everything from Chicken Picatta to lasagna to pizza to sausage and peppers to need medallions.  Please reference, "everything is made from scratch"...we waited 1.25 hours for our food to arrive.  I ordered the chicken picatta and it was the worst I had ever had.  The pasta was NOT homemade as I have eaten homemade pasta since I was a child...this was not homemade.  The penne was not either.  The one thing I can give them credit for is their sauce...it was amazing as the only reason they get 2 stars.  

After almost 3 hours of dining...we all left "content" but far from stuffed and happy.  We were all full but no one raved about anything.  Did I mention that our server failed to take food orders for my kids as well?  Ugh...just a hot mess from beginning end.  Won't ever go back...

Helpful hints:  make a reservation.  It took us a week to get a reservation at a convenient time.  Use the phone number listed for this business info and NOT the one on the groupon ~ it is the fax number.

Place was jam packed and I mean jam PACKED.  There are really only 1 or 2  "nice"  tables in the whole place.  Others are sooooooooooooooooooo close to each other that you will definitely know your neighbor by the time you are finished, if you did not know them before.  I found the timing for  "reserved" tables to be a little strange.  There were a number of tables that remained unoccupied the entire time we were there.  Someone could have been seated and served and on their way without any imposition on the reservation.

Our server was initially "on the cool side"  but improved as the meal progressed.  I understand from other reviewers that servers are an issue.  If you find one that works for you ~ request them.

It looked like there was a room for private parties at the back, I don't understand why they don't open that area when not in use for a private party to accommodate more diners.  Waiting an hour in the bar area, or the front door area, is not pleasant.

The singer in the bar was great.  I could have listened to him all night.

The food was okay, I would go back.  It is not a Capri (as in Burr Ridge NOT Downers Grove ~ which is awful) but waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay better than Clara's or Carrabba's.

Groupon. Nutshell, food was good, service pretty lousy.  Initially tried seating us directly next to a couple on a date and the place was empty.  Objected & he moved us a few tables away.  Still had to listen to this guy talk about his stocks all night... poor girl. Waiter commented how they were packed 30 minutes ago, funny.  Room is ok, maybe a bit loud from the bar.  Service was slow, he only had us and previously mentioned table. Felt like we were being pushed into wine, drinks, apps, etc, & if we said no, he wasn't digging it.  Unprofessional waitering like saying "Done?" didn't add to the experience.  Food was pretty good, pasta in a vodka sauce which I asked for spicy was good.  Date's chicken dish was pretty good.  Paying check was slow because he thought clearing the only other table was more important. Generally, a missed opportunity because of poor service.
We've been dining at Vincitori for years and never have had a bad experience.  The salads and pasta are delicious and the ribeye is melt in your mouth. Service is amazing as well.

I bought a Groupon wanting to try this place out, boy did i make a mistake !first off this was the second restaurant I have been to in Westmont that i have been  to that was too dimly lit could barely see the menu! As the other yelpers noted the wait was very long, we sat by the bar and had a clear view of the kitchen doors with windows. I saw what looked to be my order come up, i knew it was because of the large bowl they serve it in. The dish was fruti de mare a dish with muscles, clams and other shellfish. The owner walks up to the dish and starts putting his fingers into it rearranging the muscles  giving the ones that did not open to the chef (the dead ones) all the while he is licking his f ing fingers! I couldn't believe it! When i questioned our waiter about it he said oh hes the head chef and he wouldnt put dirty hands in my food. Later in the evening he was talking to a couple using foul language, now im not offended by stuff like that but dont say that kind of stuff within ear shot of my date. Will never be back again, very very disappointed in this one.

We had an interesting experience here with my husband and parents on a Saturday night, using a Groupon. I highly recommend reservations. It is a tightly packed restaurant and felt very crowded and loud. It also felt pretty dark. It was so dark that my mom actually walked into the men's bathroom instead of the ladies' room because she couldn't read the sign on the door!!! :) 

We appreciated the live music. 

Plan A LOT of time for your dinner- they make your food as you order it and our meal lasted three hours. It felt like we were there for a long time. We appreciated the quality of the food. 

The service was unique. I felt our server was irritated a lot of the time with us but my parents thought he was incredible. He shook my husband's and father's hand at the end of the meal which was a nice touch.

They bring out basic white bread and butter or oil with cheese. They didn't refill the cheese. The portions are large. I had the sausage and peppers with penne and was able to eat a lot there and then have three leftover meals with what I took home! Other dishes were richer so were smaller portions- my husband had the Mussels special and finished it at the restaurant. My mom loves the lasagna- it is very cheesy- and my husband enjoyed her leftovers later in the week. My mom says the black currant iced tea is the best she's had. My dad had the rigatoni which he said was good but also very cheesy. I don't care for cheese so had a hard time finding something I would like on the menu.

I had the chocolate lava cake with strawberry sauce for dessert- it was presented beautifully and was delicious. It cost $7. My mom really enjoyed her burnt caramel gelato. 

We thought it was funny that my husband was going through his water so fast that all of the sudden someone plopped a bigger glass of water in front of him- probably so they didn't have to refill it so often. 

I don't think I would come back again but I'm happy that my parents enjoy it so much. It is a classy restaurant with quality food (and you pay for the quality) and they do a great business.

I went here on a Wednesdays night with a group of 5 for my birthday. We had a reservation, and we were seated immediately. Our server greeted us promptly, but she was a little awkward. She didn't seem to be in the best mood, and she was a little short with us. 

To drink, I ordered the split bottle of moscato -- delicious. We ordered the grilled calamari to begin, which was very good. I recommend this appetizer. Then I ordered a garden salad with their balsamic vinaigrette. For a standard garden salad, I really enjoyed it. For my entree, I ordered the garlic-crusted chilean sea bass from the specials of the day. It was good, but the it wasn't really garlic "crusted." The garlic was more just placed on top. It was good, just keep this in mind. Everyone else enjoyed their meal as well. Everything was enjoyable about the evening aside from the occasional weirdness from our server. I really liked the dim, romantic atmosphere. I'd be back!

I made reservations for 5:30pm on Mother's Day. we arrived promptly, and even though the dinning room had tables available we were seated in the bar near the kitchen door. The manager/owner was sitting at the bar watching a sports game and was very loud cheering on his favorite team. Not the atmosphere that I was looking for on Mother's Day. The service was OK, and must of the food was tasty. When the bill was presented I handed the server a $25.00 Restaurant.com gift certificate. She promptly stated that they do not accept "coupons" on holidays. I questioned the policy and stated that there was nothing in writing stating the gift certificate could not be used, so it must be honored. She stated that she was told by the manager that she could not accept it. I told her to ask the manager. With hesitation she went to ask the manager/owner sitting at the bar. They honored the gift certificate but when the server arrived back at the table, she made a remark that I was lucky because she had been refusing coupons all night. Once again I stated if the policy is not in writing they must accept it. She stated that all coupons are accepted at the owners discretion.   She then walked back to the bar and openly discussed in plain sight the exchange that I had with her. I felt that the whole exchange was very unprofessional . The owner/manager never came to the table to speak to me, which I expected him to.  I will not return!

A coupon from Groupon brought us to this restaurant. What a great restaurant
The food is amazing. Cant wait to go back!
My husband had French onion soup and the Chicken Parmesan and I had Chicken
Vesuvio ..Large portions and everything was amazing We also had a very nice server 
( Jason ) He was also amazing .

I went in at 7pm for carry out knowing it might be a little busy.  Bartender Susie was busy, did not go in expecting top service being a single carry out order person.  My issue is the food.  Ordered the Vincitori Shrimp appetizer.  Received 6 small 45-50 size shrimp swimming in a half cup of sauce with nothing to sop the sauce up with.  Ordered the Vincitori Rigatoni as the entree.  Flavor is good.  However, here there is not enough meat to justify the price point.  I spent $60 for a carry out meal for one person.  I did have 2 glasses of wine waiting for the meal.  I would expect better quality for price point.

I wanted to try this place for months and we went last week and I was totally underwhelmed.  My husband liked his pork chop meal but the basil/lemon chicken I had was just so-so.  And even with a $25 restaurant.com certificate, our bill was astronomical.  Sorry, but I won't be back.

BY ALL MEANS AVOID THIS AWFUL EXCUSE FOR AN ESTABLISHMENT. Never in my life have I been so disgusted by a business. We went here for Mother's Day for my mother and my sister. Not only was our waiter extremely ignorant to us the entire time, but we waited OVER AN HOUR for my mother's meal to find out that the waiter forgot to put her order in. He didn't even have the respect to tell us, he made up some asinine story about how someone took the food, and didn't even tell his manager! My mother stormed out of there, hungry and livid, and no one mentioned anything to a manager. I can see why though, the manager was the biggest ass of them all. He didn't even apologize at first! My brother-in-law told him "we didn't even receive an apology," and his pathetic excuse for one didn't make up for it. I was loudly saying how disrespectful and ignorant it was, and the manager didn't even come up to me to talk to me about it. When he heard me, he hid behind a wall and continued to flirt with the hostess who is obviously too young for him. I will never step foot near this place again. How can you disrespect someone like that on Mother's Day, of all days, and have nothing to offer? Fuck you and your employees. I hope you shut down.

Been here a couple times now and the food is amazing. Purchased what I thought was a great deal on restaurant.com to dine here this evening to find out that while there are no restrictions advertised, they refused to accept the purchased deal while acknowledging it is legitimate. The server gave us water, bread, and said can't do the deal. No questions about appetizers or anything else. So far I am extremely bummed out on what should be a good evening. Beware the promotions out here and just plan on full price. The food is amazing, it really is, but business side could be better.

Small intimate setting, make a reservation. If your are not one for sitting in the center of the room call and ask for a table on the side. Out table was for two people and pretty small. I am sure that if we had more table space we would have had another drink or some more food. Over all a good plate. I had chicken piccata and my friend shrimp with a spicy creamy red sauce. Tried the pumpkins tirmisu. It was so so...Great cap. Napa cellar wine was yummy too!

My sister and I went to this place last night! We found hair in our calamari, and my sister pulled a hair out of her minestrone soup! We walked out! The wait staff didn't seem to be making our situation any better. They seemed to have a glib attitude about the fact that our food was not clean! It's not our kind of crowd either. It's kind of like a scene out of Goodfellas. It seems to be a restaurant designed for the owners friends and not the rest of the community. Will absolutely never ever ever go back!

Food was alright, service was TERRIBLE.  It was just me and my 2 children.  After being ignored for 10 minutes, we were given bread by a busboy and then the waiter came and I ordered an appetizer (baked clams), spaghetti for my daughters, and my entree - all ordered at the same time.  It was about 10 minutes and my daughter's got their food, and I waited another 15 for my appetizer - a total of 25 minutes for sub par clams.  My entree followed a few minutes later and I asked for the check.  Over an hour for some clams and pasta.  Bill was almost $50 with no booze.  Astronomical for what we got.  If my husband wasn't a waiter, I wouldn't have left a tip, but I left 20% out of pure guilt.  We won't be back.

My wife and I took my father to dinner here after purchasing a Groupon. The 3 1/2 star rating seemed strong enough to warrant us to try it out, as we live not too far away. 

My father and I arrived first and we were seated as we waited for my wife to arrive. When I informed our waiter this, he seemed frustrated by it. He never introduced himself, so I'm unable to call him by name in this review. He was a stalkier Hispanic man with his hair slicked straight back and what seemed like the inability to smile.

When my wife arrived, he took our drink orders and again seemed frustrated, this time because we didn't order from the wine menu. I would later order a Jack and Coke, which was horribly watered down.

He took our order and our food came quickly enough. There weren't too many people there on a Wednesday night. The food was ok. I had the center cut filet with a side of asparagus. The asparagus was undercooked, but the steak was a nice medium rare that I asked for. My wife ordered the home made cavatelli pasta. She said it was overcooked, with chunks of Parmesan throughout. My dad got the Shrimp Vincitori. He said it was ok and could have used larger shrimp.

I had set my phone at the edge of the table so the waiter could verify it. Without asking for my phone, he just picked it up and started looking around the screen. He quickly stated that the Groupon wasn't valid because we didn't have a party of 4. This was the first time hearing a detail like this after using LivingSocial, Groupon, and Restaurant.com. The waiter, clearly having gone through this problem with another guest, pulled up the fine print where it stated this.

I will be following up with Groupon with questions and to voice my concern that deal isn't very clear, but what followed at the restaurant was RIDICULOUS!

I admitted that sometimes you can miss that small print. I first asked if he'd be able to overlook the number in our party. No. I then asked if they'd simply redeem the amount that I paid Groupon, which was $39. No. At this point I asked to speak with a manager. Minutes passed and the waiter came back without the manager, stating that nothing could be done. I asked to see a copy of the bill. He brought back a bill for just over $100. When I bought the Groupon, I didn't plan on paying anything more then tax and tip. Now I'm looking at $115 with a basic tip. I asked 3-4 more times to speak with the manager, to no avail.

At this point, if the manager wasn't going to be decent enough to come out and speak with me, then I decided I was done negotiating about the bill. We got up and left. The waiter was close behind to take a picture of my license plate.

I got about a mile north on Cass before being pulled over by the Westmont police. I have to give it to them, they were fast!

The officers were civil and said that this wasn't the first call they had received about Vincitori's and Groupon. They said I'd have to return to pay the bill and file a complaint with Groupon about the fine print OR if I didn't, they'd arrest me for theft.

I decided not to sit in jail, so we went back.

When I arrived, the waiter gladly took my credit card, with a smile on his face for the first time the whole evening...

Another man was standing behind the bar mashing away on the computer. I asked if he was the manager. He proceeded to confirm that and also cuss me out for my indiscretions, without allowing me a word in edge wise. As he's dropping profanities, a woman and her elderly mother were attempting to leave and the old woman had a look of disgust as she heard his language. I opened the door for the women and ushered them out, apologizing on his behalf. He quickly came out from behind the bar and continued his profanity laced tirade. The police officers who were monitoring all this had to ask him to calm down and step back into the restaurant.

I wish I could give zero or negative stars to properly warn others about the horrible service and management here. Do yourself a favor and get your money back from Groupon if you've gotten one for here!

We liked it despite all the mixed reviews...service was great, martini's were made well and i like my shaken, and they took the time to make sure it was done properly.  Steak and lamb chops were perfect!  We'll be back.

Vincitori is seriously hit or miss.  Some days, it's great!  Others, not so much.  I have come to the conclusion that there must be more than one chef...a good one and a bad one.  I will go back and hope I get the good chef...because when it's good, it's amazing!!

Drove by this place at least a hundred times, cause really who stops in Westmont? 

Purchased the groupon for here so had to give it a try. 

Shrimp Vincitori was most excellent!
Chicken florentine that my partner in crime had was equally as good.

Went there with a big group of people on a weeknight and they were more than accommodating. I ordered the butternut squash ravioli and it was PHENOMENAL. Service was good and staff was super friendly. Would love to go again and try another entree.

Absolutely the worst food I ever ate in my life.  The Shrimp Vincitori left such a bad taste in my mouth I had to have a couple mints to get rid of the taste.  This was our second time eating here.  We will never come here again.  Our waiter and service was good but the food was the absolutely horrendous.

If you are looking to enjoy a night out, eat fantastic Italian food prepared masterfully by owner, Chef Bob, this is by far one of the top places to visit. I have been there on many occasions and have never, never, never been disappointed. Their service and food is top notch. Our server John was knowledgeable and very attentive to our needs. We started with Baked Clams which were fantastic. Mouth watering and delectable is how I would describe them. Then came the Shrimp Vincitori
over Angel Hair Pasta;  Gulf shrimp sautéed with garlic, green scallions,
plum tomatoes, ground red pepper, finished with white wine, cream and Romano cheese, and glass of Cabernet. ......OMG, how delicious! Then to top things off I enjoyed a piece of the homemade Tiramisu. Couldn't have spent my birthday any better.

Probably the worst meal I've ever eaten at an Italian restaurant...

I had the name sake shrimp dish and the shrimp were small and rubbery. The bread of hard and the olive oil on the table was noticeably old.

I'll never go back to this place...

A Groupon brought us here and we will be going back again.  Loved the atmosphere.  Warm and friendly service.  Food was delicious.  I had an item on the specials menu - Lemon basil chicken with asparagus and orzo - Outstanding!!  They were very accommodating when my husband wanted to add ingredients to his pasta dish.  A hidden gem in Westmont.

Good Italian-Mediterranean food (some dishes were better than others) which unfortunately does not live up to the exorbitant bill to be delivered at the end of service.

Stopped in for dinner after purchasing the recent Groupon. Got in around 5pm, and had no problem getting a table for 5. Atmosphere was intimate, however bordering an almost dismal feel (Light it up a bit!). Advised the server off the bat we were using a Groupon, which wasn't a hassle (some places look at you like an idiot when you have one) and did not exclude anything from the dinner menu - Sweet. Water and warm bread came quick (great with oil and Parmesan), but everything else seemed to be at a slower pace. Not terrible, just slower. Ordered drinks, including a $35 bottle of Chenin Blanc (later stopped at Binny's and got the same bottle for $10.99 - FAIL), and the Stuffed Banana Peppers app. Peppers were a little watery, but tasty, had a nice fiery spice, and plenty for two people. Dinner & Caesar salads served were run-of-the-mill, nothing out of the ordinary. Entrees followed after a short while, comprised of the Beef Medallion Trio with Asparagus (Garlic, Bleu Cheese, and Horseradish Medallions), Braciola with Grilled Polenta, Shrimp Vincitori (for the kid, actually an appetizer), and Grilled Salmon. Two of the three medallions were great (Garlic & Bleu Cheese), but the Horseradish needs a quick 86 from the tasty Trio. While not as overpowering as some horseradish dishes I have had, it only took away from what were some great, succulent pieces of meat (Server advised we can substitute after the fact...two Garlics would have been bliss). The included asparagus spears were unfortunately undercooked and under-seasoned. My wife's Braciola with Polenta was "eh, not bad", however a dish which will definitely be skipped if we ever make it back to Vincitori (I think it was a bit lacking in the taste department). No complaints today from the Grilled Salmon group (didn't try it, but looked appealing). The Shrimp Vincitori received rave reviews from my eight year old, which is always great. Devoured in minutes, with the white wine, cream, and cheese sauce the element which put the dish over the top. 

A family of five, a $40 Groupon, and still a bill of over $150. I'll say the service was very attentive and friendly, and more than met our expectations. Regrettably, I can't say the same for the food, especially considering most entrees fall in the $18-$35 range. Like I said earlier, Good Italian food, average atmosphere, great service, but very overpriced, both food and drinks. Bring plenty of time and money...

We recently moved to Westmont and have been to Vincitori's twice. The first time they were fairly busy but our waiter was very jovial and seemed to truly love his job and ensure that we enjoyed ourselves.
We went again on Halloween and the place was really slow. We sat at the bar and the bartender Frank was awesome. My husband ordered a duck special and loved it. I ordered their signature shrimp dish and well, it just came out ....bad. When I sent it back the head chef and I think owner, Bob, insisted that I let him personally make me a new dish. IT WAS FRICKIN DELICIOUS! I love a place that makes sure to correct their mistakes and turn around an experience. Also, the pumpkin tiramisu is amazing.
I can't wait to try their pizza, I hear it's the best around.

Husband and i decided to give this place a try and this will be our first and last time going there. The waiter was very passive, he did not ask us if we wanted a refill on our drinks and he didn't make any suggestions as to what dish to order . The food wasnt worth the price. Unless your a regular they wont notice you!

Really enjoyed this place.  Bought a Groupon and went with my husband for date night.  Ambiance was romantic.  Food was SPECTACULAR!  Server upsold us to a bottle of wine, - we were each going to get a glass, but it was incredible wine!  

Definitely make a reservation.  We heard them tell a walk-in that wait was over an hour.  Will definitely go back!

Really good food and really good service. I am really picky about service because I work in the service industry... so I place a tremendous importance on how I'm treated. This place is consistently good. The food (I've tried several dishes) is always yummy, and sometimes even great. I just can't think of a criticism...

I recently dined here and not only was the food mediocre, so was the service. The menu, overpriced for small portions was poorly assembled and under seasoned. The seafood lasagna was small for a lunch portion was $21 and had 2 very large pieces of cartilage and several small pieces. The bread "basket" had a quarter of a twin French breadstick. The waiter was short and gave a snort and sigh every time he spoke to us. The food has the ability to be good, the Vinci special was pretty tasty, but at $26, at the location, you need bigger portions or better service and/or ambiance.

The food is great.  We had their meatball appetizer, soup and split a pizza. The prior time we had pastas, both of which had great flavor.

Why three stars?.. The servers seem to really rush people. You better know what you want once you sit down.  They also like to push bottles of wine. You ask for a check and they bring you a dessert menu. I have a feeling it's not the servers, bc all the servers are the same, pushing bottles of wine and rushing people out. The first time we were there, they told us we had 45 minutes to eat because they needed the table. 

It's a shame their customer service lacks in so many ways, because their food is great.  If you do not have a groupon, or Resturant.com coupon, think twice.

The good:  huge portion.  By huge I mean enough for three meals.  Tasty food.

The bad:  i ordered the gluten-free pasta with seafood.  The GF pasta is $3.50 extra charge.  They do not have GF bread (I asked).  BUT when the GF seafood pasta arrived at my table it had  four large pieces of regular  garlic bread on the gluten free pasta.  The waitress  blamed "the kitchen."  IDK why she did not notice that  she was delivering bread physically on top of GF pasta.    Then, waitress had to check with "the manager" before allowing rejection of gluten-covered gluten-free (extra charge) pasta.   The "manager" who was ten feet away at a nearby table, did not come over to my table during the 15 to 20 min delay while they re-prepared my food.  

My dining partner had her meal put on the warmer while mine was re-prepared.  But it was not hot and had to be sent back to be warmed up.  

Total bill with bottled wine for two was $140+.

Food is four-star but minus one star for error with gluten-free, extra charge for gluten-free, and zero management response to allergy error.

I've been here a couple times with my husband, but this time (around Thanksgiving) I was hanging out with a friend. Part of the reason we went here was to see Johnny Rome perform (who we originally met at 100 South in Elmhurst). Groopies?  Perhaps.  Eitherway, we enjoy a fun night of music and whereever Johnny goes, you can usually count on amazing Italian food. I ordered the Shrimp Vincitori and I will definitely go back for it again. My buddy ordered the Caramelized Salmon Salad which he said was really good.  We both ordered the Pumkin Tirimasu and that was to die for!  I wish it wasn't just a seasonal desert.  

Since Johhny doesn't stray too far from the bar area...we generally do the same.  Therefore we actually ate our entres at the bar which didn't seem to be a problem for anyone.  Susie was our bar tender (and waitress by default) and she was excellent.    She kept us well-fed and "hydrated"!  Susie introduced me to Tito's vodka - excellent choice!  Before we left, I ordered a pizza to take home to my husband and it was a $10 special...score!  Until next time...

this is just not about the food.  have been here years ago with a friend thought was good at the time which could have been 10+ years ago, returned to same place with same friend for cocktails & appetizers.  potato skins ok, cesar salad good, pizza ok.
company great.  what makes me even write this review is based on my exit of the premises.
after several beers with appetizers & pizzas needed to use washroom facilities before i left. yes the bathroom was outdated but can still be clean. i simply could not get past the bathroom scrubber that was open & next to the toliet that an expense of $5 for a new one would remedy or may i suggest a jug of bleach!!!! this scrubber was probably the original or at least 10 years old......was sooooo disgusting!!!!! if bathroom not clean makes me wonder about the kitchen..........i will never ever go back! yuck..........do i really need to say anymore???? customers  that go & rave will give the benefit of the doubt maybe never needed to use the washroom, or are blind!!!  A sign was posted on the door that the restaurant is closed Sun & Monday from July 4th thru Early-Mid August......while business is slow during this season they should use the time constructively to clean and purchase new supplies.

Our waiter, Antonio, was indifferent and didn't really feel like he had to help us. I mean, we do have menus and a full page of specials. What more do we need? He mentioned a basic wine that was not listed on the menu and, when I asked him the price, he gave an estimate as if I was rich and it shouldn't really matter to me.

I ordered the Vinc Special, which has shrimp, chicken, veal, and portobello mushrooms. The texture of the chicken and veal were stiff and the mushrooms were shriveled and seemingly made by Uniroyal, maybe Bridgestone or Firestone.

My wife ordered an $18 dish with shrimp and there were only 7 pieces in a dish that was mostly pasta.

They take themselves too seriously over there, like they were doing us a favor. There are many other Italian restaurants that will treat you a lot better.

Never had the chance to eat here, however this review is regarding a Groupon that I have been unable to use, and will not be using at this restaurant. My husband purchased a Groupon for $20 for $40, and we made a reservation for New Year's Eve. Just received a phone call that they cannot honor the Groupon on New Year's Eve, even though the Fine Print on the voucher does not state that it is invalid on New Year's Eve, only invalid on Easter or Mother's Day. It does not state anything about any other holiday. When I told the person who called me that the voucher only states Easter or Mother's Day, he was completely indifferent and said "I'm Sorry". He did not want to help me out in any way. Now I have to try to make a reservation somewhere else. I will never eat in this establishment, which is a shame because of the many good reviews that I have seen posted below.

I ate here last night with my wife and some friends of ours.  They had a guy in the bar singing old classic songs by Sinatra, Etta James, etc which set a nice mood for our dinner.  We ordered the bruchetta and grilled calamari for some appetizers, as well as a bottle of wine.  The appetizers were fantastic!  For dinner I had Italian sausage with roasted peppers with penne pasta, which was also fantastic.  We finished off with some tiramisu and chocolate lava cake, both of which were delicious.  

Moving here recently from the city, I can say this restaurant is a gem.  I'd put it up against any Italian restaurant in the city, and it will hold it's own.  If you haven't already, I highly recommend making a trip to Vincitori, as you won't be disappointed!

Not only was the food just whatever but they servers aren't all that nice.  I had bought a Groupon to this place so it wasn't expensive at all but the food isn't worth what they charge.  After not being happy with anything we had they told me that since I used a Groupon and there was a balance of 8 dollars on it I would have to pay cash only.  They said their minimum purchase with card is 15 dollars so I then had to make my way in winter to find a ATM just because of this.  Ruined the night.
I ordered the Fruitti Di Mare and it came in a dish so large it could be used as a boat! It was good. Not great, not bad either.

We get take out from them every so often and the food is good- not spectacular, not awful.

We've eaten in the restaurant twice and each time the servers were condescending and rude. It was as if we were doing them a favor by eating there.   He was super friendly to his regulars and could care less about us. Will not eat at the restaurant again, probably wouldn't do take out if they weren't close by.  I like Westmont and try to support local businesses, but once the older folks move away this restaurant won't last, too many new restaurants coming in that offer better customer experiences and better value.  

I'm surprised that with all the negative reviews the management hasn't tried to change its ways, which is why it will probably close within five years.

In the 7 years I have had my cafe I have never stopped by. Tonight I did. I had the Chicken Marsala. The chicken was juicy & moist it was made from fresh chicken. The pasta was cooked to perfection. My only issue was the assume really did not have much flavor like the chef forgot to add seasoning. Just the basics s&p. definitely will be back in the future. Our server even though from Philly was an exceptional host. He was friendly clean & courteous. Just ask for the guy from Philly and you will have a wonderful evening.

If you like garlic, you will love this place. I, unfortunately, like most people, do not want to taste garlic 24 hours after eating at a restaurant. Every dish had it.  Every dish was overpowered by it. 

The place was overpriced, and you don't get your money's worth.  The place also couldn't decide if it was casual or upscale.  The prices are definitely upscale though. 

BTW, the restaurant really should come up with some sort of cocktail menu.
Service was slightly slow, but the food was very very good! Great date spot, live music, cozy. Definitely would go back. Chicken Marsala was phenoms!

My fiancé and I came here because of a groupon. We came on a weekday evening and were surprised and pleased by the live entertainment. Most people are used to "Italian" food being like Olive Garden or Cheesecake Factory, loaded with butter and salt but authentic delicious Italian is simple, fresh and relies on quality of ingredients. Vincitori had all this--the pasta tasted like it was made in house and sauces from scratch. Our server was awesome and nice and we will def come back without a groupon!

My boyfriend and I came to Vincitori on a later Sunday evening to try it out and use a $40 Groupon. I ordered stuffed artichoke and lobster ravioli; he ordered the Vincitori rigatoni.

Bread was good; it came warm which is the only way to serve bread. :)

The stuffed artichoke was delicious!

Pastas were a bit heavy on the sauce (especially the rigatoni, whose portion was huge), but I understand that Americans sort of expect that. (Being Italian I prefer my pasta with less.)

Service wasn't much to comment on; it was okay. But we were duly impressed with our dining experience (it is rather intimate -- i.e., dim, modest) so we'll definitely return. I look forward to trying their meat dishes next time!

I remember this quaint little restaurant in the middle of dead downtown Westmont being much better years ago. But maybe my memory is failing.

Before I came, I looked at the menu online. I saw something on the menu that I was really excited to try, but ALAS! when we got there, it was no longer available. It wasn't that big of a deal, because their menu sounds quit tasty. 

Mia famiglia e io started with the grilled calamari, which took forever to come out. Our entrees also took a very long time to come out as well-nearly 45 minutes. I understand if it was busy, but we came early on a Wednesday around 5:30-it was still early and wasn't even busy yet. The food was average. Some of the seafood was a little over cooked/chewy. I don't want to permanently put Vincitori on my list of places to never return, perhaps I went on an off day. Hopefully that is the case.

This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant--and I love Italian food!  I recently went to Wildfire--and I think that Vincitori may just have them beat in both price and quality.  The chicken vesuvio is comparable in both--but at Vincitori, it comes with these awesome, crispy potato wedges.  At every other Italian place it comes with soggy red potatoes soaked in the gravy (not bad, but not nearly as good).  

My favorite is generally their caramelized eggplant and goat cheese with gemelli pasta.  I get it most of the time when I go (though, admittedly without the goat cheese) and it has a lot of eggplant, spinach, pine nuts and flavor.  For a while they had some kind of blackened duck special that came with butternut squash ravioli (or something similar), and my brother--who can be picky about food-said that it was great.  

The ambiance is nice--kind of dark and classy.  This would be a good date restaurant.  Occasionally (like most Italian restaurants) they will give into temptation and will hire musicians.  It's sort of a small space, so that can be loud (and I'm never into cheesy singers...but I think sometimes it might be some sort of respectable jazz).  The food is so good that I'm willing to tolerate even that though!

My hunnie and I were on a double date here not too long ago and the food was incredible. 

I started with a side salad. Then I had:

Caramelized Eggplant & Goat Cheese
with Gemelli Pasta $15.95
Fresh mushrooms, spinach, zucchini,
sun-dried tomatoes, onions and garlic
topped with pine nuts.

For dessert: Cannoli which even my hunnie liked and he usually hates Cannoli.


The boys had:

Italian Sausage and Roasted Peppers
with Penne Pasta $13.95                    
Tossed with whole plum tomatoes,
garlic and Romano cheese

Which they devoured. 

My friend had:

Pasta Marinara $9.95
(with meat sauce add $2.00)
(with vodka sauce add $1.50)

...and a meatball, I believe. She really enjoyed her food as well.


:::::::::BIG NOTE::::::::: They have gluten free pasta upon request!!!! (I should have had that but that'll be next time) :]


The ONLY reason I didn't rate this place the full five stars is because when I called for a reservation for four the woman that answered the phone was snotty as all get-out. I was ready to tell her to forget it but I was really in the mood to try a new Italian place out.....I'm glad her nasty demeanor didn't stop me from coming here because this place is a gem.....I'll be back soon. :]
Excellent food and service.  However,  they are a bit pricey and all entrees are alacarte.   I would however return.

I have never had a bad meal at Vincitori - ever...

My fiance and I went here couple weeks back prompted by a Restaurant.com gift certificate we had. We came during the week and there was still a decent amount of diners there. I had the lasagna and it was truly out of this world. My fiance had the pasta in vodka sauce and it was also phenomenal. He got a side of meatballs and swore they were the best he'd ever had - that's saying a lot coming from him.

Service was friendly & attentive, atmosphere great, and location is fantastic. Very convenient for me who just stepped off the Metra and walked not even a block to the restaurant. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a good Italian meal...

Very disappointed with this restaurant.  We arrived at 4:00 on a Saturday (the time it opens), only three tables were occupied, and the service was slow!  My dish was loaded with onions (which I do not like) that was not indicated on the menu.  I told the waiter I could not eat it, and instead of saying, can I get you something else, he said, what do you want me to do with it?  I asked for plain pasta and he had to go ask the manager.  He came back and said that I would be charged for the pasta dish as well as my first order.  I told him to forget it.  I have never had this experience at a restaurant.  Possibly because we had a Groupon?  My husband's dish was fair.  We will not be going back.  There are so many other good Italian restaurants to go to!

We found the food here to be excellent!!  The beef medallions were tender, lean, and flavorful.  The rigatoni was awesome, as was the minestrone, and the pasta figouli had a nice kick, and was very flavorful too.

Our extended family visited this place for my mother-in-laws birthday. It was quite a big party. Needless to say, the wait staff was not up to the test, nor was the kitchen. Service took forever and the food was hit or miss. The winners were the Braciola, Chicken Marsala & the Shrimp Vincitori. The losers: Overcooked Pork Chops, the shoe-leather Chicken Parm, pond-scented Sea Bass and the Sausage & Peppers overladen with penne. The experience was bad enough to call attention to the owner, who promptly avoided our table like the plague. Bottom line is we spent over $400 to celebrate a birthday and couldn't even get a candle for the birthday girl's dessert. Speaking of dessert, I thought I found a fossil in the dough bites and the tiramisu wasn't quite defrosted yet. Just go to Clara's.

I have heard rave reviews from my mother about how great the food is.
I purchased a Groupon and discovered that it was going to expire on Wednesday, June 15!  So, I rounded up the family, (I have two twenty somethings living at home) and told my husband I was taking the night off from the kitchen and we were going to use the Groupon.  I made a reservation two days ahead of time for 7 pm.

We arrived at 6:50 p.m. and were told by a very young, quite shaken hostess (she must have been just barked at because customers waiting did not look happy,) that there would be a half hour wait.  WHATTTTT???? Why bother to make a reservation?  I looked around and noticed several tables were leaving.  The bar was full but did not look like "diners". My husband wanted to leave but I said, "Let's wait a few minutes."   Sure enough, within five minutes, the hostess said our table was ready and seated us in a booth in the bar area, which was fine because we were starving.  It was a small booth and my husband is 6'4 and my son is 6'2 and it was a squeeze.

My daughter ordered a chicken pasta dish.  The chicken looked overcooked.  She said is was just "ok" and said that I make better chicken and pasta. My son ordered the chicken parmigiana and experienced a somewhat nice dish.  My husband ordered the shrimp and pasta while I ordered the same dish, without the pasta, since I wanted a carb free dish.  The shrimp and sauce were delicious but I am not sure it was worth the price.  

Service was just OK and then we had problems turning in the Groupon
credit.  The waitress said, "I am not used to people using these so it will take a while."  My daughter showed her how to use the bar code.

All in all, it was a meh experience.  Our bill for four people, one drink,
one cola, was $60 plus there was the $40 Groupon discount already used!!  Absolutely, not worth the money.  Ambience was awful, too. I would recommend going somewhere else like Amber across the street for the money we spent.

I love this place. My family has been going there since they opened and we have never had a bad meal. I especially like their lasagna with meat sauce, the filet mignon and the margarita pizza. 

My parents go about once a month and I try to join them whenever I can.  They are located less than a block north from the Westmont train station so it's a great place to stop in the evening as you're getting off the train.
Amazing food right here in the suburbs. My favorite again. & again is the cavatelli with meatballs and banana beignet. Holy cow !!!!

Absolute worst restaurant experience! My girlfriend talked up this place for awhile, so naturally I was excited to dine here. The restaurant was ridiculously loud. They had live music that was cranked up to 12. Two gentlemen at the table across from us were literally shouting at one another. We even had a difficult time communicating with our waiter, of whom, only added to the woes of this place. Simply, the guy was rude and impersonal. The food was mediocre. She had the steamed clams and pasta, which, as one yelper stated, were very chewy and overcooked. I had the Vincitori rigatoni and the chef was heavy handed with the Anisette in the sauce, which was overpowering to the rest of the flavors. We finished our meal with a cappuccino and lemon Italian ice, which was the highlight to our dinning experience. Yelpers, take heed to the negative reviews of Vincitori.

For my Italian standards, food was pretty good. Dessert was AMAZING; bananas foster!!

Service was efficient. I would go back, but not in a hurry!

I have no idea how anybody could give this place 5 stars, this restaurant is horrible and dreadful, in the words of Gordon Ramsey.  The server, a younger male, was a little awkward and inappropriate during our dining experience, but we did not let that deter us.  The food was so bad, I will never go back.  I ordered the chicken parmesean and was covered with breading that eventually fell off.  The chicken underneath was gray in color and tough to cut through.  The sauce was very bland.  These chefs need to try something Italian food in downtown Chicago and think about making some changes to their menu.  People do not eat large plates of pasta with plain red sauce anymore, especially when they can make it at home, and tastes better!

Finally an Italian restaurant that is good old fashioned mom and pop recipes that are completely authentic!! My favorite is the shrimp vincitori as appetizer and anything with that gravy. yes, gravy, not tomato sauce, as any Italian knows. It's the only restaurant in the burbs that has real gravy without added sugar and is not acidy. you can buy it by the quart! This is why all the pasta dishes and eggplant taste so good. They also serve gluten free pasta and pizza. Bar is friendly and owner/chef is always around and knows you by name.
The only reason I give it a 4/5 stars is because the service isn't the best, but it wasn't bad service, either. 
The BEST family style Italian restaurant in Chicago. Even have great pizza!

Last week my fiance and I came in to try this place because he'd bought a groupon and it was in the area. When we walked in, it was packed. It was saturday night and for some reason we hadn't thought to make a reservation. The wait was over an hour. So we put our names on the list and came back, assuming that this would be the best Italian dinner ever... When we came back disappointment started to set in. The hostess tried to seat us at a table where the speakers (they had a live singer that night) would be blaring in our ears, it was very loud in there. Anyway, luckily another couple was leaving and we got their table which was a perfect seat in the corner by a window. When I saw the menu, I was a little surprised at how small it was. I usually try fettucinne alfredo at new Italian places to be on the safe side but to my surprise that wasn't on their menu. So I decided to go with the Cavatelli in vodka sauce. I got it and it wasn't good. The sauce was alright, but the noodles were like penne pasta stuffed with more pasta in the middle, it was just too much. I sent it back and asked for Chicken Limone. Which wasn't much better. My linguine was less than al dente, and the whole meal itself seemed like it had lots of lemon but lacked flavor. No matter how much salt and pepper I put on, the meal just would not taste good! To top it off, the waiter had an attitude after I told him I did not like my food, as if it was coming out of his paycheck. Then we he gave us the bill he said cash only. It'd be nice if they'd tell you that ahead of time when you tell them you've got a groupon. Nowadays many people do not carry cash and to walk two blocks in the middle of the night to an ATM is no joy.  To make a long story short, no I would not recommend this place. You may as well go to Maggiano's, it's about the same price....and no I will not be back.

We were great supporters of this restaurant and actually used their catering every Christmas. What happened???? The food is not good at all anymore. The last time I went here was about 18 months ago and was very disappointed but I figured I would give it one more try. It was actually worse than ever. Not only was the food bad but also the people employed there. There are too many good restaurants in the area. I really loved this place at one time. No more!!!!!!

Getting off work late today worked out great for trying this placein downtown Westmont. I've had it on my watch list since I saw it while trying Amber across the street. I was going to hit Uncle Bub's but as the 4o'clock hour aproached, my options expanded greatly. I called in a take-out order of Bruschetta, side of meatballs, and the gorgonzola tortellini w/ mushrooms. My server suggested the GIANT mozzarella stuffed meatball instead & I quickly agreed. All items were great. How can you go wrong w/ a meatball the size of your head stuffed w/ cheese? Little skimpy on the goat cheese topping of the bruschetta. The pasta was outstanding! Very friendly service from the bar staff. Looks like a nice place to have a drink & watch the game.

We really like Vincitori.  The staff is really friendly, great place for kids.  Last night I had the Chicken Limone, my husband had the Sea Bass - both were delicious. They have a very yummy homemade balsamic vinaigrette, too.  We love having dinner here. It's a simple place with really good food and great service.

Came in during what should be a slow time.  Not properly staffed forcing server to be host and bartender including server.  Had to answer phones, greet other customers and still serve.
Food was fair.  Braciola was overdone making the meat somewhat tough.  The risotto special claimed to have roasted tomatoes and did not indicate any onions.  The onions were not finely chopped (course chopped at best) and they overwhelmed what few tomatoes existed in the dish.  When we told the server that we didn't like onions and that there were too many onions in the dish, and nowhere on the menu did it indicate that many onions, he did not apologize and offer another dish like he stated, "What do you want me to do with the dish?"  And when we asked for a simple pasta with marinara sauce as substitute he said he would have to ask the manager.  So, even though he was performing all of the other duties, he apparently wasn't empowered to make decisions on making a customer feel respected and looking to come back because of the service.  When he did finally come back to the table he said that no substitute would be provided without charge.  At that point the fate of any future visit to Vincitori was sealed.

LOVE this place!! Have come here multiple times with different people and it never disappoints! 

Our waitress was awesome! Her name was Olivia. Ask for her bc she's great :) Very attentive, sweet, and brought tons of lemon for our water (pregnant me was very appreciative of this.) 

The beer selections are amazing and there is a huge menu to choose from.

Tonight, we ordered the cheese curds and Totchos (nachos made with tater tots) for appetizers. Both were delicious and the spicy sriracha (sp?) was awesome. 

The salmon spinach salad was terrific! They give you a huge potion of salmon. I'm actually taking half home for later. The chicken and waffles were yummy too. 

I forget what everyone else ordered, but everyone loved it! Great experience and we'll definitely be back again.

Went here for lunch with a group. On a week-day for lunch it wasn't very crowded. I had the fish and chips and upgraded to the parmesan truffle fries which were okay but not the best I have had: for that see the Chatterbox of Long Grove). It's a pub atmosphere with a number of TVs, and you can marvel at all the various taps along the wall. 

Maybe because our group was big and chatting amongst ourselves, the waitress was leaving us alone somewhat? But I had to ask her a couple of times for a refill for my water. Again, the place wasn't overly busy so that was a bit frustrating. 

Overall, a diverse menu (everything from lobster roll to chicken and waffles) in a casual setting.

Ordered: Reuben rolls,  6 mini burgers with brioche rolls,
 3 corners, fuego (spicy),  smokestack, bacon q, bison burger,  crunch burger, blueberry ale

Kayley is a very good waitress; she was helpful, smart.

Next time (if I return) I will try the tater tachos.

Split plates cost $1.99 per the menu = robbery + unintelligent thinking.

There is a problem with the way some restaurants do business in Illinois; no restaurant should charge customers extra than the menu price for the item just because that person shares his/her order with another person. It is strictly dishonest business practice for any restaurant to do this.

The food was good. The service was very good.

The food is amazing! The service is great! The beer is on point! 

They hold private parties here too. We've had family parties on the outside patio area and they do a great job catering and taking food orders. 

Love this place. The fish 'n chips are my favorite!

Live local and went a few times..very disappointed in the food ..the mini burgers came out cold,the size of burger about a quarter no meat at all..bus boy brought out and waitress no where to be found...had to go look for her had to ask bus boy  for silverware napkins mustard ketchup.Other dish shrimp tacos use to get 3 now only 2.Sat us in a corner behind a event wall ..should of left then...won't go back
Best bloody marys in the southwest suburbs. We love the staff, everyone is friendly and helpful. The food is good, we love to come on Sundays with the family.

Food was good. My beef short rib sandwich was very tasty.  My wife's steak sandwich was also very good and cooked perfectly. Her cream of chicken rice was a little less desirable.  But all in all very good restaurant. All draught beer is $3 on Mondays .

I think that a lot of the main course dishes are a little overpriced based on the taste, but I'm a huge fan of all of their appetizers. Apart from the lamb burger, I'd much prefer to just pick off of their appetizers. It's pub food, so you can't go wrong with anything like fried pickles or cheese curds. They always have a really great selection of beer as well so I usually like to try something new. Service is great, and we all leave pretty satisfied.

The menu for both food and beers as very intriguing.  Unfortunately I made a bad choice.

The pretzel stick app was great, they come with both a cheese sauce and a mustard.

For the main course I tried the BLT+C.  I am a huge BLT fan but this was just too much flare.  Just keep it simple.  The ciabatta bread was too bulky, the tomatoes were fried, and the C (Gruyere cheese sauce) made the bulky bread soggy.  It was a disaster.

15% off your bill for checking in with Yelp! was a nice bonus though.

Good beer selection and a decent environment for a bar/restaurant type of place.

Had to ding a star because my food, which tasted fine, was misadvertised.

A Philly cheese steak that was prepared like a traditional steak sandwich. If you are looking for an authentic Philly cheese steak sandwich this is very far from it and honestly does not qualify as "Philly".

I've had the burgers here before, I think I'll stick to those.

Great food! Awesome establishment! Huge selection of beers. The food is tasty for a local place - pricey? Maybe a bit but the food is tasty and worth it.

Pub chips are awesome :) Burgers are flavorful and indulgent. We usually carry out and it's still fresh and hot when it comes home.

Would be nice to get some coupons tho, once in a while :)
Great food. Good ambiance. Good beers but sometimes run out of the good stuff too quickly. May be a supplier issue? Highly recommend it overall.

This place is actually a hidden gem. I'm reading these bad reviews and am surprised. All the food I ordered came out on a normal time basis and tasted great. I suggest the lobster roll and the chicken and waffles. The beer selection is good and the staff is hit or miss. One day we had a bad server but one day I we had a great server. I can't judge them hard on servers, it's the food and atmosphere that makes me want to come back. I'm a fan and I would suggest this place if you're looking for a classier pub style restaurant to grab a cold brew and some very tasty food.

We ordered fried calamaries and tuna sashimi as appetizers. Tuna was great, loved the wasabi drizzle but wasn't the biggest fan of calamaries. We also ordered spinach and salmon salad and tuna sandwich, the fish wasn't that great. The service was nice and it's a kids friendly place.

I've been waiting to post my review of this place because I wanted to try as many different things as I could first. Here are all the things i had

Italian Sausage burger-great, juicy, covered with cheese, its definitely made of sausage not burger but i still enjoyed it

Mexicali burger- very solid, good size, moist, and lotsa guac on the burger

Build your own mac and cheese- i got it with ground beef and sausage, came with plenty of meat and a huge serving, might be my favorite thing here

Philly Cheese steak- not what i was expecting, the meat was more thicker than ive seen in philly cheese steaks, but it was still good

Shrimp tacos- good eats for sure, but not a huge plate, dont get if youre really hungry

Wild Boar Sloppy Joe- Tasted like regular sloppy joe, idk what boar tastes like, but it was still really good, the egg and onion rings compliment it perfectly

BBQ Pork- my least favorite, fell apart when i tried to eat and the meat was dry

as for sides, they were all really good and they dont skimp-french fries, tater tots, pub chips and sweet potato fries, idk if i could pick a favorite, maybe the chips

Good beer selection, they even had zombie dust on tap once!

Staff was always very nice, we had Jenna the most. 

You pretty much cant go wrong here!
Really good food and decently priced! A good place to go for casual dinner or lunch for a yummy meal!

We met some friends here for dinner and drinks on a Friday evening thinking they were open until at least 11 or 12.  We didn't arrive until around 8:30pm and ordered a few drinks before we ordered any food.  The drinks were good and our server started off very nice and helpful, but as the evening got a little later she became harder to track down.  The staff was closing down the bar/restaurant while we were still eating our dinner.  By the time we left at 10:45pm all of the chairs were pulled onto the tables and the staff was waiting for us and one other table to leave.  The food was good, but we definitely were pushed out of the restaurant and made to feel unwelcome and like an inconvenience.  Another random thing we noticed is there was no music playing and they didn't have the sound from the baseball games, just kinda odd.

Love their mini sliders ! They have a great outdoor patio in the summer and great service. It's always fun to go here with friends or family members and try the different sliders. They have many different briber sliders as well as chicken, meatball, sausage and turkey burger sliders ! All of them can also be ordered as big burgers as well. Aside from that all of their appetizers are great and they have a big beer selection.

Love this place, but management needs to take their work out of the dining room  and into an office. Not as good this time, table sticky, server never came back to check on us, needed refills, lobster roll too wet this time, wonder if they changed something in the kitchen.  Dirty dishes left on table despite the server coming to the table 3 times no now 4 times , come on management if you are sitting in the dining room you should be looking around and noticing this.
The food here is pretty decent. I've had a nice steak and a couple of good sandwiches. I really like the beer cheese soup as well. The wait staff is amazing and super friendly!
Solid choice for lemont, Definitely a sports bar type place.  Not a bad spot for a quick bite and a cold one

Great food, it was loud and the guy on the microphone needs to pull it away from his mouth about a foot. Couldn't understand what he was saying to well for trivia but the food.  Omg the food is so good! We have the baked macaroni and cheese with bacon and onions and the BBQ pork chop. It was so good. It was a surprise a sports bar type restaurant would have such good food. Sit outside in the garden if you don't like the noise. The food is really worth it.  ~new to Lemont and trying the hot spots~

Fun times. Good food. Great food. A lot of selections of beer. Sweet potato fries are awesome. Had the lamb burger. Wife had the Bison burger. Tried both and very pleased. Will make this my go to spot!

Fun atmosphere, great food, always a game on their many tvs. This is a place for everyone: young people on a pub crawl, families with kids, couples of all ages, beer samplers, etc. Somehow every dining demographic can co-exist here and have a great time. Awesome apps! Cheese curds are the best! Great selection of burgers. Even the salads are great! The lobster roll is another goodie. Has that "everybody knows your name feel" even if you technically don't know anyone there.
Have been eating here for several years, and it never seizes to amaze me. Favorite item on the menu is the Tuscan burger.

This is unfortunate, but necessary. We really enjoyed our food and drinks here. The atmosphere was great. 

Unfortunately, it was all a moot point as me and another person in our party (two out of the four of us) both had to taste our food twice. Yes, we had horrible food poisoning which resulted in the worst day and a half I've experienced in years. This was my first visit to this place, and I can't imagine I'll be returning anytime soon.

Nice place for casual dining or drinking in the Lemont area.

We sat in the bar, well, we sat at the bar, because it was open and we were good there. Our server/bartender was quite pleasant and chatty. We stayed for a lunch of mini-burgers, truffle fries and some seasonal brews. Price was quite reasonable. Lots of tv's. 

Bonus points to the establishment and to our server, for buying my Dad, a Vet, a drink on Veterans Day.
Great location, the area is growing and need a good bar to go to. Good bar food, really good beer selection. The reuben egg rolls where awesome!!

Initially I wasn't a fan of the food. However I gave 3 corners another try and I am quite pleased!  

I got the grilled buffalo chicken wrap with pub chips. And it's amazing!!!

My friend went here and put his name in with his phone number when it was busy - they got the number wrong after not confirming it, and kept him waiting.  When he inquired, he was told he would have to wait another 15 minutes for their mistake.  Forget it.

I forgot how the bf and I ended up here, but I'm glad we did!

I ordered a MiniWich Signature trio consisting of The Fuego , The Luau, and The Brooklyn. All three were fabulous! We also ordered an appetizer of the fried pickles, which were probably the best fried pickles I've ever had. It's a HUGE order, too. The two of us couldn't finish them all, and we love our fried foods! The dipping sauce served with them was exceptional.

My beverage of choice for this outing was a Strawberry Harvest lager, by Abita (they make some bomb diggity brews; I also enjoy Purple Haze and Turbo Dog. And yes, yes I did just say "bomb diggity"). After two of those and a full belly, I was a happy girl.

We came on a Thursday at about 3 p.m., so needless to say, it was pretty quiet in there, but I'm not complaining! Our waitress was nice, service was fast, and the food was great. I'd go back again if it wasn't such a lousy drive out there.
This is the most busy business in lemont. They have good food with quick service. Moreover, all the young girls working over there so. I would recommend my friends coming here.

First time here, had to kill a little time, holy fkn fruit flies!!!!!   I even moved from the bar to a table and they were everywhere.  I need to hear of a fumigation. Before I'd come back!!!!  Food was average so the rating is based 100% on the annoyance of the little creatures!!

The food here was pretty good. The only problem was the slow service. It was a Sunday night and the place was fairly empty and yet it would take our waitress forever to get back to us. We ended up being there for two hours and a half an hour of that was just waiting for our waitress to clear our plates and see if we wanted the check.
