My boyfriend had to flag down a different waitress to go get our waitress. So there definitely needs to be some training done here, because most people when they are done eating want to leave shortly after. They don't want to be feel as if they are being held hostage for a long time. I also agree with another reviewer who said they this place has a fruit fly problem. We had a few hovering over our table and plates through most of the meal.
Horrible service. Food sucked. Never going back. Waited an hour for our appetizer then it was wrong. Food was cold when we got our meals. Waitress was super slow and confused.

We came here for a really early dinner with a group of 5 and could not decide where else to go in the area, and my parents have been here a couple of times before. 

We had a bunch of sandwiches including a club, a couple burgers, a flatbread appetizer and the bison sliders. 

The flatbread appetizer was just OK. It had grapes, walnuts, cheese, arugula, onions and a balsamic glaze. It sounded really great on the menu and some of the flavors mixed well, but I felt there was far too much bread, especially on the edges. 

The club looked good, but unfortunately my cousin omitted nearly 1/3 of the toppings, which is a huge pet peeve of mine. Regardless, she said it was good along with the surprising-to-find-on-the-menu tater tots.

My other cousin and his girlfriend ordered burgers. Being the unique foodie (and used-to-be chef) he likes to add and change things when he orders. He had one of the burgers, but ordered it cooked black and blue with an added (upcharge) sunny-side-up egg on top (I know, what a freak, right?). This was a huge mess, but it came out just the way he likes it, so hey, why not?

I had the bison sliders and to be very honest I did not think they were that good at all. The bison tasted pretty bland, and although I am not an expert on bison, I felt that it was lacking something, and was kind of regretting not ordering a burger like the rest of my family. They were also pretty pricey, and for nearly the same money, I was reminded of Labriola Cafe's (Oak Brook) steak sliders which were far superior. 

I really think I just got unlucky at 3 Corners. Everyone at our table enjoyed their food except me, and I feel bad leaving only 3 stars. I really like the menu, location and atmosphere of the place and am a believer in second chances. I will have to come back for a burger and beer sometime and hopefully change my review to make it more consistent with the experiences my parents have had there; I want to like this place!

3 Stars for location, atmosphere, menu, and unfortunately everyone's food but mine.

Good food, horrible service.

I really enjoyed my 'Bison' burger with some great Parm and truffle fries. My girlfriend enjoyed her chicken sandwich. And the beer selection was above average.

However, the service was just ridiculously sub-par. It took 15 minutes to get our drink order in. I think our server only came by since we were about to leave. Then it took another 10 minutes to get our drinks. At some point we reminded her that we ordered food, and miraculously it was 'just ' ready. Although the food was already a bit cool. We didn't complain since we were already very hungry. Then we sat waiting for about a half hour for her to return with the check. Which consequently gave me time to write this Yelp review. So as I write, I wait for the check, credit card ready to swipe.

Ok...it's tough to give this place 5 stars as their menu is somewhat limited & mainly bar fare...BUT the food they serve on their limited menu...damn good eats!!!

Really nice craft, IPA & regular domestic beer list for starters.

We came for dinner but being a cheese curd lover & seeing them as an appetizer, I asked for an order & these were agreeably, by everyone at our table, the best they've ever tasted. Delicious with the sauces they provided.

Lots of burger options & have had many on the menu, but The Crunch really stands out. Great burger cooked exactly as I asked (med rare).

Oh & you have got to order the TOTS! Crunchy perfection with some ketchup!

This place is a really nice find in Lemont. I wish it was closer to home as they do everything right here food-wise in the multiple times I have visited.

Great place for a burger & beer! Congrats 3 Corners you guys are doing it right!
I don't know what it is about this place but my stomach can't hold their food for longer than 10 min and its only their food multiple times
Fun to hang out at. Everything on the menu looks great, but truthfully everything I've had here is extremely average. Staff is super nice but nothing special.

Slow at lunch but everything was spot on. From the hostess to the bartender Jenna.  Jenna was very knowledgeable of the menu which made it easy to pick a meal off their menu. Jenna had my lunch easy and quick being in a restaurant. The 3 corners burger was great

Love this place. Great for bloody Mary's and the mini sandwiches. My mom and I always split the bison and cod. It's delicious! Watched the Hawks win the 2015 Stanley cup there, great atmosphere, not too crowded. Nice outdoor seating, lots of tvs for sports watching.  definitely recommend.

Talk about solid bar food and a great selection of beer in the far western suburbs this is the place. Great burgers, solid tots, try Reuben balls too! Good desserts- chocolate chip cookie the bomb! Start with the cheese curds- best south of the border that I have had in Chicagoland! Bread pudding was great, very good beer selection

So happy to come back and try the new menu! The appetizers were really good! The beer is always good and the food was fantastic! I had a chicken chopped salad with basil dressing that was addicting! My husband had the fuego burger which was the perfect kick and not overly done (love the pairing with a slice of mozzarella- nailed it!) 

Our server Lia was awesome- she was attentive and very sweet! 

We will be back soon :) 

Thanks again 3Corners!
Great atmosphere,  great food and perfect for games with all the tvs! Outdoor patio in the summer = bonus!

Good quality food that's a few notches above typical bar food.  

I'm a regular here as it's close by and has plenty of seating available.  The menu is larger than the typical sports bar menu but not as large as a formal sit down restaurant.  Great appetizers as well as salads soups and burgers.  

In addition to the good food it has a full line of beers including craft beers.  Service is very good and plenty of TVs to watch your favorite sports shows.  

John

In my book, if you have tater tots on the menu, that's at least an automatic star for that alone.  I've been wanting to try 3 Corners for a while, as I've heard good things from friends of mine.  I went on a Saturday night, and it was pretty busy, there was a short wait for a table inside, or they offered to seat us immediately outside on the patio.  You can see the patio on your way in, and its very nice and large, but it was raining, dreary, and insanely humid that day so we opted to wait a few minutes for a table.  The food selection is what you'd expect for a classic American/Pub type place.  I had the "Crunch Burger" a half lb burger, pepperjack cheese, fried pickles, ranch aioli, on top of pub potato ships inside of a pretzel bun! (angioplasty not included).  It was very good, and best of all, they have tater tots as a side option.  I'm looking forward to going back to try some of the other burger creations.  

They also have a huge selection of craft beers, both drafts and bottles.
Loved the beer & food menu. Kale and chicken salad was delicious.   Definitely will go back often. Great for our one year old too.
3 Corners, mini sandwiches are one of my favorites!   We love coming here so much that I even had my friends baby shower here!

Wow.  The spicy Sloppy Joe (made of ground wild boar) with jalapeños and an over-easy egg on top was AMAZING!  

I'm ranking it in my Top 10 Sandwiches Of All Time.  This place hits on all the right notes, and keeps me coming back.  Glad they seem to be doing well.

Stopped in on a Friday evening to shake off the blues from a wake with a group of 5 long-time friends.  We were seated right away due to the number of peeps in our party, but smaller groups and couples that didn't want to sit at the bar had a 45 minute wait...and there were plenty of people waiting in line.  The hostess was a sweetie.  Waitress came and gave us an outstanding selection of beers and cocktails to choose from along with our food menus; She was all smiles. Not that phony, crappy smile either. She was energetic and funny.

We started out with some bacon-wrapped jalapeno poppers on a skewer.  I had a bleu cheeseburger cooked to perfection on a pretzel roll with sweet potato fries Thick, juicy burger with fresh toppings....cold beer and chilled cocktails; It was just what I needed to pull me out of my funk.  Everyone stole my fries!  Before dinner, sipped a lemondrop martini, garnished with a fresh lemon and generous on the vodka. With my burger, I chose Goose Island's Matilda. Smooth and refreshing...perfect in every way. One of my best friends drank a Coors light...which I believe is punishable by execution. 

Service is good, but you have to speak up. Even when I stood up and leaned over the bar to wave our server down, she was upbeat and acted quickly with whatever it was the table needed.

It's loud in here with the excitement of sports buzzing in the air, music playing and lots of  conversation.  Because I was with a familiar and incredibly-obnoxious crowd, this wasn't an issue , but if you go here on a first date or in an effort to converse, I'd suggest moving out to the patio, which is only open in the warmer months.  Additionally, with all the televisions, good luck keeping your date's attention...or hell, just embrace it and watch a game together. 

I'll definitely be back to check out the patio this summer. 

Note:  Bathroom was small, but super-clean and fully stocked.  Tough to find a parking spot!
Despite the removal of the 3 Corner's Club from their menu, I still love this place. The burgers are amazing and boast so many options. It's a great place to watch the Blackhawks also!

My husband and I love this place! The food is really good, we've never had a meal that we didn't like. Beer list is very decent. The staff is so friendly and very accommodating. We think the outdoor patio is so comfortable and relaxing. It's a great place to watch your favorite sport while stuffing your pie hole!

Nice, calm bar with a relaxed atmosphere. I've eaten here one time prior with no complaints, and was back for drinks over the weekend. The special was a $4 long island, and it did not disappoint! It was a little more tart than I'm used to, but I enjoyed it. Definitely had a good kick, and one was enough. Service was a teeny bit slow, seeing as we arrived around 9 and half the place was empty. This bar was a savior though-- the bar around the corner was filming a reality show which was entirely awkward, so it was nice to have a calm, normal place to hang out before the rain picked up again!
Service was slow and food was cold.  Disappointing, to say the least.  May go back and give it another try.

Great social atmosphere ! A wonderful local pub to meet friends for lunch or family for dinner . I recommend the ultimate grilled cheese , layered with fresh slices of avocado . Yum ! Cream of chicken soup is very tasty and the salads are big and fresh . From beers to hard ciders to flavored fresh brewed iced teas there's a never ending choice . I also recommend the moist turkey burger - one of the best I've had !

We often order take out from here. Never disappoints. My husband loves their food. My husband gets their sweet and spicy burger and I get a cheeseburger. Love that they are on a pretzel bun. Pub chips are delicious! I don't like seasoning on mine but he does. They make them just as requested.

Great locally owned establishment with excellent food. By now between my wife and I, we've eaten several different items on the menu. They have a good burger selection and the crunch burger is definitely my favorite burger of the bunch. Oh, they have tater tots! By far my favorite item to get is the Mac n cheese. The cheeses they use have great flavor and it is a large portion that I can never finish. My only complaint is that I love their chili but it always seems like it takes way too long for them to roll it out once it starts getting cold outside. Several times we've been there in October and even into November and they still don't have it. October would be the perfect time to roll it out. Of all the times we've been to 3 corners, I can't remember a time we were ever disappointed.

Based on our recent dine-in experience at 3Corners, I am ammending my review.  

After our less than ideal carry-out experience about a month ago, I was contacted by Kevin, the owner, who listened to my feedback and assured me adjustments would be made.  He apologized for our experience and invited us to return to 3 Corners and we did last night.  First of all, I had never experienced that kind of quick response to feedback and want to commend Kevin providing the kind of customer service that should be an example for other business owners.  

This time we ordered seafood bisque, a southwest steak salad and mini-wiches and the Allagash White Ale.  Our server was top notch - she was also knowledgeable about the large selection of beer choices.  She recommended a beer that was just to my liking.  They happened to have a $3 draft special that night so we indulged.  

The beer and the food were all very good.  I'd say the seafood soup was the best of the three, light but full of flavor.  3 Corners soups are usually the reason we go there to eat - they are house-made and one of their best menu items, in my opinion. 

The steak salad was also good - I would recommend ordering the steak medium-rare as it was pretty well done (but tasty).  The mini-wiches are always a good choice and a great value - three good size portions (fish, pulled pork, burger, etc.) of your choice on fluffy buns for $6.95...you can't go wrong. 

All in all our return visit was a great one and we'll probably give carry-out a try again soon.

I went here to watch the game with some friends... and by "watch the game" I mean, drink.  I actually hate football, but it brings people to bars to get fecked and shout things at multiple televisions.  I can blend in and pretend I needed an excuse to day drink on a Sunday when I have work in the morning.

So I guess this place is good for that- watching the game...  I wouldn't know because when football is on, it only looks like I'm watching.   It wasn't too crowded and we got a seat right at the bar.  The friends I was with seemed to think it was optimal for watching sweaty dudes knock into each other and pause every 5 seconds.  

What it wasn't optimal for, was my game strategy- try tons of tasty pumpkin beers.  They were out of everything I wanted to order.  I felt bad for our bartender, as it was obviously not her fault,  but I would suggest them adopting a beer list small enough for them to handle keeping up to date, or a chalkboard that out of stock beers can be easily erased.  

The food was slightly above average for bar food.  Interesting menu items and decent prices.  The day we went there were TONS of fruit flies everywhere.  Made it hard to enjoy the food or  my 6th choice default beer.

Love this place! Friends and I come here on a regular basis. Good burgers! Good drinks! Great food! The service is always great. They get busy and the wait can be awhile but it's well worth it! Also portions and prices are good as well.
Good Bar With good food. I like the baked Mac. They have a good menu and the company or crowd the location brings is nice too.

I don't really know what to say about 3 Corners.  I've been there about 3 times and every time there it has potential but it continues to constantly disappoint me.  They appear to have a great beer selection however, my most recent time my waitress did not know anything about the beer on tap and couldn't answer any of my questions about they beer they offer.

My most recent time around I had some kind of spicy burger with the fried jalapenos on it.  I thought this was going to be awesome because they serve their burgers on pretzel buns.  You can never go wrong with a pretzel bun.  Unfortunately they managed to go wrong with everything else except the bun.  My burger was over cooked and it was swimming in this spicy sauce.  It was an ingredient in my burger but lord have mercy a small child could have drowned in that sauce.  The waitress came by once with a drink refill after we waved her down like we were in a sinking ship.  

Someday I may venture there again when our friends that are local to Lemont decide they want to go there again.  Hopefully I'll sing a different tune.
The best sandwich in the world is served here.... turkey with cranberry compote, pear and habanero cheddar cheese all on focaccia bread.

Food was really good, service was no bueno.  We were there at 430pm, well before dinner rush and it wasn't busy.  My wife and I are former servers.  Our server took our order, then disappeared.  We paid, then on the way out noticed an employee enjoying a glass of wine.  At least someone got a refill!
Always like coming here-good food and nice beer selection. I definitely get a taste for the mac and cheese every once in a while. It's nothing real fancy but good flavors so good enough for me!

Beer beer beer beer beer beer beer!!!!
3 Corners has such an amazing beer selection that I only thought it appropriate that I write this review under the influence.  I will try and use spell chack, no promises though.
I am very excited that I finally came here.  This place is awesome.  The beer selection is dizzying.  They have so much good beer that I didn't want to leave.  They had a section on the menu for the "yard sale" which is the beer they had limited quantities of that they are almost out of and as result may be discounted.  I binged a bit on this portion of the menu.   Soooooooooooo good.  OMG, I got to try some great new, to me atleast, beers.

Try the ruben eggrolls.  Holy balls they are worth overeating for.  And did I mention that the beer selection is awesome?  They had Killians Stout on special, $2.50,   It was amazeballs.  And I didn't even know Killians made a stout.

I also ate half a hamburger, !!The Crunch!!  I wanted to surround the name with lightning, but I could not find the lightning key on my laptop.  If you happen to find it let me know.  It was a damn good burger, not my favorite, but damn good and one I will get again.  The meat was nothing special but it was so well put together and the pretzel bun was so perfect the burger part didn't even matter.  If you get it ask for fried jalapenos on it too.  
 
I don't know if I mentioned it yet, but they have a beer selection that would make you salavate like one of Pavlov's dogs.  




 MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMbeer,
The Wild Boar Sloppy Joe-fantastic.  Lots of spice and an over easy egg tops it all off

Good salad and soup for lunch - good service from the hostess as well as the staff.

I will try them again for something more complicated than what I had and I expect they'll be a 4-5 star place.
The service here was absolutely terrible. I will definitely not be back after we spent $200 there for a group of six. Soup was cold, my sandwich was chewy....very disappointed.

We recently found this place and I have yet to have a bad meal. We ate there the other night and I ate a sandwich that I want to call a piece of heaven.... turkey, pear and cranberry compote. It was one of the best things I have ever eaten.

It's the perfect place to grab a great meal, a beverage, hang with friends and watch one of the many tv screens. Though I am not a beer drinker, they have a HUGE selection and offer daily specials. I can definitely comment on the liquor selection which is very up to date and the staff is quick to offer suggestion on spirits or beer.

I can't say enough about the staff! All of them ROCK along with the management team. Always a smile on their face and very accommodating to your requests. It would be next to impossible to have a bad time there even if you came in by yourself. 

So if you are looking for a family friendly yet adult friendly bar area with a great staff and awesome food, you have found the right spot! Enjoy! It's a great place to hang your hat!
Their turkey burger and sweet potato fries are fantastic! Great place to eat in Lemont!

Go for the Bar not the Food.  Service is very very slow.  We've tried the place 4 times for dinner and my opinion has not changed.  They will most likely mess up what you order, and don't expect your server to come back after you get your meal.  If they even show up to take your order! Not sure why they get crowded, food must taste better if you drink a lot?

I was in the area visiting a friend and we decided to go in for some drinks and to watch the Blackhawks game. The service was excellent, the drinks were fairly priced and the food was great as well. Will definitely go back!!

Not that great on the food. Had the Ruben and it was average at best chewy and not worth 10 bucks. My sister had the chicken sandwich and the bacon was not cooked through. She didnt even eat it. The burgers were good but it's hard to mess that up. Beer selection is nice but someone needs to check out what the kitchen it's putting in front of the customers. Not that good.

This bar knows how to serve a Crispin.  Tall glass, little ice...perfecto!
The burgers are so tasty.  I recommend the mini burgers.  You get your choice of 3, all served on a pretzel bun.  Yum!!  Today I got the caprese, luau, and the Tuscan.  All amazing.  You can get pulled pork or fish if you wanted to mix it up.  
I've been here a number of times, and the best item on their menu is the Rueben sandwich.  I don't know what makes it so damn good, but it's awesome.  Try it!!  Besides Crispin, they have a lot of good craft beers on the menu.  Yea, sometimes they run out of the most popular ones, but that's to be expected I suppose.  If something is so good, it's gonna go quick.  
The one thing I do wish for, is that the bar had more natural light.  It has stores on both sides, so there is no way to have windows.  Maybe if the windows behind the bar weren't a brushed glass it would be better.  But not a big deal at all.  Good place to watch a game, drink good beer, and eat great food.  Good outside space too!  If I could give it a 4.5, I would.

3 Corners has been a favorite since the day they opened. Nice staff good food and drinks. They have a wide variety of beer on tap and bottles. Ask the waiter for there daily menu because there often out not uncommon at microbreweries. There food is always good. The seafood bisque is awesome so is the homemade mac and cheese. I would definitely recommend the little sliders you can get them in any burger they make. My only constructive criticism is it's loud.
Will keep coming back because it is just sooo good! Large assortment of beers. Great food. Good and friendly service

I can't wait to go back here! Such tasty food. I am not a big hamburger gal but I ordered one here and it was delish!! But the star of the meal was the tater tots. I mean who serves tater tots? They were extra crispy- just the way I like 'em. They only thing that knocked them down a star was the deco and ambiance. It looks like one big gin mill. Otherwise, all stars here!

3 Corners lacks character.  I don't think they know what they want to be, Sports Bar, or hangout for young Hipsters, as they blare music while Bar patrons are trying to watch Local Sports Events on  TV, with the TV volume off..   It's a generic suburban place, not too friendly at all, [the Ditz-Girls at the podium at the front entrance just want to know if you're coming in to eat, so they can steer you to a table of their choice, not yours.]  Other than that, they can't even utter a simple goodnight, after you've been there spending money for an hour or 2, or so.   They just stand there, talking and giggling at each other. Too much , effort to exhibit some hospitality, I guess.  Same goes for the Wet-Blanket Bartenders, who, after dealing with them 3 or 4 times now,  have about as much personality as a wet sponge, and aren't really on the ball doing what they're supposed to be doing.  [probably family members of the owners, thats probably why they're employed there].
  
The food is decent, but typically overpriced, [$10 for a grilled cheese sandwich], every appetizer is $9.00.  Regular entrees are higher of course.
  
It is a nice clean place, but really lacks character, as it is pretty white bread suburbanite boring.   Good place for the Young and Dumb.  If you like paying  $8.00 for pretzels, another $4 for a beer, and If you are easily satisfied with Mediocrity, this is the place for you.  And wait till you get a look at employee Cartoon-Kid. [You'll know him when you see him]
Food is pretty good and the prices seem fair.  Very good burgers and pretty decent selection of everything else.  I'd absolutely recommend it to a friend.

Looking for a good place to meet up with friends in Lemont? How about a place that has a large outdoor patio, good service, and down right tasty bar food? Then 3 Corners Grill and Tap is just the place for you. 

Located at the intersection of 3 roads (thus the name, clever eh?) this bar located in a strip mall was a pleasant surprise. And while the patio overlooks the parking lot- they have landscaped it enough that if you squint, you just might think you are somewhere other than a strip mall. 

We were seated promptly and given menus. The service was almost a little over bearing to start as the server was obviously oblivious to our signals that said we hadn't even looked at the menus yet as we were busy catching up. Finally- I told her I would flag her down when I needed her and that system seemed to work better for the rest of the night. 

The menu has plenty of variety with soups, salads, starters, sandwiches and entrees to choose from. I had the grilled cheese with bacon and tomato and my friend had one of their signature burgers. Both were quite tasty and mine came with tater tots so you know I was a happy camper! 

If beer is your thing- they have 15 kinds on tap, another 50 in bottles and probably 10 or so in cans- so you'd be hard pressed not to find one that you like. 

Throughout the bar and patio- there are many large screen TV's where you can watch sports to your heart's content. And if corn hole is your game- they have it available to set up on the outdoor patio to play the night away. And of course- it's the burbs so there is plenty of free parking in the lot out front. 

While Lemont is not on my beaten path every day- I know now if I'm heading in that direction- I'm heading for 3 Corners. Maybe you should too!

The food is great here but the management is horrible.  The service is close to unbearable.  The last three times I've been here, our waitress has had 6 different tables spread throught the bar and couldn't effectively manage any of them.  It took 25 minutes to get our drinks after we ordered because they're all over the bar.  We spilled our drink and grabbed a few towels from the server station and the manager just watched us clean it up without even taking a step towards us.  This bar has great potential and great food but the management is running it into the ground.  Save yourself the frustration and go to Tap House where the management Is visable and cares about the costumers.

Stopped in with my wife yesterday as we were unexpectedly in the Lemont area. The beer selection was nice and the menu looked really good. We had an appetizer and wanted to stay longer. However the service at the bar was less than stellar. Nothing really irks me more than a bartender or server on their cell phone instead of working or simply spending too much time with other regular customers. I will certainly give it another shot but I won't go out of my way to get there either. And that's really too bad because I really liked their menu. And lastly although admittedly I may be an old man the music selection was both too loud and an awful choice for that environment at that day and at that time.

Great atmosphere and service. Excellent selection of beer on tap. Good variety of food with something for everyone. This business also frequently gives back to the community which makes them a first choice in my book!

I haven't been here in almost a year due to the nature of my work. Stopped in for a drink and the bartender Jenny whom I met last summer, not only remembered my name but what I liked! Very rare and something I feel goes unappreciated, thank you for making me feel welcome Jenny

I had a late lunch here yesterday with my girlfriend.  The place was pretty empty since it was after 2pm on a weekday and we were greeted and seated right away.  Their menu is pretty big and there is a lot to choose from.  Several things looked good and I was having a hard time deciding what to order.  My friend and I ended up splitting the sampler under the appetizer menu which offered 2 mini pulled pork sandwiches, 2 mini burgers, wings w/sriracha honey sauce, tots, and soft pretzels.  It was a nice variety and there was so much food that we took a doggie bag.  We each had a beer with our lunch, too. They have a pretty impressive beer menu and you'll need a little extra time to pick out a beer.  I was definitely happy with the overall experience and would go back if i were in the neighborhood.

Really want to give this place 5 stars.  The food was excellent.  The beer was good.  Prices were pretty good too.

Over the course of the night, we were brought the wrong beer (which we didn't complain about because it was still beer), food took a long time to come (didn't care, had beer) our waitress was like a ghost that kept disappearing, there were out of beers that were on the menu, and drinks came very slowly.

Top notch food, some of the best burgers I've ever had.  The appetizer platter we got was scrumptious.  Bavarian Pretzels?  Awesome.  Fried Pickles?  Awesome.  Mini burgers?  Awesome.  Sweet and Spicy burger?  To die for.  The Fuego?  Well, the Fuego gets it's own paragraph.

Now normally when a restaurant says their food is spicy I laugh in their face, eat it and leave.  Some places this is safer than others.  Italian, safe, sushi, safe, Indian, not safe.  Come on, it's a burger bar, how spicy can it possibly be?  So when the Fuego hit the table I was not expecting it to have any fire in it at all.  But it does.  It's not overwhelmingly spicy, but if you enjoy spicy food, this is not a burger you can just power though.  But it wasn't too spicy /spiceflex

Overall, a GREAT FANTASTIC AMAZING restaurant tarnished by HORRIBAD service

The items on the menu sound amazing but don't live up to their descriptions. Friends of ours love this place but the few times my husband & I have been there the food has been disappointing.

The service isn't great either. The last time we were there the food took forever.  When they finally brought the food out they didn't have my husbands order. He waited a good 10-15 minutes until I finally walked back to the kitchen to flag down a server. His fish & chips were disgusting & slimy & the waitress didn't deduct anything off our bill for the bad service. The server wasn't attentive at all & the place wasn't even busy. 

I don't plan on returning unless we meet up with friends for a beer.
The food and beer was really good but the service was terribly slow. The seared tuna salad was great!

Idk about these other reviews but this is my first time here. The place is very comfortable and clean. I ordered the Tuscan burger and its delicious. The food came out within 10 minutes. Paired it with an Allagash White for $3! for the draught special. I will def be coming here again soon! Thank you Missy for the great service.

Decided to go there on a Thursday night with the family and we were seated rather quickly during the typical dinner service timeframe.  Our server was very attentative and the burger selection was very good.  The 4C burger was fantastic!!  Four different Cheeses and the beer selection is out of this world.  I have been here multiple times and ordered three different items with all being outstanding.

Having lived in Lemont for most of my life now and being something of a beer snob, I would never have dared to imagine that we would get a bar with such an enviable beer list.  Kids, this rivals Tribes for the Southland's best beer selection.

Continuing my comparison to Tribes, 3 Corners definitely has a leg up on the food.  My stomach is growling now recalling my the 4C burger - 4C standing for four cheeses.  What more could a girl ask for?  That might be the amazing apple bread pudding I had for dessert.  Essentially, 3 Corners offers the kind of quality food that sticks to your ribs without being pretentious.

I'll echo others in noting that the service wasn't stellar, which is the only reason my review awards 4 stars here instead of 5.  Bottom line, I couldn't be more jazzed that Lemont has this gem.

Upon further review, the food is improving by leaps and bounds. I truly enjoy the food now. The service is still hit or miss. I went two weeks ago and had bad service, today the service was pretty good. I think it's a good place with a GREAT beer list. I just wish management would really grind a service-first mentality into the front of the house

I left this review maybe 3 months ago or so, but just now realized I somehow added it for TGI Fridays. So here it goes...

Been here maybe 5 times now....food is always amazing. Today was slightly disappointing. My omelet was great, but my husband got the Mexican omelet that was supposed to have Chorizo. He said it was horrible. The Chorizo was just gross. It didn't even look like it should. He tried picking all the slices out but the bad flavor was still there. He ate about half and had them toss the rest. Very upsetting. Overall though the rest of there food is great! I always get the Californian omelet with bacon added. Delicious. Just don't get anything with the Chorizo they use. Still giving 5 starts b/c the rest of the food has always been amazing and worth the wait!

This is my 2nd time visiting Red Apple Pancake House..and it lived up the expectations that I had!  

TIP: Come hungry and expect to wait for a table!

Environment - Looks can be very deceiving! Normally I would drive past a restaurant that wasn't so easy on the eyes..but I am so so so glad that I made my way our here! Both times I went to this location was on a Sunday. The crowd you can expect it families (parents PLEASE DON'T KEEP YOUR CHILDREN IN PJS IN PUBLIC..SO GROSS), people coming after the church, high school students, and other locals from the area. Upon arriving you will be giving a number, I was number 14..and the person who walked in 15 mins later was number 59..THIS PLACE AIN'T PLAYIN AROUND! You are pretty much guaranteed a table within 15-20 mins. The staff is real nice..but the bus boys are even nicer..just over all very kind and they are always chatty with the customers! (A huge sign that they might be happy at their job!)

Food- OMG! Holy grail of breakfast food! As I mentioned, you must come hungry. From the coffee to  the omelets everything is wonderful! The portions are huge! I had the Californian oven-baked omelette (I am always thinking about Cali!) this omelette was packed with huge pieces of avocados, mushroom, green onion, sour cream, jack and cheddar cheese...a side of wheat toast..delish hash browns and overload of coffee. For the price, it's a steal! 

If you are in the area..make time to check out this gem of a spot! Good service, delicious food, and fun environment!

Date of my visit: 11-October-2016
Time of my visit: Lunch

I have been to this place before on several occasions and finally got around reviewing it.  It is conveniently located to my place of employment and I figured I'd go, since I could not figure out what to have for lunch.

The selection in this joint was not too bad and had breakfast, if I wanted it.  As usual, I asked my waitress for a recommendation and oped out to offer me breakfast, which I turned down.  I ended up ordering roasted beef panini, which came with a selection of a soup and another side order, I picked waffle fires (which I still don't get why more place don't offer).  For a dollar more, I got a salad.

The soup, I chose, was tomato basel.  Anyone who is reading this and remembers Dominick's tomato basel, this one was not it.  It was alright, just missing a bit of a kick I personally prefer.

The salad was your typical greens, tomato and some cucumbers, nothing out of an ordinary, but not too bad, I would say about average side salad and good value for that extra dollar.

The panini with waffle fries came out next.  I must say, both looked freshly cooked and had no visible or tastewise waiting period.  I thought my panini on sourdough bread was good, it did not fall apart on a touch, the roasted beef tasted fresh, tender to the bite and was nicely combined with cheese.  The waffle fires were above average, perfectly (not over not under) cooked.

The service was phenomenal.  The waitress was awesome!  Overall a solid B!  Would recommend this place and I'll back for sure.

I love brunch. Possibly my favorite meal of the day. I wish I could brunch more.

While in town for the holidays, I made plans with a friend to meet here for brunch because it was about halfway between where she lived and where I was staying. I've been to another Red Apple Pancake House in the Chicago 'burbs and had a horrible experience, so I was just a bit wary of this place. I don't know if it's a chain or they just happen to have the same name, but yeah.

FORTUNATELY, we had a really nice brunch here.... the day after Christmas.

The day after Christmas is apparently the day everyone goes out to eat. 

This place was PACKED. However, we were quoted a fifteen-minute wait, so we stayed. And it really was just only fifteen minutes or so. Whew! We were then seated quickly and promptly brought our menus and water. We all ordered (I ordered a vegetarian skillet), chatted, and had our steaming hot plates of food within twenty minutes or so. Considering the crowd, I thought that was pretty good. My omelette was good -- standard breakfast, but nothing to complain about it. It was pretty big, so I had leftovers to bring back with me.

I actualy excited to bring home leftovers to eat for breakfast the next morning... and here I am, a week later, JUST NOW remembering that I had leftovers in the fridge at my in-law's house. And I didn't eat them. DANG! OOPS.

Roughly $20 for two people to eat there. Seems pretty normal to me. In fact, as I already mentioned, it's a standard breakfast place. Nothing extraordinary. Normally I'd give a place like this three stars..... but it gets four stars because our server/the staff/everyone handled the large brunch crowd well, serving up great food and a pleasant atmosphere. Highly doubt I'll be back again because I don't live in the area, and there other places to brunch, but still a good spot.
I have been to Red Apple many times,it's outstanding,great food,great service,my go to breakfast restaurant .

The food is very good but the service is excellent. The very nice waitresses Lisa and Adriana keep everyone here feeling like they are at home. The tables are clean and always ready when new customers come in no matter how busy.

Review #401 

This was a very good experience. 

SERVICE: 5 stars. Let me start by saying our server was Jacquie (it had a "q" somewhere) and she was excellent. She didn't write ANYTHING down and she always got what we needed and our orders were 100% correct. Even when I mistakenly thought she had missed something, I realized I didn't even see it on the table. She was excellent. 

FOOD: Delicious food and huge portions. My skillet had four eggs and my husbands "crows nest" had four eggs as well. (See pictures). $8.99 for my huge skillet. The huge Apple pancake has two options: junior and the huge one we got. The huge one is $13.99 ( if I remember correctly). My skillet was great. Just enough mozzarella with plenty of hashbrowns and veggies. I usually like to add jalapeños but they had hot sauce so I was good. My sister liked her burger. It didn't have much look appeal but no biggie. The Apple pancake takes 30 minutes so put the order in right away. 

We were seated very quickly and we came in at 2:06pm with less than hour till closing. I didn't use  the bathrooms so I can't comment. The restaurant was clean. The staff were friendly. It seems very popular. Plenty of parking. Brunch hours are fine. Large portions at great prices. We enjoy coming here and next time we are in town, we will definitely be back. 

Oh and I saw the owner (I think) and his son or other male relative sitting. He took our plates at one point but he was definitely somewhere higher up on the hierarchy in that restaurant based on the interactions. He put lemon on his skillet and I plan to try that next time!!

Came here for a Sunday breakfast before leaving town. The service was exceptionally efficient and friendly; quite possibly the best I've had anywhere. My entire party loved their meals. I got the Jimmy's waffle, which was topped with nutella, custard, and an assortment of berries. My fiancée got the bacon waffle. Both were excellent, but only a single waffle.

My only gripe is that it is a little expensive for what it is; $25 before tip for the 2 premium waffles and a coffee. Otherwise, an excellent experience.

Double Yolks... I really should be ordering one egg here. Food is always consistent and servers are friendly. I don't make it here often enough. Daily specials and remember to grab an apple on your way out.

Usually consistent in quality, this place never seems to disappoint. My favorites here are the Alpine (Potato pancake combo dish) and the Down Under (Benedict made with country gravy). This place gets quite busy on the weekend and seems to be a bit noisy at times. Good food at reasonable prices.

My Mr and I live right near this place but have never given it a chance. After finding out a friends family owns this place we decided to check it out. AWESOME!

Be ware...HUGE portions....as in 4 adults can easily split an omlette! Fast service, tasty food!

Service, and food were great here! Portions and price are spot on!
You wont be disappointed by anything on the menu. Been here a few times and it has never disappointed! Traditional American breakfast/lunch menu.

The skillet I had was delicious,filling, and I had plenty to take home!

Very nice server and giant portions. My "mini omelette" filled up half my plate. I'd be scared to see what a regular portion would look like! Coffee refills were always coming without being asked and my side of sausage was three giant links when at other places it's two. 
Decor could be updated... It's just your traditional Greek place, and it could be a bit cleaner.

Amazing breakfast.  This place just does it right.  

They used real apples in my french toast, which speaks volumes of the attention to detail and quality Red Apple Pancake House provides.

Last weekend we came here--wish we hadn't.  We ordered an apple pancake and told them when we would arrive at the restaurant.  We arrived earlier than we thought. So there should not have been any time issue. The pancake was awful.  Over cooked and very little apple in parts of it.  Another person at our table ordered sausage.  It was over cooked.  Our meals looked like they were under a heatlamp for way too long.  Also, the restaurant was not busy so there is no excuse for such bad food.  The manager kept making excuses but in no way reimbursed us.  Our bill was around 40.00 Horrible customer service.  There are so many other breakfast places to go to.  Not planning on going back

Had high hopes for this place from good reviews. My experience, however, was unspectacular. My waitress was super nice though and she refilled my coffee each time she passed by. I had german pancakes and it was not too bad. Lemon and powdered sugar with my pancakes was interesting. Never had it before so Im not sure if i was eating it right. Oh well.
Biggest omelette you'll find anywhere! They also have really good sausage gravy! Ask to sit in April's area, she's great!!

I gotta say the only saving grace about living in those shitty apartments across the street (yeah, you know the ones) was having Red Apple within walking distance.

Be sure to get here early because this place is ALWAYS packed. Right around 9am is when things start to pick up and you could be waiting in line for a solid hour. But their food is definitely worth it. 

I was always a huge fan of their Popeye skillet (it had bacon, spinach, and general cheesy goodness throughout) and opted for the pumpkin pancakes when they were in season. Really, nothing on the menu here is a dud.

Pro-tip: I advise you to either tough out the wait or just go to McDonald's for breakfast and NOT go to Carol's Garden down the way and across the street. You might as well be eating out of the trash.

Ok, first this place rocks!  second. because it rocks everyone and his brother goes there so if you can get up early you won't have to wait in line or on one of the many wooden benches they've got for you.

the food is great. I sometimes go for the apple pancake. It takes twenty mins. to cook so catch your wait person first thing to get the order in.


the best thing about this place is they excel and getting stacks of people in an out. you are never rushed. stay there as long as you like but they clean the tables and set up quickly so the worst of log jams gets cleared up quickly and you get seated without much wait.

there are better apple pancakes but they are far away. this is close and yummy. if you don't like your food I'll eat it. Yum!

I have brunch here every week or so with my mother. The menu is big enough to accommodate her gluten-free diet and my normal one. 10/10 salads, always crisp every time! And big enough portions to bring home too.

Everything I've ever had here is delicious, and the servings are huge for a fair price. The staff is so  friendly and it has a nice cozy atmosphere. The Bavarian cream stuffed French toast is amazing, and the omelettes are huge and yummy :)

In the neighborhood and felt like breakfast. Read the reviews on yelp raving about the skillets so ordered the Popeye skillet.  It was ok...lots of bacon but not too fresh. The coffee wasn't that great! Hubby had a burger and it was OK. Good char on it. Chicken noodle soup was good tho. The waitress was very friendly!
Best breakfast spot in the burbs!!! My son loves the mickey mouse pancakes, I usually get the Irish skillet. Honestly, you can't go wrong everything they make is amazing!

Had the Red Apple salad and it was amazing!!! Came with soup, breadstick, and waffle fries - all for $9 on the lunch special. I'm so stuffed. Everything was tasty and fresh and I could not have asked for better! Everyone's omelets and waffles looked so good, too. I'll definitely be back!

After 17 check ins, probably more seeing as I come here so often, I am still infatuated with this place.

There's just something about it, this place is so homey. You walk in, there are apples everywhere! Pleasant employees that you will see basically every time you come in, and the food is just out of this world. Nonetheless, its really decently priced. 

If you're a plain Jane, their "From The Chicken Coop" deals are the best. My mom and I can get 2 eggs, a load of hash browns, and an English muffin or pancakes for 3.99. That's hard to beat. Keep in mind, their eggs are old country style, so you get double the eggs. :)

Just saying, this place should be named The Golden Apple. Love it. Love everything about this place. It's fabulous. I can almost guarantee you won't be disappointed... Unless of course you own a farm and are a professional cook. I am neither, so bravo apples!

Been here a few times and I have not been impressed. I am a breakfast junkie and I love breakfast food, so I am quite picky. This place is just OK. I agree with others  about the big portions, but a big portion isn't great when the food is mediocre. I've ordered a skillet and it was just OK. Nothing about my skillet stood out, except for the fact that it came with 4 eggs! It didn't have much flavor. 
I honestly can't remember what I ordered the first time I was there, only thing I remember is the dirty coffee cup and dirty fork I was given. 
Since the restaurant is a minute away from me I am sure I will be back but I know not to expect much.

Met friends here several times this year for breakfast on Saturdays- the food been good, not great and the service very good for the amount of people they pack in... and I do mean pack- I needed to ask people at other tables to get up so i could exit to go to the washroom. 

The parking can be horrible- just not enough for the amount of people they get. I have needed to circle or wait every time i have come.

*shaking head* This just doesn't happen to me.

I couldn't finish my food...

Our first time there.. been driving by for years and never really thought much about the place. The Yelp reviews drew me in, particularly Joe E who's been there like a billion and one times. We went just after lunch time, so it wasn't crowded at all... Maybe I shouldn't have snacked on toast that morning...

I asked Lisa.. "What do you think I'm going to get?".. she mumbled.."something with a lot of meat"... the "The Butcher Block Omelette"  *sigh*... sometimes I am a little predictable. That's what I ordered.. 

Lisa pulled the same stunt on me.. I smugly said "The California Omelette"... NOPE!  She wanted the Portobello Mushroom Omelette.

I'll bet she would have gotten the California if I hadn't said anything.

These are oven baked, four egg omelettes, they are loaded with fillings.. light, fluffy and delicious. Mine was really, really great. Hers was good, perfectly cooked, huge and fluffy... just like mine... but it was too mushroomy for her (I've never heard her say THAT before, I hate mushrooms so I would notice something like that) The Portobello's were just too much.. she should have gotten the California. (hmmmm...)

The potatoes are my favorite type of home fries, they get them good and crispy on the outside... fortunately for me.. Lisa gave me half of hers.. and I had some leftovers for later... delicious!

We chose pancakes instead of toast, I had the regular ones and they were great... Lisa upgraded to Pumpkin pancakes for an extra $1.. soooo worth it.. she said they were the best she's ever had.. I tasted them too and thought they were a real stand out.

So, I had leftovers, the bill was inexpensive and the quality of the food outstanding..

Atmosphere is typical suburban breakfast place.. spacious booths. Great food and value.. this place is the real deal and my new favorite breakfast place in the area!

Pancakes are huge. Had the Georgia Pecan Pancakes. Could only finish half, and I have a big appetite for breakfast. Coffee is diner okay. I like Starbucks so not as strong as I like. Bacon side is good portion and done just right - not too crisp, not greasy. 

Try this place for friendly and quick service on a weekday.

The service from the owners is top notch. The owner rings usually rings you up at the register. He's like your grandpa from the Old Country, who always knows what to say, how to say it, and makes you feel welcome. I had poached eggs with biscuit gravy n bacon. It was a good, solid, delicious breakfast.  It wasnt the most amazing breakfast Ive ever had. There wasnt anything I disliked about my experience. I took my food to go. I did notice it didnt have the best atmosphere. The dining area seemed empty n open.
This place is super awesomeness all wrapped up. Their Pancakes are AWESOME!!!!!!

My cousin had invited me to red apple too many of times and finally i was able to go. I ordered the Hawaiian omelette and i was not expecting fantastic it was. If you like Hawaiian pizza, imagine all the toppings in an omelette and it was something that I would've ever thought of in an omelette and the potatoes that came with it is also so yummy! I also ordered the Nutella crepe and it is to die for. Crepes crispy on the edges and nice and fluffy in the middle. Nutella galore topped with fresh strawberries, blueberries and raspberries. Coffee is far better than the other breakfast places as well. This is my favorite breakfast spot now and will be taking the whole family next!

I can say if you are looking for huge servings of food at a decent price, this is the place for you.

I ordered the Red Apple Skillet.  I thought the food tasted very good.  The coffee was disgusting, however.  It tasted like cheap Hill Brothers coffee.

Here's why it gets 1 star:  the interior is dark and depressing with ancient décor.  I wouldn't normally care if it was squeaky clean, but it was not.  Being that it was a Tuesday, and not very busy, I expect the place to look cleaner on the inside.  The biggest reason for the 1 star, I got horrible diarrhea about 2 hours after I ate, so I concluded that the kitchen and/or cooks are dirty, or the food is not fresh.   

This place is not for me.  Will not be back.

This place has solid breakfast and the service is great.  They give you big portions so prepare to be full.  Even with a long wait at the front we got seated fairly quickly.  Whenever I'm in the suburbs visiting my parents I love eating here.
I cannot believe this place has four stars. I ate here last summer. The coffee was so bad that I sent it back. The pancakes were completely tasteless.
Very long lines, up to an hour for groups, but worth the wait. The potato pancakes are delicious and the skillets are fantastic!

Consider splitting a single menu item here, because Red Apple Pancake House delivers quantity with the quality.

I got a Californian omelet with pancakes. My wife got a ham and pineapple omelet.

For starters, it turns out they double the number of eggs on the menu. So an item with 2 eggs actually has 4... and I guess that means the omelets have 8? That seems right, surprisingly, because I'm pretty sure the omelet alone weighed a pound.

They also seem to have doubled the amount of fillings too. My omelet wasn't particularly fluffy, but it definitely had a lot of vegetables, well cooked. They throw it in the oven at the end for a few minutes, so a light brown "crust" forms on the outside of the omelet. I like it.

The pancakes are light, as are the potatoes, which resemble scalloped potatoes without any sauce. The coffee is good and so is the syrup.

Red Apple is close enough to home to be our regular breakfast place from now on. It also helps that we get three meals for the price of one.

Signed up on Yelp just to write this review!

Like all other 5 star reviews - great food and large portions.  Met a friend on a Saturday morning and had a 10 minute wait, no biggie.  REALLY liked our waitress, Darlene!  Despite the large crowd, she NEVER rushed us and was always around to top off my coffee!  Had my "go to" breakfast - bacon, tomato & feta cheese omelet.  Awesome!  Make an effort to try this place out... you won't regret it!

Oh red apple how I love thee.. Let me count the ways! 

Anyone who doesn't love this place is a miserable, snobby, picky, looking to complain about something kind of person! Sure I've always had a long wait to be seated , but so what! The food is so good, the bacon ( mmmmmmm bacon) is perfect, the coffee is served in a big mug. The wait staff is great, even the guys who clean off the table are super nice and funny guys!  

I used to go their all the time because I dated someone close by, now I travel like 35 mins to get there less often but I think about it every time I go out for breakfast! 

I wish I could head out there more often. 5 stars every time! 

*on a side note; I hate hate hate hate hate pancakes HOWEVER- I don't know what magic ingredients you guys use in your batter but in over 25+ years I have never enjoyed a pancake. But I tried the one at red apple ( just for kicks cause it came with my meal) and OMG! my eyes have been opened, but only for red apple , because every other pancake anywhere else sucks.

Nice family spot for good breakfast.  Lot of Eggs Benedict options. I will have to try that, and maybe up my review.  I got the skillet, my fiance got bacon and eggs and was underwhelmed by the eggs.  Nice place though.

Meh.  Bring your Tums.  The food is just OK...typical greasy-spoon fare.  My husband has ordered from here twice and the food arrived cold - not sure how that's even possible in a busy high-turnover restaurant.  It is a very cluttered environment with tables smashed in very close to one another, so I do not prefer the crush-of-humanity atmosphere.  Curiously, for some reason they find it necessary to dress the waitresses in bar wench-type costumes, not unlike the St. Pauli girl beer bottle stickers.  So along with your cold greasy plate of cholesterol, with so much skin being bared, you will also likely be treated to an assortment of hickies and cleavage as we were.  If you are up for the 3am low brow bar crowd serving you sub-mediocre breakfast, then this place is for you.  If you are up for some hot and tasty breakfast food one level above Red Apple, you'd be better off going to McDonald's.
Great breakfast. Had the Classic Benedict and my friend had the vegetarian skillet.  Large portions at a good price

Friendly staff, generous portions & delicious food!  The only downside is that the wait is very long on the weekends. Be sure to check in regular where you are in line, our number was accidently crossed off last mothers day and our wait went from 15 minutes to 2 hours.

Went here for breakfast with the family.

It was very busy on Sunday, but the wait wasn't too long. 

The Red Apple skillet was really good, and it was plentiful enough to reheat the leftovers the next day. 

The man loved the biscuits and gravy, preferring them over the biscuits and gravy we get from our usual breakfast place, and the kids loved their eggs and pancakes. 

I would definitely go back. Our waitress was really nice, too.
I loveee this place. The breakfast is amazing. & large portions too. Very friendly atmosphere.

Breakfast, I'll be seeing you a lot more often now that I've found Red Apple Pancake House! Big portions, good coffee, decent prices, friendly wait staff, and quick service! What else can you ask for in a breakfast restaurant.

I had corned beef, scrambled eggs, and hash browns. I was content with my choice, but I think for next time, I'll try their PANCAKES! Ah, I should always go with what is advertised in the restaurants name!!! Anyway, next time. Oh yes, there will be a next time!

The food was delicious and portions were huge! Adults and kids all super full and really happy. Janette was a great server and took wonderful care of us. We cannot wait to come back! Great value and great experience.

My favorite breakfast place.
Reasonable prices.
Generous portions.
Good food.

Four instead of five stars because even though I order the same dish every time I go there, it never a arrives to the table the same...  The eggs will be fluffier one time and in little bitty pieces the next time.  Some times it will be shredded potatoes and some times sliced potatoes...

Great diner. I have gone here for breakfast and lunch and each time it has been crowded.  However in typical diner fashion you are able to move pretty quickly.  Only on Sunday after church will you have to wait for a significant amount of time.  The wait staff is very nice and friendly, the coffee is great, and the food is well above average.

Every single time I am in Beverly Hills of Illinois (DuPage County), I make sure to stop by Red Apple Pancake House. As my fellow Elite Yelp members have stated myriad times; there is no restaurant with the word "apple" in their name that is bad. Red Apple Pancake House is by far my favorite restaurant (can't you tell with all my check ins and photos?)

My noble profession of molding the minds of future America through fitness, nutrition, and physical education has taken me multiple counties South of DuPage. I've been back in the area a lot lately and with every visit I always make sure to stop by for coffee, a gigantic omelet filled with love, and amazing buckwheat and/or pumpkin pancakes. Let me explain!

It starts out crowded. You're worried about the overflowing crowd coming out of the door during the middle of winter. It's a brisk eight degrees outside but you couldn't care less; breakfast in heaven awaits. You know what you're getting...you've looked through the menu. Sure, it's 11:00 AM. and you could could the famous cream of chicken with rice soup, a Red Apple Cheeseburger cooked to order, or even their famous waffle fries. Don't fret young man/lady...you know breakfast fare is where your heart, brain, and stomach want to go on this culinary adventure.

You see the options: samplers (think eggs and sausage), waffles, the "Dutch Baby", and even some cereals. Eggs equals breakfast. Here at Red Apple the math is simple! 

Two eggs turns into four. I've ALWAYS ordered an omelet with multiple vegetables. I love getting it with avocado. It's sweet creamy goodness at its finest. Sure, you could go with one of the omelets on the menu...but why not get out of the palette comfort zone? Load it up with broccoli, mushroom, and avocado! You want a kick in the ass, tough guy? How about a jalapeno, onion, tomato, and black olive party in your mouth? I am drooling as I type...wait...I am not...because my coffee cup was just re-filled without even taking two gigantic gulps.Maybe change it up get a little avocado in that omelet as I mentioned before? Dare to be different!

Listen, I used this restaurant going from 225 lbs. to 175 lbs. No excuses. Yes, of course, you can't get the Mickey Mouse Pancakes every day (sugar overload). You also can't drink a Coca Cola and expect to add muscle and lose fat. Red Apple can and is a nutritious option. More so than other breakfast establishment in the area. 

You're telling me I can get fruit instead of hash browns? Count me in! Strawberries AND blueberries in the aforementioned fruit cup...in the middle of winter? You've got to be kidding me? I thought this place was just a diner in disguise...YOU WERE WRONG! I've built my own omelet, got my coffee and fruit cup...good, right? WRONG AGAIN!

You get pancakes or toast? Sure...go with toast...you milquetoast! I will take fluffy buttermilk...NO WAIT! How about buckwheat? It's not on the menu...just ASK! Sweet and silky goodness! Fall means pumpkin pancakes! Some places only have them during fall...NOT THIS PLACE! Oh, it is April...yes, I will take some pumpkin pancakes, RED APPLE!

Honestly, the servers and hosts don't BS with anything. They turn tables like Jesus Christ turned water into wine (or was it wine into water...I should go to church and find the answer). Sorry Jesus...I am going to Red Apple on the Sabbath! I pray that you forgive me...but this place is that good! I would recommend Dar or Andi. Both are great to talk to and always make me laugh. Not saying that if you have anyone else the service will suffer, but with them you will get a fluffy omelet, some laughs, and a steaming cup of coffee!!!

If you're looking for a cheap, quick, and delicious meal at an unreal price...Red Apple is the way to go. Don't mess around and go to Carol's Garden (although delicious), Egglectic, or Egg Harbor. Why have butt steak when the filet mignon is there or the taking?

Paraphrasing the great Ricky Bobby, if you don't eat at Red Apple, than F(&* you!

I have been eating here for longer than I can remember and never thought to share the word that this place has the best breakfast in Carol Stream! The portions are generous, everything is made fresh, and the menu has plenty to choose from! Lunch is okay, but nothing exciting. It can get busy on the weekends, but I've never waited longer than 20 minutes for a table.

Now that's what I'm talking about. Whoever created and manages this place needs to franchise this! Showed up at prime time Sunday morning. Got a nice thin number to hold onto. Host called out the number in about 5 minutes and we were seated at a clean table. The upside down coffee cups were NOT sitting directly on the table, but on nice little napkins. Nice touch!

Coffee was good, staff was efficient. Ordered a sampler that had everything I wanted, a couple slices of French Toast, bacon, sausage, and scrambled eggs. Simple.

Syrup was real maple syrup. Jelly basket had Smucker's jelly in it and lots of options, including apple cinnamon jelly... Nice big portions of everything. Food arrived quickly.

All in all, everything was spot on.

In fact, I forgot to bring my bill with me when I went to the register to check out and they brought it up instantly and I paid without running back to the table.

They even know how to use the TECHNOLOGY! Cool!

TIP: Check out the SAMPLERs for 3 quick options...
Outstanding!  brought my nieces and nephew here after a run - everything was great and exceptional service

This place has huge portions. Pancakes come in either 4 or 6 and they are HUGE. Plenty to share with at least 1 other person. The waitress was very nice and did a good job of making sure the coffee cup was always full. Today (Fathers day) there was a HUGE line. They had people waiting outside and on the drive way!

I struggle with reviews sometimes.  Cause, I liked this place.  But, I didn't really like it enough to go back.  Well, maybe it's more about the fact that there are places I'd rather go for breakfast/brunch.

Anyway, it's pretty standard brunch fare.  The food was good.  I had an omelette and it was tasty.  There was a lot of food so I took some home.  

The service was good.  Can't complain.  The staff was friendly.  It appeared to be pretty family friendly as well.

This place almost always has a wait, so be prepared for that.  If you are willing to wait you will most likely enjoy your time here.  They have creative menu items and they are all great.  I am very specific about my eggs, I have needed to send things back before and they are quick about making me satisfied.  

Food:  Must have the back, the French toast is always good, however I am not a big fan of their stuffed french toast, and I cannot pin point why.  Skillets are yummy, all of the food is enjoyable.  

Service: From my memory it has always been wonderful.  Everyone is always pleasant and I never feel rushed to order by the staff.  

I am a loyal patron and will continue to be.
Good food, very good service, tons of booths, lots to choose from on the menu. Our favorite local breakfast place.

Not worth the wait. Not only were they horribly inaccurate on the 10 minute wait (we waited 30), but the waitress was really rude and indifferent. I know you're busy, but c'mon you could at least be nice. 

Food was okay. My over easy eggs were not done. Lots of runny egg whites. We liked that they served double yolk eggs though. To be fair, we didn't order of their specialties. But, the standard breakfast was just so-so. Price was great and coffee was good.
Amazing food. Apple pancake, corned beef hash, and French toast are the best I've ever had.

Service is great and this place is usually pretty full on a weekday late morning. 

My main complaint is that I wish they used more fresh fruits and veggies rather than having such a big menu. I noticed that a lot of their fruits and veggies were either from frozen or from cans.

I ordered the Sonoma Country skillet that had potatoes, eggs, monterey jack cheese, broccoli, mushrooms and chicken pieces. I think the only fresh items in that skillet were the eggs, cheese and potatoes. Maybe the mushrooms...  

The broccoli seemed to be thawed from frozen and was mostly stalks. The chicken seemed really dry. 

My significant other ordered the peach crepes and the server kindly informed him that it would come in "a sauce". Well, the peaches were from canned and the sauce was the juice from the can. 

For a place that seems to be bustling on weekday mornings, you'd think fresh produce would be a no-brainer. After this most recent visit, I'll probably go somewhere that uses fresh produce next time. Sorry, Red Apple!
Friendly staff.. great food... but then again how can you get eggs and pancake wrong?

Absolutely love this place.   It gets really busy on weekends but generally I'm able to get seated within 15-20 minutes.   I'm not a coffee drinker but my friends I've taken there have ranted and raved about how tasty the coffee is as well as enjoying the food.   I love their quick service and the food is plentiful.    I especially love the swiss and mushroom omelette that I usually order.    Been here many times over the years and will be back soon.

This used to be my family's go-to breakfast place -- it's near our house, food was tasty and the kids really liked it.  We'd always go the day before school started (for an end-of-summer breakfast) and the last day of school -- you know, they make the kids go for 30 minutes to pick up report cards so they're free for the day around 9 am.  Let's go out to breakfast!  We'd usually see tons of other families and teachers there as well.

Then we had an incident that turned us off so badly that we've never returned.

We sat down, and a bus boy came by with water.  He managed to knock an entire glass of ice-cold water into my husband's lap.  He didn't apologize or even acknowledge it.  We waited to see if anyone else would comment; nothing.  My husband, who used to manage restaurants and knows how customers should be treated, went to talk to the manager.  The guy just basically said, "Oh well, stuff happens."  No apology, no nuthin'.

We can get better food and much, MUCH better service at our new favorite brunch cafe, so I guess this place did us a favor in the end.

This place was hopping on a Sunday morning. And rightfully so. It was frickin delicious, affordable, and fun. Definitely like an IHOP on steroids with a much happier staff, a nicer management team, and fresher food. 

Not to mention you get MONSTROUS portions that will keep you full the rest of the day. I rarely find breakfast places that impress me, but today I was thoroughly impressed.

I cannot say enough about the apple pancake!! Would go back for this alone.... Definitely meant for 2 or more people. Fast service and quality food... Every item on the menu is cooked to perfection & quite tasty!!
Everything is awesome..... Breakfast or lunch.  Owner Gus is awesome - recognizes you and always makes a point to say hello.  A lot of food for the money.  You will have take home

This place never disappoints. The food is delicious, plentiful, fresh and nothing less than satisfying. The servers are friendly, attentive, genuine and helpful. I have been to various breakfast joints across the country and Red Apple remains my absolute favorite.
Best Breakfast Spot in the area. Service is always on Point & Prices are fair for the amount of food they serve you. Come early or wait in line but well worth the wait :)
It was a really good place! Very quaint and homey. I was sort of skeptical on ordering chorizo meat but it was very good! The only negative was each refill was an extra full drink price.

This is my favorite breakfast spot for a couple of reasons:

- 2 eggs = 4 eggs
- Their raspberry crepes are fantastic. 
- Their combos are cheap and come with more than enough food.
- The staff is super nice and the service is super fast. 
- The owners take pride in their restaurant and are always there. 
- My coffee cup is never empty

I could go on for a while. It's a great place and I'm a frequent customer. I highly suggest giving it a try if you haven't already.

Cheerful decor and tasty food. My 11 year old daughter loved the ribeye steak and wants to give 5 stars. Crowded on Saturday morning but I suppose that's a testament to the popularity. Minor complaint: waitress didn't notice my empty coffee cup. But it was very busy. Crepes were delicious and I appreciated them substituting meat far hash browns when I asked.
Really love their food & friendly service. Plus they're close to home!!!! .

Best place for breakfast no doubt. Great menu, good service and tasty food. 
awesome deep dish apple pancakes.
The food is pretty good but the servers are hit or miss. Some are rude and defensive while others are pleasant and polite. Portions are large and not overpriced.

I have eaten here many times and the portions are huge. My breakfast was really good but my friend that I went with got really sick after eating with me. I felt so bad since I was the one who wanted to go here. I was fine so I don't know what happened but I wouldn't go back just because of that. The service was really good and yes it is an older place but that doesn't matter to me. I hate losing this place since the prices are good and you get so much food but I just cannot go back after what happened to my friend, had that not happened it would have been 5 stars.

This is my family favorite place to have a breakfast. 
I Love the food, the service. 
Definitely recommend this place.
I left before I finished my meal. The food was a mash of junk of food. Old clunky decor. Apple is always packed. They must be doing something right.

Their breakfast is great. Everything I've tried is good, but I love their skillets. They have a good lunch menu as well and their soup tastes home made. They get very busy on the weekends, but it's worth the wait.

My brother has been talking about this place for months. My boyfriend and I have gone here twice so far but haven't been let down either time. The staff was very friendly and the food was fantastic. The omelets are huge and the skillets are great. We were greeted immediately and seated very quickly. Food was served pretty fast. Will definitely be eating here again.

Red Apple is a very nice place to get a good breakfast, any day of the week.  Servings are good sized, and the quality of the ingredients is very good.  I've been there twice in the last two weeks, and their specials are definitely worth ordering, because they make use of fresh, seasonal ingredients that are not always on the menu.  You can't go wrong with their omelettes or their benedicts.  Even the toast is good.  The waitresses working for Red Apple are also some very nice people.  We're going back again soon.

I am not a breakfast person.  (I do not generally like breakfast food.) Nevertheless,  I was impressed. Food was well prepared and plentiful. (The apples in the caramel crepes were actually fresh.) The service was cordial,  efficient and fast, even though the place was quite busy. I would definitely return.
Best breakfast place around by far!! Everything on the menu tastes fresh, with high quality ingredients. Have never had a bad experience at this place. Only complaint is that they close at 3 pm.
I give Red Apple 3.5 stars. I recently had a ham & cheese omelette with hashbrowns which were tasty. The coffee is good as well. The staff is friendly.

Big Hearty Portions. That's one thing this place has. I stick to omelets and pancakes here but some time I see a dish go by that I really want and end up asking the waitress what it was. 

It has a diner-y homeish feeling decor. I have never waited more that 10 to 15 minutes tops. The service is average, nothing to write home about.

We came here for Mother's Day. We had called the day before and were told that they do not take reservations. I arrived at 945am for a table of 6. At 1115 we still had not been sat. When I talked to the manager he advised that tables with reservations were being sat before us. I don't appreciate being lied to multiple times.

What a gem!!!! This place has some of the best breakfast I've ever had. I had the gyro skillet, the meat was great the eggs were fresh and the way they put everything together was phenomenal.

The atmosphere was cozy, the noise was low and the service was great. I will defiantly be returning for more from red apple!!!

My husband and I had breakfast here recently after a long hiatus and despite the wait it was very enjoyable. Our waitress, Jennette, was very attentive, and our meal was very good, not to mention filling. We both ordered the Eggs Benedict; mine was the original and his was the biscuits and gravy version. In all my years on this planet I had never had Eggs Benedict before, so I'm glad they were so good. I will definitely be ordering them again next time we eat here, which, despite how good the food is, will be a long while simply because I'm not big on eating out for breakfast.

Visited: February 19, 2012

Red Apple is hands down my favorite breakfast place. The prices are low, and the portions are huge. It's the kind of place where you need to come hungry, and you probably won't need to eat the rest of the day after you leave. This is one of the few places where I take leftovers home.

I know the decor isn't going to blow anyone away, but with the food that they have, I usually look at nothing by my plate anyway.

Just be careful if you go there mid to late morning on a Sunday. The place will be packed, but they do a good job of getting people seated pretty quickly.

Red Apple certainly lives up to the hype regarding big breakfasts. I love going out for Breakfast/Brunch and it's pretty hard to mess it up. Some of my friends will question this as quite a few of them sing Red Apple's praises, but I can't rate it any higher. 

The food is good. No question there. Huge portions and made to order. The menu lists all the breakfast staples--baked omelets, skillets, pancakes, waffles, crepes, build-your-own meals. I opted for the California Egg White Omelet--mushrooms, green onions, avocado, jack cheese. Very well made and very fresh ingredients. It comes with a side of breakfast potatoes which were OK, a little on the bland side which was easily fixed with dashes of pepper. You get a choice of toast or pancakes, and since "pancake" is in their name, figured I should try it. Very good, fluffy pancake, nice mild sweet flavor. This was a huge portion and at least half was taken home in a to-go container. 

The thing I can't get out of my head and why I can't rate any higher was that the restaurant seemed so dingy. Dingy-hole-in-the-wall I can handle, but dingy-dirty is not very appealing. The busboys, although clearing tables quickly, were not very careful. Throwing plates/silverware into their busing bins, caused all this food to fly out and onto the floor. The last thing I wanted was a piece of someone else's scrambled egg hitting me or landing on my table. And the floors were cruddy with old food/used napkins. The restaurant was very busy this Sunday morning, but there were lulls where I saw everyone standing around--so no one else sees the old food under those tables or in the aisle, eh? And the hallway floor to the bathroom? I'm not even going to mention it. Such a shame, All it made me think of was whether or not the kitchen was in the same shape. 

Maybe the place is a bit more appealing on less-busy days, but I'm not sure if I'm ready to check it out again.

This place has great food and service.  My husband and I went here a few months back and now go at least once a week and usually it is on a Sunday after church.
