This place is always busy and always packed but the wait is not even long and it is worth it since the food is that great.  Prices are reasonable too and nice family environment to be in.  Only thing I wish was for the restaurant to be open a little later since it does close by 3. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family and their friends : )
So delicious! I had an omelet dish with 2 big pancakes. Omg so good, these servers were so nice! Love this place.

After reading the reviews on Yelp we thought we would try them out for a Sunday breakfast. The wait time was long, almost thirty minutes. We saw a family who seemed to know the manager sneak through and get seated ahead of many long waiting customers. The parking lot was full and many patrons seemed to not mind the wait, so we figured the food must be pretty good. What a disappointment. It was not horrible, but it was very bland to say the least. We had a order of house pancakes and the French orchard. The French Orchard had no taste, you could not even detect any cinnamon in the cinnamon bread. The sauce had an odd flavor. The pancakes were just bland, Bisquick has more flavor. Was not worth the wait. This place is off our list for future breakfasts.

Reasons I like Red Apple:
1) I can order take-away. It's always ready within 10 minutes.
2) It's cheap with big portions. I always have leftovers for another meal later.
3) It's super-close to my job. Breakfast food for lunch!
4) Fluffy pancakes.
5) Friendly staff at the counter.

Reasons I don't like Red Apple:
Out of the 5 times I've ordered, only once did the eggs come the way I asked. Make sure to clearly specify "very runny" if you want it that way. Otherwise, they're chalky and over-cooked.

Generic corn syrup, the flimsiest plasticware I've ever used, and the times I've gotten fruit, it's been tasteless and not too ripe.

TIPS: You can order takeaway by viewing their online menu on their website, but the website doesn't even list their phone number that I can see, so you can get that here on yelp.
Not bad for the price.  My gf and I got out of that place for under $25 with tip and my meal came with four eggs.  Definitely worth it!

The coffee here is superb..although, they definitely should invest in some new coffee mugs, a lot are chipped which is prone to bacteria!  the eggs are always cooked to perfection & taste better than your average eggs. I'm not sure what their secret is there.  I love their skillets! Great portions, I always have leftovers.  The decor & cleanliness of the place could definitely be improved , hence the 4 stars.

First time, I picked up lunch here for friends, and my chicken shawerma wrap was delicious!  The guys liked the kabobs they got.  I also really liked the muthawama, which I had for the first time ever.  Second trip a week later, I met one of the owners and he gave me free baklava which was so crispy and light!  I would definitely go here again! :D

Picked up a deluxe falafel wrap and fries for lunch. The falafels were absolutely delicious. They were crunchy and seasoned perfectly. So glad this little gem opened right across from my house. Next time, I'm just going to have them add some hot sauce to make my wrap spicier. 
PS: they have $10 off $15's coupon if you order from GrubHub. I think the promotion goes till end of November.
Tried this hidden gem for the first time, and will definitely go again! Great flavor with good quality!!!!

We went here last night for dinner and everything was delicious. My 2 year old loved the lentil soup and I enjoyed a light Mediterranean salad. My husband had a chicken wrap which he said was much better than any he has had in naperville.  The owners were very welcoming and gave us free baklava which was light and delicious. This place is a great addition to our neighborhood.

Needed a Mexican Cuisine fix as it happened to be Cinco De Mayo!

Rolled in here and was seated promptly, handed menus and some salsa, which was DELICIOUS!

Ordered a pork burrito and it came with beans and rice.

The beans and rice I could eat a whole bucket of!!!
Seriously, they blew my d!ck off.....it was unreal!

Then I got a hold of my burrito....

WOW!

It was soooo good!

I will be back for sure!

Service? - EXCELLENT!
Food? - EXCELLENT!
Value? - Cant be beat!!!

Keep up the great work!

Very very authentic and good Mexican restaurant in the middle of nowhere.  Be careful when entering their parking lot; there is only one entrance, and it's easy to miss.

The guacamole, rice and refried beans are nothing to write home about, but the main meat of the meal is; pretty obscure stuff also resides on the menu (never heard of Tacos Arabes before, for example) and worth looking at.  

Other note: the pico de gallo on the table is pretty spicy, so beware.

Been looking for some good Mexican food since moving to Illinois! We were told we'd find it in Aurora. Of all the places in Aurora we picked this place! 

Big menu CHECK
Horchata CHECK
Micheladas CHECK
Good pico de gallo & chips CHECK

I ordered flautas con carne desebrada & camarones al mojo de ajo! Shrimp was a tiny bit greasy but super garlicky (which I loved) & it was still delicious & I ate it all! Flautas were awesome! They were served with rice & beans (which I don't usually like at ANY Mexican restaurant, even in so cal) but I really liked the beans & rice here! 
My friend said he really liked the Micheladas, I thought they were good but I'm use to Micheladas having a lot more ingredients, here they were pretty basic but tasted good. 

Service is what won me over! Our server was sweet, attentive, & thanked us for coming in when we left ! I'd come back for sure!!

According to Foursquare/Swarm, this is my 138th visit to Restaurant Tecalitlan. It's my favorite place to eat. The service is friendly, knowledgeable, and they work hard. This joint is often jumping with people coming in for take out or eat in. 

I love that this restaurant is a family affair. You can often see multiple generations working together. I love the food. To the reviewer who suggested that reviewers were just friends and family writing reviews, I need to correct you. My blonde hair and blue eyes would suggest I'm not related to the people who own this establishment. I don't associate with them in any capacity other than a business one. 

However, after dining here since 2011, I feel like these are my friends who gladly welcome me with open arms and warm hearts. This is home cooking at its finest. They make their own tortillas!! The refried beans are the best in the area. And have you had the jalapeño green sauce? Also homemade. 

Today I had the sopes. They were delicious. Everyone we bring loves Teca. (Including my 85 year old mom who fought with me over the beans.) You should come. It's good.
This is by far the best Mexican restaurant in the area!!! No one can beat their steak tacos or tamales! Great service and they are always so friendly.
Driving through the area and found this place on Yelp. Great tamales, salsa and margaritas. Friendly and kind wait staff. A happy surprise in a region full of mediocre Mexican food.

My husband and I have been searching for the best breakfast chilaquiles, short of returning to Guadalajara. This morning we found them. We had great service, a flavorful breakfast, and a very warm welcome from the owner(s). A selfish part of me did not want to share this news with you. You're lucky I wrote this review for you!
The tacos were a bit greasy. I tried the burrito as well and it was probably the best burrito I've had in this area! The burrito is 2 thumbs up. :)

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant. I'm from NY and just moved here, plus I'm Mexican. This was a welcome find. Their food is perfect, authentic, fresh Mexican.  From the appetizers to their tacos, everything is perfect. You can't go wrong with this place.

Awesome sauce! Seriously, the 3 I tried without cilantro (allergic) were fantastic. Especially the one made from puréed jalapeño. Husband also tried 3 others with cilantro and was equally impressed. Beans were very good, as were the enchiladas and burrito ranchero. Super friendly staff. Must try!

This is a perfect example of how sometimes simple is sometimes just simply better. Have been here 3 times now and each time the food and service was excellent. The salsas are all fresh and their spicy warm salsa is addictive. The pork tacos are perfectly spiced and their guacamole is fresh and simply just the way it should be. Lunch specials are great also. We will be coming here often for good simple Mexican staples.

I love this place. We order it at work for lunch and they are very friendly and helpful. The food is amazing its authentic and flavorful. I almost enjoy it more than my mother in law's (who is from mexico) cooking. I recommend this place to anyone.

This is a great little casual Mexican joint. We tried the steak, pork and chicken tacos. All where delicious and flavorful. The tortillas, pico, verde and red sauces were all freshly made. The owner/manager who served us was very friendly and personable. It was obvious that she takes a tremendous amount of pride in her family's restaurant and it shows. My wife and I love Mexican food and frequent many Mexican restaurants, we even cook some Mexican dishes at home. We enjoyed our conversation with her about their food and we even shared some recipes. I loved the selection of Mexican beers. We'll definitely  be back.

Warning. I think what's happened here is that friends and family have posted good review. The food is the worst Mexican I've ever had. Dry, flavorless and poor in every way. I was looking forward to a new place. It's basically a kitchen they threw a couple of tables around and serve.  3 salsas are weird tasting. One is creamy with an overpowering garlic heart. Gosh I can still taste it in the back if my throat. All four of us ordered different things. The feedback was all the same. It was so bad it killed the evening.

We got lost looking for a different Yelp recommendation, and pulled into this parking lot to turn around.  "Screw it," we said, "let's just eat here."  I'm glad we did.

The staff was supremely friendly and welcoming, service was attentive but not overbearing, and (most importantly) the food was excellent.  I had the combination with a taco, tostada, and chile relleno and the wife had steak tacos.  It was thumbs up all around.  The pico de gallo was a real treat, too.

Next time, we are totally gonna eat at this place on purpose.

My neighbor and another friend had been telling me about this place in a strip mall a mile or so away. I had seen it and thought it was take out only, but they do have seating.

We go out for Mexican about once a week and pretty much have stopped going anywhere else.  This is really authentic and based on the family recipes of the owner.  Some of the waitstaff are granddaughters and as friendly as they come.

We like the chips and salsa, but my wife likes her sauces mild, so they bring out a red sauce that she loves.  I like a little more of a kick and they have a couple of creamy green sauces with a lot of flavor and character, including one made from pureed jalapeno!

Add a small side of guacamole for less than a buck!

The tacos are a great lunch for us. 2 tacos each and a bottle of Coca Cola de Mexico costs less $10.

Dinner selections are plentiful and affordable.  Try the carne asada and you can't go wrong with the burrito.

It has a lunch counter atmosphere and limited bar.

Authentic, affordable and muy bueno!

for good authentic Mexican food this is the place.  The food is regional as far as Mexican food.  I think the northern region.  The salsa are great, especially the green one that is made with jalapeno and garlic.  Service is great if you run out of something there right there to fill it back up.  Lunch service is speed.  This is a hidden gem.

Food was amazing. We told the waitress it was our first time and she had us try the salsa and guacamole ( all amazing and spicy). She then recommend what was popular ( which was almost everything). My husband had chicken enchiladas- which he says was great and didn't have the mole sauce( which he hates). I had the three taco dinner but added one. I tried 4 different ones- pork,goat, tongue and head. All were great. I would come here again anytime.

A friendly, authentic, and reasonably priced casual taqueria with a little broader menu than many.  Everything fresh & flavorful, my chicken torta was nice and crusty as it should be with well seasoned chicken, fresh avocado, delicious,  My wife's veggie burrito was large but not overwhelming, equally delicious.  Pico & chips a tad hot but I loved it.  Will go out of my way to stop here again.

Simple and delicious.. Great tacos and even better pico. The kids loved their food and kept talking about how much they wanted to go back. Highly recommend it if your looking for a quick easy bite. And don't worry good beer selection and a great margarita!

If you live in North Aurora or so the TV up this is the Mexican restaurant for you unlike scholle many Mexican restaurants the food is not over salt little details like the real Mexican cheese the tacos are supposed to Colby jack. Margaritas good actually have tequila in them 3 margaritas and you know you had three cocktails . Three of us had dinner with 4 margaritas unlimited chips salsa and pico de Gio $60
Small quaint,  but great food. The Pico de gailo they give with chips are excellent. I've been here several times and the great service and food are consistent and reasonably priced. Give them a try!

The owner is awesome! The food is delicious. The prices are really reasonable. The homemade salsas are perfect. I mean really, easily one of the best little Mexican places around. The owner is extremely nice and she really wants to make sure you enjoy your food and have a nice time. It's a rare find. Go here! You won't be disappointed!
Good food at moderate prices. I had the chilies rellanos , and my wife had chicken enchiladas. Both we very good and good margaritas.. Great little neighborhood restaurant.

Our favorite family-owned Mexican restaurant.  We've been here over a hundred times in the past couple of years - consistent, reliable, tasty, and most important - authentic.  We love all of the staff - they treat us like family.  Forget the chains selling pseudo Mexi-fare - this here is the real deal.
This place is great.  Everything is good.  It hidden strip mall... But worth finding it.

Small, quaint place that has delicious Mexican food! The menu is pretty basic but so far we haven't had a bad meal. The guacamole is so fresh and tasty. I had the shrimp al a diablo last night and was blown away! The shrimp were huge and the sauce had a lot of flavor followed by a great spicy heat level. The staff is always friendly, and the decor is minimal, but the food...Oh the food!! We are glad they opened, since we are nearby down the street. Don't listen to the haters, Fair prices and fresh, great tasting food which comes quickly! Give it a try.

Very friendly atmosphere with some very yummy food!  $8 for a huge platter of 3 tacos with rice and beans.  They have a $3.50 kids menu too which is so refreshing.  It's a great value and kind of an untapped neighborhood gem. Glad to find a North Aurora eatery worth returning to.

Decent Mexican food, a bit more authentic than some of the places we have visited in the area. Price is average. Nice size menu, would love if they had a menu posted online. I was kinda irked that I had to venture there one night to get a menu to order but now we have one for the future. Only had goat on the weekends, would have liked to have tried when I was there. I think the address is slightly off, my menu lists in at 200 Butterfield, but close enough.
Salsa options were really good. Get the steak Torta it was delicious!

This business takes the place of Bonito Mexico, RIP. At first I was skeptical because I liked BM so much, but Tecalitlan has proven herself. I usually order the Burrito Ranchero Carne Asada. This is probably one of the least authentic items on the menu but it is powerfully addictive. It is a steak burrito packed full of all the standard ingredients but then it is smothered in ranchero sauce and cheese. It is big enough for two meals but so hard to resist eating the whole thing. They offer plenty of more authentic food too. I was pleased to see that like BM, they have Tacos Arabe. They also have a birreria stew. And the mom, who is usually cooking, makes her own corn tortillas. 
Note: This is their second location. The first restaurant is in downtown Aurora.
good,quick  mexican food. Was a bit miffed on last visit since tacos I ordered were not same the same giant yummy tacos I had the last time. Keep it the same or don't do it at all

I originally tried this restaurant because of their participation in the Restaurant.com program, but this is the one place that has kept me coming back. 

Everything, from the homemade tortillas to the homemade flan, is amazing. Now I will say that my wife and I are vegetarian so we can't comment on the quality of the meat, but what we have eaten we love. I am so glad that we have access to such a great Mexican restaurant.

Julie and Bruce are very welcoming and always remember your name and your previous order! The service and the food is outstanding! I wish they had their business in my building! Highly recommend! Go over for lunch, you won't be disappointed!!

I love this mom, pop, and son run place.  Taco bowl day, burrito bowls, turkey subs, fried egg cheese sandwiches that come with two eggs, pepper and egg sandwiches, delicious spinach-artichoke soup, cranberry chicken salad sandwich this Tuesday!  They have so many tasty things to choose from and it's always fresh and good.  Julie is also very accommodating.  I rarely eat beef or pork but she substitutes ground turkey in the taco bowl and cut up a breast of chicken for my burrito bowl.  I can also go in and just order a cut up breast of chicken.  They sometimes have garlic mayo and chipotle mayo for the sandwiches... yum!  My very favorite item is, believe it or not, the egg salad sandwich.  My co-worker and I always walk over for lunch when they are serving the egg salad.  Keep up the great work!

Oh and yes, she remembered my name from day one.  I could never do that - I don't know how she does it!

Super adorable cafe right in the office building. There are a lot of sandwich options, a couple soups and salads. Plus the frosted sugar cookies are amazing! (they are the same ones from Subway). Also, everyone who works there is so sweet and helpful as well. I wish we had one of these in my office!

Julie and the staff are very welcoming.

with all the food optoins within driving distance, i walk over to the Park Lake Cafe for their daily special.

the food is great and i would rather spend my money here!

Rating: 4.8
Short description: Family run deli for my building

Pluses:
I'm very biased, but this is the best food place I've ever had near my work place, including down town.  But it is the perfect storm of great service and good food.

First, service.  Julie runs the front of the house, does an amazing job, will generally remember your name after maybe two visits.  Your food will be prepared in a hurry and you can either take it out or they'll bring it out to you.  And that food is prepared by her family, for you.  If there's something you like available, Julie will point it out.  I rarely escape without putting avocado on things.

They make a REALLY solid sandwich, like you would get at home (If your family cared for you).  You ask for a turkey sandwich on white, you get a beautiful turkey sandwich.  I know it's just turkey, but it is exactly what you want in one.  And it is quite affordable too.

At this point, I've worked in this building a year, and I've tried everything they've made except maybe the GFY (Good For You).   You see, they have daily specials that are unique to the day.  Last week, they had a chicken wrap like thing that was amazing, I really wish I had written down what was in it because it was their best thing ever.

Or you can get their soup, their salad bar, and a cookie.  And while I don't really eat breakfast, their breakfast stuff is excellent.

Negatives: Taco salad day, Nacho day, and Pizza day are insane because it's SOOOO popular.  So call ahead if you're in a hurry, even though you'll still have to wait through the line.

Recommendations: If you work near Diehl and Mill, swing by here for lunch sometime.  Their double-decker turkey club is fantastic but it's a lot of food.  And their Devli's Food cake is awesome.

Disclaimer: This is for my in-building deli.  And I'm the duke.  But it really is good.
Great food reasonable prices.  Family run restaurant.  Once you have been to this cafe the owners will remember you and greet you by name.

Julie and Bruce run this place at 184 Shuman on the first floor.  They get business from surrounding office complexes and they accommodate everyone who visits.
They put EVERYTHING into producing quality dishes every time.  
Wonderful daily specials like fresh Italian Sausage sandwiches, Quesadillas (a favorite) and Chicken Kiev.  Thursdays are Mexican day.  All types of breakfasts -- do not miss out on their pancakes, homemade biscuits and gravy, omelette's or breakfast burritos!  
Every sandwich imaginable - subs, panini's, burgers, beefs, fries, tots... you name it!
Daily desserts - homemade cookies and cakes often available.
Go to Park Lake Cafe if you work anywhere near Washington and Diehl - you'll become a regular.
Julie, Bruce and Tony are some of the sweetest people I Know! Food is always prepared on time, neatly and the prices are good. I Love having them in my work building!

DEEP DISH HAS ARRIVED IN THE VALLEY OF THE . 
Ok this was my favorite deep dish in Chicago and now they are here. My reco is to get sausage with pepperoni backed on top delicious. 
Please please please open a location in or near Chandler.
By Far the best pizza in Chicago. Their brushetta is my favorite, even better than my homemade, and they sell the most amazing red velvet cupcakes. I'm a big fan!

Because of the richness of Chicago-style pizza, it's only a once a quarter type of food for me but when that (rare) time rolls around, it's always Lou's. 

We've ordered from this location a few times and always been really pleased with our pizza. The crust is heaven on earth. I also like the House salad. Their salad dressing is so good! We've even had family members try it and they've been converted as fans.

Yep, you guessed it. This is my favorite pizza place. If I were anywhere in the USA this would be my first choice for deep dish pizza. I don't care for their thin crust however. When they make a deep dish they have a solid layer of sausage instead of pieces. They load on the cheese and garlic, if you ordered it of course. I like to order it with butter crust and cooked extra long. They have been getting some worthy competition lately but have not been beaten yet!

Doe wasn't even close to cooked. Ate a slice and a half a trashed the rest. Over priced and over hyped for sure.

UPDATE! 

Customer service replied to my pissed off post. 

Apologized And asked to make it right! 

I feel that any company who takes the time to read and reply to a post from a unhappy customer, deserves more then a second chance. They earned it even if they made a mistake on my pizza. 

I will return and spend money there again just because they seem to actually care. Which is good business in my book. 

Thanks for the reply.

The other day, @pizzaislife followed me on Twitter and I shrieked with happiness. I have no idea who da hell that is but... My love for pizza is real. 

My love for pizza is so real that when I traveled to India for a month back in 2006, the only thing I wanted to eat when I got back was some deep dish from LOUS. 

I wanted it so bad that I called and placed an order while waiting for my luggage at O'Hare. That's some real #fatkid4lyf dedication. 

Lou's is the real deal. It is my go to pizza in the suburbs. It is absolutely amazing... I typically order just a pizza - medium with butter crust, half cheese, half spinach - deep dish. 

I'm a vegetarian - so I totally appreciate the I uncut pizza option. Not only is it crunchier, it is meat tidbit free. I typically hate when I dine out and I can see the same knife being used to cut meaty things and then my food. Not here. Lou's doesn't disappoint. 

Why are you even reading this review? Go there already, jeez.


It tastes amazing every single time. I have literally eaten Lou's over 100 times.
Best deep dish pizza. Must order a chocolate chip cookie pizza. We had it twice while in town. Skip the other places that claim to have the best deep dish. This is the real deal.

The Malnati's got their start at Pizzeria Uno which, at the time, was the defacto standard for great Chicago Pizza.

I grew up in the downtown Chicago area eating Uno's, Due's, Dino's, Gino's and Gino's East Pizza (in the 60's and 70's before they were all ruined) and in the 80's I was a Pizza snob that thought of Lou Malnati's as suburban "Chicago Style Pizza Wanna Be"

Guess they showed me.

When friends and family come to town and they want real Chicago Styled Pizza, we get Lou Malnati's.

The places of my youth are gone, or are a caricature of their former selves. Franchising, tourism and fame has ruined them (some are still 4 * pizza's, but...)

Lou Malnati's has expanded without destroying themselves.

Their Buttercrust Sausage Pizza is edible artistry. Thank goodness they are still around and haven't compromised themselves. 

This particular shop is carry out only... so the review is for the Pizza only (carry out shop is fine) .. keeps it simple that way
We love the pizza ! The staff is always courteous ,  efficient , and estimated pick up and delivery times are spot on

I must say that, growing up in Chicago, I was always confused about the hype for Lou Malnati's. I always found it okay...but not great. That being said, I had not tasted Lou in many years, so I took it as a chance to introduce my wife (who is not from Chicago) to a new place that she had not tried before.

We ordered a medium sausage pizza online and was able to pick it up about 40 minutes later - not bad considering it was a busy evening. There were a lot of people waiting in the small store front and it was definitely cluttered, but did not have to wait long.

So as for the pizza - I will say that I am not a fan of the sausage "patty". I much prefer the crumbled. The sausage itself was fine, but lacked a ton of flavor. And the cheese...just way too much cheese. I know many people love Lou Malnati's for this reason, but not I. The crust, too, was just okay. All in all, it's an okay pizza, but I believe it's truly overhyped and I will keep going elsewhere.

3 stars is the max.
Budduh budduh budduh budduh whuttt?!?!Butter crust - need I say more?! Fork n knife in hand. The real way Chicagoans eat a pizza pie. Love it!

Never had a problem with pizzas here always ready for pickup time usually 40 mins. This past time i went my pizza wasnt ready! I had no problem waiting but an employee mike prob the manager gave me a credit for my troubles. Next pizza will be on the house and offered me a cold drink while waiting , great service at this location. 5 stars

Following my last review, I was contacted by Meghan R. (Customer Service) about my experience at this Lou's, and then subsequently the District Manager, Steve Haddon.  He and I spoke briefly on the phone about my experience.

They were both very nice and apologetic.  Following the conversation, Steve followed up with a letter and a $25 gift card.  I really appreciate their attention and effort at rectifying my lackluster experience!  

I haven't used my gift card yet, but I will definitely give this Lou's location another try in the near future!

The family ordered Lous tonight, 2 large pies. After waiting a few minutes, the manager came out and told us that they completely misread the order, and only made one of our pizzas. He was very apologetic, and rectified the issue by offering us an additional large pizza and two salad s to be delivered. An excellent example of customer service by one of the best pizza takeouts around. Left with a good taste in my mouth from Lou's.

I had a crustless pizza it was amazing. A crust of sausage is a great substitute for crust. Black olives and mushrooms made it that much better. I will be trying several different ingredient combinations.
This is my personal favorite chain deep dish pizza in Chicago! Gino's east is a close second but something about their sauce just gives them a slight edge! Deep dish meat lovers... Can't be beat!

Their deep dish pizza is to die for.    I've been to several of the locations and haven't found much deviance from the pizza.   Then again that's pretty much all I order.   I usually get a pepperoni mushroom which fortunately they have plenty of both.    But what makes the pizza top notch for me is their buttery crust.   That crust is absolutely divine and puts me in a food coma alone.

Recently I've just been ordering their ready made pizzas which aren't as custom as an order.   They do the job as well.   Been back multiple times and sure I'll be back again.

The shiz in burbtown IL.

Quality has gone down a bit in the last couple years but just pop it in the oven for another 10 minutes and it's crispy delish.

Short and simple!!!  Hands down the best pizza ever since I was a little kid.  Love their salads and I'm normally not a salad person.  #1 for Chicago pizza.  I've had NY pizza and it doesn't come close.
Good pizza but can't  touch Geordanos deep dish . Their crust needs more flavor and their too skimpy with the cheese. Good Pizza but not the top deep dish around.
Yummy deep dish and thin crust pizza with great salads delivered to hotel.  Reasonable priced.  Hit the spot when we traveled into town and wanted some Chicago style pizza.
Best Pizza in Chicago by far!!!  Though some would argue otherwise.  Never disappointed by this location!!

There are few times in life when you are able to feel truly alive.  Snuggling a kitten, running with scissors, going through a car wash with the windows open, and eating a Lou Malnatis pizza. 

Enjoy life, eat at Lous.
Love Lou's, Great pizza, good wings, and amazing salads!
Pizza is always good. Staff is friendly for the most part. Never have had any issues with here!

Coming home means a visit to Lou's.

Right down the street.

To-go pizza, beer and the best company with Andrew W....Wonderful homecoming meal.

My family and I have been eating Lou Malnati's since I was in high school.  The pizza is fantastic quality.  We love the thin crust pizza, different from typical Chicagoers but the deep dish is exquisite as well.  If you want to mix it up, try the lasagna.  It tastes amazing.  Overall, if you want great pizza, salad or lasagna, this is the place to go.
Absolutely love this place. Ordered a pizza today. Not only did it get here 30 minute early, it was steaming when I opened the box. Thank you Lou's for being here for us Chicagoans.

There are two things I love about Chicago, and one is their deep dish pizza. There's really nothing quite like it.

Lou Malnati's rivals Gino's East and Giordano's as one of the top pizza chains in the Chicagoland area. This particular location is carryout or delivery only. Typically, the wait is about 45 minutes before your pizza is ready for pick-up. You'll need to be very patient if you expect them to deliver to you.

What I like about Lou Malnati's pizza is their crusts. The crusts on the deep dish are tasty and its edges are crispier than any of their competitors'. The rest of the ingredients are great but their crusts really set them apart.

Although they aren't as expensive as some deep dish pizzeria's, it's definitely not cheap. So be prepared to shell out some dough, so to speak.

Insider tip: When ordering, be sure to tell them you'd like to cut the pizza yourself. This way, you can control the size of your slices because they tend to cut in weird or large pieces.

If you're craving some deep dish but don't want to leave the house, be sure to order from Lou's.
Love this pizza! I'm not a fan of the thin crust. The thick crust is the way to go! Even plain old cheese pizza is incredible from here!
the pick up service is actually prompt. Had a glass of wine while waiting at the bar and by far cheapest place in town. better pizza than most other places in area.
I appreciated that the management read my Yelp review and contacted me quickly, listened to my concern, and then worked to make it right. Great customer service!

When they are on their A-game, they are one of my most favorite pizza places around. But 3 of the last 4 times we've ordered from this location, the crust has been either under-done, over-done or the toppings have been half of what would normally be there. If they were more consistent, we'd never order from anywhere else. But the lack of consistency has gotten so bad that we've given up on them for now. We'll give them another chance in a few months with the hopes of being able to get the good stuff from them once again. When they are good, they are GOOD.

This place has the best deep dish pizza, period, end of story.  

Gino's East and Giordano's serve up some great deep dish also (4 stars), but Lou's is the 5 star standard.

This location is take out only, so be sure to order it uncut so the crust doesn't get soggy on the way home.  

The crust is delicious.

The cheese is awesome.

The tomato sauce is to die for.

The sausage and tomatoes are superior and generous.

If you have a craving for a deep dish pizza, Lou's won't disappoint.

This second time  I order  deep dish pizza , I complain that last pizza was lack of spinach and marshrom , I told please improve your quality. But look like you punish me second time, second time pizza was worst than first time.
I used to order pizza from Elk Grove place since 1980. They had no quality issue. This time in compatative market, it got worst. Thank you for serving . But no tanks any more.

I am reviewing this place again, just because I want to. I haven't had it in a while, but this is a great place for carryout. Buttercrust is amazing, and the sausage is great (I usually don't get sausage on a pizza). The sauce on this place sets it apart from other places, like Gino's East. This is the top "deep dish" category for me. I have favorite places for deep dish (here), stuffed (Rosatis of CS), regular, extra thin, pan (Connie's) etc. If you're looking for DEEP DISH...THIS IS THE PLACE!

no deep dish is better!!!  NONE.  the tomatoes are what does it for me...
This location has been very good, friendly, consistent. 
reviewer who said they dont cut the crust - no - the always say - we recommend you don't cut the crust so it stays crispier.  Would you like it uncut? (I know - we order probably once a month)

Great food and great service - employees are always very nice and helpful!  I just wish they offered coupons, but I understand why they don't - why should they!  Their pizza is well worth the price as it has quality ingredients - just wish we could afford it more often!  That's ok - it is an excellent treat!  You'll LOVE the pizza - try it!  :-)

I really like the crust on these piazzas. Its probably the insane amount of butter carve and calories but they do taste great. Personally I like giardanos a little more but this crust is the reason you come back. Its a weird thing to say, especially for a deep dish pizza but its really good.

We've always had good experiences for the most part with delivery from this Lou's location. It's usually pretty darn tasty, hot and on time. Only once did we have an issue and they really went above and beyond to make it right.

I highly recommend Lou's for high quality and yummy delivery! Go for the deep dish sausage, onions, peppers and fresh garlic. Be sure that you all eat it together so everyone is equally garlicky smelling! ;-)
seriously best deepdish pizza ever, way better then ginos east, giordanos, and nancys

Carry out only.  No dine in, hence 4 starts instead of 5.

Great yummy pizza with the butter crust and yes, they do deliver!  A big hit with my family.  We like this pizza, especially all the fresh ingredients they have on it.

Delivery is not fast and these pizza take awhile to cook, so plan ahead!

The best chicago deep dish pizza hands down! When you say you want sausage on your pizza, oh boy do you get sausage!!! My pizza basically had a huge sausage patty on it lol it was awesome! I love that you can buy individual size pizzas frozen, its great when you dont have an army to feed

the best pizza around , i mean come on ! its lou's !
buttercrust easy sauce ont he cheese deep dish ! bam !
the salad dressings and malnati salad ! bam !

We have ordered pizza from this location for 3 years now and have had great service.  Typically on the weekends they even have pizza with unique toppings out to sample while you wait to pick up your pizza.  The one negative experience I had was when they gave my pizza to someone else by mistake.  I waited an hour total.  They were very compassionate and I could tell they cared.  They even comped the pizza because of there mistake.  I really appreciate the service.

Best deep dish around.  They do it right every time ... this is just one of the many carryout / delivery outposts they have to serve the Chicagoland area.  If you want to actually sit down then check out downtown naperville or search the Lou Malnati's website. 

Service here is pretty quick, 30mins to cook a pizza is reasonable considering how good it tastes.
If you want to eat the best pizza in the World- eat here. Best deep dish in Chicago area. If heaven doesnt have this pizza, I dont want to go!

The pizza here is TO DIE.  

"The Lou pizza" is the best pizza I have ever had in my life. Ever. Both the garlic bread and the cheesy bread are delicious.

We've always had a great experience at this location.

The best deep dish pizza I've had in the tri-state area. It rivals Gino's East and Giordano's. This location is carry-out and delivery only. The people are friendly and the food is always ready on time. 

Please note, however, that while they may dare you to try the low-fat cheese and see whether you can taste the difference, I'm here to say you can, and I don't recommend it. Stick with the regular cheese and you'll have a much better experience. 

Besides, if you're on a diet, why are you having pizza anyway? Don't you realize how many calories are in the crust alone? You should probably put the diet on hold.

The pizza is delish-however when I made the order, the employee told me they don'tcut the pizza, so they are crispier". I find it annoying to pay for a pizza and have to get home and cut it myself. Other than that, good food.

This place is great.  In the 18 months or so I have lived in Illinois, this place has definitely become my favorite.

The food is always top notch and the service is almost always superb.  Sure, sometimes they run out of the cinnamon root beer they brew, but I won't deduct a star for that because everything else is completely off the charts.

The only real negative I could state is trying to go there on a Friday or Saturday evening and expecting to be able to find parking in a reasonable amount of time.  We usually go there in the afternoon if we go on either of those two days because of this.

It might be because we usually go when it is not super busy, but we usually don't have to wait to be seated long or at all.  The servers we get are usually pretty friendly and one of them even greets us when we see him even if we don't have him that visit.  Service at a lot of restaurants these days often leaves much to be desired but this is one place that has not forgotten that part of a good visit is good service.

I look forward to coming back to the Roundhouse for years to come!

Two Brothers Roundhouse is a fun place to go (I've been here multiple times). They have great beers, good food, and entertainment often. It's a huge venue with a restaurant, three bars, a coffee lounge, and multiple party rooms. You'll often see weddings and private parties taking place here.

Last time I was in we can to see a friend's band (Joker's Rival - they're awesome!). Originally we called ahead to reserve a table in their restaurant area, but they said they were no longer taking reservations for the night. We decided to head there about 6 pm anyway to see if we could get a seat. 

We were told it would be about 30 minutes when we got there, so we grabbed a spot up at the bar, but then my dad decided to check the back bar room for seating and they told us we could grab a seat and order food right away. Pretty confusing situation and their communication was obviously lacking, but it ended up working out well. We were able to get a table for eight right away in the room where the band would be playing. Our server was great and took our orders immediately.

I tried their version of a long island, but it was way too tart for me. I think it was just from the flavor of the beer this cocktail is mixed with. I ended up switching drinks with my mom and drank her beer. I then stuck with drinking Wobble all night, because that's my fave! They have a ton of awesome items on their menu. Our table started with a couple orders of the Beer Brezen which are three delicious Domaine Dupage organic pretzels, Cane and Ebel stone ground mustard, and Sidekick beer cheese sauce ($8). We got an order of their chips and dip too which were house-cut potatoes with their Sidekick beer cheese sauce and spicy ranch dip ($7). Both were really good appetizer options, but I preferred the pretzels. A must try!

My mom and I decided to split a few small plates for dinner. Our server was helpful in making suggestions and letting us know which small plates were bigger than others so we could decide how much to order for two people. We went with the beer mussels ($12), short rib risotto ($10), and pork belly tacos ($7).

The steamed mussels were amazing (and a whole pound btw!). The Ebel's Weiss broth was simply delicious and I'm really glad it came with two large pieces of bread for dipping. Short rib risotto was pretty good too, but not worth $10 in my opinion. Pork belly tacos were delicious and perfect for splitting between two people.

Overall this is a great venue and if you like Two Brothers beer you'll want to come hang out here. Everyone who works here really has an awesome attitude and provides great customer service. The Roundhouse is always hosting different bands, comedians, etc. so it's sure to be a good time!

Passing thru the area on the way back towards Chicago, I was using google maps for some suggestions in the area and this was the first place listed.  Checked it out on yelp and had to check it out.  This is a very cool venue.  I won't go into the history and all those details, because that's one of things to find out while you're here.  Also find the fact/history book they have, it's a fun read with some cool interesting facts.

The bar/restaurant area is very nicely done.  Large bar, lots of space in the restaurant area.  A nice outdoor seating area with fireplaces everywhere.  The staff here was very friendly and professional.  

There was just two of us, so we sat at the bar, got the low down on the place talking with the bartenders and started off the night with some of their beers and the smoked cheddar and spinach dip.  This was one of the best dips I've had in a long time, and the bread was very good!  For the main, we just went with several small plates and the fish tacos because everything just sounded very good, we wanted to try as much as we could.
Beer mussels:  wonderful dish, and the broth was very tasty, you get a good portion for two people to share
Short rib risotto:  Short rib meat was amazing, very succulent and the risotto wasn't too bad, just a little too cheesy for my taste, but I can't complain to much, who doesn't like cheese?
Fish tacos:  very good, nice and fresh tasting

If I could physically eat all night, I would have ordered one of each of the small plates, they all sound that good.  If I'm ever back in the area, I will definately make it a priorty to come back here again.

Love the menu, different and keeps things interesting. It's a verrrrry big place. Service is great and beer is always good :-) I got the bone marrow and the duck breast and the the bf got the Ruben, he said the Ruben was fantastic great amount of meat and everything toasty wonderful-ness lol my bone marrow was a bit on the over cooked side but as far as bone marrow goes, it's god awful for you but taste amazing, so even being over cooked was still pretty good! My duck breast was great and polenta chips crunchy outside soft inside exactly what you want! They also do their own coffee and chocolate there as well and have fun shirts! Did I mention he beer? Because come on! Lol defiantly a must, it's a win win for everyone

I work in Aurora, so have been coming here for lunches over the last 10 years.

I really miss the jalapeno ketchup from when it was Walter Paytons.

The menu is now much smaller. The food is good, but costly for the local standard. The building is quite nice and the historical architecture is something well held on to. At this point I find myself here most when the office needs a large place to bring 25+ people at the same time with little to no notice.

I've been to Two Brothers in Warrenville. I respect their move to take this location over, but this location has always seemed to have a rough time.

I've been here several times. Sometimes the service is lagging and that can get annoying- especially when you just want a beer!

I've never been disappointed with their food. It is a different, more refined menu than what they offer at the taphouse. 

Cobb salad is as good as it can be for a salad. I recently had the walleye with potato pancakes (whaaaat?) and it was delicious! The others in my party also enjoyed their dishes of mussels, Mac and cheese, and the sea bass.

Oh yeah, and it's Two Brothers so we know the beer is awesome.
Gave this restaurant one more chance to impress me.  Unfortunately, it did not happen.  Food and service were horrible - found some sort of non-edible in my chicken.  Never again...
Funky cool place for beer or even coffee large space I mean large you could fit a marching band in this place Coffee and pastries both good and beer is always good

I do like their coffee. completely separate from the food/beer

Server recommendation -- Mushroom risotto (small dish): taste: 4/5 (being generous), presentation: 2. plain and bland, if anything it is filling. As for how it came out on the plate well you see it. the cheese on top was stiffly cold and I would have hoped the dish was varied with mushrooms and in color it was uniform, dishearteningly looked like slop tossed on a plate by the spoonful, suggesting spooned and reheated.

I actually liked the food menu a lot more before it was Two Brothers Roundhouse.  I had an appetizer of mussels once and I thought that the mussels must have been dead for a long time before they made it to my plate because they were not very good.

On a more positive note, the beer is much better than it was when it was the Walter Payton Roundhouse.

Went here yesterday for my MIL's 76th birthday..they did a great job accommodating 18 of us! Food was really good..I had the fish tacos which are fried, but very good..my daughter had the goat..we were warned about it being a little "gamey"..and it was different. (I'm taking bragging rights on my one bite!)

Brooke was our server and she was super! We mixed up our seating arrangement at one point, which messed her system with all the checks..she was very kind and patient with us..and just regrouped and kept going! 

So..we'll be back..enjoyed the experience..and had a great afternoon with our family!

I tried so hard to like this place because the atmosphere was great and there is so much potential, but...

My boyfriend and I shared 3 small plates. We got the pork belly tacos, steak tacos, and mussels. The pork belly tacos consisted of two tacos and didn't taste or look like any pork belly I've ever had in the past. There was no color or flavor to the pork, and basically looked like it was the fat trimmings from a pork chop. It was so white, we thought they gave us fish at first. The steak was average, overly cooked, and something I could've made better. The toppings for both tacos consisted of onions and a little cilantro.  The mussels had decent flavor, but it was just mussels in broth with 3 jalapeño slices. Nothing special. Also, we had about 5-6 mussels that weren't opened (and if they don't open, that means they aren't any good) so that was disappointing. 

The waiter got my drink order wrong.  I had never tried their beer before, so I didn't notice until I got the bill because it had a different beer name (which was a higher price).

I'm pretty sure we won't be back.

I ordered a beer here and really appreciated the very icy cold drink. Great attention to detail.

Great bread, great steak, and overall happy.

The Roundhouse gets a star for the sheer size of the place. First parking here is a dangerous proposition, but no worries they are on trend with valet parking, which makes my head spin off...this is Aurora, Il, not Rodeo Drive.  The place is massive, and getting a seat possible on a  beautiful Saturday evening at six makes you wonder? What's up with that? I figured it out. The food is god awful.... Chesse plate was slices of cheese that obviously came out of packages presliced, small chunks of dried apricot and a wasteful amount of honey. Nothing to serve the honey from the condiment cup. The cheese was a low quality...very waxy. One plus- water crackers. Had  more small plates. An artichoke stuffed with goat cheese...I can not even explain the level of awful. And the visual looked like a cake used in a mens urinal. Served cold on a bed of what I think was cabbage. Beef sliders, these resembled chucks found in dog food, with green peppers and a sauce that resembled chop suey. Let me say the beef was like stale old bubble gum. At this point I did not want to try anything else. 
There will be no returing to Roundhouse, even if heading for the Paramount. Did see a darling rendition of Mama Mia after dinner.

Food was great!  Lots of gluten free options to go with Prairie Path on Draft! We had a bunch of small plates.  The service was fine.  The place is visually impressive.  Plan on taking the whole family back!
Good beer, good food, good service.. Nothing great, nothing bad.

You guys know what you're doing when it comes to beer, but you really need to hit the reset button when it comes to food. We've been here a couple of times for food, most recently for Oktoberfest, and each time is worse than the last. 
I've been to Germany 4 times and can say you miss the mark on traditional German food. Schnitzel should be tenderized to a thin slice, then breaded and fried. It shouldn't be an inch thick and tough to cut. Potato pancakes should be made with real, shredded potatoes and onions. Even the ones that come from a box mix taste better than what was served today. And $6 for one so-called pancake, are you kidding me?!? Because I was so disappointed with the "German" food, I ordered nachos to share with my group. Even the nachos were mediocre at best. Where are the jalapeños? How about some hot sauce? 
I encouraged my friends to come here today and I'm sorry I did. I know I'm not the only customer to complain about the food. I really hope you take a good long look at your menu, take your customer reviews into consideration and make some improvements. I won't even go into the service or how long it takes to get a beer. Really really disappointed.

We went to Two Brothers Round House on a Saturday night.  Along with me was 20 of my family members, including 6 children ranging from several different ages from 5 months to 17 years old.  We called ahead because we were not sure of seating.  They were very accommodating, seating all together on their fully encompassed patio.

The patio included areas that were covered and shaded from the sun, areas that were open and allowed the sun in, an area with 3 stone fireplaces, and an area that had lounge patio furniture chairs for relaxation.  

In the middle of the patio was a gazebo for a live band.  The music was good, but a bit loud to talk when playing, but they did not start until 9, which gave us plenty of time to talk beforehand.   

The parking lot was packed, due to another local event.  But they offered free valet parking.  

They brew their own beer.  I am not a fan of beer and rarely drink it.  However, I do enjoy their Dog Days brew, which is seasonal.  

We ordered the nachos and pretzels (Beer Brezen).  Both were pretty good.  You only get two pretzels, but there were good size.  The nachos were a large portion and easily enough to feed 2 for a meal.  

Our server, Jamie, was friendly and full of sass, but in a good way.  I was sarcastic with her and she right back at me.  Made the night more enjoyable.  It should be noted that before speaking with me, she was not sarcastic with the rest of the group.

Overall a very nice experience with good food and great service.

My fave spot in Aurora. So unique.  I mean, it's a former train roundhouse...! The dinner fare ranges from burgers,  fancy entrees and lots of fun items on the drink menu to small plates to share with a big group.  They have their own brewery on site so the beers are fab! Our favorite food to get here are the nachos..  damn! They are GOOD! 

The other thing that's awesome about Two Brothers is the coffee shop.  They ate seriously talented here, both drinks and food are fantastic.  They have sophisticated pour over coffees and some of the most unique syrups to add to drinks such as black pepper vanilla and lavender-tangerine. Delish!!! Check this place out!

Food here is always great!  The staff is amazing. Everyone is helpful. The place is an old train station that has been turned into a bar and restaurant.  The outdoor area has great big fireplaces, and the bar has one too.  The beer they brew on site is delicious. I am not even a craft beer person, but their beer is perfect for everyone.  I will be back soon!

Beer is one of the better craft beers in area. Food is great , selections change, specials are listed. A favorite of mine flat bread and hummus is gone. But the small plate menu has grown with a lot of interesting additions. Check menu.

Wow!  Today I had one of those meals that will go on my all time best list.  I went here for lunch and ordered their classic burger.  The meat was incredible and the bun tasted like it was just baked, (which is very possible because it's a brewery AND a bakery).  The server said Two Brothers not only brew beer, but their own coffee.  So they have the cafe for the early morning people, the restaurant / bar for the lunch and dinner crowd, and they have a back tavern with a huge screen for sports and other entertainment.  After I finished the burger I just had to try something from the bakery, so I went with the carrot cake.  It couldn't have been fresher or more delicious!  I just wish I lived closer because I'd be stopping in this place all the time to sample everything they have to offer!

I most recently went here for a Bernie Sanders event on a Tuesday night, to watch the democratic debate. We got there at 6:30 pm and the room was packed already. Luckily, friends came before us and we were able to find a table for the evening. As with the restaurant, this place can get pretty loud and I had to shout to talk to the person next to me. The food is pretty good, but I seem to remember it being better in previous times. I had a grilled chicken sandwich with mashed potatoes. I picked mashed potatoes because the other two at my table had fries that had come out cold. The chicken sandwich was dry and I had to dip it in ketchup so it wasn't quite so dry.

The beers are really great, but somewhat disappointed the porter is no longer available. The bartender was taking food orders at the bar which slowed things down. Probably would've been good to have a waiter/waitress or a few just to keep things going in the food orders department. 

Previous visits have been good, food has been good. Previous visits were 5 stars, this one was 3-4 stars, so I'll stick with 4 stars for here, for now.

I LOVE me some Two Brothers. I go there as often as I can. I love the food, the beer, the service, the ambiance. I'm a huge fan. I think I get a different meal every time I go, and I always love it.

This Sunday, I went to Ocktoberfest, and was slightly disappointed. The outside seemed great, and we sat in the area with the big screen/high top tables etc. and it seemed understaffed. The waitress was busting her butt, but it was just her and one bartender, so service was slow. We ordered food, and it was mostly good, but the pork shnitzel was really under cooked. It was really hard to cut through, and you could see the middle was really not cooked. Not as big of a deal as if it were chicken, but still. There was a point where the waitress took our drinks to get more and pretty much forgot about us. Not a big deal, she was nice, but not very apologetic. 

This will not deter me from coming back, I love it so much...just wanted to offer feedback.

I've had experience with the Roundhouse both as a restaurant and also as an event venue.

As a restaurant, this is one of my favorite places to visit when I happen to find myself in the western burbs or meeting up with friends/family outside the city.  The food is excellent and the beer is delicious and ever changing.  I haven't experienced any of the entertainment that they bring in on weekend nights, but I really love coming here for lunch.

As an event venue the Roundhouse really knows how to make an event run smoothly.  I fell in love with the space after my best friend's wedding reception.  So much so that I also eventually decided to have my wedding here.  There are two different venue spaces available for larger or smaller weddings, there are several good food packages available to choose from, and their recommended vendors were all very easy to work with.  And of course, you get to pick your favorite Two Brothers beers to have on tap.  :)  Our coordinator was very professional.  She saw to all of our requests and made sure we were running smoothly and on time.  When we had to make the call to bring our ceremony indoors out of the rain, she had everything moved and signage updated in no time.  When ALL of my out-of-state family decided my wedding was the event of the year and I suddenly found myself anticipating 20 more guests than i'd originally estimated they had no trouble mapping out room for a couple more.  I really can't recommend this venue enough.  They were simply wonderful to work with.

I wanted to like this place. We used to come here a lot when it was Payton's. However the food was not so good. 

We started out with a scallop appetizer. It was ok. Bacon wrapped and served on a pile of squash shavings and an apple compote of some sort that reminded me of spiced apple rings. Over all for 3 scallops it was $12 and frankly they didn't have much flavor other than the addons and garnish for  that. 

On to the entrees. I got a roundhouse burger was supposed to be done medium rare. Well the plastic stick said medium and the burger said medium well. It also had the appearance of a pre made frozen patty. You know the look by the sides of it. And the fact that it just didn't taste like fresh ground beef. Really had no flavor asides from the bacon and chile that was on it. Even the BBQ sauce had no taste to speak of. 

My husband got the Ruben. Which is supposed to have corned beef brisket on it according to the menu. It was well done roast beef. Easy to tell as it was grey and not pink like a corned beef is supposed to be and it wouldn't shred like a good brisket should. 

The home cut fries were good. 

All in all for an appetizer two sandwiches that were disappointing and one beer and two sodas it was 60.00. I don't mind paying premium prices when the food is done well. This was not up to snuff at all.  Disappointed doesn't begin to describe this.

I live in Aurora and love this place. I have been vegetarian and trying to become vegan and there a lot of people moving in this direction. Its nice that this restaurant has these choices for people like me and also for meat eaters that I may be with when deciding where to go to eat, there is something for everyone. I love their Chimichura nachos with seiten, vegan tacos and summer veggie wrap. The atmosphere is great and you can sit inside in rustic setting or outside. Also the chef makes a fabulous habenero sauce if you ask for it. Its a hidden "secret". Servers are also great. Wish they had house cabernet that is less than $12/glass other than this, great place.

It's okay.  Went last night after 9.  Food was quite obviously microwaved.  In my personal opinion the meatloaf is an abomination.  The cheese plate is a little lack luster.  I would have expected more cheese.

Food came out of the kitchen really quickly which was good for getting the kids fed after the dance competition.

I'd give them another go but not place the same order.

Disclaimer; We have a fondness for the Roundhouse that goes back to when it was Walter Payton's. We got engaged in the Cognac Bar, married in the gazebo and needless to say had our reception here as well (one of the first weddings held here). We even have a personalized brick in the courtyard too. Heck, my wife even teases (I hope) I'll be waked here. That said we have a special affection for this place. 
Needless to say the beer is excellent with a variety to choose from. The menu is extensive from burgers, seafood, steaks, seafood, and more. Don't forget to leave room for dessert, I would recommend the Swiss Chocolate Chalet Cake and the Italian Lemon Creme Cake too! 

After dinner don't forget to enjoy the many choices of entertainment either outside on the patio or inside at one of the bars. Have too much to drink? Don't be a putz and drink and drive, Comfort Suites is literally next door. Wake up in the morning and need a good cup of coffee? Two Brothers has you covered with their Roundhouse Cafe too. 
A visit to the Roundhouse would not be complete without a Brewery tour, they take about 45 minutes and are very "Brew-Educational". 

Thanks for taking the time to read my review-Bill
They continue to expand their offerings including more beer varieties and now coffee, which is excellent. The food is very good and the venue is very cool. Well worth a visit!

Came here for a wedding. 
Things could have been done better but that may have been at the cost restrictions of the couple so I won't fault the venue for that. 
Food was served buffet style. I had the Caesar salad which was a bit over dressed but at least a tasty dressing. There was chicken which was flavorful and not dry, a vegan enchilada option that you would never know was vegan that even had vegan cheese on it and some veal I didn't care for at all which wasn't marked as such. Maybe someone quit that night or something because our waters were always empty and the coffee guy walked around when we still had dinner in front of us. It all just felt a bit disjointed. 
I might try going here for a regular dinner and give it another go. I'd pass on having my own wedding here however.

Two Brothers Roundhouse continues to keep getting it right. It's our go-to place for family dinners out. Everyone is happy. Kids and vegetarians. Great menu that isn't overwhelming, but offers something for everyone. Gourmet-ish while still being accessible. They have great brews and food. We're satisfied every time and the ambiance is great both indoors and out on the patio. Live music with no cover is also a bonus. I'd happily start paying a cover if it kept the audience to music-listeners only. Great local art during First Fridays at The ArtBar in the tavern. Great place! We are lucky to have it in Aurora. Free valet parking also makes the parking lot manageable, and when the parking lot is redone, it will hopefully bring more spots and better bicycle parking. We also love the cafe for coffee and pastries or a quick lunch. 

Two Brothers Roundhouse is a must visit when in the Aurora area.

I recently went to the Roundhouse for a wedding.  Somehow I never had the pleasure of visiting this locale when it was Payton's Roundhouse.   

If you haven't been here, it is literally a giant round building that is something like 150 years old.  I was originally used to rotate locomotives on the track to send them in the other direction.  That being said, it is a doughnut shaped building that has multiple bars and and sitting areas.  Really a unique setup.

We really enjoyed the food served at the wedding.  We were lucky that the wedding reception was held at the Roundhouse as the Blackhawks Game 7 was going on at the same time.  There were more than enough televisions to sneak out and watch whenever you could get away!

I will definitely return to see what the roundhouse is like on an average weekend night.  But so far I am impressed!

Good service. Our Food did not meet our expectations which was unfortunate as we ordered filets. Staff was nice, quick to serve, however - appeared knowledgeable regarding the difference between gluten allergies/cooking for a celiac which was disappointing. Parking was a challenge due to a wedding at the venue. Can't see myself returning back anytime soon.

If you are looking to drink good beer- this is a five star place. The over priced menu over promises, is over priced and under delivers. 

However, the parking lot is the perfect place for a post holiday family meltdown.

Delicious food with fantastic on-site-brewed beers. Service was impeccable and everyone in our party of five left happy. I bought a growler of beer on the way out which has long since been finished off.

We'll definitely be going back soon. The service, food, and atmosphere made it well worth the price.

I've always seen the Roundhouse as dorky and lame, maybe because the first time I was ever here was for a hillbilly wedding in 1998 where both the bride and groom had matching mullets. I had been here a few times since then - all when it was still Walter Payton's - and wasn't impressed every time. 

I've only been here once before since Two Brothers bought it - for my brother's wedding - and I obviously do not remember it because I was very, very drunk. This last time my husband and I went and color me surprised: the food was great! The beer, however, was sub par compered to the beer they serve at their tap house down the road. The mere fact that they had bone marrow here is impressive in and of itself. That shit was delicious greasy paradise. Every day I'm grateful I don't have a gallbladder anymore.

I love their little coffee shop inside and it bears mentioning that they have different beer on tap at the cafe than they do in the restaurant. I was able to try a mango chili pepper beer that was one of the weirdest drinks I've ever had but damn it was tasty.

Came here between meetings with a colleague.  It was a gorgeous day so we decided to sit outside and mooch off of the free wifi.  At first our waiter did not come over right away but I think that was my fault when I said we were going to be hanging out for a bit and wasnt sure about food.  As always the beer list is decent.  I ordered the pretzel with mustard and beer cheese and it was absolutely delightful.  I have no clue how they make it the consistency that they do.  It is very different than any other I have eaten (in a good way). My colleague ordered the nacho and added pork.  Other than a few chips being soggy the flavors in these nachos were ridiculous.  We both proceeded to over eat a tremendous amount.  Our waiter was both attentive and cognizent of the fact that we were getting work done.  When he came by while on a conference call he was polite and made sure we were on mute before he began talking. I would love to work from here more often :-) but I will settle for a good hang out with friends as well.
I spend many a weekend night here. great beers and a wonderful, friendly staff. the building and it's history just make the place that much cooler. free entertainment on the weekend can't be beat.

Food was pretty good,much improved from the limited aelection on our last visit years ago, but not well explained in the menu.  The server couldn't tell us if the Arancini was made with spent grains from the brewing process, despite a huge barley flavor and no mention of it on the menu. Still not as good as the food at the taphpuse though, despite being a full service restaurant.

Beer was good, as Two Brothers typically is, but there were few (two?) selections not generally available in distribution. I expect more from to put the "brew" in "brewpub".

Service was moderate, and she was clearly trying to make up for what happened earlier....

We were seated near a window and it was freezing cold! When our server came to the table we immediately asked to be moved, in hopes of dealing with the issue prior to starting service, and explained we were willing to wait.  She found someone who told us we'd have to get in the back of the queue, despite waiting a while already.  Only when I asked for the manager did that second person explain she was the manager (no prior introduction) and that we cold deal with it or queue as if we'd just walked in.  Our server finally asked some nearby friends (having drinks only at a dinner table, not the bar or "tavern" to switch tables. It was still cold, and we were uncomfortably physically and mentally.

Probably won't be back.

This place is really good few friends brought me here to check out and the food was good, beer was better since I enjoy this, Cane and Abel, but any type of beer is here and you'll enjoy it. Heard this place is better during the summer to go outside on the area in the middle. Know I'll check that out come summer. Everything price wise was at a decent price and good for friends, family or dates.

Service was great, very attentive and knew the menu very well and offered suggestions.

I wish we had this restaurant where I live. 

Of course it has great beer - seasonal varieties too, with sample sizes available. And it has a complete menu and makes good tasting food. Coffee shop area looked like a great place. Staff are competent and friendly and fun. 

What is standout is the atmosphere - the natural light that comes in the windows and the architecture of this historical building is beautiful. 

And they offer small plates - i had the smoked duck and cheese grits small plate - great flavors! 

Aurora is lucky to have this restaurant, coffee shop and tavern. It would be a great place to have a party at too.

I'm being conservative on the ranking - more like 3.5 stars. 

Ordered some entrees here - we had pot roast and meatloaf. Both were pretty good with decent sides as well. Not a bargain by any means, though not a bank breaker either. I opted for a couple of Sidekicks - a fairly light Two Brother's brew which was good.

Came in part to watch the Hawks play game 4 of the Stanley Cup championship - good viewing TV-wise, though their large screen is a little fuzzy and somewhat archaic. Ordered a Grand Marnier - but they don't carry that. Instead, the server offered up a ginger liqueur option. I decided to get another beer instead, but the server persisted with a sample and I will say his recommendation was good. I'll put that on tap for next time. 

As when it was Payton's the place is still huge and it puzzles me how a place can make enough money here to pay for all the real estate. While we were here on a Monday night, this place was for the most part pretty dead even with a major game going on. It's a semi-central meeting spot for me and a friend from Yorkville, so I'm sure I'll be back.

Fun unpretentious place to take out of town guests and to meet up with friends. I only order from the gluten free menu which is awesome that they offer. The flourless chocolate cake is a must but I keep ordering the gf Roundhouse Burger hoping it's better ever time but maybe you need gluten for it to be good. Prairie Path is the go to beer for those with Celiac and gf sensitivities.

We had our wedding here last month and we got so many compliments - on the service, food, drinks, atmosphere, the whole event turned out wonderfully. Nicole and Stephany were great to work with. Nicole was so helpful the day of our wedding. The ceremony and reception spaces are so architecturally beautiful that you don't need to decorate much if you don't want to - and if you have your reception in the ballroom, there are two fireplaces - one outside and one inside. There's a small staircase for entrances, the bartenders were nice. Everything turned out great. If you have a summer wedding and it's warm out maybe bring in some extra fans, the AC isn't super powerful. We got married on a 90degree day, and some guests told me that was their only complaint - was the reception hall was warm.

But your guests can drink beer during your ceremony and you can drink beer while you rehearse for you wedding - so that's pretty amazing.

The front bar and restaurant area is great too. Friendly service, love that coffee bar. The beers are of course excellent. The food is just OK up front. I really wish you could get some of the awesome wedding food up front, I think it's a little better, but I like their salads in the restaurant quite a bit. I also like being able to watch weddings, it's a super fun bonus if you're there during one.

My son and I came here after his football game. The wings, beer and root beer were great, but the burgers missed the mark.  We had the Roundhouse burgers. We found them to be dry and appeared to be cooked from frozen. I've been coming here for a while now and was surprised that they missed on such a simple dish.

My wife and I sat at the bar rather than wait 30 minutes for a table. She had a chicken tostada small plate with a side of beans and rice; I had the stuffed poblano pepper with beans and rice. It took over 30 minutes to get our food, which was barely lukewarm when it arrived. We complained; the manager comped the food. Beer: I had the Revelry Imperial Red Ale - fabulous! My wife sampled two beers (can't remember the first one, the second was the Peppermint Bark seasonal, which was good). We might give it another try, but the food was a bit overpriced.

I'm not sure about the layout and how that constrains things. The bar is not very large and seems to double as a clearing station for dishes. This is utterly ridiculous. It is hardly appetizing to sit in a space where dirty food dishes are being brought, scraped off into a garbage can 3 feet away, then piled into one of several dish bins on the floor under the bar (in plain site from where we sat). They need to create a separate station for this elsewhere or take the dishes to the kitchen! We definitely won't sit in the bar again.

Service was okay. The excuse for our food being brought out cold was that there was a big ticket filled just ahead of us. That's not likely, as we saw two couples who arrived after we did receive their food ahead of us.

Maybe next time, we'll just stick to beer.

I should have went by my own rule that if a restaurants cheese plate is bad then the rest of the food will also be bad.  Well the cheese plate here consisted of the assorted cheese slices and the assorted cracker assortment from Restaurant Depot.  So these lame rubber cheeses were already pretty sliced and arrayed some deli platter from Jewel and cost $18!!!  So no labor, no fine cheeses and no artisinal cheeses and they charge that much.  I estimate about $16 of margin in that joke of a cheese plate.  Then the "stuffed" artichoke came which was nothing like a stuffed artichoke.  It was some mush from an ice cream scoop on top of a canned cold artichoke heart.  Brutal.  The ceviche was decent but they threw it on top of premade tortilla chips.  Wow.

Finally the bacon sausage was pretty good but that was premade so they just had to heat it up.  I could have done that at home which is where I should have ate and saved $80.  

The beer is good.  Buy some st a liquor store.  The server was good.  He should go work somewhere better.

Stopped in for a late night snack after the Willie Nelson concert last night across the street at RiverEdgePark. Sat outside and listened to a nice blues band playing in the gazebo. Our server, Natalia, was very accommodating and pleasant. Enjoyed several of the Two Brothers micro brews. Two Brothers has done a fantastic job since taking over this vintage venue several years ago.
Excellent food and beer.  Nachos were listed as a starter but were so large I didn't need to order anything else.  Could easily eat and drink here daily and not break the bank.

Disclaimer - we didn't eat here. We just had drinks. The venue itself is beautiful! The service was great and the beers very tasty as well. We'd love to head back to have drinks in the courtyard at night because it looked amazing.

Love this place.  I've been here before a show at the Paramount.  Had the fried brussel sprouts as a starter.  YUMMY!!! 
I'm here again with friends.    Enjoying the atmosphere and the food.

This place is great! Nice vibe, cool building, lots of indoor/outdoor seating. Nice server to boot. Absolutely loved the short rib sandwich, and the French fries were outstanding, too. Topping it off with a Hop Centric beer = perfection.

Went on a Saturday afternoon with family. Was promptly seated. Place is pretty cool and has a nice ambience. Our server came over quickly and we got a couple of beers. This is the highlight here. The food is just so so. We had a couple of small plates which were better than the entrees. We got the beef stroganoff special, the stuffed chicken (no stuffing at all) and fish tacos. The fish tacos were the best of everything. The stroganoff was soupy with linguini noodles. Odd flavor. Not really anything to write home about. Odd flavor and color and like soup. Yuck. The stuffed chicken wasn't stuffed and was just bland. We all tried each other's dishes. I'd recommend going for a beer and maybe, and that's a big maybe, a small plate appetizer. 120 bucks for 4 people for very so-so food doesn't have us returning.

This was  our first time going to this place,, i will say the inside is very nice..as we came to find out alot of good history behind it.. We started by glancing over the menu they have it in sections  Small plates, starters, and entres...We almost didnt  end up comming to this place as i called to ask if they had the fried brusselspouts,, and the girl said  no we dont have that,, when i talked to her i asked how long they were open till  said on the internet till eleven, she said the was the bar, but the restraunt closes at 9, i said does it closes at 9 or do i have to be seated BY 9, she then said well the kitchen closes at 8pm??

Somewhere we just lost an hour , so a bit rushed we are only 5 minutes away , i said to wifey lets hurry up and go.
