When we got there we found out the restraunt was still  SITTING people at 9pm this was the time we left..So im not really sure why they told us that...let me continue...The food is overpriced A BIT,  this place is very laid back in dress code as it should be its a brewery but the prices AVE were 10-12 for a salad  the ruben usually  other places i go is about 9-10  this was 14..I had the freid brusselsprouts  THEY DID HAVE THEM....a pint of the edel weiss beer, and the soup of the day..Red bel pepper soup..the soup was very good. 

The brusselsprouts were a HUGE amount for 8 bucks was a great deal...and were by them selve  OK...but with the somewhat spicey dipping sauce  was excellent//// My wife had the 12 salad, and she said that sauce for the brusselsrouts when added made the sald taste alot better,, the sald dressing was very bland she said...

We finished up with the chocolate cake  and carrot cake..  they were both  good and at a price of 7 bucks a piece is par for the course...

we spent 50 bucks not bad but nothing to brag about, i would probably go here again, the food was hot , and the service was  on par for nomality..we wanted something more than fast food, and less esquisite than table cloth dinning... 3out 5 thats all in can muster up in this visit ...

This is a "Fine" gourmet restaurant with some very odd selections and high-ticket food options that are in no way worth the cost.

The "Small Plates" menu is $11-$20 for a 3-oz portion of food.

The enchiladas are oddly seasoned and have a bitter sauce and way too much cilantro.

The Roasted Chicken Entree has what is described as a "Portabello gravy" but the sauce that comes with it has no mushrooms, is tart, bitter, and acidic. 

POSITIVE: The mashed potatoes, on the other hand are amazing!

I don't get all the poor reviews.  This place is legit! It is shaped like a huge donut. The inside has huge ceilings and tons of exposed wood.  There is a second floor balcony throughout parts of it.  They have concerts and the inside part if the donut is a huge outdoor area to hang out in.  Big fireplaces inside and out add to the ambiance.  They do weddings as well, even if you are not doing a wedding this place is perfect for a big group or work outing. 

As for the drinks,  most are brews they make but they do have a cool selection of other beers that are unique (a bit expensive for those though) the food was pretty good too.  I'm not dreaming about the next time I can eat there food but I am dreaming about the next time I can hang out there and grab a couple beers!

Ohh yeah almost forgot they have a huge area that is a coffee shop, no big deal

hiladas dish, tasted like microwaved dinner. Two bite taken and put to side. 

I got pot roast,  it was OK... fair at best.  Was a bit dried out probably because it was cooked to fast. 

Desert flour less chocolate cake or brownie.  Was ok tasted a little bit like a little Debbie brownie except dryer. 

So I hate to write a review but it's the truth.  Server  was good on a positive note 

They did remove the first meal but a manager did NOT come by to smooth anything over which is management 101 in a situation like this

When it was walter Payton it was off the hook delicious.  
The prices are cheaper now but the food quality reflects that. If I go back it's because we'll who am I kidding I can't and won't food just wasn't good.  Keep in mind This is is coming from a guy that thinks olive garden has great food.....

The beer!!! I'd love to tell you which one is the best, but many of their brews are perfect: light and refreshing, dark and satisfying, or deliciously complex. But, there's more. 

The food is delicious--I like meat and vegan dishes. The atmosphere is attractive and casual with brick and wood decor. The parking is ample. I love the Roundhouse!

I wish I could go 3.5 stars. The place is a little better than "okay". I had a Hefeweizen beer which was actually really good. My wife had a Caesar salad that was also fine.

There wasn't anything too great to bring us back. Before it was Two Brothers, we craved their nachos, dinner rolls, salads, etc. we were excited to go there. Now it is just functional: a fine dinner but not a memorable one.

I had a Reuben that used sliced brisket instead of corned beef. Great to be creative but honestly it didn't add anything. It tasted like a beef sandwich with Swiss and sauerkraut - nothing more.  

We really miss the old Walter Payton's Roundhouse. This place just isn't anywhere near as good.
Not only do they have great beer but they also have awesome food, live music, and events. The staff is great as well
Outstanding muffuletta!!  Delicious salads.  Very nice atmosphere and of course the beers are the best!  My wife and I enjoyed it very much.
It was just alright. Got some apps...they were ok, but not awesome. I'm not a huge beer drinker, so for me, it wasn't a highlight. The server was good, very helpful & attentive.

Recent visit there when my daughter was performing as part of RockU (Hix Bros).  It had been awhile since my last visit there but was reminded how nice the center patio area is...so relaxing and good vibe.  Staff very accomodating and the food & drinks were pretty good, though I would not say great.  Parking was a bit of a problem.  Couldn't find a parking space that wasn't valet.  When I thought that I found one the valet told me that I need to move it but did point out an area that I could park.  Will probably come back when its a bit less busy to enjoy the patio again.
Good place for spending time on a weekend. Had a good collection of beers. Taste n yummy food.
Very cool atmosphere with huge historical facility.  Food was excellent with many options for both kiddos and adults.  One of the best brew pubs in Chicagoland.

My organization recently had an event in one of the banquet rooms and and we enjoyed the atmosphere, food and attentive staff. I highly recommend this facility for any event as they had plentiful indoor space and even an attractive outdoor area.
Tim is such a great bartender and took such good care of us! Thank you so much for keeping that enthusiasm throughout the whole Oscars show @ 11 pm on a Sunday night. I love this kid!!!!

This is a great staple restaurant in Aurora. Two Brothers has amazing food. I love their fish taco's. They are the best I've ever had. They obviously have a great beer selection. This is also an amazing place to come see a band play. They also have a cafe for coffee and baked goods. I've heard nothing but good things about the weddings that are hosted here. The atmosphere is amazing. Two Brothers Roundhouse is a huge restaurant but they use the space really well.  The service is great! 5 stars!

I love Two Brothers. They always, obviously, have a great selection of beer on tap. Great selection of food on their menu, from great appetizers, to delicious small plates, to tasty entrees.

A fantastic place to eat before a concert at Riveredge Park or a show at The Paramount. They also sometimes offer FREE valet parking on busy nights. Friendly, fun staff.

And they also always have fun events happening throughout the week. A great place to hang out while getting a great meal too.

The only other time I'd even come close to coming here, it was the first stop on a haunted tour of Aurora. The place seemed to have cool history and a brief glimpse of the menu seemed promising, and I vowed to return. We had friends in town this weekend and I didn't know what the hell to do with them in the burbs on a Friday night, so we ventured over here. I re-checked out the menu in the car and was super excited about their small plate options.

We were seated immediately in an emptyish dining room and waited for our server. And waited and waited. And waited. When our server finally arrived, we decided to order drinks AND food, just in case. He was very flustered by this decision, especially since someone in our group ordered two samples of beer in addition to their drink, and I ordered water with my diet coke.

For food, we had a pretty mixed bag - my husband got the cheese plate (market price - $12), I ordered the marrow toasts, his friends got fish tacos and mussels (with no selection of broth, despite the menu indicating he had an option). Friend's girlfriend got the fish tacos. Our server scurried off, and we waited.

And waited.

Twenty minutes later, our food arrived, but we still didn't have drinks. One of the more outspoken members of our party pointed this out to the server who brought our food, who looked genuinely mortified at the service we were receiving and ran to get the guy. He had that "oh sh*t!" look on his face, and ran off toward the bar. About 5 minutes after that, our drinks arrived, except for mine... The diet coke. What?! He apologized and ran off again, but it was seriously annoying to not even have a beverage when trying to eat, especially a particularly heavy item like bone marrow.

When he came back with my drink, he could tell we were annoyed - but instead of apologizing and taking our obvious cues of "go away," he sat on the table next to ours and launched into this absurdly long, convoluted, not-entirely-true-sounding story about how the bartenders accidentally dropped all of our drinks and then broke a bottle of wine and then broken things were everywhere which prevented him bringing us drinks because things were broken. Being in customer service as a field of employment myself, I HATE this tactic - unfortunately, bashing someone in a different part of the building is really just relaying to the customer that the place where you ALL work doesn't have it's crap together - it does not somehow absolve you of some dissatisfaction.

As far as the food goes, opinions were all across the board. The fish tacos were great but doused so heavily in sauce that they had to be eaten with a fork and knife. My marrow toasts were good but the garlic lemon toast was an extraordinarily heavy accompaniment - marrow is about as indulgent as it gets, I promise plain or dry seasoned toast would work. The mussels came with an odd stalk of lemongrass jammed in the bowl of broth. The cheese plate was nothing special or unique. It seemed as though they'd cut the cheese they use on burgers into squares and put it on a plate. All in all, it could have been better. I think I'd go back and try more stuff if I was guaranteed not to have our server, but I wouldn't repeat any of the items we tried.

The building itself is exceptionally cool and the crowd seemed fun enough, but we left right after eating because we didn't want to deal with trying to order another round of drinks, sadly. 

I may try the Roundhouse one more time for posterity, but it won't be for awhile. If you're looking for a unique place to get beer and food in Aurora, though, this cannot be the worst option to explore.
Waitstaff are very friendly. I've never tried anything from here I didn't like. Food is great and so are the drinks. Pretty in the wintertime!
Their food is the same as its always been basically. OK food, too expensive, and too crowded. It really should demand to be better than it is.

Well that was awesome! I rarely enjoy eating alone but tonight was an exception. I wandered over from my hotel not knowing what to expect and found a treat. Great food, excellent beer, awesome atmosphere, and a friendly bar tender. The pork belly tacos were amazing and the mushroom cheese risotto was out of control good. I also had a Monarch brew and was very happy with the quality of the beer. I am at the hotel for a training all week and will be back several times I am sure.

Boy has this place gone downhill. The beer is very good, but food, not so much. Companions Reuben was uneatable. Gray soggy tasteless corned beef. Bacon wrapped scallops overlooked, tough and tasteless. Mussels were just OK, that gets the one star. Desserts unremarkable. Service was slow and confused. Orders screwed up twice. 

Maybe the burgers, steak and pot roast are better. This is certainly no place to order seafood. Good luck negotiating the parking lot.

For their prices you should get much better. Won't be back.

Ugh. ...beer not cold enough?! Nothing like warm beer.
My steak came out grey in color...how is that possible 
The "mystery mush " inside the Cuban fritters was gross.
My friends fish was borderline inedible.

Nice atmosphere I guess get it 2 stars. ..

We were quoted a 20 minute wait. An hour later we were still waiting. I checked in with the hostess to see if we were somehow overlooked and she assured me we weren't. Then some other gentlemen came up to me shortly after and quoted me 3-5 minutes. 15 minutes after that we left and neither person even apologized for the inconvenience. We ended up waiting a total of one hour and twenty minutes and left with empty stomachs. Shameful.

Just rude people, wanted to have a fun night out but they made that a challenge! At least I'm not one to let others ruin my life space!

Won't go back though, other happening and upbeat places to spend my precious time, money, and life!

I don't know why I haven't reviewed Two Brothers Roundhouse earlier. My best guess, is because I knew it would be an ultra long review, as there are so many positive things to say!

To begin with, the food is fantastic. You can tell that the Chef takes a lot of pride in what he does. Even the simplest of dishes contain beautiful ingredients with a great presentation. The Brothers certainly feel the same way about their beer. They have a good base that is offered yearly, as well as multiple seasonal options. The non-Two Brothers craft brews they offer round out the mix. In terms of drinks, even the alcohol has a different spin. The spiced rum is NOT Captain Morgan. What it is, is deliciousness in a glass that reminds you of Christmas - sugar, spice, and everything nice. It's like a gift to your tastebuds. 

I've been here a lot. For as incredible as the food is, I have a hard time weaning my way from the fish tacos. They are fantastic! Only two tacos, but still a good portion and I rarely finish it all. The fish and batter are fresh and crunchy, the slaw is light and creamy, and I love that they quickly pan fry the tortilla so it's both crispy and warm.

Really though, you can't go wrong here when it comes to ordering food. Everything I've had is delicious. And while the fish tacos stole my heart from the start, every now and then I order something different. I particularly love that I can order several small plates as a meal - tapas-style!

Lastly on the food/drink, is the coffee counter on the right hand side of the entrance. We ordered a few latte's the last time around, and they were fantastic. Creamy, rich, and FRESH. I didn't know a latte could taste so good.

Now that I've reviewed what most of you want to read, let's talk about my favorite part: the venue as a wedding location. Nicole Cook is freaking amazing, and made everything about our wedding incredibly smooth and easy. We had a Fall-themed wedding, and this couldn't have been a better location. The fireplaces were lit and beautiful, the outdoor ceremony was perfectly organized, and the service on the day-of was more than I could have asked for. I'm 100% biased, but I think the food was the best I've ever tasted. Since it's part of a restaurant, you get the added bonus of real chefs working on your plates. Our guests had an incredible time, and there's not a thing I would change about this venue. 

Wedding tips: 
-Negotiate. Most brides don't, but you can. We ended up getting the entire floor downstairs, even though we didn't have the max amount of guests to fill it.
-Get what you want. If you don't want soup and just want a salad? No problem, just apply the money you would have spent on the soup, on appetizers or late night snacks.
-Use your planner as a resource. They've all been doing this for a long time, and they are experts. Trust them!

We had our wedding reception here in the Stout & Lager room and can not say enough amazing things about this place. Everyone is so easy to work with and communicate via email quickly. The food is amazing, decor is unlike anywhere else and their attention to detail made the big day stress free. We worked with Stephany during the planning and Nicole for the actual wedding and they made everything so easy and made sure every little detail was taken care of. We HIGHLY recommend Two Brother's Roundhouse for any event and thank you for making our special day one we will never forget :)

This is based on the hostess and phone service.  I called a week before Valentine's Day to make a reservation, and I was denied because they were only accepting reservations for two or four people.  The hostess told me that I could walk in with my group, and I would be able to get a table no problem.  

I brought my family and requested a table.  They asked if I had a reservation, and I explained that they were unwilling to give me one, but I was told that I could get a table when I walked in.  The hostess told me that they were completely booked, and it would be three hours before they accommodate us.  I explained again what I was told, and the host and hostess just shrugged their shoulders.  Needless to say, we left disappointed.

The food is great & and so is the atmosphere. I love sitting outside and listening to bands play during the summer. It's the perfect place to catch up with friends after a long week over good food & drinks.
food is good here. not much of a night bar unless you're here to see a show. a big fan of the beer choices

I love this place for what they've done to Downtown Aurora.  They brought real music here.  

They have real shows, for some people you wouldn't believe would be performing in a little bar area.

It can get crowded.  I'd suggest you get there a little bit earlier then any event starts to make sure you get a good seat.

Then there's the restaurant, which is very good.  I love the nacho's here.  Also, you can't go wrong ordering one of their burgers.  Just order the next level up of what you would want.  For instance, if you want Medium Rare, then order Medium.  I found this out the hard way, but since I have changed my preference.

I've never been to a banquet here but the area looks cool.

I just wish they'd re-open the absinthe bar.  That place was so amazing.  I spent way to much money in there.  Also they used to have like acoustic folk singer type acts in there.

They might not realize what they actually have in that little section where the absinthe bar is/was... that bar was actually 1 of 3 lighted bars from the 1893 Chicago's World Fair.   It's such a cool piece of history to be locked up in a room that is never really utilized.

Really good food and of course, good beer.  Try the Brussels sprouts if you're into that sort of thing and the potato chips. We loved them both.  And skip the goat cheese unless you don't mind semi toasted soft bread instead of the usual super crunchy toast points.  They whip up a solid burger, but my salad was a little blah. My favorite beer of theirs is Ebel's Weiss, but I'm a bit picky when it comes to beer.  My friends and husband liked all the beer they tried.  Service was good and the restaurant was nice. We'll definitely go back.
The food is just ok. The beer is good. Won't take reservations which completely irritates me. Unlikely to return.

This is a great place to get together and hang out with friends.  It has a lodge feel to it and is very cozy in the winter.  The beer selection is amazing and the food is pretty good.  This place has both a dining area and a bar area that can accommodate a lot of people.  There's also a huge area outside, which I think is used for banquets during the summer.  The menu is creative and offers bar food with a twist.  The fish tacos and pork belly tacos are always a hit with the group.

Reuben Sandwich - The Reuben isn't very Reubeny as the meat is more beefy and brown rather than reddish and peppery.  However, it was a great tasting sandwich.  The fries are fresh cut and also good.

Pretzels - Comes with 2 large pretzels and mustard dipping sauce.  I wasn't a fan of the sauce and wish they had something more cheesy.

Small plate ravioli - This dish was fresh and delicious.

They also offered fried okra for $5 that I might try next time.

Although they offer a huge variety of craft beer, I typically go for the light and refreshing Ebel Weiss (20oz/$6).  Some of the other choices includes: Outlaw, Domain Dupage, The Bitter End, Cane and Ebel, Two Hearted, Revelry...

There's also a store section by the entrance where you can pick up apparels, beer to go and even ground coffee.
Good beer very good service and great atmosphere in a historic building. Food was meh.

I Absolutely love this place. Not only do they have amazing brew, but every first Friday of the month they have an art show/exhibit as well as live bands playing. Such a great atmosphere and great vibes all around. I love how big it is, and I have to definitely recommend the tacos! They were delicious and made pretty fast! I will continue to come here as long as I can!
Been there for karaoke with a live band, fun place to hang out and have a few drinks. Food menu is pretty good too.

Hhhmmmm. If you read some of the reviews and there are plenty, you might think, 'the food is just so so but the beer is great'. Imagine if you will, three adult males go into a brewery restaurant and order based solely on the menus' item descriptions and receive well prepared very delicious meals. The out come could be 50/50 based on reviews. No kidding, the beer IS excellent. But, as far as food is concerned, I had the Walleye, truly amazing, no joke. Another independent thinker at my table had the tapas Brisket and also the risotto. Replied the eater, 'Yep...great'. The third enjoyed his meal,?(no description) as I have forgotten what he had but I saw him clean his plate with a similar grunt of positivity. Overall, don't listen to negative reviews that start with, "We had a party of 30...", if you are headed out with two or three grown ass adult freethinking individuals. This place can handle your orders. The food I had was really well prepared. The beer is realllly good. Go and enjoy yourself.

We've gone back a few times since my last review and they've gotten much better. I think they were suffering from growing pains when they first opened. 
Overall happy with the place. Love the ambiance from the fireplace to the old brick walls. 
Food is really good too. Beer, five stars all the way. We are big Two Bros beer fans in my house. Kids menu could use a re-vamp but that's about my only complaint.
Cool place to go with friends, family and large groups. Fast and friendly service too.

Something about this place is special. The combination of history, beer and amazing food is incredible.  It is sad that it is no longer Walter Payton's but it still feels special. This place is actually better than the real brewery in my opinion. The ambiance is great.  The menu is unique and very tasty.  Went the tapas route and ordered a handful of small plates and everything was great. Only downside would be the location. If you live near here, try it.  I will definitely go out of my way to come back.

I've been wanting to go to this place for some time now, and I finally got there...
I made a reservation on a Saturday afternoon as we originally thought we'd have a group of at least 8, we ended up being a group of 5 because people like to cancel at the last minute or just not show and I have no control over that.  But, given the last minute decision to make a reservation they were able to accommodate us.  When we got there, they wouldn't seat us until half our group was there but as soon as we were all there we were seated promptly at our table already set with glasses of water and menus.

So yes, as others have said the parking isn't great - big place...small parking lot but they do have complimentary valet.  I decided to lap the parking lot one more time before deciding on valet but luckily I found a decent spot.

There wasn't a huge wait as again, this place is pretty big for those waiting without reservations.  While we were waiting for the rest of our group to arrive we grabbed beers in the bar area.

After we ate we headed in the room where the band was playing (no cover, yay!)  The service in there was good, even being a packed room and all. 

I would like to go back here, the beer is good, service is good, and so is the food!

Absolutely authentic south Indian food. 
Don't be dissuaded by the 1 star and 2 star reviews about service.
Tables are clean and setting is 2 star. 
 This is not exactly a white glove service 4 star ambience restaurant.
The waiters are not trying to be rude or disinterested. They simply are untrained waiters. The way they behave is their normal self. Nothing against us, the customers. 
Don't expect professional waiter service. Just expect very good food! 

The food is quite authentic south Indian food. We chose the non vegetarian thali. It is a plate with Chicken biryani in the middle dish and about 8 small cups with various curries, soup, rices and a desert. i assume that this is served only at lunch time. The food was very good. They have what is called "podi rice" - rice mixed with spiced powder - it is quite authentic and good. By the way, they will be happy to bring you refills, for your thali. I prefer this to the buffet. Buffets are underpriced and overly fattened food that I always avoid - due to the high calorific content because of use of Crisco (I am told that many indian restaurants actually use something called Dalda - a version of Crisco but Dalda is banned for import but indian groceries import it anyway)..

Anyway, I would never eat in any buffet - especially buffets in Indian restaurant.
Therefore, this thali system was quite nice. 

I ordered a chicken apetizer from the main menu. Portion size is more like an Entree. The dish was very good - made of dark meat. My personal preference is dark meat. White breast meat is used for chicken tikka/butter chicken types of dishes. 

The biryani also came with thigh meat, which was perfectly cooked and is excellent. Typical Indian restaurants mix in sauce, chicken and rice and call it biryani. The authentic way to make biryani is to cook the chicken, spices and rice together. This biryani was made the authentic way and it was excellent. It was as good as any I have tasted in Hyderabad, which I had visited just two months ago. 
Hyderabad, of course, does have superior and amazing biryani places.. I am only comparing this to an average place in Hyderabad. 

If you enjoy south Indian food, this is a very nice restaurant to try. The food is from the southern states of Andhra/Telangana. Food tends to be spicy and medium hot. No reason for you to ask for extra hot. It is sufficiently spiced.

bon appetit

Food = Good.  Service = Really Bad.

Giving my review on the overall experience.  I would recommend the food, but probably go somewhere else for the overall experience.

They rarely came by to check on us, and we didn't get all the food we ordered.

I haven't been to their Restaurant but was invited to a birthday party which is where I tasted their food. I ate Gobi Manchurian, Chili chicken, Biryani and Rasmalai. All of them tasted above average. The cake was fresh too 

Yet again as I haven't been to the restaurant. I really dont known the other aspects such as pricing, service etc.

Terrible biryani, all I could taste was the spices. Super spicy despite specifying medium to mild. The guy who picked up the phone confirmed we could order off the menu but when I got there they declineed to serve anything but the biryani. Was really excited about authentic hyderabadi biryani and this place has disappointed on all levels - food and service.

Two stars for Chicken Dum Biryani only. Me and my husband visited this place for some good authentic food but what I felt that everyone was busy and it took a lady a while to take the order. What irritated more was that they even didn't placed any silvers, plates and napkin even after serving the food. 
Even for the beverage we have to remind them again to serve it. Moving on to the food... I had Mysore Masala dosa which was not at all upto the mark to my previous experience elsewhere. I couldn't get the taste of authentic Mysore masala dosa. 
So, if you are visiting this place then go for biryani only.

A long time craving for a good Indian thali led us to take the long drive here one Sunday afternoon. Foreseeing a huge crowd we made sure to be seated at the restaurant by 12:15pm. Although tad early for Indian restaurants this particular one was packed 70% by the time we reached.

Having decided before hand to get the pre-set thali, we waited for our server to take our order. And there began the waiting saga! It took her a good 15+ minutes to just take our order. 

The thali prices are not exactly cheap but well worth the money in terms of food variety, taste & quality. Never in the US have I had better thali food. Also it is an all you can eat kind, you just need to call the server going around the room with food containers, asking for a refill. (This type of service is pretty common in India)

After what seemed like an endless wait of a good 20-25 minutes our food did arrive. This I believe is an extremely long time since we had asked for a set meal and not ala carte. The wait for order giving and the food afterwards had us exasperated but one bite of the delicious food (Bliss!) and it seemed like all could be forgiven. But the issues of poor service continued to haunt us throughout the meal. 

Every time we needed a refill an endless wait would ensue. When the server did arrive at our table they would miss (every single time) to serve refills to all parties at our table.

Meanwhile we assumed a thali as good as this should have some awesome biryani. So well before finishing our meal, we ordered for a biryani takeaway. Long story short - by the time we finally finished our meal and got the biryani order it was 2:30pm. 

Spending 2hours & 15minutes for a lunch of preset thali and takeaway is ridiculous. It saddens me so much to give 2 stars for this place because the thali was so bloody GOOD!! I am hoping very strongly that they pull themselves on the pathetic service. Clearly the front of the house and kitchen are in utter chaos.

PS: The biryani was average, I have had better. Go here only for the thali but be prepared to wait.
Awesome food. I have tried gongura mutton, uluvacharu chicken, cut mirchi, mutton sukka, chicken biryani every thing was awesome.

I have been last Sunday lunch buffet spread, it was ok. There were chat salad, naan desserts not refilled from long time, I felt there where doing a free food buffet. When I ask they where telling items r coming, but really I did not get those items. There was waiting time, still ok. On that day it was 1st anniversary, they did a big buffet, but need to refills where missing and the cake was no more, they did not take the cake board also.
Went to new store in morrisville. Worst food and service ever. They use lots of food color vs spices. Also, careful with you bill..they will add tip on their own.

The food sucks. They don't know how to serve. They serve rice and you have to wait for long time before they serve the curries and the food gets dry. The curries were medicore. I can cook better and I am worst cook lol. Avoid it all cost.

I'd like to summarise all my visits,
1. Food is good, few are really good and few are just ok. CALL BEFORE YOU WALK-IN and ask if they're serving what your looking for.

2. Everytime I came I was said we ran out of food, we only have these, why open if you can't serve just the food you choose to be on menu. My last visit, people who were walking out and held the door for us to come in said they only have biryani if you were in mood for something else don't waste time. Don't forget to drive to a casino if you got what you came for, keep that winning lucky charm.

3. Worst service, I had walked to waiter, asked to come to our table to take our order, wait a long time so anyone of them would respond to your call asking for something else like more water, napkins. Prepare yourself for long wait to get waiters attention, deck of cards might help you to kill time.

4. Worst service, there you go, I wrote it again. The attitude of waiters will get you on your nerves. Play some soothing music when you drive back to your home or keep a punching bag in truck.

5. Ambience is bad, the place is too noisy. Please avoid if you're looking for a calm place for a dinner date, meet over lunch or something else. Grab your earplugs or talk really loud on your table.

I had my spoonful at this place, giving a miss hereafter. I am sure to put some words in other ears not to endure this.

Been here couple of times. Nothing fancy about this place and food is just average. Raju Gari bhojanam on weekends is unlimited and cost $14.99 for non-veg food and $13.99 for veg food. Even though food is unlimited, taste leaves a lot to be desired. Spice levels are very low for curries. This is far away from my home and hence might not return back.
we have gone couple times there food & biryanis excellent keep it up service little poor. highly recommended for biryanis.

Considering there is no option that serves the meals plate at the table with the variety and quality they serve it's a great place. Yes be patient don't go for the Rajugaru meals if you are very Hungry. Good rasam and pastries. Overall good for authentic south  Indian food
They have the worst Indian foods

At Hyderabad house , trying out unlimited dosa , they don't serve coconut chutney and the other chutneys are cold, as good as frozen , which I doubt is the case.The potato in masala dosa is chunky and the service was very bad , just one person taking order for 8-10 tables.I wouldn't recommend to anyone.

Service along with the attitude of the owner has a lot of room for improvement. 
The food however is not bad. Tried chili paneer which was pretty tasty but the veg biryani was too dry. Since the restaurant is new, it is always packed but if they do not work on the service, I have feeling they will start losing business soon

Very Poor Service and No quality Food!! Don't ever host a party here!! Beware they serve meat instead of vegetarian.

We had a unforgettable incident on 03/18/2016 serving(To go Order) with chicken instead of baby corn starter.verify you order before you start your meal.

Very Poor Service and Okay quality Food!! Don't ever host a party here!!

I hosted a birthday party here and told to serve the food at 12 PM. The Hall was not ready until 10.30 am. They were making the call ready after 10:30 am only. And they kept lot of garbage and waste items in a corner of the hall and they did not remove it. Tables were not clean. They charged me 70$ per hour for the Hall.

Comparing the Other places in Naperville, Food is comparatively good here. But they behave and treat people like they serve great food.

They started to serve the food at 1:15 PM after we told them so many times to serve the food. And they served Veg Items first and brought Not-veg items after a long time 20-30 minutes. By the time Non-veg items were served, people already done with the Veg Items and it was not enough for Veg people. I had to order extra food for Veg people and they charged me the Menu price.

When I told the Caterer that I had to take back home Half tray of Veg Briyani and Half Tray of Chicken Briyani, he told me he could have exchanged Half Tray of Veg. Briyani for the Half tray of Chicken Briyani which was already served in the Buffet.

I was concerned about their quality standards when he said he would take back the food which was served already. Then would they serve the food to us which was taken from other parties?

They forced me to order extra food by serving the food very late and very disorganized way.

Disappointed with the service. A place where you literally have to request for each and every simple item like silver ware etc. Had to ask for the dish multiple times following which the item was delivered to our table. Something as simple as a glass of water or silver ware needs to requested multiple times upon which they might give when they feel like. Even after complaining mid way there was zero improvement on their part for the rest of the evening.
Giving 2 stars as the food was decent, won't say good but won't say bad.
Very nice must go!!!!!!!!!!! I wonder why only 3 stars ??? Trust it's best one we ever had!!!!!
Amazing food , wait time around 20 mins .. If you plan to go like after 8:30 pm on a weekend make sure you have reservations Coz it will get crowed really soon.

Here's the deal, people are going ape-shit about their food because we don't necessarily have amazing Indian food in the area. This is a good place to dine, and has relatively good food, but it's most certainly NOT WORTHY of five stars.

First of all, they have good tasting biryani, and quite a few selections, however, if you try a few of them, you'll come to realize they're similar tasting with a few spins to set them apart. Their Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani is the most flavorful of them all, and the Vijayvada Special Chicken biryani is only more expensive because it's boneless chicken, not because it's any better. We ordered the Goat Pepper Fry, which I must admit was pretty flavorful, the curry dark and earthy, with the right punch of spices, spoiled only by the fact that the meat wasn't very tender. It was cooked through, but pretty chewy. The garlic naan was the best thing I tasted all night, and is DEFINITELY recommended. I ordered the "double ke meetha", which to me would have been khubaani ka meetha, or a custard with a sauce of apricots, but it was actually soupy shahi tukdey - but maybe that's just the miscommunication of what a dessert actually is, versus my expectations. Lastly, the masala chai - let's just be honest, you CANNOT do masala chai justice by making it with a few cardamom pods in a damn percolator.

Lastly, the service definitely leaves something to be desired. They're all doing their job, but it is as if they're all forced to be there. They barely make any conversation, and there are no table touches or communication between taking the order, bringing it, and then bringing the check. Three stars does it. *shrugs*

I am a big fan of Vijayawada SPL chkn biryani. But to my suprise, I tried naans with karaikudi chkn and chkn marsala...it was amaxing... North Indian food is also really good. Hope they continue the same flavour in future.

Nothing much to say simply awesome service and food. 
Best starters and biryani ever I had in states.

Food is nice if you can get past the terrible service. You have to call 8-10 times before someone picks up because they don't even have a simple business phone. I really hate that I like their food, its demoralizing to go there.
The service was so horrible and it took an hour to get my food to the table I was not worried about that too , when I got food to the table it was cold and not tasty ...

Horrible Service :(
Food is mediocre.

Two visits - complete disaster
1 take out - complete disaster

1st visit - food took forever (~40 mins) food came out in installments, so 1 person got his Chicken Biryani after we were all done eating.

2nd visit - Ordered 1 biryani and two dosas. Biryani came after 10mins, Dosas never came - 40mins later we walked out.

Take out - we ordered VEG biryani and they delivered Chicken. Disaster

We will never water any more TIME or money at this place ever again.
I like the vijayawada Biriyani at this place - Buffet on weekend worth a wait , good options in the Buffet.
Too pricey for the area and the style of service. Also, the food is excessively spicy. I like my spicy Indian food, but this is close to inedible.

I did NOT like it. 1st, no Dosa orders on weekends, seriously!!! Ok, then I waited about 30 mins after placing the order for a buffet , just to let us know that it will take 10 more mins to get the dish for the 'buffet thali '. They were literally bringing out one dish at a time every 5 mins! I do not see that as acceptable on a weekend. Walked out! Tamarind Indian cuisine was on the rescue and I am glad because tamarind has nicer options on the buffet

Very very poor service 
management is really bad
Food was really good in past days but today I totally disappointed with sambar idly and service
We reached there by 9:20 but they said dosa night is done and u have to order some other food 
And then we ordered veg biriyani and sambar idly and one oft my  friends ordered 2-3 varieties off dosa but aftr long wait almost like 1 and half aftr we asking many time they brought us left over sambar and idly which is not even hot.
If u guys don't have staff try to take few more pple for these special offer.I agree the taste of you food is really good but management and service is really really bad which made me to write a review on ur restaurant 

Hope this is not going to repeat

They have really tasty food which is the restaurants true value, but they compromise that with terrible service. We waited 15 mins for them to take the order and another 20-25 mins for food to arrive and the restaurant was just half full. I hope they improve their service in future.
I regularly order biryani from here . The quality is decreasing now a days . I hope they work on their quality.
This place has very good gongura chicken .  Chicken lollipop also good. Nice andhra style indian place.

I am surprised this place has a few ratings of 1 and 2 stars. I was introduced to this place on 22nd april and I made about 3 trips to this place post that. I stay I about 45 mins away from this place. All their food is so amazing (be it biryanis , curries, pastries etc) and that's the only reason I visit this place. Their veg and non veg thali's on sat and sun afternoons are out of the world, severed on banana leaf and is unlimited. Just feels like your are in india. 
They have so much of rush and about 15-20 mins of wait time to get seated. In comparison to the demand they have for their food I would say they are slightly understaffed which may perhaps affect their service levels at times. Thats the only reason I believe there are few lower star ratings due to service. 
They are one of the best indian restaurants for its food taste & quality. Keep it up. Don't change anything except improving service !!

Great Indian food in Chicago land ! Especially their biryanis are awesome. I have been to the lunch here on a Sunday ! Horrible service ! No adequate planning and preparation ! If I want to spend your 3 valuable hours for Sunday lunch ! It's the best! But if you value time never ever visit

This joint appeared in an unfortunate complex of buildings that has seen a number of restaurants/clubs (mostly Paki/Desi) come and go with alarming alacrity. You can't see the face of the building from New York Street or from Rt.59. The neighboring businesses aren't exactly inviting, and the close big deal is Best Buy, which if you are like most folks, you want to get in, make your purchase and then get the hell away from there with all speed.
It was a day in which I knew I was going to have one shot at a meal. I was doing errands on rt 59, and had a hankering for Curry. Usually that means the Tamarind buffet on the flip side of New York, but then I remembered this place I had seen whilst escaping from Best Buy. I called to see if they had a buffet, and they said no, they had an "Unlimited Thali". Ah! Promising! 
The place looks higher-end from the outside than what it is inside, which is basic-diner in appearance.
The place populated with Desi folk, a good sign. The meek waitress gave me a menu and a small piece of paper that spoke of "Veg" and "Non-Veg" Thali. This was the special the fella on the fone spoke of. 
I've been a fan of Desi food for many years, and the more authentic the better. I didn't recognize a bunch of the dishes on the Thali list. This looked fab! I swung with the "Non-Veg".
If you've never had a Thali-it is a series of steel cups and bowls in a matching silver tray. Lots of little portions of different stuff. you remove the smaller cups and make combinations on the tray, which becomes your "plate".
What came to the table was a remarkable fragrant and attractive/appetizing assortment. Rice, Meat, Curry, Dal, Raita, Sambar, Naan (those are general terms-the exact names I dont remember) with a nice Pappad on top! 
I dug in with zeal, and wow, were the flavors popping! And man, there was some real-deal spice heat working in some of the dishes. I've never tasted some of these flavors before, which was a true treat, and like I say, I've had a bunch of Indian food.
The deal is, you could order refills of anything that was on the tray, and as I couldn't ask for stuff by name, I pointed to a few (including the incendiary dal).
Awfully good, this feed was, and not expensive at all. An instant favorite!!
And it's part of a small chain--good to know when out of town.
By the time I left, the place was PACKED.
I think this place will be here for while. I sure hope so...
Decent place . I picked up food for a lunch and it was good in taste as well as the Quantity.
Good food and garlic nann.  Ordered takeout and was very impressed.  We will be repeat customers

My experience at Hyderabad House was largely unimpressive. We ordered 2 dosa night specials (unlimited dosas), 1 garlic naan, 1 samosa plate, and 1 butter paneer masala. Here's a breakdown of what each dish was like:

Dosa Night Special: While "unlimited dosas" may sound like a good deal at first, you're left feeling cheated when your first dosa is brought out to you. It is cold. It is flimsy. It is clearly made without proper love. I've never seen a sadder looking dosa in my life. You might think you can liven up the poor dosa with some chutney (which by the way is mediocre at best) but you'll quickly find that the quantity of chutney provided to you is not nearly sufficient. Of course you may ask for more, but when the servers are nearly all occupied/inattentive it becomes a desperate struggle to resuscitate your close to lifeless dosa. You may decide that your first excuse for a dosa is an aberration, that surely your 2nd one will make up for the abysmal experience that was the 1st. But sure enough you'll find yourself disappointed yet again. Another cold, lifeless dosa that was probably left out to die in the harsh Chicago winter. 

Samosa Plate: When you first lay eyes on your 2 samosas, you'll notice that they appear out of place. While they look good themselves, they are presented to you on a sparse bed of shredded carrot and lettuce. Why put a hallmark Indian appetizer on an anorexic looking travesty of an American salad? It will be both an insult to you and an insult to the samosas. 

Garlic Naan: Brittle. Brittle. Brittle. You will question whether you're eating garlic naan or papadum. 

Butter Paneer Masala:  You'll find this to be the saving grace preventing a 1 star review of your own. While the other items were close to death, this is quite the opposite as it rode swiftly into battle for a sorely needed counterattack. The color alone is valiant and the flavor is warm and hearty. You'll experience a lofty aftertaste leaving you nostalgic for the first bite and in eager anticipation for the next. 

Service: Get ready to experience what it's like to live in a 3rd world country where the majority of the population doesn't have access to clean drinking water right in the heart of Naperville. Seriously, could this establishment not afford to pay the water bill? Not once will you be approached to have your glass refilled. Also forget about ice. You're not getting any. It's almost as if the staff is actively trying to dehydrate you as you force down their awful attempt at delivering you a respectable Indian cuisine. 

Take your money elsewhere, please.

I had to wait for an hour for my biriyani to come. Service is terrible. We repeatedly asked him for my food and he kept saying '5 minutes more madam'. They wouldn'teven let me cancel the order.

All I did was watch the bus boy. He didn't even seem to be washing his hands after he touched the mop and was setting the plates and filling water. 

Naperville has plenty of options with good customer service and better hygiene.  I am not going back to a place that has such terrible service.

Food is fantastic, and portions are HUGE.  Since this was a Biryani Place, I got the Vijayawada special chicken and my buddy had the gongura chicken, both of which were sooo good.   I don't remember when the last time we had biryani at a restaurant was, but this was by far the best i've had.  The spices were perfectly balanced, and the basmati was so long it almost felt like they were mini-noodles.  Fantastic!

As of now I think this is the best Indian Restaurant in LAN ( Lisle-Aurora-Naperville) . Taste is really good and come with a bit of price . We had the following dishes 
Mirchi Bajji - Really good with balanced combination of spices & Guntur style 
Karappodi Idli - Probably the best available idli in LAN, Karappodi is good but tasted like Mysore style . Thought of having Karivepaku ( curry leaves) & tamarind combination podi. 
Cone Dosa- Crispy and tasty. 
Mysore Masala Dosa - Masala is good and it could have been little more crispy
Dum Biryani - Very well cooked with right amount of spices 
Black Forest Pastries - Tasty with balanced flavour and sweetness

Service is good and best use of tablet based technology. Even though the restaurant is 70% full , they made the delivery in a reasonable time . In fact the lady took the order knows the order in which the dishes would be ready and come out of the kitchen. Good job Keep it up

Natu kodi biryani is very good. They have good number of varieties in Biryani. You will find some traditional Indian dishes here that you don't find in most of Indian restaurants. Also, options are more in the weekend. Service can be better.

Went here last night with my boyfriend and had a wonderful meal! The menu was vast, so we took some recommendations from our server based on what we already like. We had goat curry and chicken tikka masala with vegetable samosas and garlic naan. These dishes did not disappoint! We did have a minor inconvenience and the staff handled it expediently! We will be back!!

Perfect place for biryani lovers. Tried 3 different types of biryanis in my last 3 visits and each time it met the expectations and taste. Andhra chicken (home style) is also a dish to notice. Good ambiance and friendly staff. Must visit place in Naperville/aurora area.

One of the best Indian cuisine in Naperville. Ambience - pleasant , service - quick , food delicious. Price $$
I strongly recommend 'Guttivankay pulav ' (obviously it's veg) , available only during weekends . Apart, one of the best place for Biryani veg/non-veg .

The vijay wada biryani was amazing . It's the best biryani I have had outside India. The staff was friendly and service was quick. The mutton fry was delicious . I wish they had more cold beverages besides mango lassi. The Black Forest and pineapple pastries were yum.

One of the best indian foods ever had living in US. Ordered Madras Mutton Curry, Andhra Goat Curry, Chicken Mughlai, Goat Biryani, Veg Biryani and Malai Kofta - and all were right on spot. Hope they keep their maintain their quality. Kudos to them !!!
Been here for buffet on a weekend and Two stars is just for the taste of the food. Irresponsible service during the buffet, have to wait for food every time you need something.

To go order wasn't ready for 2 hours.  Had to wait for an hour at the restaurant. Why? They gave the order to a dine in and cook another one for us.  Best part, they did not even feel it is an issue.  The food is usually good.  Had to walk out empty handed after waiting.  I guess, the only people who eat here, are the ones who do not not care for service, ready to eat good food thrown at them.

Horrible horrible horrible customer service!! The staff seemed completely lost and no one came to provide menus or take our order until we went up to the register and requested assistance. Food literally took 45-60mins to come out and brought one dish at a time for 8 people. Half the time we sat there waiting for rest of our order to come out. Half our group got food the other half watched us eat. It was the worst. The lady barely spoke English or Hindi so communication was beyond terrible. Biryani was okay but chicken was to spicy to even touch. Half decent place to eat if you have time to waste waiting.

Dosa night extreme bad servicing... One dosa comes in around 50min.. Even dere was included appetizer dat also came we told dem thrice... Plain dosa was ok.. But onion dosa stuffing was also not proper... Not at all worth coming most bad service ever. I hope dere was even less than 1 rating wud have given that
Biryani was a disappointment not even close to hyderabadi biryani. Tried chinese was good and pastries are good.

This is my first time ever reviewing a restaurant. I would say, the food is really good and that's the only reason I keep going back to the place. However, the service is very bad and the waiters don't have any hospitality related training what so ever. Also the people who run the place don't seem to value a customer's time. We have been left waiting for food for upwards of an hour on multiple occasions with no signs of remorse from the staff. Oh, and the hygiene is also suspicious. 2 stars for the biryani.

I drive a very far distance to eat here. Their staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. Anytime I've had to wait (because they're busy, which is always good) I know my patience will be rewarded with a wonderful dinner/lunch. Biryani is incredible. If you like it hot, ask for spicy (my preferred way) Chicken 65 is incredible. Ask for extra crispy. Anytime I explore the menu further than my favorites, I'm always pleased but it's tough to not order what I know probably will love the most. I plan to come here for as long as I live in this state. Thursday night dosa night.

The non veg thali was very tasty, but didn't appear to be fresh as there were some overcooked, dry pieces in the Curry Leaf Chicken. While the rice was fluffy and not soggy, the dum biryani was underwhelming for a place that specializes in this dish. We heard that the weekend is the best time to sample the specialties and the phone was ringing off the hook, so I guess we'll give it another try some time.

I am Indian, and I'm glad to finally see an excellent Indian restaurant in this location. We got a couple chicken dishes and biryani and I was very impressed. Make sure you tell them to not make it spicy if you can't handle food too hot. The manager or owner came out to talk to us to make sure we were taken care of and I will go back soon.

Went there for Dosa night big big mistake, they were hardly 50% occupied but it took them more than 50 minutes to just get one dosa on the table. This is ridiculous of you're running a Dosa night you should be quicker than this even with more occupancy. Not going back for Dosa night. Please avoid and save yourself from the frustration. Also limited options for Dosa considering they are claiming it as Dosa night. Worst service ever seen.

My husband and I went couple days back..we were so disappointed. When you name your restaurant Hyderabad House - Biryani Place...you better serve good authentic Goat Dum Biryani. Let me just say, it tasted like they used shaan masala(maybe they didnt but it sure tasted like it)..and it was just not good(It's still better than what most restaurants serve, it's just NOT DUM BIRYANI) Their mirchi salan was horrible ...I make it better than they do. We also tried some South Chicken dish as appetizer called Kodipura..somethjng don't remember the name. It tasted like a mild breaded version of Chicken 65...strictly okay. I ordered hot and sour soup....it had like a hint of desi spices in it? I didnt like it. Service was so bad...there was a man standing behind the counter (where the water was) and he didn't even refill our glasses.He was lost in some deep thought.. day dreaming?  I'm giving this place a three star only because it just opened and maybe they will improve. 

Spicy Sizzlers hands down still has the best dum biryani.

Good service but beware - their "vegetarian" thali had Naan and dessert (mousse) that both have egg. By indian definition of "veg" food - eggs are not allowed. And I expected an Indian restaurant to know this and be respectful. But as good the service is, as humble the people are, food is nice overall but this one thing disappointed me since I'm a vegetarian.

Tried this new place in the weekend which opened a month back ! Loved the service , food and the atmosphere! Very friendly service! Food was excellent , authentic and loved the spice levels ! V ordered gobi Manchurian which was crispy, spicy ! Ordered idli vada combo which was perfect, then a veggie dum biriyani which was good and egg biriyani ( I ordered it spicy) which was perfect! Make sure you mention the spice level! Overall experience was great will be back soon to try the other stuff
Best Biriyani around. Authentic and yummy. The service can be better though. Have already been there many times and I love it!

I was very excited to take my boyfriend to try Indian food for his first time. Though I didn't care for much of it some dishes were amazing. But the food is not what I'm rating. Service here is horrible!! Nobody knows what they are doing. We came in I had to ask 3 different people for a high chair. The. We sat there for 20 minutes and finally I flagged someone down to take our order.  It took 45 minutes for someone to come out and apologize for the delay on our food that something was broken or stalling or something. It took over an hour to get out food. It did not come out at once. Everyone got their meal one at a time with like a 10 minute period between each one. My brother never even got him. He asked what happened to his food and they said they were sorry they never put it in. Said it will be a while. We just told them to cancel it. And we never got our drinks :( I wish they would have Givin us a discount or complimented a dish instead of offering a desert. On the positive side it they did apologize a lot and the owner or manager did come out and tell us they did just open and they were very busy. I hope they can get their service together make sure kitchen and staff know what they are doing instead of everyone running around confused.

Tried the Vijayawada special chicken biriyani and Raju gari special biriyani and both were spicy and simply superb. It would have been a five star review if not for the price, felt that the price is on the higher side, 17$ for any biryani is expensive. Customer service is good and welcoming.

Lawdy lawd, have mercy! This is THE spot for chicken in the area. None of that fried fast food garbage, oh no, this is open hearth grilled chicken. It is seasoned well, always juicy, and the sides are just mere compliments to how incredible the main course is. Imagine the best chicken you've ever had, then forget all about it because this is better!

Now, I should mention some of the sides could use work, like the rice & broccoli, but otherwise the meal is great. Remember, it's not a 5 star steak house, this is casual comfort food. You will leave full and satisfied. Give their ribs and pork chops a try too, but only AFTER you've tried the chicken. I mean, hell, chicken is in the name. You don't go to Red Lobster to try their burgers!

If you're not too full, try one of the cookies from the front counter for desert. Soft and delicious. 

I will be back time and time again, you can count on that!l

This is absolutely the best chicken ever! Wow! Just wow! It's been about 15 years since I've been able to enjoy great juicy chicken. Flavor, flavor,flavor!!!!! Juicy, juicy, juicy!!!!

We enjoyed the Texas toast, mash taters,baked beans, rice n'broccoli . We devoured every piece of chicken to the marrow. Lol. 

I highly recommend Broosters chicken if your tired of Fried chicken come and take a gander and enjoy some great chicken at BROOSTERS CHICKEN!

Just about every vegan/vegetarian/ovopescetarian I've met - including myself - falls off the bandwagon at one time or another. 

So, I've been contending with some serious meat cravings.  Shameful? Maybe. Weak? Probably. Remorseful? Not yet.

I stopped in tonight and ordered the 1/2 Chicken Meal with chicken soup and a baked potato for my sides (comes with 1 slice of Texas toast).  Total = less than $11. 

The good:

+ Nice, quick service: I was in and out in 5 minutes.

+ Good portion sizes! I'm getting 2.5 meals out of this.

+ Nice crisp to much of the skin and juicy dark meat!

+ Every little detail was attended to: fork, knife, AND soup spoon. 2 packages of Saltines (the brand, no knockoffs here!). 2 containers of whipped butter. 1 generous packet of sour cream. Everything was foil-covered and fit nicely inside the takeout box. 


The "meh":

- The chicken was obviously (re-) heated, and the breast meat was dry. I hate to say it, but a $5 roasted grocery store chicken has juicer breast meat.

- I was expecting it to be herbier. I swearrrr they had a distinctive herby rub/flavor before! The flavor was OK, but nothing that stood out. 


I'd like to think that the dryness could be attributed to ordering after peak dining hours (i.e. 7:30 pm), so I'll have to give them another try. Y'know, for wholly scientific reasons completely unrelated to chicken cravings.

Until next time, Brooster's.

It's good!  Don't tell anyone but I've bought and passed off their chicken, green beans and mashed taters, baked beans (I add a bit of hot sauce) as my own!  Huh uh, just whip up some chocolate chip cookies and warm up some really good bread and you can impress your neighbors with a lovely summer supper!  Don't forget the cold beer!  You're welcome!
Very good food at a reasonable price.  Everything is very well seasoned. Highly recommend the chicken.  Their other location is in Darien. Restaurant has been around for a while.

The food is A-OK top quality.  The customer service is awesome.  I think the prices are fair.  I only get take-out as a single diner.  I love the garlic toast, the sides and the chicken and steak are perfectly cooked.  The place is large and clean and good for families.  I think I'm heading there today for a late lunch cause I am craving their food!

I grew up in Downers Grove and there was a Broosters in the area we use to get dinner from pretty often.  I haven't had it in over 10 years.  I was so excited to be driving through Lombard looking for a place to eat and my husband was looking at yelp and mentioned there was a Broosters.  He had no idea what it was, but I got super excited.

We were on a time crunch, so I was a little concerned with how long it would take.  It was about 1 o'clock on a Saturday and we walked in with no line.  We both ordered 2 piece chicken special.  One dark meat and one white meat.  We both got mashed potatoes as our side.  They have RC which also brought back great childhood memories.  Such a great deal for $5.99.  This is way cheaper and I would like to think healthier then fast food would have been.

We both hit the bathroom, which were very clean.  As soon as got out our food arrived.  Insanely fast!  The yellow gravy was everything I remembered it to be, rich and flavorful and totally different from other gravies you have had.  The mashed potatoes soft and smooth.  The chicken is very flavorful with the chargrilled flavor, juicy meat and crunchy skin.  We both inhaled our food, leaving very full and satisfied and without a time crunch at all.  I can't wait to go back on my next visit in Chicago, so many other things on the menu look great, just don't know if I'll ever be able to pass up the mashed potatoes, chicken and gravy.

Was going to give a 4 star rating because chicken was really good, but not the best ever. 

Sides were good.  (rice & broccoli, and mashed potatoes), Texas toast was the best side there. 

Reason for the 5 star is because I went back to the register to get 1 more piece of Texas garlic toast. (It was so good). The cashier gave it to me at no charge. 

This saved me a mere $1.00, but the hospitality was so nice and authentic that I'll be back for sure because of that.

This is my favorite broosters restaurant and this broiled chicken hasn't been duplicated so an easy 5 of 5.  Between the spacious location, sweet interior, seating choices, tasty sides, inexpensive prices, and healthy chicken ill b coming back for a lifetime of awesome meals.

Love the chicken burrito with creamy parmesan!!! I have to admit, I will even get the kids grilled chicken strip meal as well because it comes with a side and garlic bread and a drink for $6. Very fair prices for some great food!!! I will pick broosters food over any other over priced place in the area. 

I eat lunch here at least once-twice a week. Super friendly staff.

Try this place! Plus they have all you can eat chicken on Saturday and sundays!

The food is always tasty.  Bonus! It's prepared fresh and quickly! Much healthier option than grabbing lunch at a fast food place. When I worked in the area I often introduced coworkers to the restaurant and they always appreciated discovering a new, affordable option for a quick lunch.
Good stake for a money and chicken the chicken is also good there they also have all you can eat chicken on Saturday and Sunday
Pretty surprised how good the steak was.  I used a coupon and they were super nice about it which I really appreciate.

I alway stop by once a month for their 2 steaks for $14.95 with local coupon. (Now up to $16.95 in 2015)
Comes with 2 sides and garlic toast.

Recommended for a very good steak for the cash!

I always go back for more.

Broosters is one of those rare finds that would remain tucked away unless you did some wide-eyed searching. I have to admit, even if I had seen the Lombard location, I don't think I would have given it a try; its THAT inconspicuous. BUT, I'm seriously happy I did.

Even if you had decided to walk into the joint, I don't think you'd feel like it was going to produce some b-o-m-b chicken. Its appearance is THAT modest. BUT, the chicken is not.

I think the first thing you should do at Broosters is order the whole or half chicken...whatever you feel like you can put away. The flavor is absolutely amazing. Add that charbroiled essence to the mix to seal the deal. What we have in the end is an incredibly moist piece of chicken that hits the spot where it counts.

The mashed potato and coleslaw side dishes parallel that of KFC. Texas toast is included with  everything! **They have this salsa thats hidden in a white container that you MUST use...it changes everything!!**
Pleasantly surprised how delicious the chicken really was. Nice salad too and the side order of vegetables were good too.
Workers were nice. Food was uber bland. I got the chicken burrito. The chicken had literally no flavor. The rice/broccoli side was just as flavorless. I most certainly won't be returning.

I'm so disappointed, I stopped here to get some food before heading back home to Schaumburg and I completely wasted my money and my time first the best thing was the garlic bread and that's it. I love  baked beans these beans lacked flavor they tasted like someone just poured them out of a VANCAMP  can and added onions. Broosters please add some brown sugar, mustard ,green peppers onions  a little bit of sugar to your baked beans add  barbecue sauce and bake them for about an hour. The broccoli rice was tasteless but it tasted like broccoli and rice I guess that's what it should taste like. the ribs were completely flavorless, I smelled no char and no grill when it came to the ribs they tasted like they were boiled or baked in an oven and then thrown on a grill no flavor at all truly disappointed. The chicken had a little bit of flavor like it had been marinated but still no Char flavor and no grill flavor. I really don't see myself trying this place again, I always like to give a restaurant to try and then that is it but I'm not sure so very disappointed this was a complete waste of $17.00 and I still have to go buy dinner :(

Marinated chicken over an open fire. What else can you ask for? Oh Texas Toast you say? Yes, they have that here too. 

We just ate here about two weeks ago and dinner for 2 was about $14.00!! That's pretty amazing now a days.

They put some awesome marinade on the chicken and it came with some Texas toast and 2 side, we opted for the green beans and the mashed potatoes. I would just go for the chicken though, make your own sides at  home. 

They have ribs and steaks here too, never have tried either but one day I just might.
So happy with this place! Great food. Happy service. I got a 1/2 slab for lunch, even the garlic bread taste great. It's a little pricy for lunch but there is free wifi.
Always a great chicken meal for me and steak for my husband. The prices are so reasonable. And the atmosphere is funky and retro. Give it a try you'll be glad you did.
Not bad. Food decent.

I can't tell you how many times my husband and I have picked up chicken from Broosters for dinner, but it's a lot! They do really tasty bird here and it's a nice change from the fried chicken chains. Plus it's better than the rotisserie chains. Whatever marinade they use is really flavorful (I think I taste lime & cumin) and the grill really brings it out. Broosters chicken tastes more like home cookin' than fast food.

The sides are 'meh'. No better and no worse than you'd get at the fast food chains, with the exceptions of the baked potato and the Texas toast. It's nice to be able to order a freshly baked potato. They'll offer you real butter and sour cream to put on it too. 
*** Update Oct. 2012.  They changed the Texas Toast to ... well ... toast. It's just 'meh' now too. Sad. *** 

We've also tried the pork chop and the steak and they are a good value, but nothing to get excited about.

Don't expect the consistency here that you get at a big fast food chain. Sometimes the chicken pieces you get will be really meaty and sometimes not. Sometimes the chicken will be perfectly charred and sometimes not. But the chicken will always be tasty and a good value. I wouldn't drive across Chicagoland to get this chicken, but I'm sure glad Broosters is in the neighborhood.

The employees are usually friendly. Feels like you're visiting a neighborhood place.

To be honest- I am not a fan of ribs. I usually hate how messy, hard to eat and dry they are (at least the ribs I've eaten before). 

But Brooster's ribs? De-li-cious.
The meat was tender, came right off the bone and was booming with rich flavor. 

We went for Father's Day and ordered a family combo consisting of a whole chicken, a slab of ribs, mashed potatoes, broccoli rice and Texas toast.  The chicken, ribs and toast = filling and yummy!  However, the mashed potatoes and broccoli rice were bland.

It wasn't crowded and our food came out within 15 minutes.

Broosters is what it's all about when it comes to good chicken the chicago land area. On saturday and sunday Broosters hosts an all you can eat for $9.99 , about 12 with tax and drink with unlimited refills ...Everything is amazing..Unlimited sides and texas toast and it's so flame. 

Try it out you will not be sorry.

Fantastic little gem.

Been eating here since I was young and the food's still the same sort of tasty. Fantastic place to eat chicken, a little on the dry side but the best sort of chicken is usually just that with a little bit of added whallop and it doesn't disappoint. 

However their hidden greatness has to be their  better than homecooked steaks. Always grilled to perfection with just the right amount of juice, it's plump, juicy and just plain old good steak. Their side dishes are what you'd expect, though their chicken soup is better than average. 

Is it the best food I've ever tasted? No. But for the prices that they sell their food at, Broosters  is one hell of a bang for your buck.

Broosters! 
It is so good. 

My boyfriend works right next door to this place so he was the one to introduce it to me. Thank the Gods he did. (Okay, so that was a bit dramatic, but you get the point)
Broosters is the epitome of food done right. 

Their chicken is marinated in some sort of magical mix of seasonings, and grilled to perfection. You don't need any kind of sauce, any kind of extra spice, not even salt. It's cooked the way it was meant to be cooked.

Their steaks are also delicious. The steaks share the same qualities as the chicken in that it is cooked to feature the flavor of the meat, not overly seasoned or done up in any kind of fancy way. It's a perfectly cooked slab of meat, for meat's sake.

Another bonus? Their texas toast, and really, all of their side dishes. They are all simple and delicious. 

I love Broosters, and I would love to give them five stars, but the menu needs more variety.

In my quest to explore the Lombard area my fiance and I stopped in Broosters. I've driven past the place numerous times. Usually always heading east so I never see the neon sign.

This time, thanks to Yelp we stopped in for dinner. It reminded me of a simplified BBQ restaurant without a lot of emphasis on the BBQ. Broosters doesn't do JUST chicken, but that seems to be what they do best. 

I wasn't sure of the portion size so I went with the 1/4 dark meat with a sides of mashed potatoes and green beans. 

The chicken was a little smaller than I expected. I have been doing a lot of grilling recently and the legs and thighs I have been buying at the store are a bit larger. However I realized the portions were rotisserie chicken sized and with the two sides and piece of texas toast there was plenty to eat. 

Overall, the chicken was very good. It was juicy and the seasoning added just enough flavor. It came without sauce, but there are two bottles of sauce at your table,. Use them if you want, but you won't need to. One is a BBQ sauce the other is a buffalo wing sauce. The BBQ sauce was okay, and the buffalo wing sauce had a nice kick that was slow starting but long lasting.

The sides were good. The mashed potatoes came with gravy and the green beans caught me off guard. They looked average, but were cooked in chicken broth with onions. That extra bit of  flavor definitely added bonus points in my book.

Speaking of bonus points, 10 points for having RC Cola.  

For the price of the meal I felt like I was getting a good deal. I know I will be back.

We were in the area, and we had high hopes based on good reviews. We were disappointed. The chicken was dry, the green beans tasted like canned beans with extra salt, the mashed potatoes seemed the instant kind with yellow gravy.  The portions were small, because a half chicken was barely filling.  We get more food at Boston Market and it tastes better.

I had high hopes when I saw this place on yelp.  Unfortunately I was disappointed  My brother and I dropped in for lunch.  The food was alright but eminently forgettable.  I can barely remember what we ordered.  We got some combination platters with various sides so we could sample everything.  The pulled pork and chicken were both on the bland side.  The cole slaw and beans tasted like fast food (i.e. come out of a gallon container).  The one bright spot for me was the Texas Toast.  

In the end, it seems like it may be a lunch spot for the corporate-types working in the area.  Maybe I was expecting too much but it was too fast food-y for what I was looking for.  The food is perfectly acceptable, but I would not make a special trip for it.  

I also saw a sign for all-you-can-eat on the weekends.  I can't speak to that but maybe it's better?

4 stars.

Lost a star for the ribs and steak - stick with the chicken.

The chicken is juicy, flavorful, and reasonable!  The garlic bread is a great side item - ask them to toast it on both sides, though.

My favorite item from Broosters is the green beans.  They are so yummy!

Also, they often have specials or coupon in those random coupon mailers that come every few weeks.

We are certainly glad we found this place.  We almost didn't... My brother was visiting one day and wanted three things: a quick bite, a lottery ticket, and a nap.  So, he ran out and grabbed some Broosters and a ticket from 7-11... a one stop shop.  Thank goodness he stopped, cuz we would never have gone in there.  It had already been years of driving past.

Thanks, bruh!

If you are looking for some non-fried barbeque chicken, this is the place to go. I usually go for the quarter chicken combo. It is about 7 dollars, and it comes with 2 sides, and a piece of texas toast.  The chicken is very tender and not dry at all. I only wish this place had some TVs.

Love the chicken! I took a new co-worker there for dinner and the guy loved the food. I personally like the cauliflower-broccoli cheese casserole with the dark meat portion. If you are hungry also get the artichoke spinach dip and be prepared for tasty ness! 

Great service too! Ask for Alex

I really like broosters. If your in the mood for some chicken you have to go to broosters. Their grilled chicken is so special. My mouth is watering as I type. You can get ur chicken with their regular seasoning, or have them put barbeque sauce on the chicken. I would recommend the standard seasoning cuz you will have barbeque sauce on your table to try some if you like!
Cons: dim poorly lit and non renovated sitting area

Anyplace with "Rooster" in the name has to be good, and Broosters doesn't disappoint.  I enjoy the chicken kabob with grilled peppers and onions.  The chicken is perfectly spiced and marinated, and juicy.  The mashed potatoes are delicious, even though portioned on the small side.

It's a nice little gem hidden in a strip mall.

Love the chicken and the fresh salsa to accompany it.  K.I.S.S. - keep it simple stupid, no need for anything like BBQ or adding any salt or pepper... order your chicken, get your chicken, eat your chicken. And definitely get the salsa as a nice accompaniment if you feel like it.  And the pricing you just can't beat.

Absolutely loved that nothing was fried here!!!!! I got the ribs and chicken but next time I think I will stick to the chicken. The ribs were tasty but the meat didn't fall off the bone with out a little chewing. The chicken was FANTASTIC. The sides were also better than expected I liked the coleslaw. Won't order beans next time. I thought this place was great over all. I would go back. Impressed there was no deep fryer. Garlic toast was yummy

I've been frequenting Broosters since it opened... it is still fantastic every time! I almost always get the chicken, which is delicious. All the workers are very friendly as well. My husband and brother are now also huge fans of the place. The one thing that for me leaves a little to be desired are the sides. I wish there were a few additional and/or fresher options.

The chicken here is very tasty. I don't know what it's marinated in but it comes out with a yellow tint. The texas toast seems like the toast from the frozen boxes but the chicken is so good that it outweighs the toast. I've only had the mashed potatoes and say they're ok. 4 stars because that chicken meal is decently priced for what you get.

Great grilled food at a price anyone can afford!  I don't cook , so Brooster's is the next best thing to a home cooked meal for me.
