I'm also not a chicken lover and NEVER NEVER NEVER touch dark meat chicken, so it always amazes me that I'll eat it here!  Steaks are great if you order medium rare.  Though the sides aren't spectacular, they are tasty and have a fresh as opposed to processed quality about them.  One of my favorite cheap eats!

My wife introduced me to this place, and I am glad she did! I have not had anything bad here!  I really like the smell when you walk in, even from when you open the car door to get out.  The price is worth what you get, great value.  I am suprised the place is not mentioned more by different outlets, better for me it's a quiet little secret.  Steak, ribs, chicken it's all good!  The sides are decent, but the main plates are the best!  All you can eat chicken dinners on Sat & Sun, and definately a better product and value than The Patio.

When I'm in the mood for chicken, I crave Broosters.  It's an unassuming place, but the food is very good. The prices are reasonable.  The service has always been excellent.  Their sides fall short of the chicken, for sure.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! Simply great food, nothing fancy.

They have always great broiled chicken. Chicken is lean, had rice, salad and bread. They have one location in Downers Grove and thats how I knew about them- am not sure if they are a chain or not. You won't be disappointed. Great food, reasonable prices.

Tasty BBQ at a very reasonable price.  They have several all you can eat options as well for about $10-16 a person, including a couple of sides.  

The staff is very friendly and always eager to give you a refill on your BBQ and side dishes for all you can eat.

I recommend giving this place a try for lots of reasonably priced, good tasting BBQ.

Okay, so I saw this place in one of those ads they send around to everyone's home, and I thought we'd try it out.  First of all, it's a grubby little place, so try not to touch anything but your plate.  And it is the only restaurant I have come across in a looooong time that doesn't serve fries.  So my kids had to have mashed potatoes with gravy for their side, which did not go over well with them.  The grilled cheese was a huge hit!  The grilled chicken, not as big of a hit, but my picky son ate it, so it must have been good!  They were especially thrilled about the texas toast that came with the meal. 
We ordered the ribs and chicken combo, my hubs got a salad and mashed, and I got coleslaw and a baked potato.  The baked potato was good, the coleslaw waaaaay too full of mayo, but not bad-tasting.  The chicken was fantastic, I would recommend getting that--it was great!  Awesome flavor!  The ribs........not so much.  They were some of the driest hardest ribs I have gotten in a long time.  I felt bad at the total waste of ribalicious meat that I had to discard because it was inedible.  
So in all, it was a decent meal, but not $50 worth of delicious.  I might go back and get just chicken.  Possibly.
Great price for such delicious flavorful and juicy chicken! Friendly service and a quick lunch.

Excellent!  I don't know what else to say!  This is not a fine dining restaurant if that's what you are looking for, but they have fabulous food at fabulous pricing!  I order for myself, my husband, and my son, and we eat good for under $20.  I always order for take-out, and go to Sal's for a beer while I wait!  The only reason I choose not to dine-in is because they do not serve alcohol!  I wish they were BYOB.  I had these guys cater my son's graduation party.  I paid $200 for so much food that I STILL (a month later) have some frozen in the deep freezer in the basement!  Everyone was so satisfied with the food selection and flavor.    Oh geez, I didn't realize that I have already rated these guys, but they deserve it again!

Not a bad option for lunch.  The chicken has a nice citrus note with hints of cumin.  On the weekends they offer all-you-can eat specials.  As the name says, the item to get is the chicken.  The BBQ items aren't really BBQ'd they are just grilled over a gas flame.

Food 3
Service 4
Dining space 4
Parking lot 2
Reasonable pricing 5

The host staff was very welcoming and wished us a great night as we left.
They were very accommodating to all the customers.
Our server Marie was very attentive and had some great suggestions.
My wife and I shared a truly spectacular 
Wedge salad and both had the all you can eat fish fry. It comes with fries or homemade chips, soup or salad. It had three large pieces of fish. We didn't have a second helping. Too much food.
11.99 is a bargain!
The servers are free to attend to the guests since they have people who deliver the food to the table for them.
The room has windows all around and a cozy fireplace. Very comfortable.
The parking lot  is large enough but is very long and some spots are a block away.
We have also been there for the dueling pianos. Very fun!
Really good food all around.  Party of 8, all were happy with their choices. Certainly not inexpensive but not outrageous either. We were in the neighborhood and glad we found it on yelp.

First time here. We sat in the dining room looking out onto the course. They have a nice patio area as well. Will need to come back to sit out on the deck. 
If you're looking to have a wedding, baby shower, birthday party, etc they also have a banquet area. There is a separate bar area. There seemed to be a lot of people in that area. 
I tried the grilled salmon which came with fresh veggies and mashed potatoes. The meal also came with soup or salad. 
Their menu is extensive. I'll need to come back for the turkey burger. 
Service was prompt and friendly. 
If you're in the area, check this place out.
I returned because a friend of mine insisted on going to another fish fry. We had a nice waitress, food was good and the experience was good. Please, keep it up!

Monday Nights 1/2 price Burgers & $2.50 for some beers. Great comfortable atmosphere you can go into the bar area to watch a game, relax in the cozy dining room near nice warm fireplace or during spring summer and fall sit on the patio and watch the golfers go by.
Truely my "Cheers"!!!

I stopped in here for a drink and appetizer with my husband. We were golfing at River Bend and Wheatstack is the perfect place to stop before a round of golf. We sat on the patio overlooking the golf course. 

Our server came to our table right away and explained the specials. We told her our tee time and she said she would put our order in right away. 

We ordered the blackened chicken quesadilla. It was a good size appetizer and perfect for sharing. 

Wheatstack has great drink and dinner specials. The patio is the perfect place for dinner or just drinks after a round of golf! I will definitely be back for the crab cakes!!

Wheatstack has been one of our favorite restaurants for years. We love the atmosphere and the food. So when we were looking to book our daughters baby shower we thought it would be the perfect venue! But, with that said, we still looked at a few other locations in the area. After calling around, reviewing the menus and guidelines, for each restaurant, we decided to book the shower at Wheatstack. 

I had never organized a shower other than at my home so I had a lot of questions! Todd Shamberg, GM & Event Planner, took the time to explain how everything would work and was flexible with the arrangements and accommodations. He was easy to contact by phone and email and never seemed bothered by my questions! 

The day of the event the room was set-up and ready when we arrived to decorate. Everyone was very attentive and willing to help us. Our server, Dina, was exceptional! She was quick, thought of things we would need before I had to ask and very accommodating and attentive to all our guests. Becky was the manager that day and she was also awesome! She kept checking in to see if we needed anything and how things were going. I felt that these two ladies really cared about our event! There was a good variety of food and all our guests commented on how good it was! Our daughter and son-in-law said "everything was perfect!" What more could I ask for?!? :)

I think the only thing I would have changed would be to have the room dividers up, separating our party from the rest of the dining room. I knew when I booked, because of the number of guests we would have, that it would be a "semi-private room." For most of the day we were the only ones in the dining room but later in the afternoon people started coming in for lunch/dinner. 

Overall it was a great venue and I would highly recommend booking your event at Wheatstack! 

Thank you for all your help!

Bridal Shower!  We hosted a Bridal Shower at Wheatstack.  The room is a beautiful backdrop for this kind of event.  We only needed a few decorations to complete the room.  We could not have been happier with the staff there, from Todd, the event manager, to the two ladies who were our servers.  It was a great experience.  I would highly recommend Wheatstack for your upcoming event. And very reasonably priced.

Took my parents to Wheatstack for their Friday fish fry.  Perfect for Good Friday, but I understand the fish fry is a regular Friday special...and all you can eat.  Looking around the dining room, it seems this is a popular deal as almost everyone was enjoying the fish. This was my first time eating in the dining room.  It's lackluster in looks and didn't look clean to me which turned me off. I will eat in the bar area as I did on my previous visit  as I didn't get that feeling dining in there. The fish fry comes with cole slaw, a side of fries or homemade potato chips and either a salad or soup. I opted for the cream of broccoli soup which was very good. The fish is battered cod and it was flaky and had a good batter. There were three pieces on my plate.  The first one was not greasy at all, but the next two were very greasy. That did not deter me from finishing all three pieces as it was very good....they just need to make sure the fish is put on paper towels to soak up the grease before serving. The tartar sauce was good with a little vinegar taste. The cole slaw was a minuscule portion and nothing special. The manager came by to check on our table which was nice. Our server was Cheryl and we loved her. She was friendly, sweet and very attentive. I would recommend the fish fry and do want to come back with my husband because I think he would enjoy it. Next time, though, I hope it's less greasy....and I'll be dining in the bar area. Less heebie jeevies there.

I've been to Wheatstack multiple times now and each time, it gets better and better! This is a great place to go to relax, eat some good food and just enjoy yourself. The atmosphere is perfect to wear whatever makes you comfortable - whether that's a nice dress or jeans and a sweater. There's a great bar area and restaurant area, and I can't wait to try out the patio when the weather gets warmer!

The food is really good and at a great price. You can't go wrong with the prime rib, fish and chips or $5 burger on a Monday. I highly recommend this restaurant - especially if you're celebrating a special occasion but want to go somewhere you can be comfortable and just enjoy good food and the company you're with!!
Nice menu and friendly service. Can't beat the patio view of the sunset over looking the golf course.

We had a bridal brunch shower for my niece this past weekend.  It could not have been nicer!
The manager, Todd, was a pleasure to work with, explaining all the pricing and arrangements, and very responsive to all our requests.  
The room was lovely and set up just how we wanted for 25 guests.  The food was great and the mimosa package was enjoyed by all!  Our server, Melissa, was "on it" and provided excellent service with a smile.  I would recommend Wheatstack for a private event anyday!!!!!

Went for the first time tonight. They have $12 all you can eat Cod on Fridays. Comes with coleslaw and soup or salad and chips or fries. House salad was very fresh. I got a Sangria which was great at $6. Our waitress was attentive and offered us refills on drinks and fish before we asked. And asked again after we'd already had more fish. The dressings for the salad were made there and yum. We were in and out in less than an hour. Our waitress told us about a rib special on Tuesdays... We'll be back. Thanks Cindy!

I've been to Wheatstack many times & have tried many different things on their menu. I never had anything here that was bad or I didn't like. They have special menu items each month which means there's always something new to try. The interior is clean & modern & not too noisy, so it's easy to have conversations with whoever you're dining with. Oh, and the view of the golf course is pretty nice too. The waitresses are all very nice & the manager Todd will go around to the tables to make sure everyone is having a pleasant dining experience. I highly recommend Wheatstack.

I don't really understand the appeal of this place. We have a lot of office "farewell" or "new employee" lunches here, I guess because they have a lot of space and take reservations. The food is nothing exciting and the service is terribly slow. They advertise that they have gluten free items, but when one person in our party was aking about options the server told her "anything white has gluten, right?" and then told her that some items that don't have gluten (rice) did have it, and items that do have gluten, don't. I ordered the "fresh garden pasta" and I don't know what goes on in that garden but it was extremely oily. 

The outside patio is nice, though last time I was out there, they were having a bit of a wasp problem. I know nature happens and is difficult to control, but it was pretty bad. The inside feels kind of scrungy. Their photos show while tablecloths, which I assume is for banquets because it's certainly not the norm, just old sticky wooden tables. This place wouldn't be a place I would choose to go.

My daughter graduated high school this evening. I was looking for a nice restaurant for dinner for our family but was very last minute (my fault) and called a couple of places who could not accommodate us until much later in the evening. I saw some good reviews of Wheatstack here on Yelp so I thought we'd give it a try. We were not disappointed!

We were running a bit late but when we arrived they greeted us and assured us it was not a problem at all. The entire experience was great - our server was so friendly and genuinely nice and the food was fantastic! The bruchetta was the best I have ever had and everyone enjoyed their meal. The flatiron steak and ribs were favorites at the table.

As we were being seated, I mentioned my daughter graduated. At the end of the meal, they brought her a cupcake and a card. It was totally unexpected and such a nice touch.

I've passed this place a million times and never thought about trying it, but I'm really happy I did! We will definitely be back and recommend it to others.

Stopped in for lunch one day through the week.  I ordered the potato soup to start, and it was thick and creamy and seasoned beautifully.  I usually find soups to be too salty, but not this one.  I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap with vegetables.  What I really enjoyed about the wrap was that the chicken was grilled, and it was served with lots of lettuce that had a delicious dressing on it...almost like a salad in a wrap.  Very tasty, and seemed healthy.  The vegetables were green beans and carrots.  They were drowning in butter, and way over-cooked.  That was the only part of my meal that I did not care for.

As for service, our waitress was fantastic.  She was also the bartender, and she was the only person working.  She had the bar area and the tables.  Granted, it wasn't busy, but she was very attentive and helpful.
love their turkey burger, and some of the steaks.

Came here for a baby shower during the middle of summer. Naturally, their air-conditioning gave out. You would think they'd find ways to make patrons comfortable or at least provide some compensation for the person who booked the venue - they did neither. I felt sorry for my pregnant friend. Though I run hot, I couldn't imagine what she was feeling. Shortest baby shower EVER! We wanted to make sure the mama-to-be didn't overheat. We paid more attention to her than the staff did. SERIOUSLY? I even asked Wheatstack on her behalf if they'd give her a price break on the bill. The answer a flat out NO. The only reason I elected to give them two stars is because their food was good. Beyond that, pray that your event or dining experience goes smoothly. If it does not, do not look for them to give a damn

You can never go wrong with this place!  I've been here may times for lunch, dinner, and just for drinks.  There are drink specials every day of the week such as half price bottle of wine night, and the food is always tasty, and the service is always up to par.  They also have a decent selection of beers on tap and a nice selection of martinis to choose from.  I've been here all hours of the day/night and I've never had to wait long to be seated and be served.  Some of my favorites are the goat cheese salad and buffalo burger. 

It's nice to sit outside on the patio with a nice view of the golf course during the summer and sip their awesome sangria, and in the winter there is a fire place in both rooms which makes for great ambiance.  You can almost always stumble upon a coupon for Wheatstack too in the clipper magazine or elsewhere.
I came here with the family.. Salmon Salad is pretty dece! Father in law had the meat loaf.. Not to shabby!

Came here last week for a family dinner.  
Everything was perfect except my mother in-laws salmon. I had the ribs and my boyfriend had the meatloaf which were both excellent!! 
We love that this place is just around the corner from our house and can't wait to try some of their specials either!  :)

My husband and I stopped in for lunch today. It was our first visit and we will definitely be back. I had the lemon chicken and my husband had the ribs and both were really good. Our server was Dina and wow! She was racing around between the inside and the patio yet had time to talk to us. She is a keeper. There are so many places to eat in the surrounding area but this experience will not only keep us coming back but we will recommend it to our friends.
The food was solid and the server was very nice.

We eat at Wheatstack regularly --- 2-3 times per month, the servers are great. Last night we came with a large group for their dueling pianos. It would have been a great evening if it hadn't been ridiculously hot -- when the employees were asked if the air could be turned down they said nobody on staff could do that --- doors were opened, but when you have a full room that does very little. We came back tonight for dinner and it is 84 degrees in the dining room --- we asked the manger on duty why the air wasn't on and got the same response ---- they need the general manager here to turn on the air conditioning. 
Guess what people like restaurants to be comfortable!!!!!  We have been coming here for years-- but won't return unless this problem is remedied!!  The manager on duty should have the ability to regulate the temp in the dining room --- you trust them enough to MANAGE  in your absence --- you should trust them to regulate the temperature

Service was great!  Both the hostess and waitress were very friendly.  Good selection of tap & bottled beers.  Several of us also enjoyed the sangria.  I'd give the food a B.

Crab cakes - tasty but not very warm
Bruschetta - excellent!
Wheat Stacker sandwich - pulled pork, ham, provolone, spicy mayo on ciabatta - pork was a little dry, could have use more mayo in general, the bun was perfect
Steak sandwich - yum!!!
Lemon chicken - good, could have used a little more flavor

*Ratings and Highlights*
Ambiance: 4.5 / 5 - Casual yet cozy
Service: 4.5 / 5 - We were helped by 5 different staff members
Food Quality: 4.5 / 5 - Fresh, flavorful, satisfying
Value: 4.5 / 5. Dinner for two, consisting of soup, two heavy appetizers, a burger, and a slice of cake, with 3 alcoholic drinks, totaled approximately $50 before tip. 
Overall: If Yelp offered half star ratings, this would have definitely been a 4.5.

*The Juicy Details*
After seeing the brightly lit sign many times in passing along my travels, I finally made plans to check out Wheatstack last week. I brought along my Better Half (BH) to serve as both my dinner companion and as my specialist for all things spicy and beer. The restaurant is adjacent to the River Bend golf course. The exterior/interior of the building are visually appealing, with emphasis on pastoral colors (green, gold, brown) which complement the wheat theme and pair well with the golf club atmosphere. The interior layout offers both a pub section with a sports bar setup and a dining section with an open dining room containing a combination of booth and table seating. There is also outdoor seating on the back (West facing) deck. I would describe the atmosphere as a mid-range casual setting; jeans/khakis, t-shirts/polo shirts/blouses all mix well in this crowd. The lighting in the dining area is not very bright, but is compensated by several large windows which just weren't showing their full potential on this rainy evening. The dining area had Top 40 music playing softly in the background while on the bar side, the sounds of sports from the television rose above the din of bar chatter.

We arrived at approximately 7pm on a Wednesday. The hostess asked us whether we would prefer to be in the bar or dining area, and we opted for the latter. When we selected the one vacant booth which had not yet been reset from the last customers, the hostess promptly cleared and reset the table herself and we were seated that same minute in our desired spot. Within 5 minutes of being seated, our drink orders were placed - I ordered the red blend, while my BH selected a pre-prohibition beer on tap. Both were suitable choices based on our personal preferences. For dinner, we ordered a cup of the homemade chicken noodle soup, 10 chicken wings with the spicy thai sauce (capitalizing on the 49-cent wing special), an order of the (loaded) nachos w/ beef, and the buffalo burger. The soup arrived within 60 seconds of our order being placed and tasted newly made, as the menu purported. It was refreshingly simple yet satisfying with chunks of white meat chicken, carrots, celery and a unique spin on the traditional noodle - a thin (possibly angel hair) pasta. Next up were the wings. These wings were the highlight of the evening in terms of cuisine - meaty and juicy chicken perfectly glazed in a savory, sweet yet tangy sauce. The heat in the sauce was perfectly paired with the neutralizing creaminess of the homemade peppercorn ranch dip that accompanied it. I could continue gushing about the wings for several paragraphs but suffice it to say, I could make a worthwhile trip to Wheatstack for these wings alone.

At the point that we finished these delicious wings, we entered the one and only break in the service continuity of the evening - for about 8 minutes, we were left with nothing but our waters and each other to focus our attention on, which in the scheme of things is minuscule. In any event, that tiny blip in the flow of the evening was easily overcome by the otherwise outstanding attentiveness and pleasant demeanor of the servers, manager and staff. 

When the main course (burger and nachos platter) arrived, they were served hot. The burger was adorned with traditional produce toppings, sans sauce. Being a native New Yorker, I naturally tried ketchup first, but ended up requesting a side of the peppercorn ranch and applied that instead, to my taste buds' delight. The burger was cooked to juicy perfection and the waitress' medium rare recommendation was most certainly the right call. The nachos platter, fielded by my BH, were less noteworthy - though a generous portion of tricolor nachos with all the fixings, they did not possess the same wow factor as the burger, and paled in comparison to the wings that had stolen the show earlier in the evening. The vanilla bean cheesecake, on the other hand, turned out to be very creamy and rich, though not overly so, and definitely provided a nice finale to a satisfying dining experience.

*Bottom Line*
Wheatstack provides a great setting for a casual date night or social gathering. The separate bar and dining areas offers the ability to calibrate your experience either towards a more sports bar vibe or a more sit-down restaurant feel. Overall, Wheatstack delivers solid service and quality food at a reasonable price in a convenient location. My BH and I will definitely be back to explore the menu further, and to experience those wings again.

My girlfriends & I went on Fri night. We were told it would be 30 minutes. An hour later I ask the the hostess when will we be seated & she said soon. Another 30 minutes later we are finally seated but not until I complained! You would think that after waiting 11/2 hours that we would get good seats, but they took us to the bar area with wall to wall people standing. They had the nerve to try & seat us in the middle of a crowd! I complained  & demanded to get better seats after waiting so long. After all that, the food was below average! My fish was overcooked & their rice was awful.  My girlfriends were not pleased w/ the dinners either. And our calamari was rubbery!

Just adding to a previous review! We attended the dueling pianos event this weekend and had a blast! Food and service were stellar and really enjoyed the entertainment of the dueling pianos. The only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5, is we were not made aware of the fee or ticket options. I called a few weeks early to make our reservation, but at no point told about the coat of the tickets. Not too big of a deal except we brought guests and hadn't given the heads up of extra cost.

We love this restaurant.   We love their Angus steak burgers especially on Mondays when they are half price.   We went for prime rib recently and were blown away by they flavor.  And the price is right on Saturday's the 10 oz. cut is around $17 and it comes with soup or salad (both good) potato and vegetable.   The veggies were delicious and crisp.   (There's nothing worse than overcooked mushy vegetables!)   So glad we are close to this great place!

I am not a fan of outdoor dining.  Perhaps it is because the extent, up until now, of outdoor dining included a few lunches in the loop, accompanied by a bunch of homeless guys asking for food and change, and the wonderful smell of city bus exhaust.  So when my dining companions decided on outdoor seating here, I did an inward cringe.  Mistakenly so, since the patio here was absolutely charming.  I'm no country-club type, but I must say that the view here was magnificent, overlooking lush and well kept greens, and a beautiful lake (or water trap, depending how you look at things.)  It was at the end of August that we went here for a late lunch, and there were umbrellas over the tables for shade, and just enough breeze to keep the bugs at bay.  So, if all outdoor dining could be like this, I'm game! 

Our server on this day was not only wonderfully nice, she did a great job keeping up in drinks.  I always had a full glass of iced tea at the ready!  The food matched the service when it comes to excellence.  The 1/2 Reuben was just the right mix of meat, kraut, cheese, and 1,000 island as not to be too sloppy, nor too skimpy.  I really enjoyed the grilled marble rye it was served on.  I also had a cup of chicken soup which was homemade and delicious.  By far the best part of the meal was my red-skinned potato salad.  Something so simple, but yet delightfully delicious; quite possibly the best potato salad I have ever had.

Since this place is fairly close to home, I need to try it out more often.  I'm looking forward to trying out their seasonal Friday night fish fry, to see what it's like to eat inside, since I already know they have the patio down pat!
The nachoes were good, the clam chowder was excellent, and the guiness stew was fantastic.  The crowd was mostly older people but they had a good kids menu.  We will definitely be coming back.

Disappointed.   First of all, I thought this is the place we had Mother's Day brunch at 2 years ago, but the minute we walked in this morning I realized we were at a different place. 

I now realize that 2 years ago we were at Seven Bridges for their Mother's Day brunch.   At Seven Bridges 2 years ago, when we walked in, we were greeted by 2 smiling staff members who handed all the mother's a rose. That would have been a nice touch today at Wheatstack.   At Seven Bridges, the room where people dined was huge and very spread out and there were so many choices of food at different stations spread out through 2-3 rooms so you never had to wait in a line. However, today it felt very tight and cramped today at Wheatstack.

Our waitress never even said Happy Mother's Day nor did she appear too thrilled to be waiting on us or to be there this morning.   Perhaps if Wheatstack allowed their servers to earn their tip by good service instead of implementing an automatic unwritten/unspoken 18% service charge on the bill, their servers would try to work harder at earning the gratuity.  Instead, it appeared like they were treating the day like a cafeteria and our server clearly wanted to have no interaction. There was a blonde server with straight hair pulled back into a pony tail that seemed to be doing really well with her tables and talking/being friendly.  Unfortunately, we had almost not communication with our server.  She even scolded my mother for leaving her fork on her plate when she was trying to clear it.  God forbid she had to give her a clean, new fork.   

Today, there were 25 large tables at least in the room and you had to squeeze by people to get out of the room to get to the food room.  There was only a u-shaped row of tables put together for the food.  So you had to wait in a line for food every time.  The eggs benedict container was empty at it was only 10 minutes after the 9am seating and didn't appear it was known it was empty by staff.   

Now here is what irks me the most. Below is the description from Wheatstack's website about what is included in the price.  OK, they don't mention OJ is included (I realize that now.....but come on.....we were charged for 4 OJ's which were in small tumbler glasses for $2.50 each).   It is brunch.  I have NEVER been to a brunch where OJ and Mimosa's were not included.   We also ordered 3 mimosas which we found out were $5.00 each.  I see that is in the description below, but we didn't realize it until we got the bill.  On top of it, they added 18% gratuity (they called it a service charge).   

When we were at Seven Bridges 2 years ago, we had a dedicated waitress who was constantly refilling water, coffee, OJ, plates and checked on us.  Today at Wheatstack, our waitress was not very friendly and took our initial drink order and we didn't see her again for at least 30 minutes at our table.  We had to flag her down to get refills on drinks.  I asked for an OJ and she started to walk away without asking the others at my table if they would like anything.  My sister attempted to ask for a coffee 3 times before I finally practically yelled it as she was walking away.  So you can imagine my frustration for a $25 service charge being applied when I don't feel it was earned.   At Seven Bridges 2 years ago, we gave the gratuity we felt was deserved and we gladly gave our server $25 (and we only had 4 people then).

Our bill with their service charge plus 3 mimosas, 4 OJs, for 4 adults plus one child came to $162.   Had the food and service been good, I would be happy to have paid this amount.  Today was very disappointing.  The food was just OK and the service was severely lacking.  Around 11am I could tell the wanted people to clear out.  It got really stuffy and hot in there which it was clear they had the A/C off and were trying to smoke the 9am seating out.  

Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere for brunches.   I would never attempt to dine at their restaurant after this experience.   Even the grounds/lawn at Seven Bridges are so much better kept.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TREAT MOM! She deserves to relax and have someone wait on her. Let us do the work for you.

Call 630.968.1920 to make reservations now.
 
Adults: $28 * Children 5-10: $13 * Under 5: FREE
 
Seating Begins at 9:00am * Last Seating at 1:30pm * Open for Dinner at 5:00pm
 
Brunch Includes: Prime Rib Carving Station, Omelet Station (omelets cooked to order), Honey Ham, Smoked Salmon, Shrimp, Sausage & Peppers, Pasta, Eggs Benedict, French Toast & Maple Syrup, Scrambled Eggs, Bacon & Sausage, Biscuits & Sausage Gravy, Mashed & Breakfast Potatoes, Fruit Tray, Salads, Assorted Desserts, Chocolate Fountain, Coffee, Soda & Tea, Ice Sculpture, and $5.00 Mimosa or Bloody Mary.
One of the best outdoor patios in the chicago area.
Noisiest place ever!  Waitress told us the loud mouths were local firemen!  Very disappointing.

Just held a corporate dinner for 45 people. The manager Todd was great to work with. He helped me stay within budget with some nice pairings. I was a bit disappointed that their dessert menu was so pricey. I had a great dinner with an appetizer and it ended on a dull note because all my budget could handle after that nice meal was assorted cookies.

My night manager or event director Kim was super!! I found I had to gentleman who needed glutend free meals and she was able to adjust their entrees without making them stand out or feel uncomfortable. The servers were great. Always on top of things and making sure that coffee came out right after dinner plates cleared, which was important.

Just a few things shorted them that last star. The ambient lighting was too dark even with the lights up all the way. We had a few speeches and we needed to move the person around until they were properly "lit" so everybody could see them. My final gripe is that they won't set up a direct bill. I work for a university and the events I through even though they have RSVP s I still have surprise guests and to through a $1500 dinner on my credit card, which I know I will be reimbursed in two weeks still is a strain on my financial state,  when the university could cut them a check by the end if the week if we were set up to direct bill.

What stinks is that, I love using intimate and neighborhood restaurants, but the more they shy away from direct billing the university won't let me and other event planned use great places like wheatstack! Then I'm stuck with hotels and chain restaurants which doesn't boost our local vendors. I wish we could find some kind of halfwat point so we can still use them and they are equitably paid for their services.

Done with my musings....PS my sister ate in the main room and had the crab cakes and she said they were moist and oh so good. She also brought home a piece of their chocolate cake...it was divine. Too sweet for one person but just right for two to share. The frosting wasn't gooey and the cake had nice thin players that were light and airy. The cake itself wasn't sweet, which was nice, the creamy frosting brought the sweetness. Yummy!

My husband and I go regularly for their specials which are wonderful.  Ribs, burgers, fish all very good. Once, I had the lemon chicken with vegetables. Chicken was tender, but veggies...seems to always be green beans and carrots...and taste like they were seasoned with butter flavored oil that you use to make popcorn.  Not overcooked, but would rather have them plain than in this greasy oil. Outdoor patio is very nice, but facing west, so at dinner time the sun is in your eyes. We will continue to return. All staff very personable and attentive.

Made reservations for New Years Eve the person who answered  the phone assured us they would have plenty of prime rib at 7:00. Needless.to say they were out we had a hamburger which was nothing specisl. The server was nice but not very attentive
 Will not go back.

Once upon a time this used to be a great place to eat. We even had our office Christmas parties here several times over the years. Maybe i just can't get it out of my mind that this is not the same place it used to be,  which was called The View.

That was then and this is now.   Now it's called The Wheatstack.   Last night's dinner experience scarred me for life. The cod fish was rubbery, cold and undercooked; the coleslaw was awful the service was bad - oops, make that horrendous -  wrong drinks were served, and the margaritas were were bitter.  My wife said the potato salad should be renamed the onion salad.  

One gets the impression that young school children were let loose in the kitchen, creating their Easy-Bake masterpieces for all to enjoy.

On the pro side it was close to home and this is a free country so I don't have to go back again. Trust me, I won't.

Came here with a book group recently and was really impressed.  I have weird cravings sometimes, so what I ordered was admittedly bizarre, but all of it was great.  I got the chicken noodle soup (very chock full of meat and noodles and perfectly cooked veggies with still a bit of crunch).  Bonus points for two packs of oyster crackers on the side.  Then I got an order of fries.  So good!  Perfectly crispy, not oily, none were mushy!  For dessert I went with donut holes!  Why not?  The order is huge - it would easily feed four people.  Freshly done, perfectly puffy and not oily either!  Raspberry and chocolate sauce on the side and the holes have an expert dusting of cinnamon sugar on them.  I'd haul out here again in a heartbeat!  And - the staff graciously put all of our orders on separate checks, which is very unusual (and a pain, I know).

I've been here a couple of times and each time, it was good.  Not 5 stars because it wasn't really anything special.  The food options, taste, and service was good...not great.  I like this place and will be back.

This is the replacement for The View. It is still working out the kinks, but it seemed like there was a better variety offered on the menu. The limited salad dressing selections was a dilemma for me.  
It is cozy and the fireplace is really great on a cold/cool night.

They are offering movie night on Mondays starting June 6, so I think they are trying to become more family friendly.

I'd be willing to go back and try one of the specials and check to see if things are now working well.

After seeing a post on Chicago's Best TV and a Yelp ad... I thought I'd give their Friday fish fry a try. I was mislead to think they served perch for $10... it was nice juicy cod instead, I'm not a fan of their fresh potato chips and you barely receive 2 tablespoons of their bland coleslaw in a little plastic cup, this was not what I had envisioned. Their tarter sauce was nothing special and $2.50 for one pop was a bummer. It would have been nice to see a server check on you for a refill, before it's time to leave.

Parking lot was packed near the building with golfers and the few spots marked for a 2 hour limit were full too. I have a hunch those premium spots are not monitored. The trek from the remote lot for dinner is a bitch. They need to shuttle you with a golf cart or at least valet.

Dining outside is always a plus but  I find service is often compromised. We were on a time line, we had decided on an early dinner with an early show. You'll be sitting out in the evening sun here, as the awning or umbrellas offer no help from the setting evening sun. Not what I had pictured and I'll probably avoid their other weekly offers.
Always a quality meal for the price...but never certain on the service quality or how long it will take for someone to take the order or food to arrive
This place has fast friendly service with a casula atmosphere.

I was here for a luncheon and I was so impressed by how warm and welcoming the staff was throughout our afternoon.  Everyone's glass was always half full, the food was excellent, and we had a beautiful view of the golf course.  We enjoyed the chicken, mashed potatoes, and steamed vegetables.  The chicken was VERY SPECIAL! Great crust, deep garlic and citrus flavor, and very moist.  While we were there we all agreed that it would be a great location for a bridal shower, baby shower, or any luncheon for a large group.  The room that we were in comfortably sat 50+ people, had a fireplace, and the view would be even more impressive in the spring.

I was here for a private event recently, so this review is for their banquet food/service, but I have a hard time imagining the restaurant is much different. 

Everything about Wheatstack was unremarkable: the food, the service, and the view (which, from the banquet room off to the side was partially of a parking lot and then of the patio).  

We started off with bruschetta and stuffed button mushrooms.  Neither were bad, but both added nothing special.  There was no need to go up to the buffet for seconds.  They were just...ordinary.  The main course was lemon chicken, tilapia, and a plain, mixed salad with choice of 2 dressings.  Again, not one of these was offensive, but not one of thee was particularly good.  

I'm not going to say the food was out of any box, as I'm not in the kitchen, but if that is all their culinary team has to offer, it's probably more cost efficient to get frozen lemon chicken and stuffed mushrooms at Costco and warm up some chafing dishes at home.  

The staff, while not rude or inattentive, exuded very little effort and wasn't always around to order drinks from when needed.  

I would not go there for any reason, unless it was, like this, the chosen venue for a friend/family's special occasion, and then, I would eat before I arrived.

Another great meal here. The lemon chicken was awesome.  Erin loved her vodka pasta as well. Kids also loved their food. We'll be back. Calamari was adequate for being bagged/frozen. 

Portion sizes and quality match the price.

The outdoor patio is really nice and very large too.  It has a great view of the golf course, with only really one small problem in that it faces west, into the afternoon sun. 

But the food was really a problem.  As was the service.  I was served an undercooked burger that was still cold to the touch.  I informed our waitress and her response was that she would tell the kitchen.  She left the burger on the table.  She didn't ask if I desired another or something else.  My date had a steak salad and her steak was over cooked.  So one under cooked item and one over cooked.  When we were finished eating our waitress asked if I wanted my under cooked burger wrapped to take home.

Perhaps our food experience was unusual.  But there is never an excuse for poor service.

It's not worth trying a second time.

We went here for a late business lunch and the place was empty. There were a few tables full, a few people people at the bar and a few people sitting out on the patio. We took a table right by the patio. It offered a magnificent view of the adjacent golf course.

The service here was top notch. Our server was very friendly and made us feel like we were in her dining room at home. The manager took some time to chat with us also treating us more like friends and family than patrons. Just by them going out of their way went a long way with me!

I ordered something simple as I was only mildly hungry. I ordered a half chicken caesar wrap with a cup of soup. The chicken soup was very good and the wrap was also very good. It came on a wheat tortilla and was presented very attractively and filled with the right amount of stuff where it wasn't too skimpy or not falling apart.

To make a great meal  there are dozens of "little things" that need to taken care of with each table. Wheatstack carried each one out flawlessly!

We stopped in here over the weekend as we were looking for a place to have dinner before seeing a movie over at Seven Bridges. We stopped on a  whim as all the places near the theater are terrible. I'm hoping this is our new go-to place. We had Chicken Parmesan and Pot Roast.  Both were surprisingly good. The golf course was a nice view to.

I'm sad to give this place 2 stars because Lisle is my hometown and I'm always hoping some great restaurant will swoop in and paint the town red. However, I just don't think Wheatstack will be it!

I went here for lunch once and got the Chicken Tender salad. It was great and huge. It better be for $14 dollars (which is ridiculous), I live in the city and can get the salad cheaper there! Anyways, I came here Friday with my family (party of 6) for the fish fry. We were told it would be a 25 minute wait. 50 minutes later...we were seated...ridiculous.

We were STARVING by the time we got seated. 2 people ordered the fish fry, 3 just ordered the perch dinner, and me (not being a huge fish fan, but it's Lent so no meat) decided to get the chicken finger salad but asked for just 2 pieces of fish on top. I was told this would be a $6 up-charge. Your kidding, right? You just made me wait 50 minutes for a table and now you want to charge me $20 for a salad? Of course, I asked to speak to a manager.

The manager (a man, can't remember his name) came over, explained why service was so slow and then said "What can I do to make this right, you name it" so then I asked for my salad with no up-charge. He said they would still have to charge me $2 extra dollars?! Why did you ask me what I wanted if you weren't going to give it to me? This is honestly the entire reason for the 2 star review. I hope the 2 dollars was worth it! He did end up comping our appetizers, but I was still annoyed.

The fish fry was the slowest fish fry I've ever been to, my boyfriend had to ask for his beer 3 times, and the service was lackluster. They gave us a coupon to come back next time, but honestly, I will not return. 

If you want great reviews you need to have the customer service to go along with it.

I just had a baby shower for my daughter and fifty guests at Wheatstack. Everything was better than I could have imagined. From the food to the exceptional service, I could not have been happier. I highly recommend Wheatstack for any special event or just a lunch or dinner.
     Thank you so much for making my daughter's day so very special.

This place has a little bit of everything for everyone. It has beautiful outdoor seating as well as a bar and dining room. Food, drinks, and service well exceed your expectations! I highly recommend this place.

I came here before when it had a different name, but didn't have a chance until recently. It was fantastic. I would have given it 5 stars back then.

We tried a couple of dishes. The pasta dish was bland and had this weak watery sauce that just collected at the bottom of the dish. Between the two of us, we probably finished a  quarter of it. I hate watery marinara-type sauces on pasta. The Portobello Mushroom sandwich was equally disappointing. It was also very bland and way too watery, but we split it and salted it up and was able to get it down. 

It'll be quite a while before I try this place again.

On another note, it was loud as can be inside, so we opted to sit outside viewing the golf course. It was quite lovely and quiet back there and it is a shame the food was bad because it would be nice to eat out there from time to time.

I thought my server was fantastic.

It is also quite expensive. Add $5-10 on top of what you'd expect to pay elsewhere for most dishes.

This place used to be called "The View", this was my first time there since it became Wheatstack.  The atmosphere is largely unchanged and is what you'd expect for a restaurant on a golf course.  There's a bar area which was lively and had lots of tv's with sports, and then an attached dining room which had some holiday decorations and a nice roaring fire.  

We sat right down, which is always nice, and the service was friendly and attentive.  My friend and I shared a buffalo burger and a grilled veggie sandwich.  The buffalo burger was very good, served on a nice brioche type roll.  It's getting harder and harder to find buffalo burgers on menus so I was happy to see it offered.  The grilled veggie sandwich was also very good, it was served on ciabatta which held up nicely to the sloppiness of the veggies and garlic sauce.  

I would like to see them offer fries instead of chips (which were nothing special), and they could have done a better job with refilling the sodas (which were $2.50).  

I'd also like to see them offer live music every weekend.  It looks like they have it once in a while, but in a place like that, it should be a regular part of the experience.

We went here just to get out, not many Bar n Grills in Bolingbrook. 
Service was ok,  but I had the best Ribeye Steak sandwich ever. It was medium ordered and medium cooked. No tearing to get a bite off just bite and savor. As with first time at any new place different,  but when I want a Ribeye sand I will come here. I will try to golf there soon and enjoy another one. I don't mind the slow service when the food comes out perfect.

My wife and I drive by Wheatstacks frequently and from the looks of the parking lot we thought this place has to be good. Well, I can only describe Wheatstacks with one word. "DISAPPOINTING"!  

This is a club house off the first tee. Thus all the parked cars. Prices are high and the service from the wait staff is poor at best.

Went here for first time on a Saturday night just for drinks. Great service, very friendly and attentive. They had dueling pianos going in the dining room and the Bulls game in the bar. Here's where they shine: my wife noticed the bartender making a special drink that looked good. We asked and were told it was a root beer float made with root beer schnapps. We commented that it looked good. Five minutes later the bartender brought a sample to our table in a short glass. We didn't ask for it. Now that is brilliant customer service.

We used to eat here when it was The View - not because it was our favorite restaurant, but because its 1/4 mile from our house.  The View couldn't decide what it wanted to be, and Wheatstack is closer but not quite there.  It seems to be geared to American heartland type food - heavier food and beer (but who isn't focusing on that now?).   The menu changed more than I expected, but it would be nice to see a couple of staples (grilled chicken salad etc) and some real innovative standouts.   Even better would be to focus on local food.   

Service is better than The View - probably because the same manager who managed The View in its last couple of years is still there.  Decor has been mildly revamped and reflects more arts and crafts style.   We'll have to try this place in summer and see if the drunk golfers still dominate.

We had Wheatstack catered in for a happy hour event in my office, and it was delicious! The meatballs were super juicy (I would assume that's how everyone likes them) and the soft pretzels were, well, soft!

Can't wait to try their location in Lisle!

Went on a Friday with a large group that included a toddler.  Because of the fish fry and the fact that it was a Friday night at dinnertime, we expected a wait, but were sat in the bar at a large table.  The waitstaff was friendly.  Some people might characterize the frequency of her service as "slow", but again, having worked in restaurants and bars over the years, I would just consider it busy.  

As for the food, I was happy with the steak sandwich I got.  It was tasty and done exactly how I asked for it.  There really is nothing more disappointing than having someone ask you how you want something cooked and then have them bring it to you the way the chef wanted it done.  But I digress.  Everyone was pretty happy with what they got.  Two people had burgers, two others went with the stuffed pork loin special.  All in all, a good visit.  I'm sure we'll be back, next time I'll probably try to fish fry.

Very disappointed! We used to come here a lot when we lived in Lisle, even back when it was The View. This time we had a bad experience.  Seven of us went for Father's Day dinner and only two of our group liked their food. The fish was cooked poorly - two people got the salmon, which was raw and had to be sent back.  Unfortunately, my 10 year old got one of these and took several bites before I noticed.  The tilapia was gray and flavorless, and the ribs were rated a "5 out of 10" by my father-in-law.  Our server was nice, but the service in general was slow.  Half our table's drink orders were brought out but it took another 10 minutes for the rest, even though it was just wine and soft drinks.  The only good things about the meal were the view and the cupcakes!  Sadly, we won't be coming back any time soon.

Really good menu, and I've had some good beer there too. We've gone for lunch in the middle of winter, and also eaten on the patio during summer. It's a great place to go for a nice dinner or lunch that you may not have considered. It was also never too busy when we've gone.
I'm a regular here great food and friendly service and the prices are fair!

Great artichoke app nice and cheesy
I had the swordfish. It was Ok not great. They topped it with cold ceveche which chilled the hot fish. 
Decient beer selection for a small bar.

I've been here on many occasions. I've never had a bad meal yet. The staff is more than accommodating and fun to be around. The reason Wheatstack really shines is their handing of my mothers funeral luncheon. The food was fabulous and Todd and his staff were more than sympathetic to our needs. They went way above and beyond what they need to do. I felt like family the way they treated us. Whether your looking for a place for lunch or dinner, or you have a banquet need, I can't speak highly enough about Wheatstack and Todd and his staff.
Pot roast is awesome. No wonder it is their house specialty.
I wasn't a fan when it was The View and I'm still not. Bad service and misleading on the half price burgers on Monday, which was our whole reason for going.

very good ribs; hot and fall off the bone tender.  gluten-free menu.  friendly staff.  good prices.   great specials!  today is baby back ribs, full slab for half slab price.  BTW the 1/2 price burgers are great deal too!

Poor atmosphere, sub par food, undrinkable martini, and they wouldn't honor the value of my expired Groupon.  It clearly states the amount I paid ($32) never expires.  Regardless, there is no reason to go back to this place.
good food and chill atmosphere with a fun beer selection

My husband and I have family in Downers Grove, IL and decided to try Wheatstack with some friends after the holidays with a great Groupon deal we found.  We could not have been more impressed with the friendly service, delicious food, and warm ambiance.  We all enjoyed dinner together on the evening of 12/28/11 where a waitress and trainee provided us with wonderful and attentive service.  We had the blackened tilapia and vodka penne pasta along with a couple of appetizers and everything was absolutely delicious with generous portions.  Although we enjoyed dinner at a leisurely pace, service was prompt and professional.  We genuinely felt welcomed throughout the evening - never rushed.  It is also a great place for families as we had a young child with us.  I hope this Groupon deal attracts many new customers to this establishment as they have certainly won us over.  We will definitely be back!!
Good variety, lot of food for price,  nice atmosphere.

We moved from the city to the burbs a few months ago and we have been trying new places to eat. Tonight we based our decision on a coupon from the Clipper Magazine. We were immediately seated in a booth which was nice. I had a rough day and told the girl I was in need of a cocktail. She brought me one and it was great. My boyfriend and I commented that the menu had quite a bit of options we were interested in. We weren't sure what to order and decided on a wedge salad, 2 cups of soup (chowder and chili), nachos, and calamari (weird combo we realized, but it was what we wanted). We got the salad it was great. We didn't get the soup for about another 15 minutes, my boy friend asked for no onions and it was piled high with onions and my clam chowder was cold. We then proceeded to wait about 40 minutes for soggy nachos and extremely salty and cold calamari. During this time I got another martini and we barely saw our waitress. We then had to wave down another waitress to get our bill. I went to the car and luckily I did because when my bf gave the girl our coupon she proceeded to say within ear shot, "They barely spent $50, ordered appetizers and have a coupon!" I worked in many restaurants while in college all of them much nicer places than this and I would have never given such poor service and at the very least wouldn't have topped the evening off with utter rudeness. The only reason we went there was due to the coupon, this is the point of marketing with coupons, to draw new people into your establishment and then you treat your patrons with such poor service and disrespect. Never again, too many options in the Chicagoland area for this mess.
I don't understand why this has such low stars.   The food is great, the service was good and we had a really nice time eating there yesterday.

Had a girls weekend, and one of the girls recommended this for lunch on Saturday. Sat out on the terrace. Awesome view, great wait staff (Sara), and the best tuna melt EVER!!. Love the specials that I see are offered. With good marketing, this place should be a new favorite. Thanks for a new memory with old friends!!

My best find in a while. 

Cool owner and really unique food. 

Will definitely be using them to cater my business events in the future.

In all the time I've been eating here, I haven't branched out at all: I love the pepper steak pie so much that whenever I come I get the same thing! I'm almost afraid to get something else because I don't want to miss out...

So it was good that I finally brought my parents with me so I could taste their (different) pies and try something new! Mom got the chicken and mushroom and Dad got the ham and cheese. While both were tasty, my heart still belongs to pepper steak!

We also got the mini dessert pies: mine, the vanilla custard liberally sprinkled with cinnamon, reminded me of horchata, the Mexican rice milk drink, yum! 

This is a unique and affordable dinner option for the whole family. Love it!

Really good.  You have to try this place.

These aren't dessert pies, these are more of what you would consider "chicken pot pies".  They are small, and can be eaten individually, or you can buy a bunch of different flavors and share them.

Yes, they do have a chicken pie, but they also have varieties of beef, lamb, pork, and more.

The guy who owns the place is from Africa and also has a small African grocery store next to it.  Not sure if the recipes are from Africa, but they are all very good.

Finally made it here and it was well worth the trip.  My wife and I ended up buying pretty much one of everything to take home to share over the weekend.  Everything was great but the spicy beef and potatoes was

First off thanks to Dr. C for his review pointing me out to Pie Boss.   I'm bummed that I found this place just as I'm in the process of relocating but how does that saying go...it's better to have love and lost then never to have loved at all.   And yes I absolutely LOVE the pot pies that are made here.

I agree with those who say....RUN...don't walk to Pie Boss immediately.   Get some pie then come back and read my review...LOL.

But seriously the whole process from my initial emails to Ty about the pies to picking up some frozen pot pies and a few tasty dessert pies was on point.   Ty was very nice when responding to my emails and when I called to place an order, the lady who answered the phone was equally pleasant.    Ty even helped me out when my good old GPS was directing me to the wrong destination.

When I went inside the shop, he was very patient explaining the whole pie process to another customer and her daughter.   In my mind I was like, hurry hurry, I'm late for a Yelp event, but I couldn't be mad because I was witnessing some excellent customer service.    When he did get to me, he gave me that same courtesy and took the time to explain how I go about baking his pies.   I ordered the Pepper Steak, Chicken & Mushroom, Spicy Chicken, and the Spinach & Feta Pies.   I also ordered one each of his apple, vanilla, chocolate, and cherry pies.

I've tried the Chicken & Mushroom and Spicy Chicken so far.   The crust is so flaky...so tasty.    It's fine whether you add the egg and milk on top or leave it out.    The pot pie seems so tiny but it is packed full of goodness.   I can't say enough good things about the pies and Ty.

I ate all the dessert mini pies within a couple days and loved them all.  I will have to put a special order for a full dessert pie.

I promised to bring D the Pepper Steak pie to try but I hope I can hold out from eating it before I can get it to him.    Yum to the E.

P.S... I think Ty thought I was joking when I suggested he open a 2nd location in Northwest Indiana somewhere.    But he does offer shipping options for his pies if I'm not inclined to drive the 80 minutes or so needed to get to Pie Boss once I move.   So hope is not lost.

Where do I start! This place came up on the who's who of restaurants in Aurora, IL and the Yelp reviews were amazing so I decided to give it a try. I must preface that I am not the biggest fan of pot pies but since people are raving about it, let's see what's it all about. When you walk in, it has a mom and pop shop feel to it. Since this restaurant is owned by a South African family, the colors of the restaurant are of the South African flag. When I called in my order, I told the young lady that this is my first time and I am not familiar with how the system of your restaurant works. She was more than helpful and willing to explain that you can either pick up your pot pies frozen or they can bake them in the house and pick them up a half-hour later. I decided to order the chicken pot pie and the pepper steak pot pie. Let me tell you they both were amazing for two completely different reasons: if you are looking for a homestyle meal, the chicken pot pie is the way to go. If you are looking for a savory meal, the pepper steak pot pie is the way to go. The crust was flaky, buttery, and extremely flavorful. This is the best pot pie I have ever eaten! We will back very soon!

OMG, I started going in this place last year.  I LOVE IT.  I will say the staff is so awesome, They remember me everytime i go there and even remember small aspects that we speak about the next time no matter how long.  Not to mention the food is AMAZING.
Awesome family run joint w great service and best pies and pasties in the suburbs.  Will be back many many times!

Go. Now. Don't waste your time. This place is AMAZING. I got it for lunch, brought it back to work to eat, and the entire office stopped to see what I was eating because it smelled SO good!

I had the cheeseburger pie and a sausage roll, and am extremely full/happy! The pie crust is flaky and delicious, and the meats are flavored wonderfully.

I will be returning. Heck, several people went there for lunch immediately after I finished! 

PS- The staff was beyond friendly! Very helpful and informative if your a first timer.

column2: R I C K Y B O B B Y.
column13:
Sometimes you just know you are going to have a good meal, simply by the smell of a place when you first walk in the door.  My first whiff left me with a "Oh, WOW!", and I was looking forward to what lied ahead.  After talking with Ty (the owner) about the menu and what he recommended for a first timer, I went with the Beef Pasty and the Vanilla Custard dessert pie.  Simply AMAZING!  The Beef Pasty was a hand-held it that was like a beef stew wrapped in a pie crust.  The crust was buttery, flaky, and absolutely perfect!  The filling was scorching hot, so I do recommend waiting a bit before biting in, unless you like a burned tounge.  It was delicious though, and I highly recommend it.  The vanilla custard pie was perfect in its own right.  Creamy, a little eggy (which I like) and topped with a cinnamon (and nutmeg??) dusting.  The whole meal was A+!  Add to it Ty's service and this is a place I will DEFINITELY be back to, and soon!

If you find yourself in the area for lunch or dinner, you should give this place a try.  Excellent!

My husband ordered 5 different savory pies, chicken, beef, ham & cheese and 2 spicy ones.
We loved the quality, the Flavors, the service, the different options and the flexibility to please the customer.
You have the chance to order baked or you can bake it at home.
My daughter loved to help us brushed with egg yolk to bake at home and all of them were really tasty and fresh.
For sure we will order again, to taste new flavors. They have around 20 different flavors, without including the pie desserts. We ordered cherry and chocolate!
Good to know that we have more options close to our place. I'm tired of the same restaurants at downtown Naperville. Pie Boss is a nice option if you want to try something different!!

South African inspired pies. My wife loved this little joint in a strip mall near montomery rd and farmsworth ave. It's a take out place so lower your expectation if you're looking for a nice place to eat. What we do all the time is, just stay on the car and try to devour everything before we even drive out of the parking lot. Yes! That good!!! If you want meat on your pies, this is a place to go. I tried the chicken peri peri, chicken and shrooms, pepper steak, including the ham and cheese that my kids always order. Of all these our fave is the pepper steak which is like beef stew on a pie. Right amount of spice and saltiness to bring out the flavor of the flaky dough. I did try the custard and chocolate pies, they're just too small IMHO for the price. Be ready to spend maybe $20-30 to feed 4 hungry mouths. They close early so better call in your order before 7pm. Definitely our go to place for a quick grub. You could also stock-up on frozen pies, if you're too lazy to drive in and pickup your food.
Very good pies. Our group had a chicken pie, spicy veggie, cherry and blueberry pie. The crusts were very light and flaky. This place does not disappoint. Give it a try.

So lately I have been craving a good meat pie. After doing some searching on the interwebs I discovered this place. Let me tell you...this place is indeed a hidden gem. It looks very unassuming but it holds some delicious items.

I tried their steak pie and sausage roll. Both had an incredibly flaky crust. The steak was tender and swimming in a delicious gravy. The sausage roll was basically a flaky croissant with a yummy sausage stuffing. Both were so good I managed to chomp down on them within minutes. But I took my time eating the flaky crust. 

The staff were very friendly and they explained everything they made was in-house. It really tasted like it was. Very fresh. Like eating homemade pie. The whole place smelled like a bakery. I decided to even take home one of their custard pies for dessert. A bit small but very yummy. Like eating rice pudding pie. 

 My only complaint is its selection. Though varied and with different specialties made each week I would like to see some more options...like a pizza pie...or a gyro pie for example. Something a bit more extreme or experimental.

Overall this place was yummy and unique. A bit out of the way for me to drive but definitely worth it. If you ever feel like eating a tummy-warming meal then come to Pie Boss.

I have never been to a restaurant who season their meat as well as Pie Boss does. These are the most delicious meat pies you'll ever have. They have excellent customer service , and to make it even better you can take home their pies frozen and cook at a later date if you'd like. This is definitely one of our go to places for a nutritious full feeling meal.

I don't usually find "no fault!"  Pie Boss is a hidden gem, a rose among thorns, a great value and well worth a special trip.  Loving Jamaican beef patties  (which I can't find in Naperville) I was drawn to check out Pie Boss since it's a stuffed pastry combination.  What a delight!  There are meat pies, vegetarian pies, sausage rolls, pasties and dessert pies.  The crust on all is a flaky well cooked puff pastry that is crispy top to bottom and melts in the mouth.  The fillings are very well seasoned, my favorite so far is the Pepper Steak.  On a recent trip the "special" was their homage to a pizza roll with pepperoni, and mozzarella cheese.  With the exception of the dessert pies portions are generous.  Other standouts are feta and spinach, spicy chicken and cheeseburger.  Among the desserts I've only tried the custard pie which is just the perfect bite of custard vanilla goodness!  Check them out!

Heard good things from others about Pie Boss. Shouldn't have waited so long to try it. Excellent pies all around. Owner is very friendly and helpful also. Altogether a great experience and highly recommended.

Great food, great desserts, and great service. There is nothing on the menu that is bad. I'm an customer for life. This is an south Africa restraint what is a great change then the normal food in the area.

We were in the store this past weekend TWICE! We had family in from out of town for my daughter's graduation - so big crowd to feed. They absolutely LOVED the chicken pot pie, beef pasty, and the biggest HIT of all, the sausage rolls (my personal favorite)!! My dad kept asking if there was more. :)  I will have to send him some in the frozen form. Thank you so much PIE BOSS for making such DELICIOUS food!!!
Pies are amazing! I have literally had every single one. Has great flavor, even reheated.
Excellent quality!! Such a treat eating here. We get the pies & bring them home. Great customer service, would highly recommend!

Hot Diggity Damn! I usually am not into pastries of this sort....I don't like pies in general. I have some fam from Michigan so they're all really into pasties but it's never been my thing. So much crust...ugh. 

Enter: Pie Boss.

Pie Boss does have a lot of crust but...it's just unlike any other I've ever had. I don't mind all the dough and not only that but I think that may just be the best part of their goods. It's flaky in all the right places on the edges, soft & gooey in all the rights places in the middle, just absolutely delicious. I tried a few different specimens to get a good scope and now am dying to go back to try more items.

+Sausage Roll $3.49 - This looked like a snack in my carry out box, but after I popped it in the oven, man did the sausage expand with some heat (har har har, too easy). Seriously though, it accounted for an entire lunch for me. It was so good.
+Chicken & Mushroom meat pie $5.29 - Holy goodness. I swear I didn't think it could get better after trying the sausage roll but I was wrong. The chicken & mushroom mixture was so insanely good, eloquent words are eluding me from describing the delight properly.
+Spinach & Feta vegetarian pie $4.99 - This might have been my favorite of the bunch! It's really so hard to pick because I felt like each was better than the next. Thi s pie, along with the others, was completely packed full of spinach & feta goodness. I absolutely loved it.

I *have* to get back to buy some pasties to go to see how they stack up for my fam vs. those from the UP. As everyone said, call 30-35 minutes before going in so they can prepare your pies to eat there. I prefer taking mine frozen. Trust me, they taste just as amazing if you heat them up at home. It's super easy & makes for a filling, delicious meal! I live nowhere near Aurora but I'm already planning my next trip to Pie Boss in my head! Nomnomnomz.
They make two things and they make it well. Customer service is great, the employees are friendly and very helpful
This is an interesting place, little pot pies and all homemade by a fella named Ty from South Africa. All I can say is it was delicious and Ty was a gentleman!!

The food here is very tasty!  I've only been here once, but the flaky crust/pie is very well prepared.  It looks perfect, I'm not sure how the owner Ty (from the bakery's website) makes it that way.  Anyway, it was 10am and the pies were just getting out of the oven.  I ordered the Chicken and Mushroom Pie and a Sausage Roll.  I was thinking of eating it later in the day, but it was freshly prepared so I ate some of it right away instead.
      The prices are low and the food is good IMO.  I'd recommend this place to people. Although it's more like a bakery than a restaurant, there are a few tables.  Oh and I had a chance to ask Ty about the food and he was super nice!

I wasn't sure what to expect but I found the pie a little smaller than I was expecting. Maybe a little too much for one person, but not enuf to split without a salad or something else to share. Around $7, fair enuf.

Nice mild, maybe curry/white pepper, spice on the spicy lamb that was not on the take away menu I requested; so you may have to ask for spicy lamb as I don't think they always have it. I shared half of the spicy lamb with my older brother who I was visiting in the Fox Valley and he didn't find it too spicy, and he doesn't like spicy. I was a little disappointed in the low spice level. I'm also a crust snob and not looking for carbs in general, and I ate ALL my crust.

I did pick up a frozen chicken and mushroom pie and baked it about two weeks later just coating the top with milk (powdered goat milk was all I had and it worked) since I was out of the other egg wash option (why waste an egg). Came out nice and brown and flakey. I preferred the chicken and mushroom, rich, complex, just delicious. I found the spicy lamb not that special frankly and may have just gotten a less than stellar one, light on lamb imo.
I'll try the highly recommended pepper beef next, but I'll pick up another frozen chicken and mushroom guaranteed.

If you don't know this part of Aurora, you might want to call first and get some landmarks like Copley Memorial Hospital, and across from a 7-11 in a pretty nondescript strip mall. My garmin kept taking me to a wrong address a few long blocks away on Montgomery road, so watch out for that.
Nice people. I hope they do well. Kind of out of the way from my usual Fox Valley Aurora to Elgin run, in extreme SE Aurora (Montgomery :~)

Don't miss Johnny and Sarah's excellent reviews.

The favor of the pies was good and the crust tender. However, it's a carry out place with two dirty tables. Had I just carried-out and not sat in such a sorry location, I may be a happier customer. The food wasn't superior enough for a return visit.

Pies are excellent. Crispy buttery crust that melts in your mouth. Meat is always spiced to the perfect amount and tastes fresh. My favorite isbthe pepper steak. Service is always top notch, these are some of the nicest people I know. Small seating area but you always have the ability to order to go.

This place is the best!  If you are looking for something unique and delicious, check out Pie Boss.  Even if you don't live in the area, it is worth taking a trip to!  I have been coming here for a couple years and have never been disappointed.  This is a locally run business, and the owners/employees are wonderful and genuinely nice people.  The restaurant is always clean and well maintained.  You can eat in the small dining area or take your pies to go. 

I have enjoyed every single pie that I have tried here.  They have a unique array of spices and flavors.  My favorites are the beef pepper steak, chicken and mushroom, and spinach and feta.  Sometimes the owners have limited time new flavors or specials.  The dessert pies, pasties, and rolls are fantastic too.  The pies are a bit heavy, so make sure you come in with an empty stomach.  If you have a specific flavor in mind, you may want to call ahead so they can make sure it's in stock and prepared for you.  Additionally, you can order frozen pies to take home and bake yourself.  Unfortunately, if you are gluten free or vegan, I don't think you will be able to find anything to eat here.  I think the reason though is because the owners want to keep the pies as authentic and tasty as possible.

We took home the Peppered Steak pie and the Cheeseburger pie, it was easy to follow the directions that came with them. 
I enjoyed the crust more than anything, it was fluffy and crispy. My husband was overwhelmed with his Cheeseburger pie after 3 bites. 
We both shared the chocolate custard tart for dessert which was phenomenal.

The staff go above and beyond. I recommend ordering a half hour early if you plan to get takeout. Loved most of their pies. Not crazy about the cheeseburger one. Their mini pies for dessert are just the right size to quench your sweet-tooth without the guilt of overindulging

This place is fantastic! We used to drive to the city to get our meat pies...SO EXCITED to have found a place closer to home!! We are from New Zealand and grew up with 'classic' meat pies...and by classic...I mean the good stuff! :) These are the REAL DEAL...you cant go wrong...I will be telling all my friends about this place! And for those of you who are complaining about the location...get over it :) If anything...i think they were brilliant to start somewhere that probably cost less money...BUT, I hope they do decide to open a place in downtown Naperville...i think they could really make a killing :)

Came here for dinner with my wife and son for the first time after hearing nothing but good things about it from the wife. Well, I'm here to tell you that all her ravings were worth it. Had a delicious ham and cheese pie. Very tasty! As this was my first time here I played it safe, but next time I'll be a bit more adventurous. Also had a sausage roll that was spectacular, and a cherry crumble pie for dessert that was heavenly. Eat Here!!!

This place is absolutely fanatic. If you call ahead and they will put the pie in for you coming out of the oven right when you arrive.....then get some to take home for later. The crust might be the best part,is buttery and flaky. The flavors at so complex. I love the spicy veggie, hands down favorite. With the peri peri a close second, it would be my top pick if the was a veggie option. Absolutely love the spice and the pies. This spot is a winner and can make your place#1 with pies to go.

I love this place!  I feel bad that I haven't come more often or that I haven't yet written a review, but now I can begin to correct those mistakes.  Located near Copley Memorial Hospital, it's located in strip mall at the corner of Waterford and Montgomery Road, and well worth finding--as you'll find nothing else like this anywhere near.  I'm not at all familiar with South African food, and don't come from any pie/pastry-and-meat-eating culture, so I can't tell you how 'authentic' or 'traditional' anything here is; all I can tell you is that I find their offerings to be delicious and very filling.
