They have a standard menu (chicken pot pie, chicken and mushroom, something with beef, something with ground beef and cheese, spinach and feta), plus 'daily special' type things; they also have a sausage thing and something called a 'pasty' (which is pronounced like 'nasty' not 'tasty').  I don't really like beef or sausages, so my experience here is limited to veggie pies and chicken; I did try their beef-and-something pie once and I thought it was weird-tasting and gamey, but it really could have just been me.  First I have to mention--as others have more thoroughly and eloquently mentioned--that the crust is freakin awesome; it's tasty, flaky, and just the right amount of chewy.

My favorites are the chicken pot pie, the spicy chicken, and the spinach and feta.  The pies with chicken are both incredibly flavorful, and the chicken isn't all sad and dried out; the chicken pot pie has a tasty gravy with peas and carrots, and, best of all, you can actually taste everything, it doesn't all just blend together; the spicy chicken isn't actually all that spicy--to me anyway--which is probably best because you can still taste the warm spices and appreciate the great flavors; the spinach and feta is also really good--it's not drenched in salt which means you can really appreciate the mild taste of spinach.  My only complaint about the spinach and feta, and actually it isn't really a complaint so much as a statement of my own personal preference, is that I wish it had a little more feta; it's also worth noting that whatever feta it is that they use isn't as salty as feta can sometimes be.  I haven't yet tried their desert pies, but I can't imagine that they're anything but awesome.

I've only ever gone/ordered from Pie Boss between 1:00 and 3:00, so I'm not sure what it's like during lunch or late afternoon/early evening, but every time I've gone I've just walked in and ordered from whatever pies they have at the time and I've never felt like I had to settle for anything.  They do suggest ordering about 30 minutes before you'd like to pick up your pies, so if you want something specific or are ordering at a busy time I would suggest doing that, but otherwise I would suggest just walking in and letting whoever is behind the counter walk you through.  I also have to mention the people behind the counter, who have been INCREDIBLY friendly and interactive; the last couple of times I've gone they asked if I had ever been there before, which I think is a really nice touch: if you are a first-timer they really do take the time to talk to you and make you feel comfortable about ordering.  Oh, and one last thing I would like to mention about the pies: they don't look large, so you might think that they're going to leave you wanting, but trust me when I say that they're much more substantial and filling than they appear.

I probably would go with five stars just based off of the food and the service, but five stars is a no-brainer here to me especially when you consider that there isn't anything like this around.  With great food, great service, and a unique concept, I think Pie Boss is a place that people should make a point of trying.  Bookmark it if you haven't yet!

I work at the pawn shop close by here so we get pies from here regularly. I have tried pretty much everything on the menu from the meat pies to the beef pasty and the apple pie, it's all DELICIOUS! You can order fresh pies and the also have them warm and ready to go! Today I asked what was ready and they did have chicken pot pie so I tried that one for the first time today and I was not disappointed! Never had a bad pie here and I'll return! Thanks Pie Boss!

Great place for a meal. We've eaten Pasty's up in Northern WI for years. When we ordered the beef one here we were expecting the same. But the first bite was a relevation. So much flavor!  And the vegetables inside really add to the meat. I don't know if I'll be able to eat a bland Pasty again!  The chicken pot pie is also full of flavor. We will be back for sure.

We had the spicy chicken, chicken peri peri, beef pasty, vanilla custard, cherry crumble and (our favorite) apple crumble. All of them were amazing!! Full of flavor and surprisingly filling! Very affordable and is always fresh! They are really friendly, we are definitely going back! Excited to try their new specials!

Food is delightful here!! The crusts are amazing, as well as the stuffings. Everything is seasoned to perfection and the textures of everything are great. My favorite pie for now is the spicy chicken (which is not too spicy). However, every pie that I've tasted has been very good. 

I'm excited to go back to try some of their dessert pie!!

This place is a little hidden gem in Aurora located near Rush Copley Hospital. I am so glad my friend took me here to try because I would've never known about it!

The staff is great and the owner is very friendly! This is definitely a great place to try if you haven't been, you will not be disappointed.

Honest review do not go here it
Is not good i went here to try it n it takes forever for the food to be ready like forever im tlaking like an hour for like a little pie the prices are supper cheap but it jus doesnt taste good i got the pepper steak which all the reviews says is the best its not it was gross looked like dog food n my gf got the cheeze burger pie n it wasnt good n we got the dessert ik this is the new fad but its gross u have been warned

Doesn't look like much but WOW is it mouthwateringly delicious!  The limited menu didn't make me feel like there were limited options. A friend and I split the Chicken & Mushroom and the Cheeseburger pot pies, and I would definitely recommend either. It could just be because I'm pregnant, but I could've eaten a whole other one all on my own... so I'm not sure if that means they're a little small to fill up on one or what. :)

We also split the mini dessert pies: the apple and the vanilla custard. I'm not a custard person at all, but that was delicious too! Sprinkled in cinnamon... it was really hard to decide which I liked better.

I'm 30 minutes away from this place, but it would be worth it to take my hubby here next time I have a craving for flaky pastry and delicious filling... Mmmm... I think I feel one coming on now...

Met the Pie Boss himself and got the origin story.

When he was a student in South Africa, they would buy pies like this for lunch. These are his authentic versions made with imported spices.

Had the Spicy Lamb and a Chocolate Cream dessert pie. Yum!
Best pie in town!! The Chicken Pot Pie and the Cherry Pie are among my favorites. They never disappoint.

Pie Boss is a great lunch spot. The pies are delicious. They are all freshly hand made. 
The Montgomery road location has a very small dining area. 
They have most of the pies made fresh in a display but you can order a baked one that takes 30 minutes. 
I plan on returning for more lunches.

Since my browser froze and I lost my first review, I'm going to keep this one short and to the point:

I had the Spinach & Feta pie, and I really liked it.  I only had a few bites of the Cheeseburger, but I didn't really like that one.

Pies are about $5 each, so it's totally affordable for lunch or dinner.  The pies are "personal" size, but after one I was still a little bit hungry.

If you phone in your order, pies will be ready in 30 minutes.  They also stay very hot for a 20-30 minute car ride.

Pie Boss is a welcome addition to the area, which is filled mostly with chains and tacquerias.

What fast food should taste like.

Pie Boss makes you curious about culture and want to experience more pot pie cuisine. A perfect pie every time, all the time.

How many times has eating a pot pie brought a smile to your face? A simple concept, tried and true recipe and a whole lot of rich wholesome goodness.

You'll have to try all of them to gain an around the world appreciation for Pie Boss.

You walk-in, You tell him what youwant, Easy. Recommend calling 30 mins ahead out of convenience for you and Pie Poss to have order ready.

The only thing better is if the owner would of played his guitar.

The service and attention of this place is enough to go, but the food will keep you coming back. Right down the street from the growing place... Why WOULDN'T you stop by?? My husband and I collectively tried everything they have. It's all delicious. Don't be afraid to ask the guys behind the counter for help, they genuinely seem like they want to be there!

I was really impressed with everything that we ordered. We bought a spicy chicken and a pepper beef pie and they were wonderful. Nicely seasoned, great gravy sauce and tasted homemade. We also ordered a beef pasty and it also was great! The menu isn't large but what they do have is perfectly made. I can't wait to try all of their pies. We all enjoyed the chocolate pie too which isn't overly sweet and reminds me a bit of german chocolate cake. I would recommend getting one of each flavor and serve it up for lunch or dinner! It was that good. 

The restaurant is small and homey and could easily be passed by if you aren't looking for it, but this place deserves it's five stars! I have told some of my friends about it, and now they are fans too. 

I also purchased their frozen pies and it makes a nice changeup for dinner. The frozen pies can go straight into the oven, make the house smell so good, and boom, you have dinner. Keep up the good work, Pie Boss!

Awesome pies, seriously! The sausage rolls are my favorite, the spicy chicken second favorite! Definitely recommend calling your order in advance, and if you like the spicy lamb then get your name on the call list!

Hadn't been in the area for a while.  Was glad to see the boss was still going strong.  The spicy chicken was as tasty as I remembered.  Hope I'm in the area again soon so I can try the spinach and feta.  Excellent food and service!

Had the sausage roll for lunch thinking it wasn't going to be enough food, but sure enough it just hit the spot. Nice onion flavor and choice herbs, moist and unctuous sausage meat. The flaky crust is what really completes the package.

No peri peri chicken when I walked in, but most everything else was warm and ready to order. For $4 I think this place strikes a keen bargain, evocative of the London street food I had in my brief visit there. Simple menu, straightforwardly presented. The owner there asked me how I heard of the place and where I was from, getting the low-down on his consumer market. He seems quite on top of things. I hope his business continues its success.

...South African Savory Pie Shop...

... are you on your way yet? ...
... ... .... well, what are you waiting for, ya big dummy? ... ... ...

Move over Pleasant House! There's a new, more affordable (and IMO, better) savory pie shop in town and in one visit they offer double the veggie variety that you've offered in the last 2 years. 

I walked into an empty shop during what was damn near an apocalyptic storm and was both warmly and promptly greeted by owner and Chef Tyrell. My immediate question was regarding their veggie options, of which they have two different ones each day, a Spinach and Feta and also Spicy Vegetable mix that they had already sold out of, but I couldn't resist so I purchased a take and bake frozen spicy veggie and a spinach and feta. I knew I should stop there, but I'm really into new and unique local businesses and I wanted to spread the word a bit more and support the cause. 

So I thought about how my mom is the most boring, eater ever and rarely strays from meat, potatoes and pasta. The most ethnic she gets when it comes to food  are pierogis and maybe egg rolls and fried rice. If I told her I was bringing home South African food she'd probably make a cringe-y face and then I'd get mad at her for being so lame and non-adventurous and exactly what everyone thinks of when they talk sh*t about suburban people. But I decided to get her a pie anyway because I know she'll love it if she doesn't know it's origins and just thinks it's a pot pie... which it pretty much is. I ordered her up the chicken and mushroom and also the spicy chicken with traditional South African spices for my Dad.

I can't speak for my parents as they had already eaten dinner by the time I'd gotten home so they're making it a lunch-time thing for tomorrow, but my spinach and feta pie was superb. and I have to confess that I've never been much of a pot pie fan, but this was moist and perfect and unlike the pot pies I've had in the past. Me = hooked. After being rained on today while running errands, I needed some comfort food of epic proportions and my pie did just the trick. I gobbled it up, managed to stay awake for about an hour and a half more, and that set the stage for a good cat cuddle/single girl snuggle with a big ole fleece blanket on the couch. It might not be fall yet, but in my head I'm already wearing my drawstring mens sweatpants and gettign ready to carve a out a solid groove on the sectional until spring. 

All my 4 savory pies came to a total of $22... affordable, savory and my new hot spot for autumn through winter eats. 

Insider tip: Call 35 minutes ahead with your order and they'll make your pie fresh. The ones I got were just from the warming case but they were all buttery and moist as a mutha, so I can't imagine how good a fresh one would be. Defo going to call in advance next time... or you can do an order of frozen pies... or you can go bulk (totally what I'm doing next time) and order 6 pies for $28.99. That's a meal for 6, for under $30. 

... NOW, are you on your way? ...

Located in a strip mall, there are only 2 tables and the door has some difficulty opening up all the way.  There is a heated case for already cooked pies, but there are plenty of frozen options to order from.  We came in on an afternoon and they were out of the spicy chicken.  The owners were surprised that so many people ordered them as well.  I got a mix of frozen pies to go including the cheeseburger pie, pepper steak, chicken and mushroom, along with a spicy veggie.  

The owner was really nice as he mentioned that it started from South African street food the he grew up on but they upgraded it with sirloin steak, ground beef for the cheeseburger, and using higher end ingredients for the flaky crust.  The price point is pretty reasonable as well.  Although the distance is pretty far, it's worth the trip if you go to the outlet mall or anywhere near there.

I absolutely love this place. Great food and excellent staff. They always make you feel welcomed. This is the type of restaurant I love eating at and love getting delicious food from. My favorites are Chicken Peri Peri, and the beef pasty's. Absolutely delicious!  

You won't be disappointed!

I wanted to like Pie Boss more than I actually did. I typically work until around 6:00 most days, and they're open until 7:00... So it's sort of a rush to get over there before they close. The first time we went, we got there at around 6:30, and they didn't have any pies ready to go. Maybe my expectations are weird, but the places that serve these kind of pot pies in my experience aren't the kind of place you call ahead and order but instead just swing by and choose from the selection they have on hand that are ready to go. I guess this is the case with Pie Boss if you come around lunch, but it'd seem dinner is a prime time to also have your pies ready to roll out without needing to call ahead.

Anyway, we came back the next day, phoned in 30 minutes ahead of time, and ended up getting a cheeseburger pie, a spinach and feta pie, and some kind of curried mushroom pie along with a sausage roll. First off, the crust on these things were just bananas. Flaky, perfect, pot pie crust that tastes incredible. The fillings though, we weren't so wild about. The mushroom one was my favorite, I didn't really dig the spinach and feta, and the cheeseburger one was just weird. I was expecting something closer to like, I don't know, Hamburger Helper Cheeseburger Macaroni instead instead of a legit burger patty, piece of American cheese, and ketchup. Really weird. The sausage roll was pretty good, but we really wanted to try their dessert pastries which I guess they only serve on weekends?

We'll totally go back, as I feel like there's lots of potential here with the incredible crust they're able to produce on these pies, we just really haven't found a filling we're crazy about yet. If nothing else, the people who work there are SUPER nice, and it's cool seeing such an odd business (apparently) doing well in a random Aurora strip mall. I say check it out, get a wide assortment of pies, and share them.

I've driven by here a million times and always just assumed it was a pizza joint. I finally decided to stop in and boy am I happy I did. I went in with the intention of just picking up a menu to look over but after chatting with the friendly and helpful staff I ended up walking out with 2 meat pies. I got the chicken peri peri and the cheeseburger meat pie. 
The chicken peri peri was very delicious and had a little bit of a kick to it, the cheeseburger pie was exactly how it sounds, a cheeseburger in a pie, both were very good and I'll definitely be going back.

Let's face it, Chicago is really not where you think to go when you're craving a pasty. In fact, I lived here nearly 20 years before even understanding what one was. I knew it was some type of English foldover thing, stuffed with meat but that was about the extent of it. Sure I knew what an empanada was, but to this day I'm still not clear on the difference between the two things...if a difference exists. 

Then I met my mother-in-law and started taking trips to Michigan, where pasties are in plentiful supply. These are not the little sparkly cups that strippers wear over their nipples. These are the real deal. But...being a teenage boy, I was a bit more familiar with the former than the latter. And seeing as how they seem to be all over the place in Michigan. Well, let's just say Mom was amused at my lack of knowledge on the subject.

A lot.

Enough that she thought she'd be funny and buy a pair of stripper pasties and wrap them up for a gag Christmas gift for me that year.

So funny, right? 

Yeah, not so much. Especially when you get a pair of tassels from your future mother-in-law. 

FAIL. EPIC FAIL.

But what doesn't fail in any way shape or form is the food at Pie Boss. This was a bit of a hike for us, but turned out being worth every mile put on the old SUV. There's no easy way to get to Aurora from Willow Springs. Trust me, I've tried all of them. You just have to suck it up and deal with the fact that you're going to be in the car a lot longer than you want to be. 

So to reward ourselves for the long long car ride, we stuffed ourselves with flaky deliciousness upon arriving at Pie Boss. 

Cheeseburger Pie, Chicken & Mushroom, a sausage roll and the aforementioned pasty were all on the menu. And like another reviewer stated, one item is definitely enough to satisfy a person. We were being gluttonous pigs, but the leftovers filled us up for the rest of the day, so that was good. 

Everything was surrounded by the most buttery delicious flaky crust you've ever had. Perfectly golden brown, this is that fall food you know you've been craving. And with colder days in our future, this will really fill you up. Grab some frozen ones to take home while you're there.

The fillings were all seasoned very well, and everything tasted very fresh and perfectly cooked. No frozen carrots & peas like you find in a lot of pot pies. The sauces were rich and satisfying as well. 

The gentleman behind the counter mentioned that everything is prepared by hand; even the cheeseburger is grilled before being put into the pie. 

Five stars here, people. Make plans to try this because you will leave happy. I guarantee it.

Pie Boss is awesome! 

Aurora and the western suburbs are lucky to have Pie Boss, which serves up South African savory pies. Where else are you going to get South African savory pies anywhere around here? Also, Pie Boss's are amazing. I love the spicy lamb, spicy vegetable, and peri peri chicken, but I can't imagine making a bad choice in pies from the Pie Boss. Hurry on over, get some hot pies, take some frozen ones home. They're amazing. 

I'd go more often than I do, but I have a celiac kid and she can't eat this, and I'm not mean enough to eat it in front of her.

Ordered the peppered steak pot pie  after week of 100% organic juice dieting...NO SOLID...just juice...ordered this to reward myself....It wasn't super fresh since the pies are pre-made and stored underneath some kind of heated glass compartment....BUT IT WAS GREAT....Crust was  little bit too thick and dry for my taste but the filling was GREAT......VERY SMALL POT PIE FOR 5.99....not even six inches wide....its about 4 and half inches....Don't be fooled by the pics on yelp....its much smaller...much much smaller in the physical....their desert pies are incredibly small....about 2.5 inches wide for $1.50....I also ordered a regular can sprite soda...MY TOTAL WAS over 10$...COULDN'T BELIEVE IT...I could have ordered a large beef fried rice and a specialty sauce with meat for about 13$ to last me last me lunch and dinner or gotten a big ass subway sandwich and a jumbo sized fountain drink for the same price or less...$6 for a pie sitting in a heater for God knows how long is robbery.....It was really hot inside the store....It was about 15 degrees outside but it felt like a sauna inside....GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE....My cashier had a sexy south African accent and he looked like a cross between native Indian American, an indian from india with a dash of African American....very beautiful unique looking individual....beautiful man....Good service....hot cashier...good food....not a fresh as I thought it would be but still great....This place was a winner besides the sauna temp and overpriced pies...but that won't prevent me from going back again....I'll be going back next week after juicing for another 6 days....They would make way more money if they changed their location....Its too hidden....A place like this should be in downtown naperville....not in Aurora....Who the FCK opens a business in Aurora instead of Naperville?....I shall return to update my review....

This place is great!  I just wish it was closer, I'd definitely be a regular.

We tried the chicken & mushroom pie, the sausage roll, and the steak pasty, while we were there.  Each was terrific.  They were all loaded with well seasoned fillings which were moist and flavorful.  The owner told me that the meat in the sausage roll was 90% lean, which is amazing because it stayed so moist and flavorful.  All of the pies/pasties shared the same buttery flaky crust that is made on a daily basis!

The owner Ty was as nice as could be, and he explained all of the available pies that were ready to eat, as well as frozen pies to heat at home.  We bought 4 pies to take home!

This will be a regular stop anytime we go to the outlet mall in Aurora!

When I was driving down Montgomery and saw the sign for Pie Boss, I thought it was a new pizza place.  I checked Yelp and was surprised to see this was a meat pie restaurant.  I decided to go in and I tried the spicy chicken pie and the sausage roll.  The crust was flaky and the meat was well seasoned and flavorful.  I like this place because it was something different.  They offer a good variety and it's priced where I would come back to try something new.

Four stars for the pies; weak three for service. This is essentially a take-out place that happens to have two small tables for people who can't wait until they get home to eat these flaky-crusted savory treats. There are one or two people baking and taking orders and rather than greeting customers they seem a little puzzled about why you are there.

The pies are baked fresh. The top crust puffs up in layers that melt in your mouth. Unless you visit when they have pies ready, be prepared to wait. You can also phone in orders ahead for pick-up. The day we visited they were out of spinach-feta and sausage rolls. We tried the chicken-mushroom -- good. The spicy vegetable was excellent and so was the pasty. We took home several frozen pies and they are every bit as good baked later.
Their food is very unique. After eating their "pot pies" its hard to get one from anyone else. You have to try their mini-desserts. My favorite pie is the spicy chicken.

Customer service goes a long way for me. Long way. I was impressed from the moment I called to place my order to when I had the order that I placed dancing around my taste buds. Super friendly service... and their pies are orgasim in your mouth delicious. 

Yesterday was my first time eating  food from here and guess what!!! It was so good that I'm having my girlfriend pick up some more today so I can have more for dinner. So happy my gf lives about a mile from this place ....I live over 50 miles! Yaay for me. 

So yesterday we literally ordered almost everything on the menu. We also had some frozen so we can experience what it's like to bake at home. We got the spinach and feta as well as the samosa frozen. We baked both for dinner and they were so scrumptious ... The filling along with the buttery crust made for a heavenly marriage. No joke. 

We ordered the cheeseburger, mushroom and chicken pies, and the sausage roll fresh. My tummy is pleading  for more as I type this. You can't go wrong with either. Trust me. Please trust me. 

It's such good food and for the price why wouldn't you go? It's way more of a better option than any fast food drive thru establishment.  

Go try it. I'm pretty sure you'll love it.. And if you don't, call me and I'll HAPPILY eat your pie. Mmmmm
Worth the trip! Great food and first if it's kind in the area. Would highly recommend

This place is very good. The crust on their pie are super flaky. The only hnag up and this is not necessarily their fault be we had no idea it takes 30-45 min to make one of their pies. luckily they had a few already made that they just heated up. All in all a good place for food.

I ate at Pie Boss over the weekend, and I gotta say that I am craving it now.

This place is amazing. 

Think more pot pie then desert pie.

I had a cheeseburger pie and was very impressed.  It was more like a meatloaf pot pie with cheese... Probably doesn't sound good but really is.

And, I had a sausage roll which could have been a meal all in itself.  It was so tasty that I am starting to salivate as I am writing this.

Then for desert I had a little Custard pie, which was to die for.

Awesome place.  Unlike anything else in the area.  Although, I should be watching my carbs but this place calls out to me at night while I am sleeping.

You have to go here, like now!
This place is awesome, first tome coming in and I can smell the best pies ever!! I love this place, especially the beef pasty
Great place to try and visit again,  seemed a bit pricy. Good experience. Will try again.

Food was incredible.  Hott, tasty, flaky crust.  Best sausage roll I've had outside of the south side of Chicago.  Met the owner, very friendly.
Pies for all ages, my two year old inhaled the cheeseburger pie.  
I will definitely be back!

Thanks for another winner, Yelp! :9

AFAIK, there's only one place around that recycles #6 styrofoam -- the Dart Container facility in North Aurora. I don't live nearby, so when we have enough styrofoam to take a trip over there, we usually like to look up somewhere that looks good for lunch. (45 minute - 1 hour drive, yo.)

I...just...where do I begin? The reviews made it seem like this place was completely up my street. I'm happy enough when someone does good homemade pastries, but I'm even happier when I get to try new foods that I haven't tried before. And who doesn't love a good savory pie? Also, SAUSAGE ROLLS. :9

I knew from Yelp that you could call and order ahead of time to get exactly what you want...but how could I know what I wanted without having previously been there? Instead, I decided to just stop in after dropping off my recycling, and trust whatever they had freshly baked in their case. 

One of the owners and chefs, Tyrell Naidoo, greeted me warmly and told me about their pies. He also told me that they have two new pies that aren't on their menu yet: spicy steak and spicy lamb. He explained that they're both in a South African curry that's very traditional to Durban, the city in South Africa from whence these two wonderful restauranteurs came. I asked which was his favorite, and he immediately told me the spicy lamb. I took his advice and had one of those and a sausage roll (hey, I was starving). 

The sausage roll is light, flaky, and flavorful. Very good. But that spicy lamb pie? That, my friend, is the stuff that dreams are made of. Delicious curry dreams. So much depth. Such tender chunks of lamb that almost melt in your mouth. The chef informed me that they use only leg of lamb in their pies, because the quality of the meat is so much nicer. He also told me that they make their own pastry, but I already knew that part. 

Once you taste one of their pies, you'll have no idea how you survived so long without trying one. You'll also never eat a terrible frozen pot pie from the grocery store again (at least, not without weeping and wondering why you didn't just go to Pie Boss and have something a million times better instead). They also sell their pies frozen, so you can bake them at home and have one fresh anytime. I brought home a chicken and mushroom pie, a steak pie, a sausage roll, and one of each of the dessert tarts (apple crumble and milk custard) to share with my SO, since we don't get over to Aurora very often. I'll update my review once we've tried those. 

Oh, and the chef started telling me about how they sometimes offer bunny chow -- a Durban specialty consisting of that same delightful lamb curry that was in my pie, only served inside a homemade loaf of bread, like a bread bowl. They make their bread there, like everything else, because they weren't satisfied with anyone else's bread. If you follow them on Facebook, you can find out when they're offering bunny chow as a special. (I did ask why it's called "bunny chow," since there's no way my two bunnies would ever touch lamb. The chef said he wasn't sure; it's just always been called that. I definitely want to try it, though!)

I do also want to try the veggie pies. But there are only so many pies I can fit in a day, Pie Boss. I'll be back. Oh yes, I'll be back. As I told the owners, I'm not sure if it's a good or bad thing that I don't live closer. I'm going to say it's a good thing, since I'd probably eat far too many pies if I did live closer. :O They may be individually sized, but there is still such a thing as too much pie, lol.

Take a look at their menu, call in with your order 30 minutes before you get there, and be ready to be warmly welcomed with great staff and delicious savory pies.

My only complaint is that the pies weren't as large as I was hoping. Then again, I basically inhaled mine for lunch so if I slowed down and ate it like a normal person, I would have been okay. I can be somewhat of a snob with pie crusts but Pie Boss' is tasty with good texture, despite just sitting under a heat lamp for a while, which makes me wonder how much more delicious it would have been if I gotten it baked fresh.

I took my pepper steak pie to my car dealership and ate it in the waiting area while my car got some work done. Everyone else present was made jealous. It was so obvious.

After reading the review in Trib local we decided to give it a try. Didn't know what I was missing until after my first bite of the spicy lamb pie! WOW! Incredibly delicious! I savored every bite! Due to ordering with co workers, I got to try a bite of each dessert pie. Fantastic! My favorite was the custard! Quite an incredibly delicious take on lunch! Will definitely return. The price can't be beat for these delicious pies!

The place looks small but has the most awesome pies. We ordered the spicy chicken and the lamb pie .. The chicken pie was good but the lamb pie was the best .The custard was nice as well !

Though they have limited menu but still worth it .

Recommended: lamb pie (its not on the menu so you need to ask for it )
Super friendly couple, delicious flaky crust, loved it! Will be back to try the dessert on Saturday :)

So I was not into PIE very much, until I found this place! It has the best pies, no matter which one you pick, they are all so yummy! You just wanna keep eating without stop! The deserts are also very good!

This place is excellent! The pies are delicious and they have a nice range of choices, from basic comfort food (chicken pot pie) to spicy chicken to vegetarian and even a few dessert pies. I stopped here from lunch, which was a nice change of pace from the usual sandwich lunch spots.

SO GOOD. We had the peppersteak, spicy chicken and cheeseburger pies, and sausage rolls. All were delicious, the crust was incredible! I probably wouldn't order the cheeseburger again as it was just a little strange (burger patty, american cheese and ketchup inside the pie crust...). We also bought one of each of the dessert tarts, and they were positively scrumptious. We will definitely be back!

I think I got turned on to Pie Boss from a recent Yelp mailing, and then promptly forgot about it. Good thing someone suggested we try it recently, or it might have stayed forgotten. Four of us descended on Pie Boss for a Saturday lunch, and we tried...I think most things on the menu. The pies all have an amazing flaky crust, just outstanding, and they're pretty well filled with all sort of stuff. I think the only things we didn't have were the cheeseburger (which I say sounds good) and the beef pastie.

Particular highlights are the spicy vegetable and the chicken and mushroom. The spicy chicken is also good - I think if they combined the spicy chicken and spicy vegetable, that would be the only thing I'd ever order. When they say spicy, what they mean is a sort of traditional Indian flavored curry, and it's delicious. My pepper steak was good as well, with lots of good black pepper flavor. Their dessert - apple crumble and custard pies - are good, but not really remarkable. I would say I could probably eat...about one and a half pies? Maybe one and a third? So one might leave you a bit hungry, depending, but I think two would leave you stuffed.

Of note, unless they have them baked, you can wait 20-30 minutes for a pie to be cooked. I would say it's worth it, but if not, they look to keep a small stock of things warm for immediate service. But, in another twist I hadn't thought of, you can also take away frozen pies, which is kind of cool. Might be a good thing to keep in the freezer. I need to keep this on my list as a good change from the normal stuff.

Love you yelp. My husband was foraging in the hood and found this place thanks to yelp. If you love Swansons, no make that Marie callender pot pies, you are never going back once you have these pies. Omg, the flakiest crusts ever.  They have peri peri chicken, chicken and mushroom, pepper steak and many more kinds. Plus they have these things called foldovers, which is like a hot pocket but much much better. Oy, we couldn't eat enough. We bought some frozen to take home.
Great chicken and mushroom and cheeseburger pot pie but the lamb had an almost funky taste. Will deffinetly be going back!

If I had to sum up my experience in one word, it would be: disappointment.

When we found out about this place, we got really excited. My grandma, who is from the UP, thought maybe we won't have to make pasties anymore.

Wrong.

The steak pasty was unlike any other pasty I had ever met the acquaintance of. Peas, corn, gravy - especially inside the crust? All cardinal sins of pasty making.

We also had a cheeseburger pie, and we were all very confused at the fact that the slice of what appeared to be Kraft American cheese had not melted, despite being warm. It's an anomaly. 

I'm giving two stars for the crust alone. It's usually the hardest thing to perfect, and yet it's the only thing this place got right.

I give Pie Boss five stars since it is the only one of its kind in the area/anywhere else I have ever heard of. I mean, who thinks to themselves "Hey, let's go open a place that only serves Pot Pie!" Then when you ask, do you have Cherry Pie??? They say No, we have Lamb?!?!?!  

So, anyway, they serve "POT" Pie (I guess you couldn't add the "pot" to the name, people might confuse us with Colorado). More so, they serve really good Pot pie! I got an off menu pie with lamb and it had great intense flavor! 

They have some other things too, but I'm not sure why you would get something other than Pie. 

They had some ready when I walked in, but I hear its good to phone in your order 30min b4. 

Staff (all 1 of them) were cool and happy to talk you through the menu.

Oh, one more thing.... This place is cheap for the amount of food you get, 5ish for just about everything on the menu!!! Sweet(er...Savory)!!!!!!
Stopped by on my way home.  1st visit, and I'll be back! I took 5 pies home, 2 sausage rolls and 2 apple crumbles.  All very good.  The best part is the crust.  Thank you!

If you grew up with SWANSON Pot Pies, these are not them. But hen you see these, they'll bring back Happy Memories. These pies are larger, but back when we were growing up SWANSON looked big. 

That said a good friend of mine told me to try this place. I bought two Chicken & Mushroom, a Spinach with Feta. These were AWESOME. ate for dinner when I got home. t the last minute I bought a Sausage Roll, this I ate on the way home. I was told they make there own sausage, now most of us know, it can be spicy and greasy. The sausage was perfect favor, for me it could have used a little ketchup. But other than that it was very good.

Can't wait to try the Pepper Steak Pot Pie as I hear it's there best seller.
I think this place is a perfect place to stop and get dinner as a Surprise for your love ones at home.

Yes, we're still loving Pie Boss pies. I've got 10 more frozen pies in my freezer (6 spinach and feta, 3 beef pasty, 1 sausage), waiting to be liberated from their chilly slumber, and tossed down the family gullet. (That didn't come out quite right, but whatever.)  So yeah, instead of a side of beef in my freezer, I've got South African hand pies. Because that's how we roll in Des Plaines - "City of Destiny."

So go eat your's fresh out of the display case. There's not a lot of ambiance in the dining area, so your car will also do nicely. Unless you really love large maps of the world and enjoy talking to people from other countries (which I do).  

My favorite way to eat the pies is tucked into a napkin by hand. They are not like those weak mostly liquidy pot pies you're used to. So don't be afraid of them pouring out all over your lap. These are hearty dense pies built by a couple brothers, and suitable for a man's appetite (after doing hearty man-work, like logging or telephone pole tossing or polishing your rims). 

You'll want to eat two, maybe three (if your rims were particularly dirty). Your dainty lady-friend will claim she only wants to try 1/2 of one with a house salad. Try not to smirk and roll your eyes, because everyone knows they don't sell salads! Because, what's the point of a salad, when you can bake veggies into a savory pie? Buy her 2-3 varieties, so you get the extras. That's called tactical dining.  You're welcome.

If you're a lady who can relate to said tactical dining, hoorah! And please adjust above genders according to your personal predilections.

If you're a man and a huge fan of crisp vegetables, not cooked into pie form...just stop OK? Cause I don't want you reading this review anymore.

My wife and I found this place via Yelp while waiting for an appointment at Rush Copley. The food is fantastic. We loved both the peri pie and the spicy chicken pie we ordered. Also, the staff is very nice and friendly. I highly recommend coming here. Remember to call ahead!

This place is incredible.  I was turned on to this joint because of everything I read here on yelp.  The hype is justified.  This place is one in a million.  The pies are unbelievable.  You really have to get in there and try them for yourself.  I am a fan of the Pepper Steak and also the Spicy Chicken....they taste great!  Follow their Facebook site for other unique options like the spicy lamb or bunny chow.  They only prepare those meals on special occasions.  
Pies taste great....thats the bottom line.  Fresh ingredients...its almost as if it is homemade!  Go check this place out for sure!  My friends told me I'd be addicted to it and I AM!

Amazing pies!! These put Grandma's pies to shame!  So far I have tried 4 different pies (pepper steak being my fave ) cannot wait to try the others! 
I've never had good like this the crust was buttery & flakey & the fillings are all seasoned to perfection! You can tell the owners put their heart & soul into it

Wow! We had the spicy vegetable pie and the chicken mushroom pie. The crust is super flaky and buttery. 

Next up, melktert!

Really enjoyable pies! Went yesterday and stocked up on a lot of pies based only on Yelp reviews, and so glad I did!  Had the spicy chicken and spicy beef so far and they were really good!!!  Anxious to try them all!

I drove by this place for a few weeks.  There is a really weird looking sign of a chef in the window and I just assumed it was a bakery.  A friend told me that it was a South African place and the next opportunity I had I stopped in.

The place used to be a BBQ place and a Middle Eastern joint, and was pretty smokey and nasty inside.  Now it is all cleaned up and super bright and nice.  They took some of the big counters away and really opened it up.  I didn't know what to expect so I picked up a few of the ready made pies.  The owner said to call ahead 35 min and they will bake them fresh next time.

I had a cheeseburger pie.  I had to try it and it is literally a cheeseburger baked into a pie.  It was pretty good.  The crust was buttery and crispy. 

The next pie we tried was a spicy chicken.  This was pretty spicy.  The taste is pretty mild and the spice creeps up and lingers.  Really good.  

Then I got a sausage roll. It was a mild beef sausage inside of a pastry.  Like a giant pig in a blanket.

I love different places in the community.  I think this place was pretty cool.  The menu is short but I want to try the peppersteak one next.  I would stop by and check it out, but don't expect apple pies.  I think they need to put a flag in the window or explain what they do a lot better.

I looove savory pies so I was extremely excited to learn of this place. Oh, it was so fantastic. We called 30 minutes beforehand and the pies were ready maybe 3 minutes after we arrived. I tried both their veggie pies, the spinach feta and the spicy curry veg. I loved both, but the curry in particular was absolutely everything I could ever hope for. Amazingly flavorful curry that perfectly matched the obscenely buttery, flaky crust. It was addicting. I don't know if I could stop myself if a row of these pies was placed before me. My partner enjoyed his beef pasty and especially loved the sausage roll. We both enjoyed the little dessert pastries.

Very friendly service and easy to talk to on the phone. I always appreciate it when small shops like this post a nice clear menu on their website.

I just wish it wasn't so far away in this barren-looking strip mall next to a corn field. I feel like they would do better in downtown Naperville with traffic from the school and shoppers looking for something non-chain. Either way, I really, really, really hope they succeed.

Will be back soon. Bringing the whole fam with me next time!

Stop reading these reviews and go already! 

You absolutely have to come here for amazingly delicious homemade pies. I have tried almost all the pies on the menu, they are all so good! So far the pepper steak is my absolute favorite, it's very... And I mean VERY savory *drool*. The pasty they have is also really delicious! 

The food is very filling, I'm a small person so one pie is more than enough to satisfy me. If you are a bigger person or just have a big appetite, a pie and a sausage roll or pasty should be enough to fill you up! Also, I always make sure to get their custard for desert for a little over $1! It's so creamy, milky, and lightly sweet. Yums!

I read a few reviews on here that complain about the price being too high. Honestly, the price is just right for a freshly made homemade savory pie that will make you come back again... And again. Seriously, I keep coming back. These pies will rock your socks!

Was living in the city before...I was pretty spoiled by the abundance of Chinese places I could order from. Review is based purely on pick-up and delivery orders.

At least I have 1 reliable place that seems to have pretty decent staples...more importantly, for smoothies that they will DELIVER to you. If you're curious, the cup of smoothie is delivered in a small brown paper bag. Dunno what they do if you order more than one. If you do pick-up order, they'll make it when you arrive (unless you request otherwise, I assume). As you watch them make it, you can also be really confused & surprised that the interior is actually really nice.

Food I've tried so far:
One of their egg foo youngs: It's not bad. It's ordered for family members, so...yeah. It's not any different from any other places, really.
Orange chicken: It's actually slight hot/has "heat", opposed to straight up sweetness. It's still too sweet for my tastes, though.
Sesame chicken: Would 100% order again always. The sauce stays on the bottom of the container, so definitely spoon some on top when getting your food.
Chicken & Mango Fried Rice: Thumbs down. :( I was thinking it'd be a typical brown soy-saucey fried rice with chicken & mango. Nope. It's some sort of seasoned fried rice with chicken & mango. The rice & chicken are great, but the fresh ripe mango they use in it really has no place.
Veggie Lo Mein: Your standard lo mein. Their veggie lo mein has a LOT of mushrooms in it, not too much onions.
Crab rangoon: Wonderfully stuffed with the cream mixture and are delicious.

Delivery is also pretty quick. I order via Grubhub usually - always gets here in 20 mins flat. Maybe a full 30 minutes if I ordered during a peak time, like dinner or something.

Food is good but when we ordered delivery it took over 2 hours for them to deliver.   They tried to first tell us it was traffic but we only live about 12 minutes away,  approx. 6.8 miles.
Apparently they are under new ownership and no one there speaks English. 
Food was cold..noodles were supposed to be crispy but was like spaghetti because they absorbed all the sauce.
We were very patient with them but they showed no sympathy for the fact they messed up. 
Sorry to say i will never order from here again.

Food wasnt bad. Ordered a small plain fried rice & an order crab ragoon.
But got food poisoning from this place !

Ordered General Tso's chicken, Sesame chicken, and chicken fried rice. They were all very good. The fried rice had a little too much soy sauce, but it may have just been enough not to add more soy sauce. It was tasty, no matter what.

The delivery time was very reasonable at about 20 to 30 minutes, as was the price. I will be trying more dishes from this restaurant.

We have a tradition when we move to a new place - always order Chinese food the first night we move in. We moved from downtown Chicago where there are a million wonderful Chinese restaurants that delivered to us. We were a bit nervous because we don't always have the best luck finding a new place right away. We've lived here 3 weeks and already ordered from here twice! We LOVE it! Everything we've gotten has been wonderful. 
The reason I deducted a star: there is no small regular wonton soup and no fully steamed pot stickers. Those are two Chinese staples in my eyes.

My boyfriend and I just ordered for delivery for the first time! Wow!!!!! Everything we got was still steaming hot when it was delivered! We got the following dishes: 


BBQ pork fried rice : tasted great, my boyfriend needed a little more soy sauce but for me it was just right

Mongolian beef: best Mongolian we've had from a Chinese place!!!! The vegetables tasted fresh not frozen the beef tasted fresh! My favorite so far, it also did have a little spice factor to it which we enjoyed!!!

General Taos chicken: also great! The sauce sits at the bottom so make sure to stir well! Had great flavor chicken tasted fresh!

Chicken with black bean sauce: my favorite !!!!!! Such fresh, crunchy vegetables!!!! And the sauce and chicken were amazing!!!



Overall, this Chinese restaurant has been one of the best we have tried! We've never received this many food for the price and not to mention the freshness! Will definitely order again and recommend!!

While a certain other popular restaurant is taking its sweet time reopening in Naperville, we've been forced to look elsewhere for our bubble tea. I'm pleased to say, we've finally found the next best in the area! I recommend the mango tapioca. 

Oh yea, their food is alright, too.

Just kidding! We had Mongolian chicken, which we ordered extra spicy, and it was perfect. Crab Rangoon was pretty bland, so I'd skip that next time. Same with the barbecue pork. I think I was expecting Filipino style barbecue pork, so was obviously disappointed with the chewy red mess they served, but that's my fault for having my porks confused. I think I read that their chicken fried rice is delightful, so I will add that onto my list of dishes to try next time I need my tapioca smoothie.

I ordered food through grub hub Saturday night at 6:23. My delivery time was 7:26-7:36. My food didn't arrive until  8:08, more than 30 minutes late and very cold. I called the restaurant and they apologized but didn't offer anything. I said that I would need a refund as they were way outside the delivery time, I was very hungry and everything had to be microwaved. They offered a credit for the next visit and would not give me a refund. I called grub hub, who was very kind and said that they would give me a refund if the restaurant did not. The restaurant refused and grub hub kindly refunded me and gave me wonderful customer service. On to the food: the taro bubble tea tasted as it should. The chicken lo mein was flavorless. I had never had this low of quality at an Asian buffet. There was no seasoning, it was like eating plain spaghetti noodles with my chicken. The shrimp wonton soup base was in a separate container from the wontons. The base was intolerably salty. The wontons were all mushed together with two random thin noodles that didn't belong. There was almost no shrimp in them even though they cost more than other varieties of wontons. The cold boring food and customer service from the restaurant was a huge disappointment. I would have been even more upset if I had accepted the credit as I never want to eat food from here again. I have had so much Asian food and have never had anything so subpar.

Great food, fast service, clean facility. 

Easy to order online; even has name slots for each item ordered which is very useful when ordering fit a group.

Their chicken is delicious. Many Asian restaurants I have ordered chicken at scared me enough not to go back, not an issue here.

Everything was literally perfect.

I stopped by here because i couldn't find another restaurant I was looking for. I saw their lunch special posted outside so I decided to give it a try. The place was very bare. There weren't any decorations- jut tables and chairs. I wonder if this is a new restaurant.

I ordered the Szechuan shrimp and it was a big portion. I ate half of it and left the other half for dinner. I thought the flavor was alright. It was a little bland for my taste buds. However, it was a very good deal.

I ordered a vegetarian lo mein and a honeydew melon smoothie with tapioca yesterday afternoon. I had asked for the low mein to have light oil and what I received was the exact opposite. The noodles were soaked in oil and soy sauce. It was terrible. The saving grace was the honeydew melon smoothie. Would visit again just for that maybe.

Dishes were tasty and delivery was fast.

BBQ Pork Fried rice 5 stars
Salt and Pepper Pork-5 stars
Salt and Pepper Tofu-4 stars
Good food. I wish they have Chinese  carp fish in sauce. Really like Wong tong noodle soup and bento box.and fresh snoozy .

This was my go to Chinese place for the past 6 months. The always empty dining room kinda threw me off the first few times. The food is really good. But we made the mistake of eating there last night. I had 1 serving of my noodles and of course asked for the rest of it to be wrapped up (yay lunch tomorrow), they brought our food into the kitchen to wrap it up. Which I'm not a huge fan of, but ok. When they brought it back out, most of it had disappeared. When I asked the waitress what happened to the rest of it, she said that was all that was left. I told her no, there was a lot left it wouldn't have fit in the tiny little box they gave me. She continued to argue and then walked away. Only time someone came back was to get our money. 

No we are sorry we dropped it or ran out of bigger boxes nothing. This really is a shame as the food is good and this place is less than 5 minutes away. Time to find another place.

We walked in and ordered for carry out.  Our 4-star rating is based on:
Sweet and Sour chicken - 4 stars
braised noodles with vegetables - 4 star. 
vegetable fried rice- 5 star
egg rolls - 3 star because it was not a typical American-style egg roll. It should have been listed as a Spring roll.
Restaurant dining room cleanliness - 5 stars
Friendliness of staff - 5 stars
The wait time for our food to be prepared - 5 stars

It is probably the best Chinese food restaurant near our house so we will eat here again.

Sesame chicken - yummy
Kung pao chicken - just ok
Garlic chicken - blah

I'd like to try a few more dishes but this place is pretty decent and cheap. Plus it's really close!

Attended a party at China Chef. First time and hopefully not our last. Great venue for a party or just to stop in for take out or dine in. Flavor was good, we enjoyed several dishes and had food to take home. They also have fruit smoothies and the staff is pleasant and attentive. Cute little spot for good Chinese food.

The chef in China Chef definitely knows how to throw down on some good Chinese food.  

I was in the area & was looking for a good Chinese restaurant that was close so I pulled out my trusted Yelp App & found this place.  This place was definitely a good find.  It is in a little strip mall next to a Subway.  The parking lot is a decent size but the parking right of front next to the door can be full at times.  

I was surprised when I walked inside at how big it was & how many tables they had.  It was very spacious & the tables were spaced about with lots of room.  I came around lunch time.  I ordered a Mongolian beef & it came with fried rice & a soup.  For my soup I had the choice of egg drop or hot & sour.  I went with the hot & sour & it was very good.  Some places taste a little bit too sour but this place was more on the hot side which I liked a lot.  

After about ten minutes the Mongolian beef came out.  It was piping hot which was a big plus & you could tell it was brought to the table promptly after it was finished cooking.  The portion was a good size & the food was delicious.  The fried rice that came with the food was also very good.  

The service here was very good & the people who were running the place were also very nice.  I decided to come here again & the second experience was just as good.  

Overall the food was delicious & the service was very good.  I would definitely eat here again if I was in the area.

It was really random that I ended up going here. I was watching a show that had Chinese food on it and then had a craving for it. Looked on yelp what was around, and this was the best rated one. Never heard of it and realized that it was very new, just about a week open when I went there on a Sunday afternoon. I'd give this play 4 stars for the food which I'll explain later, but bumped it up to 5 because of our waitress.

Doesn't look like a traditional Chinese restaurant, but it's such a big open room, not sure what else they could do with it. For the food, we got dumplings, egg drop soup, Mongolian beef, and shrimp fried rice. Dumplings were alright, different style than other traditional places. The small egg drop soup is a great deal for the price. A small was big enough for 2 people. The Mongolian beef was pretty good and same with the shrimp friend rice. Made for a good leftover meal later on that day too.

Our waitress was really nice, and tea is free too. She even wondered if we didn't like the food since we had so much left over but really, we just don't eat a lot. So that's really nice on her part. Got some coupons for next time that she gave us too.
Got general tso chicken and 2 eggrolls. Food is good serving size is good eggrolls are small for the price. Total was 11.37 was ready very fast for pickup and was burning hot , will def return

I've ordered twice from them. Once it was delivery, the second time was carry out. The day we ordered delivery we were told 30 min but it actually was delivered in 15. Only complaint was that the person taking the order did not speak english very well. My bf had to repeat the order and address many times until she got it right.  Well we ordered a beef and scallop dish and we got the dish we ordered minus the scallops. She placed the wrong order.  It wasnt a big deal since the dish was very good and had a nice spice  to it.  We also ordered beef fried rice that was very good and not greasy like others I've tasted.  The best part of the meal was my melon soothie. It was delicious!  Sweet, refreshing and yummy! 
Second time we ordered carry out. I ordered beef lo mein and my bf got the chicken szechwan and he ordered it very spicy, very spicy it was.  He was extremely happy with it, the portion was huge and the price decent. My dish was good, I loved the noodles. We are very happy with this place. We will make this a regular spot for us.
Food was great, customer service was less than mediocre today.

Today was our first time ordering carry-out from China Chef. We typically order from Lom Lings in Lombard or Jins and China Ho in Winfield, but China Chef is geographically closer so we figured let's give it a shot. We were very glad we did. From time of order to food bagged and ready to go was 11 minutes.  We ordered 3 basic, chinese restaurant staples: Mongolian Beef, Shrimp in Lobster Sauce and General Tso's Chicken.

Mongolian Beef: Flavorful with a bit of heat, nice sized portion and not drowning in gravy like other places treat this dish.

Shrimp in Lobster Sauce: First, I give them props for not skimping on the Shrimp and unlike the Mongolian Beef, they went heavy with this awesome egg, lobster and bean sauce which was very tasty. 

General Tso's Chicken: Where's the breading? A lot of places put a heavy batter on their chicken so the ratio of bread to chicken is 2:1.. NOT here.. They again served a good sized portion of lightly battered chicken and veggies for flavor. They didn't  over douse the chicken in sauce either. It was just the right amount.

My opinion, so far much better than all the surrounding Chinese take-out. This is a place you should try. Next time we'll try delivery and 4 new dishes...
Excellent tasting Chinese food.  Beyond the typical Chinese that a lot of times all tastes the same. Had the mango and chicken fried rice and Garlic chicken.  Both excellent.

Consistently above average Chinese food. I love that I can get kiwi bubble tea delivered to my house and the sweet & sour chicken is by far the best in the area. My roommate loves the fried tofu and pork fried rice though there is milk in some of the sauces (she's allergic) so if you're vegan you might want to tread carefully. That's not their fault though, lol, so not deducting any stars for that. Four stars because it's not the best Chinese delivery I've ever had, but it's definitely the best in the area and I will continue to order from them.

Experience: I ordered delivery and received my food within 30 minutes. The host was friendly and helpful to make sure that my order was correct.
I didn't see an online menu so I just ordered typical Chinese dishes.

Food: Sweet and Sour Chicken was lightly crispy on the outside, tender and surprisingly juicy inside. Typical Sweet and Sour sauce. 
The egg roll was more like a spring roll and lightly crispy on the outside, I think they come in vegetable only. Delicious!
Chicken Fried Rice was good not great.
Vegetable Chop Suey was also notable.

I will definitely be ordering from here again.

I got an order for delivery. The food showed up early, and very hot!! Everything tasted amazing and the delivery driver was nice. Would definitely order again!

Ps: The mango smoothie is outstanding! It tasted very fresh.

This place is great!! My family likes to eat out after church on Sunday and we love Chinese food. Wanting to try a new restaurant, I searched Chinese here on Yelp. The reviews were great, and we decided to give it a try. The reviews were correct. The portions are HUGE. The staff is so so friendly. And the food is amazing!!!!! I think we found our new regular Sunday afternoon spot. I ordered the vegetable tofu bento box with lo mein and crab rangoons. 

I didn't order a smoothie but they looked so so good. I already know what I'm going to order next week!

Walked into the restaurant and it was an awkward vibe. No other customers were there. Just 2 Asians on their laptop. The food was terrible. I was questioning how it was made and what I was actually eating. The service was terrible!! Omg. Words can't describe accurately. Felt like they were talking shit in Chinese the whole time.. There were TVs on the wall but nothing playing.... No wonder why there was no one in there.

This place is good and was fast, would definitely come back. I ordered chicken fried rice and Mongolian chicken. You can't go wrong with any Chinese restaurant that has chili oil. Next time I would like to see if they have Hong Kong style fried rice.

Hit or miss......sometimes this place is great and I love the food! But then I get misses like my last pick up, and probably my last meal here. The fried egg rolls were fine as usual, but the pan fried dumplings (my favorite from here)were almost raw :(. The pinapple and chicken fried rice was blane. My boyfriend asked if I ordered white rice. I did order late, and I understand kitchens close early sometimes, but tell me your closed! Please don't give my blane, undercooked food.

No stars for the new management with gross food and horrible service.
They bought the brand but didn't the quality of previous owners. Nothing was consistent with the menu either. By far, the worst experience you'll ever have my fellow yelpers. The server couldn't even explain the menu. The potstickers weren't fresh and the fried rice was steamed and unlike anything I ever seen eating Chinese food for 30 years. Save your money and avoid the aggravation. Go somewhere else.
The vegetable lo mein is very good.  Tried this place a few weeks ago because our current favorite Chinese restaurant is just a tad bit too far.  We will be back for sure!

Decided to order lunch from here as it's the only Chinese restaurant which delivers near me. Ordered the crab Rangoon and chicken fried rice. Rangoon had an old mixture inside, wasn't very keen on it. The fried rice was completely bland. Won't be returning here.

im seriously obsessed with their fried rice, especially the bbq pork. hubby really the taste of their general tsos and their very precise about the level of spiciness that is requested. very plump and tasty egg rolls. i like their crab rangoon because they've managed to make the ratio of the filling just right. not a lot of chinese places do that. when we order for delivery, theyll give us a time frame of 30-40 min, but we've learned to expect them within 20 min and the food is still hot and fresh which makes everything better  :). we've also dined in their and the restaurant has always been very clean and the service has been great. also, the won ton noodle soup is pretty good, but theres some after taste that ive never been able to figure out. its not bad!, but its just strange cuz won ton noodle soup from anywhere else generally doesnt leave an after taste. 
the reason for not giving them five stars is because of their prices. when compared to other chinese restaurants, the amount of the serving you get from here vs other places is typically the same, but china chefs prices are quite higher.
Went in to order. Food was fast and packaged well for travel. The cashew chicken was excellent. Large chunks of white meat and hand cut vegetables.

We ordered take out.  We wanted to try some place different and picked this place after reading the reviews.  We would definitely recommend and plan to make this our go to for Chinese.  The food was excellent.  I had the Orange chicken and my husband had Mongolian Beef.  Both were very good.  We also had an order of egg rolls which were also quite good.  My daughter had a strawberry smoothie and loved it.  We've had Chinese in the past which has been greasy and heavy and we've questioned the ingredients.  Everything was fresh and tasty.   Can't wait to try something new next time!

We had the food delivered from this place. The chicken was very fresh and lean. The egg rolls weren't the best. I would say they were more like a spring roll. The fried rice and bbq pork was decent as well. Well prolly order from here again. Delivery was quick and food was really hot on arrival.
Authentic Chinese Food! Ever have soup at Wonton Gourmet? Well, its MUCH BETTER here! Good hot soup! Can't wait to try more of their menu!

Great Chinese food. I was in that area to attend church Sunday. My wife and I saw their lunch special posted on the window. Bbq pork noodle soup is delicious. If you love noodle soup, you got to try this place. Service is super fast. Server is very attentive and polite. Great experience. My wife and I could not wait to come again next Sunday.

***OPEN NOW!!***

We never tried from the former China Chef, but this one was hot, fresh, and delivered early! We will definitely order from them again!

The location is in Carol Stream, and we are in Glen Ellyn. This was absolutely no problem. They charged a minimal $2 fee, but it was well worth it!

My wife tried both Sesame and Orange chicken, and I tried Kung Pao chicken. Everything was great! The Orange chicken was probably my least favorite. We also had Chicken fried rice, which was cooked with fresh ingredients.

Great take out in the area! We tried it for the first time this weekend and everything we ordered was delish. The crab Rangoon was so good, and the fried rice was SO flavorful! Only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the sesame chicken, a bit sweet and the chicken was over cooked. The schezuan shrimp was so good and the veggies were definitely fresh and had a great crunch...yum! We will be regulars now and are officially ditching our old take out place!

We had takeout from here the other night and were quite satisfied. The egg rolls were just ok. Outside was nice and crunchy, not too greasy, but the flavor of the filling was not to our liking. The house fried rice was full of meat and good flavor, however the shrimp had a slightly off taste. The Szechuan chicken and Mongolian beef were both loaded with veggies, which I like but others may prefer more meat. The meat that was there however was tasty and tender. Both dishes though could have been more spicy, so we will probably ask for extra spice next time. They also came with a decent size side of white rice. The taro smoothie was excellent! Service was quick and efficient, food was ready in less than 15 mins. Prices were good and we ordered the small portions which were more than adequate. If you want leftovers though maybe get the large size. It was very easy to order online, so no mixup in translation. Overall happy to find a good place for takeout Chinese!

Read the reviews and decided to give this place a try!! SUPERB!!! Everything was so fresh-and they deliver!!!! Best beef fried rice ever and the chicken egg foo young had the whitest freshest chicken in it!! We are fans!! Prices are so good too!! This is our new Chinese takeout place!! Amazing!

So we went back for lunch two weeks later. The waitress remembered us, and politely repeated what we had ordered last time and asked if we would like the same beverages and entrees. My son was very impressed. And the food was great again!

WOW! That didn't take long for the food quality and taste to go down! The restaurant changed owners last week and I'm sad to say it's no where near the standards they had prior! The eggrolls are HORRIBLE! They are made with spring roll wrappers and had a distinct taste of curry in them! The beef fried rice tasted fishy at first and then I guess I got used to it because I tasted it less as I ate more, But I couldn't finish it. I miss the original owners and sadly will not be returning to this restaurant again! They didn't even have the crunchy chow mein noodles and their new slim menu has gotten rid of many options! I really hope the original owners open a new location! So sad!

Ordered pizza Thanksgiving night when we got to the hotel. I like the online ordering. Easy and quick. Delivery was about 40 minutes. Pizza was great! I like the peppers, dipping sauce, and crushed red pepper in the pizza box. 

It was a great second Thanksgiving feast!

TWO STARS because the pizza is actually good.

i literally ust got my delivery and I am not satisfied. They forgot my wings and when i called the store she said my wings were left at the store. So I said uh okay? when will i get it and she said probably 30 mins. MIND YOU, i had already waited over an hour so like 1 hour and 15 minutes. and now to wait another 30? the girl on the phone did not even apologize for the inconvenience. I am not usually one to complain and yeah i get it things happen people make mistakes but atleast apologize.

I've been ordering from the North Aurora location for quite some time now through my old work, and one night I decided to order from home and the Naperville location is the one that delivers to my apartment. 

Honestly, you're going to have your ups and down with pizza places like this. One, it's a chain, it's to be expected. Two, their pizza is reasonably priced and they have free delivery, which of course is going to attract people. I've ordered from this location about 3 times now, and I think they're A-Ok. I've had much worse and I've had better. 

I think what has been a saving grace for these guys is we've had the same delivery driver 2 out of the 3 times. He's awesome and always careful with the pizza. The other delivery driver we had was also super thorough and called while he was on his way to make sure he had the correct address and directions. So, I think that's part of the reason why we've had good experiences; delivery drivers are key. 

In regards to the pizza, yeah this location isn't as good with the amount of toppings as the North Aurora location. They're a little stingy, which is unfortunate. Otherwise, the pizza is always solid. It's exactly what I expect it to be every time. Fluffy crust, even cheese and toppings, and warm when we get it. 

I mean, their online system is super convenient, you can get 10% off when you order online which usually takes care of the tax, and it's free delivery. Who can argue with that? 

Solid three for these guys. I will be ordering again, because hey, it's convenient, decently cheap, and pretty solid quality.

There is not much to choose from for good eats late night.  I decided to try Sarpinos, happy I did.  They made a perfect pie.  Got a medium sausage, mushroom , onion pizza.  Not over or under done, ingredients taste fresh and delicious.  Definitely a good option!

I don't understand all the crappy review, this place is good priced, great tasting pizza, and the delivery guy was super nice! He was! He called me when he  was in his way and when he got here was very friendly I couldn't be happier. And everything tastes great! I'll defiantly order again!

Once again, Sarpinos never ceases to amaze me... I don't understand how difficult it is to put a side sauce in a box, but apparently it's almost impossible for the workers here. Obviously they hire anybody willing to work but they should really check to see if they can read/write. "Shay", the manager, is too busy at the gas station across the street picking up smokes/dip/swisher sweets to take a customer phone call so you have to deal with some arrogant asshole who continues ... You know what. Fucking idiots.
Guy in the phone was an asshole when I called to tell them they screwed up our order. They kept telling us we were wrong and hung up on us.

I've been hesitant to try Sarpino's for many reasons.  For one, I've heard that it isn't that great.  Two, I am constantly receiving menus from them shoved in my door, which is super annoying.  Three, the Yelp reviews are quite a mixed bag.  But I've grubhubbed every other pizza place, and I was getting tired of the same ol' same ol'. So I browsed their menu, found an enticing 'za, and ordered. 

The pizza that caught my eye was the Midnight Express, which contains spicy ground beef, salami, pepperoni, spicy Italian sausage, jalapeno and red chili peppers.  I love spicy and I love meat.  So there's no way this could be bad.

Their prices seem to be a bit higher than other pizza joints, but they don't charge delivery, so I suppose that's a fair trade off.  Aside from pizza, you can also select wings, salads, sandwiches, calzones, and desserts (much like any other pizza joint).  I did notice the abundance of sauces to choose from, which definitely sets them apart from the rest.  

Their online ordering system is impressive, as you can easily select your meats, toppings, your preference of how the pizza is cut (pie or square), cooking instructions, sauce application, dipping sauces, etc. It's almost overwhelming. Sarpino's covers all the bases when it comes to customers creating their perfect pizza. 

About twenty minutes after ordering, I received a friendly phone call from the driver stating that he was leaving and would be here shortly.  I found that to be a very nice gesture. He was at my door five minutes after that. I had my order from start to finished in 20 minutes flat. I was amazed and thrilled, because I hadn't eaten a thing ALL DAY.  I couldn't wait to devour this thing.

The pizza looked and smelled phenomenal. At first bite, I was pleasantly surprised. It was a bit greasy (due to the meats) but delicious.  Every ingredient was detected, including the spicy jalapenos and red chili peppers. It was enough to make my nose run slightly and burn my lips, so this pizza met my approval, without a doubt. The sauce was good- not at all sweet. I ordered thin crust which would work for a standard one-topping pizza, but for their gourmet or specialty pizzas, I would pick thick crust. 

All in all, I gotta say I'm surprised by Sarpino's. Sure, there are some better pizza places out there, but I've most certainly had worse. The delivery driver was super friendly, quick, and polite.  The food was better than I expected. Three stars for now until I try more items.

Whyyyyyyyyy?! Why do I continue the torture of dealing with this half ass pizza place??? Why? Because they have free delivery. And I am a cheapskate just like the owner of this franchise. 

You're order will be wrong 99.79% of the time, the pizza is greasy and unforgiving the next day, and please don't order cheese on the breadsticks because that is wayyyyy to expensive of a cost to ownership! $1? Really?!

I've called corporate before and guess I'll have to again but I'm not sure it is even worth my time since I'll never eat at this hack pizza place again.

Sent my entire order back tonight. With the guy who came out for a second time with the wrong delivery for the second time. Just handed him the pizza, wings, non cheesy breadsticks and gas money and told sarpinos as a whole to kick dust.

Placed order..got a confirmation email...an hour passes and no delivery, So I called and they told me the order was just placed, I complained and told them that I placed it an hour ago and have proof, an email confirmation from them. Their solution was to simply cancel my order, instead of apologizing and rushing my order for immediate delivery. Not cool.

This has been our ONLY go-to, insta-crave, end-of-a-long-day pizza delivery of choice for nearly 3 years!

We've never waited longer than 35 min, even for the largest orders. The pizzas are always well-cooked, tidy, and appetizing. The ingredients always taste fresh. The crusts are always crispy on the outside and baked fluffy on the inside. Really no complaints!

My favorite pizza is the Sorrento Delight and my husband's favorites are the Santa Fe Chicken, the Florentina, and the Pesto Lover! (The cheesy breadsticks are also an awesome snack.)

We will definitely keep ordering~~~

Well, aside from my orders almost always being off quality wise, the delivery drivers are rude. Always. Rude. I don't know if they're racist or just rude but it's appalling.  I don't know who delivered my order tonight, but he's delivered to me several times and each time he's extremely dismissive and passive. He literally DANGLES the pen at me. He DANGLES the receipt at me. Tonight he delivered to me, and his typical rude deamenor and I was in the midst of putting my 75 pound dog in his crate when he knocked at my door. I said just a second. Not even TEN seconds after I said this- loud enough for him to hear me (the walls are thin) he knocked again. I opened the door after making sure my dog didn't tackle him for a hug and expressed that I was putting my dog away. Absolutely no response except for dangling the pen- at the furthest edge at me. And I signed. He then ripped off the receipt and dangled at me. I took it and he facetiously said for me to have a good night. This is my last time patronizing this business. Don't waste your money here.

The only stars are based on their late night hours and quality specials, which easily beat other pizza places in the area. Their hot wings are fantastic, and they offer discounts plus points/freebies for ordering online, which is a great feature. 

The bad? Calling in an order. They act like you're bothering them when you call in to place an order. My family and I have been Sarpino's customers since 2010, but you're almost crossing your fingers that they don't snap at you when you call to place an order. There are more options if you order online (you can choose free 'sauces' per items), plus you won't have to deal with the front-end staff. The owner's wife "blacklisted" my address for delivery after criticizing them for putting me on hold and expressing frustration at their coldness towards "not being able to accept credit/debit" at the time. 

Recommendation: Order online, their hours and food quality is great. Stay away from management.
