**This was my go-to place for late night delivery, and it's easily the best late night combo-pizza place in the Naperville area, but the kicker for me is how quick they are to blacklist anyone criticizing them over the phone. Once you're on the "list", you're there for life...Be careful how you talk to the management, you might lose their unique, super late night delivery privileges, which truly sucks. Here's to hoping that there's a resolution.

This was my first try - I ordered online and got the delivery in time. But was not at all impressed with the pizza. I had asked for a well done - which I didnt see my pizza to be. The cheese that I specified was ricotta and felt that the only cheese in the order was mozzarella. The pizza seems to be oily - not sure adding garlic butter to the pizza meant that you get only that on the pizza - plus it didnt even smell like garlic butter - felt like oil. The side sauce on the order looked like "Jalapeno Ranch" and what I got was marinara - which i sincerely hate.
The only two good things that I could say about the experience was that the pizza was hot when delivered and the variety you offered was good. Sadly for that amount I would have ended up getting an extra large from any competitive chain. 
There is merit in getting back to your customer to ask for changes required if you don't have the necessary ingredients rather than stuffing whatever you have on the pizza.
Thoroughly disappointed and not sure would try it again ever.

I am a very frequent customer at this Sarpinos.
Pros: 
free delivery
Delivered reasonably quick
Calzones are amazing. I mean amazing.
Cheese bread is amazing
You acrew points with each purchase that after a while give you money off.

Cons: 
Delivery drivers are bad drivers and whip through my neighborhood recklessly
Pasta is not worth the money
I've had better pizza from other delivery places.

I get the Alfredo chicken calzone just about every week. Definitely recommend trying it.

Terrible new ownership. Why offer buy one/get one free pizza if you don't deliver two pizzas. And it was the OWNER I spoke to on the phone when I made the order...

They've lost my business forever.

So bad shipments system, I order third time, they are always late for one hour, it wasted my time.  Also, no weather problems but they did not apologize and told me did not receive my order? Are you kidding? And the chicken wings made me sick, I had stomachache after I ate that

They decided to stop making deliveries when the snow started, which I can understand. What I can not understand is still taking online orders for delivery, charging my card, sending out a confirmation email, and then not even bothering to call the customer to tell them you won't be making their food. I waited an hour and a half and finally called them, only to be informed we would not be getting dinner. The man on the phone was not the least bit apologetic, and was very hesitant to give a refund (for food that they hadn't even made!). Terrible customer service, I don't think I'll be ordering from here again.

First off this pizza was 1 hour late.   Then they come and give me half my order.  A manager on the phone hangs up on me because I told her what a terrible job they are doing.  They told me they would only refund half my money because I received half my order.  I gave the driver the money and she drove off with the money.  Terrible Anya, Victoria , and Megan should all be fired.  Terrible service.... Never order from here after hours... Listen from someone who knows pizza it sucked .... Will be calling corporate in the morning.  Please save yourself the pain and order a real pizza from Lou Malnotis or Giordano's ... This place is terrible!!!!! If you order from here expect an experience.... Like getting teeth pulled out at the dentist.
The pizza wasn't that great, I felt like neither the bbq or buffalo chx tasted like what I thought it would. Could be totally about preference though!

As a working, commuting mom of three, ages 5, 2, and 1, the family is never home earlier than 630pm. Trying to get dinner made, kids fed, baths, and in bed at a decent time is a challenge. I ordered Sarpinos online Tuesday at 430pm to deliver at 700pm. They showed up right on time, the food was delicious, and the kids were in bed 30 minutes earlier than every other night this past week. Kudos to Sarpinos for the easy online ordering process and coming through with great food. Makes a busy parent's life much easier. Happy Mom, Happy Life!
The absolute worst customer service (Naperville)!! Good food but distasteful employees!

Terrible service. We used to order from Sarpinos at least once every couple weeks, after several bad experiences and our order being wrong we started ordering from other places. We missed the cheesy bread and decided to try to order again tonight. Terrible idea!! After waiting over an hour we called, we were told, "the driver was on his way". Well, we waited another 45 minutes and called again, mind you Sarpinos is a 10 minute drive from our house. The person who answered placed my fiancé on hold for 7 minutes to "find out where the driver was". Instead of telling us he'd give us a discount, give this to us for free, since we waited TWO HOURS at this point for a small Hawaiian pizza and a cheesy bread, he gets back on the phone and says, the driver is close, want to cancel your order? My fiancé says he isn't paying for a pizza that took two hours to get to our house and he is told , reluctantly that we'd be issued a refund. What a joke. We loved you Sarpinos, we really did, but after this we will stick to Fox's pizza , they stick to their delivery times.

Sad truth is I probably order from Sarpino's once (sometimes twice a week) and have always LOVED and raved about their pizza and food. SARPINOS was my go to pizza place whenever   I was too lazy and tired to cook a meal after work. Although the quality of service and food isn't always the best (or consistent) I still showed my loyalty and settled for the l"decent" food. I order from this place so often that I've been able to collect 10 coupons 3 times to earn a free item.

However, after my last experience I have no intentions of spending a dollar on this place or refer anyone else. In fact, I plan on steering other consumers far from this establishment by sharing the multiple unacceptable experiences I've had.  Not only are they liars and do not honor anything they say or print on brochures/coupons, they don't respect or appreciate loyal customers who continue to help keep them in business. 

I've had the owner completely dismiss a coupon sent by his pizza shop  (with no expiration date, mind you) and tell me it was a misprint sent out in error and honoring it would leave him without a profit. My last experience they arrived 30 minutes late with a cold chicken parm sandwich, that was more like a bread and cheese sandwich with a smear of sauce and sprinkle of chicken bites, and when I answered the door the driver told me he didn't have my receipt. How convenient, considering that would have been my 10th one, allowing me to order a free item my next order. 

Few days later, I call to order a pizza and mention I should be at 10 receipts, and explained what happened only 3 days ago. I I was told they wouldn't  honor a free item without 10 receipts. I asked to speak to the manager to explain and let them know I could provide proof I made the purchase with my card, and the manager on duty (Victoria) wouldn't  entertain the thought for a second and kept saying no. 

For someone who orders ALL the time, I would have expected a little more from management. Especially considering it's YOUR staff who keep messing up and conveniently misplaces reciepts. This place creates the perception that they offer deals and reward programs but they will do whatever they can to scam you when they get the chance.......STAY AWAY!!!  Buy pizza from a place who appreciates your business.

1 star for being open late and for serving food...perhaps the delivery Drivers could come to my door and not expect Me to meet them at the car wth? This was the 3rd time that this happened with this location. The food is OK AT BEST!,but when you are tipsy At 1am its an option..heck,maybe the only option in Naperville..still,I expect my "delivery driver" to deliver to My door...at the risk of a DUI or burning down my house I'll probably order again...

I was worried after reading reviews of late deliveries. I had a Birthday party for my son and expressed concern about late delivery upon ordering. Glad to say my order arrived 10 min ahead of scheduled time and was spot on perfect. The kids loved the pizza and asked for 2nd and 3rd helpings. They cut the pizzas into 16 triangles for the kids and squares for the parents as I asked. I would definitely recommend Sarpinos to anyone that needs great tasting pizza and delivered on time. The parents really enjoyed the veggie pizza without pineapple.

This place sucks ass big time!!!  I ordered for delivery they told me 45 minutes and it took them an hour and a half. When my food came it was cold and my pizzas were burnt,  burnt!!  I called them to tell them and they said fine we'll send you other pizzas but we'll need the burnt ones back.  And my baked spaghetti was hard and tasted horrible,  the breadsticks were thin n hard. I put my original order in at 8:30 pm and its 10:56pm and I'm still waiting for my non burnt pizzas and my kids are not happy.  I'll never order from them again!!

These people cannot get an order correct. They do not care about what they do. They once gave me the wrong pizza. They once gave me a salad, no dressing. They were hours late delivering and no apology. They send unfriendly individuals to your home.
They are banned from ever having my money again.

the online system was so easy to use and had no problems ordering. The driver did have a little hard time finding my place but that's not his fault since it is kind of hats to find but they delivered it within 30 mins which was amazing cuz I was staving.  Ithe pizza was so delicious I almost ate the whole thing but had to stop myself. I plan on using sarpinos to cater food for my b-day party next weekend. So glad I tried them out. I only wish I took a pic of the pizza.

I'm done with sarpinos. They are getting worse every time I order.

But this time was the last straw. 2 hour delivery, Pizza was burned, Pizza was cold. 

This isn't even pizza. 

Stay away from here.
Food took over 1.5 hours to arrive when I was told 1. Girl on phone terribly rude. Taco pizza was disgusting. Pepperoni mediocre at best.

Easy to get burnt out on this place. Owner/manager is rude and I never had a good rapport with their drivers, very rude too. Everything tastes the same as the sauce is probably out of a can and they really try to up sell the extra order. It's been a while since I've been in here and it's obvious why. 

**I received a message here on Yelp and have added a screen shot picture of both the message and the review left by this so called customer, "Nina". Obviously I've never worked for them and I did amend the wording of my original review. I was not going to sit on my hands on this one and the owner obviously doesn't know the first thing about customer care or damage control. Buyer beware...**

So I call to place an order and am put on hold for 12 minutes! Even worse, I start to place my order with coupon #24 which clearly states you get two regular specialty or gourmet pizzas for $7.99. The idiot of a lady taking my order says that the coupon is not working and she doesn't know why. After being placed on hold two more times, I get hung up on! I call back and they hang up on me AGAIN!!! Finally, the last time I call I get to speak to the worthless manager/owner by the name of Greg who tells me that the coupon is a type-O and that they are not going to honor it and that it was ME trying to take advantage of them!!! Like REALLY?!!! This is the worst customer service experience EVER and I will NOT be ordering from them ever again! Sarpinos+Greg, YOU SUCK!!! Go back to school and learn how to provide good customer service MORONS!!! 

PLEASE do me the favor of calling and trying to use this coupon! I wonder if maybe 1,000 upset customers will make them change their ways... Probably won't change a thing but it's worth the try right?!
Late delivery, and the delivery guy brought it smashed up. The two stars are only because the pizza was decent.
Nice, friendly, good customer service, open late those are the positives. Slow, had to wait forever for burnt chicken wings. I don't think I'll be back.

I was a little surprised to see some of the reviews and ratings, and a lot of them are from people ordering delivery, like I do.  Luckily, so far my experiences with Sarpino's have all been great, and I've ordered for delivery from them about a half dozen times. 
So far, they've always delivered in the time-frame given, my order has always been correct--and hot--and every person I've spoken to or who has delivered my order has been polite and professional.  The prices are reasonable and it helps that there is no delivery charge.

I'm not really much of a pizza guy, so I haven't even tasted their pizza, but I enjoy their calzones, and they have a really good salad with fresh green peppers, onion, mushrooms, spinach, cheese, grape/cherry tomatoes, and bacon that's pretty awesome with their creamy garlic dressing.  The calzones are actually really good, and although they may be a little greasy, it's not gonna be dripping off your chin or down your arms, but the bread is what makes it--it's flavorful and just the right amount.  

I would like to give this place five stars, but feel that I still need to try a few different things--including the pizza--and I also have a wish.  I wish that they would use a better quality cheese, or have the option of getting fresh mozzarella, and use more ingredients of the same quality that I consistently find in their salads.  The menu says something about a blend of gourmet cheese--and I don't know, maybe it is--but it still has that waxy-thing going on.  I realize that it may be more expensive and that there may be no demand for it, but I would be willing to pay more and maybe other people would be too.  Anyway, I'm going to continue to order and if I find a good number of great options, I'll definitely update this review.

I made an account just so I could leave a review for Sarapinos. We waited over an hour and a half for our pizza. We were pretty near famished by the time it finally got to us. To make matters worse, the pizza was extremely greasy and mediocre at best. 
Take your business elsewhere.

I ordered a pizza tonight with fresh basil as one of the toppings. There were one or two shreds of basil, and the rest was salad greens. Honest to God. Either the kitchen doesn't know what "fresh basil" means, Sarpino's is cheap and thinks their customers are too stupid to know the difference, or they were nearly out of basil and thought I wouldn't know the difference. The rest of the ingredients were OK, and the crust was nicely cooked. But an experience like this doesn't make me inclined to give them my business again.

Ok, it's 8 months later. And this guy want to start a feud! First he sends me a private message asking me to take down the pics of his car that I posted. Denying any wrong doing still. Now, I let this go a long time ago! But he wants to do this? What is wrong with this guy? You mess with a bull, you're going to get the horns. In his little pm to me he totally contradicts himself! AND I HAVE IT ALL DOCUMENTED! What an idiot. FYI. Yelp took the pics down. A clear violation of freedom of speech! Hey Yelp! You're the one who wanted a public forum. Yeah yeah yeah, I get it, it's your site. Do with it as you will! Just to add, his car is used as a part of his business! And offers delivery. A huge part of his business! Therefore, those pics should not have been taken down IMHO. But my bone to pic with you is no big deal.

They suck all the way around! Gave them 5 chances! They suck! Pizza sucks and customer sevice is a joke! Call John and Eddies or Nancys! Call a reputable pizza place this place is beyond a joke! Yeah they are cheap this time Cheap=cheap!!!!! I order out 2-3 times a week....They lost my biz 100%! Nothing will change my mind now!!! If the pizza isnt burnt..its late if it not late its drenched in grease..I have pix! Also one time someone at the location baked it with hot peppers on purpose, they probably spit in the pizzas as well! I wouldnt put it past them I dont care what they say! I love the owners rebuttals to these reviews. Has No Business Sense! There is no rebuttal or excuse! Apologize and fix it! Hes not capable....Sales and Management is a talent thats my field! This owner has no business sense whatsoever!!! Im eating card board with grease..have to call my bank for fraud and call Jon and Eddies now! Save youselves! EVEN IF THEY CREDIT U IT TAKES 5 DAYS TO GRT UR $ BACK! WORST PLACE EVER!!!!!!!!

Absolutely terrible, pizza came with all of the cheese attached to the top of the box and they were kind enough to send us another one but this one came even worse. See picture. Got our money back. Don't order from here!

After a little bit of a run around, we were finally able to get a pizza ordered. Even with it being 5 minutes until close, (yes we were those people), they still took our order and delivered the pizza. They quoted 30-40 minutes and it had arrived in less than 25. This meal totally saved us from our drunk munchies. Thank you so much for understanding the struggle of late night hunger!

I ordered 3 pizzas yesterday and one of them was completely wrong - I asked for Spinach with Alfredo sauce and received tomato, raw onions, garlic and an olive oil sauce.  When I called, I was told by the manager that she'll give me a partial credit, although I asked to get the pizza I requested, not the one received. She did not want to comply.  I don't appreciate paying for a pizza I ended up throwing away because not only was it wrong, it was the worst pizza I've ever tasted (and that says ALOT).   With the abundant number of pizza venues in the Chicagoland area, you'd think they'd want to hang on to the loyal customers they have.  I guess not.  
Due to this experience, I will NEVER order from them again and I warn those who are thinking about ordering, only do it if you want to waste money on wrong items, get poor customer service and be totally frustrated.  What a disappointment!

one star because I have to select something in order to leave a review...
I'll start off by saying I was a customer when the Naperville location opened, and have had Sarpinos deliver every time. But now, GREG, THE OWNER OF SARPINOS NAPERVILLE, has changed his boundaries, and I can no longer receive delivery. (I wonder if corporate allows their franchise owner to have control over their boundaries?)  Seriously, my home is less than 6 miles from the store!!
I left a message with the store manager to have Greg call me, but GREG NEVER CALLED ME BACK!  Sadly, I guess Greg is rollin in the dough (so to speak), and doesn't care if he loses customers.  'Go out of your way to serve your customer...They are the reason your business survives!' With all the negative reviews I see here, I don't believe Greg can afford to sacrifice even ONE customer.

Waited 3 hours on my order, only to be told that "sorry, they were short a driver and would be unable to make my delivery". Extremely unhappy with them, and will obviously be taking my business elsewhere. I suggest you do the same...

ordered at 12:30 am on May 12th and our medium pizza showed up basically cold and hard at 3:00am.  I got into my hotel late and had to get up early. If I would have known that The pizza was going to show up the way it did and about 2.5 hours later I never would have ordered.   There was nothing gourmet about this pizza.. Gross.

Order was perfect and delivered within 20 minutes.  Food tasted great and was prepared as asked.  No complaints here.  Except... we're moving back to TN and we wont have one there..
so...yeah...keep up the improvements guys!  Its showing..

I was not impressed with the pizza.  Kind of like greasy cardboard with cheese.  On the plus side, the delivery girl was very friendly and prompt, but I won't order from them again.  There are too many other good choices.

Ordered a pizza on New Year's Day and it took a long time since the owner/mgr had some no call/no shows. That's fine, he was upfront about the time it would take. Anyways, I wasn't in a huge hurry and he was in a tough spot so I was fine waiting a bit. Anyways, he turned it into a good experience by being friendly, honest and upfront. I'll come back.
Excellent service! Love to see the owner doing delivery! Getting out to meet the customers shows me they CARE about the customer!

Ok, so I'm going with 4 stars because I would put this place at 3.5 stars.  Does the pizza blow you away in terms of taste?  No.  But it's up with there with pizza hut, and papa johns.  Also it's about bang for your buck, and the triple deal they offer is a good value.  In my neighborhood if its 11:00 p.m. and we want pizza we callin sarpinos!

I cannot say enough good things about this place! The customer service we recieved was beyond amazing, our calzones were cooked to perfection. Our order was running a little late, when we called to check the status they said if it wasn't there in 20 minutes call back they did not try to give any excuses other than they were busy. The delivery guy was very courteous and friendly and apologize for the tardiness. The person that took our order over the phone was exceptionally friendly. I wish that we lived here so that we can order from here more

Yummy pizza for great prices. I just love all of the premium flavor options they have. This is also one of the few pizzas I can actually eat all the crust too. Their dough is really good!

I love this place for their catering prices as well. Whenever we have pizza parties at work, this place works out the best. You can get so many fun flavors for the low.

The pizza is ok. Nothing to ride home about. The best part is the convience of it. Open until 2 am during the week and 4 am in the weekends. Nowhere else is open that late and you get free delivery. I haven't tried the sandwiches or anything else so will need to try that next time.
Yummy pizza & sandwiches! The delivery guy is really nice and delivery is timely! Friendly phone staff!  We order at least once a week!

This place used to offer fast quality delivery to my front door. Not any longer. 1-1.5 hour wait times are routine for me. And I live less than a mile away! Only one road with no turns except into my complex. Yet the drivers always seem to get lost despite clear instructions on the order... Even if I explain on the phone. IF I order again from this location it will be carry out only. But even that's unlikely given that food quality has deteriorated so drastically in my experience. 
... My most recent order included mozzarella sticks. They had been nuked to the point of ALL the cheese melting out of the crust and solidifying on the bottom of the tray. They arrived cold so it was a solid cheese platter. AND they cheated me on extra sauce I ordered... and not for the first time!!! I was so ticked, I called to demand a refund. But after waiting for the driver AGAIN, I drove to the store and delivered the order back to them and demanded my cash back in person.

Excellent sauce and crust. Polite delivery driver. Best I've had in Chicago. Only thing to improve would be quantity of toppings.  I would say amount on the extra large pizza I had would have been sufficient MAYBE for a medium... Don't skimp on toppings!!!

I was surprised to see the negative posts about Sarpino's...I would consider myself a tough customer to please, and have had good experiences so far.  It's important to note that I may have tried their pizza once, years ago, and remember not being overly impressed.  However, when I'm in the mood for a calzone, I love the create your own!  You can customize everything on it, and the ingredients have always been fresh and plentiful.  The "above and beyond" part for me though was the delivery driver.  The food is delivered quickly, and he calls to let you know when he is close by, and he's very friendly.

I've ordered from this location for a few years. Always had good service and good food! Went to order Thursday afternoon (around 3:30) online and online ordering was not available so I called the store - was very disappointed when the young lady who answered told me they could not take orders because their computers were down. Although she was very apologetic, she could not tell me when I would be able to place an order. Are the ovens and other appliances ran by the computer system as well? What happened to writing an order down on a piece of paper and using a calculator to figure out a total???? That's how it was done back in the day (omg I'm getting old). Obviously making money or servicing customers was not a priority that day because I bet it could have been done without the computer. They have the menu with prices and I'm sure they have paper and pen - even if no calculator was available - they could have added the old fashioned way. It's a shame people are so dependent on computers they can't function without one. Very poor decision on the part of management. Being in management myself, my customers would not suffer due to a computer system not functioning. That is an internal issue - not the customers problem. Not sure if I will be back - this was very disappointing.

My calzone did not have the mushrooms that I paid extra for, the 2 sodas I ordered were not cold and the BBQ wings were pretty burnt. I had to peel off most of the skin because of the burnt flavor. First time I've ordered from them, but probably won't order from them again. 
The only plus was that they delivered to my hotel within an hour.

We just ordered from here and we've eaten from this place several times and have had no problems, but this time was a nightmare. They delivered our order completely wrong much later than it was supposed to be here (so it was also cold), we had to direct the delivery driver here to our house because he couldn't speak English, and when we called to try to get our order corrected, the employee tried to make it sound like it was our fault and also said it would be another hour and a half.  It's absolutely absurd how awful this has been and now we'll be lucky if the charges will get reversed for this. If you're looking for pizza, steer clear of this establishment.  You'd be better off getting Pizza Hut.

After hearing my coworkers rave about the pizza here, I had to give it a shot. It didn't help that I have been swamped by their menus at my apartment complex either. I had heard if you place an order online it's 10% off the order. So when the mood hit for some pizza, this was the logical place to go.

By going online, you can browse the specials. I was able to score a large 2 topping pizza, one pound of wings and an order of breadsticks for $18. Plus 10% off which just covered the tax (Damn you Illinois). Not bad considering Pizza Hut is around $30 for the same.  

I decided on delivery and within 20 minutes the order was at my door. I have to say the wings here are phenomenal. Not overcooked but just right. I ordered the mix of hot and BBQ. Both flavors were delicious and not overpowering or drenched in the sauce. This may have been the perfect chicken wing. Or at least the best I've ever ordered from a pizza place.

Sarpino's offers a pretty solid pizza. There are better choices out here, but for the price it was good. The sauce tasted great, the crust was thicker than I prefer it and the mushrooms held up and didn't turn out burned. The one thing that was weird concerned the Italian sausage. Instead of globs of sausage balls, they have little sliced sausage on the pizza. It kinda left the pizza not having that "meaty" flavor. 

The breadsticks were forgettable. I see why they're thrown in as a freebie. They bake them like a pizza and cut them into strips. It left the sticks a little too chewy. 

One plus I will add is the dipping sauces included on everything. This is good because lately I decided pizza didn't have enough calories so I need my ranch dipping sauce to put it over the top. Hey when you splurge, you might as well go all out.

Certainly not the best or the worst, but Sarpino's offers a good pizza for the price. Plus on the weekends, they're open until 4 in the morning.  What's not to love about that?

Never had a problem with this place. Pizza is always good, sometimes delivery times are awful, and I don't mean a Friday or Saturday night. Ordered during the week and delivery is very sluggish. However they always do provide a coupon or had instances where I have gotten items for free for a time delay. Ordered many times various toppings always good. A little pricier than some places, but personally never had a problem with a coupon or anything. I would say to pick up instead of carry-out if you are hungry and in a time crunch. Would give it a better rating but I feel delivery is important when rating a place like this.

I give this Sarpino's two stars for the food.  I give it zero stars for the service.  I have ordered from here a few times, and each time I ordered delivery.  I cannot understand why on a slow weeknight (Tues-Thurs) it would take them an hour to bring two salads to my home.  Nothing even needed to be cooked.  

On my last order, I requested that they call me if they estimated that they might be running an hour behind schedule.  At 1 hour and 10 minutes after placing the order, the manager called to let us know that the driver is late and that he's "sorry."  Sorry doesn't cut it this time.  He should have called at the 45 minute mark to let us know.  Our order finally arrived about 90 minutes after the initial order.  

We will not be ordering from this location again.

I will NEVER SPEND A DIME IN THIS RESTAURANT AGAIN. Who sends out burnt wings to a customer and thinks it ok ? This location!! So I get these wings an immediately get angry. I call the location and was put on hold for 8 min while they "got the manager". After calling from several different phones we finally got the person to stop throwing us right on hold. Spoke with Victoria "the manger" who could not give two sh**ts about the burnt wings, hold time, or lack of customer service any of them couldn't give. Asked about the owner was told his name was Greg and all I could do was leave a message for him and wait for him to call back. Nope I Don't hunt people when I'm giving them my money. Had them come take back these non edible wings that you can't even tell which is which and give me my money back. Then they had the nerve to try to give me just $8. Not happening give me my tax back too. Sorry Greg when you get your cooks some better training on how to cook wings and your manger Victoria some better customer service training. I will never be back and will make sure no one here at this job orders from there! Horrible!!

The spinach special pizza is fantastic. It was about $15 with tax for the regular 10" size pizza, and worth every penny for this gourmet delight.

The toppings are: fresh spinach, blends of Parmesan, Sarpino's gourmet cheese blend, cheddar and feta cheeses, garlic butter, fresh garlic, eggs, leeks, green onions, herbs and spices.

Yum, I cannot wait to have it again.

Service has been much better!  Keep it up, and business will continue to strive. I had made my point known by them not accepting cash for delivery.  Now everything is back to the way it should be.  I don't no what changed, but I am very satisfied with the quality now.

I am new to the area so I'm still trying out new places, I received a coupon for Sarpino's and figured to try it out because I was getting sick of Dominos all the time, We ordered the wings and large pie, I'm sorry to say though I was not impressed at all, The pizza was chewy and tasted old and the wings had no flavor. It was the first and last of this place, I think I will stick with Dominos.

Sarpino's really surprised both my fiance and myself. We probably would have never ordered from here, but after arriving at our hotel in Naperville around 2 AM we asked the desk clerk what places were open and he only knew of Sarpino's and gave us a flyer.

We ordered a few things, because we were really hungry after a long flight. The pizza was actually very good. So were the wings and the bread we ordered. It was all very unique and so good that we actually ended up ordering from here again on another night on our trip. If I remember correctly they even had free delivery! How cool is that?

Sarpino's has really good food for being open this late at night. Who knew?

OMG, sooooo good! As much as I wanted to dock them a star for littering our apartment community with their flyers stuck in doors, I can't. Everything I've had from there is awesome...especially obsessed the the Build Your Own calzone. Word to the wise: Don't order the large calzone unless you're HUNGRY. The regular is more than enough for any normal appetite. Great pizza, too. Worth it being a little more expensive than the average place. AND they give a 15% discount if it's ordered to your place of business. My office gets it at least once a week. Delish!

** Oop, had to dock them a star since I discovered JET'S**

My family has been ordering from Sarpinos for years; we enjoy their flavors.  Several times, the pizza has been delivered later than promised, and once, it was delivered free of charge due to it's delivery delay.  Yesterday it came 2 hours late, after being promised 45 minutes after my order was placed.  I called an hour in to waiting and complained, and was assured that they were "just busy" and that the driver had already left.  An hour and a half later, I still had no pizza.  When I called the second time, I was put on hold by the girl who took my order, and then again by another girl, only to talk to a manager who told me it was my error and that I said I would come to the facility to pick it up.  Upon pointing out to him that I had already talked to the original order-taker and she'd assured me about the delivery, he claimed to give me 20% off, and that the pizza was on it's way.  

It finally arrived at the 2 hour mark, cold and soggy.  I apologized to the delivery person for not tipping him and told him to discuss it with his manager.  I paid the full price.

Unfortunately, my family likes their pizza - I fear we'll order from them again, and be faced with the same situation.  It's really unfortunate.

I order from Sarpinos about 3 times a month either for myself or when I have people over. The sandwiches and other items are pretty good, but the pizza is never good. Either the cheese is burnt or the crust is soft and super chewy. My last two experiences will probably be my last. 

A couple of weeks ago I had a buddy over and we ordered a simple large pizza that took an hour and twenty minutes to arrive with no contact from the store about any issue with delivery. I had to call them to find out what was going on. The cheese was burnt and the crust was chewy. Last week I placed an order and it took them 45 minutes to call me and say it was going to be delayed, but wouldn't tell me why. This was on a Tuesday night. An hour later I called them around 130am to ask what was going on because I knew they closed at 2. The guy said they hadn't started making it yet because they were busy. He offered to cancel the order and refund my card right away. It was clear they couldn't be bothered with my order. I told him I wanted my food made and delivered and 45 minutes later I finally got my order. The food was okay, but took 2 1/2 hours to get to me.

Neither time did they try and make up for their terrible service. I got an apology from the delivery guy this last time, but the part I noticed is that in two dozen orders over the past several months I have never seen the same driver twice. Out of all those orders only two of them have found my place without having to call even though I put specific instructions on the order. They have since admitted to not reading them.

I have spent many years in retail management and quality customer service can trump a product/service problems any day. It is clear they need new management because they clearly are not concerned with keeping customers. I probably won't order from them again unless it's the only option.

I order from Sarpino's all the time because I really like their bbq wings.  I love it that they are always open even on holidays and until the wee hours of the morning while everybody else shuts down at a wimpy 10:00.  The owner has always been nice & seems to care about any problems that arise.  They do have a problem with consistency, however.  Things can vary wildly from one order to the next.  Sandwiches are pretty light on ingredients & ditto on flavor.  And I have never ordered a pizza that contained all the ingredients I asked for.  NEVER.  I complained to the owner once about this and he sent me out a free replacement.  You guessed it!  It arrived missing ingredients!
They're sort of like a friend...always there for you, but perhaps slightly flawed.
Good in a pinch for late night munchies.
(They just delivered an order to me & I see I received cans of soda instead of the 20oz bottles I ordered). But, hey, it's 1am, so I'm lucky to be able to get anything!

This was a pleasant surprise. 

After a night of Slammin beers with friends we needed a late night meal. A friend of mine order from this place at 130am on a Thursday and they still delivered. The pizzas promptly arrived and I was very surprised by the quality and appearance. I've had some late night pizzas before and they were just complete shit. This place is not one.

The pizza was great for what it is, give it a try late night/early morning. U won't be disappointed.

Good pizza and calzones! I live down the street from this location and order delivery and pickup frequently because they are one of the only restaurants open late in the area. Also they deliver pretty quickly to me. They have a large variety of pizzas. I always like to try new ones. The Greek pizza and the Mexican pizza are my favorites. I also like to create my own calzone. They give out a lot of coupons and the prices are very good.

Simply put, not that good of pizza delivered by criminals, employed by incompetence.

Congratulations, I joined Yelp to write a review on how bad this place is.  After being a loyal customer for two years (mostly out of not having any other options for pizza delivery past 1 am besides this place), the final straw was a delivery driver crashing into my mailbox and fleeing the scene without telling me or my neighbors.

Here's a tip for the driver next time you commit a hit and run, don't park your car that left gray paint on my wooden post right in front of the restaurant the next night.  I may not be able to recover any of the cost of the repairs, but at least you get to drive your Acura with a messed up bumper or have to shell out a deductible to get it fixed, enjoy working for another half year to save up that amount.

As for the owner, Greg, who was "angry" that his driver could do this and not say anything, but apparently not angry enough to look into it or call me back, enjoy your lost business and negative review, you sure earned it.  Your willful ignorance and dismissive demeanor regarding this matter has been astounding.  You might have been able to salvage your reputation with me as a customer by showing a modicum of professionalism or  even returning a phone call.  I'm still here a month later waiting for a direct response from you Greg, i'm not holding my breath though.  I guess the next step is to start pestering corporate.

Update:  After posting this review, the owner's wife and apparent other co-owner took such offense to it that she called me up at 10 am this past sunday.  At first I was excited to see them finally taking responsibility to their driver's actions but quickly realized that this contact was made to try and shame me for publishing the truth.  Some gems from this contentious conversation include: 1. claiming that car bumpers do not have paint on them in order for it to rub off on my mailbox post, 2.  Taking issue with me referring to a hit and run being a moving violation, and 3. Her making a strong implication that all the negative yelp reviews are a result of people whose opinions aren't worth her time and coming from the voices of cowards. Never have I rolled my eyes so much in a ten minute period.  Trying to outline a logical argument with her was akin to me trying to teach my dog algebra.

These people are obviously in way over their heads on how to run an efficient customer driven business, and it will not surprise me when this location closes after they are done alienating their customer base. The irony of her claim that yelp reviews are meaningless but my yelp review prompting her to contact me is apparently lost on her.  In all seriousness, I just think both the owner and his wife are just not that bright of people.  It makes me wonder how they even got the money to start up this franchise in the first place outside of a dead relative.

I thought the biggest insult  was using the apparent death of one of their managers almost 2 weeks after i initially contacted them (as referenced by another yelper as well) as being the reason they never contacted me.  The fact that the owner's wife referenced this as "people having died for this business" to give legitimacy to her argument very disturbing.  I know that if I was a manager at sarpino's,  I'd like to be remembered for all my contributions to two swarmy owners using my passing to lend credence to their business acumen.  (A business who's quick google search shows a court case complaint concerning the Fair Labor Standards act)

My fiance and I ordered a pizza from here because it is one of the few places open passed 10:30. We ordered a pepperoni pizza and onion rings. The onion rings were cold, soggy and absolutely tasteless. The pizza had a taste to it which I could not describe, it was completely disgusting. It also came with a garlic sauce which I dipped my crust in in order to mask the taste of the pizza, and it was similar to straight up mayonnaise. It literally made me gag. Coming from an Italian, this is the second pizza I turned down in my entire life. We ended up tossing it.

In the words of my fiance, "I know this is drunk food, but take pride in your business". That is all.

Been burnt by this place so many times, messy food like the pizza was dropped, items ordered but missing when order delivered. So I gave them a last chance tonight. Same problem. Ordered super taco pizza with thin crust and jalapeño slices on the side, when order was delivered it looked like someone dropped the box on its side and surprise surprise no jalapeño slices. Call and speak to manager he can't even see the order. He's reading back to me an old order from June 2012 (yeah that's how long it's been) and he reorders that order. So my 2nd order is completely wrong...a super taco pizza with thick crust, extra cheese and sour cream and no tomato...and STILL no jalapeño slices, on the flip side it didn't look like it was dropped....I call and request a refund, I'm just fed up now. The guy is nice about it and after a few minutes he's like ok you're all set. I hang up but I'm sitting here wondering....how am I "all set" if I paid cash??? The food here is good when it's done right, don't get me wrong and it's Saturday night I understand you're swamped with orders but you need to make sure your customers are getting what they paid for. How do you mess up an electronic order??? It's all listed out right there clear as day! Needless to say they've lost my business. Won't ever give them another try and tomorrow if the card I used to order back in June 2012 hasn't been refunded I'll have to call AGAIN and I really won't be happy....

I can say without a doubt that I have never been treated worse by anyone in customer service . Their pizza is average at best and the employees are beyond rude. I will never ever spend another dollar there or recommend to anyone

As far as cheap pizza goes it's not bad but the service and delivery times have been horrible for the last couple of months. New management? New owners? No idea. They sent us someone else's order which took over an hour to get, they called us because they caught their mistake and offered us a credit. They told us we'd have to call to use the credit instead of ordering online then wanted to charge us close to double for our order to use the credit because their 'in store' prices were different online.  What was the point in the credit? After a back and forth we finally got the pricing we should have but horrible customer service. We've been ordering from them for years...it might be back to the drawing board to find a new pizza delivery place...

I love pizza, so I am a pretty touch critic when it comes to reviewing it. I like going here though. Being from Chicago, where there is always a place to go to for good pizza, Sarpino's is pretty good. We usually only get the thin sausage, but their other pizzas look good too. I like their pizza because, it has a unique (in a good way) flavor. The sauce is VERY good, free delivery, they have quality ingredients, the crust is buttery and crispy...so good! Even though my husband prefers it very hot and eats his most the day we get it, to me, the pizza is still pretty good the next day. 

I would recommend this pizzeria to anyone.

and this is a generous 2 stars.

I have to preface that my girl and I have been living in NYC for the last 8 years for me, over 13 for her.  Needless to say we've had the best of the best....but also realize that finding the corner pizza joint that does Neapolitan-style pizza anywhere around the Midwest might be a stretch.  So back to the puffier, cheesier pizzas we both grew up with!

That being said, there just wasn't anything that impressed us about our two pizzas from Sarpinos.  With a thinner crust, this pizza could have easily been something we bought frozen in the supermarket, ala Red Baron or Tombstone.  And that would have been cheaper.

First off, 14" isn't a "large".  That is hardly constitutes a medium, but that's semantics.  We had a few toppings on 2 pizzas (for a whopping $31...and that was with a 50% discount on the second pizza....jeez), one was totally missing and the other was pretty much dumped onto one piece.  Missing was...fresh basil.  Uh...this is a pizza joint, right?  How is it that one of the base ingredients can be easily forgotten?

- sauce was too sweet.  points to being canned or a can base to balance out over acidic tomatoes.
- cheese was thick and not-pleasant "chewy".  needs to be fresh and less...which would go further
- our garlic, spinach and mushroom pizza was totally bland.  I am by no way a salter (kinda sneer at salters) but this pizza had me reaching for the kosher salt.
- tomatoes were crunch and white-pink
- we picked the pizza up a few minutes after getting our email notice.  the pizza was slightly warm but not "piping hot".

We could understand some of these problems...if there was a line or the place was hopping, but when we pulled up there wasn't any activity.

Really don't understand what others saw but we sure as shootin' didn't have any form of magical experience.

back to the great Midwest pizza search....

So they left a coupon on our front door, we tried it out, we got the wrong pizza, and then had to wait for a new one to be delivered, once we got it, the pizza was not that great, and we ordered a large, it was more like a medium.  On top of it the manager wasn't even apologetic for sending the wrong pizza.

Yikes...this pizza really sucks.  I just moved to the area and since there aren't many pizza options close to my new home I was really counting on Sarpinos to be good.  Sadly it is really bad pizza.  It's like some weird hybrid between a buttery Chicago deep dish and a more floppy style pizza, like papa johns and Pizza Hut.  Sarpinos just isn't good, not to mention it's expensive to boot.  When I want pizza I'm either going to have to shlep it to Cassanos or just go to the dominoes on brookdale.  Dominoes isn't the best pizza but it's still hands down better than Sarpinos, and half the price.

I'm generally not a fan of chain or franchise pizza, but this pizza is FANTASTIC. 

Why? 

1. Amazing pizza concoctions I never thought would be good - but I find myself craving all the time: 

Buffalo Blue - my current addiction: (you can't taste the bleu cheese at all), spicy buffalo sauce instead of regular pizza sauce, sliced chunks of chicken breast, onions, cheddar, etc. 

Spinach Special: spinach, scrambled eggs, garlic, garlic butter instead of regular pizza sauce, and lots of different cheeses. 

Mexicana: ground beef, onions, chili peppers, jalapenos, peppers, diced tomatoes, and lots of cheese. 

Cheese Bonanza: puts Pizza Hut's cheese lover's to shame. Parmesan, Ricotta, Feta, and a secret gourmet cheese mix. Dip it in the Jalapeno Ranch for an extra kick.

*Chipotle Ranch and Jalapeno Ranch are both dipping sauce options. 

2. FREE DELIVERY!!! For reals. And no minimum to deliver, either.

3. 10% Off if you order online. Seriously! 

4. They've got great deals under the "store specials" section. My favourite is the 'Sarpino's Sampler': 2 10" gourmet or specialty pizzas for $16.99.  I get that and a 2 liter of Diet Coke, and I've got lunch at work for 2-3 days!  

5. The delivery guys are always nice, friendly, and quick.  (Others have complained, but I order at least once a week, and have never had a problem).

- only draw back is the limited availability of sides. but with pizza this good, i've never had enough room for sides anyway!

As Jonathan B. pointed out, the free delivery service is spotty.  But Sarpino's pizza is so damn good, I make an effort to carryout instead every time.  I wish I could either take advantage of the free delivery or get a discount for picking it up every time.

We've only ordered the thin sausage, but one day we'll try something new.  The menu is large, and Yelpers seem to like other items.

Reasons the pizza is phenomenal:

-Uniqueness.  Never tasted a pizza like it.
-The sauce is borderline perfect, and they even include an extra marinara dip with your pizza.
-Spotty delivery is free.  Although it should be noted the pizza tastes soooooooo much better when hot as hell.
-Quality ingredients, including the sausage.
-The thin crust is so buttery with the right amount of crispness.  if you're looking for paper-thin crust, look elsewhere.
-Franchised, meaning there are tons of other locations where you are supposed to receive the same, standardized product.  i can't speak for other locations, but theoretically every other Sarpino's should be as good as this one!
-Discounts.  Order more than one for Buy One, Get One 50% off.  Or stop in to order from their carry-out menu, which has about 10 money-saving coupons for almost anything on the menu.  This pizza will come out cheaper than most other quality competitors.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED (for pickup and a swift drive home)

4.25/5 (minus 0.75 star for spotty, but free, delivery service)
This is the 3rd time I've ordered from here and not once have I been disappointed! Great food every time!  Love the fact I saved 10% when I ordered online & free delivery !!!

I have been ordering from Sarpino's strictly for delivery over the past 2 years and today, was the first time that I ever have gone inside this location.  I must say, I was IMPRESSED! The staff was super friendly, the place was SPOTLESS and also, I was greatly impressed with finding out that they MAKE THEIR CRUST FROM SCRATCH! I had no idea... I was expecting something like a Pizza Hut crust that's already made but these folks use ALL FRESH INGREDIENTS! :o)  I will definitely be going back again for carryout!

We have ordered from Sarpino's twice and had two wildly divergent experiences.  The first time, the pizza was delivered within a reasonable amount of time and was hot and tasty.

The second delivery took 1 hour 45 minutes to get there.  The pizza was warm at best, but the soda was surprisingly cold.  Go figure.  :-)

I had to call several times to check on the order, starting an hour after the order was placed.  Eventually they did offer to refund the purchase, without my requesting this.  However, the overall experience was less than satisfactory and it will be a while before we order from here again.

When they first opened, they were great - the pizza was always good.

Then something changed about a year or so ago.  The pizzas became overcooked (like where the top is nearly black), with little sauce.  Even if you ask them to put more sauce on it and not overcook it, they don't follow those directions.

But it's really hit and miss...one time the pizza is good...the next week, the pizza is terrible.  I want to call them and ask them who's making the pizza just because I think it's really just the difference of the pizza maker...I'm just surprised at how inconsistent it is.

Really nice delivery folks - never had a problem - except for once when our pizza didn't arrive for 2 hours.  They comp'd the next pizza, though, so that was nice.

the pizza taste old people are rude and they act like they are doing you a favor buy answering the phone. i do not judge places on one time i have eaten here 3 times and each time has been worse. and to top it off last time i ordered a pizza they left me a coupon # 24 that clearly states $7.99 for two regular pizzas or 3 dollars more for medium, 7 dollars more for large 9 dollars more for a xl. i thought wow great deal these people want return customers and what the heck i will try them one more time. when i called up they said there was a miss print  and it was suppose to say 17.99 for two regular( sounds like a bait and switch to me)  needless to say she wouldnt honor the coupon they made and delivered to my house and proceded to talk like i was trying to take advantage of them ok. so instead of getting a loyal repeat customer you are getting some one who cant stand your company and refuses to eat at you establishment

I had a late night craving for a pepperoni pizza around 10:30p on a Friday night and was glad they were still open.

I decided to pick up so I can't comment on delivery times. The pizza was ready in about 20 minutes.

Perfect thin slices of pepperoni with a little crisp. Not too heavy on the cheese and tasty sauce. I'd say all the ingredients were proportional. The crust was not thin and had a nice chewy consistency. Ingredients went nearly to the edge of the pizza (no skimping). 

Came with some red sauce and a pepper. Will likely order from them again. The medium was a great snack/meal for 2. At around $8.50, way better than any frozen thing at the grocery (even if it's rising crust)

Wow - I'm really surprised this place has over 3 stars, let alone 4 1/2.  Little Caesar's offers the same pizza for $5, but this place charges $10.  Looks the same and tastes the same.  We go to Adamo's.
still no refund and I contacted corporate without any response seems like they are a rather shifty business

First time here and the place smells amazing.  9:45 am on a Sunday and it's packed, but my party of 3 was able to get a seat right away.....

Coffee was hot and fresh and service was prompt.  Off to a good start.  

I opted to go with my omelet and fruit!  Always my go to breakfast when I am dieting....sigh.....

Everything was absolutely delicious!!!!  Service to get food took a little while, which is the only reason I didn't get 5 stars.  However if you are in Bolingbrook this place is a must if you are looking for a tasty breakfast!

My family and I were planning to go to this location for a brunch for my Grandma's 70th birthday. There was about 15 people in our group. The day prior the hostess we spoke with instructed us to call about an hour ahead on the day we were planning to arrive..so thats what I did. When I called at 10:30 Saturday morning the very rude hostess- Jessica was her name I believe snapped and "snootily" said we dont take reservations! I explained to her that I know that and was just doing as instructed the day prior by another host. She abruptly told me to hold on and put Debbie( her mgr) on the line w/o any prior warning may I add. So I re explained to Debbie the reason for my call. She as well was not very welcoming and very un-accomodating! I was very agitated at this point. Decided to call the Downers Grove location-glad I did! Spoke to a girl who was very nice and friendly, explained that ans why they dont take reservations but  and offered to put my group on a wait list. She then suggested that I speak to her mgnr- Suzanne who was SUPER warm and welcoming! I told her what I had dealt with with the Bolingbrook location and she was highly shocked. Needless to say that I alerted my family that we would be going to the downers grove location instead. They seated us all in about 15mins and the service was exceptional!!! Moral of my review..avoid the Bolingbrook location and go get quality service at the Downers Grove location..I guarantee you wont be disappointed.

S.N. I called the Bolingbrook location back and spoke to mgr Debbie and told them about their horrible customer service and the exceptional service we got at the Downers location . I also informed her to look for my review on yelp. Hey Debbie!

This is a modern day pancake house with a clean open and tall feel to it. A lot of stain glass decor and windows. We did not have to wait long at all for a table.

I had the country skillet which was amazing with two over-easy eggs on top of the skillet. The waitress did not bring me white toast which comes with the order. I also ordered an espresso which was actually great, it did not have a strong bitter taste but it went down like mud cause I love it like that and it definitely wakes you the eff up!

Not pricey at all for you and your other half or the family. I need to come here more to see what is the best to get on the menu.

On that note I will update soon
Great place for a traditional breakfast. One of our favorite places to visit on the weekends. French toast is awesome!

Just left the restaurant for having the poorest service. Waited for almost an hour and a half and still no breakfast. Waitress checks every now and then but the tables close to me keep turning their beards because they are either waiting for their checks or waiting to be served. Don't open a breakfast place if you can't serve within 20 minutes.

We went there on Black Friday to eat lunch. We ordered our food, but then it took so long. It was because they dropped our ticket of our order in the back. It took them like an hour to serve us our food. So we ate, and the chicken did not taste good. After we ate, my mom asked for a discount or something. The cashier said why and my mom told them the story. But the cashier did not let us have one. So we don't like it.

Food was ok... First time there and the server was great food so so.. I ordered a spinach feta cheese and artichoke omelette and it was watery and gray they didn't drain the artichokes before adding them to the eggs and it made the whole thing soggy it look horrible when it was served and I just picked thru the stuff to eat it.

Well, I gave it another try.  Shame on me.  I ordered three eggs over medium with grits instead of hash browns, crispy bacon and an English muffins.  Service was fast to get me my order and that where it went bad, again.  Eggs were literally cold.  I asked the server how can this be and she said I don't know.  Crispy bacon was wobbly and no where near crispy.  Grits were luke warm at best and the English muffin was sopping wet with butter which I did not ask for.   It is a shame this place can't do the basics correctly, serve hot food and as your customer ordered it.

For a breakfast joint this place has it figured out. Banana Foster dessert with Nutella is my favorite by far. For breakfast I ordered eggs and bacon and a crazy badass pancake with blueberry jam on top of it amazing. I will go ahead and update my review next time to five stars as long as I get the same exact service quality.  . Thank you

Last day in the area, wanting a decent breakfast to start the day. I ordered the the skirt steak with hash browns, over easy eggs, and toast. I wanted the steak medium well, and the hash browns well done. They nailed it, steak was very good. hash browns were perfect. Even though the eggs were on the running side, it didn't ruin the meal. Had more then enough portions. I was seated immediately, waitress was a little slow. Food came out pretty quickly though.
Overall I had a really good experience, I recommend all the yelpers to give this place a try when you're in the area.
Don't bring a large group. Could not handle a group of 48 people without consolidating checks and couldn't get orders correct. After calling ahead!!

It was pretty busy on a Sunday morning but we were seated (party of 2) in about 10 minutes. Waitress was very attentive. Order waffle combo and breakfast burrito. My wife loved the burrito, said the salsa had a great flavor. My waffle was good, but as others have stated my eggs weren't cooked quite right. Ordered over medium came very over easy. Not a big deal. Overall a great, fast sit down breakfast spot!

The service was debatable but she was nice. The red velvet French toast was AMAZING! Good
Portion sizes and pretty quick in and out.

I've come here many times over the past few years so I think I know enough now to say what is working there and what is not. What works? I've always had very nice servers there. The coffee is better than most other breakfast places and they often ask if I want to take a cup to go, which is nice. Bacon is great. All pastry, pancake, waffle and sweet types of breakfasts have tasted very good; they appear to specialize in the sweet side of breakfasts. French toast cream cheese creations, wonderful! All the different kinds of pancakes have been good. But if you want eggs, this is not the place for it. We love trying omelettes at every breakfast place we go, and we have NEVER been able to enjoy the ones here. Runny or greasy is a way I would describe them. Scrambled eggs have tasted watery. We've avoided ordering egg dishes because of it. But stupidly, i try to order eggs benedict three times now, and this third time was my last. First - I will say that I always ask for my poached eggs to be poached WELL/Hard. I don't like runny eggs, which seems to throw off every server when I order eggs benedict but want the eggs cooked well. EVERY TIME I have ordered this, the eggs come out runny and have to be re-done. i don't totally get what the issue is, but it has happened three times. Second, when they brought out the last re-done dish, the eggs were cooked but the entire dish was drowning in sauce. Drowning to the point I had to fish out the food and move to another plate to eat it. The English muffin was soaking and gross. I ate the eggs and left everything else. And this was not the only time it came out this way. So long story short: Coffee, bacon and sweet breakfasts good. Egg dishes not so good.

My wife and I decided to take our kids out for breakfast, since it was our anniversary and we didn't have a babysitter for the day.

We walked in and were impressed with the friendliness and the size of the place. We were seated right away, which is always great when you have small children. After a few minutes our server came by and introduced herself and took our drink order. All seemed to be going well.

After looking over the extensive menu, we had made up our minds about what to order. Actually, I was torn between two items, so I asked our server. She immediately suggested that I NOT order the skirt steak and eggs. She told me it was not good and is one of the most returned meals on the menu. So I went with my second option, chicken and waffles. 

I don't particularly care for the fake syrup, so I ordered the Vermont Maple Syrup for $1.50 extra. A small price to pay for actually enjoying my food.

When the food arrived, it all looked good. But that's generally where it stopped. I ordered my eggs over-medium. When I cut into them, the whites were  not cooked. Not a little runny. Not cooked. So I tried my daughter's scrambled eggs. Bad choice. They seem to use an artificially butter-flavored oil to cook them. I couldn't swallow what I was chewing because the flavoring was that bad. 

My wife encouraged me to order more eggs, but since we were 0 for 2, I choose to just forgo the eggs and focus on my waffle, which was actually very good. The chicken portion of the "Chicken and Waffles" was just two fried chicken tenders, but they were okay. So I poured my syrup all over my waffle and starting eating. Much to my dismay, this was not the real maple syrup I ordered, but it was too late. My wife's breakfast wasn't positively memorable, either, as she said her grits were utterly tasteless.

When we received the check, I noticed we had been charged for the maple syrup. My wife wanted me to just let it be. If the food had been better, I might have.

I mentioned the syrup issue to the cashier and she apologized, which I appreciated. However, she asked if I wanted to take the syrup home with me. I declined and told her I just wanted it with my meal. She had to get approval to remove the charge, but the manager asked her why I wasn't just taking it now. She explained to him I didn't want it because I wanted it with my meal. It seems a little silly to expect your customers to just take a small bottle of syrup home with them, because you forgot to give it to them with their meal and you'd rather get the $1.50...or push a few buttons. 

All in all, the staff was friendly, the place was clean and service was quick. The food just wasn't all that great.

I was under the impression that this was a cute little coffee shop but it is actually a fancy sit-down brunch place. Don't get me wrong, the place is gorgeous but was completely surprised when I walked through the door. I ordered the 'Lemon Blueberry Ricotta Pancake Combo' and was not as good as I expected unfortunately. The eggs were average and the pancakes had no special taste, very bland. My boyfriend ordered the strawberry crepes and was also disappointed-  they were just a few strawberries over a plain crepe. Was a total let-down.
Great place! Beautiful restaurant! Great people! Love everything about Honey Jam Cafe

I love going to Honey Jam Cafe.  They always have friendly service and the best atmosphere.  The decor is like eating at home, with a beautiful fireplace in the main diningroom.  They have a new Chicken and Waffles that has amazing chicken.  I recommend bringing your appetite as the portions are large.

DO NOT EVER GO TO THIS LOCATION - MANAGER HAS NO CONCEPT OF CUSTOMER SERVICE
My family and I went to Breakfast at Honey Jam on Boughton Road. This commentary is limited to this specific location. We all ordered our breakfast and waited quite a long time for it to be brought to our table. During our wait, the toast I ordered was brought to the table. This was the same toast brought to the table next to us but no one at that table ordered toast. I did os they brought it to me. I said I prefer my toast to be hot and served with my breakfast. They removed the toast. What seemed like an eternity (probably another 5 minutes or so), our breakfast was served. I had pancakes, eggs and bacon, all were cold. I did not get my toast. I called to the waitress and said my breakfast was cold, to remove it and take it off the bill as I was not going to pay for a cold breakfast. She obliged and returned with another plate of cold toast. Shortly afterward, the manager came to the table. You can tell he had an attitude. He said he did not appreciate that I told the waitress my meal was cold and remove it. When I tried to explain, he got all huffy and asked me to leave. My family left.

HORRIBLE SERVICE waited 35 minutes to be seated, why so long if there was a ton of available tables. Once they finally sat us down it took 20 minutes for us to get our drinks another 10 minutes to get water and after an hour of sitting g waiting on our order we finally had enough, we were STARVING we decided to leave and go next door to Portillo's and we were all seated with our burgers,chicken sandwiches, drinks and salads at the table in less that 15 minutes... that was my 2nd time here and the wait LAST time was about 2/3. So it's a pattern and I won't be returning. So people beware... don't chance it

We ordered a Dutch Baby as soon as we walked in and the waitress came around 20 minutes later telling us the first one didn't work out and they were putting in another one. She later brings out an undercooked flat pancake. We obviously didn't eat it and didn't pay for it but no other comps were given for the inconvenience, barely an apology. Not very good customer service.
**I would like to add that our waitress was excellent and very apologetic. We have also come here several times and had absolutely no issues**

This place is on a slow and painful downfall. They purposely tell you a shorter wait time so you do not leave. You then get seated and it takes your server 8 minutes to get to the table, another 5 before you'll see drinks. Once the food arrives it's a 50/50 on whether it will be A. Hot and B. Good. We used to frequent this place, not anymore. Once they left the Portillo group it lost the passion for the people. All they care about is tge

The decor is nice and it is clean, however we had to wait several minutes before our waitress came to the table. I ordered an ice tea and a cheese burger. When she brought my ice tea she did not give me a straw and left prior to me being able to ad for one, she did not return to our table for another 10 or 15 minutes. I had a cheese burger and fries. The fries were frozen and had no seasoing. The cheese burger came with no cheese or condiments, it had only lettuce and tomato. The bun was relatively tasty however the patty itself lacked seasoning and was very dry. I would not recommend for lunch. I have not had their breakfast but I do not think I will be going back to try it

We arrived at 9:45 am for breakfast, host said we have a 45 minute wait, we looked around and saw many tables open and thought it was a over estimate . After sitting for 40 minutes and several tables being emptied (counted 15 ) we where sat . 
Took awhile for waitress to show up , asked
For coffee ( very weak) asked for
Another still weak, food was not cooked right ( over hard eggs where runny ) over all not good ! 
Witnessed other tables with similar issues . 
We will not be returning !

First time here on Sunday morning, had about a 15 minute wait.  Well worth the wait!  We both ordered the Pumpkin Pancake combo, so delicious!!  The service was fast and friendly, in fact the owner sat down at our table to chat about the previous night's Cub game.  Will definitely come here again when in the area.

Crisp delicious gourmet style waffles, perfect French toast, huge omelettes to feed an army.. Or you know someone who's just hungry..excellent service. 
Always leave satisfied and full!

I knew I should have voiced my preference of somewhere other than here, at a recent family outing, what a disappointment. Our server was attentive and a manager discounted our bill slightly, but serving up 4 cold dishes for breakfast, before a Sunday rush, was an epic fail. Obviously the kitchen has low standards. The group census was comical, as no one wanted the voucher for $15 off a future visit. Discounting the bill just 20% for such a huge disappointment, 4 of the 5 orders were served luke warm, was on the cheap side. The food is nothing special and not good enough for a return visit.

This was my sister, my boyfriends, and I's first time trying this place and it was awful. We had a short older woman who seemed really annoyed to have us there. It took her about ten minutes to come over and when we ordered drinks we asked for waters too. Got the drinks never brought us water. After ordering our food we noticed after a half hour everyone around us who came WAY after us got their food and we didn't have anything. We had empty drinks and no server. She kept running by us staring but wouldn't tell us what was up or just ask if we wanted more to drink. Finally I got so angry I walked up to the host stand and she ran over and told me that my sisters food got screwed up and that was what was taking so long. I'm so baffled that I just had to walk away. My sister and I are servers too, if something gets messed up we get it but don't ignore us because we look like your average "teenagers". My boyfriend went over to the manager to complain and she was very nice to us. Apparently our server didn't tell her what was going on with our table because she was very genuine in her apology and also looked confused when we told her. She gave us a coupon to come back and comped our entire bill as it should have been. We had to take our food to go unfortunately because we had to attend classes! Which also made the situation worse. Wanting to eat out before class sounded like a great idea, which was unfortunately ruined by bad service. We will give it one more chance but probably try downers grove then here.

Sad. When Portillo's owned it it was delicious, could not go wrong with any of the food. Instead of the old Strawberry Cheesecake French toast they used to have they now have Strawberry "cream cheese" french toast. Let me tell you... that was not even close to cream cheese.

Artificially colored flavorless (I MEAN FLAVORLESS) "cream cheese" topping added nothing and made me feel sick. Such a disappointment. Place is headed down hill FAST.

Portillos has a breakfast place?!?!!?????!!!!

Yes...yes, they do.

It's a cute little space.

Menu is monstrous.  They have tons of breakfast, brunch, & lunch choices for all of your desires.

Our server was really cool.  On too of the game.  Thumbs up!

The food was standard...good, not knock your socks off.

Overall, I would stop back if I was in the area.

The caprese panini with chicken was cold. Cheese was cold, not close to melted, and the bread was white. No effort or pride was executed when preparing my meal. It looked sad on the plate. 
Cream of chicken with wild rice soup was the only saving grace-even the French fries were bad-stale, cold and hard. Unbelievable for noon on a Saturday.

There are a few items on the menu it is best to pre-order  since they take longer than most items to prepare.  Arriving 20 minutes before my companions were due, I took advantage of this by ordering one of these items.  A  full 20 minutes AFTER they arrived  as my breakfast companions were being served (approximately 40 minutes after being ordered) the waitress informs me they were "out" of my selection, "would I like something else".  This bothered me I asked why it took so long to inform me, she explained she was just told - after 40 minutes?  I ordered eggs and hash browns.  A few minutes later the same waitress brings out a "failed attempt" at my original order asking if I still wanted it.  Now I'm confused - I was informed they were out.

The manager comes over to take the blame.  At this point I don't care who is to blame, I'm hungry and I was lied too.  The manager insists I was NOT lied too.  Okay, customer is wrong...Not worth the aggravation, I'll eat my breakfast elsewhere from now on.  

Poor management staff - Poor customer service

This happened the morning of 7/26/2015 at the Bolingbrook location.  I can be reached at 630 270-9156 if there are any questions.  Do not attempt to placate me with any Honey-Jam incentives.  I am a longtime customer that will NOT be returning.
Service was fantastic but unfortunately my meal was not. The Eggs Benedict was simply not good.

My family and I have frequented here quite a bit.  Overall it's decent food & friendly atmosphere.  We have a toddler so we go early and there is never a wait.  

Yesterday was the first time I went I was pretty disappointed.  Service seating us was good.  We ordered.  I got eggs Benedict with fully poached/hard eggs.  Food comes to table and eggs were soft.  I'm pregnant and can't eat runny eggs.  First time ever I sent something back.  What was weird though was the waitress wanted me to scrape my hash browns off my plate so she could take the dish portion back.  I told her to just take it all back.  She returned pretty quickly.  Clearly the cook removed the runny eggs put new eggs on and put a ridiculous amount of sauce all over the dish....it was seriously inedible.  Oh and I got the same hash browns back and they were cold.  Frustrated I just picked off my husbands plate.  I would have sent it back again but the waitress never returned.  My kid was getting tired of sitting at the table so I took her out to the car.  Another 5 minutes go by and my husband texts me saying still no service at the table.  

Really disappointed by this last experience.  There are so many choices in the area--we will prob give this place a rest for a while.

This place was great when it was owned by Portillos. Ever since they sold it to a new owner quality has gone downhill. Their breakfast burrito was great when they used authentic chorizo. I don't know what they use now but it's terrible. Not to mention, service really dropped. We could barely get the waiters attention any time we needed anything and it took him about 15 minutes just to say hello and get us some water. This is the third and consistent time I have been disappointed there. Three strikes, you're out. We will not be returning anymore.

Place is really going down hill. They just fed me breakfast with a 2 foot black hair twisted through it. Then the waitress quickly takes it away and brings me the bill. Then the so called manager Patrick comes over to to say he credited just the food woth the hair in it. My guests couldn't wat after seeing the nastiness of the hair and so on. The manager would not talk to me and walked away. Made me pay for the drinks and everything else. DO NOT GO HERE. ITS AWFUL NOW.

Usually would have given this breakfast spot a 5 today was not that day. We come here pretty frequently, love the pancakes and the skillet. Today the service was spotty at best, the food even worse, cold pancakes, I asked for fresh hot pancakes , they come and now they are not cooked all the way, the server is pleasant enough, never refills my glass is ice tea, my party goes to the car while I have to wait almost 15 mins before the check comes. I tell the hostess the service was ok but the food was not cooked well and we had to keep sending it back... Her response.. Well we are kinda of busy today. Had she shown any level of CUSTOMER SERVICE, I would probably not written this review.

Great restaurant! Good portions and the customer service was great! The quality of the food is awesome and I was throughly impressed! If you are visiting the Illinois area around Plainfield or Bolingbrook then definitely give this place a go! Ill be back!

Went for breakfast this weekend and got in before the breakfast rush. Huge menu selection and great menu options for kids.
