Big portion, enough leftovers for my husband & I to split for a dinner this week. Only had a half of one, but their" warm to the table" garlic rolls are delicious. Service also very good. (Thanks, Erica) Will definitely go back.

This the best little hidden gem in Will County!  I have been here about 5 times. I never order off the menu.  I always ask what the chef's specials are and order from that. I have never been unsatisfied.  The decor is pleasant and the wait staff is very courteous.  I will definitely be going there again! A+ in my book

Can't say enough good things about this place. This is a nice little Italian restaurant in Lockport and we are usually greeted by the owner who is very nice.

The menu is easy to read and not like the huge size menus at other restaurants. Many items on the menu to choose from. For starters we went with the fried calamari and I had the veal parmesan for my entree, which was really good. Portions are big, so bring your appetite. For dessert we had tiramisu, a cannoli, and an amaretto cake which was really delicious. That was the first time I had amaretto cake and I'm mad at myself for not trying that much sooner.

The restaurant staff was really friendly and was on top of things. Never had to wait until the glass was empty to get another drink.

Make sure you get a reservation on the weekends because it fills up, but if you walk in, just grab a drink at the bar and I'm sure they will squeeze you in without too much of a wait.

We will definitely go back to Mama Onesta's and make this a regular stop.

It's a schlep to get here  but well worth it for this San Francisco-based food snob.  (How I got there in a terrifying Midwest T-storm is too long a story to relate here.) 

Your meal at Mamma starts moments after your hit the chair with a bowl of freshly warmed rolls drenched in olive oil and bristling with chunks of fresh, diced garlic.  With a bottle or two of the restaurant's reasonably priced wine, you could stop right there.  

But I went for the politically incorrect veal parmigiana, which is topped with a thick, smoky, clearly home made tomato sauce - the best I have tasted since the last time my wife made red sauce.

Our party tried a variety of pasta dishes, which were freshly executed and more than abundant.  As my brother in law correctly noted, the sauce on every dish is unique - a sign that Mamma takes pains to get it right.  

Any one portion would have been enough to serve a party of four at a fancy eatery in downtown Chicago, New York or San Francisco.  And the prices are cheaper than an appetizer at most places that promise lots more and deliver lots less.  

Go there before the premiere of the Johnny Depp remake of "Public Enemy," which was filmed in part at this restaurant.  When the place becomes a tourist destination, Mamma may be hard pressed to sustain its authenticity and its charm.

Mamma Onesta's has good food and a good atmosphere.   We have always had good service.  The creamy Italian dressing is delicious.   I had a side of creamy marinara spaghetti and it was fantastic.  Every main dish I have ever tried has been at very least good.
Best Itailan food in the area. good size portions and the tastes of everything I have had has been out of this world. Very freindly staff and owner.

I enjoyed the fairly authentic Italian food here. It could be good for families or just couples. Large portions and well priced. We tried the bruschetta, calamari, gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce, pasta with puttanesca sauce, and the tiramisu.  All very good.

We had the rehearsal dinner for our son's wedding on 7/25/12 at Mama Onesta's and I can't say enough about it. We had 26 people, and everything went well. We selected the chicken florentine for the meat course, the penne pasta with red peppers and sausage for the 1st pasta course, and 4-cheese ravioli for the second. A sumptious salad was served with warm garlic rolls. All were delicious.The food was served family style which complemented the decor and cozy ambiance. The owner, Frank DeGrassi, was very accommodating, and his staff gave great service. We have been there twice, and we intend to go back.  This is a real jewel in the Lockport-Joliet area and is on our favorites list.
Terrific food. Full bar. Great specials. Good service. Limited parking and space for seating. Make a reservation!

AMAZING!  My fiance and I were in the Joliet area (where our wedding will be in several months) and were looking for a rehearsal dinner spot.  Well, we found nothing in Joliet but wandered up to Lockport.  Mamma Onesti's caught our attention as a cute little spot in the downtown area, so we decided to go in.  Frank, the owner, was extremely helpful and showed us the options we could have for our dinner party.  We were very satisfied with the quaint, cozy, Italian ambiance in the restaurant and the great menu prices.  We decided to stay to try out some of the food before deciding on booking our dinner there.  We each ordered a dish and Frank brought out a 'sample' of about everything else on the banquet menu!  I almost cried!!  I LOVE Italian food, and especially good quality Italian food, which this was.  I am so excited to go back to Mamma Onesti's.  After living in Chicago for several years, it's really nice being able to experience a more reasonable, true Italian restaurant where all of the servers are friendly and polite.

went for lunch with daughter. wanted to share but after asking was informed of 3.95 split plate charge. Another restaurant with this ridiculous fee. waitress was extremely rude when i told her we were not paying it and i would order soup. $2.95 for a thimble sized cup of soup. Had to ask for crackers from miss attitude and finally she brought some and then threw done bread after i was almost done. Nice. Would not go back.

This place really is hit or miss. I've been here about 5 or 6 times, service is slow and you have to know what to get. I've had the smoked mozzarella gnocchi which was so awesome. The Lasagna is pretty good. Their chicken is not good at all, so stay away from anything with chicken, it's really fatty and not seasoned at all.

I really wanted to like this place but it's just ok at best.  The prices do not reflect the service or food.  It's too expensive to just be O.K.  I wont be back but wish them luck and hope they imporve.

Food is fantastic! Sauces are homemade and delicious.  Went for lunch today and will return soon to experience dinner!  Wine list adequate and ranging from $32.00 to $70.00 per bottle.  Park off side street and enter through the back!  Well worth the trip! The Alfredo sauce is awesome and the chicken Picatta is mouthwatering good!

I've been meaning to try this place for awhile now.  The decor is okay.  The walls are painted orange and the ceiling is painted black.  It was a bit halloweenesque, but I decided to look past and concentrate on the food.
They bring out rolls to begin with.  The rolls we got were cold and were soaked in oil and jarred, chopped garlic.  Eh, I'll pass.
I did get a salad and hubby got the minestrone.  I got the Italian dressing and it was the best creamy Italian dressing I've ever tasted.  It made up for the cold, soggy rolls.
I got the spaghetti and meatballs and he got the chicken fiorentina.  They were both decent, but not amazing.  The meat in the meatballs were overly ground up and the seasoning was non-existent.  The chicken fiorentina was definitely a lot more flavorful than the meatballs.
I don't think I'll be back anytime soon, but it was worth a shot.

Ate breakfast here with my brother. The food was excellent and the staff was friendly. The prices were good and serving sizes were large.

They served a complimentary bowl full of bakery goods (maybe a bit of overkill, but it IS a bakery as well as restaurant). I ate a breadstick and it was crusty and moist as it should be. Great flavor.

I had the steak skillet and my brother the Gypsy (ham) skillet. Meat with hash browns, onions, peppers and American and Swiss cheese with two eggs atop. They also came with choice of toast or pancakes(?!).

The whole damn meal was excellent. The steak was tender and flavorful, the hash browns crisp, the onions between fried and caramelized, the eggs perfectly cooked to order (over medium for me).
There is a reason they advertise their pancakes. They are moist and tasty and rather substantial.

They even have a tiny bar in the corner for their lunch and dinner crowds (open 'til 10).

I got nothing bad to say about my experience. Maybe they could get slightly larger coffee mugs. Oh, and their coffee was good.

After the hostess seated me, I moved myself near a window because I was seated at the far end of the restaurant. My waiter who should have retired 10 years ago scolded me for moving without taking the bread basket with me. After receiving my meal, I asked him for the WiFi password. It didn't work. I got up and asked the hostess. She gave the same one. Then I walked over and the owner gave the same one. Finally, a waitress walked by and gave me the necessary info to sign in. Never saw my waiter again until I was done eating. I told him the correct password but he obviously didn't care.  No apology for giving the wrong one. No comment at all. 
Food was just ok. I had a chicken Caesar salad that was way too small for $9.99 and didn't even come with a cup of soup. No, I won't be back any time soon - if ever.

The usual Greek family restaurant.  Good omelet..
And flavored creams on the table. A bit outdated, but the good food makes up for it.

My group of coworkers have been going they're for a few years.  Service has been slipping. Went in today with 8 people.  They offered us a booth and a table.  They couldn't understand why we weren't happy.  They didn't want to bring another to the area above where the booth. We left went down the street to Butterfields it was great! Plenty of seating.

Not sure what the hype is about. Husband ordered chicken tenders--we've had better tenders at drive-thrus and the BBQ sauce they offered was watered down. I had the skirt steak skillet and was surprised to see barely melted American cheese slices on top, and the hash browns were practically mashed potatoes. I had to ask twice for water, and we never received any bread with our soups. I suppose the only redeeming factor from today were the pancakes, which were surprisingly good.
This place has huge portions and reasonable prices.  It's my go-to for corned beef hash breakfast when I'm in Naperville visiting the in-laws.

The menu is quite a variety of things.  And lately there has been a dieter's menu as well which is low on carbs and was very filling.  We haven't dined in here over a year but came back today for brunch.  I ordered the Stuffed Avocado with chicken salad.  It comes with a boiled egg, cottage cheese, and fresh fruit.  I ordered my favorite marbled rye on the side.  Plus coffee, hit the spot.  My bf ordered some bacon, eggs, potato pancakes w applesauce.  Their potato pancakes were very good!  The food was very well prepared and presented for the local diner.  When we got our food, I actually got excited.  

BTW, they have the best tasting baked goods around.  We'll usually order our cakes from here for birthdays or holidays.  

This place is a Naperville staple.  I would highly recommend for all groups and ages.  There's something on the menu for everyone.

Great pork chops and eggs.  The pork chop was juicy and the eggs were perfect.  Yum. The waitress was nice and friendly.  Less expensive than Butterfield pancake house.  My mom ordered crepes with peaches she said it was really good.

This is a classic style, non-chain family restaurant.  Overall, the dishes are reasonable size, medium-priced, with good service.  Lunches and dinners are served with a bread basket and most come with a soup or salad and a dessert.  Favorites include the Greek-style pork chops and the ribs.  Breakfast is served anytime.  This is not a trendy place and generally appeals to an older crowd.  Seating has booths along the windows and includes a handful of diner-style stools along the counter.  Definitely worth a visit to experience a different style of dining compared to the franchised operations.

I did see at least one comment about WiFi.  They don't advertise as having free WiFi although they may give you the password and all the waitresses may not be aware.  I wouldn't go there expecting WiFi service, though.

I have been going here since I can remember (I am 24). I usually eat breakfast here, but this particular day I came for lunch. I got the baby lamb chops. SO good. It smelled like Easter for me (I'm Greek, we do the full lamb). However I must say I always feel awkward going in there when I'm not with my mom. The owner & the cashier lady are constantly just standing around staring. The cashier lady never seems happy either. She barely told me have a nice day.. And even when she did she just sounded like she really didn't care. My waitress tho was the sweetest. I wish I could remember her name, she was young. I believe it was Valerie?

We've been to Quincy's a few times now and enjoyed the complimentary bread basket, good service, and solid food. Tonight our waitress put in my order wrong and skipped the soup that came with our meals. We were still charged for the soup (she brought it after our food arrived). We were charged $.99 for hot water and .75 for a sandwich to come with marinara (that wasn't good). The third plate showed up without the thousand island dressing described on the menu. 

All in all, we won't be back anytime soon

Have not been here for a few years. Remembered the free dessert and thought we would stop. I ordered their pork tenderloin special, my son got another house special. The soup was fine, the bread sort of stale, and wonder how many times it was "handled" during the day.
There were several wait staff. Not that friendly, but efficient. 
The problem was the meal itself. The meat dish was dry and bland. Like breaded cardboard. The mash potatoes and vegetables were cold. I immediately wish I had ordered a breakfast, My son's entre has similar issues, and we joked about being sick on the way home. The dessert was a plus, but at that point, considering that was a $40 meal, was not the icing on the cake. 
Bottom line, if you are a regular and know what works for you, great. We had a bad experience and will not likely return, Was hoping for a great "home-cooked" meal which was not delivered.

My family visited on a Monday night. The restaurant was not busy, so I expected service to be attentive. That was not the case. Rather, our server needed to be sought out numerous times for drink refills. The food was definitely edible, but not good. I ordered vegetable barley soup, and the soup appeared to be a combination of veggies, tomato soup, and barley - not impressed. Besides, it was bland. I also had a Rueben, which did not come with thousand island dressing (not a big deal). I asked my server for a side of it, and she didn't bring it for ten minutes. The booth I sat in had crumbs all over the seat, and the bathroom didn't appear to be very clean. Toilet paper was on the ground and the walls and floor looked dirty. I typically love diners like this, and there are plenty more in the area to choose from. I'll be visiting those other establishments from now on.

The food is always delicious but alas you cannot run a restraunt on merely good food. You also need customer service. 

My last visit was for mothers day. I ordered the roast sirloin of beef. I'm not a butcher and would not notice the difference between that and London broil. Well when the bill arrived London broil was on the bill. While London broil is not very much more expensive it was a higher price, and not what I had ordered. 

I went to the register to bring it to their attention. The question I was met with was did I eat it? Well, yes, I ordered beef and I ate beef. Which cut I recieved I was now unsure. 

I was told London broil was what was on my bill so therefore London broil was what I ate. He was rude and stated if it makes such a big difference he would charge me for the sirloin...

My point being, it was not about the difference in pay. It was that what was on the bill was not what I had ordered. But to have a customer walk out the door feeling down about their experience is as I see it, unforgivable. 

I left disappointed and unsure of my return to this venue.

I experienced the best mom and pop diner today! Food was flavorful and not very expensive. Huge portions. Had an entree and got a complimentary dessert with our dinner. Dont get turned off by the decor, it feels very homey inside and the waitress was so attentive. I told her this was our first time here and she gave us some free muffins to take home. Ahhh so happy. Coffee is smooth too btw! Give this one a try :)

Oh I had high hopes, high hopes, high apple pie in the sky hopes.

Was recommended.  Walked in and was seated quickly.  Place looked bright and clean.  Waiter came quickly and service was okay.  
So why the 2 stars?  Yikes! Sauce, sauce, sauce!
I was excited that they had mushroom soup today.  When I received it, it seemed like it was a bowl of thick cream.  I would not have known it was mushroom soup except for a couple mushroom slices at the bottom.  That is okay.  Maybe just a bad soup day.
I ordered the turkey,  The gravy was like it cam out of a bottle.  The turkey looked like it was sinking in an ocean of gravy.

I would try one more time perhaps getting a sandwich.

I went here with my friends before our senior high school homecoming a few weeks ago, and it was pretty decent. Service was a bit slow, but that might have been because we went at 6pm, so maybe since it was dinner time then they were short on staff. The food was overall good though, with big portions and good deals (I got a special for the day, which then came with a soup or salad and a dessert)! Would recommend going here, just maybe not at the dinner rush if you have more than maybe 2 people in your party.

I have been coming here for years. The owners are very nice and they will make your food any way you want it. I just had baby Lamb chops that were fantastic. It is not often you get Lamb chops at a resturant like this so I was skeptical. I was more than please with the meal.  I have had breakfast lunch and dinner here and have been more than satisfied. If something is not right they will make it right.

Come back Grandma Sally's!!!  This is the closest coffee shop to the former Grandma Sally's and, I gotta tell ya, location can only take you so far.  The family went there for a Sunday breakfast, a post-mass tradition.  After standing around the lobby with people wandering around (there is no host station) and no idea who would be considered "first" the owner came over to take names.  The restaurant was crowded, but not overly so., which does not explain why it took so long to get seated. 

Once seated, the experience did not improve dramatically.  The server seemed pretty disinterested in serving with alacrity.  Coffee?  Maybe I should just go to the station and get my own.  Who knew that water was such a commodity, since asking for resulted in a fish-eyed look.  Finally, the food arrived.  The food was good.  No complaints about flavor.  OK, one complaint.  Grandma Sally's uses homemade salsa that is sublime.  Quincy's?  Does not.  Bland.  Portions are about 2/3 the size of Grandma Sally's.  Who knows?  Maybe I should be eating smaller portions, but I'd like to make that decision on my own, not because they've decided to scrimp on the sizes and ingredients. Oh, Quincy's, it was lucky for you that GS had the fire but that doesn't mean you no longer need to compete.

Quincy's is an uncomfortable little restaurant located off of Ogden Avenue in Naperville. Once I walked inside I was fairly shortly thereafter seated. The there are a handful of very small tables and I was seated at one. I quickly looked over the breakfast menu in an attempt to zero in on exactly what I wanted. I decided to go for a Gypsy skillet (a fairly popular item as it appears on many pancake houses menus) and soon enough had placed my order.

What made this visit rather interesting were the senior citizens siting next to me, first expressing their disappointment that they did not receive a bread basket and at the size of the food cup. But then they commented at the entrees they received, "I wish Omega were still open" one of them exclaimed. I'm pretty certain they were referring to the now closed Omega Restaurant in Downers Grove. As I heard their complaining about their meals I waited eagerly for my breakfast to arrive. 

When my food arrived I was somewhat disappointed by the size of my skillet. There was a lot of egg compared to other places, but it seems like it was overall less food than most places, as I snapped a photo and dug in I noticed it was very bland. A lot of other pancake houses add extra seasoning to their eggs, to the potatoes at the bottom to provide a richer flavor. This was nowhere to be found on this skillet. The potato at the bottom was particularly disappointing as it was no on way crispy and was mostly made up of white soft potato fluff. 

The pancakes I got with this weren't any better than the skillet, and while the syrup was thick it wasn't super sweet or flavorful. These pancakes were average at best and not enough to salvage the sub-par skillet. 

Overall I was not in any way impressed with Quincy's, while my food wasn't horrible I wouldn't be tempted to visit again. I'd recommend avoiding this place as many better options exist.

started coming here because gramma sallys had the fire and is closed.....and have to say im not sure I would go back to sallys when they re-open.  quincys is really good...and you can get bar drink for dinner.  ive had the maple salmon salad and another time the chopped chicken salad and an omelette....all were very good...no complaints.

pretty big space...comfortable...and lots of old people...which I actually kind of like.

Quincy's Restaurant is a nice break from the multitudes of chain restaurants in Naperville. This restaurant reminds me more of the family owned restaurants I grew up with. 
The food was very good, reasonably priced, and you get a lot for what you pay. I had the western chicken and my girlfriend had an omelete and we both really liked what we got. The restaurant was pretty quiet while we were there, but we were there pretty close to the end of their day. Our server was very friendly and I really have nothing to complain about.
In the end, I'd definitely go back.

Dude, regardless of the other review(s) this place is totally fine... I almost want to give it 5 stars to even out what the average rating should be. 

When my BF and I went we stood out like a sore thumb being that we were the only people there after 2:00 on Saturday, who were under 80 years old, and not ordering Dinner for an early bird special. Our server was rockin'. Totally sweet, working her ass off serving chumps and the elderly breakfast for mere pennies. 

My bf and I were getting a late start after a slight drinking binge and chose to do a 2:30 breakfast. The food was was pretty damn good... I mean, I cleaned my plate. Was it Egg Harbor quality? No. But was it Egg Harbor prices? No! It was super cheap, and damn good diner food. 

I can understand not liking the place based on pastries per the previous review but I also can't imagine going here to pick out a wedding cake unless I was a big fan of the trucking industry either. It's a dive diner- not the Ritz, order some God damned eggs sunny side up and move on with your day. 

For my Bf and I getting coffee, 2 meals, and some sort of dessert the bill was $14- I'm not complaining and I will prob be back.

I have eaten here now four times and never have been disappointed...especially for a greek family style restaurant...The lentil soup, and navy bean soup is very good...I tried the lamb chops and must say they were very good. Now is this an upscale resturant, no  BUT "Family Style"  and it is one of the best around. These types of restaurants aren't in business any longer... They have an Omega restaurant in Addison and Schaumburg, and the food is not what it use to be, it is awful. I could write more reviews on where not to eat then where to eat but this one is not on the list. The only thing I would say that is not good is the bread and rolls in your bread basket. The quality is just not there. Dry and not fresh...change vendors on this. Hey Qunicy's we need a restaurant like you in Schaumburg/Bloomingdale...in fact Bloomingdales  does not have any good family restaurants. Dino's in Bloomingdales is consistently busy and it is the worst food I ever tasted...if you opened out there you would do quadruple their business.

So, I like breakfast. I like to eat breakfast out. Not to say that I make bad pancakes, but it's nicer to have someone else do it, and then, you know, I get hash browns too. 

And I liked Quincy's when I went for the first time recently. For one thing, they break from the pack of pancake places by NOT having the "big as your head" pancakes, which tends to make pancakes tough. 

Quincy's pancakes were smaller, with a light, more delicate texture. No rubbery mouse pads, these. 

I have yet to eat a non-breakfast meal here but they seem to be a "Big Boy" simulacrum in that they have lots of choices, as well as the pie/cake case in the front, and the lifetime waitresses who are efficient and know how to balance the room. 

We'll be back. Because of the pancakes.

Your normal family dining restaurant.

Nothing special - they give you a basket full of different breads but you could tell they were stale; I assume they reserve if customers haven't touched them.

Food was mediocre - nothing special. Pancakes were VERY good - it's a pancake house

I just had the chopped chicken salad and it was awesome! For the paleo/low carb crowd it would be great, just ask for the dressing on the side or omitted and exchange with olive oil. Bf got the Mexican omelette with hash browns, he thought it was good. Our server Susan was polite, prompt with our coffee and pleasant. Didn't bat an eye when we asked for no bread. Overall cost was about $25 for two meals and two coffees. Not cheap but fairly priced for the experience.

We finally made our first trip in here though we've now been in Naperville for 12 years.  We found the brunch food quality to be on mediocre side, including the coffee. I'm thinking about 2.5 stars here. They do have quite an extensive menu of not only breakfast items, but pastas, hot sandwiches (steak, philly beef and such), desserts, and cakes.  Wife has their hobo skillet (two cheeses over hash browns, poached eggs, and pancakes) and I had their french toast with bananas.  The food was brought out rather quickly, but everything seemed and tasted like it had all been sitting for a bit.  The french toast was dry and chewy could have used more eggs.  Place is comfortable and it's good to have around for convenience, but no rush back for us.

Decent family restaurant in Naperville. I like it because of the cozy and quiet atmosphere. Food is decent and the prices are excellent. I normally stick to their breakfast menu, but they do have a couple decent lunch/dinner items like their gyros and fried shrimp. However, if you want a "fresh" basket of bread, come earlier raher than later.

We've been coming here for a while - OK, I'll be honest - since Grandma Sally's burned down. We think the food is very good, and a good value - OK, honestly again- we love taking home the desserts included with the full dinners, particularly the lucious brownies!  The service has always been nice and friendly.  But last night our waitress went above and beyond.  We had our 3-year old granddaughter who was almost in tears about her pet frog escaping.  In the middle of a crowded dinner hour our waitress took the time to listen to the story.  After dinner she was so kind to surprise our little one with a "chocolate frog" from the dessert case and told her maybe that would make her feel a little better!  The baby was thrilled and must have told us at least 2 dozen times "that was so nice of her!". To me, this gesture was significantly representative of the folks here, and made us faithful customers!  Thanks!

Very friendly people and nice homey atmosphere, but the food (dinner menu) was really subpar.  Cream of Mushroom Soup, Seafood platter, chicken tenders, spaghetti with meat sauce - all awful.  Hire new chefs/cooks, and you've got something.

I like this place.  It seems like your average diner, and the prices on the menu may seem a little high, but the food is good and portions are large and filling.  Everything was good, though the bread should have been replaced.

Quincy is one of those family restaurants you pass by on the road...take the hint...PASS.    Our waitress looked like she was about to pop (must have been 9 months pregnant), so we basically served ourselves the whole night which wasn't a problem.  She hardly came around to check on us, but when she did she seemed so annoyed that we were still there (think her shift had ended already).  The one good thing I can say is that they have a huge selection on the menu.  I was really craving a gyros sandwich.  Not bad.  The fried chicken looked good, but apparently had no seasoning on it, according to my mother-in-law.

I guess they're known for their cakes.  So I went with my future mother-in-law to try cakes for my bridal shower.  They've got a small bakery area set up where people can just order a whole cake or by the slice.  Their selection ranges from strawberry shortcake to the Quincy's special (just a mix of a chocolate cake & strawberry shortcake).  We tried the Quincy special...not so special-dry & too sweet.  Also had the carrot cake, not too bad, not too sweet, light cream cheese frosting but the cake was a bit too heavy for me.

So overall, service is poor & the food follows suit.  Just go to Denny's.

We came in later in the evening, before they were closing and most of the staff (aside from our waitress.) were not friendly or welcoming. I ordered the alfredo fettuchini and it was more like overcooked and underseasoned noodles with butter and some parmesan.

For some reason..I like coming to this place with my family. 

I really like their gyros and I love their Tiramisu. 

They do give a basket of rolls & most of their lunch & dinners come with your choice of soup or salad (I really like their creamy soups...), choice of potato, then your choice of dessert. Pretty good price too!

I have always enjoyed Quincy's food. It is pretty good quality and the service for the most part was efficient. But one incident irked me. I was here for lunch while my brakes were being repaired down the street. I order a tuna melt deluxe (which I assumed came with soup because the waitress asked me what soup I wanted). I had to ask three times for the soup and it never came. I did get the bill and was billed for the deluxe. The waitress then told me that I didn't get soup. Needless to say I paid $9.50 for a tuna melt sandwich. I haven't been back since. It's a shame because their menu items are yummy but I don't like to be billed for items I don't order.

I always enjoy going to family style dinner and Quincys is by far one of the best in the Naperville area. Offering a large menu of different comfort foods at great prices this is one of my favorite restaurants to go on a normal basis. If you are looking for fine dinning by all means you are at the wrong restaurant. Quincy's is the place to go for burgers and the such. If you are into Potato Skins they are great here but be ready to take leftovers home because the portion size on them is huge. The wait staff and host here are always very friendly and I never feel rushed when I dine here. They are great on drink refills also. The bakery is also worth mentioning as they have a great cheesecake and bread basket here as well.
We love Quincy's for breakfast...we eat there almost every week!  The service is always good and the restaurant is always clean.
I love this place! The food and service is great! I am there at least 3 times a week .

We've been dining at Quincy's at least 2 or 3 times a month for the past few years.  And, the reason we keep coming back is because they have very good, reasonably priced food, great service, and it's comfortable and clean.  This is the only restaurant at which I will order a turkey dinner because it taste just like homemade.  Besides the turkey dinner (served on Tuesdays and Sundays) I also enjoy their soups, salads, the Athenian chicken breast dinner, and a variety of sandwiches.  Once I find a meal I like, I tend to keep ordering the same thing.  My fiance is more adventurous and his favorite meals at Quincy's are the Grecian Pork Chops, Quincy Burger, and he said the Gyros are the best he's had in the area!  And, dessert is complimentary with most meals.  They bake and sell their own bread, rolls, and delicious cakes, pies, and other desserts.  My favorite dessert is their cheesecake.  In the fall, try their pumpkin cheesecake - it tastes even better than the pumpkin cheesecake I had at The Cheesecake Factory!  I highly recommend Quincy's for breakfast or a casual, comfortable lunch or dinner.

First, I know almost nothing about the cuisine of India, but am trying to learn! This is the place to do that, because:
1. The menu is very extensive, as is the buffet.
       - huge selection of apps / small plates and lite / regular dinner portions, all generous.
2. Anthony, who has been there every time my wife and I have gone ( ~ 6 times) will spend
 time answering questions, making suggestions, and adjusting the heat if desired. He is a great person to help people trying to learn the joy and savor of spices new to us.
3. Decent quality wine selection.
4. The spices and ingredients are unique  for western European descendants like us.
Do not assume the location in Naperville Plaza (always plenty of free parking) takes away anything from the fine food, service and value. 

We live in the West Highlands and can walk to dine..........another plus!

What a treat to find a place offering a malai kofta dish, let alone one that made me want to lick the bowl clean. My whole group loved the food & will be returning.  Try the biryani, the flavoured naan or, of course, the mughlai malai kofta. Our server, Anthony, was just the right amount of attentive.  Tasty galub jamun.
PROS: Pick your own level of spicy/hot, from nothing to WHAP. Great selection of choices. Lots of vegetarian options.  Easy parking. Great service. Biryani is buy one, take one home with huge portions.
CONS: Ambience is just OK. 
OVERALL: There are numerous Indian options in the Naperville / Aurora area, but this is now my favorite. Yes, it is a strip mall location, but the food and service were the best I've had in the suburbs and many Chicago places. I'm so pleased they do take-out! 
TIP: This really does spice according to what you want, so don't be afraid!

Just enjoyed a great lunch here. Though the strip mall exterior is not all that inviting, the restaurant is quite nice inside. The napkins, glasses, and place settings made us feel like we were at a wedding.

We were expecting a lunch buffet, but it turns out that's only offered on weekends. Sometimes it's nice to order from the menu though, so we didn't mind changing gears. I especially like that their dishes are served with rice. Something about paying $4 or $5 extra for rice every time we go out for Indian food is bothersome, and I really can't say that this place built the cost of rice into its dishes, since I'd say prices are on par with similar places.

The tandoori chicken was delicious and well seasoned, and my son and I enjoyed the butter paneer. The naan was just okay...more like pizza crust than the buttery goodness I've had elsewhere, but it did its job as a vehicle for extra sauce.

We'll certainly be back, and I appreciate the Yelp checkin discount we were able to use.
Pretty good, will try to cater from the restaurant some time for work!
I'm SO GLAD we stopped by here! The service was excellent (Anthony is GREAT), and the food- outstanding. We'll be sure to be back.

It is really a good place to hang out with good ambiance.one thing I disliked the most is they propagate buy 1 get one free (the cheapest one) every wednesday.I ordered 1 full goat dum biriyani and took 1 full deccan special chicken biriyani as complementary,obviously paying for the goat biriyani  (as it is of higher price).The quality of rice and taste was good but there were only 4 goat pieces with 90% bone and 10% flesh.I should not expect this type of pieces when I am paying for this dish. Moreover when I call the restaurant to understand if that is the standard of pieces we should expect,thay say it should vary from 3-5 pieces depending on size and do not believe on my facts.

So please be aware of oder in goat biriyani at the place and if so pls validate.

I am one of those really aweful people who look to reviews but dont take the time to write one. So, here's my first review.

I hail from the land of Biryanis so for me Biryani has to be perfect. This means, the chicken should be juicy from inside with a fried glaze from the outside. The rice should not be overcooked or undercooked, but flaky. And achieving this perfectness isnt easy!

Moving on, Biryani needs to be spicy but not overpowering with the spices. And I personally like my Biryani to de dry and not oily. Now, Biryani is literally Chicken cooked with rice and you may be wondering why I am getting so specific about the consistency of the rice and chicken, and the spice level- well, these are the only two things that separate a great biryani from a not so great Biryani!

So, 5 stars for the chicken biryani. Its just Perfect! My husband loves goat biryani but I cant speak to that as I haven't tried it yet.

I also love their yogurt rice(stunner), veg pakoda, fish appetizer (forget the name, but it was on the buffet), and chapattis (yes, yes! they are good. I ordered the no-oil chapatis)

Deccan spice is a fantastic restaurant for Indian food. Their buffet carries a variety of options.
My 2 cents: Drop items like uttapam, idly, hot and sour soup and chat. Not that they are bad, but  for a restaurant that excels in Biryani, make sure that people dont get blurred by the array of offerings and pick something else over Biryani. This may especially be true for first time tryers.

Good Luck and please preserve the awesomeness!

Not very well versed in Indian cuisine, I will make this short. 

Been to Deccan Spice twice, once for weekend lunch buffet: big selection of food at $12.99 (?); the other time for dinner. 

You can find biryani in every Indian restaurant but I heard Hyderabadi biryani is most famous and Deccan Spice is supposed to feature Hyderabadi cuisine. The fish biryani I had here are spiced very differently from the Indian restaurant across street from my house, and spicier too. Both my friend and I liked it, and the portion is huge. 

The chicken curry we had was a little too mild on its own (we requested mild I think?), but a welcomed relief from the spicy biryani. 

Service was good, ambience nice.  

P.S. We bought a Groupon in November 2015 but was told they had issues with Groupon so anything bought in December or later would not be accepted. Consider yourself warned.

Atmosphere is very nice!  Service was excellent  Food was incredibly flavorful with nice portions and nice presentations.  The reason I am not giving a 5 star is because Deccan tacks on a 15% service fee to the bill, which we were told is separate from the tip.  It will make me think twice about re-visiting.

Great Place, Awesome Food, Excellent Customer Service

First time dine-in experience.

Great 'Hyderabadi' twist on the popular Indian dishes.

Will definitely be coming back.

Anthony, our server was excellent. Great attention to detail. Pleasant, polite and genuinely concerned about our dining experience.

Highly Recommend this place.

Absolutely UNREAL experience ordering from here via grubhub tonight. After waiting an hour and a half for delivery, I called the restaurant, who advised me that they left our food outside our door and didn't try to ring the bell. I walked outside. No food. I called the restaurant back and said there was no food outside. The person I spoke with, Anthony, then began to get very loud and demanded that I was wrong, the food was outside our apartment building door, and the driver took a photo of it to prove me wrong. Despite me standing outside and no food in sight, he just rambled on and on about our (nonexistent) "happy holidays!" sign and that he's certain his driver will prove me wrong.

I called grubhub livid about this situation. They called the restaurant, who advised they'd sent the driver back out to show me where the food is. It's freezing cold outside. I wait. Finally, a lovely woman comes walking up to me with her dog - to advise she found a bag of food at her door, checked the receipt, and brought it to me. I live at 519. She lives at 503.

I called grubhub back to demand some sort of action for this $100 bag of ice cold food left errantly at the wrong house. They call the restaurant and Anthony advises them that they've already spoken to my husband (whose number they don't have and who never called them?) and he said everything was fine so I shouldn't get a refund. I advised that was a 100% complete fabrication. They called the restaurant again who finally conceded and agreed to refund me the total (almost $100!) of the cold, abandoned food. 

The way I was screamed at by the restaurant, their driver's willingness to leave food at the wrong address, and not to buzz or call when it arrived, and their subsequent lies to me and grubhub are all reprehensible. 

Don't order from here. I will never stray from Indian Harvest ever again.
Delicious Indian food!  Great variety and very friendly service.  We are very happy we found this place and plan on returning!

I spent a couple of days in the Chicago area and had dinner one night with Uncle Mike.  He suggested Deccan Spice in Naperville, which was close to both of us.  I was hungry for Indian food anyway.  I was hoping for a good experience since this is so convenient when we visit in the area.  I was not disappointed and would say it was better than a couple of other comparable Naperville places where I have eaten.

We started with Chili Shrimp.  These had decent flavor and some heat.  I liked them OK, but would look for another appetizer.  The Shrimp get lost in the spices.  We ended up with two chicken dishes to share.  The Chettinad Chicken Curry was very good, cooked with an array of traditional spices and some tomato.  The masala included a little cinnamon.  I would certainly order this again.  Our other choice was the Andhra Chicken Korma.  It was a typical Korma dish, creamy and mild.  We liked them both but agreed that the Chettinad Curry was more interesting.  Neither was particularly spicy hot, but I'm thinking the Chettinad would be good to order on the spicier side.  They have a very nice selection of breads.  Our order of Butter Naan was delivered as Plain Naan, but was fine to scoop up the curry with.

Our service was very helpful and attentive.  The restaurant is pleasant and nicely appointed.  I look forward to a return visit with a larger group so that we can sample a broader range.

Second visit and just as good as the first!  Excellent customer service (even the owner came over to ask us how everything was) and THE BEST Indian food in Naperville, bar none.  We will be back to try their buffet next!

Had dinner at Deccan Spice recently.. Seemed like an obvious choice given the park nearby the restaurant had the 4th of July fireworks display.

We were started off with roasted papad and chutney. We ordered chili paneer that was really the way we like it- hot and spicy with soft paneer. We then got the tomato soup which didn't disappoint.

Main course was egg curry with naan. Now, I have never been impressed with any egg curry I have had in the Chicagoland area but this egg curry definitely stood out. Not only that, they have many varieties of Egg dishes, which is awesome. Can't wait to try them on our next visit.

The service was extremely courteous the waiters seem patient and helpful and the person that seemed like the owner/manager also took our yelp discount and honored it.

All in all a great experience at Deccan spice, we will definitely be back!

This is my third time(delivery) ordering from Deccan and I figured its time I wrote a review. Food is EXCELLENT, and now I find myself craving good, authentic Southie food once a week! They don't always have the all dishes I want, but honestly they also always substitute what they don't have with something equally great! I wish I knew about them sooner!The Chettinad Chicken is one of my favourites , and so is the any of the fish dishes. Currently slowly, but surely making my way thru the entire menu :D

My new favorite indian restaurant. Modern casual dinning area with welcoming hosts. The chicken tikka masala was seasoned very well and the tandoori chicken used in the same dish was very juicy. We also had the saag paneer, samosas, and the chicken biriyani.  All were cooked perfect and seasoned much better than your standard indian restaurant. Highly recommend!!!

Tasty, authentic food. Mastery of both South and North Indian cuisine. The sambaar and dosas were delicioso. We went for the lunch buffet and were blown away by how great it was. These guys aren't phoning it in - they care and ask if you need anything during your meal. I was definitely surprised by the low key atmosphere, but the place is new and word probably hasn't gotten out yet. As an Indian, I hate most "Indian" restaurants that cater to the lcd dishes and truly appreciate the few masters of their craft who put out amazing new dishes that are inspired and exciting. I don't eat out in the burbs very often, but will def be going back to this place.
Finally!!!! best chicken biryani I've had in a long time. Must visit if you are in the Naperville area.

Visiting my parents for the holidays and was craving Biryani. We decided to try Deccan Spice as they boast they have the best Biryani in town. Tried the Goat Dum Biryani today and it was NOT GOOD for the following reasons:

- not flavorful like Biryani is supposed to be
- barely any meat on the bones. I asked for extra meat when ordering but was assured there is plenty of meat in the regular order. NOT TRUE. Only 5 small pieces of goat and each one was 80-90% bone. Deccan needs to either add more pieces to each order or use better pieces of meat
- The meat is DRY does not fall off the bone like some other better Biryani places.

Can't speak for any other dishes but based on this experience I will NOT be returning to this place again. Definitely NOT worth the $15 price tag! If you are a true fan of Biryani do not order the goat.  Chicken is better.
Love this place!!!  The food is always Amazing and the staff is so nice.  Everything we have tried has been great!  Definitely a hidden gem!

Tried this place a couple times. Just another Indian restaurant. All the hype about best Briyani in town is very not true. They had good variety in the buffet but the food was not flavorful and authentic. All of seemed to taste the same. Hope things get better!!

Excellent food. Ordered Egg curry and Kaju curry and Vegetable Dun Briyani and Hot and Sour chicken soup. My daughter who is a picky eater loved the egg curry.

Definitely will visit again!

New place , lot to learn but quite satisfied no regrets.
gobi manchurian is one the best i had in States must try, Biryani not upto the mark as it claims to be their specialty but not that bad either.
Over all mixed reviews, I will go again once it has grown enough with experience. 
PS: Veg biryani was a disaster so veggie folks dont even think to try it there are other options on the menu to try but this.

So we happened upon Deccan Spice tonight because they were on Grubhub. Didn't  really know what we were doing as far as Indian food but hey, it's something different than the same lame late night delivery choices. Let's do it! Ordered fairly randomly except for Samosas. We knew what those were. We got Tandoori Chicken, Schezwan Fried Rice w Chicken, Onion Pakora, and Samosas. The Onion Pakora is basically an Indian version of an onion ring, but with more thought put into it. They were good but not outstanding. Everything else was amazing! The rice is highly recommended. A lot of effort put into presentation too. Fresh vegetable garnish with everything. Tandoori Chicken was very good. We'll definitely order again.
Amazing food! I don't know who's the chef. I love the okra and tandoori chicken really awesome.....Deccan spice great Indian restaurant highly recommended

My wife and I went for dinner to this Retaurant and mostly loved our experience. Food is good but please ask them to make it mild. If not you are dead. Food is very hot especially the Chilli chicken. Nice size servings and very friendly service. Apollo fish and chicken biryani are good. I would like to go back and try lunch buffet next time to sample other menu items. Again food here is hot for Indian people, non-Indians make sure you go mild. Your stomach will thank me later.

Wow really great Indian food!  Delicious samosa, butter chicken,curries.  Need to specify "mild" otherwise super spicy!  Nice little hidden spot in Gartner plaza.  Only critique would be that almost all the meat dishes contain nuts.  They use a cashew paste to help thicken the sauces.   Those with nut allergies should be aware of this when they order.  

I had to amend my review of this place from 5 stars to 4 stars to 2 stars.  While the food is very good, I am extremely disappointed with how they handled nut allergies.   My son is allergic to nuts - but not severely... he can generally eat food when the labels say "contain traces" and we are not a nut-free home.   When I ordered food from here I was told that cashew paste was used as a thickener in most dishes.   I asked the manager what foods did not have nuts (as long as nuts were not an ingredient in the dish, he can eat it).   I was told that the vegetable curry and the egg biryani that I ordered were nut-free and he could safely consume.  

Fast forward 2 hours and we are in the emergency room with my son having an anaphylactic reaction to the egg biryani.  I further looked at the dish and there were whole cashews and other nuts mixed in with the rice (although it was very hard to tell bc the rice was all different colors and there were other veggies mixed in).  Needless to say my son got very sick and we ended up at the hospital for several hours while he was treated.  

It was extremely disappointing how this restaurant handled this.  I would have greatly preferred if they told me that he could not safely eat ANYTHING because they weren't sure about the contents rather than assure me that dishes did not have nuts when in fact they did.  They might be better served to have a more detailed description of the food - including highlighting those that have nuts so that they can be avoided if necessary.  

As much as we enjoyed the food here, we will most likely not return.

Great food! Great food! Great food! If you like Indian food this is the place. I personally love the okra and the chicken curry. Cooked to perfection. There are other great dishes, those two were my favorites. They do serve alcohol, which is a plus. If you haven't tried it, you're missing out!

I went to this restaurant for Saturday lunch buffet. Horrible experience. No quality of food and taste . But expensive . Not sure how long they can survive . I DO NOT AGAIN. 

zero star rating .
Deccan spice is great Indian food, some of the best that I have had in naperville area, highly recommend it
Had an amazing time coming to this restaurant for lunch. The owner was super helpful and catered to all our requests and ensured that our food was fine.

What little I've had of Indian food I've liked, but admittedly I've not had much experience. So perhaps this is what chicken curry is supposed to be....cut up in small pieces with bones not removed, smothered in sauce? I found myself eating very gingerly around what little meat there was before I finally gave up for fear of choking. The flavor of the sauce was good though. Probably won't go again. My daughter had the Tandoori chicken and the portion seemed small for what we paid.

Excellent lunch buffet.  Great variety of items that were fresh, flavorful and not oily at all.  Yogurt rice was as good as the family makes it and chicken lollipop was juicy, crispy and and very well seasoned.  Deserts were not overly sweet or heavy and the service was great. We will definitely be back!

Went to the restaurant on a Friday afternoon. Food was horrible. Not much items, no taste. Completely bland. The restaurant people should try to taste the food first before putting a price tag and asking customers to try it. The card machine does not works. Will never ever recommend anyone to come over here. Stay clear from this place. Better stay hungry than eat at this pathetic little excuse for a restaurant. If I could give anything less than 1 Star I would surely have given the same.

Excellent Indian food and very nice service.  I eent with some of my american friends and they loved it too. The spice level ie varied according to our pallette. Very nice authentic indian food place.
Hands down - The best Sambar Rice ever! Comes close to the MTR bisibelebath.
We recently ordered the food for about 60 people and it was a huge success. The hyderabadi dum biryani was authentic and very fresh, We also loved their Kadai Paneer and Qurbani Ka Meetha.

Had a good experience.  I had a fish dish in a sauce that was just spicy enough.  Full of flavor.  Enjoyed immensely.  And I can tell when something is fresh or full of additives.  If it is full of artificial ingredients, I will have reactions anywhere from a half hour to 8 hours later.  Not one reaction.  To me, that is HUGE!!  So that means I found a restaurant I will be happy to return to as often as I can get there.
Awesome food! Very tasty and good service. We had  butter naan and kofta. They were yummy

Very nice lunch buffet on a Saturday. Nice and complete selection of very good South Indian dishes. We will definitely repeat the experience. Favorites were chicken 65, chicken curry, nice tomato chestnut,

I have been a fan of Indian food since way before it was trendy, I love it so much that I had to learn to cook Indian so I could have it often enough without going broke. In particular what has always impressed me is how Indian cuisine can take vegetables I don't like and make them taste heavenly and yet still be healthy.  This place is about as good as Indian gets, my wife and I are regulars here.  A very nice variety, both menu and buffet, and especially interesting and unusual vegetarian items on the buffet.  The buffet is a great deal at $12.99, with some things I've never seen on a buffet anywhere else, including bhindi pulusu (okra in tamarind gravy, highly recommended) and saag vegetables (mixed vegetables with spinach) as well as the usual tourist favorites tandoori chicken, murgh makhani, paneer makhani, tikka masala, biryani and other similar. (The reviewer who thought the buffet was expensive and not a lot of variety should probably stick to Burger King).  The dishes are spiced appropriately spicy, though they'll ask how spicy it should be, and the staff is appropriately attentive without being pushy.  The portions are nicely sized.  This isn't the rich touristy kind of Indian but the healthier kind, lighter on ghee and relying more on the subtlety of spicing, which is as I think it should be.  

Anthony, who seems to be the manager, deserves special mention.  He is very personable and helpful in explaining the menu and buffet items. I've learned a lot about Indian cuisine from him already and hope to more in the near future.  

Don't miss this place!

Came here when I was in the area and used their buy one hot dog get one hot dog free promo. Pretty good! Really cool old school 1950's hot dog place decor inside with red leather plush booths, old school jukebox, and local pictures of the DGS Football Team for their booster club.

Food came out really quick and piping hot. I got a standard hot dog with onions and ketchip, and onion rings. Your standard steamed bun with vienna dog and huge rings. Dad got the same but with crispy fries. Fiance got the sausage sandwich with hot giardiniera.

Really cute local joint, check it out if you're in the area!

I was hanging with a coworker today and we were looking for a place to have a quick lunch.  When we checked our route he saw that Teddy's Red Hots was on our way. (He got so excited, like Will Farrel in Elf when he sees Santa.)  So we went. I had a hot dog, fries and a Sprite.  It tasted just like every other hot dog, fries and Sprite that I've had at every other hot dog stand I've ever been to.  So I'm not sure why he was so excited.  He did say they had great Italian ice and he ordered one and seemed to really enjoy it.  Me?  I wasn't feel that adventurous so I was good with just eating my average hot dog and fries.

If I wasn't starving at the time and pressed for time. I would of stopped coming here two years ago I came here on a week day around 2pm. It was raining and dead inside. Like I said I was starving. The grey haired old fart w the Blackhawks jacket was playing on his phone ignoring me updating his facebook or doing something gay like playing Pokemon go while I was standing there for at least five minutes. No one was in the place totally dead. The Mexican cook was looking at me like ya this guy doesn't give a fuck are you going to walk out? I should have. Well 20.00 later a beef combo w no fries and an Italian ice. Holy shit I did not know I was in Beverly hills. Dont get me wrong it's good food but cmon. Waaayyyyy overpriced and after that stunt by Gramps I'm done w this hotdog stand.
Italian Ice, any flavor, the best in all of Chicago land.  Just do it and no one will judge you if you get a side (large) of cheese fries too!
Stopped by this place two days in a row while on my visit from California. Great variety on the menu. (Pretzel Bun Burgers!) Quick service and the custard cones were great.

It's always clean and food is consistently good. 
That's all I ask!
This place is great. Super clean, great beef, awesome sausage. They also have fantastic italian ice. On par with Portillos with a better sausage in my opinion. Highly recommend eating here.

I can't believe this place charges $20 for a large fry , a combo and a shake. They have lost the after school trade and must not care about the community they are in when they make it a point to dismiss the working class from being able to afford to eat there. They will never get my business again. 

I can get get a 7oz. Angus beef steak with asparagus, grilled onions a baked potato and a glass of wine for $20 at my favorite restaurant and it be completely satisfying.

This place is full of itself and a once coveted award that means nothing now, there living on a faded reputation and living in the past. Your way to overpriced. If you want value for your money and one of the best combo, beefs and frays, go to anywhere else. Try to accomplish something new Teddy!

If I could give less then one star I would

Another fantastic lunch! And got my free hot dog for checking in. Thanks teddys. 

I love the fries here. My usual hot dog lunch. The black cherry italian ice is the best. 

I love the updated decor. New booths and tables. A nice fresh look. 

Started eating here in 2000.  Still my top spot for downers grove 63rd and main.

Outrageously expensive. I would of given 3-4 starts based on their food, but the cost made it almost impossible to enjoy. My boyfriend, my 8 year old son and myself stopped by there for a late meal. 3 sandwiches, a lg frie, 2 milkshakes and a pop cost us $49. For that amount I expected the portions would be large. My eight year old son easily finished his Italian beef himself. And the beef was just ok. Definitely not Portillo's quality and being that it's pricier than portillos, I expected a lot more. I do enjoy the milkshakes but for the cost of $5.99 for a medium, It's not worth it. I would of been better off going to a sit down restaurant where I would of been served. Sad because the food isn't bad, but I will not be stopping here again. Just flat out not worth it. Especially when there are so many reasonable Italian beef joints around the DG area.

I really had a taste for a cheeseburger today. So I ordered a double, not knowing how big they were. No french fries though. The total was $10.27. I wasn't planning on spending that kind of money today especially on 1 double cheeseburger. However, it was totally worth it! It was big, juicy, and just hit the spot! Perfect!

Very consistent,  very good food quality.

Little over priced but they do deliver consistent good food, kitchen staff is fantastic.

Stopped by here cause of the Italian ice sign. The parking lot was empty as well as the dining area. The inside was inviting and looked recently renovated. Digital menu and all. 

They had four types of Italian ice available: lemon, banana, raspberry and orange. We got a traditional lemon and raspberry in a medium. The total was $10 which was surprising since we were recently at Jonnie's Red Hot in Melrose Park and for two large is was $6. And I thought Jonnie's could have charged more for their ice cause it was that great. 

Lemon ice was kinda weak. I didn't like that it had small chucks of lemon instead of large wedges. The raspberry was amazing. It was so refreshing. If it was a hot sunny day instead of a stormy day it would have been 10X more awesome. 

Would go back if I was REALLY craving it. But in my opinion a bit overpriced.

A treasure of hot dog stand favorite as well as some tasty new items, Teddy's Red Hot is worth s visit . Cozy booths face the picture windows and a view of Main Street. Noted for excellence in Italian Beef , Sausage and Maxwell Polish - Teddy's does it all! Friendly neighborhood feel, VERY clean with fresh well prepared foods- I will be returning yo Teddy's. note: there is something for everyone from Carnivore to Vegan!
Love all the guys at Teddy's! DG staple. Great Dogs. Philly Cheese steak is a must! Fries and O Rings rock. Don't forget the itl ice in the summer.
This our Christmas vigil eatery. We even took a pound of Italian Beef home. Beats Portillos hands down!

Love the food here. I have been coming here since I was little with my family. I recently moved back and me and my wife went in for lunch a week or so ago and it's still as good as I remember. My wife love the Italian ice always asking me if we can go back just for that alone.
Consistently good, always friendly service. Some of the best Chicago beef around, but their other items are quality as well. You will spend more, but it is worth it.
Was very good. The Beef as great and so was the black cheery it. ice. We will be back.

Teddy's has some of the best food around! My personal favorite are the chicken nuggets. Made to order and come out piping hot. 

Whenever I'm home from school, I always make sure I make a stop at Teddy's!

Food was a 5 star, really. Sadly however... The service was so sub par that I would have put no stars if Yelp would allow it. Imagine if you can the "Soup Nazi" from Seinfeld... Me and my buddy walked in and immediately were treated like complete nincompoops by the cocksure lad behind the counter. Him and his gimcrackery gold chain can dangle around the poor review I leave. And for Pete's Dragon... He displayed how basic and petty he was when he corrected us on how an Italian Sausage is not a sausage.

When we first arrived the place wasn't so bad, but then we went inside. The prices weren't horrible but the quality was not worth it. The system of ordering is you can get certain things on your food "upon request" but ofcourse, that's in the fine print. Secondly the cashier was rude. Halfway through my order I decided to take pickles off my hot dog and he rudely yelled to the cooked and said that I changed my mind about the pickles. Food wasn't horrible but could stand to be improved. The cook watched up eat and made us uncomfortable. Soft drinks tasted watered down. I definitely won't be returning any time soon.
Great food, best place to get a burger, sausage and beef in the suburbs! Also great staff, will always go to teddys for pretzel burgers.
i ordered a hot dog for my 4 yr old, asked for them to do make it kid friendly.  this is what i got. wtf

I grew up just a few blocks away from Teddy's and they've always been awesome. Cheap and delicious dogs, huge fries, and the Italian ice's are the best in town. You won't be disappointed unless you're a Scrooge.
This place has the best Italian ice around and much better then Marios on Taylor street !

Best beef period, beats the competition. Italian ice is great. Prices have increased slightly since the remodel but still worth supporting local business and enjoy a great beef sandwich in a small diner.
bad food, bad service. rude host.

Got out of the kitchen prep fairly late, and we were hungry for some fast food greasy dinner.  Decided to check out Teddy's Red Hots about an hour before they closed because we did a search for gyros.  To note: they do NOT serve gyros at this location... =(

But while we were there, figured we should get some dinner nonetheless.  Ordered up an Italian beef and a hot dog.  

Italian beef:  Tasty, and one of the better non-chain beefs in the burbs.  Didn't have any peppers with it, and the beef was a bit salty... not a homerun, but a decent double.

Hot dog, Chicago style:  A good dog, and an enjoyable   The dog is done right with the correct toppings for a Chicago style, but nothing truly stands out about the dog.  Solid Chicago dog.

Strawberry shake:  Strangely the most expensive item on the menu, and since it's served with a larger straw, we polished this before we even made it home.  It's a decent shake, no real fresh strawberries or anything, but the flavor isn't overly sweet (like those who pump way too much syrup) so it was enjoyable.

For these three items (no fries mind you), we paid about $18.  The food was solid, the price point is a bit high for my personal tastes.  

Verdict:  A-OK.  That's it.  Really.

After not having gone to Teddy's for several months, I just ate there and paid $10 for one hot dog, fries, and a drink with tax.  Outrageous!  It's getting to the point where I can't afford to eat there anymore.

The food is still outstanding as usual, so I'll let Teddy's keep the 4-star rating.  But I wanted to post an update to give people an idea of how expensive this place is.

If the prices were more reasonable I'd give Teddy's 5 stars, no doubt.

PS: Why are some reviewers in here saying that Teddy's "doesn't put celery salt and sport peppers on their hot dogs"?   They do, it's just by request and the cashier almost always asks if you want that stuff on your hot dog.  

Get your facts straight if you're going to type out reviews, people!  False information is a disservice to us all.

I went in at 8:55 on a Sunday and saw that they were only open until 9, so I turned around and was going to go somewhere else, not wanting to be that guy that gets there right before they close. The guy running the place waved me in, so I ordered a Milkshake and a chicken nugget basket. 

The chicken nuggets which are real chicken tenderloin pieces with a light breading were amazing. The fries were pretty good and the milkshake was great. I will be back.

First of all, the place is no longer the dive I've read about in other reviews.  It's obviously been remodeled recently.  

Food was good.  In fact, a great hotdog!  I didn't even mind that they don't wrap the dogs up with the fries (the best sign of a hot dog jernt that knows it's stuff).  

Anyhoo, great dog, fries were crinkle cut, but stil good.  Where my 2-star rating comes from is the price.  Jesus Christ Zombies!!!  2 hot dogs, small fry, small Pepsi....ready?  $10.71!!!

What the Jesus, Mary and Joseph kind of overhead do you have where you got to charge $10 for a couple of hotdogs? 

Oh, and the seemingly 'couldnt care less' attitude of the guy behind the register didn't help with the rating....older guy, grease-backed hair, gold rings...I'm guessing the owner.

Dear Owner, we lovers of a true Chicago style hot dog don't need the bank of  LG high def screens displaying the menu...we need to get a couple dogs, fry, and a pop for under $10....well under!  You charge $2.79 for a hot dog, wrap a fistfull of fries around it!  Don't charge me another $2.19 for a fry that took one $0.50 potato to produce.  

I'm done.  Cross this jernt off my list!

It's hard for this cheapskate to give 4 stars to a place that is over-priced, but all the food was pretty dang good.  I got a cheesy beef, small fry, and medium shake and the total was about $18.  This place makes Portillo's look cheap!  Anyway the food was tasty and honestly I might be back, or I might not.  I'd really have to get a serious craving for it.

The food here is top notch. The facilities are very clean. The staff is friendly. You cannot ask for more. The food is very, very good in my opinion. I especially enjoyed the Italian Ice. Independent businesses like this need to be supported. Believe me you do not want our neighborhood to be taken over by large franchises and chain restaurants, While they have their price wars the quality of the food continues to get worse at the big chains. Stick with the smaller guys that offer quality over price. I will continue to support businesses like this.  I hope this place can stay open for another 30 years! Places like this are why we live in one of the most culture rich spots in the country. If the food is good and you enjoy it, give them repeat business.

The standard hot dog stand that has remodeled and presumably needs to recoup the cost.  Took the family [wife and two small kids] out for some dogs. $38 and some odd change later for three hot dogs [plain and without buns for the kids] and a beef I wasn't impressed. Walked out thinking I could have went to a sit down restaurant such as home run inn just a few blocks away and paid the same with a server. Food was just maybe ok. And yes,  there is a creepy owner type looking over the seemingly criminal empire he built. I believe I saw dollar sign reflections in his eyes. I rarely say this,  but here goes...  I won't be going back ever. Hate saying that. If you go,  I recommend doing the math before ordering and don't say I didn't warn you!
Good chicago style hot dog, good Italian beef. Italian sausage with sweet peppers was excellent. Ok atmosphere, not terribly friendly. I'd go back. Prices are high.

Went here a LONG LONG LONG time ago for a hot dog special. I was partial to my local hot dog stand, Smoke House, but this was awesome when I had it when I was little! Grandma and Grandpa grew up around the corner! I've also been to the sister location in Darien for a gyros! Thanks to Dan B. for letting me know...my memory is a bit foggy of hot dogs and gyros nostalgia! 

Anyways, John Kass mentioned this in his newspaper column today and it brought back a ton of memories of my FIRST CHICAGO STYLE HOT DOG! it was from Teddy's!

Love this place!! Been coming here for over 10 years. The guys who work here are awesome! Super friendly and they get to know you right away. Within just a few visits they remembered my order and always offered me a cup of water even when I didn't ask. The food is amazing whether you order hot dogs, fries, burgers, Italian ice, etc. Never disappoints. All in all, a great restaurant, and I'd say it beats Portillo's any day.

Was excited to try a good Chicago style hot dog from here but no.  It wasn't good.  My husband said his steakburger was good but not worth the price.  We liked the crinkly fries a lot but still not worth the price.  They are very expensive and the food is just ok.   Would make the driver farther and go to Portillos next time.

The food really is pretty good, as are the shakes but I simply refuse to pay their ridiculous prices. I've read a couple of the reviews on here praising them for their food and reasonable prices, but I really don't know what their definition of reasonable prices are. Lunch for my wife and I came pretty close to $30 for beefs, fries with cheese and shakes. That folks is a rip off! And yes, the guy behind the counter with the slicked back hair is a complete douche.

I was looking for a good dog and fries and thought I would try out this local joint.

When I ordered 2 Chicago dogs, the greased back hair guy behind the register asked me if I wanted everything on them...   After me getting confused about what that meant i ask him "What everything mean?  I don't want everything,  I just want what is supposed to be on a Chicago dog."  He then points to the 8 LCD TV displays and says its up there.  It took a while to find where it was, and it wasn't everything available to put on a hot dog, so I tell him the ingredients I want.  Horrible service.

When I got my food, I was also curious as to what kind of dogs they used as I didn't see any signs around saying Vienna or anything of the sort.  They say they are, but the taste wasn't really what I am used to.  The buns also don't have the poppy seeds which was a disappointment as well.

Overall, these are below mediocre dogs.  The fries were decent, just like Portillo's.  Fresh cut would be much better.  Price of this was ridiculously overpriced.  About $11 for 2 dogs and a cheese fry.  I had water to drink.

I will not be going back here for hot dogs that is for sure.

There are better places for dogs.  The places that come to mind are Portillo's, Scooby's and Beef Villa.

Rated a 1 star for quality of food/service/price.

Almost $17 for 2 pizza Puffs and 2 cheese fries? Who in their right mind charges $1.39 for a cup of cheese. $3.99 for a puff?!?  What a joke. I'll never order from here again!  Cozzi corner is way better.  Shame on your company for these outrageous prices!!!!!!

Just a little bit South of the intersection of 63rd and Main Street in Downers Grove lies a little place called Teddy's Red Hots. It has a small attached parking lot, but a decent amount of seating and is an overall clean restaurant. In going into Teddys I decided to try the hot dog with everything, fries and a drink. 

The hot dogs I received came on a regular non-poppy seed bun. The bun was fairly soft but did not appear to be steamed. The hot dog itself was skinless and slightly longer than a normal Chicago style hot dog, it was well heated and had a good flavor. The pickle used was a thinner pickle spear, it was a bit on the sour side but fortunately not too thick. The tomato chunks used here however were on the thick side and were a bit too much for the hot dog. The sport peppers used weren't too hot and added a nice flavor. I didn't detect any celery salt on the dog, the onions were applied well and I liked the fairly sparring usage of mustard and relish.

The fries included were of the crinkle cut variety. They had nice crisp outsides and soft insides, they weren't too greasy but were a little light on salt. Overall these were decent fries but something extra (cup of cheese) might be needed to enhance the flavor here as without the salt they were a tad bland. 

Overall I liked both my hot dog and fries at Teddy's Red Hots. I'd recommend stopping by if you're in the area, it's  by no means the best hot dog you'll find in Chicagoland, but it's better than average.
I just paid $9.50 for a hot dog and a milkshake and I don't know why but that makes me angry. Waste of money, the hot dog wasn't even that good. Fries are extra! Who does that and why??

Teddy's elevates red hots and Italian beef to the level of gourmet dining. I've never had tastier selections at such affordable prices. What distinguishes Teddy's from the competition is the consistently fresh nature of its food, both the sandwiches and the vegetable toppings. Even the french fries taste like fresh, hot meals unto themselves.  Also noteworthy: the chicken breast sandwich, hamburgers, milk shakes, and Italian ice. Once you've sampled the red hots and beef, explore the entire menu -- I promise you will not be disappointed. Moreover, the service is consistently friendly, and the atmosphere is clean and inviting.

The most overpriced place I've ever been. Went there yesterday and paid $14 for a tiny cheesy beef, fries and a Pepsi. The beef was probably half the size and half as good as Portillo's. Fries were ok. 
Don't know why this place is so expensive for the tiny portions of average at best food. 
Maxwell's down the street is better and has better prices.

Good chicago/illinois traditional dogs and Italian beef. Order a dog with everything on it and you won't be disappointed. The Italian ice is great and i'd like to try their burgers soon. I've tried alot of hot dogs and this place stacks up, but I've had better. The environment is small and steamy, and the crowd mostly people grabbing a quick bite on lunch break or something.  Nice little spot if you're passing by, great local grub if it's down the street.

This place is a stones throw  away from my house and I've been going for years. There Italian ice is the best around hands down. Even better then the other teddys on 75th. They are always fresh and hot and in my opinion way better than portillos any day.

Good place for Chicago style hot dogs, they even served it on a pizza bun for me. Ingredients were solid, but the entire concoction was really oily/greasy. Their Italian ices were a hit though. I recommend the mango. 

To sum it up, it was good but not spectacular, and the food added up to more than what I would like it to. The place is also really small and you will probably smell like the food if you dine-in.
Been going here for years and will continue. Great staff and environment. Get the custard! Yum

Rude staff and way overpriced to the point of ridiculousness!   Chicken nuggets with fries is $9.00!  Lemon italian ice is so expensive that it needs to be awsome for $5.00....it isn't.  Save your money, drive to Johnnies beef in elmwood park and experience a Real Lemon ice and Italian beef!  And forget buying beef by the pound here...2 # plus a loaf of bread is $38!... buy it down the road from johnnies at sorelli's in oak park for $20.

Stopped in for lunch.  Had the Cheezy Beef w/ sweet peppers, fries and small pop.  Spent $12.42!  Pretty expensive for mediocre food.  The beef was better than I've had at other non-chain places, but lacked something in the taste.  Not worth $6.99.  Cheese was lacking for a "Cheezy Beef".  Sweet peppers had little to no flavor, some were under cooked and crunchy.  Fries were basic frozen, crinkle-cut fries.  Nothing special, but not horrible.  Small drink for $2, was more like a child size.

Guy at the counter seemed like he didn't want to be there.  He could've at least smiled a little.  Cook was even worse.

Probably will not be back.

When you're in the mood to carb load this is the place to go!  

What can I say, great beef sandwiches -wet of course.  Crinkle cut  fries, more well done light salt, made fresh to order.  A custard shake or malt - why not both...
