While I'm loading, lets add the burger on a pretzel bun and an Italian Ice.

How can you go wrong here.  30 lbs in 30 days, no problem.  
Don't forget to take a lb. of  Italian beef home for the midnight nosh.


Sometimes has Groupons.
Small place, new décor in process.
most delicious food ever! Best Italian beef. Homemade Italian ice. Great burgers. Newly remodeled and the place is looking great. The owner is Super cool too! So is his brother.

Hot dogs were good but the price is just not justified. $23 for 4 hot dogs 1 order of fries and 2 drinks is obscene! The fries tasted like cardboard. 

Some other people mentioned that these are Chicago style hot dogs. These are NOT Chicago style. There is no poppy seed bun, celery salt is extra. 

Overall, there are better, cheaper options for hot dogs, Chicago style or not.

Way overpriced. Combo  sweet and hot fries and a coke $14.97. 2 hotdogs and fries and a coke around $11.00. They make portillos look cheap. Scratching this place off my list.the food is ok. I heard they are on groupon so they have to raise the prices 
To discount them.

What a great gem in Downers Grove!  We called in our order and it was ready for pickup in less than 10 minutes.  The restaurant itself is rather small - and you'll likely come out smelling like the food, but sometimes that's not a bad thing. ;-)

My wife and I both ordered Italian beef sandwiches with a single order of jumbo fries and a plain hot dog for my son.  

We'll have to return to try their Italian ice.  Looks like it'll be a nice summer treat.  

Hope to return soon!
Overpriced and severely disappointed in the hotdogs
Food here is excellent. Never had a bad meal and the people who work there are slightly odd, but who isn't these days.. This place is pricey which is the only downfall.

This place has the best beef sandwich I've ever had.  The cheesy beef is great with sweet peppers, and the red hots and hamburgers are very good as well.  The beef is high quality, bursting with flavor, and they put a generous amount of au jus on the sandwich.  It is sliced very thin, and practically melts in your mouth.

The prices are on the high side, but are worth it as most of the food items are much better than competing places.  But if you enjoy a good beef sandwich, definitely check this place out.

I just went here for the first time about 2 weeks ago and have returned twice since then.  I've been to the other Teddy's in Darien, which is very good as well, but I was way more impressed at this Teddy's.  The service is friendly and excellent.  The pretzel buns are delicious.  And the homemade soup is so good.  The first time I went there they had beef vegetable soup and I decided to pass because I'm not a huge fan of beef soup.  But they gave me and my girlfriend a sample and it was so good that I had to get some.  The fresh ingredients make a difference.  Had the Chicken and rice soup yesterday and I was very satisfied.  They'll be seeing a lot more of me.

One of the very few beef stands that really lives up to the hype. The food was a home run with great value and friendly service. Day 1 I did a wet beef and soup that was so good I came back for day 2 dogs. I would go out of my way to try Ted's and cycle it into my lunch rotation.

If you're going to charge exorbitant prices for food, it better be darn well worth it. Unfortunately, at Teddy's, it's not. WAY too expensive for substandard food. Went once, will never go back again. I can get a burger, fries & drink for under $5.00 elsewhere that is outstanding.

3 1/2-4 stars for me. This place is one I've passed many times over the years. From time to time, I would stop in and grab a bite. So I decided to return today (Groupon and all) for another visit. The place is small but not cramped (there are about 10 tables and a counter near by). 

Now this review has a mixed bag.
The bad or disappointing- price. Now I understand about inflation and business costs but $6.99 for a char cheese steakburger ($7.99 if you want a double; almost $2.00 more than most of the competeition)? $2.50 for a regular onion ring? The "P" word is also the drink of the house w/ Dr Pepper being the other alternative. A bit more expensive than I last recalled. Add onion rings or fries and a drink and we're easily over $11.00. 

The good:
- The counter person was VERY polite.The food came was ready pretty fast as well. In fact, the staff were all very considerate.
- The polish sausage was very good (from what I recall). It's about 1/3 lbs (pretty good sized and plenty of onions if you want them). 
- Onions rings were nice, hot and crisp.
- The char cheese steakburger was very good but a bit more expensive than I would hope. So this review will be the first that has 2 part rating. 
Burger Rating for taste= Monstrous-Beast (4 1/2), Burger Rating for the price= trollish-mortal. 

Food was very good but the price was a bit more expensive than I expected. Specials rotate on a daily basis. Dial the prices back a bit and we'll talk.

Teddy's beef sandwiches, shakes, and fries are by far the best around. I have never had anything I didn't like there. In addition to amazing food they have great customer service. This is fast food done at a whole new level.

I love Teddy's - everything here is good.  This place has one of the only Italian Beefs that I think even come close to Portillo's and in the summer the Italian Ice can't be beat.  However, I do think that it is overpriced.  Other area hot dog stands are much cheaper. Not to mention that everything is ala carte here and you will pay extra for just about everything (peppers, cheese, etc).  But when you really want a good Italian Beef or a good hot dog, Teddy's is going to beat anyone else in the area in flavor.

If you want really good food then this is the place. I have been going for about 15 years. I you want good food that is always good every time then go check them out. The cheese burgers are so delicious, along with the hot dogs. The cheese fries is just icing to the cake. They have really good milkshakes but don't get them because they are so good that you will be addicted. My favorite is the strawberry banana! The owner always asks if you were your food is good, which it always is. You just have to go try it, but be careful because it is that good.

I've been coming to Teddys for years and all I can say is this place is amazing!  The place isn't much to look at but that brings some character to it and you don't come here for the atmosphere...  You come here for the food!

Teddys has all the classics from a red hots joint on the menu including hot dogs, char burgers, nuggets, polish, and fries.  For some sweetness after have a home made Italian ice.

All in all, this place has perhaps the best food of its kind in the western burbs and I would argue even in the Chicagoland area.  It is worth more than a try.

Cheers.

The man who usually rings people out (the owner) is a jerk. He usually has his chest hair on full display. The food is overpriced. Did I say overpriced?.... I mean Way overpriced.  Go to maxwells on 63rd and Woodward for cheaper and better quality food.

I have kind of a love - hate relationship with Teddy's. First, it is overpriced. I spent about $8 on lunch for one dog , onion rings and a drink. The rootbeer in particular is very pricey.

Next, the place on first appearance has some old time charm like a 50s diner. However the place is pretty beat up with wobbly tables and lumpy seats.

Having said that their dog are among the best Chicago style hot dogs that I have ever had.

Go there if you just got paid and you're not taking anyone from your family or on a date.

Well I pass this about every other day (between me and my Cardinal Fitness).  So I stopped in with my parents. I figured that they needed to taste Classic Chicago food and I didn't feel like finding a portillo's. Plus I knew Port's is a little over priced, so why not try this place?

Abrupt service. . .too be expected? They were not patient with my Hoosier parents.  Italian beef sandwich. . .tasted good. Hot dog is nothing special.  I mean really? If you can't grind your own dogs why serve em? Fries were a-ok.

Price  .eh still a little pricey for what you get (hot roast beef sandwich with au Jois).  I like it, don't get me wrong, but $4.79? eh. . .

This is the best place for hot dogs, fried and especially the shaved ice! The flavors are all delicious and fresh. Just order it without the top (even if you are taking out, and he'll fill it really high!!!!

I've been going to Teddys for 15 years and amazingly it's the same people working there. George, with the George Hamilton suntan, is usually the manager on duty and really makes everyone feel like they are Norm walking into Cheers.

The Italian Ices and Polish Maxwell Streets are my favorites and standouts on the menu. They make a good beef and hotdog but not on par with Portillos, but close. 

It's efficiently run so there is little waiting and the dine in area is simple, clean and always has a ballgame on.
the food was great! however, the meal for my husband and i was a bit pricey. the mixed berry italian ice slush hit the spot!
Same good taste as I remembered from years ago, but wow! It's expensive for a hot dog joint!

Totally had my first date here. No shame. I'm a simple gal and my boyfriend knows that. It's a small little place on the corner of 63rd. I've had their hot dogs a couple of times and have never been disappointed. There isn't much seating, but people mainly come here for take out, not really to sit down. Though they do have nice coat hooks at every booth for those that want to check out the ambiance. One of the things that sets Teddy's apart from the rest is that they have Italian ice. Only one place will ever make the best (Mario's on Taylor St. See review), but since that place is only open during the summer, I'll give Teddy's the runner-up spot. They have it all year round and have a few different flavors. I'll always go lemon though. I do like that they have those lemon pieces in there. Gives the ice a little more zest and pop to it. If you're in the area, this is a good stop for a quick bite, or a hot date.

Since our first date, D has been complaining about how much he misses Chicago style hot dogs.  He'd wistfully say, "On a poppyseed bun with quartered tomatoes, sport peppers, relish, onions, and, mmm, celery salt.  Ohhhh celery salt."  And then he'd do that thing where he kisses his index and middle fingers together with his thumb.

The hot dog wasn't the best hot dog I've ever had in my life, but the toppings were great.  Be forewarned that Teddy's Red Hots only has regular buns and doesn't have celery salt, so D and his dad bring their own.  Ohhh celery salt.

The fries are also pretty decent, but the reason for the four stars is the Italian Ice.  Typically in the Bay Area, I'm hesitant to order one because it's a glorified SnoCone.  This Italian Ice was anything but.  Wow.  We had the black cherry flavor; the ice was finely crushed and mixed with real cherries and tons of sugar so it was more like sorbet.  The flavor was spot on and I almost ate the entire order by myself, swatting away D's spoon while battling frequent brain freezes.
Have been going here for years and always have a great time. The Italian beef is very tasty and the hand battered chicken nuggets are awesome as well

The food at Teddy's is good, especially the Italian Beef and Philly Cheesesteak. However, the employees were rude and acted as though they were doing me a favor in waiting on me. How is it that the RIcobene's and Bacci that were on 75th Street folded and this place is still in business?

This place is seriously overrated and expensive. I spent 11 dollars for hot dog, small fry and beef. The hot dog was average, and didn't have celery salt or sport peppers. The fries were below average. The beef was pretty good, as were the hot peppers. But id prefer Portillos.

Chicago hot dogs couldn't be better!  I've been coming here since I was a kid, and it's a great place to come whenever I visit the area ever since I moved.  I love the hot dogs...it's the only thing I get.  Oh and the cheeeeese fries = yummy!
Good food but ridiculous prices

Grew up in dg and my parents still live there. We have stopped going to teddys for the last 5 years because he is out of control expensive. 
We got to maxwells on 63rd street for better food and half the price.

Dogs and Beef are great.  They make it quick and they make it right.  While there are many places around to get the same fare (Maxwells, Portillos, etc.) what really makes Teddy's stand out for me is their Italian ice.  You can tell its homemade, its got real chunks of fruit in it, and it is the best I've ever had.  I've never been a fan of their burgers, but they have enough items to keep me satisfied.
Way over priced for a hot dog stand. fair food at best. will not go back. $6.00 for a chezzy beef!!!!!! $2 for a med drink.$4 dollars for a double dog! they are nuts.

On my way home from work, I always pass this Teddy's Red Hots. I'm always sad when I do so, for two possible reasons:

1) I've passed the place, and the rest of the drive home consists of me realizing that I'm NOT going to be eating one of their great hotdogs when I get home

2) I've gone in, GOT one of those great hotdogs (and a small french fry and a melted cheese cup), and I'll have to work on the treadmill the next day a little bit harder.

Parking is good enough. Not a whole lot, but every spot is within 30 seconds of the front door.

Inside, the place is clean enough, and the guy at the register is always nice and friendly. My order rarely makes me wait more than a couple minutes, and the price is solid for what I'm getting.

The taste of the stuff? Well, I love their hotdogs. Juicy, tasty, although a little small (I don't know if they really ARE small, or I just want to eat more. It could be either.). Their fries are decent enough, and their portions are very large in that respect.

Bottom line: a great place to grab a great hotdog at a good price.
Wayyyy overpriced. More expensive than Five Guys. Malt, burger and fries will easily cost $20+. No thanks.

I've been  looking for a good beef since I moved to the area, found it! Just had a great wet sloppy beef just like I ordered it! Most places never get it wet enuf for me LOL. Only been there once so far, they were very fast and friendly and I will def be back. WAY better than the over rated Portillo's!

Very expensive($6-$9 for a sandwich without fries and a drink ) and tried to use groupon on Father's Day.  Cashier was rude in telling me I can only use 1.   Thought I would try them since my place in town was closed.  Will not be back way too expensive.

I heard about this place so I thought I'd give it a try. I ordered the cheesy beef with peppers and the medium strawberry peach Italian ice. I did not order fries or any additional sides yet my bill was $13.11 for the two items. I though there was some sort of mistake. I thought the Italian ice was pretty good but the beef was just OK. This place is overpriced.

This small awkwardly placed 1950's Hot dog greasy spoon is the best food of its kind in the Downers Grove area.  They make an excellent hot dog or cheesy beef.  The Italian ice is the best in the burbs, (the lemon and black cherry surpassed all the flavors they offer in my book.) It is not the Italian ice that crappy restaurants hand out in paper cups...It is clearly home made with chunks of the fruit inside of it. The restaurant has little retro booths, tiles, décor and a jukebox.  They also used to have a sit down pac-man machine which would give them a 4 star review all by itself in my opinion.  The restaurant is normally a 6 out of 10 as far as clean goes, but that's what you get when you go to a red hots place for a hot dog.   They do have bathrooms, and those are also probably a 6 out 10.  The same few guys have been working the cash register for about the last 20 years....they are friendly but look like the kind of guys you wouldn't want to fight in an alley.  

The must order @ Teddy's you ask? The cheese fries.  They are perfect.  Crinkle cut fries and the perfect cheese dipping sauce.  The large fries are enough to feed a family of 3 or 4.   Don't forget to get an Italian ice!!!!
Been a fan of Teddy's for years. Awesome cheesy beef and tasty shakes. Just tried the new pretzel dog and I highly recommend.

The food is great. The double cheeseburger is awesome. The Italian Ice reminds of a place I used to go to as a kid on the South Side of Chicago, with the little chunks of real fruit, near perfection.
But the prices here, way too high. Over 7 bucks for a double cheeseburger? I won't be going there again until my wallet gets a little fatter.

If you're about your redhots....then let's have a true chicago dog. They dont put celery salt or sport peppers on the dog...at least give me a poppyseed bun. They're pretty expensive too...do yourself a favor and drive a couple miles down the road to Portillos. You're welcome.

Easily the best value for your money. Teddy's is justly famous for its red hots, but the place also has the best Italian beef in Chicago. The relatively new Philly steak sandwich is remarkably good. Fries and onion rings are tasty as is the Italian ice.
Absolutely the best Chinese food I've ever had. Highly recommended. We had Mongolian shrimp and Mongolian chicken. Prompt deliver and reasonably priced!
Great  Chinese food at very reasonable prices. Always a good experience! The beef lo mein  and house fried rice are wonderful.  The crab rangoon was delicious and lite.

Food was great! The veggies were crisp and fresh, the shrimps were jumbo sized and perfectly done. Sauce of the 5 dishes we ordered were not salty nor sweet. They were just right. I ordered extra spicy in one dish and it was also perfect. Serving size per order is good for 2. Very reasonably priced. I live 2 miles away and it took only 16 minutes for my order to arrive.

Best chinese food around bolingbrook!! I always get shrimp fried rice and i tell them to make it spicy ( which taste AMAZING!) Crab ragoon and sweet aour shrimp also the shrimp thai fried rice are soo good!! The prices are soo reasonable and they give you tons of food im a regular customer just loveee their food!!
This place is alright. Not the best fast food chinese but decent. Mongolian beef was okay but their noodles were less than okay.

Placed a carry out order of Lo mein noodles & the (zu yan beef or something like that)... Beef platter was good but I was VERY disappointed I received half burn noodles. Safe to say I'll stick to my usual chinese joint.

Best Chinese food around! Absolutely delicious, and the lunch specials are an awesome value (and are even available on the weekends) The owners are also very friendly and accommodating. I have one child who is Gluten Free and one who is a Vegan, and they have been more than happy to work with me to make the necessary changes so my kids are able to still eat the foods they love!

This place is our go-to for Chinese takeout. My husband and I tried it because we live two minutes away, and we were so happy when it turned out to be good because Chinese restaurants can really be hit or miss. This is a hit. We get the Mongolian beef (which is actually the best we've had from anywhere), the shrimp with vegetables (the shrimp is always perfectly cooked), pork fried rice (they give you a ton) and eggrolls. However, I did order the Pad Thai once and was very disappointed. Stick to the Chinese menu and you should be good.
Excellent Pad Thai, and a good value. They have a variety of Chinese and Thai dishes, and I have not been disappointed yet. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait on busy nights, but it's worth it.

Some of the best Hot & Sour soup ever--lots of Tofu, veggies & mushrooms. Be aware there's pork in it, too, and if you're allergic to seafood, there's baby Shrimp. Mongolian Beef was good, a little on the sweet side, which I like, and a good balance of meat/onions. The lunch special portion is huge. mostly fried rice, but with egg roll a deal at under $6. Haven't tried their Thai menu yet, but that's the plan.

Dirty with slow / poor service.  

No an open view of the kitchen (need transparency)...

Taste of china is much nicer, cleaner and has an open view of the kitchen.

I have been going here for years and the food is great! Lately they have dropped on service though as I currently sit here for 30 mins when I placed my order well over an hour ago. They told me it would be a few minutes.. 25 minutes ago. They need to address that or just be honest with me so that I don't sit here wasting my time.
Excellent food.  By far the best fried rice around.  My favorite is the Kung Bao shrimp fried rice.  Friendly with a smile every time my order is taken.

I decided to try this place for the first time and I was really disappointed. I ordered a beef fried rice and their Sesame Plate (combo platter of egg rolls, fried shrimp, crab rangoon, bbq pork, teriyaki chicken, and teriyaki beef). The fried rice was good, nothing out of the ordinary, but overall I was satisfied with the fried rice. Not so much with the Sesame Platter. The crab rangoons and fried shrimp were good but then it goes downhill from there. The egg rolls seemed a little heavy on the vegetables, not that its bad, just not to my liking. The bbq pork and teriyaki beef, two of my favorites at a Chinese restaurant, were the worst I've had. The bbq pork looked and smelled good but after trying a few pieces it tasted like the smell of dog food. I hate to use such a harsh description but it was so bad I spit it out and couldn't even force it down. I decided to move on to the teriyaki beef with high hopes, and again was disgusted. First bite I tasted some strange sauce on it. Maybe it somehow made its way on while another dish was being prepared but it definitely was not teriyaki. A few bites in and there was no texture or substance to it. It was mush. Not soft, not tender, but mush like a firm mashed potato. Figuring it was a bad piece I spit it out and tried the second piece and it was just a bad. I didn't even bother with the teriyaki chicken.

After all is said and done I would have no problem with their fried rice, and its the only thing keeping it from falling from a 2 star to 1 star rating, but I would not go back just for an order of fried rice, and their combo platter was an awful sampling of their appetizers. I will find somewhere else to go the next time I want Chinese food.
Great take out! It's all good. Usually get Mongolian Beef and Chicken Cashew and egg rolls are yummy! Take out only. Not a dine in restaurant.
I live right by this place, and I can definitely say it's the best Chinese food in Bolingbrook.  The food is also very inexpensive, and they have good lunch specials.
I had the hot and sour soup and the salt and pepper shrimp.  It was good.  Nice personality of person taking order.

Yes I do love this place but its not just for their crepes... both the owner and the hostess were going above and beyond hospitality, right from suggesting (not being pushy) menus till explaining the tax break they offer to customers. 

Fan of their fries, spinach artichoke crepe and DO SAVE some space for dessert crepes (must try)  with coffee. two thumbs up!! 

Only downside I could see is that its very small eatery and can be quite a bit of a wait during peak hours.. but its totally worth it. 

These guys earned a regular customer for sure!!

My friend and I met here for brunch, But D'licious is so much more than a brunch spot.  Lunch, dinner, or just a snack, the menu covers everything.  I wasn't so sure how crepes + Indian food relate, and honestly, I'm still not sure what the two have to do with one another.  But the crepes were definitely D'licious so I'm curious about their Indian fare too.

I had the ham and cheese (gruyere) croissant which was really good.  The crepes are a generous size.  I was tempted to order their truffle fries, but the crepes are a good enough potion that you don't really need a side.  I would order another savory crepe without a second thought!

Since we spent a decent amount of time here, we also ordered dessert crepes.  I ordered a Nutella & banana crepe.  I was actually served a strawberry & Nutella crepe.  I didn't complain or send it back because I do like strawberries too.  But the strawberries made the crepe too watery.  There wasn't enough Nutella in the mix to sop up the extra moisture either.  My friend had a cinnamon crepe, which was filled with icing, and that looked like the better choice.  But for me, I'd be a little gun shy about ordering another dessert crepe, especially one with strawberries or fruit with a high water content.

The marbled hot chocolate (white and dark chocolate) was both a beverage and dessert, so I definitely got my sweet tooth satisfied.  They also have coffee, lattes, and Coke products.

The Indian side of the menu lists items like samosas, roti, and something called Bombay fries.  We didn't try any of the Indian food, but it all sounded really good.

There is seating inside and outside at this casual downtown Bartlett cafe.  There's a downtown Bartlett?  It's near the Bartlett train station, and the downtown area was pretty sleepy on a Sunday morning mostly surrounded by dry cleaning businesses, medical offices, and other businesses that don't really grab your attention.

We went for lunch over the weekend and were not disappointed . The ambience is lovely but a little cramped (hence a star less). Loved the music and the food.
We ordered the Bombay fries( I love thin cut fries so this was the absolute fav), chicken tikka kathi roll and samosa burrito. The portions are filling.(wanted to try the sweet crepes too but no more space left on the device ;) )
Will go back just to try the dessert crepes.
I would suggest the owner to add some sort of a salad or fruit as a side just to give some brightness to the dishes. After eating for a while the palette becomes monotonous.
All in all a nice place to hangout with friends while enjoying good food.

Wow. What a great local restaurant! I have been wanting to try DC&R for almost 2 years, and finally got the chance.  It's a cute little cafe, with indoor and outdoor seating. The menu has traditional sweet and savory crepes, but in a delightfully unique twist, it also features Indian flavored rolls and burritos! What a fantastic fusion!!! 

I ordered takeout over the phone. When my mom and I walked in, we were immediately greeted by a hostess who quickly stepped behind the register to pull up our order. I had ordered the Indian items; Nihari Kathi roll, chicken Tikka Kathi roll, lamb vindaloo burrito, butter chicken burrito, and samosa chole chat. The Kathi rolls have scrambled eggs, the burritos have rice.

Every single roll I had was delicious.  I was impressed with the authentic flavor of the Nihari beef. My favorite was the butter chicken roll because the butter chicken sauce had mixed with the rice. It was delicious!! 

The roti (bread) used for the rolls was perfectly soft and fluffy. 

I cannot wait to go back to try the sweet and savory crepes. The offerings are mouth watering!

Family dinner was perfect with its French-Indian Cordon Bleu Crepes, Chiken Tikka Katti Rolls and Bombay fries (best fries ever!). And we ended the night with a smiling Tuti Fruiti Crepe dessert which was way too adorable. I only wish my 5 month old could enjoy this as well! So cute! We will be back again, especially for the Mango Lassi. 

The owner, Rakesh personally serves and greet you. He was polite and courteous as well as the rest of his staff. This is what local business is about and I'm so proud to be a patron. I'm so glad they re-opened. It was fate. Every penny spent was worth it and felt good here! Highly recommend this place. I hope it will always have this kind of hospitality that deserves a gold star!

We were going to check out the new O'Hare's location, but apparently the opening date had been pushed back even further. We were walking around and stumbled upon this adorable crepe and coffee place. When I looked at the menu, I noticed they also served Indian street sandwiches as well as delicious gelato. They had all my favorite food in one restaurant. Since I couldn't decide Indian burrito or crepe, my boyfriend ordered a crepe and I ordered a paneer makhani roti burrito thing. We also ordered Parmesan truffle fries with an aioli sauce. Everything was so delicious, I had to be rolled out of the door! The owner and wait staff are super attentive and friendly. We also ordered a banana and chocolate gelato milkshake to go. I highly recommended trying this place out!!

We ended up coming to this gem on a Friday night around 8:15 or so. I was a bit skeptical as it closes at 9, and generally speaking, this is about the time you open yourself up for food poisoning at any restaurant. How ever, we were pleasantly surprised about about the entire encounter with Indian food at a French place. 

I was a bit apprehensive at first because I didn't understand the concept. We walked in and there were murals of the Eiffel Tower and peacocks. Odd. We sat out selves at a very small bistro style table and looked around the joint. 6 or 7 tiny tables inside...4 or 5 larger ones outside...fairly clean. After looking at the menu, I decided to get the chicken tikka kathi roll and paneer kathi roll. And the Bombay fries. Nothing was French about this meal other than the FRENCH fries. Ok that was a stupid joke. But seriously, the menu was extensive and there was a lot of French sounding items. A lot of crepes and what have you. 

Our food came of out and the rolls were HUGE. Not like the nyc kathi rolls that one may be accustomed to. This was more like a burrito. Before i get to the rolls, I must comment on the fries. Possibly the best fries I've ever had in my life. Better than McDonald's, homie. They were French cut...hehehe, and topped with a masala. I thought it was black salt sanchar, but it was jeerala or something. The rolls were pretty good as well, but there was room for improvement. Mind you it was 45 minutes till closing time and perhaps a better experience might we have had an hour before. Don't get me wrong, they were pretty damn good. All I kept saying was how clean everything tastes. It was just a clean fresh flavor. The chicken and the paneer could have been 20% more juicy, but everything just tasted very clean. 

Around 20 minutes into our service, the owner came out to talk to us. This is always a great sign. He told us he used to own a place at U of I. He told me he owned a crepes place in Urbana and invented a liquid roti recipe he can feed into the crepe machine. He catered to the Indian crowd there and then decided to open up this place in his home town of Bartlett after his lease ended in Urbana. 

Pros. Super Clean and friendly. 

Cons. Small. Mosquitos. Closes at 9. 

Sorry for the abrupt ending to this review. I gotta go now.

I will absolutely be returning and absolutely recommend to others. 

Get the FRENCH fries! Haha. Ok I'm done.
Highly recommended.  Delicious. Very friendly customer service. My children really loved it too and that is a hard sell for both of them to like the same thing having such different taste buds.

Absolutely excellent food. 

The savory crepe was delicious and excellent. Fresh herbs baked into the crepe itself. 

My favorite was the signature ham and cheese crepe. The recipe is unique to me, and the herbs on top were supremely fresh. If you like a ham and cheese omelet, order this- it's like an omelet, only 1,000 times better.

The coffee is imported from France, and we had a lovely cup of French press. 

The owner came to our table, introduced himself, and told us all about their coffee.

It was a delightful experience. I highly recommend!

Stellar food here!  I got a recommendation to come here a while ago and have had the place saved on my phone since.  while still being relatively cheap, the crepes taste gourmet and the portions are large.  not to mention, there is a wide variety of items in the menu.  between my friends and me, we had a Greek, buffalo chicken, and D'licious (their signature) crepe; all were very good.  lastly, I give much praise for the serving staff and the decor & music, as they both made for a comfortable atmosphere and a relaxing brunch.  my only complaint is that they open at 9.  I prefer a little bit of an earlier breakfast.

as a side note, this pace would be a good one to come and study at for a while.

column4: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column13: I finally gave in and decided to try this little crape restaurant. Service is friendly. I had the cesar chicken crepe and it was superb! It was more than enough and flavorful! Next time I shall try dessert crepes :) I had the chai masala latte and it was delicious. I guess, i shall come back again.

A different and unique concept of Roti Crapes. Loved the food and the service. We ordered the Bombay masala fries (very chatpata test) and roti paneer tikka burrito. I say this place is a must try at least once.

Delicious homemade food, cute decor, friendly service. Nice outdoor patio seating, wish they had more tables though. There's only 3 so there tends to be a wait if u want to sit outside. Plenty of indoor seating though. Came here with my 14 month old daughter on a Saturday morning. There is a bit of a wait for the food to arrive because it's cooked to order. There's no fast food here! But u can order ahead to go if you're in a rush. 

Super fresh ingredients! The seasoned tator tots are so yummy and their homemade garlic aioli dipping sauce is delicious. My daughter and I shared the Tutti Fruiti crepe... the fresh fruit and Nutella filling was amazing! I order a steak, egg & cheese crepe to go to take home for my hubby. He ate it hours later and said it was the best breakfast crepe he's ever had! Their food is on point.

Stopped here for dinner while walking our dog. Sat outside & owner even brought water out for our dog. Cinnamon crepe & nutella/banana crepe were great as always. Great service too. We love coming here. Nice variety, from breakfast to dinner choices.

Perfect. Absolutely perfect. Occasionally you come across a purveyor of food art. Rakesh is exactly that. A hospitable restaurateur who genuinely cares about the quality and presentation of his food and is personally interested in his patrons having an enjoyable experience. You've read the other reviews - just get yourself here now and enjoy the outdoor seating, artisinal entrees, and the best Iced Chai you will ever have.

This place has been my favorite. It has been my family's lunch destination for the last 4 Sundays after church. So far. Everything we tried was good. My wife and I's favorite dish is the Viva la crepe. Check this place out. The food is really good, the prices are reasonable and the staff and owners are really friendly and make you feel like your family. I seldom post reviews and in fact this is the first review I have written in Yelp. This place deserves a 5 stars!

I recently revisited here after its reopening and I was still impressed. 

We started with two iced coffees, which were perfect on a hot summer night. I got a savory gluten free crepe and my hubs got the lamb vindaloo. 

Both were so flavorful and filling. I wanted a dessert one too, but I was too full!

Please please please visit this place and go back multiple times!

Looking for something different from the run of the mill breakfast or lunch experience; then be sure to check this place out. It's clear the owner takes pride in his food. The crepes are large and bursting with flavor. I went for the spinach artichoke with chicken and it did not disappoint. Only ate half so I could save room for a dessert crepe. Also large enough to share with a friend. Outside seating available to enjoy in nice weather. Owner is hands on and very attentive during our visit. He brought a complimentary coffee beverage to our table as we lingered in conversation. Nice surprise.  No batch coffee here! Each cup made to order. Or and order a plate of truffle fries to share as a side with your lunch. One thing I noticed is the plates are plastic and a bit large for the small tables. I guess you need large plates to hold the large crepes.

one of the best places I ever try. come and try some nice French coffee.........

......
...

This was by far the best crepe I had for lunch:  I had the Spinach & Artichoke (see pictures); it was amazing.  

I like my coffee with cream, but the Cafe Americano was so smooth that I did not want to ruin it with cream.  They bring their coffee (Cafes Richard) from France!

The owner, Rakesh, is a very nice person and really values your dining experience.  If you are visiting out of town, just follow his recommendations, you will not be disappointed.  If you live in the area, well... I suggest you try everything in the menu :-)

I live in Wisconsin, but luckily I use O'Hare for most of my travels!  I will certainly stop by anytime I am in town!

How did I not know about this BYOB place sooner?!

The service here is the best I've had, bar none. I believe the gentleman helping us was the owner, he absolutely insisted on giving us top quality service.  He began moving tables together for us unasked, helped us move outside because it was nice out, helped us back inside when the mosquitoes found us, etc etc, all without missing a beat.  He was very attentive without ever being a bother.  (Yes, for the negative nellies out there I know that's how it should work anyway, but it's rare to get all that with a smile on the person's face and a friendly, helpful personality too!)  He made sure my friend and I had the best possible girls' night out. 

THE FOOD THOUGH!!!

I was debating between dishes and he helped me select the cordon bleu crepe.  Juicy chicken, nice chunks of ham.  The spinach, tomato slices, and balsamic glaze drizzle they add was the perfect thing to brighten up what could easily have been a too heavy dish.  I added a side of super yummy truffle fries.

SO GOOD. 

For desserts they have a nice selection of gelato, I got the salted caramel.  Mmmmm.  It was delicious, I would go back just for that!

I'm already trying to plan my next visit and I live nowhere near this lovely little restaurant.  Do yourself a favor, grab a bottle of something you like and head over there for a great meal in a super lowkey setting.

I ordered the Tandoori Chicken Burrito along with masala fries. All of the food was freshly cooked, but I just didn't understand what they were doing with the flavors - there was a variety of them but they just didn't soak into the food. It all tasted very bland. 

The fries had no taste, and I didn't like the sauce it came with. They had spices on them already, and I tried dunking them into the sauce that I didn't like, but the fries still had no taste.

When I first got the burrito, it looked great. I poked a knife in it and steam was coming out. I then tried a piece of the chicken and it was good - very well cooked and had a good amount of spice  to it (ordered it spicy). But then I started eating the burrito and it was just very plain. All of the ingredients tasted very fresh and were great individually, but they just did't come together. The issue was the rice and the roti that was used to wrap the burrito. Neither of those had any flavor, so when eating the burrito all together, the flavor from the chicken got lost and the flavor from the sauce just didn't soak in with the rest of it.

The people working there were great and the food was fresh and well cooked, but it was the flavors they used and how they used them that I didn't like.
The food here is outstanding!  Great staff and service! If you get here and they have the duck confit stuffed crepe...get it!  Absolutely out of this world flavors!
I do not give 5 stars. This is my 1st ever!  Food was so tasty and prepared with great care and flavor. The coffee is to die for.

The food is very delicious! 
The price is fair!
The service is friendly!
The owner is very nice!
I love their food!!

It's been a couple weeks and I decided to bring grandma here for her birthday.  Grandma is a very fussy eater.  Hates onions and garlic so I was a little nervous.  She had two cups of coffee which she said took her back to when she had visited France over 20 years ago. She had the ham and cheese signature crepe and I had the spinach and artichoke crepe.  Once again you did not fail to impress.  She LOVED her food.  Great job guys, keep the yummy going.

Today we finally stopped by here and had a wonderful experience. We got the Viva la Crepe, the Black and Red (Nutella) Crepe, and the Delicious Sweet Crepe (Nutella, toasted coconut), marble hot chocolates and the iced caramel macchiato. The portions were huge but somehow we all finished our food/drinks  - prob bc it was THAT AMAZING...very flavorful and filling. I don't think you can go wrong here. Owner/Staff, everyone is great! I will definitely become a regular and bring my friends and family!

Just enjoyed a delicious meal here and topped it off with espresso machiatto. The owner, Rakesh, was very gracious and shared his inspiration behind this unique French and Indian fusion cuisine. Definitely check this place out and pro tip, order the masala fries!
This place is, quite literally, D'licious! I've ordered from this place a few times before and they are always on point. The food is excellent and the customer service is outstanding. Très bien!!!

Yum!  Very flavorful French crepes (and coffee!) PLUS savory Indian favorites - a fabulous combination. I've been here 3 times now recommend it to everyone. I've been told that they will soon start offering wine too. The staff and the owner Rakesh are great and the price is reasonable. My only improvement would be to at least double the size! Without the outdoor seating, there aren't a lot of tables and no waiting area.

Nice concept. Chickpeas, basmati ice and chicken tikka wrapped in a roomali roti, cant go wrong with that. My friends ordered nihari burrito and paneer tikka  kathi roll and were extremely satisfied and happy with the experience. 
Authentic lassi here was awesome as well. The owner, Rakesh was very friendly and nice.
And yea,, complimentary coffee.

I thought the food was really good definitely my kind of place, I got the sausage egg and cheese crepe and I thought it was AMAZING I definitely recommend it to every one and there smoothies are really good, and addictive.

My family and I love this place but because of the location the owner had to temporarily close (it's not hard to get to, you'd just have to live in the area to even know about it). It's open again and I'd like for it to stay that way so I'm writing this review out of self-interest. 

The food here truly is very good. I rarely like Indian food because every place I've been to prior the food tasted like it was mass produced, frozen, and then reheated in a microwave; i.e. it's always brownish, mushy, and what little flavor it does have is just bad. Here they do the super weird thing of making the food on location and per order, I know crazy right!?! Take note, other Indian places.

The paneer tikka saag is easily my favorite. But in case you're wondering the chicken tikka and butter chicken are mouth-watering good. Give this place a try and you'll soon become regulars like my family and me.

The #crepes at @DliCiousCrepes are just as good as the ones I had while in #Paris. The service was great as well. The place is cute and there is seating outside as well as inside. I can't wait to go back and try more. #SoGood #yummy #sweet #savory https://t.co/te9FSPSMTI

We stopped at D'licious tonight to get some carryout for dinner and I wanted to provide a quick update to help my fellow Yelpers.
Duck. Confit. Burrito.
It is so amazing. So well seasoned, slightly sweet, perfect. I would have eaten 3 if I had two stomachs and no wife to be embarrassed in front of. We split that one as well as a Chicken Tikka Crepe and a Beef Nihari burrito. That Beef Nihari is slightly spicy and has fresh ginger! This place has a big problem; how am I supposed to decide what to order when it is all so good?

We've been back a couple more times now so we've had breakfast, dinner and dessert there and time for a review update. As noted before the masala fries are EXCELLENT with their seasoning and dipping sauce (the fries are cut the shoestring style and cooked perfectly).  The various roti "burritos" are quite tasty and very large.  And the crepes! Oh my goodness...the breakfast crepes are huge as well and stuffed with chunks of fresh ingredients. Of course, you can't go wrong with any of the dessert crepes, either - they are all true to the restaurants name, D'Licious!

The staff are very friendly and service is fairly quick.  Their hot chocolate and coffee/lattes are very good, too. This is a great alternative for breakfast out to avoid the long lines at other more traditional breakfast places - and the food is fantastic!

Based on the reviews here, my husband and I checked it out Saturday morning 10/24/2015.
The ambience is trendy, clean and warm with great light jazzy-French music.
I had the Viva La Crepe-aioli, basil pesto, goat cheese, mushrooms and baby spinach.
It was much larger than anticipated, yet light.  Absolutely  fresh and delicious-a perfect
blending of flavors.  My husband enjoyed the Rumali roti burrito with crushed samosa-also 
a generous portion.  We shared the Bombay Masala fries-very tasty (he commented that they were the exact fries he had been served in Montreux, Switzerland. 
The service was friendly, professional and attentive.  Don't miss this venue-it's a cut above the rest. Although the portions were plentiful, you won't leave feeling stuffed and uncomfortable.
What a pleasant, fresh experience!  Can't wait to return!

Food, great. Wait, unbearable. This is not the place to go if you want a fast breakfast. The quality of the food however was delicious. I'll definitely come back again but make sure I allow myself about an hour and a half for the experience.

Excellent food and service.  So happy we discovered this place.  The kathi rolls were fresh, authentic and full of flavor.  Generous size portions and beautifully served. One of the best cappuccinos around.  Crepes were also perfect.  We will be bringing friends and family here often!

Wasn't sure what to expect but with five stars we had to try it.  We weren't disappointed. Had the Viva le Crepe which was excellent.  Finished with the Mascarpone strawberry and banana crepe. The portions are large, the quality is super and the price is very fair. Great service and a very friendly owner.  Highly recommended.

New in town and gave this place a try.. While the food is pretty good it was the service that stood out. The owner works every day and makes you feel at home. Nothing better than to have the owner visit your table and explain things and offer to help.  He even let us know about free coffee in the mornings.. I suggest the strawberry crepe with ice cream..

light but filling..

I am sad that I don't live in bartlet so I could come here more often. We were in the area at lunch time and decided to see what French Indian cuisine is all about - it's delicious!!!  The owner came and spoke with us and was so friendly, we were very impressed. Mango lassi, delicious!  Twee started w Masala fries- yum! The dipping sauce was awesome.  Then I had a chicken tikka burrito and my husband has a Beef burrito- great ratio of meat to rice, the raita really added to the meal. I wish there was one of these in Chicago we would be there all the time!  Well done!

First off I would give a 4.5 if I could because I don't give 5's everyone can find something to do better. That all being said this place was awesome. I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door and it only got better from there. Beautiful French Press coffee served with steamed milk and a biscuit. They took the time to review the menu items explaining all the different options. The truffle fries came out first cooked and seasoned perfectly. Then the savory crêpe's came out. Fresh ingredients, cooked perfectly hot, full of flavor. This was a great little find that I will make the trip from Mchenry to come back to.

Indian/French cousins? How do you combine these two kitchens? India wasn't even an French colony! France and England (India was their colony) are as far apart as it gets in the culinary world. That's what I thought to myself until we decided to stop by today. It sounds illogical but tastes great! In short, they made it work! I had a spicy burrito as and a hot sauce lover, I figured I'll get the usual bit of Tabasco or some other mild sauce. I was wrong! It was pleasantly hot. I wouldn't want it any hotter. My wife and son had crepes and they loved theirs too.

We will be back. I will bring others with me to show them what's possible if you think outside the box!

Indian, with a side of French. And delicious all around.

Because I could, I ordered the Samosa Chole Chat (technically a side) with Masala Fries, which are shoestring fries dusted with garam masala. My wife ordered a chicken crepe.

The service was overwhelmingly nice, and very positive. It's probably a good thing, too, since it can be challenging for a novice to navigate the Indian side of the menu. Also, consider holding off on your morning coffee so that you can try their chai; I haven't tried it yet, but it's definitely what I'm going back for.

My wife's crepe was good, but the samosa... I can't really summarize what was in it very well (chickpeas, tamarind... everything else, I have no idea how to pronounce or can't tell you what it is) but it is vegetarian and it is delicious, and yes you absolutely need to order it.

I'm on slightly firmer ground with the fries, which have a hefty dose of fresh garam masala spice and a side of tomato sauce (not ketchup!).

It's a full service place, but the food came out fast and with a smile. I have absolutely no doubt that I will be back for some more great Indian food.

Yum, yum! My favorite place to eat in Bartlett. The savory lunch crepes are my favorite lunch-to-go on my way into work once a week. The crepes are a very generous size (i can't even eat the whole thing in one sitting) and they are made behind glass in the lobby where you can see them being made if you like. All fresh ingredients are used. It's also fun to sit outside on the patio in the summertime. Come out and enjoy. These kinds of dining options are few and far between.
Pam J, the BookLady's Book Attic, down around the corner!

I loved this place! I really need to go back and try more things! I WILL go back!

I really liked the location of this place; It's really quaint. As soon as we walked in, we were politely greeted and told that we could sit anywhere. It was quiet and, for a couple of minutes we were the only people there. I think since it wasn't so busy they decided not to play music because I did see a speaker up above. The little restaurant is beautifully decorated with paintings of the Eiffel tower and Les Miserables on one side and Indian paintings on the other. Our waitress was so kind and explained the menu beautifully. The menu is half Indian and half French but crepe-like pancakes were infused into almost everything. They make the roti with the crepe pan as well leaving the roti thin but very flavorful. 

We were only going to get dessert there but after looking at the menu, I decided to order something to go as well. Our food came out quickly. We had the tutti fruity dessert crepe which was wonderful! We also ordered ice cream with it, which was exactly what I was craving. It came with bananas, strawberries, and Nutella. It was delicious! We then ordered the butter chicken to go. It came with green sauce, which made the meal all the better. Although it wasn't traditional butter chicken, it was delightful. 

Everything was super affordable and sounded super appealing! Our waitress also was kind in answering an unrelated question about what we should do after the meal. I can't wait to go back and try more things! I really want to try something off of the French side of the menu and also some of their breakfast crepes (eggs w/ mozzarella and aioli)! 

I highly recommend this place to anyone honestly; it doesn't hurt to check this place out!

After such a great experience the 1st time here,  I went back again with my parents. I love introducing people to new great restaurants. We ordered iced caramel macchiatos. Usually elsewhere these are way too sweet, but here they were perfect,  not really sweet not bitter. I ordered the bombay fries again,  this time there was a little less seasoned but still good. My mom & I got the vegetarian version of the viva la crêpe. As an option they replace the meat with avocado. We were very satisfied. My dad ordered the strawberry banana crêpe. It was served to him with a smiley face made of the fruit on top. This made us all laugh especially because my dad is a kind of tough guy. I have a feeling we'll be regulars here.

My brother and I wanted to grab a bite to eat so we happened to pass by this place! The service was very nice and welcoming. I believe it was the owner who was attentive and checked up on us often.

The food was interesting, I never had this fusion of cuisines before. The avocado smoothie was delicious! However, the fries were over salted. I would come back to try their desert crepes.

Excellent service. Food is well seasoned and the presentation is excellent.

However, they struggle with making spicy food. Their spicy chutney is an unconvincing emulsion of tomato sauce and crushed red peppers. I'm used to getting ass kicking spicy when I ask for it, so it's a space they improve in.

Have high hopes, will be back.

Definitely good place to go and relax.  Food was well done and the staff was extremely curteous.  Couldn't find a nicer owner and staff anywhere else.  

I had the nihari burrito and it was very well done.  Nihari is basically cooked beef stew that is served with thick gravy with a side of ginger, onions and lime.  In this case, there is no gravy.  Its just the meat which is well done.  The roti wrapping was well done and had good consistency with the rest of the filling.  The basmati rice was light and fluffy and full of flavor. The masala fries weren't greasy at all and had good flavor which complimented the nihari burrito well.

I had a sip of the mango lassi which was very tasty and they give a decent portion of it. 

The staff was extremely friendly.  The owner is very kind, polite and professional and interacts very well with his customers.  He talked to us like a friend and was VERY hospitable. 

The decor of this place is nice and the place is kept very clean.  It has a nice cafe feel to it and you can choose to sit inside or out.  

I definitely recommend this place!

Let me make a few things clear...
Food was great, service was near perfect but albeit they need to tighten up their carry out orders a bit.
They billed me for 2 items yet provided just 1 item during one of the least peak hours.

I walked in at 8:40pm on a Wednesday and I'm literally the only customer who placed at order until they closed. 2 items: Lamb vindaloo kathi roll and samosa chole (really not a complicated order) and yet they managed to tightly pack up the carry out bag with just 1 item and closed for the night before sending me on my way.

They might had good intentions but they need to figure out how to stop making rookie mistakes. I get this can happen when a restaurant is super busy but irks me that I was the only person who placed an order 20mins prior to close and they still got it wrong.

With that being said, carry out customers please double check your bag.

P.S I believe the owner took my order maybe that's where things went wrong. Oh well....next time I'll remember to say 'No, Thank you' and place my order through the cashier sitting in front of a computer.
Great food.  Enjoyed the Indian flavored burritos. I can't wait to come back and try something else.

My brother and I went here for brunch this morning.   I wish I could remember our waitresses name.  She was extremely friendly and professional.  Our food was outstanding.  We had savory gluten free crepes and also nutella, peanut butter and banana gluten free crepes.    Gluten free crepes are hard to find and these were amazing, could not even tell they were gluten free.   I don't live close to here, but would go out of my way to come back.

Great food option to dine in or carry out- there are so many choices! My favorites are the shrimp scampi crepe and the paneer makhani burrito! I can't wait to come back to try the Nutella crepe and gelato smoothies. So glad Bartlett has this gem.

column2: R I C K Y B O B B Y.
column13:
There isn't much that I can say, that hasn't been said already.  This place is simply amazing.  A French/Indian Fusion, where you can get things like Chicken Tikka Burritos (the "tortilla" is actually a crepe), sweet crepes, savory crepes, crepes for lunch/dinner and crepes for breakfast.  I have tried some of each and they are all outstanding.

Where I think this place truly excels though, is in management.  Every time I have gone in, the same guy is there running the show.  He clearly knows what he is doing!  One of the nicest owners I have come across in business.  He really cares about the customer having a great experience at his place.  I have never left disappointed here!

If you are looking for something different to try, definitely give this place a run!

Came here for Sunday breakfast; it's close to where we were, and I suggested it as 'something different' and described it from Yelp to my wife.   

It's a créperie, which means that the main dishes are served in crepes (gluten free available) which are good - and there's different sections on the menu (each section labeled in French, but don't let that throw you - my French is good enough to translate 95% of it) for breakfasts, chicken dishes (avec poulet) and a whole two sections for Indian food!  

Susan had the western crepe and it was great - and I had the butter chicken 'burrito', with a little too spicy but tasty of a sauce mixed with good basmati rice and tandoori chicken.  (If that's butter chicken sauce, I'm your Aunt Edna!)  Also had a Samosa with tamarind sauce on the side, a plate of thin and perfectly cooked fried with a garlic aioli sauce that made you want to clap your flippers and bark like a seal, and a dessert crepe of strawberries, mascarpone, and bananas that rapidly quieted the fire in my mouth.  

Not cheap but very, very good and decent service.  The place was busy but not jammed, and Operatic instrumentals were playing in the background.  Nice little joint in downtown Bartlett; we'll be back.  Good coffee too!

Minus one star for the spicing level on the butter chicken being way hot.

One day a long time ago, I was looking for some Indian food and ran across this place on Yelp.  It was a new crepe/roti concept that really intrigued me.  So, FINALLY, I was able to come over to visit D'licious Crepes and Roti in Bartlett! :)

This nice, quaint restaurant is nestled in the heart of Downtown Bartlett, right in front of  Bartlett Village Hall. :)  It is easy to get to from the Bartlett Metra Station which is mere steps away! :)

I was expecting a order from a menu on the wall, fast-casual place, but I was surprised we were asked to sit down and were given actual menus to order from.  The decor is modern, lots of dark woods and rattan chairs around the  dining area.  The cooler aspect of this place are the two crepe creation stations that patrons can come up to and watch their crepes being created before their eyes.  I love seeing food being made(teppanyaki cuisine comes to mind) in front of you and D'licious Crepes and Roti does that for you!  

I brought my family along to try this place. My husband ordered the Beef Bourguignon special, which he said was awesome.  I ordered a paneer kathi roti and it was JUST as awesome I could barely tell it was cheese and not chicken! :) I will try the chicken one next time!

The flavors and spices really brought me to the Indian cuisine I had so longed for(I wish they had a vindaloo roti...ooh I don't mind the spicy. :)  But, not long after I had taken a trip to India that I was WHISKED AWAY to France with D'licious Crepe and Roti's sweet CREPES. Now, crepes are a whole different thing there are both savory and sweet crepes.  My daughter tried one of their breakfast crepes and enjoyed it, but not as much as she enjoyed her Black and White(nutella and banana) crepe, she practically inhaled it! Although I was quite stuffed after my Paneer kathi roti, I shared a La Cacahuete (Peanut Butter, Nutella and Banana) crepe. OMG the Peanut Butter EXPLODED in my mouth coating it in creamy peanut buttery goodness! :)   My husband who helped me with my La Cacahuete was in agreement as we both love peanut butter. :)

The staff and owner of D'licious Crepes and Roti were all very accommodating and helpful!  They had a lot of suggestions and were friendly.  We were very well thanked and well taken cared of on our first trip to their lovely establishment! 

Will I return? OH YOU BETCHA!!  I love crepes both savory and sweet!  Definitely check this place out if you are a crepe fanatic!! Or want something a little different than the dull and boring. :)

GO! NOW! Give D'licious Crepes and Roti! You will NOT regret it!

Wonderful crepes. A Bartlett gem.  We will be back...soon! I tried the Savoury Crepe this time, and the flavors were...well, delicious. My daughter always gets the Caesar Crepe, my husband tried the Nahari Beef this time. All of our meals were great. Love this place.
This place is AWESOME !!! The food is delicious, service is excellent . Great menu items. I just wish there was one closer to home !

A must for any fan of crepes. I had the cinnamon lovers and it couldn't have been better. Phenomenal  and friendly service. Good prices. I'm a fan of any place that serves breakfast all day. You can get crepes with just about anything imaginable.

Local business with delightful menu and owner aiming to please! You know when a proprietor radiates pride and stops at every table checking in? This is such a place. Indian food or crepes is an interesting approach that worked well for us as a casual Saturday morning stop. Add quality food and unique options with affordable pricing and this is too notch. Add fancy coffee imported from the Netherlands Douwe Egberts and it's a real treat. Only area for improvement is while they have excellent quality products they may not be fantastic baristas yet. With a little practice I think they will master that too. Give this local place a try and enjoy the outdoor seating!
Best food and service!!! Will definitely return! Their crepes are out of this world!!

I love crepes & Indian cuisine, so I've been wanting to try this place out for a while now, especially with all the great reviews.  This restaurant lives up to all the hype.  We had an Americano, wild berry black tea, savory lunch crepe, chicken tikka saag roti burrito, red & black (Nutella & strawberry) crepe, truffle fries. EVERYTHING was incredibly tasty, even better than the ones I've had in France.  The super friendly & helpful owner was there and talked about the food and drinks and gave us useful suggestions.  He says this is the only place in the world that makes roti via batter & crepe machine.  This quaint cafe is our new favorite and we will definitely be eating here again very soon.

EVERYBODY needs to support this small business! The food is delicious, the value is superb, the owner is extremely nice, the ambience is Zen, and they have GELATO!!! I love everything about this place... outdoor seating,  kid friendly, etc...

So it's been 4 days since my last visit and am already planning a return trip.

I've heard about this French/Indian/Crepe place in Bartlett for quite some time and it always had good reviews.  I just couldn't get the concept.  Crepes, Indian, Gelato, Coffee, what kind of crazy mix up is that.

Well, last Friday night I couldn't figure out what to have for dinner and for some reason this place popped in my head.  The family was out of town, so I figured I'll just go and give it a try.  I am so glad I did.  I was greeted as soon as I walked in and took a seat at the bar.  My order was taken (I had the Signature Ham and Cheese Crepe), figured I'd start out with what they identified as one of their best.  It took a little bit for the food to come out, but watching them prepare the food I understood it was fresh and being made.  For that I will gladly wait and watch. I took my first bite, mind you most Crepe's I've had were dessert based so i wasn't sure what to expect.  It was AMAZING, the bechamel sauce was wonderful.  The Crepe was great, the meat and cheese's had great flavors and all played wonderfully together.  I had to pace myself so I didn't look like a crazy guy woofing it down.

The next day on Saturday I kept thinking about the crepe and decided I had to try other options, so I used the Yelp Eat24 app to place a to go order.  Wanted to see how that worked anyhow.  This time I ordered the Butter Chicken Burrito, Samosa and 
Mascarpone Delight Crepe.  When I arrived they informed me they were running a bit behind but would have it ready shortly.  No big deal, I took a seat.  While I waited they brought me a glass of water and assured me the food would be ready shortly.  Then the owner came out and apolgized, offered me a free coffee.  I politely declined, but he insisted it would be good.  Why not, so he brought me an espresso with a little piece of chocolate on the side.  HOLY WOW, that espresso was good.  Creamy, Caramelly coffee goodness and the chocolate piece was great as well.  Anyhow, minutes later the food was ready.  I took my time finished the coffe and went home.  The food again was amazing, but I ordered more than I could actually eat.  Wrapped it up and the next day my wife finished off the Burrito.  A day old and slightly cold and she thought it was still amazing.

We'll be back soon to journey across the rest of the menu and check out the gelato next time.  So glad I decided to get past the idea of what a crazy combo this was and discovered a new wonderful place to eat in Bartlett.

Decided to drive all the way to Bartlett from Schaumburg to try this place out Solely based on the rave reviews.

We got the paneer roti with masala eggs and the paneer burrito. The flavors were good, and the prices reasonable. I've had way better Kati rolls in NYC, so this was kinda of a let down. The burrito was supposed to have spinach in it but it was pretty scarce.

Also decided to share a dessert crêpe, the strawberry & Nutella. Again I've definitely had much better elsewhere. 

Not really sure I would drive back to Bartlett again for this place.

Awesome food with nice customer service.
Food we ordered was rumali roti burrito crushed samosa, it was delicious and in fact we saw chef making our dish which was the awesome part. Will be visiting very soon.
love this place. the indo-french concept is unique & well executed. would highly recommend this gem to anyone.
After falling off the grid for several months, this place is now back open!! Food is still very good. There is no more free coffee though which was a huge bummer...

My husband and I went for dinner on a weekday night. we were greeted right away and seated. The manager was great about giving us recommendations since we told him that this was our first time here. the food was great!!! my husband is hesitant in ordering lamb since he likes his a certain way but he was very pleased with the lamb burrito. they also have a good selection of coffee and snacks. overall, excellent customer service and great food!!

Hard to summarize how wonderful this place is!!  Great food, gracious owner, reasonable prices.  Every time we go (and it's been many times!) we are thrilled with the experience.  Lots of different menu options - meat lovers, vegetarians, sweet, savory.  And our new fav - the affrogato - gelato with a shot of espresso - it's addictive.  We love D'licious!!!

Superb service. Generous portions without being excessive and perfectly flavored too. Also, the flavors are fresh and true to what they claim to be. 

The menu is not overwhelming at all. They do a few things, but they do them fantastically well. Bookmarked!

A nice surprise. Was looking for a quick, unique, vegetarian-friendly dinner spot and we found it! Great service, friendly/accomadating owner, unique, fresh, food! 4 of us and we split two "burritos", two dessert crepes, a masala fry and requested for the tater tots to be made bombay masala- called them roshni tots and glad we did, it was delish!!! if in the area, will be back!

Gave 4 stars... the burrito shell is a little soggy (was supposed to be) and wasnt fan of the rice... would of preferred a lentil option and some spicier chutneys..  but loved the concept amd fusion!

I am glad they are back ... The food is still same like last time which is awesome! I hope they are going to hang around for a very very long time... Anyone who wants to try something new they will experience nothing short of amazing food.... I am going to be a regular now.... 

Delicious' Fan....

D'Licous Cafe lives up to it's name. We are walking distance to it and go there regularly. We have tried several crepes and they have all been delicious. The owner is so welcoming. Come while it is still warm and sit outside.

The menu seems amazing. Indian food. Right when I walked in I was greeted by the owner. He has unbelievable service. He has a very calming demeanor if that makes sense. He made me want to stay, though I insisted on taking it to go. It is in a strip mall next to a liquor store and a pizza place. I imagined it being more like a moderately fast food place like panera or something. They seat you, and you have a server. It is very clean, and I would like to try many items on the menu. I am going to try the beef burrito and the lemon crepe. Both have names I dont remember at the moment. Without actually taking a bite, I expect a good meal.

We went back for dinner after it reopened. We liked it before but now absolutely love it!  Awesome options on the new menu. The Greek crepe was fantastic. Prices were very reasonable and we really enjoyed eating outside. We ended up taking the BYOB option and enjoyed a bottle of wine (ok, I fess up, we had 2 bottles of wine) with dinner. We are looking forward to trying the gelato on a future visit and are thrilled to have an option like this right in downtown Bartlett. The owner really takes pride in his work and came out to visit with us and make sure everything met our expectations. I highly recommend trying it out!!

This was an experience that was worth mentioning. I enjoyed the food and service was excellent. Rajesh, the owner was the one that welcomed and serviced us. We had the Kathi samosa roll and the roti roll too. It was so good to see them open after the short break the chef took but the flavors were bursting. Most Indian places I have been look to make a fast buck and forget the food should always be the focus and this place resounded with that theory of focus on flavors and food!! If you have not tried the place, you should get here, it is a must try.. And I will definitely come back every chance I get...

Went here for lunch and were pleasantly surprised.  We had been there when they originally opened and were not impressed.  They closed for a time and reopened with excellent changes.  My husband and I each ordered a savory crepe and then split them so we could each try two.  We had excellent service, the owner introduced himself to us and checked on us during the meal.  The food was delicious.  We will definitely be back!!

Absolutely amazing. Asked for recommendations since EVERYTHING on the menu looked absolutely delicious and I don't say that very often at all, I had the tandoori chicken saag, hubby had the butter chicken burrito. Plates cleaned. We also got the Bombay fries to share, incredible favors, couldn't stop eating them, didn't need the dip but that too was delicious. 
Beverages: I had the Indiana Masala Chai-cardamom, hubby had caramel macchiato. We got extra to go. Yummy!!!
Yes, this nice place for is on the list of favorites that we will return to again and again!!!

Every morning I go run around 5am I see the owner open this place at 6 am and I've always wondered how this place is. I seen a lot of good reviews here and the pictures looked very appealing. So today in a winter storm, my family and I decided to walk and give it a try. 
    
When we came in the restaurant, there was only a woman and her three daughters. It wasn't a surprise seeing the place empty because of the bad weather. Anyway, the owner greeted us very friendly and we took our seat, and right after he asked for the drinks we wanted to get, I asked for tea, and he recommended the lime with agave, so I ordered that one, and it was really good! My dad order hot chocolate and my mom ordered decaf coffee. 

As for the food, my dad order a chipotle chicken crepe, my mom the beef burrito, and me, I ordered the chicken tikka burrito. All I have to say that the name of the restaurant says it all. "DELICIOUS!" It was something new for us and I personally loved every bite of it. Now, in a restaurant the food can be really good, but what I think makes a great 5 star restaurant which I have this, it's the service. I really felt valued as a customer by the owner. He really cares about his customers and the community. 

I would definitely go back to this place specially to try the black and white crepes which I had no more room to eat. 

Excellent experience overall!

So we are updating our review after many visits we continue to love and enjoy the hospitality and great new menu additions they always are adding! Great summer spot for a small party or shower for up to 30 guests too!

I am giving it 5 stars. I have been subject to dining in Bartlett the past 14 years. For those like me who have suffered out here, we are glad that a real restaurant opened up in our town.

1. Owner prides himself on excellence in customer service
2. He serves real freshly prepared food
3. Overall, very clean, polite staff, ample parking, wide variety menu.

So if you are interested in eating real food in an actual restaurant. Then dine here :)

Specifics:
Ordered the burrito roti sandwiches, they make their own roti (so you are not getting the packaged bread.)

Not sure why they closed :( 
I hope they re-open at a different location. I loved their food.

This place is located in downtown Bartlett and is owned by a nice couple. I have been here twice and the prices of each dish have gone up a few dollars within the span of a couple of weeks. They offer a complimentary SMALL coffee. The Viva la Crepe is really good and comes with chicken, spinach, tomatoes, mushrooms, and pesto sauce. I have also tried the Tutti Frutti (banana, strawberry, and Nutella) crepe, which did not disappoint (the bf had to fight his urge to lick the plate clean).

Just a short bike ride away from house is this great addition to Bartlett's downtown scene. I've been meaning to make it here for months. I wish I'd gotten here sooner!

Their name says it all. The food was fantastic and the service was excellent! I had the tikka burrito with Bombay fries (a new addition to the menu).

Everything on the menu sounded great. I'll be back soon to try them!

FANTASTIC. I love this place. They recently added an Iced Chai Latte- and it's something I now crave- so tasty. 
I love the flavor of the Tiki chicken. The Samosas are so flavorful as well- every time I'm here I try something new - and I have found new favorites each time. They have outdoor seating, and excellent friendly service.
Food was d'licious!!! Lol. Great service, lots of variety in the menu, and the price was very reasonable. Would definitely recommend to friends for brunch or lunch!!!

Store review:
Delicious, inexpensive, ample parking, friendly staff, and free coffee. I was quite happy that I got to visit this place for lunch before leaving town after Christmas. I was surprised to see so many 5 star reviews for a new place so it had to be good. This is located off the strip mall in downtown Bartlett. You can park in front, around the side, or even in back. The store itself is smaller, goes with the cafe feel of the restaurant. The owner was present and was super nice when he saw our large group "5 people is large considering most of the tables are for two" and he had the waitress move two tables together. They were quick to get the orders and provide a cup of the small coffee. The coffee itself is good (Douwe Egberts Coffee (Netherlands) but it does come from a machine that likely mixed coffee powder with water, but hey free is free. I had the rumali roti chicken tikka burrito for 6 dollars. It had ample amount of tandoori chicken, the right amount of kick/spiciness with garbanzo beans and tamarind. The mint yogurt side decreased the heat when needed. It was cooked well and wrapped in roti. If they had a chicken mahani wrap it maybe even better just a FYI if the owner is paying attention, but for that price it is equivalent to chiptole and can give them a run for the money. The banana/nutella crepe for dessert was delicious. I have never been to France so I can't compare to it, but I have had Magic Pan the LEYE restaurant and it is comparable. Ample banana and nutella in a fresh made crepe. Overall great experience. I hope the friendly owner keeps up with the wonderful service. Based on that we are sold and will come again!

Pros: Free coffee small, only 1 dollar if you want a large. Fresh made crepes. Good prices and portion size. Unique dining experience, get to this place before it gets too busy!

Cons: Limited hours, small seating area, food prep takes a while after your order but that is the price you pay for good food

Hidden deals:
Free coffee

Very different.  Very yummy! Owner is very kind and talented.  It's alot of food you can share. The nihari roti crepe was yummy but could use more nihari sauce (gravy).  The desserts are very delight! Wish there were more Nutella-less options (like coconut,  caramel, etc).  We'll definitely go back.

Amazing. It is very rare that a place gets a "wow!" from me. D'licious has done that. 

We visited this place in route from Madison to Wheaton to see a show. We had no idea that we walked in a half hour after they closed. Incredibly embarrassed that we walked in after closing, we tried to apologetically walk out. However, the very kind owner insisted that we not only order some food, but stay in to eat it. We really did not want to impose and tried to respect the closing time, but the staff all urged us to stay. 

We decided to go ahead and order. We were offered free coffee while we waited for our order to be made. They give free coffee out to all who want it...regardless of whether you order food or not. And, the coffee is actually really good! The food is made right in front of you so both my boys were highly entertained watching the owner make their strawberry and nutella crepes right before their eyes. They both devoured their crepes! We also ordered the buffalo chicken crepe and the roti burrito. The kick of the buffalo chicken burrito was a nice touch to the natural slight sweetness of the crepe. It was a great combination.
