The roti burrito was, by far, my favorite. I'm in love with the concept of putting Indian flavors into a burrito style wrap. 

A few of the staff and the owner all checked in on us to make sure we were enjoying our food. They went above and beyond any restaurant I have ever been to. The service was excellent. The food was fantastic. I would highly recommend this place to anybody rolling through the area and looking for a bite to eat.

Firs time here and it was wonderful. We had the chicken tikka burrito and the paneer tikka burrito, and a side of yummy straw fries. Highly recommend it! Owner was terrific as well, and such a sweet man!

Started off with a basic iced coffee and it turned out to be the best iced coffee of my life! Food turned out to be amazing!!!! And the owner was awsome!! I cant say enough about this place. Its a must try!

Seriously when I drove past this I always kinda kept going, until one day my boyfriend told me to meet
Him as this restaurant. 

First off it is a bit easy to look past considering it's location on the highway and connected to a liquor store- but don't let the location fool you it is a
Hidden gem!! 

I've been here twice now and both times I'm super impressed! 

Have been able to try different things both times I visited but some of my favorites include the creamy
Corn starter, the shrimp taco ( al camelion) and the beer battered tilapia tacos. And the ranchero masa. All super tasty dishes with really great flavors.

The margaritas were also such a hit- the original was well made and the perfect blend, not to mention great presentation on the drink as well as the food!

Highly recommend- always such great service too!

Delicious tapas, homemade margaritas, and an elegant atmosphere! I am wishing I had ordered more food to go for tomorrow!

The prices are very fair for the amount and quality of food that is served. I highly recommend this place!!

Highly recommend, it is really good.  Here's what you might want to know:

Roberto is the owner, really nice guy.  He has 2 other restaurants, one of which I have already been to.  It's in Geneva and it's called Altiro, and it's also really good.

His restaurants aren't the typical Mexican food, it's more fusion, which means they have some flavors and dishes you may not be used to.

For this particular location, it may be a little hard to find.  It's actually on the on/off ramp for Rt. 38 and 59.

The inside is decorated very nice.  It may actually have been the nicest / most upscale feeling Mexican restaurant I've ever been to.  Don't let that fool you though, the prices are roughly the same as many other places.  

Definitely worth trying.

This is my second time here and the food is so good.  It is tapas style so you can try a lot of different things and I have not had anything that I didn't love.  The al pastor and sopras are awesome!  You will not be disappointed!

Nice little place tucked away in West Chicago with elegant decor. Nice food and the drinks are amazing. Great hand crafted margaritas (nice selection), mojitos (hard to find a good one - they are great here), sangria and craft beers. Do yourself a favor and go!

Al Chulo is the sister restaurant to Geneva's Altiro Latin Fusion.  I was a fan of the Mexican restaurant previously in this storefront (around that curvy bend of Roosevelt and Route 59, next to a liquor store) and curious to see what opened in its place.

West Chicago is not the first town that comes to mind when thinking of new restaurants to try.  In the west suburbs it's usually Geneva, Naperville, but not West Chicago - a residential and industrial town that just gets confused with the actual city of Chicago.  So it's exciting to see something new and different in the area.

The interior of the restaurant is dim and open.  With tables positioned somewhat close together, I was surprised that other conversations did not overpower ours.

The menu is composed of dishes that are easily shareable, but as the waiter jovially pointed out, "you don't have to share if you don't want to!"  Tacos come in an order of 4 for $10, but these are on the smaller side, so eating 4 is not exactly a challenge.  I had the pastor tacos and loved the spicy kick.  It would have been nice to have a mix-and-match taco option though, because there were so many others I would have liked to try!

For sides, we shared the guacamole and spicy corn.  The guacamole was good, but for $8 I thought the portion was too tiny, and it's really just guacamole.  The spicy corn was delicious; one of their most popular dishes.  It's similar to an elote.

The drink menu is like a gift from god after a long day.  Margaritas, palomas, mojitos, and more!  I had the Hibiscus Cocktail (it had a funky name, but that's what it was) which was fresh, strong, and well worth whatever the pricetag was on it.

We had no problem getting a table on a Wednesday evening.  I've visited a similar taco spot in Geneva (not Altiro) which often has wait times of an hour or longer.  Forget the cache of dining in Geneva and give Al Chulo a try.

The food was tasty and great service.
It's clean and nice decoration. 
I had the tacos al pastor and they were really good.

The food was good, but my overall experience was not good enough for me to return. If the food wasn't tasty, I would have to give this place 2 stars.

We visited on a cold and rainy night. As others have said, the door opens right into the dining room. They wanted to seat us near the door and I told them I had to sit far away from it. I don't like eating with my coat on and I had to even though I was far away from the door. Although they try to make the interior nice, the chairs reminded me of plastic patio chairs. You can put a nice pillow on those, but they are still hard and don't really encourage taking your time to eat.

The drink menu is loaded with different kinds of mixed drinks which are about $10 each. Mine was good, but for $10 it should have had more liquor. There are no beers listed, we had to ask and yes they do have some.

The menu is limited and was kind of confusing. We had several questions and then ordered some tacos. They were tasty. We also had their selection of salsas and some chips. Those were flavorful.

I used the women's restroom and it was clean, but there was no toilet paper holder! It was just indicative of how they seemed to miss on the little things at this place.

There weren't many diners in the place, yet we felt like we were ignored. There wasn't any kind of extra effort made to make sure we were enjoying our experience. You can get the food right, but without the great service and surroundings, it just doesn't work for me.

My girlfriend had great things to say about this place however my opinion differed. First, the chips and salsa here are not complimentary, and they're just as overpriced as everything on the menu. The tacos are extremely expensive without reason. The tacos aren't bad but I would've been happier spending the same amount on more tacos at any given taco place. I have no problem paying a higher price , but at that price I should at least leave with a full belly. The drinks are very tasty but should come in either bigger proportions or more alcohol given that they're ten dollars a piece. The service was good. If you're coming here you're paying for fancy plates and oblong bowls. Not worth it.

This will be simple; excellent food, excellent margaritas, excellent service.

The several different tacos plates that we tried were very good, but don't leave without trying the shrimp, avocado (forgot the name) plate. Also, my friend threatened to lick out the bowl in front of God and everybody after we finished the corn, cheese, and rice appetizer.

A very good place, I look forward to heading back when I'm in the area.

I have been wanting to dine at Al Chulo since it opened. I finally got my chance on Saturday and it was definitely worth the wait.  We started out with the Al Arroz Verde (creamy corn/poblano rice) which was out of this world. It tasted so fresh and creamy, but not heavy. If we had not been in the middle of a restaurant, I would have definitely licked the bowl clean! Next was the guacamole - some of the best I've ever had - fresh, chunky and full of flavor without too much heat. Next came the Al Tingo (shredded chicken piled on 3 mini tostadas) - the fresh flavor exploded in your mouth. Then came 4 Al Poblano Tacos which were covered in the creamy poblano sauce used in the Al Arroz - need I say more. We finished off our meal with the Tres Leches for dessert -  that was a wonderful exclamation point on a fabulous dinner. 

Service was fabulous! Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu and the handmade margaritas!

It's very exciting to have such a high quality restaurant in our small little town.

If you a night of big bold flavors with a staff that makes you feel as welcome as dinner at your best friends house, this is the place to go. I love Latin food and if I could choose only one place to eat at, this would be it...or Altiro (same owner). Don't miss out on treating yourself to a amazing night

I really love the flavors here! Unfortunately, the shrimp tacos only have one shrimp with cheese leaving me wanting for more substance within each individual taco. The corn dip was very delicious and so were the pork tacos. The flan was excellent with a hint of coffee flavor, but again they gave you a VERY small portion, 3-4 bites, for the price. If they increase the amount of product witin each taco and other plates as well, I feel that they would have more business. The price was a lot for what he were given. Very beautiful decor, but I believe they need to alter their dishes and make sure the ratio of tortilla to meat to make the customers more happy. I understand that it is an upscale Mexican restaurant, but some of their items needed a little more. My mother ended up adding guacamole to the shrimp tacos since all it consisted of was 1. The corn tortilla 2. One tiny, mini shrimp and 2. Melted cheese. Great flavors, though, just needs improvement on certain dishes overall.

We were upset when we realized Changarro closed down as we ate there regularly. However, we were very excited to learn that Al Chulo was gonna be opening in that same location. After hearing great things about the place, my fiancé and I decided to stop in for a late dinner last night. First off the decor is very classy and totally different from the Luchador masks that were on the walls when it was Changaro. We were seated right away. The place wasn't overly crowded but it was also 8:30pm. 
  We started with chips and guacamole. We both tried their specialty margaritas. My fiancé loved the passion fruit one. Next we tried a few of their different tacos. Now if you are looking for traditional taco joint style tacos, this place is not for you. There are no basic ground beef, lettuce, and cheese tacos or burritos on this menu. However, if you want to broaden your palate and try some amazing food this is the spot. We had the al pastor tacos, fish tacos, and a steak & chorizo sope. The al pastor tacos were better than the authentic ones we had when we were in Mexico. The sope was pretty amazing as well. Overall we very pleased with our food and drink choices.
   I have read several complaints on yelp about the service there. We had a great dining experience. Our waiter was actually Miguel, the owner of the restaurant. He is a great guy and has a true passion for what he does. He chatted with us throughout our meal and as the place died down he sat with us and had some great conversations. He even brought us out shots of his private reserve tequila. 
    Our quick late night dinner ended up being a 2.5 hr great dining experience. It goes to show you, treat everyone equally with kindness because we thought he was just a waiter and ended up being the owner and treating us very well. 
    I highly recommend this place if you want a  nontraditional mexican fusion delicious meal. We even talked to Miguel about catering our wedding. Please support this place so it sticks around. It is nice not having to drive to Geneva to deal with the long wait times at Bien Trucha. Miguel also owns Altiro in Geneva as well so go show some love and have a kick ass meal.
Great food! We loved the steak tacos and the al pastor. Great service and delicious food!
Nice place. Beautiful inside and great tapas. Not your everyday Mexican restaurant. Small plates to share with good variety.

Excellent tacos and guacamole. Service was good and the staff took their time to explain the different options.  Decor is very modern. Seating is not all that comfortable in the bench area although it looks pretty. Portions are appetizer sized but felt satisfied and full. Good was fresh and presentation was very appealing. Would be a great place to bring out of town guests for something unique that you don't have to drive to the larger suburbs to find.

Amazing lunch, for which I invited an extra person so that we could share more plates (having learned that lesson at the wonderful Altiro, owned by the same proprietors). Started with the Al Esquite roasted corn appetizer and the Al Camaleon shrimp/bacon/avocado tacos, which in end-of-meal review came out as close favorites.  Honestly, we could have each happily had our own bowl of the corn, but wanted to try more things. For seconds we shared Al Ceviche tortas (towers of lime-marinated Tilapia with red onions, tomatoes, avocado) and the Al Chulo tacos (steak, ham, bacon, cheese).  Almost full, we wanted "dessert," so had Al Hongo portabellos roasted with chile and a sour cream/roasted salsa combo that did actually come across as slightly and deliciously sweet. I can't forget to mention the candy-in-a-glass mojito, worth breaking my usual tee-totalling tendencies.  I wish we had taken photos, but we really just wanted to eat this food as soon as it landed on the table.  We were there @ 1:15 on a Tuesday and it was almost empty, so we hope it builds the business it deserves (since it will be the new go-to restaurant for us)!

Hubby and I just dined there tonight and already can't wait to go back. First of all, the decor is beautiful and upscale. I really like the atmosphere that they created.
I had the sangria, which was very tasty. 
We ordered the ceviche, guacamole, a creamy corn and rice casserole (can't remember the exact name) and the shredded pork tacos. This corn/rice dish was probably our favorite thing, and we enjoyed everything. (We ordered a 2nd helping of the rice/corn dish after we quickly finished the first one.)
I'm sorry that we were too full for dessert; I can't wait to try their tres leche cake or their flan. (Next visit.)
The service was wonderful - both of the servers were very attentive and pleasant. They really loved that we enjoyed everything.
Guests need to keep in mind that this is tapas style, so they are small plates, meant to be shared. A few of the other commenters didn't seem to understand that. They are priced reasonably to all the other upscale tapas restaurants in this area; the bill was not more than we expected for the amount of food we ordered and again, we loved everything.

One recommendation for the menu is to create a combo of tacos. I would have loved to try more than the pork tacos.

They changed the location of the front door from the previous restaurant; it now opens up into the dining area. In the warmer months this won't be a problem at all, but it was cold tonight, and when the door opened, a gust of air blew right into the main area. Knowing this, we'll ask for a corner table when it's cold. 

We really can't wait to come back again. We'll try all new dishes, but we're always going to order the corn/rice dish. 

As my husband, Dan Milligan says, "Don't be a fool-o, eat at Al Chulo."

First of all, drinks were amazing. I forgot what it's called but I ordered the margarita with strawberries in it...loved it. 
After that, the rest of my review goes downhill.
First walking in to the restaurant, you see the updated atmosphere, pretty wall paper and fancy chairs. Not bad. The tables are super close together though. My husband and I were seated along the wall and I had to squeeze between 2 tables to get to the bench (I'm not a big person either). If there was someone at the table next to us, we'd have no privacy whatsoever. 
We looked at the menu and saw that the salsas were $6 each. Ok...not a fan, but we ordered one anyways. The salsa came out and it was at most 2 tablespoons worth. Not enough for 2 people. We were able to eat about 4-5 chips each with that one salsa. I don't want to spend $12+ on just salsa. We tried the guacamole as well...it came out looking pretty, but again, small portion. And very salty. Won't order that again. At this point we said something to our waiter about the size of salsa. The chef ended up coming out and explained that everything there was made fresh so the portions are smaller and more expensive. I get it...but lots of other places make their food fresh and it's not so expensive. 
I ordered the chicken taco that was fried with potato and cheese (sorry, forgot the name of it...El Donato maybe), but it tasted like fried tortilla. I could not even taste the chicken, potato or cheese. My husband ordered the "Al Chulo" taco...and that was good. 
So,  the food here is just ok. I understand they just opened and maybe have kinks to work out...but this was my first experience there. The portions are "tapas" style which I understand...but I still think they are too small. I do not think my food was worth $90 including tip. Not in West Chicago. Might come back in a couple of months to see if anything changed.

Stopped for lunch on the way by and this was an absolute surprise! The choices on the menu were extraordinary. I wish I could remember the name of the sandwich I had - it was thinly pounded & lightly breaded steak, avocado, tomato, oaxaca cheese, chipotle aioli. The flavors were delicious and the temperature of the steak was perfect. Even the bun was so good and very fresh.  I can't wait to come back for dinner! I was on my way back to work - otherwise I would have tried one of their margaritas.  They looked awesome!

Went there tonight for dinner with my 15 and 12 year old niece and nephew. They have more sophisticated palettes than most adults. The decor is very cool and modern for the location and the town of West Chicago.....I give it an A for effort. Tables are a bit small but they don't bring out the food all at once so its not such a big deal. Most Americans see a Mexican restaurant and expect burritos as big as your head and the typical gringo fair! You won't get that here. The food at Al Chulo is upscale modern tapas style Mexican. If your looking for a gluttonous American chain type of experience, then this isn't your place. Prices may be higher than most but your not getting your average tuesday night fast meal for you and the family. 

I loved it and will definitely be back. Its so important to patronize small business in your community. I know this......as Ive owned one for 23 years and always appreciate the kindness of my patrons!
Had the restaurant to ourselves at 6pm on Sunday. Food was very good. Drinks good as well. We had the Al Campechano and Al Pastor. The guacamole was excellent.

Gotta try the Pulparindo drink, amazing. Love esquite and theirs did not disappoint. Had the Al Famoso sandwich and loved it. My wife said the sangria was great but small. Mostly ice and fruit in a small glass. Highly recommend for lunch.

First it was Altiro Latin Fusion, and now it's Al Chulo!  What can I say...the food is delicious, the drinks are amazing and the atmosphere is sophisticated and yet subtle.  I love going to their restaurants because each one has a little something different. Service is always pleasant and they make you feel like family. Will be going back to experience even more of their food and drinks!

Good food, understaffed. We went for cinco de mayo. 
Food was delicious but definitely on the upscale side. Menu was a bit limited but we liked it. If you're looking for a burrito with rice and beans, this isn't the place but they have great innovative tacos! 
Margarita was delicious! They have regular and flavored options. 
Decor was beautiful and the whole place was modern and classy.

We have been twice now and enjoyed it!

Just to be clear, this is a tapas style restaurant. I'm not sure if the other 2 star reviewer realized this. You wouldn't get a side of rice and beans because it's not that type of restaurant. That said, we walked in and were left standing there waiting. 4 different employees saw us and did nothing. When they finally came over we were seated at a high top table with a window seat. Not comfortable! We asked to move once a table opened up. Food was ok. Ceviche tostada had to much lime juice. Queso fundido was cold, so it was hard. Pastor and shrimp tacos were good. Too much time between dishes. We found ourselves sitting there waiting a few times. I know they just opened, but they have some kinks to work out. Not sure if we'll return or not. Those high tops tables...not a good idea at all.
If a great atmosphere, terrific food, and phenomenal service sounds appetizing, this is the place to go.  Don't let the location throw you off.  This place is great, hope it stays.

I really wanted to love this place. My husband and I live close, and the place that was here before (Changarro) shut down- it was awesome and we hoped this would kind of be a replacement. Upper scale Mexican is hard to come by in the burbs. 

The decor is pretty, but not functional. Maybe the window seats with high tables would have been better, but we were sat in the middle of the room next to another couple despite being the only ones in there. The table was so small, and I couldn't comfortably cross my legs underneath it (I'm 5'1) it was not cozy at all. 

Drinks were great, and were much like the previous establishment- fresh muddled, proper margaritas. 
We ordered the salsa sampler and they were all delicious but extremely small portions with a tiny basket of chips. 

My husband ordered tinga style chicken tacos and he liked them. 
I'm vegan, and I understand this can be a "pain in the ass" to some waiters. I don't expect to be fully catered to everywhere I go but I've never been somewhere that tweaking a few things wasn't a problem. Aside from salsa and guac there was nothing for me. I asked if they could grill up some peppers, onion and potatoes for tacos. Pretty simple....but what they sent out was completely different. Beans, a slaw and what may have been grilled cactus. They weren't bad, but I don't think what I ordered would have been difficult to whip up...and I would have enjoyed more. 
The tacos are really small, and they don't come with a side of rice or beans etc. 

The service is....brand new restaurant service. Possibly brand new to serving service. They were nice and they tried, but more experience is definitely needed here. 

Also...my tacos came out first, and my husbands order took another 10+ minutes...kind of killed the "dinner together" vibe. 

It's unfortunate, but I don't see this place lasting :(
Order the street corn  (and some chips) for an appetizer insanely more addicting than salsa.

Great Mexican style tapas!  We pretty much had the place to ourselves Saturday night around 7:45pm.  Service was excellent, as were the corn and cheese appetizer, al pastor tacos, and beef/chorizo sopes.  We will definitely be back to try more of the menu!
Al Chulo tacos and fish tacos are great as is the cheesy saucy smoky spicy rice appetizer!
Went here for the 2nd time. The 1st was only for drinks and it was great too. Their food is as good as Bien Trucha, if not better. The margaritas were super fresh and the tacos were awesome!!!

Thank you for bringing your awesome restaurant to West Chicago!  The food is amazing and we've never had a dish we didn't love!  Everything tastes so fresh and delicious.  So glad you're here...please stay!

My husband and I love Altiro and now Al Chulo. We went for lunch for the first time today to al Chulo and the food was excellent!  We had the al Chulo and the al hongo as well as a creamy corn with poblano rice.  The al Chulo was particularly tasty with grilled pineapple and we enjoyed the addition of cheese from the tacos at Altiro. Our service was fast as we were dining at an odd time, but our server was very helpful with the menu as well. It's a great local chain, and we've never been disappointed with our food.

I love this place!!  When my boyfriend and I are craving Indian food, this is our go to place!!  

One of the ladies there was super helpful and let us try the different sauces.  The last time we were there, a gentleman helped us, and offered us to try the sauces, but we denied as we've been there several times (good to know they offer that though!)

It is a great place for people who are new to Indian food to try out!  Your meal is less than $10, and it fills you up!!

I was in the area on Thursday when I passed by the restaurant, I decided then the bf and I would go for dinner on Friday night. The food was served on the paper version of the elementary school cafeteria plastic tray. Portions were on the smaller side of what you would expect for the price. The cost for two was exactly 29.00 including beverages not a bad price had we enjoyed the food.

The Good
The garlic wheat naan was the best thing on my plate. The customer service and water was something spectacular. I loved the paper and pencil circle fill sheet to guide you in picking your meal. No complaints about the rice yet not the best I've had. The bf had a mango beverage, it tasted like a liquid yogurt and was delicious.

The Bad
I had the chicken protein in the red sauce, he had the lamb in the brown medium sauce though his had a slightly better flavor than mines, I would never want it again. I dipped the naan in the sauce since there appeared to be far more sauce than meat, reminded me of a stew. The lentils were bland and so was the fried chicken pastry. The bf tasted my pastry said it was ughhh and the lamb pastry was better. My beverage was the ginger tea tasted like a spicy seasoned soda water we both agreed it was totally disgusting and I was completely unimpressed.

The Ugly
There's an untidy area leading to the back once you're in the dining area that's a bit disturbing especially for a restaurant. We didn't nearly finish our food and decided to toss it out. Needless to say we left hungry and decided to go somewhere else for dinner.

I must say of all the Indian cuisine I've had this was right at the bottom with the worst. Based on the ratings here I truly expected more. ;(

Very good food. But not so good serive for carry out. Today I tried ordering by phone and the guy put me on hold for 10 mins(probably forgot that he put me on hold). So I hung up and tried calling back again in 10 mins. The guy who answered told me they are busy but didn't apologize for forgetting to put me on hold when I told him I called earlier. I asked him if he can take my order now and be able to make in half an hour and he basically told me to hold on for another few minutes. Instead of again being put on hold and being forgotten, I thought of not ordering at all. I told him that I'll go somewhere else and he said 'okay' and hung up! 

Not sure what to say- I definitely like the place but right now quite annoyed by the treatment. Advice to management- try to hire guys that are a little more polite to customers.

Very overpriced for what you get ..

We ordered special thali which cost us $13..  food tastes decent but touch on the greasy side...the sweet was very ordinary like a burfi from a haldiram box.. 

With the competition in the area they will fizzle out if they don't loffer better food to justify the prices

Awesome concept for an Indian restaurant. Platter style with a little bit of each item makes for a mouthwatering experience. Samosa,Dahl, kofta, drink, roti and some vegetables all for under 10$ this is a bargain for your soul  leaving here much more satisfied than when I walked in ! Great customer service also casual ambiance clean restaurant

This is a different Indian concept of picking in steps from items listed.  Pick your meat, pick your sauce, lentils, bread type and choose a side.  We tend to always go with chicken and red sauce with the spicy yellow lentils.  The spicy yellow lentils are excellent.  You also get a samosa with your order which is okay but I've had better.  I love Naan and their Naam is good.  We always get an extra order of the garlic naan.  

The owners are very nice and you can tell they are very proud of their food.  Great little lunch spot.
Perfect quality and quantity of food! Quick service and courteous staff. Careful with the spice, extremely spicy option IS extremely spicy
Nice concept .. Very friendly staff..Request for the sauces to taste and you can decide which one to order.. try cheese masala pizza and Hari mirchi roti..

Awesome! Great food great service. There are a lot of Indian restaurants in the Naperville area but this stands out. It's trendy modern, the price is right, atmosphere is cheery, concept of food selection is fun and simplified for those who may not be familiar with Indian food, place is clean. Nothing to complain about will continue to go here so come and bring others! One thing is that you should be mindful it is not fast food so there is a small wait for the food. Just means it's fresh!

Awesome food. Kofta platter with brown gravy and Indian style pizza is a must try. For those who have lived in Ahmedabad, it will give you an instant nostalgia as the pizza is a close match to what we find there. Definitely going there again!

Got the chicken platter, everything was well seasoned. Also got an order of chicken briyani-not nearly as much flavor as I had hoped. I would've liked more chicken and masala sauce in the "platter" order instead of the veggie puffs and pickled cauliflower/carrot sides. Hardly touched those, and the serving sizes are very small for the price. The naan was a little too hot for my liking -this may be the first time I've never finished garlic naan! The lemon ginger tea was not good. It tasted old and I could barely taste any lemon.

What a great find!! Simplified tasty Indian food in a super casual atmosphere.  Chose your meat or veggie, choose your sauce, choose your sides (lentils, naan, etc) and in 20 minutes you have a flavorful complete meal for less than $10.  

The lady at the front counter was very helpful and friendly.  Since we were newbies she let us taste all the sauces which was awesome because they were very different.  All the sauces were "dalicious" and well thought out. We went with the brown sauce since it was vegan, but next time I think I'll try with the creamy sauce. 

The portion size was perfect.  No food was wasted, but we were both full! We both a mango lassi's that were super tasty as well.  

Great Value for your $$! :)

The food is delicious but they're very cheap with the food. Portion sizes are not enough to fill you up. 
I have never left a restaurant feeling hungry.

I was completely put off by the way the lady at the counter constantly kept on trying to upsell. Trying to get us to get buy upgrades. I have clearly marked what I want on the order sheet. So it was very annoying that the lady was consistently trying to get me to upgrade. Food is nothing to rave about. Very little quantity. Not enough value for money. Will not be visiting again.

Finally we stopped by to try their food, after reading great reviews in yelp. The menu was easy to understand and order. I ordered paneer as protein and my son ordered lamb. Both platters tasted so good. And I love that the naans were so light and fluffy and didn't stuff me and make me comotized later. I also love that there are variety of items including a bite size samosa for $7.99 

Service was very good and the ambience and the decoration are good as well. Looked clean and well kept. 

We also ordered chicken briyani as a take out and my son said it was okay and lacked bit of flavor.

4 stars because the rice that came in the platter was dry and tasted like it was cooked with not enough water. Hopefully they take care of it.

They got a permanent client now, going back again soon.

Fantastic food great spice levels and best naan ive had for sometime. Service is amazing and great menu for the novice or lovers of indian food.

Will be a regular lunch spot.
Checked the box for extra spicy twice and walking out now with tears in my eyes and sweat on my nose! Respect! Nothing has changed. Awesome food all round!!

Good concept - basically you choose the different curries/dals of your "thaali". The food is decent, service is friendly and helpful. The portion sizes are a little less, but for that price you really cannot complain.

A nice self serve style Indian eatery, with ethnic ambience and ample space. This place has good options for  lunch and indian snacks items. Their pav bhaji and chicken drumsticks are great. Also they do have rajasthani or gujrati weekend lunch buffet. This is our preferred place for Indian fast food items in Naperville/Aurora area. 
Don't forget their special Tea.

I've been eyeballing this place on Yelp for quite a while now. I had friends and family in from out of town and they wanted Indian food. Being a creature of comfort, I didn't want to stray too far from the house so I decided to roll the dice on this place. As other Yelpers say, this is a different way of ordering Indian food. I wasn't quite sure what to expect as it's a new concept for me. The staff couldn't be more friendly as they explained, in detail, every little thing about how to order and the various options available. There were three of us and each ordered something different.  We received our food in a cafeteria-style tray.  Again not what I'm used to from an Indian restaurant.  However, Dalicious is not your typical Indian restaurant.  All you need to know is that you should go here immediately and try it out. The portions may seem small but in this land of gluttony, it's refreshing. You definitely will not leave hungry and the experience with the wait staff and the owners is the icing on the cake. Dalicious has earned a spot in my top two Indian restaurants in the area.

Food is amazing!  Plus the mango lassi and rasmalai were absolutely delicious. Love that you can choose sauces, and there's even a vegan option. They're so nice there too! Awesome experience and totally recommended.

Loved the food here..they are vegan friendly which is an awesome thing considering this is an indian restaurant. 
Nice ambience, clean place, and fresh ingredients. You can tell it's quality food.
Wish we have more such spots especially in chicago downtown.
Things we liked :
Vegan Kofta, rotis, pav bhaji, and do try their lemon ginger juice.

My friend and I had the opportunity to try this restaurant for lunch. We tried the paneer platter. I wouldn't say its authentic Indian food...and the sauces are weird tasting. The food comes out quickly but the portions are not worth it for the money. For what its worth, you can definitely get a better deal for your money. We also had acid reflux and other issues after the meal. Maybe the food isn't freshly made...

Pros 
- Quick service

Cons 
- Overpriced
- Small portions
- Had GI issues.
Great food and great customer service. . They are very friendly and the food is soon yummy!!

Saw some good reviews for this restaurant on yelp so I decided to check it out. Food was amazing! Also a great atmosphere with nice decor, good music and very clean. I had the chicken with red sauce and it was on point! I will definitely be back again very soon.

Had a chnce to try em at the india parade in Naperville and loved every bite :) Had their pav bhaji with the ginger chutney - amazing.. Also was a fan of their masala chaas and ginger drink. Will definetly be trying the actual restaurant soon.

Not impressed. New concept, but very undeveloped. Few choices. Quality of food was definitely good. Service is slow, may be because they cook to order, so be prepared. If you're in a mood for good food, but not too many choices, it's not bad. Chaat is overpriced...

Fantastic food. Menu laid out really nicely to meet individuals taste. Place is clean and kids friendly. Owners provide a great service and are very courteous!!!

My favorite Pav Bhaji and Chicken Drumsticks !!

It'd different in menu and choosing the food but for a good food ( in price and quantity) don't choose this. When comes to taste I just increase a star more not much. Mango lassi in svs temple aurora is far better than here

The food was DALICIOUS. My friends and I came here a few weeks ago and I've been craving it ever since. I had to bring my picky younger sister to see what she thought and she loved it! We will definitely be back!

Just came back from this place, I have to say the food had ABSOLUTELY NO FLAVOR, this is not how Indian food tastes, don't get misled. Indian food is just not about heat and spices but the flavor of the protein as well, which was completely missing from the food.  

I wish there was a half a star that I could rate Dalicuous. Needless to say, I would never ever go to this place again. What a waste of money.

What a great experience, this was our first timing coming to Dalicious and wow! So great! The food was perfectly portioned to try a little bit of everything, if you like Indian food this is the place for you to try! Super clean and cute on the inside with intense flavor food

I want to love this place, I want this to be the new model of affordable indian fast food, the peopel are nice the restaurant is clean but I just can't give it more than this ( honestly 1 star is for the garlic naan alone) the food was meh. I know I am jaded since I am very particular about indian food and maybe I need the ethnic version not the modified version that being said I got the Lamb kadai with Lamb samosa, and yellow daal. Yellow daal needed salt ( I dont eat a lot of salt so thats something), the samosa felt microwaved, and the kadai just was missing that oomph, as my wife said if were in the neighborhood and were desperate for indian, maybe we would check it out again but not a place I would drive to

Cool concept for Indian food. Great selection of traditional Indian street food and mix & match platters where you select the protein, sauce, lentil & bread. We had two platters with lamb & chicken plus tried one of the chaats. Since it was our first time there, we relied on the helpful advice of the owners with our choices. We were happily stuffed with flavorful food. Also, very friendly Indian store right next store with a helpful staff, full Indian grocery & fresh samosas!

I loved our dinner here , they serve big portion , delicious authentic Indian food and we had many options to choose from. They have vegan food as well!! I ordered chicken , my husband had lamb and for some reason the meat was way more on my plate.  Other than that the  service is great and friendly.

Cool concept but main meals were lacking salt and poorly executed. 

This is a chipotle style Indian restaurant. I picked veg kofta w/red sauce as my main meal. The red sauce was bland, lacking salt and the vegetables were just a few pieces of cauliflower-what happened to the kofta balls? The dal that accompanied the dish (I chose dal makhni) was also bland. 

The sides are excellent at this restaurant. I got a lamb samosa and it was soo good. The minced lamb was seasoned just right and was fried to the perfect level of crispness.  We ordered samosa chaat, which was also amazing as well.

All my life, I was kind of afraid of Indian food because I thought I didn't like curry and I'm a baby when it comes to spicy. This place has prompted me to give Indian food a try because it's so delicious! I like that it has a "Chipotle"-style ordering system that lets you customize your meal. Don't be afraid to ask for help - the employees are very friendly and willing to explain everything on the menu! It is all home-made and fresh. Would definitely recommend!

Womp womp not a fan. I was just craving butter chicken and I figure every Indian restaurant can make it. She insisted this would be right but just didn't taste the same. It was only $5 but won't be back to get the whole Dalicious shebang meal.

Great food for the price!  They try to use a Chipotle style concept with Indian food where you pick interchangeable ingredients.  

This is more of a lunch place than it is for dinner.

My goal was to create a Chicken Makhani dish wish turned out really well.  The naan was crisp, and the lamb samosa were also really good.

My wife's goal was to create a Malai Kofta dish, and unfortunately, it wasn't what she was expecting.  It didn't compare well to a typical Indian restaurant where you order Malai Kofta off the menu, but I guess that' s not the restaurant's intention either.

Overall, great food, and friendly staff.

I am a big fan of Indian Food.  I usually go to restaurants that offer a buffet, but on this occasion I decided to try this as a take-out option.  As a first-time customer, they took me through the menu options and explained how everything worked.  While the selections are somewhat limited, I was very happy with the quality of the ingredients and the taste of everything once I got home.   My all-time favorite dish is chicken tikka masala and this was one of the options on the menu (although they just simply call it Chicken with red sauce). The gave a generous portion of naan with the meal.   Everyone was very friendly.   It took about 15 minutes for my meal to be ready, but they said I could always call ahead next time to save time.  I will definitely be back.

We had Dalicious cater snacks for our Indian wedding in Naperville. The food was excellent and was definitely one of the highlights of our wedding. The Dalicious team worked with our hotel to make sure everything was covered and were very accommodating of any special dietary requests. Would definitely recommend them to others looking for Indian catering for events in the Chicago area!

Worst indian food I have had in the united states.
Nothing was tasting atleast normal. No salt in rice and paneer gravy. Dhal didn't even taste like it

I love this place: So authentic and the food is so full of flavor. They have limited menu though and hence I think the quality. Their nan is to die for. Also the service is amazing. It feels so home-y!

Delicious food! The lamb was perfect - very tender. The sauces (red, brown, or cream) were all so amazing, it was very difficult to choose. I did not know ahead of time that the yellow dal are their signature, and would have ordered those if I had known. The black lentils were excellent, though.

Very friendly staff, as well.

Dalicious has a neat concept, wherein you choose a protein (chicken, lamb, kofta or paneer) and a sauce and get your own customized Indian meal (you also get to pick a samosa and dal). Best of all, they are very vegetarian and vegan friendly!

I had paneer makhani with yellow dal, naan and a veggie samosa. The paneer was probably average in flavor- I was disappointed that it was not spicier, since I checked the little box marked "Spicy!" on the order form. Next time, I will ask for it extra spicy! My samosa was really tasty and I liked the naan, too. I liked my yellow dal more than the dal makhani- I also wasn't thrilled with my husband's malai kofta and wouldn't order it again, so I guess overall I made the better ordering decisions, haha.

The value here is impressive- we ordered two meals and four beverages and our total was around $22. It would have been under $20 if my husband had not decided to order a Thums Up, which is an Indian cola, on the way out the door. (We both really liked the Thums Up, by the way!)

The lady who took our order and brought out our food was really friendly and nice, too, and our food came out quickly. This is a good choice for lunch when you want Indian food but don't want to go the buffet route.

Excellent value may earn its way to five stars with a second visit.  The rice ok and the roti just average slightly diminished the rest that was great.

Gracious accommodating order taker, I got the paneer with brown sauce.  That plus the Dal and the onion vegetable mix were outstanding.   The lamb samosa and chutneys first class and the combo plate for $7.50.  Plenty of food for lunch.

The hipster version would have all the items in front all a chipotle ... And it was very not busy at lunch which is a shame as it was very very good and is well worth a visit.

Right from the word go, this place is amazing. The service, the food, the snacks, everything was to the point. Also, they told us that they have a weekend special (different cuisines from different parts of India). They have good seating area, low fuss menu and a clean ambiance.

A great dining experience. Good food and great service. The gentleman at the front took his time and patience going through the menu, which we appreciated since we were new to this restaurant and the choices. Very flavorful!

Delicious and large portions. Hubs and I each got a meal and it was only $17. Includes: protein (chicken, lamb, paneer or veggies),  lentils, rice, Samoa, little side of veggie/salad and tons and tons of naan! The lady/owner couldn't have been nicer. Explained every item on their menu while I waited for our take out order. She even had me try their homemade desserts. Will be back!
Absolutely delicious, and incredibly friendly staff. Will definitely be going back to sample the whole menu
We eat here frequently because we love the food, and the service is great.  Everyone is very friendly and helpful.  My favorites are the chole bhatura and the lamb samosas.

Really good, will come back!
The food is quite good and the service was exceptional. 

There concept of this place is several sections of the meal (like choose a protein, choose a sauce) with options for each. The 3 sauce options were delicious and the chicken and lamb were both good. I bet the other options were also good. There was more to the menu but you should come here and try it.

Wether you are an Indian food novice or not this place is great!  I'm not experienced with the cuisine, but the owner here is more than informative about every dish they serve.  The place has simple Indian decor and is super clean.  Everyone has been immensely amiable and the food doesn't disappoint.

I chose their kofta in red sauce, regular naan , dal makhni, and veg samosa. The kofta and dal were good. The veg samosa was refried and I am not a fan of refried samosa as it takes away from the original yummy taste. In all a satisfying meal. Very friendly and smiling service. Will definitely visit again!

Let me be clear, this is a fast food Indian restaurant. If you are expecting to go there are get full table service or order whatever you want, you will be SOL.

However, if you want incredibly high quality Indian food without having to break the bank, this is your place! 

They have an excellent special, you get a protein dish, rick, dahl, samosa, bread, and a few other extras. Throw in a mango lassi, and you get all of this for less than $12!

I've eaten at quite a few different Indian restaurants in the Naperville area. None of the others can match this quality of food for the price. I actually think that the meat  used at Dalicious is better than the meat at most other local Indian restaurants.

I loved this place. Great service, from the recommendations to even asking my table for feedback. I appreciate a business open to criticism. They saw we had a toddler eating and brought out yogurt for her as a special treat. Loved the red sauce with chicken and the naan with a great seasoning on it. It had cilantro, green pepper and a masala spice. Fantastic! I'll be visiting this restaurant regularly.

Just tried this place for the first time tonight with my fiancé and LOVED it!! The place is family owned and was very warm & inviting when we walked in. Their food was  sooo tasty and  made with love, definitely satisfied my craving for Indian food :) Probably what impressed me the most was the service, the whole family was so attentive and had such a great passion and energy about them :) will definitely be coming back for more!

loved this place. interesting chipotle concept brought to Indian cuisine. staff was extremely friendly to us and let us sample a lot. the red sauce on chicken is really good. makes it great for someone who's not Indian to order and get an excellent dish. deserts were okay, gajar halwa was not the best but ras malai was good.

rude! rude! rude!   they did a money mailer coupon and i printed it out and came in.  the lady said i had to have the actual coupon copy and refused to let me use it.  even though the site specifically says you can print it.   she also said she honored it earlier and called other owners and said she should not.  i explained that you paid for advertising to get people in the door and that she should be nice and thankful for coming in.
the food presentation was horrible.  it looks like prison food ( from what i have seen in movies. not personal expereince.)  i am half indian and have eaten indian food all my life.  i think the reviews must have come from friends and family.  food is heavy on spices not a good spicy flavor!  i will save you the trip don't waste your time!

I had a great first time experience at Dalicious. I walked in to place a take-out order and was immediately greeted and given a great explanation of the ordering process. They brilliantly modeled the ordering process after Chipotle which makes ordering very simple and concise (just follow steps 1, 2,3 and 4). Food was very good- just the right amount of spices. The restaurant has plenty of seating if you decide to eat in. With meat lovers, vegetarians and vegans in our household- everyone has options at Dalicious. We will be back.

Amazing food giving you the "home cooked" flavor. The owners are super nice.
The veggie pickle is outstanding.
The food was great along with their chaas. The kofta with the brown sauce tailored to the spice level and wheat rotis and black dal was really filling.

I loved everything about eating here!  The restaurant was clean, and beautiful on the inside.  I liked the way the menu was set up and the ordering was really easy.  The owner was there, and brought samples of the sauces.  She was a delight!   The food was outstanding.  I had the paneer and red sauce, the yellow dal, and naan.  It was all so, so good and a great value for the price!  I highly recommend this place!
Very good food love brown sauce and Dal makhani and Tandoori Roti and Vag Samosa love it :)

Excellent Excellent food and prompt service. Ordered the Chole Bhatura, lamb dish, lassi, gajar halwa. Everything was dalicious. Even our 6 yr and 9 yr old enjoyed the meal and experience. Would definitely come back here soon.

Went to lunch here with a friend and really enjoyed everything about this restaurant. Atmosphere is inviting. The owner is delightful, welcoming and helpful. The food so very good. 

If you are new to Indian food, this would be the place to start. The menu is set up so that you pick a protein (chicken, lamb, etc), a sauce, type of lentils and nan. 

So easy. And we were offered samples of the sauce before ordering. Very helpful! 

I'll be returning here again to try a new "combo". This is a great go to for take-out OR sit down. Look forward to checking out the weekend menu which I believe is an expanded menu that changes each weekend to a different region of India. Yum!
If you want to taste authentic home cooked Indian food in Naperville area visit this place.

Went back for their Thali special over the weekend. It was outstanding. Everything you look for in a quick service restaurant - great food, good service and savvy business owners who give a lot of importance to customer service.

I like Indian food but not very familiar with dish names. The owner gave me a taste of the 3 sauces to select and I was able to select the perfect one for me. Food portions were just  right. I will be going back very soon.

We ate lunch in the restaurant and it was freezing (every diner had their coats on and zipped up for the duration of their meals). The food took ~20 minutes to come out (which seemed long given that there was only one other couple present) BUT the food was great (particularly the chicken samosas and the chicken in red sauce) and worth the wait. The employee we interacted with was extremely polite and friendly and the restaurant was clean. We will definitely come here again but ONLY for take out (because who likes to eat in their coat and gloves?)

Good Indian Food and a surprisingly varied menu for a small restaurant. Great for vegetarian fare, but the meat-eaters in my party loved the meat dishes. Staff will adjust spiciness. Ordering is simple and done at the counter. The food was served hot and was very tasty. Staff was as informative as we wanted them to be, not overbearing but friendly and not aloof. Good value, good experience. Don't fear the store-front presence. The food is good!

My parents picked Parkers' for their 40th anniversary dinner and invited me along to celebrate. We really couldn't have chosen better! It's a classy setting not overwhelmed by noise due to carpeting and acoustic ceiling panels (I didn't even realize til I went off to the bathroom in the lounge area that there was a piano player in the next room!) 

We started with the five-cheese course (they give you a list, but I wish they also clarified which is which when the plate arrives), accompanied by raisin crostini and fig compote; quite an excellent array, and plenty for three people. 

All of us were pleased by our entree choices. I had the deconstructed lobster mac and cheese: a lobster tail that was served alongside a plate of spiral pasta bathed in a smoked gouda cheese sauce, with a slice of bacon on the side. All the elements were delicious and I would definitely order this again. 

My dad had the Lake Superior whitefish roasted on a cedar plank, which he pronounced excellent, and my mother had the bouillabaisse, which isn't seen too often outside of French or Cajun restaurants and was enough to serve two people, loaded with crab, calamari, clams, and other seafood in a rich tomato broth. 

When they made the reservation my mom had said it was their anniversary, so when we ordered dessert (key lime pie and caramel budino), the key lime pie came out on a plate with "Happy Anniversary" written on it in chocolate sauce, which was a sweet touch. While the key lime was tasty, the caramel budino custard, served somewhat awkwardly in a mason jar, was the table favorite. 

Our waiter Luis was a consummate professional, made good suggestions and did an excellent job. 

Definitely a worthy location to celebrate a big occasion. Happy Anniversary, Mom and Dad!

Four of us dined Saturday night. 
We ordered three appetizers to share. My favorites were the polenta sticks and the grilled baby octopus. The Oysters Rockefeller were tried, but disappointed.
The husband and I both enjoyed the salad of organic mesclun greens with mustard vinaigrette. The others ordered the beet salad and the chopped salad. Both were enjoyed.
The rib tips with sweet potato purée (up charge for the sweet potato purée), 2 salmons medium rare (and perfectly cooked) with a shrimp succotash and garlic spinach, and sautéed sea scallops sided with the sweet potato purée and the garlic spinach were our entrees. Everything was delicious.
For dessert we had an order of the rice pudding, a scoop of chocolate ice cream with caramel sauce, and 2 flourless chocolate cakes with chocolate mousse and caramel sauce were our desserts. Everyone had a lovely sweet experience followed by very good coffee. 
Ambience was nice. A pianist was playing in the bar area (Saturday night).
Service was outstanding from Sarah! She made our whole dining experience much better. She was friendly, very knowledgeable about the menu options and did her best to accommodate each diner's preferences. At all times she was organized, professional, and fantastic! We plan to request to be seated with her in the future!
Overall, Parkers is a good solid place to go with a large variety of food and beverage offerings, good service, and nice ambience.
It is easy to find, just off I88 at Highland. Free parking or valet.

Been living out here for over 7 years and can't believe this is the first time to this beautiful restaurant.

Well worth the wait for sure!

We started with oysters on the half shell and 2 cups of the clam chowder. 

Both simply amazing!

For dinner my wife ordered the surf and turf and I had to have the lobster roll.

My loved her dinner as for I needed to pack my to go as I was already full, but looking forward to my lunch tomorrow!!!

Atmosphere and pricing was great.

For dessert we ordered the Vermont maple sugar cotton candy, Yes cotton candy!

Can't wait to come back again

How have I never been here?  Truly a 5-star dining experience.  We chose to sit in the lounge with live music.  Very cozy and intimate.  Our server was engaging and gave great recommendations.  Nice beer list and they even carry my favorite local beer - Miskatonic Catch Penny (Darien, IL)!  The hubbie devoured his fish entrée and I LOVED my Bouillabaisse!  The Bouillabaisse is big enough that 2 people can probably share.  We enjoyed a delicious flourless chocolate cake for dessert.

We will be back!

To show you what a class act Parker's is, I was contacted by management after reading my recent Yelp review to inform me that they were disappointed in the service I received on my last visit and will be directing their staff that this should never happen. I will always be a customer at this establishment as the food is five stars, as is the atmosphere and the friendly staff. This is the first time I ever had a negative experience with the service and I know it's not their normal protocol. I highly recommend this restaurant not only for the great and creative food, but also because they do care about their customers.

Your dilemma, searching for this restaurant online, is that it is known, for some peculiar reason, by different names. The name on the building is Parkers' Restaurant and Bar.  The domain name for their website is "ParkersAmerican."  On different sites around the web, you'll see a reference to "Parker's Ocean Grill."

I'm already confused and I haven't even been seated. The restaurant boasts they are all about "fresh," and maintain relationships with specially selected suppliers, growers and farmers for filling their larder. I have no reason to doubt that, with one exception. The "catch of the day" when I was there was "Tilapia brought from the Gulf," which is probably incorrect, an awful lot of wild tilapia is inedible, and the tilapia served in US restaurants and available in groceries is farmed - pond raised. There are a few tilapia farms in the US, but the vast majority of farmed tilapia sold in the US comes from Latin America or Asia. Small matter.

Spoiler alert. Unless you're planning a special evening, have a large group, or need to eat at a specific hour, hit the bar for their happy hour menu,  at these days and times:

Monday thru Friday - 3 p.m. to 7 p.m.
Saturday - 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.
Sunday - 3 p.m. to 6 p.m.

The bar menu is half-price and there are drink specials, of course. The bar menu includes some small plates, a number of wood-fired pizzas, and a couple sandwiches, including a traditional New England lobster roll. Here's what's cool about that. At the happy hour price, the lobster roll is less than you'd pay nearly anywhere from Massachusetts to Maine! Honest!

We went with tempura shrimp (3 to an order) and bruschetta, (Wood Grilled Garlic Crostini, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Laura Chenel Goat Cheese, Roasted Tomato Basil Salad). The bruschetta was heavy on the herbs, and the group universally panned it.

On to the dinner table, and the entree orders were preceded by a wedge salad to share, followed by sea scallops  with gnocchi, cedar plank roasted Lake Superior whitefish with mash, a tilapia sandwich with shoestrings, and me?  Why a burger, of course, "Certified Angus,"  Moody Blue cheese (Wisconsin), Lettuce, Tomato, on a toasted Challah.  The kitchen's choice is to serve this with a chipotle mayo, which I passed on.  It's a pretty fine burger, terrific Wisconsin blue cheese (but owned by the Swiss cheese giant Emmi which has been buying up small specialty cheesemakers in the US), the bun was buttered, toasted, and firm enough to hold the meat and any condiments one chose.

I have kind of a problem with "Certified Angus," which is merely a service mark a group of ranchers dreamed up in the 70s.  They have various claims about their beef being "better," I can't say if it is or not, I know I've had lots of great burgers from very small producers.  My personal favorite is (no, not Pat Lafrieda, but Creekstone Farms).  In any case, the burgers was A-OK.  $14.00.  Reports from around the table - a rave for the whitefish, a "great" for the tilapia sandwich, and a "meh" for the scallops. She thought the texture was odd.  I can relate to that.

I'm not sure where I would place this type of restaurant - I guess you could call it "casual fine dining?"  It's a nice room, tablecloths, a buncha flatware, kinda noisy, and people come in all sorts of apparel.  Entrees range from $14 - $50.  Dinner for four, with wine, was close to $300. 

You need three things to have a restaurant that's great, not simply good, in no particular order:  1)nice ambience, 2) great  food, 3) fantastic service. Parkers hits two out of three.  It's a nice room, pleasant, you don't feel jammed in or that the next table is eavesdropping. There are some private rooms as well.  The food was largely "OK," esthetically pleasing, and rather tasty, but nothing on the menu is going to make you go "wow."

The service?  Here's where this joint shined last night.  Jordan (like the river, she said), was knowledgeable, friendly, over the top attentive, checking in, but not too often, and immediately dealing with every request from the table.  Too many people in the service industry today are just passing through, and haven't bothered to even look up the definition of "hospitality." Jordan nailed it.

Parkers' is part of the Select Restaurant group based in Cleveland; they operated ten restaurants that stretch across America, and are mostly focused on entrees that swim.  You can make reservations online, and you probably should, because on a Saturday night, the place was jammed, and there were people waiting in the lobby.

This place was absolutely amazing. I had the Angus Black and Bleu burger, all I have to say if I wasn't so full I would have eaten two. they menu has a variety of different items to please every eater and its very reasonable. Our waiter was Justin and let me tell you he was great and very easy on the eyes as well. Nothing else to be said but to get your ass down to Parker's.

Find food Friday night turned out to be a success! Some days (who am I kidding.. I love Yelp EVERYDAY!) I'm so thankful for Yelp & the places it takes us. 

I called for reservations earlier in the day & they got us in without a problem. Pulling up, we were greeted by complimentary valet & walking in we heard the sweet sound of live music in the bar area. 

Although the ambiance felt pretty upscale, most (along with us) were wearing a nice shirt & jeans. I'd definitely skip the jeans with holes in them & leave your chucks at home. Save that for the pub or brewery later ;-) 

We were greeted immediately by our sever for drinks & appetizer order. Wine & whiskey were our choices for the evening & both were good. 
Complimentary bread & crackers came pretty fast & a citrus hummus & softened butter accompanied the bread and crackers on the plate. The hummus was delicious & added a nice touch for those dairy free diners. 

Okay so, we started with east coast oysters.. They were mind blowing! I'm not sure if it was their cocktail sauce or what but we loved them! No grit, already shucked & perfect!

For my entree I chose the cedar plank white fish. Honestly, I was slightly disappointed. Not that the food was bad necessarily but the fish was way under seasoned & the mashed potatoes tasted like there was beef broth added or something like that.. It was slightly off putting. 

So, all in all, pretty sweet spot for a date night dinner. Why only four stars? The entree. Other than that, service & the rest of our dining experience was on point. Definitely going back to check the rest of the menu out.. & reorder those oysters!

I come here once in a while for the happy hour because the bar menu is 50 percent off. This time we ordered a dozen oysters ($12) since it was buck a shuck, shrimp cocktail ($7.5), surf and turf sliders ($6) and Caesar salad ($4). 

Dozen oysters 3.5/5: they were smallish this time but still tasty. It came with a couple of mignette sauces which was nice.

Shrimp cocktail 4/5: the jumbo shrimp were good as was the cocktail sauce.

Surf and turf sliders (3/5): Two small sliders but they were decent.

Caesar salad (4/5): A salad is a salad is a salad but the fresh shaved parmesan cheese was a nice touch. 

It's my go to happy hour when I want to escape the hell I call studying at the library.

This review is ONLY ON THE BAR - FOOD. The real rating is 3.5 stars.

Great bar look and feel.  You really get great value when you go for happy hour and 1/2 off the all items on the bar menu.  The food was GOOD.  Although, I feel the need to comment on my fellow diner desiring a drink on the sweeter side, yet they were out of moscato and pina coloda mix.  The service was OK, it just seemed to get a little busy for one waiter to handle.  GREAT looking bar, with wood everywhere and comforatble booths and chairs; gave off a real old-school-in-its-prime type feel.

I will update my review after going back and trying some of their drinks next time.  YES, I will be returning to enjoy all that Parkers has to offer.

Great little restaurant hidden along a busy road. Parker is surprisingly a vary large restaurant with a peripheral outdoor seating area. The bar area is unique and has a few TV's with a piano and live band playing which is a nice way to start off your night. 

We dined for my birthday and were delighted to find that our waiter was patient, courteous, very informative, and an absolute gem. 

The table starts with a variety of fresh baked breads and HUMMUS which was very unique and perfect.

For starters we ordered the halibut wontons which were some of the best fish tacos that I have ever had and I would be willing to make a future trip just for these wonderful snacks. The fish was perfectly cooked and nicely blackened with a pico de gallo topping and a creamy spicy avacado relish underneath. A MUST TRY!

The lobster bisque was served with a small piece of lobster ravioli in the center. I was a bit disappointed as the bisque was not up to par with other places considering Parker's prides themselves on their seafood. My ravioli may have been hand made but a bit chewy and unappealing. The downside was that there was only lobster in the ravioli and no meaty feel to the rest of the soup. 

I ordered the white fish with a few adjustments which included jalepenos and a blackened/paprika finish. The fish was cooked to perfection on top of a cedar wood block. Extremely appetizing and fresh!. The side came with a buttery spinach which I was pleased with but I am a big fan of fresh vegatables and a side of mashed potatoes which were a bit bland but edible. 

My wife ordered the sea scallops which were not up to par with other places in the chicagoland area. The scallops were definately fresh but slightly over cooked and a bit chewy. 

Server brought us a desert on the house which was a oreo custard in a jar and a solid way to end the night!!! 

Drinks: this place has an exensive and appealing wine menu but the specialty drinks were nothing special and the drinks are fairly overpriced in my honest opinion. 

TIP: check in on yelp for 10% off your bill!!!! 

I will be back to try out happy hour and the wonton's!

Premise/Intro:
A beautifully decorated place with the perfect romantic ambiance to share with that perfect someone on any occasion. 

Decor :
This place is perfect for any romantic occasion.  These days its very tough to find a place with a dress code but this place has it.  The do not allow ripped clothes, sweats and hats.  Dress classy and be polite.  There as are several dining rooms to cater for whatever occasion you're coming for.  They have the bar area with live piano music, the main dining room, side semi private room and a private room in the back. Tables have white clean linen cloths with candles in the mddle with dim lighting.  Silver ware and drinking glasses were fantastic.

Service:
Impeccable as our waitress was very knowledgeable and pleasant.  She was very kind as well. 

Food/Product:
Food was fantastic. I ordered the fish with steamed spinach and mashed potatoes and a lot with chicken encrusted in dough with steamed spinach. I ordered tomatoe soup and lobster bisque for starters. The bread and crackers with butter and hummus were an excellent blend with the soups. After dinner we had coffee and cappuccino with a small biscotti.

Price:
The price was very reasonable for the amount and quality of food we got. 

Overall experience/Conclusion:
This is a FANTASTIC place with excellent ambiance, service, food and price.  I'll be a repeated customer for sure.

Part 1 of 2 review: Food 5 of 5

From the selection in the area, Parkers is definitely one of the best options. I certainly appreciate the integrity of the farm raised direct trade theme for both seafood and land food. The food has been consistent and tasteful. We've had the calamari, Cesar salad, raw oysters (best place to get them), bouillabaisse, crab cakes, lobster roll, braised beef, and the burger. None have disappointed. One particular highlight was our engagement anniversary. They treated us to both the key lime pie and cotton candy desserts. Both delicious and appreciated. The best deals are on Monday, Tuesday, and Friday afternoon for buck a shuck oysters ($1 each). Next are the happy hour deals, half price bar menu. I should also note that all of our dining experiences have been in the bar. Saturday night piano sessions are an enjoyment as well.

Part 2 of 2: Service (3 of 5)

I wish I could say the service has been as consistent as the food. Our first few visits were great. From the reservations to the servers and bus boys. The service and food kept us coming back. The most recent visits have not been as pleasant from sitting at a table to sitting at the bar. Our most recent visit, we weren't greeted at all. The greeting was from across the bar and we were asked "What are you drinking tonight?". Would have liked some hospitality. The bartenders and waiters have been a bit standoffish and somewhat cold. I'm not sure if it has something to do with being younger in a typically more mature crowd but it could have been off nights 3 times in a row. The first few visit really did set expectations high. Another side note, we've had great friendly interactions with the regular patrons. Overall I wouldn't be deterred from trying Parkers or going back.

I love this place. Their seafood always tastes fresh and flavorful. Even their bread is exceptional. The bread plate comes with four kinds of bread, including Indian pappadum. Desserts are wonderful and creative. The servers make you feel like a high roller even if you're not one.

Totally amazing. 
Food gourmet. 
Staff nice as possible, dressed classy 10/10.
Ambiance of an oak smoking room.
Drinks were inspiring.
Even had a 10% discount for checking in!

If you have guests to impress keep this place in mind. Even the bread at the table was impressive and artistic. They also gave us free calamari for the table.

I've been twice now.  The first time I sat at the bar and the guy behind the bar is outstanding.  Half price apps during happy hour.  This place is very large.  I would recommend sitting in the bar area and they even let you make a reservation in the lounge (most places won't let you do that).  The second time I came for the live jazz on Thursday.  The band there was actually extremely good.  Because we were there in December they were playing holiday jazz, which is possibly my favorite genre of music.  And they did it well.

The baked burrata was very good.  The fried calamari was decent as in it was cooked well but there was too much breading on it.  The flat breads are decent but the crust is too soggy.  I would prefer a thin, crispy crust.  Flavors are good though.  The clear standout to me is the shrimp tempura.  Literally the best I've ever had in my life.  The chicken spring rolls are decent.  Overall the food is above average, service and ambiance  are above average and I enjoy going there.
Has gone down hill in the past few years. Tonight's dinners was extremely disappointing. Pricy and mediocre food. Great bar, live music, but don't go for the food.

Parker's Restaurant and Bar brought a whole host of surprises and delectable comestibles that are rare to this area. Being situated adjacent to a busy intersection and in front of a large business building, the location was strange. Nonetheless, it was great food wise. This is a custom and truly eye popping attraction to the eye, with several decorative lights and plants. Walking up to the door, I smelled a beautiful fragrance of tulips but as I walked into the building to wait for seating, it smelled like urine. 

Being seated by a lovely crew I took my jacket off and observed the surroundings. This place was very fancy and clean. The bar area was large and expansive. While the dining rooms were armed with a large fireplace. It was a quality experience. 

The waiter came and greeted us (a colleague and I) and we were going to order appetizers from their well designed menus. The second we took our eyes of the menu he left for something. It was a little odd because that is against my policy for customer service and satisfactory rights. He finally did come around and he asked for appetizers. So we ordered the octopus appetizer. Waiting for a good 10 minutes, we received our dish. It was a smaller dish so it shouldn't have been that long of a duration to wait. 

Coming around again, the waiter asked us to order. So I ordered the boneless rib dish. My colleague ordered too. And then we waited, and waited, and waited. Waiting for an hour for our meal, it finally came. The waiter didn't say anything about how long it took, even though the Restaurant was not very booming that day in population. 

Eating the dish, the presentation was beautiful. As for the ribs, it was very bland. The flavor should pack a punch my mouth, but it didn't. The mashed potatoes were well seasoned and delicious. I don't think a customer ordering this quality of dish should wait an hour for it to arrive, which prevented my from giving this restaurant a 4 star rating. 

Word of notice: 
Upon drinking their water, my colleague told me that a small fly was in their water! I couldn't believe my eyes. It seemed to resemble the body and wings of a tiny insect. This was discovered seconds upon leaving. It may have been a leaf or food residue. But it was still unsatisfying.

I have to update my review, and unfortunately, not for the better. The food is still quite good at Parkers, but anyone who was there for the Mother's Day brunch knows what a mess it was. I'm not sure what happened, because we went to the same brunch three years earlier, and it had a much more logical setup. 

This time, they had one long, single-sided buffet, stretching almost the full length of the dining room. This meant that there was a line of people 20 deep extending around the corner from the start, through the foyer, and into the bar. I felt so bad for the people seated in the bar,  as a line of standing diners surrounded and hovered over them. 

I'd say I would give them another shot, but nowadays, I only go there to take my folks to brunch, and they were too old and annoyed with the experience to return. A shame. I'd stick with them for non-holidays.
Oysters were awesome. Very fresh. I had the lobster bisque which was a very neat presentation. Everything I had was very fresh and very good. Service was excellent.
Another favorite in Downer's Grove. I usually sit in the bar, order an Old Fashioned, and nibble on a few apps. Perfect after a long day. It can get pricey, so check out the happy hour deals to save.

I absolutely love this place! Easily my favorite suburban restaurant and I can not wait to come back! Everything is top notch! Service is phenomenal to match the killer food and nice ambiance! Great date night spot. I've been several times. I've gotten the oysters, lobster bisque, clam chowder, duck, lamb and surf and turf. All were flawless! Great wine selection as well. For dessert I always get the toffee creme brûlée and maple Cotten candy to go! (If you haven't tried either of those your seriously missing out) I want to stop in for lunch! That will be my next plan of attack, this place is sure to please! Cheers!!

Buffet set-up was awful.  Next time set-up stations , nobody wants to wait in a long line.   They should see how Shaws is set-up and follow their brunch ideas. 
Food was not great, will not be back.

Parker's has a beautiful patio for outdoor seating in the summer. Located in the suburbs a great location for your seafood fix! They host oyster specials and have an amazing clam chowder along with delicious lobster roll. The lobster roll comes with an amazing side of perfectly cooked sweet potato fries. If your on a date with a meat lover, have them try the bleu cheese burger, just delicious and they can share the generous portion of their crispy potato fries with you too. They also serve a delicious assortment of bread before dinner with hummus and whipped butter. Great place for lunch with a colleague or date night with your honey.

The food has been delicious here every time I've gone! I most recently ordered a lobster roll, and it was pleasantly cool and succulent. I was a little weary ordering it, but I was most definitely pleased. It came with a side of sweet potato fries and coleslaw which were also very tasty.

Service is great! Our waiter was attentive and friendly! I definitely recommend this place!

Fyi - I was told that if you are celebrating a special occasion (anniversary/birthday/etc.) they will customize the menu with a special greeting on there for you.

They also have nice different sized private rooms for events.

Came here on a last minute review of other reviews.   Staying for a conference and not from Chicago or this area.  I have to say I was impressed!  Only 4 stars because of expense ( I can do that right?)..... but food-service-ambience was excellent.  Restaurant is an upscale seafood-bar restaurant in a suburban-mall area.     They have a great craft beer list as well as wines.  I ordered the plank halibut and salad and was great.  Service was outstanding.  I would come back for sure if I lived in this area but it is expensive and for a party of 2 we paid $112.00 for the 2 dinners and 2 drafts only!  Meals themselves were $36.00.  So it is for special occasions.....
