Delicious food and great service. I will say hands down Parkers is Downers Grove best restaurant, if you haven't dined in yet you must go ASAP!

We recently had a five star experience at Parker's and during our dinner, we commented on the fact that we've liked this place for years but for some reason, it slips our minds to come here - that won't happen again.

The decor at Parker's is comfortable and stylish - not too "clubby" and dressy enough that you feel like you're someplace special but won't feel under dressed if you are in jeans.  

The service was great from the moment we checked in for our reservation through to the end of our dinner.  Our server was so friendly and accommodating - we were celebrating our 30th anniversary and she recognized that throughout the dinner and brought us a complimentary Key Lime Pie for dessert - it was delicious!

Our entrees consisted of Bouillabaisse (my husband said it was the best he's ever had), Whitefish, Lobster Mac 'n Cheese and Lamb Chops - everything was amazing.  We also ordered several cocktails and glasses of wine and enjoyed every one.  I thought their wine list was very affordable and had wonderful choices to pair with everything on their menu,

The icing on the cake was the Vermont Maple Syrup Cotton Candy that we also had for dessert - I was skeptical at first, who would ever think of ordering Cotton Candy for dessert in a restaurant like this?? - that's carnival food!!  It was so amazingly good - not too sweet but you could taste the syrup flavor.  It was so light and fluffy - we devoured the huge portion in a matter of minutes.  I will dream about that cotton candy - it will likely bring us back to Parker's very soon - we are planning to try their happy hour next.

Food and service were good. 
Their "ranked" pizza is not spectacular. Everyone in the group got something different to try and nothing to complain about but not 5stars either.
It was a little loud in the dinning room and for our group of 8 seated at a rectangular table it was difficult to have a conversation without raising your voice. 
Definitely worth a try if you haven't been. 
The only other complaint I have is they had a coupon flashing on Yelp, if you checked in you could get 10%off. So I did, and it says the coupon must be used in 4hrs of checking in but when we tried it he said we couldn't use it because it was a Saturday. I understand no coupons on Saturday but then they need to get that taken off on the days it cannot be used.

My husband and I came here during happy hour for dinner.  We sat in the lounge area because the dining room doesnt open until 5:00.  The bar area is nice and dimly lit.  We both ordered hamburgers.  I ordered mine medium well he ordered his medium.  They were both cooked correctly.  I liked my burger my husband said his was juicy but it was really plain either not enough or no seasoning.  He also thought the fries tasted like they were fried in the same oil as the fish.  We ordered the cotton candy and enjoyed it.  It was still warm when it came out and was delicious. The service was good and friendly but I thought she waited a little  too long between the time we finished our dinner to ask if we wanted dessert.  I also felt like it took just a little too long to get our bill.  I would come again and try the fish as it seemed like the fish had a lot of good reviews.

Nice ambience. Okay service. Food - not so great - wife describes it as terrible and I can't argue.

$100 for a meal and you expect it to be at least decent. All vegetables soaked in weird sauces. Salmon just okay. Bland shrimp and lobster bisque. Wife loves mashed potatoes and couldn't finish what they brought "tasted like they came from a box". 
Overall 1 star. Don't recommend, so many better restaurants in the neighborhood. If you want seafood go to Devons. If you want Meat Gibsons. And if you want decent food go almost anywhere else.
The food was excellent and the staff was very attentive. The prices were designed entry for the level of dining experience. I would recommend them for anyone looking for a nicer place to have dinner.

I just went here for dinner for the first time yesterday evening and was very impressed. My server was extremely attentive and the atmosphere of the restaurant had a nice ambiance. My date and I had the margherita pizza for an appetizer and it was the best I've ever had. Onto the entrees- he had the duck and I had the swordfish special. My dish's flavors exploded in my mouth-each component worked perfectly with the others to create a delicious and exciting meal. I would highly recommend trying Parkers' if you are in the area!

Pretty nice place. Nice bar with happy hour specials but beware...tables in the bar can be reserved and there may not be room for your group unless you plan ahead. Pluses: Open and classy decor. Not a bad noise level for our group of 6. No yelling across the table needed. Sat by the kitchen and didn't hear much noise from there either. Service was pretty good. Nice guy, friendly, offered suggestions on apps and dinner as well as wine. Also offered to split salads. Food. Lots of cool apps to chose from. Tempura shrimp yummy. Lobster fritters yummy. Not your standard seafood place. Seems like they are trying to do different/unusual things with the fish. Nice. Presentations are cool too. Tempura battered walleye over fried rice with kimchee. Very tasty. Halibut in a classic beur blanc sauce but with a nice sweet potato mash. Server happily brought extra sauce when asked. Lobster mac and cheese. Cool presentation of whole lobster tail on the side but the cheese sauce was a bit thin and slightly disappointing. Ina Garten (Barefoot Contessa) has the best lobster mac and cheese recipe on the planet! Dessert. Maple cotton candy was enough to satisfy but they have lots more! Bread pudding! Ice cream tower! Eat!!
Minus: A little pricey but oh well, we don't eat here every night. Service was just a hair slow but then again, we weren't in a rush and maybe dinner here should take time. Biggest problem, server took the signed/paid for check off the table before we left. If I owned the place that would never happen! Then the server kinda gave us the "rush" to leave. (Odd because no one was in need of our table and it was only 8:30pm.)
I'll give the place another try. The steaks coming from the kitchen looked really good. Next time.

Went there to celebrate my Mom's 70th birthday. She loves seafood and not only did Parker's deliver on the excellent food but the service was outstanding. 

We sprung for the Private room because we brought our kids, and yes they treated our kids great. They had a kids menu and everything. I wouldn't call this a kids' place but it available. 
Important for Parents with kids under 10.

Had Calamari & the Spring Rolls, spring rolls didn't do much for us but the Calamari was perfect.      Beer on tap was a little high, $ 7 for like a normal glass.    I suppose the food bargains at Happy Hour balance out the rather pricey drinks. 

Wine seemed pretty pricey, stood away from that.

The lobster roll was phenomenal and our bartender, Casey, was the best. Also best cotton candy ever. Definitely a place to come to for great service and food. Plus, the bar menu is half off during 3-7!

I've been here now for two work events and the food and service is outstanding.   We started out with appetizers including oysters.  Several of us agreed that the oysters were some of the best we have ever had.   Followed with some lobster bisque soup served with a ravioli and it was very well done and not too rich as others are served.  had the walleye prepared on plank and it had to be one of the best meal dishes I've ever experienced.   We all had a dessert which we shared and again very good including the maple cotton candy.....YES....cotton candy.  

Cocktails and wine were very good as was the service.  All you would expect given the prices.  

Definitely need to get back more often!!!!

Cheers!!!

John

A fantastic dining experience for our team of 14! Parker's had a room set up for us in less than 20 minutes when we called at the last minute to see if they could accommodate our large group. The apps and main courses were heavenly and the desserts to die for. Everyone was delightfully surprised by the high quality of the food and excellent service. Thank you to Angelo and his team for making our experience memorable.

We opted to sit at the bar tonight in this classic style steakhouse. The bartender took great care of us and the food was great, just not five star great.

Maybe it was because I wasn't in a steak mood tonight, so I went with the roasted chicken. It was quite good. Half of a chicken, on top of mashed potatoes and roasted mushrooms and what meal would be complete without bacon? Two beers on the side too.

We chose the restaurant for the name and that it was Open Table-able. I don't know if I would go back.

Food was tasty, service was strong, and the Manager Heather was attentive and apologetic after a shaky start with our reservation being somewhat meaningless. Our server Luke was determined to redeem our first experience, and was attentive and quick. My initial checkin was a low score as I was certainly "Hangry". However, great service, good wine selection and pricing, along with the fresh ingredients and fish that was perfectly prepared did redeem my rating.  BTW the desserts were light and wonderful in both presentation and taste.

Had a 6:00 Open Table reservation & didn't get seated until 6:30 due to a Derby charity event running over. No one apologized. No manager in site. Wife's Halibut was over cooked, had to wait 30 min for bottle of Voss water, asked server 4 times for shredded parm for daughters pasta. I sent a full glass of spoiled Mt Beautiful Sauv Blanc back & no one asked why. Very inattentive staff.
Definitely wouldn't recommend Parkers

After a disappointing evening on Mother's Day 2015, our son, Alexander, convinced us to give it another try for his 21st birthday celebration. 
My recommendation is if you are not pleased with the server request another.
What a difference! The server was attentive, helpful and timely. The short ribs and salmon salad were amazing!
Love this restaurant.  Fresh gourmet menu never disappoints.  Excellent service too!!

Wow!  I haven't been here in years and all I kept wondering during my recent visit why that was, as what I found was great food, better service and an ambiance that was conducive to whatever the reason that brought you there be it business, a celebration or just a casual meal.

We were seated promptly for our reservation at a table in the dining room.  It was a cold night so a seat near the fireplace was a welcome gesture.  If you are looking for a more casual ambiance, you can also get the same menu in the bar area.

Our server, Davis, was outstanding, friendly, efficient; just the kind of person who you would like to pull up a chair and join you.  Of course that would have made it difficult for him to take care of us . . .but a girl can dream!

They have specials of the day and on this day one of the specials as a delicious tuna poke appetizer which was great.  We also had some fresh oysters they have both east and west coast) as well as my friend enjoyed some of their creamy clam chowder that was packed with clams.

For our entrees, I had the red king crab and my friend had the surf and turf.  Both were quite good and reasonably priced for the quality of the food.

But the highlight of the meal had to be the dessert.  Can you say, "maple spun cotton candy"?  Holy Cripes!  This thing was every inner child's dream!  And while it may have put me in a sugar coma for the rest of the night, it was worth every calorie!!

If you drive, and you will cuz this is the "burbs" there is a large parking lot.  Dinner for two with plenty of drinks and dessert ran about $180 but well worth every penny.

Even if you don't live nearby- Parkers has food worthy of a city location and it's right in Downers Grove!

I had my first visit to this restaurant recently and I was very impressed.

The food, service and ambience was all as good as it gets.

i would say this is one of the better restaurants in the western suburbs.

I look forward to a return visit.

While in a "foreign land" travelling for business it is important for one to refer to Yelp for some direction. I am happy to report that Yelp did not steer me wrong this night. Got here at about 5:30, still a touch early for dinner but really liked the atmosphere when we got there. For the more upscale dining experience you can take a right and head into the "formal" dining area and for a couple of buddies looking for some great food you can head straight into the bar/lounge area. The piano takes center stage here, unfortunately it went unplayed this night. I faintly remember reading or hearing that they have a pianist in there on Thursdays and some other nights but please don't hold me to it.

It was happy hour so looks like we were in for some deals. Ended up with the calamari, "spring rolls" and a lobster roll. All half price and ready for the ordering. Service was great, the server was attentive and very helpful in directing us through the menu and the happy hour specials. YELP WARNING though, you get 10% on a check in but it does not apply to the HH deals. 

Calamari was a bit bready but had great flavor. The calamari itself was soft and cooked perfectly, so far so good.
"Spring rolls" were ordered, spring rolls were not necessarily received. Well, nothing like a spring roll that I recognize anyway. There were more like an eggroll but with a meaty, maybe chicken kinda spam-y inner. Not terrible with the sauce but I kinda expected something a bit more refreshing and light, they were over all fine. 
The lobster roll, wow. Couple of things here. The bread was like a taco-esque as a thick piece with a slit in the middle. Toasted with a buttery, crispy exterior and a delicious little nest dug out for the lobster mix held within. Delicious and rich in flavor these rolls are something wonderful to try. They are served with sweet potato fries that were about the size and width of McDonalds fries but with that delicious caramelized sweet potato exterior.

Overall, this place was great. I think pretty much everything ranged between $6-$10 each. The LOBSTER roll was $10.50! Normally $21, very nice!

10/29/16  - A while back I wrote a stinging complaint regarding an experience my husband and I had at  Parkers Restaurant and Bar.  I had not complained about the food or the service but was quite upset over an incident with an obnoxious customer in the lounge area , which I had been told went on each week . After my concerns were posted and emailed to the restaurant, I am pleased to say the manager , Heather, contacted me soon after.  She assured me that staff would be retrained,
 as incidents such as the one I had described would not be allowed to continue at Parkers Restaurant  and Bar. At the end of our telephone conversation,  I was also offered an considerable discount on my next visit , which I attempted to decline , as I felt that  the purpose of my  complaint was to let management know how offensive this experience was, not to be gifted in any way.  The manager, Heather , insisted that I accept her offer as well as to request to meet her when we dine at Parkers in the future.   I did take advantage of her generosity.  We  returned to Parkers one Saturday  evening  for dinner and were happy to meet Heather , who spent time with us to , once again , assure us that our unfortunate experience would not be repeated.  Kudos to Heather .  We are happy to continue to keep this restaurant as one of our favorites and one we will recommend to others to enjoy as the food , service and atmosphere are worthy of five stars , in our estimation.  Thank you to the staff at Parkers Restaurant and Bar for giving this tale a happy ending.  


8/13/16 - Parkers has been a favorite restaurant of ours for many years .  In July , we took my father - in -law there for his 96th birthday. My husband and I have been there for dinners out  as well as get togethers with friends.  I have even given him an occasional gift card since he enjoys dining here so much  Service and the quality of the menu have always been excellent.   I doubt we will be back , however considering our experience last Thursday evening.  Since the appetizers always look so good , we decided to go on a week day night to eat in the lounge area and stick to a lighter meal.  A jazz quartet was playing which I was happy to see.  The experience was beyond awful , however.  There was a man there (cannot possibly be called a gentleman)  who may have been inebriated sitting at the next table spouting , loudly, using the f bomb in just about every sentence.  I could not believe that no one spoke to him to bring down the volume as well as the language.  There were other couples there  as well as other diners with their children passing by to use the restrooms.  After a few minutes of this , I made eye contact with him, to no avail.  I waited a little longer and when it became apparent no one was going to speak to this guy, I got up to ask for the manager.  Our waiter noticed I was upset and guided me to the manager who explained to me there was nothing he could do about the situation and his hands were tied since this individual was a regular.  So , Parkers restaurant, which is a four star restaurant , according to some web sites and certainly is not just a bar or inexpensive dining experience allows boorish behavior?  And this is the image they wish to show to their clientele?  Really?  Management should be ashamed.

This is nothing more than a glorified Red Lobster. I don't know what these people are raving about, maybe they also consider Olive Garden good. 

I'd never go back for dinner, maybe lunch with the kids. 

Service was ok, lacking at first but I think she picked up that I was expecting more and got better as the night rolled along.

I actually lived in DG for several years and never checked this place out. I was missing a gem. Great seafood and very nice level of service for this part of Chicagoland. Will definitely go again when we are in the area.

One of the best in the western suburbs! We LOVE this place and always feel like it's a celebration when we go. Every dish is a special creation with extreme attention to detail. The whitefish Wellington is amazing. The pizza, oysters, wine list...all rock! The caramel boudino is one of the best desserts we've ever had. On top of the great food is the whimsical artwork throughout and on some nights you can enjoy live music. A great experience whether your formal dining by the fire or keeping it casual in the bar.

A BIG THANK YOU to Chef Patrick McLaughlin and his staff (and Heather) at Parker's for making my parents 69th anniversary dinner so special !!!
Very much appreciated, they said they had a wonder time!!

Courteous staff, dim lighting. They had private party rooms with well kept sound proof. A cool lounge area with live piano, I expected a bar and grill of sorts as we were looking for a beer and food spot on my bday weekend with my gf. Turned out to be way too fancy for our taste. We were the youngest couple in there, and the menu included duck and hummus. All in all the experience was excellent I would go here again for a special occasion. Oh yeah I order chicken breast which was the right amount of fried, tasted phenomenal. My gf had a blue cheese burger. Good beer selection, extensive wine list, the calamari was delicious, a tie for my favorite calamari (Longhorn Steakhouse)

This week my family brought our Italian out of town guests to Parkers for my Birthday, and to share with them the VPN certified pizza. I have been there many time and have suggested the restaurant to colleagues as well. Unfortunately this last time, our server was terrible. And we all know what bad service can do to your restaurant going experience. 

The host was very friendly, and Tim our bartender was also very helpful. In fact, I wish we would have just avoided being seated in the restaurant and stayed with Time. 

Our server was rude, in a hurry, not helpful and did not have a sufficient knowledge of the menu, or the beer/wine list. He paid no attention to the fact that our guests were from out of town, or that we were there to celebrate my birthday. 

We were all there to order drinks, and try to pizzas. He did not know about the types of beer, or wine list when we asked him questions. He also told us that the only pizza available was the Margarita pizza. When we asked him if there was anyway we could add other ingredients, he said no. there were no mushrooms, no prosciutto, and nothing else available. I am surprised that my fiance, father and brother didn't just get up and walk out. They told me later that the only reason they didn't was because it was for my birthday. 

My parents had just been drinking in the bar and told me that there were many other pizzas available, so I went to see Tim who ensured me that we could order any of there pizzas they would just not be half prize because of happy hour. At this point our server had already made it clear in a very rude way that what was on the menu was the only thing available and that nothing could be added. When I confronted him about this, he finally reluctantly let one of our out of town guests add sausage. 

When the food came, we found several hairs in our pizza and coffee. 

It is a shame that this one person was able to ruin what was supposed to be a great night when the rest of the staff was friendly and helpful. 

I wont be back to Parkers, and I will no longer suggest the restaurant to anyone. There are PLENTY of other places with in walking distance that are delicious AND friendly. 

If you are interested in VPN pizza, here are some other great Chicago and suburban options. 
http://www.stevedolinsky.com/top-5-neapolitan-pizzas-in-chicago
Fabulous food great wine list good cocktails ambience is awesome entertainment in bar is always good

Came by on a Tuesday or Wednesday for a late lunch. Seating is in the lounge/bar area only. Felt kinda lost when I walked in though Bc there was no one in the front to greet you.. I wasn't even sure if they were open til I poke around and saw a few people Eating in there. Someone seemed like the manager sat me. A server came over to greet and said he'll come back with menus. Well.. He went to the bar to get the menus and a few business men sat down and he forgot about our waters and menu and started to make them drinks... That was kind of a turn off for me... The small menu the manager showed me was 1/2 off. I order a surf & turf item- a mini burger and crab cake both were yummy and just enough for me. I don't recommend if you're really hungry or even a guy- it won't be enough. Literally 2bites. The tacos app were decent - dessert was yummy. My aunt ordered a burger she enjoyed it. Overall everything was good. The price for lunch was great! $30 an app, 2meals, and a dessert. Win win for me

Came here last night with my sister and mom to celebrate my mom and late father's wedding anniversary. I was so impressed by the sweet and professional hostess, friendly and knowledgeable waitstaff, and most importantly, the FOOD! Everything was tasty and FRESH and I have been raving about it since. I was happy to see that my family had a great time and we can't wait to return!

Parkers is a great spot in DG! So close to my house which is a plus! I have gone to Parkers for years, from their amazing bar happy hour, dinner, to their buffet for Easter and Mothers Day. Their oysters are great and are $1 on Monday/Tuesday from 4-7pm and Friday 11:30-2:30pm: although I have not been for their $1 oysters I would love to go! I have been for their happy hour you just can't beat it! Great choices and good drinks! Their scallops with gnocchi (dinner menu) was very good but a little on the small side. Amazing desserts as well! Over all I really enjoy parkers and their atmosphere!

Parkers' was a nice combination of Yelp reminding me that it was close and Opentable to make me feel official walking in.  It's a Tuesday night, so I figured a reservation was a bit of overkill, but why not?  Plus a bonus...Yelp ad gave me 10% off!  Even though it was an expense account meal, it still felt good.

Walking in can be tricky.  The main doors are in the back of the restaurant, not the front.  Once inside, there's two seating areas.  A more casual bar area and also a more formal dining room.  Were were immediately greeted, offered options for seating and brought to our table.  The hostess waited patiently for us to all sit before she handed us menus and left the table.  I'd say that's attention to service detail, especially because it took us a while to get seated.

Once we were seated, the wait staff was fast in greeting us and setting us up with drinks.  Overall, the wait staff was very attentive, very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.  I like that.

For starters, we had the shrimp tempura and the shrimp cocktail.  Clearly I like shrimp.  And the hot/cold thing was interesting to try.  The shrimp cocktail was excellent.  Quality and size of shrimp was very good and the cocktail sauce has a nice balance and not overpowering.  The shrimp tempura had a thicker breading, which I'm not a fan of.  I would like a lighter breading to not offset the balance of shrimp and coating.

For an entree, I had the duck breast and confit of leg.  It was excellent.  Perfect doneness. High quality meat.  Can't get any better on the duck preparation.  Highly recommended.  And the waiter helped me finalize that choice, so good for him.

Finally, I had the Caramel Budino.  Once I got through the heavy layer of whipped cream on top, it was very good custard, caramel, and chocolate cookies on bottom.  I think a dessert at a diner can overload it with whipped cream, but not a restaurant of this quality.

Overall, this is a great restaurant for service and food.  They have a few areas on the food front that can be improved, but overall it's a great experience.

Excellent experience our first time at Parkers'. The food was delicious. But, even better, our waiter, Jason, was spectacular. The attentiveness made the great food even better. We will definitely be back soon!

Wife and I have been here two times now.   We both have commented to eachother how perfect this place is.   The service is top notch professional and classy with out being rude.   The food is simply amazing!!  I have always ordered a special for that day.   They have a piano bar up front to wait for your seat or you can eat or drink up there.   The dining room is large and broken up into many rooms so it doesn't get to loud.   
If you've never been here I must say put it on your list.   It's not a place I would bring the kidos...  It's a better date night or excellent classy lunch visit.

This is truly one of my FAVORITE restaurants out there, and I am so happy that it is just a 10-15 minute drive away from home.  Parker's always has the best service.  Their waiters and waitresses are so attentive and nice, and are very knowledgeable of the menu (a must!).

I'll be honest.  I am so obsessed with this place because of their happy hour.  Monday through Saturday, the bar menu is HALF OFF.  I can't remember the exact hours, but I think it's something like 3-7...might be different on Saturdays.  AND, oysters are $1 on Mondays and Tuesdays!

My Favorites:

Neapolitan Style Pizzas - especially the classic margherita.  The sauce is light with a little sweetness to it, the crust  has a nice chew to it.  Just make sure you eat it as soon as you get it.  Doesn't taste as good when it cools down.

Calamari - a STEAL during happy hour, and I would still pay full price for it because the pieces of squid are a decent size while not being overly breaded.  YUM.

Lobster Roll - this one is served warm with sweet potato fries.  Huge pieces of lobster, and you don't have to travel to the east coast for it...comes down to $10.50 during happy hour.  Not bad at all!

Angus Steak Burger - the flavor is just amazing.  You can tell the quality is very high.  Delicious!! 

A few tips - the sliders are teeny tiny, but if you want to try them, they taste great...you will still want to order something else in that case.

As for the dinner menu, my favorites include: the lobster mac and cheese, the scallops with risotto, and the bone-in-beef short rib.  We've also tried nearly all of the desserts, and my personal favorite is the ice cream tower.  But honestly, you can't go wrong with any of them.  We've gone here so many times that I can order nearly anything and leave a happy lady with a full belly!  I don't care where you live, it's worth it to come here, if not for happy hour!
LOVE THE FISH! Sooooooo fresh. The bartender Antonio is nice for happy hour. Martinis are great. Lovely wine selection. Ambiance romantic. See you soon. (Leave your kids at home)

I've been to Parker's twice - one for lunch and once for a holiday dinner through work. 

Interior - It's fairly trendy, but nice here. Wood decor, low lighting, lively looking bar area.
Service - Incredible. We had fantastic service both times; the work function was by far the best service I've ever had at a work dinner with a larger group.
Appetizers - Go all out here. The Crab Cakes are fresh and delicious, as were the Blackened Tilapia Won Tons, Margherita pizza tasted better than some Italian joints, and the Oysters Rockefeller were super tasty.
Entree - I opted for the scallops. The scallops themselves were great, but there were only three of them and served on top of unflavorful mush. For $28, I would have expected more than three scallops. 
Dessert - Caramel Budino was incredible.

So you're probably wondering - why the three stars? Well, the location is working against them. I worked in Downers Grove for almost a year before I realized this restaurant wasn't associated with what looked like a hotel right behind it. It also doesn't look anything like a steak/seafood place from the exterior. Most importantly though are the prices & competition: I don't think the prices are necessarily unfair, but taking into regards all of the competition in the area - Ditka's, Devon, Harry Carry's, etc - this is a hard sell. None of the entrees wow-ed me for the prices and they're up against a tough crowd right around the corner.

I recommend coming to Parkers for appetizers and drinks. I'd give dinner another try though!

I was not expecting such a classy place.  Unexpectedly, I went to parkers with my wife for lunch.  We were wormy welcomed although we were not properly attired for this place - work out clothing.  We had the grilled octopus appetizer, hanger steak, and fish taco special.  Finally, hand made tortilla!  Fish was very fresh and I liked that it was not tilapia.  Hanger steak was well proportioned and very tender and good.  I usually don't like the hanger cut but this one was yummy.  We are definitely coming back for date night.

We've been coming here on and off for years, and our latest meal was one of the best. Roasted whitefish was excellent: crunchy outside and moist inside. The rest of our meal, the service, and ambiance was great.

I decided to stop here for lunch based on the exterior appearance.  Before going in I read the yelp reviews.  Glad I went in to try. The restaurant is big, beautiful and clean.  The service was great. The flatbread and hummus they give you prior to ordering is delicious and flavorful. I had the tuna melt with coleslaw. Big!  Crispy crust with melted cheese. The tuna had walnuts in it which was really good, a nice crunch.  I would like to go back for dinner and a drink ;)

I really like this place! We had dinner in the bar area on a Friday night. Parkers has a fantastic atmosphere! We were there on a  Friday night and they had a jazz band playing. Service was excellent and the food was top notch! I can't wait to go back!
The server was extremely knowledgeable and helped us pick an entree and appetizers. It was delicious and the dessert was worth every calorie.
Great food, solid vegetarian burger, awesome bread to start the meal too!

I went here on a Saturday night with a few friends after spending the day in downtown Naperville.    I think I can sum it up by saying I was a bit underwhelmed, although The decor seemed nice and the atmosphere made it look fairly upscale.   I had the beef short rib, and split the baby octopus as an appetizer.  Both were just ok.  Could have been what I ordered but there wasn't a ton of flavor and the flavors didn't seem too inspired.  Don't get me wrong I enjoyed the meal, but for the price that you're paying, I wasn't very impressed.  There wasn't really anything about it that really stood out and would make me want to come back.  

tl;dr 
Not bad, just not that good.

I would have given them 5 stars, but the hostesses were not very attentive after giving us a table that was under a vent with cold air and we requested to be seated at another (btw, we had made reservations). They did not make us a priority and they knew it was a Birthday dinner. However, the restaurant was redeemed by the manager Rob who realized we were waiting a long time for a table and seated us immediately then provided us with appetizers. He also checked on us a few times to make sure we were happy. Our server LeighAnn was amazing. Great personality, excellent knowledge of the menu and attentiveness. And of course, the food was delicious. Thank you Chef.

We stopped in to have a drink at the bar and order a small pizza which we've had before.
The pistachio/brussels sprouts pizza on the bar menu was more cheese than any other ingredient and way too much crust.  The piano music in the bar/lounge was way too loud. We noticed one couple took a table near the piano and then promptly moved to the bar. We couldn't carry on a conversation and would have stayed for another wine but the music was annoying! 

We did go there for dinner about two months ago (in the dining room) and it was very good.

Had dinner here a few nights ago - don't be fooled by the charming exterior, seemingly sophisticated menu and high prices. This place is a glorified bar. It's very loud and the food is not that great. What's most terrifying is the uneducated wait staff - I ordered a pork chop and was asked how I wanted it cooked!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I gave her a look and said - it's pork... It should be fully cooked. To which she said "our kitchen offers to cook it to different levels of doneness"... What?!?!? Terrifying. Then I got my pork chop and it was so dried out and overcooked I could barely cut into it... So maybe the waitress should have asked if I wanted it cooked or overcooked. Needless to say, I won't be back and I sincerely hope no one gets sick from undercooked pork due to uninformed waitresses and/or chefs.

I don't know the Chicago burbs too well, but Parkers' seems a little upscale for the area. Maybe the vendors I've visited out here have kept the good stuff to themselves when they take us out for dinner?

Our server was a bit of a character. After I presented the Yelp 10% Check-in offer, he talked about rave reviews he's gotten (on Open Table, iirc) and stressed his name a couple of times (which, despite the temptation, I won't provide here). Still he botched my drink order for a Manhattan twice and was the only staff member running around with his shirt un-tucked. Despite his suck-up to the guests intentions, I found his behavior and demeanor off-putting.

Anyway, ignoring our server, the food was pretty solid. 

The clam chowder (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/parkers-restaurant-and-bar-downers-grove-2?select=Z_U_rKZO5A4gBxNO5hwW_g#Z_U_rKZO5A4gBxNO5hwW_g) had a briney, lightly creamy broth and a couple of shell on Manila clams along with some shucked clam meat.

For my main, I had the Bouillabaisse ($26) which comes in a covered cast iron Dutch oven with a serving bowl (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/parkers-restaurant-and-bar-downers-grove-2?select=JocE7Db5b5LtWZOlfbaqqA#JocE7Db5b5LtWZOlfbaqqA) and another bowl for the shells and discards (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/parkers-restaurant-and-bar-downers-grove-2?select=U2AhYZUTPGyiqW4hYUZXag#U2AhYZUTPGyiqW4hYUZXag) and some Rouille on the side. The copious amounts of seafood was all nicely cooked, though the tomato-ey broth needed something more. It was a big serving and could have easily fed two.

My colleagues had a burger and the surf & turf (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/parkers-restaurant-and-bar-downers-grove-2?select=lf4tQsDzTTH4V7WGryjvbg#lf4tQsDzTTH4V7WGryjvbg) and both thought the food was above average.

When we left @ 8:30 Thursday, there was one party of 2 remaining in the restaurant.

Food: 4 stars
Service: 2 stars

My husband and I went to Parker's for the first time for his birthday, and it was pretty outstanding. The lobster mac and cheese, bruschetta with goat cheese and filet were delicious. We didn't have a chance to try any of their desserts, which is a travesty- but alas, we were too full. The bruschetta was interesting; goat cheese and sun-dried tomatoes puts a twist on an old, sometimes a tad mundane, app staple. Now if you hate these two ingredients, I presume you wouldn't be a fan. I adore goat cheese, and usually can take or leave sun-dried tomatoes, but in this case they worked very well.

I thought the service was excellent. I'm not sure how anyone could say otherwise, to be honest- the wait staff is incredibly attentive- to the point where, the second my husband got up to use the restroom, our server was at our table, diligently refolding the napkin he has tossed on his chair. We truly felt "waited on", and this should always be the case in an upscale, pricey restaurant.

I will say that if you don't like the very smokey taste of gouda, you probably won't like the lobster mac and cheese, but I happen to love it (as you can see, I'm big on the slightly uncommon cheeses), and thought the richness was perfectly balanced by the fresh, ridiculously delicious lobster, which was simply prepared, making the dish unusual but heavenly. I was very surprised at the sheer volume of lobster sitting atop the pasta- and the somewhat low price that included said volume of lobster. I figured a few small shreds may be mixed in, but not so. A rather large tail is hand-placed on your mac tableside. 

I would (and plan to) go back to Parker's for more special events (and not-so-special events) in the future.

Our dinner was really really good. We started with the bruschetta which was different from others I've had. Great fresh tomatoes. Goat cheese. I had the whitefish and my wife had the wild halibut. We both truly enjoyed them. Great sweet potatoes. Two others had the lobster roll. Not a bite left!  Final diner dug her chicken. Desserts were v. Good. Carmel budino is the bomb. Maple cotton candy lots of fun. Great service. Can't wait to go back.
I love parkers!! Short ribs and lobster Mac and cheese are amazing!! Also that carmel budino dessert is completely amazing!! It's a must :)

Discovered a scam with their drink policy.  If you order a Manhattan for example straight up as opposed to on-the-rocks they add $3 to the drink charge - without warning.  
So in other words, getting a drink without ice in a martini glass costs three bucks extra.  They have apparently done that to me every time I've been there (and to others as well).  I noticed this time as I made the mistake of ordering a special they were having that was advertised for $13.  When I got the bill I saw $16 (WTF!!!!!!!).
That's right, I paid $16 for one drink.  When I brought this up to the waitress she said the computer automatically adds it.  When I brought it up to the manager she lamely replied that they add more alcohol (so, are martinis $16? Of course not).
So I get a call on the way home.  It turns out they had a computer error, I should only have been penalized for $1 (for removing ice from my drink).  They refunded $2.17.
They have some really good food, the service is not always the best, but I cannot tolerate fraud and incompetence.

Definitely go here before 7pm on weekdays and order from the bar for their happy hour specials where many items are 50% off. (They have a menu of all the items). I was very pleased with the service and the food was excellent. The specials made the price even better!

We ordered the calamari( enough to share for at least 2). The calamari was fresh and not over cooked. The lobster roll was my favorite! It reminded me of the lobster rolls you could get in Boston (similar, but not exact). They loaded it with lobster and it came with sweet potato fries and coleslaw. It is probably the best one that I've tried in the Chicagoland area. The pizzas were decently sized and tasty. I enjoyed the crust, but the toppings were just a tad too salty for my taste. For dessert, we ordered the ice cream tower. This is a MUST TRY if you love ice cream. 

Looking forward to trying other items on their menu in the future.

I've gone to Parkers for a few years now and have noticed the service and quality of food has diminished every time I have gone. My last visit, on Mother's Day was the absolute WORST. 

One question, if you are a SEAFOOD RESTAURANT HOW DO YOU SCREW UP CRAB LEGS ?!?!? And why is the service so poor. The Bouillabaisse was God awful and the Octopus appetizer was so sparse it barely served one person. 

Stay away. There's Reel Club, Devon even the local super market, where you can get much better food.

Went to Parkers on New Years Eve.  I enjoyed my filet and husband loved his white fish.   Salads were nice.  The real surprise was no baked potatoes and no sour cream with the roasted potatoes that I asked to sub in for mashed.   What restaurant doesn't have sour cream? So disappointing.   Our servers response,  "sorry that's the way it is".  No empathy there. Probably won't go back. Trio playing in the bar was a nice.

Very tasty! Laid back vibe. Great menu selection (and happy hour!). The food is fresh and prepared very well. The people who work there were very helpful and friendly. Made for a very nice dinner out with coworkers.

The food: I loved my south beach salmon salad (see picture). I would highly recommend it. Light, refreshing, full of salmon, and perfectly dressed. My brother had the turkey burger special and LOVED it. The other brother has been to Parkers' a few times, and has never had a bad meal. This time he had the sliders with a side of fruit....not a ton of food, but hits the spot. Dad had the steakburger and said it's one of the best he had. The fries were thin/skinny, crispy, and delicious.

The atmosphere: We sat in the lounge during the lunch hour. It was quiet, quaint, and perfect for the four of us to enjoy our meal and discussion. A little chilly, but we were ahead of the crowd, so perhaps it warms up when the place is packed?

The service: Ignacio was our server and he was awesome! Very attentive, friendly, and appreciative.

Along with bread butter, they also give you hummus and thin/crunchy flatbreads to start off with....sooooo good!!!

We will definitely be back to Parkers' when in the area.

The food was delicious and the staff were very conscientious of my shrimp allergy. My only complaint is that they don't separate their oils, but at least I was warned before taking a bite into an infestation of shrimp french fries. I will definitely come back.
Great lobster roll, great service, beautiful patio on a beautiful night. Thanks, Parkers' Restaurant & Bar!

The bison burger is out of this world at this place 

The only time I've been let down is when I have gotten the deep friend fish dishes - just not my thing. 

Every other item I've ever gotten has been outstanding.
Great dinner in the bar. Nice atmosphere, fantastic food and service. Loved the tilapia wontons!

I've been waiting to really finalize my review here for awhile due to how surprised I was, but after multiple trips... I can honestly give this place 5 stars.  Here's the skinny:

Only about 30 places in the United States are Vera Pizza Napoletana (VPN) certified as producing authentic neapolitan pizza, and Parker's proudly carries one of those certification.  (Only two places in Illinois as well!)  Knowing that, we made our way here first with a group of six to sample pizzas and other dishes, and then my wife and I came three more times to enjoy some spectacular food.  Key notes:

Pizzas:  We've tried a few, but honestly the margherita is still the best here.  A great crust, a bit of sauce, some fresh bufala mozzarella, and a couple leaves of basil.  This is an enlightening and spectacular pizza that models as closely as Naples as possible.  

Lobster roll:  Very fresh tasting, and perfectly cooked... a decent deal if you take advantage of the half price bar menu, but otherwise, you're definitely paying for the convenience of eating this in Chicago instead of a coastal city where lobster is abundant and affordable.

Fish and chips:  While enjoyable, these were VERY small in size.  Not sure if it's because of the half price bar menu.  About three finger long sizes of carefully fried fish and well made fries.  This is probably appetizer portions.

Jumbo Maine Sea Scallops:  Great sear on the outside, smooth and creamy on the inside... they're doing these scallops just right.  The marscapone risotto is a little rich for my tastes, but if you love scallops, I wouldn't shy away from this dish.

Lobster mac and cheese:  I think the table fought over this one as "nicely" as possible...  it was obvious everyone was eyeing this as their last bite.  Seriously good stuff.  The smokiness of the bacon combined with the bright lobster flavor was memorable.

Bouillabaisse:  Have you ever had Cioppino in San Franscisco?  This is nearly perfectly identical.  If you love seafood, and you enjoy a great seafood/tomato based broth, you will fall in love with this dish, guaranteed.  Generous portions, and I could barely tear myself away from this when I my colleague asked if I would kindly return his dish.

Herb crusted Japanese eggplant:  I rarely say this, but this is one of those dishes that I would be willing to go vegetarian for.  The eggplant has such a perfect crisp, and the flavors along with the gnocchi offer a great balance in the dish.  A great pick.

Braised beef short rib:  Fall apart tender, swimming with flavor, they've really turned this dish into perfection.  

We've tried four of the desserts in our time visiting, and our clear favorites were:
Ice cream tower - beautiful display, each layer of ice cream was distinct in flavor and delicious.

Key lime pie - While this looks tiny, it's packed with flavor and covered in a spectacularly made meringue that adds a lot of "density" to it.  Very good stuff.

Carmel Budino and the bread pudding were very good in their own right, but ended up being too sweet for our taste buds afterwards... they were ultimately too rich for our tastes, but if you like your desserts rich and sweet, this may  be perfect for you.

Verdict:  I've gone 4 times in the last month.  I don't think I can give it any higher compliments.  The food here is spectacular, a hidden gem in the burbs.  And it's been added to our rotation of places we love to go.

Protip:  Want to do Parkers on the cheap?  Mon-Fri, they have half priced bar menu items from 3-7 PM.  You'll get to try pizzas, apps, and some smaller mains for a VERY affordable price.

I have been here three times and the food has always been great.  During one of the visits the service was a bit on the slow side, although the speed of tonight's visit was perfect.  We were in and out within an hour without feeling rushed.  The food came at just the right times.  Tonight I had the chopped salad, burger and flour-less chocolate cake - yum!  I have to also give MAJOR kudos to the valet attendant - he was my favorite.  He was very sincere - Acknowledged us quickly, asked how our evening was going, and was very respectful.  Very observant too. I went to put my purse in the back seat before getting into the driver's seat, but the door was locked - he quickly unlocked the door for me.  Also, ran around and opened the door for my mom.  Thank you!

Came in here on a Tuesday night was in town for business and saw good reviews. The bar was open and happy hour was going on but really just water to grab some dinner and a drink. The hostess and bartender were great! Really friendly.
Looked at the menu and saw seared ahi tuna as the special and the bartender said it was good. So I went with that. It came with some noodles that had shrimp in it and then the ahi sliced. I had a couple issues with it. Didn't look like the tuna got a good sear on it and it appeared and tasted like it was cooked on a warm pan and left too long trying to get a sear all around... then it was a good chunk of tuna but sliced way too thick. It was only 6 pieces where I think easily could have been 8-9. The noodles didn't seem to go with the tuna and the whole dish was missing something like some kind of veggies to cut through all the sauce on the noodles and the sweet chili sauce under the tuna. Some pickled cucumbers or some seaweed salad would have been wonderful.  Next time I'm in the Midwest I think I will stick to beef!  Nice place definitely will come back and try something else.
Tonight went to hear Carmen Stokes our favorite jazz piano artist plus have dinner. The salmon special was excellent ... highly recommend trying this

I arrived early to meet my wife for dinner and thought that I would relax with a beer at the bar.  It was just before 5:30 on a Friday afternoon and no seats at the bar and the 5 open tables/ booths had "Reserved" signs on them.  Oh well...I'm just SOL.  Hung out in the foyer like some junior high miscreant until my better half arrived.
When she arrived, we were immediately seated and greeted by John.  We started with the VPN Margherita Pizza which is EVERYTHING it is cracked up to be!  If the meal had ended with just the pizza, this would have been a 6 star review.  I'm glad I perused the Yelp reviews ahead of time and suggested we try the pizza as an appetizer.
My wife ordered the cod which was simply prepared and offered with mashed potatos and vegetables.  She didn't think it was particularly flavorful.  In fairness, going in, she second guessed why she ordered cod since it isn't a typically flavorful fish.  I ordered the whitefish welleington which is creatively prepared and presented in a puff pastry in the shape of a fish.  It is stuffed with shitake mushrooms, leeks and pine nuts.   Aesthetically, the presentation was delightful, but it just didn't spark the tastebuds.  The boldest flavor profile came from the pine nuts.
We ended our meal with Lavazza cappacinos which were served lukewarm.  This was a slight disappointment.  I'm not sure how you can brew up barely lukewarm cappacino.  We had one pizza appetizer, two entrees, 1 cocktail, 4 glasses of wine and 2 cappacinos = $122.  Considering all the booze we imbibed, a fair price.  Just wish the food had more pizzaz.  We'll probably return at some point

The scallops and risotto were outstanding and the whitefish very good. The ice cream tower was large and delicious. The maple sugar cotton candy is outstanding!
Service was very good. Nice atmosphere. Very pleased with our meal.

What an awesome place to host our office's holiday party. The food selection is so fresh and so well served. We enjoyed the surroundings, the food, and the great waiters.

I can't wait to be back on casual dinners or lunches w the significant other unit and the 'rents.

Clean spot. Decor needs help but we are here for the food an not for what hangs on the wall. Service was charming. The food is the best tasting Italian ever. The white sangria was not too sweet and not too dry.  I loved it and I don't care for sangria personally. My wine was poured very generously. You must have this place!!!!

The food is good.  I believe this location used to be the "rib house".  I went there years ago.  The set up seems a little different from what I remember, but it's still an awkward building.  It was most likely a house back in the day, which they turned into a restaurant.  Because of that, the layout is very weird.

I would recommend going to eat the food.  The quality is good, and flavored well.  I got a burger and it was good.  We also got the pizza...loved it.  It is thin crust Chicago style....crispy crust and lots of cheese.

Lovely atmosphere. The restaurant is an old house with ample seating. It was chilly, but on warm days there is seating on double-decker balconies in the back! We had the Mediterranean spread sampler with Tzaziki, hummus, and whipped feta. Wonderful flavor!
For the main course I got the steak and steamed broccoli as a side. I am usually VERY picky about my beef, but it was so yummy. Perfectly cooked and flavor explosion. (You can't really mess up broccoli...). The steak was definitely a highlight, and the owner came around so we got to say thank you. :) 

Definitely recommend it!

The food is easily 5 stars, but because of the rude waitress that offered poor service, I'm going with a 4. 

The food was delicious! I highly recommend, I'll chalk it up
To having a bad day I guess.... Lol

Decent menu and food, clean facility.  Bread was good.  My chicken kabob was a dry and tough.  Vegetables were decent.  Portion size was good. Dessert was very good.  Service was so-so - our waitress seemed to be new at her job.  I could have given one more star but I just didn't get any sort of "wow" factor.  

We were the only ones there when we arrived for lunch.  Soon one large table filled up - and completely filled the room with noise.  The could do something to dampen the sound - it's a very "lively" room in terms of acoustics.

I do wish that restaurant staff would learn that when they put a bag containing leftover containers on the table that they watch out for spilled liquids and not set the bag right on a blob of oil.

I feel like three stars is being generous with this one...   So my family and i were trying to find a place we could go for lent Friday's (no meat). We usually turn towards either sushi or pizza, and then we remembered a friend who had recommended riganato.  We thought alright well get some pizza, pasta and calamari it'll be great.  So...

Food- We started off with some fried calamari which was really good, but as I always say, doesn't take a lot to make a good fried calamari.  However it did come with some garlic aioli which was a plus (more suitable for dipping pizza crust in though).  Now, the pizza. It was amazing.  Literally the perfect pie.  Perfect thin crispy crust, tangy but not too tangy sauce.  Sauce wasn't too chunky but not soup either.  Cheese was thick but not overpowering.  It was REALLY good.  So we ordered the calamari and the cheese pizza as an appetizer, but then the entrees is where the fell extremely short.  I ordered the bow tie farfalle which came with these grilled shrimps that were cooked perfectly but overseasoned.  The pasta though was inedible.  So much pesto and artichoke it was not even box-able for lunch the next day.  Everyone else's entrees looked just mediocre...   With mediocre table reactions.  They got us on the mini desserts though and we ordered a bunch and they were decent, nothing too special.  

Service- It was really good and the atmosphere of the restaurant is nice.

Now I realize this is a grill and we went with no meat in mind but if you put something on the menu like a pasta dish it better be as good as everything else plus this is Italian so I didn't take too much of a risk!!  I might come back for the pizza but probably not.

We were here for lunch on Valentine's Day. Great food! The meatballs were huge and stuffed with cheese. I had the spicy Italian sausage pasta and it was very good! My husband had the special which I can't recall the name but it looked like rolled pasta stuffed with cheese. Our daughter had the Alfredo. Our gnocchi jalapeno appetizer was surprisingly delicious! Our server Taylor was a delight :-) On point with making sure we were happy.

Omg their gorgonzola burger is amazing! The menu said freshly pressed in house patty and the meat tasted so fresh I wish I could of eaten it all but it was huge I got a second meal out of it!. Friendly service also. The only reason they dont get 5 stars is because there was a fly on the side of my plate.  It was pretty visible I'm sure a cook or waitress could of seen it and given me a clean plate, but other than that my first experience here was great!

Our day found us in St. Charles and we were looking for a relaxed, enjoyable, Italian eatery.   Moseyed on to Geneva.  Found it!

We were in vacay mode just for the fun of it, plus we had a little birthday celebration attitude going as well.

It turns out, if an overheard conversation is true, that the restaurant is celebrating its third anniversary.

The restaurant has indoor and outdoor dining.  We chose indoor.  Wood floors, simple table settings.  Fresh food pictures on the wall.  (For good reason).

The menu is a single sheet with the usual categories.  

I carefully studied the food that was at other tables--the pizza looked very tempting--so I ordered the pizza with spinach, fresh basil and fresh garlic.  

For the pizza, they don't fool around, making sure that it's understood that they are the thin crust folks--great! thin crust folks I'd say.  The sauce was rich in flavor with each ingredient seemingly freshly harvested that day, within the hour.

The birthday one ordered gluten free pasta--the sausage and tomato that came with the order, causing a bit of light sauce that looked great.  And positively reviewed.

Reasonable prices, great, fresh food!  

I'd say wander on over, enjoy a meal, relax and enjoy more.  All is possible at this very enjoyable find.
Always great service along with great food. A must try for family and friends. Consistent quality food and a fair price!!
I really recommend the pei mussels in spicy vodka pasta sauce. And my husband enjoyed the lasagna. Service has always been good!

Riganato is our go-to nice dinner out place. It's also very good for lunch. I always like the specials and the staff are very friendly. While it's an upscale place, it's very friendly to babies and kids. Small restaurant has recently added more seating but the whole place is full of light and very cozy. We like to go early for dinner; if you are looking for a popular night out like Friday or Saturday make sure to get reservations!

A classy-looking house on State street hides a welcome surprise - Riganato's!

Riganato's has one of the most extensive gluten-free menus I've seen in the western suburbs. There was a nice selection of chicken, seafood, pizza and roasted entrees for the non-wheaties among us and the menu also included some simpler fare (burgers/sandwiches) for those obstinate family members who refuse to eat fancy. That alone guarantees we will be back, being that my family has Celiacs and picky eaters a-plenty. 

Their otherwise glutinous fare was middle of the road Italian-ish food. I feel like they erred on the side of caution with spicing their sauces, because when things were called "spicy" and "garlic" there were very few hints of those adjectives actually tasted in the food. Be brave with flavor Riganato's, you have the potential for greatness!

The wine selection was decent, though I was a little put off by the server's inexperienced at pouring wine. I would rather have poured it myself than watch her maneuver around the table dribbling wine on the bread plates, cutlery and bread.

The only place Riganato's let us down was the dessert menu. No gluten free desserts. They don't actually have a dessert menu and instead bring around a dessert tray where nothing is labeled and everything kind of looks the same in Riganato's mood lighting. Due to the lack of gluten-free options and the server's complete lack of interest in selling us on the available options, we all opted to skip dessert.

We are probably coming back for the pizza at some point.

A great find close to the Fox Valley Ice Rink! Cozy dining room with a fireplace, great service and a lunch menu with unique offerings. Enjoyed Jalapeño Gnocchi with fresh pesto, Greek lemon chicken soup and the Tilapia special. All light and delicious! Priced right also. We'll be back!

I can't wait to go back! This is an excellent dining location for those who are looking for delicious gluten free cuisine. The staff is very knowledgeable on the menu. The restaurants caters to gluten free requirements with ease, not to mention offering an entire gluten free menu including the original menu. I was so impressed. We tried 3 pizzas, and can't wait to explore the rest of the menu in the future.

Service- very nice people and great hospitality 

Decor- cozy, quaint, and also simple

Food- When the bread came out it was freshly baked and had a little bit of a charred flavor, which was delightful. I ordered two appetizers: 1. The meatballs were amazing and filled with ricotta cheese. They were perfectly cooked, a delight to the senses. 2. The fried zucchini was very light considering it was a fried dish and I enjoyed it. I Also ordered a chicken rice with vegetable soup and it was very flavorful. For dinner I had a pizza. It consisted of Italian sausage, green peppers, olives, and a nice blend of cheeses. It was to die for and I was very impressed with the sauce especially with a perfect combination if spicy, sweet, and salt. I know it sounds like a fairly heavy meal, but it was extremely light. My desert, a chocolate mouse, was on point and refreshing.
Great food! Meat Lovers Pizza excellent. Mussel's fresh and good pasta. They prefer reservations. The owner is right in the mix. He's checking on customers and keeping the staff moving.

I Came here for lunch, and the restaurant definitely exceeded my expectations. Our service was very fast and efficient, and we were seated immediately. I have celiac disease, which means that I cannot have any gluten (no wheat, barley, etc). They have an extended gluten free menu, and I was very impressed with the offerings. As an appetizer we had fried Calamari, the first time I've had it since I have been diagnosed. As an entree I ordered the meat lovers pizza, and I thought it was excellence. I felt the pricing was fair. I would return, and would like to try the restaurant for dinner.

The homemade lasagna(noodles too) was the first time my family enjoyed anything with sausage in it, like in forever! Greco brand sausage, the best. Also the gnocchi, soft pillowy like delights and that goes for anything they put in them too! Outstanding flavorful burgers and fries. Prices are great for the quality ingredients and they have a great consistency there. Lunch specials are the bees knees so get on their email list. I admire Jimmy for sticking to original proven homemade recipes and service that make you feel like you're business is appreciated and very wanted! I'll have one of everything on the menu please!

Went last night for the first time and were one of 4 tables in the place from 7 to 9. Its a converted house with a very small dining room and back porch that is enclosed for seating. 
The service is very good, very sweet waitress and host was pleasant. We started with the octopus which came on a bed of arugula and smothered in raw red onion. It was cold and shouldnt have been as it was grilled. I found it mediocre. Needed flavor and some charing.  
We then had the greek lemon and rice chicken soup and as a Greek I can say it was good. I had to add lemon but I usually do. We then had the kabobs. 
I had the chicken and my date had the beef. Served with a large pita that was black from all the oregano. 
Again, cold. And even though it was drowned in oregano and I mean BAD, it was tasteless. 
It needed salt and pepper and far LESS oregano. Lemon would have been a good addition since its called lemon chicken kabob. 
We both had a mini cannoli for desert which are brought in. Kinda stale. 
I may give this another try even though this wasnt a great experience. Im glad we didnt order the $25.00 lamb shank.
There is no outdoor dining and parking is a problem unless u want to cross a busy 4 lane road and park across the street.

This has to be one of best hidden gems in the area.
The food is fresh and the staff is great.  I love their meat balls/spaghetti, steak  panini and hamburgers . This is a very friendly place for the whole family we bring our 7 months and 3 year old everyone and the staff and patrons are friendly and loving.
Bottom line. .. if you want great food,  friendly service, fun atmospher (with family or with a group of friends) this is the place. 
I hope you enjoy as much as we do. .

There was one review i wanted to comment on,  someone posted something like "you can't be Italian and Greek,  make up your mind" all we have to say if you can cook both great, then please continue do so, as you do.

Great service and great food! 

Every time I go I like to try something new and I'm almost never disappointed! 

My favorites our the cheese tortellini with shrimp, jalapeño gnocchi, and the salmon with garlic mashed potatoes! 

A must visit if you haven't been. 

They even have coupons in the weekly clipper mags for dinning in and coupons for take out on their To Go menus. Score!

Absolutely hands downs great food and service!! Great lunch menu not pricey at all!!
I highly recommend it!

Last Saturday, was my third visit to Riganato's. I would dine there more often, but I live about 25 miles east of Geneva. The restaurant is in an old remodeled farmhouse. The last time I was there, they had outside dining on a back porch, but they have since enclosed that area, so they can accommodate more diners in inclement weather. There were 3 of us in the party, and we had lunch. We started off by sharing some appetizers. The baseball size stuffed meatballs are a must. I had them on each visit. We also had the grilled octopus, and the beets. The cocktails ordered were house creations, and very good. Two of us had the lamb shank, and one the lamb chops. The lamb shank was very tender, and the tomato based sauce gave it a great flavor. My girlfriend had the lamb chops, and said they were cooked perfect, just as she ordered them. Side dishes were good. We topped off lunch with some homemade rice pudding. I would rate the whole meal as excellent. The food is very fresh. When I saw the truck in the parking lot delivering fresh fish, there was no doubt. I would consider Riganato's a Greek-Italian fusion restaurant. I would recommend that any diner make reservations, as the restaurant is small, and they do have large parties at times.
Our second time back was not as good as our first... The atmosphere is cozy but the food lacked distinction.  Pricey pasta and soggy bread with my sandwich disappointed.

The dining room at Riganato's is small; it's an old house that's been converted into a restaurant, however it's quaint and charming.  The service is always top-notch. The staff is warm and friendly. I've taken their advice on several food selections, and they've always been spot-on.  

The food is made to order, fresh, tasty, and bountiful. The menu is extensive, and their prices are reasonable.  Our favorite dish is the lamb chops.  

We occasionally go for lunch, and in nice weather I enjoy sitting outside on their small deck. On weekends I recommend calling ahead for a reservation. Otherwise you might have to wait for a table.
Great restaurant! Home made fresh food every time. Friendly owner and staff. Love the fresh bread, and the pizza is amazing!

If you want amazing food and a personalized experience this is the place. Jimmy and Nick were extremely helpful getting a table of 14 set for us on Mothers Day. The service was incredible. The atmosphere was great. For a table that large you always worry about getting the food out in a timely manner. They exceeded expectations. In fact, not even close. We had most apps and I enjoyed them all. My favorite was the octopus but all were very good. I had a small beet salad and it was one of the best I have had. I had the chicken Kabobs and wow were they good.  I sound like a broken record but not one entree wasn't great. We unfortunately didn't try and dessert but I am sure they would have been good as well. Highly recommend this restaurant.
Excellent service, food and ambiance. The owner even came up to our table and personally thanked us for dining with them. Definitely try Nick's calamari and ANY of the pizzas! We will be coming back

Not sure why I hadn't been here sooner but I am sure glad I went. I was so impressed with the food and service I went back the next day.

Nice, small, cozy and run by very friendly engaging people who know about their food and are willing to share their thoughts is how I would describe this place.

Char Grilled Octopus
Up there with the best I have ever had. Don't change this dish.

Jalapeno Gnocchi
I am not sure who is responsible for their Gnocchi but they are very talented. I have had Gnocchi all over and even make it at home and this was the best I have ever had. Love the take on the Pesto with Jalapeno. Don't change this dish!

Fresh Beets 
Great salad course.

Tortellini Alla Panna
Great texture and Flavor.

Butternut Squash Gnocchi
See Gnocchi review above. Great dish!

We also had 2 make your own pizza's
I am a pizza lover and like lots of different styles of pizza. While the pizza was good, I probably wouldn't order it here again. Too many other great thing on the menu and these pizza's didn't WOW me like the rest of the food did.

Sampled one of the soups and it was delicious. All made in house.

Owner and Son are very hands on and very engaging as well as the servers.

Love this place and can't wait to go back and try something different.

We stopped in here because we had a gift card. We were not disappointed! The menu has a variety of options and there is something for everyone. I started with the red sangria and it was delicious and quite large! My husband had the spaghetti and meatballs which they are known for and he loved them. The meatballs are stuffed with ricotta cheese. They are the best! I had the Caesar salad and then the lemon oregano kabob. It was tasty but the chicken was a little dry. Our two younger sons were with us. One had the pizza was was really good and the other had a burger. My only complaint was that the kids menu is limited to chicken fingers or grilled cheese. So we had to buy adult entrees for them which they couldn't finish. That made the dinner out quite pricey. I gave them 4 stars because of the limited kids menu. The service was great!!  We will definitely go back.

While attending meetings in the far western suburbs, my colleagues and I discovered a great Mediterranean restaurant, Riganato.  It was so good that we went back for a second try solidifying our opinion.  I had the avgolemono soup which was tasty and authentic.  I also tried the chicken kebabs and the beef kebab.  Both were good and the chicken was my favorite.  My colleagues had steak and seafood dishes.  We were all impressed.  The rice pudding could not be better.  I will definitely return when I'm back in Geneva.

We recently moved to Geneva and found this nearby restaurant and sooo glad we have.  We have been there a number of times now and never have been disappointed.  Every time I've gone, I've had the chicken oreganato sandwich -- absolutely delish!  Luckily, the people I eat with try different things so I get to taste test other things.  We've had their pastas, burgers, shish-k-bobs, salads, homemade soups, meatball sandwiches, calamari and breaded zucchini as appetizers and rice pudding and amazing desserts too.  Everything is well seasoned, freshly made and piping hot when you get the food.  You just can't go wrong.  

The servers are always very friendly and attentive and the owners have always been on site as chefs (I think).  They stop by to thank us for coming back and are very friendly too.  I can't say enough good things about this restaurant.  Try it for yourself!

My husband and I came here for his 30th birthday. Service was great and even though we did not have a reservation, we were able to be seated immediately. I'd definitely recommend a reservation though, it's not a large dining room. It was cozy and the tables were quite close together, but the atmosphere was great. Our server was the sweetest person ever and she took great care of us. The food was amazing and very fresh, well seasoned, and everything smelled and tasted as good as it looked. Presentation was fantastic. For a special night out for us, it was well priced and both the food and alcohol menus were varied and extensive. It was a bit difficult to decide what to order, but our waitress was super patient and made sure our experience was top notch.
While it could possibly be kid friendly, I would probably not drag the kids along unless they were older (at least 10+).

Went here last weekend with a group of friends - none of us had ever been here, but we wanted to try something new.  WOW.  AMAZING.  The sangria is out of this world (yes, I simply had to try both the red and white) and the pasta is perfection.  We all ordered something different and no one had a single complaint!!!  The server was friendly and attentive.  This is one of my new favorite restaurants - I can't say enough good things about this little gem!!!

This is one of our favorite hidden gems and go to restaurants. Love the friendliness of the owners. Food is always great! It's nice to be away from the hustle & bustle of third street, although we love downtown Geneva. Get the Nick's calamari! It won't let you down. We've tried many different dishes. Loves their soups. Everything seems to be made from scratch. Can't go wrong here.

Visited 6-14-2015 with extended family.     Great service from Stacy!    Appetizers of calamari  (The specialty one) was good, if a little under done.  Had hot peppers.  Good portion size.    Two had pesto with farfale pasta with artichoke hearts - huge portion - pesto was good.    Others had tortellini and squash Gnocchi.  Again, massive portions but very heavy handed, dripping in butter presentation.     Had trout special, smallish filet prepared in too much oil.   Excellent side of grilled vegetables.   Another diner had the steak kebab which was a good value of around $10 - came with very good Greek, lemon cream chicken soup.   Food more like 3.5 stars but service made it 4 stars overall.
Best fresh Italian food we have enjoyed in a while.  Ambience was relaxed and intimate.  Even provided a kid choice for my eleven year old.  Loved the tilapia and garlic mashed.  We will be back!!

I've been driving by this place for several years and finally decided to go.  So glad we did!  We were very happy.  The meatballs were big, lasagna was good and the spicy penne pasta was spectacular!  The family was happy!

The staff were pleasant, the waitress was great and kept asking if there was anything else we needed.  However, the food was disappointing.  The flavor on the meat was good, yet it seemed like there is a lack of experience on the grill.  My wife ordered the lamb chops, I got the trio where I had three different meats.  My wife had one chop that was not medium rare, yet very raw where the outside was touched with the heat.  One chop was over cooked and dry and one was just right.  I had the same issue with mine. The grill should have even heat and all the food should be cooked evenly, either all rare or raw, all cooked just right or all over cooked.  This along with the potatoes and rice not tasting right, I had to give it 2 stars.

My family plus my parents recently dined here and had a wonderful night!  The menu has a slightly Mediterranean feel to it but there are burgers, pizza, spaghetti and other dishes available.  The spaghetti and meatballs that I ordered was exceptional, my wife ordered the sea bass and loved it!  My kids ordered a pizza and it was the best pizza I've ever had, the crust was amazing!  If you're looking for tasty dinning in the west suburbs there is no place better than Riganato's...

Took some clients here for lunch. Awesome meatballs. They were stuffed with ricotta cheese. Huge portions. Enough for two meals. Noise level was not bad and service was quick. All three of us enjoyed a great meal at a fair price. Want to take my family there in the future. Recommended this place to many people who have all felt the same. A+. Give them a try.

Finishing our day out shopping, we were looking for a restaurant to eat a quick bite at 6:30 Saturday evening. We walked in to a bustling restaurant with a wait list. The proprietor assured us we would be seated in 10 minutes. We were. I ordered the chicken with lamb chops It was very good. The lamb was cooked perfectly and the chicken came home for tomorrow's dinner. A busy place with lots of people. The dessert selections were good. The wine prices reasonable. We will go back.

I have been excited to try the food here due to their large gluten free menu.  I finally tried it and and I am beyond disappointed. The food is bland and over cooked. The chicken on top of my pasta was dry and there was a shard of bone in it that nearly broke my tooth. I don't recommend this restaurant.

Really enjoyed dinner. Had Nick's Calamari to start, then the bleu cheese burger, opting for the Moroccan carrot and potato soup instead of the fries. The calamari was good - it could have used some more varieties of peppers, but I liked the spice, and I liked the calamari cut big - and not too heavily breaded - not too crispy. The soup was amazing - great spice to it, and very flavorful. My wife had the Greek rice soup and said it was the best she ever had. Our burgers were both cooked perfectly, and the serving size was very generous. Service - outstanding - our water glasses never got empty, dirty dishes removed promptly, and everyone was very friendly. The place was pretty full, but we never felt rushed. Seems to be a family run business, and felt like it - very welcoming. Definitely will return to Riganato in the future!

This little restaurant, is absolutely AWESOME!!  I have driven past this restaurant on my way home from the Geneva Metra train station for a couple of years, but never really noticed it until a few months ago.  My husband and I dined there on Saturday, just before 5 pm, so it wasn't too crowded.  Starting at about 6 pm, the restaurant was just about full.  The food was amazing.  The stuffed meatballs were so flavorful, and the marinara sauce was perfect.  I have found a hidden gem of a restaurant, that I will definitely return back to many many times.  The desserts are catered in.  They are small mini desserts.  They offered several varieties.  This isn't the place to go to just for dessert, this is definitely the place for a great Italian meal.  I would suggest going somewhere else for dessert----Dairy Queen is across the street, if ice cream is your pleasure. The owner was the host, and gave us a full sized Reese's Peanut Butter chocolate candy bar when we left the restaurant, he said it was for Halloween...did I mention that it was a FuLL sized candy bar....very nice touch!

My husband I absolutely love Riganato!! we have been coming here since they opened. The food is always delicious and the service is fabulous!
