It is a small location, we'd love to see them expand to a location with more setting. However, with the two of us we never have a hard time getting a table. Just harder for a bigger group.

Very disappointed. Went with my 2 kids and husband. Although the food was average the service and restaurant policies were below average. My waiter acted as I was inconveniencing him in some way. And when my son asked to order a "side or house" salad in addition to his meal the waiter said they didn't have side salads and that if he wanted a salad we would have to order the big "entree" salad along with his meal. So I asked if we could then substitute his side orders for a small salad (since obviously they do have lettuce in hand!). We were told no. Restaurants owners that can't accommodate their patrons with something as simple as a side salad shouldn't be in the service industry.

Seriously guys this place is the best!!!

I know there's a couple of not so great reviews about this spot but trust me don't believe them. 

If you want great authentic Italian food this is the spot to come get it at, and it gets better -they are not over priced. 

They have great customer service. Jimmy is great!

Ok so lets get down to the food. I've been here three times since I discovered this gem and I've yet to be disappointed by anything that's been served.

Spaghetti and meatballs -to die for!!! I've ordered this all three times. Today they had a special with one meatball, Italian sausage, and penne pasta. My boyfriend loved it so much he asked our server to please keep this on the menu permanently! Lol 

Lamb chops and chicken- I've never been to crazy about lamb chops
 but these were awesomely delicious! Chicken was juicy and flavorful.

Gnocchi is rich and a must try! 

Pizza by far the best pizza I've ever had ( no lie) seriously this is the perfect pizza - the crust is so crispy and the sauce is just the perfect flavor! 

Hmmmmm.... What else.... Oh yea their bread they bring out at the beginning of dinner I can't even describe other than perfect. However be careful , it's so delicious that you may end up filling up on it! 

Calamari  and saganaki are our favorite appetizers . 

So yea I obviously will definitely be coming back to this place as long as they are in business. If your a fan of great food and awesome friendly service this is a place you definitely want to go to! I know there's a couple of reviews that weren't all that great but who knows what really happened . Give this place a try you won't regret it !!!

My wife, daughter, and I went fairly early on a Saturday night (530) after I saw generally good yelp reviews.  Overall it was disappointing.  

Atmosphere was not good - lighting was too bright - felt I was dining in the light level of your average grocery store or Walmart.   Not relaxing or inviting at all.   The tables were crammed into the dining room and uncomfortably close - difficult to get into your table without nearly asking the adjacent diners to please scoot in.  Another weird thing was that the tables by the windows had white tablecloths, but then most of the other tables did not (including ours).  Did we not deserve a white tablecloth?   The chairs and tables had a dated feel and the decor in the place was very generic and cheap looking, and a white table cloth on all the tables would have classes the place up some.  This contributed to a general sense of amateurism and lack of taste in the decor and the general execution of the restaurant.  

We ordered some white wine and it was ice cold -  don't restaurants like this realize that whites need to be served 42-50 degrees in most cases?  The food was mediocre.  Daughter had to order a full size cheese pizza because they didn't have a kids personal pizza on the menu.  I had the signature baked chicken dish that was decent.  My wife had some pasta that was bland and uninspired.  

Service was uneventful and adequate.  Price was actually high considering the lack of atmosphere and mediocre food.  Overall a giant "meh" and we won't be returning.

What a wonderful surprise! I wish I didn't wait so long to try it out. Everything tasted wonderful and the service was excellent! I love the Mediterranean menu! so many things to choose from. And so unique! I had the CAPRESE BURGER. It was cooked just the way I like it. I had the option to get soup instead of fries and it was the best Greek soup ever! NICK'S CALAMARI and the fresh bread were served very quickly. Even my 16-year-old loved it! I can't wait to go back and try something new!

I took my husband here for his birthday and the food was delicious. He satisfied his meat craving with the Riganato mixed grill. I had the Bleu cheese burger and it easily became one of the best burgers I've had. They have a large menu and it was hard to choose one thing because everything sounded so good. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is inviting- a house turned into a restaurant. I can't wait to go back and try something else from their menu.

As a family of four, we've eaten here several times.  Always had a wonderful meal at a very reasonable price!  It's refreshing to eat at a great family restaurant that's not a chain!  Our favorite dishes include Nick's Calamari, Meatball sub, Chicken Riganato (with garlic smashed that are to die for), Ribeye Kebobs, I could keep going...

I kept thinking I wanted to write a review, but what finally prompted me to do so was after I held a surprise party for my husband here last week.  I emailed Jimmy - chef and owner - about a month before.  He handled everything so gracefully and easily over email - helping me pick the menu, seating, etc...

We arrived that night to find an extra couple had arrived - Jimmy swooped in like it was no problem and added another table, turning our party of 16 into 18.  I arrived with my husband about twenty minutes after everyone else.  They were all enjoying hummus, fresh bread and drinks when we arrived.  Then the food started flowing - stuffed peppers, calamari, friend zucchini - all amazing!  It was all piping hot and fresh.

We had two salads come out next - Caesar and the House.  Both were phenomenal and I would have been happy to complete my meal at this point.  Next up were four amazing entrees.  I wish i would have taken photos to show the quantity of food - it was incredible!  We had flat iron steak, spaghetti and meatballs, chicken Riganato, and a spicy sausage pasta.  Each one was better than the next.  We also had mixed veggies and potatoes.  Every couple left with at least one container of leftovers - we left with five!

We had an assorted tray of desserts - I honestly can't tell you how they were - there was no way I could fit one more bite in but they looked delicious.

Bottom line - from start to finish - this was the easiest party I've ever planned.  Everyone raved about the food.  The service was exceptional.  I would not hesitate to recommend Riganato's to anyone - seriously, an A+ experience!

After reading the reviews I wanted to try this place for myself!! Honestly the place was cozy and inviting... The staff were great and the food was simply Aaaamazzing! Hats off to the chef. The place wasn't crowded so I don't know how the seating arrangement or the wait would've been!? I personally had a great experience... Give it a go at least for the great food.

Second time here with the family.  We were again happy with the service and food.  One of the specials was a Sea Bass dish which they de-boned right at the table, which I thought was a nice touch.  I had the horseradish cheeseburger with fries, and the kids (5 & 4 yrs) split a classic cheeseburger with fries.  Overall, the food was above average and my wife told me that the fish was very good without trying it.

     We did not get dessert and she had the only glass of wine through dinner.  The bill was again around $50 for the four of us without really getting any alcoholic drinks, milk, or juice for the kids.  
 
     We really like this restaurant due to it's small cozy feel.  The fireplace was going and the head chef was walking around the restaurant talking to several different tables and taking finished plates away.  It's a nice change from going to the regular chain restaurant spots.

We had the mussels for an appetizer, which were very tasty. I had the salmon and it was very good, probably one of the best i've ever had.  My husband had the primavera pasta and it had some very unique flavors. we both had the house rice pudding and agreed it was some of the best we've ever had. we were very impressed with the menu and wished we could have tried more! the only downside is that the dining area is extremely small. however; we will for sure be back and try something new. they also do carry-out, which is nice.

Let me start wIth the fact we moved to Geneva from California last September.  We have tried almost every Italian restaurant in the tri cities area prior to coming to here and now we no longer have to look any further.  Everything was delicious!  The pizzas are thin, crispy and super flavorful.  Our son had the pork tenderloin in the mushroom gravy with capers, yum! My youngest and I split the chicken kebob(the Spicer one) and a pepperoni pizza - both were delicious!  My husband had the chicken pesto pizza and he loved it. The restaurant is on the small size so reservations might help although it was Saturday night and we had no wait.  Karen our waitress was awesome and the young lady refilling water's kept our water's filled to the top.  I am used to restaurant's being hit and miss and it was a very pleasant slam dunk with everything here.  So glad we decided to try it.

What a great little place! Maybe 12-14 tables in a converted home. Very small and intimate with exceptionally friendly service. 

The Chicken Riganato was a bit salty for me but the pizzas are super thin and outstanding! I would have never ordered the beet appetizer on my own, but once I tried it, I was hooked: marinated with thinly sliced red onions. Yum! Others in my party had the pork chops and spaghetti and meatballs and everyone seemed happy with their pick. 

Two words of advice: 1. you NEED a reservation over the weekend at least. The restaurant is too small to really accommodate walk-ins and there is no waiting area except for outside. 2. ask for oil and parmesan with the warm bread. They serve it with butter but when we asked for another loaf of bread, they then asked if we would like a plate of olive oil and parmesan. Yes! It's really good olive oil. They also do not offer parmesan when the meal is dropped off, which I would expect with pizza and spaghetti. But they will bring it if you ask.

Overall very enjoyable!

Half-assed hospitality.

I really wanted to like this place, but never had the chance.  Let me explain.

A friend and I had wanted to try Riganato for a couple of years.  Tonight was the night.  With spring in the air and a grumbling tummy, everything seemed right.

We arrived at 6:20 this evening and an older woman with blond hair told us that it would be a 25-minute wait.  I did not relish sitting around.  After waiting in the almost nonexistent waiting (cramped and two chairs) area for a couple of minutes, she asked us if we wanted a cocktail and to wait on the deck.  We declined the cocktail, but took the deck.  After fifteen minutes waiting out there, with blaring music and an ever stronger breeze, I decided to take a brief walk through the adjoining residential neighborhood.  My friend is the type of person who thinks nothing of agreeing to wait 45 minutes to an hour for any old type of restaurant.  I cap it at 10-15 minutes.  I was trying to be compliant and patient.

As I made my way back to the deck, I can see the blond woman summoning my friend.  She takes us back to the waiting area--not to a table.  At this point it becomes clear that SHE IS SEATING PEOPLE NOT BY WHEN THEY ARRIVED, BUT BY MATCHING UP THE WAITING PARTY TO THE SIZE OF THE JUST OPENED APPROPRIATE, AVAILABLE TABLE.

My friend politely asked how long it would be and also pointed out that the party just seated had arrived at least twenty-five minutes after we had.  She simply admitted that she was matching party size to available table and said "it may be a few minutes more."  

With that, friend and I decided to get the hell out.  Blondie acted surprised.

The food smelled great and the menu tempting, but that type of hospitality will not entice me to come back.  In addition, seated is limited and with the fireplace roaring on a spring night, it was pretty stuffy with all the bodies in there.

Hospitality that horrible does not deserve a second chance.  We went back to Gemato's in Naperville.  Always a winner.

Loved it!
Food was great!
Get the  octopus:)
Service was excellent ;)
We will be back!

Don't know why my review was deleted  I am a real reviewer !!!! 

My daughter & I ate here she has a gluten allergy & this place was listed on her app so we went   She ordered the pasta & I  could not tell the difference that's how good it was :)  she will try the pizza next time.  This restaurant is very good, worth a trip to Geneva & service was great too

This is a small restaurant with a fairly small parking lot. It's located in an old home. It was a little bit cramped and tight. However, that never bothers me because it tells me that the restaurant is a good place to eat.

We had the small pizza and a ribeye kebob.  This is a thin crust pizza. It was very cheesy and an excellent choice.  The ribeye kebob was one of the best meals I've ever had.  The service was excellent and simply topped off a great dining experience.

Excellent little restaurant!  Awesome roasted pepper appetizer.  Great blend of cheese.  Salmon is fantastic along with garlic mashed potatoes.  2 servings of warm  bread was nice!  Great wait staff.  Nice touch to have a chef walk by and ask us how we liked our food.

Stopped in for a lazy Sunday lunch. Owner and his son were VERY accommodating. Wait staff was excellent. Food was outstanding. This restaurant should be on your top 2 or 3 in the Tri City area! Everything they touch here is homemade and you can taste the difference. It's true Mediterranean, so you get some great authentic dishes that aren't on anyone else's menu. They also have a very good wine menu and some good craft beers. For a small place, this has more to offer in food, service, wine and beer than any other restaurant in the area.

A cozy and warm place to have dinner. The waitresses and staff were great.  Warm and inviting and bending over backward to please.  We came because we love grilled octopus, which isn't easy to find on any menus in and around Geneva and St. Charles. We will certainly go back !   The grilled octopus was really good.  I also ordered a salad of fresh beets and feta cheese.  It was really, really good.  Both orders were generous and very fresh. 
My husband ordered penne pasta, and felt the pasta was a bit over cooked and not as spicy as he would have liked.  I ordered the rib eye steak and I was sorry because it wasn't great and I was already full.  I won't order so much next time.
We both enjoyed the restaurant and will go back.

Went here last night with another couple because of the yelp reviews we saw. I can honestly say this was the first time I ever had been disappointed in a "yelp-worthy" journey. 

The atmosphere was warm and quaint and set the stage for what we thought would be a great meal. First, the staff took forever to get to us...all night...the 4 of them were apparently swamped by the 15 tables. Slow and inattentive is the best description.  

The menu was varied but no theme, we had read the meatballs and pizza were king. Well the meatballs were good but the pasta tasted like it was chef boy-r-dee. Not rustic, no flavor and overly sweet. The pizza was looked forward to but when it arrived we couldn't taste anything but the oregano, all of the other toppings were drown out...oregano was the flavor...that's it. 

Finally we were blown away with a check for over $200 because of mistaken entries. When I questioned it the server asked, in honest shock, if I was surprised it was so cheep and not $100 more. What?!?!

I may go back, but no over priced drinks and we are going to stick to the sandwich part of the menu. The one bright spot was a complimentary cocktail. The disappointment was great, but perhaps worth a shot again once they work out the bugs.

We had an awesome experience at Riganato last night. We had 5:45 reservations and I had to call twice to make them later. We added two people to the reservations as well. They were so very accommodating, and never made us feel uncomfortable about all the changes we had made on a very busy Saturday night. The food was fabulous, the server , Nicki, was excellent and we are looking forward to becoming regulars there. Can't recommend enough.

Riganato's Old World Grille is welcome addition to the neighborhood.

Generous wine pours.

Eclectic mix of Greek and Italian "comfort food".

Thin crispy hot pizzas.

$25 for 5 perfectly char-grilled Colorado Lamb Rib Chops! Costs $40 in most restaurants. 

Chef Jimmy greets all the guests.

The menu is inspired by Jimmy and his dad.

Price value relative to quality here is excellent. 

Is this place perfect? No place is perfect, but I cannot think of a better place 5 minutes from our home to grab a generous glass of wine, delicious food at affordable prices, and where the owner cooks your food and treats you like he actually values your business. 

Chef Jimmy- don't take the lamb chops off the menu. Anytime I crave lamb chops, I'll be coming to Riganato's.
Great food.  Calamari the best we have had. Great bread.  Great service.  Very fair pricing.  Our entrees also was very good.  Highly recommended.

My friends and I had lunch at Riganato the other day and we all loved the food, the service and the atmosphere. It is really a hidden gem in Geneva. The food is fresh and flavorful. The menu has great options - something for everyone. The building looks like a house and is complete with a big porch on the back with tables and umbrellas for a wonderful outside eating experience. We are definitely coming back!

We had an over-the-top meal this afternoon at Riganato!

The closing of the Rib House was a shock, but we were happy to hear that something was in the works there.  Watched as the place was gutted and rehabbed top to bottom, and then finally some months ago a sign appeared.  Today it was time to visit.

We took two friends with, and upon entering were very impressed with the new design and decor--they did an excellent job and it was very warm and inviting with lots of light.  The interior, while still not spacious, has a much more open feeling now.  There is, as before, outside seating on the south side of the restaurant.

But it's all about the food.  I was hungry and asked the server for guidance between the Chicken Riganato or the Citrus-Seared Pork Chops (3).  She recommended the chops, and am I glad she did.

Dinner began with warm, crusty bread which we devoured (and asked for seconds).

When dinner arrived, my chops were grilled just perfectly and very moist, and served in a wonderful sauce of herbs, tomatoes and white wine reduction.  I got the lemon-oregano roasted potatoes as a side and they were perfectly done and quite tasty.  The iced tea was very flavorful (not the bland stuff that comes out of the soda dispenser).  My wife had the Wild Atlantic Salmon; it was as good as any other place but not distinguished in any way and lacked any grilled flavor.  The others in our party had Tortellini Alla Panna (a sample bite was very tasty) and the char-broiled pork chops (also 3).  His chops were perfectly grilled and he was quite pleased with the flavor and doneness.

After dinner we shared two small servings of Tiramasu and Red Velvet cake; both were very tasty.

The tab for four dinners, dessert and refreshments (no alcohol) was about $75 with tax.

A "heads up" that the sandwiches are VERY reasonably priced, so we'll definitely return to try lunch.  The dinners we had are pricey enough to be reserved for special occasions, but it's nice to have such good quality so close by and we are eager to return and try other selections.

So to wrap it up, three excellent dinners, one OK dinner, and excellent service.  We'll be back!
Jalapeno gnocchi? Wonderful! Great staples here like calamari and meatballs. Wonderful pizza. The prices are very reasonable. Best of all, we appreciate the warm atmosphere and friendly staff.

We stumbled upon this gem of a restaurant while searching for a place for dinner with some friends.  The menu looked decent, the prices seemed fair, but the reviews were a bit mixed.  In the end, the good reviews plead their case well and we decided to give it a shot.  Suffice to say, I am very glad we did.  

It was nighttime and on our first pass, we drove right by, not even recognizing that this spot was the location where the old Rib House was a number of years back.  

We walked in the front door and I was actually quite surprised that the restaurant is incredibly small.  I was expecting a much larger venue.  Perhaps 11 or 12 tables in all, and every one of them seemed full.  Figuring that a lengthy wait was in our future, I inquired with the hostess to see how long of a wait it would be.  I was quite happy when she said probably no more than 5 minutes.  In less than that time, we were seated at a nice table adjacent to the fireplace.  

Menus were presented, water glasses were filled, and white linen napkins were available.  All good so far.  

The menu contains a very diverse selection, from steaks to seafood, pizzas and burgers.  Prices are very reasonable.  The drink list was on the reverse side of the menu and contained an assortment of cocktails, wine and beer.  I felt the drink prices were a bit on the high side, so I opted for an iced tea.  I don't mind enjoying a cocktail or a glass of wine with dinner, but I know liquor costs quite well and if the prices are too high, I let it sit on the shelf.  

Our table ordered an assortment of different menu items so that we would have a variety of items to try.  A salad, a pizza, steak kebabs and a pork tenderloin were among the items we chose.  

I did not try the salad, but it looked fresh and crisp and there were no complaints.  I ordered the steak kebabs which came with french fries and tzatziki sauce.  Knowing that the average kitchen usually over-fires kebabs because the veggies take longer than the meat, I ordered mine medium rare and planned on accepting the dish if it arrived medium.  Sure enough, they came out very medium.  I wasn't overly upset about it and they still tasted just fine, but just be aware that if you are expecting your beef at a certain temperature, you may want to consider ordering one temperature lower.  In any case, the flavor was very good and the tzatziki sauce was obviously homemade (which I later verified).  

I tried the pork tenderloin and found it to be excellent.  It came with a side of garlic mashed potatoes which were equally delicious.  

I also tried a piece of the pizza and found it to be terrific as well.  Thin cracker crust and the toppings all had good flavor.  

The dessert tray came around and I chose a rice pudding.  Another member of our party chose the tiramisu.  I was a little bit disappointed that they did not have any whipped cream for the rice pudding.  Fortunately, the rice pudding was obviously made in house and was still very good, but would have been better with some whipped cream.  

About half way through our dinner, the place cleared out, rather abruptly I might add.  It seems that they have a rather busy dinner hour and then it gets a bit quiet.  If you can dine at off hours, you will likely walk right in and be seated.  If you arrive at a busy time, I could see where a wait could be possible. 

Ordinarily, I would give them five stars, but I am withholding that last star for a couple of minor reasons, all of which are easily remedied if management chooses to do so:

1.My iced tea was cloudy, which is one of my pet peeves.  If they don't cool the iced tea properly, it will be cloudy, and sure enough, cloudy it was.

2.I felt the portion size of our meals was a bit small.  They could easily raise the price of the meals by $1 across the board and lower the bar menu a little bit to balance things out.  It would have been nice if the kebabs were served with a nice rice pilaf or something.  As it was, I received just one smallish kebab, a few fries and a side of tzatziki.  I couldn't help but notice a lot of vacant real estate on my plate when it arrived tableside.  Further, if the drinks were priced a bit better, I would have had a cocktail or two.  

3.Rice pudding should always be served with whipped cream, or at least it should be available upon request.  As it was, there was allegedly no whipped cream in the restaurant. 

4.The menu is a piece of legal sized paper, printed on both sides.  I felt the paper menu sort of cheapens an otherwise excellent, quasi-elegant experience.  

On the plus side, the food was excellent.  The service was excellent.  The menu is diverse.  The meals were prepared in a timely fashion.  The staff was most friendly.  And for having such a surprisingly small dining room, the ambiance, complete with fireplace, was very warm and inviting.  

You really owe it to yourself to give this little gem in Geneva a try.  I will certainly be back sooner rather than later.

In a town that is not short on Italian restaurants, Riganato holds its own, both in its food and its service. It's also nice to have a restaurant of its caliber on the East Side of Geneva. Not much at all to write home about east of the river, restaurant-wise.

Mom, Dad and I went to Riganato for a Thanksgiving eve dinner, and it was excellent. Being a resident of Chicago, the affordable prices were a welcome change of pace for me.

My mom had the huge meatballs, and loved them. Dad ate the pork tenderloin and mushrooms, and I went for the spaghetti with mussels. Delicious all around. Also got a great bottle of red for a reasonable $22.

What we appreciated the most was the personal attention we received. The waitress, the manager and the chef all stopped by at different times to ask how we enjoyed our meal. And then the waitstaff allowed us to take our time, continue conversing, and finish our wine while the rest of the restaurant was closing down. We didn't feel rushed, and we felt like our business was truly appreciated. We will definitely be back again.

What a wonderful little find. My boyfriend and I just happened to stop in on a Saturday night even though we didn't have a reservation. The owner and his son were both incredibly welcoming. It's nice to go to a restaurant where the owner/chef actually comes out to the dining room to see if you are enjoying your meal. The son was very polite and the woman that was working there offered me a chair to sit on while we were waiting in the lobby. Yes it is tiny and you may have to wait but the food is more than worth it. The meatballs were absolutely delicious as was the Panini. Very reasonably priced for generous portions.  We will definitely go back.

This was my first time visiting Riganato's in Geneva, and it won't be my last. The ambience upon entering is very cozy and inviting. While they could have a bigger waiting area, I could see how it pays to have reservations.

Based on the recommendations from Yelp, I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The food was absolutely delicious. However, simple touches of asking if you'd like parmesan cheese would be welcomed. My friend ordered the tortellini with grilled chicken breast. Since we were going to split the items, our server kindly offered to do this for us in the kitchen. It arrived in two separate bowls - how wonderful. The food portions are generous. 

My first bite of pasta and meatballs was absolutely divine. The tortellini was just as wonderful and the cream sauce was light and flavorful. The food passing our table looked just as inviting, especially the pizza, hamburgers, salads and lasagna. 

The hostess/owner was warm and gracious, as was the servers. We ended our meal with the small taste of red velvet cake. It was also delicious and just the right amount of sweet. The prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get too.

I will definitely be back to sample other dishes.

Hands down, best spaghetti & stuffed meatballs I ever had. I give this restaurant high marks on food quality, attentive service, cozy atmosphere and value! This dining experience reminds you of the small family owned restaurants you used to find in Little Italy. Charming, delicious, and affordable. Others in group had filet, burger, Athenian chicken, kebab, all high marks. Dinner for 6 with bottle of nice Cabernet, $105 plus tip, wow! Can't wait to return next time we're in town.
Love it! The pizza is fantastic, especially on the porch with a glass of wine.

Three words: get the meatballs.

My husband and I tried them for the first time at Geneva's Festival of the Vine.  They are huge, like the size of a billiard ball, and stuffed with ricotta cheese.  Oh, they are delectable and the marinara they're in is fantastic.

Riganato's is an old home renovated into a restaurant. The outside is meant to represent the Mediterranean with pink stucco siding.  Inside, it's homey and warm with about 10 tables, many of which were filled when we dined on a Thursday night.

The servers all seemed very friendly.  You get bread right away (ours came with a previously opened butter package, however).  We got the meatballs to start and they were to die for all over again.

I got the evening's special for my meal.  It was a penne pasta with salmon and capers, and it was just okay.  My husband got the tortellini with chicken, and the cream sauce was pretty bland.  For dessert we split a tiny (tiny!) piece of cake.

The price was decent: just over $60 for an appetizer, a bottle of wine, two entrees, and a small dessert.  We decided that next time we go (because we will go again) we will get the meatballs for sure, and then for our meals we will each get the spaghetti with the stuffed meatballs!  They are that good - we're not going to bother with the other pastas.

My heroism continues.  This time, I brought dinner home for the brood.  I ordered the Meatballs Riganato, the Chicken Riganato, the pork tenderloin with the mushroom gravy, and a Lemon Oregano Kebab.  The kids were so excited by this "smorgasbord" of food and they are only 9 and 7 yrs old.  They loved each dish they tried and asked for seconds for the meatball.  Most parents know that the biggest test with new food is if the kids are gonna like it.  So, in my book Riganato Old World Grille gets 5 stars.  

As for my husband, I asked him which dish was his favorite and he said "All of them".  This seems to be the consensus from everyone who I bring Riganato's food to.  This is a casual, neighborhood restaurant that you are going to wish is in your neighborhood.  And, if you're lucky, it already is.

We had a large group of 32 women who dined in one night. We took up most of the dining room. We all had separate checks as well.  We were greeted with smiles. The owner came out to greet us as well.  Food was served in a timely manner, waitstaff attentive, and all-in-all, a wonderful experience. PS--we had made reservations ahead of time so they were expecting us!

The food was very well prepared: the beef tenderloin kabobs were out of this world, the spicy penne pasta was flavorful and light. The saganaki  was good but be sure to specify your texture preference. (My husband and I prefer more crispy and melted on the inside and for this it must be on fire longer). As for the service, our waitress was very attentive and warm. The decor is cozy yet crisp and fresh. Prices are reasonable and there are daily specials. I would give four and a half stars for all these reasons and I would make it a five for improved saganaki.

We usually eat here for lunch on the weekend and have never been disappointed. The food is always fresh and decently priced. It doesn't have the largest menu in town, but what food it does have, it does correctly. The black Angus beef kebobs are our favorite item. 

Truly one of the top-notch restaurants in town (and that's saying something considering the restaurants in Geneva).

Hate to review  after just one visit but not sure we'll be back. My preference would be for them to make up their mind and be either Greek or Italian rather than somewhere in between. Very small which offers an element of quaintness.  The staff was very friendly and responsive even though the place was full. As mention,  they are small,  maybe 12 tables so there may be a wait on Fri/Sat night. i had pork chops and rice pilaf.  Chops were good but smothered in  tomatoes.  The odd thing was that the were cut the size of salad tomatores rather than diced so as they would "melt" when cooked.  The  rice was average at best. I'm not even sure if it was the correct rice for pilaf. My wife had roasted chicken which was over seasoned with salt. It was also more boney than meaty. So as I said, not sure we'd go back. Not so much due to quality but there are other options so nearby that deliver a better experince overall. Torn on giving 2 or 3 stars but since I've only been there once,  I'll give benefit of the doubt and give 3.

Pizza is fresh and tasty, and that's all l ask for in my favorite pie. I'll definitely have it again. Enjoy!

(We had a sausage-mushroom-onion, as well as a white pizza with feta cheese.)
Good Italian and Greek food.  You can find better of both nearby but it's definitely worth a try.  Really good pizza and pretty good pasta.

Pizza is cracker thin with a nice char.  The pasta we had was very good.  Waitress suggested a nice off-menu variation that worked out great.
The room is small and relaxed.  The chef stopped by twice to ask if everything was ok.
We will be back.

I really enjoyed this place. Small. Quaint. Classic. Very clean. The menu was a welcomed surprise with a very diverse menu. My family got a nice sample of the menu. From the pizza to the kabobs to the talapia. Everything was delicious. 

I wasn't sure what to expect when I walked into the location, but without a doubt, these guys will be successful. The staff was very friendly. The owner went out of his way to introduce himself. And it is just the nice little touches that go a long way in repeat business. 

I will be back and very much look forward to trying some of the many other options on the menu.

I really enjoy everything about Riganato. From the very beginning the staff has treated me and my family like we are their family. We have tried just about everything on the menu. The dressing on the chopped salad is insanely good. I would buy it if they ever bottled it! The burgers are filling and nothing like the ordinary burgers that you can get anywhere. The chicken Riganato is by far my favorite! Finding out that it is the owners grandma's  recipe was nice to see that the family heritage is represented on the menu. My husband loves the lamb chops and they are an awesome value. I only eat red meat once a week so I come here for the flat iron steak. I love the pepper butter stuff that they put on the special. 
I have brought my friends and family here on many occasions, some special and some special only because we were all together. My aunt from Villa Park loves coming to Geneva for a tasty meal with me. My son loves having dinner or lunch here whenever he is in town. 
I gave it four stars because there is  always room for improvement.  
Keep up the great job, Jimmy and Staff!

Tried Riganato for the first time tonight.
Overall, we had a very good experience.  The newly remolded restaurant looked great, especially as the 'Rib House' which was at this location previously was showing its age.

We were seated right away,  really enjoyed the outside seating option.  

Bread was brought right away and was piping hot!  Unfortunately the butter was in the plastic (peal off top) type and was rock hard.

We ordered soft-drinks which were pricy, but included free refills.  We ordered the Saganaki as an appetizer... The waitress set it ablaze and then tried to immediately put out the flame with the lemon juice.   This left a lot of Alcohol left on the dish and it was a bit 'wet' with alcohol.  I prefer mine to burn off a bit more.  The Saganaki was tasty, and was crispy on top... but had no form.  it was if it had melted away underneath the top.

I ordered the special, which was a portobello and cheese stuffed ravioli with marinara sauce and broccoli florets.  The marinara tasted AMAZING!  The broccoli was just fantastic... the protobello and cheese tasted very good, but was cold inside the ravioli.

Ordered dessert and I had the rice pudding.  It was pretty middle of the road, but satisfying.

Overall, the tastes were very good and the portions were large.  The prices were also very good for the amount of food.  

Overall, we had a very good experience, and will be back again.

Huge fan.  Wasn't sure the first time we went, but we've become regulars.  Really enjoy the salads, kabobs, burgers.  Pizza is very thin and for thin crust it's the best around, in my opinion.  Staff is friendly.  Owner comes around often.  This restaurant could hold its own in downtown Geneva.
Great evening!  I can't wait to come back!

Stopped in with Wife, pleasantly surprised. Decent menu - outstanding value! I had the chicken and lambs chops, wife had the pork chops. 

All was very tender and moist, very flavorful. 

It's a very small space but quite homey.

We'll be back to try the pizza and meatballs.

Did I say it's a outstanding value? It is - check it out!

For people that knew this building before it was the Rib House, a beloved local place that closed suddenly about five years ago. Locals watched as slowly the run down facade of the restaurant took shape and excitedly, we waited for the new place. Those of us close to the Rib House were eager to see Riganato. We went the first night, knowing there would be some kinks and issues. 
The service moved like molasses and not because of first night jitters, they looked like there was just no fire under them to hurry. If your familiar with the building, its a very small place, there's not a lot of tables. But they didn't seem to be rushed or apologetic in any way for the delays. It took about 15 minutes for a waiter to come to our table. Our drinks took about 15 minutes. Dinner took about 20-25 minutes, and getting the check and paying took a surprising 15 minutes. For burgers, dinner lasted 2 full hours.
I decided to play it safe on the food and ordered a blue cheese burger. it was fine - I couldnt taste the meat, it lacked seasoning, but I love the flavor of bluecheese and there was plenty of that. The fries were soggy. 
My husband ordered the horseradish burger. he said it was flavorless. His fries were also soggy.
Our friends ordered a the Marie G pizza (I believe it was called that?) and the "chicken" on the pizza was actually lunchmeat!! So weird! Flavorless, too. The other friend ordered tortellini - they definately had that store bought bland quality and the sauce was rich and flavorless. 
Ok, So i can forgive the lack of flavor in the food - the kitchen is probably getting used to cooking the menu. one would assume it will improve.

But what will actually keep us from ever returning is the owner's lack of responsbility and welcome to the patrons who were not her friends and family. For the entire evening I watched the owner chat with tables she clearly new on a personal level and for a good chunk of time they sat with what I believe was immediate family - at a table. I spilled an entire glass of water on the table - the clutz I am, and though its noone's responsbility to clean it but my own, it went unacknowledged by any staff member until we flagged down the "bread and water" guy who didn't understand I needed towels to soak the water up and at first brought us linen napkins (which dont absorb anything). Finally, he brought the towels and I was able to clean it up. The owner was just two tables down from us and I felt a little surprised that she didnt acknowledge or offer to help. 
Later in our evening another family she knew came in with a baby a little younger than my own. While my baby's carseat sat on the floor the whole time while I held her, the owner immeidately offered a high chair flipped over where the carseat for her friend could sit - I was never offered assistance for my child. 
I guess I could try to forgive all of that, but the overall lack of acknowledgement for those patrons that they weren't familair with was an indication of poor business practice to me. I expected at a grand opening that the owner of the place would greet everyone and check in on the tables (especially since there arent that many!) But we never met her or her husband. I was insulted that it appeared to me that her friends and family were more important. My husband was familair with the old Rib House and looked forward to talking with the new owners. They just never came over to say hello.

First time here. Very nice and clean. Great staff and the food was very good. Went during Sunday lunch, we were the only patrons. Decently priced, also printed a coupon from their website. Would definitely go again and recommend to a friend!

Chill atmosphere, good food and great service.   Had dinner with the family and I gotta say I was impressed.   

We will definitely be back.   Special thanks to our server Emily (Amelia) who handled our party of 8 like a pro, which if you know my family is saying ALOT.

The "vibe" here is awesome for downtown Winfield. 

I was given the responsibility of picking up our catering order for our fantasy football draft. Italian beef, pasta peppers, fried chicken, and pizza. It was all great. Just one problem....WHERE'S DA BEEF?

Luckily, they had someone deliver it. I had a guy help me out to my car (so I just assumed everything was there?)

The pizza is okay, the bar and outdoor seating are cool. Great spot for Winfield but if you want great pizza, I'd use Yelp to find a place around the corner.
First time trying this place, my mom is an employee at a near by hospital so we stopped there for lunch. The service was great, the menu had lots of options. Would definitely go back sometime!

Came here for dinner before visiting a loved one at the hospital across the street. We sat on the restaurant side and had a great experience. The menu has a lot of options, food tasted delicious, and atmosphere was pleasant. I will say our server was a little uncomfortable at times almost gave off an attitude but he overall was great with service. This places reminds me of another place with similar menu and layout that's in a town about 30 ministers away. I will return again and hopefully soon!

My husband and I stopped in for lunch and ordered the spicy beef panini and antipasto salad. Our food was perfect, but we can't say the same about the service. We had also ordered pizza bread as an appetizer, but apparently our server forgot, as we never received it and our check showed she never rang it up. The one time throughout our meal she did check on us, she brought my (very skinny and not-diabetic) husband a diet Pepsi when he ordered a regular Pepsi. We enjoyed our meal, but I'm not sure we'll be going back.

The lasagna is far too mushy and seems to not have enough sauce in it.  The meat tasted odd.  I hated it and so did my company.  The soup, some sort of white sauce, tasted like flour paste with no seasoning.  The bread tasted stale.  At least the pizza was ok or we would have starved.

I work in Wheaton, and very close to downtown Winfield.  I'm not a fan of driving all the way to downtown Wheaton plus having to find parking, so Winfield is a great lunch time spot.  Someone recommended their salads here, so I finally made it in, after almost a year.  My co worker and I stopped in last week for lunch before the noon hour (11:30-ish).  We had no problem finding parking in the back, and plenty of seating, even when we left, this place wasn't jammed packed for the lunchtime rush.  The service was great, our waitress had our water refills constant, and we enjoyed the food too.  The food is decent and the prices are reasonable.  They also have daily specials.  I'm on a low carb diet but I did eyeball a caprese salad and added steak to it, it was a decent size and filling.  I was pleased coming here and look forward to visiting again sometime for lunch.

Not a fan of Caliendos. Well, got to watch the Cubs and Sox continuing their first place seasons, so that was good. But the service was so RUDE and the food stunk. There was no silverware when the server gave me my soup. So had to ask him for a napkin. Then my husband had to ask for a fork for his salad. The server had never brought us the famed bread. The waiter never smiled, never responded to the conversation, and continually made us feel like we were intruding on his life. The pasta with spinach was flavorless.   Will not be returning to Caleindos.

Caliendo's is at most an ok spot. I feel bad for people that come here and say, "The food is amazing!" Really? Have you lived in a 5 mile radius your whole life? Let me guess, "Pal Joeys"is your favorite pizza place. lol. 

The food here is bar food, nothing special. Decent pizza, nothing special. The chips were poor quality, similar to a generic tostitos brand. 

I'm sure this is a happening place in Winfield, but if you've ever been to Chicago, Naperville or St. Charles.....you might be disappointed. Small town hangout more for the locals.

Caliendo's was a hit in my book!  We were in the area on a Friday for lunch and wanted a quick bite. We don't spend much time in Winfield, but this is right on the beaten path and it was next to a bakery we wanted to try, so it was an easy choice to make. 

The service was really good. We had attention from the owner more than once during the visit. We had no trouble getting our glasses refilled promptly and the food was served hot. 

The calamari was nice. I enjoyed that it was freshly battered and the accompanying marinara sauce was tasty.  Mom and I split an Italian beef sandwich and fries and a chicken Parmesan sandwich. They even split it for us, so that was a plus. The food was really good. Fresh cut fries. We wanted to try a few things so this was a good way to go about doing so.

The restaurant was clean. The food was good. The service was pleasant. We will absolutely be back again!

Only go there if you want delicious ribs that fall right off the bone! Mashed potatoes were amazing and service was even better! Thank you to our server Tim aka "Dominic". Everything was great and we're all happy that we made the drive! 
We shall return again! Thank you!

Stopped in here while picking food across the street. Friendly staff food looked really good reasonably priced drinks. A lot of Tvs to watch the games.


The bartenders are attentive and nice. I came on a Monday night admittingly slow but it's a Monday in the burbs. 

I have been here 5-6 times always friendly people.

This place is OK. Nothing special at all. The reason I'm giving it such a low rating is because they are way over priced. Ordered the tri cheese panini when it was a daily lunch special for 6 bucks instead of the regular 8 bucks. When I decided to add bacon they said they can't do the special so they charged the regular 8 bucks plus added 2 bucks for bacon. So the grilled cheese was 10 bucks!!! Soup and sandwiches were mediocre at best. Probably won't come back

Caliendo's is a nice little restaurant in tiny downtown Winfield. I've been here twice recently - it's close enough to DuPage Animal Control that it's easy for volunteer meetups. Both times I've ordered only appetizers, but the service is AWESOME and the food I have tried is really delicious.

This past time I got the spinach and artichoke dip and the homemade chips with bleu cheese dressing. The artichoke dip was standard but very delicious, and the toasts that accompanied it were perfect. The homemade chips with bleu cheese were OUT. STA. NDING. Everyone at my table wanted a sampling when they arrived and we all obsessed over how delicious they were. Just typing this now, I want them again. And they were like $6 for an ENORMOUS portion. So worth it.

I like their patio as well - roomy and fenced in, allowing you to be removed from the foot traffic of the sidewalk and actually enjoy your conversation/dinner mates. I'll be back soon to enjoy those delicious chips.

The food is alright. Good burger although overcooked. My wife liked the meatball sub and my daughter's Chicken Vesuvio was fried chicken with olive oil and Italian seasoning. Worst part was the foul language and people with a little too much to drink. Definitely not a place to bring the wife and kids.

Almost flawless

My husband and I stopped in Saturday night for the St. Patty's day special (Corned Beef and Cabbage) and to check out the place for a future gathering of friends and family.

We were not disappointed!  The server was pleasant and for the most part always around and refilling our soft drink and coffee. He kept tabs on our appetizer time and checked in with us. My only two critiques of the server was that he did not ask if we needed anything when the food was delivered and a few times my coffee cup was empty for a period of time before I flagged him down for a refill. He was better at refilling my husbands water and soft drink.

The Corned Beef and Cabbage was a massive platter.  The corned beef was delicious.  You didn't need a knife to cut it. The potatoes, carrots and cabbage were good.

The side salad before the meal would have been better if it were served on a rimmed place or less lettuce.  My salad was falling off the plate.  Additionally, the salad would be better if the lettuce were romain or mixed/  I had the blue cheese dressing, however it's taste was lost on the iceburg lettuce.

My husband ordered a pizza and it was delicious.  Another server even whispered in my husbands ear that all pizza's were 1/2 half off on Sunday evening.  Go to Know.

We were offered dessert, but we were plenty full.

Thanks, we'll be back!

Delicious.  Delivered right to hospital.  The food was fantastic, even got all the condiments.  Even got great bread with it.  Steak medallions were cooked perfect and enjoyed every minute of the meal.  Will be visiting this restaurant often, now that ive tried em.
Had the antipasto salad. It was very good. Small salad was perfect for lunch. Ingredients were good as well. Only complaint is diet pepsi tastes weird. Why cant people just serve it from a can?

I would never eat their food or pizza. They use to have very good pizza but not now. Whatever happened  that customers are always right? Unless you only want cheese, don't order from them. Horrible service and food.

Honestly everything was just OK. Calamari tasted like fried chicken. Alfredo sauce was very bland. Tasted more like a thick butter sauce. Way too many onions in the chicken marmalade. Whatever spice they put on the croutons left a really bad after taste. Nothing magic nothing tragic.

The apple brie bacon burger is out of this world good! FULL of flavor and crispy bun that makes it perfect! Melted in my mouth! Their bread they bring to the table is delish! Their pizza is good! Cheesecake is great!!!!!

Legit beef sandwich with the exception it comes with provolone on focaccia bread! Good a
amount of fries all for $5 (lunch special 1-4 pm). Knocks the doors off subway that's for sure. ;)

A bunch of good ole boys sitting around drinking tall boy Pbr's talking about pawn stars on the tv. Like I said. Legit.
This was our first time eating here and the food was delicious! I would recommend this restaurant to my friends and family whenever they're in Winfield. I will definitely be back in the near future.

All I can give this place is 3 stars.  It's OKAY, but truly doesn't live up to the hype it seems to get from others.

- Pizza is just OKAY.  Sorry, it is not that great. Try Garibaldi's in Hoffmann Estates for that.

- Various other food items I have had = JUST OKAY.

- Burgers - JUST OKAY.  Fries were decent as I remember.

- Nachos - literally small Tostito chips out of the bag and basic Gehl's cheese sauce (which is near tasteless). You could make better at home with the cheap ingredients from your grocery store.  Across the street at John's restaurant, they have about the best nachos I have had.  Complete night and day from what you get here.

Haven't been here in awhile and I am in no rush to go back.  The place is just OKAY - it is really just another run-of-the-mill sports type restaurant and bar.  Years ago, it used to be kiddie-corner across the street and was known as the Winfield House, which had a much different atmosphere than a trendy sports-bar.  Winfield House closed/moved and became Caliendo's around 2004-ish.

I highly recommend John's Restaurant across the street if you truly want some great food.

Excellent food, beyond superior service. 

Have visited several times and service is excellent each and every time as well as the food. 

Love this place!!!
Hit or miss. so many good pizza spots round here...Sometimes it's good sometimes it's not so good...never been bad..pizza is better than the pasta. I have not yet tried a sandwich.

Wow. Just wow. Came here while waiting for my mom to be discharged from CDH. Ordered an iced tea and mushroom and sausage panzarotti.  Got my tea.  And eventually some bread. And a mushroom and sausage thin crust pizza. 20 minutes more to fix it so I just kept the pizza. It was ok.  Never asked me how it was, never brought a refill.  The waiter's response was "My bad on that order." Ya think?? Order came to $10 and change.  Funny, my change back was $10, he brought me 2 5s.  Yeah, good luck with that...

Went here for lunch. Went to the carryout side because I saw their sign that said "Pizza Slices". Once I got inside and took a look at their menu I wanted to try everything! I ended up going with "The Godfather", a warm pressed sandwich with layers of capicola, salami and mortadella with provolone on focaccia bread. It was soooo good!! It was more than I expected. The meat was piled on, the cheese was gooey and the bread was warm and soft. It came with a hefty side of homemade potato chips. For a quick lunch. It was more than enough and definitely satisfying. I'll definitely be back!

First time last night for dinner, ordered nachos with shrimp it was good but I think chicken would have been better, pizza had too much sauce, Italian beef was really good this would have been a great dinner if the waiter was a bit more attentive and threw in a smile here and there.
This our favorite go to for dinner and sports. Soups are made fresh everyday and delicious. Lots of menu choices and daily specials.

I've gone here for years, but NO MORE!!! I give up on them, going way down hill.

Ive never yelped before, but I made an account just to tell about this experience.  My family arrived and the place was dead.  The lady that sat us was completely uninterested and was rude to her tables. But halfway through our meals after overhearing her being berated by a manager somewhere out of sight but well within ear shot I could understand.  
The food was very late, we waited over thirty minutes.  At one point we were the only people there so whats taking so long? My eggplant was awful. Over cooked and had the texture of a sandal. I told the waitress and she removed the plate but never offered a replacement! Fine, Ill save my appetite for johns or union house, heck even 7 11 has better quality food and service. Constantly had to flag someone down for refills. EVERYTHING was dirty and had a used and abused type of film on it. From menus to the table itself.

Will not return.

We heard from a neighbor about the all you could eat crab legs and decided to check it out because my husband has been craving them. They start you with a delicious loaf of warm bread and butter, which is always a plus for me. I ordered the spinish salad. It was a basic salad, but hit the spot for me. Plus, their ranch dressing was delicious which is super important to me. :) I ordered my one year old daughter a cheeseburger from the kids menu. I figured it would be a typical gross hamburger that you normally see on kids menus, especially since it was only $3.75. It turned out to be a full sized, yummy cheeseburger and fries. Great deal! My hubby fulfilled his craving of the crab legs. He said they were pretty meaty and good. 

The staff was really pleasant as well. The manager was very interactive and our server was nice and attentive. 

We don't live very close but will most likely hit this spot up again!

Yum!  The pizza is really tasty. The crust is buttery and flaky. The mozzarella sticks are yummy and the marinara sauce is flavorful. The staff is friendly, environment is comfortable and they give the kids dough to play with while we wait. They loved it. We will definitely go again.

So I decided to do one of the food challenges there. I had my choice between the hitman (giant burger) or the wise guy (4lbs calzone). I opted for the calzone because it was listed at 4lbs and I had 30 minutes to complete it. A feat I have done in the past at different restaurants. Long story short it took me 33 minutes to finish a 5lbs precooked weight (4.5 lbs cooked weight) calzone. Was it tasty? Yes. Was it something you find at every restaurant? No. Would I order it again knowing that it weighs more than what is listed on the menu? No. I would have opted for the hamburger challenge instead. 
Go ahead and say what you will for food challenges and the fact I am complaining about a half a pound of food but until you try a challenge you will not realize how much food a half a pound is. 
I say 3 stars
So back to the restaurant my wife ordered the sausage and peppers and loved it. Portion was good, taste is good, and quality of food was good. 
She says 5 stars
Final thoughts: clean restrooms and friendly staff and managment. I would say this place is a solid 3.8 rounded up to a 4. Thanks for reading.
The prices are fair and decent for a pizza place. The pizza is good but nothing to write home about. The drinks are kinda expensive also. The waitstaff is super friendly tho.

The take out pizza as ordered; extra well done on double dough is awesome.  All I have had is the pizza not sure about the other items on the menu.   Manager gave me a free powerade for arriving early and having to wait for my order.  Take out has their own door to go in and pick your food up.  I do dive out of my way for this place.

The cocina special pizza was decent, I like to go for the thin crust and their thin crispy crust hit the spot.  
The buffalo chicken wrap was sub-par, a little soggy and lacking much the flavor punch I expect from buffalo chicken.
Atmosphere is typical pizza place, with a couple sports channels on tv.
Service was friendly.

My Wife and I have eaten here on and off for the last couple of years and we always got great food and service. That was not the case on Friday nite. We arrived about 6 PM and the place was only about half full. Our waiter took ten minutes to greet us and brought no water or bread, had to ask for both after we placed our order. My wife had the special Fish fry and I had the Spaghetti with sausage. In the past the dinners came with soup and salad, now we had to pick one or the other. My wife mentioned that the fish looked smaller then in the past and it took forever to get another piece which seemed like it was sitting around under the heat lamps. My spaghetti was fine but the sausage was not very hot. Also had to twist the waiters arm to bring out refills on the drinks. When he brought out the check he kind of threw it on the table. When we arrived this waiter seemed to have a friendly conversation with another group, like he knew them, and we where cramping his style. I won't mention his name but it began with Mi!
I don't know if this place has changed hands, but it seemed different. Don't know if we will going back any time soon,sorry guys, step up your customer service.
Great wait staff. Bringing our son back next time. Caters to all ages here plus cool to sit outside when it's nice out. Good experience.

We didn't have a slow server, our server was a fairly new employee, so perhaps they have read the previous reviews!

This is a small place with maybe 10 tables on the dining side and a great bar side.  We ate on the restaurant side.  Most of the menu items are around $7.  We ate a lot.  First there were stuffed mushrooms and bruschetta for appetizers.  The bruschetta was great, the stuffed mushrooms ok.  They had some kind of yellow cheese on them and it just didn't work for me.

Hubby had make your own burger which he said was great, but he got lettuce and no tomato.  You had to ask for a tomato which we found kind of weird, but whatever.  I had the whitefish which had a great sauce on it and it came with a salad.

Whenever I go out, I get dessert.  It's part of my dining experience.  The dessert choices here are pretty limited which disappointed me.  They had gelato, tiramisu and ice cream with a variety of toppings.  I wanted maximum chocolate, but there wasn't any!  The tiramisu turned out to be just right, not too dry and not too creamy.

At the end of our meal we asked if they took dinner reservations.  When my whole family goes out, which is kind of rare, there are 6 of us.  That can make getting a table kind of hard, but they take reservations.  Between that and the $7 burgers, the whole crew will be returning here!

The food is so so.  The worst part of the visit was the waitress and owner.  The waitress made an error on our bill. The waitress was rude and blamed us instead of apologizing. The owner was very rude and actually swore at us! I am never going back again.  Save yourself some money and go somewhere else where the food is good and they treat their customers right!

Been coming here for years since we live in Winfield. I thought this was a great place. But recently, all of the pizzas were dry. I started to order the pizzas with extra sauce. sometimes they remembered, sometimes they forgot. So fast forward to Xmas eve. I ordered $95 worth of pizzas and ordered them with extra sauce, because we would be serving them later that night around 5pm. So my wife picks them up at 1:45pm and brings them home. My daughter goes to St. John in Winfield and she has her XMas church choir event at 5pm. So, I decide when my wife brings them home to have a couple pieces......now mind you.....this is at 3pm. The pizza was good but it did not have the extra sauce that I requested. A little pissed because this is what I did not want to happen. So fast forward to 12/26 and I call Caliendo's. I explain the situation, I spent $95 on pizzas and you didnt put extra sauce on, I still have the pizzas in the box, yadda yadd and the manager says he will talk to the boss.He comes back and tells me that they will buy me a pizza. I told him that wasn't good enough and he proceeds to tell me, and I quote, 'our pizzas are made to be eaten right away, not to be re-heated 3-4 hours later' Well how come they were dry 15 minutes after I tried it? Guy tells me they made all these pizzas and he remembers my 5 pizzas and that they put extra sauce on it. After reading other comments about Caliendo's, I see how ownership is. To not resolve this issue was bad business. I will be sure to frequent another place and take all of our school events, parties, catering, and nights out to the bar to another location.

Average to mediocre food
Long waits after calling in order, they tell you 15 minutes, and 25 minutes later it still isn't ready -.-
Staff is just ok, not the friendliest
Meatballs ok

Would definitely skip this place if you're looking for pizza or Italian food. Not sure if bar is any good.
Quality of food is fantastic , cost is average. Service is great. When you crave Italian food and your in the Winfield area , check it out. You will not be dissapointed.

A few years ago, I would have given 5 stars. Lately though, the food seems to have taken a dive. Burgers are not as good as they used to be and neither are any of the pasta dishes I've ordered. Our last visit was a huge disappointment since I drove out from Elgin for burgers, and they were overcooked, with soggy buns and very skimpy on the bacon. I don't know - it doesn't seem to be the recipes, it seems to be the cook? The employees and owners are always nice though!

My daughter and I will walk down there for lunch or dinner on occasion, and she LOVES it. They bring out dough for the kids to play with, and are always very accommodating in terms of making sure she has plenty of paper for coloring. The wait staff is very friendly, too. It makes this restaurant one of her favorite places to go!

The food is primarily pub grub, but it's tasty. Their appetizer sampler platter is MASSIVE; it's almost enough for 6 or more people. I highly recommend their loaded fries and potato skins. Their burgers are pretty basic, but tasty, and their Italian beefs and sausages are wonderful. We're not big pizza people, so I haven't tried it, but my friends adore it. 

The bar side of the restaurant is fun at night. While week nights can be a little slow, weekends are a good time. The bartenders are fantastic, and there's always great people watching.

All in all - highly recommend!

The short:

4 stars for desserts ...

-1 star for delivery/take out (since they have been here, there is always a problem)
-1 star for food (Eggplant parm, ravioli, the cheese and the sauce are all inedible)
-1 star for owners go f yourself policy (apparently he makes no mistakes on relies on 20 year old recipes to try and carry him)

Italian fare is the easiest thing to get right.  Fresh ingredients and some love will garner A+ results EVERY TIME .....why do some get it so wrong??  Clearly there is no chef on staff, just inept cooks and a flaccid owner.

The long:

We frequented this place when it was the Winfield house.  Shortly after they moved across the tracks, we started noticing problems with service and food quality.   Our past experience includes getting our order wrong twice, and after 3 hours, we just wanted a credit and no more attempts at food. I know one time was pizzas for a poker party, which I then had to order from somewhere else...but last night takes the cake:

My fiancee and I decided to give them another shot.  At 8:30pm we ordered Eggplant parmigiana and Linguini with bacon and scallops, which my fiancee substituted gnocchi and white cream sauce.  So when she went to pick up, hers was ready, and mine was not even ordered yet.  After waiting another 15 minutes to get mine, she came home to find the bacon and scallops had red sauce.  While she was calling to get them to deliver what she ordered, I looked at the scallops.  They looked dry and stringy ...perhaps frozen.  I tasted one, and it was dry and stringy ....not plump, caramelized and juicy.  She then changed the order to ravioli and meatballs.  At 10pm, we called to see where the ravioli and meatballs were ....no apologies ...no nothing.  When they finally arrived, the sauce was overcooked and the sauce at the bottom of the pot had burnt, and was stirred back into the rest of the sauce.  Here is the conclusion:

Ravioli - Burnt, inedible sauce, pasta overcooked and filling/sauce was a salt bomb.

Scallops - lol ....if you cannot get fresh, and cook them properly TAKE EM OFF THE MENU!  If you do not know how to do any of that, then hire someone that does!

Eggplant parm - Inedible salt-bomb cheese, and a lot of it.  The 4"x4"x1" brick of parm was a soggy mess that you could not tell where the eggplant starts and the breading ends.  No flavor, just a mushy mess that I threw 75% of it away.

This place relies on locals that drink and smoke everywhere.  I cannot imagine anyone coming here for the food, unless they do not know what this food is SUPPOSED to taste like.

Oh ...and when I called to ask for my money back, I politely provided all details,then, the owner told me to stuff it, after he said that he'd been serving the same crappy eggplant for 20 years.  Nice customer service!

I like this place a lot.it has great food at a great price. The patron pizza is the best pizza I ever had. It's like an Italian beef but pizza! I get it every time I go. I literally crave it once a week.

A group of us went for lunch on a weekday, all for our first time at Caliendo's. 

The warm bread may be the best I've ever had at a restaurant- amazing! It's a small round loaf and they didn't flinch when we asked for more. :)

We were really disappointed in how slow the service was. There were only three other tables of people in the restaurant, and yet we had to wait a long time between our drinks and then to order our meal, and then a long for the salad/soup and then for our meal and then for our check. We didn't get drink refills in a timely manner either. We got there at noon and didn't get our food until 12:50. We were surprised since it was lunch time and most people only have a certain amount of time for lunch. 

The server was actually very sweet with a kind smile. Just really slow- maybe she had too much to do herself?

I had the bambino pizza which is a small thin crust pizza for only $4.50- I added bacon for 50 cents and it was delicious! Great flavor. I had to blot the grease off with a napkin (which is typical of other places too) but it was so good. I also had the house salad which was bigger than I expected- mostly iceberg lettuce with a slice of tomato, but good Italian dressing.

My coworkers seemed to overall like their meals too. One ordered the chopped salad with chicken and ate every bite, though said that they forgot to include the bacon which was listed as an ingredient. Another person had the antipasto salad which was huge, but was disappointed that it was almost all iceberg lettuce. Someone else ordered the Godmother sandwich which was a hot Italian beef and provolone sandwich on focaccia bread, with onion rings, and she was really happy with it. Everyone loved their soups too.

It's a pretty small dining room (though I guess the other half of the restaurant is the bar area). They have big TV's and actually were showing HGTV type shows at lunch which I've not seen at a restaurant before. 

I will definitely give Caliendo's another chance and come back again for some more bread and pizza.
This rating is based on carry out. My wife and I both love their chicken Parmesan. The portions are generous and delicious.
I always get the panzerotti when I go there, it is amazing!  You really can't go wrong with their pizza. Customer service is good as well, friendly servers.

This place has really good pasta.That's for sure. Our waiter was pretty cool and attentive. However they aren't very good at math. Yeah simple addition. We had to mention how we were over-charged $15 and got the amount but its an uncomfortable conversation no one needs to have! Pesto sauce is reeeally bland so definitely try the other sauces. Massive portions. Eating el fresco is clean but tons of mosquitoes!
just moved in first time their and sub and salad where excellent , don't understand the bad reviews, I can walk their to viva Winfield

Nice local spot. Food is GREAT! The pizza is delicious... I recommend the thin crust with ricotta, sausage, mushrooms & onions. I can't explain how AMAZING that combination is! I never tho't I'd like ricotta on pizza but... yeah... its pretty great. And I'm literally on the verge of PROPOSING to the Eggplant Parmesan!!! OMG... so... good.... The Eggplant is literally SWIMMING in this delicious sea of melted cheese that is nice and crusty over the edges of the bowl... O M G.... no words can describe the absolute mouth watering deliciousness.... 

Anyway, please give this place a try. It can be a bit loud in the evenings and weekends because the ceiling is very high. Service is good and the staff is friendly and helpful. I only give 4 stars because the parking can be challenging (small lot in the back).

They are middle of the road. They are good because there isn't much in the area but I would love if they had more lighter choices for lunch etc. The pizza is good not amazing but good. Definitely a good place to go or get delivery from but nothing really amazing.

Born and raised in Winfield and seen the transition from 'Winfield House' to the present Caliendos. Their pizza is one of my favorite thin crusts and I've had my order ready in less than 30 minutes on a Friday night - much shorter than local competitors. Recently I did order Eggplant Parmesan and was puzzled when I received it without pasta- the menu didn't describe it as coming with pasta, but for $13+ including tax I expected more. The bar is fun for a small town and drink are reasonably priced.

My Favorite Hometown Joint !  We have eatin here over 15 times and orderd out at least 20 !!!!! Robby and Mike are great owners yes , great people , great environment and staff ! but you are reading this for the food , so lets get to the point
here is what to eat
-Pork Chop Sandwich
-Pizza Pizza Pizza ! its the best
-Wings
-All you can eat Crab Legs
-the Bread they bring to the table , is so good and hot and fresh
-Italian Beef w/ mozzarella

Caliendo's is the mullet of sports bar/restaurant combos.

It's separated into two sections: one half is a fully-stocked sports bar with an outdoor patio area and the other half is a restaurant leaning heavily toward Italian food.

Their sports bar is a good place to hang out.  They have pretty good beer specials and the regular crowd is not consistently old balls -- as John's (the dive across the street) or Muldoon's (across town) are -- so that's always a welcome plus.

The restaurant is odd though.  The food is alright but they've tried to create the ambiance of a nice, quaint Italian restaurant.  There are candles on each table and the room was designed with mood lighting in mind.  The problem is that, well, it's next to a really loud sports bar.  So you'll be eating your fettucine alfredo in a dimly-lit restaurant with Gwen Stefani's "Sweet Escape" blaring into your ear.

I wouldn't go to Caliendo's on a big date but it's a pretty good place to have a couple of drinks with your friends.  Having access to an expanded menu at a bar comes up big, especially as the night wears on.

It's a mullet: classy fettucine alfredo in the front, Gwen Stefani booty music in the back.

First time at caliendos...not impressed. I ordered chicken vesuvio and I asked for boneless chicken instead of bone-in and the waitress said that would be fine. When I got my food, the chicken was sitting in a pool of pure oil. It was so saturated and oily and quite inedible. The potatoes could have been good if they weren't drenched in oil too. Definitely will never order that again. The table next to us ordered a pizza and it looked really good. I guess if we ever come here again (unlikely) I would try to pizza.
Went on a Wednesday night not very busy. Staff was nice not much to say we were drinking and the drinks were good. I will stop back for a drink next time I'm in the area.

If you are looking for good food at a great prices, this is a good spot for you. The italian food is good, the pizza is great and the all you can eat fish (wednesdays and fridays) is yummy. Saturday is all you can eat crab legs, also terrific.

Try it, you'll like it!

I very much like locally own, small-scale, informal places like this. I've passed by it for years, but never gone until tonight. I had the beef panini. My kids had the cheese pizza, my daughter a build-it-yourself pasta with marinara and baked cheese. My wife had the Fish Fry special. We were all underwhelmed. :-(  The food was heavy and just OK. Nothing really going on here to make us want to go back. The service was very good, friendly and prompt. No complaints there, but just nothing to encourage us to go back.

Winfield House as it will forever be known to me was pizza I grew up on.  The had a wonderful double dough and 4 star atmosphere.  However since they moved the good side tracks of the tracks they've lost they're touch.

The pizza has changed.  It's almost the same but as if they've forgotten a secret ingredient.  The bar has changed.  There were dudes in Winfield House that literally held the establishment up, they would play dice at the bar and it was not well lit.  It could almost be called dicey, but 5-star dicey.  It definitely had the feel that anything could happen and it often did.

The new Caliendo's has a sports bar feel, HD TVs, beer specials and those kind of places are a dime a dozen.  RIP Winfield House, I miss you.

I found this place because I was following a Latin band on FB and they were finally out this way so I decided to go.  
Much to my suprise, this quaint little town has this pizza 'joint' that is a gem in this suburb.  
I have been there many times since and every time have enjoyed myself both with the staff and the delish food. 
GREAT THIN PIZZA.  
Went there a couple weeks ago on a Sunday afternoon, only to find out that after 4pm, pizza is 1/2 price. HOMERUN RIGHT THERE.  
Love this place, its only a few miles from my house and have made regular trips there because ITS JUST THAT GOOD.

Sausage & Giardiniera pizza = AWESOME!!!

I like Caliendo's and I like their pizza.

Not too sure about having a noisy sports bar on one side and restaurant on the other because I'm sure that the noise carries over to those who are trying to enjoy their meal in peace.

I recommend coming here to grab a drink with some friends & have some pizza. Man up & get their spicy Giardiniera on your pizza. DO IT.

I've heard that Caliendo's is a great place to watch the Bears. I've been told that if you show up before 2nd quarter you get a raffle ticket for raffles throughout the game, AND you get to partake in the pizza buffet during halftime. I'm going to have to investigate and confirm whether this is true or not. Stay tuned for updates!


Holla!!!™

First, I want to say that the food was really good, especially the thin crust on their pizza (and others loved their pizza sauce). But I am giving them a bad review because of the service. Granted we had a large group, and the waitress was frazzled, but very nice. One manager, a woman, is very nice and helpful, but the other, a man, snapped at several of us multiple times and was borderline rude. We were being very pleasant, just asking for water after waiting for it for 25 minutes, or asking for another pitcher of water; the usual stuff (the waitress could not handle these inquiries, so we went directly to him). Will not come back. Go to John's across the street instead.

Although the food was good, our service was absolutely unacceptable.  We had to wave our server down every time we needed something and even when we were trying to pay!  We arrived at 2:30 in the afternoon, so it did not get busy until 4 ish.  I won't go out of my way to come here again soon.

We were drawn to Caliendos for their outside seating and nice looking sports bar but wow were we in for a surprise!
We waited 15 minutes just to get our drink order in, another 5 for our drinks another 15 to order our food and a good 30 minutes for it to come out!
By far the worst service I have had in years and this is coming from someone who has worked in the restaurant business.
