Upon confronting the manager he was rude and had an attitude, didn't offer to comp anything and sat at the bar the whole time.
I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone... 60 dollar bill later that was an expensive lesson to learn.

I give it 3 stars for "ok."

I came here on a Wednesday night and sat in the bar area. I wasn't at the bar, but a table in the bar. It was pretty busy for a wednesday, but not offensive. it was a nice crowd.

Service was decent. My salad came, then 3 mins later the pizza came which is never a positive. The server was attentive with my double talls, so that's what really counts.

The antipasto salad was excellent.

I got a medium thin crust pizza with 2 toppings. The menu said it serves 3-4 people, but as a 6-3 male just a little north of 200lbs i ate the entire thing by myself (except for 1 piece). The pizza was about $15, so that's reasonable.

The pizza was good. I don't agree about "the best pizza in dupage" but it was good.

they're on restaurant dot com, which is a huge plus.

We weren't too hungry when we came here, so we just ordered appetizers.  We chose to eat in bar area since we had a kid with us.  What was pretty nice was that they gave our son a ball of pizza dough to play with while we were waiting for our order.  

I ordered bruschetta and stuffed mushrooms.  I know that bruschetta can be made different ways, but my bread was extra soggy with all the juices from the tomatoes - not the way I like my bruschetta!  My stuffed mushrooms were really salty, too.  My husband thought his meal was just OK.

I'm sure we'll stop by again and try out their pizza, and if I have a better experience, I'll update my review...

Caliendo's is a great local spot.  I may be a little biased because I have become friends with the owners, but there's nothing wrong with this place.  Always have their booze in stock, open late 7 days a week, and have good music, with DJs pretty often at your request and some good specials.  Since updating their menu, the food is much more appetizing and everything is pretty good.  Pizza is great for the late cravings.  Overall a good stop.

The pizza is outstanding and it's my favoriter carryout in the area,  however I have eaten there two times and was disappointed with the food and service. The food was blan and small portioned. I also ordered a Patron Margarita and had to send it back because it tasted like 100% mix. Stick to the pizza and beer here and you'll enjoy yourself.

Have mixed feelings about this place. Has some good meals (sausage and peppers) and some not so nice (chicken caccitore so heavily 'hot' spiced with  it was almost inedible). Go try it, see what you think.

I've had a lot better Italian.  My Chicken Parmesan's chicken was tough enough that you could have used it as a paving stone.  It was far too overdone and then smothered in sauce to hide it.  The dinner salad? A mound of iceberg lettuce, half a slice of cucumber, and one slice of tomato.  Add insult to injury, our server was slower than molasses.  She'd bring some of the drinks, go back for the rest, and come back twenty minutes later.  Apparently they have drink specials or something, so I can see why people would go to such a lousy place, but I for one won't be back.

An A-OK Italian restaurant that put in my "I haven't been there for a while" rotation.  I love their fresh baked bread, soups, pizza, and make your own pasta.  A bonus about this restaurant are their $5 weekly specials.  You get a decent amount of food for the lunchtime rush, weekdays only and dine in only.

I went to Caliendo's on a Friday night with my husband, 13 year old son and sister's family, which includes 3 young children.  We loved everything about our evening.  The prices were pretty reasonable and the food was fantastic.  I especially liked the stuffed artichokes, onion blossom and baked lasagna.  My husband got the shrimp diablo pasta and was very pleased with it.  

What I thought was a unique touch was that upon arrival, my young nephews and niece were each given a ball of pizza dough to play with...genius!!

It wasn't a quiet dining experience...and we fit right in.  I think we may have been the noisiest ones there, since my nephews are just plain wild.

My husband and I are happy to have found another good restaurant to put on the rotation.

I came in today with my 3 daughters. Right away, we were seated, and the waiter was wonderful and attentive. He even gave my kids little balls of pizza dough for them to play with and keep them busy (genius!) The food came out quickly, and was delicious! Our drinks were refreshed as soon as they were half full. 5 stars for the attentiveness, promptness, and of course the deliciousness of the food! We will definitely be coming back!!!

Caliendos has absolutely the best thin crust pizza in DuPage County bar none. Their fried chicken rocks, too.

If you're in the mood for a great pizza this is the place to go. It's worth driving for.
Had lunch there and for $5, had soup, a HUGE sandwich and side of very good pasta salad. The service was wonderful and felt very at ease in the atmosphere. Will take husband there next lunch date!
It's ok. Very small inside, kinda a weird set up. Their pizza is NOT as good as Al's in Warrenville. Seriously.

This place isn't far from where one of my brother's lives. He says since Winfield is really small town, population less than 9,000, he says that having a decent place to sit down to eat is nice. 

Newly opened Caliendo's has great pizza, salads, and burgers. It's no Kuma's but it did the trick. Very busy for a Thursday night, we were sat quickly, but the service wasn't so hot. Looks like a lot of teenagers work here after school. Katie our server was sweet, but she wasn't really fast or knowledgeable about the menu. Oh well. 

Whenever I have a chance to have late lunch or early dinner when I'm in the West Suburbs, I'll stop by again.
Based just on the cheeseburger I had, it was really good. I had it delivered over to the hospital and would have it again with out any thought!!
awesome food great specials and daily deals

went on a saturday with my dad and mom. he raved about the $17.99 all you can eat crab legs. i had my doubts, but went for the chance to raise a little hell with the old man. WOW! what a pleasant surprise. i put away 3 huge platters of legs. they were great.
also had sever cocktails that were strong and served by a great waitress.
i am definitely making this a go-to place for legs.

This is the place to go for the best pizza hands down in Dupage County. That is saying alot because there are alot of great pizza joints competing with Caliendo's. Such as Jakes and Rozattis just to name a couple ones that I love as well. But Caliendo's is the best I have ever had.

i'd have to say, upon entering this restaurant, my expectations were low.  No frills.  But, I had the "all you can eat snow crab" on Sat night and it was surprisingly good.  Fresh and one of the better "all you can eat snow crabs" I have eaten.  Friendly staff as well.  I'd say if your in Winfield and want a casual place, try it.

Great pizza!   Some of the best pizza I've had in the suburbs.

Whether you come out for the restaurant or sit in the bar area there is plenty of seating.  

Regular weekly drink specials.  Lots of events held during sporting events.  

Great place to meet up with some friends to grab a pizza and some beers and catch a game.

Don't forget to ask about some of their great food specials.  All you can eat crab legs, all you can eat prime rib, or their rib special.
great pasta sauces...the pizzas are good too. a family member of mine was at CDH for over a week, the cafeteria food is pretty good but for a change we'd go to caliendos...it hit the spot :)
Excellent pizza!!!  We have only been in for lunch.  Nice casual place.  Great food and very good service.

Having moved here from Southern California recently, where good Mexican food was literally on every corner, I struggled to find something in the area that was a good as the Mexican I had back there.  The kitchen, food, and plating are what you would expect at an upscale, waiter server, sit down restaurant, but in a quick service format. Some of the best Al Pastor I have ever had. This place is the real deal, there is a reason there is a line. Generous portions, fantastic food, and very fair prices.

I ate here tonight. Please note that I did not dine in so my experience is based solely on takeout. I went through the drive thru. I was very excited when I saw that they had arrive thru. Definitely not typical for a Mexican restaurant. Major plus! The wait wasn't ridiculous either. Very fast service. 

Also note that I LOVE Mexican food. I believe I was Hispanic in a different life so one could argue  I'm overly critical because I believe I've eaten at some of the best Mexican restaurants around. I ordered 2 steak tacos with cilantro, onions, cheese, and sour cream. Cost was a little over $6. It was good. I like how they serve their onions on their tacos. I think my steak needed a tad bit of salt though. That's why I'm giving 3 stars. I would give 3.5 if I could. It  tasted like it was missing something. Steak was cooked perfectly besides seasoning. I probably would have given 4 stars if the drive employee wasn't just ok. She wasn't bad. She just wasn't good either. I will be back though for a dine in experience.

First off they have a drive through which made stopping her for lunch really easy. 

I ordered the steak burrito with sour cream and guacamole. I also ordered a side of chips and salsa. The burrito was huge! Way bigger than I expected. The chips and salsa were delicious. Spend the extra money to get the guacamole and sour cream in the burrito. 

If you have ever been to Los Burritos in the area, it is almost the same salsa. Absolutely delicious.

The prices were reasonable as well.

Not a fan.  I thought the chips were awful, and the "salsa" was worse.  Like tomato sauce with no actual chopped tomatoes, and barely any seasoning.  Burrito was the most uninteresting and tasteless (other than salt) that I have ever had.  Barely any cheese, beans or lettuce.  Only reason it was close to passable was we had asked for tomatoes and onion to be added.  Other than salt, that was about the only flavor to be found.  

Much better out there at this price point in my opinion, so I will not try again.  Too bad - had high hopes based on all the great reviews.

So walking in, I was expecting a bit more a taqueria but this was somewhat in the middle of a taqueria and a fast casual take on mexican food.   Walked in, ordered at a counter, was given a number and sat down - chips and salsa given at the table (really good salsa).    Order came out - disappointed with the steak tacos - it felt like it was a cheaper cut of meat than your traditional arrachera - not very flavorful.   The milanesa torta was great as was the horchata as others mentioned.   The cost of the meal was higher than most of this type of place as well.

Stop... The.... PRESSES!!!

I cannot believe food this good comes at this price. 

Let me explain something to you. I'm a HUGE fan of many Mexican places around the west burns as well as in the city.

Burrito Parilla just de throned my favorite go to places. It's a 20-25 min drive and I'm now ready and willing to ignore my favorite taco place that is 2 blocks away. Sorry, I DON'T CARE!!! 

Burrito Parilla steak taco just blew my d!ick off and laughed in my face!!!

The steak taco.
This isn't some cheap cut of steak. This is steak you would be proud to serve your family to celebrate a special occasion! Served with cilantro and onions, they do it up right with grilled red onions and the freshest cilantro I've ever had! 

The ground beef is seasoned to perfection!

The red sauce has a nice hint of garlic that rings through and changes the way you think of red salsa!

The flan is freakin HUUUGE!!!! My wife said it was amazing....solidly in the top 3 flan's she has ever had!

The horchata!!! This lands firmly in the top 2 horchatas of all time in my experience and I've had PLENTY!! NOT EVEN KIDDING!!!!

I kept seeing many people drinking a yellow drink and I asked what it was and they said fresh pineapple juice and coconut.... I immediately got up and went and got a cup of it. I'm seriously contemplating coming back, sitting on the patio and smuggling in my own rum cuz this would the THE PERFECT cocktail if it want also already THE PERFECT drink for any meal at any time of day! It was delicious!

I ordered the ground beef burrito suizo. It is huge. The red sauce on top has a great tomato flavor and a nice little kick to go with it. 

After eating tacos at Cilantro in Elmhurst and then downing 3 more here and eating half the burrito I was stuffed!

I can't wait to come back, the food is freaking amazing and it's soooo affordable!!!

I was refilling my drink with the pineapple concoction and I said tot he line cook "You guys are doing a great job! That food was delicious!!"

I'm so excited! 

I cannot wait to come back!! 

CAN'T WAIT!!

BURRITO PARILLA I LOOOOOOOVE YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This place was okay, better than pepes, but still not worth the $45 we spent. We got 2 burrito meals, a chorizo quesadilla and chorizo nachos with "extra cheese" they give you chips and salsa upon seating. The salsa is ok, but give 2 hot sauces if you'd like spicier. Overall, our taco place near our house is better and cheaper.

We've liked it all. Every single bite. After three visits here and trying a variety of dishes, we are convinced that this is the fast casual Mexican restaurant for us. 

It's almost always busy, but they keep it clean and well cared for. The setup is in an old BK restaurant and when I first walked in and placed my order, I was not confident. From my first bite, I knew that judging a book by its cover would have been a mistake here. 

The meat is a very good quality and always seasoned nicely. The rice is tasty. Even the chips and salsa are good. We've tried enchiladas and tacos, taco salads and even desserts. Nothing seems to greasy which is nice. Sharing churros and a fried ice cream is the perfect end to a meal here. 

The prices are reasonable, they're easy to find and they have plenty of parking. If you find yourself in the area, I would highly recommend a visit to see for yourself.
Really good food and very reasonable prices. Fantastic service even though it's fast food. The staff was very attentive to all the customer needs

Since we've moved at the beginning of the years, we've been attempting to scope out the localish food scene to find all the food basics! I found this place which seems to be sorta a fastish Mexican food like place, but with a sit down like atmosphere inside. There are TVs around to almost, kinda give you the sports bar feel, which it's totally not!

So, when you enter you go through an ordering line to pick out your meal and pay. They give you a number to put in a stand at your table. You can a cup to fill your own drinks, so I grabbed some Horchata and we sat. We put the number at the end of the table like the people next to us so nobody could miss it. A random OCD busser flew by and moved them to the wall or back of our table with no word! Like, we weren't following the rules! Uh, okthanksbye! It was quite rude, but we were hungry so we just sat there quietly as did the other table who got the same fly by!

I ordered the Grilled Steak Burrito Suizo - no sauce, just the cheese please! I don't know why, but I have a thing for burritos... Anything in a culture that throws everything in one dish makes me happy! Especially if they wrap it up in something! I know, it's typically Americanized. I love all the flavors though! If I am limited to just trying one thing based on time or the size of my belly, I'll get that one thing then! Ahem, anyway... The grilled steak was great! Nicely seasoned and cooked to a nice medium! That made the whole thing! I had to take home almost half of it for leftovers! I even loved the guac!

The boy ordered a couple Grilled Steak Tacos and a Grilled Steak Quesadilla... So, you already know that the steak was spot on! With that said, you know that these were good too! The quesadilla was nice and cheesy and the little tacos came with some lime wedges which made him very happy!

All in all it was a very good experience for a place that looks to be sorta fast foodish! It was clean and bright! I highly recommend check it out!

I am completely stoked (That's a good thing) because I LOVE tacos and they make them exceptionally well.

I approached with trepidation, because while I liked the Burrito Parrilla in Naperville I was underwhelmed by the flavors (great presentation though)... we approached hopefully.

Gobsmacked! That's what I was.. three tacos (Mexican Style) Chorizo, Steak and Carnitas.. every single one of them offering a packed tortilla bursting with flavor (Yeah, I said bursting.. just like a bad commercial) really excellent tacos, great presentation.. really good rice and beans and a great price.

The chips and salsa? Chips goods... salsa almost "ketchupy" BUT, THOSE TACOS!

Hot sauces? Nice little zing.. good flavor.

Lisa enjoyed her tacos just as much.

A wall of TV's,  we were able to watch Jay Cutler throw a pick and even THAT didn't dampen my enthusiasm.

We'll be back and back and back.

I went back for tacos, fried ice cream and the pineapple-coconut drink. I'm satisfied enough to bump Burrito Parrilla to 5 stars.

I don't mess around with tacos, so I ordered one al pastor, and one with chorizo. I have say that the chorizo was excellent. Sometimes it can just taste greasy, but here the chorizo was moist and spicy. Likewise, the al pastor was marinated very well, leaving the meat tender and spicy (but different from the chroizo).

Cilantro, lettuce and monterey jack were all welcome additions to the taco, and it was hard to say which of the sauces went well with the variety of meats. I'd probably have to try them all.

I got a free dessert for joining the mailing list, so I went for the fried ice cream. Which was decently sized. But with an oat, flour and sugar coating it also tasted like the topping for a crisp, and it was very good.

Definitely keep this place in mind for great Mexican food!

My coworker took me here on a Friday, raving about the steak he had. So I was excited and... He was totally right. This place isn't a taco joint. This place is a sit-down restaurant. The place was crowded, yet the food cam out fast. The servers were attentive even when we were sitting outside. Also, this one server was so funny. He kept joking around with us. It was a good experience. The food was amazing in case you were wondering.
Good, clean Mexican. Sort of American drive thru hybrid. Got a red and green sauce included.

Rarely do I write a review while I'm still in the act of enjoying my meal, but today I'm dining alone, and I need to rest so that I have the stamina to lick my plate clean.

I've enjoyed Burrito Parilla in Lombard many times, so I (along with many others) was pretty thrilled when I heard there was another one opening in Wheaton. Okay, okay, I know it's really Carol Stream. But I'm claiming it anyway, especially since it's close to the border. If you've visited the Lombard location, this has the same offerings, only with a less grand facility.

Beginning with the chips and salsa, everything served here is amazing. Today I'm having enchiladas, which I've had before, but with white poblano sauce, which is new to me. I know some people think chicken is chicken, but they do it really well here. The rice and beans served as accompaniments are delicious as well. 

I dig the music, the people who helped me are very friendly, and the bathroom was clean and well stocked. It doesn't get much better.

I'm pleased to see there's a drive-thru, especially for the cold winter months when I won't need to drag my kids out of the car. I've heard a person or two complain that drive-thru service is slow, but it's important to understand that this is absolutely not fast food, and I think the drive-thru would be better used just for pickup of call ahead orders.

Both of my visits here have been good experiences. 
I'd definitely recommend the Mahi Mahi tacos - the salsa and sauce on them are fantastic.  The fish itself is okay. 
Probably the star of the menu is the al pastor. I've had it as tacos and as a burrito and both times it's been seriously fantastic. 

This place is priced like qdoba and Chipotle, but the portions here are slightly bigger and the meat is slightly better.  The free chips for dine in are an added bonus for sure,  even if their salsas are only okay. 

I'll definitely be coming here for my weekly burrito fix instead of qdoba or Chipotle. It's no comparison to a legit Mexican restaurant, but compared to the big bjrrito chains it's far superior.

Came for lunch today with coworkers. We weren't sure what to expect. You order like you would at a fast food place and then they give you a number to place on your table for your food to be delivered. Free chips and salsa (a plus!). Our food was quickly prepared and....DELICIOUS! we all thought it was amazing and the dangerous part is that they have a drive-thru...to make it even more tempting! most of our group got the 2 taco plate which is a perfect sized lunch! really really good and we will certainly have to come back! don't forget to tip those who bring you the chips and salsa and clear your plates! they help make the experience great!
Great food and at great prices with abundant portion size. Been here a few times. Love this place, so good!

If you ask for sour cream make sure you get it. The first time I went I asked for sour cream (and paid for it) to be in my burrito. I cut it open and none. I asked the guy who comes around to the tables and he said he would bring me some. He came back a few minutes later and asked if I found the sour cream. I had to ask THREE times for the sour cream. The next time I ordered it on the side so I'd know it was there. My friend did the same and she didn't get her sour cream on the side. The food is the same as any other place but more expensive. To me it isn't worth the extra money.

I don't know what all the good reviews were about. They certainly don't serve AUTHENTIC MEXICAN FOOD here. We had Steak Burrito Suizos and the Steak was so BLAND !!!  It is definitely not the same kind of steak that is served at Real Authentic Mexican Restaurants. I grew up eating Mexican food and we have been to many Mexican Restaurants so I know how to tell the difference. Authentic is not here people.

Listen up, haters, this is hands down the best Mexican food in the area. I live in Carol Stream, and I'm a Mexican food connoisseur. As far as Mexican food goes, this place is on point. I've been to their location in Naperville, and I was pumped when I seen they were opening one by my place. 

My girlfriend and I had lunch here yesterday. She had the chicken burrito, and I got three tacos. Two tacos al pastor, and one grilled steak. The pastor was marinaded perfectly. The flavor was excellent. The steak had great flavor and was very tender. Her burrito was a nice size, and the chicken was perfectly seasoned. I got the black beans instead of refried beans. They were cooked perfect, and had plenty of flavor. The salsa is homemade, and is very, very good. 

I truly recommend you give this place a shot of your looking for Mexican for lunch. You won't be disappointed.

I dont understand all the great reviews. Just average mexican food at best They screwed up my sons order and gave him A quesadilla instead of a burrito. They gave him no guacamole which I paid $.79 extra for. When I went up to the counter and asked for some they looked at me like I was trying to rob the place. I had a chicken burrito. The chicken was completely bland. I wanted to give this place a good review and I hope they found a new Mexican restaurant but I don't think I will be coming back

every time we stop by for great dinner more and more costumers are showing up - food is awesome service is great and it's clean. 
We tried tacos , enchiladas , burritos and they all are so so good and I love the rice  and it's all made in front of you so you know it's fresh and you can see the whole kitchen nice and clean , chip and salsa are also good

Closer to a 3.5 stars but it's worth a visit 

My favorite part was the fresh pineapple juice they serve! Made fresh and it's free refill for $1.99. It definitely reminded me of the fresh fruit juices my mom would make. 

I had a carnitas Torta and a pineapple juice (best part) then I had some churros which where amazing and fresh made. 

I can say it's a delicious place and the fresh (free refill) pineapple juice was almost a guaranteed 4 stars but the prices are a bit high and the salsas they offer are good but left me wanting more (none of the two were spicy) 

I would maybe come here again, not sure tho.

Really friendly, caring staff. Good food. I really love the carnitas. The green salsa on the tables is amazing. I used almost an entire bottle. The steak tacos are good. It is in a good apot by Home Depot on Schmale. The best part is they have a drive thru as well
My family loves Burrito Parrilla. Great service and food. They Bring chips and Salsa to your table. Can't go wrong! Husband gets the ground beef burrito he loves it. Nachos are good..

Second visit, still a big fan!

Their carnitas border on to-die-for.

Their ground beef tacos border on burrito-sized.

The $10 taco plate is a monster deal, and way more than a single-sitting lunch worth of food.

I had to see what the deal was here since I had heard so much about it. I had 2 tacos and guac and salsa to go. 

The tacos were great! I got corn tortillas and they were packed with plenty of food. They were very flavorful and fresh. The salsa had lots of heat. Hubby is the guac critic and said it didn't have enough flavor.

I'm going back to try other stuff because my tacos were excellent!
Steak tacos are bomb. Salsas are great. And service is even better. Always consistent.
Fabulous cheese enchiladas with mole sauce.  Delicious fresh made  guac with chunks of avocado, garlic and onion.  Fast, friendly service.

My hubs loves the chicken burrito with a side order of retried beans for his chips!  He orders chicken burritos as long as I've known him...  (Years and many different Mexican venues)....  And this is hands down his favorite!  I've tried most of the items and I have to say I love the chili Rellanos (yum) I also love the tamal!  The avocado "sauce" is the sooooooo good, you have to ask for it, it's spicy and (not to be confused with avocado dip) and bright green!  I personally go there for the avocado "sauce" put that on anything and it taste great!  It's hot!  You've been warned...

I used to frequent the location in Lombard..... Then I moved...... Then this location opened up! :) 
Delicious fajitas, tacos, and of course burritos! 
Free chips and salsa! 
Clean, fresh, fast and decent prices! 
It's a beautiful thing!

Very fresh and tasty. This was our first time coming here, and we will be back. My wife got the taco salad and I got the burrito made it suizo with sauce and melted cheese on top. Both dishes were delicious. They dont throw alot of rice or fillers in. This might become our favorite Mexican restaurant.

Yesterday was our second visit here. The first was on their grand opening day. Last night I enjoyed their grilled chicken fajitas. They were cooked perfectly and delicious. We also ordered the 1/2 size of guacamole. It was OK. The size was small for the price and not many ingredients. The rice that comes with the dinners is really good. Very fluffy and light. Nice taste. This is a fast food place but the selections and quality are more upscale. I'm ready for trip number three!
Great food at very reasonable prices.  They have amazing Al Pastor and breakfast too!

First time here:
me and my husband ordered there Parrilla Steak dinner..."It wasAMAZING!!!
Hot, Juicy,Tender the Best Ive had in this Area!!!
Surly a once a week visit and will make our rounds in trying more delicious dinners from there Menu
Thank you Burrito Parrilla Mexicana for your awesome Hot Hot Dinner

Delicious! I've been here three times now and had the al pastor, steak, and carnitas tacos with rice and beans. Everything tastes super fresh and flavorful. The guacamole is perfect and I love ending the meal with churros. It's a bit on the pricey side compared to say, El Famous, but the food is fresher and tastier IMO. Plus they have a drive through which makes it convenient for carry out.

This just opened and I was excited to try it. I've driven past the one in Naperville but I never got a chance to stop, this new location is right by my house. 
It's a cute place and they have a nice outdoor seating area. We ordered for take out. I tried calling In my order ahead of time but the phone was never answered. I ordered the 3 taco plate which came with rice and beans. I ordered steak, chicken and al pastor. It was not a huge disappointment but I was not impressed either. It isn't authentic Mexican food but it isn't Taco Bell either. Out of all 3 meats I liked the steak the best. The rice was not bad but I didn't like the refried beans. My boyfriend ordered three tacos but when we got home he was only given 2. Sucks for him, lol. I ate my food and it was ok but there are authentic taco joints within a mile radius to this place and I would choose them over this place. 
Fresh, fast food, a little bland, no authentic flavoring but edible.

Love this place! The al pastor burrito is delicious. I always think I will try something else, but can't pass up the al pastor burrito. My wife has tried the enchiladas and the tacos. She said both were good. I can't wait to go back.

My son and I had lunch and we both had the Parrilla Grill and it was amazing!  The meat was cooked perfect and all of the condiments, guacamole, pico, etc....were well made and super fresh.  The food definitely gets 5 stars.  The only thing preventing me from giving the full 5 stars is the man standing in the dining room busing tables and bringing out orders.  He kept reaching around our table moving silverware, trying to get us to try different hot sauces by squirting them on the plates, interrupting us by telling us to try this and try that, and things of that nature.  I was dumbfounded...I don't want anyone touching my food or plate when I'm eating.  At one point, my son finally said, "Excuse me, but please don't touch anything on our table until we leave."  He seemed a bit offended, but I thought it was so bizarre that he thought what he was doing was acceptable.  We do hit the drive through on occasion, but I won't go back inside.

This place is phenomenal and is easily one of the best Mexican places I've ever been to. Some friends and I have nicknamed this place "Los Dos" since it's an upscale offshoot of Los Burritos in Glen Ellyn. My wife swears by the chicken fajitas. Father-in-law swears by the steak tacos on corn tortillas. And my go-to is kind of a DIY version of the SoCal favorite; California Burrito. Order the steak burrito with sour cream and guac. and add a side order of fries (Unfortunately they'll look at you like you're crazy if you ask them to add fries inside the burrito). So when they arrive to your table, open the burrito and add the fries to the inside. It'll change your life. 

Lunch time this place gets packed at noon. Best to beat the rush by getting there 11:45am to get a table.

The food was good, but found a piece of gristle in my "el pastor" pork, pretty big one.  Hate that.  Did not realize this wasn't a classic "sit down" but a "order, then sit down" type place.  That's okay, but prices are more leaning towards the "full waitress" range.  The guacamole was very good and the never-ending chips were served warm - yum!  This would get a better rating if prices were a tad lower for waiting to order in a line.  Sometimes you want time to think and the pressure is on to not hold up the line!

I loved my steak burrito. The steak was very vendor without your typical piece of chewy meat mixed in which you get at most taco joints. The meat must have been prepared over charcoal or something as it had a touch of smokiness to the flavor. I enjoyed both the green and red sauces. I took a pass on the guacamole at $8 for an order. I felt is was a bit steep for guacamole for this type of walk-up/drive through venue. The service was prompt and our order was accurate. I'll go back.

Best steak tacos i have had in a very long time. the steak was flavorful and i could taste the grill flavor in the steak...most places i taste more grease than steak. kudos to the cook who made our food. also kudos to blanca the cashier and the gentleman who was our server he really went the extra mile. i will indeed be back in the future

One of the best "fast food" restaurants to grace our area in a while. I've frequented this location dozens of times, I have tried a plethora of menu items, and each is more delicious than the last. The food is fresh, the flavor is authentic, and the portion sizes are generous. The service is impeccable, the employees are always very polite and courteous. Since they do cook as food is ordered, the drive through isn't a very fast option, but it's a nice alternative to going inside. I definitely recommend checking out this gem!

I was very pleased with everything about the place.  The menu is much broader than burritos, with a nice selection of tortas, tacos, enchiladas, etc.  Lots for me to go back and try.

I ordered a milenesa torta.  You order from the line, pay cashier, and they give you a number to place on your table.  After grabbing a drink, yummy horchata, and finding a table, a friendly server brought chips and salsa.  I didn't order chips/salsa, so I thought that was a nice touch!  She brought a mild salsa in a bowl with a medium (green) and hot in a squeeze bottle.

The torta didn't take long to bring out.  Service was quick.  The torta was delicious and a good portion.  Price point was right as well.  I should've taken a picture.

The server came back at least once to make sure everything was ok.  

Tables were clean.  Nice mexican music for ambiance.  There is a wall of TVs to watch as well.  They were all tuned to futbol.

I'm so happy that they here,  

food it's awesome, 

Customer service always Great, 

Everything looks so clean. 
 full of flavor  
I did order enchiladas with a Al pastor taco traditional with cilantro and onion. 
And a horchata  you get refills 
As many's you can drink.

I saw this place setting up a few months ago and was excited to give it a try. Husband ordered the chorizo burrito dinner and I ordered the steak suizo burrito dinner which comes with rice and beans (refried or black). 
At first we thought this was fast food with the way you come in and order at the register. But turns out its anything but! They do have a drive through window, but it looked a bit slow. You get more bang for your buck if you come in. 
You are seated by a waiter who brings you chips and salsa which were delicious! There were four to choose from- your typical red tomato salsa in a bowl and three others in squirt bottles to put as much or as little on your chip as you'd like. There was an avocado green salsa, a HOT (and I like spicy!) salsa, and a bbq salsa. All were delicious and they keep bringing you chips. My kinda place!
They also have a variety of standard sodas to choose from plus Horchata and Pineapple water which are the same price as a soda.
The food came out fairly quickly (5min or so). It was authentic (for American Mexican!) and outstanding.  Everything seemed fresh and high quality. The burritos are giant. Like the size of a baby. I couldnt finish mine, but it was delicious. We'll definitely be back.

Tried Burrito Parilla last night for the first time. It was absolutely hoppin', so you know they had to be doing something right to have a line out the door within the first 10 days of being open for business!!

I tried their steak taco salad, which was yummy! It's steak prepared in a Carne Asada style, so you know that's some good eatin'. For $9.99 or so, it was a little on the small side related to portion vs. price, but the quality overtook every other aspect. Something not to miss.

My husband and son tired the Steak Tacos and Ground Beef burrito, and said they were very good. 

They also provide chips & salsa on the house when you dine in, which were also delicious. The drive thru seemed to move a little quicker than ordering on the inside (the family behind us in line decided to get back in their car & try ordering in the drive-thru, and we noticed them being served just before we got to the cashier in that long line). We might try that next time if in a pinch.

Overall, great new spot in the CS to try for Mexican food. I'm sure you'll agree it's pretty good. A tad pricey, but good 


P.S.- Best enchiladas I've ever had my whole life... Granted, I've only purchased the cheese so far, but with their Ranchero sauce it's fantastic

I like this restaurant.  The food has great taste.  I tried the steak burrito suizo style.  Fantastic!  My daughters and I also shared the guacamole.  They advertise it as homemade.  It very well may be but a bit lacking in avocado flavor.  They could do better on this.  All in all, the whole family enjoys this restaurant and we'll return.

Went on a recommendation from friends and was not disappointed one bit. I got the carnitas tacos and they were so good! The complementary chips and salsa was very good and the horchata was very very good...and I am very picky about my horchata! My family ordered churros and they were not like most.  They were soft, yet crunchy, and served with a side of caramel. We liked them but wished they were larger.

I'm looking forward to coming back and trying more of their menu!
Love the tortas really good Mexican. The nachos are great.  Have a lot of salsas to choose from. Drive-through and dine in or carry out.

Very good food! Eat in and get free chips and salsa. Food presented well, very quick delivery. Dining room is clean and all staff members were very nice and helpful. We went here on a lunch break from my office near by so it's important to have quick delicious food on our busy schedules. You won't be disappointed.

Finally Mexican Food that meets the entire families expectations. We ventured in on a Friday afternoon for lunch, so glad we did. We were quickly greeted and asked if we would be dining in. We said yes and he quickly set us up with a nice table and some warm chips and salsa as we looked over the menu. I ordered the burrito plate with chorizo. It was HUGE! I enjoyed every bite. I can't wait to visit this place again and looking forward to the summer when they have the patio open.
Love this place! I'm in town for work every week and eat here usually once or twice each trip. Everything on their menu is done very, very well and tastes fresh.

Was in the area from orland park and tried this place and Wow wish there where closer to me the food was great and there sauce was to die for. Best food m sauce in a while. Really Impressed with the service and the food.

I have heard such good recommendations for this restaurant so I thought we could give it a try.  We ordered tacos for the adults and kids meals for the kids.  Food was good, but underwhelming.  I was really disappointed at the flat guacamole.  Red "salsa" was very acidic.  A good solid meal, but nothing was truly flavorful or wonderful.  Kids meals are very basic, but GENEROUS!  Service is friendly, over so by the person bussing the tables.  I thought the price for the meals for adults was very high for what was received.

Might return to try another category of meal.  Will update....

Excellent food, excellent service, friendly staff, clean restaurant.  We have been here many times and have never been disappointed. Take out orders are never wrong. This is our go to Mexican restaurant when we want authentic Mexican food.

I ordered a chicken burrito and picked it up through the drive through.  When I got home there was a long curly black hair intertwined in the tortilla.  I called the restaurant back to let them know I was coming back to get a new one.  I also mentioned that they forgot the sour cream and guacamole, and the rice was hard.  when I arrived to return my order I came in to show them the hair.  On my way driving to the restaurant I decided to not get anything from there because who knows what they were doing to my food.  Most places don't like when you call to complain so I wanted to be safe rather than sorry. I had about 5-7 employees staring at me as if I was doing something wrong, I felt very uncomfortable.  A man looked at the burrito and said we don't have anyone here with long hair.  I was looking at him like are you kidding me, I'm not going to eat a burrito with hair on it, whether you have someone with long hair or not.  They said they already made my burrito and they said are you sure you don't want to take the burrito, I said no thank you.  They lady returning my money wouldn't give me cash back and I paid with a debit card so she said she was voiding the transaction.  I wanted proof it was voided and she had a hard time coming up with a receipt, finally she gave me a receipt that said voided.  Just waiting for the proof to come from the bank that the transaction was voided.  I will not be going back there, maybe the employees should wear hair nets!

Here you go! A great new restaurant with great tasting food.  My husband had his usual: steak burrito. I had the al pastor torta. Both were very tasty. The chips and salsa brought to the table while waiting for food was a nice surprise. They were tasty, especially if you added the green sauce to your chip.  We will definitely be back again. If this place served margaritas, I would make this my new hangout place.  Everyone was very nice!
Delicious and fresh authentic Mexican food. Hands down some of the best mahi mahi fish tacos I've ever had. I highly recommend this restaurant for eat in or take out.
The tacos are scrumptious! And the horchata is my favorite. The service is friendly and quick. Great place!  Wish there was a place closer to work that was this good
Fast service. Free chips n salsa while you wait. We had the nachos with chorizo and al pastor burrito - delicioso!!

First time eating here was last night. I asked for Carne Asada Burrito and received a grilled chicken burrito. Green salsa was ok not the best I had. Red Salsa tasted way to much of tomatoes. Very small burrito compared to others I had. Overpriced for what you get. Most likely my last.

This place is AWESOME.  Ive had the steak and Al Pastor tacos.  The service and fast and the food is fresh.  Free chips and salsa when you dine in.  Everything looked great!  They have a drive thru and their open late too.

This place is muy fantastico!! I cannot recommend highly enough. Fresh ingredients make for delicious entrees, and of course burritos!  Their salsas are the cherry on top-super fresh, delicious, and served right to the table. My favorite is the green avocado salsa, I can't get enough. Friendly service and a gentleman who brings your food to your table after counter service ordering and checks consistently to make sure you're happy with everything. Their pineapple/coconut drink is wonderful, and so is their horchata. My top recommendation though, has got to be the al pastor-authentic and cooked on a vertical rotisserie. So good!  Go now! Let's support this west suburban gem!
A fast food experience done right.  Food was good,  service was great,  and enjoyed the vibe.  Will be back!
Great new spot in Gh. Great, fresh, homeade food. Good portion sizes at a good price.
Excellent spot.  Al Pastor anything is really good.  Fresh salsa has kick!  Will be repeating often....

I'm giving them 2 stars for fresh ingredients. There is nothing "authentic" about this place. I had the steak chimichanga and the best part about it was he poblano pepper sauce on top. The steak had absolutely no seasoning just bland flavorless steak and too much cheese. The only thing that gave it flavor was the sauce. The rice was, meh. The black beans were good. The place was a mess. Go to Mi Casa...their food is authentic Mexican.

Loved the food. Everyone compares it to chipotle. I got a chicken burrito pretty much exact same as I did at chipotle except no rice. In my opinion, it's better than chipotle AND they don't have E. coli.
Lot of traffic in here tonight and it was raining, but they still delivered quick for the drive tru. Great service, nice people, yum torta'sss!! Will be back for sure.

It was muy bueno!! Fantastic food,  as authentic as i have experienced & the staff were super friendly!  Always checking on us,  super clean,  real comfortable & the plating was nice. Such fresh food,  no complaints from me. My. New favorite place! !
Definitely worth a try. Had chicken tacos that were good and guac is good too. Staff was on top of things and friendly.

came back, and had a very good experience. the food is delicious, and the service was very quick. Memo, who is a server, is incredible. i've never seen anyone work so hard, and he thanks every patron individually, as they get up to leave. he's a gem.
The tacos are good but the burritos are GREAT and I usually don't eat pork much but the al pastor burrito was delicious!
Wow great Mexican restaurant. Great burritos and tacos. They have a great out area and indoors. Price will not break the bank. The steak burritos are the best!
Ordered the Milanesa Torta for lunch today, amazing! The meat was tender and it was the perfect portion!! I'm a picky eater and I would go back for sure! Guacamole was fresh and delicious!

This place is awesome. Tremendous service, and amazing Mexican food. The tacos pastor "Mexican style" are fantastic. Their burritos live up to the name of the restaurant and more. The churros are the best I've ever had, and the horchata is a must. Josh - one of the employees is an excellent resource, and has provided great recommendations and service every time my wife and I have eaten there.

I chose a Friday lunchtime for my first visit and it was packed beyond standing room only! However, despite the crowd, the line moved quickly, the service was very pleasant and the food arrived quicker than I expected. I had the Al Pastor burrito and Mahi Mahi tacos and both were excellent and reasonably priced. The burrito was a good size, good tasting and had good proportions of meat and rice - far better than the large chain restaurants. I'll be back for sure!
Food its great, good attitude of the employees, the only thing i dont give them the 5 star its because, they should have waiters, its a nice place, overall its good.
Great food! Fresh ingredients and wonderful service! The interior is beautiful and refreshing

Good Service with fresh tasting good food 

I noticed this place a few weeks back while it was still undergoing construction. I work in the area and have been keeping an eye out for it to open, because I am excited to try something new for a change. 

Well I noticed today that it was open and deiced to stop in. I am glad I did!

I typically like steak burritos, so that is what I ordered, with guacamole. I also noticed the drinks were self serve, so I ordered a small drink. Upon placing my order with a friendly gentleman taking orders and operating the cash register I was given a number to take to the table so they can bring my food to me. At first I was a little surprised at the cost of the meal, a steak burrito with guacamole and a small drink for over $11.

After paying for my meal I went over to the drink station and noticed thy had horchata. I poured a glass of it. 

I then headed towards the dining room to find a seat and was promptly asked by a staff member how many I need a table for and if I would like chips and salsa. I replied that I would. By the time I sat down at my table there was a bowl of chips and a cup of salsa along with red and green hot sauces.

The salsa was very good. My burrito arrived shortly after. After the first bite I could tell it was very fresh and the steak was very good.  Through out the whole burrito I could tell it was fresh and high quality. A nice change of pace from all the greasy burrito places I am used to.

Personally I thought the meal was very good, I intend on gong back and trying more of the menu. While I do try to find places slightly cheaper than this to eat lunch at on a regular basis, I will be back when I feel like treating my self to this delicious food.

LOVE THIS PLACE! Restaurant quality food but with a drive through. Delicious food and big portions, enough for leftovers. It's Worth the prices. Our kids love their food. Lots of flat screen TVs inside. Friendly employees and they even gave me a free large drink of their pineapple coconut water.

Excellent enchiladas!  If you are looking for a quick, not too pricey, Mexican restaurant this place is great.  Fresh chips and salsa and a great simple menu. Husband had a burrito and it was huge. We will be back!

My neighbor and I stopped in to give this place a try and we were pleasantly surprised on how great everything was. I ordered the steak burrito and she had the two steak taco dinner.  We dined in and received warm chips and salsa.  The place filled up quickly and after receiving my food I now know why. The steak is delicious, big juicy chunks of meat in the burrito and tacos.  We decided we liked this place so much we came back the next day for lunch and I tried the steak torta, which was excellent.  This is my new go to Mexican restaurant.

Everyone was very nice and the food was good.  The Churros, with I believe it was caramel sauce were outstanding.  They were brought out hot as we finished our meal.   The dining room was kept very clean and we must have been there during shift change, so we had 2 different men that served our food and chips and salsas. Both were very friendly and worked hard to keep up with everyone. They couldn't have been nicer, so we had a nice experience for my husbands birthday.

We've only tried the take out so can't speak to the dine-in experience. Lots of great choices and ways to customize your meal. The tacos and enchiladas are delicious. The meat is seasoned well and the tortillas are tasty. I love the salsa. It's a little spicy for a house salsa, but that's how I prefer it anyways. Glad to have a quick place to get decent Mexican where the meat isn't questionable and the food is overly salted.

Went in for carryout after being lured by the word chocolate in the name - can it be bad?   the answer is no.    
The famous chicken salad is amazing.   Might be one of the tastiest salads I have ever had.   Since I was so good, I allowed myself to have the white chocolate blondie, which was equally delicious.   
For carryout they did a great job of packaging everything up and still making it appetizing which is more important than you would think   
The place was hopping on a Wednesday night so I cant imagine what it is like on the weekends.    They seemed to handle the crowd well though and it was vibrant and buzzing rather than feeling stuffy and overwhelming.

I was happy to be quickly seated with 4 guests.

I ordered a Caprese Salad and bowl of Mushroom soup. One other diner had the soup. Service brought it separately from the mains, as first courses. The awkwardness of serving nothing to 3/5 the table while we had soup escaped service. The soup itself was awkward: Spooning soup and French fried onions and long strings of melted cheese proved problematic. I really didn't like the challenge in front of 3 others that were not served.

Caprese Salad was a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT. Sliced Cherry Tomatoes floating in a bowl of balsamic vinegar with a small amount of mozzarella cheese. Strange, and unimpressive. If this is the Best Effort from the kitchen to through together practically the simplest of dishes, then don't bother doing it....or anything more complicated!

Went for the first time on a Friday for an early dinner; got seated  right away and the place filled up around us quickly. The decor is modern, with a beautiful bar and even though the lighting is pretty dark, the energy and noise level make it more of a friends for dinner place then romantic evening.
We started with my standard G&T and a pomegranate martini, G&T was small and forgettable, but the martini was pretty and tasted great.
Then moved to appetizer of egg rolls, nicely crisp with slightly spicy filling and 2 dipping sauces to compliment.
For dinner we had Chicken Crepes and Balsamic Ribeye with spaghetti squash sides. The crepes had a good texture and the chicken was moist, the mushroom sauce had some depth. The spaghetti squash had an interesting preparation with an herbed butter, raisins and pistachios.
The steak dinner came out cold, but the waitress immediately took it back and it was comped from the bill without asking. After it was returned it was cooked properly and had good flavor.
We finished with the White Chocolate Brownie with ice cream, which was rich and warm, a great way to finish  the meal. 
Overall good experience, mistakes happen but it was handled professionally and quickly. The food was good standard fare with some interesting sides and really good desserts.

Management reached out to me after seeing my review posted and showcases great customer service. For future first time diners like me, there is "bread upon request" on the menu somewhere that I must've missed. It's also encouraged to seek a manager if I'm unsatisfied with the meal - not all restaurants are open to this so kudos to White Chocolate Grill :)

The great follow through might have me coming back after all...

I came here to take out my friend out for her birthday a few weeks ago and I came with the expectations that it would be something like Wildfire. I made a reservation so we were seated right away but we waited quite a bit for our actual waiter to come around. It was extremely busy so I don't think he was intentionally avoiding us. There was just 4 of us but we were seated in a very nice and roomy booth probably meant for 6. Our food came out in a timely manner and everything seemed fine but the Salmon New Orleans I ordered was disgusting. I love salmon and I know what it should be like but this was not quality salmon. It tasted okay, but it LITERALLY felt like I was chewing paper. It just ruined the whole experienced of it. Salmon should not be rough and hard to chew. I even had my friend, her husband, and my boyfriend try my salmon and they agreed something was very very off about the salmon. I actually felt like I might get a paper cut eating the salmon. Again, it took a while for the waiter to come to us but when we finally caught his attention, he was very apologetic and nice and offered to get me a new one. When they brought my new salmon out, a woman, who I assume is the manager, brought it out and spoke with me apologizing. It would have been fine to just leave it at the apology but she said that if I had wanted it medium rare, that I would have had to order it that way. I DID NOT WANT IT MEDIUM RARE. I WANTED IT HOW SALMON IS NORMALLY COOKED. She treated the situation as though I had just ordered it wrong and that their salmon was fine. The cooked parts of the salmon was still had a very paper-y consistency but most of it was very under cooked so it was bearable. I just pretended to eat sashimi, which luckily for them, I love. They did take out my dish from the bill but I was still irritated.
Overall, it wasn't terrible time, I just wish the manager didn't act like I was at fault and like I had done something wrong.

Driving by a sea of restaurants that I've never tried before, but I wanted to before heading by to Maryland. I did a lot of research on Yelp to find the one restaurant that I wanted to try while here in Illinois. I decided on trying The White Chocolate Grill. 

We made reservations and arrive a little bit early. We were seated right away and a few minutes later our waiter came by to get our drink order and explain the menu.

Here's what we ordered:

-Barbecued Baby Back Ribs Pork baby back ribs grilled and finished with signature BBQ sauce  - $24.79

-Tomato Gin Soup (House Specialty) Fire roasted tomatoes, cream, mushrooms and smoked bacon. Topped with Tanqueray Gin - $6.79

-Southern Chicken Salad Crispy hand-battered chicken, field greens, smoked bacon, cherry tomatoes, avocado, chopped eggs and house made Hailey's croutons with Ranch dressing -$14.39

My father said the ribs were decent but a little dry. The sauce was tangy and tasty. My mom had the Tomato Gin Soup and she thought it was too salty. She tried to eat it with bread but it was still salty to her. I tried a little bit and thought the overall taste was very good but I too thought it was too salty. I had the Southern Chicken Salad, the chicken was crispy and juicy. The mixture of vegetables with the fried chicken and ranch was so delicious that I ate the whole thing pretty quickly. My parents may of heard mmm sounds. 

Overall the service was good because he was very attentive and apologetic of my mom's salty soup. They took my mom's soup and said we could try something else, but we were all too full to eat anything else or even try the delicious sounding white chocolate desserts. They did not charge us for the soup my mom didn't eat which was nice.

We stopped in here for brunch after checking out the Morton Arboretum and were looking forward to filling our bellies. Before our meal, my husband had about 8 servings of bread, which the server was very friendly about bringing to our table. For brunch, my husband had a sandwich and I had an Eggs Benedict with steak, both of which were delicious. Our biggest disappointment was that (understandably after so much bread) we didn't have room for the restaurant's namesake white chocolate desserts! Oh well...Guess we have a reason to stop in again when we are in the area!
I meet friends and business folks here for lunch from time to time. If always find the staff pleasant, food fresh, tasty and in generous portions. I thought my filet mignon cobb salad was delicious.

We came to White Chocolate Grill for lunch while out and about and had a very enjoyable meal.

Décor: This is a pretty nice (upscale) restaurant that oozes class and sophistication. The décor is fancy and the lighting is set to a very relaxed and more intimate mood. It's a great spot to have a business lunch, a more private meal, or to celebrate an occasion. It was particularly inviting due to the very HOT day we visited - the cooler and darker interior was a very welcomed break.

Staff: Our waiter was very friendly and super knowledgeable about the menu and offerings, even providing suggestions and answering every question we had.

Food: We were just in for lunch so we skipped any apps and went straight to the meal: We had a burger (good but pretty standard) w/ fries and the Club Sandwich (rather large and tasty) with a side of Brussels sprouts (very tasty!). The food came out rather quickly and everything was enjoyable. 

Value: The prices are right about where you'd think they'd be. In fact, I'd say a few choices were even cheaper than I expected (which is great!)

We had a nice meal here and would return again in the future if we're in the area.

Excellent! I went here with some friends before an event and was very happy with my meal! I had the Basaltic marinated steak and it was to die for! The atmosphere was excellent for a small gathering or date and the staff was friendly and was well informed on the menu.

I want to start out by saying that the decor and staff are good. We were in a group of 18 the other night for dinner. I felt the staff was not organized well to serve large parties. The runners had no idea where the drinks or food orders went to. Every time they had to go around our table and ask who ordered the item. Also one of them spilled a drink on me and did not seem too concerned. Seems the wait staff are not well trained. 

As for the food it was ok but not great. We had multiple appetizers. The spinach and artichoke dip was average. The southwestern style egg rolls were pretty good. My ahi tuna appetizer was very good. Had a unique Asian slaw with it which was very good. It was big enough for 2. Probably the best thing I ate that night. I then had the mahi-mahi for my dinner which came with a side of choice. I had the fresh green beans which they seemed to be pushing that night. The fish came topped with crab meat. The fish itself was dry in spots. Obviously overcooked and the green beans were very much undercooked. They were way too far on the raw side. Several other folks had various steaks all of which they stated were average and nothing special. Also the booze is watered down in my opinion. I know my vodka and can tell right away when a rocks drink is not right. I complained and the replacement was the same. I complained again and ordered a mixed drink and you could not taste anything but the mixer. At this point I was frustrated as with everything else I mentioned here there was never a manger that came by to address or at least acknowledge any of the issues. Tells me that this is as good as it gets there and they do not really care. I will not come back by choice. Lots of better places in the same parking lot there to go to.

This is a beautiful restaurant. The ambience is very romantic with plush, comfy seating and dim light. This would be a lovely date spot. The staff was polished and professional all while being friendly and welcoming. The ahi tuna salad was so, so, amazing. I cannot recommend it enough. So fresh and beautifully plated. 

I ordered a cappuccino at the conclusion of my meal, and this was my only criticism. It was Luke warm and not great, however everything else was so wonderful that this place still earns 4 stars. I would return and order some of the amazing looking deserts next time.

Great service,  cool bar, and good food. You won't go wrong with this choice.  Some reviews said you can get better food at Applebee's.  Not sure what Applebee's they are going to but that was not my experience.  The boss and I shared a dessert and it was the best desert I've had in a long time.

Long wait good food !
Love the atmosphere 
Could use more qualified 
Servers or more training for them 
Other wise kind people and advise this place 
A good choice

Below average experience all around. Not worth the experience nor money. I had the steak on the recommendation of the staff and it was on the level of an Outback, Texas Roadhouse, etc. at a price much greater.

There are better steaks and experiences in Naperville. Definitely look to other areas for finer dining.

This is a good place with very good food, but it's a chain... so you get their standard fare. The menu has some funky options, and the pace is dark and noisy. The wait-staff are helpful with suggestions, and the food is solid. The price tag isn't cheap, but a good spot to come fora special occasion.

However, if you come in on a Friday or Saturday night, you better plan for a reservation well in advance, because they book up well out in advance.

The following morning of our friends wedding we decided we needed some heavy food to soak up the alcohol from the night before. We found this place on Yelp with an expansive menu and it looked to be a nice place. 

Well.. It's a very nice place and the service is wonderful. It's a large restaurant with lots of menu options from crepes to BBQ platters. 

I got the breakfast special which was crab cake eggs benny. It was kind of lame. The eggs are poached to hard and the crab cake was literally about a 1/4" thick. Not sure how they even got it that thin and were a still able to fry it without falling apart. 

He side was some bacon potatoes which were decent. The fruit was mushy and old tasting. 

The BBQ that Michael had was pretty good. Probably smoked the day before and reheated but good none the less. 

Don't get dessert. It's way too sweet and rich. Almost gross to eat. Maybe the first bite is ok, but no more. 

This place seems like it has great potential, especially the location and quality of the building but the food needs work. 

The in house ranch dressing was the best part of the meal for me. 

Michael liked his though so that's good!

Not bad. I didn't fall in love with it as much as I loved the one in Schaumburg but it was ok. Very nice ambiance inside and very clean and nice bathrooms.

Came in with my wife and another couple. I got the BBQ trio (pulled pork, ribs and rotisserie chichen) with honey glazed carrots. For starters, all of the meat was tender so no complaints there. What I wasn't fully feeling was the sauce dressed on the ribs. Wasn't nasty or anything. Just didn't blend well with my taste buds.

For dessert we got the apple pie. It was pretty good accompanied with the ice cream on top. And it was a big enough size for two people. I can definitely see myself returning here someday but it may not be an immediate rush to do so.

Wanted to try this place for a while. After a late afternoon outlets shopping, we came 15 minutes before the closing time to enjoy our dinner. We made a great choice.

Apparently we were the last table to be seated and served. Our waitress was wonderful. She kindly ensured us no worries on the closing time. Well, we were hungry so very quickly decided on Ahi tuna salad, New York strip, and Mignon salad.

Ahi tuna salad was tasty with a good portion for me. Fresh fish and seared nicely. The salad got the right amount of dressing. New York strip was truly medium rare. Less fat than I anticipated but still juicy and tender. Mignon salad was not what I expected. The beef was chopped to small pieces instead of a big chuck or third slices. Also a little bit hard to chew. I will either skip chopped bacon or blue cheese next time which make some bites very salty.

We were for chocolate soufflé for our dessert. I liked it but not impressed. The cream inside was not warm enough and the cake was a little bit sweet. Would be better if I got my coffee.
We chatted happily during our dinner. Overall it is a very decent place.
The food was amazing would defiantly eat here again and again!!!! I had the salmon and couscous my man had the veggie burger

I was definitely mislead by the reviews I read on Yelp. To start of, there's nothing upscale about this restaurant. It's a grill and that's exactly what it feels like. Perhaps some of the reviewers confused upscale with modern because the decor is definitely nice and modern. It is also does not have a romantic feel whatsoever. It's just a modern, well decorated grill, with low lighting. With that said, I shouldn't have gone there for our anniversary dinner. We should have stuck to Mortons.
However, the food we ordered was good overall. I asked for a bellini and they gave me something with peach and sparking wine--it was good, but not a bellini. We had spinach artichoke  dip for appetizer--it was good but definitely not the best I've had, and the chips were extra salty. My husband had the ribs, and he really liked them. The meat was soft--fell off the bone--and it was well seasoned. I had the blue cheese crusted fillet cooked medium--the meat was soft and they cooked it correctly. I enjoyed the steak! For dessert we had the bread pudding simply because I didn't know what to order and that's the server's favorite dessert--it was definitely good, if you have a sweet tooth. Finally, our server, Joey, was quite nice and professional--I appreciated that! 
So, even though the food was good, my expectations for this place were much higher. I was quite disappointed with the dessert menu though. Given the name of the restaurant, I was expecting a better selection of desserts made with white chocolate, not just a bunch of desserts with white chocolate sauce over them.

It was simply OK. A more modestly priced wildfire with steaks going for 25$ instead of the usual 45$ at wildfire... Same atmosphere and everything. The way the tables were setup was indicative of a steak house vibe and just screamed out again wildfire. 

One cool thing they had going on was that the bar was in the very center of the restaurant so as the bar patrons backs were to everyone but cool at the same time cuz you get to more or less look at everyone at the same time. 

My steak was ok; it was smothered in a very juicey sauce that probably ruined or masked the flavor of the meat. Not sure if they serve USDA prime or choice... who knows... my side if I remember correctly were fine, the drink was meh could've been stronger but thats ok. the service was there as well, but could've been stronger. 

Maybe ill come back maybe i wont. Dont know.

WCG is a new restaurant chain I hadn't tried before (other 2 locations in Phoenix & Denver).

This is located on a corner with lots of choices (Maggiano's -been there, Morton's-been there, and more).  BUT, I hadn't tried WCG, and who could resist a place with White Chocolate in the name.

FYI, you can make reservations thru Opentable, but our group of 6 plans kept changing so we just stopped by.  The wait?  Around 30 minutes.

Restaurant is huge and contemporary (actually all the restaurants are huge; LA restaurants just don't have the space).  We were seated in a room, next to a window, with other large groups. (Later, my teens complained it was cold by the window, but they have thin L.A. blood).

Service?  Excellent.  Our server was fast & friendly. 

Drinks?  Bynum Pinot Noir by the glass.

Food?
Grilled artichokes w/Parmesan "dusted" on top & aioli sauce.  Ok.  Stem was tender, but rest was tough.  Needed a discard bowl.

Wedge salad-they don't skimp on dressing or blue cheese.  Large salad that I was able to split this with my teen daughter.

Blue cheese crusted filet (comes with mashed potatoes and an additional side).  Ordered steak medium rare and it was prepared correctly.  Was craving and really enjoyed it (saw my daughter ate all of hers).  Also, good quality, cut of meat.  I didn't care for mash potatoes. I ordered couscous as additional side. Its served cold and I thought it was good, but I was too full to enjoy.

I had no room for dessert, but a very pleasant dinner.

TV dinner quality experience

Would rather go to Cheesecake Factory where it is consistent and equal in menu pricing, same ambient

This restaurant is outstanding!  Great service, great food.  I ordered the prime rib steak salad, it was done to perfection!  Very tasty!  My husband had the trio of BBQ ribs, chicken and pork. It was so much food, he took some home.  The service was outstanding, the cocktails were very good as well.  I would highly recommend this place!

Our first experience at this Naperville hotspot was more than satisfying.  This second trip was a huge disappointment.  I had made reservations for 6:45 PM and we arrived a few minutes early.  There were several parties waiting to be seated and i could hear at least one party of two bemoaning the fact that they hadn"t made reservations.  They were of course seated ahead of us.  Finally, we were seated at one of the two heaviest traffic areas in this restaurant.  One is the front door.  The other is a door which is a point of convergence between the kitchen, the bar and the open seating area.  Of course,  someone has to sit at the table there.  Righhhhht...the party of two with reservations.

Then came the ordering of drinks.  Classic Margarita for my better half and a Cab fir me.  The Cab was perfect.  The Rita was a disaster.  I wonder if this is a trend in fine dining because this is the second time in three weeks that Virginia's favorite drink was butchered.  My expectation is that we would receive a well mixed Rita.  It tasted like a lime powder preparation...just nasty.  Our waitress explained that the Margarita is prepared earlier.  Steam is now coming out of my ears.  I expect a mixologist in a fine dining establishment to squeeze a couple of limes and add an orange liqueur before the Tequila.  A bar manager can only go so far to keep the beverage and labor cost down and not offend well heeled patrons.  

I had steak the previous night so I tried the Chicken Madeira.  It was wood fired and a bit dry as a result.  However, the taste was excellent and with a sauce to balance the dryness this dish was yummy.  

Virginia had the strip steak ordered medium.  It was perfectly cooked.  Virginia was taken back a little by the "sliced" presentation (Wheres my steak?), but outside of presentation the steak was bland.  I added salt to a piece I tried and that helped.  Can't fault the kitchen there...you want to let diners season to taste.  Still, it was nearly tasteless.  I would like to see an au poivre on the side as an option, but at least a bernaise.

I tipped 16%.  I'm not inclined to return.  C'est la vie.
Consistent and DELISH food. Not super crazy big like The Factory. Elegant low light and classy decor.

Love the ambiance!  The food is delicious, it has a really unique menu.

Its great for special occasion or for a very casual dinner!  Lovely food, great menu, yummy food!  

Been there twice, excellent servers, fast and friendly!

Highly recommended you make a reservation!  

And highly recommend the white chocolate brownie!

The White Chocolate Grill has always been one of my favorites, however for health reasons and other concerns my wife and I decided to be more healthy and become vegan (actually, a whole foods plant based diet, but we settle for "vegan" when eating out). We decided to try this place again to see if we could get some somewhat healthy options.

While our waiter was excellent and knew exactly what ingredients were in each entree, he admitted that none of the menu items were vegan.  There is honey in the veggie burger and egg in the bun. Even the guacamole had egg. They made a special salad (not on the menu) which was not good at all, doused with way too much dressing. The brussel sprouts without the cheese was great. Unfortunately we found two big chunks of cheese in the salsa that came with the chips (appetizer). 

We walked away disappointed. You can eat vegan easier at Chipotle or Subway. We were wrong to think that a newer, contemporary restaurant would be more in tune with our generation and have at least some healthy options on their menu. Lesson learned.

Came after 8pm after a rough week.  My server Chris was excellent - very little wait between seating and taking order.  Recommended great fish of the day - barramundi pesto on cauliflower mash and spaghetti squash, and split my dessert so I could take the brownie for later.  Great job Chris!

Yum! I love white chocolate! Came here for lunch n ordered the prime dip with veggies and a glass of vino.  Perfect lunch! The sandwich was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside and the dip was not too salty!  The side of bbq sauce and wine added the cherry on top!  My co workers got the salmon which looked very good as well.  We alll enjoyed our meal!  Wish we had time for dessert but had to run to our next meeting.   Next time I'm around I'll be stopping by for some dinner and dessert!

Applebees quality food at much higher prices. I've been hearing about this place for years so we finally decided to try it and were disappointed. It was just very below average. I thought the desserts were supposed to be amazing but my SO and I both ordered different ones and both were disappointing.

WCG is a bit of a stand-by in my life. The place I choose when I want good food, but I don't feel I have to be runway ready. Or when I want a quiet dinner in a nice atmosphere without the fussiness of my favorite Naper steakhouse that's located next door. ;) WCG is beautiful space. Dark. Quiet. Perfect for a date. 
 
I always start with the grilled artichoke. It's dusted with parmesan cheese and the saltiness of the parmesan is perfection with the artichoke. My favorite way to begin a meal there.

The rainbow trout with the herb goddess sauce is a staple for me. The fish is prepared perfectly and although I use the sauce sparingly, I love it enough to eat with a spoon. 

If you're a fan of sushi as I am, the Ahi Tuna Salad is perfect for lighter fare. When I am being strict with calories, I even like the Ahi salad sans dressing. The mangos, avocado, and sushi provide enough flavor to eat it dry. It's one of the few salads that I really love the dressing though. 

The much loved tortilla soup is made of big chunks of their in-house rotisserie chicken. It hits the spot on cold Chicago evenings... It is different than other tortilla soups that I have had. More like an Enchilada soup since it's a cream based and has been thickened with masa instead of the typical clear broth, which is how most prepare it. Regardless of the consistency, it's delicious.

I have eaten at WCG with at least 6 friends and all 6 have said that the Israeli Couscous with roasted pistachios is their very favorite side. It's mine as well. Unexpected flavor that makes me want to eat every bite, even though I told myself I would not. I wonder if they'd just bring me an entire plate of it instead of an entree? 

Dessert. Ask nearly everyone. Order the White Chocolate Brownie Sundae. A warm blonde brownie served with warm chocolate sauce, vanilla ice cream, whipped cream and huge shavings of white chocolate. I am not a big fan of white chocolate, but this dessert is heavenly. We don't even look at the menu anymore. If we're ordering dessert, it's a must.
  
While I wouldn't say it isn't good for kids, I wouldn't be quick to bring mine for dinner either. I took my 15 yr old and 4 year old here for lunch. The 15 yr old of course was fine... the 4 year old was happy enough there. They do have a kids' menu and the staff was very good with her. --I never once felt she shouldn't be there. That said, it was lunch, not dinner. I don't think I've ever seen a child there at night. It definitely has a night club feel to it and almost everyone there seems to be on a date. I personally would not bring my kids here on a weekend night. While they are certainly  seasoned restaurant goers and behave very well in public, I don't think kids would fit in that scene nor would the majority of the people there want to see kids on their date night.  Just my opinion.... 

Make sure you have reservations for weekend nights because a 90 minute wait is very typical if you don't.

Do not hesitate to sit in one of the seats at the bar if seating in the dining is full. It makes for quite a pretty focal point.
We absolutely love this place!! They closed the one in Schaumburg so we found the Naperville location and had to go! Love the intimate setting. The chicken salad was great as usual!!

Crab cakes, martinis, guacamole, brussels sprouts. We came here a bit ago as a team, and I can't recall what else we got. What i do remember are the drinks. The drinks make this place awesome! And...the crab cakes. I would not recommend getting the guacamole. It was brownish and tasted a bit off. Other than that, stick with martinis and crab cakes. :) By the way...did i mention the martinis and crab cakes?

Great portions and good food.
Good service.
A little too dark I think and the bar area is cramped as people show up

I had the balsamic ribeye steak with honey carrots. The steak was cooked perfectly and you can taste the juice from the marinate.
