The dessert was excellent as well with the silky chocolate soufflé cake. Though a heads up, it's a very rich, very sweet tasting cake. Meant for those with wig a sweet tooth.

Mardi Gras Jambalaya is the way to go. I got nothing chocolate with my meal, despite the name of the place.  The ambience is a little on the romantic side, but you can go with friends all the same.

My jambalaya was the perfect amount of moist, and the seafood in it tasted nice and fresh.  Has a good kick to it, but not overpowering.  The portion is huge, and sadly I ate most of it. I usually limit my carb intake, but I had to make an exception for this. Ceasar side salad was good and added to the meal, and the Brussels sprouts were uncooked, which wasn't what I was expecting. Still pretty good.

I'd come back here for sure for the jambalaya alone!

Visiting from LA and stumbled upon this place.The name caught my attention. Amazing food and the dessert  out of this world .Just as good as ( Cheesecake Factory ). Carlos the bartender will take care of you .If your in the Chicago suburbs visiting , must come to this place you won't be disappointed ..

I've eaten in & take-out over 50 times. Good food until last week my server suggested the barbecue combo... it was the finest fall off the bone baby back ribs I have ever had... this will become my go to meal from now on

This is an okay spot if you are in the area.  Nothing really stood out as awesome but nothing wasn't good either.  I have never been out in downtown Naperville so I wasn't sure what to expect.  The space is rather large.  It does appear properly staffed though.  We grabbed a drink at the bar and they make a good dirty martini with blue cheese olives.  They were very quick to take our orders and give us our drinks.  Good thing we checked in half an hour early though cause by the time our reservation came, the buzzer went off.  I would not have been happy if we had to wait a half hour after.  The place was extremely packed at 6:30 on a Saturday and, on our way out, it was even worse.  So good for them but just be prepared for a very crowded spot.  We had a table that was in the bar area and I liked that.  Our service was decent.  We were never wondering where he was and the food came in an adequate amount of time.

I got the center cut filet.  I ordered medium rare and it came out more on the medium side but not so much I would send it back or anything.  The meat itself was just average to me.  It did not seem like a prime cut and the meat wasn't particularly tender or flavorful but again, not bad.  The filet is served on a bed of mashed potatoes.  Had I known that, I would not have ordered more mashed as a side.  The portion size was too large for me.  But I guess that is the crowd that goes in there so since I'm not their target demographic, that is fine.  But if you're used to city spots, you'll think these potions are rather large.  The cous cous salad that my husband got as his side was the highlight.  That is very tasty and refreshing.  His French dip was okay.  There was too much mayo on it and the bread was just plain bread and not toasted and a baguette  like is typical with a dip of any sort.  Although the large side of jus was appreciated.  The banana dessert was tasty but nothing to rave about.  Overall everything was okay, no complaints.

Yum Yum Yum!!! A friend from out of state had actually remembered going there and recommended it to me! I asked if we could be seated somewhere a little quieter and they gladly moved us. All 4 of us had a delicious dinner and then my dad and I split the chocolate souffle cake....mouth orgasm!! The hostess was also kind enough to go outside to take a picture for us!

Omg I'm heartbroken! You know I rave about this place and have loved it since I went to the original in Scottsdale, but my experience this past weekend was ooh so sad :(

I feel like this was a long term relationship and we're breaking up. :( Thank god the bread pudding and pulled pork sandwich is so good or else I don't know if I'd ever come back.

2 major disappointments, the service and the cleanliness. OMG I can't even begin to explain how shocked I am. I'm still in denial. Maybe it was just a bad night for them, I don't know. The service was absolutely horrible. I've never experience this ever in the tons of times I've been here :( we had like 4 different waitresses. It was really weird, like stuff was out of order. The service was extremely slow. Then out table was dirty so they came to clean it yuck. The worst part is, the platter they brought the artichoke drip out was filthy and crusty on the bottom. Then the plates they brought out for the appetizer had dried food still on it. Dishes were not cleaned. I was about to throw up. I'm completely disgusted. :(

The ambiance was updated enough, the drinks were good, but the music can be loud. The food was just OK. The chicken enchiladas were so salty, I only ate 1/2 of one. There's nothing exceptional about the place, it doesn't stand out with anything, just rides the fence on menu & service. Won't be back.

This place was good the ambience was very nice the waiters and  staff were very attentive. However the portions are small so get some sides. I had their flirty martini would definitely do it again it was really good my favorite by far their. The chicken was moist and juicy. Can't wait to go back to try something different.

Made reservations and I was stuck in traffic, they were awesome enough to accommodate us and hour and half after we finally made it to the restaurant. We waited about 15 minutes, which was great taken it was busy "Sweetest Day".
I enjoyed the feel and decor of the place, it was very inviting. I was completely satisfied with my blackend salmon. I recommend this dish! If you are in Naperville and looking for a good place for a dinner date, this is it!

So my girlfriend and I went here for valentines day and had one of the best meals and service experience in a long time. 
We had reservations, but had to wait half an hour because it was valentines day. It was no problem because we had a few drinks at the bar. But what made the service exceptional was that the manager offered us a free appetizer because of our wait. We didn't complain about the wait, but it was great knowing that they were thoughtful about the customer.
The food was fantastic. I had the jambalaya which was some of the best I've had. I paired it with the brussel sprout salad which was also great, and i don't even like brussel sprouts. My girlfriend had the salmon and roasted carrots and she said the flavor was great and the salmon was cooked perfectly. Also the entree sizes were well portioned.
Finally the dessert. We ordered the white chocolate bread pudding and we only wanted a small taste cause we were pretty full. Let's just say we finished the bread pudding. We will be coming back. Fantastic place.

We thought the White Chocolate Grill was pretty good.  We went there on a Saturday night with a reservation and had to wait ~15 minutes to be sat which is a little long given we had a reservation, but it was a Saturday night, so I suppose it happens.  The service was good, the decor was pretty cool and the layout was comfortable.
Due to all of the reviews, I knew I needed to try the Tomato soup and I thought it was very good.  I did not taste Gin at all, so I'm not sure what it adds to the flavor, but I liked the bacon and mushrooms in it.  It is a pretty filling soup, so for my meal, I just ordered a wedge salad.  The salad was a standard wedge but it was huge for a side salad...I had plenty of food with just that.  My husband got fish (I can't remember what kind) and the brussels sprouts on the side.  The brussels were tasty in flavor but they were cold, which surprised me.  So, be forewarned that it's more like a brussels slaw/salad than a warm side.
Obviously, we saved room for dessert and got the banana cream pie.  The crust was delicious and I love bananas with the caramel, but I found the filling to be a little flavorless.  Maybe they just want to focus on the other stuff...I guess I would've preferred more banana flavor.  
We thought it was a pretty good spot and intend to go back sometime.  We'll definitely try the bread pudding next time and I have my eye on the Jambalaya.

I don't even need to get into the details. Every single time I've eaten here, they've consistently proven that they are one of - if not the - best restaurants in the western burbs. I've taken business associates, international guests, and my wife here and they've all loved it.

Came here pretty excited with the reviews I saw. I assume we were lucky to be seated since they first thing we were asked is if we had a reservation. Took about 20 minutes to get a seat which wasn't bad at all, though we did see a few empty tables when we walked in.

The ambiance is more on the romantic side. For the most part, unless you sit near the bar, you will get a booth and have some privacy to you and your party which is nice. There is one center light that shines from above so you can at least read the menus. Overall, I would say it would be a great place to take a date to get some privacy and enjoy the setting.

I ordered the Shrimp Jambalaya with Mashed Potatoes for 16.99 (without tax and tip) which is why I am giving this place only 3 stars. I was pretty excited about the jambalaya even though there were only 4 shrimps on top of it. However, after the first bite, you immediately taste how salty the jambalaya was.  Or perhaps, I was simply unlucky. The mashed potatoes were also not bad, as I would give them a 4/5 for the taste. Portion wise, it was decent and able to fill me up and I consider myself to be a pretty decent sized eater if that means anything to you. However, I couldn't overcome the saltiness of the jambalaya. I almost didn't even want to drink water after each bite because I wanted my tongue to be desensitized.

On a brighter note, I would give the service a solid 5/5. Even if they aren't your waiter, the other serves will come by and take anything away from you that needs to be and refill your water whenever it's below midline. Also, the roasted carrots were quite amazing, so if I ever go back, I would get that.

Overall, this place is nicer and fancier than a Cheesecake Factory with higher quality items and a more pleasant atmosphere and amazing service. However, it seems like the seasoning of the food is where it is a hit or miss, especially when considering the price point.

We have been to the WCG in Scottsdale Arizona a few times, and now that we have moved to Chicago, we had to try the Chi-town location (Naperville), and they did not disappoint! The service is top notch, better than Scottsdale, and the food was good as well. My partner elected to have the Barbecue Bacon Burger, and it was very good, very tasty. He also had carrots and mashed potatoes for sides, he loved them. 
I had the stacked chicken enchiladas, which were good, but honestly not great, I would not order this again. 
Again, the service was on point, and we really enjoyed ourselves. We will be back!!

Seated right away. Server seemed to be rushed as we were trying to settle in and he came over at least 5 times to see if we were ready yet. Booths are comfortable and atmosphere inviting. We ordered Blue Vodka Martinis, pretty and tasted good but I did not taste much vodka yet alone blueberry. Tasted like lemonade with Blue Curcao added. I had the Southern Style Chicken Salad. Very large portion and good fresh ingredients. We split a Bread Pudding desert which was to die for. Loved it! Would probably go back again if in the area.

I went here for a Saturday afternoon lunch. The restaurant is beautiful. Great atmosphere and nice and intimate.
The menu is a good mix of salads, sandwiches, and steak and seafood items. I got the trout which was a fish I've never had before and it was really good. It comes grilled with seasonings it was nice and  fresh, and a good size.  
Price point wise it is fairly expensive. every main course was at least $23 and then the salads were at least $15. The desserts are all per the name sake including white chocolate I got the chocolate souffle that was overly sweet but it was very good.
Service staff was attentive and friendly and helpful.
It honestly was a good place just not my style. Check it out and decide for yourself.

This is an average rating based on food, service, and ambience. 

Service was 5 Stars! - The server was absolutely attentive, caring , and patient. She really went above and beyond.  I was really impressed with her suggestions and advice. As well as timeliness. It was really quite impressive. The bar must have been a behind however, drinks were slow to arrive.

Food was 3 Stars - The food was delicious but small.  So small it was stingy.  For the prices charged the portions should be at least 1/3 larger if not 1/2.  The $16 salad was itty bitty, ahi tuna was over cooked, 2 cherry tomatoes, and 2 pieces of small mangos.  The Chicken Madiera wasn't even 1 chicken breast large.  The salmon was filling for me but I'm a small chicka anyone with a larger appetite would be left hungry for more.  The $30 steaks were small as well. The $7 Chicken Tortilla soup was 1/4 cup was missing ingredients listed - no chicken, no avocado, a sprinkle of cheese.  

Dessert was good. 

Ambience was 3 Stars! 

The A/C was up too high. The room we were in had the blinds shuttered to keep out the hot sun, but when the sun went down no one came to open them up.  

The bathrooms could have been fresher.  They smelled and had toliet paper clogs. 

Not worth the value to return.

Eaten here twice, both times, the service was less than desirable.  This time, we were seated by the bar.  We were served by many different people, including the bar tender.  Servers did not check on us.  When we were finished eating, she placed the dessert menu on the table without asking how everything was or letting us know it was the dessert menu.

I had the crab eggs benedict with the bacon hash and fresh fruit,  The eggs and fruit were delicious.  The hash, however was a greasy pile of bacon bits and mushy broccoli.  One bite was enough.  

I am disappointed because I really want to like this restaurant.  Hopefully, they will improve their service and customer experience.

Not terribly impressed.   Food was OK.  I had the appetizers.   Eggs rolls were ok but not great.   Shrimp cocktail was shrimp cocktail.   They were out of the tuna.  Best was the bread pudding desert.   But it was not very warm.  My Margarita was OK.  Asked for salt and could barely see it on the rim.  Going back to Coopers Hawk.

We came here at 6pm on a Tuesday and had no trouble being seated. We booked a reservation through open table, just to be safe, which I would still recommend. We had an 'interim' person come over and explain the food specials. For some reason this site offers no official drink specials or happy hour, but if you look at their website, other sites/states do have specials. I don't quite get that! The waitress did offer that their Angel's Envy whiskey would be $6 no matter what way you ordered it, so we opted for that with ginger ale, as our waiter was not a drinker and couldn't recommend a cocktail to us (no biggie). 

I am a huge burger fan wherever I go, so I ordered their BBQ bacon burger ($13 range), with the sauce on the side. The burger was topped in shredded cheese and chopped onions, so you actually got a lot of cheese on it. The bacon was thin but crispy and delicious. The sauce tasted housemade and was smoky and not too sweet. The meat had good flavor and was cooked the way I asked. Overall, a solid burger. Their shoestring fries were perfectly thin, crispy and salty. I couldn't stop eating those!

My friend ordered their steak sandwich with fries that she also really liked. The waiter said it's a popular menu item. 

They offer pricier items like steaks and fish, but I'm a simple girl and prefer burgers and sandwiches ($13-$17). The atmosphere was warm even though the place was large. Service was good, I felt we got checked on the appropriate amount of times to feel cared for but not rushed. I will definitely return!

Very surprised. I'll say that from the name, I was expecting a Cheesecake Factory-type food. And nope!

We started with the spinach and artichoke & tuna poke. Both were tasty. We also had the Stag's leap Cabernet. Great stuff. 

For the main course: parmesan cheese crusted fillet on top of garlic mashed potatoes and frites. Served with creamy horseradish sauce. Yum. 

Service was great. Atmosphere too.

We had lunch here last Father's day.
I am not too eager with the food selection (there's not alot and mostly are burgers), service was very good, price was decent and the food was delicious!
I would say I will come back and try the other food in their menu and hopefully I won't forget to take a picture of what I had!

If you've read any of my west suburban reviews, you know that I had to slog out there from the South Loop every weekday for nine weeks this winter, and I took public transportation (all the better to work on, my dears). One bitterly frigid day, a holiday for most people, a friend drove me out there. This was his reward.

And quite the reward it turned out to be. I have low expectations going to a restaurant in an overly-engineered, upscale-looking... Well, let's call it what it is: a strip mall. And the name, The White Chocolate Grill sounded a bit too close to The Cheesecake Factory.

But if have to go to Naperville and want to do something special for the friend who drove you out there, you can't go wrong with this place. Great menu for the suburbs, and a nice, chill interior (OK, unmistakably a chain-restaurant architect, but one with some sense of style). 

I had the French Dip (people may claim that you are what eat, but I'm not French and NObody better call me a dip). It was delicious, as were the mashed potatoes. Mon generous ami smacked-up his burger and fries, giving props to them both. 

We usually wouldn't have had dessert, but here we had to make an exception, and the pastry chef made one that was an exception too: it was exceptional. We chose the white chocolate brownie and practically licked the plate clean. I came close with my fork and spoon, but didn't want to be a poor example for any kiddies in the restaurant, which there were thankfully few. (Love ya kids, but sometimes you'll have more fun with the nanny.) 

I would definitely go back, even if they opened a location in the city (though I would have to do it on the down-low, away from my "locally-owned-only" friend).

A nice place to sit down and eat with the family. Not too crowded when we came over probably because it's post vday dinner with the fam. The booths are cozy and could fit even our newborn's carseat which is a big plus. Food has kids selections but a little more on the expensive side for a burger and grilled chicken. I ordered the maytag burger with bleu cheese and bacon. Burger was perfectly cooked to my preference medium but I didn't taste the bacon at all. So sad... But for $15 bucks I had better ones from red robin or smash burger. The AZ egg roll was good though. It came with the choice of either a cream tartare or a roasted salsa dipping sauce. A very unique take on a traditional asian dish. Only mistake is that we came here for dinner instead of just trying the desserts which IMHO, where they truly shine. That explains the name of the resto, go figure. We got the warm white chocolate brownie served with vanilla icecream, chocolate sauce and white chocolate shavings. Hits the spot! Friendly advice go eat dinner elsewhere and come here to enjoy your dessert in a nice cozy ambiance.

Excellent service from Jesse, she was very attentive and made it her priority to ensure we were satisfied. We orders the AZ egg rolls, Chicken Madeira, and Citrus Salmon. The food was fresh with great flavor. We will be back soon!

Great for business dinners or dates. It's a little pricey, but the drinks are well-made and the food is really good. I love anything that is fish here! Always fresh and perfectly cooked! If they have a special for the day, order it. I have never been disappointed when I do that.

With a name including White chocolate, make sure to leave room for desert! We opted for the banana cream pie and it was fantastic. We split the AZ Egg rolls and they were amazing. I ordered for the Rotisserie chicken and would recommend it. The bacon, almond hash it lays on might have been my favorite part of the dish. Overall it was a great dinning experience with the most attentive staff.
Really inspired menu. Not cheap but good value + friendly service. Prime rib sandwich, Brussel sprouts and seafood of the day excellent!
Great food, drinks, and dessert.

At the start of the evening I wasn't anticipating giving this review 5 stars.

We arrived for a 7.30pm reservation 10 minutes early, but still had to wait 40 minutes to be seated.

We were not happy at all, but were eventually seated.

Then White Chocolate turned it around. As we sat down a manager came over to apologise for the wait and offered us an appetizer on the house.

We had fantastic service and the food was excellent. I had the balsamic ribeye and my wife had the parmesan crusted fillet.

We finished our dinner with the white chocolate brownie which was delicious.

My only critique is when I called to place a reservation I asked if they did anything for birthdays and was told they'll put a candle in your dessert and we were visiting to celebrate my wifes birthday, but the birthday request was possibly not noted.

Anyway, it's something small and regardless, we'll be back!

WCG was on my list from sometime, so finally we went on Friday night. Even though i did the reservation via opentable we waited for 20 min but there was huge crowd waiting.
We went straight ahead with entrees as we have to save some space for their great desserts. I got shrimp jambalaya and it was great, perfectly moist and flavourful, the shrimp was wonderfully done and sausage and chicken taste great, overall a 5 star entree. +the Israeli couscous salad i loved it. My wife did ordered center cut fillet as welldone and even then it was little juicy, though the amount looks ok to me but it was sufficient for her. We end up having the white chocolate brownie, slurrrp :P

I decided to come here based on a recommendation by the Sheraton hotel up the street. This place is an upscale restaurant that has a swanky atmosphere. I sat down in the bar area as I was instructed by the hostess. It took a good 10 minutes for anyone to pay attention to me. This is why I have to give the restaurant 4 stars. 
I ordered the wedge salad which was an average wedge salad. Nothing over the top or any twists on the known recipe. For my entree, I ordered the Cajun salmon. It was wonderful. The shrimp and crab on top of the salmon was delicious. The salmon was perfectly cooked. The only complaint that I actually did have was that I couldn't get enough of the Cajun sauce that they put on it. Lastly, I had the bread pudding for dessert. It was very good. A perfect combination and not two sweet. 
Overall I would recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area.

My mother and I had a GREAT work lunch here today. The decor is very modern and beautiful.  It is dimly lit which can make it relaxing or romantic depending on your dinner/lunch companion. We let the waitress know as soon as she came over we would be only here for lunch and she was extremely accommodating. I ordered the rotisserie chicken over a bacon hash with brussel sporuts and my mother had the chicken crepes. My mother enjoyed her crepes except that they were a bit too sweet. My rotisserie was delicious and i loved the hash. The brussel sprouts were just TOO sweet. Shortly after the meals were brought out our waitress brought us the bill acknowledging that we may want to leave fast. It was very polite and helpful. Overall we had tea, coffee and two big entrees with sides for 40 bucks. Not bad at all. I would come back again for sure.

OMG awesomeness!  We had the tomato gin soup, ahi tuna salad, permasan crusted filet, and white chocolate raspberry cheesecake.  We ate every bite! Eat here if you're in town. You will not be disappointed!

The strengths of this place are delicious desserts, strong drinks and an overall friendly environment. We were not 100% impressed with our main courses, nothing special, yet not totally bad. But, once again, this is a great place to hang out for a drink and dessert after having dinner elsewhere. The bar area also has large screen televisions for sports.

Excellent food and great service.
 Prompt staff and were sat quickly.
    The pork tenderloin was delicious
 Will definitely go again as everyone in my party had a great time
A bit pricey, but the steak was great, the seared ahi tuna was perfect, not dried out or overcooked like most places, and the desserts will make your date swoon.
Prices are off the charts. Almost $14 for a cheeseburger?  Wow

First time at White Chocolate Grill. Interior is really nice and borders on upscale steak house vibe. We started with the Arizona egg rolls as an appetizer. I had the blackened mahi and the wife ordered the pulled pork sandwich. The mahi was good with the right amount of spices. Pulled pork was also good! We ended with the banana cream pie which was fantastic. Service was spot on a extremely professional as you would expect in a higher end restaurant. Overall good experience. Probably would return.
Nice place in an area crowded with good restaurants. Parking for all if them is tough, but worth the extra walk.

Great Food,  outstanding service,  good value! 

While on business in Chicagoland, I stay in Naperville, Illinois. Within a short walk from the hotels are probably 10 restaurant choices,  but I never seem to go anywhere but the White Chocolate Grill. The tagline above might suggest why,  but  it's the house specialty soup that has ruined me! The soup is called Tomato Gin Soup. Let me tell you,  it's Freakin Fantastic! Addictively good. Fire roasted tomatoes,  cream, marinated mushrooms,  and smoked bacon make up the soup,  and they top it with Tanqueray Gin. You must try it! 

The restaurant has a comfortable upscale feel, suitable for entertaining business clients,  a date,  or just a traveling salesman having a somewhat expense account compliant meal. 

The menu is diverse,  featuring a daily fresh fish selection, scrumptious entrée salads, ribs,  and steaks. 


In addition to the soup,  I had a wonderful entrée salad; Sesame crusted Ahi Tuna salad, The tuna was seared rare and very flavorful,  with field greens, mango, avocado, cherry tomatoes and cucumbers in a champagne vinaigrette. I had them put some shaved parmesan cheese on the salad, and it was even better. 

On my second night in town, I of course had the Soup, and the blackened mahi as my main course. It was grilled, topped with crab meat and a tomato creole sauce. It was decent, ok flavor, but nothing that I would order again. There was nothing wrong with it, but for me, it just didn't work. Mahi is a great tasting fish with just a simple preparation, so maybe it was just to much going on for what I usually think of Mahi. ( go ahead and try it) 

On my final night in Naperville, I had a taste for steak, and after kidding myself that I could go a night without the soup, I walked past WCG to Morton's, next store. After getting sticker shock, I decided to go back to WCG for soup and to try their steak. I had the New York Strip, for a more reasonable $27.99 vs. my car payment, or a surely to be bounced on my expense account amount for an ala carte steak.... Anyhow, the steak at WCG was excellent! It was a great cut of meat, flavorful, seasoned perfect, and cooked a beautiful medium rare! it was finished with a steak butter. It was better than I had expected, but not surprised as this place is great. 

I am looking forward to returning for the soup and I will try the BBQ ribs next time. 



Food Giants rating system;  5* = Freakin' Great. 4* = Really Darn Good.  3* = sure, why not, 2*= it's better than starving, 1* = A hungry homeless person, after one bite,  wouldn't eat this, even if you gave it to them for free. (Although you should still offer it to them) No Stars = Ptomaine Tillie's foodborne pathogen Diner. (Yes the P is silent in Ptomaine)

Food Quality: *****
Portion Size:  *****
Service:          *****
Menu:             ****
Uniqueness:   ***
Atmosphere:  *****
Cleanliness:   *****
Value:             ******

Its great to be able to patronize an independent small business, that offers great food at a good value. Please support these types of businesses.

This was our second time at White Chocolate Grill and it was every bit as good as the first time a year ago. My carnivore husband and vegetarian self could happily dine together. Don't usually order cocktails but we each tried one and they were both delicious (mine was the Vitamin C Martini and I think my husband's was Frisky Whiskey). The quinoa veggie burger was among the best veggie burgers I've ever had. They offer an inventive choice of sides and I highly recommend the Brussel sprouts with marcona almonds. The banana cream pie for dessert was also yummy! One warning though - make a reservation! We arrived at 5:15 on a Saturday and there was already an hour wait (we were lucky to snag a bar table)

I gave them 4 starts for the delicious white chocolate blonde I had been craving all week.
My best friend and I went here to celebrate her Birthday and wedding engagement. It has a very nice ambiance. A bit pricey but manageable. 
I really enjoyed my salad, which had alot going on, but all the flavors ended up blending together nicely. The dressing was a bit heavy. It's their signature salad/dressing, and overall it was ok. Probably wouldn't order it again because it was a bit too "hearty" for my taste is all.
Loved the food, ambiance and service here. Would definitely recommend and come back again

It's a decent spot but not really blow you away nice. Cocktails are better than the food, I thought it was rather bland and menu was pretty basic, would love to see them do more, if your in this area go to Cooper's hawk instead way more worth your money, you'll leave this place disappointed. They got three stars for being basic. Staff was sub par as well

This place was phenomenal. Not only was the service fantastic, but the food and drinks were amazing. 

Service: Our waiter was a huge help in picking out what to get on the menu. My boyfriend is a big whisky drinker, but they had so many options he wasn't sure which would be the best pick. He asked our waiter if one of them was good and the waiter said, "Oh no don't get that." I really appreciate it when a waiter is honest about the food and drinks at a place. He made a recommendation to my boyfriend and he loved it so it was a win. He was prompt on a busy night which is another thing I appreciate because there have been too many times I have been to a restaurant that was empty and received no service at all. He was also personable and nice which makes the experience great. 

Food: For an appetizer we got the egg rolls and they were pretty good. I would get them again. However, the Idaho tuna was amazing! The fish was cooked perfectly which I always appreciate because fish is hard to perfect and few restaurants put in the effort to achieve it. The fish was also packed with flavor. The mashed potatoes were creamy and full of flavor as well. The true gem of this experience was the bread pudding. The breading pudding was amazing probably the best I have ever had. If you are going to check this place out make sure to get the bread pudding. Also make a reservation. We went on a sat night and thank goodness we made a reservation because there was an hour and a half wait, but we only waited 5-10 mins.

Great for a special occasion.  Very lovely food, choices you don't normally get in Naperville. Excellent service as well. My husband was even able to get a very tasty vegan option. 

I highly recommend that you make reservations; however, even on a weekday. This is easy online, but if you don't, you won't get treated as well and will wait a long time.

The hubby and I went for Valentine's Day. Although we had reservations we still waited a while for our table. I'm my opinion the menus was just average and the prices above average for the quality and flavor of the food we received. I may have had equal or better food at a Chillis for a fraction of the cost. I left with no real interest to return.

We reserved the private party room for a business dinner for 20 people on a Wednesday evening in May. The wait staff was courteous and attentive to the needs of our group. Food was good on time, taste and price were on key and the menu has enough interesting variety to please all. The desserts are wonderful, creatively crafted and our group was pleased. Looking forward to returning. Not only on business but with family and friends.
First time around had a bad experience but second time was great.  Are server Chris was great and on top of things.  Manager seemed nice as well. We will be coming back soon

This place has quality in all their foods, the service, and the atmosphere.  

I love the WCG salad, with satisfying amounts of blue cheese.  Their desserts are also all great - the bread pudding is my favorite.  I have had quite a few different dishes there and loved them all - except the one time I ordered a hamburger, which was dry.  

Their prices are high, but it never bothers me because I know I am getting food and service that matches that price.  I don't eat here frequently because of the price and the calories, but it is my first thought when we need a "nicer" place.
We were disappointed in the food and the slow service. The salmon I ordered was raw in the middle. The servers were friendly but slow. I don't think we will go back any time soon.

The best service I have experienced ever! The young manager is doing an exceptional job and the service is out of the world! Food is great too and they look for feedback to make the restaurant better. Not seen another restaurant that does that. 
Leave some room for amazing deserts. White chocolate is generally too sweet for me but their desserts are not and are amazingly delicious! Our favorite is White Chocolate Brownie. Yum!

Great decor! Great food and probably one of the best service in the world!

Had lunch here for the first time.
Awesome service and food.
Waiter let me taste a few things before making up my mind to have the Tender Filet Sandwich. My friend had a Salad which I also tasted. 
There was no room for dessert, but we saw several come out that worth a trip back for just Dessert.

The service and food were awesome. Great guacamole and salsa. Even the chips were perfect! Our girls devoured them. The pulled pork sandwich was yummy. We got great service and very good food. We didn't get to try dessert, so we might be going back just for that. Even with being in a big group, the service was just perfect!

Consistent and visit-worthy! When I have to travel to Naperville and beyond I like WCH for its atmosphere and dependability. The seafood selections are my favorite thing to order at this establishment. I always get an ahi tuna preparation when I visit.

Went here for a friends birthday last night. To be honest the food was average. I ordered the Blackened Mahi Mahi with Mashed Potatoes.  The Mahi was grilled perfectly but I felt it lacked seasoning.  And the crab meat on top was also blah.  The mashed potatoes were average as well. 

The reason I gave this place 4 stars is because of the service and dessert. Our server Cassie was on point. We were a party of 20 and Cassie always checked on us in a timely manner.  She was knowledgeable about the menu and made good recommendations as it was the first time dining for most of us there. We ordered the French White Chocolate Bread Pudding for dessert and it was amazing. 

Great service and dessert. The food was a bit lacking but I would be willing to give it another shot.

Good food, a menu with good variety, and good drinks.  This place gets really busy sometimes and it can be hard to get a table during dinner rush;   if there's a line try to snag one of the few tables around the bar that are self-seating.   My standard order is the Rustic (turkey) Club sandwich which is now only on the lunch menu but they'll make it for dinner if you ask them.   My wife really likes the salad with the fried chicken.   

When they take your drink order ask for bread, they don't seem to advertise it but they have complimentary warm pretzel rolls with salty butter.

I went here to see a band that my friend plays in. We were considering using them for our wedding. After last night, we were sold. They all sounded great together & the sound system at Manny's really helped.

It was a nice bar. Good space in the corner near the entrance for the band to play. They had also a nice back section as well for those either not wanting to hear the band or not be near the bar/have more privacy. I'm not sure I'd come back here if my friend's band wasn't playing, as it's nowhere near me at all. But all in all, it was a nice place to see them perform at.

Solid 3 star bar with food. Decent beer selection, nothing extensive...but a good variety. 

Food was also pretty good. Had the drunken burger (bacon, blue cheese and saute'd onions) with fries. Fries were some strange shaped fry/chip combo and were very good, lightly battered...like a cross between a chip and a waffle fry. Burger was so-so, the patty seemed like it could use some seasoning...but not bad. Good price to value ratio on food and beer and the bartender was very friendly and attentive.

Overall decent place...I'm hesitant to call it a dive bar because it was pretty clean and well kept, but it kind of had that older neighborhood bar vibe and it's a sizable place so it was a little odd.

I wouldn't go out of my way, but definitely could do a LOT worse on that stretch of St Charles rd.

Very pleasant surprise and willing to bet the next time, this becomes a four star. A really nice atmosphere with a hustling barkeep donning a friendly, hard working demeanor. Cleaned up a lot from it's previous life and food is well above average (best pretzels this side of any mall). Well worth the effort to get there but very police heavy in the area so uber it and be careful!

Bruschetta Burger ... doesn't that sound awesome?  Well, it did to me.  That's why I ordered it.  But, alas, to quote my friend Jim, "while I was eating the burger I was trying to remember what I ordered."  That was, unfortunately, the experience that all three of us had at Manny's Ale House (formerly Elmhurst Public House) last Friday.  I wouldn't even say the burgers were "ok," I would say, don't order one.  Despite the toppings, they had little flavor.  Fortunately, the fries were really good, the coleslaw not bad, and the drink prices very reasonable.  I was disappointed in the burger, but they did a really nice job on the remodel!   My son and friend would rate Manny's at 3 stars, I would give them a solid 3 1/2.

As of this writing there are ninety-six restaurants in Elmhurst.  I plan on eating at, and reviewing, every one.  Follow me on Yelp.
Great place, great people and great food. Manny and Dimitri are so nice. You feel at home.

I live just down the street from Manny's, and I've been in a good handful of times. Today, I came in for the Barcelona / Real Madrid game. I was hoping to watch the game with fans, on either side, and unfortunately it was pretty quiet today. Regardless, the fiancé and I enjoyed the game and the service. Manny, the owner, is great. Very friendly, and he always makes you feel comfortable, and is always making sure you have everything you need. 

The food is good, not great, and although they have a good selection of beer, they lack in their stout beers. I had to settle for a Guinness. This place should be drawing in more people. With an owner like Manny, who is invested in his business and his customers, it should attract more people for a Saturday afternoon. 

Add some more stouts, and I'd be back more. In any case, the place is worth checking out.

So the drunken burger was really good. It's a big burger and I still consumed it because it was so good. Plus I loved their wedge fries.

The place is clean, the TV's are big, and they played great background music. Also loved that craft brews are $4 on Wednesdays. Will definitely be back.

The bar was pretty empty when we went there. I thought with the Blackhawk's game on, it would be busier.  The beer selection was okay and the apps were 50% off which was cool. The bbq wings were good. My turkey club was terrible. The turkey was slimy. Yuck. I choked down 1/4th of my sandwich and just couldn't.  For a $10 sandwich, I wasn't impressed. 

We actually went there for karaoke (didn't realize there was a game on) and the place pretty much emptied after the game...okay...yeah it wasn't a fun atmosphere since karaoke happened after the game. The dj tried his best but my friend and I kinda took turns singing cas no one else did. It was kind of a disappointment.  

The worse part is we left the bar to find my friend's car had been towed from a local strip mall parking lot! Not the bar's fault, just thought I'd mention that you should be careful where you park around there...

Any way, we don't plan on going back. There are better karaoke places in the burbs.
Average food, average drinks. For my $$ it's disappointing to waste it on average anything

I went here the other day for lunch with three other people. We were all told we were going to back alley burger and then the person who told us that was like no we're going here. Boooo. I would have rather had back alley.

Ok, so as soon as you walk in the smell of bleach hits you right away. I guess that's good? Idk I don't really like the smell of bleach. 

If you go to the bathroom beware that room smells like straight sewage. Gross. They need an air freshener or something.

One of my lunch mates is extremely picky they didn't have anything that really appealed to her. She ordered hot wings extra hot and they barely had any sauce on them. One plus side was she really wanted fried pickles so they made some for her. 

Myself and another lunch mate went with the Mediterranean burger. It had a weird taste. There was two types of cheese. I know one was feta the other I have no clue. I tried a bit by itself and it was disgusting. Weird flavor and texture. The fries were honestly the best part of the meal.

One person had the fish tacos and loved them. Not one complaint from her. 

Ps if you order mikes hard lemonade they only have cranberry not regular. The picky one made them take it back and they did. That's why I'm giving them 3 stars and bc they made her her fried pickles. 

The best part of my whole experience was the other customers. The two guys to our left and the two girls to our right. We had a great time bs'ing together.

Stopped in for lunch after a business meeting.  This was my first time at Manny's.  The place was empty but I was immediately greeted with decent craft beer list.  I ordered the Mediterranean Burger which sounded delicious.  Before the food was served I was offered a bowl of fish soup to try and it was good.  The food was served quick and the burger was excellent.  The fries were different and something I have never had before but were absolutely delicious.  I was happy with both the food and the service and will definitely be back when in the area.  Great stop for lunch!

Yay! The old Elmhurst Public House has been fabulously transformed into Manny's Ale House! Fresh renovations and a shiny new beer menu are some of the highlights. That big clunky bar in the center of the main room is still there but looking much spiffier. Lots of big screens to watch sports. Dining room off to the side is nice for families. Our baby LOVED the aquarium.

Two thumbs up for the awesome local craft brew selection on tap. Everyone was friendly and service was fast! Might need a hostess at the door though...

Steak sandwich with seasoned fries is a winner. The flat bread was cardboardy rather than crispy. Meh. PLEASE consider putting a good house made veggie burger on the menu for us veggies! This is a burger and beer type of place after all!

I stopped in (first visit) cause I was buying wine next door and was really really hungry. I dislike 'sports' bars and pubs for the most part, so, I decided to check out the menu and get something to take home.  It was 3 pm / Saturday - a few patrons watching 'sports' on screens.  I took a seat at the bar and asked for a take out menu.  I asked for a recommendation and settled on a burger.  I checked out the beer list and decided to order a brew while I waited. The barkeep, named Clay, was so polite and genuinely 'nice' and attentive that I felt totally at ease. There was some nice blues station on and so I was content to sip my porter (from Eugene) and talk to Clay a little about some of my favorite porters.  That experience was nice enough but when I got home and tasted the burger, I was pleasantly surprised.  I didn't have high expectations.  On first bite, the burger was perhaps a little more cooked than I requested, and maybe a little less seasoned than I hoped. But that was all fine in the end, because the overall quality of the burger, with the steamed bun, toppings, seasoned fries, and slaw was pretty close to perfect as pub food goes. Seriously one of the best burgers I've ever eaten.  And actually, although I had to add a little salt, I would rather add than have food that is over salted.  My little mantra on Yelp is "hold the salt".  Well done Manny's Ale House!

Love this place!  Great food, great service.  Have an excellent rotating beer menu too and plenty of social events.  If you need a private space, there's a nice area in the back with a huge tv.  We've even gathered to watch the F1 races back there.  Fun!

We've been trying to find new places in the area and always forget about this one. Decided to give them a try when we only had the youngest of our kiddos. It was pretty dead for a Wednesday night. We arrived there around 630. We were pleasantly surprised to find out they had half price on selected appetizers. Hubby ordered the hot wings (10). He likes hot wings just not the vinegar kind which those are I guess. He said he'd get them again as BBQ or teriyaki. I ordered the spinach and artichoke dip. It comes with pita chips. It was really good and there was plenty left for lunch the next day. Dinner for my hubby was the Rueben with fries and coleslaw. The Rueben had just the right amount of sauerkraut. The fries were big seasoned wedge twisted fries. They were awesome I had 2 and would of stole more if he hadn't finished them first. I had the southwest salad minus jalapeño. It comes with a Chipotle ranch dressing which had a little more bite then most of the ones I've had before but it was good. I added some regular ranch to it to calm it down a little. Their ranch is the kind I like too, regular not buttermilk. We took a look around it's been open under new owners for 2 years now. Same lay out without the booths, and everything has an updated look. Brought our son to look at the fish tank which he loved. We had a great waitress and a waitress that was training. We met one of the owners who was bartender that night Manny. He was a sweetheart and took an adorable picture of our little guy through the other side of the fish tank. We'll definitely be back and tell our friends and family to join us. I think our next visit we'll have to try their breakfast buffet the owner told us they have on Sundays. If you haven't given them a try you should.

My buddy and I stopped by Manny's. Turned out to be a great decision. Amazing food, rock and roll music, nice place to hang. Met the owner Manny, bartender Cori has a million dollar smile!

Will definitely coming back.

Great bar to sit and watch the Hawks play - even if they're losing =\ They serve a decent burger and everything I've tried on the menu is good. Hummus plate is great! Manny is a good guy and there's always a cold beer waiting for ya. Speaking of beers, great selection of craft beers with a good representation across spectrum of flavors (hoppy, malty, etc.)  Can't go wrong stopping here!

Everything inside was clean and brand new. The bar is huge and is surrounded by big flat screen tv's. The food tasted great and was perfect for watching the Hawks game. I had the pulled pork sliders and a side of loaded fries. The BBQ pork was tender and the fries were nice and crispy. They have a bunch of local beers on tap and was told they change them seasonally. 

The place was bustlin with people inside. They have tables located all around and a designated dining area. They even have a 150 inch projector playing the game.  

Staff is friendly but u can tell they just started out.  I was told they opened in September so service will improve

Will comeback for the food tv's and drinks.

Recently moved to the neighborhood and I have driven past almost daily since. Looking for a casual meal and after weighing our options on Yelp, my husband and I decided to try Manny's for the first time. The atmosphere is laid back and comfy. They have a ton of tvs and when we walked in they had some college basketball on with no sound but some house music playing. Once the Bulls game started however they did turn the tv sound on. Great place to watch a game! The restaurant was very clean and has a good vibe. Our waitress greeted us right away and took our drink order. They have an impressive variety of bottles and draught beer and good daily drink specials! I ordered the Mediterranean burger and fries and my husband had the steak sandwich. Holy feta! The burger was pretty good and filling. My husband liked his steak sandwich too and says he would order it again. The place was quiet for a Saturday night but it was perfect for us, we where in and out in less than an hour. Our waitress was nice and attentive even though she seemed to have the entire floor and several parties came in while we were eating. The whole place is a lot bigger than I originally thought, and they have a party room in the back! We plan to frequent the spot for a cold beer and some grub again soon!
My new favorite bar!!!! Love the bartender, love the food, love the atmosphere definitely recommend it!!!! If you come have the onion strings!

Went here today as friends of mine bought a house nearby. I like the place itself. Great place to watch a game and I like the setup of the bar in the middle. It was totally empty when we went, but whatever on that. The guy who served us didn't seem interested in serving us; he was slow, unattentive. Had to get up and flag him down a couple of times. Didn't even bring waters until we asked after we got our food. And that was only to two people.

I got the cream of chicken soup and that was good. I ordered a burger, which I followed the advice of other reviewers. Someone wrote they have "out of this world burgers." That person was wayyy off. The burgers seemed frozen to me (although my friends disagreed with me). My biggest peeve with burgers is not melting the cheese and this had that problem. I liked the guac and onions, but that's about it (I got the Mexico burger). I ate it, but still. I liked the weird fries/wedges, but they definitely skimped on that, should be more on the plate. 

Great drink menu with lots of beers. The bloody mary was from the bottle. This place I feel could do a lot better but they just don't want to. That was the vibe I got.

This place is the ideal sports bar grill!! With a  vast selection of local and national beers... The New York steak sandwich is the delicious!!  

A definite must try for beer and foodies alike! The fish tank is also a nice touch in the main dinning room.
I love it here  great burger awesome fries I'm done done trying all the beers I'll be back

We have driven by many times and have always thought about stopping in.  Friday night my wife and had a date night and we are pretty sick & tired of most of the spots in the Oak Brook area.  We wanted to try something different.  We often drive St. Charles on our way home from kid's hockey and wanted to try La Tosca.  Unfortunately, we were not quick enough - they have closed.  We then drove by Manny's and turned around and came back.  What a pleasant surprise!  I had the Adult Mac and Cheese and it was pretty good.  Nice beer selection too.  A little off the beaten path, but those are the kind of places we like.  It looks like there may have even been a band setting up in a back room, but it was about medium crowded in the front.  We will definitely be back.

We walked in surprised by the bar. Then you go a little further to a cute dining room. Which is what we were looking for. We had great service by a very nice accommodating waitress. Food was excellent and very reasonable. In the back they have a room for private parties! A great local place to go!

My husband and I were there Thursday night. The place was on fire. It was a karaoke night and I have to admire the service, the food and how clean it was. They have an amazing fish tank too!! Even though was so busy everything was on time and cooked perfect. My cheeseburger was fantastic and my husband loved the N.Y. steak. As appetizer we ordered hummus plate, ( exelaint ), and buffalo wings ( delicious ).  The manager came around and asked us how everything was and if they satisfy our expectations. It is very nice of them to care about their business and their customers.  We'll be back for sure, I extremely recommend it!!! Keep up the good job Manny's Ale House, thumbs up!!!

So I just moved to the area less than a month ago and I've been looking for a bar close by with a good beer selection and good pub food, and this, my friends is the place. Manny's has an easy going ambience, friendly staff (clay the bartender was great), and their burgers are honestly way above any standard bar food that I've had in some time (and their fries are ridiculously good too). This is the second Monday in a row I've come up here and I'm sure this is the start of a great relationship. Definitely recommended for a quick beer and bite, and just as easily some where you could spend a night out at!

What the HELL?  Can't any establishment that rests in this lot get anything right?  Well, at least Elmhurst Public House started on a good note.  It's too bad that I can't say the same for Manny's.  

Interior is clean and spacious, but doesn't have any particular motive or theme associated with it.  Food tastes and looks frozen bought.  Completely over-priced for the amount and quality you receive.  Service is like watching a flying trapeze act - especially when it comes to getting your bill.  

There's nothing unique, quirky, quaint, etc. about this place.  If they were to revise the menu and just focus on some really good home-made items, I would consider coming back, since we only live five minutes away.  

I anticipate a CLOSED sign in the next 6-8 months.

Pretty awesome bar with pretty awesome food. The manager and our waitress were super nice to our family and the food came out super quick. I wish the tv's had been more coordinated so they weren't playing so many different shows, but that's just a personal preference. Nice to have found such a great little bar so close to home.

The key to Manny's is to know what to order!  The good is great, the bad is really bad.  This is what I gathered from half a dozen visits. 

Pros:  excellent burgers and pulled pork. But don't ask for a burger not on the menu, I ordered a mushroom and Swiss burger, and got. Their Mediterranean. Sent back 3 times. Finally they asked "what's on a mushroom Swiss burger?"!  Sereously?

Great beer selection, apps are ok

Cons:  horrible corned beef, shoe leather style, terrible salad dressings (home made, my butt!) service is still in the weeds, but getting better. 

I really want this place to work, and it has enough pluses to succeed. Awesome redecorating, lots of tv screens. I just wish the menus was good across the board.

Came on a mid day around for Manny the owners son made made me an awesome Mao tai . He was friendly and I felt bad not one person at the restaurant b which I wasn't use to on a Thursday afternoon at 4 or 5. I Think THEY NEED To MAKE MORE Drink Specials And GOOD LIKE Caps bar down the street. MANNY WAS VERY FRIENDLY. CLEAN PLACE

Went here with my wife tonight for dinner after passing it on pretty much a daily basis. It looked a bit empty for a Friday night around 6:30pm. For starters we ordered the loaded fries. The fries were unique, the looked like steak fries from places like Red Robbin (yumm!!!, sorry couldn't resist) but they were twisted and seasoned quite well. I ordered the "adult Mac and cheese" and it was really good, it had chicken mushrooms and bacon (at least it said it had bacon, could see or taste any but it's not a huge deal) the sauce had a good cheese flavor, I think it's made in house since I tasted multiple cheeses. My wife had the drunken burger which had onions bbq glaze and bacon (maybe the bacon that was supposed to be on my dish?). She ordered it medium rare but it came out medium, it was seasoned well.

My only major complaint was the service, our server was nice and all but she wasn't around enough. An older gentleman who I'm guessing is the manager kept coming over to help us which what we needed. 

Over all a good experience, my wife isn't sure about going back but I think I may.

The food is great, the beer selection is always on point, and the owers are pretty cool people.  They have good daily specials, and the draft beer selection changes regularly.  Very awesome place! Oh, and they have the best fries in the world!!!!

So I've been here thrice within the fortnight which I guess means I'm becoming somewhat of a regular here - at least when I'm in town. The first time I had the Mexico burger, which you can read about in my prior review. The second I had the meatloaf, which was pretty good. The mashed potatoes are made from real potatoes, not flakes. Bonus points for that, but the plate was lacking color. It could have used a vegetable of some sort. Last night I came again for the pulled pork and a couple of Sapporos, which (again) were on special for $2.50. The sandwich was quite tall, as it was piled high with onion tanglers. The pork was brushed with a sweet BBQ sauce and was pretty good, though I'd have preferred a mustard style sauce myself (I'm from the south). It was pretty busy for once, but I attribute that to the Blackhawks game being on. Service was still pretty good though. Overall it was an inexpensive yet oddly satisfying dinner. I still don't really care for the cole slaw though, but that's just me. If you're looking for a decent pub to go to, Manny's is the place to be. The food could be better, yes, but it's worth the price. The staff is attentive, though not flirty, and the beer is cold. I give it a solid 4 stars.

Our family ate here over the weekend and I have to say, we were treated like an old friend. The owner came over, shook our hand and introduced himself. You dont see that to much. It was a nice touch. Our server was very friendly and the food was great. We will be back soon.

Stopped in this place for some drinks, but ended up ordering some food. This was over 7 months ago. Since then I probably stop in at least once a week because something is always new. So impressed with how clean it is compared to the Public House! 
They have different events featured  during the week to appeal to different crowds. Some coin games and multiple TVs inside for sporting events. A backroom that can be reserved for parties. A beautiful and clean fish tank that separates the bar from the dining area.
Not only that, but their food is amazing.  I absolutely love their fries and bruschetta burger, mouth watering. Daily soup and entree specials.
The owners are always around and personally greet you and make sure your experience is nothing, but the best. Manny always has great recommendations if you aren't sure what to drink and they always have amazing drink specials. Especially their $4draft special. It's a great chance to try those speciality brews. Their wait staff goes out of their way to get to know you and give personal service.
My elderly parents who are very choosy about the restaraunts they go to love this place.  Manny and Demetri are so patient with them and make sure their experience is nothing but the best! I love that they actually care about their customers and actually go out of their way.  
Definitely recommend this place! Something for everyone!!!

Ordered the Mac and cheese and baked French Onion soup. Tasteless and luke warm. I would guess they are heated in microwave. Side salad had no crispness to it at all. I will be surprised if this restaurant lasts at all as it is really tasteless food.

Sign outside for "Grand Opening" $2 burgers special.  We were frequent customers at Elmhurst Public House ready to try it out.  Stood around for seating until we were finally greeted.  Server tried to talk us out of $2 burger to get $8 burger with fries.  $2 burger came with NOTHING, not even a pickle.  Burger was over cooked, fries were average at best, Iced tea was $3.00.  Service was average at best.  Not going back.
Someone came and classes this place up. Burgers here are out of this world. If you haven't been by in a while it's definitely worth stopping by.

Just spent a great afternoon at Manny's Ale House.  The food was great as was the service.  Five of us met there for lunch & drinks. Two of us had Cheese Burgers, one of us had a Drunken Burger, one a Southwestern Wrap, one had a salad.  Each one of us found our meal delicious! 
Our Server, Clay, was attentive, friendly and a pleasure to talk to.  He took good care of us. Told us about the craft beers & answered a few menu questions.
The restaurant is clean and comfortable.  There are TV's to watch the games. We  just wanted to chat but to be able to catch the game score was nice.

Manny's was very comfortable, we hung out for 4 hours but never felt rushed or like we were taking up space.  

Great place to meet & eat!  Will be going back again & again!

I really wanted to like this place but I just don't. The staff was super friendly and the chili was good but that's where it stops. Their nachos were odd with what seemed like canned nacho cheese then shredded on top. Will I give it another go? Probably for a beer because they have a nice beer menu but I'll skip the grub.

The Ale House.  Not sure they have an identity. The food at this place is just OK. Its pricy and not worth what they charge. I ordered the sliders.. After 20 minutes they finally arrived.  They were obviously sitting around for a while because they were not warm. The female bartender was not friendly or engaging at all. No real management training obviously.   She appeared to be just doing her job.  The atmosphere is sparce . Sure its clean and all...I just get the feeling its missing something.   I've been to this place twice now and sorry to say my last. Nothing here to write home about. For now this place will survive on the novelty of a new spot and holdovers from the old Elmhurst public house.  I give this place a year at best and then good night. I will not be back.

We just had lunch at this place today.  We used to live right down the street and ate here under previous ownerships. There were three adults and two children ages 11.
Everyone was very pleased with what they had ordered. The burgers were very tasty.  My daughter thought the turkey sandwich was the best you ever had.  I had the fish tacos and thought they were really good.

We all agreed that the price was right the restaurant was clean and the service was good.  We don't come down this way very often but when we come back we will visit here again.

Stopped in after work one day to grab a drink.  Great beer list and friendly service at the bar.  I saw a few food orders walked by, so decided to check out the menu.   Got the drunken burger, which was excellent!  Will definitely be back again.

Me and my friends try to go at least once a week to Manny's, we love the food and the atmosphere is great. The Cobb salad was one of the best I have had and the way the place looks is great. Great food, great drinks and the owner is always nice.

A great beer and food selection makes this a much better improvement than the old bar that was at this  location. The upscale improvement is so needed in this area and this is a great place to drink ps ale beer and watch sports in the burbs. The best house bar in the area

Manny's has quickly become our local favorite bar, and my husband and I try to stop in several times a week. We love the beer, food, and friendly and relaxed atmosphere. A really good spot to take it easy and unwind. They've got a huge variety of beers, bottled and on tap (including lots of local favorites but ranging further afield too). The food is tasty and there are always daily food/drink specials -- $5 cheeseburger and fries on Monday!
Amazing selection of beer ( I rarely even like beer and had some DELICIOUS ones here..) and mouth watering food. This is a fantastic place that you must visit if you're from or visiting Chicago!
Great food, food times. Mannys use to be a college bar. They've cleaned the place up and have team trivia on Tuesdays and Karaoke every Thursday! Great beer selection. Nice atmosphere.
Wow! Great beer selection, great food, great prices and clean! Friendly people. Highly recommend! Fun place to watch a game.

Just had dinner with my Fiancé and our six year old daughter. Service was OK. I ordered blackened salmon which came as grilled salmon and was dry. The temperature inside was very hot and uncomfortable. However the place looks great inside. Definitely a step up from the old public house. Fries are ridiculously good. Wish them the best of luck!

Amazing food... the boys loved the pulled pork sandwiches and the beef jerky is one of the best I've had. All the food is prepared in house( no pre packaged stuff). I'm completely hooked on The spent grain crackers.
Desserts were drool worthy. One of the best bread pudding I've had in a while.
Friendly staff and quick service.

So I just moved back to the area and after a long day of moving/cleaning/organizing I wanted a really good meal and drink. This place came up on my handy dandy Yelp app and voila. We had a place to go.

It was a Sunday night and the place was dead. I mean the bartender, one server, and a manager on duty, that was it. We were one of maybe three tables total while we were there.

But the service we got was decent and the good was delicious. My hubs got the chicken and waffles - let me tell you this will be the only thing I order here from now on. So good! Best chicken and waffles hands down. I got the BBQ potato which is a large baked potato with BBQ pulled pork and onion strings. it was good as well, just not as delicious as the waffles.

I actually didn't get a beer because they had a beer mimosa on special for $2. $2!! I got one and so did my husband. They were great and would definitely order it again.

Overall I liked this place. Good food, service, & drinks. I know it was a Sunday but I wish this place was a little more busy. I hope it doesn't go out of business because I would certainly miss it.

Let us count the ways we like this place....

This is our go-to pre-comedy show stop for a drink or two. Very happy to hear that our favorite bartender, John, has been promoted to manager. He is the reason they call it the "hospitality business".  Not to worry, after a three month Colorado sabbatical, Sergio is back ready to take names and kick tail. We are confident in his skills and ability to mold young minds behind the bar.

Try their new concoction, Extinction. You'll be glad you did...it will take you back to the ice age.

Servers are friendly, patrons are friendly....and we will keep coming back. Keep doing what you do, Hopvine.

Came for beer, but (very friendly bar manager) John claimed to make a mean Long Island. He wasn't kidding - these things are legit. Come by and see John, you won't regret it!
Also, we ordered the spoon salad and grilled chicken wrap... Both delicious! Side Caesar salad was also fiyaaaa

We've ordered takeout from here via GrubHub twice and both times have been A-OK (which, for the grubhub offerings in my neck of the woods, is a welcomed respite)! This time, we ordered: beer cheese soup (delicious, and came exceedingly hot), rubbed smokey wings (awful, had zero flavor, greasy, and no ranch or blue cheese), the chicken and waffles (delightful, crispy fried boneless chicken strips atop a crispy, sugary sweet waffle and doused in a jalapeño slaw that actually didn't taste like jalapeño or slaw), and the bread pudding (good). I can't speak to the service or atmosphere but the food was packaged well, arrived very hot, and our order was correct. If I'm ever in the Aurora area, I'll have to stop in and try the full restaurant experience but for now, I'll enjoy decent takeout when the mood strikes.

I will start my review by saying a previous manager was kind to my better half and made an excellent margarita.  Tonight's "Hoprita" was another Rita gone carbonated with the likes of Fox and Hound, White Chocolate Grill and now Hopvine Brewery.  If there was an ounce of Tequila it was unnoticeable. Not as nasty as the other two eateries, but an imposter nonetheless. 

My Rib Eye sandwich tasted great,  but was impossible to handle, my hands taking a bath in the course.  My side salad had little or no dressing.  

We live very close and would love to make this a go to place, but alas...the attitude of some is discouraging.  I asked the bartender if he could make a Golden Cadillac and he flippantly responded, "I know how to make one...but I have no galiano or blender."  Well. galiano is required, but a blender is not, unless you want to make it with ice cream.  Discouraging.

My reviews tend to be generally positive.  Maybe I have been lucky with my choices.

Hopvine was unlike any place I have been. Since we are into craft beers we thought that Hopvine might be a good choice. Wrong. 

Our party of 5 was seated promptly enough but that is when the fun started. Ever have a situation where no one stops by your table to greet you? We did. I actually had to find the hostess to get our server. Interesting that there were seemingly more hostesses than waiters  ( or so it seemed).

We got a variety of beer including a number of the house beers. These  we're some of the most mediocre beers I have ever had. One of us got the beer flight. The golden ale tasted like a Weisse beer, the ' sour' tasted like vinegar.  We asked if that beer was supposed to taste like that and we emphatically told yes! Even though half of the beer in the flight were essentially undrinkable the manager (beer guy?- maybe we insulted him?) didn't offer up another beer to try.  All in all the beer program, in my opinion, needs to be totally reworked.  Thankfully there are other bottled beers and a full liquor bar. Stick with that.

The redeeming part is that the food was good. I had the chix wrap which actually was in a pita. The burger was good, chix and waffles was a generous portion and falafel average- not crispy as though maybe sitting around.

So 1 star for the beer part 3 for the food.

Prologue - I left my phone and when I returned looking for it the hostess had an odd reaction - not very helpful and seemed not too concerned. Staff acted really weird , definitely a odd vibe from the staff.

There are better places to go.

Terribly belligerent, drunk, loud woman sat at the bar and used profanity very loudly without a comment from the staff. I know it's a bar, but this woman was a wreck and the staff said nothing. By the time the food came I was so annoyed that I just ate so I could leave. They had Three Floyds beer which is a huge plus.

Came here for the first time with my girlfriends and the place is very spacious & clean! Our waitress was friendly and very attentive. None of us ordered any beers but ordered some sort of mojito. The one I ordered was something of a ginger, cucumber, mint mojito and it was delicious! For my main entree, I ordered the chicken & waffles, one of my friends also ordered the same. I thought there was too much syrup for my liking but she loved it! So, if you're not a big syrup fan... Just ask for a light drizzle. For dessert, we had a s'more brownie which was good but very rich tasting. I will definitely go back and explore the menu and maybe try one of their beers!

This place is great. Service here is always terrific and they have a great selection of food and beer. They have the hoppiest vines around. Go here pretty regularly on my lunch break. See you soon hopvine!

First time here during lunch hr on a Sunday. Met Doug the owner even served our plates. Got to know us and customer service was fantastic and a nice touch. Big beautiful place. Don't forget to sit in patio area. Huge and beautiful.  Family owned and ran. Every food item and beers are well crafted and unique in flavor.

My husband and I ate dinner here tonight (Saturday night) with our 6 year old. The place is in a strip mall around the perimeter of the Fox Valley Mall. It's nice enough inside- open and has the cool windows where you can look in on beer being brewed. 

The food was really delicious- my husb had a burger and LOVED it. I ate the roasted beet salad, and it was tasty with a great mix of flavors, fresh greens and all that.

What completely sucked butt about this place is: 

1. My husb ordered an iced tea, and they came back to tell us they were out of iced tea. If you are a restaurant you just don't run out of iced tea. That's just something you absolutely cannot do.

2. I wanted a fancy girly drink, so I ordered a raspberry mojito. What I was served can only be described as grape soda with mint leaves and lime pieces. It was surreal. It was purple. It had not a drop of alcohol in it.

I think you just need to skip any other beverage but beer when you go here, so I'll return when I'm feeling beer-y.

If your near. Gotta come and try a flight of their home town brews!
Found a very tasty beer named 'Yes Dear' my personal fav, which I'm going to miss once I leave town.

We went in again and had dinner on Sat night. We had great service, the food was fantastic  and the beer has just gotten better and better. 

The steak sandwich was unreal. The Mediterranean sampler appetizer was really good. 

Brew Monkey is probably one of the best local beers I have ever had. 

The only thing I can suggest for the owners is if there is a game on and people come in turn it on all the tv's to the game and play the sound for the game. The guy playing his guitar was good but it was the NHL playoffs and the Hawks were playing. Kinda odd.

Not sure if the bar was short handed but we sat at the bar for 10 min and neither bar tender even made contact with us to tell us they would be right with us.  I realize they were busy making drinks for the tables but at least hand us a beer menu to look at while we wait.  I've been meaning to try this place for a while but instead we had to walk out.

A-OK is a good way to explain my experiences at Hopvine. 

I've been here a couple times now. Once just for drinks and a couple apps up at the bar with my husband, and once with a group of 8 for dinner and drinks in their dining area (for my birthday). I'm going to spell this out REAL easy for everyone - with bullet points of course. Here we go...

GOOD:
- Beer flights: You can choose up to 6 at $1.75 each (or maybe $1.25, I can't remember). I enjoyed them all but one!
- Spoon Salad: Yummy and great for splitting
- Lobster Mac & Cheese (on special): AMAZE. Still thinking about it.
- Live acoustic music occasionally
- Located conveniently right next to the Comedy Shrine which is bomb dot com

BAD:
- Service, service service: Slow. Like REALLY slow. Which is not ideal when you're trying to be on time for a comedy show next store. Wait staff seems uneducated on the menu and beers as well.
- Fried pickles: MEH.
- Pretzel sticks: Not great when I had them (my sister liked it). Mine were hard to bite into, as opposed to the soft pretzel like app I was expecting.

WILL I BE BACK?
Most likely. I live nearby so it's a super convenient place to go grab a beer. I'll stick to sitting at the bar though if the wait staff doesn't kick it up a notch. The Mac N Cheese was fantastic so I'll be back for that too. 

TIP:
If you're going to Hopvine before a show at the Comedy Shrine, be sure to give yourself PLENTY of time because the servers definitely aren't in a rush.

I really like this place. The bartender at first was kind of snobby but at the end she turned around and was ok. Maybe she was having a bad day but never take it on your customers. Anyways, I ordered the root beer and it was so good I bought a howler. For dinner, I had the fried chicken and waffles. 
I've had this at other restaurants but never with cole slaw. I say it was different but delicious. 
My total experience was ok. The food and drinks were good. I recommend this place if you are in Aurora. #SenorFood

I came here for lunch a week ago with my boyfriend-it was our first time here. Upon entering the bar area seems nice enough and the restaurant has an elegant feel to it. We tried a beer flight, appetizer and two meals. The beer was disappointing and most left a very odd aftertaste-which the bartender blamed on "the kegs being low."  Okay...not a good look, especially considering they are supposed to be a brewery. My next big issue is that their descriptions on the menu do not match what they serve you. The chicken and waffles had no jalapeño slaw or maple ginger syrup as promised on the menu...just an overly sweet waffle and a sugary piece of chicken.  The roasted beet salad was empty, containing only a handful of arugula, canned beets, and a small amount of chewy pancetta. While I wouldn't mind trying other menu options, the prices make further sampling not worth it.
Nice place! I had the buffalo chicken wrap and it was very very good! They have their own craft beers by I had the Belgium cranberry beer and it tasted like a dessert! Loved it!
John, our bartender, was great! He was hilarious! He made the absolute best Long Islands & recommended great beers! We give our highest recommendation!

Horrible service on Mother's day, a table of 9. There were 4 other tables of 3 to 4 people each and two or three people at the bar the during entire time we were there.
After ordering (all meals at the same time ) we waited 45 plus minutes to get 5 of our meals, ten more minutes to get 3 more and then another ten to get the last meal which was only a bowl of chili! During the wait we only got drink refills when flagging down the waitress (multiple times).
Two of the orders were wrong, two were burnt.  Before we finished our meals the waitress told us that if we wanted desert we had to order it now, as the night menu did not serve desert. We ordered 2 deserts which took 30 minutes  (we times it). During the wait for desert, no waitress to even flag down for more drinks, and we bussed our dishes and glasses onto an adjacent table.  
We asked for the manager who could really care less, and gave us an excuse that they were extremely busy, I said really with the 4 other tables?
