Done with them for good! Now I know why the place was empty on mothers day.
Had a great Thursday night. Best bartender named John makes the best Long Island Iced Teas.  Pulled pork sandwich was amazing. Definitely coming back.

Every beer they brew in house is so smooth and delicious. Only had thing is trying to decide on what to get because literally everything sounds so good. This place has one of the most beautiful beer gardens I've seen. I'm posting this on a Friday night and they have a live musician playing by the bar and he is really good ( takes request)  waitress was very lively not to mention hilarious. Great place for food and beer. Perfect date or group outing place.

Terrible experience on Friday.  After 85 minutes our main lunch order hadn't arrived.  Two tables that arrived after us had theirs.  Ours was a party of two.  Does not make sense.  The bartender did his best.  Management needs to understand one cook and one server on a Friday isn't enough help.  They themselves probably need to look into the mirror and realize they probably don't need to be managing restaurants any longer.  We won't be back.  Ever.  Sorry guys.

Very nice-looking brewery/restaurant. The beers are fairly good and will likely improve as they get more brewing under their belts. The food menu is good, with an interesting variety of options. They also suggest beer pairings with each otem which is a great idea.

The outside patio & live music was the only nice thing about this place. $30 for frozen burgers & frozen fries!
All of the staff was sitting inside at the bar watching TV while one waitress took care of all customers outside.. And did I mention that it reeked of raw sewage?

My husband and I dined here a few weeks ago around 5:30-6:00pm... After we almost drove right past! Terrible location. When we first walked in we were surprised to see that we were the only customers there! Especially so close to dinner. We had to wait for someone to come up from the back to assist in seating is. Our server was kind of.. Different. He was very quick to walk away when we were speaking with him, even if we weren't done talking, and since we were the only table there he was asking us how things were from a few tables away.. Unprofessional? Onto the meal, our appetizer was delicious - we got the maple pork waffles. For our entrees, we had the pulled pork sandwich and a burger. My husband had the burger and enjoyed his but my pulled pork was extremely dry. The food was pretty overpriced in general as well. We had an alright experience, but probably won't return.

I got the grilled chicken wrap with fries, it was a suitable size and it was real good too, i also got the bread pudding dessert, which was very good, one of the better bread puddings i've had, i got the 6 beer flights, some were better than others, but i liked the IPA and the krusher the best, id definitely be up for going back

We had such great expectations for this brewery /eatery. It is right next to the comedy shrine and a bunch of friends were stopping there to eat and drink before heading over.

Unfortunately the food was dry and cold. It was a group of 6 so we had ordered a plethora of apps and meals. I am sorry to say not one of them were very good. When we arrived at hoping on a Saturday night we wondered why the area was only 1/4 filled......we found out. Very disappointed

Very pleasantly surprised!  Hopvine resides in the location of a former beloved joint I used to frequent back in the 90's called Pockets.  It's been gone a long time so it took me a minute to make the connection.  Anyways, I kind of left Hopvine alone for awhile because I guess I associated the place with the shopping mall..and why would a good brewery want to be in that type of a location?  Don't follow my ideology on this, I only postponed a good meal & beer for inaccurate reasoning.

Food - We came here for a very late lunch so for all intensive purposes it was our dinner.  The food menu has a solid number of choices and I went with one of my favorite staples, the Club Sandwich (smoked turkey, lettuce, tomato, bacon, maple dijon, sourdough).  Very tasty and on the greasy side...but that probably made it better!  Had fries on the side, both were a substantial cut above your average bar food.

Beer - It's winter so I rarely touch anything on the light side.  Russian imperial stouts atypically have a heavy feel but not Hopvine's selection called Weekday Mild.  One of the best and most original RIS's I've ever had.  It's super light for an RIS and somehow manages to keep a very prominent flavor.  Instead of customarily sampling a second beer I couldn't resist another pint of the stuff.  Easily 9 stars out of 10, if not perfect.  

Service - We had great service, very friendly staff and the layout is such that you can drink in the bar area or have a meal in the restaurant area with family.  I made the mistake of associating this place with a shopping mall.  Don't repeat my error and give this place a shot ASAP.  
Cheers!

Let me just say: TERRIBLE service. Went in a Friday evening when they were relatively empty. Took over half an hour to get our first round of drinks. Pretty much any time we asked for anything (even a side of ranch) took 30+ minutes! Food and drinks were good, but so not worth the wait.

Sort of meh.  I was told they had a chef partner and their food was a big part of the experience.  I have only been once but the menu was average and the beer did not stand out in any way.  I tried 3 beers and none were anything I would try again.  In this area you cannot get away with shooting for just getting by, too many great places to choose from.

I was here due to Yelp. 

It sucked that they didn't have any stouts on hand but the manager was kind enough to give me a sampling! They have a good selection of beers. 

I had the Hopvine Burger. First burger I've met that I couldn't finish. Pulled pork and bacon topped the juicy 1/2lbs patty. Cooked the way I wanted it. 

I also had their coleslaw. When he said it was made fresh, he want lying. Crispy lettuce and cabbage, not too juicy, lots of flavor. 

All in all, a great place to grab some beer and good food!

Well, I guess some Yelpers didn't like what I had to say about the bartender here.  So, here's my edited version:

I can't keep up with the number of craft beer gastropubs opening in the suburbs. After going to many suburban craft beer breweries or bars and rating them all five stars, I knew there was either something wrong with me, or I'd eventually find one that I didn't like. Unfortunately for Hopvine, I'm just fine, but I really don't like this place.

The service is bad. Dominic P. and I came here for a casual date night on a Saturday night. We arrived around 8:00 p.m. and were told there would be a 10 minute wait. We decided to sit at the bar instead, which is first come first serve. I later saw at least 20 tables open while I walked to the bathroom.

We were never really acknowledged and had to flag down bartenders to order drinks and food. One of the bartenders spoke so softly, I couldn't hear a word he said OR attempt to read his lips since he also sported a massive beard. The other bartender was busy but also occupied with some friends/regulars sitting at the bar. I was almost mowed down by three waitresses while heading to the bathroom - they were all in a hurry like it was opening night and they were slammed.

The beer is OK. I had the Yes, Dear, a strawberry ale made with local honey. It wasn't as sweet as I expected, but it was OK. I didn't want to have a second one though. Then I had the Adult Root Beer, but it was definitely NOT as good as "Not Your Father's." I had a sip of the Farmhouse Ale, a solid craft beer, but again, I just wasn't blown away.

Unfortunately, the food is just as mediocre as the beer. We ordered the Spicy Goat Cheese Dip, which was served with pita. The pita was lightly toasted, but still soft and pillowy. I liked the creaminess of the dip mixed with pancetta and cranberries. But it was not at all spicy. I was completely puzzled by the word "spicy" in the description.

I ordered the Grilled Cheese. How can you mess up a grilled cheese? The flavors were just weird. I ate a grilled cheese in Cleveland with 14 different types of cheese, so when I say there was TOO MUCH blue cheese on this sandwich, there was too much. The house made summer sausage had a good flavor, but it didn't belong on the sandwich. It also should not have been ice cold. The flavor of the sausage didn't work with the blue cheese at all. 

When we ordered, I asked the bartender if he liked the grilled cheese or macaroni & cheese better. I barely got more than a "uh, they're both good" out of him. Same goes for when I asked him about the fries or the house chips. Staff was useless when it comes to making recommendations or making anything SOUND good here. I felt like a nuisance the entire time we were here.

Oh, and when we asked for our check, the bartender had the audacity to ask my husband how many beers we had. Um, isn't that your job? I wanted to say, "ZERO" and walk out. The bartender still effed up the check, but in our favor - we got a free beer.

Hopevine is OK, but it is nothing special. I'd come back for their guest taps, but that's about it.

2.5 stars. It isn't awful, but they need to try harder given all of the competition in the suburbs.

The wife and I stopped in late in the afternoon on a Friday. It was during happy hour so we tried some of the specials while at the bar. Really good food. It wasn't crowded yet so the bar tender was real fun to talk with. The brewmaster also had a chance to talk a little and answer some questions...I do a little home brewing on occasion.    He makes some good brews. One thing I really liked was the size of the bar.  Nice and big so you shouldn't have a problem finding a seat. Give them a try if you are in the area.

I love this place!  Hopvine has a good selection of their own craft beers; my favorite is "The Oaty."  It's an Oatmeal Stout and it has a dark, rich flavor and goes down smooth with no bitterness. Our server, John is very friendly and attentive.  My husband and I each ordered different burgers and they were cooked exactly as we ordered.  Portions are large; I couldn't finish mine and the place is very clean. I have recommended Hopvine to many people and will definitely go back again.

Went in for a late lunch on a Sunday. Walked in to the place and there was no host/hostess or server to be found.After waiting 5 minutes, I had to go up to the bar to find out whether we could seat ourselves or if we needed to continue waiting to be seated.

After being seated, the service did not improve. It took 40 minutes to get our food. The employees were more interested in talking to each other than they were the customers. I could forgive slow service if the food was great, but this was typical bar food.

There are plenty of bars near my home, Hopvine is not worth the drive for this kind of experience.

One day my husband and I were shopping at Fox Valley Mall and we were famished. Not a fan of mall food, I whipped out my phone and looked up restaurants near us via Yelp. I rattled off a few places and I found this - a brewing company? My husband was all in. Come to realize it was very close by, in a strip mall. It's tucked away and when we went, it was veryyy quiet. Whether that's a good thing or a bad thing is subjective. I didn't mind. They did have one of the World Cup games on the big screen, which we appreciated.

I had a dish comprised of tilapia, brown rice, and spinach and it was delicious. A little broth-y, but it was healthy and just what I was looking for. With it, I had a beer...I believe it was the Brew Monkey. Although I don't recall 100% which beer I drank, I do remember enjoying it very much. My husband also gives thumbs up for his food and drink.

Service was great! Our server was attentive and helpful. I love the ambiance and wish this establishment were closer to where I live, because I think my husband and I could become barflies here. Definitely a nice place to relax. Lots of brick and you can even see where they brew the beer, which is always a nice touch! We'll be back the next time we find ourselves out in the Naperville/Aurora area.

Noticed this place while doing some shopping and stopped in just to checkout.  Staff was excellent - provided great input on drink ideas and discussion on beer types. There was something for the non beer drinkers in the group as well. Looking forward to going back!

Awesome for drinks with a cool brewery atmosphere, beer was good, Good service.  Menu is very chain like with no Vegan options- vegetarian was denoted but server could not tell me if it was Vegan.  Just because I don't eat meat its nice to have eateries raise to the challenge of providing Vegan options.

I've had very mixed experiences here.  

Sometimes I go there and love it, and other times I don't.  And, I could order the same thing twice and get different experiences.

I had high hopes when I saw that they were opening.  It took forever to open, so it heightened my expectations.  Then the day finally came that they opened.  I went in with some friends later in the evening.

I got soup and an appetizer.  I had the Beer Cheddar soup and Pretzel sticks.  The soup was not at all what I had expected, but it wasn't bad.  I've had it a few times since and I think it needs something, just can't tell what.  It needs to be served warmer though, for sure.

The pretzel stick weren't bad, so I wouldn't mind ordering them again.

Since then I've gone back there maybe a dozen or so times, and when they are good they are very good... but sometimes the food just isn't at the love it stage.

The service has always been great.  I've gone in there late and they don't seem to mind.  Which I hate at my job, and try my hardest not to do... but sometimes, it happens.

I am not a beer drinker, but people in my parties seem to like the beers and the variety.

We have been to Hopvine several times this Spring and Summer, it's our official "place". The patio is lovely , as well as the bar/ restaurant area. 
The roasted beet salad has consistently been wonderful, nice light dressing.  My guy likes the burgers.  The spicy goat cheese dip has a great flavor.  Our faves from the tap are Brewdacious Blonde and Urban Tumbleweed.
The service has definitely improved from last year.  This is where we take out of town guests for a relaxing dinner.

Nothing too special here. This strip mall location is spacious with an outdoor area, wrap around bar, and banquet/large group area. 

Yet there was just nothing memorable about this spot. Their home brewed beer was so/so and their prices were surprisingly high at 6+ a glass. They also had a large selection of housemade dishes that while sounding interesting fell a bit flat for the prices of 9-15 bucks a plate. 


Overall if you are in the area it won't hurt to stop by, but it isn't worth going out of your way to visit.
The waitress was amazing and had recommended my whole meal to me and it was all great!!

Stopped by Hopvine Brewing Company for a drink before catching a show next door at The Comedy Shrine. The interior of the restaurant is spacious and much larger than it appeared from outside as it is tucked away in an inconspicuous strip mall. I ordered the Yes, Dear, a strawberry honey ale and my boyfriend ordered the Urban Tumbleweed, a German style Hefeweizen. Neither of us were blown away by our beers so we tried a sip of each other's. Still, not that great but we thought maybe we made bad choices. We decided we would definitely give this place another shot though next time we are in the area, given how friendly and accommodating the staff were! Our server made sure we had plenty of time to get to our show next door, which we really appreciated.
Friendly servers and good food. The prime rib sandwich was delicious and the amber ale brewed onsite was full of flavor. I will be back!

After enthusiastically exploring the Farnsworth House in Plano, we needed to take nourishment before driving back to Chicago.  I am always a fan or brew pubs that serve food, and Lynne found Hopvine for us to try.

We arrived for a rather early dinner, about 430pm.  They wanted to seat us in the dinning area because we had two children (11 & 8), but asked if instead we could sit at one of the high tables in the bar area.  No problem at all, and the kids love sitting on the high chairs.  

My wife is a pesci-vegetarian, and she found many options to choose from.  The kids were happy with the choices on the adult menu.  Our Chinese guest Long who we met at Farnsworth House was most enthusiastic about the Smoked Potato and I devoured the LARGE 1/3 pound Hopvine Burger and it rivaled any burger I have ever had at Kuma's Corner on Belmont.  Great tastes blended perfectly on this burger.  

Our waiter was very enthusiastic to make sure we had a chance to taste more than the two beers I was able to comfortably have and still drive us back to Chicago.  While I was there I enjoyed an "Aurora Amber," an American Amber Ale, and thought it was a fine brew.  Perfect for a session, and ideal for quenching a beer thirst on a hot summer afternoon.  I also enjoyed an off the regular beer menu IPA, and found it to be a very drinkable, if not a slightly generic IPA, but again a good session beer IPA, not too hoppy, perfect for introducing someone to the style.  Our waiter also gave me tastes of the Urban Tumbleweed, a German-Style Hefewizen (not my favorite style of beer, but always willing to try) and the Brew Monkey, a Belgium Style Tripel, which he was particularly fond of.  I enjoyed both, but felt the Aurora Amber was the best beer of our visit.  

Finally, we finished our meal with a show stopping dessert, their Chocolate Stout Ice Cream Cookie Sandwich.  IT WAS FANTASTIC.  And only $5 for a dessert that we could all share and feel it was still too much.  It stole the show, and left us leaving with a happy glow after our meal, beer and dessert.  

I see that there are some rather disparaging other Yelp! reviews of this place, but I'd tell you to enthusiastically give this place a try.  I found the physical space comfortable and modern without being overly trendy, the staff we interacted with were knowledgeable and very helpful, the food was a tad pricey, but good, and the beer was well made and tasty, though a bit generic for each style.  I'd certainly return, and was glad to have had what I would consider an above average and delightful meal and few beers here.

Can you butcher Sweet Caroline? Well, yes, you can.
The musician on Friday night nearly butchered every song that he sang. Ok. Not related to the restaurant, right? Fine.

My fiancé, parents and I went on a Friday night and maybe we had it coming. Well, it was 7 pm and there was live music. But it was very, very loud. We were seated as far away from the music as possible, and still had to shout to talk to one another. They eventually turned it down when we asked them to. Every so often, the musician took a break. Even when he wasn't singing, it was very loud in there from everyone talking so loud. Not very good acoustics, I guess.

The bar area is cute, but the farther back you get in the restaurant, the crappier it looks. It looks like they spent money on the front, but not on the back (where we sat).

My fiancé and I ordered 2 different beers, but I honestly don't know if they brought us 2 different beers. They tasted the same. Only a very slight difference, even though one was an amber ale and one was a wheat beer. 

We ordered the pretzel sticks appetizer. It was $8. Had I known that it would only include 3 pretzel sticks, we would've ordered something else. They were good, but nothing different form pretzel sticks from any other place that's serving them right now. They came with a strange cheese and cinnamon butter, which was a nice change.

I had the tilapia sandwich. It had oranges on it, which was interesting. Though, the filet could have used some seasoning. It came with fruit, which was nice. I wouldn't order it again, though. I prefer seasoning to no seasoning.

My fiancé had a chicken sandwich and he said it didn't rate very high. My mom had their "spoon salad" and was disappointed as well. It didn't have any salad dressing and was apparently mostly tortilla strips. My dad seemed to enjoy his burger.

The waitress was really nice, but unfortunately her service doesn't make up for the crappy food and beer. 

I was really hoping for a good experience, because I had been looking forward to dining here.

I'm told this place is always deserted, and I'm not sure how they make money. I was there for a few hours after work on a Wednesday, but besides my groups I saw maybe 3 others groups come in. Their drinks and drink selection was very good. We just had appetizers and they were good. Its a really nice location so I hope they get more traffic!
We have been here a few times now, and have enjoyed everything we have tried. Chicken n waffles are amazing!

Good beer and good poutine. The rest of the meal was very bland pub food. The nachos were horrible, they managed to be overdone and still cold, not to mention they had very few toppings. The service was overworked but the restaurant wasn't even close to full... Go figure. Go to two brothers instead.

The yelp reviews about this place really seem to be hit or miss...lucky for me, I had a good experience here.

For starters, I discovered this place via Restaurants.com - I'm always up for trying the new place in town, especially a new brew pub!  I told my friends about this place and of course they went right over there and then later informed me they saw the place wasn't taking Restaurants.com vouchers.  I took their word for it and just returned my voucher for something else, though I still wanted to try the place.  They also informed me that the place was not good. I take opinions with a grain of salt and wanted to find out for myself so I met a friend here for lunch this past Saturday afternoon.  I met her at 1:30 so the place wasn't jammed packed but there was no wait and we got seated right away.  

We got two menus, a lunch menu, the regular menu, and drink menus.  Our server went over the list of beers with us with a brief overview, and told us what was comparable as "This is comparable to Miller Lite, Blue Moon, etc."   I like when places do that so you have an idea of what you're ordering.  We both had the beer similar to Blue Moon and enjoyed it.  For lunch my friend had chicken tacos, I had steak tacos.  If it weren't for us picking the tomatoes out of the tacos, we wouldn't have discovered the tooth pick IN each taco.  Lucky for us we discovered this before biting into our food so a suggestion would be to maybe have the toothpick visible on the OUTSIDE so people aren't biting into toothpicks in their food.  

Regardless of the placement of the toothpick, I'd still go back here - they have a pretty decent list of food and drinks so I'd definitely return.
Had lunch and a couple tall ones there this afternoon. I was impressed at this little place tucked away in a corner outside the mall. Give it a shot.

Awesome place!  The strip mall location kind of stinks but they more than make up for it with their upscale interior and huge, awesome patio.  The service was great, our server was super helpful and friendly.  We got flights of a few of their home brews all of which were yummy.  We went for lunch and were raving about our food for the rest of the day! Generous portions and very reasonably priced. Definitely a hidden gem in the Fox Valley area!

PS: lots of vegan, vegetarian & gluten free options! They're very accommodating!

Woah, what have we here? I drive to the Fox Valley Mall on the day before Christmas Eve (like an idiot, who waits that long?) and see a sign saying "Now Open" about Hopvine Brewing Company. I called my husband and said "Let's meet for lunch, i'm already stressed out about shopping." So we head over to Hopvine, situated next door to The Comedy Shirine (my guess is that they bring each other some biz, since this isn't the most lively strip mall).

Very nice and new on the inside, plenty of seating space, both at tables and at the bar. Our bartender was knowledgable on the beer (both their own and guest taps). After seeing another gentleman order a beer flight, we opted for the same...it was large! The bartender said each beer was 4 oz, but they definitely looked bigger. I am glad we shared. I can't remember the names of any of them, but I enjoyed them all. The IPA wasn't overly hoppy (I could've stood it to be a bit hoppier), the Kolsch was good (the guy next to me said he thought it was bitter...he was 100% mistaken, it was the most unbitter beer ever). 

My husband ordered the Hopvine Burger (burger with onions, pulled pork, on a pretzel bun...your standard over-the-top-but-delicious bar burger) and I ordered the beer cheddar soup. His burger was cooked perfectly, although because it was med-rare it was a bit messy, but he had no complaints and said the flavor was awesome. The only downside (for me) from my experience was that I thought the soup was a bit watery for a beer cheddar soup. Cheese soup should never be watery...it tasted like it had been reheated. I am not naive, many restaurant items are reheated, but you never want the customer to taste it or think it. 

But alas, we will return. We're happy to see breweries pop up near us, and the beer was very good. It was also great to have a bartender who knew her stuff and could offer viable opinions (other than "It's good" or "Its bad"...seriously I'm so sick of people without a palate serving me beer!). The menu looked really great, so we will be back to try more!

Came to visit from Denver and found out about this place.

I really really like it!  It's a nice locations with a very nice atmosphere.  I went there twice and at night, there was a small band playing really good music.  It's the sort of place that Aurora/Naperville needs...an upperclass brewery with good food.

Can't say enough good things about it...I just hope other ppl start coming and support a great business!

Beer is good and food was fine. Service wasn't. Will not be coming back to this establishment. Went with a group of 8 and we all ordered at the same time.  Approximately 25 minutes after everyone's food came out, I was told that they couldn't make what I ordered.  Everyone was done eating and I was forced to order something off the menu that I didn't want.  The food came out and tasted ok but I had to force it down while everyone watched me eat.  Got charged full price for food I didn't want.  Will not return.

I'm not wasting my time writing a long review since this place doesn't really care about anything they do. Tasteless beers in today's world? If you cant make a half decent IPA just stop please. Cuban Sandwich was downright terrible. I ate it cause I was hungry and had a side of buffalo sauce to make it taste like something other than cardboard.
Service was actually not bad considering only one person was working the ENTIRE place. Water was cold, if that counts for someone? Space was nice but it all ended there.

They should be ashamed of the product for food and drink they put on ones table.

This was our second visit after dining here shortly after the restaurant opened. It was a Thursday night and there were only a few other tables occupied along with a few patrons hanging in the bar area. An underwhelming crowd at peak dinner time, even for a weekday night. The server was pleasant enough and seemed to be invested in her work. There was an extensive menu of beers to choose from although a few were listed as out of stock.  Of course the beer I selected was also out of stock even though it didn't indicate this on the menu. The fallback option was very good, so it worked out. The food was very good which was a pleasant surprise given the long delay in delivery to our table. The server apologized for the long wait indicating the kitchen was backed up. If so, it was clearly due to the lack of staffing in the kitchen, not the demand from the dining room. The atmosphere was great, the food was good, but the kitchen was extremely slow getting the food out which made the experience average.

I wish I had more to go on but other than my husband and I, there were two other couples in the entire place. Kinda made us nervous from the start. My husband loves new beers and and described his beer as "salami soaked in coffee for three days and then smelling fresh cut grass". In other words he did not like the weekday mild beer, but he admits he should have done a taster before just ordering a pint. We ordered nachos and frankly it was cysco style chips slathered in same generic cheese sauce. Nothing special. With the lack of people we decided that was as fat as we were going to try and left. Waitress was fine, hostess guy would have been fired if he worked for me and I over heard his conversations. I don't think we will be back sorry.

My husband and I came in for a beer last week, had a great bartender who was engaging and very personable. He first let us try a flight of their microbrews; I decided on the Tumbleweed hefeweizen and my husband ordered the Amber ale. Both were good, atmosphere was modern and inviting. 

We thought we would come back to try to the food and more beer during the Bears game the following Sunday. We brought a group of 5, and had gotten everyone excited about it. Although they had the game on the TVs, they wouldn't put the game sound on and instead were playing annoying pop hits through the speakers the entire time. When we asked the staff about it, we were informed that the management didn't want that kind of "element" in here, so they would not put the sound on. We all felt like this restaurant was too new to already be making those kind of claims. Additionally, if that's not the crowd you're trying to attract, then don't even have the game on at all! 

We would have left at halftime since we didn't feel welcome, but our entrees hadn't come out yet. Entrees, which, despite the hype, were just ok. Wings and nachos were good, but the poutine needed more gravy, burgers and salads were average. Prices are also pretty steep. 

We really wanted to like it here, but there are other comparable microbrews where we would rather spend our money :(

Best onion rings I've ever had.
Entrees were good, not great. One had the potato, the other the chicken wrap. Pub chips were house made, but only ok. Bbq sauce is fabulous.
Server was super knowledgeable about the beer menu. That was very impressive. Live music but it wasn't too loud. I will be back

I stopped in at Hopvine last night for the first time, I've been tracking their posts on Facebook and have been waiting for the place to open.  The interior of Hopvine is beautiful, they did a fantastic job with the decor.  There is a lot of brick and wood and down to earth feel to the place, it's well laid out and just a generally nice place to be.  It wasn't very busy, but it was early on a Tuesday night, which isn't exactly party time.  I sat up at the bar and the bartender was great, very friendly and knowledgeable about the beer and types I might like based on my preferences.  I was able to try all of the beers that they brew in house plus a couple of guest beers.  They have a really nice selection of local micro brews (Solemn Oath, Two Brothers, Revolution, Lagunitas, etc) plus the beers they brew.  All of the Hopvine beers that I tried were great and are well worth the trip to try.  
I wasn't going to get anything to eat but they had a daily special of cheese curds that was for that day only.  These might have been one of the best things I've ever tasted, they were that good.  They need to make them a permanent menu item, I would go just for those.  I also tried the plain cheeseburger, which was a 1/2 pound burger on a nice soft bun, served with fries.  The burger was cooked to perfection and it had a great beefy flavor.  
All in all a great experience, friendly knowledgeable staff, great atmosphere, excellent beers and awesome food.  Make it a point to check this place out, you won't be sorry.
Oddly located in a mall, but don't overlook it. Quality beers and decent food. Every time I visit it's quiet.

My husband and I were really looking forward to trying out this local brewpub, ended up rather disappointed. We started off with some beers - I had their "Brewdacious Blonde" which was... OK. Nothing special and it wasn't very cold - almost like a cask-conditioned temperature which I found odd.  My husband started with a guest beer which was fine, and then sampled 3 of the Hopvine beers - Aurora Amber (meh) Alpha Mastadon (overly sweet, which was strange) and Brew Monkey, which was probably the best of those 3 but not impressive. 

We were craving burgers that night, so we both ordered cheeseburgers, mid-rare. They were cooked to temperature, but didn't have much in the way of seasoning. The generous topping of white cheddar was delicious, though, and the fries were very good. Overall, we weren't blown away by the food and the beer left a lot to be desired. With so many other places to try, we won't be back.

The prices lend you to think you're going to have a elevated microbrewery dining experience. My experience was tainted by the lack of knowledge about the beer and service of the staff, and worst of all, the manager. Also, the tables lend to more of a buffalo wild wings vibe. Uncomfortable. Chairs too tall, tables too short.

The food was great. Meaty, plentiful portions. Not necessarily natural or organic, but flavorful. Unfortunately, OVERPRICED. 

Let me tell you my journey.

 We got a flight of the four beers featured by the microbrewery. The server set them down and walked away........OK. Thanks. Bye..... no explanations. No notes.

We then saw a staff member SPRAY THE TABLE and then wipe it down. Anyone who has ever worked at a reputable establishment knows this is wrong wrong wrong.

We asked our server, and two others walking by, "What's an IBU?" (on the beer list)
We got three wrong answers, from three people. Then a friendly patron at a nearby table let us in on Bitterness units. Thanks man.

I ordered the beet salad. And got a pile of greens, with one beet chopped to a tiny couple cubes. I let the server know and he suggested he bring out a plate of beets.????  The manager came over and said, "I hear there is a problem here."
Oh. Ok. 

The salad was $8. I assumed that since there was no beets he would take it off the bill. Nope. Or, instead of asking me if I want more beets, bring them!
Bad manager. Poor customer service. 

The hopvine burger is awesome. Pulled pork on TOP of the burger. Sharp cheese, fried onions. Yum. Unremarkable fries, but standard.

 For the price, the experience has to be up to par, and the lack of knowledge KILLED IT. We paid $22 dollars for the sampler appetizer and they don't tell you where the animals are from. 

The taste is there but you can't price the dishes that high without a "grass fed" or " organic" label on them. 
They are just covering their opening overhead.

Stumbled across this hidden (literally) gem. Me, my husband, and a friend all went last night... first time for all of us... will 100% be back! It's hidden in a strip mall behind Fox Valley mall and it's fantastic.

Specialty brews were dope. We all had the "Brew Monkey" which was one of the best local brewery beers I've had in a while. It was flavorful, strong, and reasonably priced. 

The food was amazing. NOT typical bar food at all. "Gourmet" bar food (if that makes sense) at everyday prices. From the goat cheese dip, to the shrimp and scallions mac n cheese, to the bacon cheeseburger... The menu had lots to pick from and nothing disappointed. 

Atmosphere is comfortable and friendly. Our server was on point. Not loud, over crowded, and filled with douchebags like most area pubs can be. There was live music (no cover) and they were great too! Two thumbs up.

Wow once again this place continues to impress!! Try one of the new beers Farmhouse Rye was fantastic and now my new favorite beer here.  The ribs we amazing.  Please do yourself a favor and come out to this hidden gem of a place.  And ask for Tina as she is a fresh of breath air and a true delight as a waitress!

it's "company policy" not to turn the volume up of the Bears game in the bar.  Instead they choose to play canned Pandora music. Everyone in the bar was clearly there to watch the game. 

The staff was friendly, however service was very slow.  The food was mediocre.   Beer list was adequate for a suburban establishment

My search for quality food, beverage and service in the western burbs continues.

Went back again. I don't think whoever concocted the grilled chicken salad wrap tasted it before putting it on the menu. The beer that is listed as paired with it on the menu wasn't available. The fries were all salt. The waitress was nice, but the food was inedible.

Not going back.

Took a friend from out of town to this place because he's into breweries and (big surprise there!) beer/ales. I didn't expect much from the outside, but the interior was quite elegant and well done. The food, all of that which we ordered was well done. I ordered the soup of the day (Chicken Tortilla), and it was quite flavorful, and then ordered the Mac & Cheese without any meat, and it was really quite rich and sumptuous! My friend ordered their sampler, which was a very sizable portion, and he enjoyed every bit of it. Another friend ordered the Baby Back Ribs, and she was delighted that the meat was quite succulent. I'm giving it four stars because 1) the menu is too limited! There are no options for fish, and only a few options for shrimp. If you don't eat beef or pork (and I eat neither), this place is severely limited in its offerings. And 2) despite our waitress being a sweetheart, there were a lot of delays and ups and downs with our checks and orders. I'd go if I was into the brews and good tasting American fare...but I would view the menu before going if you're not a hardcore beef/pork fan!
Great beer, food, and atmosphere! Had their Pablano corn fritters and Spoon salad topped off with an Oaty Stout. Their servers are friendly and the food was fresh, couldn't ask for more!

I loved this place! For a new restaurant they really had it together. The staff was friendly, everyone was smiling. Our waitress immediately served us and made great recommendations. I had the amber beer which was solid. My husband had a guest ipa which was amazing. For the meal I had the burger and it was worth ordering. I enjoyed its complexity. My husband had the steak wrap which was fresh, light and tasty.

I will definitely be back!

Hopvine is a welcome addition to the pub scene in aurora/Naperville. The saisons I've tried here have been good, and they have a decent selection of guest ales, so there's always something new to try. The menu has some great items including poutin, spicy goat cheese dip and the steak sandwich, but there are a few items we really didn't like, including the smoked chicken wings and the fish sandwich. As a designer I also have to comment on the logo and marketing pieces, which are very amateur and don't match the quality of their product. They would benefit from an upgrade in their design.

The food was excellent and delicious get there onion rings there off the chain. So when I came to watch some sport games in the bar area I asked them to turn up the TV volume, they said the owners don't want it turned up. I was a little disappointed so I left earlier and went somewhere els for drinks and to watch the games. I also told another employee before I left that you guys should have a BRIGHT NEON OPEN SIGN up so people know your open. I told her I've been driving past this place for a few months and thought you guys were out of business,  It looks like there always closed from the street. The employee said the owners don't want an open sign. The employees are super nice, the food was top notch, but the owners are weird from my understanding. So please turn up the volume on the TVs so I can enjoy watching some good sports games, buy some good beer and relax. I'm gonna check it out one more time, it's a nice place with good food and employees. But will see if they finally turned up the TV volume so I can enjoy some drinks as I watch some sports games.

Took stepson there sat nigh. Night started out a little shaky. Sat there for about 7 min before a waitress came to the table. I saw her look at us and walk over to the hostesses stand then came to are table. I ask if they figured out who was going to wait on us and she said the hostess usually tells the waitress who gets what table. She didn't do that this time. Are waitress saw us sitting there for a while with no one going to are table so she went up and asked who was supposed to wait on that table. My wife and I are not beer drinkers. My stepson is. We ordered 2 7&7s and stepson ordered a very dark beer. The drinks came and the 7&7s were flat. The beer was very good. They took the drinks back and we try 2 more and they were flat. The bar manager came to the table with a glass of Sprite and had me taste it to make sure it wasn't flat. He said we'll figure this out and get get you a good drink. He was very pleasant and they did get it figured out. We we're talking to the waitress and she asked if we would like a tour of the place. We said we would. The owner of the pub came over to the table and introduce himself and took us on a tour. His name is Doug and he was very hospitable and very nice person to talk to. He and his wife own the place. There were a couple of other issues like we weren't told the special of the night and there was a beer on the menu that it said was coming soon and the owner told us that it was out now so my stepson tried it and loved it. Another very dark beer. All in all we had a very pleasant time there and they did comp us a beer. The food was very good also. My stepson took home leftovers and he never does that. So right there tells you the food was very good. I would recommend this place. The staff seems to care that you have a good experience. They just need a little better communication among the staff I think.

I tried Hopvine earlier this week for lunch and there were a few positives, but a lot of not-so positives.  I was one of just a few people in there and the service was not great-sat with an empty drink glass for much of the meal and had to ask for a second one at the same time I asked for the check.

Ordered the grilled steak sandwich.   While the steak may have been grilled, it was covered in a rich sauce with mushrooms and served on a toasted roll with swiss cheese melted on same.  It was a good sandwich, not very large, and came with a choice of fries, house made chips or a side salad.  I tried the chips, which weren't bad-could have used a little something to dip them in-very lightly salted.

$13 for the meal-quite a bit for what you get-a good sandwich, but not all that substantial-which might make it difficult to draw much of a lunch crowd considering its tucked in the corner of the plaza on the northwest perimeter of Fox Valley Mall.

I'll try it again after work some day to check out the happy hour crowd/atmosphere or maybe before or after going to The Comedy Shrine next door.

Our family had lunch at Hopvine on Saturday.  We were the first customers in the restaurant just before noon and lunch started off great.  The staff was friendly, my wife and I tried a couple of different brews, the kids got to watch the brew master work at his craft...then it all went downhill quick.

I ordered the pulled pork, unfortunately about a quarter of the meat was actually the fat cap from the pork shoulder.  After the first bite, I just picked through the rest, but I felt a bit ripped off for the price I paid.

My oldest daughter ordered the chicken fingers.  During dinner she made a comment that they tasted funny, but she nibbled away and finally ate about half.  On the way home she commented that her tummy hurt.  In just a few minutes after pulling into the driveway her nausea turned into vomiting.

After she got sick over and over I called the manager just to let him know that my daughter may have food poisoning from lunch.  I just wanted him to investigate and possibly prevent the next person from getting sick, and he promised to check out the kitchen.  Unfortunately his last comment was along the lines of...I hope it is food poisoning 'cause she will get better a lot quicker than if it's the flu.  I'm gald to report after only 12 hours of vomiting my daughter was back to normal and feeling better.  So, I think it was not the flu.  

My daughters only request sounded like a Taylor Swift song, "Dad, promise we never-ever-ever-ever-ever go back there again."

I really enjoy this place! The old Enchanted Castle got a new twist and turned into a nice brewery. The live musician sang wonderfully but it was a little bit too loud but at least it wasn't blaring bad music. 

       I ordered the South of the Border burger and it was very delicious! The chipotle mayo just made the burger spectacular. At the end of our meal, we ordered dessert which was a chocolate chip cookie mousse. It was amazing!

       The interior design was very nice with fun quotes on the walls and elements from the Enchanted Castle. Mainly, this restaurant was very yummy and I would invite my friends and come back.

Great service Kimberly was super attentive. 
Food is something to go back for. Try the pouting!

We went to a business networking event here and were really excited about finding out about this place. It's great! 

Nice menu. We had passed small plates at the event, pulled pork sandwiches and they even brought one for on a gluten free bun for the lady standing near us. Would be a great place to have an event. 

After the event, we stayed at the bar for a bit. I bought a Growler to take home and had a beet salad with pancetta and baby greens that was out of this world good. 

Can't wait to go back and bring the whole family or go for the beermakers dinner (date night).
Great service... Their burger was so big, I had to take half home. The beers are awesome,  highly recommend the Mastodon IPA!!!
This place is 50/50.  Small menu, a bit pricy but depending on the batch the beers can be pretty good.  Loved the strawberry honey ale the first time but the next time it tasted like miller light :/

This suburban brewery has some amazing food. Deep fried pickles, delicious wings and a breakfast burger I devoured with my s'more beer. Their beer list is pretty dang great and our waitress knew some great pairings with our dinner and introduced me to a few new favorites! What confuses me about this place is the atmosphere. It's not quite the brewery type! It's a great space perfect for events but it's more on the upscale side. I felt underdressed in a big way! It seemed more of a sit down restaurant than a brewery to me.

After our second trip, I found the experience as pleasant as the first.  On Thursday they offer great craft beer specials for 3 dollars a pint. So far We've had the pulled pork sandwich, steak sandwich, and the hummus platter. Both sandwiches were tender and the portions are generous. After living in the Naperville area for just over a year it's currently our favorite restaurant/pub. If you like craft beer you'll like the beer menu.

I'm a huge comfort person person and had never been here.  Melody at the bar was incredible.  Truly versed in a multitude if craft beer!  Plus her recommendations (to my comfort food palate) of the chili and and cheese were incredible!

Hopvine has some work to do before they can complete with the other local breweries of the area.  My boyfriend and I are beer enthusiasts so we were excited to see a new brewery open in our area.  As a huge foodie, I am always eager to eat at breweries because they typically have inspired menus.  Sadly, we paid $50 and left hungry.  The atmosphere is very attractive with clean lines and beer quotations on the wall.  I will say that the acoustics need some help because there are not enough elements to absorb the sound in the restaurant.  I would imagine that it would be very overwhelming to dine here when the restaurant is full.

For food I ordered the ribs and my boyfriend ordered a cheeseburger.  I should tell you I'm a ribs enthusiast so I get really excited about eating this for dinner.  I was very disappointed with my entree.  The ribs had a foul smell to them and I did not enjoy their flavor.  My boyfriend was disappointed in the size of the regular cheeseburger.  As previously mentioned, we left hungry.  

Our waiter appeared very awkward and unknowledgeable of the menu.  This was disconcerting to me because the restaurant was so new I assumed he would have had better training.  I was also surprised that he didn't take an interest in our obvious disappointment in the food.  

That said, we both agreed that we would try the restaurant again in the future in hopes that they redeem themselves from our first experience.  We want to love you Hopvine!  Make it happen!

This place was recommended to me by a friend. I tried it last night and ordered the hopvine burger and a porter. I had dinner at around 8:30 and in less than 5 hours I was nauseous and vomiting in the middle of the night. I think there was something wrong with the meat.

The ambiance looked very classy but from someone who rarely gets sick at restaurants, I won't be coming back.

While I enjoy the beer and appreciate the new, lower cost menu, my friends and I try to avoid band nights like the plague. I'd love to go here every Friday, but the music that I've been unlucky enough to endure is loud and unpleasant. I would be a much happier patron enjoying my tall Urban Tumbleweeds without the attempt at 'atmosphere.'

Been here twice.  

First time warranted 4 stars. The food and beer were both really good. 

Second time,however, I noticed the beer had an "off" taste and was warm.  I mentioned it to the bartender, and she told me they were having problems with their cooler.  Isn't that something to mention BEFORE  I order a beer?  

Might give it another try, but only if others want to go.  It won't be recommendation.

This place has some of the best microbrews I have ever had.  Yes, ever.

I have been to Hopvine 4 times since they opened and had excellent experiences each time.  For those of you who remember the bar and pool hall called "Pockets" from the 1990's, Hopvine occupies the same space on the outskirts of the Fox Valley Mall.  It's in the strip mall adjacent to Toys R Us and next to the comedy club.

The restaurant & bar has an upscale, modern, and somewhat urban feel to it.  The service is excellent, and you will find that the servers and bartenders are knowledgeable about the beers they sell.  The staff also has been very conversational and interactive - that is an important element when I am out at a bar or restaurant.

My favorite beer (and one of my all-time favorite beers ever consumed) is called "Urban Tumbleweed", a wheat brew.  I have also tried a number of their other brews and have been very pleased.  One of the best things about Hopvine is that they offer free samples, so you can try before you buy.

I have only eaten there one time, and I had their burger.  It was outstanding, and the aged cheddar cheese made it very unique and memorable.

So I will be back.  In my earlier days, I would make it to the bar weekly, sometimes twice a week.  These days, I make it out 1-2 times per month to meet up with my friends.  I can't wait to get back there soon again!!

I do see a number of checkered reviews here on Yelp and disagree with many of them.  If you like microbrews, I would suggest ordering a flight, or best yet, have a tall one and ask for a few samples.  You won't stop at one beer, believe me.
The food here is fantastic and all of the options are great. However. As a beer snob, the beers didn't do it for me, though beer is always a personal preference.

My wife, daughter and i ate here on our first night in Illinois. I've moved the family to the naperville area for work and immediately went to finding the local brew pubs for eats and beer. The Hopvine had great beer and the food was very good along with the service (Marcus was his name?).

My meal of the ribs and the collard green soup was good. The soup was actually my favorite part and it hit the spot. My wife's meal was the signature hopvine burger and that was fantastic; the pork and fried onions in bbq sauce sealed it. She normally doesn't rave about burgers but frankly she wouldn't shut up about it. The beer was also solid. The IPA, Amber and kolsch were sampled this trip. My daughter had a standard kids meal that i think was grilled cheese. She ate some which for an 18mo old means a positive review.

Of note, i spilled some of my soup on the table. I told our server that I wanted to purchase another order of the soup because it was delicious - he brought it complimentary.

We plan on smashing into this place again, soon.

Just went and the food was really good.  I believe it just opened, and we live down the street.
I got the regular burger.  As someone who searches for gormet burgers, this place was at the top of my list.  The have 2 burgers on the menu, and one is called the hopvine Burger.  That one I think is loaded....didn't get it but might when I go back.
Even if u are not drinking alcohol, they make their own root beer as well as some seasonal drink (alcohol free).  I tried both.  The seasonal drink was so good, but I wish it came in a bigger glass.  It comes in a wine glass, so not much there.  The root beer comes in a normal soda glass, and is also pretty tasty.  
My wife got the fried chicken and waffles.  I am not a fan of fried chicken.....this is kind of like unfried fried chicken, if that makes sense.  It is chicken breast, so already reduced fat.  The fried part seems more like a crust which is really good. Never had waffles with chicken, but it was really good.  The maple syrup gave a sweet flavor to the savory chicken.  Good combination.

I recommend this place to anyone in the fox valley area....or western suburbs.

Went here on a lunch break. Close to the office and lots of parking.

Highs 

1. Good prices
2.Great beer selections. Lots of different beers to try and the alcohol % is clearly  stated.
3. Nice outdoor seating with umbrella tables.
4. Friendly staff.
5. Food tasted good and fresh and the guacamole is really tasty.

Lows

1. None really.

I recommend!

Well I honestly can't say this is my favorite Mexican restaurant in the Fox Valley because I think Puebla Modern Mexican in St Charles is just as good, but it is certainly one of my favorites. 

One of the killer items on the menu is the Tacos Duros. This is a ground beef or chicken taco sealed and deep fried in a corn tortilla toped with salsa and queso fresco. Even though the concoction is deep fried I don't find it to be greasy and heavy. Deep fried tacos are special and hard to find at most Mexican restaurants. The only other establishment that I am aware of that does a good deep fried taco is the Fire It Up locations. If anyone knows of any other deep fried taco options please let me know. Another favorite is the taco sampler. Although the tacos duros is not part of this you get two pork tacos, a beef taco, and a chorizo taco. I also especially like the enchiladas. The standard beef, cheese, and chicken options are available and they come with rice and beans. I like that you can mix it up and have two red sauce and one green or vice versa. Salsa and chips are provided and the chips are home made and delicious.  The lunch menu is greatly appreciated. Many of the most popular options are available including the tacos duros. The portions are nicely sized for lunch and include a side. Please see my review of the other location on third street. Although it is the same owner and many of the menu items are the same there are some differences.

Zee best of zee best. Perfection on the CHILES RELLENOS
2 chiles poblanos stuffed with Chihuahua cheese breaded and deep fried. Topped with chipotle adobo and sour cream. Served iwht rice, beans, and flour tortillas....
NOBODY CAN DO IT LIKE THEY CAN!!!

I still can't believe that El Molcajete is in Geneva. I've been to Mexican restaurants throughout the Western burbs and Chicago -- but El Molcajete remains my favorite. The staff is helpful, friendly, and very knowledgeable about the menu, while the food is fresh, full of flavor, and even surprisingly well-plated. The portions are pretty hearty, but this isn't just about getting a plate overflowing with burritos (obviously, there's a time and place for that as well). We typically spend about $30-$40 for two and walk away feeling stuffed but on top of the world.

It's pretty small inside (about ten or so two-tops), but there's usually an open table on weeknights or during lunch. Even on weekend nights, we've never waited longer than 15 or 20 minutes. If you've ever been to Geneva on a Saturday night, you'll know how ridiculous that is. 

After we've gorged ourselves on continuous chips and salsa, I usually stick with my standby order of tacos and poblano rice (rice with poblano peppers, sour cream, and chihuahua cheese, where have you been all my life?), but everything that I've ever ordered here has been incredible. My friends and family switch things up a little more often, usually with some help from our waitress, and I haven't heard a single complaint yet (which is rare in itself). If you're a guacamole lover, do yourself a favor and order the guacamole trio (Traditional, Habanero and Pineapple). You'll never go back to boring old regular guacamole again. 

The margaritas will also rock your world, but I'm sure I didn't need to tell you that. My personal favorite is the blackberry (muddled lime, blackberry, orange liquor, organic agave nector, El Mayor reposado, and sugar), and I like it twice as much when it's half-price on Thursdays. 

All in all, this little downtown gem delivers great food at great prices, and has even better people. Keep it up, El Molcajete!

What the heck was that?  4 months ago I left a good review of this place and now it's turned to the dark side. I ordered exactly what I had last time. Corn and cheese dish as a side and a steak torta. The corn was old tasting and was watery. The torta was a flat mashed up mess. The meat tasted like it was cooked and put on a warming table for all day. Covered with cheese and slapped on a roll. I sent it back and ordered 3 tacos. Not better at all. Stewed meat that tasted old, some kind of special sauce. Served with two lime wedges. The wife had chicken enchiladas. Dry chicken wrapped in a tortilla with green sauce...straight from a can then sprinkled with cheese. This place really sucked. Won't be going back anytime soon. Maybe their moderate success spoiled them. Take a pass...

I think the secret's out. Not many tables so there was a short wait but it was worth it. Servers were all smiles and great at efficiency although they were just a tad behind because of the rush. The guacamole and fresh chips were good. The cochinita tacos, beef fajitas, and enchiladas were crazy good. I had two La Tomasita margaritas that are high on my list of top tequila cocktails of all time. They weren't cloyingly sweet or mouth puckering sour. They weren't too weak or overpoweringly strong. They were pretty close to perfect. Took dessert to-go: tres leches cake. It's a delicious pillow of cake and sweet caramel notes of the leches. Can I haz more?

It can be surprisingly difficult to find good vegan options on the Fox, so I was happy to note that El Molcajete has a versatile menu. I got the burrito without any meat or dairy, and it was flavorful and delicious even in their absence. The chips and salsa were also delicious.
We love their location on 3rd street. We love both but there's more space at the outdoor seating is fantastic.  The food, the service-just can't be beat!  Love everything!

Went for a late lunch today. Small place only one other table was dining. We found the food to be mediocre and over priced. Ordered the guacamole it was good and fresh but a small serving with stale chips. Overheard the other table complaining on how small their plate of nachos were. The margaritas were small, not very good and definitely overpriced. $50.00 for lunch and we left disappointed. Won't be back!
Delicious!! Everything is made to order, fresh!! Definitely recommend this yummy place!!
My toddler sized  portion of tacos al pastor was dry and tasteless.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing because the food was meh at best.

Molcajete is like the "non-trendy" version of Bien Trucha. You won't find lines out the door. You won't find modern-Mexican decor. You won't find yourself waiting for 45 minutes for 3 tacos.

What you will find, is glorious. I went with my brother to try out this place and I am so sad I have not been there since. The chips and salsa were fantastic and they kept them coming til we got our food. I had the taco platter and therefore had like 8 different kinds of tacos. They were smaller tacos, ok? It's totally fine..don't judge. My brother had some sort of burrito and really enjoyed it. We both had horchata of course (I mean why would you not have it). I would like to return to try their guac and margaritas. However, I hear they are fantastic.

Do not let the lack of decor and exterior of this place fool you. This place has good mexican food and the margaritas are phenomenal! We stopped here on a whim, and I'm very glad we did. We started off with a cucumber margarita and a mango margarita. One world...AMAZING! It's very evident that they are using fresh fruit in their drinks and that is what makes them so delicious  (we ordered a guava and strawberry margarita after that and they also didn't disappoint) We then got some guacamole which was average. We also ordered some nachos and we were very surprised when we got them, they were definitely not the nachos we expected. It was a tostada with melted cheese, beans and meat, although the presentation wasn't that great, they were pretty tasty. The steak tacos were flavorful but a little on the chewy side. I would definitely come back for the margaritas and maybe an appetizer. The only major downfall of this place is how small it is. You feel like you can't even have a conversation without the whole restaurant hearing you. With that being said, not a good place for large groups.

Went there for lunch and the food, service, and the prices were great!  I'm gluten free and they were very accommodating.  I had 3 mushroom tacos, they were delicious!  So tasty, I love tacos and if I lived closer I would go to this place pretty often.  My only complaint was that I wish you could pick a variety of tacos but most places don't let you do that.  The waitress was super nice, and the prices were great.  I will absolutely return of I'm in the area again

I think this place should have been better... 
My husband and I came here and both he and I had the fish tacos, tilapia I think, as well as the guacamole, salsa and chips appetizer. He had a Corona and I had two of the horchata drinks, which were delicious, by the way. The appetizer was great; the chips were homemade, the guacamole smooth and tasty, I wish it had more heat but whatever. Next, the fish tacos came out, after quite a while, and the fish itself was good but the sauce ruined them for me, completely. The sauce literally tasted like ketchup from a bottle you get at a Wal-Mart; overly sweet, fake and with absolutely no spice. What kind of Mexican food has no spice? This meal was ruined by the main course and I really thought that this place had potential. Maybe, I'll come back.
Hint: Geneva "spicy" should never be the norm for any food, let alone Mexican food.
Chicken enchiladas and corn. Chicken tacos. Tri guacamole. All delicious!  I gave it a 4 because the margaritas were terrible.  We will definitely come back the food and service is awesome

Nice cozy atmosphere and flavorful margaritas.  When we got our bill, I wasn't thrilled to see the charge for chips/guacamole when we didn't really "order" it.  If I am not mistaken, it was $7.  The server offered to bring it to our table right as we sat down and started to look over the menu.  As chips/salsa are most often complimentary, we said "sure".  Every other table seemed to have it, so it sure seemed like a complimentary thing.  I was the only one of 4 who even likes guacamole so we wouldn't have ordered it.  It didn't sit right with me that they would bring a dish without being upfront that they are going to slap you with $7 for it.

I went here a few weeks ago for my friend's birthday dinner. There were about 15 of us, and we ended up taking up a long table along the back part of the room, when you turn the corner. Despite having a huge party, our food came pretty quickly and the servers were very attentive and polite. 

Some friends and I shared a guacamole and chips plate and a salsa and chips plate, which were pretty typical. I ordered the taco sampler plate, which comes with 5 different tacos and a mini cup of lime pieces. The moment the waitress set my plate in front of me, my mouth started watering. I personally thought I could down 5 tacos with no problem at all, but around the 3rd taco, I was stuffed! They were so good though, so I ended up finishing them.

I think my bill came out to be around $13, so I handed my waitress a $20, thinking I would get change back. Unfortunately, I didn't get anything back. My party was in a rush to go somewhere else, so I didn't have time to as for my change, but I a 50% tip is just crazy...

I'll be back here again, but I'll be sure that I get correct change back.

Yum yum yum. This is upscale Mexican food, so do not expect taqueria prices, but it wasn't too expensive either. Try the esquites- that was most memorable for me.  They also had great horchata and steak tacos. Cute, small restaurant with friendly servers.

Geneva is fast becoming a hot spot for great tacos.  Bien Trucha is a well-known destination, but El Molcajete deserves as much renown and acclaim.  Unlike BT though, you won't mistake this for a trendy spot.  It's just an excellent place to eat some really delicious food with fast and friendly service.

Of course, it all starts with the food.  On our visit, the chips looked like they were just fried, and the salsa was tasty with a little kick.  We were thrilled to try as many of the tacos as possible and ended up going with three: compechanos (carne asada, chorizo, and melted Chihuahua cheese), cabos (beer battered fish), and the pork belly tacos.  All were delicious with the pork belly tacos as my favorite for its taste, though the pieces could have been crispier. The fish in the cabos were huge and balanced well by the red cabbage slaw.  The compechanos were less filled but nonetheless tasty.  Each order of tacos comes with a side, and I recommend the esquites, poblano rice, and the drunken beans.  The drinks are great here also.  The La Tomasita is a standout margarita so make sure you try it. 

We really enjoyed the service as well.  Our server was very friendly and accommodating.  The prices here are very reasonable though you could easily rack up a sizable bill by ordering so much of the delicious food.  I look forward to coming back!

This is our go-to favorite for Mexican food! I've lived in the area for less than two years, and have tried just about every Mexican restaurant within 10 miles. This place is charming, family-owned and has great food overall.

I love their chips, homemade guacamole, and I'm a big fan of their steak tacos. For a side, go for the esquites - it does not disappoint!

Aside from the good food, I love the people. They are all so kind and attentive - they make you feel like you're part of the family!

We actually ate at the restaurant on Third street, but they didn't have a separate Yelp page. We ate outdoors on the rooftop patio, which was quiet (soft music playing...thank you, El Molcajete for that...nothing worse than blaring music when the patrons can't even talk to each other) and had a good view of the town. Anyway...first time here and the three of us *loved* the food. I had the pork tacos with grilled pineapple and the corn as a side. My mom and aunt had the chicken tacos on top of guacamole...all as good as it gets. We also had guacamole and chips on the side. The guacamole was amazing and the chips were homemade, but greasy. They also gave us a small bowl of salsa, which was too mild. No kick at all. So that's my only complaint on the food (greasy chips and meh salsa). 

Our waitress was excellent - friendly, sweet, attentive, very compliant with separate checks, making sure my mom and aunt didn't have any dairy in their corn due to food allergies. She must've picked up on my mom talking to me about my birthday, so at the end of our meal, she came out with a tres de leche cake with three forks for sharing. And the cake was absolutely delicious. My no-sugar eating plan, be damned! That cake was worth it.

I can't wait to go back and try the enchiladas with mole sauce - and a margarita. Cheers!

Ate here with the wife and mother in law. Food delicious. We had the queso with mushrooms app. Good, but not easy to eat. I had the fish tacos (hard/crispy taco shells), which were good.  It came with a soup that I can't describe.  It had a tomato base with balls of dough  of some type floating in it. Whatever they were, it was good. 

The wait staff was friendly and efficient. There were times when a young one moved so quickly that I did not see her refilling out drinks.

The customer service at this restaurant was absolutely horrible!!! First off, depending on how the tables are arranged there are only about 8 tables in the restaurant. My husband and I were seated in the corner booth nearest the front door and were essentially forgotten about after getting our drinks. My husband had to get a waitress' attention when seating a table near us to ask for a refill (which had been empty for a while) and I figured it'd be a smart time to ask for a refill, too. I also asked for more chips and salsa which we never received. If it weren't for reaching out to her we wouldn't have had an interaction with any of the servers until our food was ready to be served. Oh yeah, they also messed up my husband's side. 
Compared to all of the Mexican restaurants I've been to in my life, El Molcajete has the smallest portions I've ever seen. My husband and I left still hungry because we just wanted to leave after being completely ignored during our time here. The food wasn't horrible which is the only reason why I'm giving them 2 stars and not one. The servers were absolutely horrible in being attentive and completely forgot we existed in one of the tiniest restaurants I've ever eaten at. Don't waste your time or money here!
Great little place! Hands down the best mole I've ever had..and I know mole! Foods authentic and good..! Portions are large so bring your appetite!
Best Mexican around.  The two locations both have excellent food.  Their black bean soup is divine!

Good food, great small place.  Staff are very nice and fast service.  They also have an outdoor seating. Too bad it was too cold when we went. Tacos are very good. It also comes with a side of black beans and rice. I had a mango margarita and it was good!  A bit pricey but worth it. Will go back again when it gets a bit warmer so we can seat outside!
Excellent authentic Mexican food. Our group of six all had outstanding meals. I had the chicken burrito, it was a perfect blend of spices. The chips & salsa where fresh. Definitely will go back!

YAAAAAAAAAAAAS ME ENCANTA EL MOLCAJETE

Husband and I have been here... oh man I dunno... eighty times since we moved to the area a few months ago and it's our favourite place to go. Everything is delicious - LITERALLY EVERYTHING. I always get the taco platter because it's a great variety and I am a glutton. Guayaba margarita? Si, ponla en mi boca pronto. The staff there are so friendly and are always happy to help us out and get us more chips, always more chips.

Seriously. The chips.

The restaurant would have gotten a much better rating if the service was better.  The food was good but everything else was really lacking.  We were seated quickly, but it went downhill quickly. 
We sat with menus for 15 minutes, watching new seated tables get water and greeted before us.  The food was served randomly to every table. Our main course meals were served in multiple drops with no reasoning. My steak came out well before my wife's tacos.  We think they gave her tacos to a large party behind us. The service in general was a mess. People were running around trying to serve food to wrong tables and running back to figure out where it goes. It was really a mess. Maybe we will try it again to see if it was just an off night.

We went at the last minute with a party of 11 people. They were very accommodating and the wait staff was friendly. Our party selected many different entrees from the menu and everyone enjoyed their food. 

Good food and good service.

Ok, food amazing!!!!  
Drinks. Delicious!!

Service, there was a glitch to say the least, but they handled us with such respect.  Our order didn't get put in, so our wait was kinda crazy.... but, with that said, without prompting, they comped our meal.  That deserves a 5 star in our book. 

They were gracious, owned the mistake, and the food, to say the least was fresh and yummy.  

We will be back.  Absolutely.

Sometimes I wonder if people cook anymore. It's the only explanation for some reviews-if people have a low baseline to begin with it impacts perception. This is a small place with ok food. Nothing to write home about based on our order today. My husband did give a solid thumbs up to the house made margaritas! I ordered chicken enchiladas and DH ordered fish tacos. We started with chips n salsa. IMHO Mexican places are first judged on chips n salsa, it's a gateway to their menu. The chips were homemade, a plus but a minus as the bottom half of basket very oily. The salsa was very good. The rice and beans were average, rice was not impressive. My enchiladas were chicken-flavorless, only hint of flavor came from sauce which was sparingly covering them. I think perhaps they have done better with other menu items, so I would still say give them a try.

okay, so my husband and i are fairly new to Geneva, and we know we should try as many of the restaurants around here as we can, but i love this place. basically, i just want to eat here. hands-down, the best mexican i've ever eaten. so fresh and delicious!  my husband had the taco sampler platter, and i cannot even begin to describe how flavorful each one of them was.  i recommend ordering that for a first visit here. 

i love cheese enchiladas, and these are probably my favorite. i've also had the SINCRONIZADAS, which is basically a quesadilla with pork, pineapple and other flavors- seriously, one of the most delicious things i've ever eaten

their chips & dip are so good too. We had the nachos as an appetizer  but be warned, they are nothing like nachos you get a chain restaurant like chilis (i.e. gooey cheddar cheese and chips). these are authentic and seem to be baked - i highly recommend, but i could see some people not liking it. 

For dessert, we had the dulche de leche chimi, which is a deep fried crepe. i can just say that you need to save room for dessert because this was amazing.

oh, i also had the horcata - not quite as good as Los Burritos Mexicanos, but up there. however, this one is REALLY sweet - my husband wasn't a fan, since he doesn't like really sweet drinks, but i enjoyed it!

Have passed this restaurant for years. Decided to try it last night and realized we found a gem! Fresh food, warm service and a quaint atmosphere. At our server's suggestion we ordered the taco combo platter. We also ordered Tampiquena. My sister and I shared the dishes and found each to be wonderfully flavorful! 

Looking forward to taking my husband!

CONSISTENT! Food, Service, and a place that makes you feel at home. I have noticed some odd reviews regarding my favorite Mexican. I honestly would like to share some of my favorites with the folks with a bad experience to see why and what about the food they dislike. This family run restaurant I am sure is not for anybody but every one and I take a lot of people here for lunch and dinner love it. I understand the portions aren't those of the chain or BOCA shops. That is not why we love it. The food is remarkable. Try a sample of each of their taco's and ask the wait staff what they recommend. They do have specialties. Tell them when things are wrong in a respectful way and I bet they fix it. Come with a clean pallet and an open mind. Keep in mind this is upscale Mexican. 

By the way if you don't like it that is ok. That will make it easier for me to get a table. 

Love it!

Nice spot in downtown Geneva. Chips were homemade and the guacamole and salsa were fantastic. The guacamole had chunks of avocado, which I like, and the salsa had great flavor without being too hot.  My wife and I each ordered tacos, which are the now trendy smallish version, sometimes known as street tacos. Notwithstanding my preference for regular sized tacos, they were excellent. Service was a little slow, but very friendly. We will definitely make a return visit.

My husband and I have come here several times as a recommendation from a friend and we are lucky to find this place. It's a small restaurant with probably around 15 or so tables. They have excellent mojitos and the food is amazing. Even though we live about 30 minutes away I still will come here for authentic mexican food.
Great food.  The shrimp tacos are very fresh and they had a vegetarian selection which was excellent.  The guacamole comes in different levels of spices.  I would return again in the future!

Our first clue should have been going in on a Saturday night and getting a table immediately when there are no more than 8 tables in the whole place. We were asked if we wanted chips and salsa, which is normally free in Mexican restaurants. Not in this "upscale" place. $6.75 for a greasy little pile of chips and salsa, which we did not know until we got the bill. After we placed our order, we waited 30 minutes for our food. Excessive, especially with so few tables. Their food is expensive for what you get. My tacos were not listed on the menu as mini tacos, but that's exactly what they were. Save your time and money and eat some place else. (This was the State St. location, and we won't be trying the 3rd St. one.)

Flavor was good, but that's about it. Ordered a steak burrito and side of rice, for a total of $13.
Burrito was VERY small for the price, and got literally two forkfuls of rice for $3.50
Unreal

this is the first time i haven't been overwhelmed by the food. chicken enchiladas were very ordinary, and the portion was small, rice and bean portions were small. but the kicker was when i ordered drunken beans to go. $3.50 for the smallest container i've ever seen. no longer a fan of this place.

This was an amazing reprieve after a long day. I no longer live in Illinois, so I miss good, traditional Mexican fare.
