I started with an awesome house margarita, followed by chips and habañero guacamole. The guac brought a nice heat and was fresh and smooth as silk. The Tortas Asada was the highlight. It was perfectly spices and every bite was delicious from start to finish. I can't wait to make another trip if I make it back to Illinois. A must eat!!

We thought food and service was great here.  We tried taco sampler and beef enchiladas with mole.  
Chips looked like they were freshly fried, like home made, and tasted great.  Salsa was nicely spicy, had a canned tomato flavor to it, but I thought it went well with the chips and tasted good.
Taco sampler was great.  They use slightly smaller tortillas than a regular size corn tortilla, but there was plenty of filling on each taco.  Flavors for everything was better than we expected.  We loved every bite of every taco.  Normally there's at least 1 or 2 taco fillings we don't like at a taco place, but this one made us want to order them all again!
Enchiladas were good, the mole was tasty.  Came with black beans and rice.  The rice was good-average, nothing amazing, but a lot of places have lousy rice.  Beans were good-average too.  
We went on a Thursday for lunch, about 4 other tables were seated.  Service was friendly.  Our food took about 15 minutes, which seemed a little long, but we had chips to eat while waiting, and the food was worth it.

What a nice surprise to find this place hidden on the second floor   of a bunch boutique stores on 3rd St.  It was mid afternoon and we were the only ones at the time.  The hostess a day the waitress were very kind.  We had the Guacamole and home made chips,  my wife ordered ochata which is rice milk and I ordered the hibiscus tea.  For dinner we Pollo almendrado.  And I had the Bisrec Mexicana.  Everything was great.  We will definitely come back.
Tried it and was pleased. the food was seasoned just a bit salty.  Would go again
Torta was small and lacked flavor. The chips had a weird texture to them. Came in for lunch and the place was dead. Shoulda known.

Yup, another good review about another great Mexican restaurant in Geneva.

Chips are warm and crunchy. Guacamole is fresh and delicious, and every dish I have had here is good. The waiters are really nice, very helpful, and the whole experience is terrific. Having a hard time getting into some of the other Mexican restaurants in Geneva? Then come here and give this a try. You won't be disappointed.
Ate here again...   Top notch food and tacos!!!!

What an amazing find!!!  It is so funny to me how some places get crazy publicity and recognition for some unknown reason and places like El Molcajete fly under the radar. I'm here to say: You want to try this place!  You need to try this place!  Trust me. 

While spending an afternoon in Geneva with my sister, we knew that lunch was on the agenda. We had no specific place in mind, but wanted to try something new.  So I turned to Yelp and saw El Molcajete. Four and a half stars?  Maybe we should check this out. We did. Oooh baby, baby was it good!

So it is truly a tiny restaurant. They seem to seat about twenty people at a time, but I overheard them mention they could do up to thirty for a private party. The tininess just adds to the charm. 

Chips and salsa are not an automatic on the table.  I'm actually okay with that for two reasons. 1.  The prices are right. 2.  This gave us an opportunity to try a fresh mango guacamole instead (served with a side of salsa).  I have only recently entered the guacamole arena. I always stuck my nose up at it. I am older and wiser now. This was the second best guacamole that I have ever tried. Second only to my cousin, Christopher's homemade guacamole. The salsa was nice. A little different to me. I think some of the veggies were roasted, so the overall flavor was unique. 

We didn't want to overdo it at lunch, so we decided to split a chicken and steak fajita combo. Then, we realized that we could each try a little something extra. So, she chose a single taco al pastor with grilled pineapple. I chose a chicken enchilada with mole. We skipped the beans and went with double rice. 

Okay, so here's the lowdown. It was all good. The rice was moist and seasoned well. Her taco was fabulous!  My enchilada was so good that I was using a plain tortillas to wipe the extra mole off my plate (I wasn't ashamed...it was darn good!). The fajitas were just perfect. Nice large pieces of meat made this lunch an absolute success!    

Add to all of that, a charming staff who kept my water glass full in a clean and cute space and you've got a winner. Half hour drive from my home?  No problem. I feel a date night with the hubby here coming on very soon. Ole!
Tex Mexican at best.  They charge for extra salsa.  Much better options around.  Try Taco Bell.

First time ordering something from here, and I got the Pastor Burrito.  Usually not a fan of huge chunks of avocado or the large amounts of lettuce in burritos, but the marinade that soaked through the whole package, and the salsa, made everything pretty delicious.

We've eaten once each at the two locations in Geneva. Food is good, service is great and it's a decent meal for the money. We will definitely be back in the future. Haven't been to Bien Trucha because I can't bring myself to stand in line outside waiting for a seat. El Mocajete is good enough for us. Can't wait to sit on their deck at the Third Street location this summer and sip some margaritas.

Other reviewers weren't kidding when they said the place was small.

The food was excellent. 
Service was excellent
Atmosphere; very cozy and not in a good way.

Ordered the guacamole halbenero style and chips. The guacamole was amazingly good. Spice level was more of a Geneva, Il spice. Our server agreed that it was "spicy" for Geneva. Chips were just how I liked em. A little greasy.

J ordered the chicken burrito which was nice size. He said it was very good.

I ordered the shredded beef chimichanga with all rice. Nice size, lots of meat and tasty. Rice was good.

Sprite came in a bottle. That's old school, but bottles always taste better to me.

Unfortunately, the place is quiet, so we had the misfortune of sitting next to three loud mouth women; whining, complaining and gossiping about everything under the sun. Just when we thought they were going to leave, they sat and yapped away. I wish Bravo or VH1 would have been in the area, they would have cast these catty irritants in a minute. Go out , have a good time, but don't be that irritating in a small place. 

Other than being stuck by the Housewives of Geneva cast in training, the experience was excellent.

I don't think we were alone in hoping that they would leave either.

column4: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column13: My husband and I recently visited this place on 3rd st. We weren't dissapointed...  It is not the best food we'eve ever had, but it is one of the good ones. The ambience is super nice and the staff super friendly. I will be coming back many times to enjoy their smiles and margaritas. The food is also good, but I've had better burritos. So, it's hard to critique because in comparison to restaurants in Geneva is one of the best ones, but in comparison to restaurants that I've visited is one of the good ones. Definitely, a must try though....
The food here is bland and not worth it. It was a little busy the night but it was not worth the 45 minute wait for our food to brought to the table.
What a special little place!   Love the family atmosphere.  The food is awesome.  Great service.   Recommend the jalapeño margarita!
Great food, lovely staff. Really worth the trip out to Geneva...

Great service and amazing food! What I love most from here is their Agua de Horchata. It is so delicious and refreshing! The tacos are also very delicious as is their arroz poblano. I've only been here a few times but each time the service has been amazing!

This place is the bomb. The food is really yummy, the service was good, the portion size was perfect to fill you up and the prices were fair. I wouldn't choose this place for a date night or anything fancy but it's a great casual place to eat Mexican.

Small place, big flavors.

It's not as small as Bien Trucha used to be, but it's definitely cozy. Maybe seats 20-30. I came around 11:30 on a Saturday to meet a friend for lunch, and I was the only customer at the time, though it definitely filled up as the lunch hour went on.

It's not a huge deal, but at least at lunch, they don't seem to offer complimentary chips and salsa. We did go for some guacamole, though, which was served with a big (delicious) bowl of salsa as well.

The guac was definitely fresh, but I think it could have used just another 30 seconds of mashing and a touch more seasoning -- the bottom was mostly just avocado chunks. That salsa was really good.

I ordered tacos with shredded seasoned pork, and they came with a side of soupy black beans. The little bitty tortillas were stuffed full of pork, with a slice of avocado and some pickled red onion. Really good flavor, I actually think they were a little over-full, and would've preferred a little less pork and a little more onion. (Maybe I'm just a nitpicky weirdo.) The beans had great flavor and a little spice to them.

My friend got steak tacos and pretty much devoured them, so I'm guessing she was pleased with her meal. :)

Service was friendly and prompt, with a good amount of checking in and refills. 

While El Molcajete didn't quite blow me away the way Bien Trucha did (does), the atmosphere is less hip and more cozy, more of a "family" atmospphere, with a somewhat different/expanded menu. It's definitely very good for what it is, and if you just can't be bothered to deal with the hype or the lines, El Molcajete is full of fresh and delicious flavors.
Great salsa, steak tacos were amazing and their traditional margarita was the best part of the night. It's a small, quaint place. Service was quick.

Stopped in while shopping. Our server recommended the steak tacos and chicken enchiladas with green sauce. They were both very flavorful. Server was very cheery. If you like Mexican, this a good choice.

Wow!   That sums up my experience this past weekend here. My husband and I stopped for dinner around 5 pm on Saturday. We got the last open table at the tiny restaurant.  We ordered the chips and guac which were amazing. I had the mango margarita and it was by far the most amazing margarita I have ever had.  For dinner I had the deep fried chicken tacos.  I'm still thinking about them now. My husband had the burrito which he really loved, but to me it seemed quite small.  

Overall it was a great experience and I will definitely be going back!

After listening to the bro next to us say "El Mokaheetee" and "Pahbano rice" 50 times and talk with his date (who called him "babe" every 2 seconds just like that skit they used to do on SNL) about working out and counting calories, and THEN ordering fried ice cream, it kind of made me not want to go out in public ever again, but I guess that's the demographic that goes out to eat in Geneva. (It is.)

Their guacamole is good. It doesn't look like a lot (like, an ice cream scoop amount) but my fam ate it with the chips and had a little left over so it was just the right amount. They just hid the rest of the guac under some of the pile of chips so it looks misleading. Their chips are legit, and home made.

We had to wait about a half hour which wasn't that surprising because we went on a Friday at 6. I'm vegan but they have a section of vegetarian entrees on their menu which can easily be made vegan. Although on my side plate, they couldn't help themselves and just had to sprinkle some cheese on my black beans even though I said no cheese. Whatever.

The food was pretty tasty, I got the fajitas which seemed like more food than some of the other entrees people ordered. They make a hibiscus water (Jamaica) which is really refreshing and not overly sweet. Our waitress was really helpful and our food got made pretty timely once we sat down. It kind of took a while for them to take our check, though, so we flagged down the guy behind the desk so we didn't take up a table longer than we had to.

Overall, pretty good, but for me, I wouldn't go out of my way just because of the wait and the overwhelming desperate-white-male-ness of the surroundings. But the food was tasty and well made. Just... Don't put something someone is allergic to on their food when they mention it twice! Just sayin'.

After a few light Food Fare munchies for lunch and a very pleasant afternoon spent exploring most every spot in Geneva's Festival of the Vine, my lovely wife and I worked up a decent appetite. And from the get go, our dinner focus was set on El Molcajete. 

When we walked in, the room was pretty empty but after all, it was 4:30pm on a Sunday afternoon. We were greeted and seated promptly and within a few minutes had two gorgeous margaritas in front of us (one traditional and one strawberry) to quench our thirst.  These were excellent drinks with obviously freshly made ingredients.  In addition, a bowl of fresh tortilla chips and some of the best salsa this side of the border appeared. The salsa looked like it came from a jar, but FAR FROM IT.  There was a roasted flavor to either the peppers or tomatoes, finely chopped cilantro and a nice heat at the back of the throat which was irresistible and addictive.

For our entrees, we chose the Mini Burrito dinner with chicken, which (again) looked like standard Mexican fare but had a much richer and deeper flavor profile than expected. However, the star was the El Molcajete Sincronisadas, achiote marinated pork quesadillas elevated to heavenly status by the guacamole, crema and roasted pineapple tomatillo sauce accompaniments.  This was seriously good food, well prepared, nicely presented and the price was very reasonable. 

By the time we asked for the check, the room was full of what sounded to be equally pleased diners enjoying the tempting menu selections.

We'll definitely be back soon.

Awesome little Mexican spot in downtown Geneva! The food is great, although oddly disproportionately priced. The service was excellent, and the speciality margaritas were superb -- hand-muddled and full of flavor. We can't wait to go back.

Quite a nice place. Pretty cozy on the inside than how it looks on the outside. The food was delicious! The regular guacamole and the steak anything is a must here! Just keep in mind that portions are on the smaller side. 
The service was fine. They had a warm greeting and answered all my questions nicely (about food recommendations). However, there is a slight glitch on the service if you may say if it gets busy. Other than that, quite a decent place for a decent meal.

Delish! A friend and I dined here for lunch one day and we shared the steak and pork tacos. They were amazing. The fresh guacamole was very tasty and the house margarita was perfect. I've been fantasizing about returning here ever since.
Had lunch here on a Saturday and enjoyed it a lot.   Good margaritas, good food, good service and the price seemed reasonable.    What more could you ask for.   We'll be back.

Delicious-- great food & great service. I would recommend the tacos los cabos, they're fish tacos with a cabbage dressing on top. My mom got the asada tacos, but I let her have one of my three tacos and she preferred mine to hers. Once again I have to say delicious!

I really loved this place.  We started off with the guac and chips.  They have those great chips that come out warm, and you can see the salt at oil glistening on them.  I had the cured beef tacos which were really delicious; the meat had a ton of flavor.  I ordered the tamarindo margarita, since it was recommended by the waitress; it was really good.  We capped off our meal with the mexican sundae.  The sundae wasn't anything special, but I find that to be the case with most desserts at mexican reataurants.  In addition to a great meal, the service was excellent.  I'll definitely be coming back!

Excellent flavors. Craft margaritas. Attentive service. Creative presentation. Fair prices. All of the above are spot on. The fish tacos are terrific and the carnitas were solid. The jalapeño margarita bests the ones I've had at Frontera Grill. This place is the introverted sister of Bien Trucha. Shhhhhh, don't tell the folks at Chicago Magazine or they'll ruin it for those who tried already.
Found this place on Yelp and tried it.   So good.  We had the Taco sampler and cheese enchiladas.  Both were insane. Highly recommend. Small but authentic with good service and great food.

I almost don't want to review El Molcajete because then I'll be giving away my little Geneva hidden secret....oh wait! It's on the main road that runs through the town. Not so hard to find, but if you don't know it's there, you may just walk or drive right past as I have over the past 10 or so years. 

This little Mexican restaurant is as authentic as you're going to find...especially in this area. They have pineapple guacamole as a regular item on their menu with an occasional guacamole special using something like Mango instead of pineapple. The guac alone is worth the drive to Geneva! It's creamy. It's flavorful. It's delicious. 

Their salsa is excellent; I practically eat it with a spoon. No need for those pesky chips, but there chips are quite tasty as they are made fresh in house.

I have found that the tacos al pastor entree is my go-to choice. The meat is tender and so well prepared!I love the small tortillas they double up and present beautifully. They very clearly take pride in their presentation and it shows! Their rice is basic but very flavorful. I don't partake in beans, so I can't tell you about their beans, but I can tell you that I love this place. 

It's small, seating probably about 20 or 25 guests, but its worth the wait should there be one upon your arrival. They have Mexican Sprite which is by the bottle but they also offer fountain beverages and they do an awesome job of keeping the tables clean and your glass full. 

I think this is the perfect place for lunch on the weekend or a cozy date night with your spouse during the week. The prices are totally reasonable and if they ever open a location closer to home, I'll be the first one standing in line on their opening day!

First visit to this local Mexican eatery but not the last.  Cheerful, prompt and informed service underscore a strong menu of authentic Mexican dishes executed with perfection.  Add in excellent guacamole and chips with ice cold beer and you have one of the best dining options in the Fox Valley!

We have been coming to this fine restaurant since it opened. It is still our favorite. I would highly recommend that you try their specials. Last night my wife and I both tried two different specials and both were excellent. Mine was with marinated pork and a special sauce, guacamole, and sour cream (served on the side) absolutely wonderful meal. My wife had Alhambre which was very good as well. Keep up the good food and service.
People love this place and I just don't get it. Margaritas and food are overpriced for what they give you.

Tomatillo Margerita was amazing, although a little small.  Mole that came with the chicken enchildadas was wonderful, but chicken was dried out. Taco sampler was OK. Child friendly place and beans were good.

I love the food at this place but the service at the new location on 3rd is atrocious. We had a terrible experience with too many mishaps to mention (forgotten reservation, drinks, apps, entrees, took forever). Owner came by, told her how bad and she said she would comp our NEXT meal. Not looking for a freebee but they should've comped our meal that night. Was at that location when they opened and we were the only ones in there and the service was still bad. Please get your act together!!!

Molcajete is your no frills modern Mexican restaurant. The restaurant is small and cozy rigth off state street in downtown Geneva. This place gets packed on weekends so come early. Parking can also be tought to find. The food is authentic and very delicious. The chili rellenos are highly recommended, especially if you like cheese.

What a great experience!  The guacamole is OUTSTANDING. The food is fantastic.  Mr husband had the chili releno and I had one of the house especiales.  Steak medallions in  mortal sauce. OMG  it was so yummy. Great flavor. The telenovela was also YUMMY. Moving to third street is a plus.  We cannot wait until warm weather to enjoy the outdoor patios. Very friendly, helpful staff is a plus.  Make the trip upstairs. Well worth it

After a day of antique shopping with my mom we were starving....my mom is a picky eater and didn't want Italian...didn't want sandwiches...she didn't want anything so I quickly yelped to find the nearest Mexican food...

This is NOT an authentic Mexican restaurant...it is better...Mexican with a contemporary twist...and I LOVED IT...and my mom who is from from Mexico loved it too. 
As soon as I looked at the menu I realized it wasn't the usual tacos burrito kinda place. The detailed description of the marinade and sauces really made every dish sound delicious!! 

We ordered chicken tacos marinaded in some orange spicy sauce. AMAZING!!! My favorite part is that under the chicken there was a spoonful of guacamole in the taco. Even the presentation of the tacos was pretty. I loved the black bean soup that came along with it. 

The place is small I can see why it gets packed...but we in between lunch and dinner so we basically had the place to ourselves. I can't wait to go back!!
Not impressed! Good quality has gone down and I always get sick after eating here. The owner is so rude!!! They made a mistake on my Oder and thew my card and receipt at me.

We visited on Saturday - LOVED this place! I wish it was closer to home and a little bit larger! Luckily we were able to get a table arriving around 5:30... but people arriving around 7 when we left had a bit of a wait since there are only 8-10 tables.

That being said, I would happily wait for the food here! My husband and I both had the server's recommendation of the Tampiquena (skirt steak, cheese enchilada, black beans, rice, and a huge jalapeno) and cleaned our plates! Our daughters had the cheese quesadilla and a steak burrito and loved them as well. 

I also enjoyed the mango margarita - not overly sweet, which is what I prefer in a cocktail. 

I wish we would have had room for dessert - if we lived closer, we would be frequenting weekly! 

Previous posters mentioned it's not Bien Trucha - that's true, but I feel we had a better meal for our money here!

Considering price and type of food, this is as good as it gets!  

Mexican food can get tired and almost soggy.  Not here.  Wife had steak tacos and I had chicken enchiladas en mole.  Of course, chips and guacamole.  

The enchilada was stuffed with chicken (well prepared) and the beans and rice were tasty.  

The waitstaff clearly wanted the meal to be enjoyable and made sure that it was.

I noticed that there are a fair number of Mexican restaurants in the area.  Maybe it's the competition, but this place is great.  

p.s.  the mole here is on the sweeter side.  My preference is for more bite in it, but none-the-less a good mole.

I love El Molcajete. I don't live in the area but when I visit my brother we seem to always end up here. 

I'm not a huge guac fan but i always get it here. I think theirs is fantastic, probably has something to do with the freshly fried chips that come with. They are thick, crunchy, greasy and salty and pair perfectly with the gauc. I don't think they season the guac much and its very chunky but for me, it works.

The margs here are good too and my favorite taco is the steak/chorizo combo. Very good.

Our server was king of the upsell - almost every single table has a platter of guacamole and chips on it, probably because his opening line is "Hi folks, start with chips and guacamole?" Uh, well... YES, please! You won't be sorry - perfectly ripe avocado with just a touch of tomato and onion. 

We'd stopped in for lunch, so I ordered a cheese enchilada and the black bean soup. My Salsa Verde was fresh and zesty, not too spicy with a nice sour lime finish. The black bean soup is thick and smooth, topped with a sour cream drizzle and a bit if shredded cheese - just that + the guac and chips would have been PLENTY for lunch. My husband was happy with his chicken burrito, and everything was fresh and delicious. Definitely will go again.

Love this place! My husband and I come here at least once a week. The service and food are both wonderful!  Great lunch specials and half price margaritas on Thursday!  Chicken tostada is my favorite.  Chicken fajitas and burrito are also great! A must try!

I come here all the time and get their shrimp or fish tacos. The drunken beans are amazing!!!! The guacamole is so good. Everything is so fresh. The only complaint the place could be slightly bigger.  

A few weeks ago I had the grilled chicken tacos with orange salsalita oh my they are also too die for.

In a city where there are more Mexican restaurants per capita than Chicago itself, I would comfortably say that El Molcajete is my favorite because they are considerably more traditional, and their meals are executed perfectly. We have been here more than any other restaurant in Geneva; it is consistently delicious. I always look forward to a meal here. The staff is excellent and very accommodating, I was here with my vegan sister once and they really went the extra mile to ensure her meal was prepared to her liking. HIGHLY recommend.

This is our favorite Mexican restaurant in Geneva.  The specials are so yummy and not over priced.  We love the SINCRONIZADAS and ALAMBRES.  The verdes burritos are great as well.  My kids the love the chicken tacos and CHEESE ENCHILADA.  This is a great family restaurant or date night meal!
One of our favorite restaurants. The staff is awesome and the food is great. It is a bit small so plan on a wait if you go during peak hours.

Went here for dinner on Sunday night and highly recommend this restaurant. The food was delicious and everything was homemade and it showed-from our chips an salsa to our entrees.  We ordered the enchiladas with mole and La Tampiquena.  I'm very picky when it comes to enchiladas and mole sauce since my mom made me the best Mexican enchiladas growing up and this mole sauce came pretty darn close to my mom's recipe.  I was also impressed with the house salsa, it was full of flavor and had the perfect amount of spiciness.  We went to their location on third street and loved it.  It was a calm night and not too crowded so we felt very comfortable there and the service was outstanding.  It looks like a fun place to visit in the summer as well since there is a rooftop seating area, we will definitely be back!

Best food best service! When we get a night off or time for take out you better believe it's always this place. Every time we eat here we feel like family. The chips and salsa are the best. Campechanos tacos are to die for!! Must try!

Terrible.   My husband and I decided to try this place after all of the raving reviews.  

My husband had carne asada tacos and he asked to not have any sauce, but it came with sauce that he did not like.  The steak was also overdone.   

I had the pork specialty dish - I can't remember the name of it - but it was roast pork in a spicy sauce.  The sauce was good, the pork was over done and had an 'off' taste to it.  I asked for black beans and not refried, I got the refried.  

Came straight home after we ate and good thing - I was physically sick - food poisoning.

Still seeking out new places to try in the area, we stumbled upon Verdict for breakfast one morning... So what the verdict?! See what I did there? 

I ordered a full order of Country Biscuits and Gravy with 2 eggs and hashbrowns... Seemingly a boring start to the day... But I love sausage gravy! Grew up on it! I judge restaurants on it! And this one is pretty darn good! They even did a nice job of cooking my eggs to an over medium. So many places over or under cook eggs!

The boy ordered the Potato Pancake Combo with 2 eggs scrambled with cheese, 1 sausage link, 2 pieces of bacon, and 2 cakes. These were like no potato pancakes we've ever had! They were larger and served as the main part of the dish. They were fluffy like a regular pancake. They were delicious! 

The server was very nice and kept our drinks filled. We will be back again for breakfast some time!

I was working at the Wheaton Du Page County Civic Center and was a bit hungry. I had limited money and was very hungry. I went to the Verdict Restaurant which is an establishment that is patronized by many County employees and court staff. A friend and I entered the restaurant which had both table and booth seating. The attractive waitress greeted us and provided us with menu. There were many choices and a very hearty healthy menu. I ordered the Tuna Pita which came with a cup of soup, fruit and cottage cheese. The portions were large and tasty. My friend had a Verdict Burger which was cooked to perfection with onion rings. The service was good and the restaurant was clean. The prices where very reasonable. The restaurant however closes at 3:30pm each day. It is a great place for breakfast , lunch or an early dinner. If hungry and want a good meal try this place out. Many Judges and Attorneys eat there when on lunch.

MJM

I was torn on 3 or 4 stars. The reason for 3 would be my food came out 10-15 minutes before my husbands. The 4 would be the customer service. We had a really good attentive server other than the food mishap but she made it right with a dessert on her.
I chose the potato soup and was happy with that. It tasted homemade with lots of flavor.  My husband got chicken noodle soup which was a bit bland. It was definitely homemade but we didn't really like the flavor.  It wasn't bad we just didn't care for it.
The bread comes out in a full loaf and was a bit on the dry side but definitely fresh and homemade. 
They serve it with some garlic butter that does nothing for the bread. Just use the table butter that is prepackaged. The garlic ruins it as the bread has more of a sweet flavor imo.
The cheeseburger quesadilla was good. Exactly what you expected. We got the veggies on the side. They are both abbot greasy so beware. The fried were good. 
The steak and peppers was really good and flavorful. Reminded us of Swiss steak which we like.   We noticed some ladies at another table brought their own to go boxes. Smart, as my leftovers leaked on the way home but thankfully into the bag!
We ordered the eclair for dessert. Wow!  Delicious and the filling tastes like homemade pudding!!  Yummmmmm!!!
We will swing by here again someday!!  Check it out if your in the area. We thought the service was really good.  This is a nice, small family oriented establishment and not a chain.

If you can make it a point to come here you must try this place! Family Greek owned restaurant with an array of choices to pick from, HUGE portions, great prices, and friendly employees!!! Their specials include soup or salad, meal AND dessert. Definitely a must try!

The service felt like a family. Very hospitable with an aunt with some sass as a waitress. The breakfast skillets are plentiful and our scrambles eggs cooked just right. The skillet with gyro was very good and balanced with the innocent skillet which was all veggies. They go easy on the salt which is good. The English muffin and pancakes were good too.

The rewards for being a good son is breakfast. 

After my mother's follow up visit to the eye doctor this weekend, she decided to treat her favorite son to breakfast. The follow up doctor's appointment was in Naperville which neither of us are familiar with. At first I did turn to Yelp for suggestions around that area, but after a few minutes of searching and checking reviews, Ma wasn't in the mood to try something new. 

Ma turns 79 next week. She said we'd pass a place heading back to her house that she's been to before. But with the last year of her 70's approaching, she couldn't remember the exact name. "The Trial?  The Jury?  Something about court. You'll know it when you see it". And I did. 

We were seated by a friendly hostess right away and a waitress who was just as friendly took our orders.  Ma was craving cook beef hash which looked delicious. She wasn't able to finish the plate which she was ok with because it gave her a snack later. 

I had the country biscuits and gravy with sausage and two sunny side up eggs. (Have a mentioned my high cholesterol?). It was probably the best country breakfast I've ever had. I also had a side of rye toast. 

It's not as close to some of the other places by my mother's building, but I'd gladly drive the extra distance for their food.

My office is right down the street from this place so we order from here all the time...lunch, usually but we've also ordered breakfast too.  I'd say every meal from this place has been right on point, and well...good.  I visited this place for the first time a few weeks ago.  What better place to have lunch with an attorney than The Verdict right?!?!? It was my choice, till I realized what a high profile place it is for the attorneys around here but going in late, we avoided all that and the lunch rush.  I got a salad this time around... the salads are huge and fill me up!  You also get bread and soup with it...the chicken/lemon/rice soup is really good as well!  The lawyer I dined with insisted I get pie as well...to go, so I got the cherry.  I felt guilty eating it all at once so after 2 or 3 helpings of my slice of cherry pie, I definitely wanted more.  They really do have some good pie here, so this is a great diner to stop in for all your breakfast/lunch/brunch/pie needs! :)

Decent place for breakfast. Nothing too special but it's not bad. It's your typical breakfast/lunch spot. Their portions are good and the service is good. It's frequented by many of the lawyers that work across the street at the court house. 
I've had the eggs Benedict and the pancakes and both were good. I went there while I was in court one day and on a break I went for breakfast. I wouldn't make a special trip there but if you're in the area you'll get a decent meal.

Oh, Verdict, I'm never quite sure how I feel about you. While I'm glad to have a breakfast-all-day place so nearby, I've experienced surly service from you a time or two and just not been as pleased with your food as I feel I should have been.

Many of your servers are lovely (one or two are not), but the person who who seems to own you can be grumpy and even rude. Tsk tsk.

However, HOWEVER, you do have some of the best gluten free pancakes I've ever tasted (and I've tasted many), so I'll keep coming back regardless.

I am told this place is called the Verdict because there are courts nearby and the people who work at the courts eat here. This is a straight up diner. They don't try to do the highbrow four or five dollar coffees or they're not lowbrow like Denny's. I've had breakfast here twice and it is exactly as I expected. The clientele, besides the people who work at the courts, are old folks, moms and kids, etc. so just ordinary people.
Was good for breakfast food. The crepes were on the sweet side, but would recommend this place for a good breakfast & friendly service.

Really nice and cozy.       
I get breakfast there usually 
Crew always nice.. They changed the hours resantly 
Mao check before you go

My husband and I ate here today for the first time. We are new to living in Wheaton and looking for independent, local places to eat. We adore breakfast places and diners. We found Verdict because of yelp reviews. 
Our normal breakfast place is normally so crowded at 10:30 (you know the right time for breakfast) so we decided to try Verdict because it is within walking distance (~ 1 mile) from our house! 
Coffee was good. Just coffee nothing special but not bad (and I've had bad coffee at breakfast places). My omelet (chef's omelet) was the perfect size! Omelets tend to be either too small or too big when it comes to breakfast places. It also had the perfect amount ingredients beyond egg. Not too man of all the extras to make you think you have no eggs but enough where it's more than an oblong shaped group of scrambled eggs! 
Hash browns were awesome! Perfect crust on them, just like they should be. Potatoes cooked but not mushy just beyond the crust. And there was also ketchup already on the table! I've had waitresses look at me weird for asking for ketchup (I thought ketchup on hash browns as always been normal). The pancakes were good. Fluffy but dense at the same time. Didn't skimped on the size of pancakes due to it being a "side" for the omelet like other breakfast places. Other places in the area make bigger pancakes if you order them by themselves which is okay as long at this is reflected in the price.
My husband had the Mexican skillet and ate it all so I assume no complaints.
Only complaint was that the waitress took forever to take our order. Another waitress passed by with a pot of coffee, twice! Wish she had asked us if we would like some coffee since we had our cups flipped up and waiting. Waitress also only showed up minimal times. Drinks, order, 5 minute "how do you like everything", refill the coffees because I asked, and to give the check. So not the worst but not the best. I appreciated her not being overly friendly, but still pleasant. It would have been nice though if she had asked if we had ever been there or if we had any questions. These are just picky things and did not effect my rating. 
Also the only reason I knew we paid at the front is because I saw the register at the front and when she just handed us a bill and walked quickly away, I put two and two together (and the fact it is a diner).
Many probably wouldn't like the atmosphere. It's normal diner-esque. Nothing trendy or contemporary about it at all (which isn't a bad thing). I personally love the old diner feel (would be even better if there was a counter top!)
Maybe next time we'll go for lunch!

So to recap. Good, solid breakfast. Work on the service a bit.

Great family breakfast on New Years Eve morning! I had the eggs and bacon with pancakes on the side. Everything was great, especially the service. Our waitress made my daughter a Rudolph pancake by request!  (She saw it on TV and had to have one even though it's not on the menu) The only complaint I have is the bathroom cleanliness. Could have been better, but it was busy. We'll come back again for sure though!

We enjoyed a late breakfast here recently and the food is delicious!  I had the veggie benedict which included three poached eggs, artichoke hearts, mushrooms and spinach topped with a wonderful hollandaise sauce.  It was sumptuous and mighty good.
My wife had the "Innocent Skillet" and couldn't finish it.  It was so big.  Nice big cups of coffee and you have the makings of a really solid breakfast place.  You've got to watch for the place or you might miss it, but it's worth the search.

I've been to the Verdict on multiple occasions, but I feel like it's time to update my previous (2009) review.

I love breakfast foods, and the Verdict does have very good breakfast, but I had eggs earlier in the day, and since it was dinner time, I decided to go with their dinner fare, specifically a Grecian dish.

After debating between a few things, I decided on the Slouvaki Chicken Platter. It comes with a choice of beef or chicken, and I went double bird. There's a picture of the dish on their menu, so I was swayed by that. 

The meal also comes with soup or small greek salad, their house rice, potato, veggies, a mini loaf of their homemade bread, and a complimentary dessert (jello, rice/chocolate/tapioca pudding, fruit, or ice cream. Since I was a to go order, the ice cream wasn't an option. Also, I ordered double veggies instead of the potato. I'm not quite sure if I got double veggies (no pic, sorry), but I did get rice and a serviing of veggies in my tray. As for my soup, I went with the roasted red pepper, which is a common soup in their rotation (check site for daily soups). For dessert, I opted for the chocolate pudding.

I really want to give the Verdict a 5 star rating... Food and the prices are right, but there's always a small issue with my experience. This time, when going through our to go orders (there were just 2; a coworker and myself), they forgot my pudding! I was really looking forward to it too. 

As for the rest of my meal... YUM! The chicken kebobs were actually my least favorite part of the meal. They were good, but nothing really stood out. They were skewered with red onion and peppers, but the chicken really had no outstanding flavor. Besides the chicken, everything else was excellent. The yellow rice had a slight butter flavor and pieces of carrots in it. The veggies featured green beans, broccoli, and carrots. They weren't wilted at all which was very surprising! The homemade bread was super good. About as big as an italian beef roll, the light brown roll tasted amazing by itself, with butter, and in the red pepper soup. The soup was my favorite part of the meal. Not sure what exactly is in the soup, but I will definitely be ordering again. No chunky veggies and not too heavy; not sure if it was completely cream or broth based.

In the end, I actually did call back and pick up my pudding. I was also given a complimentary eclair. The custard inside the eclair was amazing! All in all, the Verdict is a great place for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, and I'm looking forward to my next visit.

My first time here...a very busy family pancake/omelet place on a Sunday morning. Lots of regulars plus families with kids/teenagers. Generous portion size, servers polite. I think I have a crush on the gorgeous owner at the cash register.

I've come here a couple of times for an early dinner, before a meeting that's held just down the road. I've only ordered the BLAT with fries, and it's delicious. Huge plates of food. Good service.

Nothing fancy, but the food is decent diner-style food from what I can tell. It's better than the fast-food joints around...
Waiter was pushing and honestly not helpful at all. Food was ok, editable, but nothing to write home about. Never again. Bottom line.

Good, solid Greek diner with great service, food, portions and prices.  They even have oversized coffee mugs.  Plus, it's called the Verdict since it's by the Wheaton courthouse and I love cheesy names.

Hands down, they have the best breakfast in the area.  Hashbrowns are crispy on the outside and tender and buttery on the inside.  And, if you don't want to be a fattie and have the fruit instead of hashbrowns, they give you a very nice portion of super fresh fruit.  Usually places that offer fruit as a sub give you a measly wedge of overripe cantaloupe!  Not here.

They have a ton of different benedicts to choose from including a smoked salmon option and it's under $10.  Hello screaming deal!  Their version with spinach is also delish.  And, they have the BEST bacon in the world.  I am not kidding.  You get 4 pieces of the thickest and tastiest bacon and it's cooked just right so it's crispy and chewy at the same time.

At lunch, you can't go wrong with one of their melts.  I like the turkey one on rye.  Their rye bread slices are humungous and they use real turkey not the slimey deli kind.  With lunch or dinner, you also get your choice of soup.  I've had several and all were very, very good with the chicken, rice, lemon being my favorite.

The staff including bus boys have been here for years.  This tells me the owners are good and treat their employees with respect.  I really appreciate that.

Ya, this place is a favorite of ours in the Wheaton area.  Whatever we order it always hits the spot.  Love it.  Now go there and you will love it too!

BRING BACK THE HOMEMADE FRENCH TOAST!!! I love this place and their French toast that the owner made himself. Absolutely delicious and Charlene is our favorite server alongside with the owner. Oh yeah go pack go!!!

So where to start.   We dropped in while looking for a place to eat on the way home.   Pleasant surprise!  The sick thing here is I have driving by "The Verdict" the last 10 years traveling here and have missed the great meals.


 Kirsty R review is one of the problem reviews as it is obvious she must have a vendetta against the business.  To bad there isn't a way to to flag it.  


We will be back.  Just met the owner very nice guy.

We had incredibly slow service our first visit here. The Greek gyros skillet was a standout...the eggs were poached perfectly. Husband got the Cajun Benedict which had potential but was smothered (in a bad way) in the seasoning. 

Parking was easy and I liked the diner ambiance so we will give it another try.

Update to my review...so bummed that the Verdict is only open to 3:30 now.  Probably won't get to go any more since I have to work during the day.  Very upsetting.

Love the Verdict Restaurant!  Although I have lived right by it for about 14 years, I only tried it about a year ago.  What a surprise!  Their Gyros are excellent.  I just discovered my new guilty pleasure...Gyros and Eggs.  You get the best of both worlds...breakfast and dinner!  2 eggs, fluffy hashbrowns (awesome hashbrowns) and huge serving of gyros and you can select pancakes as a side!  So delicious!  It's a huge amount of food for the price with plenty of gyros left over to take home for lunch the next day!  They also have friendly servers and great service.  I am so glad we found this little gem so close to home!

I have to say this this review is YEARS in the making. I have been frequenting The Verdict for as long as I can remember. My Grandparents used to drive to The Verdict what seemed like every weekend. My Grandpa knew all the waitresses, knew the menu back and forth and was in love with this place. 

I have NEVER had bad service at The Verdict. That's a feat to say nowadays, and I hope that everyone else can keep that experience too. The service is always friendly, prompt and the servers typically have a great sense of humor as well! Oh, and the food is amazing as well!
This is a very nice diner with good food, fast friendly service and reasonable prices.  My favorite dish is the bacon and avocado omelet.  It is a little slice of heaven

Pass this place weekly and finally decided to check it out.
Went for a casual Friday night dinner. They had a lot of choices on their menu!

My husband and I ordered pasta dishes; Mostaccioli and Chicken Parm. They were excellent. Being Italian and raised in the NY area, I know what good Italian food is and what it should taste like. The sauce was great!

We went back again two weeks ago and my husband had a great burger and I had a good salad.

Cute Greek diner with excellent food!

Worth a visit!

The Verdict Restaurant is a small and cozy diner located off of County Farm road in Wheaton. Located just on the other side of the street from the large shopping center that is home to Target and Ultra Foods it might not be immediately visible to those passing by (I had never noticed it before) but is well worth keeping your eye open for. The inside is clean with a good amount of seating available, there's nothing particularly noteworthy about the decor.

After walking in I was immediately greeted and seated, after looking over the menu I noticed that most of the items here are court themed (hence the name Verdict restaurant). I decided on a skillet called "The guilty" which contained cheese, ham, onions, sausage, and bacon. For a drink, I also decided on ordering the municipal building code violation also known as Cola (well, not really be it would be funny if they carried the naming convention scheme all the way).  I chose pancakes instead of toast as the side. My waitress was friendly and courteous. Not too long after placing my order my food was ready.

The skillet I received was nice and hot, the sausage and meat pieces were well cooked and flavorful. The big thing that made this skillet great was that the potato's at the bottom were nice and crisp. The eggs were spot on, and everything had just the right amount of seasoning. This was one of the better skillets I've come across. The pancakes here were fairly average but I did appreciate the thick and sweet maple syrup that came with it. Overall I was very happy with my meal.

My general opinion of the verdict was very high, great service, great food at a fair price. I wouldn't say the food here is the best of breakfast places I've visited. But it's certainly in the top 3. I highly recommend Verdict Restaurant, the verdict is in and they're guilty of being a great place to stop for breakfast. Five stars, case closed *pounds gavel*.

In reference to Peter K's comment posted on 6/21/2015: I am thinking this is the man I was seated next to during Fathers Day breakfast this past weekend. I overheard the customer state that the kitchen was out of capers and that something was wrong with his onion, the server was visibly upset by how the customer handled the situation. She immediately sent the owner to the table but the owner's attempts to fix the order were met with vulgar language and rude, loud comments!!! I had to bite my tongue because I couldn't believe how mean the man was to the employee and the owner! My family and I have been coming here for years and The Verdict always serves up great food with kind service. The owner goes above and beyond to make sure you are happy!!! Do not let Peter K's comment deter you from dining at this restaurant!!!!

Ok to start they have my all time favorite soup every day chicken rice egg lemon. Soooo good! But besides that I have developed an obsession with their Greek chicken breast. Good food, relatively fast friendly service! Decent selection of food, will be back often!
Old Chicago Greek restaurant.  Big menu.  Great food and plenty of it. Reasonable prices.  Great breakfast and lunch place.

The amount of food you get is staggering. The corned beef hash is homemade. The gravy for biscuits and gravy he is white gravy with a good amount of pepper. All in all five stars and the waitresses here are fantastic. These people move! I have never seen a better staff at a Greek restaurant. 

My fiancé and I just purchased a home in the area and we were looking for new restaurant to try. We just Yelp this this morning and I am thrilled to say this will be one of our favorites enjoy!

Food is good enough dine-type fare. But service severely lacks. If you're alone or a group of women you could get seated by the door even if it's winter and no one else is there. I always got the impression that the owner and crude waitstaff thought they were doing you a favor to serve you. Usually, I love a good diner and the Greek dishes are a plus. But this place swathes in too many unpleasantries.

Bring back your famous fillet mignon !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
It was better than any steak house in Chicago !!!!!!!!

This place rarely disappoints - reliable "Greek Diner" food, great staff, and warm atmosphere.  Affordable and generous, recommended to everyone - lots of variety and fast service.  Good and delicious.

This is the 2nd time I came here, and both times I really enjoyed the food. The staff was friendly, the restrooms are clean, and you have to get the steak and eggs medium rare if you're into bloody. Whether you are coming back from court, probation, or being sued, or if you're just in the area stop by because here we all get along despite what side your on. Peace at the verdict! Ask for Charlene, she is awesome, and very positive, made us feel welcomed.

Please be aware that as of the weekend on Aug. 7th the Verdict has changed their operating hours. They now close at 3:30 PM everyday of the week. This will greatly surprise a lot of people who will be stopping there for dinner.

I would say the food was bad, but we left before even ordering. I always love it when a snotty waitress tries to take me to school for having the overwhelming audacity to bring a cup of coffee in from Dunkin Donuts next door. I think her exact words were "i'll let this happen this time". Well, there wont be a next time.

PS, to the owner who I've spoken with before and seems to be a very nice lady, your waitress is rude and its bad business to sacrifice a $25 ticket at the expense of a $.60 cup of coffee.

I gave this four stars because the food is really good but they also have takeout which is really nice. My family lives pretty close to the restaurant and I can't remember the last time we actually ate there, we always order out. They're really good about keeping the food warm until we get there-even the soup is still really hot. They include bread every time which is also really nice. 

The food is all pretty good. The lemon pepper rice soup is amazing! I get some every time I go. I have ordered both breakfast and lunch items and have been satisfied every time.

Fast service, great price, good food.

The waitress was attentive but not overbearing.  Their menu was so big, it took me a while to read through.  They have sandwiches, burgers, steaks, gyros, pasta, seafood, and even stir fry.

GYRO PITA:  For under $9, it came with 1 side and a soup or salad.  There were plenty of meat in the gyro (so much that I had to take it home).  The sweet and sour cabbage soup was really good.

And what better way to end a meal than with a dumdum...love those suckers.

The owner (or manager) is so friendly and funny.  As we were exiting out of the restaurant, he furiously waved good bye to us with a big smile on his face.

One of the better breakfast places in the area, hands down.  My family has been here a few times in the past year, and each time it's been absolutely delicious.  I'm not a big eater by any means, but this is one of the VERY few places that I will push myself to the max stomach capacity to finish everything (and then some).  The wait staff is extremely friendly and attentive, but it's the food that really drives the rating.  Everything is prepared virtually perfect...hash browns are crispy, eggs aren't overdone, pancakes fluffy and moist, and bacon/sausage, delicious. I always get the standard breakfasts, while my wife usually gets a skillet.  And we definitely need the extra order of bacon AND sausage (the pup at home lucks out with those leftovers).

Why four and not five stars?  The food is great, staff is awesome, prices are just/fair, location is close, and food is great (yeah, I said it twice), it's missing just that little "something" to get it to five.  Perhaps a menu item that is truly original?  Something that differentiates the menu from your standard ones....  I HIGHLY recommend this place and will continue to take my family there.

I wanted to see bars on the windows, FBI ten most wanted posters on the wall and maybe the host/hostess could dress in a Judge's robe complete with a gavel.  That's just me being cheesy. I did appreciate how some of the menu items had "law enforcement" names.  Like "The Innocent" basically a veggie skillet, followed by "The Guilty" a meat   filled skillet. How could you not love a diner called "Verdict Restaurant" just down the road from the DuPage County Courthouse.  A clean, tidy and family friendly spot.  It was a nice stop after some shopping in the area. 

Friendly service from beginning to end and a HUGE breakfast menu.  Me and my friend had lingered long enough to see that they offer either the breakfast or lunch menu after 1130. Lingered--yes, we didn't feel rushed or pressured to leave.  Once we had our breakfast dishes cleared, our server still asked me if I wanted a refill of my coffee.  

I opted for the veggie egg white omelet, it came with a choice of hasbrowns or fruit and then either toast or pancakes.  I just wanted the hashbrowns and fruit and they were fine with my request.  The egg white omelet was great.  The veggies were fresh and not overcooked and the omelet itself was not watery--which sometimes happens with lots of veggies.  The omelet wasn't greasy either--another big plus. The fruit (melons and grapes) was very fresh, but the hashbrowns were just meh. The coffee is piping hot, but not as strong as I'd like.  

The verdict?  I'm guilty...of liking Verdict Restaurant!

We had such a wonderful experience. Our server was great. She was quick, attentive and personable. She made our dining experience that much better. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends!  Great coffee is an extra plus!!!

Not what I was expecting at all, but was happily surprised. 

Very basic breakfast place with TONS of options. Friendly staff and decent prices.

We came here for breakfast with a toddler. 

Everyone that worked there was very nice and very friendly, it was very welcoming.

I *LOVE* how the menu has healthy options. It's nice to be able to go out for breakfast and not regret it.

They have a huge breakfast menu, and everything looks good.

I went with the Ironman Omelette. It's an egg white omelette with mushrooms, avocado, tomatoes, onions and green pepper, and is served with some fresh fruit on the side. I was a little iffy on how it would be with the avocado inside the omelette instead of just on top, but it was really tasty. I would definitely order it again. 

But there's so much on the menu i'll have to make the rounds before I get back to it.

Good little diner to hit up for breakfast.
Horrible place. I got nothing right that I ordered  and they had attitude about it too. Customer comes last here. Stay away.

I've frolicked around the Carol Stream/Wheaton area for several years now and NEVER heard of The Verdict Restaurant until a friend of mine (who lives in the north suburbs and comes out this way for work periodically) suggested we meet up there after they were done at the county courthouse.

WONDERFUL!  FABULOUS!  TASTY!  I couldn't inhale my food fast enough!  Seriously!  Rarely do I ever eat so quickly, but both times I've been there I inhaled my food because it was so tasty. 

Besides their breakfast foods and their great prices, when I say I want hash brown "extra crispy" they know exactly what I mean.  

Both times I've been here the services was perfect.  As Misty S. said, "attentive but not overbearing."  

I'm sad that I discovered this hidden gem just as I was leaving the area.  I'll have to stop by when I'm in the neighborhood.

The food (we got Grecian gyros and Grecian chicken)  is very good but what swayed me to review were the absolutely huge portions and a dessert came with my meal (nice surprise). We went for dinner one evening and we both took home enough food for 2 more meals (seriously)!
Good food and good service this is really a nice place to eat!! PS prices are awesome too!!

Cockroaches, cockroaches, cockroaches!!!! I use to eat here but years after eating here one day I spotted a cockroach.  The food is good especially their lemon drop soup but after seeing the cockroaches I never returned.  My coworkers were eating here one day despite me warning them they had cockroaches and they saw a roach crawling across their table.  Hate to say I told you so, but I told you so.  Service is OK nothing to brag about.

Great price but horrible luch. Started w/ a salad w/ Italian dressing. The dressing was like when you don't shake the bottle, tasted watered down. Main course was pork oscar (pork flank fried w/ hollandaise sauce, crabmeat and asparagus), it was fake crabmeat...had I looked at the price I might have known so maybe that was my bad...but the dried up 'jerky' chop was what determined this post; hopefully I will save someone from this bad choice. I even found the dessert a bit off. I got lemon merengue and the top was great but the crust had a maple flavor.  The only good point I can make is that all of that food came with my main course and was only like $12.
Got a breakfast. All three of us were happy with food. Coffee was good and service prompt.. Definitely come back for breakfast again.

My boyfriend takes me here when I want to remember my family. Having moved far away, I don't often get mom's homemade cooking but this place is my favorite stand in. I've even ventured outside of the traditional breakfast favorites of mine. The shrimp and crab pasta last night was just what I was craving. The Law burger was pretty awesome as well! And the name is so clever considering the vicinity of the courthouse. 

Both dining in and carry out are great, with great servers and large takeout portions.

Solid place. Solid food, friendly, quick service and a nice big menu. Local family owned diner. Food is not spectacular but nothing is bad. The red pepper soup, served only on Mondays and Thursdays, is excellent, as are the fries. The portions are large. They serve a professional clientele due to it being so close to the courthouse, but they aren't stuck up. You can often chat with the owners as you settle your bill and they are there pretty much everyday. I've never had a bad meal.

Always a good meal. Very friendly staff.  Very nice soup selection. Portions are generally large, so I always has leftovers for the next day. Not health food, not creative, but dependable and affordable!

Just want to thank the yelpers who reviewed this restaurant. We live about an hour away but had business to take care of nearby around supper time. Since we aren't familiar with the area, we turned to yelp for help! So, what's the verdict on this diner? We voted with the majority of the jurors who declared the defendant to be guilty of serving delicious food in great quantities at reasonable prices! Enjoyed everything from the Saganaki through the rice pudding. I had so much food left over that I was able to get two more meals out of it.

Was I having lunch with a lawyer? Yes
Am I a lawyer? No
Was I dressed like a lawyer? Fortunately, yes.
It's a good thing too: for a second I thought some sort of surveillance camera, with the ability to detect barristers from non, would sound off when I entered the place.

Fear not, this little diner is a charming cross between a Ma and Pa kitchen, a bank, a law library, a conference room, and a judge's chamber. From the lighting, to the clientele rolling in after court session down the road, to the art work, to the "supreme court-like columns" it has atmosphere.

It also has very good service and very good food! We managed a 2-seater booth for lunch and I really enjoyed my spinach feta pie. Great flavor and it came with a nice portion of fresh, fresh fruit. My friend had one of their lunch/dinner specials: artichoke and chicken linguine. I grabbed a taste; also very good. 

There were also about 4-5 different types of fresh soup, as well as 5-10 types of desserts; carrot cake looked good, as did the homemade apple pie.

From the tons of stacked up "to go" containers, I suspect that is a massive additional draw here at The Verdict. I mean, do lawyers really have time for lunch? Should they have time for lunch? I don't think Tom Cruise ever had time for more than a sandwich, but every firm seems to be different. My verdict on this place: I'm definitely a fan!

Decent breakfast spot...great eggs Benny. The service is a bit slow though, so be prepared to wait! My girlfriend didn't like the ambiance either. It did not bother me though. Only place like this is town.
Cream of broccoli soup was bad, tasted like flour and butter. Burger/onion rings/fries all mediocre. Staff was attentive and nice though.

Had high hopes based on the reviews, and my daughter and I eagerly decided to try the Verdict out. 

We went  to have breakfast, and ordered crepes, pancakes, with sausage. Crepes were more like rubbery pancakes on the thick side. Pancakes were mushy, sausage was greasy and flavorless. 

The waitress literally slammed our plates down on the table. Wow, what did we do to offend you??? 

Won't make that mistake again!

Lots of good food at good prices!  As the other reviewers pointed out, the decor makes you feel like you traveled there in a time machine.  That's not going to keep me from going back!

This place has one big menu.  You can spend lots of time going over it.  You want it, the probably serve it.  There's soups and salads and sandwiches and gyros and pasta meals and fish....you get the picture.  Every item comes on a large plate with plenty of food on it.  The service is speedy and friendly.

I went here for lunch, so I don't know what it's like at dinner, but there was a variety of people there.  I saw families, tables of seniors and some guys working out a deal (probably some lawyers).  The noise level was fine.

This is located in a strip mall at the corner of Roosevelt (38) and County Farm Road, across from a mall with a Target, Kohls and Ultra Foods.  There is some fast food nearby, but this is the only sit down place in the area.

This is one of my favorite places! The food is always good and you get more than enough! The owners are so sweet.  They greet everyone like an old friend! I have been going here for years and will continue.

Pretty decent coffee and food was better than I thought it would be after seeing the so-so decor. I imagine much less busy than Eggclectic and Egg Harbor as that's where all the Wheatonites go post church.
Staff were nice, but food was not good. Wide variety to choose from, but all dishes were just OK. Gave two stars because they served Heineken. Otherwise, better off somewhere else.

My second visit to this restaurant as I did enjoy the breakfast there. I had a nice meal, the waitress was attentive and then when it was time to go I bought the bill up to the counter to pay....I had to go that way to leave...The woman who owns it started to accuse my waitress of not doing a good job because of me!!! She was very nasty to this poor woman...I felt terrible.  I spoke up and told the woman that my waitress had done a great job and I was just paying my bill...she then  accused the waitress of  complaining about her to me as if we were somehow partners in this.... then she started verbally insulting me!!!! Her husband came over and joined in and it was just the most offensive thing I have ever seen as a customer..These Greeks don't know how to treat their staff or their customers and they clearly don't  understand what verbal abuse is...It was incredible....I was simply trying to tell them the service was fine ...The husband told me not to tell him how to treat his staff and told me I didn't have to come back...WHAT are these people crazy....I happen to work across the street with several thousand employees and I have told all of my coworkers what happened and we are all boycotting this place for life. Truly the most disgusting two people I have met..they might want to look up the definition of a paying customer..I strongly suggest the two of them go to some kind of counseling to take care of their anger management issues..or maybe they  should just move back to GREASE...the VERDICT on this GREASY Spoon  is a huge thumbs down. Don't go there.

I don't get here as often as I would like.  Now that we've moved to Bartlett though, it's pretty close.  As of last night, the Verdict is officially going into our the rotation.  

We met a couple of friends for a casual dinner and left happy and full.  Success!  I had the $9.99 Gyros Platter - a giant plate of gyros, onion rings (instead of fries), yummy chicken noodle soup and homemade bread with garlic butter. Normally, I think this comes with a scoop of ice cream, pudding, rice pudding or jello, but our waitress didn't say anything about it and I was so full that it didn't matter.  Quite the deal if you ask me.  My friend had some basted eggs, bagels, etc. - normal breakfast foods that must have been cooked right (otherwise she wouldn't have eaten them).  Our kids both had chocolate chip pancakes, sausage, bacon and hot chocolate.  

It's a clean restaurant with a nice staff.  Easy to find.  Open when I'm hungry.  It's a great go-to for any meal of the day!  Trust me, we will be having more meals here soon.

I cannot believe I have driven past this place a million times and never gave it a second thought! This small, family owned restaurant will meet and exceed your expectations. The staff and owner's are friendly and their service is superb and quick as well. 

The menu has anything you could ask of a diner. It has breakfast items served all day, lunch, dinner, sweets, steak, hot dogs, gyros, sandwiches, soups, salads, it has it all!

The prices are very fair, especially since their serving sizes are quite large, which is good if you like leftovers!

Overall this place will continue to get my business, so long as it stays open. Five thumbs up!

One Yelp review for The Verdict in 2006, none in '07 or '08, now three in '09.  Does that mean this place is getting hot?

No.  But it does deserve a few reviews, even if all of the others are 3 stars.  The Verdict is a great alternative to fast food.  It's a traditional Greek-owned diner.  HUGE portions.  Giant menu.  4-5 specials of the day each day.  For a late dinner, I went for the BBQ pork chops, with soup, baked potato, vegetables, and my choice of any dessert in the display case.  

We brought two of my three pork chops home as leftovers, which made dinner for the two of us a few nights later.  My soup was excellent, the pork chops and baked potato were delicious, and the piece of cherry pie I picked out was gigantic.  (Note I said nothing about the taste of the cherry pie.)  

The place is large and clean, the service is great, and the prices are very reasonable.  It's everything a diner should be.   If you're on Roosevelt Road west of Wheaton, going to or from Central DuPage Hospital or the DuPage County Judicial Center, this is your best alternative for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or a late dinner.  Just skip the cherry pie and go for one of the cakes.  Or the Greek pastries.

This is my all-time favorite family diner! I've been here well over a dozen times. The food is delicious and the service is outstanding! The price is great. Also, this Is a great place to grab take-out. The menu has an enormous variety of food, so there is something for everyone! I highly recommend!!

Had breakfast there once. Hash browns were soggy and tasteless. Found black avocado pieces in my omlette, which is not acceptable! Please serve fresh produce. Mushrooms weren't cooked at all, the whole thing again was just tasteless. Also gave me stomach pains for the rest of the day. Not recomending this place at all. If you want good breakfast, go to State Street Diner.

went here for the first time in a while.
still good
Food is amazing I love the florentine eggs Benedict by far the best breakfast item on the menu.  Serves is fast. And the red velvet cheese cake is absolutely amazing

Two of our favorite things at The Verdict are the potato pancakes and the Blue Moon Smoothie.  The potato pancakes are huge and full of fresh green onions and so yummy!  My daughter orders the Blue Moon Smoothie every time we go to The Verdict and loves it.  Made with fresh fruit.

Went in the midst of a huge rain storm! Service was chaotic, but I understood. Their menu(s) are huge; I wanted breakfast food and we went at 1, so I had to ask for that. Thank goodness we got there before the power went out, I got at least one cup of coffee (really good). Our service could have been better, but what else can you do besides re fill water? We got our food pretty quick, but our waitress didn't come back at all, she was probably dealing with kitchen chaos. I got a pancake combo, and I wanted turkey sausage and two bacon strips, opposed to one sausage and two bacon strips. I ended up getting five turkey sausage links, ate two of them, asked for bacon (waitress took my WHOLE plate away to get it), then came back with bacon. The bacon was fried to a crisp; I wasn't going to complain, because I still got DOUBLE MEAT!!! YA BABY! Plus, she probably had to spit on my food for being a stickler...I would have...haha, just kidding!

I got scrambled eggs, the meat, and whole wheat pancakes instead of regular. Needless to say, I've had better service here before, but this was fine. Kudos to them for running on a generator since the power went out...and OPA!

I love the verdict! It is one of the family restaurants that is in my usual rotations for dining out .  The menu so huge, sometimes it is difficult to choose what I want to eat! I would highly recommend any of their soups or salads.  My usual sandwich is the chicken and avocado, served warm with melty swiss cheese. Yummy. They have delicious coffee and homemade bread and whipped garlic butter.  Yummy again! My only gripe is that it is not big enough inside. The place is almost always busy, you would think they could have expanded into a bigger space by now!

The Verdict is in, this place is AWESOME!! 

Went to the Verdict on a whim after visiting Cantigny Park with my family.  We tend to seek out local family owned joints and this place fit the bill.  So we dropped in for dinner and it was so tasty! 

We all opted for breakfast for dinner and it was such a good choice.  The skillets were extremely tasty, but the the Pancakes, oh the glorious pancakes, they were the BEST pancakes I've ever had.  A perfect mix of malted and buttermilk pancakes.  The pancakes, I'm still not over them. 

Dinner for 3 including some insanely good pancakes, tea, and tip was 30 bucks!! 

The only concern I had was that service was a bit slow at times because they were so busy.
